the concept of molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) tailoring using metallocene catalyst is visualized a follows : catalyst which individually produce polymer of narrow MWD but of different average molecular weight can be selectively combined in varying amount in order to achieve a high degree of control over the final polymer MWD . although widely lauded , this concept is seldom put to the test in the open literature . we have observed that soluble metallocene / methylalumoxane catalyst individually produce polymer of a very consistent and reproducible MWD , although the rate at which they produce polymer is subject to high variability . In semi-batch polymerization , this cause difficulty in controlling both the reaction rate and the MWD of the final product . In this study we present the result of several polymerization experiment combining rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride with both biscyclopentadienylzirconium dichloride and bisdicyclopentadienyltitanium dichloride . we also present a model in an attempt to predict the final MWD of a polymerization combining two catalyst . by considering the variance of catalyst activity , it is possible to generate a confidence interval around the prediction for a future polymerization . these prediction are compared with the result of actual experiment . it is observed that precise control is hindered by an inability to predict the activity of the catalyst combined in a polymerization . some mean of improving the prediction of MWD are given . the electron ionization mass spectrometric behaviour of a new series of hafnocene and zirconocene dialcoholates is discussed . deprotonized norborneol and 3-methyl-2-norbornanemethanol were used a lateral ligand . these data are also compared to those of mass - analysed ion kinetic energy spectrometry . fragmentation pattern of the complex in question give relevant information on their gas - phase behaviour and on an influence of the ligand 's structure on decomposition pathway a well . the electron ionization mass spectrometric behaviour of a new series of hafnocene and zirconocene dialcoholates is discussed . deprotonized moiety of menthol , verbenol and hydroxypinanone were used a s-ligands . these data are also compared to those of mass - analysed ion kinetic energy spectrometry . the fragmentation pattern of the complex in question give relevant information on their gas - phase behaviour and on the influence of the ligand 's structure on the decomposition pathway a well . the electron ionisation mass spectrometric behaviour of a new series of hafnocene and zirconocene dialcoholates is discussed . deprotonated moiety of borneol and fenchyl alcohol were used a s-ligands . these data are also compared to those of mass - analysed ion kinetic energy spectroscopy of the molecular ion . fragmentation pattern of the complex in question give relevant information on their gas - phase behaviour and also on the influence of the ligand structure on the decomposition pathway . the complex in question appear to be promising metal - organic chemical vapour decomposition precursor . ethylene polymerization by zirconocene-B(C6F5)3 catalyst with various aluminum compound ha been investigated . it is found that the catalytic activity depended on zirconocenes used , and especially on the type of aluminum compound . for Et(H4Ind)2ZrCl2 ( H4Ind : tetrahydroindenyl ) , the activity decrease in the following order : Me3Al > i-Bu3Al > Et3Al ≫ Et2AlCl . while for Cp2ZrCl2(Cp : cyclopentadienyl ) , it varies a follows : i-Bu3Al > Me3Al ≫ Et3Al . furthermore , the activity is significantly affected by the addition mode of the catalytic component , which may imply that the formation of active center is associated with an existing concentration of catalytic component . result of thermal behavior of polyethylene ( PE ) studied by differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) show that crystallinity of the polymer prepared with Et3Al is higher than that with Me3Al or i-Bu3Al . it is also found that the number - average molecular weight ( m ) of the polymer prepared with Me3Al or i-Bu3Al is much higher than that with Et3Al . 1H - NMR study substantiate that i-Bu3Al is a more efficient alkylation agent of Cp2ZrCl2 in comparison with Me3Al . nonisothermal , uncontrolled polymerization , conducted in varying mixing regime , offered a facile methodology to evaluate the influence of several important process development factor such a mixing , reaction exotherm , and thermal perturbation on the catalytic activity and kinetic stability , polymerization performance , and property of the resulting polymer . ethylene wa homo- and copolymerixed with hexene-1 under varying impeller speed ( hence , thermal perturbation ) , using Ind2ZrCl2 and Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 and the MAO cocatalyst . with respect to the effect of the above process development actor , the following wa observed : the reaction exotherm profile , tracing the polymerization history , qualitatively represented the kinetic profile and the catalytic stability . the unbridged Ind2ZrCl2 wa shown to be more stable than the bridged Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 . with change in the level of stirring from a diffusion - controlled regime to a noodiffusion - controlled , external gas - liquid mass - transfer resistance - free one , the reaction exotherm and the run time - average catalytic activity increased . so far a the influence of the chiral versus the achiral zironocene structure is concerned , the copolymer composition distribution and soluble fraction generated by chiral Et(Ind)2ZiCl2 were more sensitive to the mixing condition and thermal perturbation than were those produced by achiral Ind2ZrCl2 . Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 produced higher molecular weight backbone , incorporated more hexene-1 and chain branching , and introduced le crystallinity in the copolymer than did Ind2ZrCl2 . the influence of Ind2ZrCl2 on higher - weight homopolymer backbone wa opposite to that of Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 . incorporation of hexene-1 significantly decreased the average molecular weight and density and increased the run - time - dependent average catalyst activity . A positive comonomer effect took place . the bulk polymer property did not critically depend on the mixing state . thermal perturbation broadened the polydispersity index . copolymerizations of ethylene with endo-dicyclopentadiene ( DCP ) were performed by using Cp2ZrCl2 ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ) , Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( ind = indenyl ) , and Ph2C(Cp)(FIu)ZrCl2 ( flu = fluorenyl ) combined with MAO a cocatalyst . among these three metallocenes , Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 showed the highest catalyst performance for the copolymerization . from 1H - NMR analysis , it wa found that DCP wa copolymerized through enchainment of norbornene ring . the copolymer wa then epoxidated by reacting with m-chloroperbenzoic acid . 13C - NMR spectrum of the resulting copolymer indicated the quantitative conversion of olefinic to epoxy group . ethylene-propylene-diene monomer ( EPDM ) terpolymers were prepared using either vanadium ( Cl3OV / Al2Et3Cl3 ) or zirconocene ( Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO ) catalyst system . residual metal content in EPDM film were determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry . metallocene catalyst system exhibited a higher activity , producing EPDM with lower molecular weight and narrower molecular weight distribution . the highest activity guaranteed lower residual metal content ( Zr / C = 10-5 ) than in the case of EPDM produced by Cl3OV / Al2Et3Cl3 ( V / C = 10-4 ) . subsequent step of dissolution of the polymer and it reprecipitation were seen to reduce the metal content in both metal system . concerning the cocatalyst retention , despite initial use of a very high amount of methylaluminoxane / metallocene ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ) in the reactor , only about <nUm> % of this initial concentration remained in the polymer . on the other hand , in the case of vanadium - based catalyst , almost all Al present in the initial condition ( [?]8.3 ) remained in the polymer . In both case , the residual Al / m ratio wa close to the value generally proposed for the generation / stabilization of the active specie . In the case of vanadium system , a test in the synthesis of ethylene propylene rubber indicated that the absence of diene in the polymer structure lead to a reduction in the residual vanadium content , indicating that the diene double bond might be responsible for partially vanadium coordination . the kinetics of propylene polymerization initiated by ansa - metallocene diamide compound rac - (EBI)Hf(NMe2)2 ( EBI = C2H4-(indenyl)2 , rac-1 ) were investigated . the rac-1 compound could be directly utilized for catalyst formation without converting to a dihalide or dialkyl complex in the presence or absence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the MAO - free system rac-1 / AlR3 / [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] ( 2 ) is much more effective than the rac - <nUm> / MAO catalyst . the activity of the rac - <nUm> / Al(iBu)3 / <nUm> system is much higher than that of the rac - (EBI)HfCl2 / MAO or rac - (EBI)ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst , and almost same a that of the rac - (EBI)Zr(NMe2)2 / Al(iBu)3 / <nUm> catalyst under similar condition . the alkylation of rac-1 to rac - (EBI)HfR2 by using AiR3 need more time than the corresponding zirconocene analogue . the activity increase by a factor of <nUm> by increasing the aging time from <nUm> min to more than <nUm> h . the activity of the rac - <nUm> / AlR3 / <nUm> catalyst is very sensitive to the type and concentration of AlR3 , and decrease in the order : Al(iBu)2H > Al(iBu)3 > AlEt3 > AlMe3 . the catalyst keep high activity in a narrow range of the [Al] / [Hf] ratio . In addition , the activity is influenced by the concentration of <nUm> , and a a result , the maximum activity is observed when <nUm> / rac-1 = <nUm> . the activity of the rac - <nUm> / AlR3 / <nUm> catalyst is also sensitive to the polymerization temperature . the activation energy for the initiation and overall reaction are calculated a <nUm> and <nUm> kcal / mol , respectively . the property of polymer such a isotacticity ( a [mmmm] ) , molecular weight ( MW ) , molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) , melting temperature ( Tm ) , and crystallinity are similar level with those obtained with the rac - (EBI)HfCl2 / MAO system . the MW and isotacticity of the polymer produced by MAO - free system decrease monotonically a tp increase , and MWD becomes narrow from <nUm> to <nUm> when tp increase from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C because of the compositional homogeneity of the polymer produced at high tp , which is demonstrated by fractionation of the polymer . both MW and [mmmm] value of polymer decrease a aging time and anion concentration increase . the process of partial hydrolysis reaction of TMA with water and the interaction of zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) with TMA , MAO , and the in situ partially hydrolyzed product of TMA were studied by in situ 1H- and 27Al - NMR spectroscopy . the 1H - NMR spectrum of MAO sample and the in situ hydrolyzed product of TMA with water under different condition are different . A new peak at δ = <nUm> ppm in 1H - NMR spectrum is observed , and is supposed to be due to the methyl resonance of MAO with low molecular weight . alkylation reaction is observed between Cp2ZrCl2 and TMA , MAO , and the in situ hydrolyzed product of TMA , and TMA is supposed to be the actual alkylating agent . 27Al - NMR study show that MAO is tetra-coordinated . the polymerization of ethylene wa studied by using a series of polysiloxane - bridged dinuclear zirconocenes [ (SiMe2O)nSiMe2 C5H4 ] [(C9H7)ZrCl2]2 ( <nUm> , n = <nUm> ; <nUm> , n = <nUm> ; <nUm> , n = <nUm> ) , the corresponding mononuclear zirconocene C14Cl2H12Zr , <nUm> , and the pentamethylene-bridged dinuclear zirconocene [(CH2)5(C5H4)2][(C 9H7)-ZrCl2]2 , <nUm> . from the polymerization study using these catalyst it wa found that ( i ) activity of the polysiloxane dinuclear zirconocenes 7-9 were lower than that of the corresponding mononuclear zirconocene <nUm> , ( ii ) molecular weight of polyethylene produced by the dinuclear metallocenes are greater than that of polyethylene produced by the mononuclear metallocene , ( iii ) the complex <nUm> holding the longest bridging ligand exhibited the highest activity but produced a polymer having the smallest molecular weight among the polysiloxane - bridged dinuclear zirconocenes , and ( iv ) the pentamethylene-bridged dinuclear metallocene <nUm> showed higher activity than the complex 7-9 and the mononuclear zirconocene <nUm> . the formation of the lowest molecular weight of polyethylene by <nUm> wa attributed to the influence of electron withdrawal caused by the lewis acid - base interaction between the acidic aluminum of the cocatalyst and the basic oxygen at the polysiloxane linkage a well a the lack of a steric problem . an increase in steric congestion around the metal center led to not only a decrease in catalytic activity due to preventing facile monomer access to the active site but also an increase in the molecular weight of polyethylene due to supressing b-H elimination . poly(siloxane)s with bisindenyl , bisfluorenyl , bis(1,2,3,4-tetramethylcyclopentadienyl ) , bis(2,4,7-trimethylindenyl) and monoindenylmethyl side group were synthesized by condensation of the corresponding dichlorosilanes and water . for reference , diphenylsilanediol or hydroquinone wa also employed in place of water . A series of poly (siloxane)-supported zirconocene catalyst were then prepared from these precursor and applied to ethene and propene polymerization a well a to the copolymerization of ethene with 1-octene in the presence of methylalumoxane . the polymerization activity of the new supported metallocenes depends drastically upon the substituents in the siloxane backbone . the zirconocene catalyst supported on poly(bisindenylsiloxane) and poly(bisfluorenylsiloxane) give the highest activity for ethene and propene polymerization , respectively . the weight - average molecular weight of the polymer are also markedly dependent upon the substituents . on the other hand , the molecular mass distribution ( MMD ) are generally not so sharp , suggesting that the active specie formed in these supported catalyst are not uniform . the PM3(tm) semiempirical method ha been used to optimize the structure for the reactant and transition state of the first and second ethylene insertion process into zirconocene catalytic system . the result obtained for these reaction are compared with calculation published in the literature performed at different abinitio theoretical level . the agreement between our calculation and those reported in the literature is satisfactory . taking advantage of the reduced computational effort required in semiempirical calculation two additional process related with the socalled comonomer effect were also studied : ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization , and chain termination reaction , both in the homopolymerization and in copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene comonomer . the calculated activation energy support some experimental finding such a the higher polymerization activity in the presence of comonomers and also the molecular weight reduction of the copolymer due to the more favorable b-elimination reaction . both the rac- and meso-dinuclear ansa - zirconocene catalyst ( m-C12H8{[SiPh(Ind)2]ZrCl2} <nUm> ) were prepared by a coupling reaction between <nUm> equiv of diindenylphenylchlorosilane ( rac- and meso-isomers ) and <nUm> equiv of p-dilithiobiphenyl in diethyl ether at <nUm> ° C , followed by a successive reaction with Cl4Zr · 2THF in THF at <nUm> ° C . polymerization of ethene and propene were conducted in a <nUm> dm high - pressure glass reactor equipped with a mechanical stirrer at <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> ° C using methylalumoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst and toluene or decahydronaphthalene a the solvent . copolymerization of ethene and 1-octene wa also checked in brief . for ethene polymerization , the meso-catalyst wa found to be more active , which displayed an extremely high activity to give linear polyethene with a high molecular weight and a narrow molar mass distribution ( MMD ) . the apparent activity increased monotonously with rising polymerization temperature from <nUm> ° C up to <nUm> ° C , indicating that the active specie are stable even at a high temperature . on the other hand , both the rac- and meso-catalysts showed very poor activity for propene polymerization . however , copolymerization of ethene and 1-octene proceeded at a high speed . the use of crosslinked poly(styrene-co-4-vinylpyridine) having functional group a the support for zirconocene catalyst in ethylene polymerization wa studied . several factor affecting the activity of the catalyst were examined . condition like time , temperature , Al / N ( molar ratio ) , Al / Zr ( molar ratio ) , and the mode of feeding were found having no significant influence on the activity of the catalyst , while the state of the support had a great effect on the catalytic behavior . the activity of the catalyst sharply increased with either the degree of crosslinking or the content of 4-vinylpyridine in the support . via aluminum compound , AlR3 or methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , zirconocene wa attached on the surface of the support . IR spectrum showed an intensified and shifted absorption band of C-N in the pyridine ring , and a new absorption band appeared at about <nUm> cm-1 indicating a stable bond Al-N formed in the polymer - supported catalyst . the formation of cationic active center wa hypothesized and the performance of the polymer - supported zirconocene wa discussed a well . ansa - zirconocene diamide complex rac-Me2Si(CMB)2Zr(NMe2)2 ( rac-1 , CMB = l-C5H2-2-Me-4-'Bu ) reacts with AlR3 ( r = me , et , i-Bu ) and then with [CPh3] + [ B(C6F5)4l ~ ( 2 ) in toluene in order to in situ generate cationic alkylzirconium specie . In the sequential NMR - scale reaction of rac-1 with various amount of AlMe3 and <nUm> , rac-1 transforms first to rac-Me2Si(CMB)2Zr(Me)(NMe2) ( rac-3 ) and racMe2Si(CMB)2ZrMe2 ( rac-4 ) by the reaction with AlMe2 , and then to [rac-Me2Si(CMB)2ZrMe]1 ( 51 ) cation by the reaction of the resulting mixture with <nUm> . the activity of propylene polymerization by rac - l / al( £ -Bu)3 / <nUm> system are dependent on the type and concentration of AlR3 , resulting in the order of activity : rac-l / Al(i-Bu)3 / <nUm> > rac - l / AlEt3 / <nUm> > rac - <nUm> / MAO > rac - l / AlMe3 / <nUm> system . the bulkier isobutyl substituents make inactive catalytic specie sterically unfavorable and give rise to more separated ion pair so that the monomer can easily access to the active site . the dependence of the maximum rate CRp,max ) on polymerization temperature ( tp ) obtained by rac - l / al( £ -Bu)3 / <nUm> system follows arrhenius relation , and the overall activation energy corresponds to <nUm> kcal / mol . the molecular weight ( MW ) of the resulting isotactic polypropylene ( zPP ) is not sensitive to Al(i-Bu)3 concentration . the analysis of regiochemical error of iPP show that the chain transfer to Al(z-Bu)3 is a minor chain termination . the 1,3-addition of propylene monomer is the main source of regiochemical sequence and the [mr] sequence is negligible , a a result the mesa pentad ( [mmmm] ) value of iPPs are very high ( [mmmm] <nUm> % ) . these result can explain the fact that rac-l / Al(i-Bu)o / <nUm> system keep high activity over a wide range of [Al(i-Bu)3] / [Zr] ratio between <nUm> and <nUm> . an on - line electron spin resonance ( ESR ) technique wa applied to investigate the oxidation state of the metallocene catalyst CpTiCl3 , CpZrCl3 , Cp2TiCl2 , and Cp2ZrCl2 . these metallocene catalyst were activated by modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) . it wa found that the titanocene catalyst ( CpTiCl3 and Cp2TiCl2 ) were readily reduced to the trivalent state while the zirconocene catalyst ( CpZrCl3 and Cp2ZrCl2 ) were quite stable with respect to reduction . the concentration of the trivalent specie Ti (III) and Zr (III) showed linear relationship with the concentration of metallocene catalyst precursor . however , their slope were always smaller than unity indicating the existence of bimetallic interaction of the active site . the ESR detectable Ti (III) and Zr (III) concentration initially increased with the MAO / catalyst ratio and then leveled off after an 800-1000 Al / catalyst molar ratio . the deactivation process were followed a a function of aging time over a range of temperature ( 25-100 ° C ) . the decay curve strongly depended on aging temperature with higher temperature giving faster decay rate . ansa - zirconocene diamide complex rac - (EBI)Zr(NMe2)2 [ rac-1 , EBI = ethylene-1,2-bis(1-indenyl) ] reacted with AlR3 ( r = me , et , iBu ) or Al(iBu2)H and then with [CPh3][B(C6F5)4] ( 2 ) in toluene in order to perform propylene polymerization by cationic alkylzirconium specie , which are in situ generated during polymerization . through the sequential NMR - scale reaction of rac-1 with AlR3 or Al(iBu2)H and then with <nUm> , rac-1 wa demonstrated to be transformed to the active alkylzirconium cation via alkylated intermediate of rac-1 . the cationic specie generated by using AlMe3 , AlEt3 , and Al(iBu2)H a alkylating reagent tend to become heterodinuclear complex ; however , those by using bulky Al(iBu)3 become base - free [rac-(EBI)Zr(iBu)]+ cation . the activity of propylene polymerization by rac - <nUm> / AlR3 / <nUm> catalyst wa deeply influenced by various parameter such a the amount and the type of AlR3 , metallocene concentration , [Al] / [2] ratio , and polymerization temperature . generally the catalytic system using bulky alkylaluminum like Al(iBu)3 and Al(iBu)2H show higher activity but lower stereoregularity than those using le bulky AlMe3 and AlEt3 . the alkylating reagent Al(iBu)3 is not a transfer agent a good a AlMe3 or AlEt3 . the polymerization activity show maximum around [Al] / [2] ratio of <nUm> and increase monotonously with polymerization temperature . the overall activation energy of both rac - <nUm> / Al(iBu)3 / <nUm> and rac-1 / Al(iBu)2H catalyst is <nUm> kcal / mol . As the polymerization temperature increase , the stereoregularity of the resulting polymer decrease markedly , which is demonstrated by the decrease of [mmmm] pentad value and by the increase of the amount of polymer soluble in low boiling solvent . the physical property of polymer produced in this study were investigated by using 13C - NMR , differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , viscometry , and gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) . the effect of polymerization condition were evaluated on the production of polyethylene by silica - supported (n-BuCp)2ZrCl2 grafted under optimized condition and cocatalyzed by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the Al : Zr molar ratio , reaction temperature , monomer pressure , and the age and concentration of the catalyst were systematically varied . most reaction were performed in toluene . hexane , with the addition of triisobutilaluminum ( TIBA ) to MAO , wa also tested a a polymerization solvent for both homogeneous and heterogeneous catalyst system . polymerization reaction in hexane showed their highest activity with MAO : TIBA ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> and <nUm> : <nUm> for the homogeneous and supported system , respectively . catalyst activity increased continuously a Al : Zr molar ratio increased from <nUm> to <nUm> , and remained constant up to <nUm> . the highest activity wa observed at <nUm> K . high monomer pressure ( ≈ <nUm> atm ) appeared to stabilize active specie during polymerization , producing polyethylene with high molecular weight ( ≈ <nUm> × <nUm> g mol-1 ) . catalyst concentration had no significant effect on polymerization activity or polymer property . catalyst aging under inert atmosphere wa evaluated over <nUm> month ; a pronounced reduction in catalyst activity [ from <nUm> to <nUm> × <nUm> g PE ( mol Zr h)-1 ] wa observed only after the first two day following preparation . isotactic polypropylene ( i-PP ) and syndiotactic polypropylene ( s-PP ) obtained with single - site C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocenes , respectively , activated with triphenyl carbenium tetrakis (pentafluorophenyl)borate ( 3 ) are immiscible with one another . physical mixture of the two PPs is macrophase separated and crystallizes very slowly a is characteristic of s-PP . A solution of C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocenes with <nUm> also produce an incompatible mixture of i-PP and s-PP . however , in the presence of an excess of a crossover agent such a triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) , a new polymeric material is obtained that exhibit lower Tm and DHf than either of the two homosteric polymer and a much faster rate of crystallization than that of s-PP or it physical mixture with i-PP . thermal annealing of this product markedly reduces the relative amount of crystalline phase compared to the amorphous phase and atomic force microscopy find only microphase separation but not macroscopic phase separation . fractionation and 13C - NMR showed the material to contain not only the homosteric i-PP and s-PP but also a stereoblock PP ( i-PP-b-s-PP ) . the stereoblock fraction act a a compatibilizing agent ; it probably is produced by the exchange of propagating polymer chain between the syndiospecific and the isospecific site assisted by the crossover agent . A new class of organometallic polymer having a backbone of conjugated poly-yne and Zr - metal atom ha been prepared . trichloroethylene ( TCE ) and hexachlorobutadiene ( HCB ) are quantitatively converted by n-butyllithium to dilithioacetylene ( LiCfeCLi ) and dilithiodiacetylene ( Li-C = C-C = C-Li ) respectively . quenching with Cp2*ZrCl2 affords high yield of the polymer |Zr(Cp2*)C = c}n and { Zr(Cp2*)C = C-CfeCln where cp* = C2H3 = pentamethyl cyclopentadienyl . the Cp2*ZrCl2 and the polymer were characterized by viscosity , molecular weight , elemen - tal analysis , FTIR , NMR spectrum , and TGA . the PM3(tm) semiempirical method wa used to show the effect of a second ethylene molecule in the backside position on the frontside ethylene insertion in the Cp2Zr-nPr+ g-agostic resting state . the same calculation without a companion second ethylene molecule were performed to compare geometrical parameter , energy , and electrostatic charge . the result obtained show that the geometrical parameter for both case were identical , but difference in the electrostatic charge were observed . the energy profile presented two barrier , the first corresponding to the alkyl-chain rotation along the Zr-Ca bond and the second relating to the insertion process itself . the presence of a companion second ethylene molecule affected the energetic profile by lowering the energy barrier of the first stage with respect to the process without the companion second ethylene molecule . these result provide some theoretical support to the well - known trigger effect . the influence of metal , alkyne substituents , cp substitution and additional ligand on the stability of bridged and unbridged e2-alkyne - titanocene and - zirconocene complex ha been investigated . the reduction of the complex [ (e5-C5H4)-SiMe2-(e 5-C5H4)]TiCl2 with magnesium in the presence of tolan ( PhC2Ph ) doe not give the expected alkyne - titanocene complex [ ( e5-C5H4 ) - SiMe2- (e5-C5H4)]Ti(e2-PhC 2Ph ) but by coupling of two tolan molecule the corresponding titanacyclopentadiene [ (e5-C5H4)-SiMe2-(e 5-C5H4)]TiC4Ph4 ( 1 ) wa obtained . In the analogous reaction with Me3SiC2SiMe3 the stable e2-alkyne complex without additional ligand [ (e5-C5H4)-SiMe2-(e 5-C5H4)]Ti(e2-Me 3-SiC2SiMe3 ) ( 2 ) wa formed , due to the sterical influence of the alkyne substituents . the compound without additional ligand (thi)2Ti(e2-PhC2Ph) ( 3 ) and (thi)2Ti(e2- Me3SiC2-SiMe3 ) ( 5 ) were isolated from the unbridged titanocene complex (thi)2TiCl2 ( thi = tetrahydroindenyl ) . two equivalent of complex <nUm> reacted with one equivalent of water to yield the dimeric alkylidene-m-oxo complex [ (thi)2Ti(CPh = CHPh)]2(m-O) ( 6 ) . the reaction of the unbridged zirconocene compound (thi)2ZrCl2 gave the alkyne complex (thi)2Zr(THF)(e2-Me3-SiC 2SiMe3 ) ( 7 ) which is stabilized by THF . At higher temperature THF wa eliminated from the orange complex <nUm> forming the green complex (thi)2Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) . this behaviour wa investigated in detail using NMR spectroscopy and compared to similar complex such a Cp2Zr(e2-Me3-SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( not stable without THF ) , (ebthi)2Zr(e2-Me3SiC2-SiMe <nUm> ) ( ebthi = ethylenebistetrahydroindenyl ; stable without THF ) and Cp*2Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( cp* = pentamethyl-Cp , stable without THF ) . all complex were characterized by spectroscopic method . x-ray structural determination were conducted for the complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> . compound <nUm> is the first example of a structurally characterized tolan - titanocenc complex without additional ligand . bis(alkynyl)zirconocene and -hafnocene complex <nUm> react with (butadiene)zirconocene or -hafnocene , respectively , to yield the binuclear s,p-acetylide bridged complex [ ( cp <nUm> m ) <nUm> ( m-C ≡ C-R ) <nUm> ] <nUm> ( m = Zr , Hf ; r = CH <nUm> , C <nUm> H <nUm> , or CH <nUm> ph ) . the complex <nUm> are selectively protonated upon treatment with N,N-dimethylanilinium tetraphenylborate or tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate to yield the dinuclear metallocene cation complex [ ( cp <nUm> m <nUm> )(m-RCC <nUm> -H)(m-C = C-R)M <nUm> cp <nUm> + ] <nUm> ( m <nUm> = m <nUm> = Zr , a-c ; m <nUm> = Zr , m <nUm> = Hf , h ; m <nUm> = m <nUm> = Hf , i ) that contain a planar-tetracoordinate carbon atom ( C <nUm> -H ) bearing a hydrogen substituent . complex 13a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it reveals an agostic interaction of the C <nUm> -H moiety with the m <nUm> cp <nUm> unit . the planar-tetracooidinate carbon unit C <nUm> -H of 13a exhibit <nUm> C / <nUm> H NMR chemical shift of δ = <nUm> and <nUm> and a coupling constant of <nUm> J CH = <nUm> Hz . selective protonation of (m-alkynyl)bis(group <nUm> metallocene ) complex containing other additional bridging ligand provides a rather general synthetic entry to planar-tetracoordinate carbon containing complex of this type : [ cp <nUm> m <nUm> ( m-C ≡ C-CH <nUm> )(m-Cl)M <nUm> cp <nUm> ] ( 10a-c , m <nUm> , m <nUm> = Zr , Hf ) and [ cp <nUm> m <nUm> ( m-C ≡ C-CH <nUm> )(m-CH <nUm> )M <nUm> cp <nUm> ] ( 11a.b ) selectively add a proton from [ ( HNMe <nUm> ph ) + ( ArB <nUm> ) - ] at carbon atom C <nUm> of the acetylide ligand to yield the corresponding " anti-va n't hoff / LeBel complex " [ cp <nUm> m <nUm> ( m-CH <nUm> CC <nUm> -H)(m-X)M <nUm> cp <nUm> + ] ( 13d-g and k , x = Cl , CH <nUm> ) , respectively . when a mixture of stereoisomers of rac- and meso-1,2-bis(phenylphosphanyl)-1,2-dicarba-doso-dodecaborane(12) ( 1a , b ; 1a / 1b = <nUm> : <nUm> ) is treated with [Cp2ZrMe2] in boiling toluene for <nUm> h , the formation of three phosphorus - containing product , namely meso-[Cp2Zr(PPh)3] ( 3 ) , (PPh)4 ( 4 ) and (PPh)5 ( 5 ) , ratio <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> , wa observed by <nUm> P - NMR spectroscopy . In THF solution , <nUm> reacts with PPh3 to give the stable isolable complex [ CuCl(PPh3){l,2-(PHPh)2C2B10H <nUm> } ] ( 9 ) . No reaction of 1a , b is observed with [Cp'Mo(CO)3]2 ( cp' = C5H4Me ) in boiling THF , while only decomposition occurs in boiling toluene . however , [(NBD)Mo(CO)4] ( NBD = norbornadiene ) reacts smoothly with 1a in toluene at room temperature to give cis-rac-[Mo(CO)4{1 ,2-(PHPh)2C2B10H10 } ] ( 10 ) . compound <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were characterized spectroscopically ( 1H , 31P , 11B , 13C NMR , IR ) , and an x-ray structure determination wa carried out on <nUm> . hydrozirconation of propyne followed by treatment with propynyllithium yield the (s-propenyl)(s-propynyl)zirconocene complex <nUm> . it treatment with the organometallic lewis acid BC18F15 result in transfer of the s-propynyl group from zirconium to boron followed by insertion of the alkynylborate triple bond into the zirconium carbon bond of the remaining metallaallyl cation to furnish the zirconocene-(m-hydrocarbyl)borate betaine complex <nUm> . this reacts with three molar equivalent of tert-butyl isocyanide to give <nUm> . complex <nUm> contains a five - membered carbocyclic ring , formed by carbon-carbon coupling of the former propenyl and propynyl group with the C ≡ N-R reagent , to which a (e2-iminoacyl)(k-tert-butyl isocyanide)zirconocene moiety is attached . complex <nUm> wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . the reaction of cp <nUm> Zr(L)(e <nUm> -Me <nUm> CSi <nUm> SiMe <nUm> ) ( L = THF , pyridine ) with e-caprolactone , cyclohexanone and cycloheptanone result in an insertion of the carbonyl group into the zirconacyclopropene ring system of the alkyne complex to yield the five - structure analysis . complex <nUm> and <nUm> react with further e-caprolactone in a catalytic ring - opening polymerization . the polymerization reaction were monitored by NMR spectroscopy . treatment of the [ Cp2Zr(e2-acetaldehyde) / H(CH3)ZrCp2 ] adduct <nUm> with BC18F15 yield the dimetallabicyclic salt [ Cp2Zr(m-e1-O:e2-C,O- OCHMe)(m-H)(ZrCp2)]+[CH3B(C6F5)3]- 18b . similarly , hydride abstraction from the related neutral dimetallabicyclic [ Cp2Zr(OCHR) / H2ZrCp2 ] adduct <nUm> ( r = CH3 ) or <nUm> ( r = C2H5 ) with BC18F15 yield the system [ Cp2Zr(m-e1-O:e2-C,O-OCHR)(m- H)(ZrCp2)]+[HB(C6F5)3]- ( 18a , c ) and the reaction of BC18F15 with [ Cp2Zr(OCHCH2Ph) / H(PhCH2)ZrCp2)]+ <nUm> give [ Cp2Zr(m-e1-O:e2-C,O- (OCHCH2Ph)(m-H)ZrCp2]+[PhCH2B(C6F5)3]- 18d . A variety of nitrile R2-C ≡ N ( r = CH3 , CMe3 , p-tolyl , or ethyl ) cleanly reacts with the cation <nUm> by addition of the Zr2(m-H) moiety to the nitrile functionality to yield the respective aldiminium - bridged cation [ Cp2Zr(m-e1-O:e2-C,O- (OCHR1)(m-N = CHR2)ZrCp2]+ ( 21-24 ) . complex 24d ( R1 = PhCH2 , R2 = C2H5 ) wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . similarly , treatment of the system 18a-d with isocyanate RN = C = O ( r = CMe3 , SiMe3 , p- tolyl , or adamantyl ) gave the related m-formamidato complex 27-30 . 6-Amino-6-methylfulvene ha been coupled with benzoic acid by treatment with 7-azahydroxybenzotriazole and DCC . subsequent two-fold deprotonation , at the NH and 6-methyl group , generated the vinylidene-bridged cp / benzoylamido ligand <nUm> . treatment of <nUm> with ZrCl4(THF)2 gave the spirometallocene complex 3a ( characterized by x-ray crystal structure analysis ) , while reaction of <nUm> with (Et2N)2ZrCl2(THF)2 yielded the bridged half - sandwich complex 3b . treatment of 3a with two molar equivalent of the strongly electrophilic borane BC12F10H resulted in hydroboration of the exocyclic C = C double bond with concomitant intramolecular N-B adduct formation to yield the azaboretidine - type system <nUm> ( three diastereoisomers , one of which ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction analysis ) . similarly , hydroboration of 3b with BC12F10H yielded the azaboretidine derivative <nUm> . activation of the complex <nUm> and <nUm> with methylalumoxane led to active homogeneous ziegler - type propene polymerization catalyst . the first 1,2-azaphosphindoles 14a,b , 15a,b were obtained in a straightforward manner upon heating diphenylzirconocene in the presence of a cyanophosphane , which afforded azazir-conacyclopentenes 11a,b which can be reacted with various dichlorophosphanes . the use of the tetrachlorodiphosphane CCl2H2P instead of a dichlorophosphane allowed the preparation of the bis(1,2-azaphosphindoles) <nUm> , 19' . the monosulfur adduct of the azaphosphindole 14a , i.e. 16a , wa characterized by x-ray structure analysis . alkylation of 14a or 16a with methyltrifluoromethane sulfonate occurred selectively on the intracyclic phosphorus atom or on the sulfur atom , giving the salt <nUm> or <nUm> , respectively . the acetylene exchange in [L2Ti(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3)] ( L = cp ( e5-C5H5 ) , cp* ( e5-C5Me5 ) , THI ( e5-tetrahydroindenyl ) , L2 = Me2Si(e5-C5H4)2 ) by corresponding alkynylsilanes RC ≡ CSiMe2H or , alternatively , the reduction of [L2TiCl2] with magnesium in THF in the presence of alkynylsilanes led to the formation of titanocene silylalkyne complex [L2Ti-(RC2SiMe2H)] ; L = cp , r = tBu <nUm> , ph <nUm> , SiMe3 <nUm> , SiMe2H <nUm> ; L = cp* , r = tBu <nUm> , r = SiMe2H <nUm> ; L = THI , r = tBu <nUm> and L2 = Me2Si(e5-C5H4)2 , r = tBu <nUm> . the zirconocene alkyne complex with additional ligand [Cp2Zr(thf)(e2-RC2SiMe2H)] ; r = tBu 9a , ph 10a , SiMe3 11a , and SiMe2H 12a were also prepared by an acetylene exchange reaction starting from [ Cp2Zr(thf)(e2-Me3 . SiC2SiMe3 ) ] and the corresponding alkynylsilanes r ≡ CSiMe2H . dynamic NMR investigation in [D8]THF show an equilibrium between [Cp2Zr(thf)(e2-RC2SiMe2H)] and the solvent - free derivative [Cp2Zr(RC2SiMe2H)] . upon dissolving in n-hexane a complete elimination of the THF ligand yield zirconocene alkyne complex without additional ligand [Cp2Zr(RC2SiMe2H)] ; r = tBu 9b , ph 10b , SiMe3 11b , and SiMe2H 12b . IR spectrum , x-ray structural , and NMR investigation indicate that the characteristic feature of the titanocene complex 1-4 and <nUm> and the zirconocene complex without THF ligand <nUm> b-12b is an agostic interaction between the Si-H bond and the metal center . the effect of this Si-H - metal interaction is considerably stronger at low temperature and in the solid state . the L2M moiety showing this bond activation are active catalyst in hydrosilylation and dehydrogenative polysilane formation reaction . In the case of PhC ≡ CSiMe2H a coupling of two acetylene to give titana- ( 13 ) and zirconacyclopentadienes ( 14 ) wa observed ; the unsymmetrically substituted compound 13a , 14a are kinetically favored and formed first . subsequent cycloreversion lead to the thermodynamically more stable symmetrical metallacyclopentadienes 13b and 14b . both compound do not show any interaction of the Si-H group with the metal . herein we describe different C-C coupling reaction of permethyltitanocene and -zirconocene with disubstituted 1,3-butadiynes . the outcome of these reaction vary depending on the metal and the diyne substituents . the reduction of [Cp*2MCl2] ( cp* = C5Me5 ; m = Ti , Zr ) with Mg in the presence of disubstituted butadiynes RC ≡ C-C ≡ CR' is suitable for the synthesis of different C-C coupling product of the diyne and the permethylmetallocenes , and provides a new method for the generation of functionalized pentamethyl-cyclopentadienyl derivative . for m = Zr and r = R' = tBu , the reaction give , by a twofold activation of one pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand , the complex [ Cp*Zr{-C( = C = CHtBu)-CHtBu-CH2-e5-C 5Me3-CH2- } ] ( 3 ) , containing a fulvene ligand that is coupled to the modified substrate ( allenic subunit ) . when using the analogous permethyltitanocene fragment " Cp*2Ti " , the reaction depends strongly on the substituents r and R' . the coupling product of the butadiyne with two methyl group of one of the pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ring system , [ Cp*Ti{e5-C5Me3-(CH 2-CHR-e2-C2-CHR'-CH2 ) } ] , is obtained with r = R' = tBu ( 4 ) and r = tBu , R' = SiMe3 ( 5 ) . In these complex one pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand is annellated to an eight - membered ring with a C-C triple bond , which is coordinated to the titanium center . A different activation of both pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand is observed for r = R' = me , resulting in the complex [ { e5-C5Me4(CH 2)-}Ti{-C( = CHMe)-C( = CHMe)-CH2-e5-C 5Me4 } ] ( 6 ) , which display a fulvene a well a a butadienyl-substituted pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand . the influence exerted by the size of the metal is illustrated in the reaction of [Cp*2ZrCl2] with MeC ≡ C-C ≡ CMe . here the five - membered metallacyclocumulene complex [Cp*2Zr(e4-1,2,3,4-MeC4Me)] ( 7 ) is obtained . the reaction path found for r = R' = me are identical to those formerly described for r = R' = ph . treatment of the BC12F11 OEt2 ( 3 ) complex with n-pyrrolyl lithium give bis(pentafluorophenyl)(N-pyrrolyl)borane ( 2 ) , a strong organometallic lewis acid , which wa characterized by x-ray diffraction ( B-N bond length : <nUm> Å ) . it exhibit a columnar superstructure in the crystal and contains p-stacks of pyrrolyl unit . compound <nUm> readily abstract alkyl anion from a variety of alkyl group <nUm> metallocene - type complex and lead to the clean formation of the respective metallocene ion or ion pair . for example , the treatment of Cp3ZrCH3 ( 9 ) with <nUm> transfer a methyl anion to yield the ion pair [Cp3Zr]+[(C4H4N)B(CH 3)(C6F5)2]- ( 12 ) . the x-ray crystal structure analysis of <nUm> show a close contact between zirconium and the pyrrolyl-b-carbon ( <nUm> Å ) . the borane <nUm> add to (butadiene)zirconocene ( 13 ) to yield the betaine system [Cp2Zr]+ [ (C4H6)B-(NC4H4)(C6F 5)2]- ( 15 ) . complex <nUm> contains a distorted e3-allyl moiety inside the metallacyclic framework and it feature an internal zr+ ⋯ (pyrrolyl)B- ion pair interaction with a Zr ⋯ pyrrolyl-a-carbon separation of <nUm> Å ( determined by x-ray diffraction ) . from the dynamic NMR spectrum of <nUm> the bond strength of the internal ion pair interaction wa estimated to be DG[?]diss ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> kcal mol-1 . treatment of dimethylzirconocene ( 16 ) with <nUm> yield the metallocene borate salt [Cp2ZrCH3]+[(C4H 4N)B(CH3)(C6F5)2 ] - ( 17 ) , which is an active catalyst for the polymerization of ethene . polycyclic zwitterionic complex that incorporate one or two phosphonium unit ( s ) a cationic center ( s ) and zirconocene - ate moiety(ies) a the anionic counterpart ( s ) can be easily prepared by either [1+3] or [1+3] and [2+3] cycloadditions which involve bi-or tricyclic a-zirconated phosphanes <nUm> or <nUm> and various azide . some of these specie exhibit unprecedented phosphazide chelation with bonding between the zirconium and a nitrogen atom in the a position relative to phosphorus . when heated , the phosphazide complex lose dinitrogen to form stable polycyclic zwitterionic phosphonium mono-or dinuclear complex . the solid - state structure of the two zwitterionic complex <nUm> and <nUm> wa determined by x-ray crystallography . As homoenolate equivalent , zirconocene-1-aza-1,3-diene complex were used for the first time in stereoselective synthesis . by insertion of an unsymmetrical ketone in the Zr-C σ bond , sterically demanding trisubstituted dihydro- and tetrahydrofuran derivative were prepared in good overall yield and with high diastereoselectivities ( see below ) . none vinylsilanes and / or allylsilanes are formed upon silylation of terminal alkene with R3SiCl in the presence of a grignard reagent and a catalytic amount of [Cp2ZrCl2] [ eq. ( a ) ] . the reaction also proceeds under mild condition when silylsulfides ( x = SPh ) , silylselenides ( x = SePh ) , and silyltellurides ( x = TePh ) are used in place of chlorosilanes ( x = Cl ) . r ' = alkyl , aryl , alkylsilyl ; r ' = me , et , nPr ; r = CH2R , aryl , H . the systematic regulation of the molecular weight distribution in the MAO - activated polymerization of ethylene ha been realized by using amino- functionalized ansa - zirconocene dichloride a precatalysts ( one of the active specie is shown ) . the formation of high- and low-molecular-weight polyethylene with a unimodal distribution a well a the formation of polyethylene with a bimodal distribution is possible by varying the polymerization temperature . the electronic structure and geometry of polymethylaluminoxane ( MAO ) [-Al(CH3)O-]n with different size ( n = 4-12 ) have been studied using quantum - chemical DFT ( density functional theory ) calculation . it ha been found : <nUm> ) starting from n = <nUm> , the three - dimensional oxo-bridged ( cage ) structure of MAO is more stable than the cyclic structure . <nUm> ) both for cage structure and for cyclic structure the lewis acidity of Al atom characterized by their net positive charge amplifies with increasing size of MAO ( n ) . <nUm> ) trimethylaluminium ( AlMe3 ) reacts with the cage structure of MAO with cleavage of an Al-O dative bond and formation of acidic tri-coordinated alv and basic di-coordinated ov atom in the MAO molecule . two molecule AlMe3 are associated with acidic alv and basic ov center . As the MAO increase in size , the acidity of alv center amplifies and the distance alv - ( AlMe3 ) shortens ; on the contrary , interaction of AlMe3 with ov center weakens and the distance ov - ( AlMe3 ) increase with increasing n value . the total heat of Al2Me6 interaction with MAO ( sum interaction of alv - ( AlMe3 ) and ov - ( AlMe3 ) ) noticeably decrease a the size of MAO increase ( from <nUm> kcal / mol for n = <nUm> to <nUm> kcal / mol for n = <nUm> ) . it is proposed that acidic alv and basic ov center formed in the cage structure of MAO interact with zirconocene yielding ' cation - like ' zirconium active center . the cationic alkyl zirconocene complex Cp2Zr+Me[CH3B-(C6F 5)3 ] is found to initiate the ring - opening polymerization of 1,5,7,11-tetraoxaspiro[5,5]undecane under mild condition to give poly(oxypropylenepropylenecarbonate) with low polydispersity . the rate of the polymerization is first - order with respect to monomer and catalyst concentration . At high monomer concentration , the initial rate of polymerization becomes zero - order with respect to monomer concentration . In this paper we report on a zirconocene dichloride / methylaluminoxane catalyst system supported on a crosslinked polystyrene in order to provide ethylene polymerization catalyst for gas phase or slurry process . our novel approach us the diels - alder reaction of cyclopentadiene function a the final , crosslinking synthetic step . this provides polymer supported zirconocene catalyst with a homogeneous distribution of active site . the catalyst were shown to be highly active and to form spherical bead a proven by scanning electron microscopy . nanocomposites of high density polyethylene ( HDPE ) , linear low density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) and highly branched polyethylene rubber were prepared both by mean of melt compounding and ethene homo- and copolymerization in the presence of layered silicate which were rendered organophilic via ion exchange with various quaternary alkyl ammonium cation . In comparison to melt compounding , in-situ ethene homo- and copolymerization , catalyzed with MAO - activated zirconocene ( MBI ) , nickel ( DMN ) and palladium ( DMPN ) catalyst , proved more effective in nanocomposite formation , a evidenced by larger interlayer spacing and formation of exfoliated anisotropic nanosilicates with high aspect ratio . four non-bridged dimethylzirconocene complex , i.e. , bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)dimethylzirconium ( 1 ) , ( e5-cyclopentadienyl ) (e5-fluorenyl)dimethylzirconium ( 2 ) , bis(e5-indenyl)dimethylzirconium ( 3 ) and (e5-cyclopentadienyl)(e 5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)dimethylzirconium ( 4 ) were synthesized and used a a catalyst for the methyl methacrylate polymerization combined with triphenylmethyl tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate in the presence of ZnEt2 or Al(i-Bu)3 . the catalyst activity strongly depends on the zirconocene compound and decrease in the order <nUm> > <nUm> > <nUm> ≫ <nUm> . the polymerization proceeds in a living manner when <nUm> and <nUm> are used combined with ZnEt2 . on the other hand , stereoregularities of the resulting polymer are independent of the zirconocene compound , and syndiotactic - rich polymer are formed by a chain - end controlled mechanism . propene polymerization were performed using the two ansa - zirconocene catalyst system dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride / methylaluminoxane and dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride / methylaluminoxane . the polymerization rate wa observed by continuously monitoring the monomer consumption . reaction rate profile were obtained in the temperature range from <nUm> ° C to <nUm> ° C at pressure between <nUm> and <nUm> bar and catalyst concentration from 4.6*10-6 m to 4.2*10-5 m . isotacticity , a measured by NMR , melting point and molecular weight decrease markedly at higher temperature . small amount of 1,3-inserted monomer ( < <nUm> mol- % ) wa observed at polymerization temperature above <nUm> ° C . No 2,1-inserted monomer wa detected . A kinetic model wa developed that describes the polymerization rate for Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 a the catalyst over the entire observed temperature range , and the polymerization rate for Me2Si(2-Me-Ind)2ZrCl2 in a limited temperature range . the model includes an activation reaction , latent site that may revert to active site and a permanent deactivation that is second order with respect to the active site . the activation energy for the propagation reaction wa found to be <nUm> kJ / mol for Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 and <nUm> kJ / mol for Me2Si(2-Me-Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO . several kinetic model are compared and discussed . stereospecific polymerization and asymmetric oligomerization of allylsilanes were investigated by using C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocene catalyst . isotactic and syndiotactic poly(allylsilane)s were produced with rac-ethylenebis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) and diphenylmethylene(e5-cyclopentadienyl)(e 5-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 6 ) , respectively . bulky allylsilanes afforded optically active oligomers in the reaction using optically active ethylenebis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium and -hafnium complex . A magnesium chloride supported zirconocene catalyst wa synthesized using a soluble tetrahy-drofuran complex of magnesium chloride . the supported catalyst polymerizes ethylene with high activity in the presence of methylaluminoxane . the siginificant feature of the supported catalyst is that it polymerizes ethylene even at temperature a high a <nUm> ° C at low Al / Zr ratio . the polymer molecular weight obtained using supported catalyst are found to be higher compared to the unsupported catalyst . the molecular weight distribution index is in the range of <nUm> - <nUm> . the active site concentration of the supported catalyst wa found to be five time lower than that of the unsupported catalyst . the olefin polymerization catalytic system iPr(CpFluo)ZrCl <nUm> / MAO wa investigated by UV / visible absorption spectroscopy in solvent of various polarity at <nUm> ° C . it wa shown that the UV / visible main absorption band of the zirconocene , which can be related to the ligand to metal charge transfer band ( LMCT ) , varies greatly upon incremental addition of MAO or AlMe <nUm> . for low [ AlMe <nUm> ] / [Zr] or [MAO] / [Zr] ratio ( Al : Zr < <nUm> ) , a hypsochromic shift of the initial iPr(CpFluo)ZrCl <nUm> absorption band , corresponding to the monomethylation of the metallocene dichloride , is observed . on the contrary , for higher Al / Zr ratio ( with MAO uniquely ) , a bathochromic shift of the metallocene absorption band proceeding in two distinct step is observed . these two step are interpreted by the successive formation of associated ( or complexed ) and dissociated active zirconocenium specie . the change in the absorption spectrum of iPr(CpFluo)ZrCl <nUm> / MAO are correlated with the initial activity observed for hex-1-ene polymerization in the various solvent examined . In the same way , the catalytic activity loss with polymerization time observed at elevated Al / Zr ratio ( > <nUm> ) with this system is attributed to a reduction of active specie concentration , a indicated by the intensity decrease of their UV / visible absorption band . this reveals the low stability of active specie formed from iPr(CpFluo)ZrCl <nUm> compared to those from rac - Et(Ind) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> . propylene / 1-hexene copolymer were prepared with the isospecific Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst by using a wide range of solvent . In the order of increasing dielectric constant ( ε ) they are : heptane ( 1.92 ) , methylcyclohexane ( 2.02 ) , toluene ( 2.38 ) , chlorobenzene ( CB ) ( 5.68 ) , methylene chloride ( 8.93 ) and o-dichlorobenzene ( o-DCB ) ( 10.12 ) . the effect of solvent structure and polarity on yield , composition , and microstructure of copolymer wa investigated . the data show that solvent polarity , which ha an enormous effect on the activity , ha a negligible effect on the copolymer composition . very close 1-hexene content are obtained with all the solvent used except for toluene , in which the comonomer content is remarkably lower than that in the other solvent for all composition . detailed 13C NMR analysis of the copolymer obtained wa performed : the reactivity ratio obtained by statistical elaboration of the experimental value of triad and tetrad comonomer composition confirm the actual lower accessibility of the active site to 1-hexene in toluene than in the other solvent . this fact can be explained by the competition of the nucleophilic toluene with 1-hexene in the coordination to the active site . our work of the last two year concerning the use of zirconocene catalyst in the production of polyethylene ( PE ) is reviewed . In earlier study , using Cp2ZrCl2 , the metal loading capacity of different commercial silica , namely grace <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> wa determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) . the adsorption isotherm of Al from methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and trimethylaluminium ( TMA ) cocatalysts were determined using the 27Al(p , g)28Si nuclear reaction at <nUm> MeV . In the present work we could determine the Al / Si ratio with the simultaneous induction of nuclear reaction with 27Al and 28Si using proton of <nUm> MeV . after replacing Cp2ZrCl2 by (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 , an exhaustive search of activation , grafting and polymerization condition ( monitored by RBS , infrared spectroscopy , differential scanning calorimetry , and gel permeation chromatography ) allowed u to set an optimized protocol that yielded polyethylene with thermal , molecular weight and composition characteristic typical of high - density PE . the ab initio hartree - fock theory ha been demonstrated to give accurate geometry prediction for bridged zirconocene dichloride . equilibrium geometry of crystallographically characterized bridged zirconocene dichloride were optimized by hartree - fock , MP2 , BLYP , and B3LYP method , with basis set ranging from 3-21G* to 6-311G** . selected geometrical parameter were compared with experimental crystal structure . the least expensive HF / 3-21G* method proved to be notably accurate . the accuracy of HF / 3-21G* wa verified by a comprehensive data set of <nUm> bridged zirconocene dichloride . furthermore , experimental correction were applied to the optimized geometry parameter to eliminate systematic deviation . correction resulted in considerably improved accuracy for systematically overestimated metal - ligand distance , with maximum deviation falling from <nUm> to <nUm> Å , and absolute average deviation from <nUm> to <nUm> A. ligand - metal - ligand angle were predicted accurately with absolute average deviation of <nUm> - <nUm> ° . zirconium-chlorine distance and chlorine-zirconium-chlorine angle are relatively constant in the studied molecule . zirconium-cyclopentadienyl distance can be influenced mainly by modifying the ligand structure , whereas cyclopentadienyl-zirconium-cyclopentadienyl angle and cyclopentadienyl-cyclopentadienyl plane angle can be controlled by bridge modification . the HF / 3-21G* method can be applied for the estimation of steric effect in zirconocene catalyzed polymerization reaction , therefore being suitable for the construction of structure - polymerization property correlation . [ Me2C(Cp) (Ind)]ZrCl2 metallocene catalyst ha been prepared and employed in a study of ethene polymerization in the presence of the cocatalyst methylaluminoxane . C1 and C2 signal are detected in the 13C NMR spectrum of the resultant polymer ; this reveals that the resultant polymer is a branched polyethene ( polyethylene ) . the influence of polymerization temperature , catalyst concentration and [Al] / [Zr] ratio on catalytic activity and polymerization kinetics is investigated . A plausible mechanism for forming branched polyethene is suggested . the electron ionisation mass spectrometric behaviour of a new series of hafnocene and zirconocene chioroalcoholates is discussed . these data are also compared with those of mass - analysed ion kinetic energy spectrometry . with respect to dialcoholato complex previously studied by u , the monochloro-alcoholato specie show rather high intensity in their molecular ion peak , which reflects their higher volatility and sufficient stability in the vapour phase . fragmentation pattern of the complex in question give relevant information on their gas - phase behaviour and also on the influence of the ligand structure on the decomposition pathway . the complex in question appear to be promising precursor for metal - organic chemical vapour deposition ( MOCVD ) . zirconocene dichloride and bis(n-butylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride are used a catalyst precursor for the heterogeneous polymerization of ethene . A methyl-substituted microgel a support material for heterogeneous cocatalysts on the basis of MAO is compared with different commercially available silica - supported cocatalysts . the catalyst performance and the property of the obtained polyethenes show considerable difference . poly-a - olefin ranging from poly-1-pentene to poly-1-octadecene with narrow polydispersities were synthesized with (CH3)2Si(2-methylbenze[e]indenyl)2ZrCl2 and methylaluminoxane at polymerization temperature ( tp 's ) ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C and were characterized by gel permeation chromatography , NMR spectroscopy , and differential scanning calorimetry . the molar mass of the homopolymers obtained with (CH3)2Si(2-methylbenz[e]indenyl)2ZrCl2 were notably higher than those of poly-a - olefin synthesized with other zirconium - based metallocenes under similar condition . the temperature dependence of the molar mass distribution of the poly-a - olefin can be described by a common exponential decay function regardless of the investigated monomer . At tp 's ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C , moderate isotacticity prevailed , but outside this temperature range , the polymer were le stereoregular . ethene homopolymerization and copolymerization with 1-hexene were catalyzed by methyl-substituted cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) zirconium dichloride , (RnC5H5-n)2ZrCl2 ( Rn = H , me , 1,2-Me2 , 1,3-Me2 , 1,2,3-Me3 , 1,2,4-Me3 , me4 , or me5 ) , and methylaluminoxane . the polymer were characterized with fourier transform infrared , nuclear magnetic resonance , gel permeation chromatography , and differential scanning calorimetry technique . generally , an increasing number of methyl substituents on the cp ligand result in lower 1-hexene incorporation in the copolymer . the two catalyst with split methyl substitution ( Rn = 1,3-Me2 and Rn = 1,2,4-Me3 ) show a higher comonomer response than their disubstituted and trisubstituted counterpart ( Rn = 1,2-Me2 and r = 1,2,3-Me3 ) . they even incorporate more 1-hexene than Rn = H and Rn = me . these finding are qualitatively in agreement with the result of a theoretical study based on density functional calculation . the presence of comonomer doe not influence the termination reaction after the insertion of ethene . there is more frequent termination after each hexene insertion with increasing comonomer incorporation except for the two catalyst with split methyl substituents . the termination probability per inserted comonomer is highest for the le substituted catalyst . 1-Hexene wa polymerized by rac-(dimethylsilyl)bis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride catalyst and methylaluminoxane cocatalyst over the temperature range 0-100 ° C . the polymerization rate , polymer molecular weight , and polymer microstructure ( stereospecificity and regiospecificity ) were studied a a function of the temperature and the concentration of monomer , catalyst , and cocatalyst . the synthesis and characterization of rac-[ethylenebis(1-(tert-butyldimethylsilyl)-3-indenyl)] zirconium dichloride is reported . the silyl substituted <nUm> / MAO wa compared to it siloxy substituted analogue in ethylene homo- and in ethylene-1-hexene copolymerizations to elucidate the effect of the heteroatom on polymerization performance . the influence of monomer and cocatalyst concentration and the polymerization temperature wa investigated . the oxygen between the indenyl ligand and the bulky tert-butyldimethylsilyl group in the siloxy substituted <nUm> / MAO wa found to have a positive influence on polymerization activity and copolymerization performance . treatment of the tris(cyclopentadienyl) cation ( 1+ ) with zirconocene dichloride <nUm> gave , in almost quantitative yield , the <nUm> : <nUm> adduct 7+ , which wa isolated with [(CH3)B(C6F5)3]- a the counterion . reaction of 1+ with the organometallic ligand Cp3ZrCl afforded the <nUm> : <nUm> adduct 8+ , again isolated with [(CH3)B(C6F5)3]- . the x-ray analysis revealed that 7+ display a strongly bent Zr-Cl-Zr coordination mode , in contrast to 8+ , which ha a tendency to linear coordination . A theoretical analysis suggests that a subtle balance between steric and electronic factor determines the geometry in such organometallic adduct . treatment of bis(propynyl)zirconocene ( 5 ) with a stoichiometric quantity of BC18F15 lead to C-C coupling of the alkynyl ligand to form the zirconocene-(m-hexadiyne)-borate betaine complex <nUm> . this apparently is in an endothermic equilibrium with a methylenecyclopropene - type isomer <nUm> , formed by intramolecular alkyne insertion into the (sp2-carbon)-zirconium linkage , which is very effectively trapped by added scavenger reagent such a organic nitrile or isonitriles , to yield the stable unsaturated three- membered ring product <nUm> or <nUm> , respectively . subsequent hydrolysis remove the zirconocene moiety from the product , but the newly formed (sp2-carbon)- BC18F15 linkage remains intact . the resulting product <nUm> and <nUm> formally contain a central methylenecyclopropene framework , but their structural property point to a substantial p-delocalization , that indicates a pronounced participation of an enamino-substituted cyclopropenylium-borate betaine resonance structure . the description of the neutral betaine compound <nUm> and <nUm> a approaching cyclopropenylium cation - type compound that have their counteranion covalently bonded to them , is further supported by the observation of low activation barrier of the rotation around the exocyclic C3-C4 bond [ DG(CCrot) / ( ≠ ) ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 for 17a ] and around the C5-N linkage [ DG(CNrot) / ( ≠ ) ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 for 16a ] . the neutral cyclopropenylium-betaine compound 17a show a carbocation - like chemical reactivity , and insert tert-butyl isocyanide to yield the ring - expanded four - membered carbocyclic product <nUm> . n-pyrrolyllithium ( 1 ) add to BC18F15 to yield [(C4H4N)B(C6F5)3]Li ( 3 ) . the corresponding monoetherate ( 3*OEt2 ) wa characterized by x-ray diffraction and show an e5 coordination of the pyrrolyl moiety to the lithium cation . treatment of <nUm> with ClH in ether lead to H+ addition at a pyrrolyl a-position to yield the neutral dipolar bronsted acid system [(C4H5N)B(C6F5)3] ( 4 ) . the reagent <nUm> can be used to protonate Cp2Zr(CH3)3 to yield [ Cp2Zr(CH3)+(C4H 4N)B-(C6F5)3- ] ( 6 ) and methane . H+ transfer from <nUm> to (butadiene)-zirconocene result in the formation of the (p-allyl)metallocene salt [ (C4H7)ZrCp2+(C4H 4N)B(C6Fs)3- ] ( 8 ) . In analogous reaction , the neutral bronsted acid wa employed a a protonating activator component for the generation of homogeneous ziegler catalyst derived from a variety of (butadiene)-or (dimethyl)ansa-metallocenes . the system generated by treatment with <nUm> show comparable activity in ethene or propene polymerization reaction a conventionally generated group <nUm> metallocene ziegler catalyst . the new zirconocene [ ( e5-C5H4SiMe2N(SiMe 3)2]2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) ha been prepared in a convenient three - step synthesis . A crystal structure determination of <nUm> show two molecule in the unit cell , one in which the (Me3Si)2NSiMe2 group are accommodated in a nearly synperiplanar conformation directly above and below the Cl2Zr group , and one in which these group exhibit a synclinal conformation . the reaction of <nUm> with a mixture of Cl2OS / Cl2O2S lead to the formation of [(e5-C5H4SiMe2Cl] 2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) . the ab initio hartree - fock method ha been utilized to rationalize the conformational preference of racemic ethylene-bridged bis(indenyl) - type zirconocenes in dichloride and cationic methyl form . this group of catalyst is characterized by conformational isomerism due to fluxionality of the ethylene bridge resulting in two distinct orientation of the indenyl ligand , indenyl-forward ( π ) and indenyl-backward ( υ ) . A systematic investigation of the influence of methyl and trialkylsiloxy substitution on the relative stability of π and υ conformation wa performed . for the dichloride catalyst precursor the stability and orientation of the equilibrium structure are determined on the basis of repulsive interaction within the ligand framework . In the cationic methyl intermediate of the olefin polymerization catalytic cycle , the electron - rich indenyl ligand appears to reduce the electron deficiency of the cation by tilting towards the metal . the metallocene alkyne complex [Cp2M(L)(e2-Me3SiC2R)] react with diisobutylaluminium hydride at room temp. by addition of HAl(iBu)2 to yield the heterobimetallic complex [ {Cp2M}(m-e1:e2-RC C SiMe3)(m-H){Al(iBu)2} ] [ {Cp2M} : (e5C5H5)2Ti , r = ph <nUm> , r = SiMe3 <nUm> ; {Cp2M} : (e5-C5H5)2Zr , r = SiMe3 <nUm> ; {Cp2M} : (ebthi)Zr , r = SiMe3 <nUm> ] { ebthi : rac-[1,2ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl)] } . complex 1-4 were characterized by NMR spectroscopy and <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> investigated by x-ray crystal structure analysis . compound 1-4 were tested a initiator in the ring - opening polymerization of lactones . the result are discussed in comparison to the corresponding monometallic titanocene and zirconocene alkyne complex . the bridging function Me2Si , [(CH2)3(CMe2)2N]B and CH2 have been used to connect two imidazole in the 1,1'-position . the bisimidazolyl compound were treated with BH3 or BEt3 , and the resulting N,N'-bisborane - protected product <nUm> , 3b , 4a , and 5b were characterized by x-ray structure analysis . reaction of 1,1'-bis(4,5-dimethylimidazolyl) methane with BBr3 yielded the macrocyclic dicationic tetraimidazolyl compound <nUm> . the behavior of the N - protected bisimidazoles <nUm> and 3-5 towards deprotonating agent wa investigated and it wa found that 1,1'-bis(3-borane-4,5-dimethylimidazolyl)methane ( 5b ) is deprotonated to give a dianionic dicarbene compound . it reaction with Cp2MCl2 allowed the formation of the corresponding titanocene and zirconocene complex <nUm> and <nUm> , which were characterized by x-ray structure analysis . In <nUm> a 3c,2e B-H-Zr bond is present . the reaction of the mercaptocarboxylic acid HOOC(CH2)nSH ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) with H[AuCl4] followed by treatment with PMe2Ph led to the (phosphane)gold f [Au{S(CH2)nCOOH}(PMe2Ph)] [ n = <nUm> , ( 1 ) <nUm> ( 2 ) ] , which can act a metalloligands towards complex fragment of a second metal . compound <nUm> and <nUm> react with [ cp ° 2ZrMe2 ] ( cp ° = C5EtMe4 ) to give the trinuclear Zr / Au complex [ cp ° 2Zr{K1O-OOC(CH2)n SAu(PMe2Ph)}{K2O , O'-OOC(CH2)n-SAu(PMe2Ph) } ] [ n = <nUm> ( 3 ) , n = <nUm> ( 4 ) ] . complex 1-4 were characterized by 1H , 13C , 31P NMR and IR spectroscopy . the crystal structure of <nUm> show mono- and bidentate coordination of two metalloligands to one zirconocene fragment . In solution at room temperature <nUm> and <nUm> are dynamic , and the carboxylato group alternate between the mono- and bidentate bonding mode . complex <nUm> show catalytic activity in the oxidation of PPh3 with O . this paper describes the synthesis of a series of titanium and zirconium metallocenes bearing one or two first - generation silane dendritic wedge a bulky substituents at their cyclopentadienyl ring . wedge (R2R'SiCH2CH2)3SiCl [ r = R' = et ( 1 ) ; r = ph , R' = me ( 2 ) ] were prepared by hydrosilylation of chlorotrivinylsilane with R2R'SiH . they were reacted with K(C5H5 and , subsequently , with KH to give K[(R2R'SiCH2 CH2)3Si(C5H4) ] [ r = R' = et ( 3 ) ; r = ph , R' = me ( 4 ) ] . the dendronized cyclopentadienides <nUm> and <nUm> were the starting material for preparation of the mixed - ring titanocenes [ { ( R2R'SiCH2 CH2)3SiC5H4 } (C5R''5)TiCl2 ] [ r = R' = et , R'' = H ( 5 ) , R'' = me ( 6 ) ; r = ph , R' = me , R'' = H ( 7 ) , R'' = me ( 8 ) ] or the symmetrically substituted metallocenes [ { ( Ph2MeSiCH2 CH2)3SiC5 H4}2MCl2 ] [ m = Ti ( 9 ) , Zr ( 10 ) ] . cyclic voltammograms and catalytic behavior of all the new metallocenes in ethylene polymerization , using MAO a a co-catalyst , have been studied and compared to that of related non-dendritic complex . polyethylene polydispersities increase with the number of dendritic wedge in the catalyst , while activity decrease . bimodal molecular weight distribution were clearly observed for the bis-dendritic titanocene <nUm> . the 4-fulvenyl[2.2]paracyclophane ( 1 ) wa transformed , by treatment with lithium aluminium hydride and methyllithium in tetrahydrofuran , to the corresponding cyclopentadienyl anion <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . the iron complex <nUm> wa prepared from <nUm> , while <nUm> wa converted into the metal complex <nUm> ( Fe complex ) , <nUm> ( Ti ) , <nUm> ( Zr ) , <nUm> ( Ti ) , and <nUm> ( Zr ) . all new metallocene complex were characterized by their spectroscopic data . In addition , a single crystal x-ray crystallographic analysis wa performed for complex <nUm> . the metallacyclic zirconocene complex <nUm> wa synthesized by the reaction of the dichloride derivative <nUm> with two equivalent of n-butyllithium . after activation of complex 10-13 and <nUm> with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) they were used for the catalytic polymerization of ethene and propene . bis[(5-hexenyl)cyclopentadienyl]zirconium dichloride ( 3 ) underwent ring - closure olefin metathesis with loss of ethylene when treated with <nUm> mol % of the [ Cl2(PCy3)2Ru = CHPh ] catalyst in refluxing dichloromethane , to yield the large ansa - zirconocene complex [dec-5-ene-1,10-diylbis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)]ZrCl2 ( trans-4 ) . characterization by NMR and by x-ray diffraction revealed that the isolated complex contained a trans-C = C double bond inside the ansa bridge . similarly , bis[(allyl)cyclopentadienyl]ZrCl2 ( 7 ) gave the ansametallocene [but-2-ene-1,4-diylbis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)]zirconium dichloride ( cis-8 ) when treated with the same ruthenium metathesis catalyst ( <nUm> mol % ) under similar condition , except that a cis-C = C double bond wa now found to be present ( shown by NMR and x-ray diffraction ) . the cis-8 complex wa used a a homogeneous ziegler - natta catalyst for ethylene polymerization [ after activation of the metallocene dichloride <nUm> with MAO ( methylalumoxane ) or treatment of the corresponding dimethylmetallocene complex <nUm> with BC18F15 ] . complex <nUm> wa also converted into a mixture of ( scis- and s-trans-e4-butadiene)-ansa-metallocene complex ( s-cis-15 / s-trans-15 = <nUm> : <nUm> ) by treatment with (butadiene)-magnesium . the C = C double bond of cis-8 could be hydroborated with 9-BBN or with the H-B(C6F5)2 reagent . Li+[B(C6F5)4-] added to cis-8 to yield an interesting solid - state chain structure in which the [Zr]Cl2 unit and the o- / mF pair of two -C6F5 group were found to be in contact with the central lithium cation in a distorted octahedral coordination environment ( a shown by x-ray diffraction ) . (Butadiene)zirconocene ( s-trans- / s-cis-1 equilibrium mixture ) reacts with the imine MeN = CHPh ( 7a ) to form the <nUm> : <nUm> carbon-coupling product [ kN-MeN-CHPh-CH2-e3- (CHCHCH2)]ZrCp2 ( 8a ) . the x-ray crystal structure analysis of 8a revealed a metallacyclic structure featuring a distorted p-allyl moiety and a planar - tricoordinate nitrogen atom . only one of the two possible diastereoisomers is found in the crystal ( cis-8a ) a well a in solution . treatment of <nUm> with the more bulky aldimine PhCH2N = CHPh ( 7b ) selectively gave the corresponding <nUm> : <nUm> addition product trans-8b . ketimines PhCH2N = C5H8 ( 7c ) , HN = CPh2 ( 7d ) , or d1-2-methylpyrroline ( 7e ) also reacted selectively with (butadiene)zirconocene to yield the analogous metallacyclic C-C coupling product 8c-e . treatment of 8e with BC18F15 proceeded cleanly by abstraction of a hydride anion from the carbon atom α to the nitrogen atom to form the intramolecularly coordinated imine product 10a { with the [HB(C6F5)3-] anion } . similarly , Ph3C+ abstract a hydride ion from 8e to yield 10b { isolated with the [B(C6H5)4-] anion } . proton addition from HNR3+ reagent take place selectively at the Zr - amido nitrogen atom of the complex 8a or 8d to yield the substituted (p-allyl)zirconocene cation complex <nUm> or <nUm> , respectively . the cationic complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> polymerize ethene at room temperature / <nUm> bar of ethene with moderate catalytic activity . ( the cross-conjugated 1,1-diethynylethylene derivative 8b-10b were prepared from the corresponding bromide <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> by sonogashira coupling with trimethylsilylethyne and hydrolysis of the TMS-protected intermediate thus formed . coupling of the tetrabromide <nUm> with (trimethylsilylethynyl)magnesium bromide in the presence of 1,3-[bis(diphenylphosphanyl)propane] nickel (II) chloride yielded the protected tetraalkyne <nUm> , from which the 7,7,8,8-tetraethynyl-tetrahydro-p-quinodimethane <nUm> wa liberated by fluoride treatment . although <nUm> is a highly unstable cross-conjugated hydrocarbon , it could be converted into it tetraphenyl derivative by sonogashira coupling with phenyl iodide . both <nUm> and the corresponding tetraphenyl derivative were oxidized to the 7,7,8,8-tetraethynyl-dihydro-p-quinodimethane derivative <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively , on treatment with DDQ in dioxane . further dehydrogenation of <nUm> to <nUm> failed , however . alkylation of 9b with trimethylaluminium in the presence of zirconocene dichloride a catalyst yielded the semicyclic dendralene <nUm> , which on irradiation isomerized to the tricyclic diene <nUm> , presumably via the bicyclobutane <nUm> and a vinylcyclopropane rearrangement . hydration of 9b furnished <nUm> and <nUm> , the primary hydration product <nUm> either undergoing ketene elimination ( formation of <nUm> ) or a 1,5-hydrogen shift reaction ( to <nUm> ) from it tautomer <nUm> . analogously , the still more highly unsaturated derivative <nUm> wa alkylated to give the [5]dendralene derivative <nUm> and hydrated to give a mixture of the b-diketones <nUm> and <nUm> , the latter being produced from <nUm> by 1,2-methyl migration . the thermal cyclization of 10b to the homoacepentalene derivative <nUm> failed . A direct preparation of a-amino ketone derivative through treatment of acylzirconocene chloride with n-benzylideneaniline derivative , in which acylzirconocene chloride react a " unmasked " acyl anion donor , wa carried out under Yb(OTf)3 / TMSOTf - catalyzed condition . the same reaction were also carried out with the use of bronsted acid a catalyst in place of Yb(OTf)3 / TMSOTf . the operationally simple three - component reaction with aldehyde , aniline , and acylzirconocene chloride affords a-amino ketone derivative essentially in the absence of a catalyst . [Cp'2ZrCl(PHTipp)] ( 1 ) ( cp' = e5-C5MeH4 , tipp = 2,4,6-Pr3iC6H2 ) reacts with methyl formate with insertion and substitution to give [Cp'2ZrCl{OCH(PHTipp)2}] ( 2 ) . <nUm> wa characterized spectroscopically ( 1H , 31P NMR , IR , MS ) and by x-ray structure determination . only the meso-trans isomer is present in the solid state . the reaction of [e5-Cp2ZrCl2] ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) with [K(THF)n][N(PPh2)2] ( n = <nUm> - <nUm> ) and K[CH(PPh2NSiMe3)2] are reported the first reaction led to the monoamido complex [e5-Cp2Zr(Cl)N(PPh2)2] in which the { (Ph2P)2 N}- ligand - via a phosphorous and the nitrogen atom - is coordinated to the zirconium atom in a chelating ( e2 ) fashion . reaction of the potassium methanide compound , K{CH(PPh2NSiMe3)2} with zirconocene dichloride yield the carbene - like mono cyclopentadienyl complex [ e5-CpZr(Cl){C(PPh2NSiMe3) <nUm> } ] . the complex is formed by a salt metathesis and concomitant a cyclopentadiene extrusion . cyclopentadiene and metallocenes , typically zirconocene dichloride , are suitable substrate for multiple arylations with aryl bromide in palladium - catalyzed reaction . thus , various aryl bromide bearing either an electron - donating or an electron - withdrawing substituent can react with these substrate to afford the corresponding 1,2,3,4,5-pentaaryl-1,3-cyclopentadienes in a single preparative step . derivative of cyclopentadiene , including di-and trisubstituted cyclopentadienes , and indene are arylated in a similar fashion . the bridged , C1 - symmetric , single - component zirconocene [Zr{(Cp)-(Ind)CMe2}(Me)(thf)](BPh4) ( ind = indenyl , cp = cyclopentadienyl ) polymerises methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) selectively to isotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) ( PMMA ) without further cocatalysts or activator . to elucidate the stereoselective step of the polymerisation of MMA by using this catalyst we studied the propagation step occurring with the derivative [ Zr{(Cp)(Ind)CH2}-{-O-C(OMe) = C(Me)(Et)}(MMA)]+ by ab initio calculation at the hartree - Fock(HF) level of theory . after the initiation step , which consumes the first two MMA molecule , each new catalytic cycle begin with the stereoselective addition of a new MMA molecule at the indenyl side of the zirconocene fragment . At the same time the enolate ring undergoes a stereoselective inplane ring shift to the side opposite to the indenyl ring . these finding are used to postulate a mechanism for the polymerisation that explains the stereoselective synthesis of isotactic PMMA . A series of silyl-terminated diynes of varying length and substitution pattern have been prepared . these diynes undergo zirconocene coupling with selective formation of trimeric macrocycles from linear alkyne , while nonlinear diynes give cyclodimeric product . the length of the linear diynes can be increased for the preparation of macrocycles with large nanoscale cavity . reaction of the zirconium - containing macrocycles with acid result in the synthesis of metal - free cyclophanes . all of these macrocycles were prepared in multigram quantity , in the absence of high - dilution condition , to give product in > <nUm> % yield that are easily purified a crystalline solid . alkenyl zirconocene complex are readily obtained by diverse process including hydrozirconation , carbozirconation , and cyclozirconation of alkyne , transmetalations , and bond insertion .
