In combination with other metal , novel reaction manifold can emerge and provide access to useful synthetic building block . both catalytic asymmetric process and highly diastereoselective multicomponent transformation that involve the formation of three or more new carbon-carbon bond are feasible . this concept paper summarizes the current state of the art and opportunity for future reaction discovery in this field of research , with particular emphasis on synergistic effect of bimetallic combination of zirconocenes and zinc . one - pot procedure for the preparation of highly substituted indene , tetrahydroindenes , and cyclopentadienes have been developed by using a combination of zirconocene - mediated C-C - bond - forming reaction with lewis acid mediated activation of carbonyl group . the carbonyl group of aldehyde were deoxygenated in the reaction and behaved formally a a one-carbon unit . A variety of lewis acid were checked and showed different reactivity in this reaction . conversion of a racemic mixture of a chiral allene into a single enantiomer requires selective inversion of the absolute configuration of one specie . this can be accomplished a shown in equation ( 1 ) : the enantiopure imido complex <nUm> reacts more rapidly with one enantiomer of chiral 1,3-disubstituted allenes , and more slowly with the other , so a deficiency of <nUm> give an efficient kinetic resolution . for equimolar amount of <nUm> and a 1,3-disubstituted allene , both allene enantiomer are transformed into the same metallacycle . the enantioenriched allene , which now ha the same configuration a the fast reacting enantiomer , is released in high yield and high ee recovery upon treatment of the metallacycle with 1,2-propadiene . narrow band gap and high electron affinity are associated with the new oligomers containing thiophene-1-oxide and thiophene-dioxide that have been prepared by zirconocene coupling method . A series of oligomers with 3-11 ring ( x = 2H , S , and S( = 0)2 ; see picture ) allow the electronic property of conjugated chain to be investigated . of particular note is that the le electronic - withdrawing sulfoxide group result in the narrowest band gap . cleavage of the aldehyde C = O bond take place in the zirconocene- and AlCl3 - mediated cyclization of two molecule of an alkyne with an aldehyde to afford cyclopentadiene derivative [ eq. ( 1 ) ] . only one of the possible double - bond isomer is formed . the same method can also be used to couple two different alkyne with an aldehyde . In a single experiment , several supported zirconocene catalyst for a-olefin polymerization can be evaluated by a combinatorial concept . polyethylene particle produced by fluorescent dye tagged catalyst can be easily identified by their emission color , separated , and characterized ( see fluorescence microscope image ) . none the template - controlled synthesis of π ligand offer new method for synthesizing endohedral metallocenophanes . this strategy allows the assembly of previously inaccessible bridged metallocenes , for example , the doubly bridged cobaltocenes <nUm> , prepared from <nUm> , n = <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> . multiply metalated oligosilanes : treatment of bridged bis[tris(trimethylsilyl)silyl] compound with two equivalent of potassium tert-butoxide lead to the formation of 1,3- and 1,4-dipotassium silanes [ eq. ( 1 ) ] . reaction of the latter with zirconocene dichloride and hafnocene dichloride , respectively , give the corresponding metallacyclopentasilanes . how do alumoxane activator activate ? reaction ( 1 ) may help to answer this question . the product of this reaction is a zirconocene alkyl cation ( cp* = C5Me5 ) with it methylated boralumoxane anion . the structure of this compound is in accord with barron 's " latent lewis acidity " concept for alumoxane activator . the polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) in toluene with Cp2ZrMe2 ( 1 ) - Ph3C+B(C6 F5)4- ( 4 ) a initiating system wa kinetically investigated . this system can be regarded a a combination of the system described by collins and soga . only if the ratio of <nUm> / <nUm> wa larger than <nUm> , monomer conversion of more than <nUm> % and polymer with number - average molecular weight higher than <nUm> <nUm> and polydispersities <nUm> - <nUm> were obtained . from a kinetic analysis of time - conversion curve using the software package predici , it can be deduced that the mechanism is consistent with that proposed by collins et al. however , the mechanism ha to be extended by incorporating a first - order termination reaction of the active specie . rate coefficient of all elementary reaction were determined from time - conversion curve . the kinetic investigation were accompanied by ab initio calculation , which support the assumed kinetic model . combined system including diphenylzinc , Ph2Zn , a metallocene , and methylaluminoxane , MAO , have been employed to initiate styrene polymerization . these initiator system have been also used to initiate the copolymerization of styrene with p-alkylsubstituted styrene and with a-olefins . both polymerization and copolymerization process depend on the nature of the metallocene included in the initiator system , the presence of Ph2Zn , the temperature and the solvent used . titanocenes produced syndiotactic polystyrene , s-PS , while zirconocenes gave atactic polystyrene , a-PS , with a certain content , le the <nUm> % of s-PS . for copolymerizations the conversion to polymer wa also influenced by the comonomer nature and it molar proportion in the initial feed , a well a the sort of metallocene , titanocene or zirconocene included . sterically hindered olefin like norbornene , dimethanooctahydronaphthalene ( DMON ) , 4-methylpentene , and 3-methylbutene can be copolymerised with ethene by metallocene / MAO catalyst . different C2- , cs- and C1 - symmetric and meso-zirconocenes were used . only isolated and alternating norbornene sequence but no norbornene block are formed by substituted [Me2C(Cp-R)(Flu)]ZrCl2 catalyst . the alternating microstructure lead to melting point up to <nUm> ° C for ethene - norbornene copolymer and up to <nUm> ° C for the semi ycrystalline alternating copolymer of ethene and DMON . other sterically hindered olefin such a 3-methylpentene build more blocky structure with high glass transition temperature . the mechanism for the insertion reaction of the different catalyst is discussed . the combination of the copolymerisation ability and vinyl end group selectivity of siloxy substitution of ethylene-bridged bis(indenyl) zirconium dichloride suggest these catalyst a potential one for the production of polyethylene containing small amount of long chain branching . the role of the polymerisation condition with these highly active catalyst can clearly be seen . furthermore low content of multiple branch may occur , even though the probability of attaching several macromonomers into one chain is low . the effect on melt rheological behaviour depends on both the amount of long chain branching and the length of the branch . moreover the position of the siloxy group is very important . polymer synthesized with catalyst , where the siloxy group is in position <nUm> , give peculiar rheological behaviour resembling cross-linked network although the polymer are completely soluble . the polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) with the neutral enolate cp 2ZrMe[OC(OMe) = CMe <nUm> ] in the absence and in the presence of zirconocene cation cp 2ZrMe + to bypass the rate- limited initiation of the system wa investigated . only by itself the enolate is not active in polymerization , but a soon a the reaction system contains the cation MMA is quantitatively converted into syndiotactic - rich PMMA with high molecular weight ( m n > <nUm> <nUm> g mol <nUm> ) and very narrow molecular weight distribution ( m w / m n < <nUm> ) . the rate of polymerization wa found to be first order reffering to the neutral enolate and also reffering to the cation . rate coefficents of all elementary reaction were determined and compared to those received by the kinetic investigation of the polymerization using the initiator system cp 2ZrMe <nUm> / ph 3CB ( C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> . the agreement of both set of calculated coefficient is satisfying . these result confirm that the mechanism of collins et al. is suitable to describe the property of the polymerization process . the copolymerization of propene with small amount of ethene , catalyzed by tetrahydroindenyl zirconocenes such a [En(H4Ind)2]ZrCl22 or [Me2Si(H4Ind)2]ZrCl2 and MAO in liquid propene produce polymer with much higher activity and molecular weight than the homopolymerization of propene . the normal bisindenyl complex doe n't present such difference . the investigation of the microstructure show for the tetrahydroindenyl catalyst that after a 2,1-insertion of a propene unit the system is in a sleeping state and can be activated when an ethene unit is inserted . In this case these catalyst become faster than the ansa bis-indenyl catalyst . an active catalyst for the copolymerization of ethene and norbornene is the more temperature stable [Me3PhPen(Flu)]ZrCl2 . this catalyst produce atactic copolymer with high molecular weight of ' over <nUm> <nUm> g / mol at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> mol % of norbornene content . A series of asymmetric ansa - zirconocene dichloride were investigated in propene polymerization reaction with respect to monomer concentration and polymerization temperature . the two different coordination side of these " dual - side " catalyst allow a precise control of the total amount of randomly distributed isolated stereoerrors along the isotactic polymer chain leading to bulk property which can be adjusted from flexible , semicrystalline to excellent thermoplastic elastic . the obtained homopolypropenes have a great potential to come into competition with commercialized copolymer for possible industrial application . In this paper , we investigate different route to lower drastically the amount of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) required to activate racEt(Ind)2ZrX2 catalyst towards olefin polymerization . A first approach consists in replacing Cl ligand by more easily extractable x group such a me , CH2Ph or NMe2 group . A second method focus on the preparation of TMA - depleted MAO either by pumping off TMA from commercial MAO or by exploring new synthetic source to MAO via non-hydrolytic process such a the reaction of TMA with benzophenone . both method allowed u to produce polyolefins with a maximal catalytic activity for AI / Zr ratio not exceeding <nUm> , i.e. ratio <nUm> time lower than those required in the presence of commercial MAO . Meso-[Me2Si(2-Me-4,6-iPr2Ind)2 Cl2Zr wa synthesized in a pure form and used a catalyst for the copolymerization of ethene and a-olefins . the result are compared with polymer obtained by C1 - symmetric metallocenes and constrained geometry catalyst . the activity of the meso form is remarkable high and reach more than <nUm> <nUm> kg polymer / mol zr*h . the ligand structure ha large influence on the incorporation of 1-octene forming thermoplastic ( LLDPE ) and thermoplastic elastomer ( POE ) . this work examines a polymerisation catalyst based on zirconocene with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a a cocatalyst on silica surface . calculation were carried out using the atom superposition and electron delocalisation method ( ASED-MO ) considering the ( 111 ) and ( 100 ) silica plane , both completely and partially hydrated . our result suggest the production of a cationic zirconocene a a final step for the active site formation for ( 111 ) silica plane , occurring preferentially on partially hydrated silica . on the contrary this may not be possible for the ( 100 ) plane resulting in this case in the formation of a MAO - zirconocene complex a a final and most stable state . this work present a proposal for a mechanism of olefin polymerization using metallocenes , taking into account the effect of the counter ion , solvent , and olefin . the ystenes mechanism is also evaluated for the different symmetry of zirconocenes and for soluble and supported catalyst . the mechanism is related to experimental evidence and analyzed taking into account publisbed result about polymer characterization , kinetic evidence , and other experimental fact . the model try to give a reasonable explanation for the different dependency of the kinetics on the monomer : between <nUm> and <nUm> for Cs and C2 catalyst and <nUm> for c2v . bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconocene dimethyl ( Cp2ZrMe2 ) combined with triphenylcarbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] ) wa brought into contact with a suspension of <nUm> % cross-linked poly(4-vinylpyridine) to give a new type of polymer - supported cationic zirconocene catalyst . the resulting polymer - supported catalyst system combined with Al(i-Bu3) showed markedly high activity for ethylene polymerization in even a non-polar solvent like hexane at 25-60 ° C and [Al] / [Zr] molar ratio 40-200 . by the analysis of Zr content of the hexane solution , it wa found that no Zr wa detected in the solution , i.e. no leaching of the cationic catalyst into the hexane medium . the catalytic activity wa found to increase with an increase of polymerization temperature and showed the highest at [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> . the molecular weight , crystalline melting temperature , crystallinity , and bulk density of polyethylene formed were higher than those of the polymer obtained from the homogeneous system . the cationic bridged zirconocene complex [iPr(Cp)(Ind)Zr(Me)(THF)][BPh4] ( 1-BPh4 ) wa synthesized . polymerization of methyl methacrylate with 1-BPh4 in CCl2H2 at temperature between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C led to the formation of isotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) . the low polydispersity index of the polymer obtained and a successful two step polymerization of methyl methacrylate with 1-BPh4 are hint towards a living polymerization mechanism . 1H and 13C NMR analysis revealed an enantiomorphic site - controlled mechanism for the formation of isotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) . communication : using two different zirconocene / MAO catalyst system , propene wa copolymerized with the comonomers 2-(9-decene-1-yl)-1,3-oxazoline and 2-(4-(10-undecene-1-oxo)phenyl)-1,3-oxazoline , respectively . the catalyst used were rac-Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 and rac-Me2:Si[2-Me-4 , 5-BenzInd]2ZrCl2 . up to <nUm> mol- % oxazoline could be incorporated into polypropene . oxazoline content , molecular weight , degree of isotacticity and melting behavior were dependent on the catalyst system , comonomer structure and comonomer concentration in the feed . ethylene wa polymerized with cycloalkylidene-bridged cyclopentadienyl metallocene catalyst 1-9 in the presence of methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) a the cocatalyst . unlike the normal titanocene catalyst , the cycloalkylidene-bridged cyclopentadienyl titanocene catalyst show much higher activity than the corresponding zirconocene and hafnocene catalyst and show the highest activity at higher temperature . this indicates that the cycloalkylidene-bridged cyclopentadienyl titanocene system is very thermally stable and maybe a very promising catalyst system for industrial application . C2 - symmetric zirconocenes activated by methylaluminoxane were utilized a catalyst in the polymerization of 1,3-diolefins . the result indicate that the most crowded catalytic precursor rac[CH2(3-tertbutyl-1-indenyl)2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) is also the most active one , giving 1,4-polymerization of 1,3-butadiene and (Z)-1,3-pentadiene and 1,2-polymerization of (E)-1,3-pentadiene and 4-methyl-1,3-pentadiene . probably , the different behavior of <nUm> with respect to other C2 - symmetric zirconocenes utilized is due to the different stability of the bond between the last inserted monomer unit and the metal , a well a to the coordination of incoming monomer . In this review , various synthetic and structural aspect of methylaluminoxane and the elementary process involved in olefin polymerization , a identified by various spectroscopic technique , are detailed . various boron - based counterions and their interaction with metal - locenium cation are discussed . A comparison between MAO and boron - based activator in term of catalytic activity and polymer characteristic is made . finally , the use of the above system in the polymerization of cationically polymerizable monomer and acrylate is discussed . we report the first successful block copolymerization of ethylene and methyl methacrylate using a zirconocene - based catalyst system . the catalyst is generated in situ from Me2C(Cp)(Ind)ZrMe2 and BC18F15 in toluene . block copolymerization is achieved via the sequential addition of the monomer , starting with ethylene . the composition of the block copolymer is shown to be dependent on the time allowed for ethylene polymerization . the solubility of the resulting polymer , NMR data and GPC measurement are discussed , and a polymerization mechanism is proposed . the kinetics of the ethylene-norbornene copolymerization , catalyzed by rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO , <nUm> % rac / <nUm> % meso-Et(4,7-Me2Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO and rac-H2C(3-tert-BuInd)2ZrCl2 / MAO wa followed by sampling from the reaction mixture at fixed time interval . catalyst activity , copolymer composition and molar mass were studied a a function of time . the polymer showed an unusually low polydispersity and a significant increase in their molar mass with time , suggesting a quasi-living polymerization . this work present a theoretical and experimental study of the active site formation in the system EtInd2ZrCl2 / MAO . result about the effect of additive a a lewis acid ( AlCl3 ) or a lewis base ( EB ) are also anaylzed . the theoretical study take into account all the known step in the active site formation : alkylation of zirconocene , formation of a polarized complex metallocene : MAO , formation of a contact ion pair and finally a solvent separated ion pair . other reaction of the zirconocene with other aluminum alkyl ( AlCl3 and AlMe3 ) are also presented and studied . UV - vi experimental result of the additive effect are reported and explained taking into account the theoretical result . A short review of our result and others is presented to complete and discus the idea . the most probable site are loosened contact ion pair , not the solvent separated ion pair . the central purpose of this work is to develop an to attach the metallocene to a support without diminishing it catalytic activity . this article describes several method to prepare supported EtInd2ZrCl2 ( EBI ) on MAO / O2Si , varying the washing step duration and washing step temperature . the best method is the one that support <nUm> % Zr on MAO / O2Si with a final content of Al near <nUm> % . it seems that this method combine high efficiency in MAO usage at the preparation step and high activity in propylene polymerization . the activity of the supported catalyst EBI / MAO / O2Si decrease to the third of the soluble catalyst EBI / MAO with the same Al / Zr molar ratio . Zr con tent higher than <nUm> % produce catalyst with lower productivity . probably , a MAO coverage in O2Si that is higher than a monolayer is not useful in order to stabilize the zirconocene on the MASO / O2Si support . this paper report the kinetics of the supported catalyst and a discussion about the shape of the curve and the stability of the catalyst is appended . the molecular weight of the poly(propylene) obtained with supported catalyst increase , especially for the best preparation , comparing it with material obtained with the soluble one . the regioregularity of poly(propylene) increase when a lewis base ( ethyl benzoate-E.B . ) is added a external additive to the system EBI / MAO / O2Si and the activity of the supported catalyst is improved . this paper report the effect of co- and non-copolymerizable lewis base in propylene polymerization with the soluble system EtInd2ZrCl2 / MAO . with non-copolymerizable lewis base , the activity and the molar mass of poly(propylene) are diminished . this result is unusual because there is agreement about the cationic nature of the active site in zirconocene / MAO system and the effect of a lewis base must be to decrease the termination constant versus the propagation constant , considering the diminished electrophilicity of Zr . In the case of copolymerizable lewis base , the negative effect on activity is higher . an explanation of the data is given , with a new model of lewis base / cationic Zr interaction , taking account of recent report about the structure of active site . ethylene wa polymerized using a combination of Ni(a-diimine)Cl2 ( 1 ) ( a-diimine = 1,4-bis(2,6-diisopropylphenyl)acenaphthenediimine ) and rac-ethylene bis(IndH4)ZrCl2 ( 2 ) ( IndH4 = 4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-ns-indenyl ) compound , activated with methylaluminoxane in toluene . the polymerization were performed at three different temperature ( <nUm> . 30. and <nUm> ° C ) , and the effect of varying the zirconium loading molar fraction ( xZr ) wa monitored . the polymerization run carried out of <nUm> and <nUm> ° C show that the productivity increase linearly with xZr . on the other hand , at <nUm> ° C the productivity reach a maximum of <nUm> × <nUm> kg of PE / mol[M]*h for xZr = <nUm> , indicating a non-linear correlation between the productivity and xZr . the polyethylene characteristic have been evaluated by mean of differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) , and scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) . the PE produced at <nUm> and <nUm> ° C showed monomodal molecular weight distribution with narrow polydispersities . At higher temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) , using xZr = <nUm> , two different polyethylene were produced ; an amorphous rubbery PE with mw of <nUm> × <nUm> g*mol-1 and a linear high density PE with mw of <nUm> × <nUm> g*mol-1 . DSC thermogram of the PE obtained at <nUm> ° C ( xZr = <nUm> - <nUm> ) showed the presence of two melting point corresponding to branched and linear PE , indicating a low compatibility between the phase . by SEM it wa observed that the branched polyethylene obtained at <nUm> ° C form very small aggregate dispersed in the linear polyethylene matrix , but the polymer obtained at <nUm> ° C form larger particle which show low compatibility with the linear polyethylene . phenol - functionalized polyethylene were prepared by copolymerization of ethylene with 4-allylanisole in the presence of metallocene / MAO catalysis , followed by demethylation . anisole group incorporated in polyethylene main chain were quantitatively converted to phenol functional group by treating the copolymer with AlCl3 . the copolymerization of ethylene with 4-allylanisole revealed that the bridged metallocene catalyst seemed to favor the incorporation of the polar comonomer compared to the hindered metallocene catalyst . increase of the MAO concentration markedly enhanced the activity of the catalyst , but it diminished the incorporation of the polar comonomer . the end group analysis of the copolymer showed that chain transfer to aluminium occured more frequently than other chain transfer reaction . detail of the preparation and polymerization behavior of two chiral zirconocene catalyst are presented . the result of experimental and molecular - mechanic evaluation of their stereoselectivity with respect to liquid - propene polymerization are compared with those of a related catalyst system . the elastic property of the obtained amorphous poly(propylene) , due to the presence of small g-form crystallite , are compared with those of a highmolecular weight atactic poly(propylene) obtained in the presence of a c2v catalyst . propylene polymerization wa conducted with the Cp2ZrHCl / BC18F15 / [tBuNSiMe2Flu]TiMe2 catalyst system with AlOct3 a a scavenger at <nUm> ° C . the polymer obtained displayed a bimodal molar mass distribution . it could be confirmed that the polymer with higher mn wa produced from Zr active site and the polymer with lower mn resulted from Ti active site . In both fraction , mn wa increased linearly with increasing polymerization time . the MWD ( mw / mn ) value of each fraction were around <nUm> . thus , it could be said that propylene polymerization proceeded in a living manner even with zirconocene active specie by using the mixed metallocene system . the living like polymerization of propylene with Cp2ZrMe2 / BC18F15 / Cp*TiCl3 wa also demonstrated at <nUm> ° C . under the reaction between carbon monoxide ( CO ) and this living polypropylene ( PP ) at <nUm> ° C , it could be found that CO wa quantitatively incorporated into living PP . propylene polymerization wa conducted with CS symmetric (Ph2C)CpFluZrCl2 / B(C6 F5)3 / cp* TiMe3 system using AlOct3 a a scavenger at <nUm> ° C . the polymer produced wa consisted by two kind of fraction ; i.e. , hexane soluble ( atactic ) fraction and hexane insoluble fraction . the insoluble polymer had highly syndiotactic structure , indicating that the polymer wa produced from CS symmetric zirconocene . mu 's increased linearly with increasing polymer yield , although the activity wa low . thus , it could be said that syndiospecific polymerization of propylene proceeded in a living like manner with CS symmetric zirconocene active specie by using the mixed metallocene system . and by the reaction of the syndiotactic poly(propylene) chain end with carbon monoxide ( CO ) , it could be found that CO wa quantitatively incorporated into the syndioPP-Zr chain end . the polymerization of 1-hexene with the catalyst system Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO and Me2SiInd2ZrCl2 / MAO is investigated in order to elucidate the nature of the active specie in zirconocene / MAO catalyzed polymerization . varying monomer concentration and monomer conversion doe not result in any unexpected behavior . however , changing catalyst and cocatalyst concentration lead to broadened , or even bimodal , molecular weight distribution under certain reaction condition . these result may be interpreted in term of a coexistence of two active specie with different rate of propagation and of termination . the effect of polymerization temperature on the polymerization of 1-hexene with the catalyst system Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO , Me2SiCp2ZrCl2 / MAO , EtInd2ZrCl2 / MAO , Me2SiInd2ZrCl2 / MAO and 1PrCpFluZrCl2 / MAO is investigated in this paper . the molecular weight and the molecular weight distribution of poly(1-hexene) provide experimental evidence for a deviation from single - site behavior at certain polymerization temperature , depending on the catalyst system . experimental result are interpreted in term of different active specie prevailing at different polymerization temperature , and coexisting under certain reaction condition . A series of Cp'(C5H5)ZrCl2 and Cp2'ZrCl2 precatalysts ( cp' = C5HMe4 , C4Me4P , C5Me5 , C5H4tBu , C5H3-1,3-tBu2 , C5H2-1,2,4tBu3 ) together with C10Cl2H10Zr wa used for the directed oligomerization of propene and 1-hexene in comparative experiment . oligomer characterization wa carried out by 1H NMR , SEC ( GPC ) , MALDI - TOF , MS , cryoscopy and raman spectroscopy . from 1H NMR the nature and relative ratio of the double - bond end group is determined together with Mn if every oligomer molecule contains such a double bond ( from b-hydrogen elimination ) are found . from 1H NMR and MALDI - TOF MS also vinyl end group ( from b-methyl elimination ) are observed in the case of oligopropenes with (C4Me4P)-(C5H5)ZrCl2 and with the symmetrical methyl containing Cp2'ZrCl2 pre-catalyst . the vinylidene / vinyl ratio depends on the ligand and increase from C5HMe4 ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) over C4Me4P ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) to C5Me5 ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) . A comparison of Mn from 1H NMR and SEC together with MALDI - TOF MS show that the phospholyl-zirconocenes and (C5HMe4)2ZrCl2 also exhibit chain transfer to aluminium , thereby giving saturated oligomers . copolymerization of ethylene and cyclopentene ( CPE ) wa carried out with various non-bridge and bridged zirconocene catalyst using methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . non-bridged metallocene catalyst effected ethylene homopolymerization without copolymerization . on the other hand , bridged zirconocene catalyst produced copolymer containing cis-1,2-cyclopentane unit . among the used catalyst , rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride [Et(Ind)2ZrCl2] gave copolymer containing the highest amount of CPE unit by 1,2-insertion of 1,3-insertion . temperature - rising elution fractionation of the copolymer using 1,2-dichlorobenzene a a solvent showed a broad distribution of copolymer composition in copolymer obtained by specific zirconocene catalyst . A series of sila - bridged dinuclear zirconocenes [ E(C5H4)2[Cp'ZrCl2]2 ( Cp'C5H5 , e = Me2Si ( 1 ) Me2SiSiMe2 ( 2 ) , Me2SiOSiMe2 ( 3 ) , Me2SiOSiMe2OSiMe2 ( 4 ) Cp'C5HME4 , e = Me2SiOSiMe2 ( 5 ) , Me2SiOSiMe2OSiMe2 ( 6 ) ) have been synthesized . these complex have been studied a catalyst for ethylene polymerizationin the presence of MAO . polymerization result indicated that the polymerization activity of the zirconocenes increased a the bridging ligand became longer for the same type of bridging ligand . complex <nUm> , holding trisiloxane bridging , exhibited greater activity than the mononuclear zirconocene [Cp2ZrCl2] . all the siloxane - bridged dinuclear zirconocenes showed the highest activity than at higher temperature ( <nUm> or <nUm> ° C ) in contrast to the corresponding siloxane - bridged dinuclear cyclopentadienyl and indenyl zirconocenes which showed a maximum activity at <nUm> ° C . the molecular weight of polyethylene with <nUm> wa very high at low temperature ( <nUm> × <nUm> g · mol at <nUm> ° C ) but decreased significantly with increasing temperature . the molecular weight distribution obtained for polyethylene were similar with the mononuclear metallocene catalyst at low temperature . the tetramethylcyclopentadienyl complex <nUm> and <nUm> showed lower polymerization activity than the corresponding cyclopentadienyl complex <nUm> and <nUm> a a result of steric effect . the relationship between structure and catalytic property of catalyst ha been discussed . the solvent effect observed in propene / 1-hexene copolymerizations performed with the isospecific catalyst rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO is studied . A range of solvent with increasing donor character and steric hindrance ha been tested , and their effect on copolymer yield , composition , and microstructure ha been thoroughly analyzed . our result demonstrate that the solvent can have a significant influence on the comonomer reactivity , even though the solvent polarity is not the relevant factor . At the same comonomer composition in solution , polymerization carried out in coordinating solvent ( e. g. , aromatic solvent ) , lead to the formation of product with considerably decreased content of 1-hexene . the reuced incorporation of the higher a-olifen is explained in term of competition between the nucleophilic medium and the olefin monomer for coordination to the active polymerization site . these result give u valuable information regarding the mechanism of polymerization at the active center . copolymerization of ethylene and 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) wa carried out with non-bridged or bridged zirconocene catalyst using methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a a cocatalyst . the resulting copolymer were extracted with boiling o-dichlorobenzene ( ODCB ) to fractionate into soluble and insoluble part . the ligand structure of zirconocenes , the feed ratio of HD , and the catalyst concentration strongly affected the copolymer composition . In the copolymerization with non-bridged zirconocene catalyst , the amount of boiling ODCB - soluble part decreased with increasing HD content in the copolymer . on the other hand , with bridged zirconocene catalyst , it increased with increasing HD content in the copolymer . the bridged zirconocene catalyst were apt to take in more HD than non-bridged catalyst . effect of catalyst concentration wa investigated in relation to crosslinking reaction . temperature - rising elution fractionation ( TREF ) of the boiling ODCB - soluble part wa conducted to show the occurrence of heterogenous composition in copolymer obtained with some specific zirconocene catalyst . three series of novel unbridged bicyclic cyclopentadienyl zirconium complex , containing six- , seven- and eight - membered saturated ring fused to the cyclopentadienyl unit and bearing different substituents ( -H , -CH3 , -Ph ) in position <nUm> , were used in combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) for the polymerization of propene at different temperature . all the catalyst have been shown to be active , the lowest activity being observed with the eight - membered ring system . with most catalyst the polymer obtained are fully atactic when the polymerization are conducted at <nUm> ° C , and become partially isotactic at lower temperature . the 13C NMR analysis show that in one case , that is , when the seven - membered ring is associated with the phenyl substituent in position <nUm> , a preponderance of the isotactic heptad in the methyl region of 13C NMR spectrum is observed , which allows u to hypothesize the formation of stereoblocks . the copolymerization of propene with ethene in feed concentration up to <nUm> mol- % ethene wa investigated in dependence on catalyst substitution , activation and process condition . polymerization reaction were performed using rac-[ethylene-bis(e5-1-indenyl)]ZrCl2 ( 1a ) , [bis(e5-1-indenyl)dimethylsilane]ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , and [bis(e5-1-(2-methylindenyl))dimethylsilane]ZrCl2 ( 3a ) after MAO- and rac-[ethylene-bis(e5-1-indenyl)]Zr(CH3)2 ( 1b ) a well a [bis-(e5-1-(2-methylindenyl))dimethylsilane]Zr CH3 ( 3b ) after borate - activation . A detailed study of the polymerization kinetics of the different metallocene catalyst wa performed by using an autoclave system that allowed to follow the change in concentration of propene and ethene in the gas and in the liquid phase , even for the first minute of the polymerization experiment . it is known that 2-methyl substitution retard the rate of chain transfer to propene monomer , leading to increased molecular weight of the resulting homopolypropenes . however , the catalyst system 3a / MAO , bearing a CH3 - substituent in 2,2'-position of the indenyl moiety , show a significant decline of the molecular mass of propene - ethene copolymer by rising the ethene concentration , while catalyst 1a and <nUm> , having no methyl substitution , give a distinct increase of molecular weight . our investigation show that the observed molecular weight decline is independent of the process condition , but it depends clearly on the catalyst substitution and , in some case , on the activation process . b-Hydride elimination to the Zr(IV) - center is the dominating chain termination process for metallocene catalyst bearing methyl group in the 2,2'-position . chain termination via transfer to monomer and to aluminum are the preferred termination mechanism for complex lacking the CH3 substituents . copolymerizations of ethylene and 1,7-octadiene ( OD ) and 1,9-decadiene ( DD ) were investigated with various non-bridged and bridged zirconocene catalyst using methylisobutylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . the resulting copolymer were extracted with boiling o-dichlorobenzene ( ODCB ) , and the structure of the boiling ODCB - soluble part wa studied by 1H , 13C NMR and DEPT ( distortionless enhancement of polarization transfer ) spectroscopy . In the case of ethylene / OD copolymerization , the ligand structure of the zirconocene catalyst strongly affected the propagation mode of OD . the zirconocene catalyst having cyclopentadienyl or pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand gave copolymer having 1-hexenyl and 1,3-disubstituted cycloheptane unit , derived from 1,2-addition propagation and addition - cyclization propagation of OD , respectively . on the other hand , the zirconocene catalyst with indenyl ligand produced the copolymer having exclusively 1,3-disubstituted cycloheptane unit . furthermore , the copolymer prepared by diphenylmethylene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride wa crosslinked . the diastereostructure of the 1,3-disubstituted cycloheptane unit in the copolymer wa not influenced by the stereospecificity of the catalyst used , and a cis-structure wa preferentially formed . In the case of the copolymerization of ethylene and DD , the c2v- symmetric zirconocene catalyst produced the copolymer with 1-octenyl branch derived from 1,2-addition propagation of DD . other C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocene catalyst with bulky ligand yielded copolymer with crosslinking structure derived form addition propagation of sidechain unsaturated bond of 1,2-added DD unit . none none none none treatment of z-vinyl carbamate with dicyclopentadienyl(diethyl)zirconium [Et2ZrCp2] lead to cyclobutyl-zirconocene derivative in good yield and a a unique diastereoisomer . the reaction proceeds through a carbometalative ring - expansion followed by an intramolecular migratory insertion . polyethylene-b-poly(methyl methacrylate ) ( PE-b-PMMA ) diblock copolymer ha important interfacial application . hence , a PE-b-isotactic PMMA diblock copolymer wa synthesized using SiMe2(Ind)2ZrMe2 and MAO cocatalyst . the polymerization mechanism and the origin of PMMA isotacticity were duly explained . an appropriate nonisothermal avrami - erofeev crystallization model wa developed to compare the crystallization kinetics of the above copolymer with that of a PE homopolymer . for both polymer , the model well matched the entire differential scanning calorimeter crystallinity profile , notably for a single avrami - erofeev index , and predicted cylindrical crystal growth . this model particularly overcomes the limitation of the published nonisothermal crystallization model , and provides interesting insight into PE crystallization . the PMMA block significantly decreased the heat of crystallization and fusion , % crystallinity , and the relative crystallization function ; increased the nonisothermal crystallization rate constant ; and introduced minimal dilution effect whereas the PE block formed a continuous or percolated phase . this study correlate catalyst structure , copolymer block tacticity , and PE nonisothermal crystallization and melting behavior . the complete manuscript of this communication appears in : angew. chem. suppl . <nUm> , <nUm> . ( figure presented . ) A novel , soluble Ziegler-Natta catalyst enables the preparation of isotactic polypropylene , which exhibit a higher degree of isotacticity than polymer that can be produced industrially with heterogeneous catalyst . furthermore , isotactic polybutene can also be obtained with such a catalyst . the chiral , rigid zirconocene derivative <nUm> and methylalumoxane <nUm> are used for the catalysis . the polymerization activity is remarkably high . ( figure presented . ) the structure and creativity spectrum of transition-metal carbene complex ha been widened significantly by the bent metallocenes of titanium , zirconium , and hafnium . proceeding from metal carbonyl and reactive (butadiene)- , (aryne)- , or ( olefin ) MCp2 complex , many new fischer-type metaloxycarbene complex of Zr , Hf , V , Nb , Cr , Mo , W , Mn , Re , Fe , Ru , Os , Co , Ni , and Rh have been synthesized . the incorporation of titanocene , zirconocene , or hafnocene fragment allows new type of carbene complex to be prepared . for the (alkylidenamido)metallocene complex ( formula presented . ) , metallocene ylides ( formula presented . ) , and binuclear (m-alkynyl)metallocene compound , some metalligand π bonding is indicated . metallocene complex with metallaoxirane unit , ( formula presented . ) , show similar chemical behavior to that of binuclear (m-methylene)complexes ( formula presented . ) . the methylene group of zirconaoxirane complex , which are derived from carbon monoxide , may be expelled a ethylene by thermally induced CC coupling . with metal hydride , CH2 transfer with insertion into the metal – hydride bond occurs . In one case , methylene insertion into a metal – carbon bond can even be observed . these reaction of ti-group metallaoxiranes could be model for postulated intermediate in the fischer – tropsch synthesis . approximately <nUm> % stereoselectivity in the creation of the second chiral center is observed during olefin oligomerization when chiral zirconocene complex (S)-1 together with methylalumoxane is used a catalyst . the oligomerization product mixture can be largely restricted to dimer through pentamers by appropriate choice of catalyst-to-monomer concentration . relatively straight forward access is thereby provided to alkyl-substituted 1-alkenes such a <nUm> and <nUm> , which could be of interest in the synthesis of pheromone and other modestly functionalized chiral compound . ( figure presented . ) none the development of catalytic process that effect enantioselective bond formation under mild condition is an important and challenging task in modern chemical synthesis . In this connection , chiral C2 - symmetric ansa - metallocenes ( bridged metallocenes ) have found notable application a catalyst . this article discus the chemistry of this class of chiral metallocene complex with regard to their utility in catalytic and enantioselective C-C and C-H bond formation reaction . In addition , where applicable , a brief comparison with other related catalytic enantioselective process is offered . many of the reaction effected with high level of enantioselectivity by catalytic amount of these complex are of great significance to the preparation of new material and in the synthesis of therapeutic agent . for example , zirconocene complex readily catalyze the enantioselective addition of alkylmagnesium halide to alkene , and cationic zirconocene complex may promote the highly stereoregulated copolymerization of terminal alkene . furthermore , the related chiral titanocenes are involved in an impressive range of useful asymmetric catalytic reaction , including the enantioselective hydrogenation of olefin and reduction of imines or ketone . this review attempt to bring together the practical aspect of the use of [(ebthi)M] complex of group <nUm> transition metal ( catalyst synthesis and resolution ) , outline the manner in which the C2 - symmetric chiral ligand are believed to initiate stereoselective bond formation , and highlight the aspect of this chemistry that are le well understood and require further research . none none after more than <nUm> year , the friedel - craft alkylation is still one of the most studied and most utilized reaction in organic synthesis . what is the secret of this astonishing success ? perhaps the great versatility in scope and applicability continues to justify it crucial role in the synthesis of more and more complex molecule . however , it ha taken more than a century for asymmetric catalytic version of this reaction to be developed and subsequently extended to a range of aromatic compound and alkylating agent . herein we review recent development in the design and use of catalytic and stereoselective strategy for the alkylation of aromatic system and synthesis of a wide range of polyfunctionalized enantiomerically enriched compound . terminal alkene act a dual nucleophiles in a zirconocene - mediated , highly 1,4-diastereoselective , tandem reduction - allylation reaction of 1,4-diketones . A zirconocene - alkene complex ( in equilibrium with an allyl-zirconocene-hydride specie ) can deliver both hydride and an allyl group to a diketone , with control of the relative configuration of up three new stereogenic center ( see scheme ) . 1,2-Dehydro-o-carborane , a three - dimensional relative of benzyne , ha been successfully prepared and structurally characterized for the first time in the form of a zirconocene complex ( see picture ) . this carborane molecule exhibit unique e3-bonding characteristic , with an unprecedented Zr-H-B agostic interaction , a well a two Zr - C bond , which serve to stabilize the cage . unexpectedly 1-Alkynylphosphonates react with two equivalent of Ti(OiPr)2 to give phosphonates <nUm> . deuterium labeling suggests a dinuclear titanium intermediate <nUm> . the reaction is general for non-hindered 1-alkynylphosphonates . addition of br2 or I2 to <nUm> produce compound <nUm> . an unusual linkage : the zirconocene - catalyzed hydrooligomerization of norbornene proceeds by s-bond metathesis to form a 2-exo,7-syn linkage ( a evident in the pentamer shown ) . the oligomers were characterized by gas chromatography , NMR spectroscopy , x-ray crystallography , and DFT calculation . structural limitation in small cyclic hydrocarbon are a longstanding challenge to chemistry , leading to molecule with unusual geometric parameter and reactivity . for example , incorporation of C = C = C = C or C-C ≡ C-C arrangement , which are normally linear in open - chain compound , into small carbocyclic ring result in enormous ring strain a a result of the angle deformation . nevertheless , such uncommon structure have been realized by complexation of zirconocene fragment with butadiynes and butatrienes , giving five - membered metallacyclocumulenes and metallacyclopentynes . the metal atom is essential for these molecule but complicates the simplified description because of internal interaction of the metal with the multiple bond . unexpected result are obtained on treatment of alkene - zirconocene complex with cyclic enol ether . the ring size of the enol ether make the reaction proceed through different mechanism allowing zalkenols to be prepared from furan derivative and cyclobutanes from pyran derivative ( see scheme ) . tacticity tactic : the dinuclear bis(enolate) complex <nUm> , when activated with [PhNHMe2][B(C6F5)4] , is an effective initiator of living methyl methacrylate polymerization , providing partially syndiotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) with a narrow molecular - weight distribution . mechanistic study showed that <nUm> is transformed into a cationic enolate complex and this dinuclear specie is involved in propagation . alternative catalyst : the hydroamination of nonactivated double bond ha been the domain of rare - earth - metal catalyst . now alkyl zirconocene and titanocene cation , which are readily prepared from commercially available precursor , are shown to be active catalyst in the hydroamination / cyclization of secondary aminoalkenes to give tertiary pyrrolidines and piperidines . chloride coordination is the key : dimethylzirconocene reacts with amide to form methylzirconium amide complex . on heating , in the presence of a chloride source , these compound are converted into n-acylimidozirconocene complex that react intramolecularly to form the corresponding nitrile compound ( see scheme ; cp = CH ) . mechanistic study reveal that chloride coordination to zirconium is required for this transformation to occur . ( chemical equation presented ) carbon ligand transfer : compound <nUm> is formed with reactive metal - ligand fragment generated from group <nUm> metallocene compound . dropwise addition of ethanolic ClH to a solution of complex <nUm> in toluene affords complex <nUm> in a carbon-carbon bond - forming transformation that is thought to be unprecedented . ( figure presented ) bringing together : zirconium and hafnium d0 metallocene complex catalyze the dehydrocoupling of the stibines MesSbH <nUm> ( me = mesityl ) and dmpSbH2 ( dmp = 2,6-dimesitylphenyl ) to Sb4Mes4 and (dmp)Sb = sb(dmp) , respectively , with liberation of H . kinetic analysis show that thermal decomposition of hafnium stibide complex proceeds through a-hydrogen migration and stibinidene elimination . ( chemical equation presented ) not a catalyst killer : In the reaction of <nUm> with BC18F15 , a nucleophilic aromatic substitution with C-F bond cleavage lead to the unexpected difluoride <nUm> . although the formation of Zr-F specie during olefin polymerization by [Cp'2ZrR]+[RB(C6F5) 3]- ( cp' = substituted or unsubstituted e5-cyclopentadienyl ; r = me , H ) catalyst is often described a a deactivation , the catalyst precursor <nUm> can be regenerated from <nUm> through treatment with iBu2AlH . ( chemical equation presented ) A straightforward approach : an unprecedented zirconocene - catalyzed isomerization - magnesation reaction of readily available alkene - substituted enol ether allows the direct synthesis of functionalized grignard reagent . cp = cyclopentadienyl . ( figure presented ) why do n't you melt ? the zirconocene - catalyzed polymerization of norbornene proceeds by s-bond metathesis to give 2-exo,7'-syn linkage in the main chain and 2-exo,2'-exo - linked mononorbornyl branch . the resulting helical structure is very compact ( see picture , view along helical axis ) , which hinders conformational change and explains the insolubility of the polynorbornene and why it can not be melted . ( chemical equation presented ) shrinking the circle : complex cyclohexanol derivative with up to four new stereogenic center are easily obtained by simple one - pot , three - component , zirconium - mediated coupling of an alkyllithium or grignard reagent , a seven - membered cyclic enol ether , and an electrophile ( e , see scheme ) . hafnium 's triumph over titanium and zirconium ! unusual tandem Si-C and C-H bond activation by hafnium to form the alkenyl complex <nUm> and the silahafnacyclopentene <nUm> were observed in the reaction of decamethylhafnocene and bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene . the higher reactivity of hafnocene compound relative to their titanocene and zirconocene congener is of general importance for synthesis and catalytic application . ( chemical equation presented ) three new construction feature in one synthesis - for the fused cyclobutene ring , the cyclopentanone , and the functionalized six - membered lactone - characterize the procedure that lead to the natural (+)-enantiomer of the title compound starting with d-glucose . central to the routing are step involving organometallic reagent containing ruthenium , osmium , zirconium , and samarium among others .
