A stable five - membered metallacycloalkyne <nUm> with alkylidene moiety wa treated with an alkali metal to give a dianionic specie <nUm> , which wa transformed into a 1-zirconacyclopent-3-ene complex by protonation . the alkylation of <nUm> afforded zirconocene-e4-1,3-enyne complex <nUm> , which can be regarded a formal " 1-zirconacyclopenta-2,3-dienes " . Ar = 4-EtC6H <nUm> ; r = me , Me3Sn . zirconocene is the key : A new synthetic method , which utilizes zirconocene - mediated coupling of alkyne , ha been developed for the preparation of a new class of highly lewis acidic boroles ( see scheme ) . such compound hold potential for application in catalysis and the field of electron - deficient organic material . veritable jack - in - the - box : the isolation and characterization of key Zr / Si - containing intermediate wa achieved for a zirconocene - mediated intermolecular coupling reaction ( see scheme ) . the fate of the various functional group wa determined , and the reactivity of intermediate <nUm> with a variety of unsaturated substrate wa also investigated . ( figure presented ) alkyne under stress : A novel metallacycle containing one Zr atom , two Si atom , and a C ≡ C bond ha been prepared and it structure elucidated ( Zr green , Si blue , C gray ) . according to x-ray data , spectral property , and DFT calculation , the bonding situation in this compound is characterized a a l-metalla-2,5-disilacyclopent-3-yne with a weak metal - triplebond interaction . two nobel coupling : the synthesis of tri- and tetraalkylated olefin ha been achieved ( see scheme ) . these multialkylated olefin were prepared by the zirconocene - mediated carbometalation of 1-alkynylboronates and subsequent sequential C-C bond formation with negishi and suzuki - miyaura cross-coupling reaction using b-hydrogen - containing alkylzinc reagent and alkyl electrophiles a coupling partner . let 's split : reaction of the zirconium complex A with pier ' borane [ HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] yield the unusual borylalkyne zirconocene complex B which reacts with dihydrogen , activating it to give the doubly hydrido bridged alkyne zirconium complex C . an enyne - zirconium complex stabilizes molecular magnesium hydride ( HMg <nUm> ) and even a molecular hydride , nC 4H 9MgH . these system feature magnesium olefin π complexation . A two - metal job : four - coordinate aluminum dihydrides such a <nUm> are reported a terminal reductant for the selective title reaction . the heterobimetallic complex <nUm> ha been isolated and shown to be catalytically competent . N shuffle : one - electron reduction of the ansa - zirconocene complex with a side-on dinitrogen ligand furnished the corresponding anion in which the hapticity of the N ligand changed to end-on . oxidation of the anion regenerates the neutral complex with concomitant change in N <nUm> hapticity . the zirconocene complex with unusual ( N 2)3- / (N2)- ligand have been fully characterized . ad = adamantyl . on the track of schwartz 's reagent : two zirconocene hydrido amidate complex are synthesized by formal oxidative addition of amide N-H bond to reduced zirconocene fragment . insertion reaction with alkene show a different behavior than schwartz 's reagent by forming branched insertion product . the insertion product and the hydrido complex are characterized by x-ray analysis . boron chemistry without the boron : In a reaction analogous to 1,1-carboboration , [Cp*2Zr-CH3]+ reacts with diphenylphosphino(trimethylsilyl)acetylene by 1,1-carbozirconation to give a vicinal [Zr]+ / P system . like B / P frustrated lewis pair , the [Zr]+ / P system undergoes 1,2-addition to unsaturated compound ( including CO2 ) and reaction with metal complex and up to three equivalent of CO . the availability of enantiomerically enriched carbonyl-containing compound is essential to the synthesis of biologically active molecule . since catalytic enantioselective conjugate addition ( ECA ) reaction directly generate the latter valuable class of molecule , the design and development of such protocol represents a compelling objective in modern chemistry . herein , we disclose the first solution to the problem of ECA of alkenyl group to acyclic trisubstituted enones , an advance achieved by adopting an easily modifiable and fully catalytic approach . the requisite alkenylaluminum reagent are synthesized with exceptional site- and / or stereoselectivity by a Ni - catalyzed hydroalumination process , and the necessary enones are prepared through a site- and stereoselective zirconocene - catalyzed carboalumination / acylation reaction . the all - catalytic procedure is complete within four hour , furnishing the desired product in up to <nUm> % overall yield and <nUm> : <nUm> enantiomeric ratio . one-two-three punch : Ni - catalyzed alkyne hydroalumination , Zr - catalyzed alkyne carbometalation / acylation , and Cu - catalyzed enantioselective conjugate addition are combined for accessing acyclic organic molecule that contain an alkene - substituted quaternary carbon stereogenic center . the entire process take le than four hour and affords product in up to <nUm> % overall yield and <nUm> : <nUm> enantiomeric ratio . the zirconocene dinitrogen complex [ { ( e5-C 5Me4H)2Zr}2(m2 , e2,e2-N2 ) ] wa synthesized by photochemical reductive elimination from the corresponding zirconium bis(aryl) or aryl hydride complex , providing a high - yielding , alkali metal - free route to strongly activated early - metal N complex . mechanistic study support the intermediacy of zirconocene arene complex that in the absence of sufficient dinitrogen promote C-H activation or undergo comproportion to formally ZrIII complex . when N is in excess arene displacement give rise to strong dinitrogen activation . the zirconocene dinitrogen complex [ { ( e5-C5Me4H ) 2Zr}2(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) ] wa synthesized by photochemical reductive elimination from the corresponding Zr bis(aryl) or aryl hydride complex . mechanistic study support the intermediacy of zirconocene arene complex that in the absence of sufficient N promote C-H activation . when N <nUm> is in excess arene displacement give rise to strong dinitrogen activation . In a search for the hitherto elusive catalyst resting state ( s ) of zirconocene - based olefin polymerization catalyst , a combination of UV / vi and NMR spectrometric method reveals that polymer - carrying cationic Zr allyl complex make up about 90- % of the total catalyst concentration . other catalyst specie that take part in the polymerization process have to be generated from this allyl pool into which they appear to relapse rather frequently . A combination of UV / vi and NMR spectrometric method reveals that polymer - carrying cationic Zr allyl complex derived by b-hydride and subsequent proton abstraction from a Zr polymeryl cation make up about 90- % of the catalyst content when 1-hexene is polymerized with a cationic ansa - zirconocene catalyst at 25- ° C . eight Cs - symmetric complex , R1R2C(Cp)(Flu)MCl <nUm> [ R1 = R2 = CH2 2CH2 , m = Zr ( 1 ) , Hf ( 2 ) ; R1 = R2 = p-CH3OC6H4 , m = Zr ( 3 ) , Hf ( 4 ) ; RI = p- tBuC6H4 , R2 = ph , m = Zr ( 5 ) , Hf ( 6 ) ; R1 = R2 = p-tBuC6H4 , m = Zr ( 7 ) ; R1 = R2 = PhCH2 , m = Zr ( 8 ) ] have been synthesized and characterized . zirconocenes all showed the same high catalytic activity in ethylene polymerization a complex ph 2C(Cp)(Flu)ZrCl2 ( 9 ) . however , in the propylene polymerization , the catalytic activity decreased in the order <nUm> ≈ <nUm> > <nUm> > <nUm> . introduction of tBu decreased the activity , probably due to the bulk steric hindrance . the polypropylene produced by <nUm> and <nUm> with tBu substituent showed a higher molecular weight ( me ) than that produced by <nUm> . the 13C NMR spectrum revealed the polymer from <nUm> and <nUm> to have shorter average syndiotactic block length than polymer produced by <nUm> . it wa noted that [mm] stereodefect of polypropylene by <nUm> could not be observed from 13C NMR , which showed that the benzyl on bridge carbon <nUm> prevented chain epimerization and enatiofacial misinsertion in polymerization . activation of ansa - zirconocenes of the type rac [ Zr{1-Me2Si(3-R-(n5-C9H5)) (3-R'-(n5-C9H5))}Cl2 ] [ r = et , R' = H ( 1 ) ; r = Pr , R' = H ( 2 ) ; and r = et , R' = Pr ( 3 ) , r , R' = me ( 4 ) and r , R' = bu ( 5 ) ] by MAO ha been studied by UV - visible spectroscopy . compound 1-3 have been tested in the polymerization of ethylene at different Al : Zr ratio . UV - vi spectroscopy wa used to determine a correlation between the electronic structure of ( 1-5 ) and their polymerization activity . the synthesis of long - chain branched polyethylene includes the generation of vinyl-terminated polyethylene macromonomers and the copolymerization of these macromonomers with ethylene . four new bridged cyclopentadienyl indenyl ( fluorenyl ) zirconocene complex 1a-b , 2a-b were prepared and showed high activity for ethylene homopolymerization upon the activation of methylaluminoxane . the steric bulk of bridged substituent ha a profound effect on the catalytic activity a well a on the molecular weight of resulting polyethylene . complex 1b showed the highest activity of up to <nUm> x <nUm> <nUm> g PE / ( mol Zr h ) for ethylene homopolymerization at <nUm> ° C , which wa higher than that of Cp2ZrCl2 . the polyethylene produced with complex 1a -d / MAO are mostly vinyl-terminated , posse low molecular weight and fit a macromonomers . the (p-MePh)2C - bridged cyclopentadienyl indenyl zirconocene complex 1a could produce polyethylene macromonomer with selectivity for the vinyl-terminal a high a <nUm> % . A mild and rapid one - pot process for reformatsky and barbier reaction using a catalytic quantity of zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl <nUm> ) a a promoter and zinc a a terminal reductant at room temperature in dimethyl formamide wa developed . the protocol ha wide substrate suitability and afforded the desired 3-substituted-3-hydroxyindolin-2-ones from istains in good yield and short reaction time . A series of new bis(indenyl) zirconium diaryloxides of general formula Ind2Zr(OL)2 ( L = C6H5 , <nUm> ; C6F5 , <nUm> ; 2,6-Me2C6H3 , <nUm> ; 2,4,6-Me3C6H2 , <nUm> ; 4-tBuC6H4 , <nUm> ) were synthesized by a metathesis reaction of Ind2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) with the appropriate thallium aryloxide salt , TIOL . the complex 1-6 were characterized by 1H and 13C NMR technique . they were also examined a catalyst for ethene and 1-hexene polymerization with methylalumoxane a co-catalyst , and a trend of the polymerization activity a a function of aryloxide ligand wa observed . an interpretation of this trend , considering both the electronic and steric effect of the substituents on the aryloxide ring , wa proposed . zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) in the presence of DMF wa found to be a highly efficient catalyst for the synthesis of structurally diverse 2-substituted quinozolin-4(3H)-ones by reaction of anthranilimide with a wide range of aryl aldehyde . A series of ethylene-bridged C1 - symmetric ansa-(3-R-indenyl) ( fluorenyl ) zirconocene complex ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) incorporating a pendant arene substituent on the 3-position of indenyl ring have been synthesized . the structure of complex <nUm> wa further confirmed by x-ray diffraction analysis . when activated with methylaluminoxane , four sterically le encumbered complex <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> could catalyze the dimerization of propylene in toluene at <nUm> ° C to afford 2-methyl-1-pentene with high selectivity up to <nUm> - <nUm> % and moderate activity of <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> to <nUm> × <nUm> g (mol-Zrh)-1 . A series of group <nUm> metallocenes (RCp)[Cp-(bridge)-(2-C4H 3S)]MCl2 [ m = Ti ( C1 , C2 , C3 , C4 ) ; m = Zr ( C5 , C6 , C7 , C8 ) ] bearing a pendant thiophene group on a cyclopentadienyl ring have been synthesized , characterized and tested a catalyst precursor for ethylene polymerization . the molecular structure of representative titanocenes C2 and C4 were confirmed by single - crystal x-ray diffraction and revealed that both complex exist in an expected coordination environment for a monomeric bent metallocene . No intramolecular coordination between the thiophene group and the titanium center could be observed in the solid state . upon activation by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , titanocenes C1 , C2 , C3 , C4 showed moderate catalytic activity and produced high- or ultra-high-molecular-weight polyethylene ( mv <nUm> - <nUm> × 104gmol-1 ) . titanocene C3 is more active and long - lived , with a lifetime of nearly <nUm> h at 30C . At elevated temperature of 80-110C , zirconocenes C5 , C6 , C7 , C8 displayed high catalytic activity ( up to <nUm> × <nUm> g PE ( mol Zr ) -1h-1 ) , giving high-molecular-weight polyethylene ( m v <nUm> - <nUm> × 104gmol-1 ) . even at 80C , a long lifetime of at least <nUm> h wa observed for the C8 / MAO catalyst system . both amido-(cyclopentadienyl)boranes and bis(cyclopentadienyl)boranes of the type R2NB(CxHy) ( NR' ) and R2NB(CxHy)2 ( r = alkyl , trimethylsilyl ; R' = ph ; CxHy = CH ( cyclopentadienyl ) , C9H7 ( indenyl ) , C13H9 ( fluorenyl ) ) were recently shown to form corresponding boron - bridged group <nUm> metallocenes that exhibit high activity in ziegler - natta - type catalysed olefin polymerization . here , the same boranes were utilized in the formation of metallocenes of ytterbium and zirconium , where the ligand selectively bind in a non-chelate fashion . the resulting complex [ yb{e5- (C5H4)B(NiPr2)NHt Bu}2{N(SiMe3)2} ] ( 2 ) and [ Zr{e5-(C9H6)B(N (SiMe3)2)(C9H7)}Cl2 ] ( 4 ) allow study on these ligand in a metal - bonded , though unstrained , environment . furthermore , these complex might find use a precursor in the formation of organometallic polymer , since they exhibit a readily available moiety for the coordination of further transition metal centre . both complex were fully characterized by multinuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy and x-ray structure determination . the para-substituted diphenylzirconocenes [ (t-BuCp)2Zr(p-C6H4R)2 ; r = Br , NMe2 ] ( A ) were easily obtained from the reaction of the appropriate organolithium reagent with bis(t-butylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride . elimination of bromobenzene or N,N-dimethylaminobenzene from A by slight heating led to arynezirconocenes into which were inserted two equivalent of elementary chalcogens . As a result dichalcogenated zirconacycles [ (t-BuCp)2ZrY2C6H3R ; Y = S , Se ] ( B ) were obtained . complex B constitute useful potential synthons in organic synthesis and a large family of new functionalized dichalcogenated benzenic compound wa prepared by reacting electrophiles . the structure of complex B a well a related benzenic derivative ha been confirmed by microanalysis , 1H NMR and mass spectrometry . soluble metallocene catalyst can be easily metered into high pressure polymerization reactor . the performance of a homogeneous zirconocene catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene under high pressure wa tested at <nUm> bar and temperature between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C in the presence of methyl aluminoxane a cocatalyst . besides the productivity of the catalyst and the overall rate of polymerization , the most important property of the prepared polymer were determined . the result were compared with those found earlier with a heterogeneous titanium catalyst supported on magnesium dichloride . A quantitative study wa carried out on the homogeneous zirconocene dichloride / methylalumoxane / trimethylaluminum ( Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO / TMA ) catalyst system in ethylene polymerization . the effect of variation of the AlMAO / Zr ratio , absolute Zr concentration , and addition of TMA on ethylene polymerization activity and polymer property were investigated . the polymerization profile for small AlMAO / Zr ratio and the change with the Zr concentration are explained with a complexation equilibrium for the active homogeneous complex and with the change to a heterogeneous catalyst upon polymer precipitation . good polymer productivity can be achieved at AlMAO / Zr < <nUm> when working at Zr concentration between <nUm> − <nUm> and <nUm> − <nUm> mol / l with addition of TMA ( AlMAO / AlTMA ≈ <nUm> ) . the system zirconocene dichloride / methylalumoxane wa supported on silica in order to provide ethylene polymerization catalyst for suspension or gas phase process . highest activity wa found for a sandwich-like , three layer anchoring of the zirconium center on the support surface . the new catalyst system show a decrease of activity compared to polymerization experiment in homogeneous phase . however , the molecular weight are increased and the weight distribution remain narrow by immobilization of the active catalyst site . those supported metallocene catalyst could find application for the synthesis of polyethylene material with controlled rheology . ethylene / propylene copolymer ( EPM ) have been prepared by a liquid propylene suspension process , using homogeneous catalyst based on nonbridged zirconocenes and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . when bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) , bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) dimethyl zirconium ( Cp2ZrMe2 ) and bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) , dibenzyl zirconium ( Cp2ZrBz2 ) were used a catalyst component , EPM having low average molecular weight ( MW ) were in general obtained in low yield . on the contrary , a very large improvement of productivity and MW wa observed when bis(e5-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( Ind2ZrCl2 ) and bis(e5-indenyl) dimethyl zirconium ( Ind2ZrMe2 ) a well a bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl)zirconium dichloride [(IndH4)2ZrCI2] were employed in combination with MAO . In particular , this last catalytic system allowed one to obtain EPM with a narrower distribution of MW in addition to the above characteristic . better performance , in term of rheological and elastomeric property , were also found for the crude and vulcanized sample prepared by (IndH4)2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst . mesoporous molecular sieve , with pore diameter of 2.6-25 nm , were impregnated with methylaluminoxane and bis(butylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride and tested a catalyst for the gas - phase homopolymerization of ethylene at ethylene pressure of <nUm> psi and temperature of 50-100 ° C and for 1-hexene / ethylene copolymerization at <nUm> ° C . the activity and activity profile , at constant Zr and Al content , depended on the pore size of the support and the polymerization temperature . maximum activity for both the homopolymerizations and copolymerizations were observed for catalyst made with support having pore diameter of <nUm> and <nUm> nm . homopolymerization activity were highest at temperature of 70-80 ° C ; average homopolymerization and copolymerization activity up to <nUm> kg of polyethylene / ( mol of Zr h ) were obtained . the weight - average molecular weight ( mw 's ) were not a function of the support pore size but decreased with increasing reaction temperature , from about <nUm> at <nUm> ° C to about <nUm> at <nUm> ° C . the polydispersities were essentially constant at <nUm> ± <nUm> for the homopolymers . mw 's for the 1-hexene / ethylene copolymer had an average value of <nUm> with an average polydispersity of <nUm> . the amount of triisobutyl aluminum added to the reactor significantly affected the activity and activity profile . the activity of metallocene catalyst in ethylene polymerization can be increased by a factor of up to <nUm> when the corresponding metallocene catalyst precursor posse one or two bulky alkyl ligand such a benzyl group instead of the conventional chloro ligand . we assume that in the activation process with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) these bulky alkyl group are transferred from the metal to the MAO cocatalyst . the actual cocatalyst is supposed to be a cage with one or more monomeric AlMe3 molecule inside . the bulky alkyl group is transferred to such an AlMe3 unit and can act a a spacer separating the catalytically active metallocenium cation from the MAO anion . this effect is supposed to be responsible for the increase in activity . blend of polyethylene ( PE ) were produced in a single reactor using a combination of { [ ( 2-ArN = C(Me))2C5H3N]FeCl2 } [ Ar = 2,6-2CH3(C6H4) ] and rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 . the experimental result showed that the EsP obtained have a broad molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) and both the molecular weight and the MWD can be regulated through changing the mole ratio of the two active site . In addition , the polymerization activity decreased with the increase of the Fe / Zr mole ratio whereas the crystallinity of the PE obtained exhibited a contrary trend , decreasing a the Fe / Zr mole ratio went up . the morphology of the blend also directly relates to the Fe / Zr mole ratio , and more iron content in the bimetallic catalyst system give rise to compact EsP of high crystallinity . this reflects that the reactor blend are morphology controllable a well and can be easily applied to present processing technique because of adjustable molecular weight and their distribution . differential scanning calorimetry , thermogravimetric analysis , gel permeation chromatography , and scanning electron microscopy were employed to characterize the property of the reactor blend of EsP . A series of hybrid supported catalyst were prepared by combining (iBuCp)2ZrCl2 and ( TpMs*(TiCl <nUm> complex ( TpMs* = HB(3-mesityl-pyrazolyl) 2(5-mesityl-pyrazolyl)- ) sequentially grafted onto MAO (methylaluminoxane)-modified silica according to a plackett burmann <nUm> <nUm> design . supported catalyst were prepared taking into account the immobilization order , silica pretreatment temperature , and grafting temperature . grafted metal content wa comparatively determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) , x-ray photoelectronic spectroscopy ( XPS ) , and inductively coupled plasma - optical emission spectroscopy ( ICP - OES ) . the resulting catalyst were evaluated in term of catalyst activity and polymer property . according to RBS measurement , grafted metal content remained comprised between <nUm> and <nUm> wt % Zr / O2Si and <nUm> and <nUm> wt % Ti / O2Si depending on the immobilization order and on silica pretreatment temperature . all the system were shown to be active in ethylene polymerization having external MAO a cocatalyst . catalyst activity seemed to be governed by the zirconocene specie , influenced slightly by Ti one . resulting polymer were characterized by DSC and GPC . the polyethylene mostly presented higher molecular weight than those produced by homogeneous catalyst or by zirconocene grafted on bare or on MAO - modified silica . new approach have been identified for the immobilization , on a ClMg 2-based support , of borate activator for metallocene - catalyzed olefin polymerization . immobilization of [HNEt3][B(C 6F5)3(C6H4-4-OH) ] wa carried out by reaction with a support of type Cl2Mg / AlR n(OEt)3-n , obtained by reaction of AlEt3 with an adduct of magnesium chloride and ethanol . use of the resulting immobilized borate in combination with zirconocene catalyst in ethylene and propylene polymerization resulted in significantly higher polymerization activity than were obtained using the same borate immobilized on a silica support . the Cl2Mg - based support also gave the better polymer particle morphology , cross-sectional imaging indicating uniform support fragmentation , a opposed to incomplete fragmentation using the silica support . high catalyst activity were obtained using a Cl2Mg / AlRn(OEt)3-n support impregnated with [Ph3C][B(C6F5) <nUm> ] . In this case , a highly porous polyethylene particle morphology wa obtained . In the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , ethylene polymerization wa successfully performed with homobinuclear zirconocene complex { [ ( C 5H5)ZrCl2](C5H4CH <nUm> C12H7 4)[(C5H5)ZrCl2] ; 3o , <nUm> m , and 5p } , which were prepared conveniently by the reaction of disodium(phenylenedimethylene)dicyclopentadienide[C6H 4(CH2C5H4Na)2 ] with <nUm> equiv of (N5-Cyclopentadienyl)trichlorozirconium dimethoxyethane ( CpZrCl3(DME) ) in tetrahydrofuran and characterized by 1NMR and elemental analysis . the effect of the polymerization parameter , such a the temperature , time , concentration of the catalyst , MAO / catalyst molar ratio , and isomeric difference of the homobinuclear metallocene complex 3o , <nUm> m , and 5p were studied in detail . the result showed that all three catalytic system had moderate activity in ethylene polymerization and afforded polyethylene with relatively broad polydispersities . the catalytic activity of <nUm> m wa somewhat higher than that of 3o and 5p but lower than that of 4,4'-bis(methylene)biphenylene-bridged zirconocene catalyst ; this indicated that the distance between the two metal center wa too short in comparison with a 4,4'-bis(methylene)biphenylene bridge to increase the catalytic activity . the leaching of the catalyst zirconocene dichloride ( cp 2ZrCl2 ) from an SBA-15 silica support during ethylene polymerization wa studied ; severe leaching wa observed when commercial methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) wa used a the cocatalyst . however , the removal of free trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) from an MAO solution with a sterically hindered phenol reduced the catalyst leaching by 97-100 % . the result obtained from the leaching experiment with TMA - free MAO suggested that the major reason for catalyst leaching wa the free TMA in the commercial MAO solution , not the pure MAO itself . A supported metallocene catalyst wa synthesized by sequentially loading methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) ( <nUm> wt % in toluene ) and ( nBuCp ) 2ZrCl2 on partially dehydroxylated silica ES <nUm> modified by nBuSnCl3 . it shock load hydrogen responsiveness wa evaluated by polymerizing ethylene for <nUm> h at <nUm> bar ( g ) and <nUm> ° C without separately feeding the MAP cocatalyst . the shock load hydrogen feeding increased the ethylene consumption ( at a fairly constant rate ) , catalyst productivity , a well a the resin bulk density and average particle size at DP ( of hydrogen ) ≥ ∼ <nUm> psi . the bulk density increased from <nUm> to <nUm> g / cm3 . this show a procedure for overcoming the inherent drop in catalyst productivity caused by heterogenization of metallocenes ( that is a method for catalyst activation ) and improving the resulting resin bulk density . the volume - weighted mean particle diameter of the resulting polyethylene wa found to be 5.80-11.12-fold that of the catalyst corresponding to DP = <nUm> - <nUm> psi , respectively . the resulting kinetic profile showed to be fairly stable . however , mw and polydispersity index were not affected . the particle size distribution , average particle size , and the scanning electron microscope photograph of the resulting resin particle confirmed the occurrence of the replication phenomenon . on the basis of the above finding , the mechanism of ethylene polymerization under the present experimental condition ha been revisited . tert-Butyl vinyl ether ( tBVE ) wa polymerized with the catalyst dimethyl[rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)] zirconium ( ansa - zirconocene ) with tri(pentafluorophenyl) borane [B(C6F5)3] a a cocatalyst . the effect of various polymerization condition , such a the polymerization time , type of polymerization solvent , polymerization temperature , and catalyst concentration , on the conversion of tBVE into poly(tBVE) , it molecular weight and molecular weight distribution , and it stereoregularity were investigated . the maximum conversion of tBVE into poly(tBVE) wa over <nUm> % at a polymerization temperature of <nUm> ° C with an ansa - zirconocene and BC18F15 concentration of <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> mol / mol of tBVE , respectively . the number - average molecular weight of poly(tBVE) ranged from approximately <nUm> to <nUm> , with a lower polydispersity index ( weightaverage molecular weight / number - average molecular weight ) ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> , at all polymerization temperature . the number - average molecular weight of poly(tBVE) increased with decrease in the polymerization temperature and catalyst concentration . the mm triad sequence fraction of poly(tBVE) polymerized with ansa - zirconocene / B(C6F 5)3 at <nUm> ° C wa much higher than that of poly(tBVE) polymerized with the BC18F15 catalyst at <nUm> ° C , and this indicated that the ansa - zirconocene / B(C6F 5)3 catalyst system affected the isospecific polymerization of tBVE . ethylene wa copolymerized with 10-undecen-1-ol and 5-hexen-l-ol using stereorigid [rac-ethylene(Ind)2ZrCl2] , [rac-ethylene(H4Ind)2ZrCl2] , and the new catalyst system [rac-norbornane(Ind)2TiCl2] and [mesonorbornane(Ind)2TiCl2] , activated with methylaluminoxane . the characterization of the copolymer by 13C NMR spectroscopy revealed that the polymerization product were copolymer and that the conversion of the polar comonomer wa strongly favored in the case of the zirconocene precursor . very high catalytic activity value , nearly independent on the amount of comonomer in the feed , and comonomer incorporation up to <nUm> % weight have been found for 10-undencen-1-ol comonomer . catalytic activity during the formation of polyethylene ( PE ) / clay nanocomposites by in situ polymerization with metallocenes wa studied . ethylene polymerization wa carried out with the homogeneous metallocene in the presence of the clay particle and using the clay - supported metallocene catalyst . it wa found that the catalytic activity of the homogeneous metallocene doe not decrease in the presence of the clay particle and only a slight decrease of activity occurs using the clay - supported catalyst . the modification of the clay with MAO cocatalyst a well a it intercalation with ODA surfactant were found to play an important role during the in situ formation of the PE / clay nanocomposite . ODA - intercalated clay apparently facilitates the activation and monomer insertion process on zirconocene center located in internal site of the clay structure . although metallocene supported on MAO- treated clay exhibited somewhat lower catalytic activity than that supported directly on the ODA - intercalated clay , both system favored the production of PE nanocomposites containing highly exfoliated clay particle . nano-sized and micro-sized silica particle were used to support a zirconocene catalyst [ racemic-dimethylsilbis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ] , with methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . the resulting catalyst wa used to catalyze the polymerization of ethylene in the temperature range of 40-70 ° C . polyethylene sample produced were characterized with scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) , x-ray diffraction ( XRD ) , differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , and gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) . nano-sized catalyst exhibited better ethylene polymerization activity than micro-sized catalyst . At the optimum temperature of <nUm> ° C , nano-sized catalyst 's activity wa two time the micro-sized catalyst 's activity . polymer obtained with nano-sized catalyst had higher molecular weight ( based on GPC measurement ) and higher crystallinity ( based on XRD and DSC measurement ) than those obtained with micro-sized catalyst . the better performance of nano-sized catalyst were attributed to it large external surface area and it absence of internal diffusion resistance . SEM indicated that polymer morphology contained discrete tiny particle with thin long fiberous interlamellar link . separation into narrow MWD fraction ( liquid - liquid fractionation ) and preparative TREF ( temperature rising elution fractionation ) with subsequent analysis of fraction by GPC , FTIR , and 13C NMR spectroscopy were used to study the comonomer distribution of ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer produced over highly active supported titanium- and vanadium - magnesium catalyst ( TMC and VMC ) and a supported zirconocene catalyst . these catalyst produce PE with different MWD : m w / m n value vary from <nUm> for zirconocene catalyst , <nUm> for TMC , and <nUm> for VMC . 1-Hexene increase polydispersity to <nUm> for copolymer produced over VMC and hardly affect MWD of the copolymer produced over TMC and zirconocene catalyst . the most broad short chain branching distribution ( SCBD ) wa found for ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer produced over TMC . VMC and supported zirconocene catalyst produce copolymer with uniform profile of SCB content vs. molecular weight in spite of great difference in m w / m n value ( <nUm> and <nUm> respectively ) . TREF data showed that majority of copolymer produced over supported zirconocene catalyst wa eluted at 70-90 ° C ( about <nUm> wt % ) . In the case of VMC copolymer 's fraction were eluted in the broad temperature interval ( 40-100 ° C ) . accordingly , TREF data indicate a more homogeneous SCBD in copolymer , produced over supported zirconocene catalyst . A series of ortho or meta lewis base functionalized unbridged zirconocenes , [ {1-(En-Ph)-3,4-Me2C5H2} 2ZrCl2](E = NMe2 , OMe ; n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) , and a half - functionalized zirconocene , [ { 1-(p-Me2NC6H 4)-3,4-Me2C5H2 } { 1-(p-tolyl)-3,4- Me2C5H2}ZrCl2 ] , were prepared . the crystal structure of these compound determined by x-ray diffraction revealed the presence of only C2 - symmetric rac - like isomer in the asymmetric unit . In combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) cocatalyst , the meta-functionalized complex afforded mixture of polymer that exhibit multimelting transition temperature and broad molecular - weight distribution ( MWDs ) in propylene polymerization at atmospheric monomer pressure , whereas the ortho-functionalized complex did not give rise to polymerization . stepwise solvent extraction of the polymer mixture showed that the polymer consist of amorphous , moderately isotactic , and highly isotactic portion , the weight ratio of which is dependent on the reaction temperature . 13C NMR spectral analysis indicated that the [mmmm] methyl pentad value of the isotactic portion reached around <nUm> % . among the meta-functionalized zirconocenes , the di-OMe - substituted one afforded the largest amount of the isotactic portion at all temperature , and the portion comprised <nUm> wt % of the crude polymer obtained at <nUm> ° C . In contrast , propylene polymerization with the half - functionalized unbridged zirconocene resulted in the formation of nearly atactic polypropylene with a narrow MWD of around <nUm> . these result corroborate the proposition that the rigid rac - like cation - anion ion pair of type [rac-L2ZrP] +[Me-MAO]- generated in situ , through lewis acid - base interaction between the functional group and [Me-MAO]- , is responsible for the isospecific propylene polymerization with the given class of functionalized unbridged zirconocenes and further indicate that the formation of such ion pair can be favored by difunctionalization at the meta position of the phenyl ring with OMe group . the zirconocene complex [ { (C6F5)2B- (CH2)3-Cp}(Cp-PtBu2)ZrCl2 ] ( <nUm> ; cp = cyclo-C5H4 ) wa prepared by hydroboration of [(allyl-Cp)ACHTUNGTRENUNG(Cp-PtBu2)ZrCl2] ( 5 ) with BC12F10H ( " pier ' borane " ) . it represents a frustrated lewis pair ( FLP ) in which both the lewis acid and the lewis base were attached at the metallocene framework . it reaction with 1-pentyne did not result in the 1,2-addition of or deprotonation reaction by the FLP , but rather in the 1,1-carboboration of the triple bond , thereby obtaining a z / e mixture ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) of the respective organometallic substituted alkene <nUm> . the analogous reaction of 1-pentyne with the phosphorous - free system [ { ( C 6F5)2B-(CH2)3-Cp ) } CpZrCl2 ] ( 9 ) gave the respective 1,1-carboboration product ( (Z)-10 / (E)-10 ≈ <nUm> : <nUm> ) . some zirconocene complex containing ferrocenylcarboxylate ligand , [(RC5H4)2ZrCl]nY , r = H or CH3 ; n = <nUm> , Y = ferrocenylcarbonyloxy , 2-ferrocenylacetoxy , 4-ferrocenylbutanoyloxy , 4-ferrocenyl-4-oxobutanoyloxy , and 3-(ferrocenylcarbony)lbicyclo[2,2,1]hept-5-ene-2-carbonyloxy ; n = <nUm> , y = bis[(3-carboxypropionyl)cyclopentadienyl]iron , have been prepared . their IR , -1H NMR , UV , and other determination show that the carboxyl group are bidentate ligand in these complex . the electronic structure and geometry of bent sandwich phosphinomethyl complex of IVZr and ZrIII have been investigated by mean of molecular orbital calculation . A fragment MO approach and perturbation argument are utilized to explain the unusual experimental structure of Cp2ZrCl(CH2PPh2) ( 1 ) . various factor influencing monodentate ( e1 ) vs. bidentate ( e2 ) ligand coordination of a phosphinomethyl ligand in zirconocene derivative are analyzed , allowing to extrapolate to other Cp2M(X)() system ( : potentially mono- or bidentate ligand ) in general . structural and chemical consequence of one electron reduction of <nUm> are interpreted on the basis of the MO calculation . is shown to posse an e1-phosphinomethyl ligand and to be unstable towards heterolytic loss of cl- or CH2PPh 2- . the ground state structure of d1-Cp2Zr(CH2PPh2) is calculated to contain an e2-phosphinomethyl group , consistent with the observed ESR spectrum of the reduction product of <nUm> . synthesis of a Heteroatom-Stabilized rhodiumcarbene complex by reaction of CpRh(CO)2 with (Butadiene)zirconocene (e4-Butadiene)zirconocene reacts at room temperature in toluene with CpRh(CO)2 to give the metallacyclic [(p-allyl)zirconoxy]rhodium carbene complex Cp2Zr(C4H6)(OC)Rh(CO)Cp <nUm> . the structure of <nUm> wa determined by x-ray analysis . the rh-carbene unit Cp(CO)RhC(R)OM is almost planar , featuring the O[Zr] and cp group in a z orientation at the RhC moiety [ dRhC(carbene) = <nUm> Å ] . die reaktion de zirconocendichlorids mit zwei aquivalenten n-Butyllithium und trimethylphosphan liefert (1-Buten)(trimethylphosphan)zirconocen ( 1 ) in <nUm> proz . ausbeute . komplex <nUm> ist ein ausgezeichnetes ausgansmaterial zur darstellung weiterer (Alken)- oder (Alkin)zirconocen-Komplexe ; so erhalt man durch verdrangung de 1-Butens mit ethylen , styrol oder tolan die Zirconocen-Komplexe <nUm> , <nUm> oder <nUm> in hohen ausbeuten . eine weitere darstellungsmethode fur (1-Alken)(trimethylphosphan)zirconocen-Komplexe ist die umsetzung von zirconocendichlorid mit 1-Alkylmagnesiumhalogeniden in gegenwart von trimethylphosphan bei raumtemperatur ; z . B. sind so der 1-Propen-Komplex <nUm> und der 1-Penten-Komplex <nUm> gut zuganglich . spektroskopische untersuchungen ( 1H- , 13C- und 31P-NMR ) zeigen , das alle dargestellten (1-Alken)(trimethylphosphan)zirconocen-Komplexe in losung bei <nUm> ° C al getrennt beobachtbare rotamerenpaare 1a , b , 3a , b , 9a , b und 10a , b im verhaltnis ca. <nUm> : <nUm> vorliegen . die strukturen de Ethylen-Komplexes <nUm> und de Styrol-Komplexes 3a wurden zusatzlich durch kristallstrukturanalysen ermittelt . reaction of the b-CH agostic alkenylzirconocene complex Cp2ZrCl[C(SiMe3)  CHPh ] ( 1 ) with benzyl isonitrile yield the (e2-iminoacyl)zirconocene complex ( 2 ) . complex <nUm> crystallizes in space group P21 / a with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> . carbon monoxide analogously insert only into the ZrC bond of <nUm> . No evidence ha been found for insertion reaction involving the alkenyl b-carbon-to-hydrogen bond “ activated ” by the agostic Zr … HC interaction in this system . molecular orbital calculation together with an isotope crossover study provide insight into mechanistic detail of enediolate-forming early transition metal promoted reductive CO coupling reaction . it is shown by deuterium labeling , that bercaw 's carbonylation of cp 2*Zr(CH3)2 ( 1 ) , which directly lead to the enediolate complex <nUm> , is an exclusively intramolecular process . both methyl group and the two CO molecule of <nUm> assemble at a single Zr center . MO investigation for Cp2Zr(CH3)2 a a model of <nUm> reveal that such group <nUm> metallocene-promoted enediolate-producing reaction do not involve the proposed intramolecular coupling of two acyl ligand of a bis(acyl) complex generated by double CO insertion , a found for actinide derivative . based upon related available experimental evidence and the electronic structure of the monoinsertion product Cp2Zr(COCH3)(CH3) , an alternative mechanism for enediolate formation is suggested and tested by extensive MO calculation . the postulated keystep consists of a methyl to acetyl migration in Cp2Zr(COCH3)(CH3) leading to an e2-acetone intermediate Cp2Zr(e2-acetone) ( 30 ) . interestingly , the methyl-acetyl bond formation in model calculation requires a prohibitively high energy , unless it is assisted by an additional electron donor at the metal during the transfer of the CH3 group to the acetyl carbon . using a CO molecule a an incoming model nucleophile , a low energy pathway is found , which can lead from Cp2Zr(COCH3)(CH3) to a zirconaoxirane intermediate <nUm> ( an e2-acetone complex ) , carrying an additional stabilizing CO ligand . subsequent CO insertion in <nUm> and further rearrangement open a reaction channel towards the enediolate monomer . the overall mechanistic picture emerging from this experimental / theoretical study is consistent with recent result of the bercaw group , which ha actually isolated the postulated intermediate of type <nUm> . the electronic difference between the system treated here and corresponding actinide or bis(aryloxy) analog are briefly discussed . stereochemical aspect with metallacyclic Nine-Membered zirconoxycarbene complex from coupling (Butadiene)-zirconocene , hexacarbonyltungsten , and ketone or aldehyde reaction of (butadiene)zirconocene complex with M(CO)6 ( m = Cr , W ) and subsequently with ketone or aldehyde O = CR1R2 ( R1 , R2 = H , alkyl , alkenyl , or aryl ) produce the metallacyclic nine-membered zirconoxycarbene complex ( 7a-r . the complex trans-7 contain chiral metallacyclic ring system . starting from many ketone two diastereomeric compound trans-7 and trans-7' are obtained . from the dynamic 1H-NMR spectrum an activation barrier of DG(317K) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol ha been estimated fro the trans-7k [(2R*)(4,5,6-pS*)] → trans-7k' [(2R*)(4,5,6-pR*)] rearrangement . for the tert-alkyl-substituted nine-membered metalacycles trans-7f-h only the respective (2R*)(4,5,6-pS*) isomer have been found starting from aldehyde with le sterically demanding alkyl group mixture of the trans-7 [(2R*)(4,5,6-pS*)] compound and their cis-7 isomer are obtained . using the more bulky bis(tert-butylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium moiety for coupling butadiene and C6O6W with simple aldehyde lead to a large excess of the trans-isomers ( e. g . A low-temperature x-ray structure investigation of complex 7a demonstrates the chiral arrangement of the four phenyl substituents of the tetraphenylcyclopentadienyl ( C5Ph4 ) unit . A 1H-NMR study show that the phenyl group rotate rapidly on the NMR time scale at room temperature . the dependence of phenyl rotation on temperature is discussed .
