In the reaction of Cp2Zr(Py)(Me3SiC2SiMe3) with n-methyl- e-caprolactam a simple ligand exchange reaction occurs and the complex Cp2Zr(Me3SiC2SiMe 3)[O = C-N(Me)-(CH2)5 ] ( 1 ) wa isolated . with b-propiolactam the alkenyl-amido complex Cp2Zr[-C(SiMe3) = N(H) ( SiMe3 ) ] [-rN-CO-CH2-CH2] ( 2 ) wa obtained , which indicates that an agostic rnetal-hydrogen interaction ha taken place . the reaction of Cp2Ti(Me3-SiC2SiMe3) with e-caprolactam give after elimination of the alkyne and molecular hydrogen the first early transition metal complex with a deprotonated coordinated e-caprolactam in a e2-amidate bonding fashion Cp2Ti-OCN-(CH2)5 ( 3 ) . the obtained complex were characterized by KMR spectrum ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) and crystal structure analysis ( 1-3 ) and discussed a elemental step in anionic ring - opening polymerization of lactams catalyzed by metallocene - alkyne complex . the ethene polymerization activity of a series of Cp'(C5H5}ZrCl2 and Cp2ZrCl2 pre-catalysts ( cp' = C5HMe4 , C4Me4P , C5Me5 , C5H4tBu , C5H3-1,3-tBu2 , C5H2-1,2,4-tBu3 ) together with C10Cl2H10Zr have been correlated with the coordination gap aperture . In the case of the mixed substituted C5R5-nR'n ligand , the coordination gap aperture ha been determined with the help of the cyclopentadienyl cone angle and the bending angle at zirconium . A hindered rotatability of the ( erf - butyl substituted system ha been evaluated by molecular modeling calculation and wa included in the gap aperture estimation . deviation from the activity - gap aperture correlation in the case of the phospholyl ( C4Me4P ) system could be accounted for in term of adduct formation between aluminum specie and the phosphorus donor . these lewis acid / base adduct form in an equili - brium reaction at high Al / Zr ratio , a shown by 31P NMR . ab initio calculation on model L2TiMe+ complex ( L = CH , C5H4N and C5H4P ) for the insertion of ethene in the Ti-Me bond suggest a high electronic similarity for phospholyl and cyclopentadienyl . the 91Zr - NMR data ( chemical shift and line width ) for the above zirconocene series are reported . the 91Zr chemical shift value increase with a good linear correlation to the number of methyl or ( erf - butyl group , which is traced to the additive electron donating effect of the alkyl group . the hyperconjugative donor effect of a tert-butyl group is found here to be <nUm> time that of a methyl group . the x-ray structure of (C5H3-1,3-ffiu2)(C5H 5)ZrCl2 ha been determined ( monoclinic , P21 / n , a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> ) . A variety of bent metallocene dichloride / methylalumoxane catalyst , derived from the zirconocene complex <nUm> , 12-18 , have been employed in intramolecular olefin - coupling reaction yielding monomeric or dimeric product . this wa achieved by using optimized reaction condition employing low substrate concentration ( <nUm> - <nUm> m ) and rather long reaction time . under these particular condition , 1,5-hexadiene wa cyclodimerized to give l-methylene-3-(cyclopentylmethyl)cyclopentane ( 11 ) . 1,6-Heptadiene wa cleanly converted to methylenecyclohexane , and cis-1,2-divinylcyclopentane ( 19 ) and cis-1,2-divinylcyclohexane ( 22 ) were cyclized to yield 2-methylenebicyclo[3.3.0]octane ( 20 ) and 7-methylenebicyclo[4.3.0]nonane ( 23 ) , respectively . In many case , the cyclization product were accompanied by isomer originating from double - bond shift reaction that often occur rapidly at these catalyst system under the specific reaction condition chosen to keep the product in the monomeric regime . bis(propynyl)zirconocene wa treated with BC18F3S3 and then with two equivalent of ferf - butyl isocyanide to yield the organometallic three - membered ring product <nUm> . subsequent hydrolysis give the substituted (2-iminioethylidene)cyclopropeneborate betaine system <nUm> that exhibit a pronounced cyclopropenylioborate betaine character . this follows from it characteristic structural feature ( x-ray crystal - structure analysis of the isomer ci's-9 ) and it chemical feature . complex <nUm> undergoes a very facile ci / trans isomerization by formal rotation around the exocyclic partial CC - double bond ( AGr arr = <nUm> kcal mol " <nUm> ) . compound <nUm> reacts cleanly in methanol solution with / erf - butyl isocyanide by insertion and ring enlargement to form the four - membered ring system <nUm> . compound <nUm> wa also characterized by x-ray diffraction . (Butadiene)zirconocene add to BC18F15 to form the metallacyclic metal- locene - boron betaine system <nUm> , which contains a C-F → Zr interaction . addition of tert-butylisocyanide or tert-butylcyanide lead to cleavage of the zirconium - fluorine linkage and formation of the adduct <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . with additional tert-butylisocyanide , <nUm> reacts further to yield the corresponding e2-imino- acyl betaine <nUm> and <nUm> ( <nUm> stereoisomers ) , whereas <nUm> insert additional tert-butylcyanide into the Zr-C bond to give a chiral metallacyclic n-zirconaketimine complex that is probably stabilized by an internal borate → Zr interaction . ethene and propene insertion reaction into the Zr-C bond of <nUm> follow a similar course : the mono-insertion product <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively , generated in situ and characterized by NMR spectroscopy at - <nUm> ° C in [D8]toluene solution , are chiral and are also stabilized by internal borate → Zr co-ordination . complex <nUm> and <nUm> are likely to be intermediate in the formation of active homogeneous ziegler polymerization catalyst . the development of a new method for the intramolecular coupling of terminal alkyne and for the synthesis of seven- and eight - membered benzoheterocyeles is reported . the key step involve the generation of zirconocene - alkyne complex from 2-bromoalkenes and the subsequent intramolecular carbometalation of olefin or acetylides . the 8-unsubstituted zirconabicyclopentenes were carbonylated to afford unexpected product and allow access to polyfunctionalized molecule from simple starting material . the organometallic cation [Cp2ZrCH3(thf)]+ , employed a the tetraphenylborate salt ( 1 ) , reacts cleanly in <nUm> : <nUm> stoichiometry with the isocyanate <nUm> derived from valine methyl ester or valylvaline methyl ester , respectively . In each case addition of the Zr - CH3 group to the isocyanate sp-carbon center is observed with formation of a functionalized zirconocene cation derivative containing a chelating n-metallated n-acetylvaline methyl ester ( 3a ) or n-acetylvalylvaline methyl ester ( 3b ) moiety , respectively , coordinated in the bent metallocene s-ligand plane . the spectroscopic data of <nUm> , supported by an x-ray crystal structure analysis of the zirconated dipeptide derivative 3b , have revealed the presence of chelating ( e1 -O : e1-N)-coordination of the terminal n-acetyl group in addition to a Zr-O = C interaction with the adjacent valyl amido group . the titanium complex (C5H4-allyl)TiCl3 ] ( 2 ) undergoes olefin metathesis coupling when treated with <nUm> mol % of [ Cl 2(L1)(L2)Ru = CHPh ] ( L1 = L <nUm> = PCy3 , 4a ; L1 = PCy3 , L <nUm> = ( H2IMes ) , 4b ) to yield the dimetallic complex [ Cl 3Ti(C5H4)-CH2CH = CHCH 2-(C5H4)TiCl3 ] ( 5 ) . the allyl-substituted titanocene complex [ Cp(C5H 4-allyl)TiCl2 ] ( 3 ) analogously yield the dimetallic system <nUm> when treated with <nUm> . the ansa - zirconocene complex [ me 2Si(C5H4)(C5H 3-allyl)ZrCl2 ] ( 7 ) cleanly yield the analogous dimetallic coupling product <nUm> ( > <nUm> % isomerically pure ) , when treated with catalytic amount of 4b in toluene . complex <nUm> give an active homogeneous ethene or propene polymerization catalyst , especially at elevated temperature , when treated with excess methylalumoxane . A diastereoselective synthesis of 1,3-butadiene or cyclobutene derivative by a zirconium - mediated reaction of alkenyllithium compound and vinyl bromide is reported . the key step involve the generation of zirconocene - alkyne complex from haloalkenes and subsequent coupling with alkenyl bromide . thus , formally the process supposes the cross-coupling reaction between a terminal alkyne and an alkenyl bromide . moreover , the use of butyl vinyl ether instead of vinyl bromide a the unsaturated system allows an alternative access to different 1,3-butadiene regioisomers . bis(alkynyl)silanes react with low valent zirconocene specie to afford zirconacyclobutene intermediate . these in situ generated reactive organometallic intermediate can react with alkyne , ketone , aldehyde , and isocyanate by mean of a novel skeletal rearrangement . when a zirconacyclobutene intermediate wa treated with an alkyne , an a-alkynylsilyl zirconacyclopentadiene wa formed . addition of dimethyl acetylenedicarboxylate ( DMAD ) and ClCu resulted in one - pot formation of an alkynylsilyl-benzene derivative from three different alkyne . At a higher temperature , the a-alkynyl-silylzirconacyclopentadiene wa transformed by mean of an intramolecular skeletal rearrangement to a zirconacyclohexadiene- silacyclobutene fused - ring compound , which reacted with DMAD in the presence of ClCu affording the same alkynylsilyl-benzene derivative . when treated with a ketone , an aldehdye , or an isocyanate , the zirconocyclobutene intermediate also underwent the above-mentioned skeletal rearrangement , generating zirconocene - mediated cross-coupling product . A series of cycloalkylidene-bridged cyclopentadienyl metallocene complex , [ (CH2)nC(C5H4)2MCl <nUm> ] ( m = Ti , n = <nUm> ( 4 ) , <nUm> ( 5 ) , <nUm> ( 6 ) ; m = Zr . n = <nUm> ( 7 ) , <nUm> ( 8 ) , <nUm> ( 9 ) ; m = Hf , n = <nUm> ( 10 ) , <nUm> ( 11 ) , <nUm> ( 12 ) ) , have been synthesized and applied to ethylene polymerization after activation with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) . the cycloalkylidene-bridged titanocene catalyst exhibit much higher activity than the corresponding zirconocene and hafnocene analogue , and have the highest activity at higher temperature . In comparison , the silacyclopentylidene- bridged metallocene complex [ (CH2)4Si(C 5H4)2MCl2 ] ( m = Ti ( 13 ) , Zr ( 14 ) ) and isopropylene-bridged metallocene complex [ Me2C(C 5H4)2MCl2 ] ( m = Ti ( 15 ) , Zr ( 16 ) ) have also been synthesized and applied to ethylene polymerization . In both case , the titanocene complex show much higher activity than the corresponding zirconocene analogue , especially at a lower temperature . the molecular structure of complex 4-9 have been determined by x-ray diffraction . the structure - activity relationship , especially the effect of the bridge of ansa - metallocene complex , are discussed . catalytic dehydrocoupling of phosphine wa investigated using the anionic zirconocene trihydride salt [ Cp*2Zr(m-H) 3Li]3 ( 1a ) or [ Cp*2Zr(m H ) 3K(thf)4 ] ( 1b ) , and the metallocycles [ CpTi(NPtBu 3)(CH2)4 ] ( 6 ) and [ Cp*M(NPtBu 3)(CH2)4 ] ( m = Ti <nUm> , Zr <nUm> ) a catalyst precursor . dehydrocoupling of primary phosphine RPH2 ( r = ph , C6H2Me3 , cy , C10H7 ) gave both dehydrocoupled dimer RP(H)P(H)R or cyclic oligophosphines (RP)n ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) while reaction of tBu3C6H2PH <nUm> gave the phosphaindoline fBu2(Me2C-CH 2)C6H2PH ( 9 ) . stoichiometric reaction of these catalyst precursor withprimary phosphine afforded [ cp* 2Zr((PR)2)H][K(thf)4] ( r = ph <nUm> , cy <nUm> , C 6H2Me3 <nUm> ) , [ Cp*2Zr((PPh) 3)H ] [K(thf)4] ( 5 ) , [ CpTi(NPtBu3)(PPh) <nUm> ] ( 7 ) and [CpTi(NPfBu3)(nrPHPh)]2 ( 8 ) , while reaction of <nUm> with (C6H2tBu3)PH2 in the presence of PMe3 afforded [ CpTi(NPtBu3)(PMe 3)(P(C6H2tBu3) ] ( 10 ) . the secondary phosphine Ph2PH and (PhHPCH2)2CH2 also undergo dehydrocoupling affording (Ph2P)2 and (PhPCH2)2CH2 . the bisphosphines ( CH 2PH2)2 and C6H4(PH 2)2 are dehydrocoupled to give ( C2H3P 2PH)v ( 12 ) and ( C6H5P2 ) <nUm> ( 13 ) while prolonged reaction of <nUm> gave ( C6H 4P2)8 ( 14 ) . the analogous bisphosphine me 2C6H4(PH)2 ( 17 ) wa prepared and dehydrocoupling catalysis afforded ( Me2C6H 2P(PH))2 ( 18 ) and subsequently [ ( Me2C 6H2P2)2(m-Me2C 6H2P2)]2 ( 19 ) . stoichiometric reaction with these bi-sphosphines gave [ Cp*2Zr(H)(PH)2C 6H4][Li(thf)4] ( 22 ) , [ CpTi(NPtBu 3)(PH)2C6H4]2 ( 23 ) and [Cp*Ti(NPfBu3)(PH)2C6H4] ( 24 ) . mechanistic implication are discussed . the complete catalytic cycle for the intramolecular hydroamination / cyclisation ( IHC ) of 4,5-hexadien-1-yl-amine ( 1 ) by a prototypical [ ZrCp 2Me2 ] precatalyst ( 2 ) ha been scrutinized by employing a reliable DFT method . the present study conducted by mean of a detailed computational characterisation of structural and energetic aspect of alternative pathway for all of the relevant elementary step complement the mechanistic insight revealed from experimental result . the operative mechanism entail an initial transformation of precatalyst <nUm> into the thermodynamically prevalent , but dormant , bis(amido)-Zr compound in the presence of aminoallene <nUm> . this complex undergoes a reversible , rate - determining a-elimination of <nUm> to form the imidoallene-Zr complex . the substrate - free form , which contains a chelating imidoallene functionality , is the catalytically active specie and is rapidly transformed into azazirconacyclobutane intermediate through a [2+2] cycloaddition reaction . this highly facile process doe not proceed regioselectively because the alternative pathway for the formation of five- and six - membered azacycles have comparable probability . degradation of cyclobutane intermediate by following the most feasible pathway occurs through protonolysis of the metallacycle moiety and subsequent proton transfer from the Zr - NHR moiety onto the azacycle . the five - membered allylamine is generated through protonation at carbon atom C6 followed by a-hydrogen elimination , whereas protonolysis of the cyclobutane moiety at the Zr-N bond followed by proton transfer onto carbon atom C5 is the dominant route for the six - membered product . of the two consecutive proton transfer step , the second one determines the overall kinetics of the entire protonation sequence . this process is predicted to be substantially slower than the cycloaddition reaction . the factor that regulate the composition of the cycloamine product have been elucidated . when triisobutylaluminum ( AliBu3 ) is added to solution containing methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and rac-[Me2Si(ind) 2ZrCl2 ] ( ind : indenyl ) in C6D6 , NMR spectrum show that methyl-bridged mixed - alkylaluminum dimer Al(m-Me) 2Me4-xiBux predominate . these dimer react with MAO under partial transfer of isobutyl group and induce a conversion of the initially prevailing cationic trimethylaluminum adduct rac - [ me 2Si(ind)2Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2 + ] to rac-[Me2Si(ind)2Zr(m-Me) 2AlMeiBu+ ] and rac-[Me2Si-(ind) 2Zr(m-Me)2AliBu2+ ] . these specie are unstable and release isobutene under formation of zirconocene hydride . this study examines alternative reaction channel for intramolecular hydroamination / cyclisation ( IHC ) of primary 4,5-hexadien-l-ylamine aminoallene ( 1 ) by a neutral [Cp2ZrMe2] zirconocene precatalyst ( 2 ) by using the density functional theory ( DFT ) method . the first channel proceeds through a [Cp2Zr(NHR)2] complex a the reactive specie and relevant step including the insertion of an allenic C = C linkage into the Zr - NHR s-bond and ensuing protonolysis . this is contrasted to the [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition mechanism involving a [ Cp2Zr = NR ] transient specie . the salient feature of the rival mechanism are disclosed . the cycloaddition route entail the first transformation of the dormant [ Cp2Zr-(NHR) <nUm> ] complex <nUm> B into the transient [ Cp2Zr = NR ] intermediate 3A' , which is turnover limiting . this route feature a highly facile ring closure together with a substantially slower protonolysis ( kcycloadd ≫ kprotonolysis ) and can display inhibition by high substrate concentration . In contrast , protonolysis is the more facile step for the channel proceeding through the [Cp2Zr(NHR)2] complex a the catalytically active specie . here , C = C insertion into the Zr-C s-bond of 3B , which represents the catalyst resting state , is turnover limiting and substrate concentration is unlikely to influence the rate . the regulation of the selectivity is elucidated for the two channel . DFT predicts that five - ring allylamine and six - ring imine are generated upon traversing the cycloaddition route , thereby comparing favourably with experiment , whereas the cycloimine should be formed solely along the s-bond insertion route . the mechanistic analysis is indicative of an operating [2+2] cycloaddition mechanism . the Zr - NHR s-bond insertion route , although appearing not to be employed for the reactant studied herein , is clearly suggested a being viable for hydroamination by charge neutral organozirconium compound . A zirconocene - mediated one - pot multicomponent synthesis process leading to the synthesis of pyrrolo[3,2-c]pyridine ( 5-azaindoles ) and pyrrole derivative ha been developed starting from a silicon - tethered diyne and three or two different or identical organonitriles . pyrrolo[3,2-c]pyridine and pyrrole derivative with diverse structure and substitution pattern have been highly selectively prepared by this protocol . A wide variety of organonitriles and silicon - tethered diynes , either aliphatic or aromatic with both electron - withdrawing and - donating group , have been used to afford 5-azaindoles and / or pyrroles in good - to - excellent isolated yield . A key intermediate formed in the Cp2ZrIImediated reaction of one ( PhC = C ) 2SiMe2 , two molecule of iPrCN and one p-tolylCN wa characterised by xray single - crystal structural analysis , which ha allowed u to gain a good understanding of the reaction process . an efficient multicomponent synthesis of 5-azaindoles and dihydropyrrolo[3,2-c]azepines wa achieved by zirconocene - mediated coupling of silicon - tethered diynes , nitrile , and isocyanides . the synthesis , structure , and intramolecular cyclization of mono- and bis(iminoacyl)-Zr intermediate were investigated to elucidate the reaction process . upon hydrolysis , the isolated mono(iminoacyl)-Zr intermediate underwent intramolecular cyclization to afford tetrasubstituted 5azaindoles , whereas intramolecular cyclization of bis(iminoacyl)-Zr intermediate led to the formation of dihydropyrrolo[3,2-c] azepines . the structure of a bis(iminoacyl)-Zr intermediate , formed through insertion of two molecule of CyNC into the Zr-C bond , and structure of two dihydropyrrolo[3,2-c]azepines were characterized by single - crystal x-ray structural analysis . tandem insertion of 1,1-dihalo-1-lithio specie ( halocarbenoids ) and lithium alkynides into zirconacyclopentenes and zirconcyclopentanes affords carbocyclic product in high yield via an unusual rearrangement that probably involves addition of an organolithium specie to the b-position of a zirconium - alkyne complex to give an alkenylidene-zirconate specie . A wide variety of cyclopentanoid organic structure are rapidly assembled in good yield using this multicomponent coupling . the main side reaction , which becomes exclusive in some case , is b-hydride elimination of an intermediate cyclopentyl- or cyclopentenyl zirconocene . zirconocene ' ate ' complex play several role in a versatile three - component one - pot assembly of bicyclic organic structure from a 1,6- or 1,7-enyne or -diene , an in situ generated halocarbenoid RCX2Li and a lithium acetylide . the most likely reaction pathway involves the unprecedented b-addition of an organolithium specie to an alkynyl zirconocene to give a zirconium alkenylidenate complex . 5-Azaindoles either with three different substituents at their 2- , 4- , and 6-positions or with two identical substituents at their 2-and 6-positions and a different one at the 4-position , were obtained in good to excellent isolated yield by a zirconocene - mediated multicomponent process . each reaction involved four organic partner , comprising a Si - tethered diyne , one tBuCN component , and two ( either different or identical ) nitrile . all these four component were combined through the action of a Cp2ZrII specie into a three - ring fused Zr / Si - containing organometallic complex in a perfectly chemo - and regioselective manner . this multicomponent reaction process consisted of three reaction step , all of which were made clear through the isolation and characterization of their corresponding organometallic intermediate : the zirconacyclopropene-azasilacyclopentadienes <nUm> , the allenyl-aza-zirconacycles <nUm> , and the three - ring fused complex <nUm> . x-ray single - crystal structural analysis of two three - ring fused Zr / Si - containing intermediate and two 5-azaindoles unambiguously showed the position of the different substituents and the regioselectivity . iminopyrrole derivative could be also highly selectively prepared from a Si - tethered diyne and two different nitrile . treatment of me 2S*B(C 6F <nUm> ) nH 3-n ( n = <nUm> or <nUm> ) with ammonia yield the corresponding adduct . H 3N*B(C 6F 5)H <nUm> dimerises in the solid state through N-H ⋯ H-B dihydrogen interaction . the adduct can be deprotonated to give lithium amidoboranes Li[NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) nH 3-n ] . reaction of the n = <nUm> reagent with [ cp 2ZrCl <nUm> ] lead to disubstitution , but [ cp 2Zr{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } <nUm> ] is in equilibrium with the product of b-hydride elimination [ cp 2Zr(H){NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } ] , which prof to be the major isolated solid . the analogous reaction with [ cp 2HfCl <nUm> ] give a mixture of [ cp 2Hf{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } <nUm> ] and the N-H activation product [ cp 2Hf{NHB(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } ] . [ cp 2Zr{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } 2]*PhMe and [ cp 2Hf{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } 2]*4(thf) exhibit b-B-agostic chelate bonding of one of the two amidoborane ligand in the solid state . the agostic hydride is invariably coordinated to the outside of the metallocene wedge . exceptionally , [ cp 2Hf{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } 2]*PhMe ha a structure in which the two amidoborane ligand adopt an intermediate coordination mode , in which neither is definitively agostic . [ cp 2Hf{NHB(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } ] ha a formally dianionic imidoborane ligand chelating through an agostic interaction , but the bond - length distribution suggests a contribution from a zwitterionic amidoborane resonance structure . treatment of the zwitterions [ cp 2MMe(m-Me) B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( m = Zr , Hf ) with Li[NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) nH 3-n ] ( n = <nUm> ) result in [ cp 2MMe{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) 2H } ] complex , for which the spectroscopic data , particularly 1J(B,H) , again suggest b-B-agostic interaction . the reaction proceed similarly for the structurally encumbered [ cp " 2ZrMe(m -Me)B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] precursor ( cp " = 1,3-C 5H <nUm> ( SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> , n = <nUm> or <nUm> ) to give [ cp " 2ZrMe{NH 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) nH 3-n } ] , both of which have been structurally characterised and show chelating , agostic amidoborane coordination . In contrast , the analogous hafnium chemistry lead to the recovery of [ cp " 2HfMe <nUm> ] and the formation of Li[HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] through hydride abstraction . A study regarding coordination chemistry of the bis(diphenylphosphino)amide ligand Ph2P-N-PPh2 at group <nUm> metallocenes is presented herein . coordination of N,N-bis(diphenylphosphino)amine ( 1 ) to [ ( cp 2TiCl)2 ] ( cp = i*5-cyclopentadienyl ) generated [Cp2Ti(Cl)P(Ph2)N(H)PPh2] ( 2 ) . the heterometallacyclic complex [ Cp2Ti(k2-P,P-Ph 2P-N-PPh2 ) ] ( <nUm> Ti ) can be prepared by reaction of <nUm> with n-butyllithium a well a from the reaction of the known titanocene - alkyne complex [ Cp2Ti(I*2-Me3SiC 2SiMe3 ) ] with the amine <nUm> . reaction of the lithium amide [(thf)3Li{N(PPh2)2}] with [ cp 2MCl2 ] ( m = Zr , Hf ) yielded the corresponding zirconocene and hafnocene complex [ Cp2M(Cl){k2-N,P-N(PPh 2)2 } ] ( <nUm> Zr and <nUm> Hf ) . reduction of <nUm> Zr with magnesium gave the highly strained heterometallacycle [ Cp2Zr(k 2-P,P-Ph2P-N-PPh2 ) ] ( <nUm> Zr ) . complex <nUm> , <nUm> Ti , <nUm> Hf , and <nUm> Zr were characterized by x-ray crystallography . the structure and bonding of all complex were investigated by DFT calculation . all road lead to rome : heterometallacyclic complex of the type [ Cp2M(k 2-P,P-Ph2P-N-PPh2 ) ] ( cp = i*5-cyclopentadienyl ; m = Ti , Zr ) can be prepared by using four different synthetic pathway ( see scheme ) . all route yielded the corresponding metallacycles in very high yield . analysis of the structure and bonding of these complex revealed that in-plane aromaticity play an important role for the stabilization of these specie . the reaction of different metallocene fragment [Cp2M] ( cp = i*5-cyclopentadienyl , m = Ti , Zr ) with diferrocenylacetylene and 1,4-diferrocenylbuta-1,3-diyne is described . the titanocene complex form the highly strained three- and five - membered ring system [Cp2Ti(I*2-FcC2Fc)] ( 1 ) and [Cp2Ti(I*4-FcC4Fc)] ( 2 ) ( fc = [ Fe(I*5-C5H4) ( I*5-C5H5 ) ] ) by addition of the appropriate alkyne or diyne to Cp2Ti . zirconocene precursor react with diferrocenyl- and ferrocenylphenylacetylene under C-C bond coupling to yield the metallacyclopentadienes [ Cp2Zr(C4Fc <nUm> ) ] ( 3 ) and [ Cp2Zr(C4Fc2Ph <nUm> ) ] ( 5 ) , respectively . the exchange of the zirconocene unit in <nUm> by hydrogen atom open the route to the super-crowded ferrocenyl-substituted compound tetraferrocenylbutadiene ( 4 ) . on the other hand , the reaction of 1,4-diferrocenylbuta-1,3-diyne with zirconocene complex afforded a cleavage of the central C-C bond , and thus , dinuclear [ { Cp2Zr(m- I*1 : I*2-C ≡ CFc ) } <nUm> ] ( 6 ) that consists of two zirconocene acetylide group wa formed . most of the complex were characterized by single - crystal x-ray crystallography , showing attractive multinuclear molecule . the redox property of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were studied by cyclic voltammetry . upon oxidation to <nUm> n+ , 5n+ , and 6n+ ( n = 1-3 ) , decomposition occured with in situ formation of new specie . the follow-up product from <nUm> and <nUm> posse two or four reversible redox event pointing to butadiene - based molecule . however , the dinuclear complex <nUm> afforded ethynylferrocene under the measurement condition . super-crowded metallocenes : the reaction of diferrocenylacetylene and 1,4-diferrocenylbuta-1,3-diyne with group <nUm> metallocene compound yield attractive multiferrocenyl complex . depending on the metal , different product were obtained by complexation , coupling , or C-C bond cleavage of the ligand ( see scheme ) . their electrochemical property were studied in detail . the oxidation of the metallacycle induces decomposition of the complex . 1,2,3,4-Tetrasubstituted cyclopentadienes and indene derivative with identical or different substituents were obtained in good to excellent isolated yield through a zirconocene- and ClCu - mediated intermolecular coupling process . this synthetic procedure involved three organic partner , including one CH 2I2 , and two different or identical alkyne . two alkyne or one diyne undergo Cp2ZrII - mediated ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) pair - selective reductive coupling to afford the corresponding zirconacyclopentadiene derivative , which react , in the presence of ClCu and 1,3-dimethyl-3,4,5,6-tetrahydro-2(1 H ) - pyrimidinone ( DMPU ) , with CH2I2 through intermolecular followed by intramolecular coupling to afford the cyclopentadiene derivative . an application of the prepared tetrasubstituted cyclopentadiene derivative wa demonstrated by the facile synthesis of the corresponding zirconocene complex [(4RCp)2ZrCl2] and [ ( 4RCp ) 2ZrR'2 ] ( R' = me , et , or nBu ) . the unique 1,2,3,4-tetrasubstituted cyclopentadiene ligand and the corresponding metallocenes are expected to have further application in organometallic chemistry and organic synthesis . ringing in the change : A one - pot synthesis of 1,2,3,4-tetrasubstituted cyclopentadienes by zirconocene- and ClCu - mediated intermolecular coupling of two alkyne and diiodomethane ( see scheme ; cp = e5-C5H5 ; DMPU = 1,3-dimethyl-3,4,5,6- tetrahydro-2(1 H ) - pyrimidinone ) gave product that were successfully applied for the synthesis of the corresponding zirconocene derivative . A study of the coordination chemistry of different amidato ligand [(R)N-C(Ph)O] ( r = ph , 2,6-diisopropylphenyl ( dipp ) ) at group <nUm> metallocenes is presented . the heterometallacyclic complex [ Cp2M(Cl) {k2-N,O-(R)N-C(Ph)O} ] m = Zr , r = dipp ( <nUm> a ) , ph ( <nUm> b ) ; m = Hf , r = ph ( 2 ) ) were synthesized by reaction of [Cp2MCl2] with the corresponding deprotonated amide . complex <nUm> a wa also prepared by direct deprotonation of the amide with schwartz reagent [Cp2Zr(H)Cl] . salt metathesis reaction of [Cp2Zr(H)Cl] with deprotonated amide [(Dipp)N-C(Ph)O] gave the zirconocene hydrido complex [ Cp2M(H) {k2-N,O-(Dipp)N-C(Ph)O} ] ( 3 ) . reaction of <nUm> a with Mg did not result in the desired Zr (III) complex but in formation of Mg complex [ ( py ) 3Mg(Cl) {k2-N,O-(Dipp)N-C(Ph)O} ] ( <nUm> ; py = pyridine ) . the paramagnetic complex [ Cp'2Ti{k2-N,O-(R)N-C(Ph) O } ] ( cp ' = cp , r = ph ( <nUm> a ) ; cp ' = cp , r = dipp ( <nUm> b ) ; cp ' = cp , r = ph ( 8 ) ) were prepared by the reaction of the known titanocene alkyne complex [ cp 2'Ti(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ] ( cp ' = cp ( 5 ) , cp ' = cp* ( 6 ) ) with the corresponding amide . complex <nUm> a , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> a , <nUm> b , and <nUm> were characterized by x-ray crystallography . the structure and bonding of complex <nUm> a and <nUm> were also characterized by EPR spectroscopy . coordination chemistry : heterometallacyclic complex of the type [ Cp2M(L){k2-N,O-(Dipp)N-C(Ph) O } ] ( m = Ti , no L ; m = Zr , L = Cl ; dipp = 2,6-diisopropylphenyl ; see scheme ) can be prepared by a hydrogen-evolution reaction from either [ Cp2Ti(e 2-Me3SiC2SiMe3 ) ] or schwartz reagent [Cp2Zr(H)Cl] , giving the corresponding metallacycles in very high yield . EPR measurement revealed the stabilizing effect of the amidate ligand for paramagnetic d1 TiIII complex . unusual nonlinear asymmetric amplification and chiral ligand loading effect were discovered for the use of catalytic quantity of chiral aminoalcohols in the in situ hydrozirconation - transmetalation - aldehyde addition process . while the stereochemically most efficient aminothiol ligand demonstrated mechanistically conventional reaction parameter in excellent agreement with kagan 's ML2 system , the asymmetric induction in the presence of a chiral aminoalcohol wa found to vary greatly with loading and % ee of the ligand . aminothiols remain the ligand of choice for the highly enantioselective formation of allylic alcohol and provide experimentally more predictable reaction variable . however , new , optimized condition lead to a synthetically useful product % ee using the readily available and scalable aminoalcohol 2a . evaporative light - scattering detection ( ELSD ) is widely applied in the HPLC analysis of organic compound lacking a UY chromophore . however , this detection method is generally unsuitable for determination of enantiomeric ratio ( er ) . the er calculated from a UV trace and an ELS trace of the same compound differs significantly . because of the nonlinear concentration response of the ELS detector , a compound with an er of <nUm> : <nUm> appears to be enantiomerically pure by ELS detection . it is possible to obtain a calibration curve and to calculate a correction factor , but this procedure is time consuming and therefore not very practical for routine analysis . In contrast , a charged aerosol detector allows a very accurate determination of the enantiomeric ratio . like the ELS detection , the CA detection is independent of the chromophore property of the substrate . therefore , we recommend the use of CA instead of ELS detection for determination of the enantiomeric ratio of non-UV active compound . A series of (Z,Z)-tetraaryl-1,3-butadiene ha been synthesized stereospecifically and regioselectively by acidolysis of five-membered Ti , Zr metallocycles formed from asymmetrically substituted alkyne . the structure of these product have been proved by physical and chemical method . free car - parrinello molecular dynamic ( CPMD ) simulation of four diastereomers of the zirconium - propene complex [ {iPr(3-iPr-CpFlu)}ZriBu(C 3H6)]+ ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ; flu = fluorenyl ) provide valuable insight into the mechanism and stereocontrol of propene polymerization with stereorigid metallocenes . spontaneous insertion of propene into the zirconium - isobutyl bond is not observed , and propene is found to be weakly bound and to rotate relatively freely around the C-C bond to be formed . large - amplitude rotation of the isopropyl substituent around the cp - iPr bond may play a role in triggering dissociation of propene . three of the four diastereomers eliminate propene during the course of the simulation , which make dissociation the dominating event on a 20-ps timescale . the CPMD simulation thus support the validity of the assumption , fundamental to statistical propagation model , that each insertion is independent of the preceding insertion . using insertion barrier from static density functional calculation , the statistical model predicts the polypropene microstructure in good agreement with experiment at low polymerization temperature for the catalyst {iPr(3-R-CpFlu)}ZrCl2 ( r = H , iPr , tBu ) . the prediction become le accurate at higher temperature , probably due to the onset of the competing back - skip reaction , which is not included in the model . some new volatile bis-cyclopentadienyl zirconium alkoxides of the type cp 2Zr(OR)(O tBu ) ( r = iPr , et , me ) is synthesized by the reaction of the corresponding KOR with the intermediate cp 2ZrCl(O tBu ) . moreover , an alternative and convenient synthesis of cp 2Zr(O tBu ) <nUm> , based on the reaction of cp 2ZrCl <nUm> with an excess of tert-butanol and triethylamine , is reported . the obtained compound are identified by chemical analysis , thermogravimetric measurement , infrared ( IR ) , nuclear magnetic resonance ( NMR ) spectroscopy , and mass spectrometry ( MS ) . furthermore , a crystallographic study of cp 2ZrCl(O tBu ) is also reported . cp 2Zr(O tBu ) <nUm> and cp 2Zr(O iPr)(O tBu ) are then used for depositing zirconia thin film of high quality and purity on Si(100) and stainless steel AISI <nUm> substrate by metal - organic (MO)CVD . the microstructure and composition of the deposit are investigated by x-ray diffraction ( XRD ) and secondary ion mass spectrometry ( SIMS ) , while their hardness and elastic recovery on the AISI <nUm> substrate are measured using load - depth nano-indentation test . the outcome are consistent with a significant increase in the berkovich hardness of the coated sample compared to that of bulk AISI <nUm> . the allyl-substituted ansa - zirconocene dichloride [ Me2Si(C 5H4)(C5H3CH2CH = CH 2)ZrCl2 ] ( 1 ) cleanly add the borane 9-BBN to the allyl C = C double bond to yield the corresponding hydroboration product <nUm> . the borane BC12F10H ( 3 ) is also added regioselectively to <nUm> to yield [ Me2Si(C5H4){C5H 3(CH2)3B(C6F5) 2}ZrCl2 ] ( 4 ) . the strongly electrophilic boron lewis acid in <nUm> add 2-methyl-4,5-dihydrooxazole to yield <nUm> . treatment of <nUm> with pyrrole result in the formation of the respective borane adduct <nUm> of the pyrrole tautomer 2H-pyrrole . the 2H-pyrrole ligand in <nUm> is deprotonated at C-2 upon treatment with pyridine , followed by proton transfer and replacement of pyrrole with formation of the corresponding pyridine adduct <nUm> . the complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by x-ray diffraction . the monoalkyl complex [ Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) (e5-C5H3R)}(R')Cl ] [ r = me , R' = CH2Ph ( 1 ) ; r = me , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( 2 ) ; r = iPr , R' = CH2Ph ( 3 ) ; r = iPr , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( 4 ) ; r = SiMe3 , R' = CH2Ph ( 5 ) ; r = SiMe3 , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( <nUm> ] have been synthesized by the reaction of the corresponding ansa - metallocene dichloride complex and <nUm> equiv of the alkyl grignard reagent . dialkyl complex with large alkyl group only formed for the zirconocene complex containing the ansa ligand Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) ( e5-C5H4 ) and with the benzyl substituent giving [ Zr(Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) (e5-C5H4)}(CH2Ph) <nUm> ] ( 7 ) . when the alkyl substituent is CH2SiMe3 only the monoalkyl derivative , [ Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) (e5-C5H4)}(CH2 SiMe3)Cl ] ( 8 ) , wa formed . the insertion reaction of the isocyanide reagent CNC6H3Me2-2,6 into the zirconium-carbon s-bond of complex 1-8 gave the corresponding e2-iminoacyl compound [ Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) (e5-C5H3R)}{e2-R 'C = NC6H3Me2-2,6}Cl ] [ r = me , R' = CH2Ph ( 9 ) ; r = me , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( 10 ) ; r = iPr , R' = CH2Ph ( 11 ) ; r = iPr , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( 12 ) ; r = SiMe3 , R' = CH2Ph ( 13 ) ; r = SiMe3 , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( 14 ) ; r = H , R' = CH2SiMe3 ( 16 ) ] and [ Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) (e5-C5H4)}{e2- PhCH2C = NC6H3Me2-2,6 } ( CH2Ph ) ] ( 15 ) . the molecular structure of <nUm> ha been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . methylenetriphenylphosphorane wa coordinated to the boron of phenylborylidene-bridged bis(cyclopentadienyl)-and bis(2-Me,4-Ph-indenyl) zirconium dichloride to form zwitterionic ansa - zirconocene complex . the cyclopentadienyl complex <nUm> , when activated with MAO , exhibit remarkable polymerization activity that is more than an order of magnitude greater than that of a related amidoborylidene-bridged complex a well a the commercially important pre-catalyst [Cp'-SiMe2-N-tBu]TiCl2 ( cp' ; C5Me4 ) . the zwitterionic bis(2-Me,4-Ph- indenyl)zirconium dichloride specie is isolated a a mixture of rac and meso isomer 4-6 . the propylene polymerization efficiency of the isomer mixture activated by MAO is greater than that of a related silylene bridged system at <nUm> and <nUm> ° C ; however , the activity of the zwitterionic system decreased with further increase in temperature . the high level of isotactic triad ( <nUm> % ) and pentad ( <nUm> % ) in the polypropylene formed by 4-6 indicates that the rac isomer is the most active precatalyst of the mixture . the molecular structure of <nUm> and the rac bis-indenylzirconium isomer <nUm> and one of the meso isomer <nUm> are described . In this paper we report the synthesis of several unbridged zirconocenes , 1a-c , <nUm> and <nUm> , each bearing a phenyl substituent in the 2-position of the cyclopentadienyl ring . we also report their photochemical behaviour and we compare the result with those obtained with the corresponding unsubstituted metallocenes 3a-c and <nUm> . study of their electronic spectrum and EPR / spin trapping experiment showed photogeneration of ligand- and zirconium - centred radical , thus making these complex suitable a photoinitiators for radical polymerisation process . the substitution of the hydrogen atom in the 2-position with a phenyl group had positive effect both on the absorption coefficient , improving the light absorption efficiency , and on the reaction yield of tert-butyl acrylate polymerisation . these result can be explained in term of the combined effect of greater persistence of the radical in solution and / or increased efficiency of the radical in initiating the polymerisation process . treatment of the substituted (diarylphosphanyl)methyl group-4 metallocene complex [ ( C5H4-CR1R2- PAr2)2ZrCl2 ] ( <nUm> : R1 / R2 = CH3 / CH3 , H / CH3 , H / aryl ) with Li[B(C6F5)4] in dichloromethane solution result in chloride ligand abstraction ( with ClLi precipitation ) to yield the complex [ ( C5H4-CR1R2- PAr2)2Zr-Cl+ ] ( 5 ) , with both phosphanyl group internally coordinated to the metal centre . three possible diastereoisomers are observed in the case of 5c ( R1 = H ; R2 = CH3 ) , while bulkier R2 substituents give higher selectivity . the thermally induced ( reversible ) cleavage of the Zr - phosphane linkage result in dynamic NMR behaviour . gibbs activation energy of DG[?](298 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> and <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol were obtained for these intramolecular equilibration process in the complex trans-5d ( R1 = H ; R2 = ph ) and trans-5e ( R1 = H ; R2 = ferrocenyl ) , respectively . treatment of the substituted (dimethylamino)methyl metallocene complex [ ( C5H4-CR1R2- NMe2)2ZrCl2 ] ( 6a , 6b ) with Li[B(C6F5)4] proceeds analogously to yield the cation system [ { C5H4-C(CH3)2- NMe2}2ZrCl+ ] ( 12a ) and [ { C5H4-CH(CH3)- NMe2}2ZrCl+ ] ( 12b , three possible diastereoisomers ) . both complex have their pair of amino group coordinated to the metal centre . the complex exhibit dynamic NMR spectrum . selective equilibration of the diastereotopic N(CH3)A(CH3)B resonance of complex 12a is observed [ DG[?](233 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol ] , whereas the adjacent C(CH3)A(CH3)B methyl group remain diastereotopic . the dynamic equilibration of the latter wa observed at a markedly higher temperature [ DG[?](333 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol ] . treatment of [ { C5H4-C(CH3)2- NMe2}CpZrCl2 ] ( 10 ) with Li[B(C6F5)4] resulted in the formation of complex [ { C5H4-C(CH3)2- NMe2}CpZr - cl+ ] ( 11 ) , which show the internal -N(CH3)A(CH)B equilibration proceeding with a markedly higher activation barrier [ DG[?](333 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol ] than in 12a , and a stereochemical memory effect indicative of solvent coordination to the metal centre of the resulting highly electrophilic chlorozirconocene cation intermediate . complex <nUm> wa characterised by an x-ray crystal structure analysis , which show the internal zr-amine coordination . ( alkylation of ansa - zirconocene [ Zr{(e5-C5H 5)SiMe2 - (MBI)}Cl2 ] ( MBI = e5-Me- C13H7 ) with MgRCl gave the dimethyl complex [ Zr{(e5-C5H5)SiMe2(MBI)}Me <nUm> ] , but unresolvable mixture containing mono-alkylated compound were obtained when bulkier alkyl were used . however pure dialkyl complex [ Zr{(e5-C5H5)SiMe2(MBI)}R <nUm> ] ( r = CH2Ph , CH2SiMe3 ) were easily obtained using K(CH2Ph) and Li(CH-2SiMe3) a alkylating agent . diastereoselective insertion into the MBI - unprotected Zr-R bond wa observed when all of these dialkyl complex were treated with 2,6-xylyl isocyanide to give the iminoacyl compound [ zr{(e5- C5H5)SiMe2(MBI)}R{CR[e2-N-(2,6- xylyl ) ] } ] ( r = me , CH2Ph , CH2SiMe3 ) . all of the new complex were characterized by NMR spectroscopy and the x-ray molecular structure of the dibenzyl and the imino-benzyl compound were determined . the catalytic activity for ethene polymerization and ethene / 1-hexene copolymerization of the dichloro zirconocenes [ Zr{(e5-C 5H5)EMe2(MBI)}Cl2 ] ( e = C , Si ) , activated with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , wa measured . the dimethyltitanocene / BC18F15 system reacts with the 4-unprotected methyl a-D-glucopyranoside derivative <nUm> ( " HO-carb . " ) to yield the ionic complex [ Cp2Ti(O-carb . ) ] +[MeB(C6F5)3]- ( 10a ) . spectroscopic study have led u to believe that 10a is characterized by an internal ether - chelate structure in solution that involves coordination of the 6-OCH2Ph oxygen atom . treatment of 10a with trimethylphosphane give the open , non-chelated complex 11a , in which the phosphane coordinate to the metal center . reaction of the THF - stabilized salt [ Cp2TiCH 3(THF)]+[BPh4]- ( 12a ) with <nUm> gave complex 13a , with coordinated THF . experiment with bis(methylcyclopentadienyl) titanium system gave analogous result ( complex 10b , 11b and 13b ) . zirconocenes react differently . addition of dimethylzirconocene ( 14a ) or dimethylbis(methylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium ( 14b ) to <nUm> gave the neutral complex 15a , 15b and methane . treatment of 15a ( 15b ) with B(C 6F5)3 again resulted in the formation of an ionic chelate complex 16a ( 16b ) . A non-chelated complex <nUm> wa formed by treating the THF - stabilized salt [Cp2ZrCH3(THF)] +[BPh4]- ( 17 ) with <nUm> . the chemistry of the metallocene bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene complex ( Cp2M(L)(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ] [ m = Ti , without L ( 1 ) ; m = Zr , L = THF ( 2a ) ; m = Zr , L = pyridine ( 2b ) ] , the pentamethylcyclopentadienyl complex [ cp . 2M(e2-Me3Si-C2SiMe3) ] [ m = Ti ( 3 ) , Zr ( 4 ) ] , and the ethylenebis(tetrahydroindenyl) ( ebthi ) complex rac-[(ebthi)M(e2-Me3SiC2-SiMe3)] [ m = Ti ( 5 ) , Zr ( 6 ) ] ha been described in several review . A fine - tuning of the reaction is possible by varying the cp ligand ( cp , cp. , ebthi ) , additional the co-ligands ( THF , pyridine ) , and / or metal ( Ti , Zr ) , and it ha been pointed out that these complex offer a number of compelling advantage over other , similar , widely used metallocene reagent . In this microreview recent ( 2000-2004 ) example of the chemistry of complex 1-6 are summarized , and some special interaction with lewis acid are described . In these reaction the metallocene core " Cp'2Ti " and " Cp'2Zr " ( cp' = substituted cp ligand ) are mostly formed after dissociation of the alkyne . As example of this , a new selective zirconocene coupling route to large , functionalized macrocycles ha been established from 2b and polyynes , complex <nUm> catalysis the first anti-Markovnikov hydroarnination of terminal alkyne , complex <nUm> and <nUm> selectively form polynuclear titanium complex by C-C coupling of N - containing heterocycle , and complex <nUm> , 2b , <nUm> , and <nUm> promote selective C-H and C-F bond - cleavage reaction of fluorinated N - containing heterocycle . beside this recent chemistry , this microreview also focus on the reaction of the above-mentioned complex with the lewis acid diisobutylaluminum hydride and tris-(pentafluorophenyl)borane . for example , complex <nUm> , 2b , and <nUm> react with iBu2AlH to give heterodimetallic complex containing tetracoordinate planar carbon atom . the titanium complex <nUm> reacts with B(C6F 5)3 with elimination of the alkyne and gaseous hydrogen to give an electrophilic substitution of the cp or cp . ligand in which zwitterionic TiIII complex are formed . the zirconium complex <nUm> and <nUm> do not liberate hydrogen in the reaction with B(C6F 5)3 , although , after C-H activation of one methyl group of the cp . or cp part of the ebthi ligand and a B-C bond formation , zwitterionic complex containing alkylidene group with agostic interaction with the metal center are obtained . complex <nUm> reacts with B(C6F 5)3 with Si-C bond cleavage of the alkyne and formation of an alkynylboranate [ Me3SiC = BC19F15 ] - , which is complexed by the " rac - (ebthi)Ti " fragment to give a zwitterionic complex . some of the formed heterodinuclear complex and the zwitterionic complex are active catalyst in the ring - opening polymerization of lactones , cyclic carbonate , and epoxides , a well a the polymerization of ethylene . the synthesis and structure of the new zirconium(+3) silylphosphanido complex {[Cp2ZrP(H)R]2} 1a { cp = e5- CH ; r = SiMe2C(iPr)Me2 } , 1b ( r = SiiPr3 ) , and 1c ( r = SiF(tBu) ( 2,4,6-iPr3C 6H2 ) are reported . the latter are easily accessible by the reaction of the lithium salt of the corresponding primary silylphosphanes with the schwartz reagent [ Cp2Zr(H) Cl ] in THF at <nUm> ° C . they can be isolated in the form of diamagnetic red - black crystal in 68-85 % yield . the central structural motif of the complex consists of planar ( 1a , 1b ) and slightly puckered PZr ring ( 1c ) , and contains two d1-Zr(+3) center , which are antiferromagnetically coupled ( super exchange , through - bond interaction ) although the transannular Zr-Zr separation is around 360pm . thus , the compound have a biradicaloid electronic structure , heating of solution of 1a-c in toluene in the presence of Pd / C or [ ( ph 3P ) 2Pt(C2H4) ] result in catalytic dehydrogenation of the P-H bond , affording the first neutral zirconocene - phosphinidene dimer [Cp2ZrPR]2Sa-C in the form of deep red crystal in 72-88 % yield . the composition of the product is proven by multinuclear NMR spectroscopy , mass spectrometry and correct C,H - combustion analysis . the molecular structure of 3a and 3c were additionally confirmed by x-ray crystal structure analysis , showing that they consist of PZr ring with significantly shorter Zr-P distance than those observed in 1a and 1c , interestingly , the dehydrogenation of the mostly sterically crowded derivative 1c occurs also in boiling toluene solution without using a catalyst , but the process is prevented in a H atmosphere . this suggests that the zr(+3) center in 1c can serve a active site for the P-H bonding activation , which , however , are deactivated in the presence of H . the synthesis and characterization of chiral bis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride containing b-pinenyl-derived ligand substituents is reported . unbridged metallocene complex having the [?](1S , 2S , 5S)-6,6- dimethylbicyclo[3.1.1]hept-2-yl]methyl)dimethylsilyl substituent in both 1- and 2-positions of the indenyl moiety were prepared and isolated in moderate to low yield by reaction of the corresponding indenyllithium salt with ClZr <nUm> followed by work-up and crystallization procedure . the corresponding tetrahydroindenyl complex were obtained in excellent yield by catalytic hydrogenation of the indenyl six - membered ring . In a complementary approach , a synthetic route to a-pinenyl-substituted indenyl ligand analogue wa briefly evaluated , which however , suffered from low yield . selected ss-pinenyl-substituted indenyl complex were scanned a catalyst for the dehydropolymerization of phenylsilane upon activation with nBuLi , for polymerization of ethylene and propylene upon activation with methylalumlnoxane ( MAO ) a well a for enantioselective carboalumination of 1-octene with triethyland trimethylaluminum . the bis(indenyl) complex catalyzed the carboalumination reaction , albeit only low yield ( 8-16 % ) and low enantioselectivities ( ee = 0.5-10 % ) were obtained . the 2-substituted bis(indenyl)zirconocene / MAO catalyst system produced atactic low - molecular weight polypropylene with low polymerization activity whereas both 1-and 2-substituted complex showed high activity in ethylene polymerization producing polyethylene with high molecular weight ( mw > <nUm> ) . the systematic synthesis of 1,3-dialkyl-substituted 2-silylindenes and their suitability a zirconocene ligand is discussed . unexpected reactivity rendered a number of substitution pattern unfeasible , especially for alkyl group other than methyl in 2-(trimethylsilyl)indene derivative , and essentially for all derivative of 2-(dimethylsilyl)indene . the synthesis of rac / meso-bis[1-methyl-2-(trimethylsilyl)indenyljzirconium(IV) dichloride ( 12 ) and bis[1,3-dimethyl-2-(trimethylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 13b ) are de scribed . the solid - state structure of the latter display strong deformation within the ligand framework and an unusually large C PcentroidZr - CPcentroid angle . both , <nUm> / MAO and 13b / MAO , displayed ethene and ethene-co-1-hexene polymerization activity . curiously , 13b / MAO show an extraordinary monomer selectivity , which can be rationalized by mean of DFT calculation on the active site . the zirconocene complex Cp2Zr(L) ( e2-Me 3SiC2SiMe3 ) ( 1a : L = THF ; 1b : L = pyridine ) and the ethylene bis(tetrahydroindenyl) complex rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2- Me3SiC2SiMe3 ) ( 2 ) react with 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoropyridine with C-H bond activation to produce the 4-substituted pyridyl complex with agostic alkenyl group cp' 2Zr(4-C5NF4)[-C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe <nUm> ) ] ( cp'2 = cp2 ) ( 3 ) and ( cp'2 = ebthi ) ( 4 ) . with 2,3,4,6-tetrafluoropyridine , after C-H bond activation , complex <nUm> yield two isomer of the 5-substituted pyridyl complex rac-(ebthi)Zr(3-C5NF4)[-C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe3) ] with agostic alkenyl group , 5a and 5b . with pentafluoropyridine complex 1b give , after dissociation of the bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene ( btmsa ) , C-F bond activation at the 4-position and formation of Cp2Zr(4-C5NF4)F ( 6 ) . complex 1b reacts with 3-chloro-2,4,5,6-tetrafluoropyridine by mean of a preferred C-Cl activation to give Cp2Zr(3-C5NF4)Cl ( 7 ) . these result are in contrast to the reaction of the titanium complex cp 2Ti(e2-Me3-SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) which , with 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoropyridine , gave C-F activation in preference to C-H activation . with pentafluoropyridine , C-F bond activation at the 2-position wa found rather than at the 4-position . the heterometallic dinuclear complex [ Cp*2Zr(Me){(m- OOCC6H4S)Rh(PEt3)3 } ] ( 3 ) is readily obtained by methane elimination in the reaction of [ Rh(SC6H 4COOH)(PEt3)3 ] with [ cp* 2ZrMe2 ] in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio . complex <nUm> reacts with <nUm> equiv. of water to give [ Cp*2Zr(OH){(m-OOCC6H 4S)Rh(PEt3)3 } ] ( 4 ) , a rare example of a terminal hydroxo complex of a zirconocene . complex <nUm> and <nUm> are isotypic . the influence of the zirconocene group on the property of the rhodium complex wa evaluated with 31P NMR spectroscopy , cyclic voltammetry and DFT calculation . [Cp*2ZrMe2] reacts with [ {Rh(m-SC6H4COOH)(PPh3)2} <nUm> ] ( even in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio at room temperature ) or with [ Rh(SC 6H4COOH)(PEt3)3 ] ( in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio at elevated temperature ) to give 32-membered metallamacrocycles containing four rhodium and two zirconium atom , in which each zirconocene group bridge two {Rh(SC6H4COO)(PR3)2}2 unit [ r = ph ( 5 ) , et ( 6 ) ] . the only significant structural difference in <nUm> and <nUm> is the presence of two different isomer , in which the bridging thiolato ligand occupy either the exo or the endo position of the Rh2S <nUm> ring . however , this small difference ha a significant influence on the size of the macrocyclic cavity . dinuclear group <nUm> metallocene catalyst linked by a biphenylene or 1,2-diphenylethylene bridge , namely [ 4,4'-(C5Me 4)2-(C6H4)2][CpZrCl 2]2 ( 2a ) , [ p-(C5Me4)C 6H4CH2]2[CpZrCl2] <nUm> ( 2b ) , [ p-(3,4-Me2C5H2)C 6H4CH2]2[CpZrCl2] <nUm> ( 2c ) , [ (C5Me4)2-(C 6H4)2][TiCl3]2 ( 3a ) , [p-(C5Me4)C6H4CH2] 2[TiCl3]2 ( 3b ) , and [ p-(3,4-Me 2C5H2)C6H4CH 2]2[TiCl3]2 ( 3c ) , have been prepared and the crystal structure of 2b and 3b determined by x-ray diffraction method . the crystal structure reveal that these complex consist of two equivalent metal unit inverted with respect to the center of the bridge . all the complex were tested for the polymerization of ethylene and styrene in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , and direct comparison of their catalytic property with those of the corresponding mononuclear analogue [ ( PhC 5Me4)-CpZrCl2 ] ( 4a ) , [ ( p-TolC 5Me4)CpZrCl2 ] ( 4b ) , [ ( 1-p-Tol-3,4-Me 2C5H2)CpZrCl2 ] ( 4c ) , [ ( PhC 5Me4)TiCl3 ] ( 5a ) , [ ( p-TolC5Me 4)TiCl3 ] ( 5b ) , and [ ( 1-p-Tol-3,4-Me2C 5H2)TiCl3 ] ( 5c ) were performed . the dinuclear zirconocenes show a high activity in ethylene polymerization comparable with those of the corresponding mononuclear catalyst and give an increased molecular weight of polyethylene . the dinuclear half - sandwich titanocenes exhibit similar or slightly lower activity and molecular weight in styrene polymerization compared with their mononuclear analogue . the reaction of [ e5-C5H5- ( e5-C5H4CMe2C6H 4Me)Zr(CH2Ph)2 ] ( 1 ) with the cation generating agent BC18F15 wa studied by mean of multinuclear NMR and density functional theory ( DFT ) method . the clean reaction in CD2Cl2 at <nUm> ° C yielded the cationic compound [ e5-C5H5-(e5 : e1-C5H4-CR2C6H 4R)Zr(e2-CH2Ph) ] ( r = me : <nUm> , r = H : <nUm> ) , with a tolyl moiety coordinated to the cationic zirconium centre , in addition to the expected e2-coordination of the benzyl moiety . both coordination were unambiguously assigned by multi-nuclear one- and two - dimensional NMR spectroscopy . detailed DFT calculation of congener <nUm> at the B3LYP level of theory explain the unusual chemical shift of the coordinated atom of the tolyl moiety . furthermore , detailed electronic analysis ( bader and NBO analysis ) were undertaken to ascertain the type of coordination ( agostic versus electrostatic ) that the tolyl moiety adopts . the zirconocene complex [ zr(e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> ){e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -(CMe <nUm> CH <nUm> CH <nUm> CH = CH <nUm> )}Cl <nUm> ] ( 4 ) and [ zr{e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> ( CMe <nUm> -CH <nUm> CH <nUm> CH = CH <nUm> ) } <nUm> Cl <nUm> ] ( 5 ) were synthesised from the reaction of the lithium derivative [ Li{C <nUm> H <nUm> ( CMe <nUm> CH <nUm> -CH <nUm> CH = CH <nUm> ) } ] ( 1 ) with [ zr(e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> )Cl <nUm> ] or ClZr <nUm> , respectively . the ansa - zirconocene catalyst , whereas the unbridged metallocene catalyst produced atactic polypropylene . the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . the nickel - catalyzed cross-coupling of 2-bromoindene with propynyl- or (phenylethynyl)magnesium bromide give the corresponding 2-alkynyl-substituted indenyl ligand . subsequent deprotonation and transmetallation with the bis-(tetrahydrofuran)zirconium tetrachloride adduct yield the corresponding bis(2-alkynylindenyl)dichloridozirconium complex 4a and 4b , which cleanly add a C3CoO3 unit to their pair of alkynyl substituents to give the dimetallic complex 5a and 5b . complex 5b wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . complex 4a add HB(C6F 5)2 to the alkynyl substituents to yield a mixture of a- and b-(boryl-alkenyl)metallocenes . activation of these complex with MAO give active ethene polymerization catalyst , and the 4a,4b,6a / MAO system are also active in propene polymerization . the indene ligand {1-C9H7R} [ r = C2H 4(C4H7O2) ( 1 ) , C2H 4(C3H5O2) ( 2 ) , CH2(C 5H9O ) ( 3 ) ] were prepared by alkylation of indene and used to prepare the SiMe2 - bridged indenylcyclopentadiene ligand { me 2Si(3-C9H6R)(C5Me4H) } [ r = C6H11O2 ( 4 ) , C6H11O ( 5 ) ] . bis(indenyl) - and ansa-indenylcyclopentadienyl zirconocenes [ Zr{1-e5-C 9H6R}2Cl2 ] { r = C2H 4(C4H7O2) ( 6 ) , C2H 4(C3H5O2) ( 7 ) , CH2(C 5H9O ) ( 8 ) } and [ Zr{Me2Si(3-e5- C9H5R ) ( e5-C5Me 4)}Cl2 ] { r = C2H4(C 4H7O2 ) ( 9 ) , CH2(C5H 9O ) ( 10 ) } were prepared by the reaction of Cl4Zr with the appropriate mono- or dilithium salt of 1-5 . the molecular structure of [ Zr{Me2Si(3-e5-C9H5C 2H4(C4H7O2) ) (e5-C5Me4)}Cl2 ] ( 9 ) wa determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . indenylzirconium complex 6-10 were immobilized on thf - modified Cl2Mg , and these supported system were used to polymerize ethylene in the presence of methylaluminoxane . the catalytic activity of these complex in both homogeneous and supported polymerization reaction is discussed . reaction of Et2NSi(SiMe3)3 with potassium tert-butoxide give the silylenoid Et2N(Me3Si) 2SiK . structural characterisation and reactivity of this compound wa studied . it wa found that while Et2N(Me3Si) 2SiK exhibit the typical NMR spectroscopic property for a silylenoid specie it doe not undergo self - condensation under ambient condition . it reaction with zirconocene and hafnocene dichloride gave the expected silyl metallocene chloride . however , there seems to be no strong interaction between the amino nitrogen atom and the group-4 metal . besides the synthesis of Et2N(Me3Si)2-SiK also the preparation of the related silylenoid compound ( Et2N ) 2(Me3Si)SiK and wa accomplished . the 4-isoprenyl- and 1-isoprenylcyclopentadienides 6a and 6b were prepared by mean of a fulvene route involving a subsequent deprotonation reaction using potassium hexamethyldisilylamide . transmetallation to zirconium or hafnium gave the respective bis(4-isoprenyl-Cp)MCl2 and bis(1-isoprenyl-Cp) MCl2 complex 7a,b and 8a,b , respectively . upon photolysis , the (4-isoprenyl-Cp)2ZrCl2 and -HfCl2 complex 7a , 8a underwent rapid intramolecular [4+4] cycloaddition reaction to yield the cyclooctadienylene-bridged ansa - metallocenes 9a , 10a in high yield . the (4-isoprenyl-Cp)2MCl2 complex A ( m = Zr , Hf ) undergo rapid photochemical [4+4] cycloaddition to give the cyclooctadienylene-bridged ansa - metallocenes B in high yield . the synthesis , structure , and ring - opening polymerization ( ROP ) activity of new dimethyl-ansa- and -non-ansa-zirconocene complex are reported . the substituted indene precursor 1-C9H7R [ r = CH3 ( 1 ) , CH2Ph ( 2 ) and C2H4(C4H 7O2 ) ( 3 ) ] were synthesised by treating RBr [ r = CH 2Ph and C2H4(C4H7O <nUm> ) ] or MeI with indenyllithium . likewise , bridged indenyl / cyclopentadiene compound [ Me2Si(3-C9H 6R)(C5Me4H) ] [ r = H ( 4 ) , CH3 ( 5 ) , CH2Ph ( 6 ) and C2H4(C4H 7O2 ) ( 7 ) ] were obtained by treating the lithium salt of the appropriately substituted indene with ClSiMe2(C 5Me4H ) . ansa-Indenyl-cyclopentadienylmetallocenes [ Zr{Me2Si(3-e5-C9H5R) (e5-C5Me4)}Cl2 ] [ r = H ( 8 ) , CH3 ( 9 ) , CH2Ph ( 10 ) , C2H4(C 4H7O2 ) ( 11 ) ] were subsequently obtained by treating the dilithium salt of the corresponding ligand with Cl4Zr in toluene . the dimethyl derivative [ Zr{Me2Si(3-e5- C9H5R)(e5-C5Me 4)}Me2 ] [ r = H ( 12 ) , CH3 ( 13 ) , CH2Ph ( 14 ) , C6H11O2 ( 15 ) ] were prepared by treating the corresponding ansa - zirconocene dichloride complex with MgMeBr . dialkyl derivative [ Zr{Me2Si{3-e5-C 9H5(CH2Ph)}(e5-C 5Me4)}(CH2SiMe3)2 ] ( 16 ) wa prepared by adding <nUm> equiv. of LiCH2SiMe3 to complex <nUm> . mixed indenyl / cyclopentadienylzirconocene complex [ zr(e5- C9H6R)(e5-C5H 5)Cl2 ] [ r = H ( 17 ) , C2H4(C 4H7O2 ) ( 18 ) ] were prepared by treating the lithium salt of the appropriately substituted indene with [ zr(e5- C5H5)Cl3 ] . likewise , dimethyl derivative [ Zr(e5-C9H6R)(e5-C 5H5)Me2 ] [ r = H ( 19 ) , C2H 4(C4H7O2) ( 20 ) ] were prepared by treating the corresponding mixed indenyl / cyclopentadienyl dichloride complex with <nUm> equiv. of MgMeBr . the x-ray crystal structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were also established . finally , comparative catalytic study of zirconium complex 12-16 , <nUm> and <nUm> in ROP reaction of e-caprolactone are described . synthesis , characterization , and catalytic study of new dimethyl-ansa- and -non-ansa-zirconocene complex for ring - opening polymerization of e-caprolactone are described . seven - membered metallacycloalkyne compound were synthesized . the reaction of the zirconocene-ethylene complex and (Z)-1,4-bis(trimethylsilyl)buta-1,2,3- triene gave a mixture of 1-zirconacyclopent-3-yne and 1-zirconacyclohept-3-yne . In contrast , zirconocene - alkyne complex , such a those of 1-(trimethylsilyl) prop-1-yne and diphenylacetylene , gave 1-zirconacyclohept-2-en-5-yne in good yield . consideration of structural parameter suggests that both a seven - membered cyclic alkyne and a five - membered structure contribute to generation of this complex . coupling of benzyne and [3]cumulenes on a metal wa also found to afford the corresponding metallacycles . seven - membered metallacycloalkyne compound were synthesized and structurally characterized . zirconocene - alkyne complex , such a those of 1-(trimethylsilyl)prop-1-yne and diphenylacetylene reacted with [3]cumulene to give 1-zirconacyclohept-2-en-5-yne in good yield . coupling of benzyne and [3]cumulenes on the metal also gave the corresponding metallacycles . borylation of hafno - and zirconocene complex [ ( e5-C 5H2- 1,2,4-Me3)2M ] <nUm> ( m2,e2,e2-N <nUm> ) , containing strongly activated dinitrogen ligand , with pinacolborane ( HBPin ) resulted in N-B and M-H bond formation . treatment of the borylated product with carbon monoxide triggered N-N bond scission with concomitant N-C bond formation to produce m-borylimido and m-formamidido fragment . conversely , addition of tBuNC resulted in insertion of the isocyanide ligand into the M-H bond and furnished the corresponding e2- iminoacylhafnocene complex . the reaction of the metallocene generator Cp'2M(L) ( e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) [ 1a-Ti : cp' = cp = e5-cyclopentadienyl , m = Ti , L = none ; 1b-Ti : cp' = cp* = e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl , m = Ti , L = none ; 1c-Ti : cp'2 = rac - ( ebthi ) = rac-ethylenebistetrahydroindenyl , m = Ti , L = none ; 1a-Zr : cp' = cp , m = Zr , L = pyridine ; 1b-Zr : cp' = cp* , m = Zr , L = none ; 1c-Zr : cp'2 = rac - ( ebthi ) , m = Zr , L = none ] with 1,2-bis(4',4',5',5'- tetramethyl[1',3',2']dioxaborolan-2'-yl)acetylene ( bPinBA , <nUm> ) a a di-heteroatom - substituted alkyne were investigated . A slightly special reaction of 1a-Ti with <nUm> produced no titanacyclopropene or titanacyclopentadiene , but instead complex <nUm> wa produced by the coupling of two alkyne unit with one of the cp ligand to form a six - membered ring annelated to a five - membered one . the titanocene complex 1b-Ti and 1c-Ti reacted with <nUm> to form the titanacylopropenes <nUm> and <nUm> . the complex 1a-Zr reacts with <nUm> to the corresponding zirconacyclopropene <nUm> a a byproduct , in which the pyridine ligand remains coordinated . if the pyridine ligand dissociates , a coupling with a second alkyne yield the zirconacyclopentadiene <nUm> a the main product . the reaction of the sterically more demanding zirconocene precursor 1c-Zr also yielded the zirconacyclopentadiene <nUm> , whereas 1b-Zr did not react with <nUm> . the complex rac-(ebthi)Ti(e2-bPinBA) ( 5 ) reacts with gaseous dry CO2 directly to form the titanafuranone <nUm> . the molecular structure of complex <nUm> and <nUm> were characterised by single - crystal x-ray crystallography . group <nUm> metallocenes and bis(tetramethyldioxaborolanyl)acetylene gave different product : " Cp2Ti " afforded a dihydroindenyl complex . " rac - (ebthi)Ti " , " Cp*2Ti " and " cp 2Zr(py) " led to metallacyclopropenes , whereas " cp 2Zr " and " rac - (ebthi)Zr " yielded metallacyclopentadienes . one of the titanacyclopropenes reacts with CO <nUm> to a titanacyclofuranone . novel seco - analog of CC - <nUm> <nUm> were synthesized from comercially available nitroaniline by reduction , bromination , bisulfonation and bisallylation followed by reaction with tert-butyllithium , zirconocene and iodine . the obtained quinoline <nUm> wa then transformed into <nUm> and <nUm> , which , upon treatment with pd0 , led to <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . reaction of schwartz 's reagent [Cp2ZrHCl]n ( 1 ) ( one or two equivalent ) with gem - dinitrile compound of the type X(CN)2 [ x = CMe2 , CBenz2 , Ni2PPr4 ] give the corresponding mono- and di-N-zirconated imino complex selectively . substitution reaction of the zirconocene metal fragment with electrophiles such a , for example , chlorophosphanes of the type R2PCl , acid chloride RC(O)Cl or the iminium salt [CH2NMe2]Cl allowed the preparation of a large variety of stable N - functionalized mono- and b-diimine derivative . the nature of the x group is of particular importance for the success of the substitution reaction step . the x-ray crystal structure obtained for the N - functionalized gem - aldiminonitrile compound <nUm> , 10b , the N - phosphorylated b-diimine <nUm> , and the gem - formyl nitrile derivative 12b are presented . ( during the last <nUm> year , group-IV metal complex have been used extensively a catalyst in organic chemistry . however , a new and rapidly growing field for group-IV metal catalysis evolved in the 1990s when the group of bergman , livinghouse and doye found that zirconium and titanium complex catalyze the inter- and intramolecular hydroamination of alkyne and allenes . starting from early result obtained with zirconocene bis(amides) , this review deal mostly with hydroamination reaction based on titanium catalyst . In this context , study directed towards catalyst development are presented a well a application of corresponding process for the synthesis of biologically interesting compound . however , the microreview cover group-IV metal complex catalyzed hydroamination reaction of alkyne and allenes that appeared in the literature before july <nUm> , <nUm> . ( the tandem zirconocene - mediated or - catalyzed cross-coupling-elimination reaction provides an efficient and versatile procedure for the construction of scaffold that in many case are difficult to access by traditional organic chemistry . In general , this process supposes the reaction of two unsaturated molecule . one of them is coordinated to the zirconocene and the other one contains a heteroatom at an appropriate position for the subsequent elimination process . In this microreview we discus the concept of this useful approach focussing on the reactivity of alkyne- , aryne- , alkene - and iminezirconocene complex towards alkene containing a heteroatom functionality at the allylic or vinylic position . some example of heteroatom - substituted alkyne are also covered . selective reduction of semicyclic imide either to hemiaminals ( endo carbonyl reduction ) or to aldehyde and amine ( exo carbonyl reduction ) in high yield by schwartz 's reagent ( Cp2ZrHCl ) are reported . mechanistic aspect of these reaction have been investigated at the DFT ab initio level with consideration of implicit solvent effect and thermal and pressure correction to <nUm> K / <nUm> atm . the reaction proceed from the reagent to very stable final zr-oxo intermediate through the formation of σ complex and subsequent four - center transition state structure ( 1,2-migratory insertion ) . the energetic barrier for the insertion step depend strongly on the nature of the ancillary group at the reducing carbonyl group . N-Carbamoyl group are reduced to hemiaminals whereas n-acyl group react at the exo carbonyl group . the absence of the second carbonyl group in the simple n-methyl-2-pyrrolidone ( le oxidized system ) strongly reduces the thermodynamic drive for the formation of the metallocene oxo intermediate and allows an explanation of the remarkable chemoselectivity of the hydrozirconation . the zirconocene-oxo intermediate hydrolyze quickly throughout an ionic mechanism in which water molecule strongly assist the process by stabilizing ion pair separation . the computational result are consistent with a large set of experimental data on reduction of g-lactam and isoxazolidinone derivative under mild condition . they provide a way to explain and predict the relative importance of the two competitive endo / exo reduction channel of semicyclic imide by considering the electronic and steric feature of substituents . semicyclic imide such a g-lactam and isoxazolidinone derivative are efficiently and selectivity reduced by the Cp2ZrHCl agent . the energetic reaction pathway for endo and exo attack , computed at the DFT level including thermal effect , allow an exhaustive interpretation of current and previously reported experimental data . two approach for the conversion of d-glucose to (-)-neplanocin A ( 2 ) , both based on the zirconocene - promoted ring contraction of a vinyl-substituted pyranoside , are herein evaluated ( scheme <nUm> ) . In the first pathway ( scheme <nUm> ) , the substrate posse the a-D-allo configuration ( see <nUm> ) such that ultimate introduction of the nucleobase would require only an inversion of configuration . however , this precursor proved unresponsive to Cp2Zr ( = [ZrCl2(Cp)2] ) , an end result believed to be a consequence of substantive nonbonded steric effect operating in a key intermediate ( scheme <nUm> ) . In contrast , the C(2) epimer ( see <nUm> ) experienced the desired metal - promoted conversion to an enantiomerically pure polyfunctional cyclopentane ( see <nUm> in scheme <nUm> ) . the substituents in this product are arrayed in a manner such that conversion to the target nucleoside can be conveniently achieved by a double - inversion sequence ( scheme <nUm> ) . recourse to palladium(0) - catalyzed allylic alkylation did not provide an alternate mean of generating <nUm> . the acid - catalyzed reaction between formaldehyde and 1H-indene , 3-alkyl- and 3-aryl-1H-indenes , and six - membered - ring substituted 1H-indenes , with the 1H-indene / CH2O ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> , at temperature above <nUm> ° in hydrocarbon solvent , yield 2,2'-methylenebis[1H-indenes] 1-8 in 50-100 % yield . these 2,2'-methylenebis[1H-indenes] are easily deprotonated by <nUm> equiv. of BuLi or MeLi to yield the corresponding dilithium salt , which are efficiently converted into ansa - metallocenes of Zr and Hf . the unsubstituted dichloro{(1,1',2,2',3,3',3a,3'a,7a,7'a-e)-2 , 2'-methylenebis[1H-inden-1-yl]}zirconium ( [ZrCl2(1')] ) is the least soluble in organic solvent . substitution of the 1H-indenyl moiety by hydrocarbyl substituents increase the hydrocarbon solubility of the complex , and the presence of a substituent larger than a me group at the 1,1' position of the ligand imparts a high diastereoselectivity to the metallation step , since only the racemic isomer are obtained . methylene-bridged ' ansa - zirconocenes ' show a noticeable open arrangement of the bis[1H-inden-1-yl] moiety , a measured by the angle between the plane defined by the two p-ligands ( the ' bite angle ' ) . In particular , of the ' zirconocenes ' structurally characterized so far , the dichloro{(1,1',2,2',3 , 3',3a,3'a,7a,7'a-e)-2,2'-methylenebis[4 , 7-dimethyl-1H-inden-1-yl]}zirconium ( [ZrCl2(5')] is the most open . the mixture [ZrCl2(1')] / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) is inactive in the polymerization of both ethylene and propylene , while the metallocenes with substituted indenyl ligand polymerize propylene to atactic polypropylene of a molecular mass that depends on the size of the alkyl or aryl group at the 1,1' position of the ligand . ethene is polymerized by rac-dichloro-{(1,1',2,2',3,3',3a,3'a,7a,7'a-e) -2,2'-methylenebis[1-methyl-1H-inden-1-yl]}zirconium ( [ ClZr 2(2') ] ) / MAO to polyethylene wax ( average degree of polymerization ca. <nUm> ) , which are terminated almost exclusively by ethenyl end group . polyethylene with a high molecular mass could be obtained by increasing the size of the 1-alkyl substituent . coordination of conjugated 1,3-dienes to a transition metal had been considered to occur only in a s-cis geometry , until the recent discovery of cp <nUm> zr(s-trans-diene) , diene = butadiene and trans , trans-1,4-diphenylbutadiene . A molecular orbital analysis of metal-butadiene interaction is carried out , for the specific case of CFeO <nUm> ( butadiene ) and cp <nUm> zr(butadiene) , to discern the electronic origin of the novel transoid geometry . stability of the s-cis and s-trans structure of cp <nUm> zr(butadiene) is found to be well balanced and we show how the geometrical choice is affected by substitution on butadiene . none faranal ( 1 ) , the trail-following pheromone of the worker of pharaoh 's ant ( monomorium pharaonis ) , wa synthesized by the coupling reaction of the iododiene <nUm> with the chiral building block <nUm> a the key step . the geometrically pure iododiene <nUm> wa prepared by the zirconocene-mediated carboalumination reaction of <nUm> followed by treatment with iodine . A novel 11C-C bond formation based on the palladium - mediated cross-coupling reaction of alkenylzirconocenes with [11C]methyl iodide is described . the conversion of internal alkyne into the corresponding alkenylzirconocenes followed by transmetalation with Pd(PPh3) <nUm> and subsequent cross-coupling with [11C]methyl iodide gave several 11C - labelled a,a'-dimethyl-substituted alkene . the palladium complex Pd(PPh3)4 proved to be superior to Pt(PPh3)4 or Ni(PPh3)4 a transition metal complex . the scope and limitation of the novel palladium - mediated cross-coupling reaction of alkenylzirconocenes with [ 11C]methyl iodide were tested with various internal alkyne . after heating at <nUm> ° C for <nUm> min radiochemical yield of up to <nUm> % ( based upon [11C]methyl iodide ) could be achieved . [14C]Formaldehyde wa synthesized by reducing 14CO2 at ambient temperature with schwartz 's reagent . the [14C]formaldehyde wa then used in the radiosynthesis of high specific activity ( <nUm> GBq / mmol ) [14C]hydrochlorothiazide via cyclization of 4-amino-5-chloro-1,3-benzenedisulfonamide . A synthesis of [ 14C]formaldehyde by reducing 14CO2 at ambient temperature with schwartz 's reagent is described . the [14C] formaldehyde ha been applied in the radiosynthesis of high specific activity ( <nUm> GBq / mmol ) [14C]hydrochlorothiazide via cyclization of 4-amino-5-chloro-1,3-benzenedisulfonamide . several type of SiO2-supported metallocene catalyst were prepared using chemically modified silica gel . polymerization of propene wa conducted with these catalyst combined with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) or ordinary alkylaluminiums . highly isotactic poly(propylene) with high molecular weight wa obtained by the catalyst whose zirconocene ligand were chemically immobilized on O2Si . the preparative method of these catalyst and the result of propene polymerization , together with the analytical data of produced polymer , are reported in some detail . methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) wa polymerized with Cp2ZrCl2 / methylalyminoxane or Cp2M(CH3)2 ( m : Zr , Hf ; cp = cyclopentadienyl ) combined with BC18F15 ( 1 ) or Ph3CB(C6F5)4 ( 2 ) , ( ph = phenyl ) . in the presence of a lewis acid like C4H10Zn with slow inititation , which gave syndiotactic-rich poly(methyl methacrylate ) ( PMMA ) with high molecular weight . the polymer yield increase with polymerization time , which indicates that the propagation rate is zero order in concentration of monomer . the polymer yield increase also with concentration of Cp2Zr(CH3)2.2 , which indicates the zirconocene to be the real catalyst . the polymer yield and the initiation efficiency ( N / [Zr] ) increase with the concentration of C4H10Zn , which indicates C4H10Zn , to be involved in the initiation . it is also shown that the propagation reaction is independent of the concentration of C4H10Zn . methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) wa reacted with a small quantity of p-hydroquinone to obtain a modified MAO insoluble in toluene . ethylene and propylene homo- and copolymerization were conducted with zirconocene using the modified MAO a cocatalyst both in the presence and absence of triisobutylaluminium . it wa found that the modified MAO alone can not activate the zirconocene catalyst , whereas polymer with high molecular weight are obtained when combined with triisobutylaluminium . the catalytic activity is markedly dependent on the mole ratio of p-hydroquinone to MAO a well a the amount of triisobutylaluminium . olefin polymerization were conducted with novel multimetallic zirconocene catalyst system : R-CpCpZrCl2 ( 1 ) ( r = dimethylsilylferrocene ; cp = cyclopentadienyl ) and (R-Cp)2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) in combination with methylaluminoxane or tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl) borate . In ethylene polymerization , the maximum catalyst activity wa observed at a lower temperature ( 30-45 ° C ) when using complex <nUm> or <nUm> , compared with Cp2ZrCl2 . it wa also revealed that complex <nUm> is a more effective catalyst than Cp2ZrCl2 for copolymerization of ethylene and propene . polysiloxanes with bisindenyl , bisfluorenyl , and bis(1,2,3,4-tetramethyl)cyclopentadienyl side group were synthesized by condensation of the corresponding dichlorosilane compound and water to obtain supported zirconocene catalyst . the polymerization of ethene wa conducted over these catalyst combined with methylalumoxane . the polymerization activity depends markedly upon the substituents and decrease in the order : bisindenyl ≫ bisfluorenyl ≫ bis(1,2,3,4-tetramethylcyclopentadienyl) . all the supported catalyst give linear polyethene with fairly high molecular weight . the catalyst with bisindenyl group wa found to be composed of a toluene -
