soluble and a toluene - insoluble fraction . the polymerization profile ( activity versus time curve ) wa analyzed with the toluene - soluble and -insoluble fraction a well a the corresponding homogeneous system . the homogeneous system , which exerts the highest activity in the initial phase , wa completely deactivated after several hour whereas the activity of the supported catalyst , especially of the toluene - insoluble fraction , wa unchanged during <nUm> h even at <nUm> ° C . polysiloxanes with different content of bisindenyl group were also synthesized via the co-condensation with dimethyldichlorosilane and applied a the carrier . however , the activity per Zr atom decrease remarkably with an increase in dimethylsilane unit . 1-Butene polyinsertion promoted by two typical C2 - symmetric zirconocene catalyst ( i.e. rac-ethylenebis(1-indenyl)ZrCl2 ( 1 ) and rac-dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl)ZrCl2 ) ( 2 ) wa investigated under both hydrooligomerization and polymerization condition and compared with that of propene . it wa found that , in spite of a similar regiospecificity for the two monomer , the fraction of " dormant " site is higher in 1-butene polymerization , a a result of a ( much ) lower reactivity of a <nUm> last - inserted unit . accordingly , in the investigated case , <nUm> unit of 1-butene were not incorporated in the growing chain but either isomerized to <nUm> unit or remained at the chain end until they underwent chain transfer via b-hydrogen elimination . experimental evidence is also presented of an epimerization reaction of the growing poly(1-butene) chain with a <nUm> last - inserted unit , leading to a decrease of polymer stereoregularity with decreasing monomer concentration . living cationic ring - opening polymerization of e-caprolactone ( CL ) , d-valerolactone ( VL ) and 1,3-dioxepane-2-one ( 6 ) wa achieved at room temperature by using zirconocene borate complex catalyst . respective block copolymerization of CL with VL or with cyclic carbonate <nUm> wa also successfully performed . the mechanism of the present cationic living polymerization is discussed . A supported version of zirconocene catalyst on siloxane copolymer having 1,2,3,4-tetramethylcyclopentadienyl (Cp'')-fluorenyl ( flu ) ( I ) or cyclopentadienyl (Cp)-fluorenyl ( II ) group a substituents wa prepared and applied to propene polymerization using methylalumoxane ( MAO ) or [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] a cocatalyst . catalyst ( I ) , which wa soluble in toluene , exhibited very low activity , whereas catalyst ( II ) , which wa composed of a toluene soluble ( Cat-A ) and an insoluble fraction ( Cat-B ) , displayed a fairly high activity . both catalyst ( A and B ) give a mixture of syndiotactic , atactic and a small quantity of isotactic polypropene , with a fraction of syndiotactic pentad ranging from about 50-75 % . In contrast , the corresponding non-supported catalyst give almost completely atactic polypropene . the interaction of supported metallocene catalyst with methylaluminoxane lead to the desorption of the metallocene compound from the surface of the support and the formation of highly active homogeneous complex . the catalytic property of the system and characteristic of polyethylene formed are determined by these specie . the Zr surface loading from Cp2ZrCl2 toluene solution on different kind of commercial silica ( grace <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> ) wa determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry . In all silica , a saturation trend wa observed with increasing amount of metal in the initial solution , the largest Zr loading value ( <nUm> wt.- % ) being observed for silica grace <nUm> . solid surface area were determined by the BET method before and after metallocene immobilization , revealing that the value do not change after zirconocene impregnation . two different kind of cocatalyst were used , methylaluminoxane and trimethylaluminium . the aluminium loading on silica grace <nUm> wa determined using the 27Al(p,g)28Si nuclear reaction and titrometry , both showing that methylaluminoxane lead to an ' Al grafting ' four time more efficient than doe trimethylaluminium . finally , the catalytic activity of these system wa tested in the polymerization of ethylene . the supported catalyst were shown to be active , specially using the low cost trimethylaluminium a a cocatalyst . the polymer obtained with the supported system exhibited a higher molecular weight than those obtained with the homogeneous system . the influence of perfluoroborate anion on catalyst activity and stereospecificity ha been determined for propone polymerisation at 20-60 ° C . for C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocenes , activity were strongly ligand - dependent , with system activated by TIBA / Ph3C +X- , where TIBA = AliBu3 , x = {Z[B(C6F5)3]2} , and z = CN or H2N , giving significantly higher activity than methylaluminoxane under comparable condition . for high - activity catalyst at <nUm> ° C , { H 2N[B(C6F5)3]2 } - proved superior to { CN[B-(C6F5) 3]2}- , presumably due to the higher thermal stability of the amidoborate . the influence of counteranions on PP stereospecificity for these catalyst is negligible . on the other hand , the conformationally flexible catalyst , (2-PhIHd)2Zr-Cl <nUm> / TIBA / Ph3C+X- , show not only a strong anion dependence of it activity , but also significant variation in poly(propylene) isotacticity , mainly due to the formation of small fraction of highly isotactic ( mmmm > <nUm> % ) PP . this effect wa particularly pronounced for {CN[B(C6F5)3]2}- and the dianion , {Ni[CNB(C6F5)3]4} 2- . the polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) in the presence of the neutral chloro zirconocene enolates , Cp2ZrCl[OC(OMe) = CMe2 ] ( 1 ) , Me4C2(Cp)2 ZrCl[OC(OMe) = CMe2 ] ( 2 ) , and Me2C(Cp)2ZrCl[OC ( OMe ) = CMe2 ] ( 3 ) , wa investigated . none of these compound is catalytically active on it own . they could be activated by adding Ph3CB(C6F5) <nUm> ( 4 ) ; however , only if the initial concentration of enolate is higher than that of the perfluorated phenyl borate . polymer were produced with a number average molar mass of up to <nUm> <nUm> g / mol and a dispersion index of <nUm> - <nUm> with mixture comprising <nUm> and <nUm> or <nUm> and <nUm> . the degree of polymerization depends only on the quantity of excess enolate and not on the absolute concentration of the initiator component . In contrast , a mixture of <nUm> and <nUm> wa not very active . kinetic modeling of the system a well a NMR spectroscopic investigation indicate that a bimetallic mechanism can describe chain growth . the activity of these catalytic system depends on the structure of the ligand . the two zirconocenes with bridged cyclopentadienyl ligand , ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) , convert MMA considerably slower . In addition to the methyl zirconocene enolates with unbridged cyclopentadienyl ligand , the corresponding chloro zirconocene enolates are also suitable for the polymerization of MMA . the latter compound offer the advantage that preparation for the production of the initiator are comparatively simple . propene polymerisation wa conducted with three ansa - zirconocene complexed : Me2Si(2-Me-4-PhInd)2-ZrCl2 ( A ) , me 2Si(2-Me-4-PhInd)2ZrClNMe2 ( B ) and me 2Si-(2-Me-4-PhInd)2ZrClNEt2 ( C ) . methylalumoxane ( MAO ) or [HNPhMe2][B(C6F5) <nUm> ] wa used a cocatalyst . the influence of cocatalysts and trisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) on polymerisation activity , molecular weight and polymer microstructure wa studied . furthermore , the alkylation and activation of the complex were examined using UV / VIS spectroscopy . complex A wa the most active in polymerisation , but polymer produced by B and C had in general higher molecular weight . replacing MAO partially by TIBA increased the molecular weight and prevented catalyst deactivation . according to the UV / VIS measurement , all complex have low reactivity towards TMA and TIBA . similar cationic specie were formed of all three studied zirconocenes in the reaction with MAO . additional TIBA did not affect the type of active specie formed in the reaction of zirconocene and MAO , but increased the activity of B and C. coplymers of propene and higher 1-olefins ( 1-butene , 1-pentene , 1-hexene , 1-heptene , 1-octene , and 4-methyl-1-pentene ( 4M1P ) ) , prepared with rac-Et(Ind)2-ZrCl2 ( EI ) and rac-Me 2Si(2-MeBenz-[e]Ind)2ZrCl2 ( MBI ) , were comprehensively analyzed by 13C NMR spectroscopy . these catalyst known to produce isotactic polypropene lead to two vastly different family of copolymer produced with EI possessed comparable isotacticities a well a similar stereosequences . furthermore , these copolymer did not significantly differ from those of the reference propene homopolymer . however , the copolymer produced with MBI significantly differed both from the reference propene homopolymer and among themselves . In fact , in contrast to the corresponding highly isotactic homopolymer , the whole series of copolymer wa characterized by rather low isotacticities . the degree of tacticity wa strongly influenced by the comonomer type . A detailed 13C NMR analysis revealed that these copolymer are constituted by highly isotactic sequence and by atactic sequencies of various length . it is proposed that the formation of atactic sequence is triggered by the insertion of a comonomer . it seems likely that MBI can shift from a stereoselective to a non-stereoselective state due to an interaction with higher linear or branched comonomer . copolymer of ethylene ( e ) with norbornene ( N ) were synthesized using the catalyst rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO ( 1 ) , <nUm> % rac / <nUm> % meso-Et(4,7-Me2Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO ( 2 ) , and rac-H2C(3-t-BuInd)2ZrCl2 / MAO ( 3 ) . catalyst activity , molar mass ( MM ) , and copolymer composition were studied a a function of time . the polymer showed an unusually narrow molar mass distribution ( MMD ) and a significant increase of their MM with time for up to one hour , suggesting a " quasi-living " polymerization at <nUm> ° C . the experimental data were fitted to kinetic equation and the propagation and transfer reaction were described in quantitative term . norbornene greatly depressed the propagation rate , along with the chain transfer rate . the more sterically hindered catalyst of the series showed lower propagation and chain transfer turnover frequency than <nUm> and yielded polymer with a low ( 2 ) to very low ( 3 ) norbornene content . the presence of norbornene in solution seemed to be one of the main factor responsible for the observed " quasi-living " character of the copolymerization , probably due to coordination of norbornene to the active site . time - resolved kinetic study also allowed for the calculation of the fraction of active metal center , ranging from <nUm> % ( 3 ) and 66-68 % ( 1 ) to <nUm> % ( 2 ) of the total zirconium present , depending on catalyst structure . UV - vi spectroscopic study revealed that vinyl-cyclohexane interaction with zirconocene catalyst is enhanced on light exposure . if oxygen is present it interacts with the catalyst , hindering vinylcyclohexane interaction and consequently lowering the catalyst activity . the catalyst activity can be recovered with light exposure if low O concentration are used since in light the zirconocene-vinylcyclohexane interaction is favoured over the zirconocene-O2 interaction . moreover , 1H NMR study of the reaction product showed that the structure of the vinylcyclohexane - based specie produced with light irradiation were identical to the specie produced in dark . this indicates that light exposure of the catalytic system doe not change the reaction mechanism . the origin of the syndiotactic selectivity in propene polymerization of a typical bridged fluorenyl-amido catalyst , namely [Me2Si(3,6-di-tert-butyl-9-fluorenyl)(Ntert-buty]) ] Cl2Ti ( 1 ) , activated with methylaluminoxane or [HMe2N(C6H5)][B(C6 F5)4 ] / al(i-butyl)3 , wa investigated by mean of <nUm> MHz 13C NMR spectroscopic microstructural polymer analysis . the asymmetric induction wa traced unambiguously to enantiotopic - site control . compared with the better - known cyclopentadienyl-fluorenyl ansa - zirconocenes , <nUm> turned out to be almost identically enantioselective ( in agreement with computer modeling ) , but le stereoselective because of a higher propensity to undergo site epimerization . this result in a chain microstructure with large predominance of m over mm stereodefects , deceptively similar to that of syndiotactic poly(propylene) produced under chain - end control . the synthesis of C1 - symmetric zirconocene complex bearing the 2,5-dimethyl-7H-cyclopenta[1,2-b:4,3-b']dithiophene ligand ( S 2-3 ) linked to substituted cyclopentadienes is described . different synthesis of S2-3 , the common intermediate for the preparation of these complex , are discussed . many of these complex have been found to be highly active in propylene polymerization , to require very low amount of methylalumoxane to be activated , and to produce poly(propylene)s of low isotacticity and melting point . 13C NMR analysis show that the poly(propylene)s are fully regioregular and that the stereoerrors are randomly distributed , a shown by the enantiomorphic - site triad test e ≈ <nUm> . the experimental pentad distribution wa fitted using a two - site model with different probability parameter for each site . the probability of chain back - skip wa also taken into account . the molecular weight and crystallinity of the poly(propylene)s are dependent upon the type of substituents on the cyclopentadienyl ring , and the correlation between mmmm content and melting point of the PP confirms the random distribution of stereoerrors . sixteen C1 - symmetric zirconocene and one hafnocene complex bearing the 2,5-R2-7H-cyclopenta[1,2-b:4,3-b']dithiophene ligand ( r = H , me , et , ph ) linked to a substituted indenyl ligand have been synthesized and tested in propylene polymerization . most of the C 1-symmetric zirconocenes of this type are highly active in propylene polymerization at low MAO / Zr ratio and produce poly(propylene)s ( PP ) in a broad range of isotacticity and melting point . the molecular weight and crystallinity of the PPs are strongly dependent upon the type of substituents on the indenyl moiety : PPs with Tm between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C and viscosity average molecular weight between <nUm> <nUm> and <nUm> <nUm> have been obtained at 50-70 ° C in liquid propylene . copolymerizations of ethylene and disubstituted diallylsilanes ( CH <nUm> = CH-CH2)2R2Si ( r = CH3 , C6H5 ) have been investigated with various zirconocene catalyst using methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . the bridged stereospecific catalyst showed a higher reactivity for disubstituted diallylsilanes than the non-bridged aspecific catalyst , disubstituted diallylsilanes were incorporated into the polymer chain via cyclization insertion preferentially , and formed 3,5-disubstituted silacyclohexane unit in the polyethylene main chain . A zirconocene catalyst , dimethylsilylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride , produced a copolymer containing pendant ullyl group derived from the 1,2-insertion of diallyldiphenylsilane without cyclization . we have confirmed that water- and pentafluorophenol - modified isobutylmethylaluminoxane ( W / PM - MMAO ) enhances the productivity and stereoregularity of the yielded polymer and increase it molecular weight when propylene is polymerized using C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocenes . 13C NMR analysis show that when W / PM - MMAO is used a a cocatalyst with C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocenes , although the pentad peak of the stereoerrors derived from enantiofacial misinsertion have still existed ; those derived from the epimerization of the growing chain end that occurred with b-hydride elimination disappear . therefore , we propose that W / PM - MMAO interacts more strongly to the cationic metal center of metallocene than doe MMAO owing to steric and electronic effect , and W / PM - MMAO suppresses b-hydride elimination , resulting in the production of polypropylene with higher molecular weight and isotacticity . to the contrary , there wa no significant difference in the structure of the yielded polymer when W / PM - MMAO wa used with Cs - symmetric ansa - zirconocenes . In the case of C s-symmetric ansa - zirconocene , the stereoerror is mostly the result of monomer insertion error , and small amount of stereoerror caused by " skipped " insertion , not from the epimerization of the polymer chain end that occurs after b-hydride elimination ; therefore , there might not be any difference of the microstructure of yielded polymer between MMAO and W / PM - MMAO . it can be concluded that the both case of C2- and C s-symmetric ansa - zirconocenes are used a a catalyst , and water and phenol modification of MMAO doe not affect the monomer misinsertion which is one of the mechanism of the stereoerrors . propylene wa polymerised at varying trimethyl-aluminium ( TMA ) concentration with two metallocenes activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) in an attempt to better understand the effect of TMA on the activation process , catalyst activity and termination reaction . A chemical treatment of MAO solution with 2,6-di-tert-butyl-p-cresol wa used to obtain TMA - free polymerisation condition . the metallocene precursor under investigation were diphenyl-methyl(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) and rac-dimethylsilylbis(4-tert-butyl-2-methyl-cyclo-pentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) . chain transfer to aluminium wa the dominating termination route for <nUm> / MAO accompanied with b-H / b-CH3 transfer to Zr and b-H transfer to monomer . it wa found that b-H / b-CH3 transfer to Zr wa favoured over the b-H transfer to monomer at elevated temperature , and that polymerisation and b-H transfer to monomer depended on the same critical reaction . for <nUm> / MAO the detected termination route were b-H transfer to Zr and chain transfer to aluminium . A strong activity dependency on TMA concentration wa observed . with <nUm> / MAO high TMA concentration decreased and stabilised the activity , whereas TMA free polymerisation condition at <nUm> ° C increased markedly the activity , indicating that TMA coordinated to the active site of <nUm> / MAO . surprisingly , with more sterically hindered <nUm> / MAO , high TMA concentration increased the activity and nearly complete activity loss occurred at TMA - free polymerisation condition at <nUm> ° C . Rac-[CH2(2,4-di-tert-butyl-cyclopentadienyl)2]- Cl2Zr ( 1 ) , rac-[CH2(3-tert-butyl-4,5,6,7- tetrahydroindenyl)2]-ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , rac - [ CH 2(3-isopropyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl)2]-ZrCl <nUm> ( 3 ) , and rac-[CH2(3-methyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl) 2]ZrCl2 ( 4 ) were synthesized and characterized by 1H NMR analysis . these C2 symmetric ansa - zirconocenes , activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , were able to promote copolymerization of ethene and 1,3-butadiene . the structure of the copolymer are strongly influenced by zirconocene utilized a catalytic precursor . depending on the reaction condition polyethenes containing cyclopropane and cyclopentane ring , or 1,1- 1,3-butadiene inserted constitutional unit , were obtained . reaction of <nUm> and <nUm> with MAO and MMAO were monitored by EPR . it wa found that MMAO is a stronger reducing agent than MAO . <nUm> is more prone to reduction than <nUm> . the reduction of IVZr to ZrIII seems to be the essential pathway of some zirconocene catalyst ' deactivation . ZrIII specie with the following proposed structure can be identified in the <nUm> / MMAO system : (2-PhInd)2ZrIII(iBu) , ( 2-PhInd ) 2ZrIII(m-Cl)2AliBu2 , (2-PhInd)2ZrIII(m-Cl)(iBu)Al iBu2 , and [(2-PhInd)2ZrIII] +[Me-MAO]- . the degree of reduction of IVZr specie determined by EPR in the catalytic system <nUm> / MMAO can be masked by the formation of diamagnetic ZrIIIVZrIII dimer . addition of monomer to the <nUm> / MAO system promotes reduction ot the zirconium specie . reactive specie in O2Si - supported , zirconocene - based olefin - polymerization catalyst have been characterized by comparison of their UV - vi spectrum with those of related , NMR - spectroscopically identified catalyst specie in homogeneous solution . neutral zirconocene dihydride complex are found to arise in hydrocarbon solution a well a on O2Si support when catalyst system that contain rac-Me2Si(ind) 2ZrCl2 and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) are modified by addition of diisobutylaluminum hydride or triisobutylaluminum . these complex , tentatively formulated a adduct with lewis-acidic alkylaluminum specie AlR2X , racMe2Si(ind)2ZrH2 *{nAlR2X} , are reconverted into the initial reactive zirconocene cation upon addition of isobutene to these reaction system . nano-polyethylene fiber and floccule were prepared under atmospheric pressure via ethylene extrusion polymerization in suit , using the SBA-15 - supported Cp2ZrCl2 catalytic system . the major morphology unit in the sample were fiber and floccule . the diameter of the single nano-fibers wa 120-200 nm . the single nano-fibers could aggregate to form fiber aggregate and bundle . the number of PE floccule increased with extension of polymerization time , while the melting point of PE with nano-fibers wa little higher than that of common polyethylene . none the use of ultraviolet / visible spectroscopy ( UV-Vis ) for the prediction of metallocene catalyst potential for the polymerisation of olefin is described . upon addition of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) to rac-[C2H4(1-indenyl)2ZrCl2] ( [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> ) the ligand-to-metal charge transfer band show a hypsochromic shift while a bathochromic shift is observed when more MAO is added ( [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> ) . these shift can be explained by assuming that methylation of the zirconocene by MAO occurs in the case of [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> while a cationic complex , the active catalytic system , is formed upon addition of more MAO , e.g. , [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> . A series of tert-butyl substituted zirconocene / methylaluminoxane catalyst illustrates the potential for the tailoring of olefin oligomers with extremely narrow molar mass distribution , which are explained on the basis of a chain-length dependent propagation rate . comparative oligomerization experiment provide a mean to estimate the relative rate for chain propagation versus chain transfer a well a a correlation with the metallocene structure . three kind of zirconocene catalyst , supported on polysiloxanes substituted with methylindenyl , methyl-fluorenyl and two indenyl group , respectively , were prepared and applied to propene and ethylene polymerization using methylaluminoxane a cocatalyst . both the activity and stereospecificity of these catalyst were found to lie between those of corresponding homogeneous and SiO2-supported catalyst . surprisingly , all the catalyst gave a mixture of atactic and isotactic poly(propylene) , plausible reason for which are briefly discussed . ethylene wa polymerized in toluene using methylalumoxane ( MAO ) activated rac-(Me2SiOSiMe2)[Ind]2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) and rac-(Me2SiOSiMe2)[IndH4]2MtCl <nUm> ( Mt = Zr ( 2 ) ; Mt = Ti ( 3 ) ) . all three catalyst system polymerize ethylene with high activity . the molecular weight of polymer produced with zirconocene ( 1 ) wa up to a weight - average molecular weight mw = <nUm> × <nUm> at low polymerization temperature ( < <nUm> ° C ) under atmospheric pressure . the titanocene catalyst <nUm> show lower activity and produced lower molecular weight polyethylene than zirconocenes <nUm> and <nUm> . replacement of aromatic ring in <nUm> by cyclohexane ring , leading to <nUm> , increase activity and reduces molecular weight . the catalyst system show a dependency of the activity on temperature . the disiloxane - bridged zirconocene complex , tetramethyldisiloxanediylbis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride and tetramethyldisiloxanediylbis(cyclopentadienyl)dimethylzirconium initiate the homopolymerization of ethene a well a the copolymerization of ethene and a-olefin with a modified methylaluminoxane a cocatalyst . the catalyst system give resonable activity but the molecular weight of polyethene decrease drastically with increasing polymerization temperature . In the polymerization of ethene cocatalyzed with modified methylaluminoxane , the catalyst activity of the siloxane - bridged dinuclear zirconocenes , tetramethyldisiloxanediylbis(cyclopentadienylindenylzirconium dichloride ) ( 3 ) and hexamethyltrisiloxanediylbis(cyclopentadienylindenylzirconium dichloride ) ( 4 ) were lower than that obtained with the siloxane - bridged mononuclear zirconocene , tetramethyldisiloxanediyldicyclopentadienyldimethylzirconium ( 1 ) . on the other hand , weight - average molecular weight mw and ratio of weight- to number - average molecular weight mw / mn of polyethene ( PE ) obtained with <nUm> or <nUm> were higher than those of PE obtained with <nUm> . for a binary mixture of <nUm> / <nUm> or <nUm> / <nUm> , it wa found that the obtained PE exhibit a bimodal molecular weight distribution for an appropriate composition of the mixed zirconocenes . mw / mn of PE could be adjusted by changing the relative concentration of the two zirconocenes . new supported catalyst on the basis of cyclopentadienylindenylzirconium dichloride ( CpIndZrCl2 ) anchored on silica with a trisiloxane spacer ( ZATS ) and a pentamethylene spacer ( ZAPM ) were prepared and used for ethylene polymerization with modified methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst . ZATS and ZAPM produce polyethylene with lower molecular weight but show higher activity than silica - supported CpIndZrCl2 which wa prepared by reacting zirconocene directly with silica , i.e. , the activity of silica - supported CpIndZrCl2 is enhanced by introducing a spacer between silica surface and metallocene specie . ethylene-propene copolymerization wa carried out with Cp2MCl2 ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ) , rac-Et(Ind)2MCl2 , rac-Me2Si(Ind)2MCl2 ( et = ethylene , Me2Si = dimethylsilyl , ind = indenyl , m = Zr or Hf ) / methylaluminoxane . In the case of using ansa - hafnocenes , the minimum molecular size ( extended chain length ) of ethylene-propene copolymer wa obtained at about <nUm> mol- % of propene content in the copolymer . the polymerization activity decreased with increase of propene feed ratio in non-bridged non-specific metallocenes . higher polymerization activity were observed for the copolymerization compared to ethylene and propene homo-polymerization with ansa - isospecific metallocenes . the factor of molecular size lowering wa studied by the chain propagation and chain transfer reaction . copolymerizations of propene and buta-1,3-diene performed in the presence of rac-[CH2(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2] Cl2Zr and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) have been investigated . buta-1,3-diene give prevailingly primary coordination to the metal , producing overall <nUm> unit . cyclopropane and cyclopentane ring , although in low amount , are also obtained . the presence of butadiene would be responsible for some regioirregular 2,1-inserted propene unit , which at high temperature give rearrangement to <nUm> unit . propylene wa copolymerized with 1,4-divinylbenzene ( 1,4-DVB ) using rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind)2ZrCl2 and MAO in the presence of hydrogen . 1H NMR spectrum of the obtained copolymer confirmed the successful incorporation of 1,4-DVB . 13C NMR analysis revealed a unique copolymer structure with the incorporated 1,4-DVB unit predominantly forming 1,4-substituted phenyl repeating unit in the polymer main chain . A plausible mechanism involving spontaneous insertion of terminal styryl into Zr-H specie wa proposed to rationalize the unique incorporation of 1,4-DVB . norbomene ( NB ) wa oligomerized at <nUm> ° C using AlEt2Cl- Cl4Ti at a monomer / titanium molar ratio of about <nUm> . the oligomerization product consists of a fraction soluble in diethyl ether , amorphous by x-ray examination , and of a crystalline fraction , insoluble in diethyl ether . the crystalline fraction wa shown by powder x-ray diffraction to consist of a NB heptamer . single - crystal x-ray analysis indicated that the heptamer had a stereoregular 2,3-exo-disyndiotactic structure . the heptamer , adopts a strained , highly irregular , folded conformation in the crystalline state . structural difference with respect in NB oligomers obtained with zirconocene catalyst are discussed . the ability of a Cl2Mg support to activate a transition metal catalyst ha been found to depend both on the crystallographic structure of the support and on the nature of the catalyst . A high degree of crystallographic disorder can be very effective for the immobilization and activation of titanium and vanadium complex , but is not necessarily effective for zirconocene activation . A highly disordered support prepared by the reaction of MgBu <nUm> with ClH gave high activity with Cl4Ti but low activity with (n-PrCp)2ZrCl2 . high polymerization activity with the zirconocene were only obtained with support of type ClMg <nUm> / AlRn(OEt)3-n prepared from the reaction of AlR3 with Cl2Mg · 1.1EtOH . these support are characterized by additional peak in the x-ray diffraction pattern , indicating the presence of a crystalline structure which is absent in the other support and contains highly lewis acidic site able to generate the active metallocenium specie . catalytic nature of organometallic catalyst are modulated by coordinating organic ligand with proper steric and electronic property to metal center . carbon - based nanomaterials such a graphene nanoplatelets are used with and without N - doping and multiwalled carbon nanotube a a ligand for ethylene polymerization . zirconocenes or titanocenes are immobilized on such nanomaterials . polyethylene ( EsP ) produced by such hybrid show a great increase in molecular weight relative to those produced by free catalyst . specially , ultra-high-molecular-weight EsP are produced from the polymerization at low temperature using the hybrid with N - doped graphene nanoplatelets . this result show that such nanomaterials act a crucial role to tune the catalytic nature of metallocenes . hydrozirconation on vinyl-terminated substrate ( silicon wafer and nanosilica sphere ) is employed a an efficient way for immobilization of zirconocene catalyst through Zr-C bond , which is applied in surface coordination ethylene polymerization producing surface - tethered polyethylene ( PE ) . the formation of Zr-C σ bond induced by hydrozirconation provides an initiator precursor for growing a layer of PE covalently linked onto substrate . the result from SEM , AFM , and TEM show that the surface polymerization is controlled by hydrozirconation . surface pattern or core - shell structure with crystalline PE coating can be formed , when silicon wafer is selectively functionalized with vinyl-groups or vinyl-modified nanosilica is applied . it is believed that hydrozirconation for the synthesis of zirconocene initiator can be a versatile route to prepare polyolefin hybrid material . the homogeneous Ziegler-Natta – catalyst , consisting of a zirconocene compound and methyl-aluminoxane , lead to extremely high polymerization activity . with bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride pure atactic polypropylene and polyethylene with activity up to <nUm> g PE / g zr*h are formed . the higher the degree of oligomerization of the aluminoxane the more active are the catalyst . the density of polyethylene ( LLDPE ) can be lowered by using 1-butene or 1-hexene a comonomers . incorporation of dienes give EPDM-elastomers . highly isotactic polypropylene can be prepared by using chiral rac-ethylene bi – ( tetrahydroindenyl ) zirconium dichloride together with methylaluminoxane a cocatalyst . the toluene soluble part here consists of le than <nUm> weight percent . after resolution of this racemate it is also possible to produce optically active polypropylene and polybutene . with homogenous catalyst on the basis of chiral metallocenes and methylaluminoxane it ha become possible to polymerize cyclic olefin like cyclobutene , cyclopentene or norbornene . No ring opening reaction occurs . the crystalline polycycloalkenes show extremly high melting point between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C . copolymer of cyclopentene with propene are amorphous . they have a low molecular weight and glass transition point . on the other hand the glass transition temperature of norbornene / ethene copolymer exceeds <nUm> ° C . these copolymer could be used a material for optical disc and fiber . zirconocene complex carrying substituents at various position of their ring-bridged ligand framework were studied a catalyst for methylalumoxane-activated propene polymerization . effect of different substitution pattern on catalyst activity and on chain length and stereo- and regio-regularities of the polymer produced are correlated with geometrical feature of the complex , e.g. with parameter describing their structural rigidity or the aperture and obliquity of their coordination gap . rac-Ethylenebis(1-e5-indenyl)dimethylzirconium ( 1 ) wa reacted with triphenylcarbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( 2 ) to produce in situ the rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)methylzirconium cation ( 3 ) . this aluminium-free catalyst showed propene polymerization activity ( A ) and stereoselectivity which both increase with the decrease of polymerization temperature ( tp ) . At very low tp , <nUm> behaved a a “ single-site ” catalyst . an efficient way to produce such cation is to react ansa-zirconocene dichloride with <nUm> in the presence of TEA ( = triethylaluminium ) . A superior cationic catalyst wa obtained from rac-dimethylsilylenebis(1-e5-indenyl)dichlorozirconium , <nUm> , and TEA , which polymerizes propene at − <nUm> ° C(-55 ° C ) with activity of <nUm> × <nUm> ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) g polypropene per ( mol Zr η mol CH2 η h ) to polypropene which are <nUm> % ( <nUm> % ) isotactic with melting temperature Tm = <nUm> ° C ( <nUm> ° C ) and viscosity-average molecular weight mv = <nUm> × <nUm> ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) . the addition of methylaluminoxane lower the A of the cationic catalyst especially at low tp . rigorously speaking , the cation derived from <nUm> or <nUm> behaves a a “ single site ” catalyst only at very low tp . the use of TEA significantly and unexpectedly enhances the efficiency of the zirconocenium catalyst system . through polymerizing propene by mean of the catalyst system iPr[3-MeCpFlu]ZrCl2 / MAO it wa possible for the first time to generate hemiisotactic poly(propylene) ; the microstructure of this polymer is characterized by an alternating sequence of monomer unit with equal and statistical configuration . iPr[3-MeCpFlu]ZrCl2 is one of the new developed stereorigid ansa-metallocene catalyst which by mean of the structure of the bridged e-ligand system are considered to give access to the description and calculation of the behaviour of the stereospecifity . In the present paper the a-olefin polymerization wa investigated with the iPr[3-MeCpFlu]ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst system by mean of kinetics and product analytics ; parameter were the [Al] : [Zr] ratio , the monomer concentration , the polymerization temperature , the polarity of the solvent a well a the chain length of the starting a-olefin . the order of the polymerization reaction concerning the propene concentration wa found to be <nUm> ; this broken order indicates a complex reaction . concerning the dependency of the polymerization rate on the [Al] : [Zr] ratio a bell-shaped curve wa found ; obviously , at very high [Al] : [Zr] ratio the complex MAO compound inhibits the active zirconocene centre . the microstructure of the poly(propylene)s generated in toluene at <nUm> ° C corresponds with the expected hemiisotactic structure . on the contrary , the microstructure of the poly(propylene)s generated in toluene at higher polymerization temperature and in the polar solvent o-dichlorobenzene and methylene chloride at <nUm> ° C show considerable deviation from a hemiisotactic structure . under these polymerization condition the stereospecifity of the iPr[3-MeCpFlu]ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst can only be satisfyingly explained with isomerization reaction of the active zirconocene specie between two insertion step . these isomerization reaction without monomer coordination occur preferably starting from the unstereospecific state of the catalyst . this interpretation is confirmed by 1-butene and 1-hexene polymerization experiment . the polymerization kinetics of propene polymerization using metallocene / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) homogeneous catalyst have been investigated to explore the role of donor / acceptor interaction and to enhance the catalyst productivity . In the case of the non-stereospecific Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO model system it ha been demonstrated that , in addition to the well known irreversible deactivation , reversible deactivation , which are second order relative to the zirconium active site concentration , account for the decay of the polymerization rate . while MAO injection during polymerization enhances the polymerization rate , zirconocene addition deactivates the catalyst which can be reactivated by injecting additional MAO . A sequence of dynamic equilibrium involving the formation of active cationic metallocene intermediate a well a inactive zirconocene specie , e.g. , zirconocene dimer , is proposed . lewis base and lewis acid additive have been added a probe to examine the role of such equilibrium in the case of metallocene-based catalyst system such a MAO-activated Cp2ZrCl2 , racemic ethylenebisindenyl zirconium dichloride ( EBIZrCl2 ) , and racemic ethylenebis ( 4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl ) zirconium dichloride ( EBTHIZrCl2 ) . while the conventional donor such a 2,6-ditert.butyl-4-methylphenol ( BHT ) and 2,2,6,6-tetramethylpiperidine ( TMP ) reduce catalyst productivity , even at very low donor / Al molar ratio , increasing propene concentration and addition of trimethylboroxine ( TMB ) substantially enhance catalyst productivity and affect molecular weight of the polypropylene produced with metallocene / MAO catalyst . Me2C[1-Cp-9-Flu]ZrCl2 derivative with H- , CH3-and (CH3)3C- substituents β to the cp bridgehead carbon atom a well a complex having mono- or di-substituted fluorenyl ligand ( r = CH3- , (CH3)3C- , CH3O- , CH3OCH2- , C5H9 ≡ C- , (CH3)2N- , F- , and cl- ) have been investigated a propylene polymerization pro-catalysts . steric effect from the b-Cp substituents determine the iso- , hemi-iso- , and syndio-specificities of the catalyst . the relative stereospecificities of Me2Si[1-Cp-3t-Bu-9-Flu]ZrCl2 and rac-Me2Si[1-Ind-3-t-Bu]2ZrCl2 are in accord with molecular model . the more un-symmetrical the catalyst are the more m and mm stereosequences there are in s-PP . the m dyad also increase with the concentration of Me2C[1-Cp-9-Flu-2-OMe]ZrCl2 . structure-performance relationship in the propene polymerization behaviour of a number of silicon bridged bisindenyl zirconocenes show a rational pattern . prognosis of the polymerization behaviour of different type structure , however , often fails , which is demonstrated by three example of new zirconocenes . these include two bisindenyl complex with two-membered silicon bridge and one isospecific bridged fluorenyl cyclopentadienyl specie . it is thus demonstrated that the scope of a “ rational catalyst design ” in the field of metallocene catalyst is still limited . most of the supported metallocene catalyst reported so far have been devised to immobilize metallocenes on the solid surface utilizing the ionic interaction between metallocenes and surface active site . whereas , we have been challenging to prepare more rigidly immobilized catalyst by using the chemically modified O2Si . the SiO2-supported zirconocene catalyst thus prepared could be activated by ordinary trialkylaluminiums like Al(i-C4H9)3 to give highly isotactic polypropene ( PP ) with high melting temperature ( Tm ) and number-average molecular weight ( Mn ) . this paper summarizes the result obtained so far . ab-initio molecular dynamic simulation on ethylene insertion in a bridged di(cyclopentadienyl) methylzirconocene have revealed that the entire reaction path starting from the p-coordinated ethylene-zirconocene complex up to and including propyl formation take place in about <nUm> femtosecond , which is unexpectedly fast , and suggesting the absence of any significant barrier of activation . starting from a reactant structure without a-H agostic interaction , at T = <nUm> K such an interaction evolves during the course of the insertion reaction and before the propyl is formed . the product state exhibit g-H agostic interaction . the isolation of non-fluxional alumoxane compound , [(tBu)2Al{OAl(tBu)2}]2 and [(tBu)AlO]n ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) , ha allowed for an investigation of the mode of activity observed for alumoxanes a co-catalysts for the zirconocene polymerization of olefin . [(tBu)2Al{OAl(tBu)2}]2 , which contains two three-coordinate aluminum center , show no reaction with Cp2ZrMe2 , and no catalytic activity towards ethylene polymerization . In contrast , the closed cage compound [(tBu)AlO]6 reacts reversibly to give the ion pair complex , [Cp2ZrMe][(rBu)6Al6O6Me] , which is active a a catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene . polymerization is also observed for mixture of Cp2ZrMe2 with [(tBu)AlO]n ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) . A new concept , “ latent lewis acidity ” , is proposed to account for the reactivity of the cage alumoxanes , [(tBu)AlO]n. metallocene / MAO catalyst are useful for the production of syndiotactic polystyrene - a new class of high performance polymer . the melting point of the obtained syndiotactic polystyrene depends on the metallocene used and can reach up to <nUm> ° C . In the past , the most active catalyst in polymerization have been half - sandwich titanocenes such a CpTiCl3 and Cp*TiCl3 . if the chlorinated compound are changed into the fluorinated compound a CpTiF3 and Cp*TiF3 , the activity increase by a factor of <nUm> to <nUm> . the fluorinated titanocenes are more stable at higher temperature and need a lower MAO excess in order to obtain optimal activity . polymer obtained with the unsubstituted CpTiF3 show melting point which are <nUm> ° C lower than those synthesized by pentamethylcyclopentadienyltitaniumtrifluoride . especially Cp*TiF3 show a much higher activity and , compared with the chlorinated compound , give polymer with a higher molecular weight . substituted cyclopentadienyltitanocenes have even higher activity . ethene / styrene copolymer can be obtained by catalysis with zirconocene compound . combined system including diphenylzinc ( Ph2Zn ) , a metallocene , and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , have been employed to initiate the copolymerization of styrene ( S ) with p-alkylsubstituted styrene and with a-olefins . the copolymerization process depend largely on the comonomer , the nature of the metallocene included in the initiator system , the presence of Ph2Zn , the polymerization temperature and the solvent used . titanocenes produced true copolymer for S / p - substituted styrene , but not in S / a-olefin copolymerization . on the other hand zirconocenes either did not copolymerize S / p - substituted styrene or produced very low conversion , while they succeeded in copolymerizing S / a-olefin , depending on the particular zirconocene employed . A low p-methylstyrene ( p-MeS ) content in the S / p-MeS copolymer and a low p-tertbutylstyrene ( p-ButS ) content in the S / p-ButS copolymer decreased Tm , making them easier to process material than s-PS . metallocenes are highly active catalyst for the production of precisely designed polyolefins and engineering plastic . especially zirconocene / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) catalyst and half - sandwich titanium complex have opened a frontier in the area of new polymer synthesis and processing . the material obtained show different microstructures , tacticities and property compared with conventional polymer . alternating ethene / propene polymer show lower glass transition temperature than random copolymer . constrained geometry catalyst are useful for the synthesis of norbornene / ethene copolymer . In the present paper the effect of the solvent , a lewis base and of non-polymerizable olefin on copolymerization of propene with higher a-olefins performed with isospecific ansa - zirconocene catalyst are investigated . A wide range of solvent with increasing polarity , donor character and steric hindrance ha been tested , and their effect on copolymer yield , composition and microstructure thoroughly analyzed . our result demonstrate that the solvent can have a significant influence on the copolymer composition , even though the solvent polarity is not the relevant factor . polymerization carried out in coordinating solvent , e.g. aromatic solvent , lead to the formation of product with considerably decreased higher a-olefin content . the reduced incorporation of the higher a-olefin is explained in term of competition between the nucleophilic medium and the olefin monomer for coordination to the active polymerisation site . the dependence of polymer microstructure on the solvent nucleophilicity is further elucidated by copolymerization study performed in the presence of diisopropyldimethoxysilane a a lewis base . the addition of the non-polymerizable olefin , 2-methyl-1-pentene , which doe not significantly affect comonomer composition , seems to slightly modify comonomer distribution . the sum of the result obtained give u valuable information regarding the mechanism of polymerisation at the active center . copolymerization of ethylene and 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) by zirconocene catalyst proceeded via cyclization - addition mechanism to form 1,3-didsubstituted cyclopentane structure in the polyethylene chain . the 1,3-cyclopentane structure wa found to be taken in the crystalline structure of polyethylene ( isomorphism ) by partially chainging the trans zigzag chain into gauche conformation , thereby , inducing a transformation of orthorhombic crystal to pseudohexagonal crystal . copolymerization of ethylene and cyclopentene ( CPE ) by zirconocene catalyst yielded copolymer having 1,2-disubstituted cyclopentane structure in the polyethylene chain . the 1,2-cyclopentane structure wa not taken into the crystalline structure of polyethylene . the melting point ( Tm ) and the crystallinity ( xc ) of polyethylene decreased by copolymerization of HD or CPE , and the tm- and xc - decreasing effect of CPE wa stronger than HD . for copolymer of propylene and HD or CPE obtained with isospecific zirconocene catalyst , the isomorphism wa not ovserved . combined system including diphenylzinc , Ph2Zn , a metallocene , and methylaluminoxane , MAO , have been employed to initiate styrene polymerization and the copolymerization of styrene with p-alkylsubstituted styrene and a-olefins . both polymerization and copolymerization process depend on the nature of the metallocene included in the initiator system , the presence of Ph2Zn , the temperature , and the solvent used . S / 1-alkene copolymer were obtained when the initiator system included a zirconocene , but not when a titanocene participated . copolymer of propene and several higher a-olefins , 1-butene , 1-pentene , 1-hexene , 1-heptene , 1-octene , and 4-methyl-1-pentene ( 4M1P ) , have been prepared with two different metallocene catalyst , rac - Et(Ind) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( EI ) and rac-Me <nUm> Si(2-MeBenz-[e]Ind) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( MBI ) , and comprehensively characterized by <nUm> C NMR spectroscopy . all copolymer produced with EI have comparable isotacticities a well a similar stereosequences . the copolymer produced with MBI significantly differ both from the reference propene homopolymer and among themselves : in fact , they are characterized by rather low isotacticities and the degree of tacticity is strongly influenced by comonomer type and concentration . A detailed <nUm> C NMR analysis revealed that these copolymer are constituted by highly isotactic and atactic sequence of various length . the similar thermal behavior , in term of transition temperature , for the homologues of the series obtained with the two different catalyst show that the capability of crystallization of these system is not directly connected to the overall microstructural property ( e.g. the isotacticity index ) but can be accounted for by the detail of the microstructure . dual - site ethene / 1-hexene copolymerizations with MAO - activated (1,2,4-Me3Cp)2ZrCl2 and ( Me5Cp ) 2ZrCl2 catalyst were performed . copolymer with narrow molecular weight distribution and bimodal short chain branching distribution could be produced . the combined catalyst system demonstrates a number of discrepancy from an expected average behavior of the individual site . dual - site (1,2,4-Me3Cp)2ZrCl2 / ( me 5Cp)2ZrCl2 system produce copolymer with lower incorporation than expected . clear evidence for relative activity enhancement of the (Me5Cp)2ZrCl2 catalyst in the mixture were observed in melting endotherms and crystaf profile . molecular weight obtained by the mixture were higher than for any of the individual catalyst . A similar effect is observed for a dual - site system of the (1,2,4-Me3Cp)2ZrCl2 catalyst together with the Me4Si2(Me4Cp)2ZrCl2 catalyst a an alternative to (Me5Cp)2ZrCl2 . A set of different 1- and 2-silyl-substituted zirconocene dichloride / MAO catalyst system wa investigated with respect to their performance in ethene / 1-hexene copolymerisations . in-depth study of bis(2- dimethylsilylindenyl ) zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 1 ) revealed a multi-site behaviour , illustrating sensitivity to the reaction temperature and the comonomer mole fraction . surprisingly , an upper limit is observed for the latter , leading to complete catalyst inhibition . analysis of the chain termination process implies the possibility of a predominant , although in general le favourable , b-hydride elimination route under certain polymerisation condition . to increase the thermal stability of metallocene-methylaluminoxane catalyst , pentalene bridged zirconocenes and a constrained geometry catalyst were used for the copolymerisation of ethene and norbornene . the constrained geometry catalyst is stable in solution up to <nUm> ° C . surprisingly the molecular weight of the copolymer increase with higher incorporation rate of norbornene . glass transition temperature of <nUm> ° C are reached . the microstructure of the cyclic olefin copolymer material is more alternating . result of our study on polymerization kinetics and test of copolymerization statistical model of ethylene-norbornene ( E-N ) copolymer obtained on the basis of microstructures determined by 13C NMR analysis are reported , ethylene-norbornene ( E-N ) copolymer were synthesized by catalytic system composed of racemic isospecific metallocenes , i-Pr[(3Pr i-Cp)(Flu)]ZrCl2 or a constrained geometry catalyst ( CGC ) and methylaluminoxane . polymerization kinetics revealed that E-N copolymerization is quasi living under standard polymerization condition . calculation of the number of active site and of chain propagation and chain transfer turnover frequency indicate that the metal is mainly in the Mt-N* state , while the Mt-E* state contributes more to transfer and propagation rate . the first - order and the second - order markov statistic have been tested by using the complete tetrad distribution obtained from 13C NMR analysis of copolymer microstructures . the root-mean-square deviation between experimental and calculated tetrad demonstrate that penultimate ( second - order markov ) effect play a decisive role in E-N copolymerizations . result show clue for more complex effect depending on the catalyst geometry in copolymer obtained at high N / e feed ratio . comonomer concentration wa shown to have a strong influence on copolymer microstructure and copolymer property . the copolymer microstructure of alternating isotactic copolymer obtained with i-Pr[(3Pri-Cp)(Flu)]ZrCl2 have been described at pentad level . second - order markov statistic better describes also the microstrucure of these copolymer . the olefin polymerisation activity of metallocene catalyst strongly depends on the counteranion provided by the activator system . the relative activity of a number of new diborate anion [ Z(BAr3) 2]- have been quantified ( z = CN , H2N , C2N3 ; Ar = C6F5 or o-C6F 4C6F5 ) . the kinetic parameter for the initiation , propagation and termination step of propene polymerisation catalysed by BCl2ISZr have been determined using quenched - flow kinetic and batch technique [ SBI = rac-Me2Si(1-Ind)2 ] . comparison of two activator system , ( i ) CPh3[B(C6F 5)4 ] / triisobutylaluminium ( TIBA ) and ( ii ) methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) show , surprisingly , that the concentration of specie actively involved in chain growth at any one time is comparable for both system , although the MAO - activated catalyst is about <nUm> time le active than the borate system . it is concluded that the counteranion remains sufficiently strongly bound to the metal centre throughout the chain growth sequence to modulate the energetics of monomer insertion . A model suggesting that the monomer binding follows an associative interchange ( ia ) mechanism is proposed . Diphenylzinc-metallocene-MAO initiator system have proven to be effective initiator system for styrene and for substituted styrene a well a for their styrene / ( styrene - derivative ) copolymerization . titanocene produced almost pure syndiotactic polymer while zirconocenes gave atactic polystyrene together with a low content , le than <nUm> % , of syndiotactic polystyrene . system including a zirconocene , particularly ethenyl(bisindenyl)zirconium dichloride were effective initiator of 1-alkene polymerization and of styrene / 1-alkene copolymerization . conversion to polymer increase with the molecular size of 1-alkene . styrene derivative and styrene / ( styrene derivative ) polymerization wa greatly influenced by the inductive effect of substituent and by steric hindrance due to the monomer . series of propene - norbornene ( P-N ) copolymer were synthesized in the presence of two C2 symmetric zirconocenes , rac - Et(Indenyl) 2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) and rac-Me2Si(Indenyl) 2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , and of the Cs symmetric zirconocene Me2C(Cp)(Fluorenyl)ZrCl2 ( 3 ) with MAO a cocatalyst . P-N copolymer were characterized by 13C NMR spectroscopy , SEC , and DSC . A first assignment of the main 13C NMR signal of P-N copolymer obtained with <nUm> and <nUm> containing isolated N unit wa obtained on the basis of DEPT experiment and by comparison with isotactic polypropene ( i-PP ) and E-N copolymer spectrum . ab initio theoretical 13C NMR chemical shift , combined with R.I.S . statistic of the P-N chain , gave important detailed indication for the assignment of the complex 13C spectrum of these copolymer . such assignment were used to estimate the N copolymer content . the comparison of N content value obtained from the area of different region of the spectrum reveals that <nUm> propene misinsertions are formed in greater amount a the [N] / [P] ratio of the feed increase . this may be due to the steric hindrance of the Mt - tertiary carbon bond when N is the last inserted unit , which make difficult the next propene insertion and cause the low polymerization activity , molecular mass and tg . the spectrum of P-N copolymer obtained with <nUm> revealed to be even more complex . A limited assignment of the spectrum ha been achieved . this allowed u to evaluate the N content in the copolymer and to evidence the low tendency of the Cs symmetric <nUm> to give <nUm> propene misinsertions in P-N copolymer . this is in agreement with the result observed with this catalyst in propene homopolymerization . olefin-diene copolymerizations in the presence of C2 symmetric zirconocene rac-[CH2(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 / MAO catalytic system have been reported and rationalized by experimental and molecular modeling study . ethene give 1,2-cyclopropane and 1,2-cyclopentane , 1,3-cydobutane , and 1,3- cyclopentane unit in copolymerization with 1,3-butadiene , 1,4-pentadiene , and 1,5- hexadiene , respectively . propene-1,3-butadiene copolymerizations lead to <nUm> and <nUm> butadiene unit and to a low amount of 1,2-cyclopropane unit . concomitant immobilization of zirconocene ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) into a silica matrix wa performed during the O2Si synthesis through non-hydrolytic sol - gel method . two different route , varying the ClSi <nUm> : Si(OEt)4 ratio were evaluated in term of zirconocene content and catalyst activity in ethylene polymerization , using methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst . the catalyst were characterized by rutherford backscattering spectrometry , fourier transform infrared spectroscopy , diffuse reflectance spectroscopy , scanning electron microscopy and x-ray dispersive spectroscopy . the zirconocene content laid between <nUm> and <nUm> wt. % Zr / O2Si , depending upon the component ratio employed in the sol - gel synthesis . catalyst grain presented of irregular shape ( 20-100 mm size ) and zirconocene distribution wa not uniform . both route led to supported catalyst active in ethylene polymerization . catalyst activity wa intermediate between that exhibited by the homogeneous and the grafted zirconocene on silica . resulting polyethylene presented narrow molecular weight distribution and molecular weight slightly higher than that observed in the case of polymer produced with the homogeneous system . the recently described reaction product of zirconacyclopropenes cp 2Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) and five - membered zirconacyclocumulenes ( zirconacyclopenta-2,3,4-trienes ) Cp*2Zr(e4-1,2,3,4-RC4R) , cp* = e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl , r = me , Me3Si and ph , with i-Bu2AlH are active catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene and in the ring opening polymerization of e-caprolactone . here we describe the different activity of these complex after thermal activation or if additional i-Bu2AlH together with water are added . these result are compared to those which were obtained with the complex Cp2Zr(e 4-1,2,3,4-H2C4H2 ) , rac - (EBTHl)ZrF2 , roc(EBTHI)ZrCl2 , [ rac-(EBTHI)Zr(H)(m- H)]2 and roc (EBTHI)Zr(F)CH2 - CH2( 2-Py ) after activation with i-Bu2AlH together with water . reaction of Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 with excess methylalumoxane ( MAO ) give rise to ion pair containing zirconocenium cation of the type [Me2Si(Ind)2ZrMe]+ in contact with two type of anion , MeMAOA- and MeMAOB - , which differ in their coordinative strength : more strongly coherent contact - ion pair [ Me2Si(Ind)2 ZrMe +MeMAOB- ] are converted by a sufficiently high excess of MAO to more easily separable contact - ion pair [ Me2Si(Ind) 2ZrMe+MeMAOA- ] , which react with AlMe3 to form the outer - sphere ion pair [ Me2Si(Ind) 2Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2]+ MeMAO A- , and are likely to be required also for the formation of the olefin - containing reaction complex responsible for catalytic activity . exceptionally strong material could be synthesized by filled polyolefins with nanosized , regid particle or fiber . metallocene catalyst are excellent tool in the production of tailored microstructures a well a tacticitles of polypropylene . they are soluble in hydrocarbon and therefore can cover perfectly the surface of nano particle . here multi-walled carbon nanotube ( MWCNT ) ( diameter 15-25 nm , length up to <nUm> mm ) were used a filler . before polymerization , the filler were separated by ultra sound and then treated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . MAO reacts partially with defect and functional group of oxidized MWCNT . catalytically active center are formed after adding the zirconocenes or other transition metal complex directly on the CNT surface . the thickness of the polymer layer can be controlled by the monomer pressure and polymerization time . we obtained coating of <nUm> to <nUm> nm . by this method carbon nanotube can be covered also with isotactic or syndiotactic polypropylene , but also with polyethylene with any molecular mass . the nanocomposltes obtained were especially investigated In regard to their crystallization behavior , which depended significantly on the matrix used . the aluminohydride of zirconocene me 3SiCp 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> wa supported on pre-treated OSi <nUm> , and it catalytic activity for ethylene polymerization and ethylene-1-hexene copolymerization wa evaluated in order to compare with the corresponding activity of the complex in solution . As expected for system based on metallocenes , the aluminohydride of zirconocene complex showed higher activity in solution than in suspension , however it thermal and kinetic stability wa significantly increased . the effect of the co-catalyst concentration ( MAO ) on the activity and the molecular weight of the polymer are also reported in this study , finding that in heterogeneous phase low concentration of MAO were used to activate the pre-catalyst . the MW of the polymer and copolymer synthesized with the supported me 3SiCp 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> / OSi <nUm> could be controlled by adding molecular hydrogen ( H <nUm> ) a chain transfer agent in the polymerization and copolymerization reaction . copolymerizations of ethylene and a-olefins ( 1-hexene and 1-octene ) using a supported catalyst derived from the activation of a zirconocene aluminohydride complex with PMAO and MMAO are reported . the supported ( nBu-Cp 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> ) / OSi <nUm> / MAO system wa evaluated by high - throughput technique , in order to find approach to the optimal copolymerization condition . the polymerization reaction were carried out in a parallel polymerization reactor system ( PPR ) by symyx technology , inc . the screening of the activity of the supported system and the molecular weight ( MW ) of the polymer and copolymer obtained in the PPR , allowed u to optimize copolymerization condition , like hydrogen ( H <nUm> ) addition to control MW and molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) , polymerization temperature , cocatalyst ratio , and solvent type . the copolymerization reaction were scaled-up in order to validate the performance of the catalytic system at higher polymerization scale , according to the result obtained in the combinatorial phase . the scaled-up copolymerizations of ethylene with 1-hexene and 1-octene , showed high activity and MW , and low comonomer incorporation ( from <nUm> to <nUm> mol- % , determined by 13C NMR ) . however , the crystallinity ( x c ) , thermal property ( T c and T m ) and density of the polyethylene obtained with the supported ( nBu-Cp 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> ) / OSi <nUm> / MAO system , were significantly modified , approaching those of metallocene linear lowdensity polyethylene ( mLLDPE ) . binary metallocene - MAO and ternary diphenylzinc-metallocene-MAO initiator system have been tested a initiator in the homopolymerization of styrene and also in it copolymerization with several diverse comonomers including substituted styrene , styrene derivative , a-olefins and dienes . various titanocenes and zirconocenes and some exploratory experiment with hafnocene were carried out . the result indicate that titanocenes were more effective than zirconocenes in the homopolymerization of styrene while zirconocenes did better in a-olefin polymerization . it wa found that titanocenes generated mainly syndiotactic polystyrene , s-PS , while zirconocenes yielded atactic polystyrene or , depending on the zirconocene , a low percentage of s-PS . for these type of initiator the polymerization process depends largely on the inductive effect of the substituents linked to the benzene ring of styrene and on it position ( ortho , meta or para ) . substituent multiplicity reduced markedly the effectiveness of these initiator system . styrene / isoprene polymerization wa also studied using binary zirconocene - MAO initiator system that yielded low conversion and also low molecular weight polymer . In this work we studied the copolymerization of ethylene and different alpha-olefins ( propylene , 1-butene , 1-hexene , and 1-octene ) using aluminohydride zirconocene system supported on modified silica . the copolymerization reaction were carried out in hexane , at different Al / Zr ratio , using two different comonomer concentration . the effect of comonomer type on catalyst activity and polymer molecular weight and chemical composition distribution ( MWD and CCD ) wa compared . average comonomer incorporation wa determined by 13C NMR and the CCD by crystallization elution fractionation ( CEF ) . most of the copolymerizations showed very high catalytic activity ( up to <nUm> kg PE / mol Zr ) , and the molecular weight wa higher for the copolymer containing 1-octene , demonstrating that aluminohydride zirconocene system can copolymerize ethylene and alpha-olefins effectively . an opal - supported zirconocene complex ( OC ) wa prepared and employed to prepare functional polyethylene composite for the first time through in situ polymerization of ethylene . the formation mechanism of anion relating to opal wa explained and the value of anion released from pristine opal and that contained in the asfabricated polyethylene composite were detected . the OC exhibited high catalytic activity in ethylene polymerization with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) the cocatalyst . In addition to higher viscosity - average molecular weight ( me ) , experimental result also showed that the resulting polyethylene composite possessed improved anion - releasing capacity in comparison with pristine opal in addition to increased tensile strength , young 's modulus , and onset decomposition temperature ( tonset ) relative to neat polyethylene due to highly uniform dispersion of opal in polyethylene matrix . supported zirconocene catalyst on a new support , MgO , were prepared and tested in ethylene polymerization . three type of impregnation method were employed to find an optimum supporting method for MgO . the direct impregnation of Cp2ZrCl2 on MgO showed low metal loading and polymerization activity , while the catalyst had a higher metal loading and polymerization activity when MgO wa treated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) before supporting . treatment of MgO with MAO during the supporting step invoked two type of catalytic site , which wa evidenced by the bimodal molecular weight distribution of the polymer product . MgO is considered to have potential a a support for metallocenes . the use of biomass a support for zirconocene catalyst in ethylene polymerization wa studied . cellulose , starch and chitosan were conveniently characterized . many factor affecting the activity of the catalyst were examined . parameter such a surface area were found to have no significant influence on the activity of the catalyst . the activity of the catalyst sharply increased with the degree of deacetylation in the chitosan support . using this support the highest activity in ethylene polymerization wa obtained . the polymer obtained with the zirconocene supported on chitosan or cellulose pretreated with methylaluminoxane exhibited a higher obtained weight than those obtained with a homogeneous system . polymer particle obtained with these supported metallocene catalyst showed a good replication of the original support particle . polyethylene nano-composites , with different loading of silicon nitride ( NSi ) ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> wt % ) a filler were prepared by polymerization of ethylene , using zirconocene a catalyst . experimental result showed that activity of zirconocene catalyst activity wa higher for the composite having filler loading of <nUm> wt % . the thermal study using differential scanning calorimeter ( DSC ) and thermo - gravimetric analysis ( TGA ) indicated that crystallinity & thermal stability wa also influenced with the variation of filler loading . combustibility study using micro-calorimeter showed that increase in the filler loading will decrease the combustibility of polyethylene nano-composites . wide angle x-ray diffraction ( WAXD ) result indicated a decrease in the percentage of crystallinity with increase in filler wt % . scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) image revealed that morphology of the composite having <nUm> and <nUm> wt % of NSi are more fibrous when compared to control and composite having <nUm> wt % filler loading . POLYM. ENG . SCI. , <nUm> : <nUm> - <nUm> , <nUm> . A combination of diphenylzinc , a metallocene and methylaluminoxane ( Ph2Zn-metallocene-MAO ) is a suitable initiator system for the polymerization of styrene and for it copolymerization with para-alkyl substituted styrene . this paper report new experimental result which reinforce our previous finding indicating that polymerization process are initiated by monomer coordination to active specie resulting from these particular combined system . polymerization propagates by a cationic pathway . further to our previous observation that the I+ inductive effect of para-substituents in styrene improves conversion to polymer , we now find that methyl substitution on the vinyl double bond of styrene , in spite of the I+ inductive effect and a a result of increased steric hindrance , make the polymerization process difficult . on the other hand , the replacement of titanocenes by zirconocenes or hafnocenes generates Ph2Zn-metallocene-MAO initiator system which are also able to induce homo- and copolymerization , but with lower yield and producing practically amorphous polymer . the efficiency of our Ph2Zn-metallocene-MAO initiator system follows the order titanocene > zirconocene > hafnocene , at least for the studied metallocenes . the commercial interest of metallocene complex for olefin polymerization ha led to additional effort to prepare suitable metallocene complex efficiently and economically . ethylene polymerization wa carried out with a series of heterogeneous catalyst which were prepared in various Zr / silica ratio by immobilization of Ind2ZrCl2 preactivated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) on silica . this method to form the catalyst system resulted in a polymerization catalyst with reduced fouling tendency and improved reactor operability . polymerization of ethylene wa conducted in buchi reactor in a slurry phase under mild pressure . some of the physical property of the obtained polymer were also determined . background : much of the current research related to the development of in situ nanocomposites of olefin by polymerizing them with metallocenes in the presence of surface - treated filler is carried out in the slurry phase . In slurry - phase method a large amount of solvent is required and there is always a need of purification of the final product due to the possibility of trace of solvent present in the product . to overcome these drawback , to perform solvent - free metallocene - catalysed polymerization with in situ incorporation of inorganic nanoparticles , we have used a gas - phase polymerization technique a this doe not require solvent and also utilizes monomer feed stock efficiently . result : the catalyst used for the synthesis of in situ polyethylene nanocomposites by gas - phase polymerization wa nanosilica - supported zirconocene . the filler used were Cloisite-20A , kaolin and nanosilica . three different in situ polyethylene nanocomposites , i.e. Cloisite-20A-filled polyethylene ( CFPE ) , kaolin - filled polyethylene ( KFPE ) and nanosilica - filled polyethylene ( SFPE ) , were prepared by gas - phase polymerization . the nanocomposites were obtained in the form of fine powder . the polyethylene content in the developed nanocomposites is in the orthorhombic crystalline phase . using our approach , it is observed that the nanofillers are completely encapsulated by a thin layer of polyethylene . significantly higher molecular weight polyethylene wa formed in the case of KFPE in comparison to CFPE and SFPE . the thermal decomposition temperature , melting temperature and enthalpy are also observed to be higher for KFPE . conclusion : the gas - phase polymerization technique ha been successfully carried out for the synthesis of in situ polyethylene nanocomposites . themanufacture of linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) is of great significance in academia and industry . the employment of a single monomer , i.e. ethylene , to produce LLDPE by introducing two catalyst into one reactor to conduct ethylene copolymerization with in situ - generated a-olefins ha proved to be an effective way in this case . moreover , immobilization of catalyst affords LLDPE with bettermorphology and improved physical properties.An iron - based diimine complex immobilized on methylaluminoxane (MAO)-treated mesoporous molecular sieve wa used to oligomerize ethylene to a-olefins with improved selectivity to lower molar mass fraction . based on this , zirconocene compound wa also supported on mesoporous molecular sieve to comprise a two - catalyst system to produce LLDPE from a single ethylene monomer . copolymerization performed at both atmospheric and high pressure produced LLDPE of high molecular weight and broad molecular weight distribution without using MAO during the polymerization process . physical and mechanical measurement evidenced significant increase in tensile strength , tensile modulus and izod impact strength . A marked shear - thinning phenomenon and improved storagemodulus of LLDPE produced using catalyst supported on MCM-41 and SBA-15mesoporousmolecular sieve indicated a stronger interfacial interaction between themolecular sieve support and the polymeric matrix . spherical and well - dispersed silica / poly[styrene-co-(acrylic acid ) ] ( O2Si / PSA ) core - shell particle have been synthesized using an improved phase - inversion process . the resulting particle were successfully used a support for polyolefin catalyst in the production of polyethylene with broad molecular weight distribution . through the vapor phase , instead of the liquid phase in the traditional process , a non-solvent wa introduced into a mixture of micrometer - sized O2Si and PSA solution . the core - shell structure of the resulting O2Si / PSA microspheres wa confirmed using optical microscopy , scanning electron microscopy , fourier transfer infrared spectrometry , thermogravimetric analysis and measurement of nitrogen adsorption / desorption isotherm . In order to avoid agglomeration of particle and to obtain a good dispersion of the O2Si / PSA core - shell microspheres , the non-solvent wa added slowly . As the concentration of PSA solution increased , the surface morphology of the core - shell particle became looser and more irregular . however , the surface area and the pore volume remained the same under varying PSA concentration . the O2Si / PSA core - shell microspheres obtained were used a a catalyst carrier system in which the core supported (n-BuCp)2ZrCl2 and the shell supported Cl4Ti . ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization result indicated that the zirconocene and titanium - based ziegler - natta catalyst were compatible in the hybrid catalyst , showing high activity . the resulting polyethylene had high molecular weight and broad molecular weight distribution . the different elementary step in the activation process of racEt(Ind)2ZrCl2 by commercial methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) have been studied by UV / visible spectroscopy and correlated with hexene polymerization kinetics . after monomethylation of the zirconocene dichloride ( λ = <nUm> nm ) , abstraction of Cl ligand by MAO at low Al / Zr ratio ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ) yield tight ion pair , with an absorption band centred at λ = <nUm> nm , which are inactive towards hexene polymerization . addition of MAO in large excess ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ) is required to form the active specie . the latter , characterized by an absorption at λ = <nUm> nm , were identified a trimethylaluminium ( TMA ) separated ion pair . the activation by commercial MAO of racEt(Ind)2ZrX2 , with x being methyl , benzyl or dimethylamino a extractable group , instead of chloride , reveals much easier and complete activation at low Al / Zr ratio ( Al : Zr = 50-150 ) . for these system , formation of active ion pair of different catalytic activity and absorbing in the range λ = 430-440 nm is observed . the use of TMA - depleted MAO instead of commercial MAO , a cocacalyst for racEt(Ind)2ZrCl2 activation also allows the formation of active tight ion pair absorbing at λ = <nUm> nm at low Al / Zr ratio . these result underline the negative role of chloride ligand when associated with TMA ( contained in MAO ) in the activation process of zirconocene for olefin polymerization , and also suggest interesting alternative to reduce the amount of MAO necessary for metallocene activation . treatment of 2-(5-methyl-2-furyl)tetrahydroindenyllithium with Cl4Zr gave bis[2-(5-methyl-2-furyl)tetrahydroindenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 8 ) . dynamic 1H NMR spectroscopy revealed a cp - furyl rotational barrier of DGArrot[?] ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 . the x-ray crystal structure analysis of <nUm> showed the presence of a rac - like metallocene conformation in which the furyl ring are oriented coplanar with the cp moiety of the tetrahydroindenyl ligand system , but the two furyl ring are oriented differently : one ha the oxygen atom oriented toward the open front side , whereas the other ha the furyl oxygen pointing toward the narrow back side of the bent metallocene wedge . the 8-MAO ziegler - natta catalyst system produce an atactic polypropylene oil . ethene wa polymerized with the catalytic system L2ZrCl2 / MAO / TMA ( where L = cp , Me5Cp , or Me4Cp ; cp = e5-cyclopentadienyl ; MAO = methylaluminoxane ; and TMA = trimethylaluminum ) at <nUm> ° C , <nUm> bar , and AlTMA / Zr ratio of 0-2700 . the polymerization activity wa reduced with the addition of TMA for L = cp but wa almost unaffected for the methyl-substituted catalyst . increasing the TMA concentration resulted in a lower molecular weight of the polymer , with the largest effect for L = Me5Cp . A gel permeation chromatography analysis of the polymer revealed a high molecular weight shoulder and a nearly bimodal distribution for L = Me5Cp at high TMA concentration . A possible explanation of such a shoulder in term of long - chain branching wa ruled out by dynamic viscosity measurement . the origin of this effect more likely stemmed from competition between chain transfer to aluminum and b-hydrogen transfer reaction at two different site , one TMA - sensitive and one TMA - insensitive . polymerization at various pressure and temperature substantiated this assumption .
