A clue to the underlying mechanism came from investigation of chain transfer to TMA studied with density functional calculation . complexation of Me3Al to Zr wa much stronger for L = cp than for L = Me5Cp . however , the overall chain - transfer barrier wa much higher for L = cp . these result agreed both with the reduced activity for L = cp and with the strongly reduced molecular weight for L = Me5Cp observed with the addition of TMA . cyclopentadienyl magnesium chloride ( MgClCp ) and it functionalized derivative represent original and interesting supporting material to heterogenize metallocene catalyst for olefin polymerization . the synthesis of MgClCp , it functionalization , and the preparation of a catalytic system in which the ZrCl2(Flu)+ moiety is joined on the support through a cyclopentadienyl ligand are reported . this catalyst wa tested in ethene polymerization , and both the catalytic activity and property of the produced polymer were measured . it performance wa compared with that shown by the catalyst ZrCl2CpFlu employed under the same condition for both unsupported and conventional support , such a Cl2Mg . the result showed a remarkable improvement in term of the activity and polymer property with these heterogenized catalyst . moreover , this system showed stability toward leaching process and wa characterized by good morphological control of the growing polymer . finally , catalyst in which [HB(3,5-Me2pyrazolyl)3]ZrCl2+ and [HB(3,5-Me2pyrazolyl)3]ZrClOtBu+ moiety were bonded to a functionalized MgClCp- support were also synthesized and tested . the result showed that the proposed support could be usefully used to heterogenize tailored metallocene homogeneous catalyst . In fact , new catalyst were prepared that combined the peculiar advantage of both heterogeneous and homogeneous catalyst and overcame the disadvantage of the latter , such a a lack of morphology and reactor fouling . the copolymerization of propene with 7-methyl-1,6-octadiene ( MOD ) catalyzed by Cp*TiMe3 / BC18F15 ( A ) and rac-C2H4(Ind)2ZrCl2 / methylaluminoxan e ( B ) in toluene under <nUm> bar propene gave copolymer with unsaturated side chain . under these condition , catalyst A produced copolymer with an atactic backbone structure of type <nUm> , with <nUm> - <nUm> mol % MOD incorporation and weight - average molecular weight = <nUm> - <nUm> × <nUm> . using catalyst B , copolymer <nUm> with <nUm> - <nUm> mol % MOD incorporation were prepared . the comonomer incorporation wa a linear function of the feed ratio . the titanium catalyst A had a significantly higher affinity for MOD than the sterically more hindered zirconocene B . postpolymerization modification of the side - chain C = C bond allowed the facile introduction of a wide variety of functional group . epoxidation and especially ozonolysis of the C = C bond , to give -CHO and -COOH functionalized copolymer , proved to be very facile route to functionalized polypropene . according to monitoring by NMR , most of these transformation proceed in an essentially quantitative conversion . As an example of potential application of such polymer , polypropene with covalently attached dye were prepared that are suitable for blending . ethylene polymerization wa carried out with zirconocene catalyst supported on montmorillonite ( or functionalized montmorillonite ) . the functionalized montmorillonite wa from simple ion exchange of [CH3O2CCH2NH3]+ ( MeGlyH+ ) ion with interlamellar cation of layered montmorillonites . the functionalized montmorillonites [ high - purity montmorillonite (MMT)-MeGlyH+ ] had larger interlayer spacing ( <nUm> Å ) than montmorillonites without treatment ( <nUm> Å ) . the zirconocene catalyst system [ Cp2ZrCl2 / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) / MMT - MeGlyH+ ] had much higher Zr loading and higher activity than those of other zirconocene catalyst system ( Cp2ZrCl2 / MMT , Cp2ZrCl2 / MMT - MeGlyH+ , Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO / MMT , [Cp2ZrCl]+ [BF4] / MMT , [Cp2ZrCl]+ [BF4]- / MMT - MeGlyH+ , [Cp2ZrCl]+ [BF4]- / MAO / MMT - MeGlyH+ , and [Cp2ZrCl]+[BF4]- / MAO / MMT ) . the polyethylene with good bulk density were obtained from the catalyst system , particularly ( Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO / MMT - MeGlyH+ ) . MeGlyH+ and MAO seemed to play important role for preparation of the supported zirconocenes and polymerization of ethylene . the difference in Zr loading and catalytic activity among the supported zirconocene catalyst is discussed . heterogenization of tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane [B(C6F5)3] on a silica support stabilized with chlorotriphenylmethane ( CICPh3 ) and N,N-dimethylaniline ( HNMe2Ph ) creates the following supported borane cocatalysts : [HNMe2Ph]+[B(C6 F5)3-SiO2]- and [CPh3]+[B(C6F5)3- SiO2]- . these supported catalyst were reacted with Cp2ZrCl2 TIBA in situ to generate active metallocene specie in the reactor . triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) wa a good coactivator for dichloro-zirconocene , acting a the prealkylating agent to generate cationic zirconocene ( Cp2ZrC4H9+ ) . the catalytic performance were determined from the kinetics of ethylene-consumption profile that were independent of the time dedicated to the activation of the catalyst . the scanning electron microscopy - energy dispersive x-ray measurement showed that BC18F15 dispersed uniformly on the silica support . under our reaction condition , the [CPh3]+[B(C6F5)3- SiO2]- system had higher productivity and weight - average molecular weight than the [HNMe2Ph]+[B(C6 F5)3-SiO2]- system . for the [CPh3]+[B(C6F5)3- SiO2]- system , the productivity increased with the amount catalyst ; however , the polydispersity index of polyethylene synthesized did not change . the final shape of polymer particle wa a larger - diameter version of the original support particle . the polymer particle synthesized with supported [CPh3]+[B(C6F5)3- SiO2]- catalyst had larger diameter . ethene - propene copolymerizations were performed in the presence of Cs symmetric group <nUm> metallocenes . the reactivity ratio were strongly influenced by both the transition metal and the ancillary ligand . substantially alternate , almost random , and blocky copolymer were obtained with titanocene , zirconocene , and hafnocene , respectively , with the bis(dimethylsilyl)-1,1'-2,2'-diyl-(3',5'-diisopropyl)(4- isopropyl)-(cyclopentadienyl) ligand , and a blocky copolymer wa obtained with ( diphenyl methylidene)(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)TiCl2 . copolymerization of ethylene or propylene and norbornene ( NB ) wa carried out with stereospecific zirconocene catalyst rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride , rac-dimethylsilylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) , rac-dimethyl-silylenebis(2-methylindenyl)zirconium dichloride , and diphenylmethylene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride combined with cocatalysts at <nUm> ° C . temperature - rising elution fractional of the copolymer wa carried out with cross-fractionation chromatography with o-dichlorobenzene a a solvent , and a broad distribution of the copolymer composition wa detected . the fraction eluted at lower temperature contained higher NB . the effect of the polymerization time wa examined in the ethylene-NB copolymerization with catalyst <nUm> , and the higher - temperature elution fraction increased with increasing polymerization time . macroporous functionalized polymer bead of poly(4-vinylpyridine-co-l,4-divinylbenzene) [P(VPy-co-DVB)] were prepared by a multistep polymerization , including a polystyrene ( PS ) shape template by emulsifier - free emulsion polymerization , linear PS seed by staged template suspension polymerization , and macroporous functionalized polymer bead of P(VPy-co-DVB) by multistep seeded polymerization . the polymer bead , having a cellular texture , were made of many small , spherical particle . the bead size wa 10-50 mm , and the pore size wa <nUm> - <nUm> mm . the polymer bead were used a support for zirconocene catalyst in ethylene polymerization . they were very different from traditional polymer support . the polymer bead could be exfoliated to yield many spherical particle dispersed in the resulting polyethylene particle during ethylene polymerization . the influence of the polymer bead on the catalytic behavior of the supported catalyst and morphology of the resulting polyethylene wa investigated . this article report the use of a binary single - site catalyst system for synthesizing comb - branched polypropylene sample having isotactic polypropylene ( iPP ) backbone and atactic polypropylene ( aPP ) side chain from propylene feedstock . this catalyst system consisted of the bisiminepyridine iron catalyst { [ 2-ArN = C(Me)]2C5H3N}FeCl2 [ Ar = 2,6-C6H3(Me)2 ] ( 1 ) and the zirconocene catalyst rac-Me2Si(2-MeBenz[e]Ind)2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) . the former in situ generated 1-propenyl-ended aPP macromonomer , whereas the latter incorporated the macromonomer into the copolymer . the effect of reaction condition , such a the catalyst addition procedure and the ratio of <nUm> / <nUm> on the branching frequency , were examined . copolymer sample having a branching density up to <nUm> aPP side chain per <nUm> iPP monomer unit were obtained . the branched copolymer were characterized by 13C NMR and differential scanning calorimetry . because of the great economic interest in propylene-based polymer and the possibility of designing material with desired property with metallocene catalyst mixture , we investigated the characteristic of polypropylene produced by mixture of SiMe2Ind2ZrCl2 : dimethylsilane-bis(indenyl) zirconocene ( 1 ) and Et(Flu)(Cp)ZrCl2 : ethylidene ( fluorenyl cyclopentadienyl ) zirconocene ( 2 ) in different proportion . the polymer were fractionated with solvent , and the fraction were characterized . we observed that the polymer produced by the different mixed system showed lower weight - average molecular weight and only slightly broader molecular weight distribution than polypropylene synthesized by the individual catalyst . we concluded that catalyst <nUm> acted independently of catalyst <nUm> , producing polymer with the same isotacticity . ethene homopolymerization and copolymerization with 1-hexene were performed with three new tetramethyldisilylene-bridged zirconocene catalyst with 2-indenyl ligand ( A ) , 2-tetrahydroindenyl ligand ( B ) , and tetramethyl-cyclopentadienyl ligand ( C ) and with methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . catalyst A and B showed substantial comonomer incorporation , resulting in a copolymer melting temperature more than <nUm> ° lower than that of the corresponding homopolymer . In contrast , catalyst C produced a copolymer with a low 1-hexene content and a high melting temperature . the reduction in the molecular weight with 1-hexene addition also correlated well with the comonomer incorporation . for all three catalyst , the homopolymer and copolymer unsaturations indicated frequent chain termination after 1-hexene insertion and a high degree of chain - end isomerization during the homopolymerization of ethene . the chain transfer to Al in the cocatalyst also appeared to be important . the comonomer response could be correlated with the structural property of the catalyst , a derived from quantum chemical calculation . A linear model , calibrated against recent experiment with unbridged (MenC5H5-n)2ZrCl2 catalyst , suggested that the low comonomer incorporation obtained with catalyst C wa caused partly by a narrow opening angle between the aromatic ligand and partly by steric hindrance in the transition state of comonomer insertion . ethylene homopolymerizations and copolymerizations were catalyzed by zirconocene catalyst entrapped inside functionalized montmorillonites that had been rendered organophilic via the ion exchange of the interlamellar cation of layered montmorillonite with hydrochloride of l-amino acid ( AAH+Cl- ) or their methyl ester ( MeAAH+Cl- ) , with or without the further addition of hexadecyltrimethylammonium bromide ( C16H33N+Me3Br- ; R4N+Br- ) . In contrast to the homogeneous Cp2ZrCl2 / methylaluminoxane catalyst for ethylene homopolymerizations and copolymerizations with 1-octene , the intercalated Cp2ZrCl2 activated by methylaluminoxane for ethylene homopolymerizations and copolymerizations with 1-octene proved to be more effective in the synthesis of polyethylene with controlled molecular weight , chemical composition and structure , and property , including the bulk density . the effect of the property of the organic guest on the preparation and catalytic performance of the intercalated zirconocene catalyst were studied . the polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) wa investigated with tris(pentafluorophenyl)alane [ Al(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] and four metallocene imido complex that varied in the complex symmetry / chirality , metal , and r group in the = NR moiety , a well a a zirconocene enolate preformed from the imido zirconocene and MMA . this study examined four aspect of MMA polymerization : the effect of the metallocene imido complex structure on the polymerization activity and polymer tacticity , the degree of polymerization control , the elementary reaction of the imido complex with Al(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> and MMA , and the polymerization kinetics and mechanism . there wa no effect of the imido complex symmetry / chirality on the polymerization stereochemistry ; the polymerization followed bernoullian statistic , producing syndiotactic poly(methyl methacrylate)s with moderate ( ∼ <nUm> % [rr] ) to high ( ∼ <nUm> % [rr] ) syndiotacticity , depending on the polymerization temperature . polymerization control wa demonstrated by the number - average molecular weight , which increased linearly with an increase in the monomer conversion to <nUm> % , and the relatively small and insensitive polydispersity index ( from <nUm> to <nUm> ) to conversion . the reaction of the zirconocene imido complex with Al(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> and MMA produced the parent base - free imido complex and the [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition product ( i.e. , zirconocene enolate ) , respectively ; the latter product reacted with Al(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> to generate the active zirconocenium enolaluminate . the MMA polymerization with the metallocene imido complex and the alane proceeded via intermolecular michael addition of the enolaluminate to the alane - activated MMA involved in the propagation step . copolymerization of olefin ( ethylene and propylene ) and 5-hexen-1-ol pretreated with alkylaluminum wa performed using [dimethysilylbis(9-fluorenyl)]zirconium dichloride / methylaluminoxane a the catalyst . the copolymerization required extra addition of alkylaluminum to prevent deactivation of the catalyst when 5-hexen-1-ol wa pretreated with trimethylaluminum , whereas the triisobutylaluminum - treated system did not require any addition of alkylaluminum . the molecular weight of the copolymer depended on the kind of alkylaluminum compound ( masking reagent , additive , and cocatalyst ) . 13C NMR analysis proved that poly(ethylene-co-5-hexen-1-ol) containing <nUm> mol % of 5-hexen-1-ol acted a an alternating copolymer , whereas the poly(propylene-co-5-hexen-1-ol) acted a a random copolymer . the surface property of the copolymer wa simply evaluated by mean of water drop contact angle measurement . it wa found that the copolymer containing large amount of 5-hexen-1-ol unit showed good hydrophilic property . A novel approach to the preparation of polyethylene ( PE ) nanocomposites , with montmorillonite / silica hybrid ( MT-Si ) supported catalyst , wa developed . MT-Si wa prepared by depositing silica nanoparticles between gallery of the MT . A common zirconocene catalyst [ bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride / methylaluminoxane ] wa fixed on the MT-Si surface by a simple method . after ethylene polymerization , two class of nanofillers ( clay layer and silica nanoparticles ) were dispersed concurrently in the PE matrix and PE / clay - silica nanocomposites were obtained . exfoliation of the clay layer and dispersion of the silica nanoparticles were examined with transmission electron microscopy . physical property of the nanocomposites were characterized by tensile test , dynamic mechanical analysis , and DSC . the nanocomposites with a low nanofiller loading ( < <nUm> wt % ) exhibited good mechanical property . the nanocomposite powder produced with the supported catalyst had a granular morphology and a high bulk density , typical of a heterogeneous catalyst system . ethylene polymerization with catalytic system Me2SiCp*NtBuZrX2 ( 1 ) [ cp* = C3H4 ; x = Cl ( 1Cl ) , me ( 1Me ) ] , triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) , perfluorophenylborate CatB(C6F5)4 [ cat = CPh3 ( 3 ) , Me2NHPh ( 4 ) ] , or Me2SiCp2ZrX2 [ x = Cl ( 2Cl ) , me ( 2Me ) ] / TIBA / <nUm> ( 4 ) were performed within a wide range of ethylene pressure of different Al / Zr ratio , and Zr / B = <nUm> . catalytic system 1Cl(2Cl) / TIBA / <nUm> led to the formation of very high linear molecular weight polyethylene ( PE ) of me ∼ ; <nUm> with low activity . the replacement of both chlorine ligand in the precatalyst for the methyl one led to the formation of active specie producing low molecular weight PE with high activity . chain transfer to ethylene wa shown to be the main reaction controlling PE chain propagation : kp / ktr ∼ 20-30 for 1Me / TIBA / <nUm> and kp / ktr ∼ 350-500 for 2Me / TIBA / <nUm> . it wa suggested that TIBA wa present in the active center first in the form of a neutral heterobimetallic Zr-Al bridged complex followed by the formation of a partially polarized Zr - Al(Cl)R2 ( r = iBu ) or an unreactive Zr - AlR3 cationic complex by abstraction of the alkyl ligand under the action of borate . it wa concluded that AlR3 from the latter cationic complex may be easily reversibly replaced under the specific coordination of ethylene or accumulated a-olefin , giving rise to highly labile and sterically accessible cationic specie . experiment on ethylene polymerization with the catalytic system 1Cl(1Me) / TIBA / <nUm> / Ph2NH , 1Cl(1Me) / TIBA / <nUm> , 2Cl(2Me) / TIBA / <nUm> / Ph2NH , and 2Cl(2Me) / TIBA / <nUm> were performed to confirm the suggestion . catalytic system derived from dichloride complex in the presence of a s-donor substrate also produced low molecular weight EsP with molecular weight characteristic similar to those of product obtained with the dimethylated precatalysts . the specific feature of active specie derived from 2Me complex to isomerize coordinated a-olefin into trans-vinylene polymer chain wa also revealed . the catalytic behavior of the ternary catalytic system based on 2Me relative to 2Me or 2Cl precatalysts activated with polymethylaluminoxane at different Al / Zr ratio wa compared . an investigation of the catalytic behavior of the dimethylated zirconocenes Me2SiCp* NtBuZrMe2 [ cp* = C3H4 ; 1Me ] , Me2SiCp2ZrMe2 ( 2Me ) , Cp2ZrMe2 ( 3Me ) , Ind2ZrMe2 ( 4Me ) , Me2SiInd2ZrMe2 ( 5Me ) , Et(2-MeInd)2ZrMe2 ( 6Me ) , and Me2Si(2-MeInd)2ZrMe2 ( 7Me ) with the combined activator triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) / CPh3B(C6F5)4 ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ; B / Zr = <nUm> ) in ethylene polymerization at increased monomer pressure ( 5-11 bar , <nUm> ° C ) wa carried out . sterically opened zirconocenes in ternary catalyst gave rise to active specie effective in the formation of low molecular weight polyethylene ( EsP ) . these active specie tended to increase the PE molecular weight [ 1Me ( 2100 ) < 2Me ( 20,000 ) < 5Me ( 89,000 ) < 3Me ( 94,500 ) ] under similar condition . PE obtained with 4Me showed a bimodal gel permeation chromatography curve with a <nUm> % peak area [ weight - average molecular weight ( mw ) = <nUm> ] and a <nUm> % peak area ( mw = <nUm> ) . the increase in sterical demand from the zirconocenes wa also demonstrated by the reduction of the chain transfer to monomer , the reinsertion of vinyl-ended PE chain , and their ability for isomerization . these reaction were most pronounced for the zirconocenes 1Me and 2Me . the active specie responsible for the formation of low molecular weight EsP deactivated quickly . the zirconocenes 6Me , 7Me , and (2-PhInd)2ZrMe2 ( 8Me ) bearing substituent at the 2-position of the indenyl ring wa activated with TIBA alone , yielding active specie effective in ethylene and propylene polymerization . EsP formed with 6Me-8Me complex activated with TIBA had high molecular weight . an increase in the Al / Zr ratio in the catalytic system 8Me / TIBA from <nUm> to <nUm> led to an enhancement of the molecular weight of polypropylene ( PP ) sample from oligomeric product to an viscosity - average molecular weight of <nUm> . the increase in the molecular weight of PPs with an increase in the propylene concentration wa also observed . an analysis of the catalytic performance of the 8Me / TIBA system showed first - order dependency of the initial polymerization rate on the TIBA concentration and close to second - order dependency on propylene . the second - order dependency on the monomer concentration is explained in term of the monomer participation in the initiation step of the polymerization reaction . the use of functional group bearing silica / poly(styrene-co-4-vinylpyridine) core - shell particle a a support for a zirconocene catalyst in ethylene polymerization wa studied . several factor affecting the behavior of the supported catalyst and the property of the resulting polymer , such a time , temperature , Al / N ( molar ratio ) , and Al / Zr ( molar ratio ) , were examined . the condition of the supported catalyst preparation were more important than those of the ethylene polymerization . the state of the supported catalyst itself played a decisive role in both the catalytic behavior of the supported catalyst and the property of polyethylene ( PE ) . IR and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy were used to follow the formation of the support . the formation of cationic active specie is hypothesized , and the performance of the core-shell-particle - supported zirconocene catalyst is discussed a well . the bulk density of the PE formed wa higher than that of the polymer obtained from homogeneous and polymer - supported Cp2ZrCl2 / methylaluminoxane catalyst system . the copolymerization of propylene with 1-hexene , 1-octene , 1-decene , and 1-dodecene wa carried out with silica - supported rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 a a catalyst . the copolymerization activity of the homogeneous and supported catalyst and the microstructures of the resulting copolymer were compared . the activity of the supported catalyst wa only one - half to one - eighth of that of the homogeneous catalyst , depending on the comonomer type . the supported catalyst copolymerized more comonomer into the polymer chain than the homogeneous catalyst at the same monomer feed ratio . data of reactivity ratio showed that the depression in the activity of propylene instead of an enhancement in the activity of olefinic comonomer wa responsible for this phenomenon . we also found that copolymerization with a-olefins and supporting the metallocene on a carrier improved the stereoregularity and regioregularity of the copolymer . the melting temperature of all the copolymer decreased linearly with growing comonomer content , regardless of the comonomer type and catalyst system . low mobility of the propagation chain in the supported catalyst wa suggested a the reason for the different polymerization behavior of the supported catalyst with the homogeneous system . the ethylene polymerization by Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO ( cp = e5 : cyclopentadienyl ; MAO = methyl aluminoxane ) and CpZrCl3 / MAO have been studied . the MW and PD ( = mw / mw ) of polymer obtained after 2.5-60 min are the same , which indicate short chain lifetime . the value of rate constant for Cp2ZrCl2 at <nUm> ° C are : kp = <nUm> − <nUm> ( m s)-1 and ktrA1 = 0.012-0.81 s-1 depending upon [Zr] and [MAO,] ktrb = <nUm> s-1 , and ktrH = <nUm> M-1 torr-1 / <nUm> s-1 . these chain transfer rate constant value are two to three order of magnitude greater than the corresponding value found for Cl2Mg supported titanium catalyst . one significant difference between the heterogeneous and homogeneous catalyst is that the former decay according to an apparent second order kinetics , whereas the latter decay is simple first order at <nUm> ° C and biphasic first order at higher temperature . the productivity of the catalyst depends weekly on temperature while the MW decrease strongly with increase of temperature above <nUm> ° C . all the active specie were formed upon mixing Cp2ZrCl2 with MAO while it took up to <nUm> min for the CpZnCl3 / MAO system . the productivity of the former increase more strongly with the decrease of [Zr] than the latter . otherwise , the two catalyst system have all their kinetic parameter differing le than a factor of two . the kinetic parameter have been measured for octene-1 solution polymerization at <nUm> ° C catalyzed by zirconocene with the cocatalyst methylaluminoxane . the polymerization were performed in an attenuated total reflectance ( ATR ) reaction cell . the progress of the reaction were followed by observing the disappearance of octene-1 using the <nUm> cm-1 band measured by FT-IR spectroscopy . the dependence of the reaction rate , rp , on catalyst concentration and cocatalyst / catalyst ratio wa examined . the catalyst deactivation mechanism wa studied by fitting the experimental data to mathematical model involving second-order propagation and either first or second order catalyst deactivation . second-order catalyst deactivation provided a much better fit . the calculated deactivation rate constant , kd , is <nUm> (Ms)-1 . this model is used to determine the propagation rate constant for Al / Zr = <nUm> × <nUm> a kp = <nUm> ( m s)-1 . A decrease in Al / Zr = <nUm> × <nUm> lowered the propagation rate constant , kp , to <nUm> ( m s)-1 indicating that le than <nUm> % of the initial Zr is active at this Al / Zr ratio . MgCl2-supported Cl3Ti catalyst , with and / or without electron donor modifier ( internal Bi or external Be ) , were compared with rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) activated with either MAO or the cation forming agent , triphenyl carbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( 2 ) , with triethylalumium ( TEA ) . the activity of the heterogeneous catalyst depend on the presence or absence of the lewis base , were relatively insensitive to the temperature of polymerization , and produce poly(hexene) with molecular weight up to <nUm> . the <nUm> / MAO catalyst ha about five time higher activity at <nUm> ° C but is almost inactive at − <nUm> ° C ; the overall activation energy is <nUm> kcal mol-1 . In contrast , the activity for hexene polymerization by the <nUm> / <nUm> / TEA catalyst is actually slightly greater at lower temperature . the MW 's of poly(hexene) obtained with the zirconocenium catalyst are only in the ten of thousand because of rapid b-hydride elimination by the electrophilic cationic Zr center . propylene wa polymerized with rac-ethylene-bis (1-e5-indenyl)dichlorozirconium / methylaluminoxane in solvent of different polarity . the poly ( propylene ) formed wa separated by solvent extraction ; 13C-NMR and DSC measurement were made on the polymer fraction . the poly(propylene) in each solvent fraction ha it characteristic molecular weight steric pentad distribution , melting transition temperature , and enthalpy for fusion irrespective of the polymerization medium . the result suggest that the medium dielectric constant doe not affect the polymerization rate or the intrinsic stereoselectivity , propagation and chain transfer rate a given catalytic specie but can alter the occurrence of steric insertion error through shifting of distribution of the propagating specie producing poly(propylenes) of different stereoregularities . propylene wa polymerized by binary zirconocenium catalyst derived from rac-ethylenebis(1-e5-indenyl)dimethylzirconium and cation forming agent (C6H5)3C+(C6F5)4B- and BC18F15 . polymerization were also performed with the ternary system of Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 , Et3Al , and the cation forming agent . the catalyst system , with the inert noncoordinating counter-ion , (C6F5)4B- , have much higher activity and stereoselectivity than the one with the CH3B-(C6F5)3 counter-ion . much le active still are catalyst having BF4- or (C6H5)4B- counter-ions . similar but smaller effect of counter-ion structure on ethylene polymerization were observed . racemic isopropylidene (1-e5-cyclopentadienyl)(1-e5-indenyl) dichlorozirconium and the 3-methylindenyl derivative have been synthesized and characterized . these precursor activated with methylaluminoxane produce poly(propylene) with hemiisotactic microstructures . the syndiospecific propylene polymerization catalyzed by isopropylidene(cyclopentadienyl)(fluorenyl)- and (2,2-dimethylpropylidene)(cyclopentadienyl)(fluorenyl)-zirconocenium ( 1+ and 2+ ) have been investigated theoretically and compared with experimental observation . with the ab initio calculated structure for the transition state ( TS ) of 1+(M)P and 2+(M)P ( m = propylene , P = 2-methylpentyl ) , their steric energy ( e ° ) have been computed using MM2 force-field . the difference between steric energy e ° ( m ) and e ° ( r ) for the meso and racemic enchainment of propylene , respectively , is defined a the stereocontrol energy [ dE ° ( m − r ) ] for syndiotactic propagation . the dE ° ( m − r ) for the TS of 1+ (M)P is about <nUm> kcal / mol , the value is <nUm> kcal / mol greater for 2+(M)P . the observed steric pentad distribution of the syndiotactic poly(propylene) obtained by these catalyst are consistent with smaller effective stereocontrol energy , which is about two-third a large a dE ° ( m − r ) value calculated for the MM2 optimized structure . syndiotactic enchainment is favored over isotactic enchainment for all combination of site configuration in the catalyst . a-Agostic interaction seems to enhance syndioselectivity , whereas g-agostic interaction change the stereoselectivity to meso enchainment . the mirror plane symmetry of the syndiotactic propagating specie render the stereoselectivity of the polymerization insensitive to reaction condition . these catalyst are also highly regiospecific . propene wa polymerized at <nUm> ° C and 2-bar propene in toluene using methylalumoxane ( MAO ) activated rac-Me2Si(Benz[e]Indenyl)2ZrCl2 ( BI ) and rac-Me2Si(2-Me-Benz[e]Indenyl)2ZrCl2 ( MBI ) . catalyst BI / MAO polymerizes propene with high activity to afford low molecular weight polypropylene , whereas MBI / MAO is le active and produce high molecular weight polypropylene . variation of reaction condition such a propene concentration , temperature , concentration of catalyst component , and addition of hydrogen reveals that the lower molecular weight polypropylene produced with BI / MAO result from chain transfer to propene monomer following a 2,1-insertion . A large fraction of both metallocene catalyst system is deactivated upon 2,1-insertion . such dormant site can be reactivated by h2-addition , which affords active metallocene hydride . this effect of h2-addition is reflected by a decreasing content of head-to-head enchainment and the formation of polypropylene with n-butyl end group . both catalyst show a strong dependence of activity on propene concentration that indicates a formal reaction order of <nUm> with respect to propene . MBI / MAO show a much higher dependence of the activity on temperature than BI / MAO . At elevated temperature , MBI / MAO polymerizes propene faster than BI / MAO . Bis(1-indenyl)-di[1'S , 2'R , 5'S)-methoxy]silane ( 1 ) wa converted into a mixture of corresponding ansa-diastereomeric zirconocenes . further purification afforded a single dia-stereomer , di[(1'S , 2'R , 5'S)-methoxy ] silylene-bis[e5-1(R , r)-(+)-indenyl ] dichlorozirconium ( 2 ) , which is optically active and hydrocarbon soluble . extremely rapid ethylene , propylene , and ethylene-hexene polymerization were observed both in toluene and n-heptane solution ; for instance , at <nUm> ° C , activity for ethylene polymerization reach ∼ <nUm> × <nUm> ( g of PE / ( ( mol of Zr ) · [C2H4] · h ) . the “ bare ” zirconocenium ion generated from <nUm> / TIBA / Ph3CB(C6F5)4 exhibit unusual polymerization behavior ; the polymerization activity increase monotonically with temperature of polymerization ( tp ) up to a conventional polymerization condition ( <nUm> – <nUm> ° C ) , and the 13C NMR study show that the isotactic poly-propylene obtained ha fairly high [mmmm] methyl pentad distribution at high tp ( 25 ° C with [mmmm] ∼ <nUm> – <nUm> ) and a perfect stereoregularity at low tp ( 0 ° C with [mmmm] > <nUm> ) . the catalyst precursor <nUm> and Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( 3 ) supported on silica by different approach produced poly(olefins) of different molecular weight and stereoregularities , and a methylaluminokane and Ph3CB(C6F5)4 free silica-supported zirconocene system wa found to be activated by triisobutylaluminum . the study of ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization with the zirconocene catalyst , bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl <nUm> ) / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , anchored on a MgCl2(THF) <nUm> support wa carried out . the influence of 1-hexene concentration in the feed on catalyst productivity and comonomer reactivity a well a other property wa investigated . additionally , the effect of support modification by the organoaluminum compound [ ( MAO , trimethlaluminum ( AlMe3 ) , or diethylaluminum chloride ( Et2AlCl ) ] on the behavior of the ClMg 2(THF)2 / Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst in the copolymerization process and on the property of the copolymer wa explored . immobilization of the Cp2ZrCl2 compound on the complex magnesium support MgCl2(THF)2 resulted in an effective system for the copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene . the modification of the support a well a the kind of organoaluminum compound used a a modifier influenced the activity of the examined catalyst system . additionally , the profitable influence of immobilization of the homogeneous catalyst a well a modification of the support applied on the molecular weight and molecular weight distribution of the copolymer wa established . finally , with the successive self - nucleation / annealing procedure , the copolymer obtained over both homogeneous and heterogeneous metallocene catalyst were heterogeneous with respect to their chemical composition . statistical copolymer of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) with n-butyl- , s-butyl , t-butyl- , n-hexyl- , decyl- , stearyl- , allyl- , trimethylsilyl- and trimethylsilyloxyethyl methacrylate were prepared by zirconocene - catalyzed copolymerization . the reactivity ratio of MMA copolymer with butyl- , hexyl- , and stearyl methacrylate were estimated using the finemann - ross , the inverted finemann - ross , and the kelen - tudos graphical method . structural parameter of the copolymer were obtained from the calculated dyad sequence , derived by using the reactivity ratio . the effect of the nature of the methacrylate ester group and the catalytic system used on the copolymer structure is discussed . the glass - transition temperature ( tg ) value of MMA copolymer with butyl- and hexyl methacrylate were measured and examined in the frame of several theoretical equation , allowing the prediction of these tg value . the best fit wa obtained using barton and johnston equation , taking the monomer sequence distribution of the copolymer into account . metallocene and other transition metal complex activated by methylaluminoxane are highly active catalyst for the polymerization of olefin , diolefins , and styrene , which wa discovered at the university of hamburg about <nUm> year ago . these catalyst allow the synthesis of polymer with a highly defined microstructure , tacticity , and stereo - regularity , a well a new copolymer with superior property such a film clarity , tensile strength , and lower extractables . A better understanding of the mechanism of olefin polymerization lead to finding of other new single site catalyst . the development of the metallocene / MAO - catalyst from their discovery to their present state of the art is presented . the copolymerization of propylene and 3-buten-1-ol protected with alkylaluminum [ trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) or triisobutylaluminum ] wa conducted with an isospecific zirconocene catalyst [ rac-dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl) zirconium dichloride ] , combined with methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst , in the presence of additional TMA or H a the chain - transfer reagent if necessary . the result indicated that endhydroxylated polypropylene wa obtained in the presence of the chain - transfer reagent because of the formation of dormant specie after the insertion of the 3-buten-l-ol - based monomer followed by chain - transfer reaction . the selectivity of the chain - transfer reaction wa influenced by the alkylaluminum protecting the comonomer and the catalyst structure . the copolymerization of ethylene and n-(vinylphenyl)carbazole ( VPC ) wa carried out with constrained geometry catalyst ( CGC ) and isopropylidene-bridged zirconocene catalyst . the copolymerization of ethylene and styrene wa successfully achieved with half - sandwiched titanocene catalyst which include bridged cyclopentadienyl and amino ligand . it wa observed that the copolymer exhibited semicrystalline / rubbery , amorphous rubbery and amorphous / glassy feature with increasing styrene content . the result show that the electronic interaction between VPC and the active specie affected the reactivity of VPC rather than the steric factor of the active specie . through the diels - alder reaction between cyclopentadiene group attached to polystyrene in the presence of zirconocene , novel polystyrene - supported metallocene catalyst were prepared . A novel method for immobilizing metallocene catalyst wa investigated , and the resultant polystyrene - supported metallocene for olefin polymerization wa studied . the result of olefin polymerization showed that different crosslinking degree of support in the catalyst system had significant effect on the catalytic behavior . the influence of the [Al] / [Zr] molar ratio and the temperature on the (co)polymerization activity wa studied . when 1-hexene and 1-dodecene were used for copolymerization with ethylene , an obvious positive comonomer effect wa observed . investigation of the characteristic and performance in propylene polymerization of silica - immobilized methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , in combination with a moderately and a highly isospecific zirconocene catalyst , ha revealed that a simple impregnation of silica with MAO at ambient temperature is insufficient to obtain uniform distribution of MAO throughout the support particle . homogeneous Al distribution throughout the support , giving increased catalyst activity , wa achieved by a more rigorous impregnation of silica with MAO at elevated temperature . the highest catalyst activity were obtained by precontacting the MAO with the zirconocene to generate the activated specie before immobilization on silica . polymer particle morphology wa strongly dependent on the characteristic of the silica used for catalyst immobilization . statistical copolymer of methyl methacrylate with cyclohexyl and trimethylsilyloxy ethyl methacrylate were synthesized with two different catalytic system based on the zirconocene complex Cp2ZrMe <nUm> . the reactivity ratio of methyl methacrylate and these methacrylates were calculated with the finemann - ross , inverted finemann - ross , and kelen - tudos graphical method . the structural parameter of these copolymer were estimated from the calculation of the dyad monomer sequence fraction . two different borate cocatalysts were employed , and their effect on the copolymerization process is discussed . the polymerization behavior of cyclohexyl methacrylate and trimethyl-silyloxyethyl methacrylate with the catalytic system cp 2ZrMe2 / BC18F15 / ZnEt <nUm> wa examined . block copolymer of these bulky methacrylates with methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) , having high molecular weight and relatively narrow molecular weight distribution , were prepared . n-Butyl acrylate and tert-butyl acrylate were polymerized with various catalytic system based on zirconocene complex . these polymerization seemed to proceed to a nonquantitative yield , producing polymer with high molecular weight and relatively low polydispersities . this behavior indicated the presence of termination reaction in the initiation step , which appeared to be faster than the propagation step . block copolymer of these acrylate with MMA were synthesized with the catalytic system rac-Et(Ind)2ZrMe2 / [ B(C6F 5)4]-[Me2NHPh]+ / ZnEt <nUm> , starting from the polymerization of MMA . the block copolymer produced were well defined in most case , a indicated by size exclusion chromatography , NMR , and differential scanning calorimetry measurement . an investigation of the polymer particle growth characteristic and polymer molecular weight and composition distribution in ethylene homopolymerization and ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization ha been carried out with a catalyst comprising a zirconocene and methylaluminoxane immobilized on a silica support . the presence of 1-hexene lead to higher productivity and easier fragmentation of the support during particle growth . crystallization analysis fractionation and gel permeation chromatography analysis of ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer prepared at different polymerization time reveals a broadening of the chemical composition distribution with increasing polymerization time a a result of the gradual formation of a relatively high-molecular-weight , ethylene-rich fraction . the result are indicative of significant monomer diffusion effect in both homopolymerization and copolymerization . the formulation of the 4-butenyl end group in zirconocene with catalyzed propulene polymerization , wa analyzed . the olefin polymerization with metallocene catalyst ha attracted much academic and industrial research interest . the analysis of polymer chain end provides key structural information for the determination of the chain transfer mechanism in olefin polymerization . the catalyst solution wa prepared in an inert atmosphere adding <nUm> mmol of RhCl(PPh <nUm> ) <nUm> in <nUm> ml of dry toluene . the evaluation of the intensity of unsaturated group show the percentage of 4-butenyl increase with respect to 2-butenyl in the treatment of the polymer with the hydride complex derived from RhCl(PPh <nUm> ) <nUm> . the result show that the mechanism of the formation of 4-butenyl chain end may be the isomerization of ci 2-butenyl catalyzed by a zirconocene hydride complex formed in situ during polymerization . C1 - symmetric diastereoisomers of a zirconocene dichloride , SiMe2(3-benzylindenyl)(indenyl)ZrCl2 , known a catalyst precursor used to produce polypropy - lenes with similar molecular weight and tacticities , have been investigated in ethylene polymerization . activated by methylaluminoxane , they produce microstructurally different polymer : high - density polyethylene and linear low - density polyethylene , the latter characterized by the presence of ethyl branch . the formation of branch is relevant in the complex having a sterically more crowded ( inward ) site . A comparison with the complex without substituents , meso-SiMe2(indenyl) 2ZrCl2 , show that the presence of a benzyl group on only one of the two indenyl moiety can regulate the number of branch and the molecular weight of the macromolecule . actually , the unsubstituted complex is able to give double the number of branch and lower molecular weight , whereas the ci - symmetric disubstituted complex previously reported generally give linear polyethylene . the impact of propylene prepolymerization on ethylene / 1-hexene and ehylene / 1-octene copolymerization study carried out with a catalyst comprising a zirconocene and MAO immobilized on a silica support were analyzed . the copolymerization of sample , following the prepolymerization , wa carried out by the charging of the desired amount of the comonomer to the reactor , along with n-heptane and an ethylene pressure applied . the catalyst used wa prepared by the impregnation of a silica support with a mixture of MAO and rac - et / ( ind ) 2ZrCl2 . result show that the application of a propylene prepolymerization wa significantly increased in the subsequent ethylene polymerization . also , the prepolymerization of a silica - supported metallocene catalyst with propylene before ethylene / 1-hexene or ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization can lead to a narrowing of the CCD in the resulting copolymer . the copolymerization of propylene and disubstituted diallylsilanes [ ( CH2 = CH-CH2-)2R2Si ( r = CH <nUm> or C6H5 ) ] wa investigated with isoselective and syndioselective zirconocene catalyst with methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . the syndioselective catalyst showed a higher reactivity for disubstituted diallylsilanes than the isoselective catalyst . diallyldimethylsilane wa incorporated into the polymer chain via cyclization insertion preferentially and formed 3,5-disubstituted dimethylsilacyclohexane unit in the polypropylene main chain . In the copolymerization with diallyldiphenylsilane , diallyldiphenylsilane wa copolymerized via both cyclization insertion and 1,2-insertion , which formed a pendant allyl group . the structure of isolated silacyclohexane unit , determined by 13C NMR and distortionless enhancement by polarization transfer spectroscopy , proved that the 1,2-insertion of diallylsilanes proceeded with enantiomorphic site control ; however , the diastereoselectivity of the cyclization reaction wa independent of the stereoselectivity of the catalyst used , and cis-silacyclohexane unit were mainly formed . vinylcyclohexane ( VCH ) wa copolymerized with ethene and propene using methylaluminoxane - activated metallocene catalyst . the catalyst precursor for the ethene copolymerization wa rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)ZrCl2 ( 1 ) . propene copolymerizations were further studied with Cs - symmetric isopropylidene(cyclopentadienyl)(fluorenyl)ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , C 1-symmetric ethylene(l-indenyl-2-phenyl-2-fluorenyl)ZrCl2 ( 3 ) , and " meso " -dimethylsilyl[3-benzylindenyl)(2-methylbenz[e]indenyl) ]ZrCl2 ( 4 ) . catalyst <nUm> produced a random ethene - VCH copolymer with very high activity and moderate VCH incorporation . the highest comonomer content in the copolymer wa <nUm> mol % . catalyst <nUm> and <nUm> produced poly(propene-co- vinylcyclohexane ) with moderate to good activity [ up to <nUm> and <nUm> kg of polymer / ( mol of catalyst × h ) for <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ] under similar reaction condition but with fairly low comonomer content ( up to <nUm> and <nUm> % for <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) . catalyst <nUm> and <nUm> , both bearing a fluorenyl moiety , gave propene - VCH copolymer with only negligible amount of the comonomer . the homopolymerization of VCH wa performed with <nUm> a a reference , and low-molar-mass isotactic polyvinylcyclohexane with a low activity wa obtained . the ring - opening polymerization of e-caprolactone ( e-CL ) and d-valerolactone ( d-VL ) using nine catalytic system consisting of a combination of three C2V zirconocene complex and three borate cocatalysts is discussed . the polymerization proceed in a well - controlled manner , producing polymer with relatively high molecular weight and narrow molecular weight distribution . kinetic experiment of the polymerization of e-CL with the catalytic system Cp2ZrMe2 / B(C 6F5)3 ( 1 ) showed a linear dependence between polymerization yield and molecular weight with time , a well a between the molecular weight with the molar ratio of the monomer over the catalyst [e-CL] / [Zr] , indicating sufficient control of the polymerization reaction . the catalytic system ( 1 ) wa utilized for the synthesis of well - defined block copolymer of MMA with e-CL and d-VL . all sample were characterized by size exclusion chroma - tography , nuclear magnetic resonance , and differential scanning calorimetry . mesoporous alumina with average pore size of <nUm> - <nUm> nm were prepared by anodization of an aluminum film ( AAO ) , and by a sol - gel templating method ( TPL ) . In addition to a commercial alumina and sulfated TPL , the alumina were used a support for cyclopentadienyl zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl <nUm> ) and trimethyl(e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium ( Cp*ZrMe3 ) and tested in the polymerization of ethylene . the metallocenes supported on the alumina prepared with the templating method and it sulfated modification exhibited polymerization activity of <nUm> and <nUm> kgPE / ( molZr × h × bar ) , respectively , comparable to that obtained with silica - supported metallocenes ( <nUm> kg PE / ( molZr × h × bar ) ) . the acid site distribution of the alumina wa studied with FTIR and temperature programmed desorption ( TPD ) of pyridine , and also the amount of medium and strong acid site wa determined gravimetrically from the adsorption of pyridine . relative to the surface area , AAO with the highest amount of acid site ( <nUm> mmolPY / mAAO2 ) adsorbed cp 2ZrCl2 and Cp*ZrMe3 the most . study of the polymer ' morphology with a scanning electron microscope revealed polyethylene nanofibers in all the polymer sample , also in those obtained from the reference polymerization with homogeneous Cp2ZrCl2 and Cp*ZrMe3 . this finding suggests that a catalyst support with a tubular pore structure is not a prerequisite for the formation of polymer nanofibers . poly(propylene-ran-1,3-butadiene) wa synthesized using isospecific zirconocene catalyst and converted to telechelic isotactic polypropylene by metathesis degradation with ethylene . the copolymer obtained with isospecific C2 - symmetric zirconocene catalyst activated with modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) had 1,4-inserted butadiene unit ( 1,4-BD ) and 1,2-inserted unit ( 1,2-BD ) in the isotactic polypropylene chain . the selectivity of butadiene towards 1,4-BD incorporation wa high up to <nUm> % using rac-dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( Cat-A ) / MMAO . the molar ratio of propylene to butadiene in the feed regulated the numberaverage molecular weight ( Mn ) and the butadiene content of the polymer produced . metathesis degradation of the copolymer with ethylene were conducted with a CI6W / SnMe4 / propyl acetate catalyst system . the 1H NMR spectrum before and after the degradation indicated that the polymer degraded by ethylene had vinyl group at both chain end in high selectivity . the analysis of the chain scission product clarified the chain end structure of the poly(propylene-ran-1,3-butadiene) . the influence of ligand structure on copolymerization property of metallocene catalyst wa elucidated with three C1 - symmetric methylalumoxane ( MAO ) activated zirconocene dichloride , ethylene(1-(7 , 9)-diphenylcyclopenta-[a]-acenaphthadienyl-2-phenyl-2-cyclopentadienyl)ZrCl <nUm> ( 1 ) , ethylene(1-(7 , 9)-diphenylcyclopenta[a]-acenaphthadienyl-2- phenyl-2-fluorenyl)ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , and ethylene(1-(9)-fluorenyl-(R)1- phenyl-2-(1-indenyl)ZrCl2 ( 3 ) . polyethenes produced with <nUm> / MAO had considerable , ca. <nUm> % amount of trans-vinylene end group , resulting from the chain end isomerization prior to the chain termination . when ethene wa copolymerized with 1-hexene or 1-hexadecene using <nUm> / MAO , molar mass of the copolymer varied from high to moderate ( 531-116 kg / mol ) depending on the comonomer feed . At <nUm> % comonomer feed , ethene / 1-olefin copolymer with high hexene or hexadecene content ( around <nUm> % ) were achievable . In the series of catalyst , polyethenes with highest molar mass , up to <nUm> kg / mol , were obtained with sterically most crowded <nUm> / MAO , but the catalyst wa only moderately active to copolymerize higher olefin . catalyst <nUm> / MAO produced polyethenes with extremely small amount of trans-vinylene end group and relatively low molar mass 1-hexene copolymer ( from <nUm> to <nUm> kg / mol ) with similar comonomer content a <nUm> . these result indicate that the catalyst structure , which favor chain end isomerization , is also capable to produce high molar mass 1-olefin copolymer with high comonomer content . In addition , an exceptionally strong synergetic effect of the comonomer on the polymerization activity wa observed with catalyst <nUm> / MAO . C2 - symmetric group <nUm> metallocenes based catalyst ( rac - [ CH 2(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 ( 1 ) , rac-[CH2(1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 ( 2 ) and rac - [ CH 2(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]TiCl2 ( 3 ) ) are able to copolymerize styrene and 1,3-butadiene , to give product with high molecular weight . In agreement with symmetry property of metallocene precatalysts , styrene homosequences are in isotactic arrangement . full determination of microstructure of copolymer wa obtained by 13C NMR and FTIR analysis and it reveals that insertion of butadiene on styrene chain - end happens prevailingly with 1,4-trans configuration . In the butadiene homosequences , using zirconocene - based catalyst , the 1,4-trans arrangement is favored over 1,4-cis , but the latter is prevailing in the presence of titanocene ( 3 ) . diad composition analysis of the copolymer make possible to estimate the reactivity ratio of copolymerization : zirconocenes ( 1 ) and ( 2 ) produced copolymer having r1 × r2 = <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ( where <nUm> refers to styrene and <nUm> to butadiene ) ; while titanocene ( 3 ) gave tendencially blocky styrene-butadiene copolymer ( r1 × r2 = <nUm> ) . the copolymer do not exhibit crystallinity , even when they contain a high molar fraction of styrene . probably , comonomer homosequences are too short to crystallize ( n <nUm> , in the copolymer at highest styrene molar fraction ) . we inclusively investigated polymerization behavior and structure of co-polymer in the copolymerization of propylene and alkylaluminum - protected polar allyl monomer . the control of the arrangement of polar group in the copolymer wa discussed . it wa proved that the location of polar group could be controlled by zirconocene catalyst and a kind of polar monomer . the indenyl or the 2-methylindenyl ligand of zirconocene were favored to produce end - functionalized polymer . it wa also found that the trimethylaluminum- protected allylamine and triisobutylaluminum - protected allylmercaptan had superior ability in the synthesis of end - functionalized polypropylene . on the other hand , the 2-methyl-4-phenylindenyl ligand produced the copolymer containing both the end - polar unit and inner - polar unit at the polymer chain . terpolymerization of propylene , polar allyl monomer , and 5-hexen-1-ol wa also conducted . the NMR study of the terpolymer revealed that both the 5-hexen-1-ol and the polar allyl monomer were incorporated into the polymer chain . it ha also become apparent that the polar allyl monomer unit predominantly occupied the chain end , while the 5-hexen-1-ol unit were located at the inner of main chain . consequently , we have achieved the synthesis of functionalized polypropylene in which the arrangement of polar group wa precisely controlled . highly filled polyethylene (PE)-based nanocomposites were obtained by in situ polymerization technique . an organically modified montmorillonite , cloisite ® <nUm> A ( C15A ) , wa previously treated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) to form a supported cocatalyst ( C15A / MA0 ) before being contacted with a zirconocene catalyst . the main feature of C15A / MA0 intermediate were studied by elemental analysis , TGA , TGA - FTIR , WAXD , and TEM . MAO reacts with the clay , replaces most of the organic surfactant within the clay gallery and destroys the typical crystrallographic order of the nanoclay . the catalytic activity in the presence of C15A / MAO is higher than in ethylene polymerization without any inorganic filler and increase with MAO supportation time . this indicates that part of the polymer chain grows within the clay gallery , separate them , and make it possible to tune the final morphology of the composite . the polymerization result and the influence of C15A pretreatment and polymerization condition on thermal and morphological property of the hybrid PE / C15A nanocomposites are presented . the copolymerization of ethylene ( e ) and norbornene ( NB ) wa investigated using the commercially available and inexpensive catalyst system , cyclopentadienylzirconium trichloride (CpZrCl3)Zisobutyl-modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) , at a moderate polymerization temperature in toluene . for the CpZrCl3 catalyst system activated by aluminoxane with a <nUm> mol % methyl group and a <nUm> mol % isobutyl group ( MMAO ) , the quantity of the charged NB and the polymerization temperature significantly affected the molecular weight , polydispersities , and NB content of the obtained copolymer and the copolymerization activity in all the experiment . As the charged NB increased and thereby the NB / e molar ratio increased , the NB content in the copolymer increased and reached a maximum value of <nUm> mol % . the CpZrCl <nUm> / MMAO ( [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> ) catalyst system with the [NB] of <nUm> mol L-1 and ethylene of <nUm> MPa at <nUm> ° C showed the highest activity of <nUm> kg molZr.-1 h-1 and molecular weight of <nUm> g mol-1 . the 13C NMR analysis showed that the CpZrCl3 / MMAO catalyst system produced the E-NB random copolymer with a number of NB homosequences such a the NN dyad and NNN triad . copolymerizations of ethylene or propylene and allyl monomer containing 9-fluorenyl group , diallyl-di-9-fluorenylsilane ( DAFS ) , 9,9-diallylfluorene ( DAF ) , and 9-allylfluorene ( AF ) , were investigated with various zirconocene catalyst using methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . the bridged zirconocene catalyst , especially a syndioselective catalyst , showed a higher reactivity for all the comonomers than the nonbridged catalyst . DAFS wa mainly incorporated into the polymer chain via cyclization insertion , whereas DAF wa copolymerized via both 1,2-and cyclization insertion . cyclization selectivity , ratio of cyclized insertion unit , of DAF in the copolymerization with propylene wa higher than that in the copolymerization with ethylene . copolymerization with AF yielded low - molecular weight copolymer because of frequent chain transfer reaction . optical property of the propylene based - copolymer were investigated by UV - vi and photoluminescence spectroscopy , and absorption - and emission - derived from fluorenyl group were detected in the copolymer . monodisperse cyano-functionalized porous polymeric bead were synthesized by seeded polymerization ; these microparticles were further used a support for zirconocene catalyst , which performed a a solid homogeneous catalyst in ethylene polymerization . copolymerization of ethylene and diallyl-bis(pyren-1-yl)-silane ( APyS ) wa investigated with zirconocene catalyst , rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) and diphenylmethylene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) , using methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . APyS wa copolymerized via both 1,2-insertion and cyclization insertion , and cyclization selectivity , ratio of cyclized insertion unit , of APyS in the copolymer obtained with catalyst <nUm> wa higher than that obtained with catalyst <nUm> . catalyst <nUm> showed a higher reactivity for APyS than catalyst <nUm> . photophysical property of the copolymer were investigated by UV - vi and photoluminescence ( PL ) spectroscopy , and absorption and fluorescence derived from pyrenyl group were detected in the copolymer . chloroform solution of the copolymer showed emission derived from both monomer and eximer of pyrenyl unit . only the emission derived from eximer of pyrenyl unit wa observed in the cast film . the polarized PL spectrum of an oriented film showed anisotropy , and the polarization excitation parallel to the drawing direction showed high fluorescence intensity . the electron ionization mass spectrometric behaviour of a new series of hafnocene and zirconocene diadamantanolates is discussed . they are also compared on the basis of mass-analyzed ion kinetic energy spectrometry . fragmentation pattern of the complex in question give relevant information on their gas-phase behaviour a MO2 / MC ( m = Zr , Hf ) precursor for metal-organic chemical vapour deposition . two supported metallocene catalyst ( CS : PQ <nUm> / MAO / cp 2ZrCl <nUm> and CS <nUm> : PQ 3030-BuGeCl <nUm> / MAO / cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ) were prepared by sequentially loading MAO and cp 2ZrCl <nUm> on partially dehydroxylated silica PQ <nUm> . In catalyst CS <nUm> , nBuGeCl <nUm> wa used to functionalize the silica . these catalyst were characterized by DR - FTIR spectroscopy , CPMAS NMR spectroscopy , and XPS . their catalytic performance wa evaluated by polymerizing ethylene using the MAO cocatalyst and characterizing the resulting polymer by GPC . both catalyst produced two metallocenium cation ( cation <nUm> : [ cp 2ZrCl ] + and cation <nUm> : [ cp 2ZrMe ] + ) with comparable equilibrium concentration and showed varying solid - state electronic environment . the modified support ( PQ <nUm> / MAO and PQ 3030-BuGeCl <nUm> / MAO ) acted a weakly coordinating polyanions and stabilized the above cation . BuGeCl <nUm> did not affect the solid - state electronic environment . however , it increased the surface cocatalyst to catalyst molar ratio ( Al : Zr ) , acted a a spacer , increased catalyst activity , and enhanced chain - transfer reaction . the separately fed MAO cocatalyst shifted the equilibrium between cation <nUm> and cation <nUm> toward the right . consequently , more cation <nUm> wa generated , which acted a the effective and active single - site catalytic specie producing monomodal PDI . imidozirconocene complex ( Cp2Zr = NR(THF) ) posse a rich reaction chemistry , in contrast to many imido complex of later transition metal . the synthesis and structural characteristic of these compound are briefly described , along with a qualitative molecular orbital description of the metallocene - imido interaction . imidozirconocene complex react at the Zr = N linkage with a variety of X-H bond , and undergo overall [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition reaction with a wide range of unsaturated organic and organometallic compound . result of study detailing the scope and mechanism of these reaction are presented herein , along with application to catalytic hydroamination , imine metathesis , and asymmetric transformation . radical reaction mediated by schwartz reagent and zirconocene(alkene) complex are firstly described . schwartz reagent is a promising alternative to tributyltin hydride and the first transition metal hydrido complex used a a radical mediator in organic synthesis . A zirconocene ( alkene ) complex effect single electron transfer to alkyl halide to generate the corresponding alkyl radical . secondly , serendipitous allylic C - H bond activation of the coordinating alkene of zirconocene(alkene) complex and it application to organic synthesis are summarized . by utilizing equilibrium between zirconocene(alkene) and zirconocene 2-alkenyl hydride , reaction of acid chloride with zirconocene(alkene) provides the corresponding homoallylic alcohol by sequential attack of the hydride and 2-alkenyl moiety . A set of hydride and 2-alkenyl attack on 1,4-diketone yield 6-heptene-1,4-diol derivative in high yield with high stereoselectivity . selective capture of the hydride with diisopropyl ketone give zirconocene 2-alkenyl alkoxide , which is a useful reagent for stereoselective allylation of aldehyde and imine . a-Halo carbonyl compound undergo radical allylation with the zirconocene 2-alkenyl alkoxide which serf a a substitute for allyltin . metal content in supported zirconocene catalyst were comparatively determined by x-ray fluorescence spectroscopy and rutherford backscattering spectrometry . A series of supported zirconocenes wa prepared by grafting sequentially Cp2ZrCl2 ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ) and (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 on to silica . the addition order and molar ratio of the two catalyst were varied . the grafted metal content wa shown to be coherent between the two technique and wa between <nUm> and <nUm> wt % Zr / O2Si . the steric effect played by the ligand influence the final zirconocene grafted content . No influence of the grafting order wa observed . nevertheless , catalyst system in which (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 wa either immobilized in the first place or at a higher molar ratio were shown to be more active in ethylene polymerization . extended x-ray absorption fine structure analysis in the Zr - edge showed that system bearing cp 2ZrCl2 and (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio afforded a more disoriented system . according to electron probe microanalysis , the metal distribution in the catalyst particle wa more uniform than that resulting from the immobilization of solely ( nBuCp ) 2ZrCl2 on silica . Cp2ZrCl2 setzt sich mit Li(THF)2PHCy ( cy = C6H11 ) zu der metallacyclischen verbindung cp2 <nUm> , um . im 31P{1H}-NMR-Spektrum von <nUm> , tritt da fur ein A2X-System zu erwartende aufspaltungsmuster auf , wa auf da vorliegen der meso-Formen in losung hinweist . auch im festkorper liegen nur die meso-Formen vor . <nUm> , kristallisiert monoklin in der raumgruppe P21 / n ( nr . <nUm> ) mit a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 und vier formeleinheiten pro elementarzelle ( <nUm> unabhangige beobachtete reflexe , r = <nUm> % ) . der zentrale ZrP3-Ring in <nUm> , ist angenahert planar . die ZrP-Bindungslangen sind mit <nUm> und <nUm> Å fast gleich . da unsymmetrisch substituierte zirconocendichlorid entsteht au (Trimethylsilyl-cyclopentadienyl)lithium und 1,3-[Bis(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl]lithium mit Cl4Zr · <nUm> THF . die molekulstruktur wurde ermittelt ( P21 / a ; a = <nUm> <nUm> , b = <nUm> <nUm> , c = <nUm> <nUm> pm , β = <nUm> ° ) , auffallend sind kurze ZrCl-Abstande . Es wird uber die synthese und die NMR-spektroskopische charakterisierung von zirconocendibenzylen mit substituierten cyclopentadienylringen und den einfluss der substituenten auf die bindungen zwischen dem zirconiumatom und den benzylgruppen berichtet . die molekulstruktur von (Me3SiC5H4)2Zr(CH2C6H5)2 wird mitgeteilt und diskutiert . bei reaktionen substituierter zirconocendichloride , Cp2ZrCl2 , mit vinyllithium entstehen in abhangigkeit von der anzahl und der raumerfullung der substituenten zirconacyclopent-2-ene , cp2 ( formula presented . ) H , oder Zirconocen-butadien-Komplexe , Cp2Zr(C4H6) . diese verbindungen wurden durch ihre 1H- und 13C-NMR-Spektren charakterisiert . die werte der 91Zr-NMR-chemischen verschiebungen der substituierten Cp'2ZrCl2 stehen in beziehung zu den jeweiligen bindungswinkeln Cp'ZrCp' bzw . ClZrCl und sind damit al empirische parameter fur die abschatzung de reaktionsverhaltens von zirconocendichloriden geeignet . die substitution de THF-Liganden in Cp2Zr(THF)(Me3SiCCSiMe3) ( 1 ) durch pyridin ergibt den komplex Cp2Zr(e1-NC5H5)(Me3SiCCSiMe3) ( 3 ) . im gegensatz zu <nUm> ist komplex <nUm> stabil in kohlenwasserstoffen . In temperaturabhangigen 1H- und 13C-NMR-Spektren zeigt <nUm> in losung dynamisches verhalten durch eine rotation de Alkin-Liganden . zusatzlich tritt beim losen von <nUm> in pyridin ein austausch zwischen koordinierten und freien Pyridin-Molekulen auf . die kristallstrukturanalyse von <nUm> belegt eine tetraedrische koordinationsgeometrie am Zirkonium-Zentrum bestehend au den cp- , alkin- und Pyridin-Liganden . der komplex <nUm> reagiert wie verbindung <nUm> mit wasser und kohlendioxid zu gleichen produkten . pyridinverbruckte metallocendichloride de typs C5H3N-2,6-(CH2C5H4)2MCl2 ( m = Zr ( 2 ) , Hf ( 5 ) ) wurden synthetisiert . aufgrund einer N → Zr-Wechselwirkung wird die bildung von Zirconocen-Kationen begunstigt . so entsteht bei der einwirkung von feuchtigkeit auf <nUm> die ionisch aufgebaute verbindung [C5H3N-2,6-(CH2C5H4)2Zr(Cl)(OH2)]2[ZrCl6] <nUm> . die verbindungen wurden 1H-NMR und MS-spektroskopisch charakterisiert . die kristallstruktur von <nUm> lasst eine verknupfung der kationen und anionen uber H-Bruckenbindungen erkennen . die reaktion von (Z)Cp2Zr{C(Ph) = C(H)P(SiMe3)2}(Cl) mit lithiumphenylacetylid liefert den Zirkonocen-Alkinyl-Alkenyl-Komplex (Z)Cp2Zr(CCPh){C(Ph) = C(H)P(SiMe3)2 } ( 1 ) . <nUm> wurde spektroskopisch ( IR , NMR , MS ) und rontgenstrukturanalytisch charakterisiert . die verbindung kristallisiert triklin in der raumgruppe P1 mit a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> , β = <nUm> , γ = <nUm> ° . <nUm> weist zwei unterschiedliche ZrC-Bindungslangen auf ( ZrC( = C ) ) <nUm> , ZrC(C) <nUm> Å ) . im festkorper wird eine ZrP-Wechselwirkung beobachtet ( ZrP <nUm> Å ) . the zirconocene bisphosphanido complex [ (e-C5H4R)2Zr{PH(2,4,6-iPr 3C6H2)}2 ] ( r = me , H ) react with [(NBD)M(CO)4] ( NBD = norbornadiene , m = Cr , Mo ) to give only one diastereomer of the phosphanido-bridged heterobimetallic dinuclear complex cis-rac-[(e-C5H4R)2Zr{m-PH(2,4,6- iPr3C6H2)}2M(CO) <nUm> ] [ r = me , m = Cr ( 1 ) , Mo ( 2 ) ; No reaction wa observed at room temperature for <nUm> and CS2 , BF4NO . NMR ; IR ; MS ) and compound <nUm> also by crystal structure determination . the bis- and tris-alkoxyphosphane - substituted complex 11-14 and <nUm> were obtained a mixture of two diastereomers which could not be separated . the enantiomeric pure TADDOLate complex of the heavier group <nUm> metal [(e5-C5H5)2M{(S,S)-TADDOLate}] ( m = Zr , Hf ) were prepared by treatment of (S,S)-TADDOL with <nUm> equivalent of n-butyl lithium followed by reaction with zirconocene and hafnocene dichloride , respectively . the new complex have been characterized by standard analytical / spectroscopic technique and the solid - state structure of both compound were established by single crystal x-ray diffraction . the title compound are the first fully characterized TADDOLate complex of zirconium and hafnium . the effect of the structure and surface property of support material on metallocene ( zirconocene chloride ) adsorption and catalyst activity in ethene polymerization wa studied . commercial grace silica , mesoporous silicate , MCM-41 , and aluminium - modified MCM-41 were used a support . the highest amount of zirconocene dichloride wa adsorbed on Al - modified MCM-41 ( Si / Al = <nUm> ) , providing the most reactive site for attachment of the active component on the support surface . the 13C-CPMAS NMR study proved that Cp2ZrCl2 is bound to the support surface . also the highest activity in ethene polymerization wa obtained using this support . we studied a ZSM-5 zeolite a metallocene support for ethylene polymerization . we transformed the Na-ZSM-5 into H-ZSM-5 . after the cation exchange , the zeolite wa calcined at three different temperature . characterization of the material indicated that by mean of the calcination procedure it is possible to produce dealuminization with an increase in extraframework aluminum ( EFAL ) . we prepared zirconocene - supported catalyst on zeolitic support using two preparation method . the higher activity wa observed with the zirconocene supported on ZSM-5 pre-treated at <nUm> ° C . we think that the dealuminization process generates an increase in EFAL . this EFAL is responsible for the higher activity . the concept of the frustrated lewis pair ( FLP ) offer a valuable paradigm for transition metal complex . this chapter describes recent development in FLP chemistry where one or both of the lewis acidic or lewis basic component are based on a transition metal . At the forefront of these development have been zirconocene - phosphinoaryloxide complex ; the activation of small molecule , including H , CO2 , ether , olefin and alkyl chloride or fluoride , with such zirconocene ( or group <nUm> metallocene in general ) phosphine pair is described . nascent catalytic application for such complex in dehydrogenation reaction and future possibility for catalytic reactivity are also highlighted . A wider discussion of how the FLP concept may rationalise previous example of cooperative reactivity in transition metal complex , such a the heterolytic cleavage of hydrogen , suggests a strong and useful analogy . the development of ansa - metallocene catalyst is considered along several line of interest-ansa-metallocene complex with different ligand framework , insight gained with regard to relevant reaction intermediate and contribution of ansa - metallocene catalyst to industrial polymer production - with a view toward the present state of the art in these field of catalysis research . spontaneously formed fiber are formed from a number of metal - containing polymer when synthesized employing the interfacial polymerization system . this topic is reviewed with emphasis on group IVB and organotin - containing polymer . over <nUm> organotin polymer were surveyed for fiber formation . it is believed that fiber formation is favored when the backbone is rigid . the fiber have aspect ratio over <nUm> . their use a fiber in composite is encouraged . twentytwo new substituted metallocene Cp1Cp2MCl2 ( m = Ti , Zr or Hf ) dichloride have been prepared and the catalytic activity of some of them in alkene polymerization ha been primarily evaluated . the cp < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ClZr < inf > <nUm> < / inf > / C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > AlCl < inf > <nUm> < / inf > system ( cp = p-cyclopentadienyl ) wa found to be an active catalyst for polymerization of alkyne . both internal and terminal alkyne were polymerized by this homogeneous catalytic system . spectroscopic observation of a zirconacyclopentadiene compound in the above reaction led to the investigation of zirconacyclopentadienes a possible reaction intermediate . the zirconacyclopentadiene on reaction with phenylacetylene produced larger zirconacycles and poly-(phenylacetylene) . apparently , the mechanism of polymerization of alkyne is by successive insertion of the alkyne into the zirconium-carbon bond , producing expanded zirconacycles , elimination of which result in the formation of a polyalkyne . propene wa polymerized with ethylene bis(-1-indenyl)-dichlorozirconium ( Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) and methylalumoxane ( MAO ) at <nUm> ° C . the polymer wa fractionated by solvent extraction ; there wa no hexane insoluble material . the pentane insoluble , hexane soluble ( C5iC6s ) fraction . polymerization of ethylene and copolymerization of ethylene-propylene proceeded smoothly by using homometallic binuclear zirconium complex <nUm> or heterometallic binuclear zirconium - titanium complex <nUm> / methylaluminoxane catalyst system . the molecular weight distribution of polymer obtained by the binuclear zirconium complex were broader than that produced by mononuclear zirconium complex . the catalytic performance ( activity and polymer property ) of metallocenes with different symmetry in combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) in the polymerization of propylene ha been investigated at different temperature , under standardized reaction condition . the zirconocene rac-ethylene ( e5-1-indenyl ) zirconium ( IV ) dichloride , with C2 symmetry , produce isotatic polypropylene and isopropylidene(e5-cyclopentadienyl ( e5-9-fluorenyl ) zirconium ( IV ) dichloride , with CS symmetry , syndiotactic polypropylene . the degree of the tacticity of these polymer increase with decreasing polymerization temperature . only atactic polypropylene wa formed with the unbridged zirconocenes bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) zirconium ( IV ) dichloride and bis(e5-indenyl zirconium ( IV ) dichloride at any temperature investigated ( 10-60 ° C ) . the comparison of the copolymer obtained with the Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO and Cp2HfCl2 / MAO catalyst system showed that the catalyst having hafnocene wa much more reactive towards 1-octadecene than zirconocene . the comonomer concentration had to be three time higher in the zirconocene copolymerization than in the hafnocene copolymerization when the level of <nUm> mol- % wa reached . although the hafnocene catalyst wa more reactive towards 1-octadecene , the molecular weight were higher than in the copolymer obtained with the zirconocene catalyst . the total activity of the zirconocene wa <nUm> time higher than with the hafnocene catalyst . with the zirconocene catalyst the activity towards ethylene wa constantly increasing by increasing the comonomer concentration but stayed nearly constant with the hafnocene catalyst . it seemed that there is no rate enhancement effect upon comonomer addition with the hafnocene catalyst . three ethylene-bridged unsymmetric zirconocene dichloride bearing a cyclopentadienyl unit together with either a tetraphenylcyclopentadienyl- ( 8 ) , a 7,9-diphenylcyclopent[a]-acenaphtha-dienyl-(9) or a fluorenyl group ( 10 ) were used for propene polymerization after activation with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) at <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> ° C . whereas <nUm> is inactive at all , <nUm> produce atactic polypropene wax with high activity . the polypropene product of <nUm> are syndiotactic with stereoregularities depending on the polymerization rac-Et(Ind)2ZrMe2 or rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrMe2 / Ph3CB(C6F5)4 a catalyst , which resulted in highly isotactic poly(propylene) with [mmmm] > <nUm> % , Tm = 160-161 ° C and very few 1,3- or <nUm> regioirregular unit . with the use of an achiral zirconocene Cp2ZrMe2 , a polymer with Tm = <nUm> ° C wa resulted a well . base on these experimental fact that the zirconocene can form a C1 - symmetrical complex with a lewis base . the norbornene / ethene copolymerization wa investigated by using two CS - symmetric ( [Me2C(Fluo)(Cp)]ZrCl2III , [Ph2C(Fluo)(Cp)]ZrCl2IB ) and two C2 - catalyst activity , but also considers the material property of the synthesized copolymer . it wa found , that the CS - symimetric catalyst are very well suitable to yield amorphous copolymer with glass transition temperature above <nUm> ° C and molecular weight > <nUm> g / mol . these copolymer could be used a potential starting material for optical disc and fiber . the antitumor activity of the metallocene dichloride TDC , ZDC , and HDC against ehrlich ascites tumor in CF <nUm> mouse is investigated . A single i.p. injection of TDC in the optimum dose ( 30-60 mg / kg ) <nUm> h p.t.t . achieves survival of 80-90 % of the animal until day <nUm> p.t.t . without any tumor manifestation . this indicates an increase in the mean survival time of about <nUm> % referred to the untreated animal . In contrast , ZDC and HDC exhibit no recognizable antineoplastic property under equal experimental condition . assuming a similar mechanism of tumor inhibition for both DDP and the antineoplastic active metallocene dichloride TDC , VDC , and MDC , the comparatively increased non-bonding Cl ... Cl distance ( " bite " ) of ZDC and HDC may be responsible for the cancerostatic inactivity of the latter compound . the in vitro growth - inhibiting potency of titanocene dichloride ( TDC ) , zirconocene dichloride ( ZDC ) , hafnocene dichloride ( HDC ) , vanadocene dichloride ( VDC ) , and molybdocene dichloride ( MDC ) against ehrlich ascites tumor ( EAT ) cell cultured in vitro a permanently growing suspension culture were determined . the most striking growth - suppression activity wa detected for VDC . A VDC concentration a low a <nUm> · <nUm> < sup > <nUm> < / sup > mol / l effect a highly significant diminution of cell proliferation .
