TDC and MDC inhibit cellular growth only in concentration of <nUm> · <nUm> < sup > <nUm> < / sup > or <nUm> < sup > <nUm> < / sup > mol / l , respectively , whereas ZDC and HDC , which are ineffective against EAT cell in vivo , require higher concentration level . the growth inhibition is caused by a cytotoxic action of the metallocene dichloride , a is demonstrated in the case of VDC and TDC by differentiation of live and dead EAT cell by mean of the dye lissamine green . by reaction of the [1]zirconocenophane(CH)3)2Si(C5H4)2ZrCl2 with equivalent amount of Li Et3BH and sulfur , C12H14S5SiZr can be prepared a chelate complex . the structure of this S5Zr chelate is discussed on the basis of its1H NMR spectrum . <nUm> . the thermal and photoinduced reaction of Cp2MMMe2 ( m = Ti , Zr ) with Et3EH ( e = Ge , Sn ) produce <nUm> mole of Et6E2 , <nUm> mole of methane , and <nUm> mole of Cp2M . compound with the general formula Cp2M(EEt3)2 could not be obtained . <nUm> . the exchange reaction of Cp2MCl2 ( m = Ti , Zr ) with Et3ELi ( e = Ge , Sn ) in THF or toluene at <nUm> ° C result in the formation of compound with the general formula Cp2M(EEt3)2 , which decompose at <nUm> ° C , yielding <nUm> mole of Et6E2 and an adduct of the biscyclopentadienyl derivative of the metal with THF . A new class of polyhedral oligosilsesquioxane ( POSS ) copolymer ha been developed by incorporating into a polymer backbone the POSS disilanol macromer , (c-C6H11)8Si8O11(OH)2 , along with a variety of inorganic comonomers . these new inorganic cluster - based copolymer were synthesized using a condensation polymerization approach , with formation of metal oxygen bond and climination of ClH ( a HNEt3 Cl ) or CH4 driving the reaction . the polymer thus formed are isolated a amorphous powder but do not display any observable glass transition ; they decompose without melting at over <nUm> C under nitrogen . especially interesting is the formation of a zirconocene - bridged copolymer which is stable to both air and methanol . zirconocene and hafnocene dihydrides Cp2MH2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) are capable of rapid absorbing carbon dioxide at room temperature and atmospheric pressure in a THF medium . In the case of Cp2ZrH2 , the reaction result in the cleavage of the C = O bond of a CO2 molecule to form cyclic trimeric zirconocene oxide [Cp2ZrO]3 , whose structure wa confirmed by analytical and spectral method a well a by x-ray diffraction study . small amount of formaldehyde and methyl formate are found in the organic product of the reaction . A mixture of rac- and meso-2,2'-propylidene-bis(e <nUm> -indenyl)zirconium dichloride wa obtained in <nUm> % yield . the compound were separated , and their structure were established by x-ray structural analysis . Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 and the MAO co-catalyst , which polymerize ethylene and propylene , were heterogenized on partially dehydroxylated davison silica <nUm> , following the method of equilibrium adsorption . the dispersion of these catalyst component on the silica support wa investigated by measuring the spatial concentration profile of Si , Al , and Zr using a micro-PIXE technique . these component were found to be uniformly distributed over the support irrespective of the variation in the heterogenization procedure and the experimental condition used . the Si : Al ratio determined by the micro- PIXE technique were similar to those measured by the spectrophotometric method . however , the Al : Zr ratio measured by the former were somewhat lower than those determined by the latter . Micro-PIXE measurement confirmed the presence of several trace impurity such a K , Ca , Ti , Fe , Ni , Cu , and Zn which may potentially poison the resulting catalyst . ansa-{e <nUm> ,e 5' -[1,1'-(1-Silacyclopent-3-ene-1,1-diyl)bis(indenyl)] } dichlorozirconium ( 1a,b ) wa synthesized . the crystal structure of meso-[(1,4-CH <nUm> CH = CHCH <nUm> )Si(C <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ] ( 1b ) wa established by x-ray diffraction analysis . photoinduced interconversion of the racemic ( 1a ) and meso form wa studied under various condition . the photostationary state ( rac : meso = <nUm> : <nUm> ) wa established rapidly when solution of ansa - zirconocene were irradiated with visible light . an efficient synthetic approach to 3-alkyl(aryl)-2-bromoindenes wa developed . the reaction of 2-bromo-3-tert-butylindene with MeMgI catalyzed by Ni(dppp)Cl <nUm> afforded 3-tert-butyl-2-methylindene from which bis(3-tert-butyl-2-methylinden-l-yl)methane and the corresponding ansa - zirconocene were synthesized . A linear correlation between the electrochemical gap value ( g = eox - ered ) and the energy of optical transition in the UV - vi region wa found and justified for a series of non-bridged and bridged bent - sandwich zirconocene complex with the general formula R(n5-L)2ZrX2 , where L = cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) , indenyl ( lnd ) , fluorenyl ( flu ) ; x = Cl , me ; the bridging group r = SiMe2 , CH2 . the first acetylene complex of hafnium , cp <nUm> Hf[Me <nUm> CaSi ≡ CHf(H)Cp <nUm> ] , wa synthesized by the reaction of hafnocene dihydride cp <nUm> HHf <nUm> with bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene in benzene . the reaction is accompanied by elimination of the me <nUm> Si group from the molecule of the initial acetylene , a a result of which the acetylenide derivative of hafnium cp <nUm> Hf(C ≡ CSiMe <nUm> )(H) act a an acetylene ligand in the complex . under analogous condition , the reaction of zirconocene dihydride cp <nUm> HZr <nUm> with bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene affords an analogous acetylene complex of zirconium cp <nUm> Zr[M <nUm> CSi ≡ CZr(H)Cp <nUm> ] . reaction of cp <nUm> HHf <nUm> with tolane and 3-hexyne proceed differently than the reaction with bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene . here the corresponding hafnacyclopentadiene metallacycles are the final product . comparative analysis of catalytic activity of substituted bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride with the general formula ( r n cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( MeCp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( Pr i cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( Pr i <nUm> cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( bu n cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( bu i cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( bu t cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , cp* <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( cp* = me <nUm> C <nUm> ) , ( me <nUm> SiCp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , ( cyclo-C <nUm> H <nUm> cp ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> , and [ ( cyclo-C <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> cp ] <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ) in ethene polymerization using polymethylalumoxane a the cocatalyst wa performed . the molecular mass characteristic of the polyethylene sample obtained were determined . A linear correlation of the specific activity of the catalyst and the turnover number with the electronic and steric characteristic of substituents at the cp ring of the complex wa established for the first time . analysis of the polymerization kinetics and the obtained correlation between the specific activity of the complex and molecular mass characteristic of the polyethylene sample suggest that alkyl substituents participate in reaction responsible for the restriction of the polymer chain growth and regeneration of the active center . these interaction most likely involve associate of AlMe <nUm> with polymethylalumoxane molecule . A DFT study of ethylene polymerization by zirconocene catalyst wa carried out . stationary point corresponding to intermediate and transition state were located on the potential energy surface of the [ cp <nUm> CZr <nUm> H <nUm> ] + + C <nUm> H <nUm> model system . three possible reaction mechanism involving the formation of b-agostic complex were considered . the energy and thermodynamic characteristic for different reaction pathway were calculated . corresponding activation energy lie in the range <nUm> - <nUm> kcal mol <nUm> . the catalytic property of the zirconium complex with " constrained geometry " Me2SiCp*NBu1ZrX2 ( cp* = C5Me4 , x = Cl ( 1a ) , me ( 1b ) ) and bridged bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconocene Me2SiCp2ZrX2 ( x = Cl ( 2a ) , me ( 2b ) ) during their activation with triisobutylaluminum / perfluorophenyl borate ( TIBA / LB(C6F5)4 , L = CPh3 ( 3 ) , Me2HNPh ( 4 ) ) in ethylene polymerization under a monomer pressure of 2-20 atm were studied by comparison . both dichloride complex exhibit moderate activity under the action of the combined TIBA / <nUm> activating agent and give linear high-molecular-weight polyethylene ( PE ) . the interaction of the dimethyl complex with TIBA / <nUm> afford active site in which the growing polymeric chain is intensely transferred to the monomer , due to which low-molecular-weight PE is formed . the dichloride complex affected by TIBA / <nUm> also afford low-molecular-weight PE . analysis of the structure of the polymeric product ( 1H NMR spectrometry , IR spectroscopy ) , molecular - weight parameter of the PE sample ( gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) ) , and kinetics of polymerization suggested that the active site contains AlBu13 a a heteronuclear bridged cationic complex . the influence of various basic substrate ( the product of chain transfer with the terminal vinyl group , the dimethylaniline fragment of borate <nUm> or other amine specially introduced into the reaction mixture ) on the catalytic property of the Zr-Al site wa revealed . the polymerization rate and molecular - weight parameter of PE a function of the reaction temperature , ethylene pressure , and modifying additive were studied . polymerization of ethylene on zirconocene catalyst wa studied with the density functional theory . the approach proposed previously for the model system cp <nUm> ZrEt + + C <nUm> H <nUm> wa extended to substituted zirconocene catalyst ( RCp ) <nUm> ZrEt + , which allowed u to compare the result of calculation with the experimentally found rate constant of chain propagation . the ethyl fragment wa demonstrated to be an adequate model for a growing polymer chain . the order of decrease in the activation energy of chain propagation calculated for compound with r = H , me , Pr n , and bu n is in qualitative agreement with the experimental data . however , the quantitative description gave underestimated theoretical rate constant of chain propagation compared to the experimental value . In the case of polyalkyl-substituted zirconocenes ( r = 1,2-Me <nUm> or me <nUm> ) , no correlation between the calculated and experimental characteristic wa observed . the result were explained using the simplest model reaction of the replacement of the MeMAO - counterion by an ethylene molecule accompanied by displacement of the former to the outer coordination sphere of the Zr atom . this step wa demonstrated to control the kinetics of the process . it wa concluded that the isolated - cation model used in early investigation is not adequate and call for modification with regard to the effect of the counterion . o-Thiatelluraphenylenezirconocene complex were obtained in good yield by reaction of dilithium o-benzenthiatelluride with zirconocene dichloride . these compound represent the first example of heterodichalcogenaphenylene bent metallocences . they were characterized by spectroscopic method and the effect on the n.m.r . result of stepwise substitution of one and two Te atom for S is discussed . x-ray crystal structure analysis wa performed for one representative complex . the structure is very similar to that previously reported for a diselenaphenylene complex , but the disorder observed for chalcogen atom prevents an accurate comparison of the geometrical parameter with other related compound . the mixture of non-conjugated dienes , 4-methyl-1,4-hexadiene and 5-methyl-1,4-hexadiene ( MHD ) , were successfully synthesized by the reaction of isoprene with ethylene using Fe (III) - based catalyst in toluene . the conversion wa over <nUm> mol % on the basis of the initial amount of isoprene used . the production yield for MHD wa nearly <nUm> mol % , the other wa polyisoprene . the mixture were successfully copolymerized with ethylene by using zirconium - based metallocenes . the product were characterized by the combination of gas chromatography , high temperature gel permeation chromatography , 1H NMR , 13C NMR , high temperature 1H NMR , UV / visible spectroscopy , and differential scanning calorimetry . it wa found that 5-methyl-1,4-hexadiene wa active enough to be incorporated into the copolymer chain but the corresponding isomeric material , 4-methyl-1,4-hexadiene , wa inactive in metallocene - catalyzed copolymerizations . specifically , in the zirconocene - catalyzed copolymerizations of ethylene with MHD , ansa - structure catalyst seem to be more efficient than non-bridged type zirconocene . the degree of incorporation of MHD in the resulting copolymer wa able to be controlled by the amount of non-conjugated dienes used initially . new group <nUm> metallocene oligosilyl compound ( RSi(SiMe3)2MCp2CI ; m = Zr , r = H , me , SiMe3 , SiMe21Bu , SiMe2CMe2CHMe2 , SiMe2Si(SiMe3)3 ; m = Hf , r = H , SiMe3 ) have been synthesized by reaction of the respective oligosilyl potassium compound with zirconocene or hafnocene dichloride . the catalytic activity of five bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene complex of group IV metallocenes in the dehydrocoupling reaction of various 1,2-disubstituted hydrodisilanes were investigated . the reaction were monitored by GC / MS analysis in the early stage , and the polymer were characterized by NMR spectroscopy and gel permeation chromatography . the homo- and copolymerization of styrene ( S ) with p-methylstyrene ( p-MeS ) and p-tert-butylstyrene ( p-ButS ) ha been tested using initiator system of the Ph2Zn-metallocene-MAO type . the metallocenes used were CpTiCl3 , IndTiCl3 , (n-BuCp)2TiCl <nUm> , Ind2ZrCl2 and Et(Ind)2ZrCl <nUm> . the Ph2Zn-metallocene-MAO system homopolymerize styrene , p-methylstyrene and p-tert-butylstyrene , producing syndiotactic polymer in the case of the titanocenes and amorphous polymer in the case of the zirconocenes . the S / p-MeS and S / p-ButS copolymer obtained with the Ph2Zn-titanocene-MAO system are enriched in the comonomer with respect to the initial feed . copolymerizations of ethylene with 1-decene were carried out with a series of stereospecific metallocene compound , rac - (EBI)Zr(NMe2) <nUm> [ <nUm> , EBI = ethylene-1,2-bis(1-indenyl) ] , rac - (EBI)Hf(NMe 2)2 ( 2 ) , rac-Me2Si(1-C5H 2-2-Me-4-tBu)2Zr(NMe2)2 ( 3 ) , ethylidene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)ZrMe2 [ <nUm> , Et(Flu)(Cp)ZrMe2 ] and isopropylidene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl) ZrMe2 [ <nUm> , iPr(Flu)(Cp)ZrMe2 ] , combined with Al(i-Bu) <nUm> / [CPh3][B(C6F5)4] cocatalyst . all catalyst system showed very high copolymerization rate and the 1-decene reactivity decreased in the order of <nUm> > <nUm> > <nUm> ∼ <nUm> > <nUm> . the reactivity product of ethylene and 1-decene ( rE x rD ) wa below <nUm> except <nUm> catalyst , corresponding to random copolymer structure with an alternating character . the melting point ( Tm ) , crystallinity ( xc ) , intrinsic viscosity ( [e] and density of the 1-decene / ethylene copolymer decreased markedly with an increase in the 1-decene content , regardless of the type of catalytic system . propylene copolymerization with 1-hexene and 4-methyl-1-pentene in liquid propylene medium in presence of MAO - activated C2 - symmetry ansa - zirconocene rac-Me2Si(4-Ph-2-MeInd)2ZrCl2 wa studied . random copolymer of propylene with 1-hexene and 4-methyl-1-pentene content up to 7mol[?] % were obtained at <nUm> ° C . general kinetic characteristic of propylene / higher a-olefin copolymerization were evaluated . the distinct feature of propylene copolymerization with 1-hexene and 4-methyl-1-pentene in liquid propylene medium - the proximity of comonomer relative reactivity ratio ( r1 r21 ) that indicates azeotropic nature of copolymerization process in studied condition . synthesized copolymer were characterized with the use of IR , 13C NMR , GPC , WAXD , DSC technique , and uniaxial tensile testing . this article reveals the dependence of crystalline phase in titania on the intrinsic activity during in situ polymerization of ethylene / 1-hexene using the zirconocene / dMMAO catalyst to produce LLDPE / O2Ti nanocomposites . first , the O2Ti nanoparticles having different crystalline phase were employed a the nanofillers by impregnation with dMMAO to obtain dMMAO / O2Ti then , copolymerization of ethylene / 1-hexene using zirconocene catalyst wa performed in the presence of dMMAO / O2Ti . it wa found that the catalytic activity derived from the anatase O2Ti ( A ) wa about four time higher than that obtained from the rutile OTi <nUm> . ( r ) . this wa likely due to higher intrinsic activity of the active specie present on the TiO2(A) . In addition , increased [Al]dMMAO / [Zr]cat ratio apparently resulted in enhanced activity for both O2Ti ( A ) and tio ( r ) . however , the O2Ti ( r ) showed le deactivation upon increased [Al]dMMAO / [Zr]cat ratio . this can be attributed to strong interaction between dMMAO and O2Ti . ( r ) a proven by the TGA measurement . the microstructure of the LLDPE / O2Ti obtained wa found to be random copolymer for both O2Ti ( A ) and O2Ti ( r ) . the copolymerization of styrene with isoprene ( ip ) ha been tested using combined zirconocene-methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) initiating system . both '' halfsandwich '' and real zirconium - based metallocenes were used . regardless of the metallocene employed , conversion to copolymer wa much influenced by the proportion of ip in the initial feed . As the proportion of ip is enriched , conversion to copolymer decrease substantially . result of NMR and DSC analysis indicate that the product obtained were truly copolymer and not a mixture of both homopolymers . the studied zirconocene - MAO initiating system produce atactic polystyrene . A small amount of ip in the initial feed substantially diminishes the conversion and at best trace of poly(isoprene) were detected in the homopolymerization of ip with these initiating system . the spherical zirconia modified with BCl3 , Cl4Si , and glycerol wa used a the support for rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst to catalyze the copolymerization of ethylene / 1-hexene . it is aimed to investigate the modification effect from different modifier on copolymerization behavior and compare the result with the unmodified system . the modified support show higher activity than the unmodified one . especially , the Cl4Si modification exhibited the highest activity and produced copolymer with the largest 1-hexene insertion . this can be attributed to stronger interaction between the support and MAO along with the presence of Cl4Si a a spacer group resulting in the absence of induction period . the modification did not affect the copolymer microstructure and the random copolymer were obtained from all supported system . the narrower molecular weight distribution can be obtained from the modified support . besides , BCl3 modification present the highest molecular weight of polymer probably due to BCl3 suppressing chain transfer reaction . allylbenzene wa polymerized in the presence of two type of homogeneous zirconocene catalyst ( co-catalyst methylaluiminoxane ) . selective chain termination through ss-hydride elimination or chain transfer to aluminum wa observed depending upon the catalyst employed . the rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 , and rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 , catalyst gave the polyallylbenzenes with saturated end group due to chain transfer to aluminum , while the Cp2ZrCl2 catalyst gave the polyallylbenzenes with vinylidene end group due to ss-hydride elimination . lewis acidic site ( LAS ) of silica , modified with TMA and MAO sample differed by TMA content , have been characterized by IR spectroscopy ( CO adsorption a probe molecule at <nUm> K ) . two type of LAS were found on the surface of silica modified with MAO and TMA : m LAS of moderate strength ( vCO = 2204-2212 cm-1 ) and weak W LAS ( vCO = <nUm> cm-1 ) . the concentration of these acidic site ha been estimated . it wa shown by IRS study CP2ZrMe2 interacts both with W LAS and m LAS . correlation between the amount of m LAS and the activity of ethylene polymerization ha been found . thirteen differently substituted long - chain amide- and amine - functional alkene were synthesised and used a comonomers in zirconocene / methylaluminoxane - catalysed copolymerizations with ethylene and propylene . characterization of the prepared copolymer showed the formation of functionalized copolymer with isolated comonomer unit . the incorporation level of the comonomers ranged from <nUm> to <nUm> mol % with ethylene and from <nUm> to <nUm> mol % with propylene . the molar mass of the copolymer were lower than those of the corresponding homopolymers . end group analysis of the copolymer by NMR suggested that the dominant chain termination mechanism wa chain transfer to aluminium . synthesis and activity of bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride catalyst supported on unconventional silica - type material obtained in sol - gel process and activated by organoaluminium co-catalyst were studied . the effect of support modification condition ( thermal dehydration and / or modification by organoaluminium compound ) and a type of co-catalyst on an activity of the catalytic system in ethylene polymerization and property of resulting polymer were investigated and compared with result obtained earlier for vanadium catalyst supported on mentioned sol - gel carrier . the most appropriate method of the sol - gel silica - type support preparation is thermal pre-treating ( <nUm> ° C ) followed by modification with AlEt2Cl . metallocene catalyst supported on such sol - gel product and activated by MAO appeared to be most active among studied system . studied Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO supported on silica - type sol - gel carrier allow to obtain polyethylene ( at <nUm> ° C polymerization temperature ) with yield up to 30*106 g / ( molZr*h ) , molecular weight below <nUm> <nUm> and MWD = 2-4 . ethene wa homo- and copolymerized in the presence of methylaluminoxane (MAO)-activated zirconocenes comprising (Me5Cp)2ZrCl2 ( cp* ) and racemic dimethylsilylene-bis[-2-methyl-indenyl] - bridged zirconocene dichloride where the ligand framework wa varied by benzannelation ( MBI ) , 4-phenyl ( MPI ) , and 4-naphthyl ( MNI ) substitution . zero shear viscosity and shear thinning of the ethene homopolymers increased a a function of the catalyst system with MNI · MPI > MBI » cp* and were correlated with the presence of long chain branch formed via reinsertion of vinyl-terminated polymer chain . the ranking wa confirmed using the reduced vanGurp palmen plot ( σ vs. IG*I / GN0 ) being le sensitive on molecular weight for polyolefin material . poly(ethene-co-propene)s ( EP ) containing <nUm> and <nUm> wt.- % propene were long chain branched a reflected by pronounced viscosity build-up at low angular frequency and increased shear thinning at higher angular frequency , whereas with propene comonomer content exceeding <nUm> wt.- % EP wa essentially linear . synthesis and activity ofbis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride catalyst supported on unconventional silica - type material obtained in sol - gel process and activated by organoaluminium co-catalyst were studied . the effect of support modification condition ( thermal dehydration and / or modification by organoaluminium compound ) and a type of co-catalyst on an activity of the catalytic system in ethylene polymerization and property of resulting polymer were investigated and compared with result obtained earlier for vanadium catalyst supported on mentioned sol - gel carrier . the most appropriate method of the sol - gel silica - type support preparation is thermal pre-treating ( <nUm> ° C ) followed by modification with AlEt2Cl . metallocene catalyst supported on such sol - gel product and activated by MAO appeared to be most active among studied system . studied Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO supported on silica - type sol - gel carrier allow to obtain polyethylene ( at <nUm> ° C polymerization temperature ) with yield up to 30*106 g / ( molZr*h ) , molecular weight below <nUm> <nUm> and MWD = 2-4 . the present study showed enhanced activity of ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization via O2Ti - O2Si mixed oxide - supported MAO with a zirconocene catalyst . it wa proposed that titania wa decorated on silica surface and acted a a spacer to anchor MAO to the silica support resulting in le steric hindrance and le interaction on the support surface . the bimodal polyethylene obtained from O2Ti - supported zirconocene / MAO catalyst wa observed during polymerization of ethylene and ethylene / 1-hexene . by mean of XPS , it revealed that O2Ti consisted of ti3+ ( BE = <nUm> eV ) and ti4+ ( BE = <nUm> eV ) . the dual catalytic site were attributed to the presence of ti3+ and Ti 4+ in O2Ti . the study revealed enhancement ( four to seven time ) of catalytic activity for ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization via the Zr - modified OSi 2-supported the metallocene / MAO catalyst . increased activity can be attributed to an increase in absorption ability of MAO on the modified support . In addition , the strong interaction between MAO and the support wa also considered . the synthesis , characterization , and application of a wide variety of metallocene and metallocene - like polymer and oligomers is described . much of this effort involves the group IVB metallocenes , but the work of vanadium and ruthenium are also included . the use of these material a analytical reagent , laser modifier , and in solar energy conversion is described . the conductivity of the polyamine derived from titanocene dichloride and 2-nitro-1,4-phenylenediamine increase to <nUm> to <nUm> fold when doped with iodine . larger increase are found for the analogous polyamines except derived from zirconocene dichloride ( increased 103-104 fold ) and hafnocene dichloride ( 105-106 fold ) and for certain other diamine . the conductivity of the product of titanocene dichloride and n-methyl-1,4-phenylenediamine increased <nUm> fold when doped . by comparison , conductivity increased only tenfold for the product from titanocene dichloride and chloro-1,4-phenylenediamine and le for the titanocene product with 1,4-phenylenediamine and methoxy-1,4-phenylenediamine and none for the product from dibutyltin dichloride and 2-nitro-1,4-phenylenediamine . conductivity did not appreciably change when sample were exposed to the atmosphere for <nUm> h. MALDI MS and IR result are consistent with the formation of C-I compound for doped material . polyethylene nanocomposites were prepared by in-situ polymerization technique by using highly active metallocene catalyst zirconocene ( cp 2ZrCl2 ) in combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the influence of different concentration ( <nUm> , 0.6,0.83,1.6 and <nUm> wt. % ) of nano calcium zirconate on catalytic activity and polymer property wa investigated . there wa a steep increase in the activity of zirconocene catalyst ( from <nUm> to 185[?] × [?]10-3 g-PE / mol h bar , ) by addition <nUm> wt. % of the nanofiller the result of differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , crystallization analysis fractionation ( CRYSTAF ) and wide angle x-ray diffraction ( WAXD ) show that the percentage crystallinity wa influenced with respect to the nanofiller concentration . microcalorimeter wa used to study the effect of nanofiller on the pyrolysis of polyethylene . the fibril morphology appearing on the fractured surface wa reduced significantly with the addition of nanofiller a is evident from SEM morphology . the successive self - nucleation / annealing technique ( SSA ) by differential scanning calorimetry ha been applied to study the heterogeneity of ethylene-hexene-1 copolymer produced with supported catalytic system of different composition : highly active supported ziegler - natta ( Z-N ) catalyst - a titanium - magnesium catalyst Cl4Ti / Cl2Mg ( TMC ) and a vanadium - magnesium catalyst Cl4V / Cl2Mg ( VMC ) , a supported zirconocene catalyst Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 / OSi <nUm> ( MAO ) , and a chromium - oxide catalyst CrO3 / OSi <nUm> . comparative data by SSA technique with the same temperature program were obtained for copolymer differed by MWD from narrow to very broad ( mw / Mn = 2.4-54 ) and short chain branching distribution from narrow ( zirconocene catalyst ) to very broad ( TMC and chromium oxide catalyst ) . it is demonstrated that copolymer produced with the zirconocene catalyst have the narrowest melting range and do not contain thick lamella . the widest lamella thickness distribution ha been found for a copolymer produced with the chromium - oxide catalyst . copolymer produced with the supported Z-N catalyst are ranked in the middle with a more narrow lamella thickness distribution for copolymer prepared with VMC a compared with the one produced with TMC . the SSA result are compared with the data on copolymer fractionation by TREF . it is shown that these method give a good correlation for copolymer with narrow short - chain branching distribution produced with the supported zirconocene catalyst . In the case of copolymer produced with TMC , TREF yield a higher content of the high - branched fraction . the heterogenized reaction product of the partial hydrolysis of the organoaluminum compound AlMe3 and Al(i-Bu)3 with water a a constituent of highly hydrated support , zeolite ( ZSM-5-H2O ) and montmorillonite ( MMT-H2O ) , have been synthesized . the thermal degradation of the resulting heterogenized methylalumoxane compound and methylalumoxane ( MAO ) in a solid state is studied by temperature - programmed desorption with the mass - spectrometric analysis of liberated gaseous product , and the structural identity of the above compound is found . alkylalumoxanes prepared immediately on the surface of a support form heterogenized complex with the metallocenes Cp2ZrCl2 and Et(Ind) 2ZrCl2 . these heterogenized complex exhibit high activity in the reaction of ethylene and propylene polymerization . for this reason , MAO can be replaced by AlMe3 or Al(i-Bu)3 and the additional introduction of MAO or another alkylaluminum for zirconocene activation is unnecessary . it ha been found that , upon the immobilization of commercial MAO on dehydrated O2Si , the MAO molecule loses a portion of it most reactive methyl group and , a a result of this , becomes incapable of activating metallocenes . the effect of ferrocene and zirconocene dichloride on the rate and constant of copolymerization of methyl methacrylate with styrene wa studied . the result obtained suggest that the metallocenes in the elementary step of the reaction . transformation of electronic absorption spectrum of zirconocene catalytic system Ph2CCpFluZrCl2-polymethylalumoxane ( MAO ) and rac-Me2Si(2-Me,4-PhInd)2ZrCl2 - MAO ( flu is fluorenyl , ind is indenyl ) in toluene wa studied upon a change in the ratio of reactant A1MAO / Zr from <nUm> to <nUm> mol mol-1 . analysis of the spectroscopic data using statistical method determined the number of reaction product in each system . A reaction model including three equilibrium and being common for the both system wa proposed . effective equilibrium constant and absorption spectrum of individual reaction product were determined by parametric self - modeling of the experimental spectrum . A procedure wa developed for the synthesis of trinuclear cyclic ( Zr III)2-Al hydride [(Cp2Zr)2(m-H)] (m-H)2AlX2 ( x = Cl ( 1a ) or Br ( 1b ) ) . these complex were prepared in 60-65 % yield by the reaction of Cp2ZrX2 with AlH4Li in the presence of Br2Co and tolane . the structure of complex 1a and 1b and iodide 1c ( x = I ) were studied by NMR spectroscopy in solvent of different basicities ( toluene , THF , and pyridine ) . complex 1a is unsolvated and monomeric in all solvent ; complex 1b , in toluene and THF ; complex 1c , in toluene only . At room temperature , complex 1a doe not catalyze hydrogenation of hex-1-ene and doe not react with tolane , but reacts with the latter at high temperature to give bis(e5- cyclopentadienyl)-2,3,4,5-tetraphenylzirconacyclopentadiene . the reaction of equivalent amount of complex 1a and ClH produce the [ ( Cp2Zr ) 2(m-Cl)](m-H)2AlCl2 complex . the structure of the latter wa established by x-ray diffraction . preparative procedure were developed for the synthesis of new transmethylated bis-cyclopentadienyl ligand with phosphine - containing bridging fragment . these ligand were isolated a the dilithium salt Li 2[(C5Me4CH2)2PPh] ( 1 ) and Li2[(C5Me4CH2CH2) 2PPh ] ( 3 ) . phosphorus - substituted 3-ansa-zirconocene dichloride [(C5Me4CH2)2PPh]ZrCl2 wa synthesized starting from <nUm> . the NMR spectroscopic data provide evidence for the absence of the Zr-P coordination interaction in solution . A straightforward approach to 5-ansa-zirconocene dichloride [ ( C5Me 4CH2CH2)2PPh]ZrCl2 starting from lithium salt <nUm> and Cl4Zr wa shown to be impossible . catalytic cycloalumination of cyclonona-1,2-diene upon treatment with Et3Al and EtAlCl2 in the presence of cp 2ZrCl2 , leading to 10-ethyl-10-aluminabicyclo[7.3.0 1,9]dodec-8-ene ( 1 ) and 11-ethyl-11-aluminatricyclo[10.7.0 1,12.02,10]nonadeca-9,12-diene , respectively , wa accomplished in high yield . A possibility for the selective transformation of compound <nUm> to 1-allyl-9-(pent-4-enyl)cyclonon-1-ene and 10-hydroxybicyclo[7.3 . 01,9]dodec-8-ene in one preparative step wa demonstrated . reduction of the R2P - functionalized zirconocene dichloride [C5Me4(CH2)2PR2] ( C 5Me5)ZrCl2 ( r = me ( 1 ) and ph ( 2 ) ) and [ C 5Me4(CH2)2PMe2][C 5Me4(CH2)2PR2]ZrCl <nUm> ( r = me ( 3 ) and ph ( 4 ) ) with amalgamated magnesium wa studied . In the reduction of compound <nUm> and <nUm> , intramolecular C-H activation highly selectively afforded the fulvene hydride complex Zr(H)(e5- C5Me5)[e5:e2(C,P)-(CH 2)C5Me3CH2CH2PR <nUm> ] ( r = me ( 7 ) , ph ( 8 ) ) ; in the case of compound <nUm> , the aryl hydride Zr(H)(e5:C5Me5)[e5 : e1(C)-C5Me4CH2CH 2PPh(o-C6H4) ] ( 9 ) wa also formed . the reduction of complex <nUm> and <nUm> gave the ZrII derivative Zr[e5:e1(P)- C5Me4CH 2CH2PMe2]2 ( 12 ) and Zr[e5:e1(P)-C5Me4CH 2CH2PMe2][e5 : e1(P)-C5Me4CH2 CH 2PPh2 ] ( 14 ) stabilized by two phosphine group . the second product in the reduction of compound <nUm> wa the fulvene hydride complex Zr(H)(e5-C5Me4CH2CH 2PPh2)[e5:e2(C,P)-(CH 2)C5Me3CH2CH2PMe <nUm> ] ( 15 ) . the reaction of compound <nUm> with an excess of MeI resulted selectively in replacement of the hydride ligand by iodide to give the complex ZrI(e5-C5Me5)[e5 : e2(C,P)-(CH2)C5Me3CH 2CH2PMe2 ] ( 10 ) . In contrast , in the reaction of compound <nUm> with Me2Si(H)Cl , the Zr - CH2 bond underwent cleavage to give the chloride hydride complex Zr(H)Cl(e5-C 5Me5)[e5:e1(P)-C 5Me3(CH2SiMe2H)CH2CH 2PMe2 ] ( 11 ) . In the reaction of complex <nUm> with CO , a phosphine group wa replaced by CO to form the complex Zr(CO)(e5-C 5Me4CH2CH2PMe2 ) [ e5:e1(P)-C5Me4CH 2CH2PMe2 ] ( 13 ) . the result obtained were compared with analogous reduction reaction of MeO- , MeS- , and me <nUm> N - functionalized zirconocene dichloride . an efficient method for the synthesis of spiro[3.3]heptanes and spiro[3.4]octanes of various structure ha been developed using cycloalumination of substituted methylidenecyclobutanes with et <nUm> Al in the presence of cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> . A possibility of transformation of the in situ formed spiroaluminacyclopentanes to the corresponding thiophanes , selenophanes , and cyclopentanols in high yield and selectivity ha been demonstrated . the present review summarizes the result of study of Zr and Ti complex based on chelating side - chain functionalized cyclopentadienyl ligand , which were synthesized by the author of the present review and co-worker . the coordination ability of the functional group is considered . dynamic process that occur in half - sandwich complex in solution were studied by NMR spectroscopy . emphasis is given to the reduction reaction of side - chain functionalized zirconocene dichloride , a well a to the structure and property of the reaction product depending on the nature of the heteroatomic substituent . catalytic intermolecular cycloalumination of cyclic 1,2-dienes with terminal allenes or disubstituted acetylene mediated by EtAlCl2 in the presence of complex based on transition metal wa accomplished . the yield of unsaturated bicyclic aluminacarbocycles wa up to <nUm> % . new functionalized indenyl ligand ind x = 1,3-C <nUm> H <nUm> (Pri)(CH <nUm> CH <nUm> x ) ( x = OMe or NMe <nUm> ) and 1,3-C <nUm> H <nUm> ( Pr i )[CMe <nUm> CH <nUm> ( 2'-py ) ] and the zirconium sandwich complex ( ind x )Cp* ClZr <nUm> ( cp* is pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ) were synthesized . the photochemical behavior and\ the reduction reaction of zirconocene dichloride were investigated . the property of these compound are determined mainly by the high lability of Zr - ind bond . the reduction of ( ind x )Cp*ZrCl <nUm> ( x = NMe <nUm> ) selectively affords the complex cp*[e <nUm> : η <nUm> -(C,N)-C <nUm> H <nUm> (Pri)CH <nUm> CH <nUm> N(Me)CH <nUm> ]ZrH a the intramolecular NCH <nUm> -H bond activation product . the molecular structure of the complex ( ind x )Cp*ZrCl <nUm> ( x = OMe ) and it photochemical decomposition product [ Cp*ZrCl <nUm> ( OMe ) ] <nUm> were established by x-ray diffraction . none cycloalumination of macrocyclic diynes with Et3Al catalyzed by Cp2ZrCl2 resulted in unsaturated bi-and tricyclic mono-and dialuminacarbocycles in 76-91 % yield . the interaction of the negishi reagent cp 2ZrBu n 2with 1,4-bis(tert-butyl)butadiyne ButC ≡ C-C ≡ CBut lead to four product : a five - membered zirconacyclocumulene complex cp 2Zr(e 4-Bu tC 4Bu t ) ( 2 ) synthesized earlier by another method , the previously unknown seven - membered zirconacyclocumulene cp 2Zr[e 4-Bu tC <nUm> ( bu t)-C(C 2Bu t ) = CBu t ] ( 3 ) a well a small amount of the zirconocene binuclear butatrienyl complex cp <nUm> ( bu n)Zr(Bu tC 4Bu t)Zr(Bu n)Cp <nUm> ( 4 ) , and the dimeric acetylide [ cp 2ZrC ≡ CBu t ] <nUm> ( 5 ) . the structure of complex 2-5 wa established by x-ray diffraction study . A Cp2ZrCl2 - catalyzed cycloalumination of 3-methylidenespiro[cyclobutane-1,3'-(5'a)-cholestane] with Et3Al give 3-ethyl-3-aluminadispiro[cyclopentane-1,1'- cyclobutane-3',3''-(5''a)-cholestane ] in <nUm> % yield . isobutylalumoxanes of different composition were synthesized by the hydrolysis of triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) with crystalline hydrate CuOS 4*5H2O and water taken a cooled ice or a vapor . the composition of the formed alumoxanes and the degree of water participation in their formation wa monitored by 1H NMR . the hydrolysis of TIBA on CuSO4*5H2O is rather selective method of synthesis of alumoxanes . the synthesized alumoxanes were used for the activation of dimethylated zirconocenes rac-Me2Si(2-Me,4-PhInd) 2ZrMe2 and rac-Et(2-MeInd)2ZrMe2 in propylene polymerization at the molar ratio Al / Zr = 50-750 . it wa concluded that the hydrolysis afforded several product with different structure and different activating ability . the system with oligomeric form of isobutylalumoxanes , especially those obtained by TIBA hydrolysis with water , showed the highest activity . A one - pot method for the synthesis of polycyclic phospholanes and phospholane 3-oxides from norbornenes wa developed based on their cp 2ZrCl2 - catalyzed cycloalumination . the in situ formed polycyclic aluminacyclopentanes were treated with organic dichlorophosphines ( RPCl2 , where r = me , but , ph ) to obtain polycyclic phospholanes . the phospholanes were oxidized with hydrogen peroxide to obtain their 3-oxides in 81-92 % yield . the direct photophysical approach to the estimation of the energy and orbital nature of electron - excited state of organometallic compound of early transition metal wa described . the concentration dependence of the zirconocene luminescence quenching wa studied using cyclopentadiene . the quenching of metallocene Cp2MIVCl2 luminescence wa observed using CsHU . the result of experiment on quenching of the luminescence of group IVB complex in the presence of CsHU were obtained even in the case of ET ≥ ET . A series of six - coordinate " half - sandwich " zirconocene phosphate and phosphonates have been synthesized by the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with ( diphenyl- , dibenzyl-)phosphate and methylphenylphosphinic acid under different condition . all of the complex were characterized by elemental analysis , FT-IR and NMR ( 1H , 13C ) spectroscopy . except for complex <nUm> , the structure of complex <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were confirmed by x-ray crystallography . the structure analysis reveal that complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> are trinuclear complex with fascinating m3-oxygen bridging ligand , central to a Zr-O backbone ( Cp2ZrCl2 : ligand is <nUm> : <nUm> ) while complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> are centrosymmetric dinuclear complex built up about the trapezoidal Zr2(m2-OH)2 unit ( Cp2ZrCl2 : ligand is <nUm> : <nUm> ) . reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with homometallic complex of aluminium containing one residual hydroxy group Al(OGO)(OGOH) and Al(L)(OGOH) [ where g = G1 = CMe2CMe2 ( 1a ) ; g = g <nUm> = CMe2CH2CHMe ( 1b ) ; g = G3 = CMe 2CH2CH2CMe2 ( 1c ) and L = L <nUm> = C7H5O = C2H4NO , g = G1 ( 2a ) ; L = L1 , g = G2 ( 2b ) ; L = L1 , g = G3 ( 2c ) ; L = L2 = C11H7O = NCH 2CH2O , g = G1 ( 2d ) ; L = L2 , g = g <nUm> ( 2e ) ; L = L2 , g = G3 ( 2f ) ] in THF using et <nUm> N a ClH acceptor affords novel heterobimetallic compound of the type Al(OGO)2Zr(Cl)Cp2 and Al(L)(OGO)Zr(Cl)Cp <nUm> , respectively . all of these derivative have been characterised by elemental analysis , molecular weight measurement , and spectroscopic [ IR , NMR ( 1H and 27Al ) ] study . synthesis and characterization of titanium(IV) and zirconium(IV) complex of the type Cp2M(Cl)(HPO) , Cp2M(HPO)2 , cp 2M(O[?]N[?]O) and Cp2M(O [?]N[?]S ) ( where m represents titanium or zirconium and HPO , O[?]N[?]O and O[?]N [?]S represent the donor set of the ligand ) have been reported . these new derivative have been prepared by the reaction of titanocene dichloride or zirconocene dichloride with 2-hydroxy-N-phenyl benzamide(HPOH) , 1-[(2-hydroxyphenyl)-1-N-phenylamino]hydrazine-carboxamide ( HO [?]N[?]OH ) and 2-hydroxy-N-phenyl benzamide benzothiazoline ( HO[?]N[?]SH ) in different molar ratio . the ligand and their complex have been characterized by the elemental analysis , conductance measurement , molecular weight determination and spectral study . on the basis of electronic , i.r. , 1H.-n.m.r . and 13C.-n.m.r . spectral study , trigonal bipyramidal and octahedral geometry have been proposed for the resulting complex . all the ligand and their complex have been screened for their biological activity on several pathogenic fungi and bacteria and were found positive in this respect . some zirconium compound containing chelating diamido dipyrrole or tetra-amido tetra-pyrrole ligand were synthesized and used a polymerization catalyst with high polymerization activity of ethylene at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> bar , in presence of MAO or BC18F15 a co-catalyst . the maximum catalytic activity reached <nUm> kg / mol bar h for ethylene polymerization by zr2(octa-phenyl calix[4]pyrrolidine)Cl4 . these result reveal that half - zirconocene like complex including four terminal chlorine and one calix[4]pyrrolidine in middle with both π and s-interaction have the highest ethylene polymerization turnover ( compound <nUm> , <nUm> ) . substituted 1,4-dimagnesium reagent were synthesized by the zirconocene - catalyzed reaction of alkene with ethylmagnesium reagent in the presence of a methylmagnesium containing additive . improved selectivity for formation of dimagnesium reagent over monomagnesium reagent wa obtained in the presence of the methylmagnesium containing additive . the ratio of monoto dimagnesiated product wa extrapolated from the ratio of alkene to diene in the product formed when the reaction wa quenched with allyl bromide . the extent of the increase in the alkene / diene ratio wa dependent on the type of organomagnesium halide , with greatest increase ( <nUm> % ) for the alkylmagnesium chloride . A mechanism for improved selectivity by suppression of b-hydrogen abstraction in the catalytic cycle is presented . quenching the 1,4-dimagnesium reagent with allyl bromide yielded decadienes . zirconocene reagent derived from zirconocene dichloride and two equivalent of butyllithium react with allylic , homoallylic diene ether . hydrolysis of the reaction product yield substituted tetrahydropyrans . the reaction is postulated to occur via cyclization of the diene to form a zirconacyclopentane . this cyclization occurs without allylic rearrangement . the bis(b-diketonato) Zr complex CpZr(acac)2Cl ( acac = acetylacetonato ) ( 1 ) and Cp*Zr(acac)2Cl ( 2 ) can be synthesized by the reaction of Cp'ZrCl3(Cp' = cp or cp* ) with <nUm> equiv of lithium acetylacetonate . CpZr(acac)2Cl ( 1 ) can be quantitatively prepared by treatment of Cp2ZrCl2 with excess acetylacetone . the tris(b-diketonato) Zr complex CpZr(tfac) <nUm> ( tfac = trisfluoroacetylacetonato ) ( 3 ) ha been prepared by treatment of CpZrCl3 with sodium trisfluoroacetylacetonate . the replacement of both chlorine atom and one cp group from zirconocene dichloride by nonfluorinated diketone , acetylacetone , readily occurs at room temperature in triethylamine medium , offering the tris(b-diketonato) Zr complex CpZr(acac)3 ( 4 ) . the complex were characterized by 1H NMR spectroscopic method . In addition , the molecular structure of complex <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by x-ray diffraction method . when activated by excess methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , these complex were active for ethylene polymerization , offering polyethylene with high molecular weight and narrow molecular weight distribution . complex <nUm> showed a very high ethylene polymerization activity of up to <nUm> kg PE / mol zr*h at <nUm> atm . complex <nUm> and <nUm> were also active for ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization . Nano-TiO <nUm> particle with a range of crystallite size were synthesized by a conventional sol - gel method , and then used a nanoparticle substrate in the synthesis of LLDPE / OTi <nUm> nanocomposites via in situ polymerization of ethylene / 1-hexene with zirconocene / MMAO catalyst . it wa found that the size of the nano-TiO <nUm> crystallite nanoparticles can influence the catalytic activity in the polymerization system . the larger nano-TiO <nUm> crystallite provided better catalytic activity in the polymerization system due to more space for monomer attack . In addition , by thermo - gravimetric analysis , it can be seen that the larger nano-TiO <nUm> crystallite also exhibited lower interaction with available MMAO . consequently , the MMAO reacted more efficiently with the zirconocene catalyst during the activation process , and enhanced polymerization catalysis . all the polymer nanocomposites product did not have well defined melting temperature indicating non-crystalline polymer . this is due to the high amount of hexene incorporation ( based on 13C NMR ) . the difference in crystallite size of the nano-TiO <nUm> also affected how 1-hexene became incorporated into the polymer nanocomposites . the smaller crystallite size of nano-TiO <nUm> allowed greater 1-hexene incorporation due to depression of the reactivity of the ethylene . the contribution of this work help develop a better understanding of the role of nano-TiO <nUm> in the catalytic activity of the polymerization system and in the microstructure of the polymer composite product . however , this study only considers work on the laboratory scale , so for commercial application of these result , it is necessary to scale up the polymerization process . it is only at this stage , that other physical property , such a the mechanical property of these material can be sensibly determined . Ansa-Cyclohexyl-bis(4,5,6,7-tertrahydro-1-indenyl) zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) wa used a catalyst for propylene and ethylene polymerization together with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) a the cocatalyst . isotactic polypropylene ( PP ) wa obtained with the highest activity of <nUm> × <nUm> g PP ( molZr ) -1h-1 . the meso-meso ( mmmmm ) pentad sequence content of PP wa determined by 13C NMR spectroscopy . the dependence of the microstructure on the reaction temperature and the Al / Zr molar ratio wa examined and the catalytic activity of complex <nUm> wa compared with that of the similar ansa - zirconocene <nUm> . the high activity of the new zirconocene <nUm> for propylene isospectic polymerization at high temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) is the result of it unique bridged - group structure . complex <nUm> / MAO display also high catalytic activity of <nUm> × <nUm> to <nUm> × <nUm> g PE(molZr)-1h-1 in the homo-polymerization of ethylene . the visometric molecular weight of PE range from <nUm> × <nUm> to <nUm> × <nUm> g*mol-1 under the given condition . 13C NMR spectroscopy analysis prof the PE to be linear polyethylene ( LPE ) . OZn nanoparticle wa used for preparing supported catalyst , which wa applied in copolymerization of ethylene and 1-octene to obtain LLDPE / OZn nanocomposite . there were two different impregnation method ( in situ and ex situ ) in preparing the nano-ZnO supported catalyst . the investigation to compare both method wa conducted by employing various 1-octene initial concentration in copolymerization . it wa found that a heterogeneous catalytic system comprised a supported catalyst , prepared by in situ impregnation , provided higher catalytic activity and 1-octene incorporation compared to those of ex situ impregnation under similar condition perhaps due to closer similarity to a homogeneous system . for the ex situ impregnation , it wa found that when zirconocene wa directly impregnated onto the support , the catalytic activity decreased . this wa due to zirconocene close vicinity to the support and even deep into the support structure proved by XPS and TGA measurement . therefore , it wa more inaccessible to monomer attack and reducing the catalytic activity . the separate study on each catalytic system relating to the comonomer effect wa also conducted by applying initial comonomer concentration varied between <nUm> and <nUm> mmol . the increase in catalytic activity with increasing comonomer concentration can be considered a a positive comonomer effect , and the opposite wa true for a negative comonomer effect . it wa found that both positive and negative comonomer effect occurred in in situ impregnation and ex situ impregnation system with Zn / ( Al ? Zr ) support , whereas only positive comonomer effect wa found in an ex situ impregnation system with Zn / Al support . this suggested that the comonomer effect wa varied according to the nature of each system . the polymer property , such a relative crystallinity and thermal property were also investigated and found to alter with 1-octene concentration . the bis(anilino)phosphine oxide (PhNH)2P(O)H a a ligand reacts directly with zirconocene dichloride CCl2P2Zr to afford H(PhNH)P[(NPh)OZr(Cp)2Cl] ( 1 ) , while in the presence of triethylamine a a base the ligand is deprotonated and H(O)P[(NPh)2Zr(Cp) <nUm> ] ( 2 ) is isolated in a very good yield . when the ligand is treated with Cl4Ti , however , the diligand complex Cl3TiO(NPh) PH(NPh)PHO(Nph)TiCl3 ( 3 ) is separated in high yield . these new compound have been fully characterized by FT-IR , UV - vi spectrophotometry and multi-nuclear ( 1H , 31P ) NMR spectroscopy and elemental analysis a well a XRF analysis of SEM image . A method is described that allows the preparation of stable conjugated primary enamine containing furyl or pyridyl substituents . In a template reaction (butadiene)zirconocene is 1,4-selectively coupled to two 2-cyanopyridine equivalent to give the nine - membered metallacycle 8b . subsequent treatment with methanol remove the bent metallocene template and lead to the formation of 1,6-diamino-1,6-bis(2-pyridyl)-1,3,5-hexatriene ( 9b ) . the 1,6- diamino-1,6-bis(2-furyl)-1,3,5-hexatriene system ( 9a ) wa prepared analogously ( <nUm> % isolated ) . subsequent addition of benzonitrile to (butadiene)ZrCp2 followed by 2-cyanopyridine or 2-cyanofurane gave the respective unsymmetrically substituted 1,6-diaminohexatrienes in good yield . retention following ( n , γ ) reaction in solid state and in solution in benzene were measured for 1,1'-trimethylenetitanocene dichloride and for the corresponding derivative of zirconocene dichloride and hafnocence dichloride . comparison are made of these retention with those previously measured for the parent compound . retention in solution are best interpreted a due to a fast three - body recombination reaction for the parent compound and to a fast two - body recombination reaction for the bridged derivative . As part of the characterization of substituted biscyclopentadienyl Ti(IV) and Zr(IV) compound , 13C NMR and 1H NMR data have been obtained which indicate that the effect of both metal shielding ( Ti versus Zr ) and ring substitution can be taken into account by a simple additive relationship so that it is possible to predict accurately chemical shift for these system . metallacycles are formed upon thermolysis of (s-trans-e4-butadiene)zirconocene and binuclear (e2-aldehyde)zirconocene complex or photolysis of diphenylzirconocene in the presence of t-butyl- , trimethylsilyl- , and phenyl-acetylene . from a surprising equally high preference for a-t-butyl- and -trimethylsilyl-substituted product a well a the statistically favoured 2,4-disubstituted metallacyclopentadienes formed from t-butyl- or trimethylsilyl-acetylene it is suggested , that the position of the substituents in the final product is predominantly determined by the coordination of the alkyne preceding the ring - closure reaction . In contrast to the thermally induced reaction the expected major product ( 2,5-disubstituted zirconacyclopentadiene ) of the kinetically controlled cyclization reaction is formed upon photolysis of diphenylzirconocene in the presence of phenylacetylene . titanocene and zirconocene derivative with an interannular tetramethylethylene bridge can be made by reductive coupling of 6,6-dimethylfulvene with sodium amalgam , sodium anthracenide , or magnesium metal / CCl4 a reducing agent and subsequent reaction of the anionic tetramethyldicyclopentadienylethane product with Cl3Ti or Cl4Zr in THF . treatment of Cp2ZrCl(CH2PPh2) ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) with CO gave the dinuclear complex (Cp2ZrCl)2 [OCCH(PPh2)] ; a single crystal x-ray diffraction study revealed a coplanar doubly - chelated arrangement { A figure is presented } with electron delocalization throughout the six - atom nucleus . UV photolysis of mixture of dialkyl or diaryl complex of group IVA metal (e5-t-BuC5H4)2M(CH3)2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) containing grey selenium give the new complex [(e5-t-BuC5H4M(m-Se)]2 ( II ) . these complex are also formed by UV irradiation of a solution of equimolar amount of I and (e5-t-BuC5H4)2M(SePh)2 . the dark green crystalline [ZrCp''2(CO)2] ( cp'' = e-C5H3(SiMe3)2 ) , ( I ) ( d(13CO) <nUm> ppm ) , wa prepared by reduction from [ZrCp''2Cl2] and either CO ( using HgNa , Cl2HgMg , or li2 [COT] ) or CHgNaO2 in high ( CO ) to moderate ( CO2 ) yield ; the HgNa / CO procedure wa much more effective than for Zr analogue having e-C5H5 or e-C5H4(SiMe3) ligand ; the carbonyl complex I is a convenient precursor to CO-free derivative obtained either by oxidative addition or ligand displacement . the photolysis of Cp2Zr(CO)2 with diphenylacetylene or 3-hexyne yield the respective zirconacyclopentadiene complex Cp2Z(C4R4) ( r = ph , et ) . the thermolysis of Cp2Z(CO)2 with 3-hexyne or bis(pentafluorophenyl)acetylene also lead to the formation of Cp2Z(C4R4) ( r = et , C6F5 ) . ClH degradation of Cp2Zr[C6(C6F5)4] yield 1,2,3,4-tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)-1,3-butadiene and Cp2ZrCl2 . when Cp2Zr(CO)2 is heated with diphenylacetylene in a closed vessel , tetraphenylcyclopentadienone is formed along with Cp2Zr(C4Ph4) . the hafnacyclopentadiene complex Cp2Hf(C4R4) ( r = ph , C6F5 , et ) are obtained when Cp2Hf(CO)2 is thermolyzed with the respective acetylene in refluxing octane . complex Cp2Hf(C4R4) ( r = ph , et ) are also formed when Cp2Hf(CO)2 is photolyzed with diphenylacetylene or 3-hexyne , respectively . the monocarbonyl-triphenylphosphine complex Cp2M(CO)(PPh3) ( m = Zr , Hf ) can be prepared via the irradiation of hydrocarbon solution of Cp2M(CO)2 and triphenylphosphine . these complex react readily with diphenylacetylene and 3-hexyne at 55-60 ° C to afford the corresponding metallacyclopentadiene complex Cp2M(C4R4) ( m = Zr , Hf ; r = ph , et ) . the metallocene dicarbonyls Cp2M(CO)2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) are readily prepared via the reduction of Cp2MCl2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) with amalgamated magnesium metal in THF solution under one atmosphere of carbon monoxide . the chiral ansa - zirconocene derivative ethylenebis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)-zirconium(IV) dichloride ha been prepared by reaction of dilithiobis(indenyl)ethane with Cl4Zr and subsequent hydrogenation . the product ha been shown to be the 1-R,S rather than meso-metal - ring linkage stereoisomer by an x-ray determination of the molecular structure . ethylene-bridged titanocene and zirconocene derivative with permethylated ring ligand , C20Cl2H28Ti and C20Cl2H28Zr , have been synthesized and their crystal structure determined . Cp2Zr(-NCHR)Cl compound ( 9a-9c : r = CH3 , C6H5 , CH2Ph,respectively ) are formed upon hydrozirconation of nitrile . subsequent reaction with an aryllithium reagent yield Cp2Zr(-NCHR)Ar ( 14 ) . the ( alkylidene amido)zirconocene complex are characterized by a linear heteroallene - type structure possessing an sp - hybridized nitrogen atom . <nUm> reacts with the oligomeric metallocene dihydrides (Cp2ZrH2)x ( 15 ) and (Cp2HfH2)c , ( 17 ) , respectively , to form the binuclear compound Cp2Zr(m-NCHR)(m-Cl)MCp2 ( <nUm> , m = Zr ) and ( <nUm> , m = Hf ) . the formation of these thermally very stable metal complex is discussed . the reaction of imidoylzirconocene complex with zirconocene hydride yield (N-alkylamido)zirconocene complex . for a mechanistic study , the specifically substituted imidoylzirconocene complex 3b-3d have been prepared and treated with the oligomeric metal hydride (Cp2ZrH2)x ( 1b ) and (Cp2ZrHCl)x ( 1c ) . ( N-Benzyl formimidoyl)zirconocene chloride ( 3b ) wa obtained by treating 1c with benzyl isonitrile 2a . treatment of dimethylzirconocene with 2a gave ( n-benzyl acetimidoyl)methylzirconocene ( 3c ) , which wa treated with PhICl2 to give (N-benzylacetimidoyl)zirconocene chloride ( 3d ) . the reaction of 3d with (Cp2ZrH2)x ( 1b ) yielded (N-benzyl-N-ethylamido)zirconocene chloride ( 4b ) a the only identified product . A <nUm> <nUm> mixture of 4b and methylzirconocene chloride wa obtained upon treatment of 3c with (Cp2ZrHCl)x ( 1c ) ; in contrast , the reaction of 1c with 3b gave an equimolar mixture of Cp2ZrCl2 and (N-benzyl-N-methylamido)zirconocene chloride ( 4c ) . reaction path through binuclear ( m-CHR' = NR ) zirconocene intermediate are proposed to explain these experimental observation . polymer - attached Cp2ZrCl2 , Cp2HfCl2 , CpZrCl3 , CpHfCl3 , Cp2ZrCl and Cp3HfCl have been prepared . the polymer - attached Cp2ZrCl2 , on reduction with BuLi , produced an active catalyst whose efficiency for olefin hydrogenation is about eight time a great a that of the corresponding homogeneous specie under the same condition . the reduction product of supported zirconocene and hafnocene complex are active hydrogenation catalyst for diphenylacetylene which wa hydrogenated to 1,2-diphenylethane through intermediate stilbene . the similar reduction product have also been employed in catalytic isomerization of allylbenzene , cis-stilbene and 1,5-cyclooctadiene . allylbenzene wa converted into a mixture of trans- and cis-propenylbenzene , cis-stilbene wa isomerized to trans-stilbene , and 1,5-cyclooctadiene wa isomerized to 1,3-cyclooctadiene through the 1,4-cyclooctadiene intermediate . polymer - attached Cp2ZrCl2 , CpZrCl3 , Cp2HfCl2 , and CpHfCl3 can be used directly , without going through the reduction process , for the low yield epoxidation of cyclohexene . polymer - attached Cp2ZrCl2 wa used in hydrozirconation and carbon monoxide reduction study . thermolysis of zirconocene dicarbonyl at <nUm> ° C in toluene in the presence of an equimolar amount of trimethylphosphite produced dark green crystal of Cp2Zr(CO)[P(OCH3)3] ( 5 ) in about <nUm> % isolated yield . <nUm> wa characterized by NMR and IR spectroscopy ( v(CO) <nUm> cm-1 ) and by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . <nUm> crystallizes in the triclinic space group P1 with cell constant a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , α <nUm> , β <nUm> , and γ <nUm> ° ; z = <nUm> . characteristic bond distance ( for the two crystallographically independent molecule ) are COZr <nUm> , <nUm> ; CO <nUm> , <nUm> ; PZr <nUm> , <nUm> Å . spectroscopic parameter of <nUm> are compared with those of <nUm> group IV metallocene carbonyl complex described in the literature . dimeric metallocene dihydrides [(e5-t-BuC5H4)2MH(m-H)]2 ( <nUm> ; m = Zr , Hf ) react with elemental chalcogens to give the four - membered metallacycles [(e5-t-BuC5H4)2M(m-E)]2 ( <nUm> , e = Se ; <nUm> , e = S ) . In the case of sulfur , the reaction also give (e5-t-BuC5H4)2MS5 ( 4 ) . both <nUm> and <nUm> are shown to come from subsequent reaction of the primary insertion product (e5-t-BuC5H4)2M(SH)2 . the one - electron reduction of zirconocene and hafnocene dichloride Cp2MCl2 ( m = Zr or Hf ) yield the corresponding anion Cp2MCl2- . there is no cleavage of an MCl bond , in contrast to the result in the case of the analogous titanocene and vanadocene dichloride . the compound (butadiene)zirconocene reacts readily at room temperature with iron carbonyl complex under CC coupling of the conjugated diene ligand with a carbonyl carbon atom . starting from C5FeO5 and (C4H6)ZrCp2 the metallacyclic (p-allylzirconoxy)carbene iron complex is obtained in good yield . from the (butadiene)zirconocene equilibrium mixture ( 12a 14a = <nUm> <nUm> ) the preferred reaction of the (s-trans-e4-diene)metallocene isomer with C5FeO5 or Fe(CO)4PPh3 take place . (s-cis-Butadiene)ZrCp2 ( 14a ) , which is a stronger nucleophile than it isomer ( 12a ) , appears to be inert towards these metal carbonyl under kinetically controlled reaction condition . this suggests a novel mechanism for the m-carbonyl → m-carbene transformation . A new method ha been developed to synthezise group <nUm> metallocene ylides . Ph3PCH2 reacts with in situ generated (e2-ethene)MCp2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) , (e2-aryne)MCp2 ( m = Ti , Zr ) , or with ( e4-conjugated diene)MCp2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) via intramolecular hydrogen transfer to form metallocene ylides Cp2M(R)CHPPh3 . In some case competitive methylene transfer occurs leading to four - membered metallacycles . the metallocene ylides all exhibit a substantial metal to carbon p-interaction , increasing in strength on going from hafnium to titanium a the central metal atom . ylide reactivity is greatly reduced . with a non-enolizable ketone , Cp2Zr(CH2CHCHCH3)CHPPh3 reacts via the reverse of the metallocene ylide forming reaction . with enolizable ketone , zirconocene or hafnocene ylides serve a base and form metal enolates . the resulting enolate ( e ) / ( z ) ratio strongly depends on the group r of the metallocene ylide base Cp2Zr(R)CHPPh3 . (e4-Butadiene)zirconocene reacts with (e-C5H4Cl)Co(CO)2 at ambient temperature to yield the metallacyclic zirconoxycarbene complex Cp2Zr(C4H6)(OC)Co(CO)(C5H4Cl) ( 6 ) . In contrast to the analogous chlorine - free carbene complex <nUm> equilibration with the starting material could not be observed for <nUm> . complex <nUm> crystallizes in space group P21 / c with cell constant a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , β <nUm> ° . the solid state structure of <nUm> and <nUm> , a determined by x-ray diffraction , are very similar . this indicates that the electronic influence of the ( C5H4X ) ligand on the CCoO bond of the starting material may be the reason for the observed different equilibrium ratio between carbene complex and the educts Cp2Zr(butadiene) and (e-C5H4X)Co(CO)2 . zirconocene ( n-octyl ) chloride , [(e5-C5H5)2Zr(n-Oct)Cl] , prepared in situ from 1- , 2- , or 3-octene and zirconocene hydrogen chloride , ha been found to react smoothly with <nUm> molar equivalent of stannic chloride to give moderate to high yield of n-octyltin(IV) trichloride at room temperature . four zirconocene system , each containing tertiary phosphine functionality indirectly linked to either or both cyclopentadienyl ring , are described . unlike the phosphinomethylzirconocenes , in which the metal and the phosphine strongly influence each other 's basic chemistry , it ha been found that a variety of transformation may be carried out at either site on the more indirectly linked system without interference from the other . thus reduction and hydrozirconation proceed normally at the Zr center , and quaternization and complexation to a second metal may be achieved at the phosphine . two " early - late " multimetallic system containing Zr and Co have been prepared . reduction and acylation at Co proceed without interference from Zr ; however , attempt to generate hydride at Zr in the bimetallic system were unsuccessful . elementary sulfur and selenium combine ( in boiling heptane ) with [(tBuCp)2-Zr(C6H4R)2] ( cp = e5-C5H4 ; r = CH3O ) to give the corresponding dichalcogenophenylenezirconocene . with tellurium , the reaction proceeds only at lower temperature ( in boiling hexane ) , affording the first ditellurophenylenezirconocene . As no metallacycle wa obtained with the cp ligand or when the metal is Hf , complex of the general type [(RCp)2MSe2C6H4-o] ( m = Ti , Zr , Hf ; r = H , t-Bu , CH3 ) have been synthesized by allowing metallocene dichloride to react with potassium benzenediselenolate , prepared by cleaving [(t-BuCp)2ZrSe2C6H4-o] with t-BuOK . the reaction of zirconocene dichloride with disodium terephthalate in the two - phase system H2O / CCl3H yield the novel cyclic three - nuclear complex tris[di(p-cyclopentadienyl) (m-terephthalato)zirconium(IV) ] ( 5 ) , which can be isolated a the CCl2H2 solvate ( sol : <nUm> <nUm> ) . the three dicarboxylato bridge act a ( <nUm> + <nUm> ) - dentate ligand , such that each Zr atom ha three ligating O atom in addition to it cp ligand and thus ha an 18-electron configuration . the twenty-seven-membered central ring of <nUm> is puckered . the structure of <nUm> ha been solved by an x-ray diffraction study . the complex crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21 / n , with z = <nUm> , and the lattice parameter a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , β <nUm> ° . the zirconocene ylide Cp2Zr(Ph)CHPPh3 ( 1a ) reacts with benzyl isonitrile at temperature above <nUm> ° C by insertion into the ZrC(ylide) bond to give the (e2-iminoacyl)zirconocene complex Cp2Zr(Ph)[e2-N(CH2Ph)C(CHPPh3)] ( 2a ) . complex 2a crystallizes in the space group P <nUm> - with a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , α <nUm> , β <nUm> , γ <nUm> ° . the x-ray diffraction study , showed 2a the ( e2-iminoacyl ) metallocene stereoisomer to have an " RN - inside " arrangement . the bonding parameter of the Ph3PCHC[Zr]NCH2Ph unit are consistent with 2a being an internally lewis - acid coordinated stabilized ylide . similarly the hafnocene ylide Cp2Hf(C2H5)CHPPh3 ( 1c ) reacts with benzyl isonitrile to give 2c which wa identified by x-ray crystallography . it crystallizes in space group I <nUm> - with a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , α <nUm> , β <nUm> , γ <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> . the MC and MN bond of the ( e2-iminoacyl ) metallocene moiety in 2c are slightly shorter than those in 2a . (e4-Butadiene)-zirconocene and -hafnocene each react with two molar equivalent of 2-methyl-2-nitrosopropane to give nine - membered metallacycles Cp2MON(R)CH2CH = CHCH2N(R)O ( 8a : r = t-Bu ; m = Zr ; 8b : r = t-Bu , m = Hf ) , which have a trans-carbon-carbon double bond in the ring . In solution two different dynamic process can be observed by variable temperature NMR spectroscopy . enantiomerization of the chiral ring system ( dent ‡ ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> kcal / mol ) is observed at high temperature , whereas at low temperature an equilibration process involving hindered N-CMe3 rotation becomes slow on the NMR time scale ( DGrot ‡ ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> kcal / mol ) . none synthesis of disubstituted , tetramethylethanediyl-bridged titanocene derivative (CH3)4C2(1-C5H3-3-R)2TiCl2 , with r t-butyl , trimethylsilyl , isopropyl , a,a-dimethylbenzyl and 1-phenylcyclohexyl , by reductive coupling of the appropriately substituted 6,6-dimethylpentafulvenes with Mg / CCl4 and reaction of the resulting di-Grignard compound with TiCl3*3THF are described along with those of several zirconium analogue . the reaction sequence in each case give , together with the desired racemate , comparable amount of the corresponding meso-configurated complex . the NMR data for the racemic and meso diastereomers of these compound and crystal structure of one meso and several racemic representative are reported . the reaction of zirconocene dichloride with acetylene dicarboxylic acid in the two - phase system H2O / CCl2H2 and H2O / CCl3H give the polymeric compound [Cp2Zr(m-OCOCCOCO)]n ( 1 ) and [ Cp2Zr(m-OCOCCOCO) · CHCl3]n ( 2 ) in crystalline form . x-ray structure investigation show that in both compound the polymer chain have <nUm> symmetry and are packed parallel to each other in the crystal . the dicarboxylato bridge act a ( <nUm> + <nUm> ) - dentate ligand , such that each Zr atom ha three ligation O atom in addition to it cp ligand and thus ha an 18-electron configuration . insertion of borohydride into the metallaoxirane CZr bond take place upon treatment of the (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer <nUm> with 9-borabicyclo[3.3.1]nonane . the resulting metallacyclic dimer [Cp2ZrOCH2B(C8H14)H]2 ( 4 ) ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction . complex <nUm> is a model for an intermediate stage of the insertion of CO-derived methylene group into metalhydrogen bond , such a is thought to occur in fischer - tropsch type process . many metal carbonyl add to reactive ( m2-olefin ) group <nUm> metallocene type complex ( e.g. (m2-aryne)titanocene or -zirconocene , (butadiene)ZrCp2 ) forming metallacyclic titanoxy- or zirconoxycarbene complex . the metallacyclic (p-allyl)zirconoxycarbene complex derived from (s-trans-m4-butadiene)zirconocene and hexacarbonyltungsten add to organic carbonyl substrate to give nine - membered metallacyclic carbene complex Cp2ZrOC[W(CO)5]CH2CHCHCH2CR1R2O , exhibiting trans-CC double bond . the zirconoxycarbene complex undergo stereoselective base - induced alkylation and wittig - olefination reaction . oxygen - bridged dimeric (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene is obtained in high yield upon treatment of the carbon monoxide hydrozirconation product with methyllithium . the [(e2-CH2O)ZrCp2] - dimer undergoes various insertion reaction with aluminum hydride or boron hyridge reagent . metal carbonyl complex insert selectively into one metallaoxirane CZr bond of [(e2-CH2O)ZrCp2]2 to give cyclic Cp2ZrOC-[ML2]CH2O containing zirconoxycarbene complex . titanocene , zirconocene , and hafnocene dichloride were reduced in the presence of terminally disubstituted 1,6-heptadiyne or 1,7-octadiyne to produce dicyclopentadienylmetallabicyclooctadienes and -nonadienes . the compound were characterized by elemental analysis and 1H and 13C NMR spectrometry , and (C5H5)2HfC7H6[Si(CH3)3]2 wa characterized by x-ray diffraction technique . the compound crystallized in the triclinic space group P1 in a unit cell of dimension a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , α <nUm> , β <nUm> , γ <nUm> ° and V <nUm> A3 . refinement wa done to a final agreement for <nUm> reflection with F023s(F02) of R(F) = <nUm> . the oligomeric hydrido zirconium complex [Cp2Zr(H)(CH2PPh2)]n ( 1 ) reacts with (e4-butadiene)zirconocene to yield the ( m-1-e1:1,2-e2-butenyl ) , ( m-phosphinomethylene ) doubly bridged binuclear zirconocene complex [Cp2-Zr(m-CHCHC2H5)(m-CH2PPh2)ZrCp2] <nUm> . complex <nUm> reacts with butadiene to give <nUm> and Ph2PCH3 . At <nUm> ° C complex <nUm> catalyzes the chemoselective hydrogenation of 1,3-cyclooctadiene to cyclooctene . formation of a binuclear m-alkenyl zirconium(IV) / zirconium (II) intermediate , similar to <nUm> , is proposed to explain the effective protection of the remaininig CC double bond in the catalytic cycle . the (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer (Cp2ZrOCH2)2 ( 7 ) insert CO2 into the zirconium to carbon bond of the metallaoxirane moiety to give [(Cp2ZrOCH2)(Cp2ZrOCH2OCO)] ( 8 ) . reaction with diphenylketene <nUm> give the cyclodimeric <nUm> : <nUm> addition product (Cp2ZrOCH2OCCPh2)2 ( 10 ) via the mono-insertion product <nUm> . similarly , treatment of <nUm> with t-butylisocyanate yield the intermediate complex [(Cp2ZrOCH2)(Cp2ZrOCH2OCNCMe3)] ( 11 ) which give the final product (Cp2ZrOCH2OCNCMe3)2 ( 12 ) . here two five - membered metallacycles are joined together by oxygen bridge via a central four - membered OZr metallacycle . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes in space group P21 / n with cell parameter a <nUm> , b <nUm> , c <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° ; z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . 3-Arsolenes , R1AsCH2C(Me)C(R2)CH2 ( R1 = ph , me , t-Bu , R2 = H , me ) , are obtained in good yield from chloroarsines , R1AsCl2 , and zirconocene diene complex . they react with methyl iodide at room temperature to give arsonium salt and with Cr(CO)5THF to form the corresponding chromium complex . reaction of M2'[(e5-C5H4)2Si(CH3)2] ( M' = Li , Na , K ) with MCl4 produced the known complex [(e5-C5H4)2Si(CH3)2]MCl2 ( m = Ti ( 1 ) and Zr ( 2 ) . along with the predominant product in each case a new titanium and zirconium compound is isolated . treatment of the complex <nUm> and <nUm> with C4H11LiSi give the novel derivative [(e5-C5H4)2Si(CH3)2]M[CH2Si(CH3)3]2 ( m = Ti ( 4 ) and Zr ( 5 ) ) which have been characterized by NMR and mass spectrometry and in the case of <nUm> by an x-ray structural determination . (e4-Isoprene)zirconocene reacts with hexacarbonyltungsten to give the metallacyclic (p-allyl)zirconoxycarbene complex Cp2ZrOC[W(CO)5]CH2CHC(CH3)CH2 ( 14a ) , the structure of which ha been determined by an x-ray diffraction study . only one regioisomer is formed , that with the methyl substituent at the meso-position ( C2 ) of the p-allyl-carbene ligand chain . complex 14a undergoes insertion of one equivalent of acetone to give the nine - membered metallacyclic zirconoxycarbene complex Cp2ZrOC[W(CO)5]CH2CHC(CH3)CH2CR1R2O ( <nUm> , R1 = R2 = CH3 ) , which ha an e-configurated endocyclic CC double bond . the chiral metallacycle <nUm> undergoes a thermally induced intramolecular enantiomerization , the activation barrier for which ha been determined by dynamic 1H NMR spectroscopy to be DGent ≠ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol . with pinacolone , 14a form an analogous nine - membered metallacyclic zirconoxycarbene complex ( only one diastereoisomer observed under thermodynamic control ) , which undergoes a stereo - unselective base - induced a-alkylation reaction to yield a <nUm> / <nUm> mixture of diastereomeric c6-monomethylated carbene complex . (e5-Formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer [Cp2ZrOCH2]2 ( 5 ) reacts with tert-butylisothiocyanat at <nUm> ° C by sequential insertion of the heterocumulene SC into the metallaoxirane CZr linkage . the mono-insertion product [(Cp2ZrOCH2)*(Cp2ZrOCH2C[NCMe3]S)] ( 13 ) is detected a an intermediate by 1H / 13C NMR spectroscopy . the final reaction product is [Cp2ZrOCH2C[NCMe3]S]2 ( 14 ) . the five - membered metallacyclic subunit of <nUm> are connected by mean of the ring oxygen atom to give a metallatricyclic dimer with a OZr containing central four - membered ring system . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes with C6D6 solvent in space group P21 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . titanocene and zirconocene complex with a phenyl or 1-naphthyl substituent in one b-position of each C5 - ring ligand and with an interannular tetramethylethano- or dimethylsilano-bridge have been prepared . racemic complex isomer , which are formed together with varying amount of their meso isomer , were separated from the latter and characterised by 1H NMR spectroscopy and x-ray crystallographic study . the hydrosilation of olefin such a styrene , 1-hexene , and 2-pentene with diphenylsilane can be carried out with catalyst generated from zirconocene dichloride and two equivalent of butyllithium . complete regioselectivity is observed a only terminal organosilicon product are produced ( ∼ <nUm> % ) . In the case of styrene , three major product are formed : diphenylphenethylsilane ( <nUm> % ) , trans-1-diphenylsilyl-2-phenylethene ( <nUm> % ) , and ethylbenzene ( <nUm> % ) . the product distribution wa found to be dependent on reagent concentration : reaction run with excess diphenylsilane favored diphenylphenethylsilane ; excess styrene favored trans-1-diphenylsilyl-2-phenylethene . extensive H / d exchange is observed in the hydrosilation of styrene with Ph2SiD2 . polymerization of Me3SiSiHMe2 , Me2HSiSiHMe2 and MeH2SiSiH2Me take place readily in the presence of Cp2MR2 catalyst ( CP = CH ; m = Ti , Zr ; r = me , nBu ) in the absence of a solvent ( " polymerization in bulk " ) to give a mixture containing trisilanes , tetrasilanes , pentasilanes , higher oligosilanes and polysilanes . depending on the reaction condition different proportion of linear oligo- and poly-silanes are obtained . MeH2SiSiH2Me also yield branched oligo- and poly-silanes . polymerization of MeH2siSiH2Me " in bulk " in the presence of a catalytic amount of Cp2MR2 ( CP = CH ; m = Ti , Zr ; r = me , nBu ) lead to a new type of polysilane polymer , poly(methylsilane) , (MeSiHx)n , which is thought to be the first organosilicon " living polymer " . MeH2SiSiH2Me is also polymerized in inert solvent in the presence of Cp2MR2 ( CP = CH ; m = Ti , Zr ; r = me , nBu , ph ) catalyst . the reaction of (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer ( 3 ) with hafnocene dichloride ( 5 ) at room temperature give the heterobimetallic complex [ m-(e1-O : e2-C,O-formaldehyde)(Cp2ZrCl)(Cp2HfCl) ] . from thermochemical consideration it is suggested that methylene migration from zirconium to hafnium occurs during the reaction , favouring the regioisomer Cp2(Cl)Zr-O-CH2-Hf(Cl)Cp2 ( 7 ) under equilibrium condition . hydrozirconation-deuterolysis of (E)-3-methoxy-1-phenyl-1-propene wa found to give a- and o-deuterated propylbenzenes after elimination of the ether function . an unforeseen higher degree of benzylic substitution in the propylbenzenes wa observed . In an effort to account for the regiochemical outcome of the reaction , hydrozirconation of propenylbenzenes with mixed reagent and deuterozirconation wa investigated . hydrozirconation of (E)-3-propenol-2-propenol result in loss of the hydroxyl group to only a small extent , and after hydrozirconation and deuterolysis fair yield of benzenopropan-g-d-ol are formed . carbonyl insertion into 3-hydroxyl-1-phenyl-1-zirconocene-propane give low yield of the lactone dihydro-3-phenyl-2(3H)-furanone . reaction of tris(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyllithium with zirconium and hafnium tetrachloride affords 1,1',2,2',4,4'-hexakis(trimethylsilyl)zirconocene dichloride and 1,1',2,2',4,4'-hexakis(trimethyl-silyl)hafnocene dichloride . these complex show hindered rotation of the
