cyclopentadienyl ligand , with barrier to rotation of <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol and <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol being found for the zirconium and hafnium complex , respectively . these value are compared with those of the corresponding 1,1',3,3'-tetrakis(trimethylsiyl)metallocene dichloride and a model is proposed to account for the large difference in rotational barrier . the interaction of zirconocene dichloride derivative with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) wa studied in toluene medium under argon and ethylene atmosphere by IR , 13H , 13C , 27Al and 29Si NMR spectroscopy . data relating to polymerization of ethylene on these catalyst are given . the five - membered metallacycle Cp2Zr(CR1 = CR2CR2 = CR1 ) ( <nUm> , R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = ph ) is a suitable starting material for the in situ generation of the reactive (e2-phenyltrimethylsilylethyne)zirconocene ( 3 ) . thus , thermolysis of <nUm> ( <nUm> ° C ) with trimethylphosphane give Cp2Zr(Me3SiC*z.tbnd ; CPh)(PMe3) ( 8 ) and free Me3SiCCPh ( 4 ) . subsequent reaction of <nUm> with acetophenone produce Cp2Zr[CR1 = CR2CMePhO ] ( <nUm> , R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = ph ) . thermolysis of <nUm> in the presence of CpW(CO)3H also result in the liberation of one quivalent of <nUm> . the reactive intermediate <nUm> is protonated to give Cp2Zr(CR1 = CHR2)(m-OC)W(CO)2CP ( <nUm> , R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = ph ) . treatment of <nUm> with [HNEt3][BPh4] in acetonitrile give the cationic Cp2Zr(CR1 = CR2CMe = NH)(CH3CN)+ ( 3a : R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = ph ) and it regioisomer 13b ( R1 and R2 exchanged ) . there is evidence that the complex <nUm> are formed by acetonitrile addition to thermally - generated <nUm> to give Cp2Zr(CR1 = CR2CMe = N ) , which is then subsequently protonated at the basic ring nitrogen . these reaction show that a readily available metallacyclopentadiene system can be used a a convenient synthetic equivalent of a very reactive (e2-alkyne)metallocene complex by thermally induced equilibration in the presence of suitable trapping reagent . methyl e2-1,2-diphenylhydrazido(1-)zirconocene ( 1 ) ha been synthesized from the monopotassium salt of 1,2-diphenylhydrazine and Cp2Zr(Me)(Cl) . heating <nUm> in THF cause extrusion of methane , generating the transient hydrazido complex Cp2Zr(N2Ph2) ( 2 ) which is trapped by solvent to yield the THF adduct Cp2Zr(N2Ph2)(THF) ( 3 ) . the THF ligand of compound <nUm> wa replaced with a variety of s-donor ligand to form the ligated hydrazido complex Cp2Zr(N2Ph2)(L) ( L pyridine ) ( 4 ) , PMe3 ( 5 ) , NCPh ( 6 ) and CNCMe3 ( 7 ) ) . compound <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the THF adduct <nUm> also undergoes a reaction involving insertion of alkyne into one of it metal-nitrogen bond . thus , reaction of <nUm> with 2-butyne and 3-hexyne lead to zirconocene 2,3-diazametallacyclopentenes <nUm> and <nUm> respectively . the structure of these metallacycles wa supported by an x-ray diffraction study of <nUm> . compound <nUm> also reacted with phenylacetylene and acetophenone via deprotonation to furnish the e2-hydrazido(1-)acetylide ( 10 ) and enolate ( 11 ) , respectively . thermolysis of bis(2-furyl)zirconocene <nUm> at <nUm> ° C give 1,1-bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)-1-zircona-2-oxa-6-(2'-furyl)cyclohexa-3,5-diene <nUm> via a coupled s,s-exchange reaction . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction and shown to be monomeric in the crystal and to have a non-planar twist - like oxametallacyclohexadiene ring conformation . the reaction of methylzirconocenechloride with 2-bornenyllithium yield (2-bornenyl)methylzirconocene ( 10a ) . carbonylation of 10a take place exclusively by CO-insertion into the Zr - c(sp2) bond to give Cp2ZrMe(e2-OC-C10H15) ( 16a ) . the corresponding hafnium complex 10b reacts analogously to give 16b . complex 16a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction , and found to contain an e2-acyl ligand bonded to zirconium in the thermodynamically favored " o-inside " arrangement with the following bonding parameter : d Zr-C(acyl) = <nUm> Å , d Zr-O(acyl) = <nUm> Å , d CO = <nUm> Å , angle O(acyl)ZrC(acyl) = <nUm> ° , ZrC(acyl)O(acyl) = <nUm> ° . titanocene and zirconocene ketene acetal derivative have been prepared by reaction of the respective metallocene dichloride with the lithium enolate of isobutyric acid methyl ester . the crystal structure of C14ClH16O2Ti is reported . the reaction of the ferrocene-1,1'-diselenol in the presence of NEt3 , or the corresponding dilithium salt , with the tert-butylzirconocene dichloride led to the dimeric [3,3']ferrocenophane [ C10FeH8Se2Zr (C5H4tBu)2]2 ( 1 ) , a opposed to the result published previously ( B. gautheron et G. tainturier , J. organomet . chem. , <nUm> ( 1984 ) C30 . however , the 1H NMR spectrum of <nUm> recorded at different temperature correspond well with those of a [3]ferrocenophane exhibiting a dynamic inversion of the " ane " bridge . the x-ray structure only allowed the choice between the two possible arrangement . surprisingly , monomeric specie were effectively isolated from the reaction when zirconocene dichloride and tert-butylhafnocene dichloride were used . the dependence of the dimeric structure on the nature of the element present must be rationalized . monomeric zirconocene dipicolinate complex , which have a formal 18-electron configuration , are stable towards water and relatively inert against aqueous ClH . methylmagnesium chloride attack these complex at the dipicolinate carboxyl group and subsequent reaction with aqueous ClH give 2,6-diacetyl pyridine and the zirconocene dichloride . other dicarboxylates , such a 3,4-dimethoxyfurane-2,5-dicarboxylate or isophthalate , form binuclear zirconocene complex , in which one bidentate and one monodentate carboxylate ligand generate a formal 18-electron configuration . these complex react with methylmagnesium chloride to give the respective zirconocene dimethyl complex , i.e. by normal replacement of CO bond by C2H3 bond . the mono- and bis-cyclopentadienyl compound 1-(Cp'')-4-(CH3)C6H4 ( 1 ) and <nUm> , 4-(Cp'')2C6H4 ( 2 ) ( cp'' = 3,4-dimethylcyclopenta-1,3-diene-1-yl ) have been synthesized . the reaction of the lithium salt of <nUm> and <nUm> with CpZrCl3 · dme ( dme = dimethoxyethane ) and Cp*ZrCl3(CP* C2H3 ) yielded the mono- and bi-nuclear bridged zirconocenes 1-(Cp''ZrCpCl2)-4-(CH3)C6H4 ( 3 ) , 1,4-(Cp''ZrCpCl2)2C6H4 ( 4 ) and 1,4-(Cp''ZrCp*Cl2)2C6H4 ( 5 ) . when activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , the mono- and bi-nuclear zirconocenes <nUm> and <nUm> catalyse the polymerization of propene . the influence of the catalyst composition on the polymerization kinetics and molecular weight is discussed . the possible role of an a-agostic interaction in the course of an olefin insertion at a ziegler - natta catalytic centre in [Cp2Zr(C2H4)CH3]+ ha been studied by extended huckel calculation . it is shown that in a cationic zirconocene catalyst an a-agostic H Zr contact play no role in a ground state specie but becomes increasingly important along the reaction coordinate for the CC bond - forming insertion reaction . this can be traced to the weakening of the ZrCalkyl bond and the simultaneous transformation to a more electron deficient zirconium specie . In contrast , a b-agostic interaction in [ Cp2Zr(C2H4)CH2CH3+ lead to a stable ground state b-H Zr contact . the agostic interaction of one hydrogen on the a-carbon is also compared to an agostic contact of two a-hydrogens . the behaviour of orbital energy and the H Zr overlap population ha been examined a a function of the angle of methyl tilt and olegfin shift . zirconocene , generated in situ , reacts with trimethylsilylacetylene to form the dimeric complex [ cp2Zr ( C CSiMe3)]2 a a byproduct . this compound ha been fully characterized and it solid- state structure established by an x-ray single crystal structure analysis . the phosphido-bridged dinuclear zirconocene(III) complex cis-[Cp'2Zr(m-PHR)]2 ( cp'2 C5H4Me , r tBu ( 1 ) , ad ( 2 ) ) are isolated from the reaction of Cp'2ZrCl2 with solvent - free LiPHR ( r C4H9(tBu) , C2H3 ( ad ) ) . it can be shown by 31P NMR spectroscopy that the complex Cp'2Zr(PHR)2 and { A figure is presented } are also formed , a well a the oxidation product of LiPHR , meso- and d,l-P2H2R2 . <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized spectroscopically ( NMR , IR , MS ) and by x-ray structure determination . only one isomer ( ci ) is present in the solid state and in solution . the PZr bond length range from <nUm> Å to <nUm> Å in <nUm> , and from <nUm> Å to <nUm> Å in <nUm> . the central PZr ring of <nUm> and <nUm> is slightly puckered ( dihedral angle : <nUm> ° ( 1 ) , <nUm> ° ( 2 ) ) . the long Zr3*Zr distance of <nUm> Å ( 1 ) and <nUm> Å ( 2 ) indicates the absence of zrinteraction . Methyl(N-pyrrolyl)zirconocene ( 8a ) reacts with tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane selectively by transfer of the heterocyclic ligand to give the methylzirconocene cation , which is an active ethylene polymerization catalyst when generated in situ in toluene . In contrast , (diethylamido)methylzirconocene ( 8b ) undergoes only transfer of the methyl group when treated with the B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> lewis acid , to five the (diethylamido)zirconocene cation ( 10b ) . the [ ( et <nUm> N)ZrCp <nUm> + MeB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - ] salt is not stable and rapidly reacts at room temperature with methane elimination and formation of a cationic ( η <nUm> -iminoacyl)metallocene system . the resulting [ cp <nUm> zr(e <nUm> -MeC = NEt ) + HB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - ] specie ( 11b ) is isolated with an <nUm> % yield . Methyl(N-piperidyl)zirconocene ( 8c ) reacts similarly when treated with B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> to give the ( η <nUm> -iminoacylium)zirconocene ( 11c ) via the intermediate 10a . reaction of indenyllithium with 1,1-dichlorosilacyclobutane gave a mixture of diastereomeric isomer of 1,1-bis(10ineenyl)-1-silacyclobutane ( 1 ) , and the product wa in turn converted into diastereomeric (1,3-propanediyl)silylene-bis(1-indenyl)dichlorozirconium complex ( 2 ) in a <nUm> : <nUm> racemic : meso ratio . complex <nUm> wa activated with either methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) or Ph3CB(C6F5)4 to perform ethylene and propylene polymerization over a very board range of temperature of polymerization ( <nUm> ° C ≤ tp ≤ <nUm> ° C ) . variation of the polymerization activity ( A ) and molecular weight ( MW ) with tp were investigated a well a the isotactic yield ( IY ) in the case of propylene polymerization . comparison of those result with other closely related ansa - zirconocene precursor were also made . the terminal nitrogen atom of phenyl azide and diphenyldiazomethane insert into one of the carbon-zirconium bond of zirconacyclopentanes to give novel <nUm> electron azazirconacycles that are very stable towards hydrolysis . an x-ray diffraction study ha been carried out on the triazenido alkyl zirconocene complex <nUm> . hydrogenolysis of the diphenyldiazomethane inserted zirconacycle give a primary amine , the first example of the direct formation of amine from organozirconium compound . A variety of new chiral one-carbon - bridged metallocene derivative of titanium and zirconium ha been prepared . addition of the anion of cyclopentadiene , indene and fluorene to 6-t-butylfulvene produced the ligand t-BuCH(C5H5)R ( r = CH , <nUm> ; C9H7 , <nUm> ; C13H9 , <nUm> ) . the reaction of the ligand 8-10 with n-BuLi produced the corresponding bis-anions , which were reacted with titanium or zirconium tetrachloride at low temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) , to produce the complex t-BuCH(e5-C5H4)(R)MCl2 ( r = e5-C5H4 , m = Ti , <nUm> ; r = e5-C5H4 , m = Zr , <nUm> , r = e5-C9H6 , m = T , <nUm> ; r = e5-C9H6 , m = Zr , <nUm> ; r = e5-C13H8 , m = Zr , <nUm> ) . the chlorine atom in complex <nUm> and <nUm> can be easily replaced by methyl group producing the corresponding dimethyl derivative <nUm> and <nUm> . reaction of zirconocene - alkene complex Cp2Zr(CH2CHR)(PR'3) ( r H , me , et , SiR''3 or Ar ) with aldehyde or ketone were investigated . zirconocene-ethylene , -propylene or 1-butene complex reacted with aldehyde or ketone at terminal carbon of alkene to give the corresponding alcohol after hydrolysis with a high regioselectivity . A similar type of reaction product wa also obtained by a reaction of zirconacyclopentanes with aldehyde . this reaction proceeded via b-b'carbon-carbon bond cleavage of zirconacyclopentanes . A reaction of zirconocene - vinylsilane complex with ketone afforded 3-trimethylsilyl-1-oxa-2-zirconacyclopentanes with an excellent regioselectivity . carbon-carbon bond formation occurred exclusively at the terminal carbon of vinylsilanes . their corresponding g-silylalcohols were obtained after hydrolysis . the product showed that vinylsilanes reacted with carbonyl compound at the b-carbon to silyl group . it is in sharp contrast to the conventional reaction of vinylsilanes of which the a-carbon normally attacked electrophiles . the reaction of styrene and it derivative with pentan-3-one on zirconium gave a mixture of two regioisomers . substituents of alkene tend to be in a-position to Zr in 1-oxa-2-zirconacyclopentanes . this orientation showed a different aspect of the formation of 1-oxa-2-zirconacyclopentanes from the alkene - alkene coupling reaction on zirconium . the regioselectivity of the reaction with carbonyl compound decreased in this order ; r = alkyl > silyl > aryl . hydrozirconation of various alkenylboronic ester <nUm> with H(Cl)ZrCp2 produce a new class of bidentate lewis acid a crystalline solid or oil , <nUm> , in 81-96 % yield . product <nUm> were characterized by IR , NMR , and in selected case elemental analysis . the reaction of CCl2P2Zr ( cp CH ) with solvent - free LiPH(2,4,6-tBu3C6H2) yield the terminal zirconocene phosphido complex Cp2Zr(Cl){PH(2,4,6-tBu3C6H2)} ( 1 ) ( <nUm> : <nUm> reaction ) or Cp2Zr{PH(2,4,6-t Bu3C6H2)}2 ( 2 ) ( <nUm> : <nUm> reaction ) . <nUm> is more readily obtained from the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with H2P(2,4,6- tBu3C6H2 ) in the presence of Mg . <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized spectroscopically ( NMR , IR , MS ) . an x-ray structure determination of <nUm> show that the PZr bond length ( PZr <nUm> Å , P2Zr <nUm> Å ) are identical . <nUm> and <nUm> exhibit dynamic NMR behaviour ( 1H ) indicating rotation around the PC bond and inversion of the phophido group . two series of group <nUm> bent metallocene complex bearing cholestanol - derived substituents at their cp - ring have been prepared . 5a-Cholestan-3 a-ol wa converted to the 3a-mesylate . nucleophilic substitution with CpNa , followed by deprotonation and treatment with ZrCl4(THF)2 gave bis[e5-(5a-cholestan-3b-yl)cyclopentadienyl]zirconium dichloride 3b-5 . 5a-Cholestan-3-one <nUm> wa converted to the corresponding fulvene , methyl lithium wa added and deprotonation and addition to ZrCl4(THF)2 furnished bis[e5-(3b-methyl- 5a-cholestan-3a-yl)cyclopentadienyl]zirconium dichloride ( 11b ) . treatment of the chiral cp - substituted zirconocene dichloride with a large excess of methyl alumoxane gave homogeneous ziegler catalyst . propene polymerization proceeded with overall stereochemical chain end control to give partly isotactic polypropylene . the zirconocene alkyne complex Cp2Zr(THF)(Me3SiCCSiMe3) ( 1 ) and Cp2Zr(py)(Me3SiC CSiMe3 ) ( 2 ) react with acetone to yield the new zirconadihydrofurane complex Cp2ZrOC(Me2) C(SiMe3)C(SiMe3) ( 3 ) . reaction of <nUm> with tolan give , under substitution of the alkyne moiety , a further dihydrofurane compound Cp2ZrOC(Me2)C(Ph)C(Ph) ( 4 ) . complex <nUm> and <nUm> are characterized by NMR and x-ray structure analysis . they are compared with the known titanocene complex cp2 TiOC(Me2)C(Ph)C(Ph) ( 5 ) to study the influence of the metal m = Ti , Zr and the substituents r = ph , SiMe3 in selected metalladihydrofuranes Cp2MOC(Me2)C ( r ) C ( r ) . although the structure of complex <nUm> and <nUm> are similar , the complex display different reactivity . thus <nUm> is capable of reacting with tolan , CO2 and water at room temperature , while <nUm> is inactive towards these compound under the same condition . 3-Arsolenes R-AsCH2C(Me)C(R')CH2(R = ph , me , tBu , Cl , R' = H , me ) are readily obtained from zirconocene-butadiene complex and RAsCl2 . alkylation with methyl iodide give arsonium salt [R(Me)AsCH2C(Me)C(R')CH2]I ( r = ph , me , tBu , R' = H , me ) , treatment with sulphur give sulphide R(S)AsCH2 C(Me)C(Me) - CH2 ( r = me , tBu ) , while oxidation with br2 or Cl2O2S result in ring cleavage . from chloroarsolene ClAsCH2C(Me)C(Me)CH2 substitution product R-AsCH2C(Me)C(Me)CH2 ( r = I , H , SPh , OMe , NMe2 ) a well a coupling product with AsAs , As2O , and As2S unit were synthesized . In addition , a number of arsolene complex with the metal chromium , molybdenum , tungsten , and ruthenium is described . we have demonstrated a very efficient ( <nUm> step , <nUm> % yield from 1-octen-7-yne and 1,2-diiodobenzene ) and novel synthesis of 1,2-bis(9-bicyclo[4.3.0]-non-1,6-dinyl)benzen . we utilized for the firstime in a bis(cyclopentadiene) synthesis the double pauson - khand cyclization and shapiro - elimination method . the double pauson - khand cyclization is also successful in the preparation of ethylene-bridged bis(cyclopentadienes) . A novel iodine - promoted elimination of allyl methyl ether wa also applied in the preparation of bis(cyclopentadienes) . the solid state structure of 1,2-bis(9-bicyclo[4.3.0]-non-1,6-dienyl)benzenedichlorotitanium ( dl-4a ) wa obtained and it show a very obtuse angle between the cyclopentadienyl substituents . the crstallographic data for dl-4a are a follows : C24Cl2H24Ti , monoclinic , C2 / c . a = <nUm> A ̊ , b = <nUm> A ̊ , c = <nUm> A ̊ , β = <nUm> ° , volume <nUm> A3 , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> % , goodness of fit <nUm> . the six - membered ring annulated C <nUm> - bridged ansa - metallocene [(4-cyclopentadienylidene)-4,7,7-trimethyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 6a ) wa treated with " butadiene-magnesium " to yield the corresponding ( s-cis-e <nUm> -butadiene)ansa-zirconocene complex a a mixture of two diastereoisomers ( 8a / 8a' ) . their mutual interconversion wa monitored by dynamic <nUm> H NMR spectroscopy at high temperature . the gibbs activation energy of the thermally induced 8a =8a' (butadiene)metalocene ring topomerization is DG inv ≠ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol <nUm> . this is about <nUm> kcal mol <nUm> higher than observed for the analogous ( σ <nUm> , p-butadiene)metallocene ring inversion process in the parent bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium system . the corresponding ( s-cis-e <nUm> -butadiene)ansa-hafnocene complex ( <nUm> / 9' ) wa prepared analogously . it ( η <nUm> -butadiene)Hf inversion barrier ( DG inv ≠ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol <nUm> ) is about <nUm> kcal mol <nUm> higher than that of the ( s-cis-e <nUm> -butadiene)HfCp <nUm> reference . the ( s-cis-e <nUm> -butadiene)[7-n-butyl-(4-cyclopentadienylidene)4,7-dimethyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl]zirconium complex 8b wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the e-butadiene ligand exhibit only a small CC bond alteration ( <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> Å ) and a relatively small difference of the butadiene C terminal -Zr ( <nUm> and <nUm> Å ) vs. C internal -Zr ( <nUm> and <nUm> Å ) bond length . this point to an increased π complex character of the rigid ansa - metallocene complex compared with the parent ( s-cis-e <nUm> -butadiene)zirconocene complex 2a whose structure wa determined a a reference ( 2a : butadiene C terminal Zr , <nUm> and <nUm> Å , C internal Zr , <nUm> and <nUm> Å ) . A theoretical extended huckel theory analysis ha revealed that the pronounced increase in the butadiene metallocene topomerization barrier on going from the " normal " bent metallocene ( D(1)ZrD(2) , <nUm> ° , where D(1) and D(2) denote the centroid of the cp ring ) to the strained C <nUm> - bridged ansa - metallocene complex <nUm> containing a markedly opened bent metallocene wedge ( 8b : D(1)ZrD(2) , <nUm> ° ) is electronic in origin , probably caused by closing the energy gap between the 2a <nUm> and b <nUm> frontier orbitals . we conclude that the stereoelectronic feature of the bent metallocenes can be controlled by the application of specific steric constraint . reaction of Si(1,3-tBu2-C5H3)Me3 with MCl4 ( m = Ti , Zr ) in toluene or hexane at room temperature affords the new trichloromonociclopentadienyl-type derivative [M(1,3-tBu2-e5-C5H3)Cl3] ( m = Ti ( 2 ) , Zr ( 3 ) ] . treatment of complex <nUm> and <nUm> with appropriate alkylating reagent in hexane give the 1,3-di(tert-butyl)cyclopentadienyl trialkyl titanium and zirconium complex [M(1,3-tBu2-e5-C5H3)R3] [ m = Ti , r = CH3 ( 4 ) , CH2 ph ( 5 ) ; m = Zr , r = CH3 ( 6 ) , CH2 ph ( 7 ) , CH2CMe2Ph(8) ] . interestingly , when <nUm> reacts with <nUm> equivalent of LiCH2CMe2Ph in hexane at room temperature the ring-tert-butyl-metallated complex [ Ti(1-tBu-3-CMe2CH2-e5-C5H3) (CH2CMe2Ph)2 ] ( bd9 ) wa isolated in <nUm> % yield . the cationic mono(1,3-di-(tert-butyl)cyclopentadienyl) dibenzyl zirconium specie [Zr(1,3-tBu2-e5-C5H3)(CH2Ph2]+ , generated in situ by reaction of the tribenzyl complex <nUm> with BC18F15 or [CPh3]+[B(C6F5)4]- reagent , is reported and their dynamic NMR behaviour in CD2Cl2 solution at low temperature is studied . A variety of new silylene-bridged fluorenyl-containing ligand ha been synthesized with good yield via a convenient synthetic route . two dimethylsilylene-bridged (e5-indenyl)(e5-fluorenyl)(1) and (e5-cyclopentadienyl)(e5-fluorenyl) ( 2 ) zirconocene dichloride with C1 and Cs molecular symmetry have also been prepared . upon activation with methyl aluminoxane , the former produced a polypropylene of high molecular weight , but with low activity and isotacticity . the latter catalyzed non-stereospecific propylene polymerization without any syndiotactic tendency , but with <nUm> and <nUm> time greater ethylene and propylene activity respectively than the former catalytic system . the synthesis , crystal structure and propene polymerization behaviour of four bridged zirconocene dichloride is presented . all catalyst are capable of isotactic propene polymerization . methyl substitution at the 2- , 4- and 7-positions of the bridged bis(indenyl)zirconocene dichloride were introduced . the methyl substituent in the 7-position of the idenyl ring induces a significant steric interaction with the bridging group . on comparison of the 2,4,7-methyl substituted catalyst with their unsubstituted counterpart , only the ethylidene bridged catalyst rac-1,2-ethylidene-bis(2,4,7-trimethyl-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) is forced into the optimum geometry for isotactic propene polymerization . owing to the steric bulk at the bridge catalyst <nUm> is very rigid with respect to the movement of the idenyl ring and the metal centre thus produce highly isotacic polypropene even up to high polymerization temperature . molecular mechanic calculation and temperature - dependent NMR measurement demonstrate that catalyst <nUm> is not able to equilibrate between the λ and δ conformational state a the corresponding rac-1,2-ethylidene-bis(-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 3 ) catalyst doe . In the case of the catalyst isopropyliden((3-tert-butyl)cyclopentadienyl-9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride (6)_the substitution in the 3-position change the symmetry from Cs to C1 . this catalyst produce isotactic polypropene but with a decreased polymerization activity . the previously unknown 1,1-dichloro-2,3,4,5-tetramethyl-1-silacylopenta-2,4-diene ( 3 ) wa prepared in a three - step synthesis starting from zirconocene dichloride , 2-butyne , and n-butyllithium via bis(cyclopentadienyl)-2,3,4,5-tetramethyl-1-zirconacyclopenta-2,4-diene ( 1 ) and 1,4-diiodo-1,2,3,4-tetramethylbuta-1,3-diene ( 2 ) . <nUm> wa characterized by NMR spectroscopy and single - crystal x-ray diffraction . reaction of the new silole <nUm> with <nUm> equivalent of lithium in THF give the corresponding dianion 4. 1H- , 13C- , and 29Si - NMR chemical shift of <nUm> compared with <nUm> indicate some aromatic character for the ionic specie . trapping of <nUm> with Me3SiCl give 1,1-bis(trimethylsilyl)-2,3,4,5-tetramethysilole ( 5 ) in quantitative yield . reaction of either C8H11P or dmpe ( dmpe = C3H8P ) adduct of Cl4Zr with four equivalent of C5H7K lead to the formation of the respective <nUm> or <nUm> electron mono(ligand) adduct of the open zirconocene C10H14Zr . both complex were found to exist in the expected symmetric conformation , a confirmed for the dmpe complex by a single crystal x-ray diffraction study . the enantiomerically pure C2 - symmetrical (DMeBCOCp)2ZrCl2 complex (+)-3 wa synthesized from enantiomerically pure (-)-DMeBCOCp ligand (-)-1 . zirconocene (+)-3 wa recrystallized from toluene to provide single crystal suitable for x-ray diffraction . the unit cell contained two conformationally similar molecule in the monoclinic space group P21 ( # <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> A ̊ , b = <nUm> A ̊ , c = <nUm> A ̊ , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A 3 , z = <nUm> . of the <nUm> unique reflection , <nUm> observed reflection ( 3 or greater ) were refined to give a final r = <nUm> and rw = <nUm> . the cyclopentadienyl substituents are arranged in a roughly C2 - symmetrical orientation and the cyclopentadienyl carbon are close to a synclinal orientation . A study wa made of the polymerization of ethylene involving the use of a series of [e4-4-RC6H4C(NSiMe3)2]2ZrCl2 a precatalysts ( r = H ( 1 ) ; CH3 ( 2 ) ) . the benzamidinate zirconium dichloride complex were prepared from Cl4Zr and the corresponding 4-RC6H4C(NSiMe3)2Li* TMEDA ligand . the structure of complex <nUm> wa determined by a low - temperature x-ray diffraction study . " cationic " ethylene polymerization catalyst were generated from <nUm> and <nUm> with methylalumoxane . the polymerization activity and the molecular weight of the polymer are strongly dependent on the catalyst and cocatalyst concentration . the polymerization activity increase drastically with increase in pressure and temperature and decrease when electron - releasing group are attached to the aromatic ring . insertion of aldehyde into alkyne - zirconocene complex provides configurationally pureallyl alcohol in a one - pot procedure . In the case of unsymmetrical alkyne , the regioselectivity of the insertion process is high for terminal alkyne . with trimethylsilyl-substituted alkyne the regioseectivity is low . the insertion of chiral aldehyde into the symmetrical oct-4-yne-zirconocene complex provides the cram isomer a the major product . on the other hand , reaction of the complex derived from a terminal alkyne with 2-phenylpropanal lead primarily to the anti-Cram product . the result are explained in term of a four - centre transition - state model . the preparation of new zirconocene dichloride complex containing 9-substituted fluorenyl ligand is reported . the complex were characterized by 1H and 13C NMR spectroscopy . the three novel zirconocenophane dichloride [(O(Me2SiC5H4)2)ZrC12] ( 3 ) , [O(Me2SiC5H3-tC4H9)2)ZrC12] ( 4 ) and [{Me2Si(OMe2SiC5H4)2)ZrCl2]n ( 5 ) have been prepared and characterized by 1H NMR spectroscopy . according to a successful single - crystal x-ray study , <nUm> crystallizes from n-hexane a a racemic mixture with exclusively 1,3-disubstituted cyclopentadienyl ligand and Cl centre oriented transoid to the O atom . <nUm> : monoclinic ; space group P2 <nUm> c , a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> pm ; β = <nUm> ° ; r = <nUm> ( rw = <nUm> ) . In solution ( room temperature ) , all three complex are fluxional ; moreover the NMR spectrum of <nUm> display the resonance of two isomer ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) . according to a mass spectrometry study of <nUm> , the B2 e-coupled scan of the molecular ion M+ ( m z = <nUm> ) indicates at least four " parent " fragment with <nUm> { slanted equal to or le - than } m z ≤ <nUm> , suggesting here trinuclear or even trinuclear precursor . A series of Cp'(C5H5)ZrCl12 and Cp2'ZrCl12 precatalysts ( cp' = C5Me4H , C4Me4P , C5Me5 ) together with C10Cl12H10Zr ha been investigated in term of steric and electronic variation and their catalytic activity in combination with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) towards the polymerization of ethylene are compared . the change in the steric environment were evaluated on the basis of the structural data available and supplemented by theoretical structural study on the semiempirical ( ZINDO , EHMO ) and density functional ( DF ) level . the x-ray structure of (C5Me4H)2ZrCl2 ( 3 ) and (C4Me4P)(C5H5)ZrCl2 ( 4 ) have been determined ( <nUm> : orthorhombic , cmcm , a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> c = <nUm> A ̊ , z = <nUm> ; <nUm> : monoclinic , P21 / c , a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> A ̊ β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> . 91Zr NMR data for the above series ha been measured and is correlated to change in the HOMO-LUMO gap available from electronic structure calculation . under mostly homogeneous polymerization condition , at very low zirconium concentration the order of the catalytic activity found for ethylene polymerization is C10Cl2H10Zr > (C5Me4H)(C5H5)ZrCl2 > (C5Me5)(C5H5)ZrCl2 > (C4Me4P)(C5H5)ZrCl2 > (C5Me4H)2ZrCl2 > (C5Me5)2ZrCl2 > (C4Me4P)2ZrCl2 , which for the most part is inversely proportional to the steric demand of the ring ligand in the metallocene precatalysts except for the phospholyl system . the lower activity of the phospholyl vs. the tetra- and penta-methylcyclopentadienyl compound might imply an electronic effect such that the electron withdrawing phosphorus substituent decrease the activity , although further study are needed to clarify this situation . emphasis is placed on the control of the polymerization condition and evaluation of the time - activity profile . At higher zirconium concentration an increased precipitation of polyethylene take place during the course of polymerization and result in a transfer to the heterogeneous phase with a diffusion controlled reaction rate thereby invalidating any activity - comparing study . the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with magnesium and tBuC2SiMe3 in tetrahydrofuran yield the first zirconocene complex with an alkyl substituted alkyne without additional phosphine ligand Cp2Zr(THF)(tBuC2SiMe3) <nUm> . that complex is stable at room temperature and wa characterized by it IR and NMR spectrum . the spectroscopical data of <nUm> were compared with those of the well known complex of that type Cp2Zr(THF)(Me3SiC2SiMe3) <nUm> to study the influence of different sterical and electronical influence of the substituents ( tBu and SiMe3 ) upon alkyne complexation . the chemo- and regio-selectivity of complex <nUm> wa studied in a hydrogen transfer reaction and in reaction with carbon dioxide and acetone . the result show mostly a kinetically favored reaction at the Si - substituted C - atom of the complexed alkyne , giving the b-SiMe3-product , which rearranges into the thermodynamically more stable a-SiMe3 - substituted product . In contrast to titanocene in the case of zirconocene complex coupling reaction of RC ≡ CSiMe3 ( r = SiMe3 , tBu ) could be realized . carbonylation of dimethylzirconocene , followed by treatment with zirconocene dihydride , benzyl chloride and then methyllithium , gave the (e2-acetaldehyde)zirconocene dimer ( 9 ) a a mixture of trans- and cis-isomers isolated in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio under kinetic control and in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio under thermodynamic control , respectively . complex trans-9 / cis-9 were treated with carbon monoxide to give the rans-10 / cis-10 monoinsertion product , and with isonitriles RNC ( r = CH2SiMe3 ( a ) , CMe3 ( b ) ) to give the mono- and bis-insertion product trans- and cis-11(a , b ) and <nUm> ( a , b ) , respectively . complex 12a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . In all case the trans / ci stereochemical information wa predominantly retained in the product , which indicates that dimetallic pathway are favoured in these insertion reaction of the metallatricyclic (e2-aldehyde)metallocene dimer . successive treatment of triallylamine with zirconocene chloride hydride and germanium tetrachloride affords 1-aza-5-germa-5-chlorobicyclo[3.3.3]undecane , which is converted to the 5-organo derivative by the reaction with grignard or lithium reagent . the organo group showed higher reactivity toward stille - type coupling than the corresponding organotributylgermanes . BC18F15 reacts with the (e2-acetaldehyde)zirconocene dimer ( 4 ) by hydride transfer from the methyl group of a C2H4O ligand to boron . one of the metallaoxirane moiety of the dizirconium complex is then opened to give the salt [ (e2-CH3CHO)ZrCp2 · ( CH2 = CHO)ZrCp2]+[HB(C6F5)3]-(6) that wa isolated with an <nUm> % yield . propylene wa polymerized in the presence of the cation bis(O-acetyl-(R)-mandelate) ( 1+(S) ) of (S)-ethylenebis[4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-e5-indenyl]zirconium and ( 1+(R / S ) ) of a mixture of diastereomers . under the same experimental condition the polymer obtained with the latter exhibit abundant non-homosteric methyl 13C NMR pentad a well a 2,1-and 1,3-misinsertion resonance ; these stereo - and regioirregularities are absent in the poly(propylenes) formed by the enantiomeric 1+(S) . the stereoselectivity of catalysis by <nUm> ( r / S ) can be significantly raised either by reducing it concentration , lowering the polymerization temperature , or immobilizing it in a silica support ; the stereoselectivity of catalysis by 1(S) is not similarly affected . these result are consistent with the interchange of polymer chain of opposite b-carbon configuration bound to different chirality metal center of the racemic mixture causing steric inversion . In the case of catalysis by 1(S) , the same process doe not introduce stereoerror because the growing chain are of the same configuration . maximum isotactic specificity of an ansa - zirconocene precursor is obtained either with a pure enantiomer of the precursor or with a racemic mixture of the zirconium complex which is adequately immobilized on a support . four possible structure of C2 - symmetric bis(fluorenyl)zirconium complex are presented . three bis(fluorenyl)zirconocene complex have been prepared and tested for the polymerization of propylene and ethylene . rac / meso-Dichloro[e10-(1,2-ethanediyl)bis (7H-benzo[c]fluoren-7-ylidene)zirconium ( <nUm> / <nUm> * ) seems to be the most active polymerization catalyst for ethylene . the reaction of (e5-C5H5)2Zr{P(SiMe3)2}2 with C4NiO4 yield the heterodinuclear phosphido-bridged complex (e5-C5H5)2Zr{m-P(SiMe3)2}2Ni(CO)2 ( 1 ) . <nUm> wa characterised spectroscopically and by x-ray structure determination . the central four - membered NiP2Zr ring is slightly puckered ( dihedral angle between plane P2Zr / NiP2 = <nUm> ° ) . the Zr-P bond length are equivalent ( Zr-P1 <nUm> , Zr-P2 <nUm> Å ) , a are the Ni-P bond length ( Ni-P1 <nUm> , Ni-P2 <nUm> Å ) . the long Zr ⋯ Ni distance of <nUm> Å indicates the absence of a metal - metal bond . the heterodinuclear phosphido- and arsenido-bridged complex (e5-C5H5)2Zr{m-E(SiMe3)2}2M(CO)n [ e = P ; M(CO)n = C2NiO2 ( 1 ) or C4MoO4 ( 2 ) ; and e = As , M(CO)n = C4CrO4 ( 3 ) ] react rapidly with methylaluminoxane , yielding catalytically active complex which rival the known cationic system for the polymerization of ethylene . the first tin - bridged zirconocenes [ C7H10Sn 2]Zr[N(CH3)2]2 ( 3 ) and Sn{(C5H4)2Zr{N(CH3) 2]2}2 ( 4 ) have been obtained from tetrakis(dimethylamido)zirconium ( 1 ) and the CH-acidic ligand C12H16Sn ( 2a ) and C20H20Sn ( 2b ) , respectivily . the ansa - zirconocene <nUm> is formed in quantitative yield , <nUm> in <nUm> % yield . the bi- and trimetallic complex <nUm> ( SnZr ) and <nUm> ( SnZr2 ) polymerize ethylene more efficiently than the well - known silicon - bridged analogue of <nUm> ( Si instead of Sn ) . chiral ansa - zirconocene complex with a trimethylene link between the Si bridge atom and an a-position of each C5 ring ligand were prepared ; two representative , with i-propyl and t-butyl group a b-substituents , were structurally characterized . the property of these complex with respect to MAO - activated propene polymerization were studied in comparison with those of their Me2Si - bridged analog . the t-butyl-substituted spirosilane complex give a polymer with relatively high content of 3,1-insertions . these increased regioirregularities appear to be associated with decreased coordination gap aperture and increased lateral extension angle of the spirosilane - bridged zirconocene complex ; this notion is supported by a molecular - mechanic analysis of alternative olefin - insertion transition state . one unbridged and three bridged zirconocene complex , each of them bearing a cyclopentadienyl , fluorenyl , a-olefin and a PMe <nUm> ligand have been prepared and characterized by <nUm> H , <nUm> C and <nUm> P NMR spectroscopy . these model compound illustrate the mechanism of olefin coordination and insertion at the active site of syndiospecific homogeneous catalyst for the polymerization of propylene and 1-butene . the 1,2-di-tert-butylcyclopentadienyl anion ( 1 ) ha been used to prepare 1,1',2,2'-tetra-tert-butyltitanocene dichloride ( 5 ) , 1,1',2,2'-tetra-tert-butylzirconocene dichloride ( 6 ) , and 1,1',2,2'-tetra-tert-butyluranocene dichloride ( 7 ) . the bent metallocene structure of 5-7 have been confirmed by x-ray crystallography , and illustrate that the 1,2-di-tert-butylcyclopentadienyl ligand are arranged with all four tert-butyl group in the open part of the wedge between the two canted cyclopentadienyl ring , but that steric interaction between the substituents afford a conformationally dictated C2 symmetry for the molecule . In solution compound <nUm> and <nUm> exhibit NMR spectrum consistent with a facile dynamic process involving exchange between tert-butyl site that are inequivalent in the solid state . the nature of this site exchange is discussed , and comparison are made with related metallocene dichloride of group <nUm> metal . the synthesis of inflate derivative of titanocene and zirconocene from the corresponding dimethyl complex and triflic acid ( HOTf ) is described . comproportionation of Cp2M(OTf)2 with Cp2MX2 give Cp2M(OTf)X ( m = Ti , x = Cl , F , me ; m = Zr , x = Cl , me , BH4 ) . Cp2TiMe(OTf) reacts with ROH ( r = me , Me3Si or Me2tBuSi ) to give Cp2TiOR(OTf) . Cp2TiMe(OTf) and Cp2TiOSiMe3(OTf) react with H2O to give the oxo-bridged dimer (Cp2TiOTf)2(m-O) . the triflate in Cp2TiX(OTf) ( x = Cl , F , me , OSiMe3 ) is substituted by -OSiMe3 to give compound Cp2TiX(OSiMe3) . Cp2Ti(OMe)OR ( r = me , SiMe3 ) could not be obtained . the title complex <nUm> = [{O(Me2SiC9H6)2}ZrCl2] ( C9H6Si = 2-silylated indenyl group ) ha been prepared in a way slightly different from that published recently by rausch and coworkers ( J. organomet . chem. , <nUm> ( 1995 ) <nUm> ) . In contrast to the earlier report , the 1H NMR spectrum of <nUm> in C6D6 and CD2Cl2 reflect clearly the presence of both rac-2 and meso-2 ( ca. <nUm> : <nUm> ) . from toluene , <nUm> crystallizes a a racemic mixture ; rac-2 : monoclinic ; space group P21 / c , a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> pm ; β = <nUm> ° ; R1 = <nUm> ( wR2 = <nUm> ) . the high -
