anion ) that contain a planar-tetracoordinate carbon atom . complex 6b wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the activation energy of the degenerate rearrangement of 6c wa determined by temperature dependent dynamic <nUm> H NMR spectroscopy ( DG ‡ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol - <nUm> ). 2,2'-Bis[(4,7-dimethyl-inden-1-yl)methyl]-1,1'-binaphthyl and [2,2'-bis[(4,5,6,7-tetrahydroinden-1-yl)methyl]-1,1'-binaphthyl]titanium and -zirconium dichloride have been synthesized from 2,2'-bis(bromomethyl)-1,1'-binaphthylene . 2,2'-Bis(bromomethyl)-1,1'-binaphthylene wa alkylated with the lithium salt of 4,7-dimethylindene to yield 2,2'-bis[1-(4,7-dimethyl-indenylmethyl)]-1,1'-binaphthylene (S)-(-)-9 . the lithium salt of <nUm> wa metalated with either titanium trichloride followed by oxidation or zirconium tetrachloride to give titanocene dichloride (S)-(+)-10 and zirconocene dichloride <nUm> . the known complex ansa-[2,2'-bis[(1-indenyl)methyl]-1,1'-binaphthyl]titanium and -zirconium dichloride were formed and hydrogenated to ansa-[2,2'-bis[(4,5,6,7-tetrahydroinden-1-yl)methyl]-1,1'-binaphthyl]titanium and -zirconium dichloride <nUm> and <nUm> or to ansa-[2,2'-bis[(4,5,6,7-tetrahydroinden-1-yl)methyl]-5,5',6,6',7,7',8,8'-octahydro-1,1'-binaphthyl]titanium dichloride <nUm> whose solid state structure wa determined by x-ray crystallography . complex <nUm> adopts a C1 - symmetrical conformation in the solid state , but is conformationally mobile in solution , exhibiting C2 - symmetry in it room temperature NMR spectrum . the complex Cp2ZrMe(C6H4C ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( 4 ) ha been synthesized by reaction of Cp2ZrMeCl and C7H4Li ≡ CSiMe3 ( generated in situ from reaction of nBuLi with BrC7H4 ≡ CSiMe3 at <nUm> ° C ) . thermolysis of <nUm> in THF afforded an unsaturated , organometallic polymer [ Cp2Zr(C6H3C = CSiMe3)]n ( 7 ) in ca. <nUm> % yield ( mw / Mn = <nUm> / <nUm> ) . polymer <nUm> wa investigated a a synthon for other unsaturated polymer . it reacts with hydrochloric acid to form a new phenylene-1,1-vinylene polymer [ -C( = CHSiMe3)-1,4-C6H4-]n ( 8 ) , and with sulfur dichloride to give poly(1-trimethylsilyl-2-benzo[b]thiophene) ( 9 ) . thermolysis of two similar compound , Cp2ZrMe(C6H4C ≡ C2H3 ) ( 5 ) and Cp2ZrMe(C6H4C6H4C ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( 6 ) , did not give polymer . the use of ' cation - like ' metallocene combination catalyst ( Cp'2MCl2-2BuLi-B(C6F5)3 ; cp' = e5-cyclopentadienyl , or substituted e5-cyclopentadienyl ; m = Ti , Zr , Hf , U ) for dehydropolymerization of silanes significantly improves the polymer molecular weight . for example , under the same condition a Cp(C5Me5)ZrCl2-2BuLi catalyst give Mn = <nUm> , while a Cp(C5Me5)ZrCl2-2BuLi-B(C6F5)3 give Mn = <nUm> . the influence of various factor ( steric and electronic effect of the cyclopentadienyl ligand , the nature of the metal , temperature , solvent , concentration and structure of silane ) on the build-up of polysilane chain are systematically analyzed . attempt at polymerizing methacrylate using metallocenes are reported . polymerization is successful using ferrocene in a ketone solution , but not in benzene or without a solvent . ketone are effective in the order : methyl ethyl ketone < cyclohexanone < cycloheptanone . carbon tetrachloride ha an accelerative effect on the polymerization in benzene and methyl ethyl ketone solution , but no effect in cyclohexanone solution . some binary system , which consist of ferrocene and higher valence compound such a cobalt trisacetylacetonate , are effective redox initiator . cobaltocene polymerizes methyl methacrylate in the presence of carbon tetrachloride ; zirconocene dichloride induces polymerization of methyl methacrylate in a cyclohexanone solution ; whereas neither nickelocene nor titanocene dichloride are effective . styrene and acrylonitrile were not polymerized by the metallocenes examined . six kind of heterogeneous catalyst were prepared by supporting iPr(Flu)(Cp)ZrCl2 ( 1 ) and Cp2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) on Al2O3 , Cl2Mg and O2Si , and propene polymerization wa conducted with these supported catalyst using a common alkylaluminium , AlC3H9 , a cocatalyst . the <nUm> Al2O3 and <nUm> Cl2Mg catalyst gave highly syndiotactic polypropylene whereas the <nUm> Al2O3 and <nUm> Cl2Mg catalyst gave atactic polypropylene in fairly good yield . In contrast , the O2Si - supported catalyst were found to be inactive for propene polymerization . A full , two - level factorial experimental design with temperature and concentration of zirconocene dichloride and methylaluminoxane a variable wa employed to study the polymerization of ethylene . rate of polymerization and molecular weight data were used to develop a kinetic model and estimate the kinetic parameter . the polymerization rate wa continuously recorded from a semi-batch reactor and molecular weight were measured at the end of each experimental run . the analysis of the data suggests the presence of two kind of active specie . one kind of specie is produced from the other via a pseudo-first-order reaction . non-bridged zirconocene complex activated with methylalumoxane can polymerize monoalkenes to high polymer with very high activity . the main control of molecular weight in these system is due to b-H transfer from the growing chain , the effect becoming very remarkable in the case of substituted ethylene monomer and with increasing temperature . this work is mainly devoted to test the real capacity of the subject catalyst to produce structurally controlled oligomers from ethylene or ethylene / a-olefin mixture in good yield by investigating the influence of different reaction parameter . on the basis of the relevant result obtained , condition were identified favouring the cooligomerization of ethylene with propylene and higher a-olefins versus the formation of high molecular weight macromolecule . the role of reaction condition ( catalyst , cocatalysts , temperature , pressure , structure of comonomer and presence of hydrogen ) on product structure and yield is discussed with reference to previously proposed chain propagation and chain transfer mechanism . the ab initio method at the hartree - fock level ha been used on two zirconocene system , the unbridged Cp2ZrCH+ <nUm> and the bridged (Si(CH3)2)Cp2ZrCH+ <nUm> compound . for each complex the insertion of an ethylene molecule ha been followed from reactant to product through the corresponding transition state . the calculated activation energy are of the order of magnitude of those obtained experimentally , explaining the higher activity found for the unbridged catalytic complex compared to the bridged . the geometry are in agreement with other study and comparable with those derived by crystallographic method . the a-agostic interaction observed in the reactant a well a in the transition state and resulting product confirms that the brookhart - green mechanism is followed for the polymerization reaction . A kinetic study ha been made of the homo- and copolymerization of ethylene with vinylcyclohexane , using catalytic system based on methylalumoxane and bis-(tert-butylcyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride and bis-(trimethylsilycyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride . the effective rate constant were determined in the interval from 20-70 ° C for the homo- and copolymerization reaction , and the observed activation energy and the copolymerization constant were obtained . some property of the resultant polymer were investigated . the formation of product <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> ( a-l ) from both the reaction of e2-benzophenone zirconocene <nUm> with alkyl halide and the thermolysis of the a-(Cp2ZrCl) - substituted benzhydrylmethylether <nUm> , the latter proceeding with anchimeric assistance of the metal , can be understood assuming a stepwise reaction path through radical intermediate . the proposed intermediate transition - metal benzophenone ketyl <nUm> exhibit a reaction pattern differing from analogous main - group - metal ketyls . bimetallic complex of Zr Ti and boron containing a planar tetracoordinate carbon atom have been prepared by reacting titanocene and zirconocene acetylene complex with boron hydride . the remarkable structural feature ha been unequivocally proved by x-ray diffraction study . the reaction of borate and borinates with zirconocene complex of substituted benzynes lead regioselectively to heterodimetallic compound which were , without isolation , converted to the corresponding halophenols . zirconocene - catalyzed kinetic resolution of dihydrofurans may be effected in the presence of <nUm> mol % non-racemic (EBTHI)ZrCl2 . transformation reported herein proceed efficiently to afford two constitutionally distinct and readily separable product with excellent level of diastereo- and enantioselectivity . preparation and resolution of the substrate furan may be carried out in a single pot . the zirconocene p-complex of 3-methyl-1,2-butadiene(1,1-dimethylallene) can not be prepared by simple ligand substitution due to rapid coupling of the initally formed complex with the unreacted allene . this problem wa circumvented by generating the allene complex by b-hydrogen elimination from a pre-formed sigma complex . this appears to be a potentially general way to prepare allene complex of zirconocene if the allene precursor ha no cis-vinyl hydrogen . this method ha been successfully used to prepare zirconocene complex of 3-methyl-1,2-cycloheptadiene , 3-methyl-1,2-cyclohexadiene and 4-phenyl-1,2,3-cyclohexatriene . attempt to prepare a complex of 3-methyl-1,2-cyclopentadiene failed . selected reaction of two of these cumulene complex and their coupling product are reported . the reaction of n-Bu2ZrCp2 with nonconjugated dienes containing substituted vinyl group can lead to either bicyclization or the formation of conjugated diene-zirconocenes via multipositional regioisomerization . for generating cationic zirconocene specie that are useful for organic synthesis , AgAsF <nUm> proved to be an efficient catalyst that serf a a safe alternative to AgClO <nUm> . scope and limitation is discussed on this new catalyst in the process including ( 1 ) alkyl / alkenyl transfer reaction from organozirconocene chloride to aldehyde , ( 2 ) two- and four-carbon homologation of aldehyde , ( 3 ) dual synthetic method of 1,3-dienes from aldehyde / ketone via 1,3-bimetallic specie , and ( 4 ) three - component alkylative cycloaddition via o-quinodimethane specie . reaction and characterization of allylic and related zirconium reagent ( allenic and g-alkoxyallylic zirconium ) generated by treatment of allylic and / or propargylic ether with a zirconocene - butene complex ( " Cp2Zr " ) are described . deuterium labelling experiment prove that the zirconocene dichloride catalysed ethylmagnesiation of alkene occurs via a zirconocene e2-ethylene complex and allow a deuterium isotope effect for a key b-hydride transfer to be estimated ( kH kD = <nUm> ) . transmetallation from zirconium to magnesium to form 1,4-dimagnesiated reagent is shown to be an intramolecular process . kinetic study show that the reaction between e2-ethylene zirconocene and the alkene is rate limiting and that lewis base inhibit the reaction by decreasing the amount of e2-ethylene zirconocene in equilibrium with the ' ate ' complex [ Cp2Zr(CH2 = CH2)Et ] - .[MgX.Base]+ . In situ prepared Cp2ZrCl[?] catalyzes the formation of dioxolenium ion from a,b-unsaturated epoxy ester . As a consequence of this activation process , acrylate , methacrylate and crotonate derivative undergo a rapid and stereoselective cationic [4+2] cycloaddition with a wide range of dienes . ring - extended carboxylic acid derivative are formed in 1-7 h at 0-21 ° C and in 50-90 % yield after saponification of the intermediate diol ester . simple lewis acid catalysis by Cp2ZrCl[?] can be excluded on the basis of the experimental result . none zirconocene(iso-butyl) chloride , <nUm> , which can be generated in situ from commercially available , inexpensive , and air - stable zirconocene dichloride , can function a a zirconocene(methyl) chloride equivalent . the generation of allenic zirconium intermediate by treating propargylic ether derivative with " Cp2Zr " and their reaction with aldehyde in the presence of borontrifluoride etherate yield anti-b-acetylenic alcohol along with a-allenic alcohol . the reaction of monosubstituted alkene with alkylmagnesium derivative catalyzed by Cp2ZrCl2 or related zirconocene derivative provides head - to - tail alkyl-alkene or alkene - alkene coupling product , ∼ <nUm> % of which are 2,5-dialkyl-4-pentenylmagnesium halide . zirconocene dichloride act a a catalyst precursor for the stereoselective cyclomagnesiation of an array of substituted 1,6-heptadienes in the presence of butylmagnesium chloride to form trans 1,2-(bis)methylmagnesium substituted carbocycles . treatment of alkyne with zirconocene-ethylene complex and homoallylic halide gave allylcyclopropane derivative . sequential addition of a magnesium amide and methyl magnesium chloride to zirconocene dichloride provides a practical synthesis of zirconocene methyl amide . thermolysis of these zirconocene complex in the presence of unactivated alkene and alkyne give , on protonolysis , a-alkylated or a-vinylated amine . rapid hydrozirconation of alkenyl boronic ester by zirconocene hydrochloride , followed by addition of n-halosuccinimides lead to the corresponding a-halo boronic ester in high yield . two zirconocene complex of cyclooctatrienyne have been prepared by b-hydrogen elimination from zirconocene biscyclooctatetraenyl . both complex are fluxional by a ring inversion process with activation barrier in the range typical of cyclooctatetraenes . an x-ray crystal structure of 3a reveals a boat conformation of cyclooctatrienyne ring with no significant flattening when compared with cyclooctatetraene . insertion of lithium chloroallylide into a bicyclic zirconacyclopentane yield a zirconocene allyl complex which reacts with a variety of C , N , O and S containing electrophiles to give elaborated cyclopentane product on work-up . an intramolecular version of this tandem protocol give a stereospecific synthesis of a (E)-alkylidenecyclohexane . zirconocene e2-imine complex formed by a CH activation route from a variety of amine are trapped by o-halo-alkenes or -alkynes to afford 2,3-disubstituited pyrrolidines , piperidines and perhydroazepines on work up and cyclisation . In some case it wa necessary to use a protected hydroxyl group rather than the halide and cyclise in a separate step through selective formation of the o-mesylate . reaction of alkoxymethyl substituted styrene derivative with a stoichiometric and / or catalytic amount of zirconocene-(1-butene) complex ( " Cp2Zr " ) cause an unexpected zirconocene insertion into benzylic position and / or homolytic coupling reaction of the styrene derivative . d-Siloxyallylzirconium reagent ( 2 ) wa produced by reaction of the TBDMS protected derivative ( 6 ) with zirconocene butene complex " CP2Zr " . treatment of the d-siloxyallylzirconium reagent ( 2 ) with various aldehyde provided predominantly anti-homoallylic alcohol . the bis-allylic <nUm> and the bis-propargylic <nUm> derivative react with the zirconocene " ZtCp2 " and lead , after electrophilic addition , to the corresponding chiral trans heterocyclopentanes ( m = Si,Ge,P ) 3-5 and bis-methylenecyclopentanes <nUm> . new chiral diphosphine <nUm> is obtained starting from the intermediate complex <nUm> or the functionalized heterocyclopentane <nUm> . the ethylmagnesiation of terminal alkene catalysed by (R,R)-ethylene-1,2-bis(e5-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium (R)-1,1'-binaphth-2,2'-diolate gave low turnover and enantioexcesses . A novel C (i) symmetric zirconocene dichloride CpCp'ZrCl2 ( cp = CH , cp ' = 1-neomenthyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl ) wa prepared which gave better enantioselectivity , is cheaper to make , catalytically more active , and recoverable . pyridine-pendent siloxane polymer containing a backbone modified with a zirconocene moiety were synthesized through the hydrolysis-condensation reaction of the mixed precursor solution of the b-trimethoxysilylethyl-2-pyridine sol in liquor medium and the zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) dissolved in tetrahydrofurane . this polymer , in term of the polyzirconocenesiloxane-2-pyridine ( PZSP ) , wa then evaluated for use a thin coating film ( thickness , <nUm> - <nUm> mm ) , which provides excellent protection of aluminum ( Al ) alloy against ClNa - caused corrosion . the PZSP film deposited by simple dip - withdrawing coating method to Al displayed the impedance of > <nUm> Ω cm2 after exposure for <nUm> day in <nUm> N ClNa solution at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> h salt - spray resistance . A new synthesis of homochiral vinyl phosphonates starting from 1-alkynes is described. , the title compound were obtained in good yield by the reaction of chiral 2-chloro-1,3,2-oxa2aphospholidin-2-one ( 1 ) with the “ ate ” - complex of vinyl alanes. , the latter were prepared by zirconocene dichloride catalyzed hydroalumination of 1-alkynes with diisobutyl aluminum hydride ( DIBAH ) . this communication deal with a brief description of a synthetic procedure and structural characterization of a new class of coordination compound of titanium and zirconium with sulphur - containing organic moiety derived by the condensation of heterocyclic ketone and thiosemicarbazide . on the basis of various physicochemical and spectral study , viz. , UV , IR , 1H and 13C NMR , a trigonal bipyramidal and octahedral geometry have been suggested for Cp2M(Tscz)Cl and Cp2M(Tscz)2 ( where m = Ti(IV) or Zr(IV) and TsczH = ligand molecule ) type of compound , respectively . finally , attempt have been made to establish a correlation between biological activity and the structure of the resulting product on the basis of different constituent and chemical phenomenon . plasma desorption mass spectrum of a zirconocene and two ferrocenyl phenyl plumbanes have been obtained in both positive- and negative - ion mode with a linear time - of - flight instrument . for molecular weight determination of the ferrocenes the positive - ion mass spectrum exhibit radical molecular ion with high abundance . the zirconocene compound show no molecular ion at all , but show a [ m cl]+ ion . the positive - ion mass spectrum in particular provide detailed structural information . In the case of the ferrocenes the negative - ion mass spectrum show fragment ion which give information complementary to the positive mode . sample have been prepared by the electro9spray technique , by spin - deposition on nitrocellulose a support and on 3-(3-pyridyl)acrylic acid a matrix . In addition , the potential of a reflecting time - of - flight instrument with a higher mass resolution for the molecular ion and lead isotope region of the ferrocenes ha been demonstrated . the isotopic pattern of the m{radical dot}+ ion and pb+ ion obtained in the reflector mode for an electrosprayed and nitrocellulose spin - deposited sample wa compared with the theoretically calculated pattern . an excellent correlation wa found for the nitrocellulose deposition technique . the carbonyl silanimine complex Cp2Zr(e2-Me2SiNtBu)(CO) ( 2 ) ha been prepared by ligand substitution on the phosphine derivative , Cp2Zr(e2-Me2SiNtBu) ( PMe3 ) ( 1 ) and by generation of the alkyl derivative Cp2Zr(CH2SiMe3) ( NtBuSiMe2H ) under a carbon monoxide atmosphere . most aspect of the spectroscopic property and structural parameter are consistent with the formulation of <nUm> a a zirconium ( IV ) metallacycle , containing a NSiZr three - membered ring and a linear , terminal carbonyl ligand . however , the carbonyl stretching frequency for <nUm> is observed at <nUm> cm-1 in the infrared , much lower than expected for a zirconium ( IV ) complex , and indeed , lower than any other zirconocene carbonyl . ZINDO molecular orbital calculation indicate that the origin of this anomalously low stretching band is donation of electron density into the CO p* orbital directly from an orbital on the adjacent silicon center , i.e. s-p* back - bonding . consistent with this picture , the formally non-bonding Si / 3.C distance in <nUm> ( <nUm> Å ) is much longer than a typical single bond ( ca <nUm> Å ) , but in the range observed for delocalized organic p-ligands bonded to silicon . although the bond between the silicon and carbonyl ligand is not fully formed in the ground state of <nUm> , thermolysis in the presence of PMe3 yield the five - membered metallacycle cyclo-Cp2Zr[OC(PMe3)SiMe2NtBu] ( 3 ) , resulting from CO insertion into the SiZr bond and formation of a cyclic silaacyl , followed by attack of phosphine at the electrophilic acyl carbon . cyclopolymerization of nonconjugated dienes provides a route to a number of stereochemically complex poly(methylene-1,3-cycloalkanes) . the stereochemistry of these polymer derives from both tacticity and ci / trans stereochemistry of the carbocyclic ring . A unique feature of isotactic polymer with a predominance of trans ring is that they contain no mirror element of symmetry and are thus chiral by virtue of their main - chain stereochemistry . the enantioselective cyclopolymerization of 1,5-hexadiene in the presence of optically active precursor such a (-)-(R)-ethylene-bis(tetrahydroindenyl) zirconium (R)-binaphtholate ( [a]435 = <nUm> ° ) and a methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) co-catalyst yield optically active poly(methylene-1,3-cyclopentane) ( PMCP ) with a molar optical rotation [Ph]28405 of + <nUm> ° ( c = <nUm> , CCl3H ) . since the enantioface selectivity of the chiral zirconocene catalyst with propene is known , the absolute stereochemistry of the polymer can be tentatively assigned if an analogous enantioface selectivity with 1,5-hexadiene is assumed . the enantioselective cyclopolymerization of symmetrical dienes requires both a high enantioface selectivity for olefin insertion and a high diastereoselectivity for olefin cyclization in order to obtain a chiral macromolecular architecture . metallocene sulfide [Cp2M(m-S)]2 ( I , m zr4+ ; II , m hf4+ and cp = cyclopentadienyl ) have been synthesized . I and II show charge transfer absorption in the visible region . FT - raman , raman and IR spectrum of these compound are reported for the first time . the MS stretching band have been assigned with the help of a pre-resonance effect . the approximate normal coordinate analysis of the coordination skeleton ( d2h symmetry ) aid the detailed assignment in the low frequency spectral region . force constant of MCp and MS stretching imply that the bond order of HfL is higher than that of ZrL . metallocenes in combination with methylalumoxane a cocatalyst form extremely active catalyst for olefin polymerization and have become a research topic of growing interest in recent year . meanwhile a great number of symmetric and chiral zirconocenes have been synthesized to give totally different structure of isotactic , syndiotactic , stereoblock , or isoblock polymer . the isotactic sequence length of polypropylene is influenced by the nature of the ligand of the metallocenes . it ha become possible to polymerize cyclic olefin like cyclopentene , norbornene , or dimethanooctahydronaphthalene with different chiral zirconocenes without any ring opening reaction . the crystalline polycycloalkenes show extremely high melting point which are between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C . copolymer of cyclo-alkenes with ethene are amorphous and transparent with a glass transition temperature between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C and they can be used a material for optical disc and fiber . the nature and distribution of radioactive specie resulting from ( ng ) neutron - capture reaction in the metal atom of zirconocene dichloride and molybdocene dichloride were investigated . retention value of <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> % were obtained for zr-95 , zr-97 and mo-99 respectively . b-Transformation in 95Zr-zirconocene dichloride and 99Mo-molybdocene dichloride led to approximately <nUm> % of the respective daughter nb-95 and tc-99m being retained at the same molecular form a the parent . A series of (e5-C5H4R)2ZrCl2 ( r = H , me , et , iPr , tBu , SiMe3 , Me2Ph , ) complex have been used in combination with ethylalumoxane to copolymerise ethene with a-olefins ( C5C14 ) under constant condition ( P = 9-12 bar ; T = 50-80 ° C ) . activity decreased substantially for olefin > C8 . variation of the 1-hexene concentration ( (CpEt)2ZrCl2 a catalyst ) revealed rate enhancement at a 1-hexene / ethylene ratio of <nUm> . copolymer incorporation wa low ( < <nUm> % ) a detected by melting point and 13C NMR spectroscopy . A statistically designed approach ( <nUm> factorial ) wa used to investigate the influence of P,T and [1-hexene] on copolymer formation with (CpR)2ZrCl2 ( r = H , tBu ) . complex interaction between the variable wa detected but the result ( r = tBu ) were dominated by [1-hexene] . the microstructure in term of molecular mass distribution ( MMD ) and chemical comonomer distribution ( CCD ) of linear low density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) is greatly influenced by the catalytic system and process condition . furthermore , the 1-olefin insertion in the polymer chain can be distinguished between intramolecular and intermolecular distribution . to investigate the intermolecular CCD and the MMD , four LLDPEs ( ethylene-1-butene copolymer ) from different catalytic system based on Ti Cl2Mg catalyst , a zirconocene complex and a vanadium compound , are studied . the microstructure of the whole polymer and of their fraction are examined by size exclusion chromatography ( SEC ) , differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , and 13C NMR analysis . further information about CCD is also obtained by DSC analysis on the whole sample by applying a particular thermal treatment , named thermal fractionated crystallization ( TFC ) , based on isothermal crystallization of the polymer from the melt at fixed temperature . the result obtained with the different analytical technique show that the examined polymer have a very distinct microstructure depending on the catalyst type . binuclear zirconocene carton are observed by 1H - NMR in C6D6 solution containing BC18F15 and an excess of a zirconocene dimethyl complex . the CH3 - bridged cation [((C5H5)2ZrCH3)2(m-CH3)]+ , solvent- separated from the anion H3C-B(C6F5)3 / - , is present in equilibrium with C12H16Zr and the mononuclear ion pair [ ( C11H13Zr / +***H3C-B(C6F5)3 / - ] ; in more concentrated solution , a binuclear ion pair [ ((C5H5)2ZrCH3)2(m-CH3)+***H3C- BC18F15 / - ] is the dominant specie . similar equilibrium are observed in C6,D6 solution containing BC18F15 and C18H26Zr , C14H20SiZr or rac-(CH3)2Si(indenyl)2Zr(CH3)2 . complex with sterically more demanding ligand , such a C22H36Zr or rac-(CH3)2Si(2-methyl benz[e]indenyl)2Zr(CH3)2 do not form any binuclear specie under these condition . In the catalyst system rac- (CH3)2Si(indenyl)2Zr(CH3)2 / Bu3NH+B(C6F5)4 / - , activity for the polymerization of propene increase with excess of the dimethyl zirconocene complex . this effect is due in part to a sacrifice of some dimethyl zirconocene for the removal of impurity from the catalyst system and in part to a stabilization of the catalyst in the form of the binuclear cation [((CH3)2Si(indenyl)2ZrCH3)2(m-CH3)]+ . the latter appears to act , in the presence of propene , a a source of the mononuclear cation [(CH3)2Si(indenyl)2ZrCH3(C3H6)]+ , rather than a a polymerization catalyst by itself . upon irradiation of a C2 - symmetric rac - isomer of an ansa - zirconocene dichloride , an interconversion into the C ( s ) - symmetric meso-form is observed until a photostationary state between the two diastereomers is reached . the final rac / meso-proportion and the interconversion rate depend on the structure of the different metallocenes . result of a-olefin polymerization catalyzed by [ Me2Si(2-Me-4,6-(i)Pr2 Ind)2]ZrCl2 rac and meso , respectively , and methylalumoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst are reported . In propene polymerization the rac - diastereomer show the higher activity whereas in pentene , hexene , and octene polymerization the meso-isomer is significantly more active . for all polymer a lower molecular weight is found using the meso-diastereomer a catalyst . A review of recent advance in early transition metal metallacycle - mediated coupling of C . C p-bonds is presented . discussion is focused on bond - forming process stemming from a sequence of metal- . π complex formation followed by carbometalation of a second p-system and span development in intra- and intermolecular chemistry . the purpose of this review is to provide the reader with a glimpse of the growing power that this mode of chemical reactivity ha in organic synthesis and , a such , contains relevant example showcasing the utility of the reaction presented to address challenging problem in chemical synthesis , including application in the context of acyclic stereocontrol , fatty acid , carbocycle , and heterocycle synthesis . overall , the reader is expected to gain an appreciation of the present scope and limitation of early transition metal metallacycle - mediated bond construction in organic synthesis . hydrozirconation of alkene and alkyne gave functionalized alkane and stereodefined functionalized alkene under mild condition in high yield . for this purpose , commercially provided or in situ generated cp <nUm> ClHZr ( schwartz reagent ) is frequently used . the bulky zirconocene moiety is the critical factor for this big success . it lead to the high regioselectivity during hydrozirconation , and it also contributes to good functional group tolerance by sheltering the reactive point . the alkyl and alkenylzirconium complex subsequently react with electrophiles to form various CC(X) or CC(X) bond . to obtain higher or diverse reactivity , transmetalation can be employed to produce widespread synthetic application . A large number of caryophyllene - type sesquiterpenoids have been isolated from nature . many of them show a wide range of biological and pharmacological activity . recently , a highly oxygenated caryophyllene - type sesquiterpenoids , pestalotiopsin A and structurally related natural product such a pestalotiopsin B and C and taedolidol have been isolated from pestalotiopsis sp . these natural product are characterized by their highly distorted bi- to pentacyclic structure , all including a gem-dimethylated cyclobutane ring a one constituent . recently , the first asymmetric total synthesis of both enantiomer of pestalotiopsin A wa completed by the author and coworkers , thereby clarifying the previously unknown absolute stereochemistry of this natural product . these total synthesis were achieved by the following notable synthetic concept : ( 1 ) chiral auxiliary - based symmetric synthesis of the functionalized cyclobutane derivative through the lewis acid - catalyzed [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition between dimethyl ketene diethyl ketal and propiolamide equipped with the oppolzer 's camphorsultam and ( 2 ) an intramolecular Nozaki-Hiyama-Kishi cross-coupling mediated by a Cr (II) / catalytic Ni (II) system for high - yielding nine - membered ring formation . In this chapter , the author also summarize their synthetic approach toward pestalotiopsin A and related caryophyllene - type sesquiterpenoids , reported so far by procter and coworkers and paquette and coworkers . the procter group ha utilized the I2Sm - mediated reductive 4-exo-trig cyclization for the efficient construction of the polysubstituted cyclobutane moiety . the paquette group ha demonstrated the effectiveness of the zirconocene - mediated ring contraction strategy for access to the enantiomerically pure multiply functionalized cyclobutane moiety . the highlight of their synthetic endeavor aimed at the total synthesis of pestalotiopsin A are discussed in this chapter . the UV / visible absorption spectrum of rac-Et(Ind)2ZrC12 , rac-Et(Ind)2ZrMeC1 , rac-Et(Ind)2Zr(Me)2 , and the [rac-Et(Ind)2ZrMe-C2H4]+ complex , have been simulated by using the TDDFT technique within the adiabatic approximation and by using several basis set and XC functionals . hybrid XC functionals ( B3LYP , B3P86 and mPW1PW91 ) turn out to reproduce fairly well the essential feature of the experimental spectrum which originate from ligand to metal charge transfer transition . the comparison between the simulated and recorded UV / visible absorption spectrum appears therefore a a promising technique for assigning the structure of reaction intermediate in zirconocene polymerization . P = N-P = S linkage placed in some layer within dendritic architecture allow the grafting of several type of functional group at site and depth specific place in the internal layer of phosphorus containing dendrimers . these functional group are either organic derivative ( allyl , propargyl , isothiocyanate , amine , aldehyde , azide , crown - ether ) or metallic derivative ( gold chloride , anionic zwitterionic zirconocene ) . furthermore , the dendrimeric architecture is flexible enough to allow the growing of new dendrimers inside the internal void of the initial dendrimer . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science S.A . this paper describes ethylene polymerization using four kind of zirconocene with different substitutionary group in cp ring a catalyst and aluminoxane a cocatalyst . their polymerization activity and me of resultant polyethylene were compared . it wa found basically that in tp = <nUm> ° C and Al / Zr = <nUm> , polymerization activity were of the following order : A2 > B2 > A1 > B1 [ A1 : ( CH2 double bond CH-CH2-CH2-Cp)2ZrCl2 ; B1 : ( CH2 double bond CH-CH2-CH2-CH2-Cp)2ZrCl2 ; A2 : { CH2 double bond C(CH3)-CH2-Cp}2ZrCl2 ; B2 : { CH3(CH3)-C double bond CH-CH2-Cp}2ZrCl2 ] . polymerization activity were affected greatly by polymerization condition . the influence of catalyst concentration on polymerization activity were discussed . the possible effect mechanism of different substitutionary group in cp ring on polymerization activity wa investigated . propylene polymerization and propylene / 1-octene copolymerization were studied using rac-Me2SiInd2ZrCl2(1) / MAO or rac-Me2SiInd2ZrCl2 / ( MAO + TIBA ) a catalyst ( methyl aluminoxane , MAO ; AliBu3 , TIBA ) . the structure distribution of the polymer wa characterized by temperature gradient extraction fractionation or precipitation fractionation , a well a by DSC analysis of the thermal segregated sample . by comparing the structure distribution of polypropylene and propylene-1-octene copolymer synthesized by <nUm> / MAO and <nUm> / ( MAO + TIBA ) , it is found that adding TIBA in the catalyst system increase the blockiness of the polymer chain , especially in the copolymerization system . it is assumed that , when iso-butyl is incorporated in the aluminoxane , ion pair of the active center and the aluminoxane counter ion may exist in different state that show different catalytic behavior , resulting in the formation of polymer with block structure . A novel carrier of ultradispersed diamond black powder ( UDDBP ) wa used to support metallocene catalyst . Al2O3 wa also used a carrier in order to compare with UDDBP . supported catalyst for ethylene polymerization were synthesized by two different reaction method . one way wa direct immobilization of the metallocene on the support , the other wa adsorption of MAO onto the support followed by addition of the metallocene . four supported catalyst Cp2ZrCl2 / UDDBP , Cp2ZrCl2 / Al2O3 , Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO / UDDBP and Cp2ZrCl2 / Al2O3 / MAO were obtained . the content of the zirconium in the supported catalyst wa determined by UV spectroscopy . the activity of the ethylene polymerization catalyzed by supported catalyst wa investigated . the influence of Al / Zr molar ratio and polymerization temperature on the activity wa discussed . the polymerization rate wa also observed . qualitative investigation of the mechanism of photochemical decomposition of diphenylpermethyltitanocene and zirconocene have been made . reductive elimination a well a homolytic cleavage of metal-carbon 0-bonds are the two major pathway for photodecomposition of the diphenylpermethylmetallocenes . when benzene-d6 wa used a the solvent for photolysis of diphenylpermethyltitanocene , biphenyl-d0 and biphenyl-d5 were found in a ratio of <nUm> / <nUm> , indicating that reductive elimination wa the much more favorable process . but in the case of diphenylpermethylzirconocene , biphenyl-d0 and biphenyl-d5 were found in a ratio of <nUm> / <nUm> , indicating that the homolytic photocleavage of the 0-bonds wa predominant . In the presence of carbon monoxide , moderately large amount of the dicarbonylpermethylmetallocenes were found , suggesting that the permethylmetallocenes were the intermediate . the discovery of pentamethylcyclopentadiene and 2,3,4,5-tetramethylfulvene in the recovered solvent indicated further photodecomposition of permethylmetallocene . consequently another intermediate , [(C5Me4CH2)M] , is proposed . an oligomeric material wa found to be the major metal containing product after the photolyses . the reaction of dimethylzirconocene with 2R,3R-diethyltartrate proceeds with evolution of two equivalent of methane and yield the chiral diethyltartratozirconocene dimer <nUm> . the analogous reaction between Cp2Zr(CH3)2 and 2S,3S-diethyltartrate furnishes ent-2 in almost quantitative yield . complex <nUm> contains a dimetallatricyclic framework ( tetraoxadizirconatricyclo[5.3.0.02,6]decane ) in solution a well a in the solid state . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes in space group P21 with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> and rw = <nUm> . In solution the tartratozirconocene dimer <nUm> undergoes an intramolecular automerization reaction ( DG ‡ intra ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ) which probably proceeds via a ten - membered metallacyclic intermediate or transition state . A cross-over experiment between the enantiomeric complex <nUm> and ent-2 showed the activation barrier for intermolecular exchange of mononuclear dioxazirconacyclopentane unit Cp2ZrOCH(E)CH(E)O ( ECO2C2H5 ) leading to equilibration with the isomeric dinuclear tartratozirconocene complex meso-2 to be at DG ‡ inter ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 . complex meso-2 show NMR spectrum compatible with a static ten - membered dimetallamonocyclic ring structure . the reaction of dimethylzirconocene with meso-dimethyltartrate yield the (meso-dimethyltartrato)zirconocene dimer <nUm> ( two isomer , 4a and 4b in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio , both of which posse dynamic dimetallatricyclic structure in solution ( DG ‡ intra ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 4a ) ; DG ‡ intra ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 4b ) ; DG ‡ inter ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 4a--4b ) . crystallization from methylene chloride give single crystal of the isomeric (meso-dimethyltartrato)zirconocene dimer 5a which contains a monocyclic ten - membered ring structure . complex 5a crystallizes in space group P21 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° ; z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> and rw = <nUm> . the amino-functionalized metallocene (C5H4CH(Me)NMe2)2ZrCl <nUm> , [(CpN)2ZrCl2] wa synthesized by salt metathesis of Cl4Zr and <nUm> equiv. of C5H4CH(Me)NMe2Li . the metallocene wa obtained in good yield a a mixture of rac and meso diastereomers a established by NMR spectroscopy . the addition of <nUm> equiv. of n-BuLi to the metallocene (CpN)2ZrCl2 produced a co-catalyst system which wa active , at a <nUm> mol % loading , in the dehydropolymerization of PhSiH3 to poly(phenylsilane) , P2Si . the P2Si wa obtained a a <nUm> : <nUm> linear - cyclic mixture ( mw = <nUm> , Mn = <nUm> ) a established by GPC analysis ; 29Si{1H} NMR spectroscopy revealed an atactic polymer microstructure . the synthesis and characterization of an edge - bridged half - open zirconocene , Zr(C5H5)(dmch)(PMe3)2 ( dmch = dimethylcyclohexadienyl ) , are described . As expected , the Zr-C bond distance for the dmch ligand are significantly shorter than those for the CH ligand . the compound readily incorporates <nUm> equiv. of alkyne , with loss of the PMe3 ligand , leading to a zirconacyclopentadiene complex , so that the dmch ligand ha remained intact . the highly electrophilic borane BC18F15 reacts with n-octadecanol ( n-C18H37OH ) and n-octadecanethiol ( n-C18H37SH ) to form equilibrium mixture of reactant and the <nUm> : <nUm> adduct (n-C18H37EH)B(C6F5)3 ( e = O , S ) ; equilibrium constant for adduct formation are determined . the adduct are deprotonated by 1,8-bis(dimethylamino)naphthalene ( proton sponge ) to form the salt [C10H6(NMe2)2H][(n-C 18H37O)B(C6F5)3 ] and [C10H6(NMe2)2H][(n-C 18H37S)B(C6F5)3 ] , respectively , and by Cp2ZrMe2 to give methane and , apparently , the unstable zirconium complex [Cp2ZrMe][(n-C18H37E)B(C6F 5)3 ] . the alcohol , alkoxide , thiol and thiolate system are characterized in solution by 1H , 19F , 13C(1H) and 11B NMR spectroscopy and in the solid state by FAB mass spectrometry , and it is also shown that proton sponge can coordinate in monodentate fashion to BC18F15 . sixteen asymmetric dinuclear ansa zirconocene complex bearing cyclopentadienyl , indenyl or fluorenyl ligand and their ligand precursor have been synthesized and characterized by NMR spectroscopy . after activation with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , the complex behave like dual site catalyst and produce polyethylene with bimodal or broad molecular weight distribution in homogeneous and heterogeneous medium . A boron - bridged amido-cyclopentadienyl ligand wa recently shown to form constrained - geometry titanium - complex that are capable of olefin polymerisation . here , the synthesis of the corresponding amido-indenyl ligand e1-C9H7B(NiPr2)N(H) ph ( C9H7 = indenyl ) ( 2a / 2v ) and it allyl-vinyl isomerisation are discussed . deprotonated 2a reacts with Cl4Zr to give the strongly distorted zirconocene - type complex [ zr{e <nUm> : e1-C9H6B(NiPr 2)NPh}2 ] ( 3 ) in a <nUm> : <nUm> reaction . all compound have been characterised by multinuclear NMR method and structure of both the ligand 2a and the complex <nUm> have been confirmed by x-ray diffraction . the new terminal zirconocene - organophosphanido complex [Cp2Zr(Cl){P(H)Dmp}] ( 1 ) and [Cp2Zr{P(H)Dmp}2] ( 2 ) ( dmp = 2,6-Mes2C6H3 ) bearing the sterically demanding ligand dmp have been prepared and structurally characterized . A flattened pyramidal geometry for the phosphorus atom of <nUm> and a shortened Zr-P bond length of <nUm> Å provide evidence for moderate Zr-P p-bonding . compound <nUm> , however , display both pyramidal and planar phosphorus atom . the corresponding Zr-P bond length of <nUm> and <nUm> Å , in conjunction with the phosphorus geometry , indicate that one phosphanido ligand is engaged in substantial p-bonding to the zirconium center while minimal , if any , of such interaction are present for the other phosphanido ligand . the solid state structure and 31P NMR spectrum for <nUm> and <nUm> are very different than previously reported [Cp2Zr(Cl){P(H)Mes*}] and [Cp2Zr{P(H)Mes*}2] ( mes* = 2,4,6-(t)Bu3C6H2 ) which carry the related sterically demanding group mes* . comparison to other structurally characterized zirconocene(IV) and hafnocene(IV) complex having terminal phosphanido ligand suggest that upon increasing the steric congestion at the phosphorus atom greater π interaction with the metal center are afforded if such steric interaction do not prevent achieving proper alignment of the PR2 group for optimal M-P p-bonding . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science S.A . A zirconocene-ethylene complex reacted with propargylic ether to give allene derivative in good yield via b-alkoxide elimination . deuterolysis of the reaction mixture revealed that the final product after elimination still had a zirconium-carbon bond . coupling of styrene and propargylic ether wa mediated by Cp2ZrBu2 ( negishi reagent ) to give phenethyl allene derivative . b-Alkoxide elimination from zirconacyclopentadienes bearing two a-CH2OMe group wa also observed . one CH2OMe group wa easily eliminated . elimination of the second CH2OMe group wa dependent on it structure . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science S.A . the kinetics of calcite ( CCaO3 ) crystallization on calcite in the presence of titanocene , zirconocene , vanadocene , hafnocene dichloride and ferricenium salt wa investigated by the constant composition technique . the rate of crystal growth measured in the presence of metallocene complex at concentration <nUm> - <nUm> × 10-5 mol dm-3 were drastically reduced by 27-66 % , possibly through adsorption onto the active site of crystal growth . kinetics analysis suggested a surface diffusion controlled spiral growth mechanism . gem-Difluoroolefins with a wide range of substituents are readily synthesized from commercially available 2,2,2-trifluoroethyl p-toluenesulfonate , via a pathway that comprises the following two process : ( i ) a boron - mediated alkylation leading to gem-difluorovinylborane , and ( ii ) subsequent direct functionalizations via gem-difluorovinylcopper . this methodology provides a general one - pot synthesis of unsymmetrically disubstituted difluoroolefins by the introduction of difluorovinylidene unit a an ambiphile ( CF2C-+ ) . a-Nonsubstituted difluorovinylzirconocene and -zinc generated in situ from 2,2-difluorovinyl p-toluenesulfonate open a complementary way to the synthesis of monosubstituted gem-difluoroolefins bearing unsaturated carbon substituents . these difluorovinylmetals ( B , Cu , Zr , Zn ) are all remarkably thermostable against b-elimination in spite of the absence of electron - withdrawing group , and are therefore easy to handle and react readily . the reaction of the organic - soluble (trimethylsilyl)arylaminosilanetriol RSi(OH)3 ( r = (2,6-i-Pr2C6H3)NSiMe3 ) ( 1 ) with titanocene dichloride and zirconocene dichloride in dimethoxyethane a the solvent lead to the formation of acyclic and cyclic siloxane [RSi(OH)2(OTiCp2CI)] ( 2 ) and [RSi(OH)(OZrCp2)O]2 ( 3 ) , respectively . the molecular structure of the new product <nUm> and <nUm> have been established by mean of their analytical and spectral data . further , in each case the solid - state structure of the compound ha been determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction study . the el mass spectral data reveal the presence of higher molecular weight compound in the gas phase corresponding to the bicyclic or cubic structure of <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . A force field model for ansa - zirconocene complex is constructed , which represents each C atom of the C5 - ring ligand a being bonded directly to the metal center , rather than by way of the C5 - ring centroid . this e5- model , which describes coordination geometry by mutual repulsion of the C5 - ring and halide ligand , ha no adjustable equilibrium or force - constant parameter for any of the angle at the Zr center . nevertheless , vibrational frequency and structural parameter are reproduced for a series of simple and Me2Si - bridged zirconocene dihalide complex with an accuracy comparable to that of the more complex centroid model . strong steric distortion , revealed by crystal structure determination in a series of tert-butyl- substituted ansa - zirconocene dibromide and diiodide complex , are likewise reproduced with remarkable accuracy by the e5-force field model . A series of <nUm> metallacyclic zirconocene complex ha been synthesized by the reaction of o-phenyl-substituted zirconocene dichloride complex with two equivalent of n-butyllithium via CH bond - activation reaction on the phenyl ring . after activation with methyl aluminoxane , these metallacycles are up to five time more active ethylene polymerization catalyst than the original metallocene dichloride complex similarly activated . the reaction of o-phenyl-1-bromoalkanes with cyclopentadienyl sodium , indenyl lithium or fluorenyl lithium form o-phenylalkyl-substituted ligand precursor in high yield . the corresponding anion react with zirconium tetrachloride to give o-phenylalkyl-substituted zirconocene dichloride complex . after activation with methylaluminoxane , these complex are highly active catalyst for homogeneous ethylene polymerization . the nature of the o-phenyl substituents determines the polymerization activity of the catalyst to a large extent . the polymerization result of <nUm> new complex are compared . chiral bicyclic phosphanes incorporating a five- and an eight - membered ring were prepared via selective P-N bond cleavage of chiral triquinphosphoranes induced by dimethylzirconocene Cp2ZrMe2 or diphenylzirconocene Cp2ZrPh2 . the three step synthesis of 2-methyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1H-indene from cyclohexyl methacrylate is described [ ( a ) PPA cyclization ; ( b ) AlH4Li reduction ; ( c ) ClH dehydration ] . this annelated trisubstituted cyclopentadiene wa bridged selectively to form ethylene- or dimethylsilyl-bridged bis(2-methyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1H-inden-1-yl) ligand . metal complex ( m = Cl2Zr , Cl2Ti , ClY , and ClLu ) of the bis(2-methyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroinden-1-yl)dimethylsilane ligand were formed a meso / dl stereoisomeric mixture in ratio from <nUm> : <nUm> to <nUm> : <nUm> dl : meso . A protocol for asymmetric synthesis of chiral-at - metal complex is described , but enantiomerically - enriched product can not be isolated due to formation of complex between the group <nUm> metallocene product and the borane by - product . an efficient method for synthesis of racemic chiral-at - metal metallocenes , through lithium chloride catalysed ligand redistribution reaction , is described . sterically - hindered racemic chiral-at - metal complex are prepared by nucleophilic substitution of prochiral dichloride . [Cp2'ZrCl(PHTipp)] ( 1 ) ( cp' = e5-C5H4Me , tipp = 2,4,6-Pr3 iC6H2 ) and [ cp2 ° ZrCl(PHCy) ] ( 2 ) ( cp ° = e5-C5EtMe4 , cy = cyclohexyl ) readily insert CyNC to give [Cp2'ZrCl{e2-NCyC(PHTipp)}] ( 3 ) and [ cp2 ° ZrCl{e2-NCyC(PHCy)} ] ( 4 ) . <nUm> and <nUm> were characterised spectroscopically ( IR , NMR , MS ) and by crystal structure determination , which showed an e2 bonding mode ( C,N ) of the NCyC(PHR) ligand . of the two possible coordination mode of the ligand , <nUm> is obtained exclusively a the exo isomer , in which the NCy group is adjacent to the Zr-Cl bond , while for <nUm> , both isomer ( exo and endo ) are formed [ <nUm> : <nUm> ( 4a:4b ) ] , whereby the endo isomer is favoured . the exo isomer 4a wa structurally characterised . halo - alkoxide zirconocene complex (e5-C5Me5)2ZrCl(OCH 2CH2SPh ) ( 1 ) and (e5-C5Me5)2ZrCl(OC 6H4SH ) ( 2 ) have been prepared by reaction of the corresponding zirconocene dichloride with HOCH2CH2SPh or C6H6OS , respectively , in the presence of NEt3 . the molecular structure of <nUm> ha been determined by x-ray diffraction study . alkyl- and aryl-containing specie (e5-C5Me5)2ZrMe(OCH 2CH2SPh ) ( 3 ) and (e5-C5Me5)2ZrPh(OCH 2CH2SPh ) ( 4 ) were synthesised by reaction of the corresponding dialkyl or diaryl specie with HOCH2CH2SPh , or by reaction of complex <nUm> with LiMe or LiPh , respectively . finally , the dialkoxide complex L2M(OCH2CH2SR)2 [ L = e5-C5H5 , m = Ti , r = ph ( 5 ) ; L = e5-C5Me5 , m = Ti , r = ph ( 6 ) ; L = e5-C5Me5 , m = Ti , r = me ( 7 ) ] were prepared by reaction of the appropriate dichloride and alcohol in the presence of NEt3 , and (e5-C5H5)2Zr(OCH 2CH2SMe)2 ( 8 ) wa synthesised by reacting (e5-C5H5)2ZrMe2 with two equivalent of HOCH2CH2SMe . the linear relationship between the redox and optical HOMO - to - LUMO electron transition are reported for complex molecule with p-ligands for the first time . linear correlation between electrochemical ( redox ) gap and absorption charge - transfer energy have been noted for Ti(IV) , Zr(IV) , and Hf(IV) bis(cyclopentadienyl) dichloride . A similar correlation wa also observed for the fourth ionization potential of the corresponding group IVB metal . the correlation between absorption charge - transfer energy and redox gap wa justified for a series of ansa- and unbridged zirconocene dichloride and dimethyls with variable sandwich ligand . the reaction of the zirconocene-ethylene complex Cp2Zr(CH2 = CH2)(PMe3) with group <nUm> metal chloride or alkoxides give ethylene-bridged group <nUm> metal - zirconocene complex . A reaction mechanism via a five - membered intermediate which involves direct coupling of ethylene and single bonding is proposed . new unbridged zirconocene complex , bis(1,2-diphenylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 3 ) and bis(4-methy-1,2-diphenylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) have been synthesized in high yield by reaction of Cl4Zr with the lithium salt of 1,2-diphenylcyclopentadiene ( 1 ) or 4-methyl-1,2-diphenylcyclopentadiene ( 2 ) , respectively . x-ray crystallographic analysis reveals both complex are in racemic - like conformation with near C2 symmetry in solid state . when activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , <nUm> and <nUm> exhibit moderate catalytic activity for ethylene polymerization at relatively low Al : Zr ratio , producing high molecular weight ( > <nUm> ) polyethylene with high melting transition temperature . atactic propylene oligomers with average molecular weight of ≃ <nUm> g mol-1 were produced by both <nUm> and <nUm> at relatively high catalytic activity upon activation with MAO . the reaction of LiP(H)B(NiPr2)[N(SiMe3)2]*DME with Cp2ZrCl2 in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio yield the metallodiphosphane Cp2Zr{P(H)B(NiPr2)[N(SiMe3) 2]}2 ( 3a ) . combination of 3a with C4MoO4 ( norbornadiene ) provides the adduct Cp2Zr{P(H)B(NiPr2)[N(SiMe3) 2]}2*Mo(CO)4 ( 4a ) in which the metallo - diphosphane 3a act a a chelating ligand . the compound have been characterized by spectroscopic method and the molecular structure of 3a and 4a have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction method . the chemical and structural feature are compared and contrasted with related metallo - diphosphanes that contain organic substituents on the diphosphane P atom . the zr(+3) complex of composition [Cp2Zr(m-H)]2(m-H)AlCl2 ( 8 ) and the zr(+4) complex of composition [Cp2ZrH(m-H)2]3Al ( 9 ) were isolated from solution containing zirconocene(+4) and titanocene(+3) compound and AlH4Li and characterized by x-ray structural analysis . the basic structural element of <nUm> is the six - atom ring AlH3Zr2 , in which the metal atom are linked by ordinary hydrogen bridge . In the structure of <nUm> , the hb endo atom is off the bisector plane of the Cp2Zr fragment and the Al-H distance in the distorted octahedral environment of the aluminium atom are markedly different . the reaction of neomenthylcyclopentadiene with acetone solution led to 6,6-dimethyl-3-neomenthylfulvene ( 6 ) . the bridged 3-neomenthylcyclopentadienyl-2-fluorenylpropane ( 7 ) ha been isolated after reaction of <nUm> with fluorenyllithium salt . the reaction of Cl4Zr with the dilithium salt of <nUm> in diethyl ether yield the complex isopropylidene(e5-3-neomenthylCp)-(e5-9-fluorenyl) Cl2Zr ( 4 ) a a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of diastereomers . the complex wa fully characterized by single - crystal x-ray diffraction and NMR method . complex <nUm> is an active catalyst for the homogeneous polymerization of propylene when activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the polypropylene polymer produced with <nUm> ha lower molecular weight and a lower degree of syndiotactic or hemiisotactic stereoregularity , but a higher degree of isotactic character ( mm triad of <nUm> % ) than the polymer produced with the syndiospecific catalyst isopropylidene(Cp)(Flu)ZrCl2 ( 1a ) under these condition . 2-Lithiofuran wa added to 2-indanone to yield 2-(2-furyl)indene ( 4 ) after hydrolytic workup . treatment of <nUm> with n-butyllithium gave 2-(2-furyl)indenyllithium ( 5 ) . subsequent reaction of <nUm> with <nUm> molar equivalent of zirconium tetrachloride in toluene yielded bis[2-(2-furyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 6 ) that wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the homogeneous 6-methylalumoxane ziegler - natta catalyst produced elastomeric polypropylene . the reaction of Cp2TiCl2 ( cp = CH ) with ethanol in the presence of Et3N in acetonitrile yield the derivative CpTiCl(OEt)2 or CpTiCl2(OEt) . similar reaction of Cp2MCl2 ( m = Ti or Zr ) with glycol ( GH2 = 1,2-propanediol , 2,3-butanediol , pinacol or hexylene glycol ) or fluoro-b-diketones ( KeH = hexafluoroacetylacetone(hfa) , benzoyltrifluoroacetone ( bta ) or 2-thenoyltrifluoroacetone ( tta ) ) gave CpMCl(G) or CpMCl(Ke)2 . upon thermolysis in aromatic hydrocarbon solvent diarylzirconocenes undergo successive replacement of their s-bonded ligand by aryl group from the solvent . analysis of the product mixture by photochemical degradation to biphenyls reveals that intermediate aryne zirconocene complex are formed which then react with the solvent with CH bond fission and formation of new CZr bond . A b-hydride elimination process can be excluded for the formation of the aryne complex and it is suggested that they are formed via abstraction of an ortho proton from one of the aryl ligand by the other s-bonded group . the preparation and property of trimethylene bridged titanocene , zirconocene , and hafnocene dichloride are described . additional evidence is presented of correlation between ring - ring angle and differential ring - proton shift in the PMR spectrum . thermolysis of η <nUm> -benzoyl(phenyl)zirconocene yield the η <nUm> -benzophenonzirconocene complex <nUm> , isolated a a dimer . <nUm> exhibit an ambivalent reactivity pattern . the formation of five - membered metallacycles from <nUm> and olefinic hydrocarbon possibly proceeds analogous to reaction of " normal " metalolefin p-complexes . however , both reaction with the electron - deficient olefin dimethylfumarate and -maleate and the behavior towards electrophilic and protic reagent a well a aromatic hydrocarbon might be interpreted in term of a metallaoxirane - character of <nUm> . the formation of an adduct between a dihydrogen and a d0 specie of the general type (C5R5)2Zr(R')2 ( R,R' H or CH3 ) is suggested to involve a process analogous to that in CO adduct formation , and is studied by an extended huckel molecular orbital analysis . back donation into s* H orbitals arises from high - lying MR' bonding orbitals and determines the stability of alternative adduct geometry . two isomeric H adduct can interconvert by an intramolecular hydrogen shift . with D2 , this reaction sequence lead to hydrogen isotope exchange . the transition state of this reaction mode contains a three - centre ( H ⋯ H ⋯ H)- ligand configuration with bonding property similar to those of an allyl ligand ; it doe not involve an oxidative change in the charge on the metal nor generation of a positively charged , protonic hydrogen specie by heterolytic H cleavage . the term ' direct hydrogen transfer ' is proposed for this type of elementary reaction . for H - induced alkane elimination from group IV metallocene alkyl derivative , an analogous reaction mechanism , involving formation of a H adduct and a subsequent intramolecular hydrogen shift toward the alkyl ligand , is predicted to proceed with moderate activation energy . metalluorene complex (p-C5H5)M(CO)(C12H8) (IVa)-(IVc) and ( p-C5H5 ) C13F8O (IVd)-(IVf) ( m = Co , Rh and Ir ) have been prepared from reaction of the appropriate ( p-cyclopentadienyl ) carbonylmetal diiodides with 2,2'-dilithhiolbiphenyl ( IIa ) and 2,2'-dilithiooctafluorobiphenyl ( IIb ) , respectively the triphenylphoshine substitution reaction of cobalt compound ( IVa ) and ( IVd ) have also been studied . reaction of ( IIa ) and ( IIb ) with norbornadieneplatinum dichloride result in the preparation of metallocyclic platinum compound ( p-C7H8 ) and (p-C7H8)Pt(C12H8) . A reaction of ( IIb ) with zirconocene dichloride produce (p-C5H5)2Zr(C12F8) , the first example of a ziconium - containing metalofluorene . bis(h5-cyclopentadienyl)zirconacyclopentadiene complex were prepared by reduction of zirconocene dichloride in THF with magnesium in the presence of various alkyne . hydrolysis lead to the corresponding (E,E)-butadiene derivative . the negative chemical ionization ( NCI ) mass spectrum with methane of organometallic complex of benchrotrene , titanocene and zirconocene family have been determined . A comparative study with positive mass spectrum by electronic impact show the complementarity and the specificity of the two technique . the NCI mass spectrum are characterized by very little fragmentation . for the benchrotrene complex the molecular peak are considerably enhanced . for some chlorinated titanocene complex the NCI mass spectrum exhibit an ion - molecule attchment peak corresponding to [ m + cl]- . the reaction of e5-C5H5ZrCl3 or Cl4Zr with a phospholyle anion lead to phospha- and diphospha - zirconocene dichloride , respectively . these compound , which are sensitive towards air , have been characterized by mass spectrometry and 1H NMR spectroscopy . irradition of benzene solution of zirconocene dichloride and zirconocene- d10 dichloride with <nUm> nm light lead to the formation of zirconocene-d5 dichloride with a quantum yield of <nUm> mol / ei . the equilibrium constant is <nUm> zirconocene dichloride exchange a cyclopentadienyl ligand described . the volatile product resulting from the solid - state thermal decomposition of the dimethylmetallocenes Cp2M(CH3)2 ( m = Ti , Zr , Hf ) have been characterized by gas chromatography - mass bond give new racemic and optically active substituted zirconocene and hafnocene dihydrides A : (RCp)2MH2 ( m = Zr , Hf ; r = me , Me2CH , Me3C , PhCH2 ) and B : (R*Cp)2MH2 ( m = Zr , Hf ; R* = MeCHEtCH2 , PhCHEtCH2 ) , R*CpCpHfH2 R* = PhCHCH3 ) . substitution of hydridic hydrogen by halogen , mobile hydrogen compound , addition with unsaturated derivative are studied . the A and B type give novel substituted zirconocene and hafnocene dihydrides . the use of the optically active complex [ e5-C6H5C{black star}H(CH3)C5H4 ] (e5-C5H5)Zr(CH3)2 a a catalyst in homogeneous hydrogenation of prochiral alkene is reported . synthesis of C12H10O2Zr and C12H10HfO2 , a well a a more facile synthesis of CH C2O2Ti , . catalytic hydrogenation of diphenylacetylene in the presence of the new carbonyl and CH C2O2Ti is examined and indicates a reduc . the rate of hydrogenolytic alkane liberation from permethylzirconocene neopentyl halide compound , (C5(CH3)5)2Zr(X)CH2C(CH3)3 , x = F , Cl , Br ) , is greatly reduced if the ring ligand are interconnected by an ethylene bridge , a in C2H4(C5(CH3)4)2Zr(X)CH2C(CH3)3 . hydrogenolysis of the corresponding permethylzirconocene neopentyl hydride compound ( x = H ) , on the other hand , is too fast for kinetic measurement at room temperature , even with the ethylene-bridged derivative . these observation , and the inverse kinetic isotope effect observed for reaction with D2 , are interpreted with the assumption that H - induced alkane liberation from permethylzirconocene alkyl halide proceeds via an indirect ring - mediated hydrogen transfer reaction which is feasible only with freely rotating ring ligand ; hydrogenolysis of permethylzirconocene alkyl hydride , on the other hand , apparently occurs without such limitation , by direct H - to - alkyl hydrogen transfer . derivatisation of racemic ethylene-bridged bis(4,5,6,7tetrahydro-1-indenyl)-titanium and -zirconium dichloride with o-acetyl-r-mandelic acid affords diastereomers which can be separately crystallised . crystal and molecular structure of these diastereomers reveal different chelate ring conformation in the crystalline state . the separated diastereomers have been converted , via their dimethyl derivative , into the corresponding titanocene and zirconocene dichloride enantiomer , the optical purity of these enantiomer ha been demonstrated by their reconversion into the acetyl-r-mandelate derivative . diphenylmetallocene complex (RCp)2ZrPh2 ( 4a , 4b : RH , CH3 ) react with the phosphorous ylide Ph3PCHCH3 ( 5 ) at <nUm> ° C to yield six - membered metallocyclic ylides (RCp)2ZrCH2CHP(Ph)2(C6H4) ( 8a,8b ) plus two equivalent of benzene . the reaction presumably proceeds through a thermally generated ( e2-benzyne ) zirconocene intermediate which take up <nUm> to form a metallocene ylide (RCp)2Zr(Ph)C(CH3)PPh3 ( 6 ) . b-Hydride elimination and readdition followed by ortho-metallation then lead to the six - (e6-Boratastilbene)(e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) , (e6-4-boratastyrylstilbene)(e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) , [1,4-bis(boratastyryl)benzene]bis[(dichloro)(pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium] ( 3 ) , and bis(e6-boratastilbene)zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) were synthesized . the crystal structure of <nUm> wa determined by x-ray crystallography . these zirconium complex show activity in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) for the polymerization of ethylene . the activity are in the following order : <nUm> > <nUm> > Cp2ZrCl2 > <nUm> > <nUm> . the activity of <nUm> is three time higher than that of Cp2ZrCl2 under similar condition . lithium imidazolide , generated by NH deprotonation of imidazole with n-butyllithium , reacts with two molar equivalent of tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane with NB bond formation to yield the product Li+[(C3H3N2){B(C6F5)3}2]- ( 6a , isolated in > <nUm> % yield ) . the analogous reaction sequence starting from 4,5-dimethylimidazole give the corresponding salt 6b . it THF coordination product [Li(THF)4]+[(C3HMe2N2){B(C6F5)3}2]- ( 6b*THF ) wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . deprotonation of benzimidazole followed by the addition of two BC18F15 equivalent gave the corresponding benzimidazolide - metallocene dichloride titanium and zirconium complex of the type [Me2Si(e5-C5H2(SiMe3)2)2]MCl2 ( m = Zr ( 1 ) Ti ( 2 ) ) are reported . the complex have been tested for ethylene polymerization . novel metallacyclic zirconocene complex were prepared by reacting o-alkenyl substituted zirconocene dichloride complex with two equivalent of n-butyllithium . the factor determining the reaction course and the structure of the respective metallacycle formed is the chain length of the alkenyl group . after activation with methylaluminoxane the metallocene dichloride complex and the derived metallacyclic derivative are excellently suited for ethylene polymerization . reaction of the lithium salt of 3-substituted indene <nUm> , <nUm> with ZrCl4(THF)2 gave two series of nonbridged bi (1-substituted)indenyl zircogone dichloride complex . fractional recrystallization from THF- petroleum ether furnished the pure racemic and mesomeric isomer of [ ( e5-C9H6-1-C(R1)(R1 = R2 = CH3 , n = <nUm> , rac-1a and meso-1b : R1 = CH3 , R2 = C2H5 ; n = <nUm> or O , rac-2a and meso-2b ) , respectively , complex 1a wa further characterized by x-ray diffraction to have a C2 symmetrically racemic structure , where the six - member ring of the indenyl part are oriented laterally and two o-CH3O-C6H4-C(CH3)2-substituents are oriented to the open of the metallocene ( ind : bis-laterral , anti ; substituent : bis-centra , syn ) . the four zirconocene complex are highly symmetrical in solution a characterized by room temperature 1H - NMR , however 1H-1H NOESY of meso-1b show that some of the NOE interaction arise from the two separated indenyl part of the same molecule , which can only be explained well by taking into account the torsion isomer in solution . 2,2'-bis-(indene-2-yl)-biphenyl-Zirconium dichloride ( biph[2-Ind]2ZrCl2 ) supported on silica and in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) cocatalyst wa studied by FT - raman spectroscopy . even though the transition metal wa present at a concentration down to <nUm> wt. % , useful FT - raman spectrum were obtained . the aim of this work wa to correlate spectral feature to such typical catalyst property like Al / Zr ratio and catalytic yield ( CY ) . the raman spectrum contain signal due to the co-catalyst and the catalyst . catalyst signal due to Zr-Cl , Zr - CH3 and Zr - other ligand ( e.g. cp or Biph-2-Indene ) bond a well a ligand specific signal were identified using literature data , model compound and ab - initio quantum chemical calculation of the vibrational spectrum . an excellent correlation wa found between the intensity ratio of the peak at <nUm> and <nUm> cm-1 and the Al / Zr ratio . A fairly linear correlation wa found between the signal intensity due to M-CH3 bond and the catalytic yield ( kg PE per mmole Zr ) for a series of sample of different Al / Zr ratio and different catalytic yield . In response to a recent paper concerning the formation of a putative arene complex , ° C , we present data showing that this reaction lead in fact to a mixture of [(Cp2*ZrMe)2(m-Me)][B(C6F5)4] and [ Cp2*ZrMe ⋯ BC24F20 ] , while NMR signal attributed to e-arene coordination of triphenylethane are due to unreacted CPh3+ ( cp* = e-C5Me5 ) . A new synthetic route to C-2 bridged indenyl metallocenes utilizing the anion of 1-indanone ha been developed . two new ansazirconocene complex 1a and 1b were synthesized and examined a precursor for the polymerization of a-olefins . these metallocenes were shown to be active for the polymerization of ethylene and for the oligiomerization of propylene when activated with excess methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . methylenecyclopropane ( 1a ) reacts with bis(trimethylphosphane)titanocene ( 8 ) and (e2-1-butene)(trimethylphosphane)zirconocene ( 12a ) via olefin complex ; e.g. <nUm> , in a [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition to afford the metallacyclopentane derivates <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> . In contrast , a [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition reaction is observed with bis(e5-1-butene)(trimethylphosphane)zirconium ( 12b ) to furnish the 1-zircona-4-methylenecyclohexane <nUm> . similarly , reaction of the complex <nUm> and 12a with benzylidenecyclopropane ( 1c ) give the olefin complex 9c and <nUm> , while a direct reaction between the indenyl complex 12b with 1c occurs to furnish the 1-zircona-2-benzylidenecyclobutane complex 21b which wa characterised by x-ray crystallography . ansa - zirconocene complex with an allyl substituted silane bridge synthesized and characterized . the molecular structure of 1a ha been determined by x-ray crystallographic analysis . the polymer immobilized metallocene catalyst 1b is prepared by the co-polymerization of 1a with styrene in the presence of radical initiator . the result of ethylene polymerization showed that the polymer immobilized metallocene catalyst kept high activity for ethylene polymerization and wa a potential supported catalyst for olefin polymerization . the zirconocene amide [Cp2Zr(Cl)N(CH2Ph)2] ( 5 ) , and the zirconocene ketimides [ Cp2Zr(Cl)N = C(But)Ph ] ( 7 ) , and [ Cp2Zr(Cl)N = C(NMe2)2 ] ( 9 ) , have been prepared by the transmetallation reaction between the appropriate lithiated organonitrogen compound and zirconocene dichloride ( 2 ) . In addition , their methylated derivative [Cp2Zr(Me)N(CH2Ph)2] ( 6 ) , [ Cp2Zr(Me)N = C(But)Ph ] ( 8 ) , and [ Cp2Zr(Me)N = C(NMe2)2 ] ( 10 ) , have been prepared by the reaction of each of the complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> with MeLi . compound <nUm> and <nUm> have been characterized by x-ray crystallography and the structure of the cocrystalline complex occur . the stereochemistry of Sn - to - Zr transmetalation wa studied by reacting ClZr <nUm> with that isomer of meso-BnMeSi(3- t bu- C <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> SnMe <nUm> which ha the benzyl group in axial position . exchange of SnMe <nUm> against ClZr <nUm> generates both isomer of the C S symmetric ansa - zirconocene meso-BnMeSi the minor product appears to be formed , under retention at both sn-bound C atom , by a concerted ' front - side ' attack of ClZr <nUm> . the synthesis of the 1,2,3-trisubstituted cyclopentadienes 3-10 and their corresponding zirconocene dichloride 11-18 from commercially available internal alkyne is presented . the solid state structure of the differently substituted zirconocenes 11-13 and 15-17 were examined by mean of x-ray analysis . the bite angle have shown not to be dependent on the substitution pattern of the cyclopentadienyl ligand . cyclic voltammetry wa used to measure the effect of introducing electron withdrawing and donating group at the five membered ligand on the lewis acidity of the zirconium central atom . dinuclear ansa zirconocene complex containing a half - sandwich and a sandwich moiety and their ligand precursor have been synthesized and characterized . after activation with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , these catalyst produce polyethylene with bimodal molecular weight distribution in homogeneous and heterogeneous medium . the catalyst performance and the polymer property were compared with mono nuclear reference catalyst . we briefly describe the unique coordination mode of s-trans-1,3-diene complex in this review . since the first discovery of mononuclear s-trans-1,3-diene complex of zirconocene and hafnocene , this unique coordination mode ha been found for a wide variety of transition metal over the periodic table . herein we summarize general aspect of the mononuclear s-trans diene complex including the recent result , and also describe dinuclear and multinuclear complex that coordinate in an s-trans fashion to polyenes . alkyl-substituted bis(cyclopentadienyl)dimethylsilanes react with Me2Sn(NEt2)2 and with (Me2N)4Sn to yield correspondingly substituted , meso-configurated RS-8-sila-4-stanna-s-tetrahydroindacene and axially symmetric RR,SS-4-spiro-bis(8-sila-4-stannas-tetrahydroindacene) compound , respectively , which are stereoselectively converted by reaction with Cl4Zr to the corresponding meso- and rac - configurated ansa - zirconocene complex . an ethylene-bridged zirconocene complex bearing methyl substituents only on the cyclopentadienyl carbon adjacent to bridge point , ethylenebis(1,3-dimethylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) wa synthesized . crystal structure of <nUm> wa determined . the complex , <nUm> , when activated with MAO , show better comonomer incorporation ability than [Ph2C(Fluo)(Cp)]ZrCl2 in the ethylene-norbornene copolymerization but it is not better than rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 for the ethylene-1-hexene copolymerization in term of activity and comonomer incorporation . cyclization of 1,3,6-heptatrienes <nUm> with cp <nUm> ZrBu <nUm> ( negishi reagent ) furnished a mixture of trans- and cis-zirconacyclopentanes that after hydrolysis afforded a mixture of isomeric dimethylcyclopentenes <nUm> and <nUm> in ca. <nUm> : <nUm> ratio . an attempt to isomerize the mixture of zirconacyclopentanes by stirring the reaction for <nUm> h resulted , after hydrolysis , in rather surprising formation of cis- dimethylcyclopentenes <nUm> with high selectivity . this is the first example of trans to ci isomerization of zirconacyclopentanes . further reaction of the intermediate zirconacyclopentanes with various electrophiles and a plausible reaction mechanism of the trans to ci isomerization are presented . reaction of zirconacyclopentadiene - coupled macrocycles with ClS or Cl4Ge gave new macrocycles containing thiophene and dichlorogermole group , respectively . the germoles , synthesized in high yield , posse labile chloride substituents that are readily displaced via nucleophilic substitution reaction . these germole - containing macrocycles are potentially useful a supramolecular building block . A macrocyclic trithiophene compound , with 1,4-phenylene group that bridge the thiophene ring , wa characterized by x-ray crystallography . the x-ray structure of a related trigermole macrocycle , with bridging biphenylene group , is also presented . group <nUm> metallocene mono- and bis-s-alkynyl complex of the type L <nUm> M(s-C ≡ CR ) and L <nUm> M(s-C ≡ CR ) <nUm> with m = titanium and zirconium in the oxidation state + <nUm> and + <nUm> and L = cp ( η <nUm> -cyclopentadienyl ) and cp* ( η <nUm> -pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ) are important compound for stoichiometric and catalytic C-C single bond coupling and cleavage reaction . detailed investigation show five - membered metallacyclocumulenes L <nUm> m(e <nUm> -1,2,3,4-RC <nUm> r ) a the key intermediate in both reaction of a C-C single bond cleavage of different 1,4-substituted 1,3-butadiynes RC ≡ C-C ≡ CR to alkynyl group and the opposite reaction of C-C single bond formation starting from alkynyl group under the formation of 1,4-substituted 1,3-butadiynes . depending on different metal m and ligand L , coupling or cleavage is favoured . combination of both reaction offered the first C-C single bond metathesis in homogeneous solution , which is photocatalyzed and titanocene - mediated . it proceeds via titanocene-mono-alkynyl complex , which are interesting specie also for other stoichiometric and catalytic C-C coupling reaction . some similarity regarding the σ - to - π conversion exist between the coupling of the alkynyl group at titano- and zirconocenes to complexed 1,3-butadiynes on one side and the coupling of phenyl group at chromium to complexed diphenyl on the other side . by the reaction of silyl anion with group <nUm> metallocene dichloride , a number of new group <nUm> oligosilyl compound have been synthesized . the silyl residue employed include the popular tris(trimethylsilyl)silyl group and sterically more encumbered derivative . for the case of the tris(trimethylsilyl)silyl group both the mono and the disilylated product were obtained . the synthesis and polymerization behavior of four new asymmetric ansa -metallocenes containing a 2,7-disubstituted fluorenyl moiety and an indenyl moiety is reported . three of the four catalyst , dichloro[e5-1-indenyl(1-methylethylidene)-[2,7-bis- (2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-e5-9-fluorenyl]zirconium ( 11 ) , dichloro[e5-1-indenyl(1-methylethylidene)-[2,7-bis- (2,6-dimethylphenyl)-e5-9-fluorenyl]zirconium ( 12 ) , and dichloro[e5-1-indenyl(1-methylethylidene)-[2,7-bis- (2-methylphenyl)-e5-9-fluorenyl ] zirconium ( 13 ) were highly active for the polymerization of both ethylene and propylene when activated with excess methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . dichloro[e5-1-indenyl(1-methylethylidene)- [2,7-dibenzyl-e5-9-fluorenyl]zirconium ( 14 ) wa poorly active for the polymerization of ethylene and wa therefore not evaluated a a propylene catalyst . the activity for propylene polymerization with catalyst 11-13 increased a the size of the substituents around the ligand framework increased , following the trend <nUm> > <nUm> > <nUm> . molecular weight of the polypropylene decreased a the temperature wa increased . the molecular weight data follows the same trend ( <nUm> > <nUm> > <nUm> ) a the activity data , wherein the largest substituents gave rise to the highest molecular weight . using 1H - NMR spectroscopy , mutual transformation and stability of cationic complex [ (Cp2ZrMe)2 (m-Me)]+[B(C6F5)4] - ( 1 ) , [ Cp2ZrMe+ ⋯ B(C6 F5)4- ] ( 2 ) and [ cp2 Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2]+[B(C6 F5)4]- (
