zirconocene concentration is high enough . it wa shown that at high zirconocene concentration , the decay rate of complex <nUm> and <nUm> in the oil constituent of the reaction mixture is at least a factor ten lower than that in the solvent . complex 1-3 are close in energy to each other and can be readily converted to one another by changing the ratio between Cp2ZrMe2 , [CPh3][B(C6F5)4] and AlMe3 . complex <nUm> reacts with excess [CPh3] [B(C6F5)4] to yield <nUm> with first order rate constant of <nUm> × 10-4 s-1 at <nUm> ° C . complex <nUm> reacts with excess [CPh3][B(C6 F5)4 ] to yield <nUm> with a half - life of <nUm> h at <nUm> ° C . addition of 1-hexene to sample containing various relative amount of complex 1-3 , and further 1H - NMR spectroscopic monitoring of the polymer / monomer ratio , showed that 1-3 have comparable polymerization activity . the reaction of Cl4Zr with four equivalent of the 6,6-dimethylcyclohexadienyl anion ( 6,6-dmch- ) in the presence of PMe3 lead system . complex of type (Cp-R)2ZrMe+-Me -- Al ≡ MAO ( IV ) with different [Me-MAO]- counteranions have been identified in the (Cp-R)2ZrCl2 / MAO ( r = n-Bu , t-Bu ) system at low Al / Zr ratio ( 50-200 ) . At Al / Zr ratio of 500-1000 , the complex [L2Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2] +[Me-MAO]- ( III ) dominates in all MAO - based reaction system studied . ethene polymerization activity strongly depends on the Al / Zr ratio ( Al / Zr = 200-1000 ) for the system (Cp-R)2 Cl2Zr / MAO ( r = H , me , n-Bu , t-Bu ) , while it is virtually constant in the same range of Al / Zr ratio for the catalytic system (Cp-R)2ZrCl2 / MAO ( r = 1,2-Me2 , 1,2,3-Me3 , 1,2,4-Me3 , me4 ) and rac-Me 2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO . the data obtained are interpreted on assumption that complex III is the main precursor of the active center of polymerization in MAO - based system . zirconocene dichloride complex with substituents containing aliphatic end group at the aromatic ligand react with two equivalent of n-butyllithium to give metallacyclic zirconocene complex via aliphatic CH - activation reaction . As well a o-alkenyl substituted zirconocene dichloride complex with terminal aliphatic group a zirconocene dichloride complex with purely aliphatic substituents are suitable for the synthesis of such metallacycles . In combination with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , these metallacycles are excellent catalyst for ethylene polymerization . their activity can be three and a half time higher than the activity of the corresponding zirconocene dichloride educts . the catalyst <nUm> / MAO is able to produce <nUm> kg PE g-1 Zr h ( <nUm> ° C , pentane solution , <nUm> bar ethylene pressure ) . the reaction of Cp2ZrX2 ( x = Cl , Br , or I ) with AlH4Li or AlH3 in the presence of catalytic amount of transition metal compound afford the ZrIII-Al hydride complex [(Cp2Zr)2(m-H)](m-H) 2AlX2 ( 1 ) . complex <nUm> were isolated a crystal solvate with either benzene or benzene and 1,4-dioxane of composition [(Cp2Zr)2H](H)2AlCl2 *C6H6 ( 2 ) , [(Cp2Zr)2H] (H)2AlBr2*C6H6 ( 3 ) , [(Cp2Zr)2H](H)2AlBr2* C4H8O2*C6H6 ( 4 ) , and [(Cp2Zr)2H](H)2AlI2 *2C6H6 ( 5 ) and their structure were studied by x-ray diffraction analysis . molecule <nUm> contain the six - membered AlH3Zr2 ring a the central fragment , in which the metal atom are linked by hydride bridge . the bonding model for <nUm> are considered and the reason for stability of <nUm> are discussed . zirconocene and bisphosphine nickel chemistry developed in our lab and directed towards the derivatization and synthesis of polycyclic aromatic carbon compound is reviewed . complex with the formula Cp2ZrMe(e1-PAC) ( PAC = anionic polycyclic aromatic carbon ligand ) eliminate methane to produce zirconacycles and yne complex . treatment of the zirconacycles with L2NiX2 ( L = phosphine , x = Cl , Br ) in the presence of alkyne result in metallacycle transfer to nickel and cycloaddition of the alkyne . the resulting polycyclic aromatic carbon compound contain an additional ring . the nickelacycles may also be accessed by oxidative addition of ni(0) to polycyclic aromatic dihalides followed by reduction . the application of this chemistry to the step - growth synthesis of single - walled carbon nanotube is proposed . the synthesis , characterization and catalytic activity of zirconium complex containing bulky pentaarylcyclopentadienyl ligand are reported . the monocyclopentadienyl 12-electron complex , trichloropentaphenylcyclopentadienylzirconium(IV) , C <nUm> ph <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( I ) , ha an unusual monomeric structure in the solid state and ha short Zr - ligand distance suggesting that the complex ha significant lewis acidity . the phenyl ring adopt a propeller arrangement in the solid state ; VT <nUm> H - NMR measurement of the analogous trichloro(tetraphenyl- m -tolylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium(IV) ( II ) indicate that there is rapid rotational motion of the phenyl ring . the lewis acidity of this complex is manifested in it ability to catalyze the [4+2] cycloadditions of acrolein and methyl acrylate to cyclopentadiene . the sandwich complex , C <nUm> ph <nUm> CpZrCl <nUm> ( III ) , ha more typical Zr - ligand distance , but ha a more parallel arrangement of the two cyclopentadienyl ring and doe not display the reactivity shown by I and II . density - functional theory ha been used to study the first few step of ethene polymerization with the single - site catalyst Cp2ZrCH3 + ( biscyclopentadienyl methyl zirconium cation ) . insertion of the first monomer yield a g-agostic product Cp2ZrC3H7 + which can transform into a more stable b-agostic conformation with an activation barrier of <nUm> kJ mol-1 . the interaction of the b-agostic structure with a second monomer lead to chain termination ( front - side attack ) or insertion ( back - side attack ) with barrier of about 35-40 kJ mol-1 . A more likely step appears to be insertion directly into the g-agostic Cp2ZrC3H7 + , to form the g-agostic product Cp2ZiC5H11 + with a barrier of only <nUm> kJ mol-1 . the reaction of 2-indanone or 3,4-diphenylcyclopent-2-enone with pyrrolidine and N,N'-dimethylethylenediamine respectively lead to the corresponding 2-aminoindenes and 1-amino-3,4-diphenylcyclopentadienes , whose lithium salt can be reacted with Cl4Zr to generate the corresponding moisture - sensitive aminozirconocene dichloride . the x-ray crystal structure of di-(2-N-pyrrolidine-e5-indenyl)zirconium dichloride wa determined , in which the zirconocene exists exclusively a a racemic - mixture , whereas the meso-rotamer is not present . the ( indenyl ) carbon-nitrogen bond length range from <nUm> to <nUm> pm , which is indicative of considerable multiple bond character . the first ansa-[1]-zirconocene dichloride with the boron bridge atom , [(m-PhB)(e5-C5H4)2]ZrCl2 ( 5 ) is synthesised via subsequent transmetallation of C5H4(SnMe3)2 by PhBCl2 and Cl4Zr . the unstable corresponding ligand - PhB(C5H5)2 ( 1 ) - wa synthesised and isolated in the form of pyridine ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) ( 2 ) and DABCO ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) ( 3 ) adduct . the reaction of [Zr]Cl2 ( 1 ) { [Zr] = (e5-C5H4SiMe3)2Zr } with HO(CR2)nC ≡ CH ( 2a : r = H , n = <nUm> ; A convenient new one - pot synthesis make accessible CH2 - and CHR - bridged ligand precursor of the general formula C13H9-n,R'nCHRC5H5 ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ; r = H , alkyl ; R' = H , alkyl , hal ) . from these the syndiospecific zirconocene catalyst (C13H8-nR'nCHR-C5H4)ZrCl2 ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ; r = H , me ; R' = H , Br ) for the polymerization of propylene can be prepared . bis(propynyl)zirconocene ( 6a ) reacts with tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane to yield the carbon-carbon coupled Cp2M( m-RC4R)B(C6F5)3 betaine product 4a ( m = Zr , r = CH3 ) . A variety of differently substituted analog wa prepared ( m = Zr , r = n-butyl , phenyl , cyclohexyl ; m = Ti , r = CH3 ; m = Hf ; r = CH3 , phenyl , SiMe3 ) . these complex <nUm> are chiral due to the presence of a rather stable propeller - like R-B(aryl)3 conformation . the activation barrier of the intramolecular enantiomerization process of many example of this series of complex wa determined by dynamic 1H NMR spectroscopy , with DG ‡ value ranging from ca. <nUm> to <nUm> kcalmol-1 , depending on the substitution pattern . complex 4a reacts with 2,6-dimethylphenylisocyanide to yield the methylenecyclopropene derivative <nUm> that wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the coupling of enantiomerically enriched 2,2'-dilithio-1,1'-binaphthyl with various annulated cyclopentenones or 2-indanone prof to be a facile route for the preparation of a series of annulated bis(cyclopentadienes) or bis(indenes) bridged at a symmetrical cyclopentadienyl position . the six-or seven - membered annulated bis(tetrahydroindene) <nUm> or bis(hexahydroazulene) <nUm> ligand could readily be converted to titanium or zirconium dichloride complex . owing to the symmetry of the ligand , only a single C2 - symmetrical isomer of the metallocene dichloride could form . although the face of the cyclopentadienyl moiety are homotopic , the chiral bridge enforces a chiral conformation of the metallocene complex . the bis(indenyl) <nUm> or five - membered annulated bis(tetrahydropentalene) <nUm> ligand could not be metalated . unbridged 2-methyl and 2-phenyl substituted tetrahydropentalenes <nUm> and <nUm> were prepared and could readily be converted to titanium dichloride complex . the crystal structure of a meso form of <nUm> wa determined by x-ray diffraction method . <nUm> consists of two isomer with a vinylic ( 17a ) and an allylic ( 17b ) Me3Si substituent . stannylation of <nUm> by Me3SnNEt2 led exclusively to the diallylic derivative (C9H6AsMe2)SnMe3 ( 18 ) in quantitative yield . the latter wa readily converted to a polymeric , half - sandwich indenyl zirconocene [e5-(C9H6AsMe2)ZrCl3]n ( 19 ) in high yield . further reaction of <nUm> with cp * Li resulted in the formation of a new arsano substituted bent metallocene complex [e5-(C9H6AsMe2)-e5-(C5Me5)]ZrCl2 ( 20 ) in good yield . ansa - zirconocenes , me <nUm> X(Cp)(3-TolInd)ZrCl <nUm> [ x = C ( 7 ) , Si ( 8 ) ; cp = η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> ; tol = p-C <nUm> H <nUm> CH <nUm> ] and me <nUm> Si(Cp)(2-TolInd)ZrCl <nUm> ( 9 ) , have been prepared by the reaction of ClZr <nUm> with the corresponding dilithiated ligand in diethyl ether at - <nUm> ° C . the molecular structure of complex <nUm> ha been determined by a single crystal x-ray diffraction study . propylene polymerization ha been studied for complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . complex <nUm> reveals the highest catalytic activity of <nUm> kg PP / ( mol zrh atm ) and the highest molecular weight of <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> among the three catalyst . complex <nUm> produce atactic polypropylene ( PP ) , whereas <nUm> and <nUm> afford PP with a weak syndiotacticity at low temperature . the reaction of ClZr <nUm> with 2equiv . of MeLi to form me <nUm> ClZr <nUm> followed by in situ metalation of me <nUm> ClZr <nUm> with the corresponding ansa - ligand , produce the respective ansa-dimethylzirconocene complex , o-Xyl(Ind) <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> [ 1b , ind = η <nUm> -1-indenyl , o-Xyl = C <nUm> H <nUm> ( CH <nUm> ) <nUm> <nUm> ] , 2-Bn(Ind) <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> [ 2b , 2-Bu = ( -CH <nUm> CH = CHCH <nUm> - ) ] , Et(Ind) <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> ( 3b ) , and me <nUm> Si(Ind) <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> ( 4b ) in high yield . treatment of 1b-3b with ClH affords ansa-dichlorozirconocene complex , 1a-3a , in quantitative yield . synthesis of ansa-dimethylzirconocene via me <nUm> ClZr <nUm> is more efficient than that via cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( cp <nUm> = ansa - ligand ) in the conventional method . zirconocene dichloride wa reacted with either 2,6-di-tert-butyl-or 2,6-diisopropyl phenol to form bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) zirconium(IV) monochloride complex <nUm> and <nUm> respectively . A bisphenoxy derivative of Cp2ZrCl2 , <nUm> , wa formed , when sterically le demanding 2,6-dimethyl phenol wa utilized . the ability of the complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> in ethylene polymerization with MAO a cocatalyst wa examined . polymer analysis indicates that , regardless of which complex wa used , only one kind of catalytically active metal center is formed and polymer property resemble those obtained with the Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO system . the solid state structure of bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) zirconium(IV) 2,6-di-tert-butyl-phenoxy monochloride ( 1 ) is reported . the five - coordinate zirconocene dichloride PhP(CH2CH 2-e5-C5H4)2ZrC12 ( 3 ) , containing a tethered bis(cyclopentadienyl)-phosphine ligand , wa prepared by treating a tetrahydrofuran solution of ZrC14(thf)2 with Li2[PhP(CH2CH2C5H4)2] . an x-ray crystal structure analysis confirmed the phosphorus atom to be coordinated to the zirconium metal center . dissolution of <nUm> in wet methanol followed by evaporation of the solvent yielded the crystallographically characterized cationic chloroaqua complex [PhP(CH2CH2-e5-C5H4)2ZrC1(H2O)]+ a the chloride salt ( 4 ) . treatment of an aqueous solution of <nUm> with excess thiocyanate gave a good yield of the bis(isothiocyanato) complex PhP(CH2CH2-e5-C5H4)2Zr(NCS)2 ( 7 ) , the structure of which wa confirmed by x-ray crystallography . the zirconocene diacetylide (e5-C5HMe4)2Zr(e 1-CCSiMe3)2 ( 1 ) is reduced by potassium in toluene to give the paramagnetic tweezer complex [ (e5-C5HMe4)2Zr(e 1-CCSiMe3)2]-K+ ( 2 ) . the presence of Zr (III) follows from the ESR spectrum of <nUm> ( g = <nUm> , aZr = <nUm> mT ) . the x-ray crystal structure show that the bite angle of tweezer arm of <nUm> ° in <nUm> is diminished to <nUm> ° in complex <nUm> . the potassium cation is embedded between the acetylide arm , <nUm> Å away from the bite angle plane , at the Zr-K distance of <nUm> Å . new dicyclopentadienyl iminoacyl zirconium complex have been prepared and characterized by NMR spectroscopy . the reaction of [Zr{(SiMe2)2(e5-C5H3)2}Me2] with CNR ( r = 2,6-Me2C6H3 , t-Bu ) yield [Zr{(SiMe2)2(e5-C5H3)2}Me(e2-CMeNR)] ( r = 2,6-Me2C6H3 , t-Bu ) , which reacts with a stoichiometric amount of water to give the m-oxo dimer [Zr{(SiMe2)2(e5-C5H3)2}(e2-CMeNR)]2(m-O) ( r = 2,6-Me2C6H3 , t-Bu ) . the chloro neophyl complex [Zr{(SiMe2)2(e5-C5H3)2}Cl(CH2CMe2Ph)] and other b-hydrogen containing zirconium chloro alkyl [Zr{(SiMe2)2(e5-C5H3)2}CIR] ( r = et , n-Pr , i-Pr ) react with CN(2,6-Me2C6H3) to yield the related chloro iminoacyl complex spectroscopy and the x-ray molecular structure of [Zr{(SiMe2)2(e5-C5H3)2}Cl{e2-C(i-Pr)N(2,6-Me2C6H3)}] wa studied by diffraction method to prove the expected ' inside ' coordination of the iminoacyl nitrogen atom . the synthesis and characterization of two new silicon-carbon bridged ansa - bis(fluorenyl) and ansa-bis(octahydrofluorenyl) zirconocene complex , (Flu-CH2-SiMe2-Flu)ZrCl2 ( 3 ) and (FluH8-CH2-SiMe2-FluH8)ZrCl2 ( 4 ) is reported . complex <nUm> , in combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , form an active catalyst system for homogeneous polymerization of ethylene . the molecular structure of <nUm> reveals a large Centroid-Zr-Centroid angle ( <nUm> ° ) and an unusually small Cl-Zr-Cl angle ( <nUm> ° ) . the Zr-C bond distance range from <nUm> to <nUm> Å . the reaction of zirconocene dichloride , Cp2ZrCl2 , and bis(indenyl) metal dichloride , Ind2MCl2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) , with one and two equivalent , respectively , of indenyl or fluorenyl lithium lead to sterically crowded complex with three or four potential p-ligands ( <nUm> : Cp2Zr(Ind)Cl ; <nUm> : Cp2Zr(Ind)2 ; <nUm> : Ind3ZrCl ; <nUm> : Ind3HfCl ; <nUm> : Ind2Zr(Flu)Cl ) . compound <nUm> wa characterized by an x-ray structure analysis . A novel method for the preparation of heterogeneous metallocene catalyst is described that can be applied for the polymerization of olefin starting with homogeneous metallocene complex . for this purpose zirconocene dichloride complex have been prepared containing alkenyl or alkynyl substituents . these complex can be activated with methyl alumoxane ( MAO ) and then are incorporated a comonomers into the formed polyolefin chain . the homogeneous metallocene catalyst become self - immobilizing under the reaction condition and the further formation of the polyolefin is then catalyzed heterogeneously . bimetallic Zr-Re complex with bridging C5H4PPh2 ligand ( henceforth abbreviated a cp' ) are accessible from the mononuclear zirconocene dichloride Cp'2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) and reactive rhenium complex . the attempted synthesis of a cationic complex from <nUm> and [Re(CO)3(NCMe)3]BF4 resulted in the formation of the zirconium - free compound [ ReCl(CO)3(C10H10(PPh2) <nUm> ) ] ( 2 ) . <nUm> is apparently formed by cleavage of the Cp'-Zr bond followed by intramolecular diels - alder addition . the compound wa fully characterized including an x-ray crystal structure determination of the CDCl3 solvate ( triclinic , space group P1 ( no. <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> pm , b = <nUm> pm , c = <nUm> pm , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> × <nUm> pm3 , z = <nUm> ) . <nUm> and the highly reactive ' salt ' [Re(CO)5FBF3] give the mono-bridged ionic complex [Cp'Cl2Zr(m-Cp')Re(CO)5]BF4 ( 3 ) . the doubly cp' - bridged complex [Cp'2Cl2ZrReCl(CO)3] ( 4 ) may be obtained from <nUm> and either [Re(CO)5Cl] or , more cleanly , [Re2(m-Cl)2(CO)6(THF)2] . reaction of <nUm> with a stoichiometric amount of AlH4Li give the bridging hydride complex [Cp'2ClZr(m-H)ReH(CO)3] ( 5 ) . from <nUm> and NaSMe the analogous methyl thiolate complex <nUm> wa obtained in an NMR tube experiment . reduction of <nUm> using sodium amalgam produce the dark blue - green complex [Cp'2ClZr-Re(CO)3] ( 7 ) which contains a direct Zr-Re bond . addition of ClH across this polar metal - metal bond give two isomeric hydride [Cp'2Cl2ZrReH(CO)3] ( 8a , b ) in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio and with fac and mer coordination geometry around rhenium , respectively . zirconocene compound having ether bond at the substituent of cyclopentadienyl ligand , [ e5-C5H4(CH2) nOCH2CH2OCH2CH3 ] 2ZrCl2 ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) and [ e5-C5H4CH2CH 2OCH2CH3]2ZrCl2 , were prepared and tested for ethylene polymerization catalyst with methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . the presence of oxygen atom close to the metal center drastically reduced the polymerization activity . it increased a the distance between zirconium and oxygen atom increased and showed a maximum when n wa <nUm> . A series of titanocene and zirconocene dichloride wa synthesized bearing ligand that contain a ( chiral ) ether group linked by an ethylene spacer group to the cyclopentadienyl ring . surprisingly , the chiral zirconocenes (e5-C5H4CH2CH2OR)2ZrCl2 with r = isobornyl and menthyl do not show ziegler - natta activity . this is probably caused by attack of the cocatalyst (MeAlO)n on the side chain , causing immobilization of the catalyst . intramolecular coordination of the side chain is provoked by converting the dichloride to the more lewis-acidic mono and bi triflate complex . the coordination of the ether chain depends on the size of the terminal group in the chain . In the achiral derivative (e5-C5H4CH2CH2OMe)2Zr(O3SCF3)2 there is a rapid equilibrium between specie with one and two intramolecularly - coordinated ether side chain . the monotriflate complex ( e5-C5H4CH2CH2Oisobor nyl)2ZrCl(O3SCF3) decomposes rapidly , because ether coordination result in facile C-O bond cleavage and liberation of camphene . accordingly , the bistriflate ( e5-C5H4CH2CH2Oisobor nyl)2Zr(O3SCF3)2 could not be synthesized . the chiral triflate complex (e5-C5H4CH2CH2OR)2Zr(O3SCF3)2 with r = menthyl and fenchyl are active diels - alder catalyst , although no optical induction wa observed , probably because the chiral ether handle are not sufficiently coordinated during catalysis . A series of zirconocene complex of formula cp <nUm> ZrMe 2-n L n where cp = C <nUm> H - <nUm> , me = methyl , L = pyrazolyl , bis(N,N'-phenylformamidinato) , or substituted aryloxide and n = <nUm> , were synthesized by reaction of cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> and cp <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> with LiL or HL , respectively . the structure of cp <nUm> Zr(2,6-OC <nUm> H <nUm> me <nUm> ) <nUm> , cp <nUm> Zr(2,4,6-OC <nUm> H <nUm> me <nUm> ) <nUm> and cp <nUm> ZrMe{CH(NC <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> } were determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction . the complex demonstrate appreciable activity for ethylene polymerization when used a cocatalysts with methylaluminoxane and dimethylanilinium tetrafluorophenylborate . the synthesis and characterization of three siloxy-substituted zirconocene complex rac- and meso-ethylenebis[1-(tert-butyldimethylsiloxy)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 3a,3b ) and rac-ethylenebis[1-(tert-butyldimethylsiloxy)-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) are reported . the molecular structure of 3b and <nUm> have been determined and reveal that 3b crystallizes in a chiral staggered meso-conformation , whereas <nUm> adopts the expected C2 symmetric bent metallocene structure with indenyl-forward conformation of the ligand backbone . In both complex 3b and <nUm> the intramolecular oxygen-chlorine distance ( <nUm> - <nUm> Å ) are close to the sum of their van der waals radius ( <nUm> Å ) . the synthesis and characterization of 1- and 2-triisopropylsiloxy substituted bis(indenyl) zirconocenes is reported . the molecular structure of rac-[ethylenebis(2-(triisopropylsiloxy)-1-indenyl)]zirconium dichloride ( 6 ) and rac-[ethylenebis(2-(triisopropylsiloxy)-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)]zirconium dichloride ( 8 ) have been determined and reveal that complex ( 6 ) crystallizes in the indenyl-forward ( π ) conformation while ( 8 ) adopts the indenyl-backward ( Y ) conformation . an ansa - zirconocene complex having a vicinally di-tert-butyl-substituted cyclopentadienyl ligand , me <nUm> Si(C <nUm> H <nUm> )(C <nUm> H <nUm> -3,4-t-Bu <nUm> )ZrCl <nUm> ( 1 ) , ha been synthesized and characterized by x-ray diffraction ( orthorhombic , space group : pbca , a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , V = <nUm> Å <nUm> , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , r w = <nUm> ) . complex <nUm> ha a very much twisted structure due to it steric repulsion . In solution , however , the two tert-butyl group are magnetically equivalent even at <nUm> ° C , indicating very fast oscillation of the bridged cyclopentadienyl unit with respect to the metal center . complex <nUm> and nonbridged zirconocene dichloride with tert-butyl-substituted cyclopentadienyl ligand , ( C <nUm> H <nUm> -t-Bu ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( 2 ) , ( C <nUm> H <nUm> -1,2-t-Bu <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( 3 ) and ( C <nUm> H <nUm> -1,3-t-Bu <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( 4 ) , have been employed a methylaluminoxane (MAO)-activated catalyst for polymerization of 1-hexene under high pressure condition ( 100-750 MPa = ca . 1000-7500 atm ) . comparison with some non and methyl-substituted metallocenes are also discussed . the ethylene-bridged pseudo-Cs symmetric ansa - zirconocene complex , (1-fluorenyl-2-cyclopentadienylethane)zirconium dichloride ( 5a ) and (1-fluorenyl-2-tetramethylcyclopentadienylethane)zirconium dichloride ( 5b ) , were synthesized and their molecular structure have been determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction study . the complex 5a is very active toward propylene polymerization in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , affording polypropylene with good syndiotacticity . In comparison with the known syndiotactic polypropylene catalytic system iPr(fluorenyl)(cyclopentadienyl)ZrCl2 / MAO , 5a / MAO system is better in thermal stability , higher in activity and lower in syndiotacticity under the identical polymerization condition . on the other hand , 5b / MAO system show low activity and produce nearly atactic polypropylene with low molecular weight , which could be attributed to the increased electron density and steric bulkiness around the metal center . dehydrogenative coupling of phenylgermane catalyzed by cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> or Cp*CpZrCl <nUm> used in conjunction with n BuLi ( two equivalent ) give partially network polyphenylgermanes of high molecular weight ( m w = <nUm> - <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> ) in moderate yield . resulting polyphenylgermanes are soluble in common solvent and a typical sample display λ max at <nUm> nm in UV absorption and show T d5 of <nUm> ° C in the thermogravimetric analysis . the implication of titanocene and zirconocene complex in phosphinine chemistry is reviewed . two approach to polyfunctional phosphinines using dimethyltitanocene a starting precursor have been developed so far . the first one involves the thermal rearrangement of 1-alkynyl-dihydrophosphetes . the second relies on the reactivity towards alkyne of 1,3,2-diazaphosphinines which are obtained by a metal transfer reaction from the corresponding diazatitanacycle . (2-Phosphininyl)-halogenozirconocene complex , prepared by insertion of zirconocene into the carbon - halogen bond of 2-halogenophosphinines , have found interesting application in the synthesis of a-functionalized compound and 2,2'-biphosphinines upon reaction with electrophiles and nickel(0) complex , respectively . another important development of their chemistry is provided by the synthesis of monomeric and dimeric phosphabenzyne-zirconocene complex . preliminary investigation have shown that their reactivity closely mimic that of their carbon counterpart . various molecule such a polar alkyne , aldehyde , ketone , nitrile , phosphine sulfide , insert into the carbon-zirconium bond of these complex to give a wide range of annelated metallacycles which can be subsequently transformed into functional phosphinines upon acidic hydrolysis . the dipropargylic derivative of Si , Ge , P , 1a-c , react with the zirconocene entity ' Cp2Zr ' and give the intermediate bicyclocomplexes 2a-c characterized by 1H and 31P - NMR . the electrophilic addition of H+ , br2 lead to the corresponding exo dienic metallacyclopentanes <nUm> . the cyclozirconation reaction with hetero-diallylic compound 5a-d give the metallacyclopentanes 7-15 , after reaction with different electrophiles such a H+ , Cl3P , PhPCl2 , Ph2PCl or Ph2PCl(BH3) , br2 . the cyclozirconation reaction of diynes is stereoselective and lead to the E,E - exocyclic dienes whereas the selectivity of cyclozirconation of dienes depends on the substituents on the heteroatom . chiral silicon bridged yttrio- and lanthanidocene chloride [ MeRSi(C <nUm> H <nUm> )(C <nUm> me <nUm> )LnCl ] <nUm> ( r = et ( a ) , ph ( b ) ; ln = Y ( 4a , b ) , La ( 5a , b ) , Sm ( 6a , b ) , Lu ( 7a , b ) ) and zirconocene dichloride [ MeRSi(C <nUm> H <nUm> )(C <nUm> me <nUm> )ZrCl <nUm> ] ( r = et ( 8a ) , ph ( 8b ) ) were synthesized . compound 4-7 react with sodium acetate yielding the corresponding monomeric acetate [ MeRSi(C <nUm> H <nUm> )(C <nUm> me <nUm> )LnO <nUm> CMe ] ( r = et ( a ) , ph ( b ) ; ln = Y ( 9a , b ) , La ( 10a , b ) , Sm ( 11a , b ) , Lu ( 12a , b ) ) . all compound were characterized by elemental analysis , <nUm> H and <nUm> C{ <nUm> H } - NMR spectroscopy , and by mass spectrometry . single crystal x-ray structure determination show a dimer for 6a and a monomer for 8a . the zirconocenes 8a , b are active catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene and propylene in the presence of methylalumoxane ( MAO ) . the palladium - catalyzed coupling of 1,2-diiodobenzene with indenylzinc complex obtained from indene , 4-methylindene , 4,7-dimethylindene and hydrindancene gave 1,2-bis(1-indenyl)benzenes in 29-45 % yield . new phenyl-bridged ansa - bis(indenyl)titanium and -zirconium dichloride were obtained from these ligand in good yield either by addition of Cl3Ti or Cl4Zr to their lithium salt ( 61-92 % yield ) or by addition of Zr(NMe2)4 to the neutral ligand ( 59-67 % ) . In each case the zirconium tetraamide metalation gave very high dl-selectivity . the n-BuLi / Cl4Zr metalation of the phenyl-bridged unsubstituted indene gave a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio of dl- to meso- while placing substituents at the 4,7- and 5,6-positions led to <nUm> : <nUm> selectivity in favor of the dl-isomer . the n-BuLi / Cl3Ti metalation gave between <nUm> : <nUm> and <nUm> : <nUm> selectivity . the solid state structure of [1,2-bis(1-indenyl)benzene]dichlorozirconium ( dl-6a ) wa obtained by x-ray analysis . methylzirconocene cation [Cp2ZrCH3+] ( 2 ) add readily to (butadiene)zirconocene to yield the dimetallic cationic complex [ (Cp2Zr)(m-CH3)(m-butadiene)(ZrCp2) + ] ( 4 ) ( both cation with CH3B(C6F5)3- ( a ) or B(C6F5)4- ( b ) counteranion ) . the spectroscopic analysis indicates the presence of a C2 - symmetrical bridging mode of the transoid m-e2:e2 - conjugated diene ligand . treatment of 4a with Cp2Zr(CH3)Cl result in the formation of the m-chloro-bridged system [ (Cp2Zr)2(m-Cl)(m-C4H6) + ] ( 4d ) , that yield [ (Cp2Zr)2(m-CC-CH3)(m-C4H 6)+ ] ( 4e ) upon treatment with propynyl lithium . C2 - symmetric rac-ethylene-1,2-bis(e5-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)-zirconium dichloride (EBTHI)ZrCl2 ( rac-1 ) reacts with the lithium amide of 2,6-dimethylaniline , aniline and 2,3,4,5,6-pentafluoroaniline to yield the corresponding rac-ethylene-1,2-bis(e5-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)-zirconium bis(monoarylamido) complex (EBTHI)Zr(NHR)2 ( rac-3a-c ) . these new bisamides represent potential chiral version of the known Cp2Zr(NHR)2 derivative which are active hydroamination catalyst . C10F2H10Ti and C10F2H10Zr were found to be rapidly converted into catalytically - active specie for the dehydrocoupling of silanes upon treatment with PhSiH3 or H2MeSiSiMeH2 . two kind of fluorenyl containing zirconocene catalyst , supported on polymethylsiloxane micro gel and on silica , were prepared and applied for ethylene polymerization using methylaluminoxane a cocatalyst . the observed activity were comparable with those of the corresponding silica supported catalyst . the average molecular weight of the obtained polymer differ from those of the corresponding homogeneous catalyst a from those of the silica supported system . In order to further our study of the bis(2-methylbenz[e]indenyl)zirconium dichloride catalyst system , we have synthesized the analogous tetrahydro-2-methylbenz[e]indene ligand ( 4 ) . In the process of synthesizing <nUm> , we have found that the structural isomer tetrahydro-2-methylbenz[f]indene ( 5 ) is also formed . this ha been confirmed by the synthesis of a series of dimethyl ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) , methyl-phenyl ( 8 ) , and titanium trichloride derivative ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) of the parent indene <nUm> and <nUm> . the new ligand system <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were converted to the analogous unbridged zirconocene dichloride complex <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> . the precursor were then activated with either methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) or triphenylcarbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( trityl ) and used a catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene and propylene . all zirconocene complex were highly active for the polymerization of ethylene , and in some case produced crystalline polypropylene at lower polymerization temperature . the polymethylene bridged dinuclear zirconocenes [ (CH2)n (C5H4)2][(C9H7)ZrCl 2]2 ( n = <nUm> ( 10 ) , <nUm> ( 11 ) , <nUm> ( 12 ) , <nUm> ( 13 ) ) have been synthesised by treating not only the respective disodium salt of the ligand with two equivalent of C9Cl3H7Zr in THF , but also the distannylated derivative of the ligand with two equivalent of C9Cl3H7Zr in toluene . all complex are characterised by 1H- and 13C - NMR and mass spectrometry and elemental analysis . it turned out that the value of dd = [dd-dp] , the chemical shift difference between the distal ( dd ) and proximal ( dp ) proton , for the produced dinuclear compound ( <nUm> for <nUm> and <nUm> , and <nUm> for <nUm> and <nUm> ) were smaller than the dd value of the known polysiloxane bridged dinuclear compound . the chemical shift of the bridgehead carbon in these complex are about <nUm> ppm shifted downfield with respect to the other two resonance at cyclopentadienyl ring ( <nUm> and <nUm> ppm , respectively ) . In order to investigate the catalytic property of the dinuclear complex and mononuclear metallocenes , ethylene polymerisation ha been conducted in the presence of MMAO . the most important feature is that the polymethylene bridged dinuclear metallocenes represent enormously improved activity compared with the activity from the corresponding mononuclear metallocene a well a the polysiloxane bridged dinuclear zirconocenes . In addition , the influence of both the nature and length of the bridging ligand upon the reactivity of the dinuclear metallocenes ha also been observed . treatment of a variety of bis(alkynyl)metallocenes Cp2M(-C ≡ C-R)2 ( m = Ti , Zr , Hf ; r = CH3 , n-C3H7 , n-C4H10 , cyclo-C6H11 ) with tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane yield the metallocene(m,-RC4R)borate betaine <nUm> . these seem to be in an endothermic equilibrium with their methylenecyclopropene derived isomer - by mean of an intramolecular alkyne insertion reaction - which are very effectively trapped by the reaction with tert-butylisocyanide to yield the complex <nUm> that exhibit a methylenecyclopropene derived s-ligand framework . the zirconocene compound 6a ( r = CH3 ) , 6c ( r = n-C3H7 ) , 6d ( r = n-C4H9 ) , and 6e ( r = cyclo-C6H11 ) were characterized by x-ray crystal structure analysis . the hydrolysis of 6a , 6c and 6d gave the respective metal free system <nUm> that exhibit a pronounced cyclopropenylium-borate-betaine character . the title complex Me4Si2(1-C5H3-3-tBu) 2MCl2 ( m = Ti , <nUm> ; m = Zr , <nUm> ) have been prepared by reaction of Li2Me4Si2(C5H3-3- tBu)2 with MC14*2THF in refluxing THF . rac / meso ratio of about <nUm> / <nUm> wa obtained for the titanocene complex <nUm> . but for the zirconocene <nUm> , only meso isomer wa obtained . the crystal structure of meso-1 and meso-2 were determined . their catalytic property for ethylene polymerization have also been studied with MAO a a cocatalyst . reaction of hydroxyl , ether and carbonyl functionalized alkene with methylaluminoxane prepared in toluene-d8 ( MAO ) and zirconocenedichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) were investigated by 1H- and 13C - NMR spectroscopy at <nUm> ° C . the <nUm> alkene studied bear a terminal C = C bond separated by 7-9 ( -CH2- ) unit from the heteroatom moiety . intramolecular connectivity in mono ( alkene ) , bi ( alkene and MAO ) and tri ( alkene , MAO and Cp2ZrCl2 ) component mixture were determined by 2D HSQC , HMBC , ROESY and NOESY NMR technique . the five studied alkenols formed aluminium alkoxides with MAO even in the case of a substantial steric hindrance around the OH group . zirconocene enhanced the formation of aluminium alkoxides . decomposition to free alkenol wa observed only for the straight chain alkenol ( 10-undecen-1-ol ) . the OTMS derivative formed dimer of the type CH2 = CR1R2 along with methyl derivative , CH2 = C(Me) ( r ) and (Me)CH = CH ( r ) , in the presence of MAO and Cp2ZrCl2 . 10-Undecenyl methyl ether and methyl decenoate remained mainly a a free comonomer in the presence of MAO or MAO / Cp2ZrCl2 , though a transient coordination of the former to MAO wa deduced . unsaturated specie Me2C = CH-Al-X and CH2 = C4H7 = C(t-Bu)O-Al-X ( x = MAO oligomer ) were formed in the reaction of t-butyl undecenoate or 2,2-dimethyl-11-dodecen-3-one with MAO or MAO / Cp2ZrCl2 . interaction of the CH2 = CH part of the functionalized alkene with zirconocene wa not observed . A possible coordination of the C = C bond to MAO wa observed only for the sec alkenols . redox property of the substituted zirconocene dichloride : (C5H5-nMen)2 Cl2Zr ( n = 0-5 ) , [C5H5-n(SiMe3)n] 2ZrCl2 ( n = 0-3 ) , [C5Me4(SiMe3)](C5HMe 4)ZrCl2 and two ansa - analogue Me2Si(C5H4)2ZrCl2 and Me2Si[C5H2(SiMe3)2] 2ZrCl2 were investigated by cyclic voltammetry on a mercury electrode in tetrahydrofuran . In the (C5H5-nMen)2ZrCl2 ( n = 0-4 ) compound , standard electrode potential ( e ° ) of the one - electron uptake shift to more negative value by <nUm> V per one methyl group . A deviation from this linear dependence to a le negative e ° is observed for (C5Me5)2ZrCl2 . this effect is attributed to the steric hindrance between rotating C5Me5 ligand which tends to decrease the angle between the cyclopentadienyl ring plane ( φ ) and consequently , the energy difference between MO frontier orbitals . In the trimethylsilylated compound , the net effect of SiMe3 is negligible , giving virtually the same value of e ° for n = 0-3 . In m-SiMe2 - bridged ansa - compound the difference in e ° of <nUm> mV corresponds to the negative shift of <nUm> mV per one SiMe3 group . owing to the rigid angle φ , this shift can be tentatively accounted for the electronic effect of the SiMe3 group . In the non-ansa - compound , the negative shift due to the electronic effect of SiMe3 group is assumed to be roughly compensated by a positive shift resulting from a sterically controlled diminution of φ . A series of complex Si2Me4L2ZrCl2 ( L = ind ( 1b ) , 2-Me-Ind ( 2b ) , 3-SiMe3-Ind ( 3b ) and Ind-H4 ( 4 ) ) wa prepared . the synthesis of 1b , 3b and <nUm> gave predominantly the meso-isomers , whereas a <nUm> : <nUm> meso : rac mixture wa obtained for 2b . x-ray analysis of meso-3b revealed large steric hindrance on the metal center ( cp ° -Zr-Cp ° is <nUm> ° ) . the <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of meso-2b and rac-2b ( activated with MAO ) produced a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of elastic atactic and isotactic polypropylene with low activity . recent labeling experiment have detected stereoerrors in the isotactic polymerization of propene with zirconocenium catalyst , which are characterized by a deuterium transfer from the polymer chain to a methyl group . using Cp2Zr-iso-butyl+ a a model system , two alternative mechanism leading to the observed product are investigated using fully nonlocal level of density functional theory ( DFT ) . the direct hydrogen transfer starting from a g-agostic intermediate requires an overall activation relative to the b-agostic resting state in excess of <nUm> kJ mol-1 and can be excluded . the sequential mechanism involves a ( i ) b-elimination to yield an initial iso-butene p-complex ; ( ii ) a subsequent internal rotation of this p-complex ; and ( iii ) reinsertion of the olefin into the Zr-H bond via two consecutive formation of b-agostic interaction , with maximum relative energy along this path between <nUm> and <nUm> kJ mol-1 ( depending on functional and basis set employed ) . the subsequent step are the reverse of the first three step and can lead to an inverted iso-butyl complex with migrated deuterium . although certain barrier height are somewhat sensitive to the density functional employed ( BP86 vs. B3LYP ) , the sequential mechanism is much more favorable energetically . loss of olefin from the intermediate p-complex is endothermic by 104-114 kJ mol-1 and should therefore not occur . reaction of phenyl magnesium bromide with the a,b-unsaturated ketone 3-methyl-2,3,4,5,6,7-hexahydroind-8(9)-en-1-one , followed by an aqueous work-up , generates the pro-chiral tetra-substituted cyclopentadiene , 1-phenyl-3-methyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindene , cp ‡ H , a precursor to the e5-cyclopentadienyl ligand in ( cp ‡ )2Fe and [ ( cp ‡ )Fe(CO)]2(m-CO)2 . both complex were generated a mixture of rac - ( RR and SS)- and meso-(RS) - isomer , and in either case pure meso-isomer wa isolated by crystallisation and characterised by single crystal x-ray structure , both molecule having crystallographic ci symmetry . reduction with Na / Hg cleaves meso-(RS)-[(Cp ‡ )Fe(CO)]2(m-CO)2 and the resulting mixture of (R)- and (S)-[(Cp ‡ )Fe(CO)2]- anion reacts with MeI to give racemic ( cp ‡ )Fe(CO)2Me , which wa characterised by the x-ray crystal structure . the cp ‡ ligand is more electron donating than ( e-C5H5 ) a revealed by the reduction potential of the ( cp ‡ )2Fe+ / ( cp ‡ ) 2Fe couple , e ° = <nUm> V ( vs. Ag AgCl ) . reaction of LiCp ‡ with Cl4Zr yield the zirconocene dichloride [ Zr(Cp ‡ )2Cl2 ] a mixture of rac- and meso-isomers , from which pure rac - isomer is obtained a a mixture of RR and SS crystal by recrystallisation . the reaction of rac - [ Zr(Cp ‡ )2Cl2 ] with LiMe give rac - [ Zr(Cp ‡ )2Me2 ] . the structure of RR - [ Zr(Cp ‡ )2Cl2 ] and rac - [ Zr(Cp ‡ )2Me2 ] have been determined by x-ray diffraction . the structural study reveal the influence of the bulky substituted cyclopentadienyl ligand on the metal-Cp ‡ distance and other metric parameter . complex generated by treating chloro(aryloxy)bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium [ <nUm> ; aryloxy = 2,6-di-tert-butyl-4-methylphenoxy ( 3a ) , 2,6-diisopropylphenoxy ( 3b ) , phenoxy ( 3c ) , 2,3,4,5,6-pentafluorophenoxy ( 3d ) , and 2,6-dimethoxyphenoxy ( 3e ) ] with one equivalent of n-BuLi catalyze dehydrocoupling polymerization of arylsilanes <nUm> [ aryl = phenyl ( 1a ) , p-methoxyphenyl ( 1b ) , p-dimethylaminophenyl ( 1c ) , p-methylthiophenyl ( 1d ) ] at room temperature to afford corresponding polysilanes . their catalytic performance wa compared with the conventional system generated from dichlorobis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium ( 4 ) and two equivalent of n-BuLi . the reaction of 1a using 3a / n-BuLi , 3b / n-BuLi or 3c / n-BuLi gave high-molecular-weight polysilanes ( mw = <nUm> × <nUm> and Mn = <nUm> × <nUm> with 3a ; mw = <nUm> × <nUm> and Mn = <nUm> × <nUm> with 3b ; mw = <nUm> × <nUm> and Mn = <nUm> × <nUm> with 3c ) . formation of the polysilane wa fast in comparison with <nUm> , in particular when the catalyst wa ligated by a sterically demanding ( 3a ) or electron - withdrawing ( 3d ) aryloxy group . the time course of the gel permeation chromatography profile suggested that complex 3a showed faster chain growth than 3d , 3e and <nUm> . the extent of the formation of undesired cyclics wa relatively small ( < <nUm> % ) in the sterically demanding 3a / n-BuLi- or 3b / n-BuLi - catalyzed reaction . the P-H functionalised phosphinoalcohol 1-PH(Tipp)-2-OH-cyclo-C6H10 ( tipp = 2,4,6-Pri3C6H2 ) reacts with [Cp2ZrMe2] with elimination of methane to give exclusively the mono-substituted product [Cp2Zr(Me)(cyclo-1-O-2-PH(Tipp)-C6H10)] ( 1 ) , even at elevated temperature . <nUm> reacts with [Mo(CO)5(NMe3)] to give the heterodinuclear complex [ Cp2Zr(Me)(cyclo-1-O-2-PH(Tipp){Mo(CO)5}-C 6H10 ) ] ( 2 ) . the borane adduct [ Cp2Zr(BH4)(cyclo-1-O-2-PH(Mes)(BH3)-C 6H10 ) ] ( <nUm> , me = 2,4,6-Me3C6H2 ) wa obtained from [Cp2Zr(BH4)2] and 1-PH(Mes)-2-OH-cyclo-C6H10 in boiling hexane . 1-3 were characterised spectroscopically ( 1H , 13C , 31P , 11B ( for <nUm> ) , MS , and IR ) . A crystal structure determination of the RC,RC,RP / SC,SC,S P isomer of <nUm> wa obtained . the complex 1-3 were studied in the catalytic polymerisation of ethylene and propylene by activating them with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst . the unsymmetrical substituted zirconacyclopentadienes obtained by selective intramolecular cross-coupling of two different alkyne on zirconocene are used to prepare new unsymmetrical C - substituted phosphole compound . the x-ray structure of a phosphole and it related sulfide are presented . the oligomerization of ethylene catalyzed by Cp2ZrL2 ( L = Cl , me , OC6H4-Me-p ) with ethylaluminoxane or Et3Al a cocatalyst ( Al / Zr = <nUm> , <nUm> ° C , C2H4P = <nUm> MPa ) afforded not only common chain oligomers but also a cyclic oligomer , methylenecyclopentane . the selectivity of methylenecyclopentane reached <nUm> % under optimal condition . the addition of C5H5N to the catalytic system of Cp2ZrCl2 / Et3Al wa capable of further improving the selectivity of methylenecyclopentane to <nUm> % . the homogeneous homopolymerization of propene wa conducted with the two catalyst precursor Me2Si(Ind)2ZrBz2 ( 1 ) and Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind)2ZrBz2 ( 2 ) and triphenylmethyltetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate [C(CH3)3][B(C6F5)4] ( 3 ) a cocatalyst . after synthesizing the dibenzyl compound from their dichloride derivative the catalyst system ( 1 ) / ( 3 ) wa optimized in respect to the catalyst / cocatalyst ratio and the amount of tri(isobutyl) aluminum ( TIBA ) . the polymerization behavior of the catalyst system ( 2 ) / ( 3 ) is investigated using a central composite experimental design . In this design the dependence of the polymer property on temperature , catalyst and monomer concentration are modeled . the dibenzyl compound ( 2 ) show extremely high catalytic activity of <nUm> <nUm> kg PP / molZr h molp . the polymer produced with this catalyst exhibit very high melting point and molecular weight . four supported metallocenes prepared by the sol - gel method were tested by ethylene homopolymerization and in ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization . the effect of A1 / Zr ratio , polymerization temperature and cocatalysts were evaluated . catalyst A2 , produced by TEA and MAO treatment showed the highest activity ( <nUm> × <nUm> kg PE / mol Zr h-1 ) among the tested system at A1 / Zr = <nUm> . A2 showed thermal stability on polymerization performed at a temperature a high a <nUm> ° C . all the system exhibited activity in the presence of common alkylaluminum ( TMA , TEA , TIBA ) . comonomer effect wa observed in the copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene , where the comonomer incorporation is about <nUm> mol % . SAXS measurement of the employed xerogel suggested a weakly branched polymeric texture . metal content in the resulting polymer showed extremely low level of Zr . positron lifetime measurement are reported for linear poly(a-olefin)s from polypropylene to poly-1-eicosene polymerised using zirconocene catalyst . for comparison a low density polyethylene wa also studied . four lifetime are resolved , the longest of them ( t4 ) is attributed to o-Ps annihilation from free - volume hole in the amorphous phase and is used to estimate the mean volume of these hole . it is observed that the hole size increase with increasing separation between the measuring temperature ( T = <nUm> K ) and the glass transition temperature tg , estimated with differential scanning calorimetry . among the poly(a-olefin)s the average hole volume is the largest in poly-1-dodecene ( <nUm> nm3 , tg = <nUm> K ) and the lowest in polypropylene ( <nUm> nm3 , tg = <nUm> K ) . A method for estimation of the glass transition temperature tg from the experimental hold volume is proposed . from comparison of amorphous and crystalline density the fractional free volume wa calculated . from this the number of hole wa estimated to be <nUm> - <nUm> nm-3 . the effect of exposure of the polymer to positron radiation from the source on the o-Ps annihilation parameter wa also studied . while lower poly(a-olefin)s show a more or le pronounced exponential decrease of the o-Ps intensity I4 a a function of time , a slight increase is observed in higher poly(a-olefin)s . possible reason for this behaviour are discussed . copolymerization of propylene and cyclopentene ( CPE ) wa carried out using a a catalyst isospecific rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) , rac-dimethylsilylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) , rac-dimethylsilylenebis(2-methylindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 3 ) , or syndiospecific diphenylmethylene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) with methylaluminoxane a a cocatalyst . isospecific zirconocene catalyst 1-3 produced copolymer having narrow molecular weight distribution , while syndiospecific catalyst <nUm> effected propylene homopolymerization . microstructures of the copolymer were studied by 13C NMR and distortionless enhancement of polarization transfer ( DEPT ) spectroscopy . CPE wa found to be incorporated in the copolymer preferentially via 1,2-insertion mechanism in the copolymerization with the catalyst <nUm> . the catalyst <nUm> and <nUm> gave copolymer containing CPE unit formed by either 1,2-insertion or 1,3-insertion mechanism . the proportion of 1,3-insertion unit increased with increasing CPE content in the copolymer . the isomerization reaction from 1,2-insertion to 1,3-insertion CPE unit wa discussed on the basis of kinetic parameter . the effect of Al content on MAO - modified silica wa evaluated on catalyst activity , on polymer property and on residual metal content in the resulting polyethylene . MAO - modified silica were prepared by impregnating MAO toluene solution in concentration range between <nUm> and <nUm> wt % Al / O2Si . commercial MAO - modified silica ( witco ) containing <nUm> wt % Al / O2Si wa used for comparative reason . the resulting modified - silica were employed a support for grafting (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 . using external MAO a cocatalyst ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ) no difference in catalyst activity wa observed . nevertheless , for Al / Zr = <nUm> , catalyst activity were shown to be higher for supported zirconocene system containing <nUm> - <nUm> wt % Al / O2Si range . according to DSC analysis , one Tm peak wa detected for polymer obtained with catalyst prepared with <nUm> wt % Al / O2Si ( <nUm> ° C ) , but two Tm peak were observed for polymer obtained with catalyst prepared with <nUm> wt % Al / O2Si ( <nUm> and <nUm> ° C ) and <nUm> wt % Al / O2Si ( <nUm> and <nUm> ° C ) . A computational study of the ethylene-styrene copolymerization with rac-ethylenebis(tetrahydroindenyl)MCl2 [ m = Ti , Zr ] system using DFT method is presented . the complexation , coordination and insertion energy for ethylene and styrene monomer a well a for the styrene-ethylene copolymerization step into the catalytic active site model [Et2(IndH4)2]MCH3 + [ m = Ti , Zr ] were calculated . the goal of this study is to examine the influence of the metal atom [ Ti , Zr ] on the copolymerization activity . it could be concluded that zirconocene catalyst is much more active than the titanocene based catalyst . this could be explained by the higher steric congestion around the Ti a compared to the Zr complex . furthermore , it wa found that the primary styrene insertion give rise to complex in which the active site are blocked by the phenyl ring in both metal atom , so that only the secondary insertion of the styrene is possible . these fact might help to clarify the already published experimental result . copolymer of styrene and a styrene derivative having a Cs symmetrical ligand moiety were synthesized and used a the carrier for the synthesis of supported - type zirconocene catalyst . propene polymerization wa conducted using the resulting catalyst together with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , which gave syndiotactic polypropene . the productivity of the polymer - supported catalyst ( <nUm> kg PP ( mol zr)-1 for <nUm> h ) wa , however , very low compared to that of the corresponding homogeneous catalyst ( <nUm> kg PP ( mol zr)-1 for <nUm> min ) . an isospecific heterogeneous zirconocene catalyst wa prepared by supporting rac-Cl2SiInd2ZrCl2 on Cl2Mg using an impregnation method . polymerization of propene wa conducted over this combined with methylalumoxane a co-catalyst . it wa found that the catalyst displayed a fairly high activity to give highly isotactic polypropene at <nUm> ° C . with an increase in the polymerization temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C , the activity increased monotonically accompanied by a decrease in isospecificity . stereospecific polymerization of propylene wa carried out with rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) ( 1 ) , rac-dimethylsilylenebis(indenyl)zirconiurn dichloride ( rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) ( 2 ) and isopropylidene(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( i-Pr(Cp)(Flu)ZrCl2 ) ( 3 ) combined with trialkyl-aluminum ( AIR3 : r = C2H5 , i-C4H9 ) / triphenylcarbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( Ph3CB(C6F5)4 ) ( 4 ) . In isospecific polymerization with <nUm> and <nUm> , the molecular weight of polypropylene decreased with increase in the molar ratio of AlEt3 ( et = C2H5 ) / Zr , whereas , an effect of AliBu3 ( iBu = i-C4H9 ) concentration on molecular weight wa not observed . the microstructures of resulting polypropylene were studied by 13C n.m.r . and an increase in the molar ratio of ethyl end group ( derived from chain transfer to AlEt3 ) to n-propyl end group ( derived from b-hydrogen transfer ) wa observed with increase in the molar ratio of AlEt3 / Zr ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) . the chain transfer reaction by both AlEt3 and AliBu3 were also detected in syndiospecific polymerization with <nUm> . the molar ratio of alkyl ( r ) end group ( derived from chain transfer to AIR3 ) to n-propyl end group wa higher in the polypropylene obtained with AlEt3 than that obtained with AliBu3 . the relative constant ktrA / kp ( ktrA = rate constant of chain transfer to AIR3 , kp = rate constant of propagation ) were determined by kinetic study . several type of commercial and developmental aluminoxanes were studied in the semi-batch polymerization of ethylene using bis(cyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) . high temperature gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) measurement of polyethylene ( PE ) formed using various type of aluminoxanes approximated flory 's most probable distribution from a single site - type with PE mw / mn approaching <nUm> for polymerization temperature ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C . the structure and type of aluminoxane co-catalyst were found not to influence the molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) of PE although to influence the activity of the Cp2ZrCl2 catalyst . In general , modified methylaluminoxanes ( MMAOs ) and methylaluminoxanes ( MAOs ) were found to have similar activity , whereas isobutylaluminoxane ( IBAO ) gave a very low activity in the polymerization of ethylene . increasing isobutyl content in the aluminoxane co-catalyst led to a continual decrease in catalyst activity . increasing aluminium / zirconium ( Al / Zr ) molar ratio , by increasing the MAO concentration , led to increasing catalyst activity up to a maximum activity at an Al / Zr molar ratio of <nUm> . like the structure and type of the aluminoxane co-catalyst , the Al / Zr molar ratio wa found not to influence the PE MWD . mixing in additional trimethylaluminium ( TMA ) with MAO wa found not to alter the MWD but gave lower activity at similar Al / Zr molar ratio than that from MAO itself . we report an experimental investigation on long chain branching ( LCB ) in ethylene slurry polymerization with bis(cyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) / modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) using a semi-batch reactor . the effect of the reaction temperature , pressure , MMAO concentration , and catalyst feeding method on the long chain branching density ( LCBD , number of branch per <nUm> carbon ) , polymer molecular weight , and shear thinning property ( I10 / I2 ) were systematically examined . the slurry polymerization process , with it associated polymer - rich phase and the partitioning of active site , favor the LCB formation via an in situ copolymerization of ethylene macromonomers generated by b-hydride elimination and chain transfer to monomer . increasing the temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C reduced the LCBD from <nUm> to <nUm> , while increasing the pressure from <nUm> to <nUm> psig reduced the LCBD from <nUm> to <nUm> . the LCB polyethylene showed enhanced shear thinning property , with melt flow index ratio ( I10 / I2 ) in the range of <nUm> - <nUm> . the feeding sequence of reactant also had a significant effect on the LCB formation . it wa observed that feeding ethylene monomer before zirconocene catalyst produced polyethylene having much higher LCBD than feeding catalyst before monomer.We report an experimental investigation on long chain branching ( LCB ) in ethylene slurry polymerization with bis(cyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) / modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) using a semi-batch reactor . the effect of the reaction temperature , pressure , MMAO concentration , and catalyst feeding method on the long chain branching density ( LCBD , number of branch per <nUm> <nUm> carbon ) , polymer molecular weight , and shear thinning property ( I10 / I2 ) were systematically examined . the slurry polymerization process , with it associated polymer - rich phase and the partitioning of active site , favor the LCB formation via an in situ copolymerization of ethylene macromonomers generated by b-hydride elimination and chain transfer to monomer . increasing the temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C reduced the LCBD from <nUm> to <nUm> , while increasing the pressure from <nUm> to <nUm> psig reduced the LCBD from <nUm> to <nUm> . the LCB polyethylene showed enhanced shear thinning property , with melt flow index ratio ( I10 / I2 ) in the range of <nUm> - <nUm> . the feeding sequence of reactant also had a significant effect on the LCB formation . it wa observed that feeding ethylene monomer before zirconocene catalyst produced polyethylene having much higher LCBD than feeding catalyst before monomer . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. hydrogenolysis is a commonly used method to control the molecular weight or size of polymer obtained by ziegler - natta and related metallocene catalyst . however , the precise mechanism governing these controlling process is still unknown . it is most accepted that the insertion of hydrogen molecule into the metal - alkyl bond of the catalyst active specie competes favorably against the ethylene insertion . thus , the newly formed hydride complex would react with an incoming ethylene starting a new polymer chain . ab initio calculation at the B3LYP / LANL2DZ level of theory have been performed to calculate the reaction profile of both ethylene and hydrogen insertion into the metal-carbon bond of a zirconocene catalyst system . it ha been observed that the activation barrier for the hydrogen molecule insertion is lower than that in case of the ethylene insertion ( <nUm> v <nUm> kcal / mol ) , supporting the idea of a favored hydrogenolysis process controlling the molecular weight of the polymer . In addition , the ethylene insertion into the hydride complex formed after hydrogenolysis wa also studied . No barrier for this reaction ha been found , indicating that the initiation of a new chain is an easy step from both thermodynamic and kinetic point of view . the energetic data obtained in the present work provide a reasonable explanation for some experimental fact such a broadening of polymer molecular weight distribution and the early consumption of hydrogen present in the ethylene polymerization . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. all right reserved . hydrogenolysis is a commonly used method to control the molecular weight or size of polymer obtained by ziegler - natta and related metallocene catalyst . however , the precise mechanism governing these controlling process is still unknown . it is most accepted that the insertion of hydrogen molecule into the metal - alkyl bond of the catalyst active specie competes favorably against the ethylene insertion . thus , the newly formed hydride complex would react with an incoming ethylene starting a new polymer chain . ab initio calculation at the B3LYP / LANL2DZ level of theory have been performed to calculate the reaction profile of both ethylene and hydrogen insertion into the metal-carbon bond of a zirconocene catalyst system . it ha been observed that the activation barrier for the hydrogen molecule insertion is lower than that in case of the ethylene insertion ( <nUm> v <nUm> kcal / mol ) , supporting the idea of a favored hydrogenolysis process controlling the molecular weight of the polymer . In addition , the ethylene insertion into the hydride complex formed after hydrogenolysis wa also studied . No barrier for this reaction ha been found , indicating that the initiation of a new chain is an easy step from both thermodynamic and kinetic point of view . the energetic data obtained in the present work provide a reasonable explanation for some experimental fact such a broadening of polymer molecular weight distribution and the early consumption of hydrogen present in the ethylene polymerization . In the presence of 3-10 mol % of Cu ( l ) salt such a CuBr*S me2 or CCuN , alkylzirconocenes add readily to a,b-unsaturated ketone , aldehyde , and sulfones . the reaction yield is sensitive to the presence of lewis acid and base . steric hindrance a well a a broad range of functional group are tolerated in the conjugate addition process . unsaturated n-acyl oxazolidinones give high diastereoselectivities for the formation of the new asymmetric carbon . the resulting zirconium enolates can be used for tandem aldol addition reaction to aldehyde . depending on the type of copper salt used , slow or fast formation of copper mirror occurs , but no intermediate copper specie is detected spectroscopically . therefore , a mechanism involving enone complexation by the lewis-acidic zirconocene followed by inner - sphere transfer of the alkyl substituent to chelated Cu ( l ) is proposed . A new total synthesis of a-himachalene , a sesquiterpene isolated from essential oil of a himalayan cedar ( cedrus deodara loud),has been achieved . it is based on a sequence involving the [2+2] photoaddition of a cyclic enone with a silyl enol ether , followed by a radical - induced ring expansion of the resulting fused cyclobutanol ; the [2+2] photoaddition of cyclohexenone with 1-methyl-2-trimethylsiloxy-1-cyclopentene in benzene , followed by a treatment of the resulting photoadducts with acid gave a stereoisomeric mixture of 2-hydroxy-6-methyltricyclo[5.4.0.02,6]undecan-8-one(33 % ) accompanied by a product ( <nUm> % ) from a retroaldol reaction of an isomeric photoadduct . the former wa transformed into 8-tert-butyldimethylsiloxy-6-methyltricyclo[5.4.0.02,6] undecan-2-ol via <nUm> step . irradiation of the hypoiodite generated from this protected fused cyclobutanol in benzene resulted in a b-scission of the ring fusion bond to give a mixture of functionalized bicyclo[5.4.0]undecanes , which wa transformed into cis-6,6-dimethyl-8-hydroxybicyclo[5.4.0]undecane-2-ones via <nUm> step . it methylenation by a wittig reaction , followed by oxidation of the resulting 2-methylenebicyclo [.5.4.0]undecan-8-ol , gave the corresponding bicycloundecan-8-one . it ethoxycarbonylation , followed by reductive deoxygenation with zirconocene chloride hydride ( Cp2ZrHCl ) , gave ethyl 6,6-dimethyl-2-methylenebicyclo[5.4.0]undec-8-ene-9-carboxylate . the synthesis of (+-)-a-himachalene wa achieved by transforming the ethoxycarbonyl group into a methyl group by the standard method ; the a,b-unsaturated ester wa reduced into the corresponding alcohol with lithium alminium hydride . A reduction of the mesylate of the resulting alcohol with lithium triethylborohydride gave (+-)-a-himachalene . A convenient diastereoselective synthesis of d-erythro- and l-threo-sphingosine derivative is described . L-Serine - derived aldehyde ( garner 's aldehyde ) ( 2 ) wa treated with 1-alkenyl-zirconocene chloride ( 3 ) in the presence of Br2Zn in THF to give the natural erythro-(anti-) isomer with high diastereoselectivity ( anti / syn = 12-20 : <nUm> ) . In contrast , reaction of <nUm> with 1-alkenyl-ethyl-zinc , prepared from <nUm> and Et2Zn , in CCl2H2 gave the unnatural threo-(syn-) isomer predominantly ( anti / syn = 1:12-15 ) . for the purpose of exploring a new reaction of acylzirconocene chloride a an acyl anion donor , Cu (I) - catalyzed cross-coupling and conjugate addition reaction of acylzirconocene chloride were studied . the coupling reaction with allylic or propargylic halide efficiently proceeded to yield b,g-unsaturated ketone or allenyl ketone derivative , respectively . the conjugated addition reaction to a,b-enones wa carried out in the presence of <nUm> equiv. of BF3*OEt2 giving 1,4-diketone compound . none none In situ prepared Cp2(CI)Zr+ catalyzes the formation of ortho ester from epoxy ester . acid - sensitive a-amino and a-hydroxy acid derivative are converted in high yield to 2,7,8- trioxabicyclo[3.2.1]octanes ( ABO - ester ) using this protocol . this strategy is complementary to the OBO - ester technology , and orthogonal method for the deprotection of ABO- and OBO - ester have been developed . the synthesis of the mushroom component (S)-g- hydroxyleucine lactone and (S)-a-vinylglycine underline the value of ABO - ester protective group strategy . using chiral epoxy alcohol derivative , the first convenient and general asymmetric synthesis of bicyclic ortho ester ha been achieved . the novel C1 - symmetric zirconocene CpCp ° Cl2Zr ( cp = c5h5 , cp ° = 1- neomenthyl-4 , <nUm> , <nUm> , 7-tetrahydroindenyl ) is a cheap , active , and effective catalyst for the asymmetric ethylmagnesiation of unactivated terminal alkene . the diallylic phosphine - borane Ph(BH3)P(allyl)2 <nUm> , reacts with the zirconocene ' Cp2Zr ' and give the bicyclocomplex intermediate <nUm> , characterized by 1H and 31P NMR . the electrophilic addition of H+ , br2 , PhPCl2(BH3) , Ph2PCl(BH3) lead to the corresponding stabilized phospholanes <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and bicyclophospholane <nUm> , whereas Ph2P(BH3)Li on <nUm> give the boro(phospholane-diphosphine) <nUm> . under the same condition , the tetraallylsilane ( or germane ) 13a-b lead to the spirometallacyclopentane 14a-b intermediate . after reaction with br2 , Ph2PLi(BH3) and PhPCl2(BH3) , the racemic spirannic tetraphosphines 16a-b and the protected spirannic diphosphine 17b are obtained with a remarkable selectivity . decomplexation reaction by Et2NH give corresponding free phosphine 3'-17' . Titanocene(III) chloride and zirconcene(III) chloride are effective and mild reagent for radical generation in organic synthesis . In carbohydrate chemistry , these specie are useful for the conversion of glycosyl halide to glycals , and for the stereospecific preparation of c-glycosides . In all case , the 1-glycosyl radical is an active intermediate , generated by reaction of carbohydrate substrate with the organometallic . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. the regioselectivity of insertion of lithium chloroallylides ( allyl carbenoids ) into a wide variety of unsymmetrical zirconacycles ha been determined . In all but one case a single regioisomer wa obtained . A combination of steric and electronic effect is needed to explain the result and imply that the carbenoid is acting predominantly a an electrophilic specie . the first carbenoid insertion into a zirconacyclopentadiene is noted . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. 2-Aza-1,3-dienes bearing trimethylsilyloxy group at C3 undergo an unusual zirconium - mediated retro - brook rearrangement to produce , after hydrolysis , silylated amide . both [1,3]- and [1,4]-oxygen to carbon silyl migration are observed depending on the substrate structure . lithiated epoxynitriles insert efficiently into alkenyizirconocene chloride via a 1,2-metallate rearrangement to form intermediate which eliminate cp <nUm> Zr(Cl)O- to afford substituted 2-cyano-1,3-dienes . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. insertion of lithium alkylcarbenoids RC(A)LiX , A = CN , P(O)(OEt)2 , SO2Ph , OMe into alkenylzirconocene chloride derived by hydrozirconation of terminal alkyne affords functionalised allylzirconium reagent which may be further elaborated . ( C ) <nUm> elsevuer science ltd. the THF - soluble bis(methoxyethyl)zirconocene dihydride <nUm> displayed novel reactivity pattern and wa used to reductively couple alkene , dienes , and enynes . A plausible mechanism involves the formation of a 14-electron zirconium (II) and zirconacyclopentane specie . ( C ) <nUm> published by elsevier science ltd. direct access of a-amino ketone derivative through reaction of acylzirconocene chloride with derivative of n-benzylideneaniline , in which acylzirconocene chloride react a an ' unmasked ' acyl anion donor , wa carried out for the first time under Yb(OTf)3-TMSOTf - catalyzed condition . acylzirconocene chloride a an ' unmasked ' acyl anion donor reacted with a,b-ynones to give 1,4-regioselective acylation product by the use of a catalytic amount of PdCl2(PPh3)2 or Pd(PPh3)4 , and a formation of a cyclopentenone derivative is observed through the reaction of a,b-unsaturated acylzirconocene chloride and a,b-unsaturated ynones . Zr - mediated coupling reaction of aldehyde with chiral aldimine which is derived from benzaldehyde and (R)-phenylglycinol methyl ether showed a remarkable temperature effect on the sense of chiral induction to yield amino alcohol derivative with high diastereoselectivities . insertion of phenylisocyanide into bicyclic zirconacyclopentanes , obtained from a 1,7-octa- or 1,6-hepta-diene by reaction with dibutylzirconocene , affords initially an iminoacyl complex that rearranges on warming to form a zirconocene η <nUm> -imine complex which insert unactivated alkene and alkyne . the carbon-carbon bond formation reaction of diynes with EtMgBr can be catalysed by Cp2ZrCl2 . the final product , magnesiated enynes , readily undergo stereoisomerization to give a mixture of ( e ) and ( z ) isomer . the stoichiometric reaction of diynes with ethylene zirconocene give zirconacyclopentenes with alkynyl substituents in the α position with high regioselectivities . (Butadiene)zirconocene add two molar equivalent of benzyl cyanide to give the chiral nine - membered metallacycle <nUm> . controlled hydrolysis ( CH4O ) of <nUm> yield the stable conjugated primary enamine 2,7-diamino-1,8-diphenyl-2,4,6-octatriene ( 6 ) ( ≥ <nUm> % isolated ) . (2-Pyridyl)acetonitrile reacts similarly with the (butadiene)zirconocene reagent . subsequent controlled hydrolysis now produce a non-conjugated primary enamine , namely 2,7-diamino-1,8-di(2-pyridyl)-1,4,7-octatriene ( 9 ) . In this case , conjugative stabilization of a primary enamine is overcome by functional group stabilization by the 2-pyridyl substituent at the b-enamine position . reaction of zirconocene - alkyne complex with allylic ether afforded allylzirconation product of alkyne in high yield . alkoxy allylic zirconium reagent , prepared from acetal of a,b-unsaturated aldehyde and " Cp2Zr " , react with carbonyl compound to give 1,2-diols or g-hydroxy aldehyde derivative . insertion of alkyl or trialkylsilyl isocyanides into zirconacyclopentanes give iminoacyl complex which rearrange to zirconocene e2-imine complex on heating . these may insert alkyne to give 1-vinyl-1-cyclopentylamines on work up , or decomplex the zirconium to afford , after hydrolysis , cyclopentanones . with benzyl isocyanide 1,2-migration of the e2-imine complex occurs before quenching . reversal of the carbonyl activity of benzophenone , serving a electron donor in single - electron transfer process and acting a a proton acceptor through the ' carbonyl ' carbon atom , is observed upon e2-complexation to zirconocene . low temperature 1H NMR analysis of a reaction mixture containing a vinylic zirconocene , MeLi , Me3ZnLi , <nUm> mol % Me2Cu(CN)Li2 and an enone , reagent which together lead to the michael delivery of a vinyl ligand , reveals the presence of a zinc enolate , the specie likely to be responsible for the subsequent alkylation or aldol reaction a the final step in 3-component coupling . the regioselective bond cleavage of vinylcyclopropanes with zirconocene - butene complex gave e3- and / or e1-allylic zirconocene derivative depending on the substitutional pattern of the cyclopropylring . the reaction and characterization of the complex were carried out . potassium t-butoxide promotes alkylation of non-enolizable ketone and aldehyde by zirconocene dialkyls . the reaction proceeds with loss of cyclopentadienide ion from the metal center . A procedure is reported which provides for the preparation of functionalized dienes via transmetallation or protonation of zirconocene enyne complex . A second transmetallation is possible to generate 1,2-disubstituted-1,3-dienes . treatment of Cl2ZrCp2 with <nUm> equiv of alkylmetals ( RM ) containing Li or Mg , e.g. , n-BuLi , in THF produce organozirconium specie that act a source of " ZrCp2 , " the latter product being a convenient reagent for preparing zirconacycles . allylic zirconium reagent were generated by treating allylic ether derivative with zirconocene " Cp2Zr " . the allylic zirconium reagent reacted with aldehyde in highly regio- and diastereoselective manner to give homoallylic alcohol compound . allylically methyl-substituted 1,6-heptenynes , such a 3-methyl-1,6-octenyne , can be diastereoselectivity converted to the corresponding bicyclic ketone , such a ( 5R , 6S)-2,6-dimethylbicyclo[3.3.0]oct-1-en-3-one readily convertible to (+)-iridomyrmecin , the observed diastereomeric excess of the bicyclization reaction being > <nUm> % . A series of novel azazirconacyclopentenes have been prepared by the thermolysis of diphenylzirconocene in the presence of one equivalent of a wide variety of nitrile . an x-ray crystal structure show these metallacycles to be dimeric in the solid state . the zirconocene complex of 3-methoxy-4-[(methyl)zirconocene]banzyne , <nUm> , ha been prepared and isolated a it trimethylphosphine adduct . In addition , the reaction of <nUm> with a variety of unsaturated organic molecule ha been investigated . In these reaction , <nUm> serf a the synthetic equivalent of the bis(zirconocene)3-mathoxybenzdiyne complex . In combination with 3-acyl-2-oxazolones , zirconium complex such a zirconium acetylacetonate and zirconocene chloride hydride-Mg serve well a effective catalyst for regioselective acylation of polyalcohols including 1,2-diols to permit highly preferential protection of primary hydroxyl group . treatment of zirconocene dichloride with dibromomethane and zinc affords an organometallic intermediate which rapidly methylenates aldehyde , ketone , and enones at room temperature . 4-Dimethylaminopyridine ha been found to be a remarkably effective ligand for the formation of stabilized zirconocene complex . the latter specie mediate efficientcoupling reaction between 1-methylthioalkynes and a variety of unsaturated organic substrate . the reaction of nonconjugated monosubstituted alkene with t-BuMgCl and Cl2ZrCp2 at room temperature produce the corresponding monoalkylzirconium derivative in high yield , while conjugated alkene undergo either a novel t-butylzirconation or hydrozirconation depending on the reaction condition . the Zr - promoted bicyclization of 1,6- and 1,7-dienes can stereoselectively produce trans-zirconabicyclo[3.3.0]octanes and cis-zirconabicyclo[4.3.0]nonanes , respectively ; these compound can be readily converted into protonolysis , halogenolysis , and carbonylation product . conjugated oligomers bearing 4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-5S,6S-dioctyloxybenzothiophene a a central linkage were synthesized by negishi 's reagent ( n-Bu2ZrCp2 ) promoted intramolecular cyclization of a diyne and subsequent suzuki coupling reaction . the chirality in the central linkage originated from tartaric acid , which induced the conjugated backbone of oligomers to exhibit interesting optical activity . [RhCl(COD)]2 ( <nUm> mol % ) catalyzed reaction of alkenylzirconocene chloride complex to N-Ts , -PO(OEt)2 and COOR aldimine derivative were efficiently carried out in dioxane at room temperature to give allylic amine derivative in excellent yield . this is the first example of the catalytic addition reaction of alkenylzirconocene chloride complex to aldimine derivative . 2,2-Difluorovinyl p-toluenesulfonate , readily obtained from 2,2,2-trifluoroethanol , is treated with zirconocene equivalent ' Cp2Zr ' to generate the remarkably thermostable nonsubstituted 2,2-difluorovinylzirconocene , which in turn couple with aryliodides in the presence of palladium catalyst and zinc iodide to afford monosubstituted gem-difluoroolefins in high yield . the reaction proceeds via 2,2-difluorovinylzinc a confirmed by 19F - NMR measurement . low - valent titanium and zirconium reagent in situ prepared from metallocene dichloride ( Cp2MCl2 : m = Ti , Zr ) and magnesium powder activated by 1,2-dibromoethane smoothly reacted with allyl propargyl ether to afford 3-methylenetetrahydrofurans in good yield . it is noteworthy that the Cp2Zr- and Cp2Ti - mediated cyclizations proceed with inverse stereoselectivity . novel ' Cp2Zr ' - mediated ring transformation of 2-vinylheterocycles ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) to carbocycles ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) were shown to proceed through an intramolecular allylation of z-allylic zirconocene specie to the epoxide or aziridine intermediate . hydrozirconation of a functionalized alkyne followed by transmetalation and 1,2-addition to a,b-unsaturated aldehyde wa used for the synthesis of the eastern side chain of asukamycin and a precursor to the southern side chain common to asukamycin and manumycin A . these route facilitate analog preparation , and the convergent zirconocene strategy represents an alternative to stepwise wittig condensation or stille coupling in polyene synthesis . various zirconocene and titanocene complex 1-8 effectively catalyze the polymerization of e-caprolactone in a nearly living fashion at ambient temperature to afford poly-e-caprolactone . the highest T.O.N . of <nUm> wa obtained at 70-75 ° C with the agostic complex 8. g,g-Dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie can be easily prepared from the reaction of triethyl orthoacrylate with zinrconocene equivalent ( zirconocene - butene complex ) . this specie reacts with aldehyde a an a,b-unsaturated acyl anion equivalent to give the 1-substituted-2,2-diethoxy-3-buten-1-ol derivative . the zirconocene- and titanocene alkyne complex 1-10 were tested to be effective catalyst in the dehydrocoupling of hydrosilanes like PhMeSiH2 and Ph2SiH2 to give oligomers and of other example , e.g. , PhSiH3 polymer with cyclic oligosilanes a byproduct . ethylene and styrene derivative reacted with various propargylic ether in the presence of zirconocene(II) to afford allenic product in high yield . the reaction proceeded via formation of zirconacyclopentenes by selective coupling of an olefin and a propargylic ether , which wa followed by b-elimination of the siloxy group . deuterolysis confirmed that the final product had a zirconium-carbon bond . A catalytic method for the sequential cyclization - silylation of dienes containing one or two 1,1-disubstituted alkene moiety to form various cyclic and bicyclic organosilanes in good yield is presented . styrene were alkylated with alkyl tosylates , sulfate and bromide in the presence of a zirconocene catalyst and (n)BuMgCl in THF . by the use of this reaction , primary and secondary alkyl group can be introduced regioselectively at the benzylic carbon of styrene to give a-substituted ethylbenzenes . A new insight in the crucial role of methylalumoxane ( MAO ) a polymerization cocatalyst ha been demonstrated by using typical carbonyl reduction and electrophilic alkylation by comparison with various MAO analogue , (Me2Al)2O , MeAl(OPr(i))2 , and Me2AlOPr(i) . furthermore , the high ligand - abstraction ability of MAO for a zirconocene complex is evaluated by the allylzirconation of internal alkyne , where MAO wa found to be more satisfactory a cocatalyst than (Me2Al)2O and Me3Al in term of reactivity .
