(p-2,2-Difluorovinyloxyphenyl)dimethylamine , readily obtained from 2,2,2-trifluoroethanol , is treated with zirconocene equivalent ' Cp2Zr ' to generate thermostable 1-fluorovinylzirconocene via a C-F bond cleavage . this 1-fluorovinylzirconocene can be used for C-C bond formation through the cross-coupling with aryl iodide in the presence of palladium catalyst and zinc iodide , leading to (Z)-1-aryl-2-(p-dimethylaminophenoxy)-1-fluoroolefins in good yield . this chapter discus the synthesis , structural aspect , and basic chemical property of formally divalent and trivalent titanium and zirconium metallocene complex . the synthesis and handling of low - valent titanium and zirconium metallocenes require special experimental procedure because of the extreme sensitivity of the compound toward oxygen , moisture , and sometimes even dinitrogen . the element of the first transition series from vanadium to nickel form stable bis(e-cyclopentadienyl) complex having the normal e-sandwich structure , typical of ferrocene . other attempt have been made at preparing dinitrogen reactive titanocenes . several possible route to the preparation of [e-C5(CH3)5]2Ti have been explored . the best method for preparing pure permethyltitanocene is via dinitrogen adduct . this interesting reduction of the C10H7moiety probably occurs via a successive protonation of the relatively electron - rich naphthyl ligand . the exceptional chemical inertness of dinitrogen , which is related to it high ionization potential , low electron affinity , and the abnormal strength of the N ≡ N bond are well recognized . the chemistry of titanium and zirconium , bis(e-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl) system is essentially that of monomeric [e-C5(CH3)2]2M unit . this chapter discus the remarkable feature of ( e4-conjugated fiene ) zirconocene and – hafnocene complex . ( e4-conjugated diene ) transition - metal complex are important a starting material or reactive intermediate in many catalytic process . they play an increasingly important role a stoichiometric substrate or reagent in organic synthesis . group IV metallocenes readily form <nUm> : l complex with conjugated dienes in their s-trans conformation . many ( e4-diene ) metallocenes of conjugated dienes , fixed in their s-cis conformation by a rigid carbon framework , have been obtained in high yield . inner and outer methylene hydrogen appear a doublet at sufficiently low temperature . A hypsochromic shift is observed for long - wave absorption band on going from 5a to 3a . the diene moiety ( plane C1 , C2 , C3 , C4 ) of the ligand remains essentially planar . all four carbon atom of the conjugated diene skeleton are clearly within bonding distance of the zirconium center . isomeric ( s-cis- and ( s-trans-e4 - conjugated diene)zirconocene and – hafnocene complex exhibit pronounced difference in their characteristic structural data a well a their spectroscopic feature . by the nature of it molecular mechanism , carbonyl-insertion reaction represents a typical reaction mode ofs – alkyl transition - metal complex . the pronounced alkyl metal character of (s-cis-butadiene)zirconocene should make the diene ligand in 5a much more amenable to electrophilic attack than in the isomeric (s-trans-e4-butadiene)ZrCp2 ( 3a ) . the (conjugated-diene)zirconocene and – hafnocene system are unique in that three isomeric organometallic specie can be distinguished by physical and / or chemical mean . the reaction of phosphine Ph2P(CH2)2SO3Na with Cp2M'Cl2 ( M' = Ti , Zr ) in aqueous solution give the metallophosphines , Cp2Ti(OSO2(CH2) 2PPh2)2 ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ) and CpZr(OH)(OSO2(CH2)2PPh2) <nUm> . these react with CODM''Cl2 ( M'' = Pd , Pt ) ( COD = 1,5-cyclooctadiene ) in dichloromethane to give heterobimetallic complex Cp2Ti(OSO2(CH2)2PPh 2)2M''Cl2 and CpZr(OH)(OSO2(CH2)2 PPh2)2M''Cl2 respectively . the compound are characterised by infrared and NMR spectroscopy and elemental analysis . electrospray mass spectrum of the complex are reported and compared to those of Cp2M'Cl2 in water and dimethylsulfoxide ( DMSO ) . for zirconocene dichloride and it product heterobimetallic complex , the addition of ethylenediamine tetraacetic acid disodium salt ( Na2H2EDTA ) wa found to be an effective ionisation enhancement agent for the electrospray mass spectral study . cytotoxicity study for the previously reported Cl2Pt(PPh2(CH2)2SO 3H)2*3.5H2O ( wedgwood et al. , inorg. chim. acta <nUm> ( 1999 ) <nUm> ) , and the compound Cp2Ti(OSO2(CH2)2 PPh2)2*1.5H2O and Cp2Ti(OSO2(CH2)2PPh 2)2PtCl2*4H2O reported here , have been evaluated by colony formation assay against cisplatin - sensitive and - resistant cell line L929 and L929 / r to highlight potential chemotherapeutic activity . the compound Cl2Pt(PPh2(CH2)2SO 3H)2*3.5H2O overcomes cisplatin resistance . none experimental result showing the unique possibility of modification of catalytic property of homogeneous metallocene IVB group catalyst in propylene polymerization under the action of triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) or in the presence of small additive of lewis base ( LB ) are presented . it ha been shown that the preactivation of zirconocene dichloride at low MAO excess ( ∼ <nUm> <nUm> mol / mol ) followed by the activation with TIBA also at low molar TIBA excess to over metallocene ( ∼ <nUm> <nUm> mol / mol ) give rise to very active homogeneous catalyst for olefin polymerization . the approach allows a 10-100-fold decrease of MAO charge . monomethylated zirconocene complex with MAO a catalytic intermediate formed under preactivation condition and the mixture of tetraisobutylalumoxane / polyisobutylalumoxane a cocatalysts formed at nearby stoichiometric amount of TIBA and MAO were recognized a the key component of the analyzed catalytic system . it ha been shown for the first time that purposeful introduction of almost stoichiometric amount of ternary amine to the L <nUm> MMe <nUm> / h <nUm> CB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> / TIBA catalytic system ( L <nUm> MMe <nUm> = ph <nUm> CCpFluMMe <nUm> ( m = Zr , Hf ) , rac-Me <nUm> SiInd <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> ) can result in an extremely high increase in the catalyst activity , the effect being most pronounced for hafnocenes in the presence of NPh <nUm> . it wa also shown that TIBA in these catalytic system act a the reagent reducing stereoselectivity of the catalyst leading to the formation of stereoblock polypropylene for C s -symmetry catalyst . the reason for the effect observed are discussed . cyclic olefin like cyclobutene , cyclopentene , and norbornene can be polymerized to give isotactic polymer with chiral metallo - cene / aluminoxane catalyst , especially with et(bisindenyl)zir-coniumdichloride / methylalumoxane . the polycycloalkenes show extremely high melting point which are <nUm> ° C for polycyclopentene , <nUm> ° C for polycyclobutene and over <nUm> ° C for polynorbornene , which is more than the decomposition temperature . 13C - NMR spectroscopy provides information about the structure of the highly crystalline homopolymers . to lower the melting point , copolymerization with ethene or propene is carried out . the co-polymerization parameter r1 of the olefin ethene / cyclopentene increase with temperature from <nUm> ( − <nUm> ° C ) to <nUm> ( <nUm> ° C ) . even when in solution the copolymer obtained using one enantiomer of the chiral zirconocene show a small optical rotation . polymer of rigid cycloalkenes like dimethanooctahydronaphthalene with ethylene are amorphous and feature high tg value . they could be used a starting material for optical disc . the information about aging reaction between zirconocene and aluminoxane shed more light on the mechanism of homogeneous olefin catalyst . <nUm> . study by 1H NMR on equilibrium between contact ion pair such a Cp2ZrCH3d + … H3C-B(C6F5)3d- and binuclear alkyl zirconocene cation of the type (Cp2ZrCH3)2(m-CH3) + lead to the conclusion that these binuclear specie must generally be considered a participant in all homogeneous ziegler - natta system . <nUm> . different polypropene chain length , which are obtained from cis- and trans-1D - propene with the catalyst en(thind)2ZrCl2 / MAO , show that exchange of a-H with a-D atom affect the rate of chain growth by a large kinetic isotope effect ; this support the notion that an a-agostic interaction facilitates the olefin insertion step . <nUm> . A strong increase in polymer chain length , which is caused by the presence of a-methyl group in ansa - zirconocene catalyst , is shown , by the effect of propene pressure on MW , to be due to the suppression of the otherwise predominant direct b-H - transfer to a coordinated olefin molecule by these a-substituents . the atom superposition and electron delocalization method wa used to study a model of metallocene catalyst based on zirconocene supported on silica with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a a co-catalyst . the system wa analyzed for completely and partially hydrated silica . our result suggest that the production of a cationic zirconocene a a final step for the active site formation may be energetically favourable , suggesting that the process may occur preferentially on partially hydrated silica . surface reaction between bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ) and porous OSi <nUm> surface were studied by preparing series of sample by saturated gas - solid reaction in an atomic layer epitaxy ( ALE ) reactor . partially dehydroxylated silica support were obtained by preheating . cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> reacted mainly with the isolated OH group . the availability of OH group influenced the bonding mode of the zirconocene complex which wa mainly singly bonded on silica preheated at <nUm> ° C , while preheating at <nUm> ° C resulted in multiple bonding a revealed by NMR and elemental analysis . there wa no evidence for surface alkylation or chlorination . zirconocene complex carrying sterically bulky tri-substituted cyclopentadienyl ligand , (e5-4-R-1,2-Ph2C5H2)2ZrCl2 [ r = phenyl ( 3 ) , cyclohexyl ( 4 ) ] , were synthesized by the reaction of Cl4Zr with lithio salt of 1,2,4-triphenylcyclopentadiene ( 1 ) or 4-cyclohexyl-1,2-diphenylcyclopentadiene ( 2 ) , respectively . the single - crystal x-ray structure analysis reveals that both complex crystallize in C2 - symmetric conformation in solid state . when activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , complex <nUm> and <nUm> polymerize ethylene with moderate activity to produce ultra-high-molecular-weight polyethylene with high melting transition temperature at low Al / Zr ratio . under ambient condition , both system of 3-MAO and 4-MAO show relatively high activity in propylene oligomerization . the molecular weight of the polypropylene produced from the 3-MAO system is lower than that from the 4-MAO system . In comparison with <nUm> , complex <nUm> is more active in both ethylene and propylene polymerization . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. the synthesis of <nUm> organozirconium compound is described , together with their characterization . nine of them are zirconocene(IV) derivative bearing cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) or related ligand [ cp' = e-C5H5SiMe3 , CCp'' = e-C5H3(SiMe3)2-1,3 or C p''' = e-C5H2(SiMe3)3-1,2,4 ] . the remaining two compound are [ZrCp''2(DMPE)] ( 8 ) and [Zr(CH2Mes)2Cl2]*2Et2O [ DMPE = (Me2PCH2)2 and me = C6H2Me3-2,4,6 ] . x-ray structural data are presented for seven of these complex : [ZrCp2(Cl)(OAr)] , [ZrCp2{e2-C(NMe)CHPh2}(Me)] , [ZrCp2(NMe2)(OAr')] , [ZrCp'2(CH2C6Me5)(Cl)] , [ZrCp''2(e2-BH4)(Cl)] , ( 8 ) and [ZrCp'''(NMe2)3] ( Ar = C6H2Bu2t-2,6-Me-4 , ar' = C6H3Bu2t-2,6 ) . cyclic voltammetric result are presented for the zirconocene halide of formula [ZrCp''2X2] ( x = F , Cl , or Br ) and on some related compound . the zirconocene(II) complex , <nUm> , undergoes reversible one - electron oxidation and ESR data are provided on the zirconium (III) product . some variable temperature NMR result are described on the aryloxides and tetrahydridoborates . none A series of 3,4-dialkylcyclopentanones wa synthesized by template reaction on the " cp <nUm> Zr " moiety generated from cp <nUm> zr(2,4-hexadiene) or cp <nUm> zr(olefin) complex by ligand exchange reaction . the addition of a 1-olefin or 1,7-octadiene to the cp <nUm> Zr specie followed by CO insertion and acid hydrolysis gave a cis- or trans-disubstituted cyclopentanone in high yield . the five complex ( RC <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> M(S <nUm> CNBz <nUm> )Cl ( r = H , CH <nUm> ; m = Ti , Zr , Hf ; B = CH <nUm> C <nUm> H <nUm> ) have been prepared by the reaction of ( RC <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> MCl <nUm> with anhydrous sodium salt of dibenzyldithiocarbamate in refluxing CH <nUm> Cl <nUm> . these complex have been characterized by elemental analysis , IR and <nUm> H NMR . x-ray crystal structure determination of cp <nUm> Zr(S <nUm> CNBz <nUm> )Cl show the molecule ha a five - coordinate bent metallocene geometry in which the zirconium atom is attached to two η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> group , one bidentate dibenzyl-dithiocarbamate ligand and one chlorine [ ClZr , <nUm> Å ; SZr , <nUm> , <nUm> ; ClSZr , <nUm> ° and <nUm> ° ; S2Zr , <nUm> ° ] . the catalytic system cp <nUm> Ti(S <nUm> CNBz <nUm> )Cl - HNa exhibit high initial catalytic activity of hydrogenation of hexene-1 under mild condition . both ni(dppe)(edt) ( 1 ) ( dppe = Ph2PCH2CH2PPh2 ; edt = ethanedithiolate ) and [Pd(PPh3)(edt)]2 ( 2 ) react with zirconocene dihydride without any evidence of CS bond cleavage . reduction of the late transition metal to the zero oxidation state occurs together with the evolution of hydrogen . for palladium the major product of the reaction is the trinuclear complex Cp2Zr(edt)Pd(edt)ZrCp2 · CH ( 3 ) for which the crystal structure wa determined . the structure wa refined to r = <nUm> ( RW = <nUm> ) for <nUm> reflection with I > 3.0s(I) . the stereochemistry around palladium is distorted tetrahedral , and the PdZr separation are <nUm> Å , suggesting bonding interaction between the metal . In reaction of Cp2ZrH2 with <nUm> , spectroscopic evidence suggested that Cp2Zr(edt)Ni(dppe) wa first formed , possibly with the trinuclear nickel analogue of <nUm> , but all attempt to recrystallize these complex failed , and the major product isolated stemmed from ligand redistribution reaction . the homogeneous ziegler - natta catalyst , consisting of zirconocene compound and methylalumoxane , lead to extremely high polymerization activity . with bis(cyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride , polyethylene with activity up to <nUm> x <nUm> g PE / g zr*h is formed . the higher the degree of oligomerization of the alumoxane the more active are the catalyst . the density of polyethylene ( LLDPE ) can be lowered by using 1-butene or 1- hexene a comonomers . incorporation of dienes give EPDM - elastomer . highly isotactic polypropylene can be prepared by using chiral rac-ethylene bis(tetrahydroindenyl) zirconium dichloride together with methylalumoxane a cocatalyst . the toluene soluble part here consists of le than <nUm> weight per cent . cyclopentene give a highly isotactic and insoluble polymer . with the r or S enantiomer of the catalyst it is also possible to produce optically active oligomers . the side reaction and the mechanism are discussed . readily available (butadiene)zirconocene and -hafnocene complex react with various metal carbonyl to form metallacyclic metal oxycarbene complex . the p-allyl specie Cpa2MOC[M'Ln]C4H6 ) ( m = Zr , Hf ) can often be obtained crystalline . the bimetallic carbene complex exhibit a rather short OC(carbene) bond distance indicating a pronounced metal acyl complex character . carbene complex formation between (s-trans-e4-butadiene)zirconocene and CpCO(CO)2 or C5O4PV , respectively is reversible . the equilibrium can be shifted towards the carbene complex side by reducing the electron density at the carbene ligand bearing metal or by using the hafnium instead of the zirconium containing butadiene metallocene reagent . five - membered benzannelated zirconium oxycarbene complex CP2ZrOC[W(CO)5](C6H4) were obtained by CC - coupling from thermally generated (1,2-didehydrobenzene)zirconocene and C6O6W . this carbene complex is an oligomer in the solid state a revealed by x-ray diffraction . monomeric unit are linked together via intermolecular COWZr bond . this zirconium oxycarbene complex act a an organometallic lewis acid in solution . it reversibly coordinate organic carbonyl compound . zirconium oxycarbene complex CP2Zr(OR)C(Ph)W(CO)5 react readily with several non-stabilized phosphorus ylides to produce zirconium enolates CP2Zr(OR)C(Ph)CHR which can be used a carbon nucleophiles in syn-selective aldol condensation reaction . the (butadiene)zirconocene derived metallacyclic zirconium oxycarbene complex CP2ZrOC[M(CO)5](C4H6) ( m = Cr , Mo , W ) act a carbon nucleophiles at the Zr - bound substituted p-allyl ligand . ketone or aldehyde are CC - coupled regioselectively to the allyl-CH2 terminus to form chiral nine - membered metallacyclic product . bis(e <nUm> -cyclopentadienyl)chloro(4-oxoferrocenebutanoyloxy)zirconium(IV) , η <nUm> -Cp <nUm> ZrCl(OCOCH <nUm> CH <nUm> COFc ) ( cp = C <nUm> H <nUm> , fc = C <nUm> H <nUm> ,FeC <nUm> ,H <nUm> ) , ha been synthesized by reaction of zirconocene dichloride with sodium 4-oxoferrocenebutanoate and ha been characterized by elemental analysis , PMR and IR spectroscopy . the x-ray crystal structure of the title complex wa determined using <nUm> independent reflection with I > 3s(I) . the complex crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P2 <nUm> / c with four monomeric molecule in a cell of dimension a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> Å <nUm> , d calc = <nUm> g cm <nUm> and m(K α ) = <nUm> cm <nUm> . the structure ha been solved by direct method and refined by fourier and full - matrix least - square method to a conventional r = <nUm> . the carboxyl group in this complex is a bidentate ligand and the atom , Zr , Cl , O(2) , O(3) , C(4) and C(3) lie in a quasi-mirror plane . Cpo2ZrCl2 ( cpo = e5-C5EtMe4 ) reacts with LiPHCy ( cy = cyclohexyl ) with the formation of CPo2ZrCl(PHCy) ( 1 ) . compound <nUm> undergoes insertion of CS2 or PhNCS into the Zr - P bond , yielding Cpo2ZrCl(e2-S2CPHCy) ( 2 ) and Cpo2ZrCl{e2-SC(PHCy)NPh} ( 3 ) . compound 1-3 were characterized spectroscopically ( IR , NMR , MS ) and crystal structure determination were carried out on <nUm> and <nUm> , showing an e2-bonding mode of the SC(PHCy)NPh ( S , N ) ligand in the latter . the novel [ e5:e 1-(2-diphenylphosphinoethyl)cyclopentadienyl]trichlorozirconium ( IV ) <nUm> ha been prepared via (2-diphenylphosphinoethyl)(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene <nUm> . the structure of an adduct of <nUm> with tetrahydrofuran ( THF ) 3b ( two crystal modification ) and of an ionic complex derived from <nUm> and Cl4Zr { [ e5:e1-(C5H4CH 2CH2PPh2)ZrCl]2(m-Cl) 3}+2[(ZrCl4) 2(m-Cl)2]2- <nUm> have been determined by an x-ray analysis . the x-ray and NMR data prove the existence of a Zr-P intramolecular coordination in <nUm> both in solid state and in non-solvating medium within a broad range of temperature . In THF solution the flexible equilibrium between adduct of <nUm> with one ( 3b ) and two ( 3c ) molecule of THF ha been observed by variable - temperature NMR spectroscopy . the synthetic route to the simplest unsymmetrically ligated zirconocene ( e5-C5H4CH2 CH2PPh2)(e5-C5H 5)ZrCl2 <nUm> derived from <nUm> ha also been elaborated . metal content in polymerization catalyst were comparatively determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) , x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy ( XPS ) and x-ray fluorescence ( XRF ) spectroscopy . catalyst were prepared by grafting metallocene onto bare silica or onto silica chemically modified with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . catalyst were compressed a self - supporting pellet ( RBS and XRF ) , or mounted on adhesive copper tape ( XPS ) . the proximity of the mass of the atomic nucleus did not allow resolution by RBS of the signal corresponding to Zr and Nb , nor Si and Al in catalyst system such a (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 / Cp2NbCl2 / MAO / OSi <nUm> . on the other hand , Zr , Nb , Si and Al line were completely resolved in an XRF spectrum . for supported metallocenes on bare silica , XPS measurement wa ca. <nUm> % higher than that obtained by RBS . silica - supported zirconocene showed good agreement in Zr content determination by XRF and RBS . an in situ supporting method wa applied to newly synthesized [(CH2)5(C5H4)2][(C9 H7)ZrCl2]2 catalyst and other commercial catalyst , and it effect on the polymerization characteristic of these catalyst were examined through reaction experiment . the change in the molecular weight distribution varied depending on the metallocene catalyst while the change in the catalytic activity , average molecular weight and the melting point showed the same trend . the reason for the decrease in the molecular weight with in situ supporting wa discussed in relation to the co-catalysts . the polymerization characteristic of each catalyst also varied according to the alkyl aluminum , and so it is important to select a proper co-catalyst or a combination of co-catalysts to obtain a desired polymer product from each metallocene catalyst supported by in situ method . oligomerization of propylene catalyzed by Cp2ZrCl2 / ethylaluminoxane or / Et3Al at low Al / Zr ratio and high temperature regioselectively afforded trimeric carbocyclic product , 1,1,3-trimethylcyclopentane and 1,1,3,4-tetramethylcyclopentane , along with C6 and C9 chain olefin . the product distribution wa affected by the reaction temperature , the pressure of propylene , the ratio of Al / Zr and the reaction time . the combined selectivity of two five - membered cyclic product attained <nUm> % under the optimized condition . the pathway of regioselective cyclo-trimerization of propylene to substituted cyclopentanes is discussed . novel methodology wa developed for preparation of isospecific metallocene catalyst for olefin polymerization that are tethered on silica surface with covalent bond . A racemic ansa - zirconocene complex that ha a Si-Cl moiety on it bridge wa immobilized on O2Si by the reaction of the Si-Cl anchor with Si-OH on the solid surface . the prepared solid catalyst wa found to be effective for isospecific propene polymerization ( catalyst A ) . pretreatment of silica surface with Me3SiCl improved the catalyst performance ( catalyst B ) . an ansa - zirconocene complex with a BH group reacted with " vinyl-coated " silica gel to afford another immobilized catalyst ( catalyst C ) . this catalyst achieved satisfactorily high catalytic activity and high isotacticity in it produced polypropene . none A new RIS model wa developed for erythro di-isotactic polynorbornene that included long - range steric interaction that are needed to properly model it conformation . these interaction were included by extracting RIS state from an approximate energy state map for the heptamer of this polymer . the RIS model predicted a novel helix - kink conformation for this polymer in which helix were occasionally disrupted by a backbone kink and a value of approximately <nUm> for the exponent 'a ' from the Mark-Houwink-Sakurada equation at the θ condition . these RIS result were consistent with independent single chain monte carlo simulation and were also used to generate bulk periodic structure of this polymer . the result of these simulation compare well to both experimental viscometry and wide angle x-ray diffraction result for two polymer sample synthesized using Pd and zirconocene homogeneous polymerization catalyst . these result indicated that the likely stereochemical configuration for polymer produced using these catalyst is the erythro di-isotactic form . they also suggested that polymer of similar structure such a ci poly(t - butyl acetylene ) may also adopt this kink - helix conformation . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science ltd. all right reserved.A new RIS model wa developed for erythro di-isotactic polynorbornene that included long - range steric interaction that are needed to properly model it conformation . these interaction were included by extracting RIS state from an approximate energy state map for the heptamer of this polymer . the RIS model predicted a novel helix - kink conformation for this polymer in which helix were occasionally disrupted by a backbone kink and a value of approximately <nUm> for the exponent 'a ' from the Mark-Houwink-Sakurada equation at the θ condition . these RIS result were consistent with independent single chain monte carlo simulation and were also used to generate bulk periodic structure of this polymer . the result of these simulation compare well to both experimental viscometry and wide angle x-ray diffraction result for two polymer sample synthesized using Pd and zirconocene homogeneous polymerization catalyst . these result indicated that the likely stereochemical configuration for polymer produced using these catalyst is the erythro di-isotactic form . they also suggested that polymer of similar structure such a ci poly(t - butyl acetylene ) may also adopt this kink - helix conformation . addition of small amount of ethylene or hydrogen lead to significant productivity increase in propylene polymerization catalyzed by fluxional bis(2-arylindenyl)zirconocenes . to test if this phenomenon is related to the reactivation of dormant specie formed a a result of regioirregular propylene insertion , we have reinvestigated the regioregularity of these catalyst . approximately <nUm> - <nUm> mol % of 2,1-misinsertions were found in polymer synthesized by these catalyst . the presence of these regioirregular insertion could account for the ethylene and hydrogen effect observed but doe not rule out formation of other catalyst dormant site . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. four metallocene catalyst were prepared using two indenyl-containing aerogels a support , treated under different condition ( triethylaluminum ( TEA ) , methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and butyllithium ) . the catalyst were characterized by complementary spectroscopic technique : ultraviolet - visible spectroscopy ( UV - vi ) , x-ray photoelectronic spectroscopy ( XPS ) , matrix - assisted laser desorption / ionization time - of - flight mass spectroscopy ( MALDI-TOF-MS ) , scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) and electron probe microanalysis ( EPMA ) . the highest metal content ( <nUm> mmol Zr / g-cat . ) wa achieved in the case of xerogel treated with TEA prior to metallocene synthesis . after MAO leaching , such content is reduced to <nUm> mmol-Zr / g-cat. , exhibiting the highest activity in ethylene polymerization among the four developed catalyst . A relationship between catalyst activity and binding energy of Zr 3d(5 / <nUm> ) core level could be evidenced . the most active catalyst system showed a better Zr distribution , being the catalyst grain covered by aluminum cocatalyst . depth profile monitoring by XPS measurement showed that , in fact , MAO leach the zirconocene low binding energy specie , being deposited in the uttermost surface of the grain . eight zirconocene dichloride complex are described that contain an alkyl or silylalkyl substituent with a fluorenyl end group on the cyclopentadienyl ring . also , a bridged cyclopentadienyl indenyl metallocene complex with a fluorenyl terminated alkyl substituent is reported . these complex were activated with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) and used for catalytic ethylene polymerization . the synthesis and characterization of <nUm> new , unbridged metallocene dichloride complex of the type (L)(Ind)ZrCl2 ( L = o-phenylalkyl substituted cyclopentadienyl or 1-phenylsilyl substituted indenyl ; ind = indenyl ) and (L')(Flu)ZrCl2(L ' = 1-benzyl substituted indenyl or 2-benzyl substituted indenyl ; flu = fluorenyl ) are reported . after activation with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) , these complex are highly active catalyst for homogeneous ethylene polymerization . the influence of various substituents on the catalyst activity and the polymer property are discussed . ethylene polymerization wa carried out by using the zirconocene catalyst supported on MCM-41 ( or Al-MCM-41 ) , which had a uniform hexagonal array of linear channel constructed with a honeycomb - like silica matrix , and about <nUm> Å d-spacing . the zirconocene catalyst supported directly on silicious MCM-41 ( Cp2ZrCl2 / MCM-41 ) did not show any activity in ethylene polymerization . on the other hand , the activity of the zirconocene catalyst supported directly on Al-MCM-41 ( Cp2ZrCl2 / Al-MCM-41 ) were comparable to those of homogeneous zirconocenes , and much higher than the activity of those supported on Al-MCM-41 modified by methylaluminoxane ( Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO / Al-MCM-41 ) . the lewis acidity in Al-MCM-41 seemed to play an important role for anchoring the zirconocenes , such that lower value of Si / Al ratio resulted in higher catalytic activity . modification with MAO must have reduced the role of acidity . the difference in the catalytic activity among the supported zirconocenes wa discussed through the surface specie model on the interaction between zirconocene and lewis acid in Al-MCM-41 . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. 1H and 13C NMR study of the reaction between two b-alkyl-substituted aluminoxanes obtained from the in situ reaction between Al(i-Bu)3 , Al(i-Oct)3 and H2O with two metallocenes Cp2ZrCl2 and cp2 / (*)ZrCl2 ( cp = cyclopentadienyl , and cp(*) = pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ) have been performed . the b-branched aluminoxanes were obtained from the in situ reaction between Al(i-R)3 and H2O at Al / H2O molar ratio of <nUm> ( r = i-Bu ( TIBAO ) , r = i-Oct ( TIOAO ) ) . A comparison of the Cp2ZrCl2 and cp2 / (*)ZrCl2 reactivity with MAO , a the reference point for aluminoxanes , a well a with their parent aluminum alkyl AlMe3 ( TMA ) , Al(i-Bu)3 ( TIBA ) , and Al(i-Oct)3 ( TIOA ) ha been made . cp2 / (*)ZrCl2 , because of steric hindrance , is le reactive than Cp2ZrCl2 towards all aluminium compound considered . the cp2 / (*)Zr-i-BuCl and cp2 / (*)Zr-i-OctCl produced appear to be more stable than Cp2Zr-i-BuCl and Cp2Zr-i-OctCl due to the cp* steric hindrance , which inhibits b-hydrogen elimination . the lower reactivity of cp2 / (*)ZrCl2 along with the higher stability of the zirconium alkyl produced ha allowed u to produce evidence of the greater capacity of TIOAO with respect to TIBAO for yielding alkylated ion pair . these result explain the polymerization activity yielded by metallocenes when combined with the above aluminoxanes , that is , the Cp2ZrCl2 activity only with MAO , and the high polymerization activity of substituted metallocenes when b-alkyl-substituted aluminoxanes are used a cocatalysts . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. all - electron DFT ( B3LYP ) calculation with a split - valence basis set of double- and triple-x quality have been used to study the reaction path of the first and second step insertion a well a of the s-bond metathesis for the reaction of acetylene with (C5H5)2ZrCH3+ . geometry optimization of the reactant , intermediate , transition state and product were carded out without symmetry constraint . the nature of the particular point on the potential energy surface wa verified by the analytical calculation of the hessian matrix . the relative electronic energy are corrected for ZPVE , entropic and thermal contribution , and correspond to the gibbs free energy ( DDG298 ) . it is shown that the propagation step of acetylene polymerization is a facile process from kinetic and thermodynamic point of view , and that the investigated insertion reaction are kinetically and thermodynamically favoured over the s-bond metathesis reaction . the calculated energetics and structure of either reaction are compared with available theoretical and experimental data of relevant complex of group ill and IV transition metal . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. under certain condition ( <nUm> ° C , C2H4P = <nUm> MPa ) , the oligomerization of ethylene catalyzed by Cp2ZrCl2 / EAO ( ethylaluminoxane ) , Et3Al or (i-Bu)3Al afforded methylenecyclopentane ( MCP ) along with chain oligomers . the nature of cocatalysts and the Al / Zr ratio a well a the hydrolysis extent of Et3Al have tangible effect on the selectivity of the cyclic oligomer . with Et3Al a cocatalyst under optimal condition , the oligomerization of ethylene gave MCP and C4 - C10 chain olefin in a ratio of <nUm> / <nUm> . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. effect of heterogenization parameter on compositional and catalytic property of Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 supported on silica modified with MAO were evaluated using data on metal loading , catalyst activity in ethylene-propylene copolymerization , and polymer property . the supported catalyst were prepared according to a <nUm> factorial design for multivariate analysis . the parameter studied were : MAO concentration in impregnation , Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 concentration in grafting , and immobilization temperature for both metallocene and organoaluminum . the grafting solution wa monitored by UV - VIS spectroscopy , while the resulting catalyst system were characterized by inductively - coupled plasma - optical emission spectroscopy ( ICP - OES ) , diffuse reflectance infrared fourier transform spectroscopy ( DRIFTS ) , and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy ( XPS ) . At high statistical significance , both MAO and Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 concentration during preparation affected the determination of the final A1 / Zr ratio on silica . the catalyst system were tested in ethylene-propylene copolymerizations using external MAO a cocatalyst . relationship were observed between ( i ) catalyst activity and the binding energy of Zr 3d5 / <nUm> electron and ( ii ) Al / Zr ratio on silica and the average ethylene incorporation . the polymer sample presented narrow molecular weight distribution , but according to differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , and cross-fractionation chromatography ( CFC ) data , catalyst system with given Al / Zr ratio might yield different crystallite , suggesting a plural distribution of chemical composition . this work present the result of theoretical and experimental characterization of supported (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 on organosilanes pre-treated O2Si . several possibility are analyzed and considered a an attempt to explain the observed zirconocene loading , catalyst performance in ethylene polymerization and resulting polymer property of these supported zirconocenes . the effect of silica pre-treatment with Ph3SiCl , Me3SiCl and Me2HSiCl on the immobilization of (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 wa modeled . the main considered aspect were the role of the surface concentration of the organosilanes , the presence or absence of residual chlorine and the possibility of interaction between the organosilanes and the zirconocene . all these fact might afford different surface specie at the impregnation step prior to the MAO activation during the polymerization reaction . the different elementary step in the racEt(Ind)2ZrCl2 activation process by commercial methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) are studied by UV - VIS spectroscopy technique and correlated with hexene polymerization kinetics . after monomethylation of the zirconocene dichloride ( λ = <nUm> nm ) , abstraction of Cl ligand by MAO at low Al : Zr ratio ( Al : Zr = <nUm> ) yield tight ion pair , [racEt(Ind)2ZrMe]+ , [MAOCl]- with an absorption band centered at λ = <nUm> nm , inactive towards hexene polymerization . addition of MAO in large excess ( Al : Zr = <nUm> ) is therefore required to form active specie identified a TMA separated ion pair , [ racEt(Ind)2Zr+ (m-Me)2AlMe2 ] , [ MAO ∼ cl]- ( λ = <nUm> nm ) . the activation of racEt(Ind)2ZrMe2 by MAO reveals much easier and is complete at low Al : Zr ratio ( Al : Zr = <nUm> ) , yielding directly active ion pair [racEt(Ind)2ZrMe]+ , [MAOMe]- , absorbing at λ = <nUm> nm . these data underline the negative role of [MAOCl]- a a counter-anion in the activation process of zirconocene dichloride precursor for olefin polymerization . In the same condition , the use of TMA - depleted MAO allows the direct formation , at low Al : Zr ratio , of active tight ion pair λ = <nUm> nm ) . the activation process by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) of various zirconocene precursor of the type racEt(Ind)2ZrX2 , with different extractable x ligand ( x = Cl , me , NMe2 , CH2Ph ) , wa investigated both by mean of UV - VIS spectroscopy and through hex-1-ene polymerization kinetics . the different elementary step yielding olefin polymerization active specie , i.e. methylation and cationization of the transition metal could be readily discriminated . unlike racEt(Ind)2ZrCl2 precursor for which high amount of MAO ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ) is required to form catalytic specie active towards olefin polymerization , the complete activation of other racEt(Ind)2ZrX2 tested ( with x = me , NMe2 , CH2Ph ) is readily achieved at relatively low Al / Zr ratio ( Al / Zr = 40-50 ) . the corresponding zirconocenium specie exhibit different catalytic activity according to the nature of the extracted x ligand , showing the important role of the formed [MAO-X]- counter-anion in the activation process and more particularly , it ability to still coordinate with the metal center and compete with the incoming olefin . A series of supported metallocene catalyst were prepared by immobilizing (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 and Cp2NbCl2 on bare and on MAO - modified silica . both metallocenes were sequentially grafted on silica under different combination . metal loading ( Zr , Nb and Al ) wa determined by x-ray fluorescence spectroscopy ( XRF ) . final metal content wa shown to be dependent on passivation of silica with MAO , and on the grafting sequence . higher metal content ( <nUm> wt. % Nb / O2Si and <nUm> wt. % Zr / O2Si ) were achieved when the metallocene wa grafted onto MAO - modified silica . Cp2NbCl2 derivative were not active in polymerizing ethylene using MAO a co-catalyst ( Al / Nb = <nUm> ) . all the system containing zirconocene derivative showed high catalyst activity . nevertheless , higher activity were achieved immobilizing (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 on silica that wa previously modified with MAO and Cp2NbCl2 . some immobilization protocol led to catalyst system which were even more active than the homogenous counterpart . effect of support structure and chemical modification on the catalyst performance are presented and discussed . the directed oligomerization of propene and 1-hexene wa carried out with a series of CP'(C5H5)ZrCl2 and Cp'2ZrCl2 pre-catalysts ( cp' = C5HMe4 , C4Me4P , C5Me5 , C5H4tBu , C5H3-1,3-tBu2 , C5H2-1,2,4-tBu3 ) together with C10Cl2H10Zr . oligomers in the molar mass range 300-1500 g / mol for propene and 200-3000 g / mol for 1-hexene were synthesized at <nUm> ° C . the majority of oligomer molecule contain a double - bond end group . oligomer characterization wa carried out by gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) , 1H and 13CNMR . vinylidene double bond ( from b-hydrogen elimination ) are solely found for the tert-butyl-substituted zirconocenes and for most of the unsymmetrical methyl-substituted Cp'(C5H5)ZrCl2 system ( except cp' = phospholyl ) . with (C4Me4P)(C5H5)ZrCl2 and with the symmetrical methyl-containing Cp'2ZrCl2 pre-catalysts , also vinyl end group ( from b-methyl elimination ) are observed in the case of oligopropenes . the vinylidene / vinyl ratio depends on the ligand and the vinyl content increase from C5HMe4 ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) over C4Me4P ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) to C5Me5 ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) . the phospholyl zirconocenes and (C5HMe4)2ZrCl2 also exhibit chain - transfer to aluminum thereby giving saturated oligomers . heterogeneous metallocene catalyst avoid reactor fouling in olefin polymerisation . for technical use the metallocene catalyst must be fixed on carrier . silica is one of the favoured inorganic carrier . but the activity of heterogeneous metallocene catalyst on silica in ethylene and propylene polymerisation are often lower than those of comparable homogeneous catalyst system . we tested the clay mineral kaolin and montmorillonite a inorganic carrier for the polymerisation of ethylene and propylene with commercially available titanocenes and zirconocenes and also with new type of titanocenes . the heterogeneous catalyst on kaolin were le active in ethylene polymerisation a comparable homogeneous catalyst and they were not active in propylene polymerisation . In contrast the heterogeneous catalyst on montmorillonite are often more active in ethylene or propylene polymerisation than comparable homogeneous system . As cocatalysts trimethylaluminium ( AlMe3 , TMA ) and triisobutylaluminium ( Al(iBu3) , TIBA ) were used for heterogeneous polymerisation . As catalyst commercially available titanocenes and zirconocenes and also four titanocenes with unusual structure were tested which lang et al. had synthesised . the high activity in ethylene or propylene polymerisation with montmorillonite may be due to the special structure of the montmorillonite carrier . we treated silica with tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane , BC18F15 , to create borane - functionalized support , SiO2-B(C6F5)3 which wa then used a a support and co-catalyst for the in situ activated dichloro-zirconocene ( Cp2ZrCl2 / TIBA ) and dimethyl-zirconocene catalyst system ( Cp2Zr(CH3)2 ) for ethylene polymerization . the surface modification of SiO2-B(C6F5)3 wa investigated by SEM - EDX , FTIR and XPS to determine the distribution of fluorine and boron atom on the silica surface a a measure of the presence of BC18F15 and interaction with the siloxane group of the silica support . catalytic performance are presented in the form of ethylene consumption rate profile . the result show that the independent of the time dedicated to the in situ activation of the metallocene , all pre-activated system showed activity decay . In contrast , the in situ activated system either showed little or no activity decay . the presence of TIBA wa adequate to make an active MAO - free catalyst system . the pre-activated and in situ activated metallocene system produced polyethylene with slightly different molecular weight ( MWs ) and molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) . MWDs were quite narrow ∼ <nUm> . the bulk density of polyethylene product is highest for the in situ activated metallocenes , but there is no difference between the product of dichloro- and dimethyl-zirconocenes . pre-activated and in situ activated catalyst show no reactor fouling . A series of aryl-substituted tetramethylcyclopentadienyl zirconocenes (C5Me4C6H4X-4)Cp' MCl2 [ CP' = CH , x = H ( 5 ) , me ( 6 ) , Cl ( 7 ) or OMe ( 8 ) ; cp' = ind , x = H ( 9 ) , me ( 10 ) or Cl ( 11 ) ; cp' = 2-Ph-Ind , x = H ( 12 ) ] and (C5Me4C6H4X-4)2 Cl2Zr [ x = H ( 13 ) , me ( 14 ) , Cl ( 15 ) ] , with different substituents at the 4-position of phenyl , have been prepared by the reaction of the corresponding ligand ( C5Me4HC6H4X-4 ) [ x = H ( 1 ) , me ( 2 ) , Cl ( 3 ) or OMe ( 4 ) ] with n-BuLi , Cl4Zr and Cp'Li or with n-BuLi and Cl4Zr . ethylene polymerization with these complex in combination with MAO ha been studied . the electron donor ( me ) at the 4-position of phenyl led to an increase in catalytic activity while the electron - withdrawing group ( Cl ) and the strong π donor ( OMe ) led to it decrease . complex <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> exhibited very high activity , but 13-15 showed much lower activity due to the bulky steric effect . the molecular structure of <nUm> ha been determined by x-ray diffraction . the relationship between structure of catalyst and catalytic activity were discussed . the behavior of two differently prepared methylaluminoxanes ( MAOs ) on the activation process of racEt(Ind)2ZrCl2 for olefin polymerization wa studied . contrarily to commercial product , the two MAOs used are characterized by a low content of free trimethylaluminium ( TMA ) . MAO-A wa prepared by pumping off the TMA contained in commercial MAO , whereas MAO-B wa obtained by thermal treatment of TMA with benzophenone . the different elementary step in the zirconocene activation process depending on the amount and nature of added MAO ( commercial and modified one ) were investigated by UV / visible spectroscopy . In all case , monomethylation of racEt(Ind)2ZrCl2 rapidly take place after addition of small amount of MAO . then , abstraction of the second chloride of the metallocene occurs upon addition of larger amount of MAO ( Al / Zr < <nUm> ) leading to the formation of highly active catalytic specie for hexene polymerization . this is characterized by a bathochromic shift of the zirconocene absorption band . the role of TMA is clearly pointed out by comparing the modified MAO / zirconocene system with the one based on commercial MAO . the influence of structure and composition of MAO on the activation process is also clearly underlined by the very different amount of activator needed to get metallocene active specie in the presence of commercial and modified cocatalysts . A series of zirconocenes differing in the coordination sphere , namely (R)ZrCl2 ( r = (MeCp)2 , (i-BuCp)2 , (n-BuCp)2 , rac - Et(Ind)2 and rac - Et(IndH4)2 ) were immobilized on silica grace <nUm> pretreated at <nUm> K under vacuum . the highest metal loading , determined by rutherford 's backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy , wa achieved with rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 . the steric effect played by the ligand on the cyclopentadienyl ring wa seen to influence on the grafted content : le Zr wa immobilized on silica using n-Bu a ligand , a compared to the zirconocene that us me a ligand . nevertheless , this catalyst wa the most active both in homogeneous and supported copolymerizations . copolymer were characterized with respect to their molecular weight , polydispersity ( mw / Mn ) , crystallinity , comonomer incorporation and melting temperature . mono , di and tetranuclear ansa zirconocene complex have been synthesized and characterized . after activation with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) these catalyst were used for the homogeneous and heterogeneous polymerization of ethylene . the property of the catalyst and the produced polymer were compared . the multinuclear catalyst show a different performance than the corresponding mononuclear derivative . the tetranuclear catalyst have the lowest activity because of steric crowding . five new hetero - bimetallic metallocene complex were synthesized by the reaction of RCpTiCl3 and a Si - bridged zirconocene complex in refluxing toluene . they were all well characterized . these complex activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) are highly active catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene . the molecular weight ( mw = 28,957-124,089 ) and the molecular weight distribution ( MWD = <nUm> - <nUm> ) of the polymer generated from the bimetallic catalytic system were higher than that obtained by Cp2ZrCl2 . A theoretical study of Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO system is presented based on density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation performed with gaussian basis - set . the MAO cocatalyst wa modeled a a small finite section of the most probably specie in solution . the geometry of the cation - counterion forming the ionic - pair active site wa fully optimized and it electronic structure wa examined in term of the natural bond orbital ( NBO ) population analysis . In this way the ionic - pair interaction can be related to the electronic charge change around the zirconium cation . the result indicate the formation of a stable ionic - pair and the redistribution of charge in the cation complex and counterion . the latter wa concluded by mapping the charge density difference . the laplacian of charge density confirm the ionic interaction of the metallocene / MAO system . A newly synthesized catalyst , a pentamethylene bridged dinuclear zirconocene [ CH2 (C5H4)2][(C9H7)ZrCl 2]2 ) , and it in situ supported catalyst were tested in a ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization and their performance wa compared with those of Cp2ZrCl2 and rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 . when homogeneous [ CH2 (C5H4)2][(C9H7)ZrCl 2]2 catalyst wa used in the copolymerization , it activity decreased with comonomer incorporation ( a negative comonomer effect ) and it produced copolymer with a lower comonomer content than other catalyst , both of which were ascribed to the steric effect of the [ CH2 (C5H4)2][(C9H7)ZrCl 2]2 catalyst . with in situ supported catalyst , the activity did not change much with the increase of 1-hexene content in contrast to the homogeneous catalyst . In situ supported catalyst produced copolymer with higher content of 1-hexene and lower melting point and crystallinity . the change in the molecular weight and it distribution of the copolymer with in situ supporting were significant and dependant on the nature of the catalyst . A series of <nUm> dissymmetric dinuclear ansa zirconocene complex and their ligand precursor have been synthesized and characterized . after activation with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , these catalyst polymerize ethylene with different productivity and polydispersities in homogeneous and heterogeneous medium . the tendency of these series are shown . In the present work Et(IndH4)2ZrCl2 wa immobilized on silica previously modified with different chemical compound , namely Cl3OV , Cl4Sn , Bu3SnH , Me2SiHCl , polymethylhydrosiloxane ( PMHS ) and such system were compared to methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) pretreated system . Bu3SnH - modified silica led to the highest zirconocene grafted content . Zr 3d5 / <nUm> binding energy determined by x-ray spectroscopy ( XPS ) wa shown to increase for Et(IndH4)2ZrCl2 supported on silica modified with Cl3OV , MAO and Bu3SnH , suggesting the generation of more electron deficient surface specie . all system were shown to be active in ethylene-propylene copolymerization , presenting higher activity than those prepared by grafting the zirconocene on bare silica . aging test with MAO - mediated system showed that the catalyst bearing <nUm> wt. % Al / O2Si kept it catalyst activity at least for <nUm> month after preparation . the homopolymerization of ethylene wa investigated using the catalyst of (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 supported on PMHS - modified silica ( PMHS = polymethylhydrosiloxane ) . the effect of the amount of the organosilane polymer on the metallocene grafted content wa studied in loading of PMHS from <nUm> to <nUm> wt. % Si / O2Si , in which the grafted Zr content wa from <nUm> to <nUm> wt. % Si / O2Si . the metal content were determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) , while the catalyst stepwise preparation wa monitored by diffuse reflectance infrared fourier transform spectroscopy ( DRIFTS ) . the chemical environment of the zirconocene surface specie were further probed by x-ray spectroscopy ( XPS ) and the metal distribution wa studied by electron probe microanalysis ( EPMA ) . these catalyst system produced polyethylene with a narrow molecular weight distribution using methylaluminoxane a co-catalyst , and their catalyst activity were three time greater than the one obtained with (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 supported on the bare O2Si . effect of the support structure and the chemical modification on the catalyst performance are presented and discussed . A series of supported catalyst were prepared by combining ( nBuCp ) 2ZrCl2 and Cp2ZrCl2 sequentially grafted on silica in different ratio ( <nUm> : <nUm> and <nUm> : <nUm> ) and immobilization order . catalyst system were characterized by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) , diffuse reflectance infrared fourier transform spectroscopy ( DRIFTS ) , scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) and electron probe microanalysis ( EPMA ) . grafted metal content remained comprised between <nUm> and <nUm> wt. % Zr / OSi <nUm> . all the system were shown to be active in ethylene homopolymerization having methylaluminoxane a co-catalyst . catalyst activity wa shown to be dependent on the metallocene nature , but not on the addition order or molar ratio . the highest activity wa achieved with cp 2ZrCl2 / (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) catalyst system ( ca. <nUm> kg PE ( mmol zrh)-1 ) . resulting polymer were characterized by GPC and DSC . In spite of bearing two catalyst center , no bimodality wa observed in the resulting polymer . the stereotacticities of a series of polypropylene polymer chain produced with different category of structurally characterized ansa- zirconocene and hafnocene procatalysts in homogeneous catalysis have been determined by statistical analysis of the methyl pentad signal intensity distribution of their 13C NMR spectrum . the polymer microstructural characteristic have been contrasted with the intramolecular parameter of the discrete metallocene molecule obtained from single crystal x-ray diffraction and different 1H NMR measurement . for the first category , by contrasting the polymerization behavior of zirconocene - hafnocene pair the origin of the stereospecificity difference have been discussed in term of heavy atom electron configuration , lanthanoid shell contraction and relativistic effect operative on element belonging to the sixth row of the periodic table . for the second category the observed change in polymerization behavior for a pair of zirconocene based catalyst with ligand modification of irrelevant steric control have been correlated to the electron density redistribution on different aromatic carbon and the consequent change in flexibility of the catalyst framework , increase of the haptocity of M-C5 bonding and variation of the frontier orbital shape and diffusivity . for the third category , pair of syndio- and isotactic specific ansa - zirconocene and hafnocenes have been selected in which the organic ligand are constructed with the same aromatic moiety joined with different bridge . the observed catalytic change have been correlated to combined steric and electronic factor altering orbital energy and hybridization . finally , by introducing a fourth category , the Hf effect is demonstrated by comparing the catalytic olefin activity of two non-bridged hafnocene- zirconocene pair . ethylene , propylene and 1-butene polymerization kinetics have been investigated in the presence of <nUm> zirconocene and ethylalumoxane derivative with various molecular mass and a molar ratio of Al / Zr = 23-26 . it wa found that zirconocene activity in combination with ethylalumoxanes with molecular weight MW = <nUm> ( an oligomer with -[OAl(C2H5)]- unit number equal to <nUm> ) increase in series : Cp(Acac)2ZrCl < (Fulv)2Cp,Zr,Cl2 < Cp,ZrMe2 < (Fulv)2Cp2Zr2(O)Cl2 < (Ind)2ZrCl2 < (t-Bu2Cp)2ZrCl2 < Cp2ZrCl2 < (t-BuCp)2ZrCl2 < (MeCp)2ZrCl2 < (i-PrCp)2ZrCl2 , where fulv - fulvalene . with methylalumoxane ( MW = <nUm> , ( -[OAl(CH3)]- unit number <nUm> ) the following series of zirconocene activity wa established : (MeCp)2ZrCl2 < (EtCp)2ZrCl2 < (PrCp)2ZrCl2 < ( BuCp2ZrCl2 < (i-PrCp)2ZrCl2 < ( cyclo- HexCp)2ZrCl2 . all - electron RHF and RMP2 ab initio calculation with split valence basis set of double- and triple-z quality have been used to study reaction path for the reaction of acetylene ( 1 ) with the model compound Cl2ZrH+ ( 2 ) and CCl2H3Zr / + ( 3 ) . At the RMP2 / / RHF level the acetylide - complex formation reaction is calculated to have a barrier of <nUm> ( 2 ) , <nUm> ( 3 ) kcal / mol with respect to complexed acetylene and to be <nUm> ( 2 ) , <nUm> ( 3 ) kcal / mol exothermic with respect to free acetylene . the transition state are four - membered cycle . the calculated energy barrier are greater than the theoretical value obtained for s-bond metathesis of acetylene with Cl2ScR and Cp2ScR ( r = H , CH3 ) . the calculated energetics of the metathesis reaction path are compared with the theoretical value determined for the alternative insertion reaction of acetylene into Zr-H and Zr-C σ bond . the insertion reaction are kinetically and thermodynamically favoured over the corresponding metathesis reaction . the copolymerization of ethylene and 1,5-hexadiene wa investigated under high pressure of <nUm> bar using a zirconocene catalyst in the presence of methylaluminoxane . the concentration of the diene wa varied over a wide range including the homopolymerization of both ethylene and 1,5-hexadiene . from the amount of polymer formed per unit of time and the catalyst feed the productivity wa determined . the resulting polymer were analyzed by DSC , GPC , IR- and 13C-NMR-spectroscopy to evaluate the average molecular weight together with the polydispersity , the crystallinity , the melting point and the structure . the catalyst exhibit a good ability for copolymerization and cyclopolymerization of 1,5-hexadiene in which a predominance of trans ring formation wa observed . the isoselective propene polymerization using the homogeneous Me2Si(Benz[e]Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst system wa investigated . the influence of the concentration of metallocene and MAO activator on polymerization kinetics and microstructure of the resulting polymer wa studied . catalyst activity wa found to be independent of zirconocene concentration and only a function of total MAO concentration . polypropene microstructure wa not affected by either MAO or zirconocene concentration . the polymerization behavior is compared to that of Me2Si(2-Me Benz[e]Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO . A model is presented to account for the equilibrium present in the polymerization medium . this model take into account the interaction between metallocene cation and excess MAO , thus explaining the influence of MAO concentration on catalyst activity in propene polymerization . A modified extended huckel method ( EHMO ) , which includes core - core repulsion term , wa used to study a propylene polymerization heterogeneous catalyst by modeling the adsorption of the ansa - metallocene ethylen-bisindenylzirconium dichloride ( C20Cl2H17Zr from now on EtInd2ZrCl2 ) on O2Si surface . the adsorption wa considered to occur at two face of O2Si ( with geminal and isolated OH 's ) and at two different temperature for O2Si pretreatment ( <nUm> and <nUm> ° C ) . taking into account that the interaction with Al compound is considered a a way to improve the catalyst performance , specially with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , a local model of aluminoxane ( AlO ) wa added to Si-O bond with the subsequent metallocene adsorption . the result show that AlO improves the zirconocene adsorption on O2Si modeled at <nUm> ° C while it inhibits that process at <nUm> ° C . the c(s)- and c(2v)-symmetric doubly dimethylsilylene-bridged zirconocene complex (Me2Si)2{e5-C5H2-4-CHMe2{e5C5H-3,5-(SiMe3)2}ZrCl2 , 6a , and (Me2Si)2{e5C5H-3,5-(CHMe2)2)2ZrCl2 , 6b , have been synthesized by reaction of corresponding dilithio ligand salt with Cl4Zr in CCl2H2 . when activated with methyl aluminoxane , C ( s ) - symmetric zirconocene 6a catalyzes the polymerization of propylene ( liquid propylene , <nUm> ° C ) to yield a syndiotactic polymer of mw = <nUm> and rrrr % = <nUm> . by contrast , c(2v)-symmetric zirconocene 6b display a low activity and affords an atactic polymer . displacement of the anion H3C-B(C6F5)3 from the zirconocene contact - ion pair [ (C5H5)2Zr(CH3)+ *** (m-H3C)-B(C6F5)3- ] by a series of phosphine and formation of a bisphosphine complex by uptake of a second phosphine ligand have been studied by NMR method in C6D6 solution . evidence is presented that associated , outer - sphere ion pair [(C5H5)2Zr(CH3)(PR3)]+ H3C-B(C6F5)3- predominate at zirconocene concentration up to ca. <nUm> mM ; higher aggregate become apparent at higher zirconocene concentration . equilibrium constant for the formation of mono- and bis-PMe3 complex have been determined ; the latter are found to be highly sensitive to steric perturbation . these data , together with density - functional estimate for reaction enthalpy , lead to the following qualitative conclusion with regard to olefin coordination in zirconocene - based polymerization catalyst : ( i ) the olefin substrate displaces the borate anion only from a small equilibrium fraction of the zirconocene alkyl cation present ; ( ii ) the predominant fraction of the resulting zirconocene alkyl olefin cation remains in an outer - sphere association with the counteranion ; ( iii ) mutual displacement of olefin and counteranion from the Zr center is slow compared to typical olefin insertion ; ( iv ) uptake of a second olefin under formation of a cationic zirconocene alkyl diolefin complex is rather unlikely even at elevated olefin concentration . the ( conjugated diene ) group <nUm> metallocenes la-d ( diene - butadiene , isoprene ; metallocene = CP2Zr , Cp2Hf , MeCp2Zr ) add BC18F15 to yield the metallacyclic m *** F-C bridged metallocene-borate-betaine complex 3a-d . these add one equivalent of acetylene to give the chiral metallacyclic insertion product 5a-d that can be described a either intramolecular ion - pair type complex involving interaction of the negatively polarized terminal -CH = CH-CH2-[B] group of the resulting s-ligand system with the positively polarized metallocene moiety of the dipolar betaine product or r2-internal alkene metallocene complex , respectively , a it is revealed by a comparison with the related acyclic THF - addition product <nUm> and <nUm> . propyne insert unselectively into the terminal Zr-C bond of the complex 3a-c . In each case a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of the regioisomers 6a-c ( methyl at C2 ) and 7a-c ( methyl group at Cl ) is obtained . the behavior of (C2B9H11)M(NEt2)2(NHEt2) [ m = Ti ( 1 ) , Zr ( 2 ) ] mono-dicarbollide complex in olefin and styrene polymerisation ha been investigated . compound <nUm> and <nUm> , when activated by MAO ( Al / m = <nUm> to <nUm> ) , polymerise ethylene with good activity . surprisingly , <nUm> can also be activated with small amount of triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA , Al / Zr = <nUm> to <nUm> ) . the ethylene polymerisation activity of the <nUm> / TIBA catalyst ( <nUm> ° C , <nUm> atm , toluene-chlorobenzene ) is greater than that reported for the CpZrX3 / MAO catalyst but lower by about one or two order of magnitude than zirconocene - MAO system ( e.g. Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO , rac-(ethylene-bis-l-idenyl)ZrCl2 / MAO ) . the GPC ( gel permeation chromatography ) curve of the polyethylene sample obtained with <nUm> / TIBA catalyst ( <nUm> ° C , <nUm> atm , toluene-chlorobenzene ) is bimodal indicating that at least two specie are active in this system and one is more active than the other . the <nUm> / MAO system ( <nUm> ° C , <nUm> atm , toluene-chlorobenzene ) slowly polymerises propylene to atactic polymer . under the same experimental condition 1-pentene doe not polymerise at all . compound <nUm> and <nUm> , activated with MAO , produce syndiotactic polystyrene ( sPS ) with very low activity . attempt to copolymerise styrene with ethylene by the <nUm> / MAO and <nUm> / MAO system afforded a mixture of the two homopolymers . ethene / 1-octene and ethene / 1-butene copolymerization using various methylaluminoxane - activated metallocene catalyst , e.g. silylene-bridged substituted bisindenyl zirconocene system and halfsandwich titanocene , wa performed at <nUm> ° C in toluene . the influence of the ligand substitution on comonomer incorporation , catalyst activity , molar mass , molar mass distribution , degree of polymerization and copolymerization parameter wa investigated in ethene / 1-octene copolymerization at constant comonomer ratio and in ethene / l-butene copolymerization a a function of varying ethene / 1-butene feed mass ratio . In ethene / 1-octene copolymerization the highest comonomer incorporation wa achieved with MAO - activated Me2Si(Me4Cp)(N-tert-butyl)TiCl2 catalyst . best performance in term of comohomer incorporation combined with high catalyst activity and molar mass wa found for silylene-bridged bisindenylzirconocenes , where 2-methyl substitution promoted high degree of polymerization and benzannelation accounted for improved catalyst activity , comohomer incorporation and randomness of comonomer incorporation . In ethene / 1-butene copolymerization at high 1-butene feed content silylene-bridged substituted bisindenyl system showed polymerization characteristic similar to that of ethene / 1-octene copolymerization . the influence of 2-methyl substitution on activity and comohomer incorporation wa significant only at low 1-butene feed content . storage tooduli and glass transition temperature of the poly(ethene-co-l-butene) copolymer decreased with increasing 1-butene content . A novel dinuclear ansa - zirconocene catalyst ( m-C12H8{[SiPh(Ind)2]ZrCl2}2 ) ( I ) wa prepared by a wurtz coupling reaction between two equivalent of bisindenylphenylchlorosilane and one equivalent of 4,4'-dibromobiphenyl in THF at reflux temperature for <nUm> h , followed by a successive reaction with Cl4Zr · 2THF in THF at <nUm> ° C . polymerization of ethene wa conducted in a <nUm> cm3 glass reactor equipped with a stirrer at <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> ° C using MAO or Ph3C[B(C6F5)4] a cocatalyst and toluene a the solvent . the catalyst ( I ) gave linear polyethene with a broader molecular mass distribution ( MMD ) in a much higher yield a compared to the corresponding mononuclear catalyst derived from [Ph2Si(Ind)2]ZrC12 ( II ) . the apparent activity increased monotonously from <nUm> ° C up to <nUm> ° C . the replacement of MAO with Ph3C[B(C6F5)4] gave polyethene with a higher molecular weight . four newly synthesized bridged bisindenyl zirconocenes which are derivative of known structure have been tested in polymerization of liquid propylene with methylaluminoxane a cocatalyst . they include two asymmetric and two binuclear system which are suitable for isotactic polymerization . surprising difference from the behavior of similar system ( regiospecificity , chain termination ) are found and discussed . the polymerization of propylene wa studied with a series of dinuclear early transition metal zirconocene - late transition metal complex bridged by phosphido and arsenido moiety of general formula [(e5-C5H4R'')2Zr{m-ERR'}2M(CO)(n)] ( e = P , r = r ' = SiMe3 , r '' = H , m = Mo , n = <nUm> ( 1 ) ; e = P , r = r ' = SiMe3 , r '' = H , m = Ni , n = <nUm> ( 2 ) ; e = As , r = r ' = SiMe3 , r '' = H , m = Cr , n = <nUm> ( 3 ) ; e = P , r = H , r ' = 2,4,6-i-Pr3C6H2 , r '' = me , m = Mo , n = <nUm> ( 4 ) ; e = P , r = H , r ' = 2,4,6-i-Pr3C6H2 , r '' = me , m = Cr , n = <nUm> ( 5 ) ) , a well a with the corresponding monometallic zirconocene precursor complex of the type [(e5-C5H4R'')2Zr(ERR')2] ( e = P , r = r ' = SiMe3 , r '' = H ( 6 ) ; e = P , r = H , r ' = 2,4,6-i-Pr3C6H2 , r '' = H ( 7 ) ) and [(e5-C5H4Me)2Zr(ERR')Cl] ( e = P , r = H , r ' = 2,4,6-i-Pr3C6H2 ( 8 ) ) . the active cationic specie were generated treating the complex with an excess of methylalumoxane ( MAO ) . the catalytic activity wa found to be strongly dependent on temperature and catalyst / MAO ratio . supported catalyst for ethylene polymerization have been prepared by interaction of CP2ZrX2 ( cp = e5-C5H5 , x = Cl or CH3 ) with silica chemically modified by C3ClH9Si ( TMCS ) or trialkylaluminium compound AlR3 ( r = C2H5 ( TEA ) and (i)C4H9 ( TIBA ) ) . the interaction between the modificators and the silica surface have been examined by 1H solid - state MAS NMR spectroscopy , DRIFTS and chemical analysis . the Cp2Zr(CH3)2 / O2Si - TMCS catalyst showed a fairly high activity in ethylene polymerization ( 30-300 kg PE(mol zr*h*bar)-1 ) even in the absence of any cocatalysts specially added . the addition of the cocatalyst ( MAO or TIBA ) led to a further increase in the activity of the supported catalyst . polyethylene obtained with the C3H6P2Zr / O2Si - TMCS catalyst without any cocatalyst consisted of uniform polymer particle of a spherical shape replicating that of the silica particle , whereas the shapeless aggregate of finely dispersed polymer particle similar to those usually obtained with homogeneous system were produced with the same supported catalyst in the presence of the MAO cocatalyst . A series of heterogeneous catalyst system wa prepared by the immobilization of bis(n-butylcyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride , (nBuCP)2ZrCl2 , on silica support activated at different temperature . silica dehydroxylation wa evaluated in term of retained metal loading and activity in ethylene homopolymerization . characterization of the catalyst system wa accomplished by rutherford back - scattering spectrometry and infrared spectroscopy . the highest metal loading ( <nUm> wt. % Zr / O2Si ) wa achieved with silica treated under vacuum at room temperature ( <nUm> K ) , but the catalyst showed only a minor polymerization activity which may be attributed to a large number of inactive Zr - support bidentate specie formed at a high surface density of OH in silica . IR spectroscopic data show that , regardless of support activation temperature , a significant number of isolated OH group remains after zirconocene fixation . the presence of bulky ligand in the catalyst molecule seems to prevent the remaining OH group from reacting with additional metallocene complex , keeping the metal loading around <nUm> wt. % Zr / O2Si for silica activated between <nUm> and <nUm> K . high polymerization activity observed for the system based on <nUm> K - activated silica suggests a role for these OH group in the generation of active alkylated specie when methylaluminoxane and trimethylaluminum ( contained in MAO itself ) are added at the beginning of the polymerization reaction . IR analysis show that TMA , which is a le sterically demanding compound than MAO , can effectively access the remaining OH group consuming them thoroughly . practically all the prepared system presented activity in ethylene polymerization with MAO a cocatalyst , the highest activity ( <nUm> x <nUm> PEg mol-1 Zr h-1 ) having been obtained with silica dehydroxylated at <nUm> K . IR spectroscopy ha been used to study the interaction of silica with two methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) sample differed by trimethylaluminium ( TMA ) content and with TMA . MAO and TMA have been shown to react with silica in a different way . whereas TMA interacts with terminal hydroxyl group of silica via the prototysis reaction , MAO mainly adsorbs on the surface hydroxyl group of silica without noticeable protolytical reaction with them . when silica is treated with commercial grade MAO with significant TMA content , the silica surface hydroxyl group mainly interacts with TMA and MAO adsorbs on the surface of O2Si / TMA sample . lewis acidic site ( LAS ) of silica , modified with TMA and MAO sample differed by TMA content , have been investigated by IR spectroscopy ( CO adsorption a probe molecule at <nUm> K ) . two type of LAS were found on the surface of silica modified with MAO and TMA : LAS of moderate strength ( v(CO) = 2204-2212 cm-1 ) and weak LAS ( v(CO) = <nUm> cm- <nUm> ) . the concentration of these acidic site wa estimated . by anchoring of Cp2ZrCl2 on silica , modified with TMA and MAO , the corresponding catalyst O2Si / TMA / Cp2ZrCl2 and O2Si / MAO / Cp2ZrCl2 were prepared and tested at ethylene polymerization . some correlation between the amount and strength of surface LAS of support , catalyst composition and their activity are discussed . it is proposed that the surface active specie are formed at zirconocene interaction with the most strong LAS . the system EtInd2ZrCH+ / <nUm> is parallel with SiO(*) / <nUm> MAO- wa studied theoretically by mean of an extended huckel method ( EHMO ) for the propylene adsorption . the adsorption of the different form of olefin wa evaluated on the active site formed by metallocene and silica , in presence or not of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . In this way , it is possible to appreciate the important function of MAO when the active site is modeled considering all component . according to these result the presence of MAO avoids the adsorption of some form of propylene . metallocene complex of group <nUm> metal are playing an increasingly important role in olefin polymerisation catalysis . this contribution survey several aspect of the chemistry of metallocene catalyst that are being pursued in our laboratory at present , namely the application of half - sandwich complex a catalyst for high - molecular weight elastomeric polypropene , unusual C-H activation reaction of zirconium half - sandwich complex , the development of 14-electron borole complex a neutral analogue of cationic [Cp2ZrR]+ catalyst , and the heterogenisation of MAO - free zirconocene catalyst on borate - functionalised silica . A new mechanism is proposed to explain the occurrence of primary- growing-chain-end epimerization , and the structure and frequency of olefinic end group arising from primary b-hydride transfer , in low molecular weight isotactic polypropylene produced with C2 - symmetric zirconocenes . this mechanism , based on the reversible formation of a zirconocene allyl dihydrogen complex , account for both loss of catalyst stereospecificity and decrease of polypropylene molecular weight observed by lowering [propylene] , and accommodates a number of previous and new experimental observation . inter alia : ( i ) the formation of internal vinylidene unsaturations ; ( ii ) the increase of catalyst activity induced by H addition ; ( iii ) the observed deuterium scrambling in the [1-D]propylene and [2-D]propylene polymerization recently reported by brintzinger . this new mechanism is discussed in the light of the polymerization result from two MAO - activated catalyst : rac- C2H4(Ind)2ZrCl2 and the novel , highly regiospecific rac-Me2C(3-t-Bu- Ind)2ZrCl2 . ethylene polymerization wa conducted with bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) and racdimethylsilylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) combined with trialkylaluminum ( AlR3 ; r = methyl ( me ) , ethyl ( et ) , isobutyl ( iBu ) ) / triphenylcarbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( Ph3CB(C6F5)4 ) or tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane ( BC18F15 ) to study the effect of cocatalysts on polymerization rate ( r(p) ) . when AlMe3 wa used , no activity or very low activity wa observed with both zirconocenes regardless of the borane compound used . the replacement of AlMe3 to AlEt3 or AliBu3 with 1-AlR3 / Ph3CB(C6F5)4 caused polymerization and induction time wa observed to reach the maximum r(p) . especially in the case of using AlEt3 , it took about <nUm> min to show the activity . when BC18F15 wa used , AlEt3 wa not effective but AliBu3 gave the highest activity among all the combination of AlR3 and the borane compound . In the case of polymerization with <nUm> using Ph3CB(C6F5)4 , high activity wa observed with both AlEt3 and AliBu3 without any induction period . when BC18F15 wa used instead of Ph3CB(C6F5)4 , very low activity wa observed with AlEt3 . on the other hand , high activity wa observed with AliBu3 , and the maximum r(p) wa found at the beginning of the polymerization . the effect of AlR3 on the formation of active specie wa discussed based on these result . A novel class of heterogeneous ethylene polymerization catalyst , derived from homogeneous metallacyclic zirconocene complex is described . these complex can be activated with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) and used for ethylene polymerization . the polymerization reaction begin homogeneously , but the homogeneous metallacycles self - immobilize during the polymerization process . subsequent olefin polymerization is therefore heterogeneously catalyzed . this method of heterogeneous olefin polymerization is compared with a homogeneous and an alternate heterogeneous polymerization technique . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. the metallocene (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 wa grafted on partially dehydroxilated commercial silica ( grace <nUm> ) whose surface had been chemically modified by wet impregnation of an organosilane ( Ph3SiCl , Me3SiCl , or Me2SiHCl ) aiming at supported catalyst system with well spaced a-olefin polymerization active center . final Zr loading were determined by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) , and modification at the silica surface after each preparation step were monitored by in situ FT-IR spectroscopy . these catalyst system produced polyethylene with narrow molecular weight distribution when methylaluminoxane wa used a cocatalyst , with twice the activity of (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 supported on bare O2Si . effect of support structure and chemical modification on catalyst performance are presented and discussed . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. the kinetics of methane liberation during polymethylalumoxane ( MAO ) interaction with zirconocenes Cp2ZrCl2 , Ind2ZrCl2 , Me2SiCp2ZrX2 , Me2SiInd2ZrX2 , and Me2SiCp*N'BuZrX2 ( x = Cl , me ) , were studied in a wide range of metallocene concentration ( <nUm> x 10-3-1 x 10-5 mol / l ) and Al / Zr ratio ( 100-24 <nUm> ) at the narrow range of MAO concentration ( <nUm> - <nUm> mol / l ) . the reaction of methane liberation follows apparent first order on zirconium . the total methane yield is suggested to be determined by active aluminum specie present in MAO , so that [CH4](proportional to ) being ~ <nUm> [Al] both in reaction of MAO self - condensation and those catalyzed by dissolved zirconocenes . comparison of the kinetic parameter of the reaction derived in the presence of zirconocenes show considerable increase in both specific initial rate of methane liberation and the specific methane yield ( per mole of zirconium ) at metallocene concentration lower than <nUm> x 10-4 mol / l . multiple regeneration of metal-carbon ( M-C ) bond wa revealed . according to the data of analysis of the effect in term of dissociative equilibrium , the active specie that catalyze the reaction of condensation of MAO are cationic particle . it ha been demonstrated that the kinetic parameter of the reaction were also sensitive to the nature of zirconocene . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. 1-Butene wa selectively dimerised with a high yield to 2-ethyl-1-hexene using a zirconocene / MAO catalyst . 2-Ethyl-1-hexene wa further etherified with methanol to a novel tertiary ether compound , 3-methoxy-3-methyl heptane . ( C ) <nUm> elsevier science B.V. the reaction of a-zirconated phosphorus compound <nUm> and <nUm> with methyl propiolate or dimethylacetylene dicarboxylate give rise to stable zwitterionic zirconocene - ate complex <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> in which the zirconium atom is linked exclusively to carbon atom . dialkylzirconocenes react with molybdenum or tungsten hexacarbonyl and iodine or NBS to form cyclopentadiene molybdenum or tungsten tricarbonyl iodine or bromide . the synthesis , characterization and x-ray structure of two zirconium complex of the bulky pentaphenylcyclopentadienyl ligand , cp PRO , are reported . the monocyclopentadienyl <nUm> electron complex , cp PRO ClZr <nUm> ( I ) , ha an unusual monomeric structure in the solid state and ha short Zr - ligand distance . the lewis acidity of this complex is manifested in it ability to catalyze the [4+2] cycloadditions of methyl- and ethylmethacrylate to cyclopentadiene . the sandwich complex , cp PRO CpZrCl <nUm> ( II ) , ha more typical Zr - ligand distance , but ha a more parallel arrangement of the two cyclopentadienyl ring . two new C1 - symmetric zirconocenes of the type [ me 2C(3-RCp)(Flu)]ZrCl2 bearing a phenyl ( ph ) or a cyclohexyl ( cHex ) substituent on the cyclopentadienyl ring were synthesized . copolymerizations of ethene and styrene were carried out using these catalyst and compared to the result obtained with the methyl- and tertbutyl-substituted a well a with the unsubstituted system . by the introduction of the phenyl substituent both the activity and the molar mass could be increased whilst the styrene incorporation wa comparable to that achieved with the unsubstituted system .
