In the case of the alkyl substituted system ( r = me , tertBu , cHex ) the styrene incorporation is decreased drastically and molar mass and activity are also strongly effected . the effect of support calcination temperature , an important catalyst synthesis parameter , on the overall performance of the supported catalyst [ silica ES70 - nBuSnCl3 / MAO / (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 ] , polymerizing ethylene without separately feeding the MAO cocatalyst , were studied . the silica wa calcined at <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> ° C for <nUm> h. nBuSnCl3 wa used to functionalize the silica . ethylene wa polymerized using the synthesized catalyst at <nUm> bar ( g ) in hexane for <nUm> h . No reactor fouling wa observed . free - flowing polymer particle with bulk density ( <nUm> - <nUm> g / ml ) and a fairly spherical morphology similar to that of the catalyst particle were obtained . also , the particle size distribution of the polymer resembled that of the catalyst . therefore , the replication phenomenon from catalyst to polymer took place . the narrow PSD span ( 1.41 ) indicates that the resulting polyethylene are suitable for various mixing - intensive polymer application . the MAO cocatalyst - free ethylene polymerization instantaneously formed a polymer film around the catalyst particle , which coated / immobilized the catalyst constituent ; this is how leaching wa in situ prevented which favored heterogeneous catalysis to occur . the catalyst showed fairly stable polymerization kinetics . the catalyst activity , a a function of the silica calcination temperature , varied a follows : <nUm> ° C > <nUm> ° C > <nUm> ° C > <nUm> ° C . this finding ha been explained considering the relevant surface chemistry phenomenon . the calcination temperature did not significantly affect the bulk density and the PDI ( <nUm> ≤ PDI ≤ <nUm> ) of the resulting polyethylene . the low PDI substantiates the retention of single - site catalytic behavior of the experimental supported catalyst . four dinuclear alkylidene-bridged zirconocene complex were synthesized applying hydrozirconation reaction of a,o-dienes with the " schwartz ' reagent " and tested for the polymerization of ethylene . the polyethylene obtained with alkylidene-bridged dinuclear complex showed higher molecular weight mw and polydispersities revealing that more catalytically active specie exist in the polymerization system . silica gel modified by MgO , HLiO , and HNaO , i.e. , O2Si / MgO , O2Si / HLiO , O2Si / HNaO , respectively , were examined a solid support in the ethylene and propylene polymerization reaction using dimethylsilylene-bis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( SHIZ ) a the catalyst and i-Bu3Al a the co-catalyst . all three were found to be equally effective for the former reaction , whereas activity wa discrete for the latter reaction , with the order being O2Si / MgO > O2Si / HLiO > O2Si / HNaO . for the O2Si / MgO combination which showed the highest performance , BET and STEM study indicated that Mg wa evenly distributed in the silica gel . acid - base measurement of all three solid indicated that O2Si / MgO had strongly acidic site whereas the other two did not , and in addition , O2Si / HNaO had strongly basic site whereas the remaining two had only weakly basic spot . these result suggested that the presence of weakly nucleophilic anionic site is essential for high reactivity and that strongly acidic site enhance the reactivity . the immobilization of Cp2ZrCl2 wa performed by entrapment within the binary oxide O2Si - O3W using a non-hydrolytic sol - gel route . the catalyst and oxide matrix were characterized by complementary technique ( rutherford backscattering spectrometry , ultraviolet - visible diffuse reflectance and infrared transmission spectroscopy , differential pulse voltammetry , adsorption - desorption of N , and x-ray diffraction ) . the catalyst performance in term of catalytic activity and polymer property wa evaluated by ethylene polymerization . catalyst characterization suggested that the entrapped complex exhibited lower Zr electronic density than the corresponding unsupported metallocene . the polymerization result also revealed that this low Zr electronic density is optimized in term of complex activation with low MAO concentration ( low [ Al / Zr ] ratio ) and reactivity . this fine tuning result in a catalyst system that is active with a low [ Al / Zr ] ratio and that achieves high catalytic activity . the result demonstrate that the entrapping method allows the generation of a catalyst system in which part of the activation process is attributed to the support . In this sense , the support may partially play MAO function by stabilizing the active catalytic specie . catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene , which contain rac-Me 2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( BCl2ISZr ) bound to methylalumoxane - pretreated O2Si support ( O2Si / MAO / BCl2ISZr ) , were studied with respect to leaching of zirconocene and MAO into heptane solution caused by triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) . the latter is found to solubilize surface - bound MAO and zirconocene component , such that the Al content in the solid catalyst is reduced by 15-40 wt % and their Zr content by 50-60 wt % . consequently , ethylene polymerization with such TIBA - containing catalyst system occurs both on the surface of the solid catalyst and in the solution phase . polymerization in solution is favored by high MAO content in the O2Si carrier . polymerization in solution lead to polyethylene ( PE ) product with lower molecular mass than polymerization on the support surface ; this is the main cause of formation of PE with bimodal molecular mass distribution when ethylene is polymerized with O2Si / MAO / BClISZr <nUm> catalyst co-activated by TIBA . it is proposed that the co-activator TIBA interacts with surface - bound MAO to modify MAO in such a manner that it becomes soluble in aliphatic hydrocarbon and capable of solubilizing some active zirconocene component . A new scaffold consisting of a carbocycle and a substituted imidazoline in an orthogonal arrangement wa synthesized a a potential specific inhibitor of glycosidases . the spirobicycloimidazoline , (5R,6R,7R,8R)-8-(hydroxymethyl)-2-phenyl-1,3-diazaspiro[4.4]non-1-ene-6,7-diol , wa synthesized from methyl 2-O-p-methoxybenzyl-3,4-di-O-benzyl-a / b-d-gluco-6-enopyranoside via (1R,2S,3S,4R,5S)-3,4-bis(benzyloxy)-2-(4-methoxybenzyloxy)-5-vinyl-cyclopentanol . the ring contraction of the 6-enopyranoside in the presence of zirconocene equivalent ( ' cp <nUm> Zr ' ) reagent gave exclusively the corresponding cyclopentanol without cleavage of the PMB protecting group . In the course of the study , a new a-mannosidase inhibitor , (1R,2R,3R,5R)-5-amino-3-hydroxymethyl-cyclopentane-1,2-diol , wa also discovered . calcosilicate ( CAS-1 ) wa used for the first time a an effective carrier for simultaneous immobilization of a dual - functional catalytic system consisted of iron - based bis(imino) pyridyl complex ( O ) and zirconocene compound ( C ) to form heterogeneous catalyst precursor ( CAS - <nUm> / O / C ) . the a-olefins formed form O - catalyzed ethylene oligomerization copolymerized in situ with ethylene to linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) under the catalysis of C in CAS - <nUm> / O / C upon addition of cocatalysts a described hereafter . instead of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , triethylaluminum ( TEA ) wa employed to activate the copolymerization reaction with high catalytic activity and smooth kinetic process . experimental result reflected that the selectivity for lower a-olefins wa improved due to the confinement effect of the layered structure of CAS-1 , hence greatly increasing the incorporation rate of a-olefins into LLDPE main chain and the branching degree accordingly during the in situ copolymerization of a-olefins and ethylene . the layered structure of CAS-1 endowed the resultant LLDPE with improved thermal stability in addition to higher molecular weight ( Mn ) . the LLDPE / Al2O3 nanocomposites synthesized by the in situ polymerization with dried - modified methylaluminoxane ( d-MMAO ) / zirconocene catalyst were investigated . first , after vacuum heated the Al2O3 nanofiller , the d-MMAO a the cocatalyst wa impregnated onto it . then , ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization wa carried out with the presence of different amount of d-MMAO / Al2O3 in a <nUm> mL semi-batch stainless steel autoclave reactor . after filtration , the obtained LLDPE nanocomposite wa characterized by mean of scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) / energy dispersive x-ray spectroscopy ( EDX ) , transmission electron microscopy ( TEM ) , gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) , differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and nuclear magnetic resonance ( NMR ) . it wa found that the polymerization activity strongly depended on the [Al]dMMAO / [Zr]cat ratio . the addition of Al2O3 nanofiller apparently resulted in increased melting temperature and molecular weight of LLDPE without any change in molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) . the bimodal MCM-41 - supported zirconocene / dMMAO catalyst exhibited higher catalytic activity for ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization compared to the unimodal one . the higher activity can be attributed to lesser support interaction . the copolymer having broader MWD wa obtained with the bimodal support without any significant change in MW and polymer microstructure a seen by 13C NMR . In this present study , the use of silica and zirconia a a support for zirconocene / MAO catalyst for copolymerization of ethylene / 1-olefin ( 1-hexene , 1-octene , and 1-decene ) wa investigated . first , MAO a the cocatalyst wa impregnated onto the support . then , copolymerization of ethylene / 1-olefin wa performed . it wa found that the use of zirconia support showed promising activity compared to those of the silica . increased activity can be attributed to higher amount of [Al]MAO present on the zirconia support coupled with strong interaction between the osupport - alcocatalyst linkage . In addition , the use of zirconia also resulted in higher degree of 1-olefin insertion and decreased Tm of copolymer produced . here , the copolymerization of ethylene / 1-octene with zirconocene / dMMAO catalyst using different pore sized silica - based support wa investigated . it revealed that the large pored silica [ O2Si ( LP ) ] exhibited the highest polymerization activity due to both highest amount of available active site present along with the moderate interaction between dMMAO and the support . the strong interaction between dMMAO and the support a proven by TGA analysis apparently resulted in dramatically decreased polymerization activity for the bimodal pored silica - alumina [ Si-Al ( BP ) ] . the copolymer produced were further characterized by mean of DSC and 13C NMR . although they exhibited the similar triad distribution , the degree of 1-octene insertion wa different . air - stable zirconocene bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate)s [ Cp2Zr(OPf)2 , OPf = C8F17O3S ] showing high lewis acidity and high thermal stability wa prepared by reacting Cp2ZrCl2 with AgOPf , and examined a a catalyst for acylation reaction . it wa found that in the acetylation of various alcohol , phenol , thiols , and amine by equimolar of acetic anhydride , Cp2Zr(OPf)2 exhibit high activity and selectivity to desired product under mild and solvent - free condition . In the acylation of 2-phenylethanol across various acylating reagent , it also show good catalytic efficiency . In a test of ten cycle , Cp2Zr(OPf)2 show little loss of activity . the result afford a general and efficient method for the acylation of alcohol , phenol , thiols , and amine using zirconium bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate) a catalyst . zirconocene bis(perfluorobutanesulfonate) [ Cp2Zr(OSO 2C4F9)2*2H2O ] wa successfully synthesized by treatment of Cp2ZrCl2 with AgC4F9O3S , and wa found to have the nature of air - stability , water tolerance , high thermal stability and strong lewis acidity . this complex showed high catalytic efficiency for the synthesis of a-aminophosphonates via kabachnik - field reaction of aldehyde / ketone , amine and diethyl phosphite under mild and solvent - free condition . furthermore , it can be reused without loss of activity in a test of five cycle . compared with our previously reported complex of Cp2Zr(OSO 2C8F17)2*3H 2O*THF , this complex showed better catalytic activity . the synthesis of Zr-SBA-15 material from zirconocene dichloride a metal precursor ha been investigated . these material can be prepared with a high loading of zirconium while preserving good mesoscopic ordering . Zr-SBA-15 material display acid property which have revealed to confer high catalytic activity in the transesterification of crude palm oil with methanol for biodiesel synthesis , achieving yield to FAME over <nUm> % in a batch reactor under the following reaction condition : <nUm> ° C , <nUm> h , methanol to oil molar ratio <nUm> : <nUm> and using <nUm> wt. % catalyst loading referred to oil . furthermore , Zr-SBA-15 material display excellent stability in palm oil transesterification , being fully regenerated by calcination at <nUm> ° C after at least eight consecutive reaction run . the incorporation of titanium , molybdenum and tungsten a doping metal produce slightly promotion of the acidity of Zr-SBA-15 material , though this is not translated into higher catalytic activity . the efficient catalytic dehydropolymerization of phenylsilane by homogeneous zirconocene bissilanolates ( [ { ( c-C 5H <nUm> ) 7Si 8O 12O } 2Zr(e 5- C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 1a ) ; [ { ( c-C 5H <nUm> ) 7Si 8O 12O } 2Zr(e 5-C 5H 4Bu ) <nUm> ] ( 1b ) [ { ( c-C 5H <nUm> ) 7Si 7O <nUm> ( OSiMe 3)O 2}Zr(e 5-C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 4 ) ; [ { ( me 3CO ) 3SiO } 2Zr(e 5-C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 5 ) ) and chlorosilanolates ( [ { ( c-C 5H <nUm> ) 7Si 8O 12O}ZrCl(e 5-C 5H 4Bu ) <nUm> ] ( 2 ) ; ( [ { ( c-C 5H <nUm> ) 7Si 7O 9O 3}Zr 2Cl(e 5-C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 3a ) ; [ { ( c-C 5H <nUm> ) 7Si 7O 9O 3}Zr 2Cl(e 5-C 5H 4Bu ) <nUm> ] ( 3b ) ) ha been demonstrated . the presence of at least one silanol ligand in the zirconocene moiety wa found essential for high catalytic performance . solid state structure of complex 1a wa determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction analysis . A series of nine zirconocene - siliceous catalyst were prepared by grafting of zirconocene moiety onto silica using three general method : ( a ) reaction of [ ( η 5-C 5H <nUm> ) 2ZrCl <nUm> ] with silica in the presence of NEt <nUm> ; ( b ) reaction of [ ( η 5-C 5H <nUm> ) 2ZrMe <nUm> ] with silica ; ( c ) reaction of solely [ ( η 5-C 5H <nUm> ) 2ZrCl <nUm> ] with silica . supported catalyst were characterized by ICP-MS , FT-IR , TGA and selected example by XPS analysis . those catalyst prepared by method ( a ) and ( b ) were found efficient in the phenylsilane polymerization although a higher Zr / monomer ratio had to be used in comparison with homogeneous analogue . the low concentration of residual silanol group in supported catalyst wa found essential for their high catalytic performance . advantageous reusability of supported catalyst wa demonstrated using OSi <nUm> / cp 2ZrCl <nUm> / NEt 3(5.8) . the catalytic performance wa retained in three consecutive cycle producing polymer with almost identical property . the compelling advantage of synchrotron radiation ( SR ) in charge density study of coordination complex are described and illustrated with a number of recent synchrotron study , ordered according to the atomic number of the metal atom involved ( Cr , Fe , Cu , Zr , Mo , Th ) . the review concludes with two study of the Cu - containing extended solid Cu2O and the high - temperature superconducting phase Ba100Cu150O349Y50 , done with very high energy synchrotron radiation of about <nUm> keV ( ∼ <nUm> Å ) , very much beyond what is available at conventional x-ray source . this review summarises attempt that have been made to quantify and separate steric and electronic factor associated with zirconocene - type catalyst in the olefin polymerisation reaction . the use of cone and solid angle , measurement of molecular space ( coordination gap aperture , obliquity angle and lateral extension angle ) , the taft steric parameter a well a a number of theoretical method ( ab initio hartree fock , QSAR , 3D-QSAR and paired interacting orbitals ) a approach to the quantification of ligand size is discussed . attempt to associate these measure with catalyst activity are reviewed . pentalene bridged zirconocene / methylaluminoxane catalyst are described a useful for the polymerization of ethene , propene , and co-polymerizations with norbornene . they show a high thermostability up to polymerization temperature of <nUm> ° C . polyethylene with molecular mass of <nUm> million g / mol are obtained at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> g / mol at more than <nUm> ° C . the molecular mass distribution varies between <nUm> and <nUm> because of the steric isomer of the pentalene ligand . some of the complex are active for the polymerization of propene . similar to ansa cyclopentadienyl-fluorenyl complex , the tacticity of the produced polypropylene can be changed from syndiotactic to isotactic by substitution of the cyclopentadienyl ring . 6-Dialkylaminofulvenes add a variety of RLi reagent to form (dialkylaminoalkyl)cyclopentadienides [ C <nUm> H <nUm> C r <nUm> r ce : glyph() N r ′ <nUm> ] Li , which exhibit oligomeric chain structure in the solid state . transmetallation yield the corresponding titanocene or zirconocene derivative that often show interesting intramolecular CH activation reaction . phosphide anion addition to 6-alkyl-fulvenes yield the analogous phosphinoalkyl-Cp reagent and subsequently their group <nUm> metallocene complex . deprotonation of 6-dialkylamino-6-alkylfulvenes generates enamino-substituted cp - ligand . their metal complex undergo intramolecular mannich reaction to yield C <nUm> - bridged ansa - metallocene product . treatment of 6-dimethylaminofulvene with ArHLiN reagent lead to amine exchange and open a synthetic route to " CpCN " MX <nUm> " constrained geometry " catalyst . LiNHR addition to some 6-alkylfulvenes represents an alternative entry to this important class of compound . the corresponding " CpCP " MX <nUm> system are derived from the analogous LiPHR addition reaction . many typical reaction of the new fulvene - derived metal complex are presented and discussed . In this account [3]- and [5]cumulene complex of group <nUm> metallocenes that form five - membered metallacycles are described . these complex have a " triple bond " despite their five - membered ring structure , showing that they are regarded a 1-metallacyclopent-3-ynes . the molecular structure show their strained alkyne character . these complex react with transition metal to form alkyne - coordinated bimetallic complex . they also receive electrophilic attack by proton and boranes resulting in M-C bond cleavage . when a [3]cumulene couple with an alkyne on the metal , the reaction produce seven - membered metallacycloalkynes that have a strained structure showing an interaction between the " triple bond " and the metal center . hexapentaenes , [5]cumulenes , form conjugated 1-metallacyclopent-3-ynes . the aryl-substituted [5]cumulene complex wa reduced by alkali metal to give dianionic specie that reacted with proton to give 1-metallacyclopent-3-ene , a cycloalkene , and with iodomethane to give 1-metallacyclopenta-2,3-diene , a cycloallene . the hexapentaene with tert-butyl group reacts with zirconocene to form an e2-p - coordinated complex in the presence of trimethylphosphine , although it gave a 1-metallacyclopent-3-yne in the absence of the phosphine . the former wa transformed into the latter by addition of a phosphine , and vice versa by removing the phosphine , showing a " haptotropic " shift . here , we revealed the effect of particle size of the nanoscale O2Si on catalytic and characteristic property of LLDPE / nano-SiO2 composite synthesized via the in situ polymerization with a zirconocene / MAO catalyst . In the experiment , O2Si ( <nUm> and <nUm> nm ) wa first impregnated with MAO . then , copolymerization of ethylene / 1-hexene wa performed in the presence of nano-SiO2 / MAO to produce LLDPE / nano-SiO2 composite . it wa found that the larger particle exhibited higher polymerization activity due to fewer interaction between O2Si and MAO . the larger particle also rendered higher insertion of 1-hexene leading to decreased melting temperature ( Tm ) . there wa no significant change in the LLDPE molecular structure by mean of 13C NMR . this work describes the influence of the modification of the ClMg 2(THF)2 and Cl2Mg magnesium support with the AlEt2Cl , MAO , AlEt3 , AlMe3 , and AlEt 2Cl alkylaluminium compound on heterogenisation of the bis(cyclopentadienyl) zirconium(IV) dichloride Cp2ZrCl2 catalyst . it wa found that only the MgCl2(THF)2 support modified with AlEt2Cl gave the heterogeneous catalyst . on the contrary , application of a magnesium carrier modified by AlEt3 , AlMe3 , and MAO compound only result in a homogeneous zirconocene catalyst . the heterogeneous bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium(IV) dichloride catalyst of the composition MgCl2(THF) / (AlEt2Cl)0.34 / (Cp2ZrCl2)0.01 a determined by FTIR , XRD , and AAS analysis wa synthesised and , after activation by MAO , applied for ethylene polymerisation . the catalyst turned out to be stable and more active than those magnesium supported catalyst already known from the literature . the polyethylene produced ha a relatively high molecular weight ( mw > <nUm> g / mol ) , a narrow and monomodal molecular weight distribution ( MWD = <nUm> ) , a bulk density of about <nUm> g / dm3 , and monomodal particle size distribution . application of a ternary al(i - bu)3 / MAO / B(C 6F5)3 activator decreased the amount of MAO needed and increased catalyst activity , but did not change the reaction mechanism . the electrochemical synthesis and characterisation of poly(methyl vinylsilane ) and a series of poly(methyl vinylsilane-co-metallocenes ) network polymer are described in detail . this class of polymer are not accessible through wurtz coupling reaction and are however prepared by electro-reduction of dichloro methyl vinylsilane in a non-aqueous system using aluminum electrode in a single compartment cell . these polymer have been characterised using UV , FTIR , XRD , SEM and NMR spectral technique . cyclic voltammetric study of the above polymer reveal their conducting behavior . these polymer show optical property a explained from the result . polymer of this type are proposed a potential soluble precursor for CSi and metal doped CSi material . unbridged bis-substituted-indenyl zirconocene complex , [ ( 2,4-Me 2Ind)2ZrCl2 , met-1 ; ( 2,4,6-Me 3Ind)2ZrCl2 , met-2 ] , were supported on silica and montmorillonite carrier ( resulting in silica - supported catalyst MS-1 and MS-2 , and montmorillonite - supported catalyst MT-1 ) . ethylene polymerization by homogeneous and heterogeneous catalyst showed high activity , affording polyethylene with high molecular weight . the catalytic activity and the molecular weight of the polymer were improved using the heterogeneous system . the activity for the ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization by heterogeneous system were lower than those using homogeneous system , however , the comonomer wa incorporated efficiently into polymer in both the homo- and the heterogeneous system , and moreover , the microstructure of the copolymer derived from the heterogeneous catalyst showed different characteristic from those resulting from the homogeneous system . the rErH value of the heterogeneous catalyst ( <nUm> for MS-1 and <nUm> for MS-2 ) , are quite different from those of their homogeneous analogue ( <nUm> for met-1 and <nUm> for met-2 ) . 4,4'-Bis(methylene)biphenylene bridged homodinuclear titanocene ( 3 ) and zirconocene ( 4 ) have been synthesized by treatment of CpTiCl3 and CpZrCl3 · DME with Na2[C5H4CH2C6H4-p-C6H4CH2C5H4] , respectively , in THF and characterized by 1H NMR and element analysis . after activation with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) , these catalyst were used for the homogeneous polymerization of ethylene . the influence of reaction condition , such a temperature , time , catalyst concentration and molar ratio of MAO / cat . on ethylene polymerization were investigated in detail . the catalytic activity of <nUm> and <nUm> are more than three time higher than that of the phenyldimethylene bridged homodinuclear metallocene of titanocene ( 5 ) and zirconocene ( 6 ) , respectively , and also twice higher than that of Cp2TiCl2 / MAO and Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO , respectively . however , the catalytic activity of <nUm> is nearly half a high a that of <nUm> , which reached <nUm> × <nUm> g PE / mol cat h . the molecular weight of polyethylene increase simultaneously with prolongation of polymerization time . GPC spectrum show that <nUm> and <nUm> produce polyethylene with broad molecular weight distribution ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) . the high melting point of the product ( 131-134 ° C ) indicate that the polyethylene formed is highly linear and highly crystalline . copolymerizations of ethylene with 1,3-butadiene in the presence of catalytic system based on C2 - symmetric zirconocenes rac - ( CH 3)2Si(2-R-4-R'-1-indenyl)2ZrCl <nUm> ( where r = CH3- or H and R' = C6H 5- or H ) are compared . the chemical nature and the relative amount of constitutional comonomer unit from butadiene ( 1,4-trans , methylene-1,2- cyclopentane and methylene-1,2-cyclopropane ) are strongly affected by the bulkiness of the substituent on the indenyl ligand . the unsubstituted indenyl zirconocene system rac-(CH3)2Si(indenyl) 2ZrCl2 / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) insert 1,3-butadiene leading to both cyclopentane and 1,4-trans unit , whereas exclusively cyclopentane constitutional unit are obtained from rac-(CH3)2Si(2- methyl-1-indenyl)2ZrCl2 / MAO . the catalytic system rac-(CH3)2Si(2-methyl-4-phenyl-1-indenyl) 2ZrCl2 / ( MAO ) is able to incorporate about <nUm> % of butadiene unit into polymer chain and to form up to <nUm> % of cyclopropane unit . an unusual insertion mechanism for conjugated diolefins , that involves a butadiene e2 primary coordination and insertion leading to formation of cycloalkane unit , is largely predominant for all used catalytic system . mechanistic study and DFT calculation indicate that the chemoselectivity of the reaction depends on the bulkiness of the substituents on the indenyl ligand of catalyst . A cyclopentadiene compound having methyl substituents on 1,3-positions , 1,3-Me2-2-CH2(OTHP)-C5H3 ( 3 ) is prepared from 2-bromo-3-methyl-2-cyclopenten-1-one ethylene ketal ( 1 ) in <nUm> % overall yield . addition of <nUm> equivalent of indenyllithium to <nUm> affords a methylene bridged 1,3-dimethylcyclopentadienyl indenyl compound , CH 2(1,3-Me2C5H3)(C9H <nUm> ) ( 5 ) in <nUm> % yield . reaction of dilithium salt of <nUm> with ClZr 2(NMe2)2 ( DME ) furnishes an ansa - zirconocene complex [ CH2(1,3-Me2C5H2)(C 9H6)]Zr(NMe2)2 ( 6 ) , which is transformed cleanly to the dichloride complex , [ CH2(1,3-Me 2C5H2)(C9H6)]ZrCl <nUm> ( 7 ) , by treatment of Me3SiCl . hydrogenation of <nUm> over O2Pt give a tetrahydroindenyl complex [ CH2(1,3-Me 2C5H2)(C9H10)]ZrCl <nUm> ( 8 ) . reaction of the dilithium salt of <nUm> with Ti(NMe 2)2Cl2 doe not provide the desired ansa - titanocene complex , but a dinuclear complex [ ( 1,3-Me2C 5H2)Ti(NMe2)2Cl]-CH 2-[(C9H6)Ti(NMe2)Cl] ( 9 ) is obtained . the solid structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by x-ray crystallography . the ethylene and ethylene / norbornene (co)polymerizations were studied with <nUm> / MAO and <nUm> / MAO . new c-ansa-zirconocene complex containing methoxythiophenolate and mercaptophenolate ligand have been synthesized and characterized . the reaction of ( HSC6H4-n-OMe ) ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> or <nUm> ) with [ Zr{(t-Bu)HC(e5-C5Me4)(e5- C5H4)}Me2 ] ( 1 ) led to the formation of monosubstituted complex [ Zr{(t-Bu)HC(e5-C5Me 4)(e5-C5H4)}Me(k,S-SC 6H4-n-OMe ) ] ( n = <nUm> ( 2 ) ; n = <nUm> ( 3 ) ) and the disubstituted complex [ Zr{(t-Bu)HC(e5-C5Me4) (e5-C5H4)}(k,S-SC6H 4-4-OMe)2 ] ( 4 ) . the complex [ Zr{(R)HC(e5- C5Me4)(e5-C5H 4)}(k,O-OC6H4-4-SH)2 ] ( r = t-Bu ( 6 ) ; r = C3H5 ( 7 ) ) and [ zr(e5- C5H4)2(OC6H4-n-SH) <nUm> ] ( n = <nUm> ( 9 ) ; n = <nUm> ( 10 ) ) have been synthesized using the corresponding dimethyl zirconocene and mercaptophenol . however , the reaction of [ Zr{(t-Bu)HC(e5-C5Me4)(e5- C5H4)}Cl2 ] ( 11 ) with 4-mercaptophenol in the presence of NEt3 led to the formation of the first example of a homoleptic six - coordinate mercaptophenolate complex of zirconium , namely [HNEt3]2[Zr(k,O-OC6H4-4-SH) <nUm> ] ( 12 ) . complex <nUm> can be obtained in higher yield by the reaction of Cl4Zr with six equivalent of 4-mercaptophenol and NEt <nUm> . the reaction of <nUm> with [ Zr(e5-C5H 4)2Cl2 ] gave the unexpected disubstituted complex [ Zr(e5-C5H4)2(OC 6H4-4-SH)2 ] ( 10 ) . the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . the diphenyl zirconocene [ ( e5-C5H 5){e5-C5H4CMe 2(CH2)2CHCH2}ZrPh2 ] ( 2 ) wa readily obtained from the corresponding zirconocene dichloride <nUm> and two equivalent of phenyllithium . upon thermal treatment at <nUm> ° C , complex <nUm> released benzene , with concomitant activation of the pendant double bond and formation of intramolecularly a-tethered zirconaindane [ (e5-C5H5){e5 , e1,e1-C5H4CMe 2(CH2)2CHCH2C6H 4}Zr ] ( 3 ) . both Zr-C s-bonds in <nUm> easily undergo nucleophilic reaction with two equivalent of ClH or one equivalent of Cl2PPh giving rise to zirconocene dichloride with pendant phenyl group [ (e5-C5H5){e5-C 5H4CMe2(CH2)4Ph}ZrCl <nUm> ] ( 4 ) or with 1-phenylphosphindolinyl moiety [ ( e5- C5H5){e5-C5H4CMe 2(CH2)2cyclo-CHCH2C 6H4P(Ph)}ZrCl2 ] ( 5 ) , respectively . the preparation of a novel titanium(IV) metallocene ( 2 ) , including 2,6-diethyl-4,8-dimethyl-5-hydroindacenide ( Ic'H ) a ligand wa successfully achieved and it wa characterized by mean of 1H , 13C NMR and elemental analysis . cyclic voltammetry study were performed for complex <nUm> a well a for it zirconium analog <nUm> . both complex were tested in the catalysis of ethylene polymerization , showing a considerable difference between their catalytic activity in a proportion of <nUm> : <nUm> between complex <nUm> and <nUm> . DFT calculation were performed in order to gain further knowledge about the geometry of the complex and their electronic property and therefore explain the difference between their reactivity . attempt to synthesize bent metallocene complex of pyridine-2,6- bis(thiocarboxylate) , Cp2Ti(pdtc) and Cp2Zr(pdtc) yielded partially desulfurized product . In the case of Cp2Ti(IV) two type of product were obtained , in one case desulfurization wa at one of the thiocarboxylate group resulting in a carboxylate group while in the other case it wa partial and from both the thiocarboxylate entity . In case of cp 2Zr(IV) similar partial desulfurization took place from both the thiocarboxylates . the complex have been characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction analysis . the ligand pyridine-2-carboxylate-6-thiocarboxylate , pyridine-2,6-dicarboxylate and pyridine-2,6-bis(thiocarboxylate) act a tridentate ligand . with both the metal binding of ligand is through the oxygen ( and nitrogen ) atom leaving the sulfur free . electronic absorption and emission spectrum of the compound have been studied experimentally and explained on the basis of DFT computation . In situ generated Cp2Zr(n-Bu)Cl ( 6 ) reacts with { 2-[(CH 3)2NCH2]C6H4 } 2Pb to form exclusively { 2-[(CH3)2NCH 2]C6H4}Cp2ZrCl ( 7 ) , [ ( CH 3)2NCH2]C6H5 , butene and elemental lead . the further derivatization of chloride ( 7 ) to fluoride ( 8 ) , hydride ( 9 ) , methyl derivative ( 10 ) , and a reduction of <nUm> are also described . the crystal structure of 7-10 were determined . the catalytic activity of <nUm> and <nUm> in hydrogenation of styrene wa also preliminarily tested . the zirconocene alkyne complex rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2-Me 3SiC2SiMe3 ) ( 1 ) reacts with 1,4-bis-tert-butyl-buta-1,3-diyne to yield the novel five - membered metallacyclocumulene rac-(ebthi)Zr(e4-t-Bu-C4-t-Bu) ( 2 ) ( ebthi = 1,2-ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) ) , t-Bu = tert-butyl ) . the structure of <nUm> wa confirmed by x-ray study . A systematic study on organo-layered silicate intermediate used for preparing in situ polyethylene nanocomposites wa performed by pyrolysis - gas chromatography / mass spectrometry and thermogravimetric analysis . the type and composition of the pyrolysis product gave useful information about mechanism of thermal degradation . the combination of pyrolysis and thermal decomposition data allowed u to describe the evolution of the organoclay structure after the reactive pretreatment step with alkylaluminoxane cocatalyst and zirconocene or bis(imino)pyridine iron precatalyst , respectively . A proof of the formation of heterogeneous organoclay - immobilized catalyst wa obtained . unlike reported example of early transition metal e2(N,C)-pyridyl complex , scandium e2(N,C)-pyridyl complex supported by a ferrocene diamide ligand react further with pyridine to give coupling product . although most of their insertion reaction with unsaturated substrate are similar to those of previous yttrocene and zirconocene complex , in the reaction with butadiene , higher reactivity than the one reported for the yttrocene complex wa observed . herein are discussed reaction of e2(N,C)-pyridyl scandium complex supported by a 1,1'-ferrocene diamide ligand with ethylene , 2-butyne , and 1,3-butadiene . zirconocene catalyst wa heterogenized inside an organosilane - modified montmorillonite ( MMT ) pretreated by calcination and acidization , for supported catalyst system with well - spaced a-olefin polymerization active center . the varied pretreatment and modification condition of montmorillonite are efficient for supported zirconocene catalyst in control of polyethylene microstructures , in particular , molecular weight distribution . In contrast to other supported catalyst system , Cp2ZrCl2 / modified montmorillonite(MMT-7) - supported catalyst with a distinct interlayer structure catalyzed ethylene homopolymerization and copolymerization with 1-octene activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , resulting in polymer with a bimodal molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) . silica ( <nUm> m2 g-1 ) wa chemically modified with Cp2ZrCl2 and (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 by grafting . hybrid silica bearing surface indene group wa synthesized by the sol - gel method , followed by metallation with ZrCl4*2THF . the resulting phase were characterized by rutherford backscattering spectrometry ( RBS ) , 13C and 29Si magic angle spin nuclear magnetic resonance , x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy , and diffuse reflectance infrared fourier transform spectroscopy . according to RBS measurement , metal content wa 0.2- to 0.3-wt % Zr / O2Si for the grafted system and 4.5-wt % Zr / O2Si for the phase prepared by the sol - gel method . the solid phase were evaluated for the adsorption / preconcentration of lindane and heptachlor epoxide from aqueous solution . for comparative reason , the commercial LC-18 phase wa also evaluated . analyte concentration wa monitored by gas chromatography electron capture detection . for the grafted phase , the coordination sphere around the metal center seems not to influence the adsorption / desorption property of these phase vis-a-vis the studied analytes . In the case of the phase prepared by the sol - gel method , recovery result were comparable to those observed for LC-18 . experiment using OZr <nUm> and O2Zr / O2Si phase led to lower recovery result . silica wa chemically modified with zirconocenes , namely Cp2ZrCl2 , (MeCp)2ZrCl2 , (iBuCp)2ZrCl2 and (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 by grafting . hybrid silica bearing surface indene group wa synthesized by the sol - gel method , followed by metallation with ZrCl4s2THF . according to RBS measurement , metal content wa <nUm> - <nUm> wt % Zr / O2Si for the grafted system and <nUm> wt % Zr / O2Si for the phase prepared by the sol - gel method . the solid phase were evaluated in the adsorption / preconcentration of organochloride ( hexachlorobenzene , lindane , heptachlor , heptachlor epoxide , dieldrin and endrin ) pesticide from aqueous solution . for comparative reason , commercial LC-18 phase wa also evaluated . analyte concentration wa monitored by GC - ECD . for the grafted phase , the coordination sphere around the metal center seems not to influence the adsorption / desorption property of these phase vis-a-vis the studied analytes . recovery result for both analytes were comparable to those observed in the case of LC-18 in the case of the phase prepared by the sol - gel method . experiment using O2Zr and O2Zr / O2Si phase led to lower recovery result . In this present study , the linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) wa synthesized via ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization with the zirconocene / MMAO catalyst by in situ impregnation of different silica ( OSi <nUm> ) support . the OSi <nUm> support used were small - pored ( SP ) and large - pored ( LP ) size with and without Ga modification . it wa found that the SP - OSi <nUm> support exhibited higher polymerization activity ( ~ <nUm> time ) than that obtained from the LP - OSi <nUm> one . this can be attributed to the lower amount of MMAO being present inside the SP - OSi <nUm> support resulting in higher content of MMAO at the external surface . the higher activity in ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization wa also found with the supported catalyst having Ga modification onto both SP - and LP - OSi <nUm> support . the result demonstrated that the introduction of Ga may improve ability of support to immobilize metallocene catalyst . based on 13C NMR measurement , it indicated that all synthesized polymer were typical LLDPE having random distribution of comonomer . ethylene polymerization wa carried out using highly active metallocene catalyst ( cp 2ZrCl <nUm> and cp 2TiCl <nUm> ) in combination with methylalumoxane . Titanium(IV) oxide containing <nUm> % Mn a dopant wa used a nanofillers . the influence of filler concentration , reaction temperature and pressure on the catalytic activity and polymer property wa investigated . there wa a fourfold increase in the activity of zirconocene catalyst by addition of doped - titania . the morphology indicates that the doped - titania nanoparticles have a nucleus effect on the polymerization and caused a homogeneous PE shell around them . the optimum condition for polymerization wa found to be <nUm> ° C . In the present study , the polymerization behavior of ethylene-propylene ( EP ) copolymerization with a zirconocene / MAO catalyst upon the addition of a small amount of diene were investigated . it indicated that besides the addition of dienes , the polymerization behavior were also dependent on the e / P ratio and type of diene . apparently , diene addition resulted in decreased activity , especially at high e / P ratio ( e / P = <nUm> ) . In all case , the addition of <nUm> hexadiene ( <nUm> HD ) resulted in the lowest activity . it seemed that there wa no significant change in the microstructure of EP elastomer upon different e / P ratio . the characteristic of polymer obtained by mean of DSC and 13C NMR were further discussed in more detail . the practical aspect of applying CPMG for acquisition of wideline powder pattern are examined . it is shown that most distortion / modulation of spikelet spectrum can be traced to the incoherent signal averaging from multiple coherence transfer pathway . A strategy for minimizing these distortion / modulation is described . also , a few interesting observation regarding the implementation of the wideline WURST - QCPMG experiment are presented , namely the accumulation of second - order signal phase and the effect of varying the sweep rate and rf field of chirp pulse . the reaction of o-alkenyl substituted zirconocene dichloride complex with two equivalent of n -butyllithium is strongly influenced in the presence of alkene and alkyne . metallacyclic zirconocene complex of novel structure are obtained . the additive alkene and alkyne compete with the o-alkenyl substituents and the intermediate 1-butene for the formation of a metallacyclic structure . the reaction of o-alkenyl substituted zirconocene dichloride complex with two equivalent of ethyllithium and n -hexyllithium give analogous reaction and metallacycles a with n -butyllithium . the synthesis and polymerization behavior of four new asymmetric ansa -metallocenes containing a fluorenyl moiety and a substituted indenyl moiety is reported . the zirconocenes diphenylsilylene-(e 5-9-fluorenyl)-[e5-1-(3-t-butyl)indenyl]- zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) , dimethylsilylene-(e5-9- fluorenyl)-[e5-1-(3-t-butyl)indenyl]-zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) , ethylene-1-(e5-9-fluorenyl)-2-[e5-1- (3-t-butyl)indenyl]-zirconium dichloride ( 6 ) , and diphenylsilylene- (e5-9-fluorenyl)-[e5-1-(2-methyl-4-phenyl) indenyl ] - zirconium dichloride ( 8 ) were all found to be highly active for the polymerization of both ethylene and propylene when activated with excess methylaluminoxane . compound <nUm> wa found to produce highly isotactic polypropylene with an [mmmm] value of <nUm> % . the reaction of phenylalkyl substituted zirconocenedichloride complex with two equivalent of n-butyllithium give metallacyclic zirconocene complex . In this reaction aromatic CH bond can be activated in unbridged and bridged metallocenedichloride complex even if the corresponding phenyl ring contain halogen substituents such a fluorine or chlorine . after the activation with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , all the metallocene complex prove a attractive catalyst for ethylene polymerization reaction . because of their lewis basicity the halogen substituents fluorine or chlorine have a strong influence on the molecular weight of the produced polyethylene . metallocene complex with chloro substituents in the ortho position of the phenyl ring produce bimodal polyethylene . ethylene polymerization study have been carried out with novel precatalysts of the type : [ ( e5-C13 H8)-X(t-BuOC6H12)Me-(e5- C5H4)]ZrCl2 [ x = C [1a] , Si [2a] ] , [ (e5-C13H8)-XMe2- ( e5-(t-BuOC6H12C5 H3 ) ) ] Cl2Zr [ x = C [3a] , Si [4a] ] in the presence of excess methylalumoxane ( MAO ) to compare their catalytic activity and to delineate the effect of the 6-t-butoxyhexyl functionality on ethylene polymerization . the precatalysts [1a] and [2a] with the bridge functionality showed higher activity in ethylene polymerization than the corresponding complex [3a] and [4a] which have it on the cp ring moiety . on the other hand the silyl bridged complex [2a] and [4a] produced a higher molecular weight polyethylene than the carbon - bridged one , regardless of the location of functional group . A novel half - sandwich Zr(IV) complex [ e5:e 1-N-C5(CH3)4 CH2CH2N(CH3)2]ZrCl <nUm> ( 6 ) together with zirconocene dichloride [ e5-C5(CH3)4 C4H10N ] [e5-C5(CH3)5] Cl2Zr ( 4 ) and [ e5-C5 C3H8 N(CH3)2]2ZrCl2 ( 5 ) have been prepared . complex <nUm> ha been isolated and characterized in three different form , namely , a an adduct with THF 6a , an adduct with tetrahydrothiophene 6b , and a solvent - free form 6c . molecular structure of complex <nUm> , 6b , and 6c have been established by x-ray diffraction analysis . complex 6c ha been shown to be a monomeric solvent - free half sandwich Zr(IV) complex . the dynamic behavior of complex 6a in a non-solvating medium ( an equilibrium between 6a and 6c along with a degenerate interconversion of the Zr-Ccp-CH2- CH2-N(CH3)2-(Zr) pseudo-five-member metallacycle ) have been studied by the variable - temperature 1H and 13C{1H} NMR spectroscopy . the activation parameter for the degenerate five - member cycle interconversion have been elucidated . four series of reaction were explored that are aimed at the development of a functional group chemistry at the sensitive bent metallocenes of the group <nUm> metal . first , we have tested and employed the olefin metathesis reaction . two [ C5H4-(CH2)n-CH = CH2]2ZrCl2 complex ( with n = <nUm> and n = <nUm> ) were treated with the Cl2(PCy3)2 r = CHPh catalyst in dilute solution . intramolecular metathesis took place readily with liberation of ethene to yield the corresponding ansa - metallocene complex [ C5H4- (CH2)n-CH = CH - ( CH2 ) n-C5H4]ZrCl2 that were isolated in ca. <nUm> % ( n = <nUm> , trans-CH = CH- ) or ca. <nUm> % ( n = <nUm> , cis-CH = CH- ) yield . intermolecular olefin metathesis could also be effected using either a first or a second generation grubbs catalyst to metathetically couple a variety of (L)Cl2M(C5H4-CH2 CH = CH2 ) - type titanium or zirconium complex to yield the respective dimetallic product . alkenyl substituents were attached at the ligand stage at the indenyl 2-positions by mean of a nickel - catalyzed cross-coupling reaction . transmetallation eventually gave the bis(2-alkenylindenyl)ZrCl2 complex . photolysis of three example of this type of complex ( with 1-alkenyl substituents being methyl , cyclohexyl , or phenyl ) resulted in a very efficient intramolecular [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition to yield the respective substituted cyclobutylene-bridged ansa -metallocenes . these complex were MAO activated to give very active homogeneous metallocene catalyst for , e.g. , ethene / 1-octene copolymerization . the corresponding (s-trans-butadiene)-ansa-zirconocene complex feature a pronounced C-H / phenylene p-interaction that probably help to stabilize the s-trans-diene complex relative to it s-cis - isomer . deprotonation of 7-dialkylaminofulvenes provides an easy access to enamino-cyclopentadienides . transmetallation under carefully controlled condition gave the respective bis(enamino-C5H4) Cl2Zr complex . their treatment with a catalytic amount of a lewis acid ( Cl4Ti ) or a bronsted - acid ( [HNMe2Ph+][BPh4-] ) led to a rapid intramolecular mannich - type carbon-carbon coupling reaction that gave novel , very rigid C3 - bridged , -NR2 functionalized ansa - metallocene system . the analogous , readily performed mannich - coupling reaction starting from 1,1'-diacetylferrocene and a variety of secondary amine provided an interesting and useful novel entry to [3]ferrocenophane system . catalytic hydrogenation of the unsaturated bridge followed by additional functionalization opened a novel pathway to ferrocenophane - based chelate ligand ( some optically active ) for stereoselective catalytic transformation . eventually , example of direct attack of the electrophilic boranes BC6F5 <nUm> or BC12F10H , respectively , to the cp ring of bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconacyclopentadienes are described , leading to novel type of cp - borylated group <nUm> metallocene complex . the regioselectivity of the coupling reaction of the internal acetylenic derivative Ph2P-C ≡ C-SiMe3 ( 2 ) and the benzyne complex [ Cp2Zr(e2- C3H2 ) ] ( 1 ) resulted preferentially in the formation of the zirconaindene metallacycle with the metal a-carbanions stabilized by the trimethylsilyl group . we have been able to structurally characterize the two regiosomers . the unusual acute Zr-C-P angle and the short Zr-P distance revealed that a significant lewis - base / lewis - acid s-P-Zr interaction occurs in the a-phosphino zirconaindene metallacycle . addition of HCl*Et2O on the cyclic a-silyl zirconindene complex led to competition reaction between ( i ) the nucleophilic attack of the lone pair of the phosphino group followed by P-C cleavage to form Ph2PH and Ph-C ≡ C-SiMe3 ( 7 ) and ( ii ) protonolysis of the Zr - CSi bond to give the z-vinyl silyl phosphino product Ph2PC(Ph) = C(H) SiMe3 ( 8 ) . when the lone electron pair of the phosphino group is engaged intramolecularly with the metal center to achieve the stable 18-electron configuration protonolysis reaction on the Zr-C bond to give the z-vinyl silyl phosphino product Ph2PC(H) = C(Ph)SiMe3 ( 9 ) is the unique process observed . protonolysis reaction on the complex prepared in situ from the addition of <nUm> and zirconocene like reagent " [Cp2Zr] " gave Ph2PH , H-C ≡ C-SiMe3 , and Ph2PC(H) = C(H)SiMe3 ( 18 ) which resulted from the competitive P-C and Zr-C bond cleavage process of the transient alkyne complex Cp2Zr(e2-Ph2 P-C ≡ C-SiMe3 ) ] ( 14 ) . an easy and inexpensive three - step synthesis of new 2,3-dimethyl-1,4-diphenylcyclopentadiene ( 3 ) ligand and the titanium and zirconium homometallocene dichloride [ Cl2Ti ( e5-C5H-2,3-Me2-1 , 4-Ph2)2 ] ( 4 ) , [ Cl2Zr ( e5-C5H-2,3-Me2-1 , 4-Ph2)2 ] ( 5 ) , and the mixed ligand zirconium complex [ ZrCl2(e5-C5H-2 , 3-Me2-1,4-Ph2)(e5-C5 H5 ) ] ( 6 ) prepared thereof are described . the polymerization of ethene using 4-6 / MAO catalyst revealed that zirconocene complex <nUm> and <nUm> displayed moderate and high activity , respectively , whereas the titanium catalyst <nUm> / MAO wa inactive . the crystal structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by x-ray crystallography . several allyl-functionalized dendrimers and mono-functional model compound have been prepared . these have been hydrozirconated using [Cp2ZrHCl]x to give zirconocene terminated dendrimers . these dendrimers have been characterized using spectroscopic technique , particularly NMR . ansa - zirconocene dichloride complex containing a 9-fluorenyl group at the 1-position of naphthalene and a 2-indenyl <nUm> , 1-indenyl <nUm> , or cyclopentadienyl <nUm> group at the 2-position of the naphthalene were synthesised and characterised . the molecular structure of the complex have been determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction study . after activation with excess methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , the complex were used a homogeneous catalyst for the homopolymerisation of ethylene and propylene . methylene-bridged ansa - metallocene complex bearing substituents on the cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) and fluorenyl ( flu ) moiety , namely methylene[9-(2,7-di-tert-butyl)fluorenyl ( 2-(1,3-dimethylcyclopentadienyl)]zirconium dichloride ( 1a ) and it analogue , methylene [ ( 9-(2,7-di-tert-butyl)fluorenyl ( 2-(1-methyl-3-phenyl)cyclopentadienyl ) ]zirconium dichloride ( 2a ) , have been prepared from (2,7-di-tert-butyl)-9-prop-2-ynyl-9H-fluorene ( 2 ) . this procedure includes the use of 3-bromo-1-propyne which affords the methylene bridging unit by way of an intermolecular pauson - khand reaction in which norbornadiene and a pendant alkyne cyclize to form a ring that later becomes a substituted cyclopentadienyl group . ethylene-norbornene ( E-N ) copolymerization wa then carried out using these new complex ( 1a and 1b ) in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a a cocatalyst ; these activity can be compared to that of isopropylene[9-fluorenyl-cyclopentadienyl]zirconium dichloride ( 3a ) . the activity of catalyst 1a wa comparable to that of 3a but much higher than that of 2a . In addition , 1a show higher norbornene insertion performance , and give an E-N copolymer with a higher glass transition temperature ( tg ) than 2a under identical condition ; both 1a and 2a give a lower tg polymer than 3a doe . the (butadiene)zirconocene system is characterized by the occurence of two isomer , (s-cis-)- and ( s-trans-e4-C4H 6-)ZrCp2 . out of this equilibrium , (butadiene)zirconocene ha successfully been employed a a stoichiometric reagent in organic and organometallic synthesis and a a precursor for the generation of active homogeneous ziegler - natta catalyst system . (Butadiene)zirconocene wa the first mono-nuclear metal complex for which the s-trans-e4 - conjugated diene coordination mode wa established . meanwhile a variety of additional example from metal throughout the periodic table wa found . the (butadiene)zirconocenes have found use a valuable reagent in organic and organometallic synthesis , for which various representative example are described . they have also found extensive use a precursor for the generation of very active and sometimes very selective homogeneous metallocene ziegler - natta olefin polymerization catalyst . the employment of the dipolar zirconocene(butadiene) / BC18F15 addition product in mechanistic study ha revealed important aspect of the reaction course taken in the carbon-carbon coupling reaction sequence at this important class of catalyst . several specific example are described in this article . meso- and rac - diastereomers of the Me-Ph-cyclopentadienyl-disubstituted zirconocene and tetramethyldisiloxane - bridged ansa - metallocene dichloride ( m = Zr , Hf ) have been isolated by transmetallation of their lithium salt to MCl4 and characterized by NMR spectroscopy and x-ray diffraction method . the zirconocene dichloride activated with MAO are active catalyst for ethene and propene polymerization . the non-vicinal methyl-phenyl-substituted zirconocene dichloride meso-and rac-[Zr{e5-(1-Ph-3-Me-C 5H3)}2Cl2 ] and [ zr(e 5-C5H5){e5-(1-Ph-3-Me-C 5H3)}Cl2 ] have been isolated by transmetallation of the lithium salt Li(1-Ph-3-Me-C5H3) to ZrCl4(THF)2 and [ Zr(e5-C5H 5)Cl3 • DME ] ( DME = dimethoxyethane ) , respectively . similar transmetallation of the lithium salt Li2[(Me-Ph-C 5H2SiMe2)2O ] to MCl4 gave the ansa - metallocenes [ M{e5-(Me-Ph-C5H 2SiMe2)2O}Cl2 ] ( m = Zr , Hf ) for which the meso- and rac - diastereomers were separated . the dimethyl and dibenzyl derivative of these metallocenes were also prepared and the structure of all of these compound determined by NMR spectroscopy . the molecular structure of rac-[Zr{e5-(2-Me-4-Ph-C5H2SiMe 2)2O}Cl2 ] wa determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction method . the activity of the dichlorometallocenes / MAO catalyst for ethene and propene polymerization wa evaluated . A 3-tert-butyl-1-(stannylpropyl) - functionalized cyclopentadienyl ligand precursor <nUm> is readily available in <nUm> % overall yield from allylic alcohol <nUm> by a three - step reaction sequence including Pd - catalyzed hydrostannylation with Ph3SnH . treatment with Cl2Fe and Cl4Zr · 2THF afforded corresponding ferrocene and zirconocene derivative . transmetallation of Sn-Ph with Li-Bu wa observed under these reaction condition by using BuLi a a base . new bis-hydrocarbyl complex of methylene bridged ansa - metallocenes [H2Me2H2)2]ZrR2 { r = me ( 1 ) , CH2Ph ( 2 ) , CH2SiMe3 ( 3 ) , ph ( 4 ) } have been prepared . they form catalytically active intermediate with borane or borate depending on solvent and Zr-R group . specifically , [H2C(Me2C5H2)2] Zr(CH2Ph)2 ( 2 ) produced an ion pair upon treatment with BC18F15 whereas [ H C(Me2C5H2)2]Zr(CH2 SiMe3)2 ( 3 ) produced a zwitterionic specie , identified by 1H,13C , and 19F NMR spectroscopy . copolymerization of ethylene and norbornene for the metallocene dichloride / MAO and bis-hydrocarbyl complex / borate system wa compared . treatment of 6-methyl-6-dimethylaminofulvene ( 2a ) with methyl lithium in ether result in a deprotonation reaction to yield the enamino-substituted lithium cyclopentadienide reagent 3a . it reaction with zirconium tetrachloride ( <nUm> molar equivalent ) result in the formation of the [ 1- dimethylaminobutadien-1,3-diyl-bis(cyclopentadienyl)]zirconium dichloride product 4a . the unsaturated ansa - metallocene is probably formed via a lewis acid - catalyzed mannich - type carbon-carbon coupling reaction of an in situ generated bis[(dimethylaminoethenyl)cyclopentadienyl]ZrCl <nUm> intermediate . A number of related example of this condensation reaction at the intact group <nUm> bent metallocene framework is described , using different amino-substituents and Ti , Zr and Hf system . three example of the unsaturated ansa - metallocene system were characterized by x-ray diffraction . In a few case it wa possible to isolate the open ( enamino-Cp ) 2ZrCl <nUm> complex . In the case of , e.g. , ( piperidinoethenylcyclopentadienyl ) 2ZrCl <nUm> ( 13c ) treatment with a catalytic quantity of the lewis acid ClZr <nUm> or the bronsted acid [PhNMe2H+][BPh4-] resulted in a clean conversion to the respective mannich condensation product , here the ansa - metallocene complex 4c . the strongly electrophilic borane HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> did not catalyze the CC - coupling reaction under the applied reaction condition but added cleanly to the enamino-CC double bond of , e.g. , 13c to yield a cyclic nitrogen donor - stabilized hydroboration product ( 19 ) . deprotonation of di(3-methylindol-2-yl)phenylmethane ( L 2H <nUm> ) or 2-methoxyphenyldi(3-methylindol-2-yl)methane(L2'H2) with two equivalent of nBuLi , followed by reaction with cp 2TiCl <nUm> or cp 2ZrCl <nUm> yielded complex Cp2TiL2(1),Cp2TiL2'(2),Cp2ZrL2(3)andCp2ZrL2'(4) . compound 1-4 were characterized by NMR spectroscopy , and compound <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were further analyzed by x-ray crystallography and elemental analysis . the molecular structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> illustrate that chelating di(3-methylindol-2-yl) methane have a structural relationship to coordinated bis(pyrazolyl)borates . the phenyltrihydroborate complex , cp 2ZrCl{(m-H) 2BHPh } , <nUm> , and cp 2Zr{(m-H) 2BHPh } <nUm> • ( <nUm> / <nUm> toluene ) , <nUm> , were prepared from the reaction of cp 2ZrCl <nUm> with one and two mole of BHLi 3Ph . the Zr-H-B bond in <nUm> are stable under vacuum at <nUm> ° C for hour without significant decomposition . an inductive effect ha been proposed for this strong interaction . this hydrogen bridge bond can be broken upon reacting with the lewis base N(C 2H <nUm> ) <nUm> to produce ( C 2H <nUm> ) <nUm> N • BH 2Ph and the zirconium hydride compound cp 2ZrH{(m-H) 2BHPh } , <nUm> . compound <nUm> also can be prepared from the reaction of cp 2ZrHCl with BHLi 3Ph . the reaction of <nUm> with the lewis acid B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> is solvent dependent , the metathesis product cp 2ZrCl{(m-H) 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> } , <nUm> , wa formed in the toluene solution , whereas the ionic complex [ cp 2ZrCl(OEt 2)][HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , <nUm> , wa isolated from the ether solution . the reaction of titanocene dichloride , cp 2TiCl <nUm> , with BHLi 3Ph produced a 17-electron , paramagnetic complex , cp 2Ti{(m-H) 2BHPh } , <nUm> . single crystal x-ray structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were also determined . A coplanar structure of the four bridge hydrogen in <nUm> wa observed . the meso- and rac - like isomer of bis{e5-(1-benzyl)indenyl} zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) , bis{e5-(1-para-methoxybenzyl)indenyl} zirconium dichloride ( 6 ) , bis{e5-(1-para-fluoro-benzyl)indenyl} zirconium dichloride ( 7 ) and bis{e5-(1-phenylethyl)indenyl} zirconium dichloride ( 8 ) were synthesized and isolated . solid - state structure of meso- and rac - like <nUm> were determined by x-ray structure analysis . polymerization property of the methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) activated diastereomers of complex 5-8 were studied in ethene polymerization under different monomer concentration . the rac - like isomer of 1-phenylethyl-substituted <nUm> / MAO showed significantly higher activity than the 1-benzyl substituted analog 5-7 / MAO . In addition , rac - <nUm> / MAO behaves like a single center catalyst producing polyethene with narrow molar mass distribution ( <nUm> - <nUm> ) , while diastereomers of 5-7 / MAO produce polymer with molar mass distribution varying from <nUm> up to <nUm> . the rac and meso-like isomer of 5-7 / MAO have different response on the monomer concentration . quantum chemical calculation suggest a strong interaction between the benzyl substituent and the electron deficient zirconium center . the phenyl metal coordination energy depend on the electronic property of the para-substituent . In <nUm> / MAO , due to the ethyl spacer , the coordination doe not have a significant role and therefore much higher activity and single center polymerization behavior is observed . the reaction of the ansa - zirconocene meso-[C2H 4(4,7-Me2Indenyl)2]ZrMe2 with BC18F15 afforded , besides the expected ion pair with outward MeB(C6F5)3- anion , also a minor isomer ( molar fraction <nUm> ) with the bulky methylborate anion in the inward site . 2D 1H EXSY experiment revealed exchange between the two isomer , at T > <nUm> K , through the migration of the MeB(C 6F5)3- anion between outward and inward site . the presence of free BC18F15 fastened the exchange , suggesting BC18F15 attack on the zirconium bound methyl ligand of the two ion pair . novel zirconocene complex ( 1-Biph-3,4-Me2Cp ) 2ZrCl2 ( 3 ) , (C5Me5)(1-Biph-3,4- Me2Cp)ZrCl2 ( 4 ) , and (C5H5)(1-Biph- 3,4-Me2Cp)ZrCl2 ( 5 ) containing a 1-biphenyl-3,4- dimethylcyclopentadienyl ligand ( 2 ) have been prepared and their solid state structure were characterized by x-ray diffraction method . the crystal structure of <nUm> revealed a racemic , C2 - symmetric nature in the solid state . In ethylene polymerization , they all afforded high - density polyethylene with very high activity . especially , the catalytic property of <nUm> were most marked in term of both polymerization activity and molecular weight of polyethylene among them . they also showed good activity on the polymerization of propylene , but afforded nearly atactic , amorphous polypropylene with a little higher [mmmm] methyl pentad value by <nUm> and <nUm> than that by the most active <nUm> under the given reaction condition . characteristic of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) polymerization using oscillating zirconocene catalyst , (2-Ph-Ind)2ZrX2 ( x = Cl , <nUm> ; x = me , <nUm> ) , mixture of rac- and meso-zirconocene diastereomers , (SBI)ZrMe2 [ <nUm> , SBI = Me2Si(Ind)2 ] and (EBI)ZrMe2 [ <nUm> , EBI = C2H4(Ind)2 ] , a well a diastereospecific metallocene pair , rac-4 / Cp2ZrMe <nUm> ( 5 ) and rac - <nUm> / CGCTiMe2 [ <nUm> , CGC = me 2Si(Me4C5)(t-BuN) ] , are reported . MMA polymerization using the chloride catalyst precursor <nUm> activated with a large excess of the modified methyl aluminoxane is sluggish , uncontrolled , and produce atactic PMMA . on the other hand , the polymerization by a <nUm> / <nUm> ratio of <nUm> / BC18F15 or <nUm> / Ph3CB(C 6F5)4 is controlled and produce syndiotactic PMMA . mixture of diastereomeric ansa - zirconocenes <nUm> or <nUm> containing various rac / meso ratio , when activated with BC18F15 , yield bimodal PMMA ; this behavior is attributed to the meso-diastereomer that , in it pure form , affords bimodal , syndio-rich atactic PMMA . for MMA polymerization using diastereospecific metallocene pair , rac - <nUm> / <nUm> and rac - <nUm> / <nUm> , the isospecific catalyst site dominates the polymerization event under the condition employed in this study , and the aspecific and syndiospecific site are largely nonproductive , thereby forming only highly isotactic PMMA . (Butadiene)zirconocene is observed to exist a an equilibrium mixture of ( s-cis- ) and (s-trans-e4-C4H6)ZrCl <nUm> isomer . the system add a variety of unsaturated organic reagent to form metallacyclic (allyl)metallocene product . In some case , a second equivalent of a reagent is taken up , which form the basis of a variety of useful template coupling reaction of butadiene at the bent metallocene framework . the lewis acid BC18F15 add to (butadiene)zirconocene and to a great variety of butadiene complex of ansa - metallocenes and related system to give zwitterionic metallocene- butadiene-borate betaine . most of these system are active homogeneous ziegler - natta olefin polymerization catalyst , that do not require additional activation . catalyst activity are often in a similar range to those observed for other catalyst activation procedure used in this chemistry . In the case of the (butadiene)metallocene / BC18F15 system we can often observe the first olefin insertion step . this feature wa utilized to carry out a variety of mechanistic study of the essential carbon-carbon coupling step that take place at such bent metallocene catalyst system . even reaction with the functionalized monomer methylmetacrylate could be followed in this way . some chelate ligand late metal system were also included in these study . however , these system mostly behaved differently , even in case where some structural similarity were observed . benz[f]indenyl zirconium complex have been successfully synthesized and characterized . their catalytic activity were evaluated for the polymerization of ethylene . the complex combined with MAO can be highly active single site catalyst , which display activity comparable with that of the cp 2ZrCl2 / MAO system and provide very high molecular weight polyethylene . the melting point of the polymer indicates the formation of linear polyethylene . treatment of zirconocene dichloride [ e5-C 5(CH3)4CH2CH2N(CH 3)2][e5-C5(CH3) 5]ZrCl2 ( 1 ) with amalgamated magnesium in THF result in cleavage of a C-H bond in one of the methyl group of the CH3N <nUm> fragment yielding [ e5:e2(C,N)-C 5(CH3)4CH2CH2N(CH 3)CH2][e5-C5(CH 3)5]ZrH ( 2 ) . an analogous reduction of [ e5-C5(CH3)4CH 2CH2N(CH3)2]2ZrCl <nUm> ( 4 ) proceeds similarly only in the presence of great excess of C3H9P , otherwise no identifiable product are formed . heterogeneous reaction of the hydride complex <nUm> with ClH4N in THF produce the corresponding chloride complex [ e5 : e2(C,N)-C5(CH3)4CH 2CH2N(CH3)CH2][e5- C5(CH3)5]ZrCl ( 3 ) , with the Zr - CH2 bond retained . the molecular structure of compound <nUm> and <nUm> were established by x-ray diffraction analysis . reaction pathway for the formation of zirconocene phosphinidene complex Cp2Zr(PR3)PR from Cp2ZrCl2 and HLi and LiPRH and it reactivity to 1,2-dichloroethane are explored with density functional theory using model structure that are devoid of substituents . after the initial Cp2Zr(Cl)PH2 is generated with HLiP <nUm> reaction with HLi is likely to eliminate ClH in a single step to give directly the 16-electron complex Cp2ZrPH , which is stabilized by the H3P phosphine ligand . the intermediate formation of a phosphine hydride complex , Cp2Zr(H)PH2 resulting from hydride substitution , is unlikely both on the basis of unfavorable reaction energy and calculated 31P NMR chemical shift that indicate that such a specie can not have been observed experimentally . it is likely that a diphosphine complex , Cp2Zr(PH2)2 , result on using an excess of the lithium phosphide , which on H - transfer give directly the phosphine - stabilized phosphinidene complex . the reactivity of this specie is dominated by the release of it stabilizing phosphine ligand to give a highly reactive 16-electron phosphinidene complex , Cp2ZrPH , which reacts with 1,2-dichloroethane after coordination to one of the chlorine atom in two asynchronous metathesis step to the three - membered phosphirane ring . In this process , Cl2Zr is reformed enabling it recycling to regenerate the phosphinidene complex . this study highlight the special reactivity of the 16-electron Cp2ZrPH and suggests that related complex may be generated similarly , thereby expanding the synthetic potential of these nucleophilic reagent . fluorofluorenes [ 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8-octafluoro-9-(pentafluorophenyl)-9H- fluorene ( OFPF ) , 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8-octafluoro-9-(2,4-trifluoromethylphenyl)-9H- fluorene ( OFTF ) , and 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8-octafluorofluorene ( OFF ) ] react with sodium hydride or with lithium alkyl to give fluorofluorenyl anion which have been characterized in solution by <nUm> F NMR spectroscopy . OFPF is deprotonated by ethylenediamine , by HMPT and by 1,7-diazo-bicyclo(5,4)-undec-7- ene ( DBU ) , a shown by <nUm> H and <nUm> F NMR spectrometry . the new compound [ rac-ethylene-bis(e <nUm> -4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl ) ] diallylzirconium(IV) ( ZRAL ) , a prepared from [ rac-ethylene- bis(e <nUm> -4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl)]dichloridezirconium(IV) and allylmagnesium chloride , undergoes allyl abstraction with OFPF , CPh <nUm> [ B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , and B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> forming zirconium - containing cation , a established by <nUm> H and <nUm> F NMR spectrometry . toluene / pentafluoroanisole solution of the fluorinated anion , in combination with ZRAL , catalyze the polymerization of ethylene , with an activity comparable to that of MAO or CPh <nUm> [ B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , a remarkable increase of activity being observed with the ZRAL / OFPF system . Bis-(1,2-(RMe <nUm> OSi ) <nUm> )ZrCl <nUm> complex with r = me-(5a) , iPr-(5b) and tBu-(5c) have been synthesised in good yield and characterised . compound 5a-c are the first synthesised example of multi-siloxy-substituted cyclopentadienyl metallocenes . the siloxy-substituents have a for siloxy substituted metallocenes unique steric arrangement , with one almost in the same plane , and the other nearly perpendicular to the plane of the cyclopentadienyl ligand of the zirconocene . the ethylene / 1-hexene co-polymerisation activity using methylalumoxane a co-activator give low activity , with compound 5c ( <nUm> kg(PE) / g(Zr) / h ) being the most active . methodology is described for the preparation of a rigid C 2-bridged zirconocene catalyst system where the C2 - bridge is embedded in a spirane scaffold . the ligand wa prepared from 3,4-dihydro-2H-fluoren-1(9H)-one . initially , the oxo group wa converted into a spirocyclobutanone function . further conversion to a fulvene wa followed by regio- and stereoselective saturation to provide the ligand cis-2- (cyclopentadienyl)-1',2',3',4'-tetrahydro-9H- spiro[cyclobutane-1,1'-fluorene] . the ligand wa dilithiated and reacted with zirconium tetrachloride to provide the corresponding ( e5- cyclopentadienyl)-spiro[cyclobutane-1,1'-(e5-fluorenyl)] zirconium dichloride complex . the structure of the zirconocene dichloride ha been established by crystal x-ray analysis . the recent finding that the powerfully electrophilic zirconocene equivalent known a " Cp2Zr " is capable of transforming vinyl furanosides and pyranosides into enantiomerically pure , highly functionalized cis-2-vinyl cyclobutanols and cyclopentanols ha been extended in a number of direction . the synthetic potential of this methodology is illustrated by the variety of carbocycles that can be produced , ranging from cyclobutanones , a carbacyclic nucleoside , cyclooctane polyols , and medium - ring carbohydrate mimic . many of the key transformation are evaluated in term of transition state energetics . an improved synthesis of <nUm> and <nUm> is described that allows access to these complex in multigram quantity necessary for catalytic application . the crystal structure of <nUm> and <nUm> are compared and the conformational preference of the ligand , that are important for catalytic application , are discussed . complex <nUm> wa evaluated a a catalyst for carbomagnesation reaction . metallocene alkyl cation for polymerization of olefin posse two active site involved in migratory insertion . site epimerization , with an inversion at the metal atom , is considered to be one of the major cause for break - down of the alternating propagation model , resulting in stereoerrors whenever the two catalytic site have substantially different enantioface selectivity . density functional theory ha been used to determine the intrinsic reaction coordinate that connects the optimized minimum and transition state of inversion in the parent ansa - zirconocene [{H2C(Cp)2}Zr-Pr]+ ( Pr = n-propyl ) . these calculation yield a three - step reaction path for site epimerization . starting from the pyramidal b-agostic complex , an activated rotation around the Zr-Pr bond first produce an a-agostic conformation . continued rotation lead to an equivalent second a-agostic intermediate and then finally to the inverted b-agostic complex . the second step is rate - determining and proceeds through a planar three - coordinate transition state . In the case of [{H2C(Cp)2}Zr-iBu]+ ( iBu = iso-butyl ) , the situation is more complicated , because there are several interconvertible a- , b- and g-agostic intermediate , but the rate - limiting step is again an inversion process connecting two different a-agostic conformers with the alkyl group on opposite enantiosides . for both ansa - zirconocene catalyst , the computed free - energy barrier for epimerization are around 11-12 kcal / mol and almost independent of temperature , while those for insertion increase with temperature due to the entropic cost of association . according to the computational result for the isolated catalyst , insertion remains favored over epimerization for the experimentally relevant temperature range in the n-propyl case , whereas both process are competitive in the iso-butyl case . inclusion of bulk solvent effect by a continuum solvation model doe not affect the result much , while explicit consideration of a coordinating counterion cause larger change . the present model calculation on the role of site epimerization should thus be most relevant for propene polymerization with non-coordinating counterions . the dialkyl complex , [ Zr { r ( H ) C ( e5 - C5 me4 ) ( e5 - C5 H4 ) } R2' ] ( r = pri , R' = me ( 2a ) , CH2Ph ( 3a ) ; r = bun , R' = me ( 2b ) , CH2Ph ( 3b ) ; r = but , R' = me ( 2c ) , CH2Ph ( 3c ) ; r = ph , R' = me ( 2d ) . synthesis of rigid ansa - zirconocene precatalyst system with a C2 - bridge embedded in a spirane scaffold is described . fulvenes were key intermediate in regio- and stereoselective preparation of the appropriate spirane ligand . substitution in the cyclopentadienyl group in the ligand wa effected by fulvene methodology . the zirconocenes were active precatalysts for the polymerisation of propene when activated with MAO . the structure of the parent zirconocene dichloride ha been verified by x-ray crystal analysis . A series of chiral ansa - zirconocene ester enolate complex incorporating C2- or Cs - symmetric ligand , including neutral rac - (EBI)ZrCl[OC(OiPr){double bond , long}CMe2 ] ( 1 ) , rac - (EBI)Zr(OTf)[OC(OiPr){double bond , long}CMe2 ] ( 2 ) , rac - (EBI)Zr(OTf)[OC(OMe){double bond , long}C(Me)CH2C(Me2)C(OiPr){double bond , long}O ] ( 3 ) , [Me2C(Cp)(Flu)]ZrMe[OC(OiPr){double bond , long}CMe2 ] ( 4 ) , and cationic [Me2C(Cp)(Flu)]Zr+(THF)[OC(OiPr){double bond , long}CMe2][MeB(C6F5)3]- ( 5 ) , have been synthesized . within the neutral C2 - ligated zirconocene ester enolate series , the chloride derivative <nUm> is inactive toward any methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) addition , the methyl derivative rac - (EBI)ZrMe[OC(OiPr){double bond , long}CMe2 ] add cleanly only <nUm> equiv. of MMA , and the triflate derivative <nUm> can add either <nUm> equiv. of MMA to form the single - MMA - addition product <nUm> or multiple equivalent of MMA to form P(MMA) . unlike the Cs - ligated methyl cation [Me2C(Cp)(Flu)ZrMe]+ , which is inactive for MMA polymerization under various condition , the Cs - ligated ester enolate cation <nUm> is moderately active for polymerization of MMA and N,N-dimethylacrylamide at ambient temperature ; the resulting P(MMA) ha a high molecular weight of Mn = <nUm> <nUm> Da but a low syndiotacticity of [rr] = <nUm> % , and the polymerization conforms to a chain - end control mechanism . group <nUm> metallocene complex can form adduct or condensation product with a variety of typical biogenic molecule . In this account , example are presented and discussed for the reaction of zirconocene or titanocene complex with suitably protected / deprotected carbohydrate derivative . some methodological development are shown for the attachment of aminoacid or peptide derived functional group at the cp - ring of the group <nUm> bent metallocenes . eventually , the reaction of methylzirconocene- and methyltitanocene cation with a series of short oligopeptides are discussed that lead to the formation of primary kO - adduct followed by O,N,O - chelate complex formation with methane evolution . the dynamic feature of some such system are discussed . A mixture of tertiary alkyl halide and 2-methylene-1,3-dithiane wa treated with butylmagnesium bromide in the presence of a catalytic amount of zirconocene dichloride . the reaction resulted in alkylative dimerization to yield the corresponding vic - bis(dithiane) . the reaction would proceed a follows . A single electron transfer from low - valent zirconocene to alkyl halide would generate the corresponding alkyl radical . the radical add to 2-methylene-1,3-dithiane to afford the corresponding radical stabilized by the two sulfur atom . A couple of the stable radical finally undergo dimerization . the effect that a solvent ha on reaction of Cp2Zr{(m-H)2BHR}2 and Cp2ZrH{(m-H)2BHR} ( r = CH3 , ph ) with BC18F15 ha been studied . from the reaction in benzene the metathesis product Cp2Zr{(m-H)2B(C6F5)2}2 , <nUm> , wa isolated . In the case of diethyl ether , different hydride abstraction product , including [Cp2Zr(OEt2){(m-H)2BHPh}][HB(C6F5)3] , <nUm> , [Cp2Zr(OEt2){(m-H)2BHCH3}][HB(C6F5)3] , <nUm> , [Cp2Zr(OEt2){(m-H)2BH2}][HB(C6F5)3] , <nUm> , and [Cp2Zr(OEt)(OEt2)][HB(C6F5)3] , <nUm> , were isolated depending on the starting zirconocene complex . the diethyl ether molecule of 3-6 are weakly coordinated to Zr and displaced in THF solution . isolation of <nUm> and <nUm> is attributed to their fast precipitation from the reaction mixture , which prevented further reaction from occurring . In addition to the hydride abstraction , a hydride metathesis wa also involved in the formation of <nUm> . time - elapsed 11B NMR study indicate that <nUm> and <nUm> are the intermediate on the pathway to <nUm> and <nUm> . the molecular structure of 2-6 were determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . reaction of alkynyllithium with zirconocene dichloride in the presence of quinone afforded zirconoenediynes in good yield . treatment of the zirconoenediyne with p-chloranil in the presence of ClCu afforded 1,1,4,4-tetraethynyl-1,3-diene in good yield . In the presence of ClCu and / or Pd(PPh3)4 , the zirconoenediynes could be transformed into various enediyne derivative through coupling reaction with electrophiles . the chiral , terpenoid - substituted yttrocene [(e5-neomenthylCp)2Y{o-C6H4CH2NMe2}] ( 1 ) can be prepared via facile arene elimination starting from [Y(o-C6H4CH2NMe2)3] . compound <nUm> retains a C1 - symmetric structure in solution on the NMR time scale , due to tight binding of the amine donor . the (-)-phenylmenthyl-substituted complex [(e5-(-)-phenylmenthylCp)2Y(m-Cl)2Li(OEt2)2] ( 5 ) and [(e5-(-)-phenylmenthylCp)2YN(SiMe3)2] ( 6 ) were prepared via salt metathesis . reaction of Cl3Y with the planar chiral (1-neomenthylindenyl)lithium predominantly produced a single , C2 - symmetric , racemic - like diastereomer . the x-ray crystal structure analysis confirmed that [(e5-(+)-NMInd)2Y(m-Cl)2Li(Et2O)2] ( 7 ) represents the same p-S , p-S metallocene diastereomer and adopts a very similar conformation a observed by erker in his zirconocene complex . complex <nUm> reacts with LiN(SiMe3)2 to form [(e5-(+)-NMInd)2YN(SiMe3)2] ( 8 ) with retention of configuration . complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> showed moderate to good catalytic activity in asymmetric hydroamination / cyclizations of aminoalkenes , but enantioselectivities were limited to a maximum of <nUm> % ee for the sterically most hindered catalyst <nUm> . the indenyl complex <nUm> is prone to protolytic loss of an indenyl ligand at low ( ≤ <nUm> % ) catalyst loading , if sterically undemanding aminoalkene substrate are applied . formal [3+2] cycloaddition reaction between the bis-sulfonium zirconocene -
