ate dimer { A figure is presented } 1a and methylpropiolate , benzaldehyde and carbon disulfide afforded stable zwitterionic phosphonium zirconocene - ate complex 2-4 , respectively , with two orthocondensed five - membered heterocycle . x-ray crystal structure of <nUm> ha been determined . elemental chalcogens ( S , Se , Te ) gave rise also to a new variety of five - coordinate zirconium(IV) complex ( 5-7 ) by a formal [3+1] cycloaddition reaction . In these bicyclic zirconates , sulfur is included in a five - membered ring while the second chalcogen is in a four - membered one . the unimolecular isomerization mechanism from a secondary <nUm> → <nUm> propene unit promoted by the prototype zirconocene system H2SiCp2Zr+(P) ( P = polymeryl chain ) ha been investigated by using density functional theory calculation ( B3LYP ) for both gas and solvent phase . the typical route occurring through b-hydrogen elimination to the metal , olefin rotation around the metal center and olefin reinsertion into the metal hydrogen bond ha been calculated by using QM / MM calculation with the ONIOM model in the presence of the counterion CH3 B(C6 F5)3- and compared to the alternative intramolecular reversible formation of a zirconocene allyl dihydrogen complex . our calculation show that the alternative route remains energetically le accessible , at least for the prototype metallocene system used here . the reaction of the bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)methylzirconium cation ( 1 ) with four imines have been studied in the gas phase by fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry . reactivity of the bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)methylzirconium cation is governed by the availability of a labile hydrogen in the corresponding imine . the product observed differ from those that might be expected in analogy with earlier work on ketone , aldehyde and alkene ( e.g. , zirconocene e3-enolate and e3-allyl complex ) : azomethyne / benzylidene specie are found instead of enamine ; however , the general reaction mechanism resembles that proposed for ketone and alkene . an elimination reaction leading to final product wa shown to be preceded by a fast migratory insertion / deinsertion equilibrium for alkyl-substituted imines . such an equilibrium is not possible for aryl-substituted imines due to lack of lability of the aryl group and thus only methane elimination wa observed for these imines . A unique p-conjugative interaction pattern wa experimentally revealed in the doubly acetylide - bridged binuclear group <nUm> metallocene complex , which wa involved in C-C coupling / cleavage reaction of acetylides and s-alkynyl migration . to elucidate how this multi-center bonding network affect the structural and reaction property of these complex , density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation and molecular orbital ( MO ) analysis were carried out on the electronic structure and s-alkynyl migration mechanism of the doubly acetylide - bridged binuclear Zr complex , (L2Zr)2(m-C{triple bond , long}CH)2 ( L = cp , Cl ) . the B3LYP calculation suggested that the doubly [s,p] acetylide - bridged complex C2h-(L2Zr)2(m-C{triple bond , long}CH)2 wa produced by the reaction of L2Zr(C{triple bond , long}CH)2 with L2Zr through a C2v-(L2Zr)2(m-C{triple bond , long}CH)2 intermediate followed by an isomerization process . In particular , the isomerization of c2h- or C2v-(L2Zr)2(m-C{triple bond , long}CH)2 is almost thermoneutral through a low barrier of <nUm> - <nUm> kcal / mol . the MO walsh diagram revealed that the two isomer have a very similar six-center-six-electron bonding network . the coplanar p-conjunctive interaction by the electron donating and back - donating interaction between the metal center and acetylide ligand significantly stabilizes the doubly acetylide - bridged binuclear group <nUm> metallocene complex and the isomerization transition state . the ansa-bis(cyclopentadiene) compound , , Li2{Me2Si(C5Ph4)(C5H3R)} ( r = H ( 4 ) ; but ( 5 ) ) , by the action of n-butyllithium . the ansa - zirconocene complex , [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Ph4)(e5-C5H3R)}Cl2] ( r = H ( 6 ) ; but ( 7 ) ) , were synthesized from the reaction of Cl4Zr with <nUm> or <nUm> , respectively . compound <nUm> and <nUm> have been tested in the polymerization of ethylene and compared with their methyl-substituted the extraction of a methyl group from the zirconocene complex to form the cationic active specie is endothermic and therefore unfavourable . the reaction of the metallocene dichloride [(e5-C5H5)2MCl2] , m = Ti and Zr , with the 1,4-di-tert-butyl-1,4-diazabuta-1,3-diene radical anion ( lithium complex ) in diethyl ether reveal a reactivity difference within the series , yielding [(C5H5)TiCl{(t-BuNCH)2}] and [(C5H5)2Zr{(t-BuNCH)2}] through the elimination of C5H5Li and / or ClLi , respectively . we report the x-ray crystal structure of these complex , and discus their reactivity pattern and solution fluxional property . from the reaction of super hydride ( LiBEt3H ) with 6-(4-methoxyphenyl) fulvene ( 1a ) , 6-(2-fluoro-4-methoxyphenyl) fulvene ( 1b ) , and 6-(4-N,N-dimethylaminophenyl) fulvene ( 1c ) lithiated cyclopentadienide intermediate ( 2a-c ) were synthesised . these intermediate were then transmetallated to zirconium with Cl4Zr to give benzyl-substituted zirconocenes bis-[(4-methoxybenzyl)cyclopentadienyl] zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 3a ) , bis-[(2-fluoro-4-methoxybenzyl)cyclopentadienyl] zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 3b ) and bis-[(4-N,N-dimethylaminobenzyl)cyclopentadienyl] zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 3c ) . all three zirconocenes were characterised by single crystal x-ray diffraction and preliminary in vitro cell test were performed with the zirconocene derivative on the LLC-PK cell line in order to determine their cytotoxicity . zirconocenes 3b and 3c did not show cytotoxicity up to a concentration of <nUm> mM , while 3a exhibited an C50I value of <nUm> mM against LLC-PK . synthesis of rac / meso-{PhP(3-t-Bu-C5H3)2}Zr{Me3SiN(CH2)3NSiMe3} ( rac-3 / meso-3 ) and rac / meso-{PhP(3-t-Bu-C5H3)2}Zr{PhN(CH2)3NPh} ( rac-4 / meso-4 ) were achieved by metallation of K2[PhP(3-t-Bu-C5H3)2] · <nUm> THF ( 2 ) with Zr{RN(CH2)3NR}Cl2(THF)2 ( where r = SiMe3 or ph , respectively ) using ethereal solvent . these isomeric pair were characterized by 1H , 13C{1H} , and 31P{1H} NMR spectroscopy ; rac-3 and rac-4 were also examined via single crystal x-ray crystallography . the structure of rac-3 and rac-4 are notable in the tendency of the cyclopentadienyl ring towards e3 coordination . while isolated sample of rac-3 / meso-3 and rac-4 / meso-4 slowly isomerize in tetrahydrofuran-d8 to equilibrium ratio , the isomerization rate for <nUm> is more than 15-fold greater than that for <nUm> . In addition , equilibrium ratio are rapidly reached when isolated sample of rac-3 / meso-3 and rac-4 / meso-4 are exposed to tetrabutylammonium chloride in tetrahydrofuran-d8 solvent . we propose that a nucleophile ( either chloride or the phosphine interannular linker ) brings about dissociation of one cyclopentadienyl ring , thus promoting the rac / meso isomerization mechanism . new metallocene dichloride [ e5-(1,4-Me2-2,3-Ph2-C5H )2TiCl2 ] ( 2 ) , [ e5-(1,4-Me2-2,3-Ph2-C5H )2ZrCl2 ] ( 3 ) and [ e5-(1,4-Me2-2,3-Ph2-C5H )e5-(C5H5)ZrCl2 ] ( 4 ) were prepared from lithium salt of 1,4-dimethyl-2,3-diphenylcyclopentadiene ( 1 ) and [TiCl3(THF)3] , [ZrCl4] and [e5-(C5H5)ZrCl3(DME)] , respectively . compound 2-4 were characterized by NMR spectroscopy , EI-MS and IR spectroscopy , and the solid state structure of <nUm> wa determined by single crystal x-ray crystallography . the catalytic system <nUm> / MAO and <nUm> / MAO were almost inactive in polymerization of ethylene at 30-50 ° C , however , they exhibited high activity at temperature <nUm> ° C . the catalyst formed from <nUm> and excess of MAO wa practically inactive at all temperature . 2,4,5-Tri(t-butyl)-1,3-diphospholyl sodium salt ( 2a ) and 3,5-di(t-butyl)-1,2,4-triphospholyl sodium salt ( 3a ) react with Cl4Zr and CpZrCl3 to form (e5-2,4,5-tri(t-butyl)-1,3-diphospholyl)ZrCl3 ( 4 ) , Cp(e5-2,4,5-tri(t-butyl)-1,3-diphospholyl)ZrCl2 ( 5 ) , and Cp(e5-3,5-di(t-butyl)-1,2,4-triphospholyl)ZrCl2 ( 6 ) in the complete absence of water , respectively . surprisingly , bent sandwich complex <nUm> exhibit the NMR spectroscopic characteristic of a hindered ring ligand rotation but the cyclopentadienyl ligand of <nUm> rotates freely in the NMR time scale in spite of the superior space demand of it 2,4,5-tri(t-butyl)-1,3-diphospholyl ligand . this contradiction is discussed on the basis of an attractive interligand P-C interaction between homo- and heterocyclic p-ligands , which is stronger for <nUm> . water even in trace amount present in the reaction mixture change the course of the reaction completely . No zirconium p-complexes are accessible this way , but only oligo- or polycyclic organophosphorus compound . compound 3a and Cl4Zr form the asymmetric tricyclic P6(t-BuC)4H2 isomer <nUm> with two p{double bond , long}C double bond a a dimer of 1,2,4-triphosphol . it is accompanied by small amount of ClH addition product <nUm> , where one of the p{double bond , long}C double bond is eliminated . compound <nUm> contains six , and <nUm> eight stereogenic center , but both form one pair of enantiomer each only . A single stereoisomer of P6(t-BuC)4H2 cage <nUm> is formed if (1-trimethylstannyl)-3,5-di(t-butyl)-1,2,4-triphosphol 3b is used a the P3(t-BuC)2 source in combination with Cp*ZrCl3 in the presence of trace amount of water . compound <nUm> is a meso-compound , which is composed by dimerization of either two homochiral unit of (R)-3,5-di(t-butyl)-1,2,4-triphosphol 3cR or by two unit of it s-enantiomer 3cS . No trace of cyclic addition product ha been identified , which would represent the heterochiral combination of enantiomer 3cR + 3cS . P2- and P3 - zirconocene dichloride derivative <nUm> and <nUm> have been tested a ziegler - natta alkene oligomerization catalyst . both are catalytically active with 1-hexene a the substrate , but can not compete with the activity of the phosphorus - free original catalyst Cp2ZrCl2 . zirconocene and titanocene bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate)s were synthesized . In contrast to the corresponding triflates and perchlorate , these compound are air- and water - stable . they were proved to be ionic on the basis of conductivity measurement and x-ray analysis , allowing these complex to be stored for month . the strong lewis acidity of these cationic metallocene specie , which wa proved by ESR study , enabled catalytic glycosylation . the allyl-substituted group <nUm> metal complex [M{(R)CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] [ m = Ti , r = CH2CH{double bond , long}CH2 , ( 2 ) ; r = CH2C(CH3){double bond , long}CH2 ( 3 ) ; m = Zr , r = CH2CH{double bond , long}CH2 ( 4 ) , r = CH2C(CH3){double bond , long}CH2 ( 5 ) ] have been synthesized by the reaction of allyl ansa - magnesocene derivative and the tetrachloride salt of the corresponding transition metal . the dialkyl complex [ m ( r ) CH ( e5 - C5 me4 ) ( e5 - C5 H4 ) R2' ] [ m = Ti , r = CH2 = C2H3 , R' = me ( 6 ) , R' = CH2Ph ( 7 ) ; r = CH2C(CH3){double bond , long}CH2 , R' = me ( 8 ) , R' = CH2Ph ( 9 ) ; m = Zr , r = CH2CH{double bond , long}CH2 , R' = me ( 10 ) , R' = CH2Ph ( 11 ) ; r = CH2C(CH3){double bond , long}CH2 , R' = me ( 12 ) , R' = CH2Ph ( 13 ) ] have been synthesized by the reaction of the corresponding ansa - metallocene dichloride complex 2-5 and two molar equivalent of the alkyl grignard reagent . compound 2-5 reacted with H under catalytic condition ( wilkinson 's catalyst or Pd / C ) to give the hydrogenation product [M{(R)CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] [ m = Ti and r = C3H7 ( 14 ) or r = C4H9 ( 15 ) ; m = Zr and r = C3H7 ( 16 ) or r = C4H9 ( 17 ) ] . the reactivity of 2-5 ha also been tested in hydroboration and hydrosilylation reaction . the hydroboration reaction of <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> with 9-borabicyclo[3.3.1]nonane ( 9-BBN ) yielded the complex [M{(9-BBN)CH2CH(R)CH2CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] [ m = Ti and r = H ( 18 ) ; m = Zr and r = H ( 19 ) or r = CH3 ( 20 ) ] . the reaction with the silane reagent HSiMe2Cl gave the corresponding [M{ClMe2SiCH2CHRCH2CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] [ m = Ti and r = H ( 21 ) ; m = Zr and r = H ( 22 ) or r = CH3 ( 23 ) ] . the reaction of <nUm> with t-BuMe2SiOH produced a new complex [Zr{t-BuMe2SiOSi(Me2)CH2CH2CH2CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] ( 24 ) through the formation of Si-O-Si bond . on the other hand , reactivity study of some zirconocene complex were carried out , with the insertion reaction of phenyl isocyanate ( PhNCO ) into the zirconium-carbon s-bond of [Zr{(n-Bu)CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}2Me2] ( 25 ) giving [{(n-Bu)CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)]}Zr{Me{k2-O,N-OC(Me)NPh} ] a a mixture of two isomer 26a-b . the reaction of [Zr{(n-Bu)(H)C(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}(CH2Ph)2] ( 27 ) with CO also provided a mixture of two isomer [{(n-Bu)CH(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)]}Zr(CH2Ph){k2-O,C-COCH2Ph} ] 28a-b . the molecular structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . reaction of Sn[(N(C6H3iPr2-2,6)(SiMe3)]2 and [{Sn(N(C6H3iPr2-2,6)(SiMe3)(m-Cl)2] with di-n-butyl-dicyclopentadienylzirconium yielded the trimetallic a carbene - like complex {[(N(C6H3iPr2-2,6)(SiMe3)](n-Bu)Sn}2Cp2Zr . the oxidation of {[(N(C6H3iPr2-2,6)(SiMe3)](n-Bu)Sn}2Cp2Zr by oxygen give the five - membered dioxadistannazirconacyclic complex {[(N(C6H3iPr2-2,6)(SiMe3)](n-Bu)Sn}2O2Cp2Zr . new ansa - zirconocene complex with amino ( 8-11 ) and alkoxy ( 12 ) substituents attached to the e5-bonded indenyl fragment have been synthesized by the reaction of Cl4Zr with the appropriate dilithium salt in toluene . In addition to HRMS , NMR spectroscopy , and elemental analysis , all new metallocenes have been characterized by single crystal x-ray analysis . crystallographic analysis showed that heteroatom substituents , especially those in the 3-position on the indenyl ligand , have a substantial effect on the structure of metallocenes leading to an increase in the gap aperture in those complex . slippage of the indenyl fragment toward e3-bonding wa found to correlate with the electron donating ability of the substituent in the 3-position , being larger for amino than alkoxy substituents . based upon the amount of slippage , 3-amino-substituted indenyl complex bear strong resemblance to a fluorenyl complex . the alkenyl substituted fulvene compound , (C5H4){double bond , long}CMe(CH2CH2CH{double bond , long}CMe2 ) ( 1 ) , reacts with one equivalent of LiMe to give the lithium derivative Li{C5H4(CMe2CH2CH 2CH{double bond , long}CMe2 ) } ( 2 ) . the reaction of <nUm> with Me2Si(C5Me4H)Cl gave the ansa - ligand precursor Me2Si(C5Me4H)(C5H <nUm> ( CMe2CH2CH2CH{double bond , long}CMe2 ) ) ( 3 ) , which after the subsequent reaction with <nUm> equivalent of LiBun yielded the dilithium salt Li2{Me2Si(C5Me4) ( C5H3(CMe2CH2CH2CH{double bond , long}CMe2 ) ) } ( 4 ) . the alkenyl-substituted zirconocene complex [ Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) ( e5-C5H3(CMe2CH2CH 2CH{double bond , long}CMe2))}Cl2 ] ( 5 ) wa synthesized by the equimolar reaction of <nUm> and Cl4Zr . <nUm> wa characterized by spectroscopic method and by single crystal x-ray diffraction study . the zirconocene compound <nUm> ha been tested a a catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene at different temperature and Al : Zr ratio , and also in the co-polymerization of ethylene and 1-octene , observing modest co-monomer incorporation . In addition , the cytotoxic activity of <nUm> wa tested against tumour cell line 8505C anaplastic thyroid cancer , A253 head and neck tumour , A549 lung carcinoma , A2780 ovarian cancer and DLD-1 colon carcinoma . complex <nUm> showed the best cytotoxic activity on A2780 ovarian cancer ( C50I value of <nUm> ± <nUm> mM ) . this represents the highest reported cytotoxic activity of a zirconocene complex on A2780 ovarian cancer . In addition , the cytotoxic activity of <nUm> , have been compared with those obtained using cisplatin . In the literature most of the dehydrogenation reaction of alkane are described a CH activation reaction of cyclooctane . the best result of CH activation reaction have been found for the reaction of MAO activated metallocene complex and cyclooctane at temperature over <nUm> ° C . the application of ansa amido functionalized half sandwich compound of the type Ind'Si(Me)2NtBuMCl2 ( ind' = monosubstituted indenyl ) ; m = Ti , Zr , Hf ) for CH and CC activation reaction is completely unknown in the literature . In contrast to the dehydrogenation reaction of cyclooctane and the metallocene complex of the group <nUm> metal , where the zirconocene complex give higher TONs than the titanocene complex the ansa amido functionalized titanium complex give more than two time higher TONs than the corresponding Zr or Hf complex . the ansa amido functionalized ligand increase the TONs for the Ti complex and decrease the TONs of the Zr complex . In contrast to the metallocene complex , the ansa amido functionalized dichloride complex of Ti show also a higher activity than the corresponding Zr complex . it is known that the photolysis of organometallic titanium , zirconium and hafnium ( IV ) compound can give M(III) radical . the formation of the active Ti metal centre is easier than in the case of the corresponding Zr and Hf metal compound . A new and facile method is presented for the synthesis of zirconocene carboxylate compound , in which zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) is dissolved in <nUm> m aqueous ClH solution and the requisite ligand is dissolved in an organic solvent . five such compound [ Cp2ZrCl(m2-O',O''C- C6H5 ) ] ( 1 ) , [ Cp2ZrCl(m2-O',O''C- C6Cl2H3 ) ] ( 2 ) , [ Cp2Zr(m2-O',O''C- C6H3(OH)Cl)2 ] ( 3 ) , [ Cp2Zr(m2-O',O''C- C6H3(OH)(NO2))2 ] ( 4 ) , and [ Cp2Zr(m2-O',O''C- C6H(OH)Cl3)2 ] ( 5 ) have been obtained by this method . the effect of pH on the stability of Cp2ZrCl2 in <nUm> m ClH solution ha been investigated by UV / vi spectrophotometry and 1H NMR spectrometry . the result showed that the aqueous Cp2ZrCl2 solution became le stable with increasing pH , liberating cyclopentadiene . accordingly , at higher pH ( ∼ <nUm> ) , two trinuclear zirconium monocyclopentadienyl compound , [ (CpZr)3(m2-O',O''C-C 6H3Cl2)3 (m3-OH)(m2-OH)3 ] C7Cl2H3O2 ( 6 ) and [ (CpZr)3(m2-O',O''C-C 6H4Cl)3(m3-OH) (m2-OH)3]Cl2*CH2 Cl (7),were obtained . all compound 1-7 have been characterized by FT-IR , 1H NMR spectrum and elemental analysis . In all of the compound , the aromatic acid act a a bidentate ligand in coordinating to the zirconium ; both chelating and bridging mode are observed . x-ray crystallographic study on <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> have revealed that the geometry at zirconium are distorted octahedral in <nUm> and <nUm> , and distorted trigonal - bipyramidal in <nUm> . the catalytic activity of the highly fluorous system formed by the zirconocene(IV) complex [Zr{e5-C5H4SiMe2C2H4RF}2Cl2] ( RF = C6F13 ( 4a ) , C10F21 ( 4b ) ) or [Zr-{e5-C5H3(SiMe2C2H4C6F13)2}2Cl2] ( 5a ) and MMAO in toluene have been studied and compared with analogous nonfluorous system generated from [Zr{e5-C5H4SiMe3}2Cl2] and [Zr{e5-C5H5}2Cl2] . although le active than the reference system , the fluorous catalyst are stable over prolonged polymerization time , giving rise to polymer with similar molecular weight to those obtained with [Zr{e5-C5H4SiMe3}2Cl2] . additive effect of diisobutylaluminum hydride ( DiBAL-H ) wa studied in copolymerization of propylene and 1,3-butadiene with a series of C 2-symmetric ansa - bis(indenyl)zirconocene derivative , i.e. , rac-dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-4-phenylindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 4Ph ) , dichloride , rac-dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-benzoindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( bz ) , rac-dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-indenyl) zirconium dichloride ( 2Me ) , rac-dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1-Ind ) , rac-ethylenebis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( et - ind ) , activated by modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) . without DiBAL-H , the activity of the copolymerization decreased in the following order , 2Me > 1-Ind > et - ind > 4Ph ≈ bz , whereas butadiene content decreased in the following order , 4Ph > bz ≥ et - ind ≥ 1-Ind > 2Me ≈ <nUm> mol % . the addition of DiBAL-H affected the activity but hardly changed the butadiene content . the copolymer obtained without DiBAL-H contained the butadiene unit of 1,2-insertion ( 1,2-BD ) and 1,4-insertion ( 1,4-BD ) . the addition of DiBAL-H decreased the amount of 1,4-BD and produced hydrogenated 1,4-BD in the 4Ph and bz system accompanied by the increase of the copolymerization activity . the additive effect of other alkylaluminums wa investigated in the bz system , and DEAL-H wa found to show the similar effect with DiBAL-H . the 13C NMR analysis of the polymer terminated with deutrated methanol indicated the hydroalumination of 1,4-BD in the bz system . hydroxyl group can be also introduced by oxidative cleavage of the Al-C bond . the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with 3,5-dicholorosalicylic acid in a CH2Cl2-Et2O system containing ClH ( <nUm> mol L-1 ) , give a cage half - sandwich cyclopentadienyl- zirconocene compound , [ (CpZr)6(m-O2C-C 6H2Cl2-2-O)9(OH2) 3]*H2O ( 1 ) . the crystal structure of <nUm> show a twisted tripyramidal prism cage structure with one water molecule in the cage 's cavity . In the cage , the dianionic , substituted salicylate ligand adopt a bridging chelate m2-(O , O' , O'' ) coordination mode . the cage half - sandwich cyclopentadienyl-zirconium compound , [ ( CpZr ) <nUm> ( m-O2C-C6H2Cl 2-2-O)9 (OH2)3]*H 2O ( 1 ) , wa synthesized and characterized . the x-ray diffraction analysis show that a dianionic , substituted salicylate ligand adopts a bridging chelate m2-(O , O' , O'' ) coordination mode and the twisted tripyramidal prism cage structure with one water molecule in the cage 's cavity . asymmetric alkylmethyl zirconocene derivative were readily synthesised from Cp2ZrCl(CH3) , and the appropriate alkyllithium reagent . the alkyl group contain a silyl functionality on the b-position . these asymmetric dialkyl zirconocenes were successfully activated by B(C 6F5)3 , selectively abstracting the methyl group . the clear difference in the 13C NMR resonance , due to the alkyl group on the cationic zirconocene made it possible to conclude that selective activation of this class of compound wa possible . friedel - craft cycloalkylation of fluorene with 1,4-dichlorobutane ha been studied in different condition . this reaction allows to obtain the product of exhausting fluorene alkylation , hexadecahydrotetrabenzo[a,c,d,f]fluorene - perspective e5 ligand . the simplest zirconocene ha been synthesized and it structure ha been confirmed by x-ray diffraction analysis . the molecule of this compound posse skewed conformation of metallocene fragment with the phenylene moiety of fluorenyl ligand oriented towards the front side of metallocene wedge . cp - functionalized monotroticenes [ ( e7-C7H 7)Ti(e5-C5H4E) ] ( <nUm> , e = ph 2SiCl ; <nUm> , e = tBu2SnCl ; <nUm> , e = I ) and bitroticenes [ (e7-C7H7)Ti(e5-C 5H4)]2E' ( <nUm> , E' = PPh ; <nUm> , E' = BN(SiMe3)2 ; <nUm> , E' = Cp2Ti ) were prepared by salt elimination metathesis between the monolithiated troticene [ (e7-C7H7)Ti(e5-C 5H4Li)]*pmdta ( 1b ) ( pmdta = N,N',N' , N'',N''-pentamethyldiethylene-triamine ) and the appropriate electrophile . the troticenyl-substituted zirconocene monochloride [ (e7-C7H7)Ti(e5-C 5H4ZrClCp*2 ) ] ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 ) ( 8 ) and hafnocene ethoxide [ (e7-C7H7)Ti{e5-C 5H4Hf(OEt)Cp2 } ] ( cp = e5-C 5H5 ) ( 11 ) , and the heterobimetallic m-oxo complex [ (e7-C7H7)Ti(e5-C 5H4MCp2)]2O ( <nUm> , m = Zr ; <nUm> , m = Hf ) were obtained instead of the expected zircona- and hafna[1]troticenophanes by reaction of the dilithiated troticene [ ( e7-C7H 6Li)Ti(e5-C5H4Li)]*pmdta ( 1a ) with [Cp2MCl2] ( m = Zr , Hf ) or [ cp* 2ZrCl2 ] in stoichiometric amount . these compound were characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction analysis and , in the case of <nUm> , <nUm> , 5-7 , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> , also by elemental analysis and 1H , 13C and 119Sn NMR spectroscopy . exposure of the troticenyl organotin chloride <nUm> to moisture resulted in it partial hydrolysis and formation of the organostannoxane - bridged bitroticene <nUm> , while palladium - catalyzed negishi C-C cross-coupling reaction between the troticenylzinc chloride [ ( e7-C7H7 ) Ti(e5-C5H4ZnCl) ] ( 13 ) and the iodotroticene <nUm> or iodobenzene ( PhI ) led to the fulvalene complex [ ( e7- C7H7)Ti(e5-C5H 4)]2 ( 14 ) and [ ( e7-C7H 7)Ti(e5-C5H4Ph) ] ( 15 ) . compound <nUm> display an unsymmetrical structure with the troticenyl fragment ci with respect to the Sn-O-Sn core , whereas compound <nUm> is centrosymmetrically trans oriented . the energy of formation and the heterolytic dissociation energy for the ion pair cp' 2ZrMe +A - ( active site in olefin polymerization ) in the presence of al- and B - containing activator including low-molecular-weight one X(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ( x = Al , B ) and a number of model for Al - site in polymethylaluminoxane ( MAO ) were obtained from DFT calculation . the reaction mechanism were thoroughly studied and the energy characteristic of the reaction of the ion pair cp' 2ZrMe +A - with ethylene molecule ( cp' = η 5-C 5H <nUm> , η 5- C 5Me <nUm> , A - = MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> - , MeAl(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> - , and [ ( C 6F <nUm> ) 3Al-Me- Al(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - or three model for anion in MAO - containing system [Me-AOTMA] - , [Me-2AOTMA] - , [Me-3AOTMA] - , AOTMA = me 2AlO(Al 2Me <nUm> ) ) were calculated . heterolytic dissociation energy ( energy needed for complete separation of counterions ) is found to be a crucial parameter which determines the energy characteristic of the polymerization reaction . we propose that the involvement of the second and third lewis acid Al - site in the formation of the ion pair could explain why high Al : Zr ratio ( > <nUm> for Al(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> and ≫ <nUm> for MAO ) are necessary for a high catalytic activity of zirconocenes , whereas for B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> an equimolar B : Zr ratio is quite sufficient . the reaction of a series of dimethyl zirconocenes [ me 2Si(Cp) 2ZrMe <nUm> , <nUm> ; cp t-bu 2ZrMe <nUm> , <nUm> ; cp n-bu 2ZrMe <nUm> , <nUm> ; ind 2ZrMe <nUm> , <nUm> ; cp me4 2ZrMe <nUm> , <nUm> ; cp 2ZrMe <nUm> , <nUm> ] with [ HNMe 2Ph][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] wa investigated by mean of NMR spectroscopy . it wa found that protonolysis of a Zr-Me group occurred generating a coordinative vacancy at the metal center and methane . cation coming from 1-4 dimethyl precursor bound NMe 2Ph , liberated from the protonation process , and formed zirconaaziridinium ion pair { [ me 2Si(Cp) 2Zr(e 2-CH 2NMePh)][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , <nUm> ; [ cp t-bu 2Zr(e 2-CH 2NMePh ) ] [ B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , <nUm> ; [ cp n-bu 2Zr(e 2-CH 2NMePh)][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , <nUm> ; [ ind 2Zr(e 2-CH 2NMePh)][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , <nUm> } , reasonably a a consequence of CH activation of one me group of coordinated NMe 2Ph and methane elimination . the intramolecular / interionic structure and dynamic of 7-10 ion pair were investigated by 1H , 13C and 19F 1D-and 2D - NMR technique . the reaction of <nUm> and <nUm> ion pair with 2-methyl-1-heptene afforded stable diastereoisomeric ion pair bearing a five - member azametallacycle . the guanidines (HNi-Pr)2CNAr ( Ar = 4-t-BuC6H <nUm> <nUm> , 4-BrC6H4 <nUm> and 2,4,6-Me3C 6H2 <nUm> ) have been used in the synthesis of the lithium salt [Li{i-PrN(HNiPr)CNAr}(THF)]2 4-6 and [ Li2{(Ni - Pr ) 2CNAr } ] 7-9 . complex [ Zr{k2,N,N'-(Ni-Pr) (NAr)CNH(i-Pr)}2Cl2 ] ( Ar = 4-t-BuC6H <nUm> <nUm> , 4-BrC6H4 <nUm> , 2,4,6-Me3C 6H2 <nUm> ) , which contain an asymmetrical monoanionic guanidinate ligand coordinated to the zirconium atom , were obtained by protonolysis of 1-3 in the presence of NEt3 or by a metathesis reaction of 4-6 with Cl4Zr . the zirconocene complex [ Zr(e5-C5H5)2{k 2,N,N'-(Ni-Pr)(NAr)CNH(i-Pr)}Cl ] ( Ar = 4-t-BuC 6H4 <nUm> , 4-BrC6H4 <nUm> , 2,4,6-Me 3C6H2 <nUm> ) and [ Zr(e5-C 5H5)2{k2,N,N'-(Ni-Pr) 2CNAr } ] ( Ar = 4-t-BuC6H4 <nUm> , 4-BrC 6H4 <nUm> , 2,4,6-Me3C6H2 <nUm> ) were synthesized by metathesis reaction of the corresponding lithium salt and Zr(e5-C5H5)2Cl2 . complex 16-18 exhibit dynamic behavior in solution and this wa studied by variable - temperature NMR experiment . the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . reaction between trimethylaluminum and selected zirconocene and hafnocene polymerization catalyst have been computationally studied at the MP2 / TZVP level of theory . dichloride precatalyst alkylation and the subsequent activation by ligand abstraction with trimethylaluminum were explored a a function of the catalyst structure . the alkylation reaction were found to proceed via two alternative route depending on the structure of the catalyst . concerning the activation of the alkylated precatalyst , interaction between trimethylaluminum and metallocene weakens the metal - ligand s-bond , hence facilitating olefin uptake to some extent . modification of the chemical environment of the lewis-acidic Al site towards environment likely present in methylaluminoxane further facilitates the reaction , supporting the critical role of methylaluminoxane in catalyst activation . the paper is devoted to a study of the reaction of terminal alkene cycloalumination by AlEt3 catalyzed with neomenthylindenyl zirconium complex (p-S)(p-S)-bis[e5-[1-[(1S,2S,5R)-2-isopropyl-5- methylcycloh-exyl]indenyl]]zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) or (p-S)-(e5- cyclopentadienyl)[e5-[1-[(1S,2S,5R)-2-isopropyl-5- methylcyclohexyl]indenyl]]zirconium dichloride ( 2 ) . it wa shown that alkene and catalyst structure , a well a solvent , affect the overall yield and enantiomeric excess of the reaction product - 3-alkylsubstituted aluminacyclopentanes . the reaction of terminal alkene with AlEt3 , catalyzed by complex <nUm> , in hydrocarbon solvent give predominantly s-enantiomers of cyclic organoaluminum compound with enantiomeric excess up to <nUm> % . complex <nUm> show smaller stereoinduction effect and provides r-enantiomers of aluminacyclopentanes with 6-26 % ee . the effectiveness of selenium - containing derivatizing reagent (R)-2-phenylselenopropanoic acid for the enantiomeric excess estimation in b-alkyl-1,4-butanediols obtained from cyclic organoaluminum compound wa shown . air - stable binuclear complex of bis(methylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium perfluorooctanesulfonate ( 1a ) wa successfully synthesized by the reaction of (CH3Cp)2ZrCl2 with C8F 17SO3Ag . the compound 1a wa characterized by different technique and found to have the nature of air - stability , water tolerance , thermally - stability and strong lewis-acidity . In addition , it solubility wa higher than that of our previously reported uninuclear zirconocene bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate) . it showed high catalytic efficiency in the friedel - craft acylation of alkyl aryl ether and the mannich reaction and could be reused . two different supported zirconocene , that is , bis(n-butylcyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 , catalyst were synthesized . each catalyst wa used to prepare one ethylene homopolymer and one ethylene-1-hexene copolymer . catalyst active center multiplicity and polymer crystallization kinetics were modeled . five separate active center type were predicted , which matched the successive self - nucleation and annealing ( SSA ) peak temperature . the predicted crystallinity well matched the differential scanning calorimetric ( DSC ) value for a single avrami - erofeev index , which ranged between <nUm> and <nUm> for the polymer experimented . the estimated apparent crystallization activation energy ea did not vary with cooling rate , relative crystallinity α , and crystallization time or temperature . therefore , the concept of variable / instantaneous activation energy wa not found to hold . ea linearly increased with the weight average lamellar thickness lwav DSC - GT ; and for each homopolymer , it exceeded that of the corresponding copolymer . higher ea , hence slower crystallization , wa identified a a pre-requisite to attain higher crystallinity . crystallization parameter were correlated to polymer backbone parameter , which are influenced by catalyst active center multiplicity . the silica - supported MAO wa in situ- and ex situ immobilized with zirconocene catalyst to produce ethylene copolymer . the in situ catalytic system exhibited higher activity compared with the ex situ one . the ethylene / 1-hexene ( EH ) copolymerization showed the highest activity for both catalytic system . 13C NMR revealed that the copolymer produced in all system were random copolymer . In addition , the in situ system resulted in narrow molar mass distribution ( MMD ) for all copolymer indicating a uniform catalytic site present . the present study revealed the effect of different O2Ti nanoparticles employed on catalytic and characteristic property of LLDPE / O2Ti nanocomposites synthesized by the in situ polymerization with zirconocene / dMMAO catalyst . it wa found that the presence of rutile phase in titania apparently resulted in decreased activity due to low intrinsic activity of active site being present . based on 13C NMR result , all LLDPE / O2Ti sample exhibited the random copolymer having different degree of 1-hexene insertion . the highly dispersion of titania can enhance the degree of 1-hexene insertion resulting in decreased crystallinity . In the present study , the nanoSiO2 and nanoZrO2 were used a the filler for linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) nanocomposites . In fact , the LLDPE nanocomposites were synthesized via the in situ polymerization of ethylene / 1-octene with a zirconocene / MAO catalyst in the presence of the filler . the LLDPE - nanocomposites were further characterized by mean of TEM , DSC , 13C NMR and XPS . it wa found that productivity increased more when the nanoZrO2 filler wa applied . the similar distribution for both filler wa observed by TEM . based on the 13C NMR result , it appeared that the LLDPE nanocomposites obtained from both filler were random copolymer . In particular , the resulted binding energy and elemental concentration at surface obtained from XPS measurement were further discussed in more detail . the controlled radical polymerization of methyl methacrylate initiated by the ferrocene - zirconocene dichloride-benzoyl peroxide system wa found to occur a a living radical process with an increased concentration of sindio-triads in the resulting poly(methyl methacrylate ) . comparative theoretical analysis of optimized geometry and electronic structure of Cp2ZrCl2 / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) system and it interaction with a third component wa performed . the additive studied wa a lewis acid compound : AlCl3 . density functional theory ( DFT ) , that included exchange and correlation effect , wa employed with gaussian basis set . additive enhances the cocatalyst lewis acid character and , indirectly , it modifies the electrophilicity of Zr atom . by comparing the geometrical structure and charge distribution of the site with and without AlCl3 it is possible to understand the reason of polymerization performance improvement . previous experimental result for these system have showed a notable increase in ethylene and propylene polymerization activity . In this paper , an electrochemical study of the metallocene / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and metallocene / trimethylaluminium ( TMA ) specie is presented . the metallocenes used were [ (CH3)2Si(Cp) 2ZrCl2 ] and [(Cp)2ZrCl2] . the evaluation of the metallocene / MAO and metallocene / TMA system wa based on the analysis of the redox potential of the solution with different Al / Zr molar ratio using acetonitrile a solvent . the result obtained for Al / Zr ratio lower than <nUm> , suggested that in presence of TMA or MAO , the formed monomethylated specie are [(L)ZrIV(CH3)Cl] , L = cyclopentadienyl (Cp)2 or (CH3)2Si(Cp) <nUm> . for Al / Zr molar ratio higher than <nUm> , the result obtained in TMA presence are in agreement with the formation of the specie [ (L)Zr IV(CH3)(m-CH3)Al(CH3) 2]+ , while in MAO presence the ionic pair , [ (L)Zr IVCH3]+[MAOCl]- , is formed . there 's a general agreement that these are active specie in olefin polymerization . functionalized metallocene precursor ( BrMe2SiC 5H4)CpZrBr2 ( 1 ) , ( BrMe2SiC 5H4)2ZrBr2 , ( 2 ) ( Br 2MeSiC5H4)2ZrBr2 ( 3 ) , and [1,3-(BrMe2Si)2C5H3] 2ZrBr2 ( 4 ) were immobilized on partially dehydroxylated silica ( PDS ) and screened for ethylene polymerization in slurry reaction conducted in toluene using methylalumoxane ( MAO ) a the cocatalyst . the effect of metallocene precursor structure , catalyst immobilization method , and catalyst loading are presented in term of catalytic activity , polymer molecular weight distribution , and stability of the catalyst toward leaching . the catalytic cyclo-oligomerization of ethene by metallocene complex Cp2ZrCl2 with Et3Al a cocatalyst in the presence of Mg - containing third - component is described . under optimal condition ( Cp2ZrCl2 / Et3Al / Et2Mg = <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> , <nUm> ° C , C2H4P = <nUm> MPa ) the reaction afforded <nUm> % of cyclic oligomers , including exo-methylenecyclopentane ( <nUm> % ) and a small amount of methylcyclopentane ( <nUm> % ) , 1-methyl-1-ethylcyclopentane ( <nUm> % ) and vinylcyclohexane ( <nUm> % ) , along with usual open - chain alkene . when the p-ligand wa changed to e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl and indenyl ( ind ) or Cp2TiCI2 wa used in place of cp 2ZrCl2 , the selectivity of exo-methylenecyclopentane dropped dramatically to 1-8 % . In contrast , the catalytic reaction by post-metallocene complex L2ZrCl2 ( L2 = salen , salphen ) under identical condition generated open - chain alkene exclusively . A zirconacyclopentane mechanism is proposed to explain the product formed in cyclo-oligomerization of ethene . this work present a 23-1 factorial planning designed to evaluate the effect of some parameter of the metallocene immobilization route in the ethylene polymerization . the highest ethylene polymerization activity wa observed for the catalyst synthesized using TMA a modifier agent , in the inverse addition order , and impregnation temperature of <nUm> ° C . these result indicated that the immobilization route played an important role on the catalyst performance . UV - vi DRS result suggested the formation of MAO - like specie on the silica surface . these specie may be formed from the reaction of TMA either with water adsorbed on the support or OH group of the silica surface . DSC analysis indicated that the crystallinity of these polymer varied a a function of the catalytic activity , the more active catalyst producing polymer with higher crystallinity . the obtained polymer presented melting point around <nUm> ° C , typical of commercial polyethylene . this work present the result of homopolymerization of ethylene using an hybrid system (nBuCp)2ZrCl2-Cp2ZrCl <nUm> , supported on silica . the catalytic system were analyzed by RBS , DRIFTS and EXAFS and polyethylene ( PE ) by GPC and DSC . the catalytic activity and the polymer property showed dependence on the different ratio used (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 / Cp2ZrCl2 at the preparation step . theoretical study permit u to conclude that the metallocenes interact with the surface in different way . depending on the addition order and the molar ratio between both metallocenes , distribution and nature of active specie would be different . possibility of binuclear active site with different propagation and termination constant is analyzed and discussed . EHMO calculation allow u to conclude that Cp2ZrCl <nUm> ha a strong affinity by AIS plane , whereas ( nBuCp ) 2ZrCl2 show similar affinity for both silica plane . the influence of the concentration of CPh3+B(C 6F5)4- a the activator for metallocene polymerisation catalyst ha been quantified . whereas typically a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio of activator and metallocene dialkyl is employed , in line with the expected stoichiometry of alkyl abstraction , significant increase in the productivity of some - but not all - propene polymerisation catalyst have been found . the effect is particularly marked for catalyst with more open structure , such a the constrained - geometry complex ( C5Me 4SiMe2NBut)TiCl2 , where the activity could be increased by about an order of magnitude . most catalyst show an optimum CPh3+ / Zr ratio , beyond which further increase of [CPh3+] ha no effect . while some zirconocenes reach activity of up to <nUm> × <nUm> g PP ( mol zr)-1 [ C 3H6]-1 h-1 ( <nUm> ° C , <nUm> bar ) , other , typically le active zirconocenes do not show a trityl response at all . possible reason for this effect are discussed . homoleptic and mixed a-zirconium phosphonates ( ZrPs ) a-Zr(O3PR)2 ( r = me , bun , bui , hex , oct and ph ) and a-Zr(O3PR1) 2-x(O3PR2)x were readily prepared in high yield from zirconyl choride and the corresponding phosphonic acid in suitable solvent mixture under hydrothermal condition at low fluoride concentration . they form crystalline aggregate consisting of platelet from ca. 10-20 monolayers thickness , with well - defined surface structure . impregnation with Cp2ZrCl2 by sublimation or slurry method provided the first example of PZr - supported alkene polymerization catalyst . crystal morphology and interlayer spacing are unaffected by the impregnation process . solid - state NMR spectroscopy provides evidence for the integrity of the adsorbed metallocene structure . covalent attachment of Cp*ZrCl3 to functionalized ZrPs of the type a-Zr(O 3PR1)1.8(O3PCnH 2nOH)0.2 is similarly possible . the new catalyst polymerize ethene with good to excellent activity under mild condition , even at remarkably low methylalumoxane / zirconocene ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> . the polymer is obtained a free - flowing particle , which reflect the morphology of the catalyst support . the reactivity of Cp2ZrCl2 towards partially dehydroxylated silica wa evaluated and the effect of chemical modification of this silica were studied . different modified silica were prepared by reaction of the original partially dehydroxylated silica with silicon ether , EtOSiMe3 and (Me3Si)2O , or a silazane , ( me 3Si)2NH . the resulting material were activated with MAO and the catalytic system were evaluated in ethylene polymerization . the different reaction were monitored by FT-IR spectroscopy . the catalyst were characterized by elemental analysis a well a by infrared and UV - vi spectroscopy . grafting of organosilanes occurs by reaction with reactive siloxane bridge . the new SiR3 group formed on the surface react with Cp2ZrCl2 to form volatile ClSiMe3 and oxo zirconium specie . these latter specie are active , after the addition of MAO , in ethylene polymerization . the effect caused by changing the nature of the modifier in the grafting reaction with the metallocene , a well a the catalytic activity of the resulting material , are presented and discussed . IR spectroscopy ha been used to study the interaction of silica with PhNEt <nUm> ( N ) and B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ( B ) and subsequent interaction of the support OSi <nUm> / [ N + B ] with dimethylzirconocene me 2Si(2-Me-Ind) 2ZrMe <nUm> ( " Zr " ) . the data were obtained on the composition of the surface compound appeared at both stage of catalyst synthesis . it ha been shown that ( B ) and ( N ) interact with OH group of silica to form ionic pair [ HNR <nUm> ] +[(C 6F <nUm> ) 3BOSi ] - ( IP-1 ) . cation fragment of this pair contains highly reactive NH bond with a.b. at <nUm> cm <nUm> . it ha been found that NH group in a part of IP-1 complex react with neighboring OH group of silica by hydrogen bonding that give complex IP-2 . it ha been shown that " Zr " complex interact both with complex IP-1 and IP-2 . As " Zr " reacts with IP-1 , zirconium ionic complex IP-3 containing ZrMe bond are formed on silica . these complex are suggested to be the precursor of the polymerization active site . the reaction of " Zr " with IP-2 , most likely , produce surface zirconium compound containing no ZrMe bond and inactive for propylene polymerization . IR spectroscopy ha been used to study the interaction of silica with PhNEt <nUm> ( N ) and B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ( B ) and subsequent interaction of the support OSi <nUm> / [ N + B ] with dimethylzirconocene me 2Si(2-Me-Ind) 2ZrMe <nUm> ( RL 2ZrMe <nUm> ) . the data were obtained on the composition of the surface compound appeared at both stage of catalyst synthesis . the catalytic property of ( r XPh ) 2C(Cp)(Flu)MCl <nUm> complex ( r x = Cl , F or CF <nUm> ; m = Zr or Hf ) in propylene polymerization were studied . the result showed dependence of stereospecificity and polymerization activity on the substituent on phenyl group . when r x is CF <nUm> , the activity is <nUm> time of that of the complex with no substituent at <nUm> atm propylene pressure and is extremely high at <nUm> MPa propylene pressure . the CF <nUm> group increased the regioirregular insertion during polymerization to produce partially crystalline s-PP . when r x is halogen , the obtained polymer ha higher melting point than that obtained from the complex with no substituent . the meso ansa zirconocene with dimethylsilyl bridge , activated by methylalumoxane , catalysis the ethylene polymerization , producing ethyl-branched polyethylene . with respect to the polymer obtained with the previously investigated meso zirconocenes , we have found higher branching amount and lower molecular weight . the rapid b-H transfer from the growing chain to the coordinated monomer could account for both these feature of the polymer . the investigation on the structural parameter of the complex , through x-ray diffraction analysis , and on the electrophilicity of the cationic center , through NMR experiment , suggests , a a possible rationalization of this behavior , the obstruction in the inward site . silica-poly[3-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate-co-4-vinylpyridine ] inorganic - organic hybrid ( SMV ) ha been synthesized , and by loading zirconocene catalyst on the carrier , novel zirconocene supported catalyst ha been made and tested for ethylene polymerization . the silica monomer ( SM ) is prepared by coupling reaction of hydroxyl group of silica surface with 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate ( MPS ) and then , SMV is synthesized by copolymerization of SM with 4-vinylpyridine . the formation of SM and SMV ha been confirmed by FTIR , solid - state 13C NMR , XPS , and elemental analysis ( EA ) . loading Cp2ZrCl2 on SMV resulted in the zirconocene supported catalyst . ethylene polymerization data demonstrate that the SMV supported catalyst ha higher activity than the SM supported one and yield polyethylene with much higher molecular weight than that produced by the corresponding homogeneous zirconocene catalyst . UV / vi in diffusion reflection mode ( DRS ) and DRIFT spectroscopy have been used to study the surface zirconocene specie formed at the interaction of Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 and Me2Si(Ind) 2ZrMe2 complex with the MAO / O2Si support . effect of additional activation of these catalyst with TIBA ha been studied a well . structure of type [Me2Si(Ind)2ZrMe] +[MeMAO]- ( C ) is formed at the reaction of me 2Si(Ind)2ZrMe2 complex with MAO / O2Si ( a.b. at <nUm> nm in UV / vi spectrum ) . interaction of this complex with TIBA result in the formation of new structure ( d ) with a.b. at <nUm> nm in UV / vi spectrum . the surface specie of different composition and structure are formed at interaction of Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 complex with MAO / O2Si . the ratio between these specie depends on the zirconium content in the Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO / OSi <nUm> catalyst . according to the DRIFTS data ( CO and ethylene adsorption ) and ethylene polymerization data these catalyst contain active ZrMe bond but activity of these catalyst at ethylene polymerization is low . interaction of Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO / OSi <nUm> with TIBA lead to the formation of the new cationic structure of type ( d ) with a.b. at <nUm> nm in UV / vi spectrum and great increasing of activity at ethylene polymerization . under atmospheric pressure , nano-polyethylene fibre were prepared via in situ ethylene extrusion polymerization , with MCM-41 and SBA-15 supported zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) catalytic system , respectively . the effect of the geometrical structure and surface property of MCM-41 and SBA-15 on the morphology of the resultant polyethylene , catalytic activity and polymerization rate were investigated and compared in various polymerization condition . the possible formation mechanism of nano-polyethylene fibre with MCM-41 and SBA-15 supported Cp2ZrCl2 a catalyst wa discussed . In the presence of hydrogen and of (R,R)-ethylenebis tetrahydroindenyl zirconium dichloride activated by methylalumoxane , the styrene can be fully converted into low molecular weight compound . the kinetic picture of the hydrooligomers formation is made complicated by the irregular regiochemistry of the styrene insertion . however the study on the effect of the feed composition on the product composition allows inferring mechanistic hypothesis and optimizing the formation of the chiral product , (R)-1,3-diphenylbutane . the subsequent functionalization of this molecule , without loss of chirality , discloses the potentiality of such kind of catalytic system for the synthesis of optically active synthones . the new ansa - complex (R-Ph)2C(Cp)(Ind)MCl2 ( r = CF3 , F , Cl ; m = Ti , Zr or Hf ) were synthesized from the reaction of dilithium salt of the corresponding ligand with appropriate group <nUm> metal halide . they were tested for ethylene homopolymerization and copolymerization in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) at various ethylene pressure and temperature . In the case of zirconocenes , complex <nUm> ( r = CF3 ) and <nUm> ( r = Cl ) demonstrated much higher catalytic activity than complex <nUm> ( Ph2C(Cp)(Ind)ZrCl2 ) and <nUm> ( r = F ) in ethylene polymerization . the same trend wa observed in titanocenes and hafnocenes . the electronic and geometric effect of substituents at the phenyl group on the polymerization activity were easily noticed . for the ethylene / 1-hexene or 1-octene copolymerization , <nUm> also showed the highest catalytic activity , and the copolymer from complex <nUm> possessed the highest 1-hexene and 1-octene content . the reactivity of the silyl ether - substituted zirconocene [ Zr{e5-C5H4(CH2) 3OSiMe3}(e5-C5H5) Cl ] ( 1 ) towards dehydroxylated silica wa evaluated and comparative study with respect to the unmodified analogue [ Zr(e5-C5H5)2Cl <nUm> ] ( 2 ) were performed . the different reaction were monitored by FT-IR spectroscopy . the resulting material were activated with MAO and the catalytic system were evaluated in ethylene polymerization . the catalyst were characterized by elemental analysis a well a by FT-IR and UV - vi spectroscopy . In addition to the classical reaction between zr{single bond}Cl bond and acidic silanol surface group , grafting of complex <nUm> occurs to some extent by reaction between the silyl ether group and reactive siloxane bridge on the silica surface . In contrast , complex <nUm> , a one would expect , only reacts through the zr{single bond}Cl group . supporting zirconocene <nUm> on MAO - modified silica give rise to a more efficient catalyst . the effect caused by these different grafting reaction , a well a the catalytic activity of the resulting material , are presented and discussed . mixture consisting of zirconocene difluorides C p'2 Zr F ( cp' = substituted or nonsubstituted e5-cyclopentadienyl ) a pre-catalysts and diisobutylaluminumhydride i-Bu2AlH a activator were found to be active catalyst in the room - temperature hydrodefluorination ( HDF ) of fluorinated pyridine . evaluation of these system established rac - (ebthi)ZrF2 ( 1 ) and Cp2ZrF2 ( 3 ) together with i-Bu2AlH a active catalyst in the room - temperature hydrodefluorination ( HDF ) of pentafluoro-pyridine . the active specie for the conversion were the actually formed hydride [rac-(ebthi)ZrH(m-H)]2 ( 2 ) and [Cp2ZrH(m-H)]2 ( 4 ) . the result we obtained ( rt , <nUm> h , turn over number <nUm> ) showed a significantly better performance compared to other investigation published before for this HDF reaction . the ansa - indene compound {1-Me2Si(3-C9H6Et)2} ( 1 ) wa prepared by alkylation of the unsubstituted ansa - indene . this compound wa converted , by reaction with nBuLi , to the dilithium compound [Li2{1-Me2Si(3-C9H5Et)2}] ( 2 ) . ansa - zirconocene [Zr{1-Me2Si(3-e5-C9H5Et)2}Cl2] ( 3 ) wa prepared by the reaction of Cl4Zr with <nUm> in ether / toluene at <nUm> ° C . the molecular structure of meso-3 wa determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction study . the ansa - zirconocene <nUm> exhibit a greater activity in ethylene polymerization than reference complex such a [Zr{1-Me2Si(e5-C9H6)2}Cl2] and [Zr{1-C2H4(e5-C9H5)2}Cl2] and , in addition , it maintained a reasonable level of activity after <nUm> h of contact with MAO solution . furthermore , the different elementary step in the activation process of ethylene polymerization for substituted complex [Zr{1-Me2Si(3-e5-C9H5R)2}Cl2] ( r = et <nUm> , me <nUm> , nPr <nUm> and nBu <nUm> ) by commercial methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) have been studied by UV - vi spectroscopy . addition of MAO in large excess ( [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> ) at <nUm> ° C yield a previously unreported intermediate in the activation process of metallocenes ; this intermediate ha an absorption band centered at λ = <nUm> nm . we report here the influence of the type of catalyst , ring substitution , type of cocatalyst and addition of THF on the activation process of these metallocenes . heterogeneous zirconocene catalyst were prepared with an unconventional method by grafting mesoporous silica SBA-15 fiber with Cl4Zr in gas or liquid phase and subsequently with lithium salt of cyclopentadiene ( cp ) or indene ( ind ) . In order to obtain a better understanding of the bonding mode of the zirconium and the ligand , the ZrClx / O2Si and ZrClxL / O2Si were now for the first time characterized by several technique , including elemental analysis , FTIR spectroscopy , 1H MAS NMR and 13C CP MAS NMR . the result verify the e5-bonding of the ligand to the metal center , which in turn wa discovered to be both mono- and bifunctionally bonded to the silica . the catalyst were tested in ethylene polymerization , in which they yielded polyethylene with moderate activity . the group <nUm> ansa - metallocene complex with chiral substituent bearing cyclopentadienyl ligand , [ M{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e 5-C5H3{CHRR'})}Cl2 ] ( r = pri , R' = me ( 9 ) ; r = pri , R' = ph ( 6 ) ; r = but , R' = me ( 7 ) ; r = but , R' = ph ( 8 ) ) , with the tetrachloride salt of the transition metal . the molecular structure of 11a and 12a have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . the catalytic behaviour of 9-12 in the polymerization of ethylene and propylene ha been studied . isotactic polypropylene with [mmmm] pentad of the order of <nUm> % were obtained with the C1 symmetric ansa - zirconocene catalyst . the lithium derivative of the chiral substituent bearing cyclopentadienyl ligand , Li{C5H4(CHRR')} ( r = pri , R' = me ( 1 ) ; r = but , R' = me ( 23 ) ; r = but , R' = ph ( 24 ) ) , were obtained . the molecular structure of <nUm> ha been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . 5-12 and 21-24 have been tested a catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene and propylene . isotactic polypropylene with [mmmm] pentad between <nUm> and <nUm> % were obtained and their tacticity can be related directly to the structure of the catalyst . heterogeneous olefin polymerisation catalyst were prepared by combining zirconocene with a series of purely siliceous and Al - containing MCM-41 support with different Si / Al ratio , using simplified and improved version of the well - known direct impregnation and " MAO pre-treatment " method . the catalyst were tested in ethylene polymerisation . analysis of polymerisation activity and kinetic profile led to a rationalisation on the effect of support Si / Al ratio and method used for catalyst preparation over the catalytic behaviour for ethylene polymerisation . polymer were characterised by scanning electron microscopy and differential scanning calorimetry . A mechanism is proposed to associate the formation or absence of fibrous morphology with polymerisation activity . an MCM-41 ha been modified by grafting several zirconocene complex to give new material potentially active in the polymerization of a-olefins . these material have been activated by the cocatalyst MAO , to generate the catalyst MCM - <nUm> / metallocene / MAO ( metallocene = [Zr(e5-C5H5)2Cl2] ( 1 ) , [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] ( 2 ) and [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H3But)}Cl2] ( 3 ) ) . the resulting functionalized ordered mesoporous silica sample ( 1-3 ) were tested a catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene and compared with both the homogeneous system analogue and the functionalized silica derivative SG / metallocene / MAO ( SG = silica gel ; metallocene = [Zr(e5-C5H5)2Cl2] ( 4 ) , [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] ( 5 ) and [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H3But)}Cl2] ( 6 ) ) . the metallocenes <nUm> and <nUm> have been characterized by 13C-CP MAS NMR and 29Si MAS NMR spectroscopy . the structure and surface property of MCM-41 / [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] and MCM-41 / [Zr{Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C5H4)}Cl2] / MAO system have been studied by x-ray diffractometry , nitrogen adsorption - desorption isotherm measurement and thermogravimetry . the grafting of the metallocene complex , activation with MAO and subsequent polymerization reaction have been followed by an FT-IR " in situ " study . scanning electron microscopy and transmission electron microscopy have been used to show the morphology of the heterogeneous catalyst a well a the resulting polyethylene obtained . ethylene polymerization using catalyst derived from activation of zirconocene aluminohydride complex , supported on silica , pretreated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , is described . the novel catalyst composition were compared to those using conventional zirconocene dichloride complex and characterized by SEM / EDX and DRIFT spectroscopy . supported catalyst were prepared which featured various surface Al : Zr ratio . when using excess MAO a both activator and scavenger , the catalyst containing the most Zr per g of support gave rise to the most active formulation ; the high activity in the presence of excess MAO are due , in part , to catalyst leaching prior to and / or during polymerization . when tri-isobutylaluminum ( TIBAL ) wa used a scavenger , the supported catalyst that featured a higher surface Al : Zr ratio had higher activity than those prepared at the lower Al : Zr ratio . the activity of the aluminohydride complex wa significantly higher than that of the corresponding dichloride complex , when activated by MAO while the in the presence of TIBAL , there wa little difference in performance between the two catalyst precursor . several Ga-MCM-41 material , prepared using different synthesis and template removal procedure , were used for the immobilisation of Cp2ZrCl2 by a direct impregnation method . support were carefully characterised by XRD , N adsorption , ICP - AES , AAS , XPS and FTIR ( using pyridine a probe molecule for acid site ) , in order to ass their structural feature , chemical composition ( bulk and surface ) and surface acidity property . supported catalyst were tested for the polymerisation of ethylene , using methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst / activator . the relationship established between concentration / strength of acid site of Ga-MCM-41 and the catalytic performance of zirconocene dichloride supported in these material demonstrate that the behaviour of the catalytic system analysed in this paper is compatible with existing model for the interaction of single - site olefin polymerisation catalyst with other inorganic acidic oxide . zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) supported on montmorillonite K-10 , which ha previously been shown to be an efficient catalytic system for olefin polymerization , wa found to be comparable to the highly activated homogeneous combination of Cp2ZrCl2 and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , and more reactive than the originally reported homogeneous catalytic system of Cp2ZrCl2 / Me3Al in the methylalumination reaction of an aryl substituted terminal alkyne . examination of solvent effect in the ethylalumination reaction using Cp2ZrCl2 supported on montmorillonite K-10 , O2Si / HLiO , and O2Si / MgO , indicated that the anionic counterpart of the actual catalytically active zirconocenium cation is highly delocalized , thus suggesting that the actual active zirconocenium cation is only very weakly coordinating with the anionic moiety . this account for the high activity of system using solid such a co-catalysts and a supporting material in olefin polymerization in general . this paper present a study of the effect of different treatment on the polymerization activity of modified clay a cocatalysts . to achieve this goal , an intercalating cation wa introduced into two smectites and these clay were then modified with trimethyl aluminium . the result for ethylene polymerization , when a zirconocene complex wa used a catalyst , and the structure analysis , allow u to obtain interesting deduction about the generation mode of the active specie . all active material employed a support activator presented aluminium in a pentahedral environment together with acidic hydrogen atom . these two feature were detected only after TMA treatment and they seem to be crucial element in active cocatalyst generation . moreover , a material without structural aluminium displayed the best activity pointing to the new aluminium specie generated in the solid matrix a the determining factor for the activity . we proposed a synergic effect between lewis acid aluminium centre and acidic bronsted proton that generate the AlHOSi group that activate the zirconium compound . the reaction of the edge - bridged open zirconocene , Zr(6,6-dmch)2(PMe3)2 ( dmch = dimethylcyclohexadienyl ) with two equivalent of PhC2SiMe3 lead to a <nUm> + <nUm> + <nUm> ring construction , resulting in a 4.3.1 bicyclodecadienyl skeleton . the resulting complex , with e3-allyl , e4-diene , and e5-dienyl coordination , ha a formal <nUm> electron configuration , and contains close contact between the metal center and two lengthened C-C bond , indicative of weak agostic interaction . A new chiral ansa - metallocene catalyst , namely rac-dimethylsilyl-bis(2,4,6- trimethyl-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) , ha been synthesized and used a a catalyst for isospecific polymerization of propylene , with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) a the cocatalyst . the influence of polymerization temperature ( T p ) on the polymerization activity , polypropylene ( PP ) microstructure and polymer property are investigated , and the result are compared with rac-dimethylsilyl-bis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride congener ( 2 ) under identical condition . <nUm> / MAO ha a very high activity for propylene polymerization at 50-70 ° C and <nUm> atm propylene pressure . A beneficial feature of catalyst <nUm> is it higher stability at elevated temperature than <nUm> . At tp = <nUm> ° C , the novel catalyst show a great improvement in term of stereoregularity , with [mmmm] = <nUm> % and Tm = <nUm> ° C , while <nUm> display [mmmm] of <nUm> % and Tm of <nUm> ° C under the same condition . the regiospecificity of <nUm> / MAO is also better than <nUm> / MAO . C1 - bridged 2,5-dimethylcylcopentadienyl ansa - titanocene complex , [ Me(H)C(e5-C5H4)(e5-2,5- Me2C5H2)]TiCl2 ( 4 ) and [ ( CH 3CH2CH2)(H)C(e5-C 5H4)(e5-2,5-Me2C 5H2)]TiCl2 ( 5 ) and a dinuclear titanium complex , Me2Si[(e5-2,5-Me2C 5H2)Ti{O(2,6-iPr2C6H 3)}Cl2 ] ( 7 ) have been prepared . the solid state structure of <nUm> ha been determined by x-ray crystallography . ethylene polymerization reactivity of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and the structurally related ansa - zirconocene complex , [ Me(H)C(e5-C5H4)(e5-2,5- Me2C5H2)]ZrCl2 ( 1 ) , [ (Me)(H)C(e5-2,5-Me2C5H2) 2]ZrCl2 ( 2 ) and [ Me2Si(e5-2,5- Me2C5H2)2]ZrCl2 ( 3 ) are investigated after activation with MAO . interestingly , the ansa - titanocene complex <nUm> and <nUm> show much higher activity than the ansa - zirconocene complex <nUm> and <nUm> , and the molecular weight of the polymer obtained by the titanocene complex are significantly higher ( mw , ∼ <nUm> <nUm> ) than those of polymer obtained by the zirconocene complex ( mw , below <nUm> <nUm> ) . the Me2Si - bridged complex <nUm> show extremely high activity for ethylene polymerization and the activity ( <nUm> × <nUm> g / mol h ) is <nUm> time higher than that of [ Me2Si(Me4C 5)(NtBu)]TiCl2 ( CGC ) under the same condition . ethylene / 1-hexene copolymerization reactivity of <nUm> and <nUm> have been studied . the complex are inferior to CGC in term of comonomer incorporation ability . copolymer of norbornene with 1-hexene or 1-octene were prepared using the ansa - metallocene [methylene(bis(2,5-dimethylcyclopentadienyl))]zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) in the presence of MAO . the a-olefin content in the copolymer wa determined by 13C NMR spectroscopy and resulted in a dramatic decrease in polymer tg and mw . the catalyst activity wa determined to be <nUm> ± <nUm> kg ( polymer ) / mmol(Zr) h at <nUm> ° C . the reaction of phenylvinylboron chloride ( 11 ) with allylethylamine afforded (N-allyl-N-ethylamino)vinylphenylborane ( 12 ) which on treatment with <nUm> mol % grubbs catalyst gave 1-ethyl-2,5-dihydro-2-phenyl-1H-1,2-azaborole ( 13 ) . the reaction of <nUm> with LDA in ether gave lithium 1-ethyl-2-phenyl-1H-1,2- azaborolide ( 14 ) , which wa silylated with Me2SiCl2 to afford <nUm> . reaction of <nUm> with CpLi followed by LDA and then Cl4Zr gave bridged compound <nUm> . the reaction of <nUm> with <nUm> followed by LDA and then Cl4Zr gave the bridged complex <nUm> . the reaction of <nUm> with Cp*ZrCl3 gave <nUm> . the x-ray crystal structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> show that they closely resemble the corresponding zirconocene dichloride . on activation with excess methylaluminoxane <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> form active catalyst from the polymerization of ethylene . the following ansa - ligand precursor , Et(H)Si(C5H 5)2 ( 1 ) , Et(H)Si(C5HMe4)Cl ( 2 ) , Et(H)Si(C5HMe4)(C5H5) ( 3 ) , Ph(H)Si(C5HMe4)Cl ( 4 ) , Ph(H)Si(C5HMe 4)(C5H5) ( 5 ) , Ph(H)Si(C5HMe 4)2 ( 6 ) , CH2CHCH2(H)Si(C 5HMe4)Cl ( 7 ) , ) , Li 2{Ph(H)Si(C5Me4)2} ( 13 ) , Li 2{CH2CHCH2(H)Si(C5Me 4)(C5H4) } ( 14 ) and Li2{CH 2CHCH2(H)Si(C5Me4)2 } ( 15 ) have been prepared . the group <nUm> metal complex , [ M{Et(H)Si(e5- C5H4)2}Cl2 ] ( group <nUm> metal complex in hydrosilylation process ha been studied . the reaction of 16b , 17a and 17b with tetravinylsilane gave [ Zr{(CH2CH)3SiCH 2CH2(Et)Si(e5-C5H 4)2}Cl2 ] ( 22b ) and [ M{(CH2CH) 3SiCH2CH2(Et)Si(e5-C 5Me4)(e5-C5H4) } Cl ] ( m = Ti ( 23a ) , Zr ( 23b ) ) , respectively . the reaction of 17a and 17b with dimethyldivinylsilane yielded the hydrosilylation product [ M{(CH 2CH)Me2SiCH2CH2(Et) Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5-C 5H4)}Cl2 ] ( m = Ti ( 24a ) , Zr ( 24b ) ) , respectively . 23b and 24b reacted with the silane reagent HSiEt3 to form , via hydrosilylation , [ Zr{(Et3SiCH2CH
