M{CH2CH(Me)Si(e5-C 5Me4)2}Cl2 ] ( m = Ti ( 27a ) , Zr ( 27b ) ) and [ Zr{CH2CHCH2(Me)Si(e5-C 5Me4)2}Cl2 ] ( 28b ) , have also been tested in reaction of hydrosilylation with SiHMeCl2 to give [ M{Cl2MeSiCH2CH2(Me)Si(e5- C5Me4)2}Cl2 ] ( m = Ti ( 29a ) , Zr ( 29b ) ) and [ Zr{Cl2MeSiCH2CH2CH 2(Me)Si(e5-C5Me4) 2}Cl2 ] ( 30b ) . all the zirconocene compound are active to varying degree a catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene . the molecular structure of 21b and 21c have been determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction study . the synthesis , characterization and reactivity of novel carbometalla[2]ferrocenophanes (e-C5Me4)Fe(e- C5H4)CH2ER2 ( 14 ) and ( 15 ) ( e = Pb , r = ph or e = Zr , r = ( e-C5H5 ) ) are reported . compound <nUm> and <nUm> were prepared by the reaction of the dilithiated specie (e-C5Me4)Fe(e-C5H4Li)CH 2Li · xTMEDA with the appropriate dichlorodiorganoplumbane or dichlorozirconocene in low yield ( ca. <nUm> % ) . the Pb specie <nUm> wa characterized by 1H and 13C NMR , and MS , however it could not be cleanly separated from pentamethylferrocene . moreover , it wa found that the C-Pb bond of <nUm> underwent facile cleavage , and under ambient light or at room temperature , <nUm> decomposed to Pb2Ph6 and pentamethylferrocene . compound <nUm> , on the other hand , wa stable and readily purified ; this specie wa characterized by 1H and 13C NMR , UV - vi , MS , and elemental analysis . single crystal x-ray diffraction study of this compound revealed the presence of a moderate degree of ring - tilt with a value of α = <nUm> ° ( a negative value is used to denote tilting away from the bridging element ) , and a potentially moderate degree of strain due to a large b(Zr) of <nUm> ° ( angle between Cp'(Fe) plane and ipso-Cp'-Zr bond ) . attempted thermal ring - opening polymerization ( ROP ) of <nUm> resulted only in decomposition and attempted transition metal - catalyzed and photolytic ROP were also unsuccessful . the reaction of <nUm> with ClH · Et2O resulted in cleavage of the C-Zr bond , and led to the formation of pentamethylferrocene . ES-MS of dilute solution of (bcep)ZrCl2 ( 1 ) ( bcep = PhP(CH2CH2-e5-C5H4)2 ) in acetonitrile - water indicates the presence of three specie in solution : [(bcep)Zr(H2O)2]2+ ( 2 ) , [{(bcep)Zr(m-OH)}2]2+ ( 3 ) , and the singly deprotonated form of dimer <nUm> , [{(bcep)Zr}2(m-O)(m-OH)]+ ( 4 ) . In aqueous solution , reactivity study investigated largely by 31P NMR spectroscopy support the presence of <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> . one equivalent of fluoride wa found to react immediately with <nUm> , but slowly with <nUm> and <nUm> , to give the monofluoro complex [(bcep)ZrF]+ which wa isolated a the BPh4- salt . addition of aqueous sodium sulphate gave insoluble crystal of the sulfato complex (bcep)Zr(SO4) which wa characterised by x-ray crystallography . addition of acid HX ( x = Br , NO3 , HO4S , CHO3 ) to aqueous solution of <nUm> gave specie observed by ES-MS corresponding to [(bcep)ZrX]+ . reaction of phenylethynyl lithium with substituted cyclopentenones gave the corresponding pendant phenylethynyl substituted cyclopentadienes . subsequent deprotonation and transmetallation with TiCl4*2THF , ClZr <nUm> , and Cp1ZrCl3 yielded the alkyne - functionalized metallocene complex [C5Me4(CCPh)] 2MCl2 [ m = Ti ( 1 ) , Zr ( 2 ) ] , Cp1[C 5Me4(CCPh)]ZrCl2 ( 3 ) , and Cp1[C 5H2R'2(CCPh)]ZrCl2 [ R' = me ( 4 ) , ph ( 5 ) ] . these complex were fully characterized by 1H NMR , 13C NMR , MS spectrum , and elemental analysis . the molecular structure of <nUm> wa determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction analysis . ethylene polymerization wa studied with these complex in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . four zirconium complex with pendant aryloxy group attached to the metallocene moiety by ethyl or hexyl spacers have been synthesized and characterized by spectroscopic method and HR-MS or elemental analysis . the solid state structure of bis[{6-(2,6-dimethylphenoxy)hexyl}cyclopentadienyl] zirconium dichloride wa determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction . the prepared complex were tested a catalyst precursor in the polymerization of ethylene upon activation with MAO . the result showed a marked effect of the spacer length on the catalytic activity , while only a minor effect of the substitution on the aryl group , which affected it steric property . dimethylsilylene bridged 3,4-dimethylcyclopentadienyl / amido titanium and zirconium complex , namely [ Me2Si(C5Me2H 2)(tBuN)]MCl2 ( m = Ti , Zr ) , were synthesized by the reaction of the dilithium salt of the ligand with the corresponding inexpensive metal precursor TiCl4(THF)2 and ClZr <nUm> , respectively . these complex were characterized by spectroscopic technique and single crystal x-ray diffraction analysis . In addition , the obtained complex exhibited high catalytic activity in the polymerization of ethylene and copolymerization of ethylene / 1-octene , and afforded PE and poly(ethylene-co-1-octene)s with high molecular weight . especially , the dimethyl-Cp substituted constrained geometry complex ( CGC ) , [ me 2Si(C5Me2H2)(tBuN) ] Cl2Ti exhibited a higher incorporation ratio of 1-octene at <nUm> C compared to the tetramethyl-Cp substituted CGC , [ Me2Si(C 5Me4)(tBuN)]TiCl2 , which wa judged by the density and 13C NMR analysis of the obtained copolymer . this is presumably due to the steric and electronic effect of the two vicinal methyl group in [ Me2Si(C5Me2H2)( tBuN)]MCl2 during the (co)polymerization and specifically , no agostic interaction available in the propagation and termination step of the (co)polymerization . the ansa indenyl ligand precursor C3H5 2(C9H6R)2 ( r = me ( 7 ) , et ( 8 ) , Pr ( 9 ) ) have been prepared by the reaction of the corresponding lithium indene , Li(C9H6R-1) ( r = me ( 4 ) , et ( 5 ) , Pr ( 6 ) ) , with 1,3-dibromopropane . compound 7-9 were converted , by the reaction with butyllithium , to the dilithium compound , Li2{CH2CH 2CH2(C9H5R-3)2 } ( r = me ( 10 ) , et ( 11 ) , Pr ( 12 ) ) . the three carbon atom bridge ansa - bis(indenyl)zirconium complex , [ Zr{CH2CH2CH2(e5- C9H5R-3)2}Cl2 ] ( r = me ( 13 ) , et ( 14 ) Pr ( 15 ) ) were synthesized from the reaction of 10-12 with zirconium tetrachloride . compound 13-15 have been tested a homogeneous catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene . the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . A series of ethylene-bridged C1 - symmetric ansa-(3-R-indenyl) ( fluorenyl ) zirconocene complex 3a-i ( r = 2-[2-(4-methylphenyl)propyl] , 3a ; r = 2-[2-(3,5-dimethylphenyl)propyl] , 3b ; r = 2-(2-benzylpropyl) , 3c ; r = 2-methylbenzyl , 3d ; r = 2-(2-cyclohexylpropyl) , 3e ; r = 2-[2-(1-cyclohexenyl) propyl ] , 3f ; r = 2-(2-n-butylpropyl) , <nUm> g ; r = cyclohexyl , <nUm> h ; r = iPr , 3i ) were synthesized by a salt metathesis method and characterized by NMR spectroscopy , elemental analysis ( or HRMS ) and x-ray diffraction ( 3e and <nUm> h ) . upon activation with methylaluminoxane , most of these zirconocene complex exhibited sufficient catalytic activity up to <nUm> × <nUm> g C6 / ( mol - zr*h ) and high selectivity up to <nUm> % toward propylene dimerization , affording 2-methyl-1-pentene a the major isomer which wa confirmed by gas chromatography . remarkably , the selectivity and activity of complex 3a-i were significantly influenced by the structural feature of the substituent on the 3-position of indenyl ring : a pendant aryl or alkyl group linked by a quaternary carbon bridge provided the complex with high selectivity in the range of <nUm> - <nUm> % for 2-methyl-1-pentene and low to moderate catalytic activity ; the lack of a quaternary carbon bridge within the substituent would lead to mainly polypropylene of low molecular weight . the steric hindrance around the active metal center induced by the pendant group might be responsible for the catalytic dimerization behavior , and the presumed mechanism wa discussed . In addition , for complex <nUm> h and 3i , the selectivity for propylene dimerization could also be enhanced with the increase of reaction temperature . noticeably , most of these ansa - zirconocene complex exhibit excellent thermal stability at <nUm> ° C , which is important with regard to industrial application . <nUm> elsevier ltd. all right reserved . catalyst creates new grade of polyethylene while their degradation phenomenon determine the resulting application profile . the resin and the end - product eventually contain residual catalyst . therefore , the effect of the following two residual catalyst - one ziegler - natta [ PQ silica / bu 2Mg / tBuCl / Cl4Ti ] , and the other metallocene [ PQ silica / MAO / (nBuCp)2ZrCl2 ] - on the UV - induced degradation of the resulting unstabilized ethylene homopolymer film were studied . the MetCat HomoPE film wa found to be more susceptible to UV - induced degradation degradation than the Z-N HomoPE one despite the residual Zr level wa <nUm> / 15th of the Ti content . therefore , the zirconocene residual catalyst better ( i ) facilitated the UV - initiated reaction , and ( ii ) decreased the activation energy required for the decomposition of the resulting hydroperoxide . these finding were explained from the difference in ( i ) electronic configuration and atomic radius , and ( ii ) surface chemistry and solid - state electronic environment of these catalyst system . In both film , tpm and tpc did not significantly vary with the exposure time . the change of % crystallinity showed to be irregular and disturbed . As a function of carbonyl index , tpm and tpc,varied in a similar fashion in the MetCat HomoPE film . however , they significantly differed for the Z-N HomoPE film . here , tpm did not appreciably change whereas tpc initially increased very mildly ; then it did not essentially differ . crystalline structure and thermal property of poly(ethylene-co-a ,o-nonconjugated diene)s , [ diene = 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) , 1,7-octadiene ( OD ) , and 1,9-decadiene ( DD ) ] have been investigated in relation to insertion mode of the dienes . In the case of poly(ethylene-co-HD) , the copolymer containing high cis-1,3-cyclopentane unit show lower melting point depression with increasing the comonomer content than the copolymer containing high trans-1,3-cyclopentane unit . In the case of poly(ethylene-co-OD) and poly(ethylene-co-DD) , the copolymer containing pendant vinyl group show higher DHm than that of the copolymer with cyclic unit or branching structure . thermal degradation of the copolymer ha been investigated under nitrogen atmosphere and the degradation of the copolymer containing the cyclic structure begin at lower temperature than the copolymer containing pendant vinyl group . single site olefin polymerisation catalyst are suitable candidate for modelling purpose . their well - defined structure and the almost complete elucidation of their polymerisation mechanism , make these organometallic complex ideal for study based on quantitative structure - activity relationship ( QSAR ) . although the QSAR technique is extensively used in drug design , there are very few report on it application to metallocene - based polymerisation catalysis . this probably ha something to do with the difficulty inherent in controlling experimental condition during the polymerisation process . In the present study , we obtained ethylene polymerisation data using a number of zirconocene catalyst under carefully controlled experimental condition , i.e. keeping all polymerisation variable constant except catalyst structure . the catalytic activity and molecular weight of the resulting polyethylene were experimentally determined . we then applied 3D-QSAR methodology to explain the experimental data in term of three - dimensional ( 3D ) field descriptor related to the structure of the metallocene catalyst . our result provide useful correlation between experimental ethylene polymerisation activity and the steric , LUMO and local softness field of the catalyst . the molecular weight calculated from comparative molecular field analysis ( CoMFA ) model including LUMO and local softness field correlate well with the experimental one . the predictive capacity of the model wa also tested . based on the proposed model , steric and electronic factor affecting polymerisation performance are discussed . the dynamic mechanical and rheological property of five long - chain branched ( LCB ) and three linear ethylene / propylene ( EP ) copolymer were investigated and compared using a dynamic mechanical analyzer ( DMA ) and an oscillatory rheometer . the novel series of LCB EP copolymer were synthesized with a constrained geometry catalyst ( CGC ) , [ C5Me 4(SiMe2NtBu)]TiMe2 , and had various propylene molar fraction of <nUm> - <nUm> and long - chain branch frequency ( LCBF ) of <nUm> - <nUm> . the linear EP copolymer were synthesized with an ansa - zirconocene catalyst , rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( EBI ) , and contained similar level of propylene incorporation a the CGC copolymer , but no LCB . In dynamic mechanical analysis , the dynamic storage modulus ( G' ) and loss modulus ( G'' ) of the copolymer decreased with an increase of propylene molar fraction . the a- and b-transitions of the CGC copolymer were overlaid with each other . high damping ( tand ) value were found with the CGC copolymer at temperature below <nUm> ° C . In oscillatory rheological analysis , compared to the linear EBI counterpart , the LCB CGC copolymer melt showed higher zero shear activation energy , broader plateau of δ and larger elastic contribution , which are essential characteristic of LCB polymer . it wa found that the long chain branching wa the determining factor in controlling rheological property of the polymer melt while the short chain branching from propylene incorporation played a decisive role in affecting dynamic mechanical property . this work represents the first rheological evidence of LCB in EP copolymer synthesized with CGC . polyethylene and isotactic polypropylene containing hydroxylated cyclic unit were synthesized by copolymerization of ethylene or propylene and cyclodiolefins , dicyclopentadiene ( DCPD ) , 5-vinyl-2-norbornene ( VNB ) , 5-ethylidene-2-norbornene ( ENB ) , with zirconocene catalyst and subsequent hydroboration reaction of residual unsaturated group . the resulting hydroxylated copolymer showed higher glass transition temperature ( tg ) than the original and hydrogenated copolymer . relationship between the cyclodiolefin content and DTg ( DTg = difference of T g between hydroxylated copolymer and hydrogenated copolymer ) wa given by a straight line independent of the structure of the comonomers . improvement in shape memory effect wa observed in the hydroxylated ethylene-VNB copolymer . polymerization of vinyl-cyclohexane ( VCH ) in the presence of catalytic system based on zirconocenes belonging to C2 , c2v or Cs symmetry group were performed . all polymer were analyzed by 13C NMR spectroscopy and show isotactic microstructure . A steric control mechanism , involving a like 1,3-asymmetric induction of the chiral carbon of the last inserted unit on the chirality of the incoming monomer coordination , is proposed . this would be the only stereocontrol mechanism in the presence of a c2v-symmetry catalyst , and it would enforce or overcome site control in case of active specie with C2 and C s-symmetry , respectively . isoprene ( 2-methyl-1,3-butadiene ) wa attempted a a comonomer in metallocene - catalyzed propylene polymerization to prepare side chain - unsaturated isotactic polypropylene ( i-PP ) . hydrogen wa added into the sluggish copolymerization of propylene and isoprene mediated by a highly isospecific metallocene complex rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO . catalyst activity wa restored due to breaking by hydrogen of the stable p-allyl zirconocene specie caused by 1,4-isoprene insertion . stunningly , it wa found that the generated Zr-H specie had been able to take the accompanying vinylidene-terminated polymer chain for insertion a a preemptive mode of re-initiation . with a consecutive action of chain release followed by in situ reinsertion , the hydrogen - induced catalyst reactivation wa not accompanied by chain termination . with the smooth occurrence of the copolymerization , the 1,2-insertion of isoprene led to the preparation of i-PP bearing pendant vinylidene group . ansa - zirconocene complex have been studied by three - dimensional quantitative structure - activity relationship ( 3D-QSAR ) . using the comparative molecular field analysis ( CoMFA ) method , the experimental result obtained for catalytic activity and polymer molecular weight have been successfully correlated with the steric and electrostatic 3D structural descriptor , which were calculated by density functional theory ( DFT ) method . heterogeneous cocatalysts , catalyst , and catalyst mixture for the polymerization of ethylene were prepared applying " fumed silica " and mesoporous MCM-41 support material and zirconocene dichloride , titanocene dichloride , and a bis(arylimino)pyridine iron complex a catalyst precursor . the catalyst mixture produced polyethylene which exhibit the property of two single polymer . polyethylene with the desired bimodal molecular weight distribution could be obtained with a series of ternary Zr / Ti / Fe catalyst . the ability of the zirconium and titanium specie to copolymerize short - chain 1-olefins produced by the iron center ( " in situ " copolymerization ) is useful for the production of copolymer from only one monomer ( ethylene ) . A polyethylene / montmorillonite(MMT) nanocomposite wa prepared by in situ polymerization method using MMT - supported methylaluminoxane(MAO) cocatalyst and / or Cp2ZrCl2 catalyst . the catalyst component had been supported on the unmodified MMT-Na and modified commercial product , cloisite <nUm> A . with XRD it wa found that the layered silicate gallery of cloisite <nUm> A wa exfoliated by incorporating MAO cocatalyst and zirconocene catalyst while the d-spacing of MMT-Na wa le changed . the in situ polymerization of ethylene wa carried out to prepare the nanocomposite by using the supported MMT , and the fully exfoliated product wa obtained with cloisite <nUm> A . the decomposition temperature of the obtained nanocomposite increased up to <nUm> ° C , but the melting temperature wa not improved much . cycloalumination of 3'-methylene-(5a)-spirocholestane-3 , 1'-cyclobutane with triethylaluminum catalyzed by Cp2ZrCl <nUm> wa accomplished for the first time to give (5a)- spirocholestane-3,1'-(6'-ethyl-6'-aluminaspiro [3.4] octane ) in <nUm> % . the latter , without isolation , wa converted into spirotetrahydroselenophene or spirotetrahydrofuran . the catalytic cycloalumination of 2'-methylidene-2',3'- ethano-(5a)-cholestane with Et3Al catalyzed by cp 2ZrCl2 wa performed for the first time to give spiro[2',3'-ethano-(5a)-cholestane-2' , 3''-aluminacyclopentane ] in a ∼ <nUm> % yield and with high stereoselectivity ( > <nUm> % ) . the obtained cyclic organoaluminum compound wa transformed in situ into heterocyclic spiran derivative of 2',3'- ethano-(5a)-cholestane . investigation into the compositional heterogeneity of ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer obtained with various zirconocene / MAO catalyst , either homogeneous or supported on inorganic carrier such a a complex of magnesium chloride with tetrahydrofuran or methyl alcohol , were conducted . the dependence between metallocene structure , a well a catalyst immobilization , and the compositional heterogeneity of the related product wa investigated . it wa found that the heterogeneity of copolymer is determined by the metallocene catalyst structure . the amount of peak on the DSC thermogram of copolymer and their division increase with the increase of bulkiness of the ligand in the catalytic system . the immobilization of the investigated catalyst on the magnesium carrier lead to an increase of the copolymer 's compositional heterogeneity . however , the modification of the Cl2Mg carrier by tetrahydrofuran or methyl alcohol seems to not have any influence on the copolymer ' CCD . A route to an enantiopure trisubstituted cyclobutanone ha been devised . the pursuit of this building block begin with d-glucose and feature a zirconocene - promoted ring contraction . benzo-zirconacyclohexadiene-phospha or silacyclobutene fused ring system are easily prepared via a benzynezirconocene intermediate by mean of thermolysis of Cp2ZrPh2 in the presence of bis(alkynyl)phosphanes or silanes . these polyunsaturated system are the source of a variety of new mono- or tricyclic heterocycle incorporating either one or two heteroatoms . A variety of 2,4-pentadienylzirconiums were generated by reacting pentadienyl ether with zirconocene ' Cp2Zr ' . these complex underwent a highly g-regioselective and anti-stereoselective in situ addition with carbonyl compound to afford bis(homoallylic) alcohol in good yield . the reversal of anti v syn selectivity wa simply achieved with BF <nUm> , thus expanding the synthetic potential of the reaction . the 1,4-conjugated addition of alkenylzirconocene chloride complex to a,b-enones , a,b-enoic acid ester , and a,b-enoic acid amide can be efficiently achieved by the use of [RhCl(cod)]2 catalyst . A high diastereoselectivity ( <nUm> % yield , <nUm> % de ) wa obtained through the reaction of a,b-enoic acid amide derived from oppolzer 's sultam and 2-butenoyl chloride , while the use of evans ' chiral oxazolidinone a a chiral auxiliary in place of oppolzer 's sultam gave a poor diastereoselectivity ( <nUm> % yield , <nUm> % de ) . an easy and straightforward new method for the preparation of sp <nUm> zirconocene derivative from a wide range of heterosubstituted alkene such a vinyl sulfide , sulfoxides and sulfones is described . In all case , a complete isomerization of the stereochemistry is observed and only the e-isomer is obtained . the reactivity of the resulting vinylic organometallic can be increased by a transmetalation reaction into organocopper , organozinc or organopalladium specie and , therefore , several carbon-carbon formation were easily realized . cyclopentane and cyclohexane derivative are prepared from 1,5- and 1,6-dienes in a one pot procedure by hydrozirconation , then oxidation of the generated 5- and 6-alkenylzirconocene chloride with ammonium hexanitratocerate . cationic metallocene specie , generated from Cp2MCl2 and AgClO4 ( m = Zr , Hf ) , were used for the glycosylation of catechin derivative <nUm> , enabling a concise synthesis of a glycosyl flavonoid , astilbin ( 1 ) . further study revealed the efficiency of this lewis acidic specie for NS - type activation of the C(4) position of catechin derivative <nUm> , enabling selective substitution with various nucleophiles . reaction pathway a well a stereochemistries and stoichiometry of zirconocene - catalyzed silylation of olefin with chlorosilanes in the presence of nBuMgCl were studied and discussed in detail . rate determining step were examined by kinetic study and labeling experiment . intramolecular alkene-carbonyl coupling reaction of N-benzyl-N-(o- alkenylaryl)carbamate derivative derived from o-aminostyrene , o-(aminomethyl)styrene and o-aminoallylbenzene smoothly proceeded by treating with zirconocene - butene complex to give the corresponding lactam derivative . a-Lithiated phenylsulphonyloxiranes insert into alkenylzirconocene chloride with loss of phenylsulphinate to give zirconyloxiranes which smoothly rearrange by either a- or b- C-O cleavage to afford regiodefined zirconium enolates which may be further elaborated . both vinyl and alkyl zirconocenes undergo rapid coupling with aryl halide under heterogeneous condition in a microwave reactor using Ni / C a catalyst . ligand variation both in type and stoichiometry play major role in the extent of conversion . none none zirconocene - alkene complex Cp2Zr(CH2{double bond , long}CHR ) reacted with chlorophosphate to form zircono-ethylphosphonate with high regioselectivity , which is versatile and could be converted into various functionalized organophosphonates . the regioselectivity of insertion of carbenoids into a variety of unsymmetrical zirconacyclopentanes is reported . for comparison the regioselectivities of isonitrile insertion and protonation have also been determined . the enantioselectivity of chiral Zr catalyst L1L2ZrCl2 [ L1 = L2 = 1-neomenthylindenyl ( ind* ) , <nUm> ; L1 = cp , L2 = ind* <nUm> ; L1 = cp , L2 = 1-neomenthylindenyl-4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl ( cp* ) <nUm> ] in the hydro- , carbo- and cycloalumination of alkene by organoaluminium compound ( OAC ) ( AlMe3 , AlEt3 , HAlBu2i ) ha been studied . it wa found that OAC exhibit the most effect on the reaction chemo- and enantioselectivity . the reaction chemo- and enantioselectivity depend on the catalyst structure and reaction condition ( solvent type , catalyst concentration , temperature ) a well . it is shown that the lack of asymmetric induction in the reaction of a-methylstyrene hydroalumination by HAlBu2i , catalyzed with complex <nUm> or <nUm> , is the result of the formation of Zr hydride complex of different structure a reaction intermediate . MTPA wa used a a derivatization reagent for the enantiomeric excess estimation and absolute configuration assignment of b-chiral alcohol obtained after the oxidation and hydrolysis of the reaction product . the applicability of MTPA for the assignment of the absolute configuration of the stereogenic centre in b-ethyl substituted primary alcohol and b-alkyl-1,4-butanediols is shown . stereodefined butadienyl phosphine and related derivative were readily prepared in high yield with perfect regioselectivity via the zirconocene - mediated pair - selective coupling of alkynylphosphines with ethylene or alkynylphosphines with normal alkyne . interesting and synthetically useful iodination reaction were found when the in situ generated a- phosphinozirconacyclopentenes or a-phosphinozirconacyclopentadienes were treated with I2 . benzylzirconocene intermediate , which wa readily prepared by the reaction of o-alkoxymethylstyrene with ' Cp2Zr ' under mild condition , reacted with allylic halide or phosphate in the presence of catalytic amount of ClCu to give allylated product in good yield . benzylzirconocene intermediate , which wa readily prepared by a reaction of o-alkoxymethylstyrene with ' Cp2Zr ' under mild condition , reacted with acyl chloride in the presence of a catalytic amount of BrCu - SMe <nUm> to give ketone derivative in moderate to good yield . highly enantioselective 1,4-addition of alkenylzirconocene chloride to a,b-enones wa found to be catalyzed by a chiral rhodium complex generated from [Rh(cod)(MeCN)2]BF4 and (S)-BINAP . the reaction can be applied to either cyclic or acyclic enones and the optical yield wa up to <nUm> % ee . the reaction mechanism would involve the transmetalation between the alkenylzirconocene chloride and the rhodium complex to give the alkenylrhodium specie a a key intermediate . cyclopropylcarbinylzirconium complex were generated from homoallylic ether and zirconocene ( cp 2ZrCl <nUm> / 2n-BuLi ) . they underwent further in situ transformation that is , bromination - substitution , transmetallation - functionalization and insertion reaction to afford various cyclopropylcarbinyl derivative . In contrast , ring - opening product could be selectively obtained by treating the zirconium complex with MeLi , prior to functionalization . the presence of catalytic quantity of the copper (I) iodide dimethyl sulfide complex {(CuI)4(SMe2)3} with alkenyl-alkylzincate reagent allows for the complete chemoselective 1,4-addition of various alkenyl group to a number of a,b-unsaturated carbonyl compound in CCl2H2 at + <nUm> ° C . the 1,4-addition of the mixed vinylzincate reagent is more efficient than the corresponding vinylzirconocene reagent in CCl2H2 or THF . by employing CCl2H2 a a medium , the asymmetric copper - catalyzed addition of the vinyl group to a,b-unsaturated imide is facilitated by the presence of TMSOTf to give excellent yield and up to <nUm> : <nUm> diastereomeric ratio ( dr ) . heteroaromatic zirconocene intermediate were generated by the reaction of ' Cp2Zr ' with alkoxymethyl-(TMS-ethynyl)-indole , -benzofuran or -benzothiophene derivative under mild condition in moderate to good yield . copper - catalyzed C-C bond formation of the zirconocene intermediate with allylic halide gave allylation product , which were transformed into heterocyclic dienes through enyne metathesis . preliminary diels - alder reaction of the dienes with DMAD showed notable site selectivity . zirconocene catalyzed cyclization of 2-(5-methoxy-3-penten-1-yl)styrene in the presence of organomagnesium reagent wa studied . the cyclization proceeded in high isolated yield ( up to <nUm> % ) with excellent trans-selectivity ( > <nUm> % ) , which is unusual for the formation of cyclohexane derivative . catalytic cyclization in the presence of Cp2ZrCl2 proceeded a well with similar result . the reaction with (R,R)-(EBTHI)2ZrCl2 gave a ci / trans mixture of <nUm> in low yield and poor ee . treatment of the different kind of alkynyl-substituted dialkynyldiarylsilanes with zirconocene-ethylene complex Cp2Zr(CH2{double bond , long}CH2 ) followed by acidification with <nUm> N ClH gave regio- and stereoselectively the corresponding silacyclobutenes in good yield . desilylation of the silacyclobutenes with tetrabutylammonium fluoride afforded stereoselectively unsymmetrical conjugated (1E,3E)-dienes and -trienes ( R1 or R2 = 1-cyclohexenyl ) in excellent yield . stereoselective formation of carbocycles wa carried out through [RhCl(cod)]2 - catalyzed reaction of alkenylzirconocene chloride to o-carbonyl-a,b-ene carbonyl ( ketone , ester , and amide ) or to bis-enone derivative . the Rh (I) - catalyzed reaction of alkenylzirconocene chloride with o-carbonyl-a,b-enoyl amide , which is derived from oppolzer 's sultam , showed high diastereoselectivity to yield an carbocycle ( <nUm> % yield , > <nUm> % de ) . stereo - defined 1,1,4,4-tetrahalo- and 1,1,4,4-mixed-tetrahalo-1,3-butadienes were obtained in excellent yield via desilylation - halogenation of their corresponding 1,4-bis(trimethylsilyl)-1,4-dihalo-1,3-dienes , which could be readily prepared from the zirconocene - mediated high - yield and high - regioselective cyclo-dimerization of 1-trimethylsilyl-1-alkynes followed by halogenation . these poly-functionalized gem-dihalodienes are potentially useful building block . the addition of alkenylzirconocene chloride to 3,4-dihydroisoquinoline in the presence of a stoichiometric amount of acylating agent such a (Boc)2O or C3ClH5O2 wa carried out in the presence of a catalytic amount of Cu (I) ( <nUm> mol % ) to give an alkenylation-carbamation product . the enantioselective addition ( 56-75 % ee ) of the alkenylzirconocene chloride wa also achieved under Cu (I) / chiral amine ( <nUm> mol % ) condition . zirconacycles <nUm> prepared from 1-alkynylphosphonates <nUm> , zirconocene dichloride , and <nUm> equiv of EtMgCl are smoothly converted into cyclobutenylphosphonates <nUm> when treated with two equiv of ClCu in 65-81 % isolated yield . the reaction is specific and general only for zirconacyclopentenyl phosphonates . trimethylvinylsilane and disubstituted alkyne underwent coupling reaction in the presence of the lanthanide - originated zirconocene equivalent . both reaction , stoichiometric and catalytic in zirconium , could be carried out ; in the latter case the addition of a stoichiometric amount of AlCl3 wa needed . the catalytic cycle involving bimetallic polarization and a transmetallation step ha been proposed . a-Methylenyl zirconacyclopentenes are synthesized regio- and stereoselectively via reductive intermolecular cross-coupling of alkyne and allenes promoted by zirconocene specie ' Cp2Zr ' . an interesting reductive intramolecular coupling of the a-methylenyl zirconacyclopentene ha been observed in the presence of DMAD / ClCu , resulting in the generation of cyclobutene with an exocyclic double bond . polysubstituted 1,4-dienes can be given with high selectivity and good yield . g,d-Unsaturated o-methyl oxime were cyclized to dihydropyrrole by the treatment of (1-butene)ZrCp2 <nUm> prepared by negishi 's procedure ( reaction with Cp2ZrCl2 and two equivalent of n-BuLi ) . In this cyclization , the geometry of oxime wa affected and syn-oximes were cyclized efficiently . however , it wa found that the anti-oxime is not suitable for the cyclization . mono- and bisaluminacyclopentenes obtained via zirconium - catalyzed cycloalumination with et <nUm> Al and cyclic alkyne or diynes can be converted into the corresponding mono- and biscyclopentenones by treatment with CO <nUm> , ClCOOEt , or CO(OEt) <nUm> in yield of 34-73 % . zirconacyclopentenes , which are easily prepared from alkyne , alkene , and zirconocene compound , reacted with dichlorophenylphosphine to give 2-phospholene in high yield . the reaction wa performed conveniently in one - pot from an alkyne , alkene , dichlorophosphine , and zirconocene compound . A new catalytic system ( cat . (H)2Phen(Me)2* Cl2Ni or (MeO)2Dipyr(H)2*NiCl <nUm> , cat . Zr(cp)2Cl2 , <nUm> equiv Mn , and <nUm> equiv ClLi ) ha been developed to facilitate the homocoupling of a wide range of aryl , alkenyl , and alkynyl halide . the reductive coupling of imines in the presence of the lanthanide - originated zirconocene equivalent allows the synthesis of vicinal diamine or imidazolidines under mild condition in good yield with high diastereoselectivity . zirconium - catalyzed cycloalumination of cycloalkadiynes assisted by et 3Al , subsequent treatment of the in situ generated tricyclic dialuminum compound with BrCH2OMe and finally cyclopropanation of the obtained dispiro cyclopropyl dimethylene macrocarbocycles with et 3Al-CH2I2 represents an efficient one - pot synthetic approach to prepare di- and tetraspiro cyclopropane - containing macrocarbocycles in very high yield . insertion of allenyl carbenoids ( 3-tosyloxy-1-lithioalk-1-ynes ) into organozirconium complex gave allenyl-zirconocenes via a 1,2-zirconate rearrangement . trapping of the allenyl-zirconium specie with aldehyde and ketone gave , after hydrolysis , a series of homopropargyl alcohol . enantioenriched product were prepared by insertion of the lithium carbenoid derived from (S)-but-3-yn-2-yl 4-toluenesulfonate into alkyl- and alkenyl-chlorozirconocenes . stereoselective preparation of alkenyl sulfide wa carried out via syn-hydrozirconation of the alkynyl sulfide . regiochemistry of halogenation of the thioalkenyl zirconocene could be switched by different halide . a-Chloroalkenyl sulfide or b-haloalkenyl sulfide ( Br , I ) could be obtained by the treatment of NCS or NBS ( NIS ) , respectively . possible mechanism of halogenation of the thioalkenyl zirconocene wa set up herein . an air - stable lewis acidic binuclear complex of bis(ethylcyclopentadienyl) zirconium perfluorooctanesulfonate ( 1a ) wa successfully synthesized by the reaction of (CH3CH2Cp)2ZrCl2 with AgC8F17O3S . the complex 1a wa characterized by different technique and found to have the nature of air - stability , water tolerance , thermal - stability , and strong lewis-acidity . In addition , it solubility wa higher than that of our previously reported uninuclear zirconocene bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate) . this complex showed high catalytic efficiency , good recyclability , and reusability in the one - pot three - component aza-Friedel-Crafts reaction of indoles with aldehyde and N,N-dimethylaniline . the yield of the corresponding 3-diarylmethyl indoles are higher than those from the traditional lewis acidic catalyst . A borylation reaction of aromatic diazonium salt ha been optimized using titanocene and zirconocene derivative a catalyst . the reaction employ diisopropylaminoborane a a borylating agent and proceeds smoothly at room temperature to provide arylboronates after methanolysis and transesterification with pinacol . the reaction mechanism ha been found to proceed via a radical pathway . addition of oxalyl chloride to zirconacycles prepared from 1-alkynylphosphonates <nUm> zirconocene dichloride , and two equivalent of EtMgBr smoothly produced novel 2-oxo-cyclopentenylphosphonates <nUm> in 58-81 % isolated yield in the presence of a copper catalyst . none ion - ion interaction are a crucial but often overlooked aspect of many polymerization reaction . the precise nature of cation - anion binding is a yet poorly understood , and little is known of the extent of ionic interaction in the typically nonaqueous , low - polarity reaction medium of most polymerization . nevertheless , adequate control of cation - anion interaction can greatly enhance the productivity and efficiency of chemical process and can provide low - energy alternative to current method . this is illustrated here with the carbocationic polymerization of isoalkenes . carbocationic polymerization involve , a the name implies , carbocations a propagating specie . of the various type of substrate that can be polymerized cationically , the copolymerization of isobutene to isobutene - isoprene rubber stand out a the only large - scale , industrially important implementation of this reaction type . the product , elastomer with controlled degree of unsaturation for subsequent cross-linking , have excellent gas barrier and mechanical dampening property that make them indispensable component in polymer composite . for such application , the polymer molecular weight ha to be high , <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> g / mol , with 1-2 mol % isoprene . cationic polymerization are however notoriously difficult to control . As a mean of suppressing chain transfer , the process is carried out at temperature a low a <nUm> ° C , with aluminum chloride initiator in chloromethane . current industrial production of isobutene - isoprene butyl rubber is thus highly energy intensive and produce aluminum and chloride effluent . this account summarizes how highly electrophilic organometallics coupled with new type of very weakly coordinating counteranions can provide the basis for a more environmentally friendly , lower energy alternative . because any copolymerization of two monomer , here primarily isobutene and isoprene , lead to two different propagating specie , each of which is characterized by different chain growth and chain termination kinetics , variation of the associated counteranions can give rather unexpected result . with judicious choice of the initiator and the counteranion , new chemistry can be injected into such process and can open avenue to new family of polymer material . mechanistic investigation of the initiation process with zirconocene hydride illustrate the complexity of this first step . replacing aluminum with zinc initiator not only provides a nontoxic alternative but also generates a system in which the polymer molecular weight is much le affected by temperature and comonomer concentration , which can lead to a range of product , from oligomeric lubricant precursor to C-C - rich high-molecular-weight elastomer . the key in all these case is the construction of either preformed or in situ - generated complex anion that are resistant to electrophilic or redox degradation and are capable of stabilizing tightly associated carbocations . such initiator system allow much more benign operating temperature , reduce the need for chlorocarbon solvent , and can operate at concentration a low a <nUm> × 10-5 m . along the way are provided the first example of structurally characterized sec-alkyl carbocations and carbocation salt of organometallic zincates . macrocyclic compound have attracted considerable attention in numerous application , including host - guest chemistry , chemical sensing , catalysis , and material science . A major obstacle , however , is the limited number of convenient , versatile , and high - yielding synthetic route to functionalized macrocycles . macrocyclic compound have been typically synthesized by ring - closing or condensation reaction , but many of these procedure produce mixture of oligomers and cyclic compound . As a result , macrocycle synthesis are often associated with difficult separation and low yield . some successful approach that circumvent these problem are based on " self - assembly " process utilizing reversible bond - forming reaction , but for many application , it is essential that the resulting macrocycle be built with a strong covalent bond network . In this account , we describe how zirconocene - mediated reductive coupling of alkyne can provide reversible carbon-carbon bond - forming reaction well - suited for this purpose.Zirconocene coupling of alkene and alkyne ha been used extensively a a source of novel , versatile pathway to functionalized organic compound . here , we describe the development of zirconocene - mediated reductive coupling a a highly efficient method for the preparation of macrocycles and cage with diverse composition , size , and shape . this methodology is based on the reversible , regioselective coupling of alkyne with bulky substituents . In particular , silyl substituents provide regioselective , reversible coupling that place them into the a-positions of the resulting zirconacyclopentadiene ring . according to density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation and kinetic study , the mechanism of this coupling involves a stepwise process , whereby an insertion of the second alkyne influence regiochemistry through both steric and electronic factors.Zirconocene coupling of diynes that incorporate silyl substituents generates predictable macrocyclic product in very high yield . In the absence of significant steric repulsion , the macrocyclization appears to be entropically driven , thereby providing the smallest strain - free macrocyclic structure . the scope of the reaction ha been explored by variation of the spacer group between the alkynyl substituents and by incorporation of functional and chiral group into the macrocycle . the size and shape of the resulting macrocycles are largely determined by the length and geometry of the dialkyne spacer , especially in the case of terminal trimethylsilyl-substituted diynes . for example , linear , rigid diynes with four or fewer phenylene ring lead to trimeric macrocycles , whereas bent or flexible diynes produce dimer . depending on the reaction condition , functional group ( such a n-heterocycles and imines ) are tolerated in zirconocene coupling reaction , and in selected case , they can be used to influence the shape of the final macrocyclic product . more recently , cp 2Zr(pyr)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) ha been employed a a more general zirconocene synthon ; it affords higher yield and increased functional group tolerance . functional group can also be incorporated through transformation of the zirconacyclopentadiene product , with acid hydrolysis to the corresponding butadiene being the most efficient derivatization . furthermore , construction of chiral macrocycles ha been accomplished by stereoselective macrocyclizations , and triynes have been coupled into three - dimensional cage compound . we also discus various design factor , providing a perspective on the utility of zirconocene - mediated coupling in the assembly of macrocyclic and cage compound . characterizing reactive organometallic intermediate is critical for understanding the mechanistic aspect of metal - mediated organic reaction . moreover , the isolation of reactive organometallic intermediate can often result in the ability to design new synthetic method . In this account , we outline synthetic method that we developed for a variety of diverse Zr / Si organo-bimetallic compound and Si / N heteroatom - organic compound through the detailed study of zirconacyclobutene-silacyclobutene fused compounds.Two basic component are involved in this chemistry . the first is the Si - tethered diyne , which owes it rich reactive palette to the combination of the Si-C bond and the C = C triple bond . the second is the low - valent zirconocene specie cp 2Zr(II) , which ha proven very useful in organic synthesis . the reaction of these two component affords the zirconacyclobutene-silacyclobutene fused compound , which is the key reactive Zr / Si organo-bimetallic intermediate discussed here.We discus the three type of reaction that have been developed for the zirconacyclobutene-silacyclobutene fused intermediate . the reaction with nitrile ( the C = N triple bond ) is introduced in the first section . In this one - pot reaction , up to four different component can be combined : the Si - tethered diyne can be reacted with three identical nitrile , with differing nitrile , or with a nitrile and other unsaturated organic substrate such a formamides , isocyanides , acid chloride , aldehyde , carbodiimides , and azide . several unexpected multiring , fused Zr / Si organo-bimetallic intermediate were isolated and characterized . A wide variety of n-heterocycles , such a 5-azaindole , pyrrole , and pyrroloazepine derivative , were obtained . we then discus the reaction with alkyne ( the C = C triple bond ) . A consecutive skeletal rearrangement , differing from that observed in the reaction with nitrile , take place in this reaction . finally , we discus the reaction with the C = x substrate ( where x is O or N ) , including ketone , aldehyde , and isocyanides . oxa- and azazirconacycles are formed via a new skeletal rearrangement.Our result show that the zirconocene and the Si - tethered diyne cooperate a a " chemical transformer " after treatment with various substrate , leading to a diverse range of cyclic Zr / Si organo-bimetallic compound . this mechanism - derived synthesis of organometallic and organic compound demonstrates that the investigation of metal - mediated reaction and the isolation of reactive organometallic intermediate not only contribute to the understanding of complex reaction but can also lead to the discovery of synthetically useful method . (Butadiene)zirconocene add BC18F15 at a terminal diene carbon atom to yield the zirconocene-(m-hydrocarbyl)-borate betaine Cp2-Zr[C4H6-B C6F5 ] ( 4 ) . the dipolar complex <nUm> contains a distorted p-allyl moiety and feature an additional stabilizing Zr-F-C(arene) coordination . under kinetic control , an isomeric betaine system is formed , characterized by an internal Zr+***CH2[B]- ion - pair interaction , that rearranges to <nUm> upon heating . A great variety of ansa-metallocene(butadiene) complex and related system cleanly form analogous metallocene-(m - conjugated diene)-borate betaine upon treatment with BC18F15 and related lewis acid . most of these system represent very active homogeneous single - component ziegler - natta catalyst for a-olefin polymerization and copolymerization . In addition , these betaine catalyst are ideally suited for carrying out mechanistic study in active ziegler - natta catalyst system . they allow for an experimental observation of the first alkene insertion step at the active single - component catalyst . this feature ha been used for studying the mechanism of transfer of the stereochemical information from the bent metallocene backbone and for an experimental characterization of the energy profile of the alkene addition / alkene insertion reaction sequence in active homogeneous ziegler - natta system . the neutral dipolar single - component catalyst ( e.g. , <nUm> ) produce a polyolefin - modified R'-(CHR-CH2)-C4H6-B (C6F5)3- counterion at the end of the initiation period upon entering into the repetitive active catalytic cycle . A thorough investigation of the reaction of diynes , R(C ≡ C)2R , and polyynes , R(C ≡ C)(n)R , with titanocene and zirconocene wa performed using the metallocene source Cp2M(L)(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( m = Ti , L = - ; m = Zr , L = THF , pyridine ) . the conversion show an array of different product generated in complexation , coupling , and cleavage reaction . these result include remarkable structure ( e.g. , five - membered metallacyclocumulenes ) and reaction ( e.g. , C-C single - bond cleavage ) . In addition , the first C-C single - bond metathesis in homogeneous solution wa discovered . the presented finding have been supported by theoretical study . cascade reaction of internal and terminal alkyne , zirconocene hydrochloride , dimethylzinc , and phosphinoyl imines ( prepared in one step from aldehyde and diphenylphosphinoyl amide ) lead to allylic phosphinoyl amide after aqueous workup . microwave acceleration allows the completion of this one - pot reaction sequence in <nUm> min . these allylic amide can be converted into a variety of derivative , including carbamate and sulfonamide , or reacted prior to workup with diiodomethane to give novel c-cyclopropylalkylamides . A solution - phase " library from library " approach wa used to generate an intermediate 20-member library which wa subsequently expanded to a 100-member library by a series of n-functionalizations . the biological activity wa evaluated in an assay for competitive binding to the estrogen receptor ( ERa ) , revealing three potent lead compound of a new structural type . recent abiotic homogeneous catalytic research focusing on the structure and organizational capability of enzyme to discover unique / more efficient catalytic process is compiled . In <nUm> tian et al. reported a series of silane- and siloxane - bridged binuclear zirconocenes and these metallocenes were studied a catalyst for ethylene polymerization in the presence of MAO . sierra et al. described the synthesis of binuclear titanium and zirconium complex , prepared by olefin metathesis . the binuclear CGC titanium catalyst are found to be very active when activated with bisborate B2 or bisborane BN <nUm> cocatalysts . methylene-bridged binuclear bis(imino)pyridyl Fe (II) complex , activated with Al(iBu)3 , are found to exhibit higher activity than the corresponding mononuclear iron catalyst , along with an enhanced molecular weight of the linear polyethylene produced . tetra- and octanuclear half - titanocenes , when activated with MAO , display high ethylene polymerization activity . coupled cluster CCSD(T) calculation with core - valence correlation and complete basis set ( CBS ) limit extrapolation are used to benchmark the performance of commonly used density functionals in computing energy barrier for Zr - mediated reaction involving zirconocene specie . these reaction include ( a ) insertion of the Zr-H bond of Cp2Zr(H)Cl into C = C , ci - C , and C = O bond and ( b ) C-H activation by Zr = N bond in Cp2Zr = NH . the best performing functionals are M06-L , M06 , and M06-2X in the M06 series , all having mean unsigned deviation ( MUD ) le than <nUm> kcal / mol . the worst performing functional is OLYP , with a distinctly large MUD of more than <nUm> kcal / mol . considering also the trend in barrier height and the systematic barrier height deviation , our best recommended functional is M06-2X . In this work , DFT empirical dispersion correction ( DFT-D3 ) is found to improve the performance of barrier height value for most functionals ( especially of OLYP and B3LYP ) . with DFT empirical dispersion correction , we also recommend M06-2X for reaction barrier calculation of Zr - mediated reaction . the compound Cp2M((PR)3) ( m = Zr , r = ph ( 1 ) , cy ( 2 ) ; m = Hf , r = cy ( 3 ) ) and Cp*2Zr((PCy)3) ( 4 ) were prepared and characterized . these compound were prepared by the known reaction of the metallocene dihalide with primary phosphide salt . alternatively , activation of the P-H bond of a primary phosphine by zirconocene yield <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> , respectively . both stabilized metallocene(II) Cp2Zr(SMe2)2 and metallocene generated by in situ reduction were employed . attempt to identify intermediate in these reaction have been undertaken . reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with the phosphide LiPHPh in the presence of NEt4Br affords the specie [Cp2ZrBr((PPh)2)] [NEt4] ( 5 ) . these result suggest a mechanism of formation of the M(PR)3 derivative involving phosphinidene M-PR and M((PR)2) intermediate . intervention in such a mechanism is also accomplished by the additional electron on V(IV) . thus reaction of Cp2V with PH2Ph yield Cp2V((PPh)2) ( 6 ) . although this reaction could not be halted at the intermediate phosphinidene , specie <nUm> wa also generated via the reaction of Cp2VMeCl with LiPHPh . In a similar reaction Cp2V(PC6H2-2,4,6-Me3)2 ) ( 7 ) wa generated in the reaction of Cp2V with PH2(C6H2-2,4,6-Me3) . In contrast , reaction of the specie [Cp2V]+ with PH2Ph led only to the formation of the 18-electron product [Cp2V(PH2Ph)2]+ ( 8 ) . these result are described , and the implication of these result with particular reference to the mechanism of P-P bond formation are considered . compound <nUm> , <nUm> , 4-6 , and <nUm> were characterized crystallographically . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group P21 / a with a = <nUm> a,b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group P21 / n with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group , I4 / m with a = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group P21 / n with a = <nUm> a,b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , α = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . the complete series of phenylchalcogenolate derivative of permethylzirconocene Cp*2Zr(EPh)2 ( cp* = e5-C5-Me5 ; e = O , S , Se , Te ) ha been prepared by the reaction of Cp*2Zr(CO)2 with PhOH and Ph2E2 ( e = S , Se , Te ) . the molecular structure of all of the derivative Cp*2Zr(EPh)2 have been determined by x-ray diffraction , thereby providing evidence that the nature of the bonding varies a a function of the chalcogen . specifically , the structure of the phenoxo derivative is notably distinct from those of it heavier congener . for example , whereas the Zr-S , Zr-Se , and Zr-Te bond length are comparable to the sum of their respective covalent radius , the Zr-O bond length is significantly shorter than the sum of the covalent radius , a would be anticipated due to an increased ionic contribution to the bonding . In addition , the Zr-O-C bond angle [ <nUm> ° ] in cp*2 - Zr(OPh)2 is effectively linear , whereas the Zr-E-C bond angle for the heavier congener are significantly bent [ <nUm> ° <nUm> ° ] . comparison of the structure of Cp*2Zr(OPh)2 with that of the le substituted zirconocene derivative Cp2Zr(OPh)2 , which posse a bent Zr-O-C moiety [ <nUm> ° ] , suggests that the linearity of Cp*2Zr-(OPh)2 may be attributed to steric factor . thus , short M-OR bond length and linear M-O-R angle are not necessarily a consequence of strong pp-dp lone pair donation from oxygen to the metal . A stable derivative of complex <nUm> , [ cp <nUm> Zr(4,4'-dimethylbipyridine)(CH <nUm> CN ) ] [ BPh <nUm> ] <nUm> ( 11 ) , ha been synthesized and fully characterized . reaction of complex <nUm> with PMe <nUm> produce a complex mixture of cp <nUm> Zr IV -PMe <nUm> product . complex <nUm> reacts rapidly with cp <nUm> Zr(CH <nUm> ) <nUm> to form [ cp <nUm> Zr(CH <nUm> )(CH <nUm> CN ) <nUm> ][BPh <nUm> ] ( 10 ) but reacts only slowly with cp <nUm> Zr(CH <nUm> ph ) <nUm> to form [ cp <nUm> zr(e- n CH <nUm> Ph)(CH <nUm> CN)][BPh <nUm> ] ( 3 ) . the relevance of these result to the synthesis of cp <nUm> Zr(R)(L) n + complex is discussed . halide complex cp <nUm> ZrX <nUm> react with complex <nUm> to form the monohalide cation cp <nUm> Zr(X)(L)n + , which are unstable with respect to disproportionation to cp <nUm> ZrX <nUm> and <nUm> in CH <nUm> CN . the chlorozirconocene carboxylates Cp2(Cl)ZrOC(0)R , with formate ( 2a , r = H ) , acetate ( 2b , r = CH3 ) , pivalate ( 2c , r - C4H9 ) , and benzoate ( 2d , r = ph ) a the carboxylate ligand , have been prepared and characterized , and their reaction with the zirconium hydride reagent [Cp2Zr(H)Cl] ] ( 1 ) and [(C5H4Me)2Zr(H)(M-H)]2(6) have been studied . these carboxylates 2a-d are available by treating [Cp2(Cl)Zr]20 with an excess of the requisite carboxylic acid . In THF solution , however , all exist a solvated e1-O carboxylate complex , possibly Cp2(Cl)Zr(OC(0)R)(THF) . of these zirconocene carboxylates , all but the pivalate react in THF ( but not in toluene ) with <nUm> and yield the requisite aldehyde plus the m-oxo compound [Cp2(Cl)Zr]20 . yield of acetaldehyde and benzaldehyde are 92-93 % . No direct evidence for the postulated m-e1-O,O ’ gem - diolate intermediate Cp2(Cl)ZrOCH(R)-OZr(Cl)Cp2(3a,b,d) during this reduction of ligated carboxylate wa obtained . reduction of the acetate 2b with <nUm> , however , regioselectively affords the m-oxo compound Cp2(Cl)ZrOZr(OCH2CH3)Cp2 , which is consistent with transience of a m-e1'O,O ’ gem - diolate . the kinetics of n-methyl group exchange in zirconocene N,N-dimethyldithiocarbamates , Cp2ZrX(Me2dtc) ( x = Cl , Br , I , me , CH2SiMe3 , CH2CMe2Ph , CH2Ph , OPh , opy ( 4-hydroxypyridinate ) , OXyl ( 2,6-dimethylphenoxide ) ) , and N,N-dimethylthiocarbamates , Cp2ZrX(Me2mtc) ( x = Cl , opy ) , have been studied by variable-temperature1H NMR spectroscopy . for the Cp2ZrX(Me2dtc) complex , rate and activation parameter are relatively independent of the nature of the monodentate ligand when x = halide or alkyl ( k(25 ° C ) = <nUm> – <nUm> s-1 ; DH* = <nUm> – <nUm> kcal / mol ) , but there is a dramatic increase in rate a the p-donating ability of x varies in the order Cl < opy < OPh ; k(25 ° C ) = <nUm> x 104s-1and DH* = <nUm> kcal / mol when x = OPh . No dramatic increase in exchange rate is observed for Cp2ZrX(Me2mtc) a x varies from Cl to opy . except for the aryloxy dithiocarbamate complex , rate and activation parameter are similar to those for related organic dithiocarbamates and thiocarbamates , strongly suggesting a mechanism involving rotation about the C = N bond . Cp2ZrX(Me2dtc) ( x = OPh , opy ) is believed to exchange methyl group by a Zr-S bond - rupture mechanism . this mechanism , which is promoted by the p-donor property of the aryloxy ligand , is inaccessible in aryloxythiocarbamate complex because it would give a higher energy , unobserved stereoisomer . preparative method for the Cp2ZrX(Me2dtc) and Cp2ZrX(Me2mtc) complex and the Cp2Zr(X)Cl intermediate are described . cyclic organohydroborate complex of zirconium monocyclopentadienyl CpZr{(m-H)2BC5H10}3 , <nUm> , and CpZr{(m-H)2BC8H14}3 , <nUm> , were prepared from the reaction of CpZrCl3 with <nUm> mol of K[H2BC5H10] and K[H2BC8H10] respectively , in diethyl ether . compound <nUm> and <nUm> react with the hydride ion abstracting agent BC18F15 to form the same salt [CpZr(OEt)(OEt2)(m-OEt)]2 [HB(C6F5)3]2 , <nUm> . the complex CpZr(Cl){(m-H)2BC8H14}2 , <nUm> , and Cp*Zr(Cl){(m-H)2BC8H14}2 [ where cp* = C2H3 ] , <nUm> , were prepared from the reaction of CpZrCl3 and Cp*ZrCl3 with K[H2BC8H10] in <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio , respectively . an a-hydrogen of a BC8H14 unit form an agostic interaction with Zr in compound <nUm> but not in <nUm> . all of the compound were characterized by single - crystal x-ray diffraction analysis . In reaction of zirconocene dichloride , Cp2ZrCl2 , with <nUm> equiv and an excess amount of BCH6Li , the methyltrihydroborate complex , Cp2ZrCl{(m-H)2BHCH3} , <nUm> , and Cp2Zr{(m-H)2BHCH3}2 , <nUm> , were isolated . the reaction of titanocene dichloride , Cp2TiCl2 , with an excess amount of BCH6Li produced the monosubstituted methyltri-hydroborate complex , Cp2Ti{(m-H)2BHCH3} , <nUm> . the titanium wa reduced from Ti(IV) to Ti (III) , producing a 17- electron , paramagnetic titanocene complex . under a dynamic vacuum at room temperature , compound <nUm> decomposed and produced the zirconium hydride compound Cp2ZrH{(m-H)2BHCH3} . single crystal x-ray structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were determined , crystal data for <nUm> : space group P21 / c , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> . crystal data for <nUm> : space group pna21 , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , z = <nUm> . crystal data for <nUm> : space group fmm2 , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , z = <nUm> . derivatization of silicon surface is an area of intense interest due to the centrality of silicon in the microelectronics industry and because of potential promise for a myriad of other application . In this paper , we investigate the feasibility of Si-Si bond formation directly on the surface to contrast with the more widely studied Si-C and Si-O bond forming reaction . functionalization of hydride - terminated silicon surface with silanes is carried out via early transition metal mediated dehydrogenative silane coupling reaction . zirconocene and titanocene catalyst system were evaluated for heterocoupling of a molecular silane , RSiH3 , with a surface Si-H group on Si ( s ) . the zirconocene catalyst proved to be much more reactive than the titanium system , and so the former wa examined exclusively . the silanes , aromatic or aliphatic , are bonded to the silicon surface through direct Si-Si bond , although the level of incorporation of the trihydroarylsilanes wa substantially higher than that of the aliphatic silanes . the reaction proceeds on nanocrystalline hydride - terminated porous silicon surface , a well a flat Si(100)-Hx and Si(111)-H interface . the reaction were studied by a variety of technique , including FTIR , SIMS , and XPS . an activated side - on - bound ansa - zirconocene dinitrogen complex , [ me <nUm> si(e <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> )(e <nUm> - C <nUm> H <nUm> -3- t Bu)Zr ] <nUm> ( μ <nUm> , η <nUm> ,e <nUm> -N <nUm> ) , ha been prepared by sodium amalgam reduction of the corresponding dichloride precursor under an atmosphere of N <nUm> . both solution spectroscopic and x-ray diffraction data establish diastereoselective formation of the syn homochiral dizirconium dimer . addition of <nUm> atm of H <nUm> resulted in rapid hydrogenation of the N <nUm> ligand to yield one diastereomer of the hydrido zirconocene diazenido complex . kinetic measurement have yielded the barrier for H <nUm> addition and in combination with isotopic labeling study are consistent with a 1,2-addition pathway . In the absence of H <nUm> , the hydrido zirconocene diazenido product undergoes swift diazene dehydrogenation to yield an unusual hydrido zirconocene dinitrogen complex . the N = N bond length of <nUm> Å determined by x-ray crystallography indicates that the side - on - bound N <nUm> ligand is best described a a two - electron reduced [ N <nUm> ] 2- fragment . comparing the barrier for deuterium exchange with [ me <nUm> si(e <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> )(e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -3- t Bu)ZrH ] <nUm> ( μ <nUm> ,e <nUm> , η <nUm> -N <nUm> H <nUm> ) to diazene dehydrogenation is consistent with rapid 1,2-elimination of dihydrogen followed by rate - determining hydride migration to the zirconium . this mechanistic proposal is also corroborated by H <nUm> inhibition and the observation of a normal , primary kinetic isotope effect for dehydrogenation . the current study describes the first in situ synthesis and characterization of a new family of cationic coordination tetrahedron of both the FV and V4E6 type , which are constructed by a new building block based on a trinuclear zirconocene moiety and the dicarboxylate or tricarboxylate anion . by the interaction of (C5H6)2MCl2 ( m = Ti , Zr ) ( <nUm> mol ) and a b-diketone ( keH ) ( <nUm> mol ) , in the presence of triethylamme ( <nUm> mol ) , in acetonitrile solution at <nUm> ° , the compound C5H5MCl(ke)2 weee prepared . center , two - electron Zr-H-Zr bond . it molecular geometry is constrained by a crystallographic center of inversion , which requires a trans orientation for the two terminal hydride . the important bond angle within the H2Zr core are Ht,-Zr-Hb = <nUm> (1)A , Ht-Zr-Hb ‘ = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , Hb-Zr-Hb ‘ = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , and Zr-Hb-Zr ’ = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , and the metal-hydrogen bond distance are Zr-H , = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , Zr-Hb = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , and Zr-Hb ‘ = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å . so that inter-ring repulsion introduced during dimer formation might be relieved , the methylcyclopentadienyl ring have been rotated so that the methyl substituents on opposite side of the molecule are directed away from one another . the compound crystallizes in a triclinic unit cell of PI symmetry with refined lattice parameter of a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) a,c = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , a = <nUm> ( 3 ) ° , β = <nUm> ( 3 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , V = <nUm> ( 3 ) A3 , z = <nUm> dimer of fw <nUm> per cell , and pcalod = <nUm> g / cm3 . full - A simple new route to access heterometallic alkoxo precursor for a wide range of material is reported . this unique synthetic method comprises elimination of the cyclopentadienyl ring from cp <nUm> MCl <nUm> ( m = Ti , Zr ) a CpH in the presence of M'(OR) <nUm> ( M' = Ca , Mn ; OR = OCH <nUm> CH <nUm> OCH <nUm> or OEt ) in an alcohol a a source of proton . In one - pot reaction , we have prepared four different compound with Ti <nUm> Ca <nUm> ( μ <nUm> -O ) , cp <nUm> Zr <nUm> Ca <nUm> ( μ <nUm> -Cl ) , Zr <nUm> Mn <nUm> ( μ <nUm> -O ) <nUm> , and cp <nUm> Ti <nUm> ( m-OEt ) <nUm> motif . the compound were characterized by single - crystal x-ray structural analysis and NMR spectroscopy . new early - late heterobimetallic hydride (L2ZrCl)(Cp*Ir) (
