C-H activation by a coordinatively unsaturated dinuclear complex (L2Zr)(Cp*Ir)(H) <nUm> ( 3 ) . the reaction of 5,5-bis(trimethylstannyl)cyclopentadiene with CpZrCl3 ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) affords the monostan - nylated metallocene complex (e5-Me3SnC5H4)CpZrCl2 ( 1 ) , accompanied by variable amount of (e5-ClMe2-SnC5H4)CpZrCl2 ( 2 ) . the complex ( 1 ) reacts with BCl3 or with ClI to afford <nUm> ( Sn-CH3 cleavage ) , but with ClH , Cp2ZrCl2 is obtained instead ( Sn-Cp cleavage ) . depending on the reaction condition , treatment of either <nUm> or <nUm> with BBr3 affords (e5-BrMe2SnC5H4)CpZrBr2 ( 3 ) or (e5-Br2MeSnC5H4)CpZrBr2 ( 4 ) . the reaction of <nUm> with excess I2 affords the iodostannylated complex (e5-IMe2SnC5H4)CpZrCl2 ( 5 ) . two of the complex ( 2*2C6H5CH3 and 4*THF ) are crystallographically characterized . the adduct 4*THF ha a distorted trigonal bipyramidal geometry about tin with a long O-Sn distance of <nUm> Å . we find overall that Me3Sn substituents undergo electrophilic halodemethylation much more readily than corresponding Me3Si substituents , whereas the reactivity of the halostannylated complex toward nucleophiles such a airborne moisture are much lower than those of their halosilylated counterpart . the kinetics of ethylene / norbornene copolymerization with rac-Et(1-indenyl) 2ZrCl <nUm> ( 1 ) and [ 2,2'-Me(1,3-Me 2Cp ) 2]ZrCl <nUm> ( 2 ) catalyst with modified methylaluminoxane are analyzed through experimentation and theoretical modeling . these catalyst show that the rate of norbornene incorporation into the copolymer is strongly catalyst dependent . for example , while catalyst <nUm> show a decreasing polymerization rate with an increase in the norbornene concentration , catalyst <nUm> show a monotonically increasing polymerization rate with an increase in the norbornene concentration for a norbornene / ethylene mole ratio up to <nUm> in the bulk liquid phase . both terminal and penultimate model are developed to describe the rate process with these catalyst . it is shown that for both catalyst system the penultimate model yield a more accurate description of the copolymerization kinetics than the terminal model . the penultimate model ha also been applied to a continuous copolymerization reactor system with catalyst <nUm> . the copolymerization wa also carried out in a continuous stirred tank reactor . the model simulation result and the experimental data of norbornene conversion , solid content , and glass transition temperature profile obtained from a laboratory - scale continuous reactor operation have been compared . interestingly , the model simulation show that the ethylene concentration in the bulk liquid phase is much lower than the saturated ethylene concentration , suggesting that mass - transfer resistance might be present for the ethylene gas in reaching the catalytic site in the liquid phase . the present study focused on the application of mixed OTi 2-SiO2 - supported methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) with a zirconocene catalyst on the linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) production . At low concentration of O2Ti present in the mixed support , it revealed that O2Ti wa decorated on the O2Si surface and acted a a spacer to anchor MAO to the O2Si surface resulting in le steric hindrance and le interaction . As a result , catalytic activity via ethylene / 1-olefin copolymerization apparently increased with the presence of O2Ti . besides increased activity , the presence of O2Ti in the mixed support can result in a slightly lower molecular weight ( MW ) of polymer , suggesting a higher chain transfer rate . A high - pressure , high - temperature continuous stirred - tank reactor ( CSTR ) system having approximately an ideal residence time distribution ( RTD ) ha been set up for the polymerization of olefin utilizing metallocene catalyst . preliminary experiment of ethylene polymerized with the metallocene catalyst system zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) / modified-methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) / trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) in toluene at <nUm> psig have been carried out . the reactor system showed good control over temperature , pressure , and ethylene feed rate . the steady state wa obtained after four mean residence time ( <nUm> τ 's ) . with increasing Cp2ZrCl2 concentration , the molecular weight ( MW ) of polyethylene ( PE ) decreased and the catalyst activity ( kg of PE / ( [ethylene]*g of catalyst ) ) increased . with increasing temperature between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C , the MW of PE decreased and molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) polydispersity increased . EsP with weight - average molecular weight ( mw ) <nUm> 000-52 <nUm> were obtained . the catalyst activity decreased with increasing temperature with an apparent activation energy of <nUm> kJ / mol . the deactivation of the catalyst is first - order with the rate constant kd = <nUm> × 10-3 s-1 at <nUm> ° C . the rate constant of propagation and b-scission at <nUm> ° C are kp = <nUm> × <nUm> (M*s)-1 and ktr,b = <nUm> s-1 . the first example of a new class of main group metallacycles , stibathiolanes , have been synthesized via transmetalation from zirconocene metallacycles . the x-ray crystal structure of three 1-halostibathiolanes have been determined and the compound found to be polymeric in the crystalline state . physical and spectroscopic data indicate that the compound are monomeric in hydrocarbon solution but that they undergo rapid - reversible halide - exchange reaction . A consequence of one of these exchange reaction is the inversion of stereochemistry at antimony . the process have been investigated by using a variety of NMR and crossover experiment . the proposed intermediate for the inversion of stereochemistry at the metal center is supported by the solid - state structure of the compound in which the proposed connectivity of the intermediate is crystallographically established . zirconocene complex of substituted naphthalynes have been generated in situ and trapped with nitrile to form azametallacycles with excellent regiochemical control . these compound can be converted into ketone , a-iodo ketone , and iodoacylnaphthoquinones with experimentally simple procedure . none none none none none none none none none none reaction of zirconocene and hafnocene silyl derivative CpCp'M(SiR3)Cl ( cp = e5-C5H5 ; cp' = cp or cp* , cp* = e5-C5Me5 ; m = Zr or Hf ; r = me or SiMe3 ) with hydrosilanes have been investigated . the observed product depend on the nature of the starting material , since in some case the initial s-bond metathesis product react further via dehydrocoupling process . for example , Cp2Zr(SiMe3)Cl reacts with PhSiH3 to give the direct product Me3SiH and Cp2Zr(SiH2Ph)Cl , which then combine rapidly with PhSiH3 to produce [Cp2ZrHCl]n , PhH2Si-SiH2Ph , and PhH2Si-SiHPh-SiH2Ph . thus , hydrosilyl complex obtained from such reaction can be contaminated by significant quantity of the corresponding hydride . the s-bond metathesis reaction of CpCp*Hf[Si(SiMe3)3]Cl ( 2 ) with hydrosilanes RR'SiH2 cleanly give the isolable metal silyl derivative CpCp*Hf(SiHRR')Cl ( SiHRR' = SiH2Ph ( 8 ) , SiH2(p-Tol) ( 9 ) , SiH2(p-MeOC6H4) ( 10 ) , SiH2(p-FC6H4) ( 11 ) , SiH2Mes ( <nUm> , me = 2,4,6-Me3C6H2 ) , SiH2CH2Ph ( 13 ) , SiH2Cy ( 14 ) , SiHPh2 ( 15 ) , SiHMePh ( <nUm> , a a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of diastereomers ) , and SiHPhSiH2Ph ( <nUm> , a a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of diastereomers ) ) . In general , primary or secondary silanes will undergo such reaction , provided that a le sterically hindered silyl ligand is introduced at hafnium . tertiary silanes such a Me3SiH and Et3SiH do not react under comparable condition . reaction of <nUm> with bis(silyl) compound have provided the bimetallic complex 1,4-CpCp*(Cl)HfSiH2C6H4SiH2Hf(Cl)CpCp* ( 19 ) and the thiophene derivative 2,5-CpCp*(Cl)HfSiH2(C4H2S)SiH2Hf- (Cl)CpCp* ( 20 ) . the thermal ( dark ) reaction of <nUm> with PhSiH3 obeys a second - order rate law , rate = k[2] [PhSiH3] , with DH' = <nUm> ( 7 ) kcal mol-1 , DS' = <nUm> ( 2 ) eu , and kH / kD ( <nUm> ° C ) = <nUm> ( 1 ) . these parameter suggest that the above s-bond metathesis reaction involve four - center transition state similar to those that have been proposed for “ hydrocarbon activation ” reaction of d0 ; metal complex . visible light accelerates the reaction of <nUm> with hydrosilanes , via excitation of a low - intensity transition at <nUm> nm ( ϵ = <nUm> dm3 mol-1 cm-1 ) , which appears to have considerable silyl - to - metal charge - transfer character . the quantum yield for the reaction of <nUm> with <nUm> or <nUm> equiv of PhSiH3 is 1.0*0.1 . use of radical trap failed to provide evidence for intermediate radical in this photochemistry . possible mechanism for the observed photochemical conversion are discussed . reaction of <nUm> with alkoxyhydrosilanes HSi(OMe)2R' provide route to the new complex CpCp*Hf(SiH2Me)Cl ( <nUm> , R' = me ) and CpCp*Hf(SiH3)Cl ( <nUm> , R' = OMe ) . these reaction appear to proceed via initial , metal - catalyzed redistribution of the alkoxyhydrosilanes ( e.g. , HSiMe(OMe)2 is redistributed to MeSi(OMe)3 and MeSiH3 ) , followed by trapping of the new hydrosilane by <nUm> . the Hf-Si distance observed for <nUm> ( <nUm> ( 4 ) and <nUm> ( 4 ) Å for the two independent molecule ) is much longer than that observed for <nUm> ( <nUm> ( 3 ) Å ) , apparently because of greater ligand - ligand repulsion in <nUm> . In zirconium - catalyzed carbomagnesation of alkene , the dramatic enhancement in reactivity and selectivity induced by an internal lewis base is such that higher order alkylmagnesium halide , normally significantly le reactive than EtMgCl , may be used efficiently . In reaction with n-BuMgCl , two secondary carbon stereogenic center are formed with excellent level of stereocontrol ( <nUm> , > <nUm> % ) . experimental data are presented which demonstrate that the observed level of selectivity and reactivity are not simply the result of regioselective insertion of the alkene into the zirconacyclopropane . A general mechanism scheme for carbomagnesation of bicyclic substrate <nUm> is presented . noteworthy mechanistic issue are the following : ( 1 ) excess alkylmagnesium halide is required for high level of regioselectivity and substrate reactivity . we suggest that the influence of the grignard reagent stem from generation of the zirconate complex <nUm> ( r = H , me , or et ) , which may be more susceptible to ligand exchange than it zirconacyclopropane precursor <nUm> . subsequent formation of the zirconocene complex of the reacting alkene would then lead to the high level of reactivity and selectivity observed in reaction where excess alkylmagnesium halide is present . ( 2 ) deuterium labeling experiment demonstrate that the resident lewis base strictly control and revers the mode of metallacyclopentane cleavage . the heteroatom bind and delivers magnesium to initiate a highly regioselective metallacyclopentane cleavage , effecting a Mg-Zr exchange with inversion of configuration . A mechanism for the dehydropolymerization of hydrosilanes to polysilanes , a catalyzed by early - transition - metal metallocene derivative , is proposed . this mechanism is based on two s-bond metathesis reaction that pas through four - center transition state : ( 1 ) the dehydrometalation of silane , H(SiHR)nH , with a metal hydride to give hydrogen and a silyl derivative , M(SiHR)nH , and ( 2 ) coupling of the metal silyl derivative with more hydrosilane , H(SiHR)mH , to produce H(SiHR)n(SiHR)mH and regenerate the active metal hydride catalyst . this proposal is based on a number of observed , stoichiometric s-bond metathesis reaction involving zirconocene and hafnocene complex . these reaction , which involve silicon , hydrogen , and a d0 metal center , are rather facile and apparently reflect the tendency of silicon to expand it coordination sphere under these condition . one reaction of this type is rapid MH / HSi hydrogen exchange , for example between PhSi3 and CpCp*MHCl ( <nUm> , m = Zr , or <nUm> , m = Hf ) , which is observed via deuterium labeling . hydrogenolysis of CpCp*M[Si(SiMe3)3]Cl ( <nUm> , m = Zr , and <nUm> , m = Hf ) provides a convenient route to the monomeric hydride complex <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . the first step in the proposed polymerization mechanism , which is the reverse of M-Si bond hydrogenolysis , is observed in stoichiometric reaction of <nUm> or <nUm> with PhSi3 to give hydrogen and the phenylsilyl complex CpCp*M(SiH2Ph)Cl ( <nUm> , m = Zr , and <nUm> , m = Hf ) . the thermolytic decomposition of <nUm> to <nUm> result in Si-Si bond formation , with the production of polysilane oligomers . this second - order reaction exhibit a deuterium isotope effect at <nUm> ° C of <nUm> ( 2 ) and activation parameter ( DH ‡ = <nUm> ( 2 ) kcal mol-1 and DS ‡ = <nUm> ( 6 ) eu ) that suggest a four - center transition state . the second - order reaction of <nUm> with PhSiH3 ( to give <nUm> and (SiHPh)n polysilanes ) wa also studied kinetically and found to exhibit similar kinetic parameter . this s-bond metathesis reaction , which corresponds to the second step in the proposed mechanism , is believed to pas through a four - center transition state that result from interaction of the CpCp*(Cl)Hf-SiH2Ph and H-SiH2Ph bond . evidence for the role of hydride complex a true catalyst is obtained by comparing gel permeation chromatogram for polysilanes obtained from both <nUm> and <nUm> a catalyst . observed reaction of CpCp*Hf[Si(SiMe3)3]Me ( 7 ) with PhSiH3 , to give CpCp*Hf(SiH2Ph)Me ( 8 ) and then CpCp*Hf(H)Me ( 9 ) , model proposed process for the activation of catalyst precursor . the step - growth character of the reaction is illustrated by the slow dehydrocoupling of PhSiH3 by Cp*2HfH2 , which allows observation of early polysilane intermediate ( di- , tri- , and tetrasilane ) . the participation of M(SiHPh)nH complex a intermediate in dehydrocoupling wa investigated . partly on the basis of the observed reaction of CpCp*Hf[(SiHPh)3H]Cl ( 11 ) with PhSiH3 to give <nUm> and H(SiHPh)3H , it is concluded that a preferred dehydrocoupling pathway involves monosilyl intermediate , MSiH2Ph , and chain growth by one monomer unit per catalytic cycle . implication of the proposed mechanism are discussed . several example are described where in situ generated ( e2-alkyne ) group <nUm> metallocene type substrate add to X-[M2] reagent ( M2 = main group metal ) to form dimetallabicyclic product Cp2M(m-e1:e2-RCCR)(m-X)[M2] which contain a planar-tetracoordinate carbon center in the m-e1:e2-hydrocarbyl bridge . thus , (e2-cyclohexyne)(PMe3)ZrCp2 ( 4a ) reacts in this way with excess trimethylgallium to give Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C6H8)(m-CH3)GaMe2 ( 6a ) . complex 6a is one of the rare example of a gallium compound containing s-hydrocarbyl bridge to this heavy main group metal . complex 6a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes in space group P21 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . complex 6a contains a planar-tetracoordinate carbon atom C(2) with pertinent bond distance and angle of <nUm> ( 5 ) Å [Zr-C(2)] , <nUm> ( 5 ) Å [Ga-C(2)] , <nUm> ( 8 ) Å [C(2)-C(3)] , <nUm> ( 7 ) Å [C(1)-C(2)] , <nUm> ( 4 ) ° [C(3)-C(2)-C(1)] , <nUm> ( 3 ) ° [C(3)-C(2)-Ga] , <nUm> ( 1 ) ° [Ga-C(2)-Zr] , and <nUm> ( 3 ) ° [C(1)-C(2)-Zr] , both cp ring are disordered . zirconium and gallium seem to form a three - center two - electron bond with C(2) . the planar-tetracoordinate geometry at carbon atom C(2) is probably electronically stabilized by the s-donor property of the attached metal center and by a p-conjugative interaction of the C(2)-C(1)-Zr moiety normal to the s-plane . (e2-1,2-Didehydrobenzene)(PMe3)ZrCp2 ( 4b ) reacts analogously with trimethylgallium to give Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C6H4)(m-CH3)GaMe2 ( 6b ) in almost quantitative yield . complex 6b crystallizes isomorphously to the corresponding A1 compound in space group P21 / n with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , μ = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . it also contains a planar-tetracoordinate carbon atom [C(2)] . the reaction of ph – C ≡ C – GaMe2 ( 7 ) with (hydrido)zirconocene chloride produce Cp2Zr(m-PhCCH)(m-Cl)GaMe2 ( 9 ) which is probably also a similarly structured “ anti-va n't hoff / LeBel complex ” . complex 6a and 6b react with ethylene or norbornene at room temperature with liberation of Me3Ga and formation of five - membered metallacyclic product ( e.g. , bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)zirconaindane is obtained from 6b and ethylene ) . the olefin polymerization reaction by silylene-bridged zirconocene catalyst ha been investigated theoretically . with the ab initio molecular orbital ( MO ) method the structure and energetics of the reactant , the p-complex , the transition state , and the product for insertion of ethylene into (SiH2Cp2)ZrCH3+ have been determined . the nearly Cs - symmetric transition state ha a low activation barrier ( about <nUm> kcal / mol from the p-complex ) . the product show a strong Cb-H agostic interaction . based on the above transition state structure , molecular mechanic ( MM ) calculation have been carried out to investigate the effect of alkyl substituents on olefin and methyl group and other substituents on the cp ring a well a the effect of the alkyl group on Zr , a model polymer chain end . the regioselectivity in propylene polymerization , that the primary insertion is preferred to the secondary insertion , is reproduced well by the energy difference at the transition state but not by that of the p-complex . As to the stereoselectivity in isotactic polymerization of propylene by SiH2(CpMen)2ZrR+ , the substituents on the cp ring have been found to determine the conformation of the polymer chain end , and the fixed polymer chain end conformation in turn determines the stereochemistry of olefin insertion at the transition state . the direct steric effect of the cp methyl group on the olefin insertion stereochemistry is negligibly small . the same direct control mechanism is operational also in syndiotactic polymerization of propylene and 4-methyl-1-pentene . the cationic complex Cp2Zr(CH3)(THF)+ ( <nUm> , a the BPh4- salt ) reacts with 2,6-diethylpyridine to afford the chelated secondary zirconocene - alkyl complex Cp2Zr(e2-C,N-CH{Me}{6-ethylpyrid-2-yl})+ ( 2 ) . treatment of complex <nUm> with CO , C2H3N , tBuCN , and (PhCH2)(Et)3N+Cr affords Cp2Zr(CH{Me}}6-ethylpyrid-2-yl})(CO)+ ( 3 ) , Cp2Zr(CH{Me}{6-ethylpyrid-2- yl})(CH3CN)+ ( 4 ) , Cp2Zr(CH{Me}6-ethylpyrid-2-yl})(tBuCN)+ ( 5 ) , and Cp2Zr(CH{Me}{6-ethylpyrid-2-yl})(Cl) ( 6 ) , respectively . the thermally sensitive d0 carbonyl complex <nUm> is a rare example of a d0 M(alkyl)-CO adduct and is unambiguously characterized in solution by low - temperature NMR and IR spectroscopy , 13C - labeling and hydrolysis experiment , and decomposition study . IR and NMR data establish that <nUm> contains a terminal CO ligand . an x-ray structure analysis of <nUm> establishes that the CH(Me)(6-ethylpyrid-2-yl) ligand adopts a chelated structure ; the similarity of the spectroscopic data for 3-6 implies that 3-5 have similar chelated structure . At room temperature , <nUm> in CD2Cl2 rapidly decomposes to afford a complex mixture of product . 1H NMR monitoring of the decomposition of <nUm> reveals formation of a transient cationic zirconocene-acyl intermediate <nUm> , which undergoes 1,2-H shift to afford a mixture of isomeric / oligomeric zirconocene - enolates . treatment of this mixture with (PhCH2)(Et)3N+CT affords Cp2Zr(OCH = C{Me}{6-ethylpyrid-2-yl})Cl ( 10 ) a a mixture of e / z isomer , establishing the presence of zirconocene - enolate specie . hydrolysis of the decomposition product of <nUm> affords a mixture of thermally sensitive tautomers , enol <nUm> / aldehyde 11' , which are characterized by NMR , FTIR , and mass spectroscopy . treatment of the ansa - metallocene complex [Me2Si(C5H4)2]Zr(butadiene) ( s-cis- / s-trans-4 ) with BC18F15 yield the corresponding ansa-zirconocene[C4H6B(C6F5)3] betaine <nUm> . complex <nUm> is a homogeneous single component ziegler catalyst that actively polymerizes ethene and propene , respectively . with the olefin ethene , propene , 1-butene , 1-pentene , 1-hexene , or 1,5-hexadiene complex <nUm> undergoes a stoichiometric insertion reaction at <nUm> ° C to generate the metallacyclic carbon - carbon coupling product 9a-9f , which feature an internal C4 = C5 alkene coordination to the metal center and an intramolecular C6-Zr ion pair interaction . the rate of the overall 1-alkene insertion process <nUm> → <nUm> ( k(chem) ) wa measured , and the observed rate constant of the degenerate allyl inversion process of the starting material ( <nUm> → ent-6 , k(m)(obs) ) . this allows for a mathematical kinetic deconvolution of the two - step reaction sequence , namely the initial alkene addition process to <nUm> to generate the reactive (p-alkene)(s-allyl)metallocene - type intermediate <nUm> ( rate of formation ( k1[alkene] , rate of alkene dissociation : k-1 ) and the subsequent insertion reaction <nUm> → <nUm> ( k2 ) to give k1 ( = k(chem) + <nUm> k(m)(obs) ) and the ratio k2 / k-1 ( = k(chem) / <nUm> k(m)(obs) ) . this procedure quantitatively determines the two transition state involved . In each case of the <nUm> → 9b - f series the second transition state is higher than the first one : a general energy profile is observed in which the actual insertion step is rate - determining and is preceded by the alkene addition / alkene dissociation preequilibrium . for example , the rate of 1-pentene dissociation at the stage of the intermediate <nUm> to reform the starting material <nUm> is ~ <nUm> time higher than the competing actually product forming alkene insertion reaction to yield 9d . the difference of transition - state energy range from DDG(+)2 = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 for 1-butene insertion to DDG(+)2 = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 for 1-pentene and 1-hexene insertion , respectively . the kinetic analysis of the alkene insertion reaction at the single component ' constrained geometry ' catalyst [Me2Si(C5H4)N(t)Bu]Zr[C4H6B(C6F5)3] <nUm> wa carried out analogously . BC18F15 addition to [Me2Si(C5H4)N(t)Bu]Zr(butadiene) <nUm> yield a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of the stereoisomeric betaine <nUm> A / 11B ( ' supine / prone ' orientation of the ligand ) . the <nUm> A / 11B complex mixture actively polymerizes ethene . At low temperature the <nUm> A / 11B mixture reacts stoichiometrically with the series of olefin listed above to give the mono-alkene insertion product 14a-f , each found in solution a a single diastereoisomer . the kinetic analysis show an even more pronounced alkene addition / alkene dissociation preequilibrium step ( k-1 / k2 ≃ <nUm> for 1-pentene ) followed by rate - determining insertion ( DDG(+)2 ranging from + <nUm> to + <nUm> kcal mol-1 ) . reaction profile featuring the actual alkene insertion step a the kinetically controlling activation barrier could be characteristic for group <nUm> metallocene ziegler catalyst and related system . none none none none zirconocene dichloride catalyzes the addition of ethylmagnesium halide to chiral allylic and homoallylic alcohol and ether in an efficient manner . these transformation proceed with high level of regio- and stereocontrol ; with the appropriate choice of the neighboring heteroatom substituent ( alcohol v ether ) , either of the two diastereotopic face of a chiral alkene can be selectively functionalized . experimental data described indicate that the regio- and stereoselective outcome of catalytic carbomagnesation of acyclic substrate are unique . simple addition of zirconacyclopropanes to unsaturated alcohol and ether proceeds without stereoselection and affords the derived metallacyclopentanes either with no regiocontrol or with a completely opposite sense of regiochemistry compared to that obtained under the catalytic condition . A detailed mechanistic scheme is provided that account for all the characteristic of a zirconium - catalyzed ethylmagnesation reaction . the proposed paradigm includes a biszirconocene complex a it centerpiece ; intermediacy of the bimetallic complex is supported by rate study and readily account for the observed selectivity . the proposed mechanistic hypothesis rationalizes ( i ) the requirement for excess EtMgCl , ( ii ) the necessity for the presence of a lewis basic heteroatom , and ( iii ) the reason for the highly regioselective rupture of the intermediate metallacyclopentane . disubstituted aryl olefin undergo efficient alkylations in the presence of <nUm> mol % Cp2ZrCl2 , n-BuMgCl , and alkyl tosylates or alkyl bromide . In one class of reaction ( table <nUm> ) , the resulting alkyl zirconocene ( initial alkylation product ) undergoes b-hydride abstraction with a hydrogen atom from within the substrate to afford allylic alkylation product ( scheme <nUm> ) . In another category of reaction , where cyclic allylic ether ( chromenes ) are used ( table <nUm> ) , Zr - alkoxide elimination occurs after the C-C bond formation to effect a net allylic substitution . it is proposed that these reaction involve the nucleophilic attack of substrate - derived zirconates or zirconocene - grignard reagent on various tosylates and bromide . there is little or no competitive electrophile alkylation by the n-alkyl grignard reagent . several mechanistic and synthetic aspect of these Zr - catalyzed C-C bond forming reaction are examined and discussed . none none A series of silylamido complex of zirconium , Cp2Zr(X)(NtBuSiMe2H) ( x = H , I , Br , Cl , F ; <nUm> – <nUm> ) , have been prepared . these complex exhibit agostic b-Si-H interaction with the metal center and have been characterized by spectroscopic and structural method . spectroscopic evidence for the interaction of the Si-H m-bond with zirconium include ( 1 ) abnormally large upfield chemical shift for the silicon hydride and silicon nucleus in the 1H and 29Si NMR spectrum , ( 2 ) unusually small value of the silicon-hydrogen coupling constant ( 1JsiH ) and ( 3 ) low - energy Si-H stretching frequency in the infrared spectrum . AH of the spectroscopic data also establish a clear trend for the strength of the nonclassical Zr-H-Si interaction in Cp2Zr(X)(NtBuSiMe2H) : x = H > I > Br > Cl > F . this ordering directly reflects the relative electrophilicity of the zirconium center . the molecular structure of the hydride and chloride derivative <nUm> and <nUm> a determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study are also consistent with coordination of the Si-H bond to the metal center . In particular , short Zr-Si distance and acute Zr-N-Si angle point to a severe bending of the silyl group toward zirconium , and the location of the amido group near the center of the metallocene equatorial wedge is consistent with a Cp2ML3 coordination environment , not the Cp2ML2 geometry implied by the formula Cp2Zr(NR2)(X) . kinetics , stoichiometric model reaction , and stereochemical study have been employed to investigate the mechanism of the zirconocene - catalyzed cyclization of nonconjugated dienes with organomagnesium reagent . transmetalation of a zirconacyclopentane intermediate with magnesium alkyl ha been implicated a a key step in the catalytic reaction . A zirconacyclopentane derived from <nUm> , 9-diallylfluorene wa prepared and structurally characterized . zirconium metallacyclopentanes transmetalate with dialkylmagnesium reagent having b-hydrogens to form bis-(magnesiomethyl) - substituted carbocycles and product resulting from the elimination of alkane from dialkylzirconocene . metallacycles of this type also act a catalyst precursor for the catalytic cyclomagnesiation of <nUm> , 7-octadiene . the kinetics of the catalytic cyclomagnesiation of <nUm> , 9-diallylfluorene have been examined . the reaction obeys the following rate law : rate = Kobs[Zr][Bu2Mg] when [Bu2Mg] < <nUm> m , and rate = Kobs[Zr] when [Bu2Mg] > <nUm> m . the stereochemistry of the product depends upon the substrate , the magnesium reagent , the magnesium reagent concentration , and the temperature of the cyclization . the diastereoselectivity of the reaction depends on the relative rate of metallacycle formation , isomerization , and transmetalation . an understanding of these relative rate allows for the rational control of the diastereoselectivity to reflect either the kinetic selectivity of metallacycle formation or the thermodynamic stabilites of the diastereomeric metallacycles . with the aim of a possible rationalization of the probability distribution of stereochemical configuration of the regioirregular unit in isotactic polymer sample ( prepared in the presence of rac-ethylenebis(4 , <nUm> , <nUm> , 7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride or rac-ethylenebis(l-indenyl)zirconium dichloride and methylaluminoxane ) , a detailed molecular mechanic analysis on previously proposed model catalytic site is reported . In particular , catalytic intermediate suitable for primary and secondary insertion of propene on primary and secondary polypropene chain , for both system with rac-ethylenebis(4 , <nUm> , <nUm> , 7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl ) and rac-ethylenebis(l-indenyl) ligand , are compared . the model are able to rationalize the observed enantioselectivities , not only for the regioregular placement but also for the regioirregular placement ( secondary insertion on a primary chain and primary insertion on a secondary chain ) . moreover , the nonbonded interaction in the model give a contribution in favor of the monomer coordination suitable for the primary insertion , even after an occasional secondary insertion , and are able to account for the higher regiospecificity observed for titanocene - based , with respect to zirconocene - based , catalytic system . A structural analysis is reported of roughly <nUm> transition - metal (TM)-chalcogenido complex in a variety of chemical environment . with few exception , agreement between calculated and experimental geometry is excellent . the research provides convincing evidence that computational method employed are adequately describing the bonding in these diverse TM complex . interesting trend in relative TMCh ( RMCh' - RMCh ) bond length are found . experimental and computational data show that other than the zirconocene - and hafnocene-oxos there is similar behavior in relative bond length for widely varying TM - chalcogenido complex . relative bond length versus oxo ( S-O , Se-O , and Te-O ) in group IVB metallocenes tend to be larger than for other family of complex and show le variation among the heavier chalcogens ( Se-S , Te-S , and Te-Se ) . analysis of localized wave function for Cp2ZrCh point to a greater contribution from a singly - bonded Zr-Ch structure ( relative to Zr-Ch ) when ch is O compared to heavier chalcogens . taken together , the data suggest that there is a fundamental difference in the zr-oxo ( and hf-oxo ) bond in relation to heavier chalcogens , consistent with recent experimental data . In previous study of multiply bonded TM complex we have focused on the ability of ECPs to make computation feasible for complex incorporating even the heaviest transition metal . the present work also evaluates ECP method for heavier main group ( MG ) element . the chalcogens ( ch ) O , S , Se , and Te are included in this study . none this is the first report on the simulation of the full dynamic , at a quantum mechanical level , of a catalytic chemical reaction . ab initio molecular dynamic simulation on ethylene insertion in a bridged dicyclopentadienyl-methylzirconocene have revealed that the entire reaction path starting from the p-coordinated ethylene-zirconocene complex up to and including propyl formation take place in about <nUm> f , which is unexpectedly fast . this observation suggests the absence of any significant barrier of activation , a confirmed by static energy minimization . the cp ring are very flexible . starting from a reactant structure without a-agostic interaction , at T = <nUm> K such an interaction evolves during the course of the insertion reaction and before the propyl is formed . the product state exhibit g-H agostic interaction . none none the reaction of B(C6F5)3with zirconocene dimethyl complex L2ZrMe2in hydrocarbon solvent affords base - free cationic zirconium complex L2ZrMe+MeB(C6F5)3- ( L = e5-C5H5 , <nUm> ; e5-Me2C5H3 , <nUm> ; e5-Me5C5 , <nUm> ; e5- (TMS)2C5H3 , <nUm> ) in quantitative yield . As revealed by dynamic1H NMR , complex 1-4 undergo rapid intramolecular Zr-Me / B-Me exchange ( [?]G*(s , kcal / mol , ° C , complex ) = <nUm> ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ; <nUm> ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ; <nUm> ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ; <nUm> ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ) and for <nUm> and <nUm> , symmetrizing ion - pair dissociation - recombination process ( [?]G*(s , kcal / mol , ° C , complex ) = <nUm> ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ; <nUm> ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ) . complex 1-4 , <nUm> , and <nUm> are highly active homogeneous catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene with activity ( <nUm> - <nUm> x <nUm> g polyethylene / mol Zr h atm at <nUm> ° C ) comparable to methylalumoxane - based zirconocene catalyst . complex 1-3 , <nUm> and <nUm> are also active for the atactic polymerization of propylene . In regard to polymerization chain transfer mechanism , NMR endgroup analysis and labeling experiment using CH2 = CH13CH3indicate the predominant pathway for <nUm> and <nUm> is 0-H elimination , while for <nUm> it is 0-CH3elimination . these experiment unambiguously rule out propylene C-H activation process a an important chain transfer pathway . complex <nUm> is highly active for the catalytic dimerization of propylene ( nt = <nUm> s-1at <nUm> ° C ) to form a mixture of 2-methyl-l-pentene and 2-methyl-2-pentene . the development of a new method for the regiospecific synthesis of polysubstituted indoles and indolines is reported . the key step involve the generation of zirconocene - stabilized benzyne complex and subsequent intramolecular olefin insertion reaction to provide tricyclic indoline zirconacycles . the zirconacyclic intermediate were cleaved with iodine to yield diiodo indolines , which were converted to a wide variety of indole and indoline product , such a analog of tryptamine , serotonin , tryptophan , and the pharmacophore of CC - <nUm> . In some case zirconocene — imine complex insert CO2 ; more generally they insert isocyanate and cyclic carbonate . isocyanate can insert into either the Zr – C or the Zr – N bond ; protonolysis of the zirconacycle resulting from Zr – C insertion give an amide , whereas protonolysis of the zirconacycle resulting from Zr – N insertion give a urea . steric hindrance on the imine nitrogen or the isocyanate discourages insertion into the Zr – N bond and give clean Zr – C insertion . the molecular structure of an n-phenyl imine complex ( 5a ) ha been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . A coordinated THF in 5a exchange with free THF by a dissociative mechanism . coordination of isocyanate to the Zr of 5a ha not been observed before their insertion . the isocyanate insertion reaction of imine complex such a <nUm> are irreversible . A chelating o-methoxy substituent on the n-phenyl of an imine complex ( 18 ) also prevents insertion into the Zr – N bond and give clean Zr – C insertion . the treatment of <nUm> with ethylene carbonate give a spirocyclic complex ( 23 ) ; methanolysis of <nUm> in benzene give the methyl ester of phenylglycine . A crossover experiment suggests that the free b-hydroxyethyl ester is an intermediate in the benzene methanolysis of <nUm> . none none none the interaction of (e5-C5H5)2ZrX2 ( x = me , Cl ) with Al (tBu)3 and alumoxanes [ (tBu)2Al{m-OAl (Bu)2}]2 and [ (tBu)Al (m3-O)]n ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> ) ha been investigated . the lewis acid — base complex (e5-C5H5)2Zr ( x ) (m-X)-Al (tBu)3 [ x = me ( 1 ) , Cl ( 2 ) ] have been isolated and characterized by variable temperature NMR spectroscopy . the molecular structure of compound <nUm> ha been obtained by x-ray crystallography , indicating the presence of a Zr (m-Cl)Al moiety . the Zr (m-Cl)Al interaction in compound <nUm> is compared to the Al — Cl bond in [PPN][AlCl- (tBu)3 ] ( 4 ) . [ (tBu)2Al{m-OAl (tBu)2}]2 , which contains two three - coordinate ( unsaturated ) aluminum center , show no reaction with (e5-C5H5)2ZrMe2and no catalytic activity toward ethylene polymerization . A solution structure of <nUm> is proposed upon the basis of NMR spectroscopy and a comparison with [ (Et2O)Li]2[ (tBu)6Al6 (O)6Me2 ] ( 8 ) , formed from the reaction of f (tBu)Al (m3-O)]6with MeLi in Et2O . upon the basis of NMR spectroscopy , compound <nUm> exists a either the anti ( 8a ) or syn ( 8b ) isomer a a result of endo or exo methylation of the aluminum center . the lithium atom in compound <nUm> are formally two - coordinate ; however , close tert-butyl C — H***Li contact suggest the presence of agostic stabilization . these result are discussed with respect to the commercial (e5-C5H5)2ZrMe2- methylalumoxane ( MAO ) polyolefin catalyst system , and the new concept of “ latent lewis acidity ” (GAL-O)is proposed to account for the reactivity of the cage hexamer [ (tBu)Al (m3-O)]6 . crystal data for <nUm> : orthorhombic , pnma , a = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . crystal data for <nUm> : monoclinic , P21 / n , a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 7 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . crystal data for <nUm> : orthorhombic , pbca , a = <nUm> ( 8 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 6 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . none zirconocene - catalyzed carbomagnesation reaction of cyclic ether <nUm> and <nUm> with n-PrMgCl and n-BuMgCl afford homoallylic and bishomoallylic alcohol <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> in ~ <nUm> % yield and exceptional level of enantioselectivity and regiocontrol . where n-BuMgCl is used a the alkylating agent , high level of diastereochemical control are also observed ( cf. <nUm> v <nUm> in entry <nUm> and <nUm> of table <nUm> ) . study reported herein underline a number of important mechanistic issue : ( i ) although zirconocene — alkene complex <nUm> exist a a mixture of diastereomers in solution ( syn and anti ) , it is only one of the isomer which reacts to afford the observed product . ( ii ) whereas insertion of an alkene substrate into the unsymmetric complex <nUm> and <nUm> proceeds with low level of regioselectivity at <nUm> ° C , at <nUm> ° C high level of regiocontrol are observed ( cf. intermediacy of <nUm> v <nUm> in scheme <nUm> ) . In this context , various mechanistic experiment shed light on factor that may be responsible for the observed temperature effect . ( iii ) unusual mode of preference for the regioselectivity in b-hydride abstraction of intermediate dialkylzirconocene are reported ; these observation may be accounted for through consideration of the steric effect imposed by the cyclohexyl group of the chiral ligand and the stereoelectronic requirement of the elimination reaction . the first high molecular weight polystannanes , H(SnR2)nH ( r = nBu , nHex , nOct ) , result from dehydropolymerization of secondary stannanes R2SnH2 by zirconocene catalyst . good catalyst include zirconocenes based on both CpCp*Zr ( cp* = e-CsMes ) and Cp2Zr fragment , and the most active catalyst with respect to production of high molecular weight polystannanes wa Me2C(e5-C5H4)2Zr[Si(SiMe3)3]Me . the latter catalyst produced H(SnnBu2)nH chain ( mw / Mn = <nUm> <nUm> / <nUm> <nUm> ) that were contaminated by ca. <nUm> % ( by weight ) low molecular weight cyclic oligomers . lower molecular weight resulted from dehydropolymerizations of Me2SnH2 , PhMeSnH2 , and Ph2SnH2 . At room temperature , H(SnR2)nH ( r = alkyl group ) polystannanes have amax value at ca. <nUm> — <nUm> nm , attributed to σ — s* transition . thermal gravimetric analysis on the polystannanes reveal that these polymer are a thermally stable a related poly(dialkylsilane)s and have onset temperature for thermal decomposition in the range <nUm> — <nUm> ° C , under both nitrogen and air . the H(SnnBu2)nH polymer ha been shown to be a good precursor to sn02 , a shown by bulk pyrolysis in air ( ceramic yield : <nUm> % ) . preliminary result also indicate that these polymer may be useful a precursor to elemental tin . the polystannanes are photosensitive , and their photobleaching behavior ha been characterized by UV — vi spectrometry and 119Sn NMR spectroscopy , which demonstrated that H(SnnBu2)nH is photochemically depolymerized to a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of cyclo-(SnnBu2)5 and cyclo-(SnnBu2)6 . the polymer H(SnnHex2)nH and H(SnnOct2)nH exhibit thermochromic behavior which is visibly evident a a discoloration from yellow to colorless upon warming above room temperature . this reversible behavior is associated with an abrupt change in amax ( e.g. , from <nUm> to <nUm> nm for film of H(SnnOct2)nH ) and a phase change at ca. <nUm> ° C ( by differential scanning calorimetry ) . thin film of H(SnnBu2)nH and H(SnnOct2)nH on glass slide were doped by exposure to SbF5vapor to conductivity of 10-2and <nUm> S cm-1 , respectively . preliminary experiment suggest that the dehydropolymerization occurs by a a-bond metathesis mechanism involving four - center transition state . pot procedure starting from the alkyne and schwartz 's reagent ( Cp2ZrHCl ) , it is an attractive alternative to other transition - metal - based method for the synthesis of dienes from vinyl halide and isolated vinylmetal starting material . enynes and diynes react with “ ZrCp2 ” ( where cp = e5-C5H5 generated by treating Cl2ZrCp2 with Mg and Cl2Hg or <nUm> equiv of an alkyllithium , such a n-BuLi , or a grignard reagent , such a EtMgBr , and can produce in excellent yield zirconabicycles represented by <nUm> ( m = Zr ) and <nUm> , respectively . their protonolysis can provide the corresponding exocyclic alkene and conjugated dienes <nUm> , respectively . iodinolysis of <nUm> ( m = Zr ) can give the corresponding diiodides in high yield , while carbonylation of <nUm> ( m = Zr ) can produce bicyclic enones <nUm> ( Y = O ) in moderate to good yield . although the bicyclization reaction fails with terminal alkyne containing substrate , various type of substituents on the alkyne moiety , such a alkyl , alkenyl , aryl , trialkylsilyl , and trialkylstannyl group , can be accommodated . investigation of the n-BuLi-Cl2ZrCp2 reaction ha revealed that it give first (n-Bu)2ZrCp2 at <nUm> ° C , which then decomposes to give Cp2Zr(CH2 = CHEt ) , identified a it PMe3 complex <nUm> . the PMe3 - stabilized complex reacts with diphenylacetylene to produce a crystalline compound which ha been identified a a zirconacyclopropene , 36a . this demonstrated , for the first time , the feasibility of converting alkyne into zirconacyclopropenes . the reaction of preformed , three - membered zirconacycles with alkyne give five - membered zirconacycles . the reaction of diphenylacetylene is ca. <nUm> time a fast a that of (E)-stilbene . these result support a mechanism involving formation of a zirconacyclopropene intermediate followed by it intramolecular carbometalation with the alkene moiety of enynes for the Zr - promoted bicyclization of enynes . A general method for the preparation of zirconocene complex of imines ha been developed . the x-ray crystal structure of the (trimethylsilyl)benzaldimine complex 2b show that these complex should be viewed a metallaaziridenes due to significant p-donation from the zirconium center to the p* orbitals of the coordinated imine . these complex undergo a number of chemo- , regio- , and diastereoselective coupling reaction with unsaturated organic compound to cleanly form metallacyclic compound . In situ generation of the complex followed by coupling with alkyne and hydrolysis affords a general route to geometrically pure allylic amine . none none the development of a new macrocyclization reagent , rosenthal 's Cp2Zr(pyr)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) , ha allowed the preparation of two large , functionalized macrocycles . the diyne 5,5'-bis(4-trimethylsilylphenyl)-2,2'-bipyridine wa trimerized to the bipyridine - containing macrocycle <nUm> , and 1,4-bis(4-(trimethylsilyl)ethynylphenyl)-2,3-diphenyl-1,4-diazabuta-1,3-diene wa dimerized to macrocycle <nUm> . both zirconocene - containing macrocycles were characterized by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . macrocycle <nUm> , which is cleanly converted to air - stable cyclophane <nUm> with benzoic acid , ha a cavity of van der waals radius <nUm> Å . In general , the Cp2Zr(pyr)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) reagent give higher yield of macrocycles via the coupling of diynes than doe the reagent generated by addition of n-BuLi to Cp2ZrCl2 . none (Butadiene)zirconocene reacts with acetone azine by CC coupling to give a seven - membered metallacyclic <nUm> : <nUm> addition product . In contrast , benzophenone azine reacts with the diene metallocene system with liberation of butadiene to form Cp2Zr(N-CPh2)2 ( 9b ) . this product is also obtained upon irradiation of Cp2Zr(CO)2 with Ph2C-NN-CPh2 or treatment of Cp2ZrCl2 with <nUm> equiv of LiN-CPh2 . the molecular structure of the bis(alkylideneamido)metallocene complex 9b wa determined by x-ray diffraction . the zirconocene complex crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2 / c with cell constant a - <nUm> ( 5 ) , b - <nUm> ( 1 ) , c - <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 8 ) ° , and z = <nUm> . the zirconium bound — N-CPh2 ligand ( including the ipso carbon of the phenyl substituents ) are oriented in the Cp-Zr-Cp bisecting plane . to a first approximation both Zr_N-CPh2 unit can be regarded a being of a heteroallene structural type , characterized by bisecting C-N and N-Zr p-bonding plane and near to sp - hybridized nitrogen center . accordingly , very short zirconium to nitrogen bond distance are observed : N(1)-Zr , <nUm> ( 2 ) Å ; N(2)-Zr , <nUm> ( 2 ) Å . the Zr-N(2)-C(2) unit ( <nUm> ( 2 ) ° ) is slightly le linearly arranged than Zr-N(l)-C(1) ( <nUm> ( 2 ) ° ) . the solid - state structure show a clear distinction of E- and z-oriented phenyl substituents at the Ph2C-N — Zr moiety . this is not observed in solution , however . In the 13C NMR spectrum even at low temperature ( <nUm> K ) complex 9b exhibit only one set of phenyl group carbon resonance . this indicates a rapid equilibration of (E)- and (Z)-phenyl group . this is an uncommon feature for heteroallene - type (alkylideneamido)metallocene complex . we propose a linear to bent to linear (R2C-N)MCp2(X) isomerization reaction sequence to take place rapidly in solution . this unusual dynamic feature attribute to the organometallic compound 9b an intermediate position between organic schiff base ( sp2 - hybridized nitrogen , bent structure ) and stabilized heteroallene - type ( sp - hybridized nitrogen , linear structure ) inorganic (alkylideneamido)metal complex . A variety of zirconocene thioaldehyde complex <nUm> have been prepared in high yield by heating (alkylthio)-methylzirconocenes <nUm> in the presence of PMe3 . the formation of the thiobenzaldehyde complex ( lb ) from Cp2Zr(Me)SCH2Ph ( 2b ) ha been found to follow first - order kinetics independent of trimethylphosphine concentration , with DH ‡ = <nUm> ( 0.1 ) kcal / mol and DS ‡ = <nUm> ( 0.4 ) eu . A large primary kinetic isotope effect ( kH / kD = <nUm> ( 0.2 ) at <nUm> ° C ) wa observed for the transformation . A hammet plot showed that phenyl substituents exert a modest influence on the reaction rate , with ρ = + <nUm> ( 0.02 ) . these observation are more consistent with a concerted four - center cyclometalation process in which the transition state is polarized so that hydrogen move a a proton than with a stepwise b-hydride elimination / reductive elimination sequence . <nUm> , 6-and <nUm> , 7-enynes are efficiently cyclized to bicyclic metallacyclopentenes with titanocene or zirconocene reagent which are easily generated in situ . the metallacycles can be hydrolyzed to release the alkylidenecycloalkane or can be metathesized with main group halide such a C6S , ClSe , or Ph2SnCl2 to give heterocycle . the zirconium - mediated reaction is more effective for sterically demanding case . the alkylidene moiety is introduced with <nUm> % stereoselectivity for the e-diastereomer ; this provides an excellent starting place for the elaboration of chiral side chain a illustrated by a formal synthesis of the ant pheromone invictolide . the cyclization is compatible with alkyl and silyl ether functionality . sugar enynes , efficiently synthesized from readily available sugar lactones , undergo stereospecific cyclization to highly functional , enantiomerically pure carbocycles . none none none none A general method for the in situ production of zirconocene complex of substituted benzynes is reported . these complex can be trapped with nitrile to form good yield of metallacyclic compound with extremely good regiochemical control . these compound can be converted into ketone , a-iodo ketone , and isothiazoles by using experimentally simple procedure . In addition , generation of the benzyne complex under <nUm> atm of ethylene produce metallacycles which can be readily converted into the corresponding benzocyclobutanes . A family of ketene - alkylaluminum complex of formula [(e5-C5H5)2Zr(C,Oe2-OCCHR)]2(m-AlR'2)(m-X) ha been prepared by treating the zirconocene ketene complex [(e5-C5H5)2Zr(C,O-e2-OCCHR)]2with alkylaluminum reagent R'2A1X ( II , III , r = CH2CMe3 , r ’ = me , x = me ; VIa , vila , r = CH2CMe3 , r ’ = CH3 , x = Cl ; VIIb , r = H , r ’ = CH3 , x = Cl ; IX , x , r = CH2CMe3 , r ’ = et , x = H ) . the crystal and molecular structure of four compound of this series ( III , vila , IX , and x ) have been determined . complex vila crystallizes in space group P21 / c ( z = <nUm> ) with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 14 ) A , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , <nUm> = <nUm> ( 14 ) ° , and V = <nUm> ( 10 ) A3 ( <nUm> reflection , r = <nUm> ) . complex IX crystallizes in space group C2 / c ( z = <nUm> ) with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 5 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 11 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 5 ) ° , V = <nUm> ( 2 ) A3 ( <nUm> reflection , r = <nUm> ) . complex x crystallizes in space group C2 / c ( z = <nUm> ) with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 8 ) ° , and V = <nUm> ( 1 ) A3 ( <nUm> reflection , r = <nUm> ) . structural comparison of these molecule reveal several common feature . two zirconocene ketene monomer are spanned by symmetric dialkylaluminum and hydride , chloride , or methyl bridge to form slightly puckered six - membered ring . A notable feature of these structure is the coordination of the bridging ligand x ( H , Cl , or me ) , which is characterized by a large m – x – m angle and an unusual hybridization for the bridging methyl ligand . the coordination of the bridging methyl group in III represents a new bonding geometry for carbon . this geometry model the structure of intermediate in alkyl transmetallations that proceed with inversion . the reaction of III with acetylene produce a zirconocene cyclic enolate IV. complex III also reacts with carbon monoxide to produce a zirconocene acyl-enol complex V — an unprecedented reaction for group <nUm> ketene complex that is relevant to the behavior of such specie over early transition - metal fischer - tropsch catalyst . the greater reactivity of III is discussed in term of the greater lability of the methyl bridge compared to the chloride or hydride bridge . the reaction of lithiated benzhydryl methyl ether with zirconocene dichloride yield Cp2ZrCl(CPh2OCH3) ( 8 ) . the molecular structure of <nUm> in the crystal wa determined by x-ray diffraction . <nUm> crystallizes in the space group P212121 with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 2 ) A , b = metallaoxirane unit in (m-formaldehyde)(Cp2ZrCl)2(1) undergoes the same type of insertion reaction . it CO-derived methylene unit is transferred to form (Cp2ZrCl)2O ( 29 ) and Cp2Zr(CH3)Cl ( 22 ) when active ethene polymerization catalyst . polymerization study at 1-7 bar monomer pressure suggest that these , and by implication most other highly active ethene polymerization catalyst , are strongly concentration demonstrates that in these case mass - transport limitation is absent up to [metal] ≈ <nUm> × 10-5 mol L-1 . propene polymerization activity decrease in the order [CN{B(C6F5)3}2]- > mol-1 ( MeB(C6F5)3- ) . the data suggest that even in the case of very bulky anion with delocalized negative charge the displacement of the anion by the monomer must be involved in the rate - limiting step . none transition metal have the unique ability to simultaneously stabilize high - energy organic specie and to activate them toward selective attack by a variety of chemical reagent . cyclooctyne is the smallest cycloalkyne to have been prepared in the free state while cycloheptyne and cyclohexyne have been observed a fleeting intermediate by several methods.1 several year ago , bennett and co-worker reported the trapping of in situ generated cyclohexyne and cycloheptyne a their bis(triphenylphosphine)platinum complex . this paper report an integrated chemical / physicochemical investigation of the aqueous chemistry of Cp2TiCl2 , Cp2VCl2 , and Cp2ZrCl2 , employing high - field FT NMR , chloride potentiometry , pH titrimetry , and electrical conductivity . experimental condition include those employed previously to study the hydrolysis of cis-dichlorodiammineplatinum(II) ( “ cisplatin ” ) and those approximating physiological . In unbuffered aqueous <nUm> m KNO3 solution at <nUm> ° C , the order of decreasing hydrolytic stability of the M-(e5-C5H5) bond in the Cp2MCl2 complex ( monitored by high - field FT NMR ) wa found to be V ( kinitiai ≤ <nUm> × 10-3 h-1 ) > Ti ( kinitia| = <nUm> ( 1 ) × 10-3 h-1 ) ≫ Zr ( knitial = <nUm> ( 1 ) × 10-2h-1 ) . of the three complex studied , only Cp2VCl2 wa found to posse a stable M-(e5-C5H5) bond at physiological pH . addition of any of the Cp2MCl2 complex to water ( pure or <nUm> m KNO3 ) result in rapid chloride ion dissociation with approximate half - life for the loss of the second chloride ( the first is too rapid to measure ) of <nUm> min ( m = Ti ) , <nUm> min ( m = Zr ) , and <nUm> min ( m = V ) in contrast to the relatively slow chloride hydrolysis observed with cisplatin . chloride dissociation is also more extensive than that in cisplatin . equilibrium chloride ion concentration measurement indicate that the equilibrium constant ( K1 ) for the first Cp2MCl2 chloride dissociation is too large to measure , while K2 = <nUm> ( 2.7 ) × 10-2 m ( m = Ti ) and <nUm> ( 1.2 ) × 10-3 m ( m = V ) . titrimetric study indicate that the acidity of the Cp2M2+ - bound water molecule is uniformly more acidic than the metal - bound water molecule of cis-[Pt(NH3)2(H2O)2]2+ ( Ti , pKa = <nUm> ( 5 ) and <nUm> ( 9 ) ; V , pKa = <nUm> ( 3 ) and <nUm> ( 13 ) ) . implication of these result for the observed biological activity of the Cp2MCl2 complex are briefly discussed . the reaction of alkyne with a methylalane , such a Me3Al , and a zirconocene derivative , such a Cl2ZrCp2 , provides a convenient and selective route to (E)-2-methyl-1-alkenylalanes in high yield . the reaction is catalytic in Zr . the stereoselectivity is generally > <nUm> % , and the regioselectivity observed with terminal alkyne is typically ca. <nUm> % . although the reaction of alkyne with trialkylalanes containing b-hydrogens and Cl2ZrCp2 is complicated by competitive hydrometalation and diminished ( 70-80 % ) regioselectivity , the hydrometalation reaction can be avoided by using chlorodialkylalanes and Cl2ZrCp2 . the Zr - catalyzed carboalumination reaction of typical alkyne , such a phenylacetylene and 1-octyne , most likely involves direct Al-C bond addition assisted by Zr . none the soluble bis(cyclopentadienyl)bis(phenyl)titanium / methylalumoxane catalyst system produce isotactic polypropylene with a novel stereoblock microstructure consistent with a chain - end stereochemical control mechanism . chiral catalyst derived from the racemic enantiomer of ethylene-bridged indenyl derivative are the first metallocene catalyst to form isotactic polypropylene with the conventional structure predicted by an enantiomorphic - site stereochemical control model . the meso achiral form of the ethylene-bridged titanium indenyl diastereomers and zirconocene derivative produce polypropylene with an ideally atactic structure . differing regiospecificities during ci addition with soluble Ti and V chain - end controlled stereospecific system result in Ti being isotactic specific and V being syndiotactic specific . none ion pair of the type Cpx2ZrMe+***A - containing various ansa - zirconocene methyl cation in contact with Me-B(C6F5)3- or B(C6F5)4- anion have been studied with regard to their anion exchange kinetics by 2D - NMR method in benzene or toluene solution . the result - acceleration of anion exchange by added Li+***Me-B(C6F5) 3- , substantial nonproductive exchange between added and Zr - bound Me-B(C6F5)3- anion , an increase of exchange rate at increased zirconocene concentration , and the exclusively entropic origin of this rate increase - all indicate that anion exchange occurs by way of ion quadruple or higher ionic aggregate , rather than via dissociation to solvent - separated ion . these finding imply that solvent - separated ( i.e. anion - free ) alkyl zirconocene cation are unlikely to be relevant intermediate in reaction system containing Cpx2ZrMe+***A - ion pair and , hence , also in zirconocene - based catalyst system for the polymerization of a-olefins . none none reduction of bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride with potassium naphthalene , at low temperature in tetra-hydrofuran , yield m-(2-e1;:1-2-e2-naphthyl)-hydrido-bis[bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium] ( Zr-Zr ) , (e-C5H5)2-Zr(C10H7)(H)Zr(e-C5H5)2 ( hereinafter labeled I ) . the compound wa characterized by a combination of chemical method and x-ray crystallography . crystal of I are orthorhombic , of space group pbca ( centrosymmetric ) , cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 8 ) , b = <nUm> ( 6 ) , and c = <nUm> ( 8 ) nm , and contain eight molecule of C15H14Zr per unit cell . key structural parameter follow : D(Zr-Zr) = <nUm> ( 2 ) , mean D(Zr-C5H5 , centroid ) = <nUm> ( 3 ) , D(Zr-e1-naphthyl , carbon ) = <nUm> ( 1 ) nm . the hydrido ligand in I wa not located by the x-ray work , but it presence wa inferred from 1NMR spectrum in THF-d8 , which show a singlet at d(CH3)4Si-9.3 . reaction of I with excess CH3I yield <nUm> mol CH4 / zr2 unit , which is in accordance with the monohydride structure . with ClH in THF , dicyclopentadienylzirconium dichloride , hydrogen , naphthalene , and a mixture of partially hydrogenated and hydrochlorinated naphthalene are formed . reaction of the complex with H in THF yield naphthalene and dicyclopentadienylzirconium dihydride . In toluene and THF solution , I is a catalyst for the hydrogenation of cyclohexene to cyclohexane . none none zirconocene and hafnocene dichloride react with appropriate organolithium reagent to form stable dimethyl and diphenyl derivative , in the same manner a doe titanocene dichloride . the bis(p-indenyl) dihalides of titanium , zirconium , and hafnium likewise lead to dimethyl and diphenyl compound which in general appear to be more stable than the corresponding p-cyclopentadienyl derivative . an analysis ha been undertaken of trend in the nmr spectrum of these new series of organometallic compound , both with respect to the nature of the metal and to the nature of the p-bonded ligand . the formation and property of bis(p-indenyl)bis(s-pentafluorophenyl) titanium and the new titanium metallocycle 5,5-bis(p-indenyl)dibenzotitanole are also described . none linear oligophenylene diynes containing <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> phenylene ring were synthesized in high yield using the nucleophilic aromatic substitution ( ArNS ) of perfluoroarenes by aryllithium reagent a the key carbon - carbon bond - forming reaction . this reaction wa demonstrated to proceed readily at low temperature with sterically hindered substrate and in the presence of base - sensitive silylalkynyl group . diynes synthesized by this methodology were readily zirconocene - coupled into large dimeric macrocycles using the zirconocene reagent Cp2Zr(py)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) . none none none reaction of tetraiodobenzene with zirconacyclopentadienes , which were conveniently prepared from two alkyne ( or diynes ) and zirconocene complex , afforded 1,2,3,4-tetrasubstituted diiodonaphthalene derivative in good isolated yield . these 1,2,3,4-tetrasubstituted diiodonaphthalene derivative could be converted to 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8-octasubstituted anthracene derivative by reaction with a second zirconacyclopentadiene . when the two zirconacyclopentadienes were different , unsymmetrical anthracenes such a 1,2,3,4-tetraethyl-5,6,7,8-tetraphenylanthracene ( <nUm> % isolated yield ) were obtained . on the other hand , treatment of a 2,3-dihalopyridine such a 2-bromo-3-iodopyridine with zirconacyclopentadienes gave 5,6,7,8-tetrasubstituted quinoline derivative in good to high yield . 3,4-Dihalopyridines such a 4-chloro-3-iodopyridine reacted with zirconacyclopentadienes to afford 5,6,7,8-tetrasubstituted isoquinoline derivative in good to high yield . the hafnium hydrostannyl complex CpCp*Hf(SnHMes2)Cl ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 ) ha been synthesized from the reaction of CpCp*Hf(H)Cl with Mes2SnH2 . this compound ha been identified a an intermediate in the metal - catalyzed dehydrocoupling of Mes2SnH2 to the distannane Mes2HSnSnHMes2 ( me = 2,4,6-trimethylphenyl ) . the dehydrocoupling in this system appears to occur by elimination of : SnMes2 from CpCp*Hf(SnHMes2)Cl , with Sn-Sn bond formation proceeding via insertion of the stannylene into a Sn-H bond . the electronic influence of unbridged and ansa - bridged ring substituents on a zirconocene center ha been studied by mean of IR spectroscopic , electrochemical , and computational method . with respect to IR spectroscopy , the average of the symmetric and asymmetric stretch ( vCO(av) ) of a large series of dicarbonyl complex (CpR)2Zr(CO)2 ha been used a a probe of the electronic influence of a cyclopentadienyl ring substituent . for unbridged substituents ( me , et , pri , but , SiMe3 ) , vCO(av) on a per substituent basis correlate well with hammett dmeta parameter , thereby indicating that the influence of these substituents is via a simple inductive effect . In contrast , the reduction potential ( e ° ) of the corresponding dichloride complex (CpR)2ZrCl2 do not correlate well with hammett dmeta parameter , thereby suggesting that factor other than the substituent inductive effect also influence e ° . ansa bridge with single - atom linkers , for example [Me2C] and [Me2Si] , exert a net electron - withdrawing effect , but the effect is diminished upon increasing the length of the bridge . indeed , with a linker comprising a three-carbon chain , the [CH2CH2CH2] ansa bridge becomes electron - donating . In contrast to the electron - withdrawing effect observed for a single [Me2Si] ansa bridge , a pair of vicinal [Me2Si] ansa bridge exerts an electron - donating effect relative to that from the single bridge . DFT calculation demonstrate that the electron - withdrawing effect of the [Me2C] and [Me2Si] ansa - bridge is due to stabilization of the cyclopentadienyl ligand acceptor orbital , which subsequently enhances back - donation from the metal . the calculation also indicate that the electron - donating effect of two vicinal [Me2Si] ansa bridge , relative to that of a single bridge , is a result of it enforcing a ligand conformation that reduces back - donation from the metal . In a study of the reaction system MAO / (C5H5)2ZrMe2 , the size of the ion pair [ ( CH ) 2Zr(mMe)2AlMe2]+ [Me-MAO]- wa determined by pulsed field - gradient NMR of it cationic moiety . A mean effective hydrodynamic radius of <nUm> - <nUm> Å , determined from diffusion rate in benzene solution at different zirconocene and MAO concentration , indicates that the ion pair remains associated even at the lowest concentration studied . At elevated concentration , aggregation to ion quadruple or higher aggregate is indicated by an apparent size increase and by shift of the CH and me 1H NMR signal . the equilibrium constant for the reaction [ ( CH ) 2ZrMe+ ⋯ Me-MAO- ] + <nUm> / 2Al2Me6 ⇌ [ ( CH ) 2Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2]+ [Me-MAO]- change at different Al / Zr ratio ; this indicates that MAO contains various specie that produce Me-MAO- anion with different lewis basicities . the volume of the Me-MAO- anion suggests that it contains 150-200 Al atom . the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with <nUm> equiv of BuLi at <nUm> ° C , followed by the addition of an unsymmetrical tetra- or pentafluorophenyl substituted alkyne R1C ≡ CArf ( R1 , arf = (CH2)4Me , p-C6F4H ; me , p-C6F4H ; ph , C6F5 ) , resulted in regioselective coupling of these alkyne to zirconacyclopentadienes in which the arf substituents preferentially adopt the 3,4-positions ( bb ) of the zirconacyclopentadiene ring . with Cp2Zr(py)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) a the zirconocene reagent , the coupling could be carried out at room temperature ; however , at higher temperature significant quantity of the 2,4-fluoroaryl substituted ( ab ) isomer were also formed . none of the condition employed produced the 2,5-fluoroaryl substituted ( aa ) isomer . these fluoroaryl-substituted zirconacyclopentadienes were readily converted to butadiene via reaction with acid . the zirconacyclopentadiene Cp2ZrC4-2,5-Ph2-3,4- C6F5 , which resulted from the coupling of PhC ≡ C7F5 , wa converted to the corresponding thiophene by reaction with ClS , and to an arene by reaction with MeO2CC ≡ CCO2Me / ClCu . mechanistic study on zirconocene coupling of (p-CF3C6H4)C ≡ C ( p-MeC6H4 ) indicate that the observed regioselectivities are determined by an electronic factor that control the orientation of at least one of the two alkyne a they are coupled . additionally , these study suggest an unsymmetrical transition state for the zirconocene coupling of alkyne , and this is supported by DFT calculation . the reaction of [ C7F5 ≡ CH ] 2CH2 with Cp2Zr(py)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) resulted in a zirconacyclopentadiene in which the pentafluorophenyl substituents have been forced into the 2,5-positions ( aa ) . zirconocene coupling of the diyne C7F5 ≡ C-1,4-C6 H4-C ≡ C7F5 provided a route to conjugated polymer bearing electron - withdrawing pentafluorophenyl group . the rate of reductive elimination for a family of zirconocene isobutyl hydride complex , Cp*(CpRn)Zr(CH2CHMe2)H ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 , CpRn = substituted cyclopentadienyl ) , ha been measured a a function of cyclopentadienyl substituent . In general , the rate of reductive elimination increase modestly with the incorporation of sterically demanding substituents such a [CMe3] or [SiMe3] . A series of isotopic labeling experiment wa used to elucidate the mechanism and rate - determining step for the reductive elimination process . from these study , a new zirconocene isobutyl hydride complex , Cp''2Zr(CH2CHMe2)-(H) ( cp'' = e5-C5H3-1,3- (SiMe3)2 ) , wa designed and synthesized such that facile reductive elimination of isobutane and activation of dinitrogen wa observed . the resulting dinitrogen complex , [Cp''2Zr]2(m2 , e2,e2-N2 ) , ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction and display a bond length of <nUm> Å for the N ligand , the longest observed in any metallocene dinitrogen complex . solution magnetic susceptibility demonstrates that [Cp''2Zr]2(m2 , e2 , e2-N2 ) is a ground - state triplet , consistent with two Zr (III) , d1 center . mechanistic study reveal that the dinitrogen complex is derived from the reaction of N with the resulting cyclometalated zirconocene hydride rather than directly from reductive elimination of alkane . the crystal structure and electron density ( ED ) distribution of an imine coupling product with an open zirconocene , Zr(2,4-C7H11)[(i-Pr)NCHPhCH2 CMe = CHCMe = CH2 ] ( C7H11 = dimethylpentadienyl ) , have been derived from accurate synchrotron x-ray diffraction measurement . the molecular structure reveals asymmetric coordination of Zr by the pentadienyl ( 2,4-C7H11 ligand ( <Zr-C>  = <nUm> Å ) , the butadiene fragment ( <Zr-C>  = <nUm> Å ) , and the amide nitrogen atom ( Zr-N = <nUm> Å ) of the second ligand . the study of the ED and it topological analysis affords new insight into the bonding and electronic structure of the title zirconium complex . the interaction between the metal center and the ligand are represented by a Zr-N bond path and one Zr-C bond path with each of the pentadienyl and butadiene moiety , contrary to the usually depicted global metal - ligand bonding . the butadiene and pentadienyl group exhibit a polarization of the corresponding p-like ED in the C-Zr direction , indicating that the whole conjugated system are nonetheless involved . the 4d atomic orbitals of Zr exhibit unusual population according to ligand field consideration , which reveal a high degree of s-donation from the conjugated π system of both ligand . As deduced from numerical integration over the topologically defined atomic basin , the Zr to ligand charge transfer is <nUm> e to the C17H24N ligand and <nUm> e to dimethylpentadienyl . topological analysis of a short intramolecular Zr ⋯ ( C,H ) contact provides no indication of the presence of agostic interaction , despite a small Zr-N-C angle of <nUm> ° . thus , no bond path and BCP ( bond critical point ) of the ED are found in the Zr ⋯ ( C,H ) region , which would have provided evidence for such direct interaction , nor is there any evidence for charge accumulation between the Zr and H atom , or for lengthening of the C-H bond involved in the putative interaction . these characteristic , similar to those in other distorted situation , may be common for other electron - deficient d0 complex . treatment of Cp2ZrBu2 with enol ether containing a remote double bond lead to conjugated metalated diene a single isomer via a tandem isomerization - elimination sequence . 2-Arylsulfonyl 1,3-dienes can also be used a a source of dienyl zirconocene derivative , and the stereochemistry of the diene is dependent on the transmetalation reaction . hydrozirconation of alkyne with zirconocene hydrochloride followed by in situ transmetalation to dimethylzinc provides access to reactive alkenyl organometallic reagent from readily available precursor . upon addition of imines , 1,2-attack lead to synthetically useful allylic amine building block . In the presence of CH <nUm> I <nUm> or CH <nUm> Cl <nUm> , the n-metalated allylic amide intermediate is cyclopropanated and c-cyclopropylalkylamines are formed in high yield and excellent diastereoselectivities favoring the anti product . the use of enynes a starting material for this domino reaction provides conjugated biscyclopropanes and thus allows the stereoselective formation of five new carbon-carbon bond . A transition state that explains the need for both zirconocene complex and alkyl zinc in the cyclopropanation reaction is proposed . the kinetics of propene polymerization catalyzed by ansa - metallocenes were studied using quenched - flow technique . two catalyst system were investigated , (SBI)ZrMe2 / AlBu3 / [Ph3C][CN{B (C6F5)3}2 ] ( <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> ) at <nUm> ° C and BCl2ISZr / methylalumoxane at <nUm> ° C ( Al : Zr = <nUm> : <nUm> ) ( SBI = rac-Me2Si(1-Indenyl)2 ) . the aim of the study were to address fundamental mechanistic aspect of metallocene - catalyzed alkene polymerization , catalyst initiation , the quantitative correlation between catalyst structure and the rate of chain propagation , and the nature of dormant state . one of the most important but largely unknown factor in metallocene catalysis is the distribution of the catalyst between dormant state and specie actively involved in polymer chain growth . measurement of polymer yield Y versus reaction time t for propene concentration [M] = <nUm> - <nUm> mol L-1 and zirconocene concentration in the range [Zr] = ( <nUm> - <nUm> ) × 10-5 mol L-1 for the borate system showed first - order dependence on [M] and [Zr] . up to t ≈ <nUm> s , the half - life of catalyst initiation is comparable to the half - life of chain growth ; that is , this phase is governed by non-steady-state kinetics . we propose a rate law which take account of this and accurately describes the initial rate . curve fitting of y(t) data provides an apparent chain growth rate constant kpapp on the order of <nUm> L mol-1 s-1 . by contrast , the evolution with time of the number - average polymer molecular weight , which is independent of the concentration of catalyst involved , lead to a kp which is an order of magnitude larger , ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) × <nUm> L mol-1 s-1 . the ratio kpapp / kp = <nUm> indicates that under the given condition only about <nUm> % of the total catalyst is actively engaged in chain growth at any one time . the system (SBI)-ZrCl2 / methylalumoxane is significantly le active , kpapp = <nUm> ± <nUm> and kp = ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) × <nUm> L mol-1 s-1 , while , surprisingly , the mole fraction of active specie is essentially identical , <nUm> % . evidently , the energetics of the chain growth sequence are strongly modulated by the nature of the counteranion . increasing the counteranion / zirconium ratio from <nUm> : <nUm> to <nUm> : <nUm> ha no influence on catalyst activity . these finding are consistent with a model of closely associated ion pair throughout the chain growth sequence . for the borate system , propagation is ∼ <nUm> time faster than initiation , while for the MAO catalyst , kp / ki ≈ <nUm> . polymer obtained at <nUm> ° C show <nUm> - <nUm> mol % 2,1-regioerrors , and end - group analysis identifies 2,1- misinsertions a the main cause for chain termination ( <nUm> % ) , a compared to <nUm> % for the vinylidene end group . the result suggest that 2,1-regioerrors are a major contributor to the formation of dormant specie , even at short reaction time . this paper describes the synthesis of base - free (C5R5)2Zr(OtBu)+ cation , the direct observation of nonchelated alkene and alkyne adduct of these cation , and study of the thermodynamic and dynamic property of these novel specie . reaction of Cp2'ZrMe2 ( cp' = C5H4Me ) with tert-butyl alcohol followed by [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] in benzene yield [ Cp2'Zr(O'Bu) ][B(C6F5)4] ( 1 ) , which exists a Cp2'Zr(O'Bu)(CIR)+ solvent adduct in C6D5Cl and CD2Cl2 solution . addition of ligand L ( L = ethylene , propylene , propyne , 2-butyne , CO , phenylacetylene , allene , 1-hexene , cis-2-butene ) to <nUm> in CD2Cl2 at <nUm> ° C result in reversible formation of Cp2'Zr(O'Bu)(L)+ adduct . NMR data for Cp2'Zr(O'Bu)(H2C = CHMe)+ ( 4 ) indicate that the propylene coordinate unsymmetrically and is polarized with positive charge buildup at cint . equilibrium constant , defined by keq = [Zr-L][1]-1[L]-1 , vary in the order CO > propyne > 2-butyne > phenylacetylene > ethylene > allene > propylene > 1-hexene > cis-2-butene > vinyl chloride . loss of L from Cp2'Zr(O'Bu)(L)+to give <nUm> appears to proceed via associative displacement by CD2Cl2 in most case . the synthesis , structural characterization , and abstraction chemistry of ansa - zirconocene ester enolate complex relevant to the isospecific polymerization of methacrylates are reported . reaction of rac - (EBI)ZrMe(OTf) and rac - (EBI)Zr(OTf) <nUm> [ EBI = C 2H 4(Ind) <nUm> ] with <nUm> and <nUm> equiv of lithium isopropylisobutyrate in toluene produce the first example of ansa - zirconocene mono- and diester enolate complex : rac - (EBI)ZrMe[OC(O iPr ) = CMe <nUm> ] ( 1 ) and rac - (EBI)Zr[OC(O iPr ) = CMe <nUm> ] <nUm> ( 2 ) in <nUm> % and <nUm> % isolated yield , respectively . the reaction of <nUm> with B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> wa investigated in six different organic solvent ; in THF at ambient temperature , this reaction cleanly produce the isolable cationic ansa - zirconocene ester enolate complex rac - (EBI)Zr+(THF)[OC(O iPr ) = CMe 2][MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - ( 3 ) in quantitative yield . the analogous reaction of <nUm> with Al(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> in toluene , however , proceeds through a proposed novel , intramolecular proton transfer process in which propylene is eliminated from the isopropoxy group , subsequently producing a carboxylate - bridged tight ion pair rac - (EBI)Zr+(Me)OC( iPr)OAl(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> - ( 4 ) . In addition to standard spectroscopic and analytical characterization for the isolated complex 1-4 , complex <nUm> and <nUm> have also been structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction study . polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) and n-butyl methacrylate ( BMA ) ha been investigated using complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> . both the isolated cationic <nUm> and neutral <nUm> ( the latter combined with B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> in situ ) are highly active ( <nUm> min for quantitative MMA conversion ) and highly isospecific ( [mm] > <nUm> % for PMMA ; [mm] > <nUm> % for PBMA ) via enantiomorphic - site control , producing polymethacrylates with extremely narrow molecular weight distribution ( m w / m n = <nUm> ) . the aluminate complex <nUm> , however , produce syndiotactic PMMA predominantly via chain - end control . reductive elimination of alkane from a silylated bis-indenyl zirconium isobutyl hydride affords a zirconium sandwich complex with an unusual e6 indenyl ligand . crystallographic characterization of it adduct with tetrahydrofuran ha been achieved and reveals significant localization in the six - membered ring . complexation of more potent ligand such a carbon monoxide and diphenylacetylene are effective in promoting haptotropic rearrangement of the e6 indenyl ligand and provides familiar bent zirconocene derivative . the zirconium sandwich compound also undergoes oxidative addition of carbon-hydrogen bond of pyridyl ligand , resulting in a crystallographically characterized dimethylamino pyridyl hydride complex of zirconium . the ansa - zirconocene dichloride [ Me2Si(C5H 4)(3-R-C5H3)]ZrCl2 7a-e ( r = H , CH3 , cyclohexyl , -CHMe2 , -CMe3 ) were reacted with butadiene-magnesium to yield the respective ( η 4-butadiene)metallocenes 17a-e . the chiral example give a mixture of two s-cis and two s-trans diastereomers . the strong lewis acid B(C 6F5)3 add selectively to a terminal butadiene carbon atom to yield the (butadiene)metallocene / B(C6F 5)3 betaine complex 18a-e . initially , the formation of the Z-18 isomer is preferred . these consecutively rearrange to the thermodynamically favored isomer E-18 . the dipolar system <nUm> are active single component metallocene catalyst for the stereospecific polymerization of methyl methacrylate . with increasing steric bulk of the attached single alkyl substituent an increasingly isotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) is obtained . A similar trend is observed in the methyl methacrylate polymerization at the [ Me2Si(C5H4)(3-R-C5H 3)]ZrCH3+ catalyst ( 9a-e ) that were conventionally prepared by methyl abstraction from the corresponding ansa - zirconocene dimethyl complex by treatment with B(C6F 5)3 .
