A comparison of the poly(methyl methacrylates ) obtained at these two series of catalyst ha revealed substantial difference in stereoselectivity that probably originate from an influence of the respective counteranions . an initial reactive intermediate of methyl methacrylate addition to the dipolar single component metallocene catalyst e-18a wa experimentally observed and characterized by NMR spectroscopy at <nUm> K . the subsequently formed series of [ PMMA-C4H6-B(C 6F5)3]- anion oligomers ( at the catalyst 18c ) wa monitored ( after quenching ) and characterized by electrospray mass spectrometry . several dienyl zirconocene derivative were easily prepared , a unique geometrical isomer , from simple non-conjugated unsaturated enol ether with (1-butene)ZrCp <nUm> complex . this new methodology is based on a tandem allylic C-H bond activation - elimination sequence and the mechanism ha been mapped out by deuterium labeling experiment . the stereochemical outcome of this process wa determined by addition of several electrophiles . moreover , when the organometallic derivative is vinylic a well a allylic such a in 44-47Zr , an unexpected reversal of the stereochemistry ha been found during the zirconium to copper transmetalation step . the presence of " free " trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) in methylalumoxane ( MAO ) solution can be highly detrimental to the performance of metallocene and " post-metallocene " olefin polymerization catalyst . the most used strategy to remove " free " TMA is to evaporate MAO solution to dryness , until a free - flowing white powder ( " solid MAO " ) is left . this procedure is tedious and potentially hazardous , because in some case the distillate is a concentrated hydrocarbon solution of TMA . moreover , " solid MAO " is poorly soluble in common polymerization medium , and once in solution it can regenerate TMA to some extent . this communication report on a facile alternative , which consists in the controlled addition of a sterically hindered phenol , such a 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol , effectively trapping " free " TMA . we show here that 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol / MAO solution activate equally well the dichloro-precursors of well - known zirconocene and bis(phenoxyimine)Ti catalyst , and that their use in propene polymerization result in a substantially higher productivity , polymer stereoregularity , and / or average molecular mass compared with activation by MAO alone . none monomeric imidozirconocene complex of the type Cp2(L)Zr = NCMe3 ( cp = cyclopentadienyl , L = lewis base ) have been shown to activate the carbon-hydrogen bond of benzene , but not the C-H bond of saturated hydrocarbon . to our knowledge , this singularly important class of C-H activation reaction ha heretofore not been observed in imidometallocene system . the m = NR bond formed on heating the racemic ethylenebis(tetrahydro)indenyl methyl tert-butyl amide complex , however , cleanly and quantitatively activates a wide range of n-alkane , alkene , and arene C-H bond . mechanistic experiment support the proposal of intramolecular elimination of methane followed by a concerted addition of the hydrocarbon C-H bond . product formed by activation of sp2 C-H bond are generally more thermodynamically stable than those formed by activation of sp3 C-H bond , and those resulting from reaction at primary C-H bond are preferred over secondary sp3 C-H activation product . there is also evidence that thermodynamic selectivity among C-H bond is sterically rather than electronically controlled . the organometallic multicomponent reaction of alkenyl zirconocene , alkynyl imine , and zinc carbenoid in the presence of dimethylzinc lead to novel C,C-dicyclopropylmethylamines . the formation of intermediate bicyclo[1.1.0]butanes represents the first synthetically useful example of a double C,C-s - bond insertion , and the increase in structural complexity from starting material is highlighted by the formation of nine new C,C - bond in the final product . A series of enantiopure C1 - symmetric metallocenes , { ( SiMe 2)2[e5-C5H(CHMe 2)2][e5-C5H2((S) CHMeCMe3)]}ZrCl2 , (S)-2 , { ( SiMe2 ) 2[e5-C5H(CHEt2) 2][e5-C5H2((S)-CHMeCMe 3)]}ZrCl2 , (S)-6 , and { ( SiMe2 ) 2[e5-C5HCy2][e5- C5H2((S)-CHMeCMe3)]}ZrCl2 ) , (S)-7 ( cy = cyclohexyl ) , zirconocene dichloride that have an enantiopure methylneopentyl substituent on the " upper " cyclopentadienyl ligand , and diastereomerically pure precatalysts , { ( SiMe2 ) 2[e5-C5H((S)-CHMeCy)(CHMe 2)][e5-C5H3]}ZrCl2 , (S)-8a and (S)-8b , which have an enantiopure , 1-cyclohexylethyl substituent on the " lower " cyclopentadienyl ligand , ha been synthesized for use in the polymerization of chiral a-olefins . when activated with methylaluminoxane , these metallocenes show unprecedented activity for the polymerization of bulky racemic monomer bearing substitution at the 3- and / or 4-positions . due to the optically pure nature of these single site catalyst , they effect kinetic resolution of racemic monomer : the polymeric product is enriched with the faster reacting enantiomer , while recovered monomer is enriched with the slower reacting enantiomer . the two component are easily separated . for most olefin surveyed , a partial kinetic resolution wa achieved ( s = kfaster / kslower ≈ <nUm> ) , but , in one case , the polymerization of 3,4-dimethyl-1-pentene , high level of separation were obtained ( s > <nUm> ) . 13C NMR spectroscopy of poly ( 3-methyl-1-pentene ) produced with (S)-2 indicates that the polymer are highly isotactic material . x-ray crystal structure determination for (S)-2 , { (SiMe2)2[e 5-C5H(CHMe2)2][e5- C5H2((S)-CHMeCMe3)]}Zr(SC6H 5)2 , (S)-6 , and (S)-7 have been used in combination with molecular mechanic calculation to examine the prevailing steric interaction expected in the diastereomeric transition state for propagation during polymerization . precatalysts (S)-8a and (S)-8b are le selective polymerization catalyst for the kinetic resolution of 3-methyl-1-pentene than are (S)-2 , (S)-6 , and (S)-7 . A family of isolable , well - defined bis-indenyl zirconium sandwich complex , ( e5-C9H5-1,3-R 2)-(e9-C9H5-1,3-R 2)Zr ( r = silyl , alkyl ) , have been prepared by either alkane reductive elimination or alkali metal reduction of a suitable zirconium(IV) dihalide precursor . crystallographic characterization of two of these derivative , r = SiMe2CMe3 and CHMe2 , reveals unprecedented e9 coordination of one of the indenyl ligand . variable - temperature and EXSY NMR study establish that the e5 and e9 ring are rapidly interconverting in solution . the sandwich complex serve a effective source of low - valent zirconium reacting rapidly with both olefin and alkyne at ambient temperature . In contrast to bis-cyclopentadienyl chemistry , the olefin adduct of the bis-indenyl zirconium sandwich undergo preferential C-H activation to yield the corresponding allyl hydride compound , although reaction with excess olefin proceeds through the e2-olefin adduct , forming the corresponding zirconacyclopentane . the reaction of the chiral chelated bis-amide complex Zr{(2R,4R)-PhNCHMeCH2CHMeNPh}Cl2(THF)2 ( R,R-7 ) with lithium ansa-bis-indenyl reagent Li2[SBI](Et2O) ( 8a , SBI = (1-indenyl)2SiMe2 ) or Li2[EBI](Et2O) ( 8b , EBI = 1,2-(1-indenyl)2ethane ) in THF affords the corresponding ansa - zirconocenes S,S-(SBI)Zr{(2R,4R)-PhNCHMeCH2CHMeNPh} ( S,S,R,R-9a ) or S,S-(EBI)Zr{(2R,4R)-PhNCHMeCH2CHMeNPh} ( S,S,R,R-9b ) in > <nUm> % isolated yield and > <nUm> % enantiomeric excess . compound 9b wa converted to the corresponding enantiomerically pure dichloride S,S - (EBI)ZrCl2 ( S,S-10b ) in <nUm> % isolated yield by reaction with ClH in Et2O . the chiral diamine (2R,4R)-HPhNCHMeCH2CHMeNHPh ( R,R-5 ) wa recovered from this reaction . the origin of the hydrogenation of the dinitrogen ligand in [(e5-C5Me4H)2Zr]2(m2,e2,e2-N2) ha been investigated by a combined computational and experimental study . density functional theory calculation on the zirconocene dinitrogen complex demonstrate significant imido character in the zirconium nitrogen bond , arising from effective p-back - bonding from the low - valent zirconium and the side-on bound N ligand . the twisted ground - state structure of the N complex is a key requirement for nitrogen hydrogenation , a calculation on the model complex [(e5-C5H5)2Zr]2(m2,e2,e2-N2) reveal reduced overlap a the dihedral angle between the zirconocene wedge approach <nUm> ° . experimentally , isotopic labeling study on the microscopic reverse are consistent with a 1,2-addition mechanism for nitrogen hydrogenation . the generation and property of nonchelated zr-aryl-alkyne and zr-aryl-alkene complex that are stabilized by the presence of b-Si-substituents in the alkyne and alkene ligand and fluorination of the aryl ligand are described . reaction of [Cp'2Zr(OtBu)(ClCD2Cl)][B(C6F5)4] ( <nUm> , cp' = C5H4Me ) with alkyne and alkene substrate ( L ) generates Cp'2Zr(OtBu)(L)+ adduct ( L = HC ≡ CCH2SiMe3 ( 2 ) ; CH2 = CHCH2SiMe3 ( 3 ) ; HC ≡ CMe ( 4 ) ; CH2 = CHCH2CMe3 ( 5 ) ) . equilibrium constant for substrate binding ( keq = [Zr-L][1]-1[L]-1 ; CD2Cl2 , <nUm> ° C ) are much larger for the b-Si - substituted compound <nUm> ( <nUm> × <nUm> M-1 ) and <nUm> ( <nUm> × <nUm> M-1 ) than for hydrocarbon analogue <nUm> ( <nUm> × <nUm> M-1 ) and <nUm> ( <nUm> M-1 ) , which is ascribed to b-Si stabilization of the partial positive charge on cint of the bound substrate . [Cp2Zr(C6F5)][B(C6F5)4] ( <nUm> , cp = CH ) wa generated by the reaction of Cp2Zr(C6F5)Me with [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] in C6D5Cl . reaction of <nUm> with alkyne and alkene substrate ( L ) generates Cp2Zr(C6F5)(L)+ adduct ( L = HC ≡ CCH2SiMe3 ( 8 ) ; H = CCHCH2SiMe3 ( 10 ) ) . No insertion of the substrate into the Zr-C6F5 bond is observed in <nUm> ( at <nUm> ° C ) or <nUm> ( up to <nUm> ° C ) . the allyltrimethylsilane ligand in <nUm> undergoes nondissociative alkene face exchange ( " alkene flipping " , i.e. , exchange of the Cp2Zr(C6F5)+ unit between the two alkene enantiofaces without alkene dissociation ) , with a first - order rate constant kflip = <nUm> s-1 ( C6D5Cl , <nUm> ° C ) . <nUm> also undergoes slower reversible decomplexation of the alkene ( kdissoc = <nUm> s-1 ; C6D5Cl , <nUm> ° C ) . the reaction of Zr{PhN(CH2)3NPh}Cl 2(THF)2 ( 5 ) with lithium ansa-bis-indenyl reagent Li 2[XBI]-(Et2O) ( XBI = (1-indenyl)2SiMe <nUm> ( SBI , 7a ) , (2-methyl-1-indenyl)2SiMe2 ( MSBI , 7b ) , (2-methyl-4,5-benz-1-indenyl)2SiMe2 ( MBSBI , 7c ) , (2-methyl-4-phenyl-1-indenyl)2SiMe2 ( MPSBI , 7d ) , and 1,2-(1-indenyl)2ethane ( EBI , 7e ) ) affords rac - (XBI)Zr{PhN(CH 2)3NPh } ( 8a-e ) in high yield . the meso isomer were not detected by 1H NMR . x-ray crystallographic study show that the Zr{PhN(CH2)3NPh} ring in <nUm> , 8a , 8c , and ( C 5H5)2-Zr{PhN(CH2)3NPh} ( 10 ) adopt twist conformation that position the N-Ph group on opposite side of the N-Zr-N plane . this conformation complement the metallocene structure of rac-8a-e but would destabilize the corresponding meso isomer . it is proposed that the Zr{PhN(CH2)3NPh} ring adopts a similar twist conformation in the stereodetermining transition state for addition of the second indenyl ring in these reaction , which lead to a preference for rac product . the result of metallocene synthesis from other Zr amide precursor support this proposal . 8a-e are converted to the corresponding rac - (XBI)ZrCl2 complex ( 9a-e ) by reaction with ClH . the reactivity of [rac-(C2H4(1-indenyl)2)Zr(n-butyl)][MeB(C6F5)3] ( 4 ) , [rac-(C2H4(1-indenyl)2)Zr(sec-butyl)][MeB(C6F5)3] ( 5 ) , and [rac-(C2H4(1-indenyl)2)Zr(polypropenyl)][MeB(C6F5)3] with propene , ethene , and hydrogen wa studied by low - temperature ( < <nUm> ° C ) 1H and 13C NMR spectroscopy in toluene solution . In contrast with previous suggestion that <nUm> ° zirconium alkyl specie such a <nUm> are dormant site , these measurement demonstrate reactivity of <nUm> ° zirconium alkyl with propene and ethene comparable to the <nUm> ° zirconium alkyl specie <nUm> and [rac-(C2H4(1-indenyl)2)Zr(polypropenyl)][MeB(C6F5)3] . because 2,1-insertion of propene is an infrequent event , these result preclude significant accumulation of catalyst in the form of <nUm> ° zirconium alkyl for this metallocene and counterion . the reactivity of <nUm> with hydrogen is at least <nUm> order of magnitude faster than other <nUm> ° zirconium alkyl . such high reactivity account for the puzzlingly high fraction of butyl end group in prior hydrooligomerization study and implies that catalyst responsivity to H a a molecular weight control agent correlate with the regioselectivity of the catalyst . the dimethylsilanediyl-bridged ansa - zirconocene dichloride <nUm> , that contains a pendent allyl substituent at a cp - ring , add HB(C6F 5)2 to the vinyl group to yield the bifunctional zirconocene / borane complex <nUm> . substituted benzimidazoles were added to the strongly electrophilic borane moiety a protective group , which allowed subsequent chloride versus -CH2SiMe3 exchange at zirconium to take place by treatment with the respective alkyllithium reagent . alternatively , the introduction of active s-ligands at zirconium is carried out first , followed by the hydroboration reaction . this route wa followed for the synthesis of the diphenyl-ansa-zirconocene / borane complex <nUm> . complex <nUm> reacts slowly in solution by intramolecular electrophilic attack of the borane at it adjacent cp - ring , followed by deprotonation using a [Zr]-Ph group to yield the zwitterionic complex <nUm> featuring a borata-tetrahydroindenyl moiety a part of the ansametallocene framework . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it add PMe3 at zirconium to yield <nUm> . thermolysis of <nUm> with excess PMe3 lead to the formation of the (aryne)zirconocene complex <nUm> , which is stabilized by PMe3 coordination to zirconium and PMe3 addition to boron . N-Methylbenzimidazole add to the -B(C6F5)2 unit of <nUm> to give the <nUm> : <nUm> adduct <nUm> . thermolysis of <nUm> at <nUm> ° C in benzene solution in the presence of one additional equivalent of n-methylbenzimidazole result in deprotonation of the substrate to yield the s-N- methylbenzimidazolyl zirconium complex <nUm> ( a a mixture of two diastereoisomers ) . an additional n-methylbenzimidazole ligand is bonded to the BC12F10 unit in this product . zirconocene - olefin complex Cp2Zr(H2C = CHR ) , prepared in benzene-THF at <nUm> ° C , react with acid chloride to provide homoallylic alcohol . the key is an equilibrium between the zirconocene - olefin complex and the corresponding zirconocene allyl hydride complex via allylic C-H bond cleavage of the coordinating alkene . furthermore , the zirconocene - olefin complex are also available for the reaction with 1,4-diketone to afford anti-1,4-diols with excellent diastereoselectivity . thus , Cp2Zr(H2C = CHR ) serf a a donor of both hydride and an allylic group . these reaction also proceed efficiently by using zirconocene - olefin complex , derived from Cp2ZrCl2 , Mg metal , and 1-alkenes . the nucleophilic character of a charge neutral , high oxidation d0 zirconium trimethylenemethane ( TMM ) class of compound of general structure Cp*Zr(TMM)[N(R1)C(Me)N(R2)] , 1a ( R1 = R2 = i-Pr ) and 1b ( R1 = t-Bu , R2 = et ) , is presented through documentation of it reactivity with a range of alkyl and silyl halide and triflates , including unactivated one such a ethyl triflate . these result should contribute to effort directed toward expanding the synthetic chemist 's toolbox of synthetic method for the construction of complex organic molecule . one Si - tethered diyne is coupled in one pot with three molecule of organonitriles promoted by a low - valent zirconocene specie . cleavage of one of the three C ≡ N triple bond and cleavage of the two Si-C bond take place to afford pyrrolo[3,2-c]pyridine derivative after hydrolysis . cyclohexene ( CHE ) ha been incorporated into the polymer chain in ethylene / CHE copolymerization by nonbridged half - titanocenes containing aryloxo ligand of the type , Cp'TiCl2(O-2,6-iPr2C6H3) , in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) cocatalyst . the effect of the substituent in the cyclopentadienyl fragment wa found to be very important for CHE incorporation ; both the tert-BuCp ( 3 ) and 1,2,4-Me3Cp analogue ( 4 ) showed efficient CHE incorporation , whereas a negligible amount of CHE incorporation wa observed by both the indenyl ( 1 ) and the cp* analogue ( 2 ) under the same condition . cp - ketimide analogue , CpTiCl2(N = CtBu2 ) ( 5 ) , zirconocene - like Cp2ZrCl2 ( 6 ) , and linked half - titanocene - like [Me2Si(C5Me4)(NtBu)]TiCl2 ( 7 ) did not show any CHE incorporation under the same condition ; unique characteristic for using this type of catalyst precursor for the present copolymerization have thus been emphasized . functionalization of the N ligand in the side-on bound dinitrogen complex , [ ( e5-C5Me4H ) 2Zr]2-(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) , ha been accomplished by addition of terminal alkyne to furnish acetylide zirconocene diazenido complex , [ (e5-C5Me4H)2Zr(C ≡ CR ) ] <nUm> ( m2,e2,e2-N 2H2 ) ( r = nBu , tBu , ph ) . characterization of [ ( e5- C5Me4H ) 2Zr(C ≡ CCMe3)]2(m2 , e2,e2-N2H2 ) by x-ray diffraction revealed a side-on bound diazenido ligand in the solid state , while variable - temperature 1H and <nUm> N NMR study established rapid interconversion between e1,e1 and e2,e2 hapticity of the [ HN2 2]2- ligand in solution . synthesis of alkyl , halide , and triflato zirconocene diazenido complex , [ ( e5-C 5Me4H)2ZrX]2(m2 , e1,e1-N2H2 ) ( x = Cl , I , OTf , CH2Ph , CH2SiMe3 ) , afforded e1,e1 coordination of the [ HN2 2]2- fragment both in the solid state and in solution , demonstrating that sterically demanding , in some case p-donating , ligand can overcome the electronically preferred side-on bonding mode . unlike [(e5-C5Me4H)2ZrH] <nUm> ( m2,e2,e2-N 2H2 ) , the acetylide and alkyl zirconocene diazenido complex are thermally robust , resisting a-migration and N cleavage up to temperature of <nUm> ° C . dinitrogen functionalization with [(e5-C5Me4H)2Zr] <nUm> ( m2,e2,e2-N <nUm> ) wa also accomplished by addition of proton donor . weak bronsted acid such a water and ethanol yield hydrazine and ( e5-C 5Me4H)2Zr(OH)2 and (e5-C5Me4H)2-Zr(OEt) <nUm> , respectively . treatment of [ ( e5-C 5Me4H)2Zr]2(m2 , e2,e2-N2 ) with HNMe2 or H2NNMe2 furnished amido or hydrazido zirconocene diazenido complex that ultimately produce hydrazine upon protonation with ethanol . these result contrast previous observation with [ ( e5-C 5Me5)2Zr(e1-N2) ] <nUm> ( m2,e1,e1-N <nUm> ) where loss of free dinitrogen is observed upon treatment with weak acid . these study highlight the importance of cyclopentadienyl substituents on transformation involving coordinated dinitrogen . poly(propylene-ran-1,3-butadiene) that contained pendant vinyl group derived from 1,2-inserted butadiene unit wa selectively synthesized by rac-dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-4-phenylindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( ph - ind ) activated with modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) in the presence of hydrogen . the copolymer obtained without hydrogen had 1,2-inserted and 1,4-inserted butadiene unit . the addition of hydrogen to the copolymerization improved the activity by ∼ 1000-fold and gave the copolymer only with 1,2-inserted butadiene unit , of which the content wa equal to the copolymer obtained without hydrogen . the 13C NMR analysis of the copolymer clarified that butadiene also inserted into the copolymer a a tetramethylene unit , of which the content wa almost the same a that of 1,4-inserted butadiene unit observed in the absence of hydrogen . No signal that could be assigned to cyclic structure or long branched side chain wa observed . these result indicate that p-allyl specie of zirconocenes formed by 1,4-butadiene insertion at the growing polymer chain end transformed to the tetramethylene chain end by hydrogenation and continued successive propylene insertion . the zirconocene - complexed dibismuthene , Cp2Zr(BiR)2 ( cp = CH ; r = C6H3-2,6-Mes2 ) , wa prepared by the reaction of sodium metal with Cp2ZrCl2 and RBiCl2 . the air- and moisture - sensitive dark reddish / brown compound is the first organometallic compound containing Bi-Zr bond and the only example of a Bi2Zr ring . moreover , our computation on associated model system offer insight into the nature of the interaction of the heaviest dipnictene with a metallocene center . reaction of the disilenide <nUm> with Cp2ZrCl2 yield <nUm> , the first transition metal complex with an e1-s - bonded disilene moiety . the compound <nUm> exhibit a strongly red - shifted UV - vi absorption , resulting in an intensely green color . the Si = Si bond in <nUm> is considerably activated a shown by the rearrangement to a silyl-substituted zirconocene <nUm> . x-ray diffraction study on <nUm> reveal that the Si = Si bond is significantly longer than that in the precursor <nUm> . conversely , the Zr-Si distance is considerably smaller than the corresponding distance in <nUm> , suggesting a certain degree of electron donation toward the 16e- zirconium center . the rate of hydrogenation of the N ligand in the side-on bound dinitrogen compound , [ ( e5-C5Me4H ) 2Zr]2(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) and [ ( e5-C5Me 5)(e5-C5H2-1,2-Me 2-4-R)Zr]2(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) ( r = me , ph ) , to afford the corresponding hydrido zirconocene diazenido complex have been measured by electronic spectroscopy . determination of the rate law for the hydrogenation of [ (e5-C5Me5)(e5-C 5H2-1,2,4-Me3)Zr]2(m2 , e2,e2-N2 ) establishes an overall second - order reaction , first order with respect to each reagent . these data , in combination with a normal , primary kinetic isotope effect of <nUm> for H <nUm> versus D2 addition , establish the first H addition a the rate - determining step in N hydrogenation . kinetic isotope effect of similar direction and magnitude have also been measured for hydrogenation ( deuteration ) of the two other zirconocene dinitrogen complex . measuring the rate constant for the hydrogenation of [ ( e5-C 5Me5)(e5-C5H2-1,2,4- Me3)Zr]2(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) over a <nUm> ° C temperature range provided activation parameter of DH ‡ = <nUm> kcal / mol and DS ‡ = <nUm> eu . the entropy of activation is consistent with an ordered four - centered transition structure , where H undergoes formal 1,2-addition to a zirconium-nitrogen bond with considerable multiple bond character . support for this hypothesis stem from the observation of N functionalization by C-H activation of a cyclopentadienyl methyl substituent in the mixed ring dinitrogen complex , [ ( e5- C5Me5)(e5-C5H 2-1,2-Me2-4-R)Zr]2(m2 , e2,e2-N2 ) ( r = me , ph ) , to afford cyclometalated zirconocene diazenido derivative . transition metal-benzyne complex have found many application in organic synthesis , mechanistic study , and the synthesis of functional material . In sharp contrast , the reaction chemistry of transition metal-carboryne complex is virtually unknown although the theoretical calculation indicated that the formation of carboryne ( 1,2-C2B10H10 ) and benzyne is very energetically comparable . this communication report a novel zirconocene-carboranyl complex Cp2Zr(m-Cl)(m-C2B10H10)Li(OEt2)2 ( 1 ) , an efficient precursor of the zirconocene-carboryne specie , prepared from the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with <nUm> equiv of B5CH5Li in Et2O . the reactivity study indicated that <nUm> resembles zirconocene-benzyne in reaction with polar unsaturated organic molecule . on the other hand , it show no reactivity toward alkyne and alkene , a reactivity pattern which is quite different from that of zirconocene-benzyne . this work also furnishes a novel method for the preparation of functional o-carboranes and their metal complex which can not be synthesized by other method presently known . the reaction of Cp'2Zr(OtBu)Me ( cp' = C5H4Me ) and [Ph3C][B(C6F 5)4 ] yield the base - free complex [ cp' 2Zr(OtBu)][B(C6F5)4] ( 6 ) , which exists a Cp'2Zr(OtBu)(CIR)+ halocarbon adduct in CD2Cl2 or C6D 5Cl solution . addition of alkene to <nUm> in CD2Cl <nUm> solution at low temperature give equilibrium mixture of cp'2- Zr(OtBu)(alkene)+ ( 12a-l ) , <nUm> , and free alkene . the NMR data for 12a-l are consistent with unsymmetrical alkene bonding and polarization of the alkene C = C bond with positive charge buildup at cint and negative charge buildup at cterm . these feature arise due to the lack of d-p* back - bonding . equilibrium constant for alkene coordination to <nUm> in CD2Cl2 at <nUm> ° C , K eq = [12][6]-1[alkene]-1 , vary in the order : vinylferrocene ( <nUm> M-1 ) ≫ ethylene ( 7.0 ) ≈ a-olefins > cis-2-butene ( 2.2 ) > trans-2-butene ( < <nUm> ) . alkene coordination is inhibited by sterically bulky substituents on the alkene but is greatly enhanced by electron - donating group and the b-Si effect . compound 12a-l undergo two dynamic process : reversible alkene decomplexation via associative substitution of a CD2Cl2 molecule , and rapid rotation of the alkene around the metal - ( alkene centroid ) axis . this paper describes the generation and property of nonchelated d <nUm> zirconocene-aryl-alkene and alkyne adduct that are stabilized by the presence of b-SiMe3 substituents on the substrate and the weak nucleophilicity of the -C6F5 ligand . the cationic complex [ (C5H4R)2Zr(C6F 5)][B(C6F5)4] ( 4a : r = H , 4b : r = me ) were generated by methide abstraction from ( C5H 4R)2Zr(C6F5)Me by ph 3C+ . NMR study show that 4a,b contain an o-CF ⋯ Zr dative interaction and probably coordinate a PhCl molecule in PhCl solution . addition of allyltrimethylsilane ( ATMS ) to 4a,b in C6D5Cl solution at low temperature produce an equilibrium mixture of ( C 5H4R)2Zr(C6F5)(H 2C = CHCH2SiMe3)+ ( 7a,b ) , 4a,b , and free ATMS . similarly , addition of propargyltrimethylsilane ( PTMS ) to 4a produce an equilibrium mixture of Cp2Zr(C6F5)(HC = CCH2SiMe3)+ ( 8a ) , 4a , and free PTMS . the NMR data for 7a,b,and 8a are consistent with highly unsymmetrical substrate coordination and substantial polarization of the substrate multiple bond with significant positive charge buildup at cint and negative charge buildup at cterm . PTMS bind to 4a more strongly than ATMS doe . the ATMS adduct undergo nondissociative alkene face exchange ( " alkene flipping " ) , i.e. , exchange of the ( C5H4R ) 2Zr(C6F5)+ unit between the two alkene enantiofaces without decomplexation of the alkene , on the NMR time scale . exposure of e9,e5-bis(indenyl)zirconium sandwich complex to <nUm> atm of H resulted in facile oxidative addition to furnish the corresponding zirconocene dihydrides , ( e5-C9H5-1,3-R2 ) 2ZrH2 ( r = SiMe3 , SiMe2Ph , CHMe <nUm> ) . continued hydrogenation completed conversion to the tetrahydroindenyl derivative , ( e5-C9H 9-1,3-R2)2ZrH2 . deuterium labeling study established that dihydrogen ( dideuterium ) addition to the benzo ring is intramolecular and stereospecific , occurring solely from the endo face of the ligand , proximal to the zirconium . In the absence of dihydrogen , the bis(indenyl)zirconium dihydrides rearranged to new zirconium monohydride complex containing an unusual e5,e3-4,5- dihydroindenediyl ligand , arising from metal - to - benzo ring hydrogen transfer . mechanistic study , including a normal , primary kinetic isotope effect measured at <nUm> ° C , are consistent with a pathway involving regio- and stereoselective insertion of a benzo C = C bond into a zirconium hydride . the stereochemistry of the insertion reaction , and hence the e5 , e3-4,5-dihydroindenediyl product , is influenced by the presence of donor ligand and controlled by the preferred conformation of the indenyl ring . exposure of the zirconium hydride containing the e5 , e3-4,5-dihydroindenediyl ring to <nUm> atm of dihydrogen afforded the tetrahydroindenyl zirconium dihydride complex , establishing the intermediacy of this unusual coordination environment during benzo ring hydrogenation . treatment of the η <nUm> ,e <nUm> -bis(indenyl)zirconium sandwich complex , ( η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -1,3-(SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> )(e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -1,3- ( SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> )Zr , with dialkyl ether such a diethyl ether , CH <nUm> OR ( r = et , n bu , t bu ) , n bu <nUm> O , or i Pr <nUm> O resulted in facile C-O bond scission furnishing an η <nUm> ,e <nUm> -bis(indenyl)zirconium alkoxy hydride complex and free olefin . In case where ethylene is formed , trapping by the zirconocene sandwich yield a rare example of a crystallographically characterized , base - free η <nUm> , η <nUm> -bis(indenyl)zirconium ethylene complex . observation of normal , primary kinetic isotope effect in combination with rate study and the stability of various model compound support a mechanism involving rate - determining C-H activation to yield an η <nUm> ,e <nUm> - bis(indenyl) - zirconium alkyl hydride intermediate followed by rapid b-alkoxide elimination . for isolable η <nUm> ,e <nUm> - bis(indenyl) - zirconium THF compound , thermolysis at <nUm> ° C also resulted in C-O bond cleavage to yield the corresponding zirconacycle . both mechanistic and computational study again support a pathway involving haptotropic rearrangement to η <nUm> ,e <nUm> -bis(indenyl)zirconium intermediate that promote rate - determining C-H activation and ultimately C-O bond scission . the mechanism of stereocontrol in the site - controlled stereospecific polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) with C2- and C s-symmetric zirconocenes is investigated with a DFT based approach . our model explains the experimentally observed isospecificity in MMA polymerization with the C2 - symmetric rac-C2H 4(Ind)2Zr - based system a well a the experimentally observed syndiospecificity in MMA polymerization with the C s-symmetric Me2C(Cp)(Flu)Zr - based system . In both case , the chiral metallocene induces a chiral orientation of the ester enolate growing chain . In turn , the chirally oriented growing chain selects it own enantioface . comparison with the mechanism of stereocontrol operative in the case of propene polymerization by the same zirconocenes is performed to stress similarity and difference . although analogy are expected , surprising difference also exist . the most peculiar is that the in the case of 1-olefins , the enantioselective event is selection between the enantiofaces of the prochiral monomer . instead , in the case of acrylate , the enantioselective event is selection between the enantiofaces of the prochiral growing chain . the specie on the zirconocene catalyst is changed from two cp 's to the brintzinger ligand and catalytic amount of MAO are used to usually effect a > <nUm> % regiocontrol of negishi carboaluminations of 1-alkynes in toluene . an investigation of the use of Cp2Zr(H)Cl ( schwartz 's reagent ) to reduce a variety of amide to the corresponding aldehyde under very mild reaction condition and in high yield is reported . A range of tertiary amide , including weinreb 's amide , can be converted directly to the corresponding aldehyde with remarkable chemoselectivity . primary and secondary amide proved to be viable substrate for reduction a well , although the yield were somewhat diminished a compared to the corresponding tertiary amide . result from NMR experiment suggested the presence of a stable , 18-electron zirconacycle intermediate that presumably affords the aldehyde upon water or silica gel workup . A series of competition experiment revealed a preference of the reagent for substrate in which the lone pair of the nitrogen is electron releasing and thus more delocalized across the amide bond by resonance . this trend account for the observed excellent selectivity for tertiary amide versus ester . experiment regarding the solvent dependence of the reaction suggested a kinetic profile similar to that postulated for the hydrozirconation of alkene and alkyne . addition of p-anisidine to the reaction intermediate resulted in the formation of the corresponding imine mimicking the addition of water that form the aldehyde . the reaction of Li2[Me2Si(3-R-C5H3)2] salt with Zr{Me3SiN(CH2)3NSiMe3}Cl2(THF)2 in THF quantitatively afforded rac-Me2Si(3-R-C5H3)2Zr{Me3SiN(CH2)3NSiMe3} zirconocenes with <nUm> % stereoselectivity . NMR monitoring study showed that these reaction initially form rac / meso mixture , which undergo isomerization to pure rac . the isomerization requires cp - enantioface exchange and is catalyzed by chloride ion , which reversibly displaces cp- from Me2Si(3-R-C5H3)2Zr{Me3SiN(CH2)3NSiMe3} . kinetic analysis for selected complex showed first - order dependence of the isomerization rate on both metallocene and chloride concentration . reversible cp- / cl- exchange is also facile for {ansa-bis-Cp}ZrCl2 and nonbridged Cp2ZrCl2 complex . silica - tethered fluorinated sulfonic acid in combination with trimethylaluminum activate metallocenes for the polymerization of ethylene . various control experiment indicate that the in situ formation of known cocatalysts such a methylaluminoxane is not likely . it is proposed that the interaction between the alkylaluminum and the supported sulfonic acid creates a site that can activate the zirconocene precatalyst to form the polymerization catalyst . this is a new combined support / activator for single - site olefin polymerization . the zirconocene complex [Cp2ZrMe]+ reacts with 2,4-dimethyl-1-pentene to give methane and the allyl complex [Cp2Zr(e3-CH2C(CH2CHMe2)CH2)]+ . the reaction involves a an intermediate the unprecedented alkyl e1-alkene complex [Cp2Zr(Me)(e1-CH2CMeCH2CHMe2)]+ , in which C(2) is essentially carbocationic and the C(1) - C(2) bond order is sufficiently low that rotation about it occurs . the hydrogen atom of the methyl group on C(2) are sufficiently acidic that proton transfer to the Zr-Me group occurs to generate the allylic product . it seems likely that the chemistry described here provides a rationale for deactivation of propene polymerization catalyst since the normal product of chain transfer , polymer with vinylidene end group , should form allylic specie in the same way . multisubstituted olefin are efficiently prepared by the zirconocene - mediated regio- and stereoselective coupling between 1-alkynylboronates and ethylene , followed by sequential transformation in moderate to high yield . the proper combination of substrate and reaction condition is important for high yield . the synthesis of various tetrasubstituted alkene in a regio- and stereocontrolled manner is described . this methodology ha been applied to the synthesis of (Z)-tamoxifen in a concise , regio- and stereoselective manner . this multicomponent coupling strategy involves the characteristic of 1-alkynylboronates toward high selectivity followed by palladium(0) - mediated cross-coupling with aryl halide . the first asymmetric iridium - catalyzed C-C bond forming hydrogenation is described . by simply hydrogenating alkyne in the presence of n-arylsulfonyl imines using an iridium catalyst modified by (R)-Cl,MeO-BIPHEP , one may obtain the corresponding allylic amine 1b-21b in highly optically enriched form ( 92-99 % ee ) . this protocol circumvents the use of preformed vinyl metal reagent and is applicable to aromatic , heteroaromatic , and aliphatic n-arylsulfonyl aldimines 1a-16a . the reductive coupling product , allylic amine 1b-21b , are produced a single geometrical isomer ( ≥ <nUm> : <nUm> , e : z ) . nonsymmetric alkyne couple to imines 8a and 12a under standard condition with excellent level of regioselection . absolute stereochemical assignment of allylic amine 1b-21b is based upon single - crystal x-ray diffraction analysis of 22b , the p-bromophenylsulfonyl analogue of adduct 1b , using the anomalous dispersion method . A stereochemical model accounting for the observed sense of absolute stereoinduction and regioselectivity is provided . the insertion of enantiopure C2 - symmetric diphenylethylene carbonate into the Zr-C bond of zirconaaziridines lead to the asymmetric synthesis of amino acid methyl ester . because the zirconaaziridine enantiomer interconvert , the reaction is a dynamic kinetic resolution ( DKR ) . the efficiency of the DKR ( the ratio of the two diastereomeric product ) is determined by the balance between the rate of enantiomer interconversion and the rate of insertion ; slow addition of the inserting enantiopure carbonate is often required to maximize the stereoselectivity . for a case when enantiomer interconversion is fast , it rate constant kinv ha been determined by NMR line broadening ; for a case when interconversion is slow , kinv ha been determined by computer simulation of the formation of the diastereomeric product a a function of time ; for several intermediate case , kinv ha been determined by making the zirconaaziridine enantioenriched and monitoring it racemization by CD spectroscopy . the observed kinv is independent of [THF] , implying that interconversion occurs with THF coordinated . interconversion presumably occurs via an achiral intermediate , either a rapidly inverting ( via an e1-N structure ) e3-azaallyl hydride or an e1-imine . As addition of THF slows insertion without affecting enantiomer interconversion , it produce a more efficient DKR without slow addition of the enantiopure carbonate . the reaction of Cp2Zr(4-F-o-tolyl)(CD2Cl2M)+ ( A ) with 2-butyne at <nUm> ° C in CD2Cl2 proceeds by reversible formation of the alkyne complex Cp2Zr(4-F-o-tolyl)(2-butyne)+ ( C ) , followed by rate limiting insertion to produce Cp2Zr{CMe = CMe(4-F-o-tolyl)}+ ( d ) . analysis of this system by pre-equilibrium kinetics ( <nUm> ° C ) give keq = <nUm> M-1 for 2-butyne coordination to A and kinsert = <nUm> × 10-4 s-1 and δ g ‡ insert = <nUm> kcal / mol for the insertion step . stabilization of C by an agostic interaction and steric crowding in the transition state contribute to the high insertion barrier . the scope of CO-induced N <nUm> cleavage in a series of zirconocene and hafnocene complex containing activated , side-on bound dinitrogen ligand ha been studied . In each case , bridging oxamidide ligand , [ N 2C 2O <nUm> ] 4- , were formed from N-N bond cleavage coupled to N-C and C-C bond assembly . for the zirconium example , [ ( η 5-C 5Me 4H ) 2Zr ] <nUm> ( μ 2,e 2,e 2-N <nUm> ) and [ me 2Si(e 5-C 5Me 4)(e 5-C 5H 3-3- tBu)Zr ] <nUm> ( μ 2,e <nUm> , η 2-N <nUm> ) , dinitrogen loss became competitive with N <nUm> carbonylation , and significant quantity of the zirconocene dicarbonyl accompanied oxamidide formation . In contrast , the hafnocene complex [ ( η 5-C 5Me 4H ) 2Hf ] <nUm> ( μ 2,e 2,e 2-N <nUm> ) underwent clean carbonylative dinitrogen cleavage with no evidence of N <nUm> loss . CO-induced N <nUm> cleavage wa also coupled to N-H bond formation by hydrogenation and C-H bond activation , a carbonylation of the zirconocene and hafnocene dinitrogen complex in the presence of H <nUm> or phenylacetylene furnished isocyanato metallocene complex with bridging imido ( m-NH ) ligand . In the case of the ansa - hafnocene dinitrogen complex , replacing the dihydrogen atmosphere with various primary silanes yielded an isocyanato hafnocene m-oxo hydride resulting from cleavage of N <nUm> and CO , the diatomics with the two strongest bond in chemistry . the alkylaluminum - complexed zirconocene trihydride cation [(SBI)Zr(m-H)3(AliBu2)2] + , which is obtained by reaction of BCl2ISZr with [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] and excess AlH iBu2 in toluene solution , catalyzes the formation of isotactic polypropene when exposed to propene at <nUm> ° C . this cation remains the sole observable specie in catalyst system free of AlMe compound . In the presence of AlMe3 , however , exposure to propene cause the trihydride cation to be completely converted , under concurrent consumption of all hydride specie by propene hydroalumination , to the doubly me - bridged cation [(SBI)Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2]+ . the latter then becomes the resting state for further propene polymerization , which produce , by chain transfer to Al , mainly AlMe2 - capped isotactic polypropene . the ansa - zirconocene complex rac-Me2Si(1-indenyl) 2ZrCl2 ( BCl2ISZr ) reacts with diisobutylaluminum hydride and trityl tetrakis(perfluorophenyl)borate in hydrocarbon solution to give the cation [ (SBI)Zr(m-H)3(Al iBu2)2]+ , the identity of which is derived from NMR data and supported by a crystallographic structure determination . analogous reaction proceed with many other zirconocene dichloride complex . [ (SBI)Zr(m-H)3(AliBu 2)2]+ reacts reversibly with AlCl iBu2 to give the dichloro-bridged cation [(SBI)Zr(m-Cl)2AliBu2]+ . reaction with AlMe3 first lead to mixed - alkyl specie [ (SBI)Zr(m-H) <nUm> ( AlMex iBu2 - x)2 ] + by exchange of alkyl group between aluminum center . At higher AlMe3 / Zr ratio , [(SBI)Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2] + , a constituent of methylalumoxane - activated catalyst system , is formed in an equilibrium , in which the hydride cation [ (SBI)Zr(m-H) 3(AlR2)2]+ strongly predominates at comparable HAliBu2 and AlMe3 concentration , thus implicating the presence of this hydride cation in olefin polymerization catalyst system . accurate active - site count are necessary for the establishment of olefin polymerization kinetics , yet current technique are often tedious and limited in sensitivity . herein , we describe the development of a novel method for determining the fraction of initiated catalyst using standard gel - permeation chromatography ( GPC ) . the first insertion of monomer into the chromophore - bearing zirconocene <nUm> generates a single equivalent of a labeled polymer chain . the polymer - bound label can be quantified a a function of polymer molecular weight using a GPC with a UV detector ; simultaneous RI detection allows both the extent of monomer conversion and the molecular - weight distribution to also be established . we estimate that monomer to catalyst ratio of a high a <nUm> : <nUm> can be measured using this technique . 91Zr ( I = <nUm> / <nUm> ) solid - state NMR ( SSNMR ) spectrum of the zirconocene compound , Cp2ZrCl2 , cp* 2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) , Cp2ZrBr2 ( 2 ) , ( me 3SiC5H4)2ZrBr2 ( 3 ) , O(Me2SiC5H4)2ZrBr2 ( 4 ) , (1,3-C5H3)(SiMe2OSiMe2) 2(1,3-C5H3)ZrBr2 ( 5 ) , ind 2ZrCl2 ( 6 ) , Cp2ZrMeCl ( 7 ) , cp 2ZrMe2 ( 8 ) , and [Cp2ZrMe][MeB(C 6F5)3 ] ( 9 ) have been acquired . static 91Zr SSNMR spectrum have been acquired for all complex at magnetic field of <nUm> and <nUm> T. Cp2ZrCl2 and complex <nUm> to <nUm> posse relatively narrow central transition powder pattern which allows for magic - angle spinning ( MAS ) 91Zr solid - state NMR spectrum to be acquired at a moderate field strength of <nUm> T . complex <nUm> to <nUm> posse ultrawideline central transition SSNMR spectrum necessitating piece-wise acquisition technique . from the static and MAS 91Zr SSNMR spectrum , it is possible to measure 91Zr electric field gradient ( EFG ) and chemical shift ( CS ) tensor parameter , a well a the euler angle which describe their relative orientation . basis set and method for the accurate quantum chemical calculation of 91Zr EFG and CS tensor have been identified . the origin of the observed EFG and CS tensor parameter are further investigated by visualization of the EFG and CS tensor orientation within the molecular frame . correlation between the observed and calculated NMR tensor parameter and molecular symmetry and structure are made . all of these observation suggest that 91Zr SSNMR spectroscopy can be utilized to probe the molecular structure of a variety of homogeneous and heterogeneous olefin polymerization catalyst . the reaction of the low - valent metallocene(II) source cp 2Ti(n2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) ( 7 ) and Cp2Zr(py)(n2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( <nUm> , cp = n5-cyclopentadienyl , py = pyridine ) with carbodiimides RN = C = NR ( r = cy , i-Pr , p-Tol ) lead to the formation of five membered hetero-metallacycloallenes Cp2M{Me3SiC = C = C[N(SiMe3)(R)]-N ( r ) } ( 9M-R ) ( m = Ti , r = i-Pr ; m = Zr , r = cy , i-Pr , p-Tol ) . elimination of the alkyne ( a the hitherto known reactivity of titanocene and zirconocene alkyne complex would suggest ) wa not observed . the molecular structure of the obtained complex were confirmed by x-ray study . moreover , the structure and bonding of the complex 9Zr-Cy and 9Zr-p-Tol wa investigated by DFT calculation . ( figure presented ) the cationic zirconocene - phosphinoaryloxide complex [ cp 2ZrOC6H4P(t-Bu)2][B(C 6F5)4 ] ( 3 ) and [ Cp*2ZrOC 6H4P(t-Bu)2][B(C6F5) <nUm> ] ( 4 ) were synthesized by the reaction of Cp2ZrMe <nUm> or Cp*2ZrMe2 with 2-(diphenylphosphino) phenol followed by protonation with [2,6-di-tert-butylpyridinium][B(C 6F5)4 ] . compound <nUm> exhibit a Zr-P bond , whereas the bulkier cp* derivative <nUm> wa isolated a a chlorobenzene adduct without this Zr-P interaction . these compound can be described a transition - metal - containing version of linked frustrated lewis pair ( FLPs ) , and treatment of <nUm> with H under mild condition cleaved H <nUm> in a fashion analogous to that for main - group FLPs . their reactivity in amine borane dehydrogenation also mimic that of main - group FLPs , and they dehydrogenate a range of amine borane adduct . however , in contrast to main - group FLPs , <nUm> and <nUm> achieve this transformation in a catalytic rather than stoichiometric sense , with rate superior to those for previous high - valent catalyst . the extension of the frustrated lewis pair ( FLP ) concept to the transition series with cationic zirconocene - phosphinoaryloxide complex is demonstrated . such complex mimic the reactivity of main group FLPs in reaction such a heterolytic hydrogen cleavage , CO <nUm> activation , olefin and alkyne addition , and ring - opening of tetrahydrofuran . the interplay between sterics and electronics is shown to have an important role in determining the reactivity of these compound with hydrogen in particular . the Zr-H specie generated from the heterolytic activation of hydrogen is shown to undergo insertion reaction with both CO <nUm> and CO . crucially , these transition metal FLPs are markedly more reactive than main group system in many case , and in addition to the usual array of reaction they demonstrate unprecedented reactivity in the activation of small molecule . this includes S N and E2 reaction with alkyl chloride and fluoride , enolate formation from acetone , and the cleavage of C-O bond to facilitate S N type reaction with noncyclic dialkyl ether . reaction of cp 2Zr(m-Cl)(m-C 2B 10H 10)Li(OEt <nUm> ) <nUm> with alkyne r 1C ≡ CR <nUm> gave a insertion product zirconacyclopentenes incorporating a carboranyl unit , 1,2-[Cp 2ZrC(R <nUm> ) = C(R 2)]-1,2-C 2B 10H <nUm> ( 1 ) . treatment of <nUm> with another type of alkyne r 3C ≡ CR <nUm> in the presence of stoichiometric amount of ClNi <nUm> and ClFe <nUm> or a catalytic amount of ClNi <nUm> afforded symmetric or unsymmetric benzocarboranes . the regioselectivity wa dominated by the polarity of the corresponding alkyne . these reaction could also be carried out in one pot , leading to the equivalent of a three - component [ <nUm> + <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition of carboryne and two different alkyne promoted by transition metal . A reaction mechanism wa proposed after the isolation and structural characterization of the key intermediate nickelacycle . these result show that nickel complex are more reactive than the iron one toward the insertion of alkyne but that the latter do not initiate the trimerization of alkyne , making the insertion of activated alkyne possible . this work also demonstrates that a catalytic amount of nickel work a well a a stoichiometric amount of nickel in the presence of excess ClFe <nUm> for the reaction . such a catalytic reaction may shed some light on the development of zirconocene - based catalytic reaction . coordination polymerization of renewable a-methylene-g-(methyl) butyrolactones by chiral C 2-symmetric zirconocene catalyst produce stereo - random , highly stereo - regular , or perfectly stereo - regular polymer , depending on the monomer and catalyst structure . computational study yield a fundamental understanding of the stereocontrol mechanism governing these new polymerization reaction mediated by chiral metallocenium catalyst . salt metathesis reaction of cp <nUm> ( NR 2)ZrX ( x = Cl , I , OTf ) and lithium hydrosilazides ultimately afford hydride product cp <nUm> ( NR 2)ZrH that suggest unusual b-hydrogen elimination process . A likely intermediate in one of these reaction , cp 2Zr[N(SiHMe 2)t-Bu][N(SiHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , is isolated under controlled synthetic condition . addition of alkali metal salt to this zirconium hydrosilazide compound produce the corresponding zirconium hydride . however a condition are varied , a number of other pathway are also accessible , including C-H / Si-H dehydrocoupling , g-abstraction of a CH , and b-abstraction of a HSi . our observation suggest that the conversion of (hydrosilazido)zirconocene to zirconium hydride and silanimine doe not follow the classical four - center mechanism for b-elimination . chemistry research is an eloquent , yet extremely complex discipline consisting of a diverse range of topic . the complexity of every sub-discipline requires extensive focus , which can limit cross-talk between field , thus leading to their isolation . In particular , natural product and material chemistry have experienced this trend , and it ha led to an ever growing separation between them . yet by looking at the fundamental aspect of the relationship between molecular design and the resulting property , it is possible to remind chemist of their ability to bridge these research area . it is intradisciplinary collaboration that can provide a path toward collectively addressing the many challenge of chemistry . reduction of Zr(IV) metallocenium cation with sodium amalgam ( HgNa ) produce EPR signal assignable to Zr (III) metallocene complex . the chloro-bridged heterodinuclear ansa - zirconocenium cation [ (SBI)Zr(m-Cl) 2AlMe2]+ ( SBI = rac-dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl) ) , present in toluene solution a it BC6F5 <nUm> - salt , thus give rise to an EPR signal assignable to the complex (SBI)ZrIII(m-Cl)2AlMe2 , while (SBI)ZrIII-Me and (SBI)ZrIII(m-H)2Al iBu2 are formed by reduction of [ (SBI)Zr(m-Me) 2AlMe2]+ BC6F5 <nUm> - and [ (SBI)Zr(m-H)3(AliBu 2)2]+ BC6F5 <nUm> - , respectively . these product can also be accessed , along with (SBI)ZrIII - iBu and [(SBI)ZrIII] + AlR4 - , when (SBI)ZrMe2 is allowed to react with HAliBu2 , eliminating isobutane en route to the Zr (III) complex . further study concern interconversion reaction between these and other (SBI)Zr(III) complex and reaction mechanism involved in their formation . the reactivity of a series of disilazido zirconocene complex is dominated by the migration of anionic group ( hydrogen , alkyl , halide , OTf ) between the zirconium and silicon center . the direction of these migration is controlled by the addition of two - electron donor ( lewis base ) or two - electron acceptor ( lewis acid ) . the cationic nonclassical [ Cp2ZrN(SiHMe 2)2]+ ( [2]+ ) is prepared from Cp2Zr{N(SiHMe2)2}H ( 1 ) and B(C 6F5)3 or [Ph3C][B(C 6F5)4 ] , while reaction of B(C 6F5)3 and Cp2Zr{N(SiHMe 2)2}R ( r = me ( 3 ) , et ( 5 ) , n-C3H7 ( 7 ) , CHi -CHSiMe3 ( 9 ) ) provide a mixture of [2]+ and [Cp2ZrN(SiHMe2)(SiRMe2)]+ . the latter product are formed through BC18F15 abstraction of a b-H and r group migration from Zr to the b-Si center . related b-hydrogen abstraction and x group migration reaction are observed for Cp2Zr{N(SiHMe2)2}X ( x = OTf ( 11 ) , Cl ( 13 ) , OMe ( 15 ) , O-i-C3H7 ( 16 ) ) . alternatively , addition of DMAP ( DMAP = 4-(dimethylamino)pyridine ) to [2]+ result in coordination to a Si center and hydrogen migration to zirconium , giving the cationic complex [Cp2Zr{N(SiHMe2)(SiMe2DMAP)}H] + ( [19]+ ) . related hydrogen migration occurs from [ cp 2ZrN(SiHMe2)(SiMe2OCHMe2) ] + ( [18]+ ) to give [ Cp2Zr{N(SiMe 2DMAP)(SiMe2OCHMe2)}H]+ ( [22] + ) , whereas x group migration is observed upon addition of DMAP to [Cp2ZrN(SiHMe2)(SiMe2X)]+ ( x = OTf ( [12]+ ) , Cl ( [14]+ ) ) to give [ cp 2Zr{N(SiHMe2)(SiMe2DMAP)}X]+ ( x = OTf ( [26]+ ) , Cl ( [20]+ ) ) . the specie involved in these transformation are described by resonance structure that suggest b-elimination . notably , such pathway are previously unknown in early metal amide chemistry . finally , these migration facilitate direct Si-H addition to carbonyl , which is proposed to occur through a pathway that previously had been reserved for later transition metal compound . treatment of a [(trimethylsilylethynyl)alkenyl]ZrCp2 complex with pier ' borane [HB(C6F5)2] resulted in the clean formation of the Zr / B complex [ e2-(C6F 5)2B-Ci - C-SiMe3]ZrCp2 ( 3 ) . this compound show some unique reaction pattern . with a variety of typical donor ligand ( carbon monoxide , an isonitrile , a nitrile , THF-d8 , ) it form the respective adduct <nUm> ( four example characterized by x-ray diffraction ) . toward terminal alkyne ( RCi - CH ) compound <nUm> behaves a a Zr (II) metal lewis base / boron lewis acid frustrated lewis pair ( FLP ) and undergoes typical regioselective 1,2-Zr / B addition reaction to yield the metallaheterocyclic product <nUm> ( four example characterized by x-ray diffraction ) . compound <nUm> also undergoes characteristic 1,4-Zr / B FLP addition to a silyl-substituted conjugated enyne ( to give <nUm> ) and also to 1,4-bis(trimethylsilyl)butadiyne to yield a metallacyclic butatriene derivative <nUm> ( both <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by x-ray diffraction ) . eventually , compound <nUm> reacted with mes2P-Ci - CH to give the metallacycloallenoid product <nUm> , which wa probably formed by mean of 1,2-Zr / B FLP addition followed by alkynyl shift from boron to zirconium and reductive coupling . treatment of <nUm> with tolane gave the closely related zirconacycloallenoid complex <nUm> by carbon carbon coupling . both the product <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by x-ray diffraction . Cs - ligated ansa - zirconocene bis- and mono(ester enolate ) complex incorporating the diphenylmethylidene-(cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl) ligand , upon activation with appropriate activator , are highly active catalyst for the syndiospecific polymerization of MMA at ambient temperature , leading to the production of PMMA with high syndiotacticity ( rrrr = <nUm> % ) and glass transition temperature ( tg = <nUm> ° C ) . the mechanism of reversible alkyne coupling at zirconium wa investigated by examination of the kinetics of zirconacyclopentadiene cleavage to produce free alkyne . the zirconacyclopentadiene ring studied posse trimethylsilyl substituents in the a-positions , and the ancillary cp2 , me 2C(e5-C5H4)2 , and CpCp* ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 ) bis(cyclopentadienyl) ligand set were employed . fragmentation of the zirconacyclopentadiene ring in Cp2Zr[2,5-(Me3Si) 2-3,4-Ph2C4 ] with PMe3 , to produce Cp2Zr(e2-PhC ≡ CSiMe3)-(PMe <nUm> ) and free PhC ≡ CSiMe3 , is first - order in initial zirconacycle concentration and zero - order in incoming phosphine ( kob = 1-4(2) × 10-5 s-1 at <nUm> ° C ) , and the activation parameter determined by an eyring analysis ( DH ‡ = <nUm> kcal mol-1 and DS ‡ = <nUm> eu ) are consistent with a dissociative mechanism . the analogous reaction of the ansa - bridged complex Me2C(e 5-C5H4)2Zr[2,5-(Me 3Si)2-3,4-Ph2C4 ] is <nUm> time faster than that for the corresponding cp2 complex , while the corresponding CpCp* complex reacts <nUm> time slower than the cp2 derivative . these rate appear to be largely influenced by the steric property of the ancillary ligand . addition of <nUm> equiv of carbon dioxide to the ansa - zirconocene dinitrogen complex resulted in selective insertion into each zirconium nitrogen bond , forming a C2 symmetric dicarboxylated diazenido compound . treatment with excess Me3SiI furnished the ansa - zirconocene diiodide along with the N,N-dicarboxylated silylated hydrazine . new nitrogen-carbon bond were also assembled by addition of methyl triflate . tri- and tetrasubstituted hydrazine could be formed by treatment with water and Me3SiI , respectively . the regiochemistry of the N carboxylation is controlled by the ansa-cyclopentadienyl ligand where the sterically demanding tert-butyl substituents and the C2 symmetry of the dimer dictate the stereochemistry of CO2 insertion . these result demonstrate the ability of zirconium dinitrogen compound to participate in heterocumulene insertion chemistry . exposure of the isolable zirconocene sandwich compound , (e5-C5Me5)(e5-C 9H5-1-R1-3-R2)Zr ( R1 = me , iPr , tBu ; R2 = me ) to one atmosphere of dinitrogen resulted in N coordination . x-ray diffraction and NMR spectroscopy establish that the resulting dimeric dinitrogen compound contain an unusual m2,e2-bridging indenyl ring and a weakly activated N ligand . N coordination from the isolable zirconium sandwich compound is extremely sensitive to the number and size of the indenyl subsituents . compound bearing two [iPr] or three methyl substituents are stable a e9 sandwich compound for week under dinitrogen likely due to the inability to dimerize through a two - atom N <nUm> bridge . performing the reduction of ( e5-C 5Me5)(e5-C9H5-1- R1-3-R2)ZrCl2 ( R1 = iPr , tBu ; R2 = me ; R1 = R2 = SiMe <nUm> ) under an N atmosphere produced a different outcome ; rare example of side-on , end-on zirconium dinitrogen compound were isolated and in one case , crystallographically characterized . protonolysis study with weak bronsted acid were used to evaluate the relative activation of the bridging dinitrogen ligand . sodium amalgam reduction of the bis(indenyl)zirconium dihalide complex , (e5-C9H5-1-iPr-3-Me)2ZrX2 ( x = Cl , Br , I ) , yielded the corresponding end-on dinitrogen complex , [(e5-C9H5-1-iPr-3-Me)2Zr(NaX)]2(m2 , e1 , e1-N2 ) , with inclusion of <nUm> equiv of salt per zirconocene . the solid state structure of the chloro and iodo congener establish short Zr = N and elongated N-N bond , consistent with modest to strong activation of the coordinated dinitrogen molecule . exposure of the N compound to <nUm> atm of dihydrogenresulted in rapid N-H bond formation to yield a hydrido zirconocene hydrazido compound concomitant with salt elimination . these study establish a new structural type of zirconocene dinitrogen complex and demonstrate that side-on coordination of the N ligand in the ground state is not a prerequisite for dinitrogen hydrogenation . reaction of unbridged zirconocene dichloride , ( r n C <nUm> H 5-n ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> , or <nUm> ) , with diisobutylaluminum hydride ( HAI'Bu <nUm> ) result in the formation of tetranuclear trihydride cluster of the type ( r n C <nUm> H 5-n ) <nUm> Zr(m-H) <nUm> ( Al i Bu2)3(m-CI) <nUm> , which contain three [ Al i bu <nUm> ] unit . ring - bridged ansa - zirconocene dichloride , Me2E(R n C <nUm> H 4-n ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> with e = C or Si , on the other hand , are found to form binuclear dihydride complex of the type Me2E(R n C <nUm> H 4-n ) <nUm> Zr(CI)(m-H) <nUm> Al i bu <nUm> with only one [ AIBu <nUm> ] unit . the dichotomy between unbridged and bridged zirconocene derivative with regard to tetranuclear versus binuclear product formation is proposed to be connected to different degree of rotational freedom of their C <nUm> - ring ligand . alkylaluminum - complexed zirconocene dihydrides , previously observed in zirconocene - based precatalyst system activated by methylalumoxane ( MAO ) upon addition of HAI'Bu <nUm> or Al i bu <nUm> , are proposed to be specie of the type me <nUm> si(ind) <nUm> Zr(Me)(m-H) <nUm> Al i bu <nUm> , stabilized by interaction of their terminal me group with a lewis acidic site of MAO . low - valent zirconocene specie reacted with 1,1,6,6-tetraalkyl-1,2,3,4,5- hexapentaenes to form both 1-zirconacyclopent-3-ynes and n2-p- coordinated complex according to the alkyl group ( r ) and the existence of the neutral ligand ( L ) . haptotropic interconvertion between these two complex wa observed . it wa proposed that double insertion of isocyanide into the Zr-C bond of 1-zirconacyclopent-3-ynes take place via the isocyanide adduct of the n2-p - complex a an intermediate . treatment of the bis-acetylide zirconocene complex ( RCp ) 2Zr(C ≡ C-SiMe3)2 ( 8a,R = CH3 ; 8b,R = tert-butyl ) with BC12F10H result in the formation of the five - membered organometallic zirconacycloallenoid product ( 9a , 9b ) . both were characterized by x-ray diffraction , and the special bonding feature of 9a were studied by DFT calculation . the overall reaction wa followed by NMR experiment at variable temperature . starting from 8a the reaction proceeds by alkynyl abstraction to give a zwitterionic [ ( MeCp ) 2ZrC ≡ C-SiMe3]+[e-Ar2 FB(H)C ≡ C-SiMe3]- intermediate ( 12a ) , single crystal of which were obtained at <nUm> ° C for characterization by x-ray diffraction , followed by a 1,1-hydroboration / s-ligand coupling sequence to give the new five - membered zirconacycloallenoid product 9a . reaction of <nUm> equivs of MesC ≡ CPh with cp 2Zr( e2-Me 3SiC ≡ CSiMe 3)(pyr) afforded the zircona-cyclopentadiene cp 2Zr[2,5-Ph2-3,4-Mes 2C <nUm> ] . the regiochemistry of this isomer ( sss with respect to the mesityl substituents ) wa determined through single - crystal x-ray analysis and 2D ( NOESY , HSQC , HMBC ) NMR experiment . this selectivity is attributed largely to a steric - based directing effect of the o-methyl ring substituents since coupling of 1,3-dimethyl-2-(phenylethynyl)benzene with zirconocene gave a single regioisomer ( o-xylyl group in both ss-positions ) while coupling of 1,3-dimethyl-5-(phenylethynl)benzene gave a statistical distribution of zirconacyclopentadiene regioisomers . the coupling reaction of <nUm> equivs of MeC ≡ CMes or CPr ≡ CMes with cp 2Zr(e 2-Me 3SiC ≡ CSiMe 3)(pyr) at ambient temperature gave the sss regioisomers , cp 2Zr[2,5-Me2-3,4-Mes 2C <nUm> ] and cp 2Zr[2,5-Pr2-3,4-Mes 2C4 ] , respectively , a the major product . heating solution of these zirconacycles at <nUm> ° C for several hour resulted in an increase in the amount of the unsymmetrical product . for reaction mixture of CPr ≡ CMes and cp 2Zr(e 2-Me 3SiC ≡ CSiMe 3)(pyr) the major ( and apparently thermodynamic ) product under these reaction condition wa cp 2Zr[2,4-Mes 2-3,5-Pr 2C <nUm> ] . the steric strain in the mesityl-substituted zirconacycles allowed for facile substitution reaction of MesC ≡ CPh or CPr ≡ CMes by le bulky alkyne ( i.e. , tolan and 3-hexyne ) to give the unsymmetrical ziconacyclopentadienes cp 2Zr[2,4,5-Ph 3-3-MesC <nUm> ] , cp 2Zr[2-Ph- 3-Mes-4,5-Et 2C <nUm> ] , and cp 2Zr[2-Pr-3-Mes-4,5- ph 2C <nUm> ] . reaction of a mesityl-terminated diyne containing a rigid dihexylfluorenylene spacer with zirconocene afforded poly(p-fluorenylenedienylene) after demetalation with benzoic acid . ( chemical equation presented ) the reaction of cpx 2ZrCl2 ( cpx = cp , cp* ) with ammonia borane in presence of n-butyllithium yielded Cp2Zr(Cl)NH 2BH3 and Cpx2Zr(H)NH 2BH3 . these derivative are isoelectronic with the ethyl zirconocene chloride and hydride , respectively , and feature a chelating amidoborane ligand coordinating through a Zr-N bond and a Zr-H-B bridge . In solution , each of the complex consists of an equilibrium mixture of two isomer differing in the orientation of the amidoborane ligand with respect to the Zr-X bond ( x = H , Cl ) , while in the solid state , only one isomer wa observed . such isomer have not been characterized for any metal complex containing the isoelectronic b-agostic ethyl ligand or any other agostic alkyl group . treatment of the hafnocene complex bearing a strongly activated , side-on bound dinitrogen ligand , [ ( e5-C5Me4H ) 2Hf]2(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) , with two equivalent of methyl triflate yielded a mixture of product , one of which wa identified a the triflato hafnocene methyl diazenide compound , ( e5-C5Me 4H)2Hf(OTf)(N2(CH3)) , arising from methylation of one of the nitrogen atom . this reactivity contrast with that of the zirconocene congener , [ ( e5-C5Me 4H)2Zr]2(m2,e2 , e2-N2 ) , where methyl triflate addition yield a variety of product that lack new nitrogen-carbon bond . the methylated hafnocene product , ( e5-C5Me4H ) 2Hf(OTf)(N2(CH3)) provides a platform for additional transformation for the functionalized dinitrogen core . treatment with additional methyl triflate result in a second nitrogen-carbon bond formation to yield a rare example of a triflato hafnocene hydrazonato complex . loss of methane and formation of the hafnocene bis(triflate) accompany the transformation . isotopic labeling study and other experiment are consistent with a pathway involving initial methylation of the unsubstituted nitrogen in the methyl diazenido ligand followed by deprotonation by a triflate anion . reaction of 1,2-dipotassiotetrakis(trimethylsilyl)disilane with group <nUm> metallocene dichloride lead to the formation of the respective metallocene 1,1,2,2-tetrakis(trimethylsilyl)disilene complex . while the disilene titanocene complex could be structurally characterized , the zirconocene and hafnocene compound , which are believed to posse some degree of bis-[bis(trimethylsilyl)silylene] character , can only be isolated in substance a the respective trimethylphosphane adduct . analogous metallocene 1,1,2,2-tetrakis(trimethylsilyl)digermene complex and a tetrakis(trimethylsilyl)silagermene complex were prepared . instead of metallocene 1,1,2,2-tetrakis(trimethylsilyl)distannene complex , four - membered ring composed of a metallocene and three bis(trimethylsilyl)stannylene unit were obtained . ( chemical equation presented ) the C-D activation of bromobenzene-d <nUm> by [Cp*2ZrMe(BrC6D5-kBr)] [B(C6F5)4] to form s-aryl complex [Cp*2Zr(2-BrC6D4-k2Br,C)] [B(C6F5)4] is accelerated when the decamethylzirconocene methyl cation is generated in the presence of tertiary amine . computational study suggest that the overall B - bond metathesis reaction proceeds , in the presence of tertiary amine , via initial deprotonation of bromobenzene in the coordination sphere of the metal center . In a subsequent step , the resulting neutral methyl aryl specie , Cp*2ZrMe(2- BrC6D4 ) , reacts with the concurrently generated trialkylammonium cation to generate [ Cp*2Zr(2-BrC 6D4-k2Br,C ) ] [B(C6F5)4] . ( chemical equation presented ) addition of 1-hexene to methylalumoxane- activated catalyst system based on rac-Me2Si(ind)2ZrMe2 cause , concurrent with polyhexene formation and diminution of the otherwise prevalent cation [ rac-Me2Si(ind)2Zr(m -Me ) 2AlMe2]+ , formation of a hitherto unobserved specie [ rac-Me2Si(ind)2Zr(m -R)(m -Me)AlMe 2]+ , where r is a Zr - bound polyhexyl chain . As hexene is increasingly consumed , this cation decay , mainly back to [ rac-Me 2Si(ind)2Zr(m -Me)2AlMe2 ] + and , in part , to some specie containing a Zr - bound allylic chain end . the reaction of internal and terminal alkyne with organoalanes containing et , n-Pr , and i-Bu group in the presence of cp 2ZrCl <nUm> and MeZrCp 2Cl were investigated with the goal of clarifying mechanistic detail of some representative case . three fundamentally different process , i.e. , ( i ) C-M bond addition without C-H activation in the alkyl group , ( ii ) cyclic C-M bond addition via C-H activation , and ( iii ) hydrometalation , have been observed , and the course of these reaction significantly depend on ( i ) the nature and number of alkyl group in organoalanes , ( ii ) their amount , and ( iii ) solvent . the reaction of alkyne with et 3Al in the presence of <nUm> equiv of cp 2ZrCl <nUm> in nonpolar solvent , e.g. , hexane , proceeds via C-H activation to give the corresponding aluminacyclopentenes . investigation of the reaction of 5-decyne with 1-3 equiv of et 3Al and <nUm> equiv of cp 2ZrCl <nUm> , which gave mono- , di- , or trideuterated (Z)-5-ethyl-5-decene a shown , together with the previously reported structural study on the reaction of et 3Al with cp 2ZrCl <nUm> leading to the formation of well - characterized bimetallic specie <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> , support a catalytic cycle involving bimetallic specie <nUm> and <nUm> . In summary , this process requires a zirconocene derivative containing one Zr - bound et group which is linked to et 3Al ( but not to et 2AlCl ) through a Cl bridge , i.e. , <nUm> , to produce <nUm> via β C-H activation . In sharp contrast , the reaction of et 2AlCl-Cp 2ZrCl <nUm> a well a of ( n-Pr ) 2AlCl-Cp 2ZrCl <nUm> doe not involve any C-H activation process . it proceeds well in chlorinated hydrocarbon solvent , e.g. , ( CH 2Cl ) <nUm> , but it is extremely sluggish in nonpolar solvent , e.g. , hexane . the reaction may well involve direct C-Al bond addition to alkyne , a suggested earlier for Zr - catalyzed Me-Al bond addition to alkyne , but a few other alternative can not be ruled out on the basis of the currently available data . the reaction of alkyne with ( n-Pr ) 3Al-Cp 2ZrCl <nUm> in nonpolar solvent proceeds partially via C-H activation and partially via hydrometalation . In contrast with the C-H activation process observed with et 3Al , that with ( n-Pr ) 3Al is totally dominated by dimerization of alkyne to give aluminacyclopentadienes rather than aluminacyclopentenes , reflecting a previously established generalization that propene can be much more readily displaced from Zr by alkyne than ethylene . hydrometalation is the exclusive process with ( i-Bu ) 3Al-Cp 2ZrCl <nUm> . this hydrometalation reaction , however , reveals a few interesting complication . alkyl-substituted internal alkyne give double bond migrated product in addition to the expected hydrometalation product . with terminal alkyne the reaction produce the expected hydrometalation product and the 1,1-dimetalloalkanes in comparable yield . various other related reaction involving other alkyne , e.g. , PhC ≡ CPh , n-OctC ≡ CH , and PhC ≡ CH , and other reagent , e.g. , et 3Al-MeZrCp 2Cl , et 2AlCl-MeZrCp 2Cl , and ( n-Pr ) 3Al-MeZrCp 2Cl , were also studied . In polymer made from (E)- or (Z)-[1-D]propene with methyl alumoxane (MAO)-activated ansa - zirconocene catalyst , signal of deuterium - labeled mrrm pentad document that stereoerrors arise mainly from an isomerization of the Zr - bound chain end . reduced d - atom redistribution in poly( [2-D]propene ) indicates a kinetic isotope effect of k(H) / k(D) ~ <nUm> for the b-H / d transfer associated with the isomerization reaction . In all poly([1- and [2-D]propenes ) studied , d - labeled mmmm pentad occur with a probability similar to that of d - labeled mrrm pentad ; this observation requires further mechanistic clarification . olefinic chain end of polymer obtained with C <nUm> H <nUm> ( thind ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> -MAO from (E)- or (Z)-[1-D]propene deviate in their d - label distribution from the expected stereochemistry . isomerization of the Zr - bound chain end , probably via a Zr - bound tertiary alkyl intermediate , thus contributes also to chain - growth termination . with the sterically hindered catalyst me <nUm> Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> -MAO , almost all chain termination appear to occur via chain - end isomerization , which doe not lead to stereoerrors here . with the high - performance catalyst me <nUm> Si(2-Me-benz[e]indenyl) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> -MAO , finally , no d - label is found in the mrrm and mmmm pentad signal ; here , Zr - alkyl isomerization can apparently not compete with the high rate of olefin insertion . none the mechanism of diimine-Ni - catalyzed ethylene polymerization reaction ha been studied theoretically using the B3LYP density functional method . the chain initiation reaction proceeds with the coordination of ethylene to the model active catalyst [L2NiCH3]+ , L2 - CH2N , followed by ethylene insertion into the metal - alkyl bond with a rate - determining <nUm> kcal / mol free energy barrier to form a g-agostic intermediate , which with a small barrier rearranges to a more stable b-agostic intermediate and then form an olefin alkyl complex upon coordination of the next ethylene . linear polymer propagation take place from this olefin alkyl complex , the resting state in the catalytic cycle , via the same insertion , rearrangement , and coordination pathway . an alternative pathway from the olefin alkyl complex pass over a 14-15 kcal / mol barrier for b-hydride elimination and reinsertion for branched polymer propagation . these energetics suggest that the Ni (II) - catalyzed reaction is expected to produce more linear than methyl-branched polymer , and that higher temperature increase and higher ethylene pressure decrease the branching . hydrogenolysis is an energetically favorable termination pathway , proceeding via coordination of a hydrogen molecule to the metal center , followed by H-H activation though a four - centered ' metathesis - like ' transition state and reductive elimination of alkane . A comparison with zirconocene - catalyzed ethylene polymerization show that the Ni(II)catalyzed polymerization should be slightly slower and should give more branching . the microstructures of polypropene produced with several zirconocene- based catalyst system are compared , to verify the possible correlation between the type of stereospecificity and the amount of regioirregularities . it is confirmed that , while syndiospecific and aspecific zirconocenes are highly regiospecific , isospecific system produce substantial amount of regioirregular monomeric unit . the amount of these secondary unit strongly depends on the nature of the p-ligands and on the type of the bridge connecting them . molecular mechanic calculation are reported , indicating that the intermediate which are energetically suitable for the secondary and primary insertion , for isospecific or syndiospecific complex , coordinate monomer enantiofaces of the opposite or the same chirality , respectively . this difference account for the lower regiospecificity of the isospecific catalytic complex , assuming that the energy barrier for the rotation of the coordinated monomer around the metal - olefin bond , between the orientation suitable for the primary and secondary insertion is lower than ( or comparable to ) the activation energy for secondary monomer insertion . the reaction of so called ' tuck-in ' permethyl zirconocene compound Cp*(e5-e1-C5Me4CH2)ZrX ( x = cl(1a) , C6H5 ( 1b ) , CH3 ( 1c ) ) with the highly electrophilic boranes BC12F10H and BC18F15 are described . the product are zwitterionic olefin polymerization catalyst . reaction with 1a and 1b yielded single product cleanly , but reaction with tuck-in methyl starting material 1c gave mixture . spectroscopic and structural study showed that the electrophilic zirconium center in the product zwitterions wa stabilized by a variety of mechanism . In the product of reaction between 1a and 1b with BC12F10H , Cp*[e5,e1-C5Me4CH2B(C6F5)2(m-H)]ZrX ( x = Cl ( 2a ) , <nUm> % ) , C6H5 ( 2b , <nUm> % ) ) , the metal is chelated by a pendant hydridoborate moiety . chloride product 2a wa characterized crystallographically . In the reaction of BC18F15 with 1a , the fluxional zwitterionic product Cp*[e5-C5Me4CH2B(C6F5)3]ZrCl ( 3a , <nUm> % ) is stabilized by a weak donor interaction between one of the ortho-fluorine atom of the -CH2B- C6F5 counteranion and the zirconium center ( Zr-F = <nUm> Å ) . In the product of the reaction between lb and BC18F15 , Cp*[e5-C5Me4CH2B(C6F5)3]ZrC6H5 ( 3b , <nUm> % ) , a similar ortho- fluorine interaction wa found in a yellow kinetic product ( y-3b ) , which converted upon heating gently to a thermodynamic orange polymorph ( o-3b ) in which the zirconium center is compensated via an agostic interaction from an ortho C-H bond of the phenyl group and an interaction between the methylene group of the -CH2B C6F5 counteranion . these compound were both characterized by x-ray crystallography . zwitterion o-3b reacts with H to form the zwitterionic hydride Cp*[e5-C5Me4CH2B(C6F5)3]ZrH ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) , characterized by NMR spectroscopy and x-ray crystallography to reveal a return to the ortho-fluorine mode of stabilization . compound 2a , 3a , o-3b , and <nUm> were all found to be active ethlyene polymerization catalyst ; the chloride derivative required minimal amount of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) to alkylate the zirconium center . polymerization data are discussed in light of the structural finding for the catalyst employed . the extrusion of methane from (2-phosphininyl)(methyl) zirconocenes 3a-c at <nUm> ° C in benzene affords the corresponding < eta > 2-phosphabenzyne-zirconocene dimer 4a-c , one of which ha been characterized by x-ray crystal structure analysis . the parameter of the C-C-Zr three - membered ring are exactly similar to those found in the < eta > 2-benzyne-zirconocene complex : C-C , <nUm> ; C-Zr , <nUm> and <nUm> Å . the P-Zr distance are normal at <nUm> and <nUm> Å . the reaction of these < eta > 2-phosphabenzyne complex with acetonitrile , Ph3P = S , (diphenylphosphino)- and (trimethylsilyl)alkynes , aldehyde , and (+)-camphor have been investigated . In all case , an insertion into the C2-Zr bond is observed . hydrolysis of the intermediate zirconacycles thus obtained yielded several new 2-functional phosphinines , including a thiol ( 6 ) , a vinylphosphine ( 8 ) , two secondary alcohol ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) , and an homochiral phosphinine - substituted alcohol ( 17 ) . the regiospecificity of the insertion is ascribed to the huge concentration of negative charge at the a-position of the phosphinine ring . the lewis acid tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane add to the (butadiene)group <nUm> metallocenes 1a-d ( metallocene = Cp2Zr , Cp2Hf , (MeCp)2Zr , (Me3CCp)2Zr ) to give the metallocene-(m-C4H6)-borate-betaine complex 2a-d . (Isoprene)zirconocene ( 1e ) and (2-phenylbutadiene)zirconocene ( if ) add the BC18F15 reagent regioselectively at the carbon atom C-4 to give the complex 2e and 2f , respectively . the complex <nUm> all show a pronounced M***F-C interaction with one of the six ortho-B(C6F5)3 fluorine atom . the resulting metallacyclic structure were characterized by x-ray diffraction of the complex 2c and 2e ( Zr***F ~ <nUm> Å , angle Zr-F-C ~ <nUm> ° ) . the bridging fluorine atom of the complex in solution is characterized by an extreme upfield shift of it 19F NMR resonance ( δ ~ <nUm> to <nUm> ppm ) relative to the signal of the remaining five o-F resonance of the BC18F15 moiety ( average δ ~ <nUm> ppm ) . the 19F NMR spectrum of the complex <nUm> are dynamic even in the noncoordinating solvent toluene-d8 . all six o-fluorine signal equilibrate with coalescence temperature around <nUm> K at <nUm> MHz to give a single resonance signal at high temperature . this fluorine equilibration process of the -B(C6F5)3 end of the metallocene-borate-betaine complex <nUm> is very likely to proceed via a rate determining cleavage of the coordinative M***F-C interaction . from the activation barrier of this process , obtained from the dynamic fluorine NMR spectrum , Zr***F bond dissociation energy of ca. <nUm> kcal / mol were estimated for the complex <nUm> . this magnitude of the M***F-C band dissociation energy make the internal fluorocarbon coordination a very suitable tool for protecting active electrophilic metal catalyst center . the Zr***F-C bond of the complex <nUm> is cleaved by the addition of the donor solvent THF with formation of acyclic 1,2-e2-allyl metallocene complex . none synthetic pathway to several salt of the anion [Cp*2ZrH3]- have been developed . reaction of Cp*2ZrH2 ( 3 ) prepared from [Cp*2Zr(N2)]2(m-N2) ( 2 ) , with KH in THF , afforded [Cp*2ZrH3]K ( 1 ) in a <nUm> % yield .
