In a similar manner , addition of HLi gave [Cp*2ZrH3]Li ( 4 ) . while this synthetic pathway provides reproducible route to land <nUm> , purification of <nUm> is problematic . another preparation involving the reaction of Cp*2ZrC12 with <nUm> equiv of n-BuLi under H affords 4.0.5(LiCI-THF) . alternatively , reaction of Cp*2ZrC12 with AlH4Li afforded the specie Cp*2ZrH(m2-H2AlH2) ( 5 ) in virtually quantitative yield . subsequent reaction of <nUm> with n-BuLl afforded the direct and high - yield conversion to <nUm> . deuteration and NMR study infer attack of BuLi occurs at the Al center exclusively prompting transfer of a hydride to Zr and liberation of the Zr trihydride anion . variable - temperature 1H NMR spectrum and H / d scrambling experiment for <nUm> and 4-d3 are consistent with the hydride exchango process mediated by ion pairing while T1 study infer a classical trihydride formulation is appropriate . crystallographic study of 4-0.5(LiCI*THF) , <nUm> , and <nUm> also affirm cation - anion pairing in <nUm> and 4.0.5(LiCl*THF) and hydride bridging between A1 and Zr in <nUm> . treatment of bis(phenylethynyl)silane ( PhC ≡ C ) <nUm> SiR <nUm> ( r = me ( 2a ) , et ( 2b ) or ph ( 2c ) ) with cp <nUm> ZrEt <nUm> ( 1 ) ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ) and H <nUm> O / ClCu in this order afforded (1E,3E)-1,4-diphenyl-1,3-butadiene ( 3 ) in 56-88 % yield after hydrolysis . on the other hand , hydrolysis of the reaction mixture of 2a-h with cp <nUm> ZrEt <nUm> gave silacyclobutene derivative 4a-h in 61-87 % yield . zirconium - containing intermediate <nUm> wa obtained a crystal suitable for X- ray analysis when t-BuC <nUm> H <nUm> wa used a the ligand of a zirconocene derivative . structure of <nUm> showed that the intermediate contained the zirconacyclobutene-silacyclobutene fused ring system . reaction of silacyclobutene 4a with ClCu selectively opened the silacyclobutene ring . the further treatment of the reaction mixture with phi in the presence of a catalytic amount of Pd(PPh <nUm> ) <nUm> gave 1,3,4-triphenyl-1-silyl-1,3-butadiene compound <nUm> . zirconacyclopentadienes with an alkynylsilyl group at the a- position afforded zirconacyclohexadiene derivative <nUm> in 82-98 % yield . when t-BuC <nUm> H <nUm> wa used a the ligand instead of two cp , the structure wa determined by x-ray analysis . the structure clearly showed that <nUm> had the zirconacyclohexadiene-silacyclobutene fused ring system . A new class of isospecific and highly regiospecific C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocenes , characterized by a bisindenyl ansa ligand with bulky substituents in the <nUm> position of indence and a single carbon bridge is disclosed : variation of the size of the substituent in C(3) ha a strong effect on the extent of chain transfer and isospecificity in propene polymerization . In fact , while rac-[Me2C(1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 produce low molecular weight and moderately isotactic polypropene ( iPP ) also containing some regioirregularities ( m(n) = <nUm> , mmmm ca. <nUm> % and 2,1(tot) = <nUm> % at <nUm> ° C in liquid monomer ) , rac-[Me2C(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 produce iPP with molecular weight between <nUm> ( t(p) = <nUm> ° C ) and <nUm> ( t(p) = <nUm> ° C ) and a fairly high isotacticity ( mmmm ca. <nUm> % at <nUm> ° C ) , with no detectable <nUm> unit . the influence of polymerization temperature on the catalyst performance ha been investigated by polymerizing liquid propene in the temperature range of 20-70 ° C : the experimental DDE value for enantioface selectivity have been estimated for two member of the new class ( rac-[Me2C(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 DDE(enant) = <nUm> kcal / mol ; rac-[Me2C(3-(trimethylsilyl)-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 DDE(enant) = <nUm> kcal / mol ) . for comparison , brintzinger 's moderately isospecific , benchmark catalyst rac-[ethylene(1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 ( DDE(enant) = <nUm> kcal / mol ) , the single carbon bridged , unsubstituted rac-[Me2C(1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 ( DDE(enant) = <nUm> kcal / mol ) , and the C2 - symmetric , practically aspecific , rac-[ethylene(3-methyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 ( DDE(enant) = <nUm> kcal / mol ) are also reported . the molecular structure of rac-[Me2C(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 and rac-[Me2C(3-(trimethylsilyl)-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 have been determined . the zirconocene - coupling of diynes with internal silicon substituents , MeC ≡ CMe2SiArSiMe2C ≡ CMe ( <nUm> : Ar = 1,4-C6H4 ; <nUm> : Ar = 1,3-C6H4 ; <nUm> : Ar = 1,3-C6H4 ; <nUm> : Ar = 4,4'-C6H4C6H4 ) , generates regiospecific polymer containing zirconacyclopentadiene in the main chain ( 5-7 ) . these organometallic polymer hydrolyze cleanly to butadienediyl polymer of the type [ Me2SiArSiMe2CH = CMeCMe = CH](n) ( 11-13 ) , and polymer <nUm> reacts with iodine to give the iodine - containing polymer [ 1,4-Me2SiC6H4SiMe2C(I) = CMeCMe = C(I)](n) ( 14 ) . the organometallic polymer undergo facile and high - yield degradation to macrocycles under mild condition ( refluxing tetrahydrofuran solution ) . the size and shape of the resulting macrocycles depend upon the nature of the diyne spacer group . thus , polymer <nUm> and <nUm> containing parallel diyne unit convert to the trimeric macrocycles [Me2SiArSiMe2C4Me2ZrCp2]3 ( <nUm> : Ar = 1,4-C6H4 ; <nUm> : Ar = 4,4'- C3H2 ) , while polymer <nUm> give the dimeric macrocycle [ 1,3- Me2SiC6H4SiMe2C4Me2ZrCp2]2 ( 18 ) . the dimeric macrocycle [Me2SiC6H4SiMe2C6H4SiMe2C4Me2ZrCp2]2 ( 20 ) wa obtained directly from the zirconocene coupling of Me2Si[(1,4-C6H4)- SiMe2(C ≡ CMe)]2 ( 4 ) by heating the reaction mixture to reflux . diene group in <nUm> . the high- yield formation of macrocycles apparently result from the reversible nature of the alkyne - coupling reaction , which allows for a low - energy pathway to the smallest macrocycle possessing minimal ring strain . none none bis(e-methylcyclopentadienyl)(e4-butadiene)zirconium add <nUm> equiv of the organometallic lewis acid BC18F15 to yield the metallocene- zirconium carbon bond of <nUm> to yield the mono olefin insertion product <nUm> . the gibbs activation energy of this chemical insertion reaction ( DG([?])(chem) = <nUm> ( 1-hexene ) , <nUm> ( that in the presence of these reactive 1-alkenes , the ( reversible ) magnetical exchange rate ( k(m(obs)) ) , a determined by the dynamic NMR experiment , is dependent on the rate of the competing ( A series of substituted poly(p-phenylenediyne)s ( 1a-f ) wa synthesized by the palladium - catalyzed cross-coupling condensation of terminal dialkynylalkanes with substituted diiodobenzenes . polymerization were conducted with 1,4-diiodo-5-hexoxy-2-methoxybenzene or 1,4-diiodo-5-hexyl-2- methylbenzene and with 1,6-hexadiyne , 1,7-heptadiyne , or 1,8-octadiyne . thus , six different poly(p-phenylenediyne)s ( 1a-f , [ ArC ≡ C(CH2)(n)C ≡ c](m) ; Ar = 5-hexoxy-2-methoxyphenylene or 5-hexyl-2-methylphenylene , and n = <nUm> , <nUm> , or <nUm> ) were obtained . intramolecular zirconocene coupling of 1a-f afforded zirconacyclopentadiene - containing polymer 2a-f . these metal - containing polymer were then cleanly hydrolyzed to the substituted poly(p-phenylene- dieneylene)s ( 3a-f , [ ArCH = C(CH2)(n)C = CH](m) ; Ar = 5-hexoxy-2- methoxyphenylene or 5-hexyl-2-methylphenylene , and n = <nUm> , <nUm> , or <nUm> ) . variation of the polymer structure allows for manipulation of the absorption and emission maximum over the range of 316-524 nm and 437-619 nm , respectively . the optical property of model compound 9a-f , ( ArCH = C(CH2)(n)C = ArCH ; Ar = phenyl or 2,5-dimethoxy-4-methylphenyl , and n = <nUm> , <nUm> , or <nUm> ) are very similar to those for polymer 3a-f . the structure of 9c ( Ar = 2,5-dimethoxy-4- methylphenyl , n = <nUm> ) and 9d ( Ar = phenyl , n = <nUm> ) were determined by single- crystal x-ray crystallography . molecule of 9c are almost completely planar , while molecule of 9d are twisted and have poor ap-orbital overlap . the conformation of the diene unit in polymer 3a-f and the model compound 9a-f are largely responsible for the observed variation in optical property . finer tuning of the optical property for poly(p-phenylenedienylene)s may be achieved via synthesis of copolymer from mixture of 1,6-heptadiyne and 1,7- octadiyne . the optical property of the resulting copolymer represent weighted average for the corresponding homopolymers . investigation of the photophysical property of polymer retaining some of the diyne unit suggest that defect play a major role in defining the emissive property of the poly(p-phenylenedienylene)s described here . (Alkenyl)zirconocene chloride Cp2Zr(Cl)(CH = CHR ) ( <nUm> , r = H , phenyl , n- butyl , or cyclohexyl ) react with ' Cp2Zr ' generated from various precursor to yield the neutral dinuclear alkenyl-bridged bis(metallocene) complex <nUm> [ Cp2Zr(m-Cl)(m-n1:n2-CH = CHR)ZrCp2 ] . the complex <nUm> are regioselectively protonated by treatment with (HNMe2Ph+)(BPh4-) ( 8a ) to yield the unusually structured product <nUm> [ Cp2Zr(m-Cl)(m-n1:n2- C1H2C2HR)ZrCp2+ ] , which exhibit an unsymmetrically bridged hydrocarbyl ligand containing a novel type of a hypercoordinated carbon center ( C1 ) inside the rigid organometallic framework . from the NMR analysis and an X- ray crystal structure determination of the example 10c [ (MeCp)2Zr(m- Cl)(m-C1H2C2Hn-butyl)Zr(MeCp)2 / + ] , it is evident that the hypercarbon atom C1 is coordinated to four close neighboring atom ( zr1 , zr2 , C2 , and h(1a) ) in a distorted square - planar arrangement with the remaining C1-H(1b) bond being oriented perpendicular to it . h(1b) thus mark the apex of a distorted square pyramid ; the hypercarbon atom C1 is located in the center of the basal plane . this unusual structural coordination geometry around C1 is determined by the stereoelectronic feature of the two adjacent group <nUm> bent metallocene unit . from the dynamic feature of complex 9a ( r = H ) , a stabilization energy of ca. <nUm> kcal mol-1 is estimated for the uncommon coordination mode of C1 , which is favored here , relative to a ' normal ' sp3- hybridized structure in a c(2v)-symmetric metallacyclic framework . part of the pronounced thermodynamic stabilization of this unusual pentacoordinate carbon geometry originates from the strong a-agostic Zr***H(la)-C1 interaction in the basal plane . from the monodeuterated derivative 9a-C1HD , an energy difference of <nUm> cal mol-1 between d and H favoring the bridging position wa determined . none A new method for the directed meta acylation of aromatic compound is described . this method involves an ortho lithiation procedure combined with zirconocene-benzyne chemistry . 3-Acyl-1 - substituted benzene derivative were obtained by acidic hydrolysis of the azazirconacycle intermediate which result from the coupling of a nitrile with a zirconocene-benzyne complex . similarly , 3-acyl-2-iodo-1 - substituted benzene derivative were obtained by the iodination of the same intermediate followed by acidic hydrolysis . these procedure , which utilize simple , readily available starting material , give good yield of regiochemically pure product . absolute metal - ligand σ bond enthalpy have been determined for a series of titanocene , zirconocene , and hafnocene halide and dimethyls by iodinolytic titration calorimetry . absolute metal - iodine bond disruption enthalpy were measured by iodination of the monomeric trivalent group <nUm> metallocenes Cp(tt)2TiI , (Me5C5)2TiI , Cp(tt)2ZrI , and Cp(tt)2HfI ( cp(tt) = e5-1,3-di-tert-butylcyclopentadienyl ) . iodinolysis of Cp(tt)2ZrMe2 and Cp(tt)2HfMe2 in turn yield absolute Zr-Me and Hf-Me bond enthalpy . derived value ( kcal / mol ) are D[Cp(tt)2Ti(I)-I] = <nUm> ; D[(Me5C5)2Ti(I)-I] = <nUm> ; D[Cp(tt)2Zr(I)-I] = <nUm> ; D[Cp(tt)2Hf(I)-I] = <nUm> ; D[Cp(tt)2Zr-Me2] = <nUm> ; and D[Cp(tt)2Hf- me2 ] = <nUm> . that D[Cp(tt)2Zr(I)-(I)] ≃ D(I3Zr-I) and D[(Me5C5)2Ti(I)-I] ≃ D(I3Ti-I) , while D[Cp(tt)2Ti(I)-I] ≃ D(I3Ti-I) - <nUm> kcal / mol , argues for more reliable transferability of D(M(IV)-I) in sterically le congested metallocenes . the molecular structure of Cp2(tt)ZrI2 , Cp2(tt)ZrI , and Cp2(tt)HfI were determined by x-ray diffraction . In Cp(tt)2ZrI2 , the Zr ligation is pseudotetrahedral , and the ring tert-butyl group ' straddle ' the Zr-I bond to minimize steric interaction . the geometry about Zr in Cp(tt)2ZrI is pseudotrigonal , with contracted Zr - ring centroid and Zr-I distance versus Cp(tt)2grI2 , primarily reflecting substantially diminished ligand - ligand repulsive nonbonded interaction in the latter . Cp(tt)2HfI is isomorphous with Cp(tt)2ZrI , and the slightly different metrical parameter are in accord with Hf v Zr ionic radius . the significant difference in interligand repulsive interaction in the trivalent versus tetravalent complex are confirmed by van der waals calculation . high - resolution UV PE spectrum combined with ab initio relativistic effective core potential calculation provide detail of electronic structure . absolute ionization energy value indicate that iodine behaves a both a strong σ and π donor . trend in the large Cp2MX(n) structural database can be understood in term of the interplay between electronic and molecular structure factor , which are highly sensitive to the substitution pattern of the cyclopentadienyl ligand and , in particular , to competing σ v π M-X bonding . bis(2-arylindenyl)zirconium dichloride activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) produce elastomeric polypropylene . the elastic property of this material are proposed to arise from a stereoblock microstructure . the silyl bridged catalyst rac- and meso-dimethylsilyl(bis(2-phenylindenyl))zirconium dichloride were prepared and used to model the polymerization behavior of the unbridged catalyst . the meso isomer is approximately twice a productive a the rac isomer in propylene polymerization . additionally , blend of isotactic and atactic polypropylene were prepared by using varying amount of the rac and meso isomer until the IR and NMR characteristic matched polypropylene produced from bis(2-phenylindenyl)zirconium dichloride . these study suggest ( 1 ) that the rac isomer is favored in the isomerization equilibrium for the unbridged catalyst and ( 2 ) that the larger fraction of atactic polymer in the elastomeric polypropylene is a consequence of the higher rate of polymerization for the meso isomer . double [ SiMe <nUm> ] - bridged metallocenes ( 1,2-SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> { η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -4- r}{e <nUm> -C <nUm> H-3,5-(CHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> }ZrCl <nUm> ( r = H ( 1a ) , CHMe <nUm> ( 1b ) , SiMe <nUm> ( 1c ) , CHMe(CMe <nUm> ) ( 1d ) , (+)-menthyl ( 1e ) ) , when activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , catalyze propylene polymerization with high activity . the preparation and x-ray structure of the dilithio salt of an enantiopure , double silylene-bridged bis(cyclopentadienyl) ligand , Li <nUm> [ ( 1,2-Me <nUm> Si ) <nUm> - { C <nUm> H <nUm> -4-(1R,2S,5R-menthyl)}{(C <nUm> H-3,5-(CHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> )}]*3THF , a well a the corresponding zirconocene dichloride , [ ( 1,2-Me <nUm> Si ) <nUm> { η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> H <nUm> -4- (1R,2S,5R-menthyl)}{e <nUm> -C <nUm> H-3,5-(CHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> }]ZrCl <nUm> ( 1e ) , are reported . the C ( s ) - symmetric system 1a-c are highly regiospecific and syndiospecific ( > <nUm> % ) in neat propylene . At lower propylene concentration , polymer with lower molecular weight and tacticity ( mostly m - type steroerrors ) are obtained . the microstructures of polymer produced under differing reaction condition are consistent with stereocontrol dominated by a site epimerization process , an inversion of configuration at zirconium resulting from the polymer chain swinging from one side of the metallocene wedge to the other without monomer insertion . the relative importance of chain epimerization ( at the β carbon ) ha been established by parallel polymerization of 2,d <nUm> -propylene and d <nUm> -propylene with 1b / MAO at low propylene concentration . the C <nUm> -symmetric system 1d,e / MAO display an unusual dependence of sterospecificity on propylene concentration , switching from isospecific to syndiospecific with increasing propylene pressure , consistent with a competitive unimolecular site epimerization process and a bimolecular chain propagation . the microstructures of the polypropylene produced by 1d / MAO and 1e / MAO with [r] ≃ <nUm> % resemble the hemiisotactic microstructure produced by me <nUm> c(e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -3-Me)(e <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> )ZrCl <nUm> ( 2b ) / MAO . contrastingly , the hemiisotactic polypropylene microstructure obtained with 2b / MAO is found to be maintained at all propylene concentration examined . the new C1 - symmetric complex rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(2- methylbenz[e]-1-e5-indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride ( 14a ) , rac-[1-(9- e5-fluorenyl)-2-(4,5-cyclohexa-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride ( 14b ) , and rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl- 1-e5-indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride ( 15 ) were prepared in up to <nUm> % yield . these compound , activated with methyl aluminoxane , exhibit high active propene polymerization rate which remain constant over hour , even at elevated polymerization temperature of <nUm> and <nUm> ° C . the two different coordination site of these ' dual - side ' catalyst lead to isotactic polypropene with variable amount of stereoerrors , depending on the monomer concentration . the 2-methyl substituent of the indenyl ligand result , at the same time , in significantly increased molecular weight of the polymer product ( up to <nUm> x <nUm> g mol-1 ) , the bulk property of which can be adjusted from flexible , semicrystalline thermoplastic to excellent thermoplastic elastic . enantiopure biphenyl-bridged titanocene and zirconocene complex were obtained , by an asymmetric thermal transformation of the binaphthol complex formed from the metallocene racemates and subsequent transformation to the corresponding dichloride , in practically quantitative yield . increased rate of this transformation in the presence of O gas or TEMPO indicate a radical reaction mechanism . the biphenyl-bridged titanocene enantiomer give rise to an efficient asymmetric catalysis for the hydrogenation of cyclic and noncyclic imines . phosphinozirconocene complex react with isocyanides to give unprecedented bi- or tricyclic b-phosphino imines through three successive and controlled step . spectroscopic and chemical evidence for the formation of the first neutral e1-imine zirconocene complex in the reductive elimination reaction sequence is presented . none none isotopically labeled alkyl zirconocene complex of the form ( CpR n ) <nUm> Zr(CH <nUm> CDR' <nUm> )(X) ( CpR n = alkyl-substituted cyclopentadienyl ; R' = H , alkyl group ; x = H , d , me ) undergo isomerization of the alkyl ligand a well a exchange with free olefin in solution under ambient condition . increasing the substitution on the cp ring result in slower isomerization reaction , but these steric effect are small . In contrast , changing x ha a very large effect on the rate of isomerization . pure s-bonding ligand such a methyl and hydride promote rapid isomerization , whereas p-donor ligand inhibit b-H elimination and hence alkyl isomerization . for ( e-C <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> Zr(R)(Cl) , internal alkyl complex have been observed for the first time . the rate of isomerization depends on the length of the alkyl group : longer alkyl chain ( heptyl , hexyl ) isomerize faster than shorter chain ( butyl ) . the transient intermediate specie have been identified by a combination of isotopic labeling and <nUm> H , <nUm> H , and <nUm> C NMR experiment . the solid - state structure of the zirconocene cyclopentyl chloride complex , cp <nUm> Zr(cyclo-C <nUm> H <nUm> )(Cl) , ha been determined by x-ray diffraction . none by kinetically stabilizing imidozirconocene complex through the use of a sterically demanding ligand , or by generating a more thermodynamically stable resting state with addition of diphenylacetylene , we have developed transition metal - catalyzed imine metathesis reaction that are mechanistically analogous to olefin metathesis reaction catalyzed by metal carbene complex . when <nUm> mol % of Cp*Cp(THF)Zr = N'Bu is used a the catalyst precursor in the metathesis reaction between PhCH = NPh and p-TolCH = N-p-Tol , a <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> equilibrium mixture with the two mixed imines p-TolCH = NPh and PhCH = N-p-Tol is generated in C6D6 at <nUm> ° C . the catalyst wa still active after <nUm> day with an estimated <nUm> turnover ( t(1 / <nUm> ) <nUm> m ; TON = <nUm> h-1 ) . when the azametallacyclobutene Cp2Zr(N(Tol)C(Ph) = C(Ph) ) is used a the catalyst precursor under similar reaction condition , a total of <nUm> turnover are obtained after <nUm> day ( t(1 / <nUm> ) <nUm> m ; TON = <nUm> h-1 ) . an extensive kinetic and equilibrium analysis of the metallacyclobutene- catalyzed metathesis of PhCH = N-p-Tol and p-F-C6H4CH = N-p-F-C6H4 wa carded out by monitoring the concentration of imines and observable metal- containing intermediate over time . numerical integration method were used to fit these data to a detailed mechanism involving coordinatively unsaturated ( 16-electron ) imido complex a critical intermediate . examination of the scope of reaction between different organic imines revealed characteristic selectivity that appears to be unique to the zirconium - mediated system . several zirconocene complex that could generate the catalytically active ' CpCp'Zr = ArN ' ( cp ' = cp or cp* ) specie in situ were found to be effective agent in the metathetical exchange between different n-aryl imines . N-Alkyl aldimines were found to be completely unreactive toward metathesis with n-aryl aldimines , and metathesis reaction involving the two n-alkyl imines TolCH = NPr and PhCH = NMe gave slow or erratic result , depending on the catalyst used . metathesis wa observed between n-aryl ketimines and n-aryl aldimines , but for n-aryl ketimine substrate , the catalyst resting state consists of zirconocene enamido complex , generated by the formal C-H activation of the α position of the ketimine substrate . none none we report the joint application of ab initio computation and total synthesis to assign the absolute configuration of a new natural product . the expected specific rotation of the (7S,10R)- and (7R,10R)-isomers of pitiamide A in a CCl3H solvent continuum model were determined a + <nUm> and - <nUm> , respectively , by CADPAC calculation of the electric-dipole-magnetic- dipole polarizability tensor . total synthesis of these two stereoisomers of the marine metabolite were achieved by a convergent strategy that utilized evans ' oxazolidinone alkylation , a novel water - accelerated modification of negishi 's zirconocene - catalyzed asymmetric carbometalation a well a an unusual segment condensation via mitsunobu alkylation of a nosyl-activated amide . the experimental optical rotation measurement confirmed the result of the computational optical rotation prediction . on the basis of NMR comparison , the configuration of pitiamide A wa assigned a ( 7R,10R ) . these study highlight the considerable structural significance of [a](D) data , but , because the optical rotation of the natural product wa different from either synthetic diastereomer , our work serf also a an illustration of potential problem with obtaining accurate experimental [a](D) data for natural sample . rapid hydrozirconation of alkene by zirconocene hydrochloride , followed by addition of <nUm> equiv of enone and catalytic amount of Cu (I) salt , led to the corresponding 1,4-addition product in moderate to high yield and provided the first protocol for in situ preparation of alkyl cuprates from alkene . the spirocyclic 1,2,7,7a-tetrahydrocycloprop-[1,2-c]indol-4-one subunit of CC - <nUm> and duocarmycin A , which comprises the common pharmacophore of the two antibiotic , ha been efficiently synthesized in six step from readily available starting material . the key step of the synthesis utilizes a zirconocene - stabilized benzyne complex . none (Butadiene)zirconocene ( 4 ) wa reacted with <nUm> mol equiv of pivalonitrile to give the nine - membered metallacyclic product <nUm> . 1,4-Selective coupling of butadiene with the two nitrile functionality wa achieved at the zirconocene template . subsequent hydrolytic cleavage ( H2O / THF ) gave (3Z,5E,7Z)-3,8-diamino-2,2,9,9-tetramethyldeca-3,5,7-triene ( 13 ) . the stable conjugated primary enamine <nUm> wa isolated in <nUm> % yield . it wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . compound <nUm> crystallizes in space group pbca with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . analogously , coupling of two 4-methylbenzonitrile molecule with butadiene at the zirconocene template followed by hydrolysis yielded l,6-diamino-1,6-di-p-tolyl-1,3,5-hexatriene ( 6b ) . compound 6b crystallizes in space group P21 / a with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . both primary enamine contain planar conjugated polyene framework with alternating carbon-carbon double and single bond . the geometry at the sp2-CNH2 group of the stable conjugated primary enamine 6b and <nUm> are very similar a observed in aromatic amine . it wa shown by ab initio calculation of suitable model system on the MP2 / <nUm> – 31+G* / / <nUm> – 31+G* level that the conjugated tail - to - tail connection of two CH-C(NH2)H primary enamine moiety result in an unfavorable repulsive electron interaction which may become effectively compensated when the conjugated system separating the H2N substituents is sufficiently extended a is the case in the framework found in <nUm> or <nUm> . therefore , some development of the chemistry of stable , isolable primary enamine may be based on suitably substituted 1,6-diamino-1,3,5-hexatriene system which will be easily available by our novel template synthesis . (+-)-N2-(Benzenesulfonyl)-CPI ( 16 ) , the protected a-unit of CC - <nUm> , wa synthesized in <nUm> step from <nUm> with an overall yield of <nUm> % . the two pyrrole moiety in <nUm> were obtained by a zirconocene and a Pd (0)-initiated cyclization . it should be stressed that in the first cyclization a iodinated benzene moiety 7a is obtained with the iodine at the correct position a needed for the following heck reaction . also , the nitrogen at C-5 wa introduced completely regioselectively . thus , the described synthesis represents an excellent entry to the racemic CPI unit . however , also the enantiopure CPI unit may be synthesized by this route , since boger et al.8 have shown that <nUm> can be resolved after cleavage of the n-benzenesulfonyl group and formation of a BOC amide . none none Bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium(IV) complex , Cp2ZrH2(1) and Cp2Zr(0-i-Pr)2(4) , in the presence of an appropriate hydrogen acceptor such a benzaldehyde or cyclohexanone catalyze the oppenauer - type oxidation of allylic alcohol to a,b-unsaturated carbonyl compound . for instance , primary allylic terpenoid alcohol , geraniol and nerol , were oxidized to a- and 0-citrals , which are essential compound in the perfumery industry , in substantial yield without any treatment . similarly , secondary allylic alcohol such a 3-hexen-2-ol and 2-cyclohexen-l-ol were also oxidized with ease to give 3-hexen-2-one and 2-cyclohexen-l-one in <nUm> % and <nUm> % yield , respectively . but the present OPP - type oxidation by zirconocene complex is ineffective for propargylic alcohol . group IVA metallocene complex such a bis(n5-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dihydrides , Cp2ZrH2 ( 1 ) , and hafnium dihydrides , Cp2HfH2 ( 8 ) , catalyze the chemoselective reduction of polycarbonyl compound to hydroxy carbonyl compound . for instance , the reduction of keto aldehyde 3-ketobutanal ( <nUm> g ) and 2-phenyl-2-ketoethanal ( <nUm> h ) proceeded selectively at aldehyde group to provide the corresponding hydroxy ketone <nUm> g and <nUm> h in <nUm> % and <nUm> % yield , respectively . under similar condition , however , cyclohexanediones were easily aromatized to benzenediols . on the other hand , <nUm> and <nUm> also catalyze the selective 1,2-reduction of various type of a,b-unsaturated carbonyl compound , giving the corresponding allylic alcohol in good to excellent yield . thus , steroidal dicarbonyl compound , having an enone framework in their molecule d4-androstene-3,17-dione ( 11a ) and d4-progestene-3,20-dione ( 11b ) were reduced by <nUm> to 17-hydroxy-D4-androsten-3-one ( 12a ) and 20-hydroxy-D4-progest-3-one ( 12b ) , which are essential human hormone , in <nUm> % and <nUm> % yield , respectively . 2,6-Dialkylphenols , which are difficult to prepare by conventional method , have been conveniently synthesized in one step via zirconocene - catalyzed crossaromatization of cyclohexanones with aldehyde . A one - pot method for the transformation of an aryl bromide , an internal alkyne , and sulfur dichloride into a polysubstituted benzothiophene , in high yield , is described . the method involves the generation and trapping of a zirconocene complex of a substituted benzyne . the reaction of Cp2Zr(CH <nUm> CH2R <nUm> )2 with a monosubstituted terminal alkene ( H <nUm> C = CHR <nUm> ) can produce , in a highly regio- and diastereoselective manner , zirconacyclopentane derivative ; the trans-3,4-disubstituted derivative may be formed to the extent of > <nUm> % in case where both r <nUm> and r <nUm> are alkyl , while the trans-2-aryl-4-alkyl derivative may be formed to the extent of > <nUm> % in the coupling between a monoalkyl-substituted olefin and styrene or it derivative . chiral tricyclic lactam ( 5 ) wa sequentionally metalated ( LDA or LDA / zirconocene halide ) and alkylated to give quaternary alkylation product ( 8 ) in 6-54 : <nUm> diastereomeric ratio . reduction and hydrolysis furnish the title compound in three step with > <nUm> % enantiomeric purity . under the influence of zirconocene complex , Cp2ZrH2(1) or Cp2Zr(0-i-Pr)2(9) , cycloalkanones <nUm> condensed directly with aliphatic aldehyde <nUm> or primary alcohol <nUm> to form 2-alkylidenecycloalkanones <nUm> or 2-alkyl-2-cycloalken-l-ones <nUm> , respectively , in fair to substantial yield . the selectivity of the cross-condensations wa slightly improved by using <nUm> in combination with a metal salt such a Cl2Ni . dihydrojasmone ( 13 ) wa synthesized in <nUm> % yield by one - step reaction from the commercially available 3-methylcyclopentanone ( 2e ) with pentanol ( 7b ) in the presence of <nUm> and Cl2Ni . none none two one - pot multicomponent synthetic method for highly substituted indene are described . the intermolecular coupling of aromatic ketone with alkyne on low - valent zirconocene specie generates oxazirconacyclopentenes , which upon hydrolysis with <nUm> % ClH for <nUm> h afforded indene derivative in good to excellent yield . similarly , the pair - selective coupling of two identical or different alkyne bearing at least one aromatic substituent formed zirconacyclopentadienes . quenching of the reaction mixture with concentrated H2O4S also result in the formation of highly substituted indene in high yield . three different component involving alkyne , ethylene , and aldehyde were selectively integrated in a one - pot procedure to afford homoallyl ketone in good yield , via an effective combination of zirconocene - mediated C-C bond forming reaction and lewis acid mediated organic transformation . mechanistic study revealed that a formal oppenauer oxidation of seven - membered oxazirconacycles , generated in situ from the reaction of zirconacyclopentenes and aldehyde , wa promoted by lewis acid-aldehyde adduct . As a whole , the first aldehyde wa incorporated into the product and the second aldehyde wa reduced to an alcohol . multiply deuterated homoallyl ketone could be readily prepared in high yield with more than <nUm> % deuterium incorporation by using this method . ( chemical equation presented ) o-Alkenyl or alkynyl benzylzirconocene intermediate , which wa readily generated by the reaction of 2-alkoxymethyl-styrene or 2-alkoxymethyl-1-(trimethylsilylethynyl)-benzene derivative with zirconocene - butene complex ( negishi reagent , " cp 2Zr " ) , reacted with allyl or propargyl halide in the presence of a catalytic amount of ClCu to give allylation or allenylation product . conversion to dane 's diene , which is a key intermediate for estrone synthesis , wa efficiently carried out by enyne olefin metathesis of the allylation product . ( chemical equation presented ) In the presence of CCuN , reaction of g,g-dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie <nUm> , generated in situ by treating triethyl orthoacrylate with zirconocene - butene complex , with allylic and propargylic phosphate proceeded at the a-position of <nUm> in a highly SN2' - selective manner to give the corresponding 5-alkenoates and 4,5-alkadienoates , respectively . In the present Cu (I) - mediated coupling reaction , the g,g-dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie <nUm> serf a a synthetically useful homoenolate anion equivalent of propionate . the combination of zirconocene - mediated coupling of silylated alkyne with a protonation - desilylation or bromination - desilylation process afforded otherwise unavailable butadiene derivative . when (E,E)-2,3-dialkyl-1,4- bis(trimethylsilyl)-1,3-butadienes were treated with <nUm> equiv of br2 in CCl2H2 , (E)-2,3-dialkyl-1,1,4,4-tetrabromo-2-butenes were obtained in excellent yield with perfect stereoselectivity . the reaction of ene - imine with cp <nUm> ZrBu <nUm> wa carried out . when a crude imine , which wa prepared from ene - aldehyde and primary amine in the presence of MgOS <nUm> , wa treated with cp <nUm> ZrBu <nUm> at room temperature overnight , cyclopentane derivative having trans-substituents wa obtained in high yield along with a small amount of cyclopentane derivative having cis-substituents . presumably , cis-zirconacycle is a thermodynamic product . reaction using various ene - imines were carried out . In the case of ene - imine prepared from ene - aldehyde and t BuNH <nUm> , only cyclopentane having cis-substituents wa produced . In this reaction , chiral amine wa used , and diastereoselective cyclization of ene - imine wa carried out . As a result , cyclopentane derivative having cis-substituents wa obtained in an optically active form after hydrogenolysis of the cyclized compound . A novel method for preparation of allylic zirconium reagent directly from 1-alkenes via zirconoceneolefin complex ha been developed . selective transfer of the hydride of zirconocene allyl hydride complex , a tautomer of zirconocene - olefin complex , to diisopropyl ketone generates the corresponding zirconocene alkoxide allyl . the allylic zirconium reagent formed effect stereoselective allylation of aldehyde at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> ° C to provide syn- and anti-homoallyl alcohol , respectively . the anti-isomer is formed via a six - membered chair transition state under kinetic control . the syn-selectivity can be rationalized by considering isomerization of the anti-adduct by a retroallylation process . reaction of o-(alkoxymethyl)styrene derivative with a stoichiometric amount of zirconocenebutene complex ( zirconocene equivalent , " cp 2Zr " ) brought about an insertion of the zirconocene specie into a benzylic carbon-oxygen bond . the oxidative insertion of Cp2Zr to the benzylic carbon-oxygen bond is a result of sequential reaction : ( i ) formation of zirconacyclopropane by the ligand exchange with o-(alkoxymethyl)styrene , ( ii ) elimination of the alkoxy group through an aromatic conjugate system giving metalated o-quinodimethane specie , and ( iii ) transfer of zirconium metal to the benzylic position . through use of a catalytic amount of " Cp2Zr " , however , unprecedented homo-coupling reaction ( dimerization ) of o-(alkoxymethyl)styrene derivative occurred to give a tetracyclic compound . on the other hand , reaction of o-(1-alkoxyisopropyl) styrene derivative gave rise to the analogous tetracyclic compound regardless of the amount of " Cp2Zr " ( stoichiometric or catalytic ) . heterocoupling product between o-(1-alkoxyisopropyl)styrene and styrene congener wa obtained in high ci stereo- and regioselectivity by treating o-(1-alkoxyisopropyl)styrene derivative with " Cp2Zr " in the presence of an excess amount of styrene derivative . D-Arabinose and d-glucose are transformed into the identical vinyl furanoside , whose role is to serve a the precursor to enantiopure cyclooctadienone <nUm> . the key step of this relay involve a zirconocene - promoted ring contraction and [3,3] sigmatropic rearrangement of an enynol . subsequently defined are convenient synthetic route to several cyclooctane-1,2,3-triols , 1,2,3,4,5-pentaols , and structurally related glycomimetics . multi-substituted pentacenes , such a 1,2,3,4,6,8,9,10,11,13- decasubstituted pentacenes ( type I ) , 1,2,3,4,6,-13-hexasubstituted pentacenes ( type II ) , 1,2,3,4-tetrasubstituted pentacenes ( type III ) , and 2,3-disubstituted pentacenes ( type IV ) , 1,2,3,4,6,11-hexasubstituted naphthacenes ( type V ) , 1,2,3,4-tetrasubstituted naphthacenes ( type VI ) , and 2,3-disubstituted naphthacenes ( type VII ) , were prepared by a homologation method . the homologation method involved the conversion of phthalic acid ester derivative to two ring extended phthalic acid ester derivative via diynes and metallacyclopentadienes using transition metal , such a Zr and Rh . for the formation of pentacenes of type III and type IV and naphthacenes of type VII , trimethylsilyl-substituted diynes were used for zirconocene - mediated cyclization . elimination of the trimethylsilyl group after the cyclization afforded nonsubstituted position on pentacenes or naphthacenes . structure of 1,4,6,8,9,10,11,13-octaethyl-2,3-bis(methoxycarbonyl)pentacene ( 9a ) and 8,9,10,11-tetraethyl-2,3-bis(methoxycarbonyl)-1,4,6,13-tetrapropylpentacene ( 9b ) were determined by x-ray analysis . the structure of 9a had the herringbone packing system in the crystal like nonsubstituted pentacene . however , 9b , whose substituents at 1,4,6,13-positions were changed from et to Pr at 1,4,6,13-positions of 9a , had the face parallel plane system in the crystal . we report herein the total synthesis of the corynanthe alkaloid dihydrocorynantheol and the formal synthesis of the indole alkaloid tacamonine , rhynchophylline , and hirsutine . the strategy for assembling the corynanthe and tacaman skeletal framework comprised of both the classical ABD → ABCD and ABC → ABCD approach wherein the variously substituted piperidinone d-rings were formed via ring - closing metathesis ( RCM ) followed by a 1,4-addition to introduce the requisite side chain at C(15) . since 1,4-additions to a,b-unsaturated lactams represent an underdeveloped field , we conducted a series of study with two unsaturated lactams employing organocuprates and metal enolates a the nucleophiles . these study revealed that organocuprates derived from grignard reagent and either stoichiometric amount of CCuN or catalytic amount of CuBr*DMS complex are excellent nucleophiles for such addition ; TMSC1 wa a crucial additive for optimizing these reaction . the anion derived from ethyl 1,3-dithiolane-2-carboxylate wa also an excellent nucleophile in these 1,4-additions , although the stereochemistry of such 1,4-additions to carboline - derived , unsaturated lactams wa sensitive to substitution on the indole nitrogen atom . the ABD → ABCD approach to these alkaloid featured a novel one - pot sequence of an RCM reaction and a zirconocene - catalyzed carbomagnesation followed by a second RCM to generate the d - ring . ( chemical equation presented ) alkenylphosphines with various substituents were prepared by the reaction of an alkenylzirconocene with a chlorophosphine . reaction of ( a-unsubstituted alkenyl)zirconocenes with ph <nUm> ClP or PhPCl <nUm> gave the corresponding alkenylphosphines in good yield . on the other hand , direct reaction of ( a-unsubstituted alkenyl)zirconocenes with i Pr <nUm> ClP did not proceed . analogously , ( a-substituted alkenyl)zirconocenes did not react with chlorophosphines directly . however , these reaction proceeded in the presence of ClCu affording the corresponding alkenylphosphines a ClCu complex . treatment of the copper complex with Na <nUm> ( dtc ) ( dtc = N,N-diethyldithiocarbamate ) or Na <nUm> ( edta ) liberated free alkenylphosphines from the copper center . the overall protocol could be applicable to preparation of a variety of alkenylphosphines from alkyne via alkenylzirconocene specie . ( figure presented ) A synthetic approach to synthesize EDOT and EDOS from a common precursor <nUm> is reported . the method involves zirconocene dichloride mediated reaction of a common diyne <nUm> followed by treatment with disulfur dichloride ( ClS ) and in situ prepared selenium dichloride ( Cl2Se ) . the higher lability of a-trimethylsilyl group in EDOS compared to EDOT is explained using DFT calculation . large , soluble polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon ( PAHs ) have been synthesized using Zr - mediated and stille - type biphenylation reaction . both the Zr and stille methodology have been adopted to incorporate tert-butyl substituents , permitting the direct synthesis of alkylated PAHs that are much more soluble than their unsubstituted analogue . to demonstrate the utility of these method and the importance of solubilizing functionality , several large PAHs were synthesized and crystallographically characterized . the scope of the Zr - mediated and stille methodology is shown to be complementary . the stille methodology often give higher yield but is ineffective for the introduction of strain and failed with some polybrominated arenes . In these difficult case , the zirconium methodology is effective , albeit in low yield . ( chemical equation presented ) an enantiodivergent strategy for the total chemical synthesis of both naturally occurring (+)-fomannosin ( 1 ) and it (-)-antipode ( ent-1 ) from a-D-glucose ha been developed and successfully implemented . the key step in the overall pathway include the following : ( i ) application of the zirconocene - mediated ring contraction of vinyl furanosides for the construction of highly substituted cyclobutanols ; ( ii ) the use of ring - closing metathesis to form the pendant five - membered ring ; ( iii ) making recourse to a monothio malonic ester to allow for chemoselective reduction to sensitive lactone intermediate <nUm> ; ( iv ) hydroxyl-directed dihydroxylation with O4Os to generate <nUm> ; and ( v ) sequential elimination via a cyclic sulfite and a cyclobutyl triflate . the bridge between the enantiomeric series consisted of a six - step linkup involving the structural modification of <nUm> so a to generate ent-30b . optical activity wa fully preserved throughout . ( chemical equation presented ) A new and diastereoselective method for the synthesis of the estrone skeleton from a substituted styrene based on sequential 3-fold use of Cp2ZrBu2 ( oxidative addition - alkylation and two cyclization - alkylation sequence ) and a ruthenium complex catalyzed RC - metathesis of a sterically hindered diene wa developed . the prepared estratetraene wa obtained in <nUm> step from a commercially available starting material and thus the overall synthesis of estrone could be accomplished in <nUm> step . moreover , we have also found that the course of the reaction of substrate bearing the 2-halo-1,7-diene moiety with Cp2ZrBu <nUm> , i.e. , cyclization or oxidative addition to the C-X bond , could be controlled by the nature of the halogen leaving group . none reaction of vinylcyclopropane derivative with a zirconocene-1-butene complex ( " Cp2Zr " ) caused regioselective cleavage of the cyclopropyl bond to give e3 p-allylic and / or e1 s-allylic complex . the regioselectivity of the bond cleavage and the formation of a e3 p-allylic or e1 s-allylic complex depend on the bulkiness of the substituents on the cyclopropyl group and the presence of leaving functionality . A catalytic use of " Cp2Zr " in the presence of excess grignard reagent also caused a ring opening of the vinylcyclopropane derivative with the same sense of regiochemical selectivity . the reaction of the thermally equilibrated " Cp2Zr " -propenylcyclopropane complex with acetone indicated the possibility for the synthesis of the steroidal side chain in either natural or unnatural form . the synthetic utility of the present mCp2Zr " -vinylcyclopropane chemistry wa ascertained by the stereocontrolled preparation of the C-20 , C-24 dimethylated steroidal side chain which is identical to the active metabolite of vitamin D2 . imine complex of zirconocene , generated by a b-hydrogen abstraction process , which posse a carbon-carbon multiple bond , undergo inter- or intramolecular carbometalation to afford 1,4-cyclohexanediamine or cycloalkylaniline derivative depending on the relative position of the unsaturated moiety with respect to the imine complex . A new diastereoselective synthesis of azetidines ha been developed by treatment of azazirconacyclopentanes with iodine . the aldol condensation of a- and b-(benzyloxy) aldehyde with enol silanes , catalyzed by Cp2Zr(OTf)2THF or Cp2Zr(OTf)2 , in a variety of solvent were studied . the simple diastereoselectivity of these reaction is modest and comparable to that observed using simple aldehyde of similar steric requirement . study have revealed that TMSOTf is directly produced on reaction with the zirconocene catalyst with the enol silane in nitroalkane solvent or is formed during catalysis in dichloromethane solution . although TMSOTf is known to catalyze cross-aldol reaction under these condition , the rate of this process is not always competitive with that observed using the zirconocene catalyst . In particular , sterically unhindered or aromatic aldehyde react via a mechanism that appears to be mainly Zr - catalyzed , based on both the difference in rate between zr- and Si - mediated reaction a well a difference in enol silane / silyl triflate reactivity in crossover - type experiment . with sterically hindered aldehyde in dichloromethane or nitromethane , catalysis is mediated by Si . the Zr - catalyzed process occurs via formation of a Zr - aldolate complex from aldehyde and enol silane , with liberation of TMSOTf , followed by rate - limiting o-silylation of the metal aldolate by TMSOTf , a revealed by both model study and in situ monitoring during catalysis . zirconocene - coupling reaction of 6,6'-bis[(trimethylsilyl)ethynyl]-2,2'-bipyridine and 5,5'-bis[(trimethylsilyl)ethynyl]-2,2'-bipyridine give trimeric , zirconocene - containing macrocycles ( <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) in high yield . molecule of <nUm> in the solid state are chiral about their crystallographic C2 axis of symmetry , with each bipyridine unit in an anti conformation . compound <nUm> exists in solution a a mixture of diastereomers ( with D3 and C2 symmetry ) that could not be distinguished in the solid state by x-ray crystallography . compound <nUm> and <nUm> are cleanly converted to the corresponding l,4-bis(trimethylsilyl)butadiene derivative <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively , via demetalation with acetic acid . the latter cyclophanes are le conformationally rigid , a determined by variable - temperature NMR experiment . none we have developed a highly convergent synthesis of the manumycin - type m- C7N-antibiotic nisamycin that is applicable to other member of this family of antibiotic . the synthesis feature a three - step sequence to the epoxyquinol core that serf a a scaffold for the attachment of the polyene side chain . the eastern polyene side chain wa constructed via a novel organozirconocene - mediated synthesis . zirconocene methodology wa also applied to the synthesis of the polyene side chain of asukamycin . the southern side chain of nisamycin wa introduced via a stille reaction that employed a vinyl bromo ketone , derived from an acid - sensitive bromo ketal . Pd - mediated coupling of the vinyl bromide with a stannyl TIPS ester gave TIPS - protected nisamycin that wa readily converted to the natural product . the relative energetic stability of the " rac " and the " meso " rotational isomer of metallocene - based ziegler - natta ( ZN ) catalyst play an important role in determining the structural , physical and chemical property of synthesized polymer . due to the large molecular size of these system , ab initio calculation are often prohibitive . to circumvent this problem , we use the QM - pot approach , which treat the metal center and it surrounding atom / ligand by quantum mechanic ( QM ) , whereas the ( organic ) atom / functional group away from the metal center are described by an interatomic potential function ( pot ) . As a concrete example , we choose a commercially important zirconocene - based catalyst and compute : ( 1 ) the relative energy of the rac and meso structure ; ( 2 ) the activation barrier for the rotational transition from one to the other ; and ( 3 ) the effect of the addition of organic functional group on the above energy . due to small mismatch between QM and pot potential surface , one ha to be careful in defining the QM cluster . In particular , larger QM cluster do not necessarily yield better result . despite these difficulty , we show that it is possible to define a cluster for which the hybrid approach yield meaningful result when compared to full QM calculation . A bridged d0 zirconocene dichloride is reported a a first group <nUm> metal complex possessing rare long - lived ligand - to - metal charge transfer ( LMCT ) excited state with high emission yield and excited - state lifetime in fluid solution ( e.g. , PhLUM = <nUm> and τ = <nUm> m in 1,2-dichlorobenzene at <nUm> ° C ) . the basic emission parameter PhLUM and τ are shown to be extremely solvent - dependent in fluid at room temperature . the first principle dependence of LMCT emission parameter on solvent property are revealed with use of the target complex . for fluid solution , the linear correlation between PhLUM and τ is reported , thus suggesting that a solvent determines the rate constant for nonradiative decay , knr . we propose route for the catalytic cycle and possible termination reaction for the polymerization of ethylene with cationic chromium complex of the type [CpCr(L)R] + which contain donor ligand with phosphorus or nitrogen ( L = PR <nUm> or NR <nUm> ) . we confirm the rate - determining character of the insertion of ethylene into the chromium - alkyl bond . contrary to the situation with late transition metal , the resulting agostic isomer will readily isomerize . the termination of the polymerization reaction by b-hydrogen elimination to the chromium center and subsequent dissociation of the resulting olefin is found to require about <nUm> kcal / mol and to be thermodynamically much le feasible than the alternative termination process by b-hydrogen transfer to a monomer . the latter process involves spin change ; two minimum - energy crossing point a well a further transition state and intermediate have been identified . our calculation predict that adduct formation with the polymerization additive 9-BBN should be feasible both from a cp - quinoline - based chromium catalyst and a zirconocene catalyst . however , only the latter undergoes exergonic chain transfer , which is in accordance with the experimentally observed formation of ultrahigh m W polyethylene when using 9-BBN a polymerization additive in combination with Cr catalyst . for the first time , quantum dynamic simulation of such open - shell system have been performed , which give a lifetime of the Cr - alkyl complex with regard to ethylene insertion of only <nUm> f . the simulation indicate that the dissociation of ethylene from the chromium center should be relatively insignificant compared to migratory insertion . some metallocene methyl cation made of zirconium , that have been used a catalyst in polymerization of ethylene , were studied by mean of the conceptual density functional theory ( DFT ) . up to now , catalytic activity , a pure experimental parameter , that measure the kilogram of polyethylene produced per gram of metallocene , per time unit , per temperature unit , and per pressure unit , ha been mainly explained in term of steric hindrance at least qualitatively , meaning that a catalyst having a higher steric hindrance will present a lower catalytic activity . however , there ha not been a satisfactory explanation for those few case in which the steric effect can not be linked with the catalytic activity , thus meaning that the electronic inductive effect predominates over the steric effect . As a consequence , the electronic inductive effect must be quantified through the use of a proper descriptor based on quantum chemical calculation and , in addition , this descriptor should be able to explain high value of catalytic activity even when the steric effect seems to play an unfavorable role . this work ha demonstrated that a local reactivity descriptor called local hyper - softness coming from the conceptual DFT is a suitable pure theoretical parameter that explains such anomaly in some value of catalytic activity . it is expected that the finding exposed here can help to estimate catalytic activity and lead to a more rational design of new catalyst by mean of computational chemistry . ethene polymerization with bis(2-dimethylsilyl-indenyl)zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 1 ) / MAO and bis(2-trimethylsilyl-indenyl)zirconium(IV) dichloride ( 2 ) / MAO and ethene-co-1-hexene polymerization with <nUm> / MAO are presented . the end group analysis of homopolymers reveals a pronounced dependence of the termination rate on temperature change . In combination with the high molecular weight obtained , these result are in accord with theoretical prediction . gel permeation chromatography , fourier transform infrared , and 13C NMR analysis of copolymerization product from <nUm> / MAO a a function of comonomer concentration at two different temperature series denote it tendency to form inhomogeneous polymer blend . thermal analysis and fractionation result of one such blend indicate an inhomogeneity in the enchainment process and the existence of multiple active site of differing geometry . these indication are further supported by AMBER force field and density functional theory study of the catalyst precursor and the active site of <nUm> / MAO . for this system , d-agostic interaction for the stabilization of the zirconium cation are favored over b-agostic interaction , which , in contrast to the situation in study on bis-Cp system , is a sparsely populated specie . the gap in activation enthalphies for b-hydride transfer and elimination is marginalized for these bulky zirconocenes , and conceptually new mechanism for the isomerization of the vinyl end group are discussed . further , unexpected activation of the silicon-hydrogen bond within the ligand framework is observed with an activation enthalpy a low a <nUm> kcal / mol . cationic zirconocene complex are active specie in ziegler - natta catalysis for olefin polymerization . their structure and metal - ligand bond strength strongly influence their activity . In the present work , the infrared multiphoton dissociation ( IRMPD ) spectrum of mass selected Zr(C 5H5)2(OH)(CH3CN)- cation wa obtained in the 300-1500 cm-1 fingerprint range by coupling a fourier - transform ion cyclotron resonance ( FT - ICR ) mass spectrometer equipped with an electrospray ionization ( ESI ) source and the infrared free electron laser ( IR - FEL ) at the centre laser infrarouge d'Orsay ( CLIO ) . the experimental effort are complemented by quantum chemical calculation at the MP2 and B3LYP level using the 6-311G basis set . vibrational assignment of transition observed in the IRMPD spectrum to mode of the Zr-O-H , C5H <nUm> , and C2H3N moiety are based on comparison to calculated linear absorption spectrum . both the experimental data and the calculation provide unprecedented information about structure , metal - ligand bonding , charge distribution , and binding energy of the complex . the effect of zirconocenes , used a drug for various therapeutic application , on the crystal growth of hydroxyapatite wa investigated at sustained supersaturation . all zirconocenes weee found to inhibit crystal growth of hydroxyapatite possibily through adsorption onto the active site for crystal growth . the kinetics result favored a langmuir - type isotherm , suggesting a high affinity of zirconocene dichloride for hydroxyapatite . ethylene ( e ) / propylene ( P ) solution copolymerizations with low propylene ratio were carried out using constrained geometry catalyst , [C5Me4(SiMe2NtBu)]TiMe2 ( CGC ) , and ansa - zirconocene , rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( EBI ) , at 130-150 ° C and <nUm> × <nUm> kPa . ethylene / propylene copolymer with long chain branch ( LCB ) density from <nUm> to <nUm> carbon per <nUm> <nUm> carbon , molecular weight distribution close to <nUm> , and narrow comonomer composition distribution were synthesized with CGC . broad molecular weight and comonomer composition distribution were found in the EBI copolymer . reactivity ratio showed that CGC wa more active for propylene incorporation than EBI . terminal group analysis indicated that more terminal unsaturation occurred with EBI than with CGC . two additional type of terminal unsaturated group , vinylidene with side group having more than three carbon ( 2VD ) and trans-vinylene ( VE ) , were found with EBI while the terminal vinyl ( V ) and vinylidene with methyl side group ( 1VD ) were determined in both CGC and EBI copolymer . long chain branch structure were formed by the V type macromonomer incorporation . the long chain branching rate constant were also estimated . the hydro-oligomerization of cyclopentene in toluene solution using [ethylenebis(e5-indenyl)]-zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) or bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride and methylaluminoxane a catalyst wa studied . the crude oligomer mixture obtained using the former catalyst wa extracted with hot toluene to provide a fraction consisting predominantly of dimer , trimer , and tetramer . distillation provided trimer of <nUm> % purity . pure tetramer wa precipitated from methanol-toluene a a crystalline solid . hydro-oligomerization of cyclopentene with zirconocene dichloride a catalyst provided two tetramers , one of which wa identical to that produced using the chiral catalyst . the structure of the trimer , including stereochemistry , wa established by total synthesis . these result conclusively demonstrate that the original structure assigned to poly(cyclopentene) is incorrect and that enchainment of cyclopentene occurs predominantly by cis-1,3-insertion . A mechanism for the polymerization of cyclopentene using catalyst <nUm> is discussed . the termination process of zirconocene - MAO olefin polymerization catalyst under high pressure of 100-1500 MP were studied . it wa found that the ratio of olefinic polymer end depend on the reaction pressure , and trans-vinylene group predominantly form under high pressure . the b-hydrogen transfer to olefin wa accelerated under <nUm> MPa in hexene polymerization with (C5H4Me)2ZrCl2 . the diastereoselectivity of the cyclization step in the cyclopolymerization of 1,5-hexadiene with homogeneous catalyst based on zirconocene / methylalumoxane system is investigated through the analysis of the nonbonded interaction on model catalytic site analogous to those proposed for a-olefin polymerization . A model which doe not include any cyclopentadienyl ring present a small trans specificity : the minimum energy intermediate brings the formation of trans ring and resembles a cyclohexane chair in which the growing chain occupies a pseudoequatorial position ( trans-chair conformation ) . the addition of two cyclopentadienyl ring to the Zr atom , due to interaction with the growing chain which occupies a pseudoaxial position , disfavor the two most stable ci conformation ( a cis-chair and a cis-boat ) . As a consequence , the model with two cyclopentadienyl ring show a higher trans specificity than the “ bare ” model . In the presence of two pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ring , the steric interaction of the aromatic ligand tend to disfavor the trans-chair with respect to a cis-twist conformation and the model becomes cis-specific . A good qualitative agreement between the modeling and polymerization result is observed . none substantial transfer of growing polypropyl chain to methylalumoxane and trimethylaluminum occurs with the highly substituted , isospecific zirconocene catalyst Me2Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C5H2)2ZrCl2 / MAO , while little if any such chain transfer is observed for the more open isospecific catalyst Me2Si(2-MeInd)2ZrCl2 / MAO , for aspecific H4C2(Flu)2ZrCl2 / MAO , and for syndiospecific Ph2C(Cp)FluZrCl2 / MAO . propene polymerization with MAO - activated mixture of Me2Si(2-MeInd)2ZrCl2 and H4C2(Flu)2ZrCl2 give completely separable mixture of the isotactic and atactic polymer characteristic for each of the individual catalyst . MAO - activated mixture of Me2Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C5H2)2ZrCl2 and H4C2(Flu)2ZrCl2 , however , give polypropene mixture that contain , besides isotactic and atactic polymer , polymer fraction in which isotactic and atactic polypropene chain segment are inseparably linked . while clear evidence for isotactic - syndiotactic stereoblock formation wa not obtained , some polymeryl exchange between isospecific and syndiospecific catalyst site in MAO - activated mixture of Me2Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C5H2)2ZrCl2 and Ph2C(Cp)-FluZRCl2 is indicated by increased stereoerror frequency in some fraction of the polymer product mixture obtained by temperature - rising elution fractionation . structural prerequisite for an efficient transfer of growing polymer chain between different type of catalyst center are discussed . the correlation between relative reactivity of the two styrene enantiofaces and geometry of ansa - zirconocene system ha been determined by 13C NMR microstructural analysis of the poly(propylene-co-styrene-ethylene) ( P / S-E ) obtained in the presence of C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocene catalyst . the chemical shift assignment accomplished by using configurational additivity rule suggests that secondary styrene insertion with C2 - symmetric metallocene occurs with the opposite enantioface with respect to primary propylene insertion . on the contrary the analysis of 13C enriched copolymer obtained in the presence of Cs - symmetric catalyst seems to indicate that the secondary styrene insertion occurs with same enantioface with respect to propylene . this stereochemistry is what one expects for a simple olefin inserting in secondary fashion despite the peculiar behavior of the aromatic monomer toward zirconocene - based catalyst . copolymerization of ethylene with 5-vinyl-2-norbornene ( VNB ) using the dicyclopentadienylzirconium dichloride / methylaluminoxane ( zirconocene / MAO ) catalyst system ha been shown to occur with regioselective insertion of the endocyclic double bond of VNB into the copolymer chain , leaving the exocyclic vinyl double bond a a pendant unsaturation . the pendant vinyl group in the copolymer can be readily converted to the hydroxy / epoxy group with complete conversion under mild reaction condition , giving rise to the corresponding functionalized copolymer . the copolymer ( parent and functionalized ) have been characterized using IR , NMR , TGA , DSC , and intrinsic viscosity measurement . the influence of the ligand structure of zirconocene polymerization catalyst on the accessibility of the active reaction center wa studied by an ab initio hartree - fock method . the variation in the accessibility were elucidated by comparing molecular structure and relative stability of <nUm> bridged zirconocene catalyst with <nUm> different bridging unit , <nUm> ancillary cp' ligand , and <nUm> ligand substituents . ligand variation gave rise to various steric and electronic effect affecting both the nature and the concentration of active metal center in the system , such a steric blocking or shielding of the metal center , and stabilization or destabilization of the active cationic specie . comparison to experimental work demonstrated clear correlation between accessibility of the active reaction center and observed polymerization activity . furthermore , interaction between the lewis acidic aluminum center and lewis basic functionality were observed . the consequence of such interaction are discussed . poly(l-butene) wa obtained by polymerization of 1-butene at <nUm> ° C using rac-(dimethyl-silyl)bis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( I ) a catalyst and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst . the product wa characterized by NMR ( 1H and 13C ) , size exclusion chromatography ( SEC ) , and vapor pressure osmometry ( VPO ) . the number - average molecular weight of the polymer wa determined a <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> by SEC , VPO , and NMR , respectively . the poly(l-butene) is <nUm> % isotactic and ha high regioselectivity ( ca. <nUm> % 1,2-addition ) . both saturated and unsaturated end group were characterized by NMR . vinylidene and trisubstituted double bond comprise approximately <nUm> % and <nUm> % , respectively , of the unsaturated end group with the remainder consisting of vinylene , vinyl , and tetrasubstituted double bond . n-Butyl and sec-butyl group constitute the saturated end group in the approximate ratio <nUm> : <nUm> . there is a slight excess of saturated end group relative to unsaturated end group . these result are discussed in term of a reaction mechanism of initiation and propagation with various chain - transfer reaction ( b-hydride transfer with and without rearrangement , transfer to aluminum , transfer to vinylidene end group , and b-alkyl transfer ) . polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) wa conducted with the catalyst system of rac-Et(Ind)2Zr(CH3)2 / Ph3CB(C6F5)4 , rac-Et(IndH4)2Zr(CH3)2 / ph3CB(C6F5)6 , and rac-Me2Si(Ind)2Zr(CH5)2 / Ph3CB(C6F5)4 . these catalyst only weee found to be inactive . however , the addition of suitable lewis acid like alkylzinc and alkylaluminum compound gave highly isotactic PMMA . the isotactic pentad [mmmm] in PMMA a well a the propagation rate constant ( kp ) depended significantly upon the zirconocene compound . both the microstructure ( [mmmm] ) and propagation rate constant ( kp ) increased in the following order : Me2Si(Ind)2 < Et(IndH4)2 < Et(Ind)2 . the microstructure of PMMA wa also affected slightly by alkylzinc compound : C3H5 = CH2 < C2H5 > C4H9 . when the polymerization wa initiated by the rac-Et(Ind)2Zr(CH3)2 / Ph3CB(C6F5)4 / Zn(C2H4CH = CH2)2 catalyst system at <nUm> ° C in toluene , the molecular weight of PMMA increased in proportion to the conversion of MMA . the increase of temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C caused a decrease in isotactic pentad content by approximately <nUm> % . the isotactic polymerization of MMA wa revealed to proceed by an enantiomorphic site - controlled mechanism . ethylene-styrene copolymer have been prepared in the presence of the catalytic system based on [(methyl)(phenyl)methylene(1-cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)]zirconium dichloride , methylalumoxane , and Al(13CH3)3 . end - group analysis show that in the initiation step the regiospecificity of styrene insertion into the Zr — 13CH3 bond is prevailingly secondary . c2v-symmetric ethylenebis(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) and it C2 - symmetric bis-[9-(1-methyl)fluorenyl] derivative ( 2 ) have been synthesized in good yield using a convenient synthetic route . precursor <nUm> activated with triphenylcarbenium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( 3 ) catalyzes propylene polymerization with a constant activity of ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) × <nUm> g of PP / ( ( mol of Zr)*[C3H6]*h ) between <nUm> and + <nUm> ° C . the polypropylene is ideally atactic and ha the same of ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) × <nUm> . the above system catalyzes ethylene polymerization with a maximum activity of <nUm> × <nUm> g of PE / ( ( mol of Zr)*[C2H4]*h ) at <nUm> ° C which decrease exponentially with an increase of tp . all the polyethylene produced between <nUm> and + <nUm> ° C have the same of ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) × <nUm> . In contrast , precursor <nUm> catalyzed the formation of anisotactic polypropylene of low stereoregularity . molecular mechanic calculation indicated that substituents on the fluorenyl ring have little effect on both diastereomeric ratio in the synthesis and stereoselectivities in the polymerization . we report the stereospecific polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) with single - component cationic zirconocene catalyst . the complex Me2CCpIndZrMe(thf)+BPh4- ( 1 ) and Me2CCp2-ZrMe(thf)+BPh4- ( 2 ) are active catalyst for the polymerization of MMA , in remarkable contrast to other cationic zirconocenes . while <nUm> yield highly isotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) ( PMMA ) , <nUm> is syndiospecific at low temperature . this is the first example for a rational control of PMMA microstructure via catalyst symmetry . polymerization kinetics and stereospecificity control in MMA polymerization with <nUm> and <nUm> are discussed . on the basis of the experimental data , a possible polymerization mechanism is proposed . A new poly(oxyphenylene) derivative containing a 3-(trialkylammonio)propyl substituent wa synthesized via hydroiodinated poly(oxy-2-allyl-6-methyl-1,4-phenylene) followed by quaternization with trialkylamine . poly(oxy-2-allyl-6-methyl-1,4-phenylene) obtained by oxidative polymerization of 2-allyl-6-methylphenol wa allowed to react with bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium chloride hydride ( ZrCp2 - ClH ) at room temperature in inert atmosphere in which the allyl group wa converted to a terminally zirconocene - substituted propyl group . the activated propyl group can react with I2 to yield the 3-iodopropyl group . the quaternization of the resulting polymer wa performed through the menshutkin reaction with a series of trialkylamines to obtain the poly[oxy-2-[3-(trialkylammonio)propyl]-6-methyl-1,4-phenylene iodide ] . the resulting polyammonium salt a an ion exchange resin exhibit higher thermal stability than poly[oxy-2-[(trimethylammonio)methyl]-6-methyl-1,4-phenylene salt ] , e.g. , no decomposition in water below <nUm> ° C for <nUm> h . A new monocyclopentadienylamido complex , [ e5:e1-(2,3-Me2 Benz[e]Ind)SiMe2NtBu]TiCl2 ( I ) , wa synthesized a catalyst precursor . the study on the homopolymerization and copolymenzation of 4-methyl-1-pentene ( P ) and ethylene ( e ) were presented , by comparing complex I with other CpA complex and Cp2M zirconocenes . the complex I , activated with methylaluminoxane , provided an enhanced copolymerization activity , an excellent incorporation of 4-methyl-1-pentene into the polyethylene chain , and an increased copolymer molecular weight . analysis of 13C NMR spectrum of polymer , combined with the monomer reactivity ratio and the polymerization result , demonstrated that the regioselectivity of monomer insertion , tacticity , productivity , molecular weight , and polymer microstructure are significantly dependent on the ligand substitution pattern and the metal atom in CpA complex . the CpA I - derived poly(4-methyl-1-pentene-co-ethylene)s contained a significant amount of regioirregular arrangement of 4-methyl-1-pentene unit , but with no virtually consecutive 4-methyl-1-pentene sequence . In contrast , the [ e5:e1-(Me4C5) SiMe2NtBu]TiCl2 (IV)-derived copolymer revealed the small clustered sequence ( e.g. , EPPE ) but without any regioirregular arrangement of 4-methyl-1-pentene unit . the copolymer prepared with [e5:e1-(Flu)SiMe2NtBu] Cl2Ti ( VI ) not only showed quite different microstructure from that based on catalyst I and IV but also manifested the more pronounced tendency to form an alternating distribution of monomer in the polymer chain . furthermore , the VI - derived copolymer contained neither a regioregular insertion of comonomer nor the consecutive 4-methyl-1-pentene sequence . A structural analysis of the oriented γ form of isotactic polypropylene ( iPP ) is presented . the x-ray diffraction intensity distribution in the oriented γ form is quantitatively evaluated for the first time . the structural analysis is performed on a new , poorly stereoregular ( [mmmm] = <nUm> % ) polypropylene material , prepared with a novel C2 - symmetric zirconocene based catalytic system , showing elastomeric property . the sample , initially amorphous , partially crystallizes upon aging . In the oriented crystalline material , obtained by stretching the aged sample , the crystallite tend to assume a preferred orientation with the chain ax parallel to the draw direction . disorder is present in the structure . for low draw ratio ( le than twice the initial length ) disordered crystalline modification , very close to the γ form of iPP , are obtained ; increasing the draw ratio , crystalline modification , closer to the α form of iPP , are observed . the structural disorder occurring in our stretched sample originates from the random succession of bilayers of chain with chain parallel ( like in the α form ) or tilted ≈ <nUm> ° each other ( like in the γ form ) . the result of this analysis are the follows . for the sample stretched at a low draw ratio , ≈ <nUm> % of the bilayers of chain are faced each other like in the γ form so that the fraction of bilayers with chain ax pointing preferentially along the draw direction is on the order of 60-65 % ( the remaining 35-40 % , being oriented with the chain ax tilted ≈ <nUm> ° to the draw direction ) . for the sample stretched at higher draw ratio , the fraction of bilayers facing each other like in the γ form is reduced to 20-30 % , so that only 10-15 % of the bilayers result oriented with the chain ax nearly normal to the draw direction . this is a if , in all case , the region of the crystal with chain arranged like in the α form tend to be oriented with the chain ax parallel to the stretching direction rather than tilted ≈ <nUm> ° . A continuum of disordered modification intermediate between the pure γ and α form could exist . the possible inclusion in the crystalline domain of stereo defect ( mainly of the kind mrrm ) , which would favor the γ , - like packing situation on the local scale , is discussed . In order to gain further insight into dicarbollide - catalyzed ethylene-norbornene polymerization , the behavior of the (e5-C2B9H11)- Zr(NRt2)2(NHEt2) - TIBA catalyst wa studied and preliminary compared with that of Me2Si(3-tBuCp)(adamantylamido)- Cl2Zr / MAO ( 2 ) and (e5-C5Me5)- Cl3Zr - MAO ( 3 ) . several ethylene-norbornene copolymerizations were carried out over a wide range of monomer composition . the resulting polymer product were analyzed by 13C NMR spectroscopy to gain information about the copolymer microstructure . rac-[Methylene(3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 activated by MAO , employed a catalyst in the ethylene-styrene copolymerization , show a peculiar behavior . actually , it produce block copolymer , whereas the homogeneous catalytic system known to copolymerize these monomer preferentially give rise to alternating sequence of ethylene and styrene . the polystyrene block are isotactic and show crystallinity , also when their average length is a short a <nUm> unit . some evidence suggests the primary styrene insertion into the metal-carbon bond of the growing chain : this unusual regiochemistry could account for the observed tendency to give homosequences . polyethylene and isotactic polypropylene having 1,2- or 1,3-disubstituted cyclopentane structure were prepared by copolymerization of ethylene or propylene with cyclopentene ( CPE ) or 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) using zirconocene catalyst . effect of the cyclopentane structure on the melting point and crystalline structure of the copolymer wa investigated . In the case of ethylene-based copolymer , polyethylene containing 1,3-disubstituted cyclopentane structure , poly(ethylene-co-HD) , showed a lower degree of melting - point depression and decreasing crystallinity with increasing cyclopentane content than polyethylene containing 1,2-disubstituted cyclopentane structure , poly(ethylene-co-CPE) . expansion of crystalline unit cell , especially along the a-axis , with increasing cyclopentane content wa observed in the wide - angle x-ray diffraction pattern of the poly(ethylene-co-HD) . the phenomenon indicated incorporation of 1,3-disubstituted cyclopentane structure in the crystalline phase of polyethylene . on the other hand , both poly(propylene-co-CPE) and poly(propylene-co-HD) showed similar profile in the relationship between the comonomer content and the melting point or the crystallinity of the copolymer . lowest energy ligand - to - metal charge - transfer ( LMCT ) transition of racemic siloxy-substituted ethylene-bridged bis(indenyl) - type zirconocenes reacted with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) were studied using UV / vi spectroscopy in combination with the ab initio hartree - fock method . the LMCT absorption were recorded at various [Al] / [Zr] ratio , representing dichloride , methylated , and cationic form of the zirconocenes . the experimental LMCT absorption energy of each intermediate were compared to the calculated energy of the indenyl ligand - based HOMO and the zirconium - based LUMO . the lowest energy LMCT absorption were directly proportional to the calculated LUMO - HOMO energy gap . furthermore , the LMCT absorption energy were demonstrated to correlate with ethylene polymerization activity of the siloxy-substituted complex . this correlation wa clarified by a frontier orbital analysis , suggesting that decreasing absorption energy is related to the feasibility of the activation of the catalyst . density functional ( DFT ) calculation were carried out on the B3LYP level of theory on bridged and unbridged cationic zirconocene complex to clarify why unbridged [Zr(Cp)2(Me)(thf)][BPh4] is not active in the polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) , whereas [Zr{(Cp)2CMe2}(Me)(thf)][BPh4] polymerizes MMA readily , a we showed experimentally . it is shown , that the initial step of the polymerization -
