the transfer of the metallocene bound methyl group to the first MMA molecule-is endothermic for [Zr(Cp)2(Me)(MMA)]+ but exothermic for [Zr{(Cp)2CMe2}(Me)(MMA)]+ . furthermore - and more important - the activation energy is higher for the reaction of the unbridged compound compared to the activation energy of the bridged compound . from these result and an estimation of the rate constant it follows that in the temperature range investigated experimentally ( <nUm> to + <nUm> ° C ) either the endothermic product is not formed at all and / or the reversed reaction to the reactant is much faster than the reaction with the next MMA molecule . these result are confirmed by the inclusion of solvent effect by the CPCM solvation model ( also known a COSMO ) . alternative reaction path for both cation were also investigated and found to be energetically much le favorable . an investigation of the ethylene polymerization with meso ansa metallocenes of group <nUm> allows clarifying some aspect of the branching formation observed in the polyethylene produced with these catalyst . the meso structure of the zirconocene precursor is more effective in promoting the chain growing isomerization when indenyl ligand bear no substituents . but the same coordinating neighborhood when surrounding the Ti(IV) or Hf(IV) ion give rise to complex not effective in the ethyl-branched polyethylene synthesis . on the other hand , several activator in combination with meso-ethylenebis(1-indenyl)Zr(CH3)2 produce catalyst able to polymerize ethylene to ethyl-branched polyethylene . No difference ha been detected in the amount of branch with respect to that observed with MAO - activated meso-ethylenebis(1-indenyl)ZrCl2 . recently , an asymmetric ansa - zirconocene dichloride complex that is able to introduce single stereoerrors into an isotactic polypropene chain a a function of monomer concentration is described . though , one major requirement for the practical application of such new material is a molecular weight high enough to ensure satisfying tensile and creep property below and above room temperature . this paper report on a series of new asymmetric zirconocene dimethyl , hafnocene dichloride , and hafnocene dimethyl complex for the homopolymerization of propene in toluene solution and in liquid monomer after MAO and borate activation . stereoregular PPs having a hydroxyl group at the side chain were easily synthesized . the method employed is the stereospecific propene polymerization by zirconocene dichlorides-[Ph <nUm> C][B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] combined with ODIBA , in place of usual trialkylaluminum , followed by quenching with O <nUm> . ethene homopolymerization and copolymerization in toluene solution with varying amount of 1-hexene were catalyzed by the methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) activated zirconocene catalyst (1,2,4-Me3-Cp)2ZrCl2 and (Me5Cp)2ZrCl2 and a mixture of these two in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio . the dual site catalyst ( <nUm> : <nUm> mixture ) ha a homo- and copolymerization activity intermediate between the individual catalyst . deviation from the expected average behaviour taking into account the ca. 6-fold higher <nUm> h yield of (1,2,4-Me3Cp)2 Cl2Zr are observed . the dual site system result in a copolymer with ca. <nUm> % too low comonomer incorporation . the melting endotherm attributed to (Me5Cp)2ZrCl2 is found to be ca. 30-70 % too high , and the observed molecular weight for the copolymer are higher than expected and even higher than for the two individual catalyst . chain transfer to trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) is found to become le important at high comonomer concentration concurrent with an increase of the concentration of vinyl and trans-vinylene unsaturations . further , it is noteworthy that with the dual site system it is possible to produce ethene / 1-hexene copolymer with narrow molecular weight distribution a a mixture of chain containing low and high comonomer content . the observed discrepancy in the mixed system from the average of the (1,2,4-Me3Cp)2ZrCl2 and (Me5Cp)2ZrCl2 catalyst are provisionally explained by chain transfer between the site coupled with an activity increase of the latter of these site . the copolymerizations of propylene with allyl monomer carrying alcohol or amine were conducted by the rac-dimethylsilylbis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride / methylaluminoxane catalyst system . the allyl monomer were pretreated by alkylaluminum before the polymerization . although the efficiency of the introduction of allyl alcohol - based comonomer wa extraordinary low ( <nUm> - <nUm> mol % in polymer ) , the trimethylaluminum - treated allylamine wa found to be introduced more effectively ( <nUm> mol % in polymer ) . the 13C NMR study indicated that the position of allylamine unit in the copolymer wa influenced by the kind of alkylaluminum used at the polymerization . In the presence of trimethylaluminum , the terminally aminated polypropylene wa obtained ( [ amino end polymer ] / [ whole polymer ] = <nUm> ) . In the presence of triisobutylaluminum , however , the allylamine unit is located both on the main chain and at the chain end . the end - aminated polymer wa probably obtained due to the formation of dormant specie after the insertion of the comonomer followed by the chain transfer to alkylaluminum . the activation of 1-siloxy-substituted zirconocene with MAO occurs slowly , in 4-6 h . the slow activation process involves three distinct ligand to metal charge transfer ( LMCT ) band shift in the UV / vi spectrum before the maximum LMCT absorption energy and intensity of the third appearing band is reached . In addition , at very high MAO concentration , a fourth band at <nUm> nm begin to form . on the contrary , the corresponding 2-siloxy-substituted a well a the unsubstituted zirconocene react with MAO in le than a minute , immediately producing the final specie , a confirmed by only one observed LMCT band shift . the 1-silyl-substituted zirconocene reacts with MAO , producing the final active specie in <nUm> h . UV / vi spectroscopic observation were interpreted with the aid of molecular modeling study , demonstrating that the interaction of the oxygen donor atom of the siloxy substituent with electron deficient Zr center and coordinatively unsaturated Al in MAO play a prominent role in the activation process . vinyl chloride monomer ( VCM ) ha been employed a a chain transfer agent to yield polyolefins with one vinyl end group per chain ; subsequent incorporation of these macromonomers ha resulted in the formation of branched polyolefins . the use of VCM a a comonomer in transition - metal - catalyzed olefin polymerization result in b-chloride elimination , yielding polymer that contain vinyl end group and a chlorinated catalyst . through reactivation of the catalyst by advantageous MAO , or other aluminum alkyl , reinitiation of the olefin polymerization can occur ; the combination of elimination and reactivation allows for VCM to behave a a chain transfer agent . the use of VCM a a chain transfer agent result in the exclusive formation of vinyl end group ( no vinylidene or internal vinyl end group ) in polyethylene , both homopolyethylene and copolymer with octene ; in propylene polymerization , vinyl end group are formed in addition to vinylidene end group , the result of b-hydride elimination which occurs even in the absence of VCM . the chain transfer constant for VCM in ethylene polymerization for a variety of single site catalyst were determined and found to be very similar , with Cs × <nUm> ∼ <nUm> ; for a propylene polymerization using a zirconocene catalyst , Cs × <nUm> ∼ <nUm> . it wa further observed that the resulting macromonomers formed in the polyethylene polymerization could be incorporated into the growing polymer chain , resulting in the formation of long chain branch . the cationic zirconocene trihydrides [ Cp'4Zr2H (m-H)2]+X- , generated from [Cp'2ZrH2]2 with various trityl salt of weakly coordinating anion , are powerful initiator for the polymerization of isobutene ( IB ) and it copolymerization with isoprene ( IP ) ( cp' = C5H4SiMe3 ) . this study is concerned with the quantification of the effect of the counteranion and of trace moisture on IB / IP copolymer and the nature of the initiating specie . polymer molecular weight increase with decreasing anion nucleophilicity in the order x = [B(C6F5)4] ≈ [H2N{B(C6F5)3}2] > [CN{B(C6F5)3}2] . using [Cp'4Zr2H3]- [CN{B(C6F5)3}2]- , high copolymer molecular weight are found ( mw ≈ <nUm> × <nUm> g / mol at <nUm> ° C ) . there is little reduction in either rate or molecular weight on addition of isoprene . polymer molecular weight are substantially higher than with the Et2AlCl / BuCl initiator system under identical condition . water wa shown to be an important chain - transfer agent ; substoichiometric quantity of water reduced activity , and copolymer molecular weight decreased linearly with increasing [H2O] . mechanistic study suggest that [ Cp'4Zr2H- (m-H)2]+ doe not itself act a a cationic initiator but is transformed into one or more other binuclear ( polynuclear ? ) specie , accompanied by alkene insertion into the Zr-H bond and a monomer hydrogenation step . tentative structure for these reactive intermediate are suggested . methylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride substituted in C(3) , activated by methylalumoxane , is able to give polystyrene and ethylene-styrene copolymer . In this study hydrooligomers , whose structure , determined by 13C NMR and GC-MS technique , give information about the regiochemistry and the stereochemistry of styrene insertion , have been purposefully prepared . the regiochemistry of the styrene insertion is related to the encumbrance of substituents in C(3) . rac-[Methylene-(3-R-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 with r = H , CH3 , or C2H5 induces a prevailingly secondary styrene insertion into the zirconium-carbon bond . with increasing the substituent 's steric hindrance ( r = C3H7 ) , regiochemistry inversion occurs and the primary insertion becomes prevailing . the analysis of ethylene-styrene copolymer obtained in the presence of the different catalyst allows confirming the correlation between regiochemistry and comonomers ' reactivity . besides , also the stereospecificity can be evaluated from the structure of the hydrotrimers , when the insertion is primary . whereas the isospecificity in the absence of substituents ( secondary insertion ) and in the presence of the tert-butyl substituent ( primary insertion ) is well - known , a surprising syndiospecificity is observed when the indenyl ligand bear the isopropyl substituent in C(3) . copolymerizations of ethylene with 1,3-butadiene in the presence of catalytic system based on some C2 - symmetric zirconocenes ( rac-[CH2(3-R-1-indenyl)2]ZrCl2 where r = -C(CH3)3 ( 1 ) , -CH(CH3)2 ( 2 ) , -CH2CH3 ( 3 ) , -CH3 ( 4 ) , and -H ( 5 ) ) are compared . the chemical nature and the relative amount of constitutional comonomer unit from butadiene are strongly affected by the bulkiness of the substituent in position <nUm> and 3' . DFT calculation indicate that the observed dependence of constitutional unit from butadiene on the bulkiness of the alkyl ligand substituent can be easily rationalized by the occurrence of an unusual insertion mechanism for butadiene . this mechanism , involving butadiene if primary coordination followed by it primary vinyl insertion , becomes largely predominant for catalytic system based on the zirconocenes ( 1-4 ) , which present r ≥ CH3 . this kind of butadiene insertion mechanism is also able to account for the high stereoregularity which is observed for adjacent methylene-1,2-cyclopropane unit . poly(propylene-ran-1,3-butadiene) that contained selectively inserted 1,4-butadiene unit wa successfully synthesized by ind-1 activated with MAOs . the average amount of 1,4-BD per polymer chain and thus the average length of propylene unit between 1,4-BDs of the copolymer could be controlled by the butadiene concentration in the feed . the copolymer with high molecular weight were converted to a,o-divinyl isotactic PP by ethenolysis . the synthesis of a vinyl-terminated , hyperbranched polysilane and the additional hydroboration with bis(pentafluorophenyl) borohydride are reported . quantitative transformation wa proved by 1H NMR and FT-IR analysis . the polymeric borane wa tested a cocatalyst in the metallocene - catalyzed polymerization of propylene . the corresponding catalyst system comprising rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl-1- e5-indenyl)ethane]zirconocene dichloride and the polymeric borane wa activated in situ in the presence of triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) . polymerization were performed at temperature of <nUm> and <nUm> ° C with a propylene concentration of <nUm> mol / L in toluene solution using various cocatalyst : catalyst ratio ( <nUm> : <nUm> , <nUm> : <nUm> , and <nUm> : <nUm> ) . this polymer - supported catalyst system produce polypropylene with excellent activity and good molecular weight . these result were compared with an additional set of polymerization experiment using molecular dispersed BC18F15 a cocatalyst , resulting in significantly reduced polymerization activity . this indicates a hindered catalyst mobility inside the hyperbranched cocatalyst matrix , leading to a higher concentration of active specie within the hyperbranched nanostructure . addition of aluminum or zinc alkyl ( AIRs or ZnR2 , r = me or et ) lower the molar mass of norbornene - ethene ( N / e ) copolymer obtained with the catalyst system Me2C(Ind)(Cp)ZrCl2 / MAO or rac-C 2H4(2-tBuMe2SiO-Ind) 2ZrCl2 / MAO to different degree . these chain - shortening effect and change in relative end - group abundance indicate the degree to which e / N copolymer growing at a Zr catalyst center are transferred to Al or Zn center by alkyl-polymeryl exchange . increased molar mass of copolymer obtained in the presence of added Al(iBu)3 indicate that this reagent suppresses polymer chain exchange between Zr catalyst center and methylaluminum specie contained in the MAO activator . these observation are interpreted in term of reversible adduct formation between Al or Zn alkyl and cationic zirconocene alkyl specie . mechanistic study of isospecific polymerization of methacrylates by a cationic , chiral ansa - zirconocene ester enolate complex , rac - (EBI)Zr +(THF)[OC(O iPr ) = CMe 2][MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) 3]- [ <nUm> ; EBI = C 2H 4-(Ind)2 ] , are reported . complex <nUm> effect isospecific and living (co)polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) and re-butyl methacrylate ( BMA ) , producing highly isotactic homopolymers and block copolymer with narrow molecular weight distribution and high initiator efficiency . investigation of statistical copolymerizations of MMA and BMA have yielded monomer reactivity ratio of τ MMA = <nUm> and τ BMA = <nUm> ( the kelen - tudos method ) , indicating that the copolymer formed instantaneously ha a somewhat alternating character . study of MMA polymerization kinetics have shown that propagation is first order in both concentration of the monomer and the active specie . the single MMA addition product , rac - (EBI)ZrMe[OC(OMe) = C(Me)CH 2C(Me <nUm> ) C(O iPr)-O ] ( 3 ) , ha been isolated from the reaction between the neutral roc - (EBI)ZrMe[OC(O iPr ) - C(Me) <nUm> ] ( 2 ) and MMA ; however , subsequent MMA addition do not proceed , unless the single addition product is further treated with B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> to generate the eight - membered - ring cyclic ester enolate specie , rac - (EBI)Zr +[OC(OMe) = C(Me)CH 2C(Me 2)C(O iPr)-O][MeB-(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - ( 4 ) , which corresponds to the structure of the intermediate for the single MMA addition product of <nUm> . all result presented here are consistent with the conclusion that isospecific polymerization of methacrylates by 1-which model the proposed isospecific propagating specie for the methacrylate polymerization by chiral ansa - zirconocene complexes-is enantiomorphic site controlled and proceeds in a monometallic , intramolecular michael addition mechanism . A new method to prepare polypropylene-graft-polystyrene copolymer with tailored structure ha been developed . the ability of a series of copolymer with variable structure to compatibilize the polypropylene-polystyrene blend wa evaluated through microscopic observation of the morphology of the blend . the synthesis is a two - step process , the first one being the preparation , in the presence of ansa - zirconocene - based catalyst , of the backbone formed by i-PP sequence spaced by p-methylstyreneethylene unit . In the second step , the methyl group in the aromatic ring are reacted with sec-butyllithium , and the resulting metalated polymer allowed to add the styrene to initiate the side polystyrene chain growth . this synthesis turn out versatile both in the first step because by changing monomer feed ratio , backbone with different number of the site of growth of the graft and with different length of the polypropylene sequence can be obtained , and in the last step because , by tuning styrene concentration and reaction time , the side chain length can be regulated . the PP-g-PS copolymer with PP sequence varying in the range of 24-98 unit , with number of the side chain from <nUm> to <nUm> and with PS side chain length from <nUm> × <nUm> to <nUm> × <nUm> unit , were obtained and afterward tested a compatibilizers in the PP / PS blend . the morphology of the blend , analyzed and compared by scanning electron microscopy , suggest that the compatibility of PP / PS blend is improved with increasing either the PP sequence length or the PS side chain length or the number of the side chain in the PP-g-PS copolymer . the coordination acrylamide polymerization by the cationic , chiral ansa - zirconocene ester enolate complex wa discussed . the feature of the polymerization include the high degree of control over polymerization stereochemistry and polymer molecular weight distribution . Poly(N,N- dimethylacrylamide ) ( PDMMA ) with unprecedented isotacticity , high m n , low polydispersity index ( PDI ) and T m a high a <nUm> ° C is synthesized . the effort are underway to synthesize other type of stereoregular polyacrylamides using this technique . A comparative analysis of the structure and mechanical property of two elastomeric amorphous and semicrystalline polypropylene sample , produced with c2v-symmetric and chiral C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocene catalyst , respectively , is presented . the poorly isotactic polypropylene ( iam-PP ) of medium molecular weight , prepared with the chiral C 2-symmetric catalyst , slowly crystallizes , by aging at room temperature or by stretching , in a continuum of disordered modification intermediate between α and γ form of isotactic polypropylene . structural and morphological transformation occur during stretching . disordered α / γ modification , containing a high fraction of perpendicular chain , present in the unoriented film , transform by stretching at high deformation into structure more similar to the α form with a high content of parallel chain . the development of the small level of crystallinity induces elastic property . the small crystalline domain in the amorphous matrix , indeed , act a physical knot of the elastomeric lattice . this poorly isotactic iam-PP sample show , instead , poor elastic property and viscous flow at high deformation in the amorphous state , before crystallization , because of the not high molecular weight . the unique crystallization mode of the iam-PP sample explains the remarkable enhancement of elastic property in low stereoregular polypropylene upon development of crystallinity . the fully amorphous high molecular weight atactic polypropylene ( a-PP ) , prepared with the c2v-symmetric catalyst , present elastic behavior only in a small deformation range ( up to <nUm> % strain ) and experience viscous flow of the chain at high deformation . the elasticity arises from the physical network generated by the high degree of entanglement of the polymeric chain generated by the high molecular weight of the sample . the poorly isotactic iam-PP sample , before crystallization , present much poorer elastic property than the a-PP sample because of the lower molecular weight . after crystallization , it show better elastic property in a large range of deformation with higher strength , notwithstanding the lower molecular weight , due to the presence of crystallinity . unbridged zirconocene catalyst , where a seven- or eight - membered ring fused to a cyclopentadiene is associated with a phenyl substituent in position <nUm> ( C7Ph-Zr and C8Ph-Zr ) , were tested , under the same polymerization condition , to produce polypropene with microstructure , molecular property , and thermal behavior similar to those prepared with (IndPh)2ZrCl2 ( w-Zr ) , the " classical " waymouth catalyst . different result were obtained from the homologue titanium catalyst ( C7Ph-Ti and C8Ph-Ti ) and from the titanium benzyl derivative ( C7Bn-Ti ) , which produced quite heterogeneous material with broad molecular weight and that can be separated into fraction spanning from completely atactic to fraction characterized by the presence of long isotactic block . A quite interesting behavior is observed with the zirconium benzyl derivative C7Bn-Zr , which produce good yield of a polymer with narrow polydispersity , which , despite it rather high isotacticity , show a hardly detectable melting peak and is completely ether soluble . quite surprisingly , the same sample , after prolonged annealing , show a narrow melting peak at low temperature ( 55-65 ° C ) . this result , together with the x-ray analysis , is in favor of a quite homogeneous material , capable of giving crystallite of small size . density functional calculation have been performed on different conformers and isomer of the propyl group in alkyl cation [L2Zr-Pr] - ( L = cp , cp* ; Pr = n-propyl ) , corresponding to two catalyst with different observed rate order ( n ) for ethylene polymerization , to explore the single - center , two - state kinetic model for olefin polymerization . for L = cp ( n ≈ <nUm> ) , the b-agostic conformer is found to be the most stable structure and also the most reactive with respect to ethylene coordination , which is commensurate with unity rate order . for L = cp* ( n ≈ <nUm> ) , the favored propagation route involves the g- and a-agostic conformation of the alkyl complex , with coordination taking place to an a-agostic conformation in order to minimize the steric hindrance experienced by the incoming ethylene . the barrier to rearrangement from the a- and g-agostic conformers to the more stable b-agostic structure are significantly lower than those of propagation . moreover , no structure wa found to be of lower energy than the b-agostic conformation , and the latter thus take the role of the resting state for both catalyst in the present study . assuming that the single - center , two - state model applies to zirconocene - catalyzed ethylene polymerization , our calculation thus suggest that the corresponding fast and slow , or dormant , state do not originate from equilibrium of the alkyl group a investigated here . A protocol is described in which zirconocene - catalyzed alkene polymerization reaction are terminated by bromine to give polymer containing brominated end group , Br - polymeryl . using NMR spectroscopy , the Br - polymeryl group can be identified a primary or secondary , thus providing information concerning the nature of the Zr - polymeryl linkage ( s ) , and ( via integration ) quantified , thus giving information about the relative concentration ( s ) of the Zr - polymeryl linkage ( s ) . the procedure can in principle give very useful information concerning the nature and concentration of Zr - polymeryl group in existence during polymerization process and is tested through ethylene polymerization by the Cp2ZrMe2 / B(C6F 5)3 catalyst system and propylene polymerization by the Cp2ZrMe2 / BC18F15 , (indenyl)2 - ZrMe2 / BC6F5 <nUm> , and rac-{C2H4(1-indenyl)2} ZrMe2 / BC18F15 catalyst system . to this point the resulting data concerning Zr - polymeryl concentration are generally consistent with data in the literature but are rather more easily obtained . A kinetic model based on the coordination - insertion mechanism wa developed to characterize metallocene - catalyzed propylene polymerization using two different catalyst system : rac - Et(Ind) 2ZrCl <nUm> / MAO ( I / MAO ) and rac-Et(4,7-Me 2-1-Ind ) 2ZrCl <nUm> / MAO ( II / MAO ) . slurry propylene polymerization were performed in a semibatch reactor at <nUm> ° C to investigate the effect of propylene partial pressure and MAO / Zr ratio . the kinetic model account for the formation of regioirregularities , the occurrence of chain transfer to trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) , and b-hydride chain transfer to both monomer and metal to predict the effect of propylene partial pressure and the MAO concentration on polymer molecular weight and the formation of isobutyl end group . A systematic optimization strategy wa applied to estimate the kinetic parameter from on - line measurement of the reaction rate and end - of - batch measurement of the molecular weight and percentage of end group . the formation of <nUm> , 1-insertions wa more frequent for catalyst II / MAO ( k s = <nUm> L mol <nUm> s <nUm> v k s = <nUm> L mol <nUm> s <nUm> for I / MAO ) . the m w of polymer produced with I / MAO decreased at low pressure due to the high rate of monomolecular b-hydride transfer to the metal ( k H = <nUm> s <nUm> ) . chain transfer to TMA wa more significant with the catalyst II / MAO ( k Al = <nUm> × <nUm> + <nUm> L mol <nUm> s <nUm> v k Al = <nUm> × <nUm> + <nUm> L mol <nUm> s <nUm> for I / MAO ) . this work study the mechanism and application of the novel diastereospecific ion - pairing polymerization ( DIPP ) effected by a catalyst system comprising chiral zirconocene bis(ester enolate ) rac-(EBI)-Zr[OC(O iPr ) = CMe <nUm> ] <nUm> [ <nUm> , EBI = C 2H 4(Ind) <nUm> ] and <nUm> equiv of lewis acid A1(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> . the <nUm> / 2Al(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> system effectively promotes DIPP of functionalized alkene such a methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) , producing polymer having various stereoregularities , including isotactic , syndiotactic , and isotactic-e-syndiotactic multiblock microstructures , depending on the [monomer] / [catalyst] ratio employed . our detailed investigation into the polymerization characteristic and kinetics , elementary reaction , characterization and behavior of the isolated key intermediate , a well a temperature and lewis acid effect have yielded a mechanism for the DIPP of MMA by the l / 2Al(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> system . this mechanism consists of four manifold - isospecific , syndiospecific , anion - monomer exchange , and chain - transfer domain - and satisfactorily explains the formation of various polymer stereomicrostructures under given condition . the most significant part of this overall mechanism is for the production of the isotactic-b-syndiotactic stereomultiblock structure , which is made possible by two pathway that can interconvert diastereospecific propagating manifold : exchange between the coordinated anion and monomer a well a chain transfer . this unique polymerization technique ha also been applied to the copolymerization of MMA with methacrylates having longer alkyl chain , leading to functionalized polymeric material with tunable property that are controlled by their stereomicrostructures and nature of the comonomer . the systematic investigation of the synthesis , thermal property , and microstructures of isotactic poly(3-methyl-l-butene) ( iP3M1B ) wa performed . three C2 methallocene catalyst , namely , (DMSBMPI)ZrCI2 , (DMSBI)ZrCl2 , and (DMSMBI)ZrC12 with MAO , are used for the synthesis of iP3M1B . it wa synthesized in a <nUm> mL three - necked glass bottle equipped with a magnetic stirrer . the reaction equipment wa evacuated for half an hour and filled with nitrogen before polymerization . the melt - state NMR analysis revealed that sample synthesized with (DMSMBI)ZrCl2 show a high regiospecificity . melt - state NMR analysis yield important microstructure information for insoluble polymer , similar to that obtained by solution - state NMR analysis , although melt - state NMR analysis suffers from a lower spectral resolution . the calculation based on the density functional theory ( DFT ) to investigate the experimental difference observed in the molecular weight of the polymer obtained using different zirconocene catalyst have been performed . geometric structure and gibbs free energy profile were obtained using the B3LYP hybrid DFT functional and LANL2DZ basis set for all atom . all calculation were performed using the gaussian03 package , while thermodynamic data were calculated for <nUm> bar ethylene pressure and <nUm> K using standard statistical thermodynamic method implemented in the gaussian package . it wa observed that the silyl-bridged bis-indenyl catalyst containing linear alkyl substituents in the 3-position of the indenyl ligand yield polyethylene with different molecular weight depending on the alkyl chain length . the corresponding product present a metallacycle structure and the polymer chain ejected from the catalyst . the effect of cyclopentadienyl ring substitution on the immobilization and activation of zirconocenes on support of type Cl2Mg / AlR n(OEt)3-n ha been investigated . comparison of the activity of immobilized zirconocenes (RCp)2ZrCl2 in ethylene polymerization , using simple aluminum alkyl such a AlEt3 or AliBu3 a a cocatalyst , revealed a remarkable effect of the substituent r in the cyclopentadienyl ring . low activity ( < <nUm> kg / mol bar h ) wa obtained with r = H or et , but longer alkyl substituents , notably n-Pr or n-Bu , gave more than an order of magnitude increase in activity . zirconocenes with branched substituents ( i-Pr , t-Bu ) were le easily immobilized and gave relatively low activity , while the activity of zirconocenes of composition cp - (RCp)ZrCl2 ( r = n-Pr , n-Bu , n-pentyl ) were intermediate between those of Cp2ZrCl2 and (RCp)2ZrCl2 . experiment carried out under homogeneous condition with aluminoxane cocatalysts indicated that the effect of cyclopentadienyl ring substitution can be related to difference in the ease of formation of the active specie . an inverse relationship between activity and the catalyst loading on the support wa found . At a low loading of <nUm> mmol (n-PrCp)2ZrCl2 / g support , an activity greater than <nUm> <nUm> kg / mol bar h wa obtained in ethylene polymerization at <nUm> ° C , with AliBu3 a the cocatalyst . the result demonstrate that with certain Cl2Mg - immobilized zirconocenes it is possible to achieve very high polymerization activity without the use of methylaluminoxane or a borate activator , but the strong effect of catalyst loading on activity implies the presence of a relatively low number of active specie . the mechanism of stereoselectivity in methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) monometallic polymerization promoted by the C1 - symmetric ansa-Me 2C(Cp)(Ind)Zr - based zirconocene , presenting two diastereotopic coordination site , wa investigated within density functional theory . At variance from the case of propene polymerization , our result suggest that MMA addition is stereoselective when the growing chain is in the more hindered a well a in the more open diastereotopic coordination site . In both case the same enantioface of the enolate bond of the ester enolate growing chain is selected , although selectivity is higher when the growing chain is in the more hindered diastereotopic coordination site . further , there is no substantial energy difference between these two situation , which indicates that the moderate isotacticity of the produced PMMA is consistent with an almost regular chain - migratory mechanism . the different stereoselectivity of the two diastereotopic site is due to different steric interaction between the growing chain ( chain effect ) or MMA ( monomer effect ) with the indenyl ligand . this decomposition of stereoselectivity into chain and monomer effect is used to reinvestigate the stereoselectivity of strictly related C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocenes . A liquid crystalline phase ha been discovered in a polyolefin of poly(methylene-1,3-cyclopentane) ( PMCP ) having low molecular weight , which wa obtained with cyclization polymerization of 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) using a zirconocene catalyst in the presence of chain transfer reagent . PMCP clearly show fluidity and birefringence above the glass transition temperature under the ambient condition . schlieren - like texture , which indicates nematic liquid crystalline phase , ha been detected in place . clear diffraction pattern is observed in wide - angle x-ray diffraction analysis below the isotropization temperature . the isotropization temperature decrease with decreasing of molecular weight of the PMCP . PMCP with the higher molecular weight take the longer time for liquid crystallization from isotropic phase . Non-Newtonian viscosity region in the range of low share rate , which is a characteristic of liquid crystal , ha been detected below the isotropization temperature . the copolymerization of ethylene with tert-butylethylene ( TBE , 3,3-dimethyl-1-butene ) using various half - titanocene [ cp' TiCl2X ( x = O-2,6-iPr2C6H <nUm> , N = CtBu2 ) ] - cocatalyst system ha been carried out . the aryloxo-containing half - titanocenes , Cp'TiCl 2(O-2,6-iPr2C6H3) ( cp' = cp* , tBuC5F4 , 1,2,4-Me3C5H2 ) , displayed the capability to bring about TBE incorporation in the presence of MAO a a cocatalyst , while their ketimide analogue , Cp'TiCl2(N = CtBu <nUm> ) ( cp' = cp , cp * , tBUC5H4 ) , could not accomplish TBE enchainment in ethylene / TBE copolymerization . among aryloxo derivative , those carrying tert-butyl and trimethyl substituents on the cyclopentadienyl moiety , Cp'TiCl2(O-2,6- iPr2C6H3 ) ( cp' = tBuC5H4 , 1,2,4-Me3C 5H2 ) , exhibited efficient TBE incorporation and moderate catalytic activity in the presence of MAO , affording ethylene / TBE copolymer with relatively high molecular weight and uniform molecular weight distribution . however , the copolymerization conducted by employing constrained geometry catalyst ( linked half - titanocene ) , [ Me2Si(C5Me 4)(NtBu)]TiCl2 , and zirconocene [ cp 2ZrCl2]-MAO catalyst system resulted in polyethylene without TBE incorporation . furthermore , the copolymerization of 1-hexene ( 1-Hex ) with TBE and vinyltrimethylsilane ( VTMS ) , by ( tBuC5F 4OTiC12(O-2,6-iPr2C 6H3 ) and CpTiCi2(N = CtBu <nUm> ) - MAO catalyst system , indicated a considerably higher reactivity of VTMS . the 1-Hex / VTMS copolymerization ha been elucidated to proceed via 1,2-insertion a manifested by the remarkably efficient VTMS enchainment , hence revealing the difference in the reactivity of TBE and VTMS to arise from that in their electronic and / or steric nature . poly(methylene-1,3-cyclopentane) ( PMCP ) , which is composed with alternating linkage of methylene and 1,3-cyclopentane unit , wa synthesized by cyclization polymerization of 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) with various metallocene catalyst . the optically active PMCP sample were prepared by cyclization polymerization of HD with an optically active zirconocene catalyst , [ (+)-(S,S)-ethylene-1,2- bis(n5-4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)- 1,1'-bi-2-naphtholate ] , combined with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a a cocatalyst in the presence of triethylaluminum ( A1Et3 ) a a chain transfer reagent to control the molecular weight in toluene at room temperature . the PMCP sample obtained with the optically active zirconocene catalyst show optical rotation in chloroform solution . the MnS of the PMCP sample were measured by gel - permeation chromatography and relatively calibrated with standard polystyrene sample . the birefringent texture of PMCP with relatively high molecular weight showed the fingerprint texture indicating cholesteric liquid crystal . low molecular weight ( ca. <nUm> ) ethylene - 1-butene copolymer were synthesized at <nUm> ° C using rac-(dimethylsilyl)bis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( I ) catalyst and methyl-aluminoxane ( MAO ) cocatalyst . comonomer composition , triad sequence distribution , and end group were analyzed by 1H and 13C NMR . the average polymer molecule contains about one double bond and one saturated end group . the unsaturated end group were formed almost exclusively by transfer from propagating chain containing 1-butene a the terminal unit . At least <nUm> % of the unsaturated end group are vinylidene and trisubstituted double bond , which are present in the approximate ratio <nUm> : <nUm> . saturated end group result from the initiation process . both ethylene and 1-butene are involved in initiation , but ethylene more than 1-butene . the product is a random copolymer with very short block ( no longer than 2-3 monomer unit ) of both ethylene and 1-butene . the comonomer sequence distribution determined by 13C NMR were fitted to first - order markovian statistic , which allowed calculation of the monomer reactivity ratio . the result are discussed in term of a reaction mechanism consisting of initiation , propagation , and chain transfer reaction . A molecular mechanic analysis on model metallocene complex , a possible intermediate for the propene polymerization , in which the two coordination position available for the monomer and the growing chain are diastereotopic , is presented . the energy difference between the corresponding diastereoisomeric preinsertion intermediate appears to be relevant for the model complex based on the meso-ethylenebis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl) ligand ( 1 ) , the isopropylidene[(3-methyl(e5-cyclopen > r tadienyl))(e5-9-fluorenyl) ligand ( 2 ) , and the rac-ethylene[1-(e5-9-fluorenyl)-1-phenyl-2-(e 5-1-indenyl ) ] ligand ( 3 ) , while it appears to be small for those based on the rac-ethylene[1-(e5-cyclopentadienyl)-1-phenyl-2-(e 5-1-indenyl ) ] ligand ( 4 ) . it is suggested that these energy difference can be related to an increased probability of a back - skip of the growing chain toward the outward coordination position after the monomer insertion and prior to the coordination of a new olefin molecule . the kinetic competition between the back - skip of the chain outwards and the monomer coordination is able to rationalize the kind of defect in prevailingly hemi-isotactic chain obtained with system based on <nUm> , a well a the increased stereoregularity at decreasing monomer concentration for system based on <nUm> ( not shown by system based on <nUm> ) . the molecular mechanic analysis show that the nonbonded interaction are also able to account for the influence of the ethylene bridge conformation on the stereospecificity of the propene polymerization in ansa - zirconocene complex . none the polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) , initiated by zirconocene complex cp2 - ZrMe2 ( 1 ) and [Cp2ZrMe(THF)][BPh4] ( 2 ) , provides partially syndiotactic poly(methyl methacrylate ) ( PMMA ) in high yield and with a narrow molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) . the kinetics of this process were studied and reveal that in this system , the rate of initiation is much slower than that of propagation . initiation appears to involve the rate - limiting reaction of complex <nUm> with monomer to generate a cationic enolate complex ( 3 ) . the latter compound also initiate polymerization of MMA , albeit at a much slower rate than that observed using initiator <nUm> and <nUm> . the mechanism for propagation in polymerization initiated by complex <nUm> and <nUm> ha a rate - limiting step involving the reaction of neutral zirconium enolate specie ( 4 ) , produced in situ from <nUm> and <nUm> , with monomer , activated by coordination to complex <nUm> . neutral enolate complex <nUm> and complex <nUm> function a effective initiator of MMA polymerization in which the rate of initiation is greater than or equal to the rate of propagation . under these condition . PMMA can be produced with very narrow MWD and the polymerization process is living at or below <nUm> ° C . the rate of this process is highly sensitive to the presence of impurity and thus the degree of polymerization is practically limited by initiator concentration . the polymerization of MMA , using initiator <nUm> and <nUm> , in the presence of trialkylaluminum compound wa studied with a view to overcoming these limitation . alkylaluminum compound appear to act a chain transfer termination reagent in these polymerization , although the rate of this process is much slower than the rate of propagation . In particular , triisobutylaluminum can be used to purify monomer and solvent and allows production of PMMA with a narrow MWD at high conversion . the polymerization of n-butyl acrylate ( BuA ) , initiated by complex <nUm> and <nUm> , wa studied . poly(n - butyl acrylate ) ( P(BuA) ) can be prepared in high yield at low temperature with a narrow MWD . this process is not living and the principal termination process involves back - biting cyclization a revealed by MALDI - TOF mass spectrum of low-MW polymer . At higher temperature , the growing chain are deactivated by this process and also by competitive a-hydrogen transfer , such that high monomer conversion are not obtained . the zirconocene coupling of conjugated dines is a versatile route to a new family of polymer with primarily cross-conjugated structure . this partially cross-conjugated and irregular structure result in the relatively wide band gap of the polymer which appear to be responsible for the observed emission of blue light . A kinetic study of the ethylene-styrene copolymerization in the presence of rac-(ethylenebis-(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride activated by MAO show the peculiar behavior of this catalytic system that is known to produce crystalline nearly alternating copolymer . some inference on the monomer - metal interaction are made on the basis of this study . the parallel investigation on the catalyst based on isopropylidene(1-cyclopentadienyl)(9-fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride allows u to produce a stereoregular nearly alternating ethylene-styrene copolymer also with this catalytic system . the same main tacticity seems to characterize the copolymer obtained with the C2 and Cs symmetric catalyst in accordance with the generally accepted mechanism of stereocontrol in the 1-alkene polymerization . cationic metallocene / borate catalyst , generated from zirconocene dimethyl compound , LnZrMe2 , and anilinium borate , [HNMe2Ph]+[B(C6F5)4] - , were used to polymerize 5-amino-1-pentenes and one 4-amino-1-butene with dimethyl , diethyl , diisopropyl , or diphenyl substitution pattern on nitrogen . the monomer 5-(N,N-diisopropylamino)-1-pentene showed the highest activity with Cp*2ZrMe2 / borate and wa used for all further investigation . the catalytic system Cp*2ZrMe2 / borate wa <nUm> time more active than the corresponding methylaluminoxane - based system and <nUm> time more active than the heterogeneous system , Cl3Ti / Al(i-Bu)3 . 1-Hexene and 5-(N,N-diisopropylamino)-1-pentene were polymerized with Cp*2ZrMe2 and rac-ethylenebis(tetrahydroindenyl) zirconium dimethyl , rac-EB(THI)-ZrMe2 . polymerization of both monomer with Cp*2ZrMe2 displayed similar activity . hexene polymerization with rac - EB(THI)ZrMe2 were <nUm> time more active than those with aminopentene . 5-(N,N-Diisopropylamino)-1-pentene polymerization gave rise to isotactic poly(aminopentene) with C2 symmetric catalyst , syndiotactic polymer with a Cs symmetric catalyst , and atactic polymer with achiral catalyst precursor . synthesis of " meso " - and " racemic " - like diastereomers of Me2Si(3-MeInd)(Ind)ZrCl2 ( <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) wa achieved through either metathetical reaction between the dianion of Me2(3-MeIndH)-(IndH) ( 4 ) with Cl4Zr or via amine elimination reaction , followed by fractional crystallization . propylene polymerization using meso-5 in the presence of methyl aluminoxane under a variety of condition lead to the formation of low molecular weight , semicrystalline , low tacticity , poly(propylene) ( PP ) . the dominant chain transfer mechanism in this case is shown to involve b-H transfer to monomer . In contrast , rac-6 provides higher molecular weight , semicrystalline , elastomeric poly(propylene) ( elPP ) under a variety of condition ; chain transfer in this case involves , predominantly , b-H transfer to Zr . the property of elPP produced using catalyst <nUm> show a gradual change from a lightly , cross-linked elastomer to a poorly crystalline thermoplastic , depending on both polymer molecular weight and crystallinity a revealed by differential scanning calorimetry and tensile testing . In particular , more crystalline material exhibit a higher initial modulus , yielding behavior and lower strain to break than le crystalline material of equivalent molecular weight . these finding further define polymer property for the synthesis of flexible elastomer using this class of catalyst . the zirconocene complex CP2ZrMe2 and Cp*2ZrMe2 activated with BC18F15 initiate the carbocationic polymerization of isobutene and isobutene - isoprene copolymerizations to IIR rubber at temperature a high a <nUm> ° C . unlike conventional metal halide initiator , these metallocene - based initiator system produce both homo- and copolymer of broadly similar molecular weight . copolymer prepared in the presence of ca. <nUm> mol % isoprene show a diene incorporation rate of <nUm> - <nUm> % , with the typical 1,4-trans structure . comparison of the effectiveness of zirconocene dialkyls with that of the metallocene hydrolysis product Cp*2Zr(OH)2 and (Cp2ZrMe)2(m-O) in the presence of BC18F15 suggests that initiation by trace of proton is le efficient than initiation by cationic metallocene alkyl specie , while oxo-bridged complex (Cp'2ZrMe)2(m-O) / B(C6F 5)3 ( cp' = CH or C5H4SiMe3 ) are inactive . A possible rationalization of the dependence of regiospecificity of propene polymerization for catalytic system based on C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocenes ( and hafnocenes ) on the p-ligand alkyl substitution is presented . with this aim , model of preinsertion intermediate and transition state for primary and secondary monomer insertion reaction are compared through molecular mechanic analysis . the nonbonded energy contribution to the regioselectivity , a well a the enantioselectivities of regioregular and regioirregular insertion step have been investigated . nonbonded energy interaction are able to account for the increase of regiospecificity experimentally observed for zirconocene - based catalytic system when the p-ligands are alkyl substituted in position <nUm> or <nUm> a well a the decrease of regiospecificity observed when the p-ligands are dimethyl substituted in position <nUm> and <nUm> . the property of three elastomeric stereoblock polypropylene ( PP ) sample made with unbridged 2-phenylindene zirconocene catalyst were investigated . one of the characteristic of these catalyst is the ability to control the structure and property of the polypropylene by manipulation of the reaction condition . sample PP1 and PP2 were prepared to have similar tacticities ( a indicated by IR and NMR spectroscopy ) yet different molecular weight . the molecular weight of PP2 is approximately half the molecular weight of PP1 . sample PP3 ha a molecular weight similar that of PP2 but is lower in isotactic pentad content . all three sample were separated into fraction that differ in their solubility in boiling ether and heptane . the fractionation appeared to be governed by tacticity and molecular weight . thermal analysis by differential scanning calorimetry showed very broad melting endotherms . the broadness of the transition and the relatively large standard deviation calculated for the enthalpy of fusion are indicative of a multiphase material . x-ray powder diffraction pattern of the three sample and their fraction ( except the ether - soluble fraction ) all showed characteristic peak of the α crystalline phase . the heptane - insoluble fraction of both PP1 and PP2 also exhibited g-phase reflection , whereas in the heptane - soluble fraction , that reflection is le evident . tensile test performed on PP1 and PP2 yielded a similar tensile modulus for the two , indicating similar degree of crystallinity . PP1 exhibited better recovery property , a measured in test at <nUm> % and <nUm> % elongation . A kinetic model for chain propagation that can account for reaction order higher than one on monomer concentration , observed for several insertion polymerization , is discussed . this model is based on the presence of a ` single - center , two - state catalyst ' system , where the slower state is of lower energy and the interconversion rate between the two state is intermediate between the fast and slow propagation rate . this kinetic model fit available experimental data on polymerization rate , a a function of propene concentration , in the presence of zirconocene catalyst . different possibility for the chemical nature of the two catalyst state are discussed . the solid - state structure and physical behavior of an elastomeric polypropylene ( PP1 ) synthesized with unbridged 2-phenylindene zirconocene catalyst were examined using solid - state 13C NMR spectroscopy , differential scanning calorimetry , wide - angle x-ray powder diffraction , and birefringence measurement of relaxation behavior . extraction of these elastomeric polypropylene with boiling ether and heptane yielded three fraction of different molecular weight and tacticity . the ether - soluble fraction is the lowest in isotactic pentad content and exhibit no detectable crystallinity . for the other fraction and the parent homopolymer , the degree of crystallinity estimated from DSC and WAXD result are similar . the amount of the immobile phase determined by solid - state NMR , however , appears much higher than the degree of crystallinity . an increase in temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C result in a loss in the relative fraction of mobile and immobile phase a measured by solid - state NMR and a corresponding loss in the percent crystallinity a measured by DSC . the relaxation of polymer sample subjected to step shear a a function of increasing temperature wa investigated using polarized optical birefringence measurement . these study revealed that the elastic network remains stable up to temperature of <nUm> ° C . blend of atactic and isotactic polypropylene with similar average isotactic pentad content a PP1 and it heptane - insoluble fraction were examined in comparison . despite their similar taciticities and degree of crystallinity , the blend show no evidence of a network structure after being subjected to a step shear but instead relax back to an isotropic orientation . RHF / 3-21G ab initio , density functional theory ( B3LYP / 3-21G ) , and single - point calculation using an effective core potential ( B3LYP / 6-31G*-ECP(S) / / 3-21G ) are performed for different mechanism of polymerization of acrylic acid and methyl acrylate by dicyclopentadienyl-zirconocene enolate complex . polymerization is considered involving a cationic zirconocene complex and a neutral zirconocene complex , respectively . In addition , a mechanism proposed by collins is treated which involves a neutral and a cationic zirconocene complex in the CC bond - forming step at the same time . catalytic cycle can be devised in all case which suggest that all three mechanism may be realizable under suitable condition . however , the ' bimetallic ' mechanism proposed by collins show the lowest energy of activation for the propagation step . it is shown that bridging of the cyclopentadienyl ring should be important not only with respect to reactivity but also with respect to the possible catalytic cycle . methyl methacrylate is not included in the treatment ; i.e. , the problem of tacticity in these polymerization is not addressed . an experiment wa conducted to show the presence of ethylene a catalyst reactivator in the propene - styrene copolymerization . the copolymerizations have been performed by bubbling the gaseous monomer at atmospheric pressure into a flask containing a styrene solution of the prototypical ansa - zirconocene complex rac-(ethylene)bis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride activated by methylalumoxane . In structure A one tertiary carbon atom bearing the phenyl ring is surrounded in both side by sequence of two methylene group while in structure B the junction is characterized by the presence of two tertiary carbon atom bearing the phenyl ring separated by three methylene group . by reducing the styrene content in the comonomer feed composition ( [E] / [P] / [S] ) <nUm> / <nUm> / <nUm> in the liquid phase ) a copolymer with a <nUm> % styrene unit is obtained . the result reported show that it is possible to introduce some styrene unit in an isotactic polypropylene sequence by using a small amount of ethylene to reactivate the catalyst after the styrene insertion . the synthesis and polymerization behavior of a new C1 - symmetric bridged indenyl-fluorenyl zirconocene dimethylsilylene [9-fluorenyl][(2,4,7-trimethyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) is reported . the complex when activated by MAO wa found to polymerize ethylene and propylene , although the activity and stereoselectivity of <nUm> for propylene were found to be lower than for the previously prepared ethylene-bridged analogue <nUm> and several other ethylene-bridged precursor . it ha been found that , depending on both the substitution pattern on the indenyl ligand and the nature of the bridge in this series of asymmetric zirconocenes , polypropylene with varying microstructures from aspecific to highly isospecific are obtained . the propylene polymerization behavior of the new complex ha been studied in detail , and the mechanistic aspect of polymerization are discussed . various technique were applied to study thermoplastic elastomeric polypropylene derived from oscillating bis(2-phenylindenyl)zirconocene in order to provide information on the morphology of this stereoblock polymer . multiple melting fraction in the differential scanning calorimetry scan of thermally fractionated sample characterized the polydispersity of the crystallizable block length . crystal morphology of these material and their change during and after tensile extension were observed using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) . In addition , AFM and acid digestion study provided estimated of the crystallizable sequence length in these elastomer . polymerization of 1-hexene or 1-octene under high pressure ( 100-1000 MPa ) wa investigated using permethylated ansa - metallocenes / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a catalyst system . besides the known zirconocene complex ( <nUm> , Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)2ZrCl2 ) , dialkylsilyene- and dimethyl-germylene-bridged hafnocene dichloride , R2E(e5-C5Me4)2HfCl2 ( <nUm> , r = me , e = Si ; <nUm> , r = et , e = Si ; <nUm> , r = vinyl , e = Si ; <nUm> , r = me , e = Ge ) , were synthesized and structurally characterized . the catalytic activity of the ansa - metallocenes wa remarkably enhanced under high pressure despite their very congested structure . poly(1-hexene) with unprecedented high molecular weight such a mw = <nUm> × <nUm> ( mw / Mn = <nUm> , by GPC ) wa obtained under <nUm> MPa with <nUm> . study on termination reaction revealed that the bimolecular chain - transfer process ( b-hydrogen transfer to olefin ) is much accelerated under <nUm> MPa in <nUm> , while b-hydrogen elimination to metal is still major termination process in <nUm> . this indicated that two complex that have same structure but central metal showed quite different high - pressure effect . Cp2ZrCl2 is presented a both an effective photoinitiator and additive for radical photopolymerization reaction in aerated condition . this compound is characterized by remarkable property : ( i ) an efficiency higher than that of a reference type I photoinitiator ( 2,2-dimethoxy-2-phenylacetophenone , DMPA ) , ( ii ) an excellent ability , when added to DMPA , to overcome the oxygen inhibition of the polymerization , and ( iii ) a never reported in situ photoinduced and oxygen - mediated formation of zirconium - based nanoparticles ( diameter ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> nm ) . the photochemical property of Cp2ZrCl2 are investigated by steady state photolysis and electron spin resonance ( ESR ) experiment . the high reactivity of this compound is ascribed to a bimolecular homolytic substitution H2S ( clearly characterized by molecular orbital calculation ) which convert the peroxyls into new polymerization - initiating radical and oxygenated Zr - based nanoparticles . ( matrix presented ) the zirconocene - catalyzed enantioselective methylalumination of terminal alkene is greatly accelerated in the presence of water . terminal olefin that are inert under the standard condition can be readily methylated in good yield and with good to high enantioselectivities . furthermore , methylaluminoxane is also shown to accelerate the reaction , albeit at a lesser rate . ( equation presented ) addition of " zirconocene " to 1-alkynylphosphonates give three - membered zirconacylces that can be hydrolyzed to cis-vinylphosphonates or further reacted with alkyne / hydrolysis to give substituted (Z,E)- and (E,E)-1,3-butadienylphosphonates . matrix presented the addition of stoichiometric quantity of water accelerates both the trimethylaluminum - mediated aromatic claisen reaction and the chiral zirconocene - catalyzed asymmetric carboalumination of terminal alkene . the two reaction occur in a tandem sequence resulting in the selective formation of two new C-C and one C-O bond after oxidative quench of the intermediate trialkylalane . ( equation presented ) hydrozirconation of internal and terminal alkyne followed by in situ transmetalation to dimethylzinc and treatment with diiodomethane lead to chain extended allylic organometallics . addition to n-phosphinoyl or n-sulfonyl aldimines provides homoallylic amine in 48-87 % yield and <nUm> : <nUm> to > <nUm> : <nUm> diastereomeric ratio favoring anti-products . ( equation presented ) the ring contraction induced by treatment of 4-vinylfuranosides with zirconocene in the presence of boron trifluoride etherate can be rendered highly diastereoselective by proper adjustment of substituent stereochemistry . the two competing transition state that are seemingly involved appear to be usefully sensitive to nonbonded steric interaction . ( matrix presented ) copolymerization of bis(4-vinylbenzylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride and styrene in a test tube , followed by extraction of the bulk polymer and slicing into " disk " <nUm> mm thick and <nUm> mm in diameter , give a supported zirconocene specie that exhibit both stoichiometric and catalytic chemical activity . the disk catalyze reaction of trimethylaluminum and phenylacetylene to give a-methylstyrene with modest turnover number and are active over at least six recycling . equation presented A stereoselective synthesis of the indole alkaloid dihydrocorynantheol ( 1 ) from indole-3-acetic acid ha been achieved by a sequence involving <nUm> a a key intermediate . the synthesis of the unsaturated lactam ring in <nUm> highlight a series of catalytic organometallic reaction featuring two ring - closing metathesis and a zirconocene - catalyzed carbomagnesation . since no protecting group were used , the present synthesis of <nUm> is exceedingly concise , consisting of only eight distinct operation . ( matrix presented ) A zirconocene - mediated ring contraction of 4-vinylfuranosides generated either from d-arabinose or d-glucose is followed by sequential oxidation to the ketone and alkynyl grignard addition . the resulting cis-cyclobutanediols are subjected in turn to thermal rearrangement and intramolecular oxymercuration-demercuration . the regiochemistry of the final ring closure is controlled by the nature of r . ( matrix presented ) commercially available 1-bromobenzocyclobutene is a potentially useful synthon particularly with the application of organometallic methodology . here we show that it is readily converted into cp 2Zr(benzocyclobutadiene) , which couple with alkyne or nitrile giving five - membered zirconacycles . treatment of these alkyne- or nitrile - derived zirconacycles with ClCu yield substituted naphthalene , isoquinolines , or in the presence of MeO2C-CC-CO2Me , a 2-benzazocine containing an eight - membered ring . ( matrix presented ) hydrozirconation of alkyne followed by in situ transmetalation to dimethylzinc and 1,2-addition to activated ketone and n-diphenylphosphinoylimines lead to tertiary allylic alcohol and amine in high overall yield . with 8-phenylmenthol a the chiral auxiliary , si - face attack proceeds in good to excellent diastereoselectivities . none ( matrix presented ) In this study , it wa demonstrated for the first time that a phosphazirconocene catalyzes the ring opening of epoxides with TMSCI . this reactivity lead to a facile preparation of chlorohydrins . the late transition metal Fe analogue wa found to catalyze the reaction at rate and stereoselectivity comparable to those of the Zr complex . ( matrix presented ) A very efficient method for the synthesis of benz[f]indenone derivative wa developed . this method allows the introduction of a variety of substituents to a molecule . the first zirconocene compound of benz[f]indene wa synthesized . ( equation presented ) A new , convenient , one - pot protocol is described for oxidation of zirconocyclopent-2-enes selectively at the sp <nUm> carbon by efficient transfer to electrophilic ( c HeX ) <nUm> BCl followed by oxidation with H <nUm> O <nUm> / HNaO to afford 1-alkylidene-2-hydroxymethylcyclopentanes . result with several substrate show that overall reaction efficiency for the zirconocene - mediated enyne cyclization , boron transmetalation , and oxidation sequence are generally comparable to yield obtained from protonation of intermediate zirconocycles . the formation of e / z olefin isomer from the cyclization - oxidation sequence and an acid - catalyzed pinacol - type rearrangement of a vinylsilane are described . ( equation presented ) Cul*0.75DMS complex is an excellent catalyst for the direct conjugate addition of alkenyl group from vinylzirconocene reagent to ab-unsaturated aldehyde and ketone . the presence of the catalyst with an alkenylzirconocene , at + <nUm> ° C in THF , circumvents the need for making discrete alkenylcopper reagent . the catalyst is superior in term of product yield and alkene flexibility in comparison to other copper (I) source a well a the nickel (II) - catalyzed conjugate addition . this simple one - pot procedure show that only <nUm> equiv of the vinylzirconocene is needed . ( matrix presented ) allylzirconium reagent are effective for radical allylation of a-halo carbonyl compound . the key step would be homolytic cleavage of the zirconium-carbon bond and halogen abstraction by the resulting Cp2ZrCI(III) . zirconocene - olefin complex can be also utilized for the allylation of a-halo compound . ( chemical equation presented ) A synthetic route to select cyclooctane-1,2,3-triols and 1,2,3,4,5-pentaols ha been defined . the starting material are d-glucose or d-arabinose , and the key step consist of a zirconocene - promoted ring contraction , a [3,3] sigmatropic rearrangement , and more extended functionalization of the resulting cyclooctadienone . ( chemical equation presented ) hydrozirconation of terminal alkyne , followed by AgClO <nUm> - catalyzed in situ addition of the resultant alkenylzirconocenes to 1,2-anhydrosugars ( glycal epoxides ) lead to a-C-glycosides in moderate to high yield . ( equation presented ) multicomponent condensation of N- diphenylphosphinoylimines , alkyne , zirconocene hydrochloride , and diiodomethane provides a rapid access to o-unsaturated dicyclopropylmethylamines . these novel building block are converted into heterocyclic 5-azaspiro[2.4]heptanes , 5-azaspiro-[2.5]octanes , and 5-azaspiro[2.6]nonanes by mean of selective ring - closing metathesis , epoxide opening , or reductive amination . the resulting functionalized pyrrolidines , piperidines , and azepines are scaffold of considerable relevance for chemistry - driven drug discovery . an asymmetric route from the epimeric b-hydroxy ester <nUm> and <nUm> to the densely functionalized (+)-10 and (-)-10 , respectively , is described . either cyclobutanol can be made available a the predominant product . the levorotatory antipode ha been transformed into the advanced intermediate <nUm> bearing side chain destined to become incorporated into the cyclononene ring of the title compound ( 1 ) . A new regio- and stereoselective zirconocene - catalyzed reaction for the synthesis of medium - sized ring is described . the global reaction supposes a formal ring expansion of a cyclic enol ether to give a functionalized carbocycle . trimeric diphenylanthracene macrocycles were synthesized via the zirconocene - mediated coupling of 9,10-bis-[4-trimethylsilyl(ethynyl)phenyl] anthracene . the macrocycles feature a strained architecture due to orientation of the anthracene unit into the plane of the macrocycle . the demetalated cyclophane exhibit a considerably higher flexibility in solution , while the zirconocene - containing macrocycle is quite rigid . ( figure presented ) A one - pot synthesis of pyrrolo[3,2-d]pyridazine derivative via zirconocene - mediated four - component coupling of one Si - tethered diyne , two nitrile , and one azide is reported . when TMSN3 wa used , pyrrole-2,3-diones were formed in good yield . further condensation of these highly functionalized pyrrole-2,3-diones with hydrazine and hydroxylamine afforded useful pyrrole - fused heterocycle . stereoselective synthesis of the northern and the southern fragment <nUm> and <nUm> of leupyrrin A1 are reported . the convergent preparation of <nUm> is highlighted by a zirconocene - mediated one - pot cyclization - regioselective opening of an advanced diyne while the route to <nUm> involves a krische allylation and a one - pot sharpless dihydroxylation-cyclization . comparison of the spectroscopic data with those reported for the natural product support a relative stereochemical assignment within these heterocycle . ( chemical equation presented ) A new , mild , one - pot method for the synthesis of cyclobutabenzenes by the zirconium - promoted cross-coupling reaction of aryllithium compound and alkenyl bromide is reported . formation of an arynezirconocene complex and it regioselective coupling with an alkenyl bromide are the key step of the process . this method allows the regio- and diastereoselective synthesis of functionalized cyclobutabenzene derivative from simple and easily available starting material . heating grey selenium with [e5-C5H4(t-Bu)]2Zr(C6H4(p-OCH3))2in boiling octane affords the diselenophenylenezirconocene complex containing a methoxy group in the ortho position . A similar reaction , although le selective , occurs when starting from [e5-C5H4(t-Bu)]2Zr-(C6H4(p-CH3))2 . the structure of the diselenophenylenezirconocenes obtained were confirmed by NMR spectroscopy and definitively proved by comparison with the authentic orthosubstituted derivative prepared from the corresponding methyl-o-anisyl- and methyl-o-tolylzirconocene . the mechanism proposed to explain this transformation involves the activation of a tert-butyl C — H bond by a transient benzynezirconocene specie . the cyclometalation product , which is obtained by heating the diphenylzirconocene , reacts toward selenium and unsaturated organic compound like the benzynezirconocene but the reaction take place at room temperature . the cyclometalation pathway allows a more sterically hindered selenium - containing derivative [e5-C5H4(t-Bu)]2ZrSe2C6H3(o,o'-(CH3)2) to be prepared . the new diselenophenylenezirconocenes described are good precursor to generate benzodiselenagermoles and related spiro compound by a zirconium - germanium transmetalation reaction . all the new product synthesized , zirconocene complex and cyclometalated derivative , benzodiselenagermoles , and spirobisbenzodiselenagermoles , were identified by the multinuclear NMR method and mass spectrometry . the structure of the cyclometalated product [e5-C5H4(t-Bu)]Zr[(2,5-(CH3)2C6H3)(e1:e5-CH2C(CH3)2C5H4)] wa determined by x-ray diffraction analysis . this compound crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21 / c with two molecule per asymmetric unit with cell dimension a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , and β = <nUm> ° at <nUm> K . least - square refinement led to a value for the final r index of <nUm> for <nUm> reflection with I > 2s(I) . the titanium and zirconium complex ( e5- C5H5)2M(OAr)2 ( m = Ti , Zr ; Ar = C6H5 , p-MeOC6H4 , p-MeC6H4,p-ClC6H4 , p-CNC6H4 are shown to be convenient , stable precursor of dehydrocoupling catalyst . their reaction with a primary silane , at <nUm> ° C or below , generate active catalyst for RSiH3 dehydrocoupling at <nUm> ° C . all - electron RHF and RMP2 ab initio calculation with split valence basis set of double- and triple-x quality have been used to study reaction path for the reaction of acetylene ( 1 ) with the model compound Cl2ZrH+ ( 2 ) and Cl2ZrCH3+ ( 3 ) . At the RMP2 / / RHF level the insertion process is calculated to have a barrier of <nUm> ( 2 ) and <nUm> kcal / mol ( 3 ) with respect to complexed acetylene and to be <nUm> ( 2 ) and <nUm> kcal / mol ( 3 ) exothermic with respect to free acetylene . the transition state ( TS ) are four membered cycle . the product and TS of Cl2ZrCH3(C2H2)+ are stabilized through an agostic interaction . the calculated energetics of the reaction path are compared with available theoretical a well a experimental data for insertion of unsaturated hydrocarbon into metal — r ( r = H , CH3 ) σ bond . on the basis of extended huckel calculation a MO picture of the insertion path is provided for the reaction of acetylene with Cp2ZrH+ and Cp2ZrCH3+ . the crystal and molecular structure of the C2 symmetric rac-(EBI)ZrCl2(1r) [ monoclinic , space group I2 / c , no. <nUm> , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° ] and of it meso isomer ( <nUm> m ) [ monoclinic , space group P21 / n , no. <nUm> , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° ] have been solved . 1r is in the indenyl-forward ( ∏ ) conformation , a is the case for most of the chiral ansa ethylene-bridged bisindenyl-type metallocenes . In solution however , already at room temperature there is a rapid ( NMR time scale ) interconversion between the two ∏ and Y ( indenyl-backward ) conformation , a shown by conformational analysis on the proton spectrum of the bridge methylene . this equilibrium is shifted toward the lower energy conformation δ at lower temperature and is influenced by both the solvent and the s-ligands . the solid state structure of <nUm> m show that this meso form is actually in a chiral conformation ( C1 symmetry ) because of the staggered placement of the two indenyl ligand ( Ind[?]Ind = <nUm> ° ) . In solution this aspecific zirconocene give a perfectly symmetric 1H NMR spectrum , indicating that , a in the case of the rac - isomer , there is a rapid interconversion between the two equienergetic In contrast , the weakly lewis acidic boron center in <nUm> ( 11B NMR ; δ <nUm> ppm ) doe not show a bonding interaction between the alkoxy ligand on the zirconocene fragment and the boron center . the synthesis of a variety of nonbridged optically active C2- and C1 - symmetric titanocenes and zirconocenes is reported together with a detailed investigation of the ability of these complex to effect the catalytic asymmetric hydrogenation of 2-phenyl-1-butene and 2-(a-naphthyl)-1-butene . the respective dihydro product are shown to be produced with enantiomeric excess ranging from <nUm> % to <nUm> % . the absolute configuration of these 2-arylbutanes wa noted to be sensitive to the three - dimensional characteristic of the particular bicyclo - fused ligand involved . for a series of verbenone - related metallocenes , an increase in the size of a substituent positioned a and syn to the metal center wa found to be unfavorable for stereoinduction . this phenomenon ha been rationalized in transition state term , with the alkene approaching laterally to engage in hydrogen atom transfer . the three - dimensional stereochemical model advanced in explanation of the observed catalytic selectivity underscore the development of steric bias during olefin coordination to the reactive metal hydride intermediate . tandem mass spectrometry method were used to assign the structure of C10H10Zr*+ ion produced by electron impact ionization of C12H16Zr and [(C5H5)2ZrO]2 . the result were consistent with the formation of the zirconocenium radical - cation . the neutralization - reionization mass spectrum of this specie showed a recovery signal , indicating that neutral monomeric zirconocene had been generated in the gas phase . the formation of η <nUm> -imine-zirconocene complex ( zirconaziridines ) ( cp <nUm> Zr(NR <nUm> CR <nUm> r <nUm> ) by elimination of r <nUm> H from cp <nUm> Zr(R <nUm> )(NR <nUm> CHR <nUm> r <nUm> ) ha been investigated with regard to the variation in r <nUm> , r <nUm> , r <nUm> , and r <nUm> , in particular by making use of hammett type structure / rate correlation ( r <nUm> , r <nUm> , r <nUm> = p-XC <nUm> H <nUm> , x = me <nUm> N , MeO , H , Cl , CO <nUm> me ; r <nUm> , ρ = <nUm> ; r <nUm> , ρ = <nUm> ; r <nUm> , = − <nUm> ) . the elimination is first order in the zirconocene complex , ha a deuterium isotope effect for the hydrogen eliminated of <nUm> at <nUm> ° C , and kinetic study on cp <nUm> Zr(Me)(NPhCHMe <nUm> ) give the activation parameter DH ‡ = <nUm> kJ mol − <nUm> and DS ‡ = − <nUm> J K − <nUm> mol − <nUm> for the elimination of methane .
