(2-Methylcyclopenta[l]phenanthryl)2ZrCl2 and (2-phenylcyclopenta[l]phenanthryl)2ZrCl2 were synthesized and used , after activation with MAO , a catalyst for the polymerization of propene . the resulting polymer had low isotacticities ( 8-18 % [mmmm] ) . ligand rotation barrier for the corresponding zr-dibenzyl derivative were determined by dynamic NMR spectroscopy . pathway and transition state for ligand rotation in this series of complex were studied by molecular - mechanic calculation and are discussed in relation to the microstructure of the respective polymer product . the zirconocene e2-formaldehyde dimer <nUm> reacts with trialkylchlorosilanes R3SiCl ( r = ethyl , methyl , isopropyl ) to yield the (e2-(trialkylsiloxy)methyl)zirconocene chloride complex cp2- Zr(Cl)CH2OSiR3 ( 7a-c ) . these complex exhibit internal o-coordination ; they belong to a metallaoxirane structural type . thermolysis of 7b,c at <nUm> ° C lead to equilibration with the isomer 8b,c and 9b,c . complex <nUm> are the acyclic Cp2Zr(Cl)CH2OSiR3 isomer of <nUm> , whereas dyotropic rearrangement ha resulted in the formation of the Cp2Zr(Cl) OCH2SiR3 product <nUm> . the kinetics of the thermally induced rearrangement of 7b ( r = CH3 ) is described by a 8b ⇌ 7b → 9b kinetic scheme . At <nUm> ° C the k(8b ⇌ 7b ) equilibrium constant is <nUm> . the gibbs activation energy of the 7b → 8b isomerization at <nUm> ° C is DG ‡ isom(383 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 . the activation barrier of the 7b -9b transformation is in the expected range of a concerted dyotropic rearrangement process at DG ‡ dyo(383 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 . treatment of <nUm> with triphenylchlorosilane ha resulted in the direct formation of the acyclic addition product Cp2Zr(Cl)CH2OSiPh3 ( 8d ) . our study underline the important participation of metallaoxirane type structure in dyotropic rearrangement system . two general synthetic route for the preparation of ethylene-bridged ansa - zirconocene dichloride rac-[1-(e5-Cp1)-1-R1-2-(e5-Cp2)-2-R2-C2H2]ZrCl2 ( 6a-c ) bearing different cyclopentadienyl fragment [ Cp1,Cp2 = cp ( cyclopentadienyl ) , ind ( indenyl ) , flu ( fluorenyl ) ] and a variable bridge substitution pattern ( R1 , R2 = H , ph ) are described , using chiral epoxides a starting material . diastereomeric complex were separated by crystallization . the solidstate structure of two representative example are reported . In combination with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) , rac-[1-(e5-9-fluorenyl)-2-(e5-1-indenyl)ethane]ZrCl2 ( 6a ) , carrying no bulky bridge substituent , and the diastereomeric system rac-[1- (e5-9-fluorenyl)-1(R,S)-phenyl-2-(e5-1(R,S)-indenyl)ethane]ZrCl2 ( 6b1 = RR,SS ; 6b2 = RS,SR ) , showing different bridge conformation , were used for propene polymerization . the stereoselectivity depends on monomer concentration for all three unsymmetric catalyst . under comparable condition 6a and 6b <nUm> produce polypropene with significantly different stereoregularities . this demonstrates the importance of a defined bridge conformation for the design of highly stereoselective catalyst . page <nUm> . figure <nUm> and the text should reflect that the distance between the Zr atom and ha in 6b and 7b ha been calculated to be <nUm> Å for 6b and <nUm> Å for 7b . the distance between and Zr amount to <nUm> Å for 6b and <nUm> A for 7b . synthesis of rac-[((1,2,3,4-tetraphenyl-1,3-butadiene-1,4-diyl)germylene)bis(1-e5-indenyl)]dichlorozirconium ( 1 ) wa achieved with substantial suppression of the undesired meso diastereomer a predicted by MM2 force field calculation . the corresponding zirconocenium ion of <nUm> polymerizes propylene with high catalytic activity and stereospecificity to very high molecular weight . the characteristic of this catalysis are essentially independent of polymerization temperature over a broad temperature range . the synthesis of seven new bridged zirconocenes is described , which make isotactic polypropylene when used in polymerization of propylene with methylaluminoxane a cocatalyst . their polymerization behavior in propylene and ethylene polymerization is examined and discussed . aromatic substituents in appropriate position of the zirconocene ligand frame result in catalyst with activity , stereospecificities , and polypropylene molecular weight much higher than those of any previously described metallocene system . by structure variation it is demonstrated that the effectiveness of these substitution strongly depends on their position and on a nonincremental synergism with alkyl substituents on the ligand frame . the high activity of the system can be explained well by electronic effect , whereas steric effect obviously play the more important role for the high stereospecificities and high molecular weight of the polymer . the dimethylsilyl-bridged zirconocene complex (CH3)2Si(benz[e]indenyl)2ZrCl2 ( I ) and (CH3)2Si(2-methylbenz[e]indenyl)2ZrCl2 ( II ) have been synthesized ; the structure of II wa determined by x-ray diffraction . complex I is about <nUm> time more active in polymerizing propene than it bis(indenyl) analog when activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) under otherwise identical condition . the resulting catalyst system polymerizes also the g-branched olefin 3-methyl-1-butene and 3-methyl-1-pentene . polymer produced with complex II have molecular weight about <nUm> time higher than those obtained with complex I under identical condition . the a-methyl substituents of II appear to block those chain termination which arise from b-H transfer directly to a coordinated monomer molecule . treatment of the zirconocene terminal imido complex (CpR)2ZrqqNtBu(THF) ( 1a-THF : r = H ; 1b-TNF : r = me ) with acetylene result in the formation of a dinuclear product , [(CpR)2Zr]2(m-CHCHNtBu)(m-NtBu) ( 3a , r = H ; 3b , r = me ) , in which the zirconium center are bridged by nitrogen and carbon . upon heating , the dinuclear complex <nUm> is cleaved into the azametallacyclobutene (CpR)2Zr(e2-NtBuCHCH) ( 4 ) and the terminal imido complex (CpR)2ZrqqNtBu ( 1 ) , which can be trapped with lewis base or alkyne . heating <nUm> in the absence of trap cleanly produce the alkynyl-bridged specie [(CpR)2ZrNHtBu]2(m-CqqC) ( 5 ) . kinetic data indicate that the dinuclear complex <nUm> fragment into the mononuclear specie <nUm> and <nUm> prior to C-H activation to form <nUm> . the x-ray structure of [Cp2Zr]2(m-CHCHNtBu)-(m-NtBu) ( 3a ) and [Cp2ZrNHtBu]2(m-CqqC) ( 5a ) are reported ; the structure of the dinuclear specie [(Cp2Zr)((CpMe)2Zr)](m-CHCHNtBu)(m-NtBu) ( 3c ) is included in the supporting information . A mixture of Cp2Zr(PMe3) complex of cycloheptadienyne ( 5a-c ) ha been prepared . hydride abstraction from the mixture gave the first example of a zirconium complex of tropyne . reaction of 5a-c with , 2-butyne followed by hydride abstraction gave the first example of a transition - metal metallacycle with the π framework of an azulene . the use of tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane , BC18F15 , a a cocatalyst in the dehydrocoupling of phenylsilane , in the presence of zirconocene - derived catalyst , lead to suppression of chain scission reaction and to an increase in polysilane chain length ( Mn > <nUm> ) . an exhaustive multinuclear NMR study of the catalytic specie lead to the conclusion that they are zirconocene - ( IV ) hydride bridged dimer , with a “ cation - like ” silylium ligand on each zirconium : [Cp2Zr(SiHPh)(m-H)]2[Bu2(C6F5)2B]2 . the synthesis of the Zr primary phosphido complex Cp2Zr(PH(C6H2-2,4,6-t-Bu3))Cl ( 1 ) and Cp2Zr(PH(C6H2-2,4,6-Me3))Cl ( 2 ) from the appropriate LiPHR and <nUm> equiv of Cp2ZrCl2 are described . In reaction of PH2(C6H2-2,4,6-Me3) or PH2SiMe3 with Cp2ZrHCl , the respective bridging - phosphinidene derivative (Cp2ZrCl)2(m2-PC6H2-2,4,6-Me3) ( 3 ) and Cp2Zr(m2-PSiPh3)(m2-e1:e5-C5H4)ZrCpCl ( 4 ) are obtained . these product are planar at phosphorus , indicative of Zr – P p-bonding . reaction of PH(C6H2-2,4,6-t-Bu3) with excess Cp2ZrHCl result in the formation of the planar , trinuclear phosphide complex (Cp2Zr)2(m2-Cl)(m3-P)(ZrCp2Cl) ( 5 ) . this specie <nUm> is also generated from the addition of PH(C6H2-2,4,6-t-Bu3) to a mixture of Cp2ZrCl2 and Mg . the mixed - valent product <nUm> is paramagnetic , exhibiting an EPR spectrum typical of Zr(III)-P specie . under similar reaction condition , but with prolonged exposure to Mg , the diamagnetic phosphide derivative (CpZr(m2-e1:e5-C5H4))3(m3-P) ( 6 ) is obtained . In contrast to <nUm> , the geometry at phosphorus in <nUm> is pyramidal . the terminal phosphinidene complex Cp2Zr(P(C6H2-2,4,6-t-Bu3))(PMe3) ( 7 ) and Cp2Zr(P(C6H2-Me3))(PMe3) ( 8 ) are generated via the reaction of <nUm> or <nUm> with KH and PMe3 . the reaction mechanism operative in the formation of these phosphinidene or phosphide complex are discussed . MO calculation were performed on model of the terminal and bridging phosphinidene complex a well a the planar and pyramidal trinuclear phosphide complex . these study provide insight regarding the structure and bonding in these compound . cumulatively , this work implies that phosphinidene specie are generally highly reactive , exhibiting the ability to induce C – H and P – C activation . crystallographic data are reported herein for compound <nUm> , and <nUm> . compound <nUm> : space group P21 / a with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> : space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> : space group P21 / a with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , and z = <nUm> . reaction of anionic zirconocene e2-aldehyde complex with metal carbonyl lead to rapid and quantitative formation of heterobimetallic complex containing a new carbon-carbon bond , thereby suggesting a modified mechanism for homogeneously catalyzed carbon monoxide hydrogenation . nine new bimetallic complex are reported , including the x-ray structure of(e5-C5H4Me)2Zr(Me){OCH(C6H4Me)C(O)Fe(CO)4}Li-(THF)2 . In this study valence force field parametrizations for zirconocene dichloride complex are reported . the three model developed and investigated provide complete set of parameter that can be used either in standard force field without software extension for the treatment of p-ligands or in force field that can handle the multiple - reference problem encountered in highly symmetric coordination compound a well a in force field where a distributed - force model for the treatment of centrosymmetric ligand is available . the new parameter have been tested with a series of <nUm> nonbridged and <nUm> ansa - metallocene complex . the agreement between x-ray structural data and the result of the three model calculation is excellent . on the average , bond length are reproduced to better than <nUm> pm , bond angle to <nUm> ° , and the torsion angle defining the relative orientation of the ligand in the bent - metallocene conformers to about <nUm> ° for complex exhibiting no significant intermolecular interaction in the solid state . additionally , the new series of parameter set presented allows for a good reproduction of the experimental vibrational data . the intramolecular zirconocene coupling of 4,4-bis(hexyloxymethyl)-1,7-bis-p-halophenyl-1,6-heptadiynes provides 2,5-bis-p-halophenylzirconocyclopentadienes ( bromo and chloro derivative ) , which undergo efficient transmetalation reaction with Br4Ge . methylation of the resulting dihalogermoles with MeLi provided bis-p-halophenyl-2,5-germole monomer . these functionalized germoles were polymerized via nickel coupling to give oligo- and poly(2,5-diphenylgermole) material ( 7 ) . investigation of optical property reveal that the monomer and a model 2,5-bisphenylgermole are somewhat photoluminescent ( φ = <nUm> - <nUm> ) , while the high molecular weight polymer ( Mn ≈ <nUm> ) exhibit very efficient photoemission ( φ = <nUm> ) . electrochemical study indicate that delocalization in <nUm> is accompanied by a modest lowering of the LUMO level relative to that of the monomer . In the presence of excess butylmagnesium chloride and in diethyl ether at <nUm> ° C , zirconocene dichloride is an effective catalyst precursor for the the stereoselective cyclization of nonconjugated dienes containing a terminal alkoxide substituent . the product are carbocyclic ring containing adjacent vinyl and methyl substituents with trans stereochemistry . it ha been shown that the zirconocene complex Cp2Zr(THF)(Me3SiC2SiMe3) readily reacts with disubstituted butadiynes R1C ≡ CC ≡ CR2 ( R1 = R2 = SiMe3 ; R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = tBu or ph ) to form the dimeric symmetrical complex [ Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C ≡ CSiMe3)]2 ( 2 ) and doubly acetylide - bridged , unsymmetrical complex [ Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( m-e1:e2-C ≡ CtBu)ZrCp2 ] ( 3 ) and [ Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C ≡ CSiMe3)(m-e1:e2-C ≡ CPh)ZrCp2 ] ( 4 ) , respectively . the structure of the product ha been established by x-ray structure analysis . the (m-formaldehyde))Cp2ZrCl)2 complex <nUm> reacts with alkyl isocyanides RNC ( r = -CH2SiMe3 , -CMe3 ) with insertion into the Zr — C bond and opening of the metallaoxirane unit by cleavage of the adjacent Zr — O bond to give the “ n-inside ” (if-iminoacyl)zirconocene complex 2(a,b) [ (Cp2ZrCl)C(CH2OZrCp2Cl) = NR ] . this insertion behavior of <nUm> is unusual a compared to the (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer <nUm> that reacts with Me3SiCH2NC without zi — O bond cleavage to give a four - membered metallacyclic (e1-iminoacy)zirconocene complex . the isonitrile insertion product 2a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes in the space group PI with cell parameter a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw2 = <nUm> . the C = N bond length in 2a is <nUm> Å . the adjacent Zr — c(iminoacyl) bond is <nUm> Å . intramolecular cyclization reaction of YCH2- CH = CHCH2XCH2CH = CH2 ( x = CH2 , NPr , NPh ; Y = PhO , MeO ) , which have a terminal double bond and an allylic ether moiety , were catalyzed by zirconocene dichloride ( 10-20 mol % ) in the presence of n-BuMgCl . cyclization product 2-methyl-1-vinyIcyclopentane , 4-methyl-1-propyl-3-vinylpyrrolidine , and 4-methyl-lphenyl-3-vinylpyrrolidine were obtained in <nUm> ‒ <nUm> % yield . stoichiometric cyclization with Cp2ZrBu2 or (C5H3Me2)2ZrBu2 at room temperature gave the same product in high yield after hydrolysis . when an excess of Cp2ZrBu2 wa used , the stereoisomerization of ci product to trans isomer wa observed . an ethylene-bridged zirconocene complex , (Cp2ZrMe)2(CH2CH2) , wa prepared by the reaction of Cp2ZrMe2 with a zirconocene - ethylene complex , [ cp2- ZrEt(CH2 = CH2)]MgBr , and the structure of this complex wa determined by a single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . the structure of this complex showed one methyl group on each zirconium and an ethylene ligand simultaneously coordinating to the two zirconocene moiety . A bis(cyclopentadienyl) ligand containing two ethanediyl bridge is obtained by skattebol rearrangement of the bis(dibromocarbene) adduct of 1,2,5,6-tetramethylenecyclooctane . reaction of it dilithium salt with TiCl3(THF)3 , Cl4Zr , and VCl3(THF)3 afford , after appropriate workup , the corresponding doubly bridged metallocene dichloride . x-ray diffraction study give space group P21 / n for all three of the complex C14Cl2H14Ti and C9Cl2H11Zr , and C14Cl2H14V . dimethylzirconocene ( 4 ) wa treated with <nUm> molar equiv of pyrazole to give methane and (pyrazole-N)methylzirconocene ( 5 ) . treatment of <nUm> with tributylammonium tetraphenylborate gave the cationic (e2-pyrazolyl-N,N')(tetrahydrofuran)zirconocene complex <nUm> , isolated a the tetraphenylborate salt in > <nUm> % yield . the related (e2-pyrazolyl-N-N')(e1-pyrazolyl-N)zirconocene tetraphenylborate salt wa obtained by treating the methylzirconocene cation <nUm> with pyrazole in dichloromethane . cationic (e2-pyrazolyl-N-N')(tetrahydrofuran)zirconocene <nUm> reacts with acetylacetone by proton transfer to give (acetylacetonato)(e1-pyrazole-N)zirconocene tetraphenylborate ( 9 ) . complex <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by x-ray diffraction . complex <nUm> wa employed a a general lewis - acid catalyst in the mukaiyama aldol reaction between [(trimethylsilyl)oxy]cyclopentene and benzaldehyde . the arsenic - functionalized zirconocene arsenido complex [Cp'2Zr{As(SiMe3)2}(Cl)] ( <nUm> ; cp' = C5H4Me ) and [Cp2Zr{As(SiMe3)2}2] ( <nUm> ; cp = CH ) are obtained by the reaction of [Cp'2ZrCl2] or [Cp2ZrCl2] with Li(THF)2As(SiMe3)2 <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by spectroscopy ( IR , NMR , mass spectrum ) and by x-ray structure determination . In <nUm> there are two distinctly different As(SiMe3)2 group and Zr-As bond length ( Zr-As1 = <nUm> Å , Zr-As2 = <nUm> Å ) , indicating the presence of a Zr-As1 single bond and a Zr-As2 double bond . substituted 7-hydroxynorbornenes were prepared in a single step by the reaction of titanocene dichloride with electron - deficient alkene . the reaction is diastereoselective and also exhibit mild regioselectivity . the effect of solvent , added reagent and alkene structure upon the reaction were studied . the reaction is proposed to occur via a metal - assisted oxidative cycloaddition . zirconocene dichloride also reacts with electron - deficient alkene , but yield unoxidized cycloaddition product . the diels — alder reaction between cyclopentadiene and various dienophiles is efficiently catalyzed by cationic zirconocene compound ( e.g. [Cp2Zr(OtBu)THF][BPh4] ( 2 ) ) . the use of catalytic amount of optically pure (S)-[ethylenebis(e-tetrahydroindenyl)]-zirconium tert-butoxide tetrahydrofuran tetraphenylborate ( 3 ) resulted in modest enantioselectivity in this CC bond - forming process . compound ( S ) -3crystallizes in the hexagonal space group P61 : a = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , V = <nUm> A3 , z = <nUm> with r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> for <nUm> observed reflection with F > 6.0s(F) . A model for the facial selectivity observed is presented on the basis of the structure of compound (S)-3 . the interaction of the chiral difunctional ligand (1R,2S,3R)-3-mercapto-1,7,7-trimethylbicyclo-[2.2.1]heptan-2-ol ( 1 ) with group IV metallocene complex affords the product Cp2M(OC10H16S) ( cp = cyclopentadienyl ; m = Ti ( 2 ) or Zr ( 3 ) ; C10H16OS = (1R,2S,3R)-3-thio-1,7,7-trimethylbicyclo-[2.2.1]heptan-2-olato ) . In CDC13 solution , complex <nUm> exists a a mixture of a monomeric specie and an associated dimeric specie . complex <nUm> readily hydrolyzes to give an air - stable complex , [ Cp2Zr(m-O) (m-OC10H16S)ZrCp2 ) ] ( 4 ) . the complex <nUm> crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group P212121 with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , V = <nUm> ( 10 ) A3 , r = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . the complex <nUm> is an oxo-bridged zirconocene dimer that is also bridged by a heterodifunctional ligand . the Zr-O-Zr angle is small at <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , and the Zr ⋯ Zr distance is <nUm> Å . two zirconocene moiety are inequivalent due to the asymmetric difunctional ligand . the related complex [Cp2Zr(m-OCH2CH2S)]2 ( 5 ) wa also prepared . complex <nUm> crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , V = <nUm> ( 7 ) A3 , r = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . the complex <nUm> is a zirconocene dimer bridging through the oxygen atom . the OZr framework is nearly planar with both sulfur atom above the plane by ~ <nUm> Å , and the Zr ⋯ Zr distance at <nUm> Å is somewhat longer than that in complex <nUm> . doubly bridged zirconocene derivative with C2 symmetrically disposed substituents , ((CH3)2-Si)2(3,4-dimethyl-1,2-cyclopentadienediyl)2ZrCl2 ( <nUm> A ) and ((CH3)2Si)2(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1,2-indenediyl)2ZrCl2 ( 4B ) were synthesized by reaction of the corresponding ligand dilithium salt with Cl4Zr in toluene ; the racemic isomer were obtained by fractionated crystallization of the diastereomeric product mixture . x-ray diffraction study give space group P1 with a = <nUm> ( 5 ) Å b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 4 ) ° , β = <nUm> ( 4 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ( 4 ) ° , and z = <nUm> ( two crystallographically independent molecule ) for <nUm> A and space group P21 / n with a = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , and z = <nUm> for 4B . both complex show the expected C2 - axial symmetry . In combination with methylalumoxane , <nUm> A and 4B are slowly converted to catalyst for the polymerization of propene , which yield polymer with low and medium isotacticities , respectively . control experiment indicate that conversion of these complex to active catalyst involves degradation of their strained ligand framework ; intact <nUm> A and 4B do not appear to give rise to catalytic activity . zirconocene complex of two strained cyclopropenes , bicyclo[3.1.0]hex-5-eneandbicyclo[4.1.0]-hept-6-ene , have been prepared by elimination of bicyclo[3.1.0]hexane and bicyclo[4.1.0]heptane from bis-(bicyclo[3.1.0]hexyl)- and bis(bicyclo[4.1.0]heptyl)-zirconocene in the presence of Me3P . the bicycloalkene complex undergo reaction with diphenylacetylene to give reductive coupling product which react with ClH to give bicycloalkyl-substituted cis-stilbenes . the carbon-carbon triple bond in bis[(dialkylamino)(phenylethynyl)boryl]methanes 2a,b can be easily cyclized using zirconocene to give derivative 3a,b of the new pentalene - like 6,8-dibora-3-zirconabicyclo[3.3.0]octa-l,4-diene , containing a zir-conacyclopentadiene ring attached to a 1,3-diboracy-clopentane unit . these heterocycle are characterized by NMR method and by an x-ray structure determination of 3b . compound 3b crystallizes from pentane in the monoclinic space group C2 / c with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> Å <nUm> , and r(calc) = <nUm> Mg / m <nUm> for m = <nUm> g / mol and z = <nUm> . from Cp2ZrCl2 and <nUm> equiv of the appropriate lithium phosphinomethanides (D)Li[HC(PMe2)X] ( d = -,X = PMe2,6 ; d = TMEDA , x = SiMe3,7 ) , the 1,3-zirconaphosphacyclobutane derivative [ formula omitted ] ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) , containing the first example of doubly metalated alkylphosphines a chelating ligand , are formed via the known zirconaphosphacyclopropane derivative [ formula omitted ] ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) . an intramolecular pathway is deduced from a cross-coupling experiment with [ formula omitted ] , <nUm> and <nUm> . In contrast , <nUm> ( x = SiMe3 ) reacts with LiCH2PMe2 ( 5 ) to give the substitution product [ formula omitted ] ( 13 ) . In the case of <nUm> ( x = PMe2 ) , again metalation occurs with LiR ( r = CH3 , CH2PMe2 , tBu ) , thereby generating {Cp2Zr[C(PMe2)2]}2 ( 14 ) . an x-ray diffraction study of the yellow crystal of 14-toluene ( monoclinic , space group P21 / c , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> a,b = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , z = <nUm> , I = <nUm> ° C , rw = <nUm> , [ formula omitted ] show the diphosphinocarbene ligand to function a e2(C,P)-u-(C,P') six - electron ligand to 18e zirconium center . only trace of metalation product are observed , however , in the sterically most crowded system [ formula omitted ] ( 4 ) / (TMEDA){Li[C(PMe2)(SiMe3)2}2 ( 8 ) . instead , an oxidative phosphinomethanide coupling ( PC ) lead to the phosphorus ylide (Me2P)(Me3Si)2CPMe2C(SiMe3)2 ( 15 ) , probably via an external reaction in the ligand sphere . however , a metalation product , [ formula omitted ] ( 17 ) , can be obtained via a more indirect route from [ formula omitted ] ( 9 ) and KCp . insertion of tBuNC into the ZrC bond of <nUm> give the six - membered heterocycle [ formula omitted ] ( 19 ) . all compound were characterized by mean of NMR spectroscopy . oxidative addition of PH bond to “ zirconocene ” have been studied . the resulting zirconocenephosphidehydrides are not stable and react further to give a variety of product the nature of which depends on the electronic and steric property of the phosphide moiety . In the case of the PhPH2 derivative , cyclopentadienyl CH activation occurs affording the fulvalenidephosphide dimer [CpZr(m-PHPh)]2(m-e5-e5-C10H8) ( 1 ) in the similar reaction of CyPH2 , the isolated product is [Cp2Zr(m-PHCy)]2 ( 2 ) . the isolated derivative of (2,4,6-Me3C6H2)PH2 resembles <nUm> and wa confirmed crystallographically to be [CpZr(m-PH(2,4,6-Me3C6H2)]2(m-e5-e5-C10H8) ( 3 ) . the compound <nUm> crystallizes in the space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> A3 . In the case of Ph3SiPH2 three product were obtained . [Cp2Zr(m-PH(SiPh3)]2 ( 4 ) and [CpZr(m-PH(SiPh3))]2(m-e5-e5-C10H8) ( 5 ) are the major product , while [CpZr]2(m-PH(SiPh3)(m-PSiPh3)(m-e6-e5-C10H8) ( 6 ) is also formed in low yield . the compound 4*THF crystallizes in the space group P21 / n with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> A3 , while <nUm> crystallizes in the space group C2 / c with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> A3 . the phosphidephosphinidene - bridged , mixed - valent Zr(IV) / Zr (III) compound 6*[(THF)2Li(m-Cl)]2*THF crystallizes in the space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> A3 . the course of these reaction is discussed in term of the electronic and steric property of the phosphine . the mechanism for cyclopentadienyl CH activation is considered , and a dimeric Zr(IV) intermediate [CpZr(m-e5-e1-C5H4)(PHR)]2 is proposed on the basis of spectroscopic data derived from monitoring these reaction . alternative synthetic route to these dimer were explored . the dimer <nUm> and <nUm> were obtained from the reaction of zirconocene dichloride with Mg in the presence of the respective phosphine . these dimer <nUm> and <nUm> were also isolated from the reaction of the primary phosphine with zirconocenehydride chloride . the compound [Cp2Zr(m-PHPh)]2 ( 7 ) wa isolated in a similar reaction . the specie <nUm> crystallizes in the space group C2 / c with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> and V = <nUm> A3 . direct reaction of Li2PPh and Cp2ZrCl2 or deprotonation of <nUm> generates the bis(phosphinidene) - bridged homobimetallics [Cp2Zr(m-PR)]22- ( r = ph , 8a , r = cy , 8b ) . reaction of 8a with a proton source and TMEDA affords the mono(phosphinidene) - bridged complex [(Cp2Zr)2(m-PHPh)(m-PPh)][(THF)2Li(TMEDA)] ( 9 ) . the compound 9*THF crystallizes in the space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> A3 . similarly , reaction of 8a with Me3O+ generates the specie [(Cp2Zr)2(m-PMePh)(m-PPh)]Li ( 10 ) . the heterobimetallic complex Cp2Zr(m-PHCy)(m-e1-e2-OC)Mo(CO)Cp ( 11 ) is derived from the reaction of <nUm> with [CpMo(CO)3]2 . this product crystallizes in the space group P1 with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> A3 . deprotonation of <nUm> affords the phosphinidene - bridged heterobimetallic [Cp2Zr(m-PCy)(m-e1-e2-OC)Mo(CO)Cp]- ( 12 ) . this process is reversible . the chemistry and structural data for these phosphide and phosphinidene specie are presented and discussed . In particular , the structural data for the Zr (III) specie are considered in light of recent postulate of “ super-long ” metalmetal bonding in related zirconocene dimer . some of the discussion is supported by the result of fenske - hall and extended huckel molecular orbital calculation . this paper outline the generation of the transient monomeric imido complex Cp2ZrNR ( 1a – e ) , their successful trapping with unsaturated organic molecule and dative ligand , and their use in activating C — H bond . the generation of Cp2ZrNR ha been accomplished by thermolysis of the alkyl amide Cp2Zr(NHR)(R') ( 2a – d ) and bis(amides) Cp2Zr(NHR)2 ( 3a – c ) via a-abstraction of alkane and amine , respectively . the imido intermediate 1a , generated from alkyl amide 2a ( r = 4-tert-butylphenyl , R' = me ) in THF , resulted in the formation of the bridging imido dimer 4a in <nUm> % yield . In contrast , the generation of intermediate 1b – d ( 1b r = tert-Bu ; 1c r = 2,6-dimethylphenyl ; 1d r = Si(CMe3)Me2 ) under similar condition furnished the monomeric imido THF complex 5b – d in <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> % yield . imido dimer 4a and monomer 5b were characterized crystallographically . the THF ligand of 5b – d are weakly bound , a demonstrated by the exchange of bound and free THF in 5c on the NMR time scale and by facile substitution of Ph3PO for THF in 5b , giving the triphenylphosphine oxide adduct Cp2Zr(NCMe3)(OPPh3) ( 6b ) . thermolysis of the alkyl amide 2b and 2d at <nUm> – <nUm> ° C in benzene resulted in the addition of the C — H bond of benzene across the Zr — N linkage to provide the phenyl amide 7b and 7d . similarly , the THF adduct 5b reacted with benzene under the same condition to give the C — H activation product 7b . the imido intermediate Cp2ZrNR undergo cycloaddition reaction with a variety of unsaturated organic compound . In addition to formation of azametallacyclobutenes ( e.g. , 8b , 8c , 9c , 10b ) from alkyne , certain olefin react with cp2 - ZrNR to give azametallacyclobutanes . thus , upon reaction of norbornene or ethylene with imido complex 5b an equilibrium mixture of 5b , free olefin , free THF , and the metallacycles 12b and 13b , respectively , were observed . addition of a large excess of norbornene shifted the equilibrium almost entirely to the azametallacyclobutane 12b and facilitated it isolation . the structure of 12b wa determined after crystallization from hexamethyldisiloxane . complex 5b also reacted with benzophenone and tert-butyl isocyanate to provide the tert-butylimine of benzophenone and di-tert-butylcarbodiimide in <nUm> and <nUm> % yield , respectively . monomer 5b reacted with tert-butyl isocyanide to provide the coupling / trapping product Cp2Zr-(N(CMe3)CNCMe3)(CNCMe3) ( 16 ) , while reaction of 5b with isobutene oxide gave the epoxideopened product Cp2Zr(NHCMe3)(OCH2C(Me)CH2) ( 17 ) . finally , heating the alkyl amide Cp2Zr(NHCHPh2)(CH2CH2CMe3) ( 2e ) ( which contains hydrogen both α and β to nitrogen ) with diphenylacetylene yielded the azametallacyclobutene product formed via a-abstraction in <nUm> % yield . zirconocene and hafnocene complex such a CP <nUm> MH <nUm> and cp <nUm> M(Cl)H ( m = Zr or Hf ) were found to catalyze efficiently the selective dimerization of aldehyde to ester under mild condition . hafnocene complex exhibited higher activity than the corresponding zirconocene complex , while titanocene complex were inert in the present reaction . the reaction wa found to be markedly influenced by the structure of the aldehyde used . cross-dimerization could be achieved by allowing cp <nUm> HZr <nUm> or cp <nUm> ClHZr to react with two different aldehyde whose reactivity are slightly different from each other . the result of ab initio RHF and RMP2 geometry optimization on the model compound of the postulated intermediate in ziegler – natta catalysis Cl2ZrCH2CH3+ ( 3 ) and Cl2ZrCH-CH2+ ( 4 ) and for comparison on three neutral complex Cl2Zr(X)CH = CH2 , x = H ( 5 ) , CH3 ( 6 ) , Cl ( 7 ) , show that these specie are stabilized through a three - center 2-electron Zr – Hb-C interaction . In <nUm> – <nUm> this interaction is regiospecific and take place either ci ( 5a ) or trans ( 6b , 7b ) to the Zr – x bond , depending on the steric repulsion between x and hb . the examination of the potential energy surface on the basis of extended huckel calculation on substituted specie Cp2ZrC(R1)-CH(R2)+ , R1 = SiMe3 ( 8 ) , CMe3 ( 9 ) and R2 = H ( a ) , me ( b ) , H3Si ( c ) , CMe3 ( d ) , SiMe3 ( e ) , ph ( f ) , reveals that <nUm> and <nUm> can be stabilized through either g-Si ( C ) – C or b-CH agostic interaction , depending on the subtle balance between the electronic and steric effect on R1 and R2 . to expand the availability of transition - metal aldehyde complex for study , a new method for their synthesis ha been developed . our first application of this method ha been to the synthesis of zirconocene e2-aldehyde complex . proceeding through a-stannylalkoxide intermediate ( M-OCHR-SnMe3 ) , this route provides ready access to both neutral and anionic complex under mild condition . the first x-ray structure of an anionic aldehyde complex is reported . the neutral complex dimerize producing meso and racemic diastereomers . monomeric zirconaoxiranes are shown to be excluded from the reaction coordinate during insertion and isomerization reaction of these neutral complex . ( r , S)-[Cp2Zr(e2-OCHCH2CHMe2)]2 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21 / c with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , and z = <nUm> . the refinement wa carried out with <nUm> observed room temperature reflection to give R(F) = <nUm> % and Rw(F) = <nUm> % . { Cp2Zr(Me) (e2-OCHCH2-CHMe2)Li}2(C4H8O) crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group c2cb with a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , and z = <nUm> . the refinement wa carried out with <nUm> observed room temperature reflection to give R(F) = <nUm> % and Rw(F) = <nUm> % . two rare example of complex that contain an acetylide ligand bridging between a main group metal ( aluminum ) and a transition metal ( zirconium ) are described . such complex are prepared by treatment of dimethylzirconocene with <nUm> molar equiv of (alkynyl)dimethylalummum [(RCC)AlMe2]2 ( r = SiMe3 , cyclohexyl , CMe3 , CH3 ; 2a – d ) . In this reaction an (e2-alkyne)zirconocene complex is probably formed in situ which is then trapped by the excess (alkynyl)dimethylaluminum to yield the complex Cp2Zr ( m-e1:e2-RCCMe ) ( m-C = CR ) AlMe2 ( 6a – d ) . the complex 6a ( r = SiMe3 ) and 6b ( r = cyclohexyl ) were characterized by x-ray diffraction . for comparison , we have also carried out the x-ray crystal structure analysis of the [(trimethylsilyl)ethynyl]dimethylaluminum dimer 2a . the complex <nUm> contain a dimetallabicyclic framework . one of the bridgehead position is a carbon center which is planartetracoordinate . In these complex the CCR bridge between zirconium and aluminum can be described a being mainly of m-(s-acetylide) character . it ha been shown that the bis(trimethylsilyl)-acetylene complex of zirconocene Cp2Zr(THF)(Me3SiC2SiMe3) ( 1 ) and the binuclear s-alkenyl complex of zirconium {Cp[m-(e1:e5-C5H4)]Zr[C(SiMe3)CH(SiMe3)]}2 ( 2 ) readily react with carbon dioxide at room temperature to form the dimeric zirconafuranone metallacycle [ formula omitted ] ( 3 ) . under similar condition the reaction of Cp2Zr(THF)(Me3SiC2SiMe3) and {Cp[m-(e1:e5-C5H4)]MZr[C(SiMe3)CH(SiMe3)]}2with water affords the zirconoxane complex [ Cp2ZrC(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe3)]2O ( 4 ) . the structure of the obtained complex have been established by x-ray structure analysis . two zirconocene derivative with organic ligand containing a nitrogen substituents have been prepared , and their structure have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffractometry . the reaction of Cp2Zr(Me)(e2-CHPhNMe2) with C2F3HO2 yield Cp2Zr(O2,CCF3)(e2-CHPhNMe2) ( 8 ) . the reaction of Cp2Zr(CMeNtBu) ( C2F3O2 ) with Cp2Zr(Me)H yield Cp2Zr ( e2-XMeNtBu ) (m-O,O'-O2CHCF3)Zr(Me)Cp2 ( 9 ) . the structure of <nUm> wa determined at - <nUm> ° C ; it crystallizes in space group P21 / n , with a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 5 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , and z = <nUm> . the structure of <nUm> wa determined at - <nUm> ° C ; it crystallizes in space group P21 / n , with a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , and z = <nUm> . In both <nUm> and <nUm> the nitrogen is coordinated inside the carbon and oxygen ligand atom . PhCH(K)NMe2 and LiCH2NMe2 react with zirconocene or hafnocene chloride in THF to give satisfactory yield of their (dimethylamino)alkyl derivative . Cp2Zr(R)CH(Ph)NMe2 ( r = Cl , <nUm> ; r = me , <nUm> ) wa prepared by treating Cp2Zr(R)Cl with PhCH(K)NMe2 . Cp(e5-C5H4R)M(Cl)CH2N(CH3)2 ( m = Zr , x = Cl , r = H , <nUm> ; m = Hf , x = Cl , r = H , <nUm> ; m = Zr , x = Cl , r = CPh(CH3)2 , <nUm> ) wa prepared by treating the appropriate metallocene dichloride with C3H8LiN . acidic reagent ( C2F3HO2 , CpMo(CO)3H , [n-Bu3NH][BPh4] ) cleaved the methyl ligand from <nUm> and gave the -O2CCF3 complex ( 10 ) , the -(m-OC)Mo(CO)2Cp complex ( 12 ) , or the solvated cation ( 13 ) . complex <nUm> did not react with excess C3H8LiN , LiPh , MeI , CO ( g ) ( <nUm> atm ) , or HgNa , but a low yield of it methyl derivative wa obtained by treating it with CH3Li . the inequivalence of the n-methyl group in the 1H NMR spectrum of complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> – <nUm> at low temperature showed that the CH(R)NMe2 ligand were bound in an e2 fashion . simulation of the temperature - dependent 1H NMR spectrum of CDCl3 solution of <nUm> gave DH ‡ and DS ‡ value of <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal / mol and <nUm> ± <nUm> eu , respectively , for n-methyl exchange . the Zr-N interaction energy in <nUm> can thus be estimated at <nUm> kcal / mol . generation of “ Cp2Zr ” in the presence of PhPH2 result in P-H activation , affording the intermediate Cp2Zr(PPhH)H. C-H activation and subsequent C-C bond formation yield the Zr (III) diphosphide- and fulvalenidebrkdged complex [(e5-Cp)Zr(m2-PPhH)(m-e5:e5-C5H4C5H4)]2 ( 1 ) . In the analogous reaction employing (2,4,6-t-Bu3C6H2)PH2 , the isolated product is the trimeric , phosphide - capped Zr(IV) specie ((e5-Cp)(m-e1:e5-Cp)Zr)3(m3-P) ( 2 ) . C-H activation is evident a metalated cp ring bridge adjacent Zr atom in a e1:e5-fashion . this compound <nUm> also represents a rare example of a trinuclear organometallic specie containing a capping phosphorus atom . further , the structure of <nUm> implies a mechanism for the formation of <nUm> involving the initial formation of a dimer in which the Zr center are linked by e1:e5-Cp moiety . the hydrosilylation of olefin such a styrene , 1-hexene , and 2-pentene with diphenylsilane can be carried out with catalyst generated from zirconocene dichloride and <nUm> equiv of butyllithium . complete regioselectivity is observed a only terminal organosilicon product are produced ( ~ <nUm> % ) . In the case of styrene , three major product are formed : phenethyldiphenylsilane , trans-1-phenyl-2-(diphenylsilyl)ethene , and ethylbenzene . the product distribution wa found to be dependent on reagent concentration : reaction run with excess diphenylsilane favored diphenylphenethylsilane ; excess styrene favored trans-1-(diphenylsilyl)-2-phenylethene . reactivity a a function of silane , olefin , and catalyst wa examined . secondary silanes are generally superior to primary and tertiary silanes for hydrosilylation . silane coupling reaction compete with hydrosilylation with le sterically hindered silanes to produce oligomeric product . sterically hindered silanes , such a triphenylsilane , react only at elevated temperature and yield vinylsilane a the major product . extensive H / d exchange is observed in the hydrosilylation of styrene with Ph2SiD2 . stoichiometric reaction indicate that dibutylzirconocene reacts to form a zirconocene - butene complex at room temperature . the possibility of an “ olefin first ” mechanism is discussed . attempt to synthesize fused bicyclic thiophenes by zirconocene - mediated cyclization of bis(trimethylsilyl) a,o-diynes led to the isolation of air - stable bis(e <nUm> -cyclopentadienyl)zirconacyclopentadlene complex when there is a heteroatom ( i.e. oxygen or substituted nitrogen ) tethered between the acetylene . anion of the type [(C2B9H11)2M]-(M = Fe , Co , Ni ) are suitable for use a “ noncoordinating ” anion with [Cp2ZrMe]+ cations.Catalysts generated from Cp2ZrMe2 and[PhNMe2H] [(C2B9H11)2M] are active for the polymerization and copolymerization of ethylene and a-olefins . spectroscopic examination of the cobalt complex indicates that the anion is weakly coordinated to the metal at room temperature . At low temperature , however , the aniline - coordinated adduct [Cp2ZrMe(NMe2Ph)][(C2B9H11)2M] is present . these catalyst are active in toluene or hexane for the polymerization of ethylene and the copolymerization of ethylene and 1-butene . zirconocene dichloride reacts with <nUm> molar equiv of (2-furyl)lithium to give bis(2-furyl)zirconocene ( 1a ) . the (s-furyl)zirconocene complex Cp2ZrR(2-furyl) ( r = CH3 , ph , SiMe3 ) were similarly prepared by treatment of the respective Cp2Zr(R)Cl complex with (2-furyl)lithium . Cp2Zr(SiMe3)(2-thienyl) wa obtained from the reaction of Cp2Zr(SiMe3)Cl with (2-thienyl)lithium . the Cp2ZrR(2-furyl) complex with r = 2-furyl , methyl , or phenyl all undergo an intramolecular high - temperature ( ≥ <nUm> ° c),s , s-exchange reaction to give the oxazirconacyclohexadienes [ formula omitted ] ( 2a-c ) . the 1a -2a rearrangement follows first - order kinetics in the temperature range 140-180 ° C and is characterized by the activation parameter DH ‡ = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 and DS ‡ = <nUm> ± <nUm> cal mol-1 K-1 . the complex Cp2Zr(SiMe3)(2-furyl) ( 1d ) and Cp2Zr(SiMe3)(2-thienyl) ( 1e ) undergo the analogous dyotropic rearrangement much faster . the 1d → 2d isomerization is fast at <nUm> ° C and already take place during the formation of 1d from Cp2Zr(SiMe3)Cl and (2-furyl)lithium . the activation parameter of the 1e → 2e ring enlargement reaction of the (2-thienyl)metallocene system are DH ‡ = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 and DS ‡ = <nUm> ± <nUm> cal mol-1 K-1 . the oxa- and thiazirconacyclohexadienes [ formula omitted ] ( x = O , 2d ; x = S , 2e ) were characterized by x-ray diffraction . complex 2d crystallizes in space group PI with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , α = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = 4,R = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . complex 2e crystallizes in space group cc with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 4 ) a,b = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . both chalcogenazirconacyclohexadienes are monomeric in the solid state and exhibit nonplanar metallacyclic conformation with the metal - chalcogen vector rotated significantly relative to the plane of the endocyclic conjugated diene moiety . the ligand (S,S)-2,3-butylene-1,1'-bis(indene) wa prepared from diindenylmagnesium and the dimesylate of (R,R)-2,3-butanediol after conventional synthetic method had failed . reaction of the dilithium salt of (S,S)-2,3-butylene-1,1'-bis(indene) with TiCl4*2THF in THF under high - dilution condition gave [Ti-((S,S)-2,3-butylene-1,1'-bis(indenyl))Cl2] , which , upon O2Pt / H reduction , gave [Ti((S,S)-chiracene)Cl2] a a mixture of kinetically formed isomer . these consisted of the R,R , R,S , and S,S diastereomers . upon irradiation , a photostationary state consisting of <nUm> % of the R,R isomer and <nUm> % of the R,S isomer wa obtained . the desired pure (R,R)-[Ti((S,S)-chiracene)Cl2] complex wa isolated , and it crystal structure wa determined by x-ray diffraction . it wa found that this complex wa configurationally stable under normal condition , confirming our initial expectation . the circular dichroism spectrum of the R,R and R,S isomer have been recorded and discussed , and a connection between the photostationary state and thermodynamic equilibrium of the isomer is suggested . the corresponding zirconium complex were obtained in low yield . there is a strong kinetic preference for the (R,S)-[Zr((S,S)-chiracene)Cl2] isomer . this isomer wa isolated , and it structure wa determined by x-ray diffraction . the photostationary state is different from that of the titanium analogue . it consists of a mixture of R,R and S,S diastereomers . the metathetical reaction between the lithium 1-azaallyl compound [{HMPA*LiN(H)C(t-Bu)CH2}2] ( 1 ) with zirconocene dichloride ( 2 ) result in the formation of the zirconocene ketimide [ Cp2Zr(Cl)N double bond C(t-Bu)CH3 ] ( <nUm> ; cp = cyclopentadienyl ) and lithium chloride . after it is transferred to the transition metal , the azaallyl ligand isomerizes to a ketimido variation . an energetic preference of <nUm> kcal mol-1 in favor of the zirconocene ketimide over it theoretical azaallyl isomer wa determined by ab initio molecular orbital calculation ( at the HF / LanL2DZ level ) . these study , in combination with an x-ray diffraction analysis of <nUm> , suggest that the preference for the ketimide isomer is due to the presence of a heteroallenic ( Zr-N-C ) interaction . this bonding mode is consistent with the short Zr-N bond length of <nUm> angstrom found in the crystal structure of <nUm> . treatment of <nUm> with MeLi affords the corresponding methyl derivative [ Cp2Zr(Me)N double bond C(t-Bu)CH3 ] ( 4 ) . 1H NMR spectroscopic experiment reveal that addition of the lewis acid BC18F15 to <nUm> result in methide abstraction , with retention of the ketimide unit on the cationic zirconocene . ab initio molecular orbital calculation confirmed the energetic preference for the e1-ketimide cation [ Cp2ZrN double bond c(t - Bu)CH3]+ over either the e1-azaallyl isomer [Cp2Zr{e1-N(H)C(t-Bu)CH2}]+ or the e3-azaallyl isomer [Cp2Zr{e3-N(H)C(t-Bu)CH2}]+ ( by <nUm> and <nUm> kcal mol-1 , respectively ) . both <nUm> and <nUm> have been shown to be active catalyst for the polymerization of ethylene in combination with a MAO cocatalyst . In addition , <nUm> polymerizes ethylene in combination with a mixed BC18F15 / i-Bu3Al cocatalyst . protonolysls of [Cp2ZrCH3(THF)] [BPh4] with tert-butyl mercaptan lead to the (thlolato)zirconocene cation [ Cp2Zr(S-t-C4H9 × THF)][BPh4] in <nUm> % yield . In addition to the usual spectroscopic method the complex wa characterized by x-ray crystallography ( monoclinic , P21 / c , a = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 18 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 7 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> ) . structural parameter and THF exchange rate point to a le electrophilic Zr center than In the parent alkyl specie . nevertheless , the center is electrophilic enough to induce C-S bond cleavage under thermal duress . activation of a C5Me5 ligand on reaction of (C5Me5)2ZrMe{B(4-C6H4F)4} ( 1 ) with excess 1,3-butadiene affords an unusual linked cyclopentadienyl-allyl figand in [(C5Me5)Zr{e5:e3-C5Me4(CH2CH2CHCHCH2)}]+ ( 2 ) . formation of <nUm> proceeds via elimination of 2-pentene from an observable e3-allyl intermediate , followed by trapping of the putative tetramethylfulvene product by diene insertion . stable lewis - base - free e3-allyl complex , [Cp'2Zr{e3-CH2C(Me)CH2}]+ ( cp' = C5Me5 ( 3b ) , (Me3C)C5H4 ( 3c ) ) , are obtained with 1,2-propadiene . the reaction of zirconium and hafnium tetrachloride with tris(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene affords the monocyclopentadienyl complex (l,3-bis(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl)zirconium trichloride ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) and (1,3-bis(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl)hafnium trichloride ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) in good isolated yield . the reaction of <nUm> with (1,3-bis(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl)lithium affords 1,1',3,3'-tetrakis(trimethylsilyl)zirconocene dichloride ( <nUm> % ) . In contrast to the preparation of <nUm> and <nUm> , reaction of bis(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene with zirconium and hafnium tetrachloride affords l,l'-bis(trimethylsilyl)zirconocene dichloride ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) and l,l'-bis(trimethylsilyl)hafnocene dichloride ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) . the reaction of (trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene with zirconium and hafnium tetrachloride affords zirconocene dichloride ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) and hafnocene dichloride ( <nUm> , <nUm> % ) . the intermediacy of monocyclopentadienyl specie in the preparation of the metallocene dichloride is supported by the reaction of cyclopentadienylzirconium trichloride with (trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene to afford <nUm> ( <nUm> % ) . reaction of zirconium tetrachloride with <nUm> equiv of (trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene at <nUm> ° C for <nUm> h affords <nUm> and cyclopentadienylzirconium trichloride in a ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) : ( <nUm> ± <nUm> ) ratio . the silyl group regiochemistry in <nUm> and <nUm> wa established through an x-ray crystal structure determination of the titanium analogue (1,3-bis(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl)titanium trichloride ( 3 ) . complex <nUm> crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group pbnm with a = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , V = <nUm> ( 9 ) A3 , and z = <nUm> . the metallatricyclic (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer <nUm> reacts with metal carbonyl complex LnM(CO) <nUm> [ LnM = C5MoO5 , C5O5W , CpCo(CO) , CpRh(CO) , CpV(CO)3 , C13F10OPt ] to give the metallatricyclic zirconoxycarbene complex Cp2Zr(m-OCH2)ZrCp2(m-OCH2C[ = MLn]O ) 12a-f in good yield . In each case , only one of the two Cp2ZrOCH2 metallaoxirane unit of <nUm> can be reacted with the [M]-C = O functionality . under equilibrium condition , the oxygen atom in the five - membered metallacycle adjacent to the CH2 group bridge the zirconium center of the Cp2ZrOCH2 structural subunit . In the photochemical - assisted C6O6W addition to [Cp2Zr(m-OCH2)]2 , a mixture of regioisomeric zirconoxycarbene complex 12b and <nUm> is formed under kinetic control . In <nUm> , an oxonium type oxygen atom is adjacent to the carbene carbon center . the metallatricyclic zirconoxycarbene rhodium complex Cp2Zr(m-OCH2)ZrCp2(m-OCH2C-[ = RhCp(CO)]O ) ( 12d ) wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . complex 12d crystallizes in space group P21 / n with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 2 ) a,b = <nUm> ( 5 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , z = <nUm> , R(Fo2) = <nUm> , and Rw(Fo2) = <nUm> . the Rh = c(carbene) bond is rather short at <nUm> ( 5 ) Å . titanocene , zirconocene , and hafnocene derivative with an interannular 1,1,4,4-tetramethyl-1,4-disilabutylene bridge were synthesized by the reaction of the dilithium derivative of 1,4-dicyclopentadienyl-1,1,4,4-tetramethyl- 1,4-disilabutane with titanium , zirconium , and hafnium tetrachloride in THF . the identity of all new compound have been documented by analytical a well a by spectroscopic ( IR , MS , 1H and 13C NMR ) data . zirconocene complex of cyclic alkyne can effect ring - opening reaction of cyclic allylic ether to produce homoallylic alcohol and substituted <nUm> , 3-dihydro-furans . the utilization of in situ generated zirconocene-benzyne complex a a mean to effect ci car - bofunctionalizations of cyclic olefin in a one - pot procedure is described . the stereospecific insertion of cyclic olefin provides the cis-zirconaindane metallacycles exclusively . the intermediate metallacycles were treated with a variety of electrophiles to provide diastereoselective synthesis of arylcyanoalkanes , tricyclic ketone , and 2,3-dihydrobenzo[b]thiophenes in moderate overall yield . several new , novel bridged and unbridged bis-tetrahydrofluorenyl zirconocenes were synthesized and evaluated a ziegler - natta type catalyst for ethylene and propylene polymerization . the complex were found to be highly stable compared to some bisfluorenylzirconocenes . polypropylene and polyethylene were produced in good yield using the new catalyst precursor with MAO or trityl / TIBA a cocatalysts . both the unsubstituted and substituted bridged bis-tetrahydrofluorenyl zirconocenes were isolated a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of rac and meso isomer , which produced mostly atactic polypropylene . partially crystalline polypropylene wa obtained at low temperature with bis(3-methyltetrahydrofluorenyl)-zirconium dichloride . In situ generation of i-BuZrCp2CI by treatment of Cp2ZrCI2 with <nUm> equiv of t-BuLi followed by addition of <nUm> equiv more of t-BuLi can serve a a satisfactory “ ZrCp2 ” source , permitting direct conversion of various alkene and dienes into the corresponding ZrCp2 complex in high yield . the (e2-formaldehyde)zirconocene complex (Cp2ZrOCH2)2 ( 1 ) reacts with alkyl isocyanides CN-R ( 2a-c ) ( r = -CH2SiMe3 , -CH2CMe3 , -CMe2CH2CMe3 ) to give the insertion product [ Cp2ZrOCH2C( = NR)]2 ( 3a-c ) . the doubly oxygen bridged c2e − symmetric metallatricyclic complex <nUm> contain (e1-iminoacyl)zirconocene moiety . the (trimethylsilyl)methyl isocyanide insertion product 3a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes in space group pi with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , α = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , ( β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , and rw = <nUm> . the C = N bond length in 3a is <nUm> ( 2 ) Å ; the Zr-C distance of the (e1-iminoacyl)zirconocene moiety is <nUm> ( 1 ) Å . the reaction of Cp2ZrMe2 with the dithiols HS(CH2)nSH ( n = <nUm> – <nUm> ) and o- and m-HSCH2C6H4CH2SH proceed with evolution of methane , affording the insoluble zirconocene dithiolate derivative . In the case of HS(CH2)nSH , where n = <nUm> and <nUm> , the product can also be synthesized via reaction of Cp2ZrMe2 or [Cp2ZrHCl]n with HS(CH2)nSSiMe3 ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) . crystallographic study of two of these product show that there are bimetallic compound . the compound Cp2Zr(m-SCH2CH2S)2ZrCp2 ( 1a ) crystallizes in the space group P21 with a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , ß = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> ( 3 ) A3 . this specie is best described a a twisted macrocycle in which two of the four sulfur atom bridge the two Zr center . the molecule Cp2Zr(m-SCH2CH2CH2S)2ZrCp2 ( 1b ) crystallizes in the space group pbca with a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> ( 1 ) A3 . In contrast to la this specie is a true macrocycle that incorporates two zirconocene dithiolate moiety in a 12-membered ring with a zr(1) ⋯ zr(2) separation of <nUm> ( 1 ) Å . molecule 1a and 1b are shown to act a metalloligands , a each reacts with AgBPh4 to yield the <nUm> : <nUm> silver - ligand derivative . crystallographic study confirm that both 1a and 1b act a macrocyclic metalloligands , presenting a four sulfur coordination sphere to the encapsulated silver ion . the complex [(Cp2Zr(m-SCH2CH2S)2ZrCp2)Ag]BPh4 ( 2a ) crystallizes in the space group P21 / n with a = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , ß = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> ( 2 ) A3 . molecule [(Cp2Zr(m-SCH2CH2CH2S)2ZrCp2)Ag]BPh4 ( 2b ) crystallizes in the space group P1 with a = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 7 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 10 ) Å , α = <nUm> ( 4 ) ° , ß = <nUm> ( 4 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ( 4 ) ° , z = <nUm> , and V = <nUm> ( 5 ) A3 . the result of these study are discussed , and the implication of the data are considered . (EtMe2SiC5H4)CpZrCl2 ( 5 ) reacts with BBr3 in <nUm> , 2-dichloroethane ( reflux , <nUm> h ) to afford a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of (EtMeBrSiC5H4)CpZrBr2 ( 10 ) and ( BrMe2SiC5H4 ) CpZrBr2 ( 11 ) in a nearly quantitative conversion . similarly , (tBuMe2SiC5H4)CpZrCl2 ( 6 ) reacts with BBr3 to afford a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of (tBuMeBrSiC5H4)CpZrBr2 ( 13 ) and <nUm> . the product <nUm> is obtained independently by treating (Me3SiC5H4)CpZrCl2 ( 12 ) with BBr3 . In contrast , Si-Ph bond are cleaved with complete selectivity in the presence of Si-Me group . (PhMe2SiC5H4)2-ZrCl2 ( 8 ) reacts with excess BCl3 in dichloromethane ( reflux , <nUm> h ) to afford (ClMe2SiC5H4)2-ZrCl2 ( 14 ) in <nUm> % yield . ( ph2 MeSiC5H4)2ZrCl2 ( 9 ) reacts with excess BBr3 in <nUm> , 2-dichloroethane ( reflux , <nUm> h ) to afford ( Br2MeSiC5 H4)2ZrBr2 ( 15 ) in <nUm> % yield . complex <nUm> and <nUm> were analyzed by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . crystalline <nUm> adopts a pseudo-C2 conformation in which the face of the ph group of one ligand show a weak interaction with a C-H bond of the other ligand . crystalline <nUm> also adopts a pseudo-C2 conformation , in which the Br2Si group are directed away from the Br2Zr group . heterobimetallic CO2 adduct Cp(CO)2MC(O)OM'(Cl)Cp2 [ m = Ru , M' = Zr ( 9a ) , Ti ( 9b ) ; m = Fe , M' = Zr ( 10a ) , Ti ( 10b ) ] were prepared by treating the metallocarboxylates CpM(CO)2CO2-Na+ ( m = Ru , Fe ) with the appropriate zirconocene and titanocene dichloride at low temperature . the metallocarboxylates CpM(CO)2CO2-Na+ are available from the reaction of a cold CpM(CO)2-Na+ ( − <nUm> ° C ) solution with <nUm> equiv of CO2 , and CpRu(CO)2-Na+ is prepared by sonication of rp2 / sodium metal in tetrahydrofuran ( THF ) . the solution stability of these bimetallocarboxylates , decreasing in the order RuZr ( 9a ) ≫ FeZr ( 10a ) > RuTi ( 9b ) > FeTi ( 10b ) , determines how readily that they are isolated and characterized . the heterobimetallic CO2 adduct 9a is available analytically pure ; IR , 1H , and 13C NMR spectral data are complete for 10a , and IR spectral data for all four bimetallocarboxylates , a well a for the isotopomer Cp-(CO)2Ru13C(O)OZr(Cl)Cp2 ( 9a-13C ) , are consistent with similar m-(el − C : e2-O,O ’ ) carboxylate structure . all four bimetallic CO2 adduct decompose in benzene solution to give similar product , Cp2M2(CO)4 and m-oxo (Cp(Cl)M')2O ; 10a , 9b , and 10b decompose at or below room temperature , and 9a slowly degrades above <nUm> ° C . protonating 9a and 10a with BF4H also deoxygenates the ligated CO2 and affords CpM(CO)3+BF4- ( m = Ru , Fe ) and [Cp2(Cl)Zr]2O in moderate yield . In the reaction of Cp2ZrCI2 with Mg and (2,4,6-Me3C6H2)PH2 , the mono(phosphinidene) - bridged specie (Cp2ZrCI)2(m2-P(2,4,6-Me3CeH2)) ( 1 ) wa isolated and crystallographically characterized . In the related reaction of Cp2rCl2 with Mg in the presence of CyPH2 , the Zr (III) phosphide - bridged zirconocene dimer [ Cp2Zr(m2- PCyH)]2 ( 2 ) wa isolated . the structure of <nUm> ha been confirmed crystallographically . preliminary mechanistic information obtained from the analogous reaction employing cp* 2ZrCI2 suggests the formation of the hydride - phosphide cp* 2Zr(PHCy)H and the terminal phosphinidene intermediate cp* 2Zr = PCy . A variety of chiral and achiral zirconocene complex were investigated for the stereoselective dehydrogenative coupling of phenylsilane . polymerization of PhSiH3 with rac - (EBI)ZrCl2 / 2BuLi or Cp2Zr(H)CI yield a stereoregular polymer by 29Si NMR spectroscopy . these result suggest that the stereogenic center of the growing polymer chain may play a role in the stereo chemistry of phenylsilane polymerization . A syndiotactic microstructure for the polyphenylsiianes is tentatively a signed on the basis of comparison of their 29Si NMR chemical shift with those of known stereoregular cyclic oligomers . In the course of the investigation , for the first time the long postulated m-e1-O,O' gem - diolate specie Cp2Zr(Cl)OCH2OZr(Cl)Cp2 wa observed . formation of diastereomers is precluded when biphenyl-bridged bis(cyclopentadienyls) and transition - metal halide combine to give chiral ansametallocenes . these cyclopentadienyls must be symmetrically substituted . synthesis and x-ray diffraction analysis are reported for four biphenyl-bridged ansametallocenes : titanocene dichloride <nUm> and <nUm> , zirconocene dichloride <nUm> , and ferrocene <nUm> . decomposition of in situ generated cp' <nUm> Zr(n-Bu) <nUm> in the presence of <nUm> equiv of lappert 's stannylene Sn[CH(SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ] <nUm> yield the product cp' <nUm> Zr{Sn[CH(SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ] <nUm> { <nUm> ( cp' = C <nUm> H <nUm> ( la , <nUm> % ) , C <nUm> H <nUm> CH <nUm> ( 1b , <nUm> % ) ) . the <nUm> Sn NMR resonance for 1a appears at + <nUm> ppm relative to me <nUm> Sn , with satellite arising from coupling to an adjacent <nUm> Sn nucleus ( <nUm> J <nUm> Sn = <nUm> Hz ) . the compound lb wa the subject of a single - metallocene derivative are discussed . A study ha been carried out to examine the factor that influence the overall [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition reaction between imidozirconocene complex Cp2(THF)Zr = NR ( r = 2,6-i-Pr2C6H3 , 2,6-Me2C6H3 , t-Bu ) and small , unsaturated organic molecule . steric factor in the cycloaddition reaction investigated were found to be significant in both the imido fragment and the heterocumulene reactant partner . when Cp2(THF)Zr = NR ( r = 2,6-Me2C6H3 ) wa treated with symmetrical carbodiimides RN = C = NR ( r = t-Bu , i-Pr , SiMe3 cyclohexyl , p-tolyl ) , the corresponding diazametallacycles formed in high yield . however , with the more sterically encumbered zirconocene imido complex Cp2(THF)Zr = NR ( r = 2,6-i-Pr2C6H3 ) , diazametallacycle formation wa observed only with the heterocumulenes 1,3-diisopropyl-carbodiimide , 1,3-dicyclohexylcarbodiimide , and 1,3-di-p-tolylcarbodiimide . A series of singly and doubly bridged ansa - zirconocene dihydride complex ha been prepared from hydrogenation of the corresponding dimethyl complex . for the singly [SiMe2] - bridged specie , the hydrogenation reaction is facile at <nUm> ° C , whereas for the doubly [SiMe2] - bridged complex hydrogenation occurs over the course of day at <nUm> ° C . hydrogenation of { meso-Me2Si(e5-C5H3-3- CMe3)2}ZrMe2 affords the isomeric dimeric dihydrides [ { meso-Me2Si(e5-C5H3- 3-CMe3)2 } ZrH]2(m2-H)2 , one of which ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction . the racemo isomer of Me2Si(e5-C5H2-2- SiMe3-4-CMe3)2ZrMe2 ( BpZrMe2 ) reacts with dihydrogen , affording the first example of a monomeric ansa - zirconocene dihydride , { rac-Me2Si(e5-C5H2-2- SiMe3-4-CMe3)2}ZrH2 ( rac - BpZrH2 ) . In the presence of dinitrogen , rac - BpZrH2 undergoes thermal reductive elimination of H and reaction with N , yielding the dinitrogen complex BpZr(m2,e2,e2-N2)ZrBp , for which the dinitrogen ligand is coordinated in a side-on fashion to both zirconium with a N - N bond distance of <nUm> Å . the doubly [SiMe2] - bridged zirconium dimethyl complex { (Me2Si)2(e5-C5 H3)2 } ZrMe2 ( RpZrMe2 ) undergoes hydrogenation under forcing condition , affording the mixed valent ( Zr(IV) / Zr(IV) / Zr (III) ) hydride trimer [RpZr]3(m3-H)2(m2- H)3 , which ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction . more substituted doubly [SiMe2] - bridged zirconocene dihydrides such a [ { (Me2Si)2(e5-C5H-3,5- (CHMe2)2)(e5-C5H2-4- CHMeEt}ZrH]2(m2-H)2 [sec-BuThpZrH]2(m2-H)2 ) and [ (Me2Si)2(e5-C5H-2,4- (CHMe2)2)(e5-C5H2- CHMe2)ZrH]2(m2-H)2 ( [iPrThpZrH]2(m2-H)2 ) have been prepared and shown to be robust dimer in solution . the reaction of methyl 2-ethylbutyrate with an equimolar amount of lithium diisopropylamide ( LDA ) lead to the formation of the lithium enolate of methyl 2,2,4-triethyl-3-oxohexanoate . further reaction with bis-(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium(methyl)chloride yield a crystalline zirconocene enolate complex , the structure of which wa determined by x-ray diffraction . (1,2,5,6-Tetramethyl-3,4-dimethylenetricyclo[3.1.0.02,6]hexane)zirconocene ( 2a ) , prepared by irradiation of diene la and diphenylzirconocene , and (2,3-dimethylenebicyclo[2.2.1]heptane)zirconocene ( 2b ) , obtained by reduction of zirconocene dichloride with lithium in the presence of 2,3-dimethylenenorbornane ( lb ) , both react with carbon monoxide under displacement of the conjugated diene forming zirconocene dicarbonyl . envelope - shaped s2 , p-type structure were found for the diene zirconocene unit in x-ray diffraction study of both complex . 2a crystallizes in space group P1 ( z = <nUm> ) with cell constant o = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , α = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , β = <nUm> ( 8 ) ° γ , and y = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° ( <nUm> observed reflection , r = <nUm> ) . compound 2b crystallizes in space group PI ( z = <nUm> ) with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 7 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 8 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 7 ) Å , α = <nUm> ( 5 ) ° , β = <nUm> ( 5 ) ° , and γ = <nUm> ( 7 ) ° ( <nUm> observed reflection , r = <nUm> ) . comparison of the molecular geometry of (diene)zirconocenes 2a , b , d , e and the zirconaindan <nUm> reveals a continuously increasing metallacyclopentene character . In this series the reactivity of 2a and 2b toward carbon monoxide is markedly le influenced by ground - state effect a compared with that of 2d , 2e , and <nUm> . dibenzylzirconocene ( 3a ) and ( s-trans-n4-trans , trans-1,4-diphenylbutadiene)zirconocene ( 5 ) are formed rapidly upon irradiation of benzyl(b-styryl)-zirconocene ( 2a ) in benzene at ambient temperature . trapping and crossover experiment using benzyl chloride and (b-styryl)zirconocene chloride and the kinetic influence of added “ moderator ” trimethyl phosphite and triphenylphosphine in addition to ESR experiment point to a radical reaction mechanism for alkenyl group transfer . transfer and coupling of alkenyl ligand can also be initiated in a dark reaction when starting from methyl(b-styryl)zirconocene ( 2b ) . the (1,3-pentadiene)zirconocene complex and it higher homologues of the type (e5-C5H5)2Zr(CR1-(CH3) = = CR2CR3 = CR4H ) were prepared by reaction of (e5-C5H5)2ZrHCl with alkyl-substituted or complex are composed of ca. <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of s-cis and s-trans isomer while each of the complex containing 2-methyl-1,3-pentadiene , 3-methyl-1,3-pentadiene , 2,4-dimethyl-1,3-pentadiene , 1-(trimethylsilyl)-1,3- pentadiene , and 1,5-bis(trimethylsilyl)-1,3-pentadiene ligand consists of a single isomer of s-cis structure . the process of hydrogen transfer wa elucidated on the basis of the analysis of the stoichiometric reaction between (e5-C5H5)2ZrDCl and (2-methylpentadienyl)potassium . the reaction of (e5-C5H5)2Zr ( 2,4-hexadiene ) with 1-alkenes or 2-butyne showed that the coordinated diene is easily expelled to give zirconacyclopentanes or a zirconacyclopentadiene derivative , respectively . the addition of butanal or 3-pentanone resulted in double insertion into the 2,4-hexadiene moiety to selectively afford 3-hexene-1,6-diols through hydrolysis . lithium enolates , e.g. , C2H3LiO , prepared by the reaction of BuLi with THF , or CHLiO = CMe2 , prepared from MeLi and Me3SiOCH = CMe2 , react readily with Cp2MXCl ( x = me , Cl ; m = Ti , Zr ) to give the corresponding enolates Cp2M(OCH = CR2)Me and Cp2M(OCH = CR2)2 ( r = H , me ) . these complex are thermally quite stable and show no tendency to eliminate aldehyde and form ketene complex . the crystal structure of Cp2Ti(OC2H3)2 ha been determined : orthohombic , pbcn , o = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å title compound <nUm> ( Cp2Zr(Cl)CH(CH3)OCH2CH3 , cp = e5-C5H5 ) ha been prepared in good yield by treatment of Cp2ZrCl2 with (1-ethoxyethyl)lithium . compound <nUm> is the first example of a stable , structurally characterized secondary zirconocene alkyl derivative which show no tendency to rearrange to the primary alkyl derivative at room temperature . carbon monoxide and isocyanides react with <nUm> to give migratory insertion product without rearrangement of the 1-ethoxyethyl fragment . At high temperature , <nUm> decomposes to give ethylene and Cp2Zr(Cl)OCH2CH3 , the same product obtained at ambient condition from the reaction of Cp2ZrHCl ( schwartz 's reagent ) with ethyl vinyl ether . attempt to develop a ring - opening polymerization ( ROP ) approach to polymeric zirconocene complex are reported . A new silicon - bridged [1][1]zirconocenophane , (SiMe2)2(e5- C5H3)2Zr(NEt2)2 ( 3a ) , wa synthesized by reaction of Zr(NEt2)4 with (C5H4)2(SiMe2)2 ( 4 ) . single - crystal x-ray diffraction revealed a highly tilted structure with an angle of <nUm> ° , a significant increase over the untethered compound (e5-MeC5H4)2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , which posse a tilt angle of <nUm> ° . this and the related compound (SiMe2)(e5-C5H4)2 MCl2 ( 1a , m = Ti ; 1b , m = Zr ) and (SiMe2)2(e5-C5 H3)2ZrCl2 ( 3b ) were tested for transition - metal catalyzed ROP behavior in the presence of pt(0) catalyst but were found to be inactive . the novel spirocyclic silacyclobutane - bridged monomer (CH2)3Si(e5-C5 H4)2ZrCl2 ( 7b ) wa prepared via a " fly trap " amine elimination reaction between cyclotrimethylenedicyclopentadienylsilane ( 8 ) and Zr(NMe2)4 ; this initially yielded (CH2)3Si(e5-C5 H4)2Zr(NMe2)2 ( 7a ) , which wa converted to 7b by reaction with a slight excess of Me3SiCl . 7a and 7b were characterized by 29Si , 13C , and 1H NMR spectroscopy and mass spectrometry a well a single - crystal x-ray diffraction . both showed moderate tilt angle ( <nUm> ° and <nUm> ° , respectively ) a well a highly strained silacyclobutane ring with C-Si-C bond angle of <nUm> ° and <nUm> ° , respectively . transition - metal - catalyzed ROP of 7b led to the formation of the polycarbosilane [ (CH2)3Si(e5-C5 H4)2ZrCl2]n ( 10 ) . both the soluble and insoluble fraction of <nUm> were characterized by CP - MAS 29Si and 13C NMR , and the soluble , oligomeric fraction wa further characterized by solution 29Si , 13C , and 1H NMR . complex 7a , 7b , and polyzirconocene <nUm> were found to exhibit moderate activity a ethylene polymerization catalyst . treatment of the reagent [C5H4B(C6F5)3] Na,Li*Et2O ( 4 ) with zirconocene dichloride gave the neutral tris(cyclopentadienyl)Zr-betaine - type complex (e5-Cp)2[e5-C5H4B (C6F5)3]Zr ( 1 ) . In the crystal complex <nUm> contains the three e-cyclopentadienide ligand in a nearly trigonal - planar coordination around zirconium with a pronounced Zr-F-C(aryl) coordination perpendicular to it . the Zr-F bond length is <nUm> Å . the Zr-F-C(aryl) coordination is persistent in solution . the activation energy of the reversible cleavage of the Zr-F linkage of <nUm> wa determined a DG ‡ ( Zr - f)diss(253 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 by dynamic 19F NMR spectroscopy in toluene-d8 . ( e6-Phenol ) tricarbonylchromium complex are conveniently converted to [(e6-phenoxide)Cr(CO)3]- specie on treatment with aqueous base . the phenoxide chromium anion , which are readily isolated a crystalline tetraethylammonium salt , react with main - group electrophiles ( (p-tol)SO2Cl or C2ClF3O ) to produce new sulfonate - and carboxylate - substituted arene chromium complex . similar reaction between the phenoxide anion and metal electrophiles ( CpFe(CO)3 + or Cp2ZrCl2 ) result in electron - transfer reaction that consume the starting arene complex . transition - metal complex bearing (e-phenoxide)Cr(CO)3 ligand are conveniently prepared through alcoholysis reaction with metal alkoxide and metal dimethylamide precursor . an x-ray crystallographic study of Cp2Zr{(e-OC6H5)Cr(CO)3}2 wa carried out . for <nUm> unique intensity data collected by using Cu ka radiation in a θ – 2th scan procedure , the space group for the molecule wa determined to be pnma with unit cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 5 ) Å , and c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å . the refinement converged to an R(F) of <nUm> and an RW(F) of <nUm> . the molecule show general structural feature common to other bent zirconocene and p-arene chromium complex but show some unexpected feature associated with the Zr - aryloxide bonding . little evidence is found for either steric interaction between the (e-OC6H5)Cr(CO)3 unit or for Zr-O π bonding . the o-arene bond doe show a small degree of multiple - bond character . this observation is supported by the deviation of the O-C arene vector from the least - square arene plane , suggesting that a small degree of a cyclohexadienone resonance form is contributing to Zr - arene bonding . none bis(alkynyl)zirconocene and -hafnocene complex (R1Cp)2M(C ≡ CR)2 ( 6 ) were prepared by reacting metallocene dihalides (R1Cp)2MCl2 ( R1 = H , CH3 , terf - butyl ) with alkynyl anion equivalent . subsequent comproportionation of <nUm> with additional (R1Cp)2MCl2 yielded mono(alkynyl)metallocene chloride <nUm> . complex <nUm> and <nUm> were treated with zirconocenes (R2Cp)2Zr , generated in situ from the corresponding (e4-butadiene)metallocene system to give binuclear alkynyl-bridged complex (R1Cp)2M(m-Cl)(m-C ≡ CR)Zr(CpR2)2 ( 9 ) or (R1Cp2)M(m-C ≡ CR)2Zr(CpR2)2 ( 10 ) , respectively ( m = Zr , Hf ; R1 R2 = H , CH3 , t-Bu ; r = CH3 , ph ) . the x-ray crystal structure analysis of Cp2Zr(C ≡ CCH3)2 ( 6a ) revealed no noticeable conjugative interaction of the 16-electron d0-configurated early - transition - metal center with the acetylenic p-system . complex 6a crystallizes in space group pnc2 with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 7 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 5 ) Å ; d(Zr-C(1)) = <nUm> ( 3 ) , C(1) - In contrast , the metal-acetylide unit in the Cm symmetric (H3CCp)2Zr(C ≡ CPh ) dimer ( 10f ) ha a much shorter Zr-Ca bond ( <nUm> ( 2 ) Å ) , a revealed by x-ray diffraction . together with the other pertinent bonding feature [ d(Ca ≡ cb ) = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å ; . A series of (alkoxymethyl)zirconocene chloride ( <nUm> , Cp2Zr(Cl)CH2OR , cp = e5-C5H5 ) ha been prepared by treatment of Cp2ZrCl2 with (alkoxymethyl)lithium reagent . compound lc , Cp2Zr(Cl)CH2OCH2C6H5 , crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group pbca , with a = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 8 ) Å , and z = <nUm> . the x-ray crystal structure show that the alkoxymethyl ligand is e2 , with a significant Zr-O interaction . compound <nUm> with r = benzyl or substituted benzyl undergo a wittig rearrangement when heated to give product <nUm> ( Cp2Zr(Cl)OCH2R ) . the activation parameter that were determined for the transformation , the effect of substituents on the rate of the reaction , the identity of the reaction 's side product , and the retention of configuration at the benzylic carbon are all consistent with the formation of a short - lived radical pair intermediate . thermally generated (e2-1,2-didehydrobenzene)titanocene and - zirconocene react with hexacarbonylmolybdenum or - tungsten at <nUm> ° C to give five - membered metallacyclic titan - and zirconoxycarbene complex <nUm> . the carbene complex Cp2ZrOC[ = W(CO)5]C6H4 ( 4a ) is an organometallic lewis acid . At ambient temperature <nUm> reacts with the ylide Ph3P = CH2 to yield the zirconium enolate Cp2Zr(OPh)OCPh = CH2 ( 14 ) which serf a a carbon nucleophile in the aldol condensation reaction with benzaldehyde . the <nUm> to <nUm> transformation can be regarded a an organometallic equivalent of the elusive wittig olefination reaction of a carboxylate salt . the first example of a new class of main - group metallacycles , 4,5-didehydro-2-thiastibolanes , have been synthesized . these compound were prepared via transmetalation from zirconocene metallacycles . the x-ray crystal structure of the 1-chloro-4,5-dlmethyl-4,5-didehydro-2-thiastibolane ( 4a ) and the 1-bromo-4,5-diphenyl-4,5-didehydro-2-thiastibolane ( 5b ) are reported . the metathesis of Li2[X(C6H4)2] with <nUm> equiv of (C5H5)ZrCl3-2THF or (C5Me5)ZrCl3 offer a convenient method for the preparation of several binuclear zirconocenophane complex [X(C5H4)2][(C5R5)ZrCl2]2 , where x = CH2 or SiMe2 and r = H or me . hydrolysis of [X(C5H4)2][(C5H5)ZrCl2]2 in the presence of aniline affords the corresponding oxo-bridged derivative [X(C5H4)2] [(C5H5)ZrCl]2(m-O) . these compound have been characterized by 1H and 13C NMR measurement and elemental analysis . the molecular structure of [SiMe2(C5H4)2][(C5Me5)ZrCl2]2 and [SiMe2(C5H4)2][(C5H5)ZrCl]2(m-O) were determined by x-ray diffraction method and provided the opportunity to evaluate the structural response of the [SiMe2(C5H4)2]2- ligand to change in the coordination environment of the two Zr center . [SiMe2-(C5H4)2][(C5Me5)ZrCl2]2*1 / 2C7H8 crystallizes in a triclinic unit cell of PI symmetry with a = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , α = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , γ = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , V = <nUm> ( 8 ) A3 , z = <nUm> , and dcalcd = <nUm> g / cm3 , whereas [SiMe2(C5H4)2][(C5H5)ZrCl]2(m-O) crystallizes in a monoclinic crystal lattice of P21 / c symmetry with a = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , V = <nUm> ( 1 ) A3 , z = <nUm> , and dcalcd = <nUm> g / cm3 . full - matrix least - square refinement ( based on F02 ) of diffractometry data converged with final discrepancy index of R(F0) = <nUm> with s1 = <nUm> and R(F0) = <nUm> with s1 = <nUm> , respectively . reaction of the isodicyclopentadienide anion with RCpTiCl3 ( r = H , CH3 , t-Bu ) and Cp'TiCl3 in tetrahydrofuran solution at-78 ° C is shown to proceed stereoselectively with formation of endo titanocene dichloride complex . when the same reaction are performed at <nUm> ° C up to the reflux temperature of the solvent , the stereoisomeric exo complex are cleanly formed instead . control experiment have not led to the interconversion of these isomer pair . comparable reaction of isodiCpLi with CpZrCl3 and Cp'ZrCl3 in boiling tetrahydrofuran also delivered only exo complex . the structural parameter of several product , a defined by x-ray crystallographic analysis , are discussed . the endo complex appear to be more sterically constrained than the exo isomer . their formation at low temperature is thought to be kinetically controlled and to stem from electronic feature imparted to the cp anion portion of the isodicyclopentadienyl ligand by it fused norbornyl framework . reaction of phenyl(trimethylsilyl)acetylene with hydridozirconocene chloride yield the b-CH agostic alkenylzirconocene chloride formula - omitted ( 2a ) . halogen exchange with lithium bromide or iodide produce the analogous alkenylzirconocene bromide 2b and iodide 2c , respectively . intermediate . the first structurally characterized transitionmetal complex of cyclobutene is described . the complex is formed by the elimination of methane from cyclobutylmethylzirconocene with subsequent trapping by trimethylphosphine . the reactivity of the complex with unsaturated organic molecule and it x-ray crystal structure are reported . the crystal and molecular structure of ( s-cis-2,3-dimethylbutadiene ) hafnocene ( 3b ) , (1,2-bis(methylene)cyclohexane)zirconocene ( 4a ) , and (1,2-bis(methylene)cyclohexane)hafnocene ( 4b ) have been determined from x-ray data . 3b crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group pnma with a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , V = <nUm> A3 , and dcalcd = <nUm> g cm-3 for z = <nUm> . full - matrix least - square
