In all three complex the diene is e4-bonded to the metallocene fragment with the metal in a ps-tetrahedral coordination . the bond of the diene terminus to the metal are noticeably shorter than those of the internal C atom of the dienes . the respective bond length ( 3b , <nUm> (5)-2.641 ( 5 ) Å ; 4a , <nUm> ( 2 ) – <nUm> ( 6 ) Å ; 4b , <nUm> (8)-2.72 ( 1 ) Å ) are in a range typical for M-C σ and π bond of the respective element . together with the other geometrical parameter of the diene-metallocene framework they allow the following generalization : ( a ) (s-cis-e4-diene)zirconocenes and -hafnocenes are best described a s2,p complex , ( b ) the σ / π ratio in the metal-diene bonding is smaller for the zirconocene complex than for their Hf analogue , ( c ) this ratio is smaller for 3b than for 4b , a trend which is similar in the previously reported (s-cis-e4-2,3-dimethylbutadiene)zirconocene ( 3a ) and 4a , and ( d ) , Zr-C bond are slightly longer than their Hf counterpart . difference in the chemical behavior of corresponding ( s-cis - conjugated diene)zirconocene and -hafnocene complex can be rationalized in view of their characteristic structural feature . the reactivity of [(e5-C5H4CH3)2ZrH(m-H)]2 with various substituted acetylene ha been investigated . diphenylacetylene and phenylacetylene react with [(e5-C5H4CH3ZrH(m-H)]2 below <nUm> ° C to yield primarily (e5-C6H4CH3)2Zr(C4(C6H5)4) and the 2,5-diphenyl-substituted isomer of (e5-C5H4CH3)2Zr(C4(C6H5)2) , respectively . under appropriate condition substantial hydrogenation of diphenylacetylene to trans-stilbene and phenylacetylene to ethylbenzene , respectively , is observed . these result suggest that at least two competing process — zirconacyclopentadiene formation and acetylene hydrogenation — are present . complementary EPR study for the reaction of [(e5-C5H4CH3)2ZrH(m-H)]2 with diphenylacetylene , 1-phenylpropyne , and 2-butyne have further revealed the formation of a paramagnetic zirconocene specie (e5-C5H4CH3)2Zr(H)(RC ≡ CR ) . the possible participation of this adduct in the acetylene chemistry of [(e5-C5H4CH3)2ZrH(m-H)]2 is discussed . an electrochemical cell designed to work in the cavity of an ESR spectrometer at variable temperature wa used to study the electrochemical reduction of zirconocene compound Cp2ZrX2 ( x = halogen ( hal ) ; cp = e5-C5H5 ) and Cp2Zr(CH3)2 in THF . it is shown that in each case zirconocene(III) specie are formed . on the basis of their spectral parameter they are characterized a the anion radical (Cp2ZrX2)- . for x = Cl , Br , and CH3 and a the monohalide Cp2ZrX for x = I . halogen hyperfine interaction are resolved for the first time . for x = Cl and Br , electrochemical reduction in the presence of PMe3 and PMePh2 yield spectrum attributable to the specie Cp2ZrX(PMe3) and Cp2ZrX(PMePh2) . the reaction of methylenetriphenyl-phosphorane with |Cp2Zr(H)Cl]x , Cp2Zr(CH3)2 , and Cp2Zr(C6H5)2 have been studied . At <nUm> ° C methylene transfer from CH2 = PPh3 to the hydridozirconocene chloride occurs producing methylzirconocene chloride and triphenylphosphine . In contrast to dimethylzirconocene , which turn out to be unreactive up to <nUm> ° C , diphenylzirconocene at <nUm> ° C reacts with the ylide to form Cp2Zr(C6H5)CHPPh3 ( 1c ) . this reaction proceeds through an (e2-aryne)zirconocene intermediate a revealed by a labeling experiment . the Cp2Zr(C6H5) - substituted ylide ha been characterized by NMR spectrum at various temperature and an x-ray structure analysis . 1c crystallizes in space group pbca with a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , and z = <nUm> . the preferred conformation and a rather short Zr-C7 bond distance ( <nUm> ( 4 ) Å ) indicate substantial p-interaction of the Zr-C(ylide) linkage . photolysis of diphenylzirconocene ( 5 ) at low temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) in the presence of the isomerically pure dienes (Z,Z)- and (Z,E)-2,4-hexadiene ( 8a ) and (Z,Z)- and (Z,E)-1,4-diphenylbutadiene ( 8b ) , respectively , lead to the stereospecific formation of the corresponding ( s-trans-e4 - conjugated diene)zirconocene complex 1a-ZZ , 1a-ZE , 1b-ZZ , and 1b-ZE . upon thermolysis , 1a-ZZ ( t1 / <nUm> ≈ <nUm> min at <nUm> ° C ) first rearranges to give 1a-ZE exclusively , which consecutively rearranges to a thermodynamic <nUm> / <nUm> mixture of <nUm> a EE / 3a-EE at higher temperature ( + <nUm> ° C ) . similarly , 1b-ZE undergoes a thermally induced geometrical isomerization at + <nUm> ° C to form 1b-EE / 3b-EE ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) . the same product mixture is obtained directly from 1b-ZZ at + <nUm> ° C . the observed stepwise loss of the stereochemical information at the terminal carbon center of the conjugated diene ligand of <nUm> indicates a rearrangement process proceeding through a p-allyl-type intermediate ( 4 ) . this interpretation is supported by the result of an extended huckel calculation : an approximate transition state ( 10a ' ) for a related isomerization process with an unsubstituted butadiene system can be reached by rotating this ligand around a Zr - cterm bond ( <nUm> ° ) , lifting the exposed CH2 group by <nUm> ° , and rotating it <nUm> ° . A barrier of <nUm> kcal / mol wa computed . the orbitals of 10a are in agreement with the formulation of an allyl complex . A low - lying LUMO predominantly localized at the exposed CH2 moiety indicates carbenium ion character at this carbon . terminal p-donor substituents at the butadiene ligand cause a drop of the rearrangement barrier to <nUm> kcal / mol , which can be explained by mean of delocalization of carbenium p orbital character into filled wave function of the p-donor residue . stereochemistry and calculation have thus revealed a third general mechanistic pathway for an intramolecular diene transition - metal complex isomerization : rearrangement through p-allyl-type intermediate <nUm> can be of importance in addition to the established diene rotation and topomerization mechanism . parallel thermolysis ( at <nUm> ° C in solution ) and photolysis ( <nUm> ° C ) study of [(e5-C5H4CH3)2ZrH(m-H)]2 , <nUm> , and {[SiR2(C5H4)2]ZrH(m-H)}2(R = ch3 , 2a ; r = C2H5 , 2b ; r = n-C3H7 , 2c ) have shown that these dinuclear zirconocene hydride complex reductively eliminate H . In each case , this process is accompanied by the initial formation of a paramagnetic zirconocene hydride specie , which exhibit a hydride doublet with A(1H) = <nUm> g in the corresponding solution EPR spectrum . the result from a low temperature gas chromatographic analysis of the gas mixture containing H , HD , and d2generated during the thermolysis of <nUm> in the presence of a large excess of d2are consistent with deuterium incorporation into the methylcyclopentadienyl ring and the hydride position . further evidence for the involvement of the methylcyclopentadienyl ring during the thermolysis of <nUm> is provided by the fact that <nUm> equiv of h2are eliminated per equivalent of <nUm> . comparable experiment conducted on <nUm> , however , clearly reveal that the chelating [SiR2(C5H4)2]2- ligand significantly restricts the chemical participation of the ring . linking the ring with a dialkylsilyl bridge reduces the number of equivalent of h2evolved per equivalent of <nUm> to ca. two upon prolonged thermolysis and stabilizes the corresponding paramagnetic zirconocenophane hydride specie produced during the initial reductive elimination step . A series of consecutive solution EPR experiment have demonstrated that this Zr(III)-H intermediate undergoes reversible H / d exchange at the hydride position . complementary NMR measurement have further confirmed that deuterium incorporation is restricted to only the hydride position of <nUm> . the role of paramagnetic zirconocene hydride specie in these H / d exchange reaction is discussed . the compound cp <nUm> ScR ( cp = r = H , me , p-tol ) react readily with nitrile R'CN to provide azomethine complex cp <nUm> ScNC(R)R ‘ containing a C = N double bond <nUm> – <nUm> cm <nUm> ). if is used , further reaction may occur to give product containing two nitrile . the related complex cp <nUm> HZr <nUm> will insert two nitrile in a stepwise manner ; however , the dimethyl analogue is unreactive toward nitrile . the compound cp <nUm> ScNC(H)R may be hydrogenated under relatively mild condition to yield the corresponding amide complex this transformation is reversible ; addition of ethylene lead to dehydrogenation of the amide complex and production of ethane . the amide complex may be independently synthesized by reaction of cp <nUm> ScR ( r = H , me ) and the corresponding amine , with resultant elimination of hydrogen or methane , respectively . cp <nUm> CH2NSc <nUm> CMe <nUm> will catalytically hydrogenate ( <nUm> atm of H <nUm> ) me <nUm> CCN to me <nUm> CCH <nUm> NH <nUm> ; however , termination occurs by insertion of the nitrile into the scandium - amide bond to form cp <nUm> ScNC(CMe <nUm> )NHCH <nUm> CMe <nUm> , the NC bond of which is not hydrogenated under these condition . labeling experiment show that hydrogen can add reversibly across the Sc-N bond of the amide , and this step is believed to play a crucial role in the catalytic reaction . (e2-Benzophenone)zirconocene ha been obtained by the thermolysis of (e2-benzoyl)phenylzirconocene . led to multiple insertion into the Zr-H bond and to simultaneous reductive coupling of iso-cyanides with the formation of an unusual zirconacycle : current interest in the reduction of carbon monoxide ha led to study of the reactivity of CO with various zirconocene hydride which have resulted in the observation of C-C bond formation.la , ba well a simple CO reduction by these complexes.10Examination of the reactivity of zirconocene hydride ha recently been extended to reactivity with isocyanides , which are isoelectronic with CO.12Specifically , interest ha focused on the question of whether CO insertion into a Zr-H bond is thermodynamically feasible and , by analogy , whether such a process occurs in the cp2ZrH2-isocyanide system . another aspect of this chemistry concern the role that the cp ligand play . it ha been noted that alkyl sub-stituents on the cp ring increase the ligand to metal electronic donation , thereby heightening metal basicity . reduction of dichlorobis(175-cyclopentadienyl)titanium(IV) ( 3 ) with <nUm> equiv of sodium amalgam ( Na / Hg ) give the dinuclear e5:e6-fulvalene complex <nUm> of composition and the <nUm> in <nUm> % yield each ; both compound represent Ti (III) specie . the chloro-bridged complex <nUm> undergoes quick oxidation upon exposure to air , thus yielding the Ti(IV) derivative ( 6 ) . reduction of <nUm> with lithium triethylhydridoboranate cleanly give “ titanocene ” <nUm> , with the latter compound representing a good starting material for the synthesis of the sulfido-bridged fulvalene complex ( 7 ) . compound <nUm> in turn undergoes a sulfur / oxygen exchange reaction when treated with molecular oxygen ; in this case , the oxo- / sulfido-bridged derivative ( 8 ) is formed . reaction of the isodicyclopentadienide anion with TiCl3in tetrahydrofuran at <nUm> ° C , with ZrCl4in dimethoxyethane at reflux for <nUm> h , and with HfCl4in dimethoxyethane ( reflux , <nUm> h ) have been performed in order to ass the x-facial stereoselectivity of complexation to group <nUm> transition metal . In all three instance , a single complex wa isolated . x-ray crystallographic analysis of the titanocene and zirconocene dichloride demonstrate both to be the result of dual coordination to the exo surface . by NMR 1H comparison , the hafnocene is shown to be closely similar and therefore of the same stereochemistry . the three - dimensional feature of the complex are discussed . thermally in situ generated (i2-1,2-di-dehydrobenzene)zirconocene reacts with M(CO)6(M = W , Mo ) to give the benzannelated five - membered metal - lacyclic zirconoxycarbene complex 4a,b . controlled hydrolysis of 4a ( m = W ) with CuS04*5H20 yield the tetranuclear Zr-O-Zr - bridged bis(carbene) complex [(C0)5W-C(Ph)0-Cp2Zr-0-ZrCp2-0C(Ph)-W(C0)5] ( 5a ) . the molecular structure of the molybdenum analogue 5b wa determined by x-ray diffraction . 5b crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 5 ) A , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) A c = <nUm> ( 2 ) A , and <nUm> = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° . 5b is characterized by a completely planar c-framework ( Zr-O-Zr* = <nUm> ° ) . the most remarkable structural feature of 5b is the trans arrangement of the voluminous (CO)5Mo-carbene unit at the Zr-O-Zr bridge . this favored antiperiplanar conformation is unique among the family of early - transltion - metal Cp2M(X)-0-M(X)Cp2compounds . the ( s-cis- / s-trans-e4-butadiene)zirconocene equilibrium mixture ( <nUm> / <nUm> = <nUm> / <nUm> ) reacts with CpCo(CO)2at ambient temperature to give the metallacyclic fischer - In the case of <nUm> , a disorder in the structural data is consistent with two possible conformation of the 12-membered dimetalated ring . molecular mechanic calculation in which the geometry at Zr is fixed were performed for the two possible conformers . the pseudocrown conformation is predicted to be thermodynamically more stable than the pseudochair form . In contrast , complex <nUm> adopts a pseudochair conformation . In addition , the disposition of the alkyl substituents on the oxygen atom is endo for <nUm> and exo for <nUm> . these structural difference between <nUm> and <nUm> are considered and discussed . the nature of the Zr – O bonding in these complex is discussed in term of the extended huckel molecular orbital picture . the structural and theoretical data support the notion of significant p-bonding between Zr and oxygen . the reaction of a zirconocene acyl chloride with <nUm> equiv of trimethylaluminum result in the formation of the trinuclear Zr <nUm> Al complex [ cp <nUm> zr(e <nUm> (C,O)-OC-(CH <nUm> ) <nUm> ] <nUm> ( m-AlMe <nUm> )(m-Me) , which contains a trigonal - bipyramidal bridging methyl group . the complex crystallizes in the monoclinic system , in space group P2 <nUm> / n ( C <nUm> <nUm> h , no. <nUm> ) , with a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , V = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å <nUm> , and z = <nUm> . this is one of the few structure that contains a bridging methyl group with a near-trigonal-bipyramidal structure in which the metal occupy the axial position and the three hydrogen atom are in the equatorial plane . the effect of counterion on the kinetics and mechanism of ethylene polymerization by the zirconocene - boron catalytic system wa examined using the density functional theory approach . A comparative study of three model catalytic specie , namely , ethylzirconocene cation , Cp2ZrEt+ , and two ion pair of composition Cp2ZrEt+A- ( A- = CH3B(C6F5)3- , B(C6F5)4- ) wa carried out . it wa shown that the nature of counterion affect mainly the ratio between the most stable b-agostic and nonagostic Cp2ZrEt+A- isomer , the thermodynamic and kinetic characteristic of ethylene addition to the Cp2ZrEt+A- ion pair , and the chain propagation kinetics . the weaker the nucleophilicity of the counterion , the higher the fraction of the b-agostic isomer , the higher the exotermicity , and the lower the activation barrier to ethylene addition to Cp2ZrEt+A- , and the lower the activation energy of chain propagation . all possible pathway of the interaction between Cp2ZrEt+CH3B(C6F5) 3- and ethylene molecule were examined and compared . among all specie of composition Cp2ZrEt+CH3 B(C6F5)3- , the nonagostic isomer wa found to be the most reactive toward ethylene . the hydroxysilsesquioxanes (c-C5H9)7Si8O12(OH) ( I ) and (c-C5H9)7Si7O9 (OH)2OSiMePh2 ( II ) have been studied a model support for silica - grafted aluminum alkyl specie . treatment of AlMe3 with I gave polymeric { [(c-C5H9)7Si8O13] AlMe2}n ( 1a ) , which is readily transformed into the corresponding monomeric pyridine adduct , { [(c-C5H9)7Si8O13] AlMe2*Py ( 1b ) . when AlMe3 wa reacted with II , noticeable amount of the <nUm> : <nUm> product { [ (c-C5H9)7Si7O11- (OSiMePh2)](AlMe2)2}2 ( 2 ) and the bronsted acidic <nUm> : <nUm> product { [ (c-C5H9)7O11 (OSiMePh2)]2-Al-}{H+} ( III ) were obtained besides the main product of the reaction , { [ (c-C5H9)7Si7O11- (OSiMePh2)]AlMe}2 ( 3a-c ) . the main product is a mixture of three dimeric conformational isomer all with the aluminum methyl trans to each other . the difference of the conformers originates from the different orientation of the silsesquioxane ligand . reaction of the bronsted acid III with AlMe3 yielded the kinetic product { [ (c-C5H9)7Si7O11 (OSiMePh2)]2Al2Me2 ( 4 ) . the kinetic and thermodynamic stability of the three conformeric methyl aluminosil - sesquioxanes { [ (c-C5H9)7 Si7O11(OSiMePh2)]AlMe}2 ( 3a-c ) and their chemical isomer { [ (c-C5H9)7Si7 O11(OSiMePh2)]2Al2Me2 ( 4 ) ha been investigated . isomerization experiment showed that 3a isomerizes to 3b , which subsequently isomerizes to 3c , affording the thermodynamically most stable mixture with a 3a:3b:3c ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> after <nUm> h at <nUm> ° C . isomerization of 3a to 3b is considerably faster than from 3b to 3c . direct conversion of 3a into 3c wa not observed . complex <nUm> slowly isomerizes into 3c , which consecutively isomerizes into the thermodynamic most stable isomeric mixture ( <nUm> h at <nUm> ° C , ea = <nUm> kJ*mol-1 ) . treating Cp2ZrMe2 with the bronsted acid III gave clean transfer of a silsesquioxane ligand to zirconium , yielding [ (c-C5H9)7Si7O11 (OSiMePh2)]ZrCp2 ( 5 ) . the methyl aluminosilsesquioxanes 1a and 2-4 are not lewis acidic enough to effectively abstract a substituent x from Cp2ZrX2 ( x = me , CH2Ph , Cl ) . though , 3a-c and <nUm> definitely interact with Cp2ZrX2 . dependent on the substituent x , the zirconocene can accelerate the rate of isomerization over <nUm> order of magnitude ( 3a , <nUm> h ; <nUm> , <nUm> h at <nUm> ° C ) . surprisingly , complex <nUm> also reacts with the strongly lewis acidic BC18F15 . As soon a all <nUm> ha been converted into 3a-c , the accelerating effect stop , which demonstrates that lewis acid have no effect on the isomerization of 3a-c . complex <nUm> , 3a , 3c , <nUm> , and <nUm> have been structurally characterized . the silsesquioxane - tethered fluorene ligand ( c-C5H 9)7Si8,O12CH2-9-Flu(H) and zirconocene complex thereof , C5H3(SiMe 3)2[(c-C5H9)7Si 8O12CH2-9-Flu]ZrCl2 and [ ( c-C 5H9)7Si8O12CH 2-9-Flu]2ZrCl2 , have been used to optimize the synthetic strategy for the corresponding silica - tethered zirconocenes and to study their steric and electronic property . . none density functional calculation on a variety of alkyl-transition metal complex R-M are reported . specifically , the following compound have been studied : zirconocene complex [Cp2Zr(H)R] , [Cp2Zr(Cl)R] , [Cp2ZrR]+ , and [Cp*2Zr(Cl)R] ; iron compound [CpFe(CO)2R] and [ CpFe(CO) {P(CH3)3} ] ; dimethylamino-dithiocyanato-palladium complex [ {(CH3)2NCS2}- Pd{P(CH3)3}R ] ; and cationic diimino palladium complex [{NN}Pd(L)R]+ ( with {NN} = HN = CH-CH = NH or N,N'-(o,o'-bis-diisopropylphenyl)diiminoacenaphthalene , and L = nothing , cl- , C2H6O , C2H6S , CH2 , or C2H3N ) . the r group considered are methyl , n-propyl , isobutyl , isopropyl , and tert-butyl , thus covering the whole range from primary group to tertiary one . it is shown that primary alkyl complex are usually more stable then secondary and tertiary one and that this is an electronic effect , due to the partial carbanionic character of the alkyl group . steric effect , which are usually invoked in the literature whenever this issue is considered , are shown to play only a minor role in many case . notable exception occur in the case of extremely bulky compound or for system in which the metal-carbon bond is le polar . stereoselective reaction of zirconium biphenolate complex of the general formula (BIP)-ZrCl2(THF)2 ( 1a-c ) , where BIP = 3,3'-iPr2-6,6'-Me2-1,1'-bi-2- phenolate ( a ) , 3,3'-tBu2-5,5'-Me2-1,1'-bi-2- phenolate ( b ) , or 3,3',5,5'-tBu4-1,1'-bi-2-phenolate ( c ) , with <nUm> equiv of the lithium or magnesium salt of various ansa - bis(indenyl) ligand give the ansa - zirconocenes rac-C2H4(Ind)2Zr(BIP) ( 2b ) , rac-Me2Si(Ind)2Zr(BIP) ( 3c ) , rac-Me2Si(2-Me-Ind)2Zr(BIP) ( 4c ) , rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind)2Zr(BIP) ( 5c ) , and rac-Me2Si(2-Me-Benz[e]Ind)2Zr(BIP) ( 6c ) in isolated yield of 60-75 % . reaction of C2H4(Ind)2Mg(THF)2 with 1a and 1b and of Me2Si(Ind)2Li2 with 1c give directly the pure diastereomers rac-2a , rac-2b , and rac-3c , respectively . more highly substituted indenyl ligand , on the other hand , give initially kinetically controlled mixture of the rac- and meso-zirconocene BIP derivative 4c , 5c , and 6c , from which the pure rac - derivative are obtained a thermodynamically favored product by heating the reaction mixture to <nUm> ° C for 5-7 h . the meso - to - rac isomerization of 6c is catalyzed by addition of TEMPO and is thus likely to occur by way of radical intermediate . crystal and molecular structure of 1b and 2b and of 1c and 6c indicate that formation of the racemo diastereomers is favored by repulsive interaction between biphenolate and ansa - bis(indenyl) ligand . the displacement of the MeB(C6F5)3- anion from seven different zirconocene methyl cation by neutral lewis base , such a dimethylaniline , benzyldimethylamine , and dinbutyl ether , wa investigated by 1D and 2D NMR spectroscopy . equilibrium constant for reaction with dinbutyl ether change by factor of le than <nUm> between the zirconocene contact ion pair studied , despite substantial steric difference . rate constant of this displacement reaction , however , change by a factor of more than <nUm> between Me2Si(C5H4)2ZrMe-MeB(C 6F5)3- , the most " open " complex , and rac-Me2Si(2-Me-BzInd)2ZrMe-MeB(C6F 5)3- , the most highly substituted specie studied . kinetic and stereochemical data indicate that lewis base - anion exchange proceeds by way of an associative mechanism , which occurs without side change of the zirconium - bound methyl group . DFT calculation support an associative substitution mechanism and propose five - coordinated reaction intermediate with the lewis base coordinated to the central coordination site . the reaction of zirconocene - alkyne complex Cp'2Zr(L)(e2-Me3SiC2 SiMe3 ) { cp'2 = ( e5 -C5H5)2 : L = THF , <nUm> ; L = pyridine , <nUm> ; cp'2 = rac - ebthi , <nUm> , [ ebthi = 1,2-ethylene1,1'-bis(e 5-tetrahydroindenyl ) ] } with <nUm> equiv(or excess ) of bicyclo[2.2.1] hepta-2,5-diene ( NBD ) in THF at <nUm> ° C result in five - membered zirconacyclopentane complex Cp2Zr(C14H16) ( 4 ) and rac(ebthi)Zr(C14H16) ( 5 ) ( C7H8 mean two coupled NBDs ) in good yield . NMR spectrum of complex <nUm> and <nUm> show the C2 symmetry of the molecule , indicating that the two NBD component in the complex are in exo-trans-exo conformation . an x-ray crystallographic structure determination of <nUm> confirms that the two NBD fragment are exo-trans-exo linked to form a racemate . both optical isomer are present in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio in the crystal . reaction of <nUm> and <nUm> with <nUm> equiv of NBD have also been investigated , and only zirconacyclopentane complex <nUm> wa isolated from the reaction . the analogous zirconacyclopentane complex Cp2Zr(C22H20) ( 6 ) and rac-(ebthi)Zr(C2H20) ( 7 ) ( C22 H20 mean two coupled BNBDs ) are obtained from the reaction of <nUm> ( or <nUm> ) and <nUm> with an excess of 1,4-dihydro-1,4-methano-naphthalene ( BNBD ) , respectively . the x-ray structure of the orange complex <nUm> show that the geometry of the Zr coordination sphere can be described a a distorted tetrahedron and similar to that of <nUm> . the zirconacyclopentane complex rac-(ebthi)Zr(C14H15N) ( 9 ) , bearing a free N coordinating site and a double bond , is formed from the coupling reaction of rac - ( ebthi ) C7H7NZr ( 8 ) with NBD . all these reaction are stereospecific , and all new complex are characterized by NMR , MS , and elemental analysis . density functional theory ( DFT ) study of the energetics of the isomer of C <nUm> H <nUm> -cyclocumulene ( 1 ) , ethynylcyclopropene ( 2 ) , diethynylmethane ( 3 ) , and their organometallic analogue obtained by replacing the CH <nUm> group by cp <nUm> Ti and cp <nUm> Zr ( 4-6 ) - show that the relative energy of the hydrocarbon are dramatically altered in the transition - metal analogue . the metallacyclocumulenes are comparable in energy to <nUm> and <nUm> . the relative energy also explain the experimental observation that the metallacyclopropene ( 5 ) is more favorable for the Ti complex . substituents on the carbon skeleton help to fine - tune the energetics . the bonding situation in <nUm> and the recently characterized five - membered zirconacyclopentyne complex <nUm> are very similar and are in tune with their structure . methyl-versus-cloride exchange equilibrium between different zirconocene complex provide a sensitive measure of relative electron density at the Zr center of these complex . As expected , methyl and trimethyl silyl substituents increase the electron density at the Zr center of a bis(cyclopentadienyl) Zr(IV) complex ; the same hold for a dimethyl silyl bridge . In bis(indenyl) complex , on the other hand , electron density at the metal center is reduced and substituent and bridge effect are different from those observed in bis(cyclopentadienyl) Zr(IV) complex . possible structural candidate for the active ( III ) and dormant ( IV ) specie in dimethyl-zirconocene - catalyzed , MAO (methylaluminoxane)-activated olefin polymerization have been studied via density functional theory ( DFT ) . these specie are [Cp2ZrMeAlMe3]+[MeMAO] - ( III ) and [Cp2ZrMe]+[MeMAO]- ( IV ) , respectively , where me = CH3 and cp = n5-C 5H5 . relative energy in gas phase and toluene solution a well a 1H and 13C NMR chemical shift have been calculated . these chemical shift have been compared with 1H and 13C NMR data from new experimental investigation studying the interaction between Cp2ZrMe2 and MAO in toluene solution.1 by combining experimental and theoretical result , we have been able to identify the most likely candidate for both the dormant and active specie . moreover , we are able to predict that an Al / Zr ratio of ~ <nUm> : <nUm> at <nUm> K is necessary in order for all of the Cp2ZrMe2 to bind to MAO a the structure we propose for III and IV . this ratio corresponds to the disappearance of the following specie from solution : free Cp2ZrMe2 , the weak complex of Cp2ZrMe <nUm> and MAO ( I ) , and [ Cp2ZrMe(m-Me) cp 2ZrMe]+-[MeMAO]- ( II ) . such a mixture would have a IV / III ratio of ~ <nUm> : <nUm> . an ansa - zirconocene compound , [2,2'-meth-ylenebis(1,3-dimethylcyclopentadienyl)]zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) , bearing methyl substituents on the carbon adjacent to a bridgehead carbon , wa synthesized by key step of the catalytic pauson - khand reaction and the retro-Diels-Aider reaction . the crystal structure of <nUm> wa determined . the small angle ( <nUm> ° ) between the two centroid of the cyclopentadienyls and a zirconium atom and the absence of any substituents on the position β with respect to the bridgehead carbon indicate that the coordination site for catalysis is widely opened . compound <nUm> , when activated with MAO , showed good performance for copolymerization of ethylene with a bulky monomer such a norbornene . the activity and norbornene incorporation ability are much better than those of [Ph2C(Fluo)(Cp)]ZrCl2 . A remarkably stable diborate anion a the metallocene polymerization catalyst wa investigated . the multiple intramolecular hydrogen bonding wa obtained in the molecular structure of the amidodiborate anion . In regard with it , the treatment of zirconocene dimethyls that resulted in the obtaining of highly active alkene polymerization catalyst wa reported . the reaction of [ cp ° 2ZrMe2 ] ( cp ° = C5EtMe4 ) with the thioglycolic acid HOOC(CH2-SCH2)nCOOH ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) resulted in evolution of methane and formation of the macrocyclic , dimeric zirconocene complex [ cp ° 2Zr(OOCCH2SCH2COO)2ZrCp ° <nUm> ] ( 1 ) and [ cp ° 2Zr(OOCCH2SCH2CH2SCH2 COO)2ZrCp ° <nUm> ] ( 2 ) , which can act a metalloligands toward complex fragment of a second metal . both complex were characterized by NMR and IR spectroscopy , ESI mass spectrometry , and x-ray diffraction analysis . In solution at room temperature both complex are dynamic , and the carboxylato group alternate between mono- and bidentate bonding mode . for complex <nUm> the free energy of activation for this process wa determined to be DG ‡ = <nUm> ± <nUm> kJ / mol by variable - temperature NMR experiment . compound <nUm> reacts with [Mo(CO)4(NBD)] ( NBD = norbornadiene ) to give the tetranuclear Zr / Mo complex <nUm> , the crystal structure of which showed that an C4MoO4 fragment is coordinated to one S and one O donor center of each bridging ligand of <nUm> . this heterobimetallic complex <nUm> wa also characterized by NMR and IR spectroscopy , and in contrast to <nUm> , it is not dynamic in solution at room temperature , owing to the coordination of the C4MoO4 fragment . compound <nUm> and <nUm> also react with [PdCl2(CH3CN)2] to give the trinuclear Zr / Pd complex <nUm> and the tetranuclear Zr / Pd complex <nUm> . both complex were characterized by NMR and IR spectroscopy and by elemental analysis . the synthesis and use of the ansa - zirconocene complex [ Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5 -C5H3R)]-ZrCl2 ( r = H ( 5 ) , me ( 6 ) , et ( 7 ) , iPr ( 8 ) , tBu ( 9 ) , SiMe3 ( 10 ) ) a catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene and propylene ha been studied . the alkyl complex [ Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5 -C5H3R)]-ZrMe2 ( r = H ( 11 ) , me ( 12 ) , et ( 13 ) , iPr ( 14 ) , tBu ( 15 ) , SiMe3 ( 16 ) ) have also been prepared . the reaction of 11-16 with BC18F15 gave the cationic specie [ { Me2Si(e5-C5Me4)(e5 -C5H3R)}-ZrMe]+ ( r = H ( 17 ) , me ( 18 ) , et ( 19 ) , iPr ( 20 ) , tBu ( 21 ) , SiMe3 ( 22 ) ) . In the absence of cocatalyst , 17-22 have been shown to act a catalyst in the polymerization of ethylene . the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . preparation of zirconocene hydrido chloride complex ha been accomplished via addition of <nUm> equiv of tert-butyllithium to the corresponding zirconocene dichloride . In this manner , both Cp*Cp''Zr(H)Cl and Cp''2Zr(H)Cl ( cp* = C5Me5 , cp'' = 1,3-(SiMe3)2C5H3 ) were prepared in high yield . further addition of tBuLi to Cp*Cp''Zr(H)Cl affords the isobutyl hydride complex Cp*Cp''Zr(CH2CHMe2)(H) , which upon addition of <nUm> atm of dihydrogen undergoes rapid hydrogenolysis yielding the monomeric dihydride Cp*Cp''ZrH2 . In the absence of dihydrogen , the zirconocene dihydride undergoes reversible C-H activation of a cyclopentadienyl trimethylsilyl group , affording the " tuck-in " derivative Cp*(e5-1-SiMe3C5H3-3-( e1-SiMe2-CH2))ZrH . addition of <nUm> equiv of tBuLi to the ansa - zirconocene tPr2Si(e5-3-SiMe3C5H 3)(e5-3,4-(SiMe3)2C5H 2)ZrCl2 result in the corresponding zirconocene isobutyl hydride complex , which upon exposure to H affords the dimeric dihydride [ iPr2Si(e5-3-SiMe3C5H 3)(e5-3,4-(SiMe3)2C5H 2)ZrH2]2 . In a similar procedure the substituted indenyl complex rac-(1-CMe3-C9H6)Zr(H)Cl and rac-(1-CMe3-C9H6)Zr(CH2CHMe2 )(H) have been prepared . this synthetic methodology allows for the preparation of metallocene alkyl hydride and dihydrides inaccessible by more traditional route . formal [2+2] and [2+1] cycloaddition reaction between the azazirconaindenes 1a,b and aldehyde RCHO ( r = ph , -CH = CHMe - ( e ) , fc ) , heterocumulenes [ R-N = C = O ( r = ph , 1-naphthyl ) , Me-N = C = S , Cy-N = C = N-Cy ] , and the azide (PhO)2P(O)N3 afford stable pentavalent zirconocene compound 2-8 , respectively . the single - crystal x-ray structure of <nUm> is reported . Zr-X ( x = C , O , N ) distance in <nUm> are in the range of Cp2Zr-X s-bonds in pentavalent zirconium complex and not in that of p-X-coordination . this is in accord with a formal description for these compound a iminium zirconate complex . treatment of [Cp2TiCH3(thf)+] ( <nUm> , with [BPh4-] anion ) with 1,3-diisopropylimidazol-2-ylidene ( 4 ) at ambient temperature resulted in a rapid displacement of the thf ligand by the stable heterocyclic carbene to yield the arduengo carbene methyltitanocene cation complex 6a ( > <nUm> % isolated ) . the x-ray crystal structure analysis of 6a showed that the heteroatom - stabilized carbene ligand [ d(Ti-C(carbene) = <nUm> Å , d(Ti-CH3) = <nUm> Å ] wa bonded to titanium in an orientation where the imidazol-2-ylidene ring lie in the major s-ligand plane of the bent metallocene moiety . A DFT calculation of 6a and a series of related model compound ha revealed that the arduengo carbene serf a a pure s-donor ligand to the titanocene moiety . the observed favored " in-plane " orientation of the ligand is steric in origin . consequently , complex 6a attains an analogous Cs - symmetric structure in solution , featuring symmetry - equivalent cp ring and a pair of diastereotopic isopropyl substituents a well a chemically differentiated imidazol-2-ylidene C4H = C5H group . the reaction of the ion pair [(Cp2ZrCH3)+CH3B(C6F5] 3- ] ( 7 ) with <nUm> gave the analogous arduengo carbene zirconocene cation complex 6b ( > <nUm> % isolated , with [CH3B(C6F5)3-] anion ) . the reaction of BrC5Cl2H5Zr with <nUm> equiv of K(2,4-C7H11) and <nUm> equiv of dmpe wa found to lead to the 18-electron half - open zirconocene Zr(C5H5)(2,4-C7H11)(dmpe) ( C7H11 = dimethylpentadienyl ; dmpe = Me2PC2H4PMe2 ) , which ha been fully characterized . A structural study ha revealed that the Zr-C bond distance for the open dienyl ligand are significantly shorter than those for the CH ligand . alternatively , through a similar reaction involving the use of only <nUm> equiv of a more selective (pentadienyl)magnesium reagent , the two dienyl anion serve a one - electron reducing agent , and the Zr (II) complex Zr(C5H5)(Br)(dmpe)2 is obtained , which ha also been fully characterized . In the absence of dmpe , the reaction between BrC5Cl2H5Zr and <nUm> equiv of the magnesium reagent lead to an unusual C19H26Zr complex . the C2H3 ligand wa formed from the coupling of two 2,4-C7H11 ligand , followed by the loss of one hydrogen atom , presumably abstracted by the third 2,4-C7H11 ligand . the C2H3 ligand bond to the zirconium center through both e5-dienyl and e4- " diene " coordination , leading to an 18-electron complex . the structural parameter indicate that the diene coordination can be more appropriately described a enediyl coordination , leading to a formal Zr(IV) instead of Zr (II) complex . the presence of a high formal metal oxidation state would seem to explain the fact that in this complex , a opposed to Zr(C5H5)(2,4-C7H11)(dmpe) and many other related complex , the M-C bond distance for the CH ligand are much shorter than those for the open dienyl ligand . the zirconocene - alkyne complex Cp2Zr(py)(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3 ) reacts with methyl vinyl ketone to yield the zirconadihydrofuran Cp2ZrOCMe = C2H3 ( 1 ) . In contrast , rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) ( ebthi = 1,2-ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) reacts with methyl vinyl ketone giving , for the first time , the 1,4-conjugated insertion product rac - (ebthi)ZrOCMe = CHCH2C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) ( 2 ) in good yield . an x-ray crystallographic structure determination of <nUm> show that the seven - membered ring is twisted in such a way to fit the steric demand of the " ebthi " and SiMe3 group . treating rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) with tert-butyl acrylate give the zirconadihydrofuran rac - (ebthi)ZrOC(OtBu) = C2H3 ( 3 ) . the monomeric structure of <nUm> ha been established by x-ray crystallography . A different type of zirconadihydrofuran , rac - (ebthi)ZrOCMe(CH = CH2 ) - C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) ( 4 ) , result from the reaction with mesityl oxide . complex analogous to <nUm> and <nUm> were observed consecutively by NMR in the reaction of Thi2Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3 ) ( thi = e5-tetrahydroindenyl ) with methyl vinyl ketone . this let one conclude that the carbonyl insertion product ( e.g. <nUm> ) are formed first a intermediate . finally , rac-(ebthi)ZrCH2CHMe = C2H3 ( 5 ) , a zirconacyclopentene , is obtained from rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) and isoprene . the Et3N - assisted condensation of the ferriomethyl-silanol Cp(OC)2Fe-CH2-SiMe2OH ( 1 ) with <nUm> equiv of Cp2MCl2 ( m = Ti ( 2a ) , Zr ( 2b ) ) lead to the formation of the iron fragment substituted heterosiloxanes Cp(OC)2Fe-CH2-SiMe2O-M(Cl)Cp2 ( m = Ti ( 3a ) , Zr ( 3b ) ) . the bis(siloxy) zirconium complex [Cp(OC)2Fe-CH2-SiMe2O]2-ZrCp2 ( 4 ) is obtained by further condensation of the M-Cl functionality of 3b with <nUm> . the new compound have been identified spectroscopically , and in addition , 3b and <nUm> have been structurally characterized by single - crystal x-ray diffraction method . the reaction of Cl4Ti with (chlorodimethylsilyl)(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadiene result in the chemoselective elimination of Me3SiCl and cleanly affords ((chlorodimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl)titanium trichloride ( 2 ) . likewise , the reaction of Cl4Ti with (chlorodimethylsilyl)(trimethylsilyl)tetramethylcyclopentadiene ( 6 ) also result in the chemoselective elimination of Me3SiCl and cleanly affords ((chlorodimethylsilyl)tetramethylcyclopentadienyl)titanium trichloride ( 7 ) . this observation is in sharp contrast to the reaction of <nUm> with Cl4Zr , which result in the chemoselective elimination of Me3SiCl but affords a mixture of half - sandwich and zirconocene complex . support of complex <nUm> or <nUm> on (aminomethyl)polystyrene ( AMPS , <nUm> % cross-linking , <nUm> wt % N , <nUm> mmol of N / g of support ) , where the mole ratio of amine content of the support to precursor catalyst wa selected to be <nUm> : <nUm> , lead to the assembly of the constrained - geometry catalyst ( CGCs ) <nUm> or <nUm> , respectively . from the 29Si NMR , the presence of a single silicon specie wa observed in complex <nUm> , which ha been attributed to the CGC form . however , for <nUm> two silicon resonance were observed , one of which ha been attributed to the CGC form and the other to a titanium amide moiety . the Ti : Si : Cl ratio for both <nUm> and <nUm> wa found to be <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> through elemental analysis . complex <nUm> and <nUm> , in conjunction with MAO a the cocatalyst , were tested for ethylene homopolymerization and ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization . the thermal property and the molecular weight of the resulting polymer were determined . the observation of ethylene-co-1-octene provides independent evidence for the formation of supported CGC from the synthetic protocol . binuclear siloxyaluminum methyl complex of the type Me2Al(m-OSiR3)2AlMe2 react with protonated N,N-dimethylanilinium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate , with release of CH4 , to form the dimethylaniline (DMA)-stabilized siloxyaluminum methyl cation Me2Al(m-OSiR3)2AlMe(NMe2 (C6H5)+ . these cation abstract a cl- ligand from CH Cl2Zr , to give the dinuclear cation {(C5H5)2ZrCl}2(m-Cl)+ , and a CH3- ligand from C12H16Zr , to give by way of the DMA - stabilized cation (C5H5)2Zr(CH3)NMe2(C 6H5)+ the CH - activation product (C5H5)2ZrCH2NMe(C6 H5)+ ; reaction with Me2Si(ind)2 ZrMe2 in toluene solution yield a moderately active catalyst for ethene polymerization . this reactivity of siloxyaluminum methyl cation is qualitatively similar to , although substantially lower than , that of a silica gel surface treated with trimethylaluminum and a cationizing agent . treatment of 6-(dimethylamino)-6-methylpentafulvene ( 2a ) with methyllithium in ether at <nUm> ° C lead to CH3 addition to the C6 - fulvene carbon atom to yield the [C5H4-CMe2N-Me2]Li reagent 3a , whereas treatment of 2a with MeLi in THF at <nUm> ° C result in deprotonation with formation of [ C5H4-C( = CH2 ) - NMe2]Li ( 4a ) . In contrast , treatment of 6-diethylamino-6-methylfulvene ( 2b ) with methyllithium under any of these condition lead only to H+ - abstraction to give [ C5H4-C( = CH2 ) - NEt2]Li ( 4b ) . treatment of the reagent <nUm> with CpZrCl3 yield the enamino-Cp - substituted bent metallocenes [ e5-C5H4-C( = CH2 ) - NR2 ] CpZrCl2 5a ( r = CH3 ) and 5b ( r = C2H5 ) , respectively . analogous treatment of 4b with zirconium tetrachloride gave the doubly functionalized zirconocene complex [ e5-C5H4-C( = CH2)-NEt2]2ZrCl2 ( 6b ) . the complex 5a , 5b , and 6b were characterized by x-ray diffraction . treatment of 3a with CpZrCl3 gave [e5-C5H4-CMe2-NMe2]Cp Cl2Zr ( 8a ) ; the analogous reaction with Cl4Zr gave [e5-C5H4-CMe2-NMe2] 2ZrCl2 ( 8b ) . both complex <nUm> reacted with (butadiene)magnesium with replacement of both chloride ligand at zirconium . the probably generated (e4-butadiene)zirconocene complex were , however , not stable under the applied reaction condition , but reacted further by C-H activation at the N-CH3 group with intramolecular hydrogen transfer to the butadiene ligand to yield the cyclometalated product [ e5-C5H4-CMe2- N(CH3)-CH2-]Zr(L)(CH2CHCHCH3) 13a ( L = cp ) and 13b ( L = [e5-C5H4CMe2-NMe2] ) , respectively . complex 5a reacts analogously with (butadiene)magnesium to yield the C-H activation product [ e5-C5H4-C( = = CH2)-N(CH3 )-CH2-]ZrCp(CH2CHCHCH3) <nUm> . the 1-diethylaminoethenyl-Cp - substituted system 5b and 6b react differently with (butadiene)magnesium . they form the stable e4-butadiene complex s-trans-15 and s-cis15A / B ( from 5b ) and s-trans-17 and s-cis-17 ( from 6b ) , respectively . [N]CH activation wa not observed in these case . treatment of the cyclometalated product 13a , <nUm> , and <nUm> with BC18F15 gave active homogeneous ziegler - natta catalyst for ethene polymerization , whereas the system 13b / BC18F15 and <nUm> / BC18F15 were close to inactive under comparable condition . Cp2Zr(e2-benzocyclobutadiene)(PMe3) , a rare e2-cyclobutadiene complex , wa investigated . the stabilization of a cyclobutadiene by a rare e2 coordination mode wa described . the coupling reaction of the complex with alkyne , nitrile , and isocyanides yielded zirconocene cyclobutene derivative , including a unique dewar-naphthalene structure . reduction of [ ZrCl2{e5-C5Me4(SiMe3 )}2 ] ( 1 ) with excess magnesium in tetrahydrofuran affords a mixture of the monomeric zirconocene hydride [ ZrH{e1:e5-C5Me4- (SiMe2CH2)}{e5-C5Me4( SiMe3 ) } ] ( 2 ) and the dimeric , tetranuclear Zr(III)- and Zr(IV) - magnesium hydride complex <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . In the presence of bis(trimethylsilyl)ethyne ( btmse ) , a similar reduction yield the e2-alkyne complex [ Zr{e5-C5Me4(SiMe3)}2 - ( e2-btmse ) ] ( 5 ) a the major product and compound 2-4 a minor impurity . upon thermolysis under vacuum , <nUm> undergoes a 2-fold hydrogen transfer from trimethylsilyl group in the zirconocene intermediate to leaving btmse to afford [ Zr{e5:e1-C5Me4 (SiMe2CH2)}- <nUm> ] ( 6 ) and a mixture of alkene (E)- and (Z)-Me3SiCH = CHSiMe3 ( e ≫ z ) . crystal structure of compound <nUm> and 4-6 were determined by x-ray crystallography . the rate of reductive elimination a a function of alkyl ligand ha been measured for a series of zirconocene alkyl hydride complex , Cp*Cp''Zr(R)H ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 , cp'' = e5-C5H3-1,3-(SiMe3)2 , r = CH3 , C4H9 , C8H17 , CH2cC6H11 , CH2CHMe2 , CH2 - CMe3 ) , where the steric disposition of the alkyl ligand ha been systematically varied . the rate of reductive elimination increase modestly a the steric bulk of the alkyl ligand is increased . this trend is attributed to ground state destabilization arising from unfavorable steric interaction between the alkyl ligand and the cyclopentadienyl substituents . the effect is magnified when more voluminous cyclopentadienyl ligand are incorporated into the metallocene framework . thus , the Cp*Cp'''Zr(R)H ( cp''' = e5-C5H2-1,2,4- (SiMe3)3 , r = CH3 , CH2 C3H7 , C8H17 ) series of alkyl hydride complex lose alkane more readily than the corresponding Cp*Cp''Zr(R)H complex . In addition , the rate of reductive elimination ha also been examined for Cp*Cp''Zr(Ph)(H) and Cp*Cp''Zr(CH2Ph)H ( ph = C6H5 ) and is slower than the alkyl hydride series . the sluggish rate of reductive elimination are a result of ground state stabilization imparted by a strong zirconium-phenyl bond and by e2 coordination of the benzyl ligand , respectively . this interaction , along with the solid state structure of Cp*Cp''Zr(CH3)H , ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction . the kinetic data led to the synthesis of Cp*2Zr(CH2CMe3)H , which undergoes reductive elimination of alkane and coordination of dinitrogen . the reaction of bridged tris(trimethylsilyl)silyl fragment with <nUm> molar equiv of potassium tert-butoxide allow the generation of a,o-oligosilyl dianions ( 1a , 2a , 3a , 4a ) . depending on the nature of the spacer between the oligosilyl unit , these compound can be used to generate either linear or cyclic derivative . they are especially attractive for the formation of homo- and heterocyclosilanes , a exemplified by the synthesis of sila- , stanna- , and zirconocena-cyclosilanes . A linear bis(potassiumsilyl)acetylene ( 4a ) wa used to bridge two zirconocene unit , ( Cp2Zr(Cl)Si(SiMe3)2CCSi(SiMe3) 2Zr(Cl)Cp2 ) ( 11 ) . density functional theory calculation at the B3LYP level were performed to study the electronic structure of a recently synthesized zirconocene complex , Cp2ZrCHRCCCHR ( r = SiMe3 ) . through detailed bonding analysis and stability study , we conclude that the originally proposed metallacyclopentyne form can not adequately describe the complex . instead , a resonance hybrid between a cumulene complex form and a metallacyclopentyne lewis structure is required to account for the structure and stability of the complex . the sequential reaction of 9-fluorenyllithium and CpNa with ( iPr ) 2NBCl <nUm> followed by the sequential treatment with LDA and ClZr <nUm> afforded [ ( η 5-C 13H 8)BN( i-Pr ) <nUm> ( η 5-C 5H 5H 4)ZrCl <nUm> ( 2e ) . the structure of 2e wa determined by x-ray diffraction , which show that the molecule ha C s symmetry . on activation by excess methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) 2e wa converted to an active catalyst for polymerization of ethylene and propylene . the polypropylene is syndiotactic ( <nUm> % rr triad ) . reaction of a particularly bulky silanol , (2,4,6-Me3C6H2)3SiOH , with Al2Me6 give , instead of the otherwise preferred unreactive binuclear siloxalanes with two siloxy bridge , a binuclear siloxalane with one siloxy and one methyl bridge , Me2Al(m-OSi(2,4,6-Me3C6 H2)3)(m-Me)AlMe2 . this specie reacts with zirconocene dichloride under chloride / methyl exchange ; with the cationizing reagent PhMe2NH+B(C6 F5)4- it form the B(C6 F5)4- salt of the mononuclear cation AlMe2(NPhMe2)2+ . A superphane consisting of one thiophene ring and one CpCo - stabilized cyclobutadiene ring , <nUm> , wa prepared in an eight - step synthesis from 5-cyclodecynol protected with tert-butyldimethylsilyl , <nUm> . the first key step in this sequence wa the reaction of <nUm> with zirconocene and subsequently with ClS to yield the tricyclic thiophene derivative <nUm> . the second key step wa the ring closure of <nUm> with CpCo(COD) to give <nUm> . x-ray structural investigation of <nUm> and <nUm> confirmed the structural assignment . evidence for the close proximity of the CpCo - stabilized cyclobutadiene and the thiophene ring is also given by the electronic absorption spectrum of <nUm> and the oxidation potential ( <nUm> V ) . hydride abstraction reaction of the zirconocene cyclic organohydroborate complex cp 2ZrH{(mH) 2BR <nUm> } ( r <nUm> = C 4H <nUm> ; C 3H <nUm> , <nUm> ) with B(C 8F <nUm> ) <nUm> were observed a a function of solvent . the reaction in poorly coordinating solvent , benzene and toluene , form [ HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - salt of Zr-H-Zr hydrogen - bridged cation [ (m-H){Cp 2Zr(m-H) 2BR <nUm> } <nUm> ] + ( r <nUm> = C 4H <nUm> , <nUm> ; C 8H <nUm> , <nUm> ) , in which there is no direct metal - metal bonding between the bridged metal . the unsupported hydrogen - bridged bond in complex <nUm> wa cleaved when it wa dissolved in the coordinating solvent THF to produce the neutral complex <nUm> and the ionic complex [ cp 2Zr(THF){(m-H) 2BC 6H 14}][HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] . In the coordinating solvent , diethyl ether , the salt of [ cp 2Zr(OEt 2)X ] +[HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - ( x = OEt , <nUm> ; { ( -H ) 2BC 8H <nUm> } , <nUm> ) consisting of zirconocene cation with coordinated solvent ligand were isolated . the formation of <nUm> involves hydride insertion from zirconium into the carbon oxygen bond of one the coordinated ether , resulting in the liberation of ethane and the formation of an ethoxyl group coordinated to zirconium . the diethyl ether molecule in the cation <nUm> and <nUm> are weakly coordinated to Zr and are displaced in THF solution . single - crystal x-ray structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were determined . standard ligand - substitution reaction afforded moderate yield of ( PhC 5H <nUm> ) 2ZrCl <nUm> ( 1 ) , ( 1,3-Ph 2C 5H 3)CpZrCl <nUm> ( 2 ) , [ 1,3,-(C 6F <nUm> ) 2C 5H 3]CpZrCl <nUm> ( 5 ) , and [ 1,2,4-(C 6F <nUm> ) 2C 5H 3]CpZrCl <nUm> ( 6 ) . crystal structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and [ ( C 6F 5C 5H <nUm> ] 2HfMe <nUm> ( 7 ) were obtained . physicochemical study ( CV , IR ) show that C 6F <nUm> group are strongly electron - withdrawing compared to phenyl group . In ethylene-1-hexene copolymerization reaction using <nUm> , <nUm> , ( C 6F 5C 5H 4)CpZrCl <nUm> ( 3 ) , ( C 6F 5C 5H <nUm> ) 2ZrCl <nUm> ( 4 ) , and <nUm> ( toluene solution , methylalumoxane cocatalyst ) , C 6F <nUm> substituents decrease catalytic activity but increase comonomer incorporation compared to phenyl substituents . the alternating copolymerization of CO and ethene at the zirconocene center Cp2Zr , Me2-SiCp2Zr , and rac-Me2SiInd2Zr wa investigated by DFT method . CO coordinate much more strongly than ethene but ha a rather high insertion barrier . thus , propagation is slowed dramatically but the growing chain will not necessarily all incorporate CO . secondary alkyl insert CO more efficiently than primary alkyl . after the first CO insertion , subsequent olefin and CO insertion will alternate . olefin insertion will be very slow at high CO pressure , but at low [CO] the olefin and CO insertion barrier are comparable and are lower than that of the first CO insertion . use of CO a a quenching and chain - counting method appears to be safe , provided a high pressure of CO is employed and the quenched reaction is not worked up at low temperature . the dual - site zirconocene dichloride rac - and meso-SiMe2(3- benzylindenyl)(indenyl)ZrCl2 have been synthesized and used , after a methylaluminoxane activation , in propene polymerization . these diastereomers produce isotactic polypropene with similar microstructures and molar mass under equivalent polymerization condition . the complex [ Zr(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe 3)(e5-C5Me4R)2 ] ( r = me ( 5 ) , H ( 6 ) , SiMe3 ( 7 ) ) reacted smoothly with terminal alkyne HC ≡ CR ( ŕ = CMe3 , SiMe3 , ferrocenyl ( fc ) , ph ) to give the agostic alkenyl-alkynyl complex [ zr(e1- C ≡ CR){e3-C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe 3)}(e5-C5Me4R)2 ] ( r / ŕ = me / CMe3 ( 5a ) , me / SiMe3 ( 5b ) , H / CMe <nUm> ( 6a ) , H / SiMe3 ( 6b ) , H / fc ( 6c ) , H / ph ( 6d ) , SiMe <nUm> / CMe3 ( 7a ) , SiMe3 / fc ( 7c ) ) . complex 7a , formed in situ from <nUm> and HC ≡ CCMe3 , dimerized tert-butylethyne exclusively to give the head - to - tail dimer Me3CC ≡ CC(CMe <nUm> ) = CH2 , and when all the terminal alkyne wa consumed , <nUm> wa restored . complex <nUm> reacted similarly with 1-hexyne , phenylethyne , and (trimethylsilyl)ethyne , affording the respective alkenyl-alkynyl complex , which also changed back to <nUm> on evaporation of the reaction solution ; none of these terminal alkyne wa dimerized with 5-7 . heating of complex <nUm> with CLi ≡ CSiMe3 in toluene or THF yielded the diamagnetic zirconate complex Li[Zr(e1-C ≡ CSiMe3)(e2- Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3)(e5-C 5HMe4)2 ] ( 6e ) and it solvatomorph Li[Zr(e1-C ≡ CSiMe3)(e2-Me 3SiC ≡ CSiMe3)(e5-C5HMe 4)2]*C4H8O ( 6f ) , respectively . the lithium cation in 6e and 6f is placed in a position at the side of the alkynyl triple bond and close to C3 of the e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ligand , apparently interacting with both moiety . all presented complex were characterized by the standard spectral method , and the structure of 5a , 6a , 6c , 6d , and 6e were determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . bridged silsesquioxanes . the zirconocene methyl cation [ ( C 5R 5)ZrMe(ClC 6D <nUm> ) ] [ B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( C 5R <nUm> = C 5H <nUm> ( 1a ) , C 5H 4Me ( 1b ) ) react with PhSiH <nUm> in the dark to yield [ { ( C 5R <nUm> ) 2Zr(m-H) } 2][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] <nUm> ( 5a , b ) and a mixture of ph xMe yH zSi product . the reaction proceeds by initial Zr-C / Si-H s-bond metathesis via a four - In the presence of light , significant amount of [ { ( C 5R <nUm> ) 2Zr(m-Cl) } <nUm> ] [ B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] <nUm> ( 4a,b ) are formed by photochemical reaction of ( C 5R <nUm> ) 2ZrH + specie with the chlorobenzene solvent . the azazirconacycle [ rac-(EBI)Zr{e 2(C,N)-CH 2CHMe(6-phenyl-2-pyridyl) } ] [ B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( <nUm> , EBI = 1,2-ethylene-bis-indenyl ) doe not react with PhSiH <nUm> at <nUm> ° C . however at <nUm> ° C , <nUm> deinserts propene to afford the η 2-pyridyl complex [ rac-(EBI)Zr{e 2(C,N)-(6-phenyl-2-pyridyl)}][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 6 ) , which is catalytically isomerized to [ rac-(EBI)Zr{e 2(C,N)-2-(2-pyridyl)phenyl}][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 7 ) by PhSiH <nUm> . the key step in this process is Zr-G / Si-H s-bond metathesis of <nUm> with PhSiH <nUm> via a transition state in which Si is α to Zr . the le crowded azazirconacycle [ cp 2Zr{e 2(C,N)-CH 2CHMe-(6-methyl-2-pyridyl) }][B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 3 ) reacts with PhSiH <nUm> directly to afford [ { cp 2Zr(SiPhH <nUm> ) } <nUm> ] - [ B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] <nUm> ( 8 ) via a transition state in which Si is α to Zr . steric factor may play a role in determining the selectivity of these reaction . the sterically shielded cation rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-Bu-C 5H2)2ZrMe+ , generated by reaction of rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-Bu-C5H2) 2ZrMe2 with methylalumoxane ( MAO ) or with dimethyl-anilinium or trityl perfluorotetraphenylborate , differs from other , more open zirconocene methyl cation in that it doe not form the symmetric AlMe3 adduct rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-Bu-C5H 2)2Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2+ . instead , the unsymmetric ternary adduct rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C 5H2)2ZrMe(m-Me)AlMe3-NMe 2Ph+ is formed in the presence of dimethylaniline and trimethylaluminum . UV / vi and 1H NMR characteristic of hydrocarbon solution containing rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-Bu-C5H 2)2ZrMe+ ⋯ B(C6F 5)4- or rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-Bu-C 5H2)2ZrMe+ ⋯ MAOMe- indicate that cation - anion association in these ion pair is unusually weak . the rather exotic and uncommon five - membered metallacyclocumulenes ( 1-metallacyclopenta-2,3,4-trienes ) Cp'2M(e4- RC4R ) ( cp' = substituted e5-cyclopentadienyl ) are formed by " ci " complexation of titanocene or zirconocene fragment with 1,3-butadiynes or by coupling of two s-acetylide group in the coordination sphere of the metal . example of these complex , cp 2M(e4-RC4R) ( m = Zr , r = t-Bu ; m = Ti , r = t-Bu , r = ph ) , Cp*2M(e4-RC4R') ( m = Zr , r = R' = Me3Si , me , ph , t-BuMe2Si ; r = t-Bu , R' = C = C-t-Bu ) , ( e6-C5H 5BX)2Zr-(e4-RC4R) ( x = i-Pr-2N , r = ph ; x = ph , r = ph , et ) , ( e5 : n 1-C5Me4SiMe2N-t-Bu ) Ti(e4-RC4R) ( r = t-Bu , SiMe3 ) , and [ cp 2Zr]3[1,3,5-(e4-t-BuC4) 3C6H3 ] , are discussed with regard to their genesis , synthesis , dynamic , structure , and bonding . these compound are compared with the also uncommon and very similar five - membered metallacyclopentynes ( 1-metallacyclopent-3-ynes ) Cp'2M(e 4-R2C4R2 ) ( m = Zr : cp' = cp , R2 = t-Bu / H , Me3Si / H , H ; cp' = t-BuC5H4 , R2 = H ; m = Ti : cp' = cp , R2 = H ) formed by analogous " ci " complexation of 1,2,3-butatrienes , in term of their chemistry , structure , and bonding . furthermore , reaction in which metallacyclocumulenes were assumed to be intermediate are described , together with the reactivity of metallacyclocumulenes toward different complex and substrate : e.g. metal complex , carbon dioxide , diisobutylaluminum hydride , and tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane . upon complexation with a second transition - metal complex fragment either bridging formal m- " ci " or m-mtrans " complex of 1,3-butadiynes and 1,2,3-butatrienes were formed . the zirconocene-ethylene complex and (Z)-1,4-bis(trimethylsilyl)-1,2,3- butatriene reacted to give a mixture of 1-zirconacyclopent-3-yne and 1-zirconacyclohept-3-yne . A zirconocene - alkyne complex gave , on the other hand , 1-zirconacyclohept-2-en-5-yne , which wa structurally characterized a the major product along with a lesser amount of 1-zirconacyclopent-3-yne . A series of chiral ansa zirconocene compound that feature ( i ) [ me 2Si ] and [ me 4Si <nUm> ] bridge and ( ii ) two tert-butyl substituents on each cyclopentadienyl ring , namely , rac- [ me 2Si(CpBu <nUm> t ) <nUm> ] - ClZr <nUm> , rac - [ me 2Si(CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]Zr(Ph)Cl , rac - [ me 2Si(CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]ZrMe <nUm> , rac - [ me 2Si(CpBu <nUm> t ) 2],Zr(CO) <nUm> rac - [ me 4Si <nUm> ( CpBu <nUm> <nUm> ) 2]ZrCl <nUm> , and rac - [ me 4Si <nUm> ( CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]Zr(CO) <nUm> , ha been synthesized . In each case , the complex exists a the racemo isomer due to inter-ring steric interaction between the bu t substituents proximal to the ansa bridge that destabilize the meso isomer . rac - [ me 4Si 2-(CpBu <nUm> t ) 2ZrCl <nUm> is the first structurally characterized ansa zirconocene complex with a [ me 4-Si <nUm> ] bridge that adopts a racemo geometry . IR spectroscopic study on the dicarbonyl complex ( cp 1,3-Bu <nUm> t ) 2Zr(CO) <nUm> rac - [ me 2Si(CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]Zr(CO) <nUm> , and rac - [ me 4Si <nUm> ( CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]Zr(CO) <nUm> demonstrate that the [ me 2Si ] and [ me 4Si <nUm> ] ansa bridge have opposite electronic influence in this system , with the [ me 2Si ] bridge exerting an electron - withdrawing effect and the [ me 4-Si <nUm> ] bridge exerting an electron - donating effect . the [ me 2Si ] and [ me 4Si <nUm> ] bridge also exert a different influence with respect to olefin polymerization , with { rac - [ me 2Si(CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]ZrCl <nUm> / MAO } being a more active catalyst system for polymerization of ethylene than is either { ( cp 1,3-Bu <nUm> t ) 2ZrCl <nUm> / MAO } or { rac - [ me 4Si <nUm> ( CpBu <nUm> t ) 2]ZrCl <nUm> / MAO } . A 1-zirconacyclopent-3-yne complex ( 1 ) reacted with " zirconocene " to give a symmetrical , bimetallic 1,2,3-butatriene complex ( 6 ) in which butatriene coordinate to two equivalent zirconocene unit . treatment of <nUm> with trimethylphosphine gave the phosphine - stabilized zirconocene-1 complex ( 2 ) , which wa transformed into <nUm> by addition of triethylborane . the catalytic system of Cp2ZrCl2 and n-BuLi ( <nUm> equiv with respect to Zr ) promotes hydrosilation of styrene derivative in the markovnikov addition manner , which is the reverse regioselectivity compared to that for Zr - catalyzed olefin hydrosilation with the standard protocol ( Zr / n-BuLi = <nUm> / <nUm> ) . the reaction of sodium metal with cp 2ZrCl <nUm> and RGaCl <nUm> in hexane affords cp 2Zr(GaR) <nUm> ( r = -C 6H 3-2,6-(2,4,6-i-Pr 3C 6H <nUm> ) <nUm> ) a deep green - black air - sensitive crystal . essentially , cp 2Zr(GaR) <nUm> is isoelectronic with the well - known 18-electron zirconocene dicarbonyl , cp 2-Zr(CO) <nUm> , complex . the title compound is the first example of an organometallic compound containing Ga-Zr bond ( Ga-Zr = <nUm> Å ) . the synthesis ( 4a-d ) and structure ( 4a,c ) of the four crystalline , water - stable , hydrocarbon- and perfluorocarbon (PFC)-soluble fluorous zirconocene(IV) dichloride precatalysts [ Zr-{n5-C 5H4SiMe3-n(RF)n } 2Cl2 ] ( n = <nUm> , RF = C2H3 2C6F13 ( 4a ) , C8F17 ( 4b ) , C7F5H2 ( 4c ) ; n = <nUm> , RF = CH 2C6F5 ( 4d ) ) , possessing one to three fluorous alkyl or aryl group attached to the cyclopentadienyl ligand through a silicon atom and an additional methylene ( 4c,d ) or ethylene ( 4a ) spacer or no spacer at all ( 4b ) , are reported . A nonfluorous analogue of 4a , [ zr{n5- C5H4-SiMe2C8H17 } 2Cl2 ] ( 4e ) , wa prepared for comparison , and 4a wa easily converted to it dimethyl derivative [ Zr{n5-C5H 4SiMe2CH2CH2C6F 13}2Me2 ] ( 5a ) . the ethylene polymerization activity of the zirconocene dichloride were compared to those of the known bis-{(trimethylsilyl)cyclopentadienyl}zirconium dichloride [ zr{n5- C5 H4SiMe3}2Cl2 ] ( 4f ) , in both toluene and fluorous biphasic solvent ( FBS ) system . In the case of 4b a PE with a bimodal molecular weight distribution and a significantly lower molecular weight wa obtained . polymerization data and polymer property for 4a-d , compared to data for 4f , show a marked influence of the fluorous group and the alkyl spacer ( e.g. methylene in 4c or ethylene in 4a ) . FBS condition result in PE with a higher average molecular weight . evidence on the nature of the active specie formed when these precatalysts were treated with an excess of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) is presented . treatment of bis(propynyl)zirconocene with BC6F 5)3 result in a linear C-C coupling of the alkynyl ligand to form the zwitterionic complex <nUm> . it treatment with excess RC ≡ N yield an organometallic methylenecyclopropene derivative ( 6 ) . this reaction topologically requires a very endothermic substituted butenyne to methylenecyclopropene cyclization to become energetically feasible by suitable stabilization effect . A DFT study ha revealed that the <nUm> → <nUm> conversion is probably triggered by nitrile addition to the metal with formation of a planar-tetracoordinate carbon intermediate , featuring coordination of the three - membered carbocycle through one of it carbon-carbon σ bond . evaluation of the steric and electronic influence of a family of silyl-and alkyl-substituted indenyl liganda on zirconium and iron center ha been accomplished by a combination of x-ray diffraction , IR spectroscopy , solution NMR dynamic , and electrochemical measurement . three tetrasubstituted , bis-indenyl zirconocene dichloride complex have been characterized by x-ray diffraction and adopt a gauche ligand conformation such that the interaction between tertiary substituents on adjacent ring are minimized . similar solid state conformation were also observed in two of the corresponding iron compound . evaluation of the electronic environment about each zirconium center wa achieved by measurement of the CO stretching frequency of the dicarbonyl derivative . simple inductive effect govern the electronic property of each zirconocene where silyl group are relatively electron withdrawing and alkyl group electron donating . for the most hindered zirconocene dicarbonyl derivative , population of three vibrationally distinct rotamers ha been detected by IR spectroscopy . independent assessment of these stereoelectronic parameter by variable - temperature NMR spectroscopy and electrochemistry with the analogous series of iron complex provided the same relative ordering of the indenyl ligand . the structure and relative energy of onsa - zirconocene bis-amide complex were studied by DFT computation . x-ray crystal structure and experimental trend in DE rac - meso value for a series of zirconocenes with terminal and chelated bis-amide ligand were reproduced with reasonable accuracy by B3LYP / LANL2DZ / / B3LYP / LANL2MB . In the absence of overriding steric interaction , the most stable conformation of Zr{PhN(CH <nUm> ) 3NPh } ring in zirconocenes is the twist conformation . for ( C 5H <nUm> ) 2Zr{PhN(CH <nUm> ) 3NPh } ( 5 ) , the twist conformer is <nUm> kcal / mol more stable than the chair and <nUm> kcal / mol more stable than the boat . rac - (MBSBI)Zr{PhN(CH <nUm> ) 3NPh } ( rac-3 ; MBSBI = me 2Si(2-Me-4,5- benzindenyl ) <nUm> ) is <nUm> kcal / mol more stable than the meso isomer because the latter specie must undergo a combination of distortion to accommodate the favored twist conformation of the Zr{PhN - ( CH <nUm> ) 3NPh } ring . these distortion include a significant η 3-slip and an exaggerated angle between the C6 and C5 ring plane for one benzindenyl ligand and a subtle flattening of the Zr{PhN(CH <nUm> ) 3NPh } ring . In contrast , rac - (MBSBI)Zr{PhN(CH <nUm> ) 2NPh } ( rac-7 ) is only <nUm> kcal / mol more stable than the meso isomer . In this case , the Zr{PhN(CH <nUm> ) 2NPh } ring adopts an envelope conformation in which one N-P / i ring lie in the N-Zr-N plane and steric interaction on the crowded side of the meso metallocene unit are minimized . these result provide insight into the origin of rac / meso selectivity in chelate - controlled synthesis of ansazirconocenes based on the reaction of Zr bis-amide compound with lithium arcsa-bis-indenyl and cyclopentadienyl reagent . summary : In reaction of the zirconocene 2-vinylpyridine complex cp 2Zr(2-vipy) ( 1 ) with iBu2AlH and iBu2AlF the isostructural complex [ cp 2Zr(m-e1:e2-2-CH2CH- C5H4N)-(m-W][iBu2Al] ( 3 ) and [ Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-2-CH 2CH-C5H4N)(m-F)][iBu 2Al ] ( 5 ) were formed . these complex can serve a model for the transfer of fluorine from zirconium to aluminum ( Zr-F with Al-H to Zr-H and Al-F ) found in the reaction of rac - (ebthi)ZrF2 with iBu2AlH to form the dimeric complex [ rac-(ebthi)ZrH(m- H)]2 ( 6 ) . the compound are important in obtaining an understanding of the activation of zirconocene fluoro complex by ' BusAl and of the role of iBu2AlH in activation process for the catalytic polymerization of olefin . C1 - bridged and Me2Si - bridged 2,5-dimethylcylcopentadienyl ansa - zirconocene complex , [ Me(H)C(C5H4)(2,5-Me 2C5H2)]ZrCl2 ( 6 ) , [ ( CH 3CH2CH2)(H)C(C5H4)(2,5- Me2C5H2)]ZrCl2 ( 9 ) , [(Me)(H)C(2,5-Me2C5H2)2]ZrCl <nUm> ( 13 ) , and [ Me2Si(2,5-Me2C5H2) 2]ZrCl2 ( 15 ) , are prepared by using 2-bromo-3-methoxy-2,5- dimethylcyclopentene ( 7 ) a a starting material . solid structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by x-ray crystallography . the C1 - bridged zirconocene complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> are highly active for ethylene / norbornene copolymerization with high incorporation of norbornene , while the Me2Si - bridged complex <nUm> show relatively low activity . complex <nUm> show the highest activity and the highest incorporation of norbornene among the complex , but the molecular weight of the obtained polymer is relatively low . density functional theory calculation at the B3LYP level have been performed to investigate the mechanism of the zirconocene - catalyzed addition of the ortho C-H bond of a-picoline to propene to produce 2-Me-6- iPr-pyridine . the computational result support the proposed mechanism , which involves ( i ) 2-Me-pyridine dissociation from [ cp 2Zr(2-Me-6-pyridyl)(2-Me-pyridine) ] + followed by the insertion of propene into the Zr-C bond of the η 2-pyridyl complex cp 2Zr(e 2-2-Me-6-pyridyl ) + ( 1 ) to yield the azametallacycle cp 2Zr{e 2-C,N-CH 2CHMe-(2- me-6-pyridyl ) } + ( 2 ) , ( ii ) hydrogenolysis of <nUm> to produce cp 2Zr(H)(2-Me-6- iPr-pyridine)+ ( 3 ) , ( iii ) ligand substitution of <nUm> by a-picoline to release 2-Me-6- iPr-pyridine and form cp 2Zr(H)(2-Me-pyridine) + ( 4 ) , and ( iv ) C-H activation of <nUm> to release H <nUm> and regenerate <nUm> . consistent with the experimental result , the 2-Me-pyridine dissociation from [ cp 2Zr(2-Me-6-pyridyl)(2-Me-pyridine) ] + followed by the propene insertion of <nUm> and the hydrogenolysis of <nUm> are calculated to be the rate - determining step . the calculation provide new insight into the role of the cocatalyst H <nUm> , the origin of the regioselectivity of the C-H activation and insertion step , and the preference for a-picoline / propene coupling over propene hydrogenation . starting from zirconocene bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene complex Cp'2Zr(L)(e2btmsa) via the 2-vinylpyridine complex Cp'2Zr(2-vipy) a novel synthetic method for zirconocene difluoride and alkyl monofluoride complex wa elaborated . example with selected different ligand system cp'2 [ cp2 = bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) ; ebthi = 1,2-ethylene-1,1'- bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) ; (thi)2 = bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) ; Me2Si(e5- C5H4)2 = dimethylsilylbis-(e5- cyclopentadienyl ) ; (i)2 = bis(e5-indenyl) ; ebi = 1,2-ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-indenyl) ; and me 2Si(e5-C9H10)2 = dimethylsilyl-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) ] were synthesized . In the series of these investigation new complex ( i ) 2Zr(THF)(e2-btmsa) ( 1 ) , rac - (ebi)Zr(THF) ( e2-btmsa ) ( 2 ) , (thi)2Zr(2-vipy) ( 3 ) , me 2Si(e5-C5H4)2Zr(2- vipy ) ( 4 ) , (i)2Zr(2-vipy) ( 5 ) , and rac-(ebthi)-Zr(2-Ph-vipy) ( 6 ) were prepared a starting material . different method for preparation of the zirconocene difluorides rac - (ebthi)ZrF2 ( 7 ) , ( thi ) 2ZrF2 ( 8 ) , Me4C2(e5- C5H4)2ZrF2 ( 9 ) , and me 2Si(e5-C9H10) 2ZrF2 ( 10 ) and the monofluorides Cp2Zr(F) ( CH2CH2-2-Py ) ( 11 ) , rac-(ebthi)-Zr(F)(CH 2CH2-2-Py ) ( 12 ) , (thi)2Zr(F)(CH 2CH2-2-py ) ( 13 ) , Me2Si(e5-C 5H4)2Zr(F)(CH2CH2-2-py) ( 14 ) , and Me2Si(e5-C9H10) 2ZrF(Me) ( 15 ) are reported and compared . the molecular structure of the bis-e5-tetrahydroindenyl complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were confirmed by x-ray crystal structure analysis . enolizable ketone and thiols have been investigated a potential transfer agent for methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) polymerization mediated by the cp <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> / B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> system . addition of 1-10 equiv of acetophenone , acetone , or thiophenols inhibits polymerization , while the system tolerates the presence of tert-butylthiol ( tBuSH ) . In this case , a moderate decrease in the molecular weight of the PMMAs is observed . the stoichiometric reactivity of these organic acid toward the cationic ester enolate complex [ cp <nUm> Zr(THF)(O(tBuO)C = CMe <nUm> ) ] + [ MeB-(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - ( 1 ) , which model the active specie for MMA polymerization , ha been investigated . ketone undergo aldolization reaction with <nUm> to generate specie that are inactive in MMA polymerization . thiols readily cleave the Zr-O bond of <nUm> to give [ cp <nUm> Zr(SR)(THF) ] + cation ( r = tBu , <nUm> ; SC <nUm> H <nUm> -p-Cl , <nUm> ; SC <nUm> H <nUm> -o-OMe , <nUm> ) . the crystal structure of <nUm> ha been determined . In the presence of a tert-butyl ester R'CO <nUm> tBu , thiolato complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> smoothly decompose into the corresponding cationic carboxylato complex [ cp <nUm> Zr(THF)(O <nUm> CR' ) ] + ( R' = iPr , <nUm> ; CH <nUm> , <nUm> ) and thiol RSH , with release of isobutene . tert-Butylthiolato complex <nUm> and the in situ combination cp <nUm> Zr(StBu)Me / B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> polymerized quantitatively MMA in toluene to yield PMMAs with narrow dispersity ( m n / m w = <nUm> - <nUm> ) , but with molecular weight much higher than the expected m n value , consistent with poor initiation efficiency and / or instability . A series of 2-R 2P - substituted indene , where r 2P = ph 2P , cy 2P , iPr 2P , and tBu(H)P , were obtained via Pd - catalyzed reaction of 2-bromo-1H-indene ( or 1H-inden-2-yl trifluoromethane sulfonate ) with r 2PH / et <nUm> N . analogous indene bearing me 2P , tBu(Cl)P , and tBu 2P substituants at position <nUm> were obtained through the reaction of 1H-inden-2-ylphosphonous dichloride with MeLi , tBuMgCl , and tBuMgCl / tBuLi - CCuN , respectively . diethyl 1H-inden-2-ylphosphonate , prepared via the Ni - catalyzed arbuzov reaction of 2-bromo-1H-indene with P(OEt) <nUm> , wa found to be a convenient starting material for the synthesis of 2-H 2P - substituted indene . 1H-Inden-2-yl(phenyl)phosphine , prepared via the Pd - catalyzed arylation of 2-H 2P - substituted indene by PhI , turned out to react with 2-bromo-1H-indene in the presence of Pd(PPh <nUm> ) <nUm> and et <nUm> N to form di(1H-inden-2-yl)(phenyl)phosphine in almost quantitative yield . analogously , di(1H-inden-2-yl)(tert-butyl)phosphine wa prepared via catalytic reaction of tBuPH <nUm> with <nUm> equiv of 2-bromo-1H-indene . triethylamine - promoted condensation of indene bearing P(H) tBu and ClP tBu fragment gave a mixture of cis- and trans-bis-indenyldiphosphines . zirconium complex ( 2-R 2P-indenyl ) 2ZrCl <nUm> ( r 2P = ph 2P , me 2P , cy 2P , iPr 2P , tBu 2P ) , a well a ansa - zirconocenes RP(2-indenyl) 2ZrCl <nUm> ( r = ph , tBu ) , were obtained in good yield from ClZr 4(THF) <nUm> and lithium salt of the respective 2-P - substituted indene . ansa - zirconocene ( tBuP ) 2(2-indenyl) 2ZrCl <nUm> including a P 2R <nUm> bridge wa synthesized in a similar manner and isolated a the pure rac - isomer . reaction of alkyllithium compound RLi ( r = me , et , i-Pr , Np ) with BC18F15 result in the formation of the alkylborate salt Li[RB(C6F5)3] . metathesis reaction of these with ph3 - CCl and chloride salt of ( ph 3P)2N+ , PMePh3+ , and HNMe2Ph+ proceed with varying degree of success , a shown by NMR spectroscopy and electrospray mass spectrometry , and the compound [PPN][EtB(C6F5)3] , [PMePh3] [NpB(C6F5)3]3 , and [ HNMe 2Ph][NpB(C6F5)3] have been characterized crystallographically . all three anion assume the expected pseudotetrahedral structure with normal B - aryl bond length and R-B-aryl and aryl - B - aryl bond angle . the compound [HNMe2Ph] [ NpB(C 6F5)3 ] reacts with Cp2ZrMe <nUm> , (Indenyl)2ZrMe2 , and SBIZrMe2 to give propylene polymerization catalyst that are significantly more active and give higher molecular weight polypropylene than do the catalyst obtained using BC18F15 . thus the [ NpB(C6F 5]- anion is for steric reason more weakly coordinating than is [MeB(C6F5)3]- . A kinetics study of b-methyl elimination reaction of the compound Cp2ZrNp(m-Me)B-(C6F5)3 ( in various solvent ) and Cp*2ZrNp(m-Me)B(C6F 5)3 ( in CD2Cl2 ) show that the reaction are accelerated by polar solvent and by steric crowding in the cp* system , result consistent with previous finding and conclusion that the methyl migration are accompanied in a concerted process by borate anion departure from the inner coordination sphere of the metal ion . surprisingly , however , the isobutyl compound Cp*2Zr(i-Bu)(m-Me)B(C 6F5)3 , which is expected to undergo / ? -methyl elimination by analogy with an extensive literature on chain transfer process during propylene polymerization , undergoes very rapid b-hydrogen elimination only . the synthesis of mono- and 1,1'-diphosphaferrocenes bearing thienyl or phenyl substituents at the PCa carbon is described . monophosphaferrocenes can be obtained using a " one - pot " procedure involving the oxidative coupling of phenyl- or thienyl-capped octa-1,7-diynes with zirconocene . this route implies a cp transfer from a Zr specie to the iron center . these novel compound have been characterized by x-ray diffraction study , and their optical and electrochemical behavior have been elucidated . these data revealed that the optical gap vary with the substitution pattern and the nature of the metallocene ( mono v diphosphaferrocenes ) , whereas their electrochemistry is mainly controlled by the structure of the metallocene . the lowest gap are obtained with thienyl-substituted mono- and diphosphaferrocenes . compared to the corresponding oligomers featuring phosphole unit , these phosphaferrocene - based compound exhibit higher thermal stability and higher HOMO-LUMO separation . cationic methyl- and phenylzirconocene specie readily undergo insertion of CO2 into the zirconium-carbon bond , giving the corresponding dimeric carboxylato complex <nUm> and <nUm> in quantitative yield . <nUm> wa structurally characterized , displaying a bridging acetate ligand . In the reaction of the decamethylzirconocene-bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene complex Cp*2Zr(e2-Me3-SiC 2SiMe3 ) ( 1 ) with i-Bu2AlH , CH bond activation , an electrophilic substitution , and alumination of the pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand resulted in formation of the e5-C5Me4CH2-Al(i-Bu) 2H ligand . the final product contains an alkenyl complex that show an agostic C-H ⋯ Zr interaction , Cp*Zr[ - C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe3)](m-H)[e5-C5Me 4CH2-Al(i-Bu)2 ] ( 2 ) . heating complex <nUm> give the heterobimetallic complex Cp*Zr[ - C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe 3)Al(i-Bu)(m-H)(CH2-e5-C 5Me4 ) ] ( 3 ) , which is formed by an intramolecular reaction , analogous to intermolecular reaction of titanocene- and zirconocene - alkyne complex with i-Bu2AlH , which yield the well - known heterobimetallic complex with tetracoordinated planar carbon atom . both complex were characterized by NMR spectroscopy and x-ray crystal structure analysis . complex <nUm> catalyzes the ethene polymerization and the ring - opening polymerization of e-caprolactone . thermolysis of the cyclometalated zirconocene hydride ( η 5- C 5H 3-1,3-(SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ) ( η 5-C 5H 3-3-SiMe3-1-e 1- SiMe 2CH 2)ZrH , at <nUm> ° C in benzene-d <nUm> or toluene-d <nUm> , resulted in H / d exchange arising from reversible C-H activation of sp 2-hybridized bond . more careful inspection of the isotopic exchange reaction by NMR spectroscopy revealed formation of zirconocene aryl hydride complex in equilibrium with the cyclometalated hydride compound . In contrast , activation of (dimethylamino)pyridine ( DMAP ) wa complete at <nUm> ° C and afforded the ortho-metalated (dimethylamino)pyridyl hydride . performing the thermolysis of the cyclometalated zirconocene hydride in alkane solvent resulted in activation of a second [SiMe3] group on the opposite cyclopentadienyl ring , forming the C 2-symmetric double-cyclometalated complex ( η 5-C 5H 3-1,3-(SiMe <nUm> ) 2)(e 5-C 5H 3-3-SiMe3-1-e 1-SiMe 2CH <nUm> ) 2Zr . isotopic labeling study demonstrated that neopentane reductive elimination to yield the cyclometalated hydride proceeds through a cyclometalated assisted pathway , while the analogous extrusion of benzene occurs by direct C-H bond reductive coupling , possibly a consequence of the lower orbital reorganization energy associated with the sp2 - hybridized carbon . activation of DMAP follows a different course , where the nucleophilicity of the heterocycle induces reductive elimination and subsequent ortho metalation . In contrast , conversion of the cyclometalated zirconocene hydride to the double-cyclometalated derivative most likely occurs by a-bond metathesis , highlighting the various pathway available for carbon-hydrogen bond activation . combined car - parrinello and QM / MM dynamic simulation have been carried out in order to investigate the polymer chain propagation and termination process in ethylene polymerization catalyzed by zirconocene with the counteranion [CH3B(C6F5)3]- included . A complete account is given not only of the potential energy profile ( PEP ) but also of the free energy profile ( FEP ) for the first and second step of ethylene insertion , a well a of the chain termination . solvation effect were included on the basis of a continuum model . special attention wa given to the counteranion mobility in the catalytic process and the possible difference between PEP and FEP . two different mode of attack by ethylene , ci and trans to the counteranion [CH3B(C6F5)3] - , were considered .
