In general , the FEPs differ from the PEPs in the barrier height and the shape . the FEP give a higher barrier over PEP due to entropic contribution . the transition state of ethylene uptake by the metal center , the ethylene p-complex , and the ethylene insertion transition state are all clearly present on the FEPs . this is not always the case for the PEPs , especially for the trans pathway . the calculated FEPs for the chain propagation indicate that the ci pathway is preferred over the trans pathway for both the first and second insertion . for the energetically favorable ci pathway , the ethylene insertion into the Zr-Ca bond rather than the ethylene uptake by the metal center is the rate - determining step for both PEP and FEP ( with / without solvation effect included ) . free dynamic simulation without any constraint on the process after ethylene insertion show that the counteranion can recoordinate to the metal center again in a period of le than <nUm> p . In comparison with the estimated time scale of the chain propagation , the counteranion which wa displaced by ethylene in the ethylene uptake process ha sufficient time to recombine with [Cp2ZrR]+ again before a new monomer approach to the metal center . this is in good agreement with very recent experiment . the energetically most favorable pathway for the chain termination corresponds to the ci approach , with a free energy barrier of <nUm> kcal / mol . reduction of the hafnocene diiodide ( η 5-C 5Me 4H ) 2HfI <nUm> with excess sodium amalgam under <nUm> atm of dinitrogen yielded the hafnocene dinitrogen complex [ ( η 5- C 5Me 4H ) 2Hf ] <nUm> ( μ <nUm> , η <nUm> : η 2-N <nUm> ) . x-ray diffraction ha established a strongly activated , side-on bound , bridging N <nUm> ligand with an N-N bond length of <nUm> Å . exposure of the dinitrogen compound to <nUm> atm of dihydrogen at <nUm> ° C resulted in rapid hydrogenation of the N <nUm> ligand , affording the hydrido hafnocene diazenido complex [ ( η 5-C 5Me 4H ) 2-HfH ] <nUm> ( μ 2,e <nUm> : η 2-N 2H <nUm> ) . confirmation of N <nUm> hydrogenation ha been provided by NMR and IR spectroscopic study and x-ray diffraction . pseudo-first-order observed rate constant for H <nUm> addition have been measured by monitoring the disappearance of a principally LMCT band centered at <nUm> nm [ ( η 5-C 5Me 4H ) 2Hf ] 2-(m 2,e <nUm> : η 2-N <nUm> ) a a function of time . the hafnocene complex hydrogenates dinitrogen approximately <nUm> time faster than the corresponding zirconocene compound . divergent chemistry from zirconium is observed upon thermolysis of [ ( η 5-C 5Me 4H ) 2HfH ] <nUm> ( μ 2,e <nUm> : η 2-N 2H <nUm> ) , which result in cyclopentadienyl methyl group cyclometalation rather than N-N bond scission . the reaction of dimethylzirconocene with nitrosobenzene gave the hydroxylaminatozirconium complex <nUm> . it structure in the solid state wa characterized a the n-inside isomer [ e2(O,N)-ON(CH 3)Ph](CH3) - ZrCp2 ( 6a ) by x-ray diffraction . dynamic 1H NMR spectroscopy indicated a rapid enantiomerization process of the chiral system 6a in solution , probably taking place via a rapid equilibration with a reactive e1(O) isomer . the reaction of the zirconocene compound [ ( e5-C 5H5)e5-C5H5SiMe 5C6H5)ZrMe2 ] ( 1 ) and [ e5C5H4SiMe2C6H 4Me)2ZrMe2 ] ( 2 ) with either B(C 6F5)3 or the trityl salt [Ph3C] +[B(C6F5)5]- in CD 2C12 were monitored by NMR spectroscopy . In the case of the cationic product [ ( e5-C5H4SiMe 2C6H5)ZrMe]+[MeB(C6F 5)3]- ( 4a ) and [ ( e5-C <nUm> H4SiMe2C6H4Me ) 2ZrMe]+ X- ( 4a ) and [ ( e5-C 5H4SiMe2C6H4Me ) 2ZrMe)2ZrMe]+ X- ( 5x , x = [MeB(C6F5)3]- ; 5b , x = [ B(C 6F5)4]- ) , coordination of the arene , bonded through Si to the cyclopentadienyl ring , to the cationic zirconium wa observed . however , this coordination is rather weak , and stronger lewis donor such a the anion or the starting material replace the coordinated arene moiety . the solid - state structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by x-ray crystallography . density functional computation ( B3LYP / ECP1 and B3LYP / II level ) have revealed that the phenyl group in [ e5-C5H5)(e- C5H4SiMe2C6H5)ZrMe + ( 10 ) , [ ( e5-C5H4SiMe 2C6H4Me)2Zr]2+ ( 11 ) , and [ ( e5-C5H4SiMe2C 6H5Zr]2+ ( 12 ) are coordinated via one of the arene carbon atom . the structural assignment are supported by the good agreement between the experimental NMR shift and the computed ( GIAO-B3LYP / II level ) shift in the case of the cationic compound ( 10 ) . the structure of the dicationic compound <nUm> differs significantly from that of <nUm> , indicating a strong influence of the para substituent of the arene ring . compound <nUm> and <nUm> validate previously suggested model for solvent ( arene ) adduct in kaminsky - type polymerization . we present a DFT study of the monometallic group transfer polymerization ( GTP ) of methyl acrylate ( MA ) catalyzed by Sm - based and Zr - based metallocenes . the process examined are the generation of the catalytically active specie , the subsequent C-C coupling reaction , and the ring opening of a metallacyclic stable intermediate , resting state of the polymerization process , obtained from the C-C coupling . the mechanism for a neutral zirconocene , a cationic zirconocene , and a neutral samarocene are compared . the isoelectronic neutral samarocene and cationic zirconocene system share many feature , which explains their similar behavior in both the C-C coupling ( no energy barrier on the potential energy surface ) and the MA - assisted opening of the metallacycle . an analysis of the factor driving polymer stereoregularity in the process catalyzed by the neutral samarocene and the cationic zirconocene ha led to identifying a relationship between stereoregularity and the relative disposition of the acrylate and enolate ligand , a well a the direction of the incoming MA molecule in the opening of the metallacycle resting state . on the basis of these discovery a kinetic model ha been developed , which ha proved successful in qualitatively predicting stereoregularity . the well - known zirconafuranone , obtained by the reaction of the decamethylzirconocene bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene complex cp* 2Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) with carbon dioxide , rearranges upon thermolysis to a complex with the [ C 5Me4-CH2-CH(Me3Si)C( = C = O ) ] 2- ligand resulting from an electrophilic substitution of a hydrogen atom at one of the methyl group of a cp* ligand , a cleavage of the CO bond in the starting zirconafuranone , and a movement of the Me3Si group from b-carbon to oxygen . another example of the functionalization of a pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand by carbon dioxide wa found with a complex obtained by the reaction of Cp*2ZrCl2 with magnesium in the presence of the butadiyne t-BuC ≡ CC ≡ Ct-Bu . this complex reacts by formally inserting <nUm> equiv of carbon dioxide into each of two CZr bond , but yield a dinuclear complex with twofold functionalized cp* ligand acting a bridging dicarboxylato ligand , [ O2C-CH 2-C5Me3-CH2-CH(t-Bu)C( = C = CH-t-Bu)- CO2]3- . both complex result from a simple method of functionalization of cp* ligand of zirconocene complex and were characterized by NMR and x-ray crystal structure analysis . isotopically labeled zirconocene methyl neopentyl complex of the formula ( CpR n ) 2Zr-(CH 3)(CH 2C(CH <nUm> ) 2CD <nUm> ) are obtained via reaction of CHLi 2C(CH <nUm> ) 2CD <nUm> with ( CpR n ) 2Zr(CH <nUm> ) - ( Cl ) . addition of B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> to ( CpR n ) 2Zr(CH 3)(CH 2C(CH <nUm> ) 2CD <nUm> ) result in b-methyl elimination , forming the ion - paired specie [ ( CpR n ) 2Zr(CH <nUm> ) ] [ CH 3B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] along with isotopologs of isobutene . the relative amount of d 3- and d 0-isobutene afford the isotope effect for b-methyl elimination . for cp 2Zr(CH 3)(CH 2C(CH <nUm> ) 2CD <nUm> ) ( cp = ( n 5-C 5H <nUm> ) ) , a kinetic deuterium isotope effect of <nUm> ha been measured at <nUm> ° C . comparable deuterium kinetic isotope effect have been observed for four other zirconocene methyl neopentyl compound : [ Cp*(C 5Me 4H)-Zr ] ( cp* = ( n 5-C 5Me <nUm> ) ) , [ cp* 2Zr ] , [rac-(EBI)Zr] ( EBI - ethylenebis(indenyl) ) , and [(THP)Zr] ( THP = 1,2-(SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ( n 5-3,5-C 5H(CHMe <nUm> ) 2)(n 5-C 5H <nUm> ) ) . the direction and magnitude of these effect are consistent with g-agostic assistance in the transition state for b-methyl elimination , the microscopic reverse of a-agostic assistance in the transition state for olefin insertion into the zr-methyl bond . reaction of group <nUm> metallocene dihydrides , ( r nCp ) 2MH <nUm> ( r nCp = alkyl-substituted cyclopentadienyl ; m = Zr , Hf ) , with olefin afford stable metallocene alkyl hydride complex of the general formula ( r nCp ) 2M(CH 2CHR' 2)(H) ( R' = H , alkyl ) . for sterically crowded , monomeric dihydrides , cp* 2ZrH <nUm> ( cp* = η 5-C 5Me <nUm> ) , cp*(e 5- C 5Me 4H)ZrH <nUm> , cp*(e 5-C 5Me 4Et)-ZrH <nUm> , cp* 2HfH <nUm> , and cp*(e 5-C 5H 3-1,3- ( CMe <nUm> ) 2)HfH <nUm> , second - order rate constant for olefin insertion have been measured . for cp* 2HfH <nUm> , the relative rate of olefin insertion have been found to be 1-pentene > styrene ≫ cis-2-butene > cyclopentene > trans-2-butene > isobutene . the rate of isobutene insertion into cp*(e 5-C 5Me 4H)ZrH <nUm> is <nUm> × 1Q <nUm> time greater than that for cp* 2ZrH <nUm> at <nUm> ° C , demonstrating the striking steric effect for isobutene insertion imposed by a tenth methyl substituent on the two cyclopentadienyl ligand . A primary k H / k d of <nUm> at <nUm> ° C and a linear free energy correlation to σ ( ρ = <nUm> ) for para-substituted styrene insertion indicate that insertion into a Zr-H bond proceeds via rate - determining hydride transfer to coordinated olefin , with small positive charge buildup at the b-carbon of the inserting styrene . the rate of b-H elimination for the series ( r n-Cp ) 2Zr(CH 2CHR')(H) have been measured via rapid trapping of the intermediate zirconocene dihydride with 4,4-dimethyl-2-pentyne . key observation for b-H elimination are ( a ) primary kinetic deuterium isotope effect ( k H / k d = <nUm> - <nUm> ) and ( b ) a linear free relationship for the phenethyl hydride series cp*(e 5-C 5Me 4H)Zr(CH 2CH 2-p-C 6H 4-X)(H) ( x = H , CH <nUm> , CF <nUm> , OCH <nUm> ) , which correlate better to o than σ + ; p = <nUm> . the rate of b-H elimination slows with more substituted , hence more sterically crowded , cyclopentadienyl ligand . equilibration of a series of Cp*(CpR n)Zr(CH 2CHMe 2)(H) and Cp*(CpR n)Zr(CH 2CH 2CH 2CH 3)(H) with free isobutene and 1-butene ha established the relative ground - state energy of isobutyl and n-butyl complex . these data , in combination with the free energy of activation for b-H elimination , allow free energy profile to be constructed for insertion and b-H elimination for each olefin . the second - order rate constant for the insertion of cyclohexene into substituted bis(indenyl)zirconocene dihydrides , ( η 5-C 9H 5-1,3-R <nUm> ) 2ZrH <nUm> ( r = SiMe <nUm> , CHMe <nUm> ) , to yield the cyclohexyl hydride complex have been measured . comparison of these value to the corresponding tetrahydroindenyl derivative ( η 5-C 9H 9-1,3-R <nUm> ) 2ZrH <nUm> reveals significantly faster insertion reaction for the bis(indenyl) compound . accordingly , primarily s-donating ligand such a PMe <nUm> , PEt <nUm> , and tetrahydrothiophene coordinate to ( η 5-C 9H 5-1,3-(CHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ) 2ZrH <nUm> to form ( η 5-C 9H 5-1,3-(CHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> ) 2ZrH 2(L) compound , one of which ( L = PMe <nUm> ) ha been structurally characterized . In contrast , the more electron - rich zirconocene tetrahydroindenyl dihydrides exhibit weaker binding in solution . taken together , these result establish an " indenyl effect " in zirconocene hydride chemistry likely arising from increased electrophilicity of the metal center , rather than a change in hapticity along the reaction coordinate . zirconocene precatalysts with sterically bulky alkyl group were designed a model system for the propagating specie in zirconocene - catalyzed alkene polymerization . specialty alkyllithium reagent Li(CH2CEt <nUm> ) and Li(CH2CMe2CH2Ph) were prepared and utilized in the synthesis of dialkyl and methyl-alkyl zirconocenes of the form CpCp*ZrR2 , Cp2Zr(CH3) ( r ) , and CpCp*Zr(CH3) ( r ) ( cp = ( e5-C5H <nUm> ) ; cp* = ( e5-C5Me5 ) ; r = CH2CMe3 , CH2SiMe3 , CH 2CEt3 , CH2CMe2CH2Ph ) . these new zirconocene alkyl were isolated and fully characterized by NMR spectroscopy and in some case by x-ray diffraction . the molecular structure determined display the bent - sandwich coordination mode common for zirconocenes . the steric influence of the alkyl group on the observed structural parameter is reflected in slightly expanded C-Zr-C or C-Zr-Cl angle in the equatorial plane and long zirconium - alkyl bond distance . the cyclobutylene-bis(2-indenyl)zirconium dichloride complex ( 4 ) , derived from an intramolecular photochemical [2+2] cycloaddition reaction of bis[2-(methylethenyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 3 ) , wa reacted with methyllithium or phenyllithium to yield the corresponding cyclobutylene-bis(2- indenyl ) - zirconium dimethyl ( 12 ) or diphenyl ( 13 ) complex , respectively . insertion of carbon monoxide into the zr-phenyl linkage of <nUm> yielded the " o-inside " e2-benzoyl ansa - zirconocene complex 18-syn / anti , which were characterized by x-ray diffraction . tert-Butyl isocyanide insertion into the Zr - CH3 bond of <nUm> gave the " n-inside " e2-iminoacyl metallocene isomer 17-syn and 17-anti ; the latter wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . under kinetic control tert-butyl isonitrile insertion into <nUm> gave the " n-outside " e2-iminoacyl metallocene isomer 25-syn / 25-anti , which rearranged to 17-syn / anti at <nUm> K with gibbs activation energy of DG rearr = <nUm> / <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal*mol-1 , respectively . the analogous rearrangement of the " n-outside " to " n-inside " isomer of the corresponding cyclobutylene- bis(cyclopentadienyl)Zr-(e2-iminoacyl) reference system ( 23-syn / anti to 24-syn / anti ) is much faster ( <nUm> K : DGrearr = <nUm> / <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal*mol-1 ) . similar difference in the kinetic " n-outside " to thermodynamic " n-inside " e2-iminobenzoyl metallocene isomerization were observed for the tert-butyl isonitrile insertion product of the cyclobutylene-bis(2-indenyl) ZrPh2 ( 13 ) and cyclobutylene-bis(C5H4)ZrPh <nUm> ( 15 ) system , which indicates a pronounced influence of the covering phenylene group on the s-ligand chemistry in these rigid ansa - metallocene system . ethylene polymerization using catalyst derived from activation of zirconocene aluminohydride complex with either methyl aluminoxane or B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> is reported . variable - temperature NMR spectrum of mixture of cp* 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> or cp' 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> and excess B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> reveal the formation of di- or polynuclear metallocenium ion - pair featuring terminal or both terminal and bridging borohydride counteranions HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> arising from hydride abstraction . At higher T , ion - pair featuring the terminal HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> counterion decompose , and the AlH <nUm> that is liberated degrades B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> to furnish mixture of ( C 6F <nUm> ) nAlH 3-n and , in the case of cp* 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> , a new ion - pair partnered with the diborohydride counteranion [ cp* 2ZrH][(m-H) 2B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] . the latter compound wa independently prepared from cp* 2-ZrH <nUm> and HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> and is active in ethylene polymerization ; however it is <nUm> time le active than the catalyst formed from cp* 2ZrH 3AlH <nUm> and B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> and so can not account for the multisite behavior of the latter combination . there is evidence of chemical exchange between " free " or terminal HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> and excess B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> in these mixture , and on the basis of model study with [ nBu 4N][HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] and B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> , this involves reversible formation of [ nBu 4N][(C 6F <nUm> ) 3B)(m-H)B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , which can be detected by 19F NMR spectroscopy in solution at low T . the reaction of the zirconocene compound [ ( e5-C 5H5)2-Zr(CH2C6H 4R)2 ] ( r = F ( 1 ) , CMe3 ( 2 ) , me ( 3 ) ) with either BC18F15 or the trityl salt [ ph 3C]+[B(C6F5)4] - in CD2Cl2 were monitored by NMR spectroscopy . In all case , the cationic compound [ ( e5-C5H 5)2-Zr(e2-CH2C6H 4R)]+ wa obtained , irrespective of the activator used ( BC18F15 or the trityl salt ) . whereas NMR study suggest a e2-coordination of the benzyl ligand to the cationic zirconium metal , detailed DFT study revealed that in CD 2Cl2 this is only the case if one solvent molecule is coordinated via the lone pair of one chlorine to the metal . without this coordination , a e3-coordination is more likely to occur . computed NMR shift at the B3LYP / IGLO II level corroborate this observation , which is in concert with a detailed NBO analysis of the cationic zirconocene compound . the molecule Cp(3-Me3Si-6,6-dmch)ZrI2 ( cp = e5-cyclopentadienyl ; 3-Me3Si-6,6-dmch = e5-3-trimethylsilyl-6,6-dimethylcyclohexadienyl ) ha been synthesized , and the molecular and electronic structure have been investigated . photoelectron spectroscopy show that substitution of a trimethylsilyl group in place of a hydrogen atom on the 6,6-dmch ligand destabilizes all of the ionization of Cp(3-Me3Si-6,6-dmch)ZrI2 by ca. <nUm> - <nUm> eV compared to those of Cp(6,6-dmch)ZrI2 . density functional calculation accurately reproduce the experimental structure of the molecule and agree with the observed shift of all ionization to lower energy . interestingly , the ionization are calculated to shift to lower energy without the expected increase in electron density at the metal center . this apparent contradiction is understood from analysis of one - center and two - center charge effect in the molecule . As a consequence of these charge effect , the silyl substitution make the 3-Me3Si-6,6-dmch ligand a slightly better donor and , surprisingly , also a better acceptor ligand than the 6,6-dmch ligand . gently warming the e6,e5-bis(indenyl) zirconium dimethoxyethane compound ( e6-C9H 5-1,3-(SiMe3)2)-(e5-C 9H5-1,3-(SiMe3)2)Zr(DME) ( 1-DME ) to <nUm> ° C resulted in C-O bond scission to yield an equimolar mixture of the zirconocene ethylene compound ( e5-C9H 5-1,3-(SiMe3)2)2Zr(e 2-CH2 = CH2 ) and the corresponding zirconium bis(methoxide) complex ( e5-C9H5-1,3- (SiMe3)2)2Zr(OMe)2 . monitoring the relative rate of 1-DME versus 1-DME-d10 cleavage by 1H NMR spectroscopy established no kinetic isotope effect ( kH / k d = <nUm> ) , eliminating the possibility of C-H activation in or prior to the rate - determining step . computational study support a pathway involving rate - determining DME dissociation from the e6 , e5-bis(indenyl)zirconium complex followed by facile e6 to e5 indenyl haptotropic rearrangement and C-O bond scission . corresponding C-S bond cleavage chemistry ha been investigated for three thioethers and the mechanism of bond activation compared to the oxygen congener . the cp - alkenyl and cp - dienyl ligand system <nUm> and <nUm> were prepared by fulvene route . subsequent transmetalation gave the respective (Cp-propenyl)2- , (Cp-butenyl)2- , ( cp - pentadienyl ) 2- , and Cphexadienyl)2ZrCl2 and - ClHf <nUm> complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> . In the crystal these complex favor metallocene conformation that feature the alkenyl and dienyl substituents far separated from each other at the open front side of the bent metallocene wedge . photolysis in the solid state consequently did not result in an intramolecular C-C coupling reaction but led to e / z isomerization of the alkenyl unit . In solution rapid conformational metallocene equilibration take place . photolysis of the (Cp-alkenyl)2ZrCl2 complex <nUm> in solution very efficiently resulted in the formation of the cyclobutylene-bridged ansa - zirconocene isomer <nUm> by rapid intramolecular [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition reaction by mean of a dynamic topochemical reaction control . photolysis of the (Cp-dienyl)2ZrCl2 and - Cl2Hf complex ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) in solution proceeded analogously to efficiently yield the cyclooctadienylene bridged ansa - metallocenes ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) by formal dynamic topochemical [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition reaction control . the effect of the metal on elementary chain propagation and termination reaction in hafnocene- and zirconocene - catalyzed olefin copolymerization process ha been systematically studied by quantum chemical method . two consecutive monomer insertion , parallel with the competing chain termination reaction , were studied for copolymerization of ethene with propene , 1-butene , and 1-hexene . for the purpose of a comparative study , analogous specie along the reaction pathway were studied for each metallocene / monomer combination . effect due to incorporation of a comonomer were analyzed a a function of both the central metal and the comonomer size . In accordance with the general experimental observation of zirconocenes producing lower molecular weight polymer than the hafnocenes , difference in activation energy for chain propagation and termination are smaller for the zirconocene . for the zirconocene , the activation energy is particularly low for b-hydrogen elimination after secondary comonomer insertion . reaction of (phenylethynyl)lithium with substituted cyclopentenones gave the corresponding phenylethynyl-substituted cyclopentadienes 1,2-R 2-4-(PhC ≡ C)C5H2 ( r = me ( 1a ) , ph ( 1b ) ) , which underwent subsequent deprotonation and transmetalation with ClZr <nUm> to yield the corresponding alkyne - functionalized zirconocene complex { e5-[1,2-R2-4-(PhC ≡ C)C 5H2]}2ZrCl2 ( r = me ( 2a ) , ph ( 2b ) ) . thermal treatment of 2a,b with C4O4Ru in refluxing benzene afforded the trinuclear complex ( 3,4-R2C5H 2)2(m3-C4Ph2)Ru 3(CO)6(m-CO)2 ( r = me ( 3a ) , ph ( 3b ) ) and the dinuclear complex ( 3,4-Ph2C5H2 ) 2(m-C4Ph2)Ru2(CO) 5(m-CO) ( 3c ) , via the unexpected cleavage of the two Cp'-Zr bond . the crystal structure of 2b and 3a,c were determined by x-ray diffraction . bis(cyclopentadienyl)aluminum and -gallium specie of the type (Pytsi)ECp2 [ e = Al ( 2a ) , Ga ( 2b ) ; pytsi = C(SiMe3) 2SiMe2(2-C5H4N) ] have been prepared from NaCp and respective dichloride (Pytsi)ECl2 in isolated yield of <nUm> % ( 2a ) and <nUm> % ( 2b ) . In addition to applying standard method of characterization ( NMR spectroscopy , CHN analysis , and MS ) , the molecular structure of both compound were solved by single - crystal x-ray crystallography . reaction between 2a or 2b with Zr(NMe2)4 in benzene , followed by addition of an excess of ClSiMe3 , gave the first ansa - zirconocene dichloride with aluminum ( 4a ) or gallium ( 4b ) in bridging position . the gallium compound 4b wa isolated in a yield of <nUm> % and characterized by NMR spectroscopy , CHN analysis , and mass spectrometry . the aluminum specie 4a could not be obtained in an analytically pure form ; it wa characterized by NMR spectroscopy , and it molecular structure wa determined by single - crystal x-ray analysis . the angle between the two plane of the cp ligand in 4a wa found to be <nUm> ° , which is larger than in cp 2ZrCl2 ( α = <nUm> ° ) and smaller than in silicon - bridged ansa - zirconocene dichloride ( e.g. , Me2Si(C 5H4)2ZrCl2 : α = <nUm> ° ) . crystallization attempt of 4a from DCCl3 solution gave crystal of the new specie (Pytsi)AlCl[(C5H4)ZrCp] ( 7 ) , which wa characterized by NMR spectroscopy and single - crystal x-ray analysis . In comparison to the pytsi - containing specie 2a and 2b , the le sterically protected compound [ 2-(Me2NCH2)C6H 4]AlCp2 ( 6 ) , which wa prepared from NaCp and [ 2-(Me 2NCH2)C6H4]AlCl2 in yield of <nUm> % and characterized by standard method ( NMR , CHN , and MS ) , reacted with Zr(NMe2)4 to give the known Cp2Zr(NMe 2)2 . the targeted ansa - specie wa not formed , a judged by 1H NMR spectroscopy . the gallium - bridged compound 4b and cp 2ZrCl2 , respectively , had been tested for polymerization of ethylene utilizing MAO a an activator ( <nUm> equiv of MAO ; <nUm> or <nUm> mmol of precatalyst ; <nUm> or <nUm> psi ) , resulting in activity of <nUm> to <nUm> for 4b and of <nUm> to <nUm> kg PE ( mol zr)-1h-1atm-1 for Cp2ZrCl2 . reaction of the five - membered metallacyclocumulenes Cp2M(e 4-t-Bu-C4-t-Bu ) ( m = Ti , Zr ) with the lewis acid i-Bu 2AlH were studied . Cp2Ti(e4-t-Bu-C 4-t-Bu ) ( 1 ) reacts with i-Bu2AlH to give a heterobimetallic complex which wa isolated a the THF adduct cp 2Ti[m-e1:e2-t-BuCC-CHC-t-Bu)(m-H) (i-BuAl)(THF) ] ( 4 ) . the reaction of the corresponding zirconocene compound Cp2Zr(e4-t-Bu-C4-t-Bu) ( 2 ) with i-Bu 2AlH result in a cleavage of the central C = C bond of the metallacyclocumulene C4 chain and formation of the dinuclear complex <nUm> and the dinuclear acetylide [ (Cp2Zr)2(m-C ≡ c-t- bu)2 ] . In addition to the formation of <nUm> and the acetylide specie an elimination of the butadiyne take place , which give in the subsequent interaction with i-Bu2AlH the zwitterionic aluminum cluster <nUm> . alternatively , complex <nUm> is also formed in the direct reaction of the butadiyne with a 3-fold excess of i-Bu2AlH . the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> were confirmed by x-ray analysis . we have used QM / MM molecular dynamic simulation of the olefin - bound borate ion pair of the mainstay zirconocene catalyst ( [ Cp2Zr(C 2H5)(C2H4)]+[CH 3B(C6F5)3]- ) to examine the effect of the counteranion on the active catalyst . free energy perturbation / molecular dynamic calculation show that the a-agostic configuration is stabilized by <nUm> kcal mol-1 when the counteranion is present , which we attribute to the larger counteranion - dipole interaction of the more polar a-agostic structure . In this paper , we compare the electronic structure of the hafnacycloallene complex Cp2HfC4RR'2R'' ( 5Hf ) , which wa previously described by erker et al. , with those of the titanium , zirconium , and hafnium complex Cp2M(e4-RHC 4HR ) ( <nUm> m ; i.e. metallacyclopent-2,3,4-trienes , metallacyclocumulenes ) and Cp2M(e4-R2C4R2) ( <nUm> m ; i.e. 1-metallacyclopent-3-ynes ) using density functional theory ( BP86 / LANL2DZ ) calculation . moreover , the e3-phenylallenyl zirconocene complex 7Zr , which wa synthesized by wojcicki et al. , is included for the comparison . these calculation and extended huckel calculation show that the bonding in complex 5Hf is remarkably similar to that of complex <nUm> m and 7Zr . an analysis of the structural parameter and bonding reveals that the unique interaction of the internal carbon atom along with the terminal carbon atom with the bent - metallocene moiety is the reason for the unusual stability of these metallacycles . the molecular orbital analysis further suggests that complex 5Hf can react with another metal fragment to give the bimetallic complex <nUm> and <nUm> . the electronic structure of complex <nUm> m , <nUm> m , 5Hf , and 7Zr have been comparatively studied to get a general understanding of the bonding in these metallacycles . the e isomer of a [5]cumulene derivative , 2,2,9,9-tetramethyl-3,8- diphenyldeca-3,4,5,6,7-pentaene ( 1 ) , which wa previously believed to be unisolable owing to very fast e / z isomerization , wa isolated and structurally characterized . the z isomer wa trapped a the transition - metal complex <nUm> , and the molecular structure wa determined . DFT calculation and an electrochemical study on <nUm> are also described . ansa - zirconocene amide incorporating a Me2C - linked cyclopentadienyl-dicarbollyl or indenyl-dicarbollyl ligand were conveniently prepared from direct deboration of the corresponding carboranyl metal complex using diamine a deboration agent . this represents a new methodology for the preparation of metal dicarbollides . the first well - defined zirconocene complex processing vinyl-imine and keteniminate specie have been achieved from zirconacyclopentenes or zirconacyclopentadienes and <nUm> equiv of Ph2CHCN . multifunctional effect of Ph2CHCN is observed for the first time in one system . this process proceeds via the azazirconacyclopentadiene intermediate and it intramolecular proton transfer . moreover , b,b'-C-C bond cleavage of tetra-alkyl-substituted zirconacyclopentadienes is observed for the first time under the appropriate condition . the potassium salt of <nUm> wa transmetalated by reaction with (Cp-allyl)ZrCl3(dme) , yielding the complex (NC-nacnac)Cp- allylZrCl2 ( 2 ) . addition of <nUm> molar equiv of B(C6F 5)3 gave [ (C6F5)3B-NC- nacnac]Cp - allylZrCl2 ( 3 ) , and the subsequent addition of <nUm> molar equiv of BC12F10H to <nUm> gave the hydroborated specie [ ((C6F5)3B-NC-nacnac)Cp-(CH 2)3-B(C6F5)2]ZrCl <nUm> ( 4 ) . the hydroboration of <nUm> with <nUm> molar equiv of HB(C 6F5)2 gave an insoluble product . this product wa fully characterized by 11B and 13C solid - state NMR and IR , which showed that the hydroboration followed by intermolecular adduct formation ( R-B(C6F5)2- - -NC- - -R' ) occurs , resulting in an organometallic polymer ( 5 ) . In addition to the CN - free [nacnac]Cp - allylZrCl2 ( 6 ) , the hydroborated derivative [ (nacnac)Cp-(CH2)3-B(C6F5) <nUm> ] ( 7 ) wa also prepared . complex 2-7 were activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and gave active catalyst for ethylene polymerization . the polymer produced were linear and had high molecular weight , with polydispersities ( PDI ) of le than <nUm> , indicating that the catalyst are single site . the presence of the allyl group on the cp ring wa found to increase the molecular weight of the material produced . In addition to discrete complex , an organometallic polymer ( 5 ) wa formed . this compound is air stable and , while not very soluble , polymerizes ethylene with good activity . reaction ofCp2Zr(m-Cl)(m-C 2B 10H 10)Li(OEt 2)2 ( 1 ) with various n-heterocycles derived from pyridine were studied . treatment of <nUm> with pyridine , 2-bromopyridine , <nUm> , 4-lutidine , quinoline , and 2-(1-hexynyl)pyridine generated a-C-H activation ( s-bond metathesis ) product Cp2Zr(e2-C , N-C5H4N)(s-C2B10H11) ( 2 ) , Cp2Zr[e2-C,N-(6-Br-C 5H 3NN)](s- B10C2H11 ) ( 3 ) , Cp2Zr[e2-C,N-(4,6-Me2-C5H2N)] ( s-C2B10H11 ) ( 4 ) , Cp2Zr(e2-C,N-C9H6N)(s-C2B10H11) ( 5 ) , and Cp2Zr- { e2-C,N-[6-(nBuCtC)-C 5H 3NN]}(s-C2B10H11) ( 7 ) , respectively . on the other hand , reaction of <nUm> with acridine gave the addition product 1,2-[Cp2Zr(10,9-C13H9N)]-1,2-C 2B 10H <nUm> ( 6 ) in <nUm> % isolated yield . complex <nUm> reacted with 3-(1-hexynyl)pyridine to afford a-C-H activation specie Cp2Zr{e2-C,N-[5-(nBuCtC)C 5H 3NN]}(s-C2B10H11) ( 8a ) andCp2Zr{e2-C,N-[3-(nBuCtC)C 5H 3NN]}-(s- B10C2H11 ) ( 8b ) in a molar ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> , a determined by the 1H NMR spectrum . In the presence of CuI , however , the CtC insertion product zirconacyclopentenes 1,2-[Cp2ZrC(2-C5H4N)dCR]-1,2-C 2B 10H <nUm> [ r = bun ( 9 ) , ph ( 10 ) ] were obtained in 74-77 % yield . it is suggested that the coordination of pyridine to the Zr atom is crucial for a-C-H activation ( s-bond metathesis ) . the presence of CuI can alter the reaction path by preventing the coordination of pyridine to the Zr atom , which block the a-C-H activation path , leading to the alkyne insertion reaction . all complex were characterized by 1H , 13C , and 11B NMR spectrum a well a elemental analysis . their structure were further confirmed by single - crystal x-ray analysis . we have applied 3D-QSAR chemometric tool to analyze the polymerization activity of a series of analogous zirconocene catalyst with different substitution pattern in the cyclopentadienyl ring . the selection of the most stable conformers wa performed by mean of a conformational analysis of the different catalyst in a step previous to the QSAR study . the calculated QSAR model ha been assessed in robustness following a progressive scrambling protocol that help to check redundancy in the descriptor space . this model present a good predictive ability a tested with a set of four catalyst . the final model is controlled mostly by steric contribution , which can be related to the weakness of the catalyst - cocatalyst interaction . A highly efficient and convenient method for the monozirconation of silyl- or tert-butyl-substituted 1,3-butadiynes using the negishi reagent ha been developed . the resulting zirconium butadiyne complex undergo two syn-SE2 reaction with various aldehyde to yield the cis-[3]cumulenic diol with moderate to high diastereoselectivities . the silyl substituents at the butadiyne terminus show remarkable influence on the diastereoselectivity . the new 1,3-disiloxo-bridged dichloro zirconocene [ { ( η 5- C 5H <nUm> ) 2-m,m-1,3-(Me 2SiOSiMe <nUm> ) 2}ZrCl <nUm> ] ( 2 ) ha been synthesized and fully characterized . complex <nUm> , combined with MAO , polymerizes propene and 1-hexene with high 1,2-regioselectivity , yielding oligomers containing vinylidene end group produced via a b-hydrogen elimination reaction . kinetics associated with the [ (SBI)Zr(CH 2SiMe <nUm> ( C 6H 4)NMe 2)][MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] (1a)-catalyzed polymerization of 1-hexene in a mixed toluene-d <nUm> / chlorobenzene-d <nUm> solvent at <nUm> ° C were investigated via 1H NMR and compared to the kinetics associated with the (SBI)ZrMe(MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ) (1c)-catalyzed polymerization of 1-hexene under identical condition . In the presence of 1-hexene , both catalyst form an identical propagating specie , (SBI)Zr(poly-1-hexyl)(MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ) ( 1b ) , but the concentration of 1b during 1a - catalyzed polymerization is only ca. <nUm> % of the anticipated value . under reaction condition , 1b reacts reversibly with the model complex p-TMS-C 6H 4-NMe <nUm> ( 2 ) to yield the outer - sphere ion pair tentatively identified a [(SBI)Zr(poly-1-hexyl)(2)] [ MeB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 1e ) , which act a an essentially dormant site during 1-hexene polymerization . warming of 1b in the absence of additive generates the well - defined hydridoborate complex (SBI)ZrMe(HB(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ) ( 1d ) , which doe not reinitiate in the presence of 1-hexene . b-Hydride elimination of 1b in the presence of additive such a 1,2-dichloroethane and <nUm> result in catalyst decomposition . A number of 2-methyl-4-aryl-5-methoxy-6-alkylindenes and C 2-symmetric me 2Si - bridged ansa - zirconocenes based on them were synthesized . zirconocenes were obtained by mean of highly effective and scalable racemo - selective synthetic approach based on the use of a Zr tert-butyl amide complex . the structure of m-(bis-[e 5-6-tert-butyl-5- methoxy-2-methyl-4-tert-butylphenyl-1H-inden-1-yl]dimethylsilanediyl ) dichlorozirconium(IV) ( 14 ) ha been established with x-ray analysis . the introduction of a methoxy group into the indenyl fragment of zirconocene significantly improved it catalytic performance ( i.e. , it activity , stereoselectivity , molecular mass potential , and thermal stability ) in the polymerization and copolymerization of propylene in comparison with the benchmark spaleck - zirconocene . the role of the methoxy group is proposed to stabilize the cationic catalytic intermediate , which wa confirmed using DFT calculation . reaction of zirconocene-carboryne in situ generated from cp 2Zr(m-Cl)(m-C 2B 10H <nUm> ) Li(OEt <nUm> ) <nUm> with various alkene RCH = CH <nUm> in refluxing toluene gave the monoinsertion product 1,2-[Cp 2ZrCH ( r ) CH 2]-1,2-C 2B 10H <nUm> ( r = aryl ) or 1,2-[Cp 2ZrCH 2CH(R)]-1,2-C 2B 10H <nUm> ( r = alkyl ) in good to high isolated yield with very high regioselectivity , depending on the polarity of the alkene . this reaction offered an efficient route to zirconacyclopentanes with a carborane auxiliary , which can be viewed a a carborane version of zirconacyclopentanes . they are thermally very stable and chemically inert toward unsaturated organic molecule such a alkene , alkyne , nitrile , CO , and CO <nUm> . all complex have been fully characterized by various spectroscopic technique . some have been further confirmed by single - crystal x-ray analysis . A new zirconocene bis(arsenide) derivative , cp 2Zr(AsMes <nUm> ) <nUm> ( <nUm> ; cp = cyclopentadienyl , me = 2,4,6- trimethylphenyl ) , ha been prepared by the metathetical reaction of <nUm> equiv of LiAsMes <nUm> with cp 2ZrCl <nUm> and structurally characterized . effort to prepare cp 2ZrCl(AsMes <nUm> ) ( 2 ) by reaction of <nUm> equiv of LiAsMes <nUm> with cp 2ZrCl <nUm> yielded a mixture of product that could not be separated , including <nUm> and <nUm> , a identified by 1H NMR spectroscopy . compound <nUm> thermally decomposes with formation of As 2Mes <nUm> , suggestive of reductive elimination to form an As-As bond . further evidence for reductive elimination come from effective interception of a putative zirconium (II) intermediate with diphenylacetylene to give cp 2Zr(C 4Ph <nUm> ) . the C1 - symmetric metallocenes rac-[1-(9-e5- fluorenyl)-2-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl)ethane ] zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) and rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(5,6- cyclopenta-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl)ethane]hafnium dichloride ( 2 ) are known to produce elastic polypropylene . they were investigated concerning their temperature stability during the polymerization of propene . after activation of these complex with triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) / [ CPh 3][B(C6F5)4] , first polymerization experiment ( 80-100 C ) afforded moderate to high activity . however , at these polymerization temperature , the molecular weight of the produced polymer are significantly decreased , resulting in a waxy appearance and , therefore , a loss of the elastic behavior . the main reason for this behavior , especially for the more significant decrease of the molecular weight in the case of hafnocene <nUm> compared with zirconocene <nUm> , wa revealed to occur due to a fast b-methyl transfer reaction . hence , hafnocene <nUm> can form polymer chain with a high selectivity toward allylic chain end . these macromonomers can be used in the catalytic insertion polymerization for the formation of new grafted copolymer . initial copolymerization experiment with ethene were conducted . the reaction of the seven - membered azazirconacycloallene <nUm> with ph 2CHCN wa carried out to yield a zirconocene complex with three fused ring and a keteniminate ligand . further reactivity toward propargyl bromide or propionyl chloride show that the keteniminate ligand can be replaced by halogen atom ( Br or Cl ) . In addition , the reaction of the strained four - membered zirconacycle <nUm> with Ph2CHCN give zirconocenes possessing vinyl-imine and keteniminate specie . A series of group VI metal complex bearing a group IV metallocenyldiphosphine moiety and a pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand have been prepared and structurally characterized . reaction of trinuclear complex with C8K give the corresponding neutral chloride - bridged complex . further reaction of the resulting chloride - bridged complex with ArBNa F4 give the corresponding monocationic chloride - bridged complex . on the other hand , reaction of the neutral chloride - bridged complex with n-BuLi give the corresponding chloride - bridged alkyl complex , where the group IV metallocene(III) moiety and the coordinatively unsaturated group VI metal(II) center are in close proximity . spectroscopic and crystallographic study of the reaction of a chloride - bridged alkyl complex with CO or a protic acid indicate that further disproportionation take place at the alkyl zirconocene(III) moiety . the electro- and spectroelectrochemical behavior of diverse (multi)ferrocenyl five - membered heterocyclic compound , including furan , thiophene , pyrroles , phospholes , etc. is discussed , giving a close insight into the electron transfer process of these organometallic compound in their mixed - valence state , whereby electronic and structural modification of the heterocyclic connecting unit and / or of the redox - active ferrocenyl terminus directly influence the electron transfer property . In addition , the structural feature of these compound can be correlated with their electrochemical behavior , allowing calculation of the effective electron transfer distance within a specific series of molecule . tendency in molecular wire molecule based on bi- , ter- , quarter- , quinque- , and sexithiophene connecting building block and the appropriate pyrrole derivative are discussed a well . the consequence of introducing an additional redox - active transition - metal building block , such a a titanocene or a zirconocene moiety , respectively , into the heterocyclic ring , on the electrochemical behavior of the resulting five - membered heterocycle are also highlighted . the title complex Cp2ZrCl(CH2PPh2) reacts with BC18F15 under specific condition by phosphinomethyl transfer to give the phosphane - stabilized salt [ cp 2ZrCl+][Ph2PCH2B(C6F 5)3- ] . x-ray crystal structure analysis showed the P-Zr coordination . this salt is trapped by phenyl isocyanate in an in situ three - component reaction to yield the respective P / zr+ frustrated lewis pair ( FLP ) addition product . In contrast , a mixture of cp 2ZrCl(CH2PPh2) / B(C6F 5)3 and benzaldehyde under similar condition give the P / B FLP addition product . the Cp2ZrCl(CH2PPh <nUm> ) / BC18F15 system may form a P / B adduct [ Cp2ZrCl(CH2PPh2)*B(C 6F5)3 ] or a P / zr+ adduct [ cp 2ZrCl*PPh2CH2B(C6F 5)3 ] . from the former it seems to show P / B FLP reaction and from the latter P / zr+ FLP behavior ; the outcome is dependent on the specific reagent and reaction condition chosen . A DFT study on the carboxylation of hafnocene and ansa - zirconocene dinitrogen complex with CO2 indicates that the most favorable initial CO2 insertion into M-N ( m = Hf , Zr ) proceeds by a stepwise path rather than a concerted [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] path . the calculated result explain the regioselectivity of the N-C formation in experiment . In addition , a comparative analysis of ring tension and charge distribution unveils the different activity of N-N bond cleavage in the CO and CO2 direct N-C bond formation reaction . the chemoselective C-O bond functionalization of benzofuran with an aluminum dihydride may be catalyzed by zirconocene dichloride . the reaction proceeds with the formal addition of a C-O bond to , and elimination of dihydrogen from , aluminum . the product of C-O bond alumination reacts with benzaldehyde via insertion of the carbonyl into the newly formed Al-C bond . zirconium - mediated multicomponent reaction of silyl-butadiynes with two molecule of aryl nitrile are described , which provide rapid access to polysubstituted pyrimidine in a regioselective manner and in one pot . employing aliphatic nitrile result in coupling of only one nitrile , leading to the formation of enynyl ketone after hydrolysis . A zirconocene monoyne complex undergoes similar reaction with nitrile to form highly substituted pyrimidine . the reaction of [Cp2ZrMe][MeB(C6F5) <nUm> ] ( 1 ) with 2,4-dimethyl-1-pentene and 2,4-dimethyl-1-heptene , respectively , in C6D5Cl at <nUm> ° C result in irreversible formation of the cationic Cp2Zr+-allyl complex [ Cp2Zr(e3-CH2C(CH 2R)CH2)]+ ( 2a , 3a ) and [ Cp2Zr(e 3-CH2C(Me)CHR)]+ ( 2b , 3b ) ( 2a,b , r = CH(CH 3)2 ; 3a,b , r = C4H7 2CH3 ) and release of methane . the Cp2Zr +-allyl complex were characterized with regard to their structure and rearrangement dynamic of their allyl ligand by NMR spectroscopy . variable - temperature 1H NMR experiment show that the allyl ligand of complex 2a,b and 3a,b are fluxional . the fluxional behavior in these complex is mainly due to a mechanism that involves e3 to e1 isomerization , rotation of the allyl carbon-carbon π unit about the carbon-carbon σ bond , and reversion to the e3- allyl coordination mode , when both the allyl syn / anti hydrogen exchange and apparent cp ligand exchange occur . the rotation of the C-C unit about the allyl carbon-carbon σ bond also result in a reversal of the e3-allyl coordination face relative to the Cp2Zr + moiety . A second mechanism which may account for the apparent cp ligand exchange in the Cp2Zr+-allyl complex under investigation consists of rotation of the e3-coordinated allyl ligand about the metal - allyl bond . the free energy of activation for the exchange process , a estimated from the coalescence temperature of the two cp ligand , is between <nUm> and <nUm> kJ / mol . aside from the intramolecular allyl exchange process described above , this study also show that the e1- and e3-coordinated allyl form of a particular Zr - allyl complex coexist in solution and that the equilibrium composition of these specie is temperature dependent . the Cp2Zr+-allyl complex described in this paper serve a model for similar cationic cp 2Zr+-allyl intermediate implicated in zirconocene - catalyzed alkene polymerization reaction . A general method for the synthesis of multiply substituted pyrroles through zirconocene - mediated coupling of two alkyne and an azide in the presence of ClCu ha been achieved . (m-Ethylene)bis(zirconocene chloride ) ( la ) is formed rapidly in nearly quantitative yield upon hydrozirconation of vinylzirconocene chloride , 5a . In contrast , the slow reaction of (b-styryl)zirconocene chloride ( 5d ) with oligomeric hydridozirconocene chloride ( 4 ) give an equimolar mixture of Cp2ZrCl2 ( 6 ) , Cp2ZrCl(CH2CH2Ph) ( 7 ) , and the novel binuclear (olefin)zirconocene complex Cp2ZrCl(CH = CHPh)ZrCp2 ( 8 ) . the latter crystallizes in space group P21 / n with cell constant a = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 9 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 6 ) Å , and β = <nUm> ( 3 ) ° . the molecular structure of <nUm> is characterized by an almost planar bridging olefinic ligand . the Zr(l)-C ( l ) σ bond is short ( <nUm> ( 7 ) Å ) . Zr-C bond distance of <nUm> ( 7 ) and <nUm> ( 7 ) Å are found for the zr(2)-(e2-alkenyl) moiety . the chemistry of <nUm> is dominated by the reactive Zr-C σ bond . carbon monoxide is rapidly inserted with preservation of a binuclear structure to form <nUm> . reaction with protic reagent point to the formation of mononuclear ( η 2styrene)zirconocene a a reactive intermediate . the reaction of dipiperidinoacetylene ( pipC ≡ cpip , pip = NC 5H10 , 1a ) with [Cp2Ti(e2-btmsa)] ( 2 ) or with [Cp2Zr(e2-btmsa)(py)] ( 4 ) ( btmsa = bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene , py = pyridine ) afforded the metallacyclopentadienes [Cp2M(C4pip4)] ( <nUm> , m = Ti ; <nUm> , m = Zr ) , which in the solid state exhibit twisted five - membered metallacycles with an unusual half - chair conformation . In contrast , the sterically more demanding decamethyltitanocene ( Cp*2Ti ) and -zirconocene ( Cp*2Zr ) complex fragment can only accommodate one alkyne ligand . thus , the titanacyclopropene [ Cp*2Ti(C 2pip2 ) ] ( 7 ) wa isolated from the reaction of 1a with [Cp*2Ti(e2-btmsa)] ( 6 ) or with [Cp*2TiCl] in the presence of magnesium , whereas the zirconacyclopropenes [Cp*2Zr(C2X2)] ( 8a , x = pip ; 8b , x = NC5H9-4-Me ; 8c , x = NEt2 ) were prepared by the reduction of [Cp*2ZrCl2] with magnesium in the presence of 1a , bis(4-methylpiperidino)acetylene ( 1b ) , and bis(diethylamino)acetylene ( 1c ) , respectively . NMR study showed that complex <nUm> are in equilibrium with their tucked-in tetramethylpentafulvene-diaminovinyl isomer [ Cp*(e6-C5Me4CH 2)Zr(CX = CHX ) ] ( 9 ) in solution , which are formed by intramolecular C-H - bond activation and hydrogen transfer from one cp* methyl group to the alkyne ligand . thermodynamic and kinetic parameter were derived by variable - temperature NMR spectroscopy and DFT experiment . the molecular structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , 8a , [8a*MgCl2]2 , 8b , and 8c were established by x-ray diffraction analysis . hydrozirconation of phenylacetylene followed by a reaction with ((trimethylsilyl)ethynyl)lithium gave the respective (s-alkenyl)(s- alkynyl)zirconocene complex 6a . it treatment with a catalytic amount of BC18F15 ( <nUm> mol % ) at room temperature resulted in efficient s-ligand coupling with the formation of the isomeric five - membered zirconacycloallenoid complex 9a . two similar example with different substituents R1 ( SiMe3 , tBu ) were also investigated . all three new zirconacycloallenoids ( 9a-c ) were characterized by x-ray diffraction . the addition reaction of carbon dioxide to the zirconacycloallenoid complex 9c and two related example from the literature were studied . the carbon dioxide addition product were also characterized by x-ray crystal structure analysis . cationic (C5H4R)2ZrAr+ aryl specie ( 2a-d : r = H ; Ar = o-tolyl ( a ) , 2-Me-4-F-C6H3 ( b ) , 3-F-C6H4 ( c ) , ph ( d ) ; 2e : r = me , Ar = ph ) are generated by the reaction of a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of ( C5H4R ) 2ZrAr2 and ( C5H4R ) 2ZrMe2 with <nUm> equiv of [CPh3][B(C 6F5)4 ] via methide abstraction and ligand exchange step . complex 2d and the Cp2HfAr+ analogue ( 2f,g : Ar = o-tolyl ( f ) , ph ( g ) ) are generated by the reaction of cp 2MAr2 with [C6Me6H] [ B ( C 6F5)4 ] . NMR study suggest that these metallocene aryl cation exist a ( C5H4R ) 2M(Ar)(RCl)+ solvent adduct in chlorocarbon solution . NMR and DFT study show that the (C5H4R)2Zr(Ar) (RCl)+ specie contain b-C-H-Zr agostic interaction involving an ortho-aryl hydrogen . the " endo " isomer , in which the b-agostic interaction occupies the central coordination site , are ca. <nUm> kcal / mol more stable than the " exo " isomer , in which the b-agostic interaction occupies a lateral site . the aryl agostic interaction are weaker for Hf than Zr , and Cp2Hf(Ph)(C 6D5Cl)+ ( 2g*C6D 5Cl ) doe not contain an agostic interaction . the synthesis and structure of novel 3,3,3-trifluoropropyl substituted cyclopentadienes ( <nUm> / <nUm> ) and of their zirconocene dichloride derivative [ Zr(e5-C5H4C2H 4CF3)2Cl2 ] ( 6 ) and [ Zr(e-C 5H3-1,2-(C2H4CF3) 2}2Cl2 ] ( 7 ) is reported . these precatalysts have been investigated toward their property in the methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) assisted polymerization of ethylene . the result can be compared to the polymerization property of the non-fluorinated analogue [ Zr(Eta ; -C 5H4C2H4CH3 ) 2Cl2 ] ( 11 ) . complex <nUm> and <nUm> produce high - density polyethylene ( HDPE ) and are among the most active precatalysts for donor functionalized nonbridged metallocenes . an unprecedented temperature independence of the molar mass distribution is observed for the polymerization with <nUm> . the Cp2ZrCl(m-1,4-diphenylbutenyne)PX2 complex 7a [-P(C6H5)2] and <nUm> [ -P(C6F 5)2 ] insert tert-butylisonitrile into the Zr - c(sp <nUm> ) σ bond to yield the n-inside e2-iminoacyl zirconocene complex 13a and 13b . x-ray crystal structure analysis of complex 13a and 13b revealed the presence of a chiral atropisomeric structure with a torsion angle of <nUm> ° ( 13a ) and <nUm> ° ( 13b ) , respectively , around the central iminoacyl / alkenyl c(sp2) - c(sp2) σ bond . In solution an analogous chiral structure is observed . the barrier of interconversion of the enantiomeric atropisomers of 13a and 13b wa determined at DG ‡ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 13a ) and DG ‡ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 13b ) by temperature - dependent dynamic NMR spectroscopy . reaction of 7a and <nUm> with methyllithium followed by treatment with BC6F5 <nUm> gave the corresponding cationic zirconocene complex 12a and 12b . these complex took up <nUm> mol equiv of tert-butylisonitrile to yield the cationic n-inside e2-iminoacyl zirconocene system 14a and 14b a isonitrile adduct . the cationic complex 14a and 14b are also axially chiral . the barrier of enantiomerization ( DG ‡ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 14a ) , DG ‡ ( <nUm> K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ( 14b ) ) were also determined by dynamic NMR spectroscopy . 2,5-Bis(alkynylsilyl)-l-zirconacyclopentadienes <nUm> were formed highly regio- and chemoselectively in excellent yield by the homocoupling reaction of <nUm> equiv of bis(alkynyl)silanes <nUm> mediated by a low - valent zirconocene specie ( negishi reagent ) generated in situ from Cp2ZrBu2 . single - crystal x-ray structural analysis of 2,5-bis(phenylalkynyldimethylsilyl)- 1-zirconacyclopentadiene ( 3a ) revealed a sandwich - type conformation . hydrolysis or halogenation of these zirconacyclopentadienes <nUm> afforded multisubstituted stereodefined Si - bridged conjugated system . skeletal rearrangement of these 2,5-bis(alkynylsilyl)-1-zirconacyclopentadienes with aromatic substituents afforded zirconacyclohexadienesilacyclobutene fused ring compound <nUm> . using these zirconacyclopentadienes <nUm> a starting reactive organometallic reagent , interesting cyclic compound such a bis(alkynylsilyl)benzene derivative and bis(alkynylsilyl)thiophene derivative could be prepared in high yield . further application of these alkynylsilyl-substituted compound for more complicated product and functional material can be expected . exposure of a series of zirconocene amido and hydrazido hydride complex , (e5-C5Me4)2Zr(NHR)H ( r = 1Bu , NMe2 , me , H ) , to <nUm> atm of D2 gas at <nUm> ° C produced isotopic exchange in both the N-H and Zr-H position . In general , the relative rate of 1,2-elimination can be rationalized on the basis of groundstate effect , whereby amido compound with the strongest N-H bond , a judged by the corresponding free amine , undergo the slowest isotopic exchange . for the compound with the strongest N-H bond in the series , ( e5- C5Me4H)2Zr(NH2)H , the barrier for 1,2-elimination is sufficiently high such that s-bond metathesis becomes the dominant intermolecular exchange pathway . for the other amido zirconocene hydride , the rate constant for deuterium exchange into the N-H position are faster than for the Zr-H position . this behavior is a result of a faster intramolecular isomerization process driven by an equilibrium isotope effect favoring N-D over Zr-D bond formation . computational study on a related model compound , (e5-C5H5)2Zr(NH tBu)H , successfully reproduce these observation and support a pathway involving the formation of rare d0 dihydrogen complex . the lithium salt of 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8-octamethylfluorenyl ( flu'' ) and 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9-nonamethylfluorenyl ( flu* ) were reacted with Zr and Hf half - sandwich complex to generate mixed-ligand-metallocenes Cp''Flu''ZrCl2 ( 1 ) , Cp''Flu*ZrCl2 ( 2 ) , and Cp*Flu*HfCl2 ( 3 ) ( cp'' = 1,3-(SiMe 3)2C5H3 , cp* = C 5Me5 ) . reaction of the metallocene dichloride with MeLi yielded the dimethyl derivative Cp''Flu*ZrMe2 ( 4 ) and Cp''Flu*HfMe2 ( 5 ) . reduction of the zirconocene dichloride in the presence of CO gas yielded the dicarbonyl derivative Cp''Flu''Zr(CO)2 ( 6 ) and Cp''Flu*Zr(CO) <nUm> ( 7 ) , which represent the first example of zirconocene dicarbonyls containing a fluorenyl ligand derivative . structural characterization of the zirconocene dichloride <nUm> and the dicarbonyls <nUm> and <nUm> revealed that the methylated fluorenyl ligand adopt an e5-coordination and display a twisted tricyclic core in each case . A spectroscopic study of a small series of zirconocene dicarbonyl analogue indicates that the methylated fluorenyl ligand are strong electron donor and similar in this regard to heptamethylindenyl ( ind* ) and cp* . zirconocene - alkene complex Cp2Zr(PMe3)(CH <nUm> = CHR ) reacted with chlorodiphenylphosphine to form zircono-ethylphosphine derivative with high regioselectivity , which could be converted into various b-functionalized alkyldiphenylphosphine oxide in the presence of ClCu . oligosilyl-substituted alkyne complex of group <nUm> metallocenes have been prepared by reaction of group <nUm> metallocene dichloride with magnesium in the presence of the respective alkyne . depending on the alkyne substitution pattern , either metallacyclopentadienes or metallocene alkyne complex were formed . In order to suppress the oxidative coupling process , PMe3 wa added to obtain the metallocene alkyne complex base adduct . the reaction of 1,4-bis[tris(trimethylsilyl)silyl]butadiyne with zirconocene caused the formation of a 1,4-bis[tris(trimethylsilyl)silyl] - substituted zirconacyclocumulene . reaction of zirconacyclopentadienes with iodine proceeded to the expected 1,4-diiodobuta-1,3-dienes . systematic exploration of zirconocene ( Cp2ZrII ) chemistry since the 1980s ha offered a wide range of useful method for organic synthesis . many of these reaction are stoichiometric in zirconium , and even if several catalytic reaction are known , the development of catalytic zirconocene chemistry is of continuing interest . In this paper , the study of reaction catalytic in zirconium , i.e. alkyne dimerization and cyclotrimerization , is presented . these reaction are carried out by employing the recently introduced lanthanide - originated zirconocene equivalent . the use of <nUm> mol % of cp 2ZrCl2 , together with La metal or mischmetall a reductant and AlCl3 a transmetalating agent , lead to an efficient formation of dienes from disubstituted alkyne . under the same condition , monosubstituted alkyne underwent cyclotrimerization reaction to afford benzene derivative . this reaction also occurs efficiently in the absence of AlCl3 . it wa postulated that the catalytic cyclotrimerization did not proceed through a typical insertion of the alkyne into the zirconacyclopentadiene intermediate . this unprecedented reaction take place in the presence of zirconocene and lanthanide specie , possibly involving a bimetallic polarization process . we have carried out a combined QM / MM study to rationalize the factor that can affect the performance of C1 - symmetric ansa - zirconocene catalyst that contain bridged cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) and fluorenyl ( flu ) ligand in olefin homo- and copolymerization . two growing chain with different b-C ( tertiary or secondary ) and two olefin ( propene and ethylene ) have been used for this purpose . our calculation indicate that chain transfer ha a higher barrier than chain propagation in EE ( ethylene homopolymerization ) , PP ( propylene homopolymerization ) , and PE ( propylene complexation to a metal with a propyl chain ) system . however , the two process are competitive in EP ( ethylene complexation to a metal with a 2-methylpropyl chain ) system . substituents on the carbon in a C-H link weaken the C-H bond . this in turn determines the order EP < EE < PP < PE for the heat of reaction of the b-hydrogen transfer process , giving rise to the chain termination , where the process with the most negative reaction heat is the more thermodynamically favorable . it is further argued that the barrier for the termination process must follow the same order of EP < EE < PP < PE . for the insertion process the barrier increase with the number of substituents on the olefin and the cb atom of the growing chain a PP > PE ∼ EP > EE . the different propensity of the four system for termination and propagation result in the higher barrier of termination for EE , PP , and PE , whereas the barrier are similar for EP . our analysis explains why ethylene / propylene homopolymerization affords high molecular weight polymer , whereas ethylene / propylene copolymerization affords low molecular weight polymer . thermal decomposition of Cp2ZrPh2 in the presence of the buta-1,3-diynes RC = CC = CR ( r = ph , SiMe3 ) can lead to seven- or five - membered metallacycles . In both case a stable benzo - fused seven - membered zirconacyclocumulene arising from a 2-fold insertion of the triple bond of the dialkyne in the in situ generated zirconocene benzyne is formed . In the case of Me3SiC = CC = CSiMe3 a second minor complex is isolated : a 3-alkynyl-substituted zirconaindene arising from a β monoinsertion of one acetylenic function of the conjugated diyne in the zirconocene benzyne . No stable 2-alkynyl-substituted zirconacycle wa isolated . this a monoinsertion complex is an intermediate in the exchange of the metalated moiety with a main - group atom ( e.g. , antimony ) in a zirconacyclocumulene , explaining the formation of a 2-alkynyl-substituted stibaindene . In the thermal decomposition of Cp2Zr(Me)SCH2R4 ( R4 = ph , p-MeOC6H4 ) in the presence of PhC = CC = CPh , only the α monoinsertion of one triple bond of the diacetylenic reagent in the transient zirconathiirane is observed . the 2-alkynyl-substituted five - membered zirconathiolane is isolated a a bis-sulfonium zirconocene - ate dimer . x-ray diffraction study corroborate the molecular structure of all these zirconacyclic complex and stibacycle . four neutral zirconocene bis(ester enolate ) and non-zirconocene bis(alkoxy) complex have been employed for ring - opening polymerization and chain transfer polymerization of l-lactide ( L-LA ) and e-caprolactone ( e-CL ) . all c2v- , C2- , and Cs - ligated neutral zirconocene bis(ester enolate ) complex effectively polymerize e-CL at <nUm> ° C with high ( > <nUm> % ) initiator efficiency . the Cs - ligated complex ph 2C(Cp)(Flu)Zr[OC(OiPr) = CMe2]2 ( 1 ) also promotes highly efficient polymerization of L-LA and is at least <nUm> time more reactive than the c2v.,- and C2 - ligated analogue . the L-LA polymerization by <nUm> exhibit living characteristic , producing PLA with quantitative isotacticity ( no sign of monomer epimerization ) and controlled molecular weight . this polymerization follows firstorder kinetics with respect to both [L-LA] and [1] , consistent with a monometallic , coordinationanionic propagation mechanism . the structurally characterized non-zirconocene bis(alkoxy) complex [ ( 2,6-iPr2C6H 4)N(CH2)3N(2,6-iPr2C 6H4)]Zr(OiPr)2[O = C(NMe 2)CHMe2 ] ( 2 ) ha been synthesized in quantitative yield from the reaction of the zirconium bis(amido) precursor with isopropyl isobutyrate . complex <nUm> behaves a a single - site catalyst for polymerization of both e-CL and L-LA , unlike the comparative homoleptic zirconium tetraisopropoxy complex , which show multisite behavior for the same process . both the zirconocene <nUm> and the non-zirconocene <nUm> catalyze efficient chain transfer polymerization in the presence of iPrOH a a chain transfer reagent ( CTR ) for the catalytic production of PLA and PCL , respectively ; however , the metallocene system is more robust ( in term of ligand stability and maintaining the polymerization rate ) toward an excess of a protic CTR than the present non-metallocene system . menthyl-substituted group <nUm> metallocene dihalides of type Cp'2MX2 ( cp' = e5-menthyl- C5H4 ) have been known so far for m = Ti , Zr , and x = Cl ( 1-Ti , 1-Zr ) . A gap in knowledge is closed now by the expansion to hafnium ( 1-Hf ) and the preparation of complex with x = F ( 4-Ti , 4-Zr , 4-Hf ) . In a first catalytic application 1-Ti is used in the enantioselective buchwald hydrosilylation of imines and compared to (S,S)-(ebthi)TiF2 . also the variation of the ligand to ( e5-8-phenylmenthyl-C 5H4 is realized with a zirconocene dichloride ( 3-Zr ) . the reduction of 1-Ti afforded compound <nUm> , a dimeric titanium (III) complex , [Cp'2Ti(m-Cl)2TiCp'2] . such a specie is assumed to be an intermediate in the ring - opening reaction of epoxides with titanocene dichloride a precatalysts . we report the first crystallographically characterized dimethylaniline complex of a group <nUm> metallocene . [(IPCF)ZrMe(NMe2Ph)][B(C 6F5)4 ] show strongly coordinated NMe 2Ph which doe not interchange in solution . DFT calculation suggest that the Zr-N bond is <nUm> kJ mol-1 stronger than the Zr-Me-Zr bond in [[(IPCF)ZrMe]2(m-Me)][MeB(C6F5) <nUm> ] , the structure of which is also reported ( IPCF = me 2C(C5H4)(fluorenyl) ) . attempt to synthesize zirconocene hydrido alkoxide specie , cp 2Zr(H)OR , via several synthetic pathway consistently failed to yield the targeted complex , which seem prone to undergo disproportionation into Cp2ZrH2 and a bisalkoxide complex . reaction of cp 2ZrH2 with HOR , Me3SiOR , or Ph2CO yielded the corresponding bisalkoxide complex Cp2Zr(OR) <nUm> , of which Cp2Zr{OC(H)Ph2}2 wa characterized by an x-ray diffraction study . insertion of vinyl ether into Cp2ZrH2 yielded Cp2Zr(OR)2 and Cp2Zr(Et)OR . attempted hydrogenation of Cp2Zr(Me)OR or reaction of Cp2Zr(BH4)OR with NEt3 did not yield the targeted complex . Cp2Zr(H)OC6H5 and Cp2Zr(H)OC6F5 could be obtained , however , a transient specie by b-H elimination from Cp2Zr(tBu)OR , ligand exchange between Cp2ZrH2 and Cp2Zr(OC 6F5)2 , or protonation in the presence of olefin to yield the corresponding hydrozirconation product . In hydrozirconation reaction of styrene both specie are highly regioselective . the alkoxide substituent failed to inhibit b-H elimination in hydrozirconations of trans-3-hexene or b-OR elimination in reaction with vinyl ether . on the other hand , it imparted a vastly increased thermal stability to the tert-butyl complex Cp2Zr(tBu)OR , which were stable for up to several month in solution , before they isomerize to the respective isobutyl complex . cp 2Zr(iBu)OC6H5 wa characterized by x-ray crystallography . summary : the reaction dynamic of b-hydrogen transfer in the zirconocene olefin polymerization catalyst wa modeled using DFT path sampling . trajectory were found to cross the reaction barrier at a broad range and showed that Zr-H bonding increase during the reaction due to dynamic effect and a Zr-(e2-C2H4) fluctuation is critical to inducing the transfer . the reaction of a C,N - chelated ( (LCN)2M , where LCN is 2-((dimethylamino)methyl)phenyl and m is Sn ( I ) or Pb ( 2 ) ) stannylene and plumbylene with di-n-butylbis(rf-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium ( h ) were studied . In the case of the stannylene , the trinuclear carbene - like complex [ ( lcn ; )2Sn]2Cp2Zr ( 4 ) wa isolated a the major product . the second product isolated resulted from transmetalation of the C,N - chelating ligand from tin to zirconium , followed by 1-butene coupling to the coordinated aryne ( C,N - chelating ligand ) ( 5 ) . In the lead case , the major product wa the complex S . byproduct were elemental lead , the free ligand ( LCNH ) , butane , and 1-butene . the oxidation of <nUm> by oxygen gave the six - membered trioxa trizircona cyclic complex ( 6 ) and an eight - membered tetraoxa tetrastanna cyclic complex ( 1 ) . s-Symmetric propylene polymerization catalyst <nUm> with a bridged cyclopentadienyl and fluorenyl architecture are known to produce syndiotactic polymer . on the other hand , related C1 - symmetric catalyst , such a <nUm> , that are obtained from <nUm> by the introduction of a bulky substituent ( tert-butyl ) on the cyclopentadienyl ring afford isotactic polymer . In this study we employ DFT calculation in order to analyze several aspect of olefin polymerization catalyzed by the fluorenyl-based C1 - symmetric zirconocene <nUm> . modeling of the propagation in naked cationic system , disregarding the noncoordinating counterion , yield information on the factor that affect streoselectivity ( and ultimately stereoregularity ) , regioselectivity , and reactivity of the " crowded " site of the zirconocene relative to the " open " one . several hypothesis are investigated , with the aim to rationalize the experimental observation that <nUm> affords isotactic polymer whereas <nUm> give rise to syndiotactic polymer . we provide in addition an analysis of the stability of dormant specie <nUm> produced from <nUm> propylene mi - insertion . for this task , the need to include explicitly the counterion in the modeling seems to be inevitable . comparative study of the energetics of b-H elimination to the metal or b-H transfer to the monomer , relative to insertion into a Zr - secondary C bond , indicate that dormant specie <nUm> are prone to b-H elimination . chemistry of reduced bis(indenyl)hafnium compound ha been explored . sodium amalgam reduction of 075-C9H5-1,3-(SiMe3)2)2HfCl2 wa studied in several different solvent . while reduction in toluene resulted in decomposition , performing the reaction in the presence of THF or 1,2-dimethoxyethane ( DME ) yielded n 6,n 5-bis(indenyl)hafnium solvent ( THF or DME ) complex arising from ligand - in - duced haptotropic rearrangement . using le coordinating solvent such a diethyl ether or 2,5-dimethyl THF furnished a rare example of a structurally characterized hafnocene(III) complex , ( n 5-C9H5-1,3- (SiMe3)2)2HfCl . an unusual sodium chloride complex of n 6,n 5-bis(indenyl)hafnium , [ ( n 6-C9H5-1,3- (SiMe3)2)( ? 5-C9H5-1,3,-(SiMe3)2)HfCl]2Na[Na(DME)3] , wa also isolated and crystallographically characterized a a byproduct from synthesis of the DME compound . the reactivity of the t]6,t]5- bis(indenyl)hafnium THF compound a an isolable source of Hf (II) wa also evaluated . addition of H or N,N-dimethylaminopyridine ( DMAP ) resulted in facile oxidative addition , while C-O cleavage of THF wa observed upon mild heating . preparation of the corresponding hafnocene dicarbonyl derivative allowed comparison of the electronic property of the new complex a compared to their zirconocene congener . reaction of the zirconocene dichloride cp flu * ClZr <nUm> ( cp = 1,3-(SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> C <nUm> H <nUm> , flu = C <nUm> me <nUm> ) with i BuLi ( i BuLi = CHLi <nUm> CHMe <nUm> ) resulted in elimination of isobutylene and formation of cp ( η <nUm> η <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> H)ZrH ( 1-syn-1,2-DH * FD ) , possessing an η <nUm> : η <nUm> -dihydrofluorenediyl ligand derived from ametal - to - benzo ring hydride transfer . this specie undergoes reversible hydride transfer and exists in equilibrium with only one of it three other possible isomer ( 1-syn-3,4-DHFD ) . compound l-syn-l,2-DHFD catalyzes the cyclization of 1,5-hexadiene to methylenecyclopentane , and it reaction with excess isobutylene lead to the elimination of isobutane and formation of the cyclometalated zirconocene isobutyl specie ( η <nUm> : η <nUm> -C s H <nUm> -l-SiMe <nUm> CH <nUm> -3-SiMe <nUm> )(e <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> )Zr i bu ( 2 ) . reaction of cp flu ClZr <nUm> with i BuLi directly generated the cyclometalated zirconocene specie ( η <nUm> : η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -l-SiMe <nUm> CH <nUm> -3-SiMe <nUm> )(e <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> Zr i bu ( 3 ) ; however , reaction of the dichloride cp flu ClZr <nUm> with i BuLi in the presence of hydrogen generated the dihydrofluorenediyl monohydride derivative cp ( η <nUm> : η <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> H <nUm> )ZrH ( 4 ) . treatment of the cyclometalated isobutyl specie <nUm> with H <nUm> led to partial hydrogenation of the flu ligand and formation of the monohydride cp ( η <nUm> : η <nUm> -C <nUm> me <nUm> H <nUm> )ZrH ( 5 ) , which contains a hexahydrof-luorenediyl ligand . partial hydrogenation of the flu ligand proceeded exclusively via an intramolecular pathway , a evidenced by the all - exo configuration of the methyl group on the saturated benzo ring . structural characterization of l-syn-l,2-DHFD , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> revealed a highly strained η <nUm> : η <nUm> -coordination mode for the dihydro- and hexahydrofluorenediyl ligand . zirconocene-l-aza-l,3-diene complex , [ me 2Si(C 5H <nUm> ) 2]Zr[N(Ar)CH = CHCH(Ph) ] ( Ar = ph , 2a ; Ar = / J-MeOC 5H <nUm> , 2b ) and cp 2Zr[N(Ar)CH = CHCH(Ph) ] ( Ar = ph , 3a ; Ar = p-MeOC 6H <nUm> , 3b ) , have been synthesized and characterized by NMR spectroscopy . x-ray crystal structure determination of compound 2a and 3a,b reveal folded five - membered - ring moiety for the zirconacycles . DFT calculation and variable - temperature NMR experiment for complex 2a establish a rapid ring - flipping process at room temperature , with the conformation bearing a pseudoequatorial ph group more stable by <nUm> kcal / mol . kinetic study on ketone insertion into these zirconocene complex show second - order reaction , and the insertion is more favorable in the presence of a [ me 2Si ] ansa bridge , a le electron - rich substituent on the nitrogen , and a more basic ketone . one of the insertion product , namely cp 2Zr[N(Ph)CH = CHCH(Ph)CPh 2O ] ( 5a ) , ha also been characterized by x-ray crystallography . In this work , the reversible chain transfer to Al in ethene polymerization catalyzed by Cp*2ZrCl2 / MAO wa studied via comparison of the polymerization in the presence and absence of trimethyl-aluminum ( TMA ) contained in commercial MAO . it wa found that the weight distribution of the product were narrower , in the presence of TMA , at low Al / Zr ratio taken in these experiment . PDIs of about <nUm> or lower were attainable at temperature up to <nUm> ° C . we propose that a fast to moderate reversible chain transfer between Cp*2ZrR+ and TMA ( similar to a catalyzed chain growth mechanism ) is the origin of the low polydispersity . simulation of the polymerization with the proposed mechanism confirmed this hypothesis ; the qualitative result are consistent with the experimental trend . reaction of zirconocene-carboryne precursor Cp2Zr(m-Cl)(m- C2B10H10)Li(OEt2)2 with various kind of alkyne R1C = CR2 in refluxing toluene give the monoinsertion product 1,2-[Cp2ZrC(R1) = C(R 2)]-1,2-C2B10H10 in good to very high isolated yield with very good chemo- and regioselectivity . this reaction offer an efficient route to zirconacyclopentenes incorporating a carboranyl unit , a carborane version of zirconacyclopentadienes . all complex have been fully characterized by various spectroscopic technique and single - crystal x-ray analysis . deprotonation of 6-dimethylamino-6-methylpentafulvene ( 3a ) with methyl lithium yielded the (l-dimethylaminoethenyl)Cp lithium reagent 4a . it treatment with zirconium tetrachloride under carefully controlled reaction condition gave the corresponding bis(enamino-Cp)ZrCl2 complex 5a . the product 5a is very sensitive to acid - catalyzed mannich condensation . photolysis of 5a ( HPK <nUm> , pyrex filter ) resulted in a rapid intramolecular [2+2]cycloaddition reaction to yield the cis-bis-(dimethylamino)cyclobutylene-bridged ansa - zirconocene complex 7a in a photostationary equilib - rium ( 5a:7a ≈ <nUm> : <nUm> ) . after acid - catalyzed mannich conversion of the minor component ( 5a to 6a ) the new photoproduct 7a wa isolated pure by fractional crystallization . the complex 5a and 7a were both characterized by x-ray diffraction . reaction of [(2-phosphino)ethenyl]zirconocene chloride ( 1 ) with CpM(CO)3Cl ( m = Mo , W ) in THF yielded the[(3-phosphino)propenoyl] dicarbonyl(cyclopentadienyl)metals { CpM(CO)2[(CO)CR = CRPPh <nUm> ] } ( 2 ) . when the reaction between [(2-phosphino)ethenyl]zirconocene chloride ( 1 ) and CpMo(CO)3Cl wa carried out in the presence of a catalytic amount of C4Cl2H6N2Pd , [(3-phosphino)propenoyl]dicarbonyl(cyclopentadienyl)molybdenum , { CpMo(CO) 2[(CO)-CR = CRPPh2 ] } , wa exclusively observed . when [(2-phosphino)ethenyl]zirconocene chloride ( 1 ) and MeCpW(CO)3Cl were reacted in the presence of a catalytic amount of ClCu , [(3-phosphino)propenoyl] dicarbonyl(methylcyclopentadienyl)tungsten , [ MeCpW(CO)2[(CO)CR = CRPPh2 ] ] , wa formed . their structure are determined by x-ray diffraction analysis . A comparative quantum chemical study ha been performed to shed light on the fundamental difference between hafnocenes and zirconocenes concerning reaction between the metal and a-olefin monomer , namely , ethene , propene , 1-butene , and 1-hexene . analogous specie along the a-olefin polymerization pathway were studied for bis(cyclopentadienyl) zirconocene and hafnocene , taking into account the structural variation of the first two monomer insertion step and of the competitive chain - termination reaction . the result were analyzed a a function of both the metal and the monomer , the metal showing more distinct difference . the most notable difference in the reaction of the zirconocene and hafnocene can be seen in b-hydrogen transfer to metal , activation energy for which are significantly higher for the hafnocene . Bis(vinyl-Cp)zirconium dichloride ( 6 ) undergoes a clean intramolecular photochemically induced [2+2] cycloaddition reaction to yield the cyclobutylene-bridged ansa - zirconocene isomer ( 7 ) when irradiated with UV light ( HPK <nUm> , pyrex filter ) at ambient condition . both the open and the ansabridged isomer ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) were characterized by x-ray diffraction . the corresponding bis(2-vinylindenyl)ZrCl2 complex ( 12 ) also close rapidly and completely to the ansa - metallocene ( 13 ) upon photolysis . the bis(2-butadienylindenyl)ZrCl2 complex ( 20 ) undergoes a formal [4+4] cycloaddition reaction upon photolysis to yield it ansa - metallocene isomer <nUm> , exhibiting an eight - membered carbocyclic bridging unit . the metallocene complex prepared and characterized in this study give very active ethene polymerization catalyst upon activation with excess methylalumoxane . frustrated lewis pair , highly active in heterolytic dihydrogen splitting , were used a active and very selective hydrogenation catalyst for organometallic substrate . conjugated dienamines fixed at the ferrocene framework and at the zirconocene nucleus were selectively 1,4-hydrogenated under catalytic condition at ambient temperature . hydrozirconation of 1-alkynyl pinacolboronates , <nUm> , with HZrCp2Cl provides gem - borazirconocenes <nUm> . the latter when treated with BrCu give the homocoupled (1E,3E)-2,3-dibora-1,3-butadienes , <nUm> , in good yield ( 62-67 % ) . the reaction work even for hindered <nUm> ( r = t-Bu ) . structure <nUm> wa assigned on the basis of NMR . suzuki - miyaura coupling of 3a ( r = n-Bu ) with PhI in the presence of CsF lead to the replacement of both boron group by phenyl and hydrogen to give <nUm> in <nUm> % yield . zirconocene - mediated coupling of <nUm> lead to diastereomeric product : (1E,3E)-1,3-dibora-1,3-butadienes , <nUm> , in 7-26 % isolated yield and (1E,3E)-1,4-dibora-1,3-butadienes , <nUm> , in 17-34 % isolated yield . the two isomer can be separated by selective precipitation of <nUm> from the reaction mixture in pentane ( <nUm> ° C ) followed by silica gel chromatography to give pure <nUm> . the reaction doe not work when r in <nUm> is the t-Bu group . assignment of structure for <nUm> and <nUm> were done on the basis of 1D and 2D NMR experiment . In addition , a single - crystal x-ray analysis of 5a showed it to be a highly planar and linearly oriented molecule . suzuki - miyaura coupling of 4a proceeded to replace the terminal boron group exclusively , while the internal boron group of 4a remained intact . Titanium(IV) and zirconium(IV) bent - sandwich complex containing the new donor substituted [2-(diisopropylamino)ethyl]cyclopentadienyl ( CpN ) ligand are described . CpNH ( <nUm> ; C7H9NiPr <nUm> ) is prepared from sodium cyclopentadienide and 2-chloro-1-(diisopropylamino)ethane . the highly moisture - sensitive metallocene dichloride Cp2NTiCl2 ( 2 ) and Cp2NZrCl2 ( 3 ) are synthesized by reaction of CpNLi with Cl4Ti and Cl4Zr , respectively .
