In combination with the cocatalyst methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) they are precursor for ethylene polymerization catalyst . compound <nUm> and <nUm> react with <nUm> equiv of ClH with protonation of the amino group to give the air- and moisture - stable metallocene dichloride dihydrochlorides Cp2NTiCl2*2HCl ( 4 ) and Cp2NZrCl2*2HCl ( 5 ) , which also are found to be precatalysts for the polymerization of ethylene . the dimethyl compound Cp2NTiMe2 ( 6 ) and Cp2NZrMe2 ( 7 ) can be obtained by reaction of <nUm> and <nUm> with <nUm> equiv of methyllithium . the dibenzyl complex Cp2NTiBz2 ( 8 ) and Cp2NZrBz2 ( 9 ) are formed analogously with a stoichiometric amount of benzylmagnesium bromide . the diphenoxy complex Cp2NTi( OPh)2 ( 10 ) is synthesized by reaction of <nUm> with <nUm> equiv of lithium phenoxide . the dialkyl compound 6-8 and the diphenoxy compound <nUm> show a remarkable activity in the catalytic dehydrocoupling of phenylsilane . Zr(NMe2)4 reacts with <nUm> equiv of CpNH ( 1 ) to give the zirconocene derivative Cp2NZr(NMe2)2 ( 11 ) in quantitative yield . the structure of <nUm> ha been determined by a single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . the effect of the (dialkylamino)- and (dialkylammonio)-ethyl substituents in metallocene - type compound of titanium and zirconium are described . zirconocene olefin complex Cp2Zr(PPh2Me)-(e2-RCH = CH2 ) ( r = H , et , ph ) react rapidly with <nUm> equiv of [HB(C6F5)2]n to give the zwitterionic product Cp2Zr{e3-[CH(R)CH2BH(C6F 5)2 ] } ( r = H ( 2a ) , et ( 2b ) , ph ( 2c ) ) and the borane - phosphine adduct Ph2MeP* BC12F10H . spectroscopic and structural evidence confirms an interaction between zirconium and the b-carbon attached to boron , resulting in pentacoordinated carbon . the thermal decomposition of dibutylzirconocene ( 1 ) at room temperature affords paramagnetic butylzirconocene(III) ( 11 ) , zirconocene(III) hydride ( 12 ) , the diamagnetic butenylzirconocene(IV) hydride dimer 5a , and the 1,1-bis(cyclopentadienyl)-2-methyl-3-(zirconocenyl hydride)-1-zirconacyclobutane(IV) dimer <nUm> . initially , decomposition furnishes crotylzirconocene(IV) hydride ( 3a ) , followed by 1,1-bis(cyclopentadienyl)-2-ethyl-1-zirconacyclopropane(IV) ( 2a ) and 1,1-bis(cyclopentadienyl)-3,4-diethyl-1-zirconacyclopentane(IV) ( 4a ) , listed in the order of appearance . this order suggests that the primary decomposition reaction is a g-H abstraction , which lead to the formation of 1,1-bis(cyclopentadienyl)-2-methyl-1-zirconacyclobutane(IV) ( 6a ) . the latter wa not observed experimentally but is postulated on the basis of secondary product . reaction leading to the above compound are discussed from mechanistic and thermochemical point of view . the reported compound have been characterized by either EPR or multidimensional , multinuclear NMR spectroscopy . compound 3a ha also been synthesized independently from zirconocene chloride hydride and crotylmagnesium bromide and undergoes the same rearrangement into 2a and then 4a . the allyl analog 3b , synthesized from zirconocene chloride hydride and allylmagnesium bromide , exhibit the same behavior and rearranges into 1,1-bis(cyclopentadienyl)-3,4-dimethyl-1-zirconacyclopentane ( 4b ) . A one - pot regioselective synthesis of tricyclic 1,1-diphosphines involving , first , insertion reaction of 2,3-dihydrophosphole ( 3 ) into the zirconium-carbon bond of a generated in situ zirconocene benzyne and , then , an exchange reaction between the resulting tricyclic metalated phosphine <nUm> and various dichlorophosphines is reported . one of these 1,1-diphosphines , 15a ( bis-(sulfide) adduct ) , is characterized by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . when it is first treated with n-butyllithium at <nUm> ° C , zirconocene dichloride is an effective reagent for the cyclization of some 2-bromo a,o-dienes at <nUm> ° C . the product are carbo-and heterocyclic five - membered ring with adjacent methylene and methyl substituents . reductive cyclization to form zirconacyclopentanes , followed by b-bromo elimination , is indicated a the order of step in the reaction mechanism . use of catalytic zirconocene dichloride with excess butylmagnesium chloride in diethyl ether at <nUm> ° C is effective only for cyclization of 2-bromo-1,6-heptadiene . the synthesis and property of two soluble , weakly coordinating derivative of the tetrakis-(perfluoroaryl)borate anion B(4-C6F4TBS)4- and B(4-C6F4TIPS)4- ( TBS = tert-butyldimethylsilyl and TIPS = triisopropylsilyl ) are reported . reaction of the trityl salt of the above anion with a variety of zirconium and thorium L2MMe2 complex in benzene or toluene affords the cationic ion - paired methyl complex L2MMe+X- or the corresponding hydrido complex L2MH+X- ( L2 = bis(cyclopentadienyl)- or cyclopentadienylamido-type ligand ) when the reaction is carried out under dihydrogen . the solid state structure of the complex (Me5Cp)2ThMe+B(C6F5) 4- ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction . the BC24F20 -- based zirconocenium methyl complex L2MMe+ are unstable at room temperature with respect to , among other factor , intramolecular C-H activation of the ligand framework . In general , the thermal stability of the B(C6F4TBS)4 -- and B(C6F4TIPS)4 -- derived complex are greater than those of the corresponding BC24F20 -- and MeB(C6F5)3 -- derived analogue . the relative coordinative tendency of MeB(C6F5)3- , B(C6F5)4- , B(C6F4TBS)4- , and B(C6F4TIPS)4- are estimated from the solution spectroscopic information and the structural dynamic of the ion - pair and follow the order MeB(C6F5)3- > B(C6F4TBS)4- ≈ B(C6F4TIPS)4- > B(C6F5)4- . the coordination of the neutral metallocene precursor to the cationic metallocenes is found to compete with counteranion coordination . arene solvent coordination to the zirconium constrained geometry cation [(Me4Cp)SiMe2(NtBu)]ZrMe+ is also observed when B(C6F5)4- is the counteranion . (1,2-Me2Cp)2ZrMe+B(C6F 4TBS)4- undergoes slow decomposition under an inert atmosphere to afford [(1,2-Me2Cp)2ZrF]2(m-F)+B(C 6F4TBS)4- , which ha been characterized by x-ray diffraction . the olefin polymerization activity and thermal stability of the zirconocene catalyst reach a maximum when B(C6F4TBS)4- and B(C6F4TIPS)4- are used a counteranions . the polymerization activity of the zirconium constrained geometry complex also reach a maximum in aromatic solvent when B(C6F5)4- is used a the counteranion , apparently due to solvent coordination . As modification of the effective catalyst precursor [dimethylsilanediylbis(benz[e]indenyl)]-zirconium dichloride , the ansa - zirconocene complex Me2Si(cyclopenta[c]phenanthryl)2ZrCl2 , Me2Si(cyclopenta[l]phenanthryl)2ZrCl2 , Me2Si(2-methylcyclopenta[l]phenanthryl)2ZrCl2 , and Me2Si(2-methyltetrahydrobenz[e]indenyl)2ZrCl2 have been synthesized . when activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , these complex give highly active catalyst for the polymerization of propene to polymer with high isotacticities and molecular weight . alkyl- and aryllithium reagent add cleanly to the electrophilic carbon center C6 of 6-(N,N-dimethylamino)fulvenes to yield the corresponding substituted cyclopentadienyllithium system Li[C5H4-CR1R2NMe2] . subsequent treatment with ZrCl4*2THF give the corresponding cp - functionalized zirconocene dichloride . these were reacted with methyllithium to give the ( C5H4CR1R2NMe2 ) 2Zr(CH3)2 complex 11a ( R1 = R1 = CH3 ) and 11b ( R1 = CH3 , R2 = ph ) , respectively . treatment of <nUm> with tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane wa carried out to generate the corresponding alkylmetallocene cation ( 12 ) , which turned out to be unstable under the reaction condition applied ( <nUm> ° C ) with regard to liberation of <nUm> equiv of methane by CH activation at a methyl group adjacent to nitrogen and formation of the spiro - metallocene complex system <nUm> . CH activation may be a major reaction pathway open to alkylzirconocene cation system under suitable reaction condition . new zirconocene complex cp *[Cp(CH2)n-NMe2]ZrCl2 ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) and Cp[Cp(CH2)nCH(CH3)2] - ClZr <nUm> ( n = <nUm> , <nUm> ) catalyze , in conjunction with <nUm> equiv of n-BuLi , dehydrocoupling polymerization of phenylsilane to afford high-molecular-weight poly(phenylsilanes) ( mw > <nUm> ) . 29Si NMR reveals that the microstructure of the resulting polymer is predominantly syndiotactic . diacetylenic phosphanes are cleanly transformed when reacted with zirconocene into zirconacyclopentadiene phosphiranes . these new cyclic system are the source of a variety of unsaturated phosphorus compound like phospharadialene or alkenyl alkynyl phosphanes . the migration of a Zr center between adjacent carbon atom of a Zr - bound alkyl group is investigated by a density functional study of alternative reaction path available to a C10H10Zr - alkyl cation . this migration is found to occur by the classical reaction route , i.e. by b-H transfer , olefin rotation , and reinsertion into the Zr-H bond without loss of the olefin ligand , rather than by a concerted Zr / H exchange . the activation barrier is determined to decrease from <nUm> kJ / mol for the degenerate isomerization of a zirconocene ethyl cation to <nUm> kJ / mol for the isomerization of a primary to a secondary zirconocene propyl cation and <nUm> kJ / mol for it back - reaction . it is further reduced to <nUm> kJ / mol for the isomerization of a primary to a tertiary zirconocene isobutyl cation and <nUm> kJ / mol for it reverse , which model the isomerization process competing with stereoregular chain growth in zirconocene - based catalyst . the facility with which the zirconocene isobutyl cation transfer it b-H atom is connected with a particularly soft stretching vibration of the agostic b-C-H bond . substantial stabilization of positive charge at the b-carbon atom by two alkyl substituents appears to be the cause . reaction path by which an olefin ligand in an intervening isomerization intermediate can change it coordination from one enantioface to the other have also been identified . reaction of Cp2M(PMe3)2 complex ( m = Ti , Zr ; cp = e5-C5H5 ) with the n-(p-tolyl)-diphenylketenimine Ph'N = C = CPh2 ( ph' = p-MeC6H4 ) in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio affords the ketenimine - containing metallocene derivative Cp2M(e2-(C,N)-Ph'N = C = CPh2)(PMe <nUm> ) ( m = Ti ( 1 ) ; Zr ( 2 ) ) . the ketenimine ligand reacts in the same way with the " Cp*2M " specie ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 ) generated from the reduction of the corresponding Cp*2MCl2 complex with LitBu ( <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio ) to give the related complex Cp*2M(e2-(C,N)-Ph'N = C = CPh2 ) ( m = Ti ( 3 ) ; Zr ( 4 ) ) . the molecular structure of <nUm> show a titanium atom bonded to two e5-cyclopentadienyl ring and a e2 -(C,N) - bonded ketenimine ligand . reaction of " Cp*2Ti " with the ketenimine ligand in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio give 1,1,5,5-tetraphenyl-3-(p-tolyl)-2-(p-toluidino)-3-aza-1,4-pentadiene , which probably result from the coupling , followed by hydrolysis , of two ketenimine molecule coordinated to one titanocene moiety . protonation of <nUm> with Et3NHCl or H2O ( <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio ) affords the intermediate specie Cp*2Ti(X)(e2-(C,N)-Ph'N = C(H) - In solution at room temperature , the two benzyl group of <nUm> are magnetically equivalent , however , in the solid state , x-ray diffraction reveals that one benzyl group is coordinated in a normal η <nUm> -fashion and the other in an η <nUm> - mode . the small Cp-(centroid)-Ti-O angle of <nUm> ° in <nUm> indicates sterically open feature in common with amido-based " constrained geometry " polymerization catalyst . low - temperature NMR - scale reaction of <nUm> with B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> and ph <nUm> C + B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - indicate the formation of the corresponding cationic complex (TCP)TiCH <nUm> ph + PhCH <nUm> B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - ( 4 ) and (TCP)TiCH <nUm> ph + B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - ( 5 ) . upon activation with ph <nUm> C + B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - , complex <nUm> is highly active for ethylene , propylene , and styrene polymerization . the diels - alder cycloaddition reaction between enoyl-oxazolidinones <nUm> and dienes is efficiently catalyzed by zirconocene bis(triflate) catalyst ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) in CCl2H2 or nitroalkane solvent . the use of chiral catalyst [S]-8 led to significant asymmetric induction in the adduct derived from dienophiles <nUm> and cyclopentadiene , but only in nitroalkane solution at low temperature and at lower catalyst loading . the binding of acryloyloxazolidinone 3a to <nUm> wa studied in detail by 1H , 13C , and 19F NMR spectroscopy in both CD2Cl2 and nitroalkane solvent . these study reveal that two isomeric , five - coordinate , monotriflate complex ( 9a and 9b ) are formed from 3a and <nUm> in both solvent . the minor isomer ( 9a ) ha the carbamate C = O coordinated to the metal at a central site , while in the major isomer ( 9b ) it is coordinated to a lateral site . ( NMIn ) <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> carboaluminates 1-alkenes and dienes with moderate ( 55-65 % ) enantioselectivities . In contrast , ethylenebis(tetrahydroindenyl) dimethylzirconium ( (EBTHI)ZrMe <nUm> ) and related zirconocenes give low activity and selectivity in the carboalumination reaction . study of the interaction of zirconocene methyl cation with trimethylaluminum by <nUm> H NMR show that [(EBTHI)ZrMe][MeB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] form a stable bis(m-methyl) aluminum adduct . zirconocene methyl cation derived from cp* <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> and ( NMIn ) <nUm> ZrMe <nUm> react slowly with large excess of trimethylaluminum to form weakly bound trimethylaluminum adduct . the difference in trimethylaluminum binding to the cationic zirconocene center is consistent with the significantly lower activity observed when (EBTHI)ZrMe <nUm> is used a the precatalyst . formal [3+2] cycloaddition reaction between various aldehyde and 2-phosphino-1-zirconaindene ( 1 ) lead to stable anionic zwitterionic zirconocene complex . extension of this method to the reaction of internal or terminated aldehyde containing dendrimers with <nUm> allows the preparation of the first dendrimers and multidendritic macromolecule containing zwitterionic [ phosphonium anionic zirconocene(IV) ] complex . the ( e2-diaryl ketone)zirconocene dimer 17a and 17b ( aryl = phenyl or p-tolyl ) react with the group <nUm> metallocene dihydride complex [RCp2MH2] ( RCp2M = Cp2Zr , (MeCp)2Zr , or Cp2Hf ) to yield the dimetallic compound [ (m-e1-O:e2-C,O-Ar2CO)ZrCp <nUm> / H2MRCp2 ] 18a-f . these system contain a dimetallabicyclic framework in which the two metal center are bridged by the e2-diaryl ketone ligand oxygen atom and a m-hydride ligand . the remaining hydride ligand is trans-oriented to the m-H moiety at the MRCp2 unit . the complex 18a-c were characterized by x-ray diffraction . treatment of the complex <nUm> with BC18F15 result in the selective abstraction of the terminal hydride ligand to form the dimetallic cation complex [ (m-e1-O:e2-C,O-Ar2CO)ZrCp 2(m-H)MRCp2]+ 19a-f ( with BC18F15H - anion ) . the complex <nUm> contain the intact ( e2-diaryl ketone)ZrCp2 unit to which a (H-MRCp2)+ cation is formally attached . they exhibit a planar dimetallabicyclic framework , in which the two group <nUm> metal center are connected by mean of the e2-ketone oxygen atom and the m-hydride ligand . the complex 19a,b and e were characterized by x-ray crystal structure analysis . the complex <nUm> behave chemically a adduct of the highly reactive (RCp2M-H)+ cation with a metallaoxirane matrix . ethene is polymerized by the system <nUm> with high catalyst activity . A series of zirconocene dihydride complex of the general form [(RnCp)2ZrH2]x having substituted cyclopentadienyl ligand ha been prepared by hydrogenation of the corresponding dimethyl complex . the most sterically crowded member ( Cp*(e5-C5HMe4)ZrH2 , ( cp* = ( e5-C5Me5 ) ) , Cp*{e5-C5H3-1,3-(CMe 3)2}ZrH2 and { e5-C5H3-1,3-(CMe3) 2}2ZrH2 ) are monomeric ; those le crowded member ( [ Cp*{e5-C5H4(CMe 3)}ZrH2]2 , [Cp*(THI)ZrH2]2 ( THI = e5-tetrahydroindenyl ) , and [ { e5-C5H3-1,3-(CHMe2) 2}2ZrH2]2 ) are predominantly dimeric in benzene solution . Cp*{e5-C5H3-1,3-(CHMe 2)2}ZrH2 and (e5-C5HMe4)2ZrH2 exist a equilibrium mixture of monomer and dimer in benzene solution . the hydride ligand rapidly exchange with D2 , affording the dideuteride complex . deuterium incorporation into some of the substituents on the cyclopentadienyl ring of the monomeric dihydride complex is also observed . the x-ray structure of Cp*2HfH2 , Cp*{e5-C5H4(CMe 3)}ZrCl2 , Cp*{e5-C5H3-1,3-(CHMe 2)2}ZrCl2 and { e5-C5H3-1,3-(CMe3) 2}2ZrCl2 are reported . the reaction of zirconocene dichloride with <nUm> equiv of butyllithium and 1-trimethylsilyl-propyne yield yellow 1,1-bis(cyclopentadienyl)-3,4-dimethyl-2,5-bis(trimethylsilyl)zirconacyclopenta- 2,4-diene , <nUm> . the metathesis reaction of <nUm> with Cl3P give a mixture of 1-chloro-and 1-cyclopentadienyl-3,4-dimethyl-2,5-bis(trimethylsilyl)-1-phosphacyclopenta-2,4- diene , which wa allowed to react in THF with distilled calcium . crystallization of the product from THF solution gave yielded nearly quantitatively 1-chloro-3,4-dimethyl-2,5-bis-(trimethylsilyl)-1-arsacyclopenta-2,4-diene , <nUm> . 3,4-Dimethyl-2,5-bis(trimethylsilyl)-1-arsacyclopentadienyl bis(tetrahydrofuran-O)calcium chloride , <nUm> , wa isolated from the reduction of <nUm> with distilled calcium . five new indenyl zirconium metallocenes with 2-alkyl and 2-aryl substituents were synthesized and characterized . for the synthesis of the ligand the di-Grignard reagent 1,2-bis(magnesiomethyl)benzene dichloride wa explored a a synthon to 2-substituted indene . this procedure provides access to a variety of functionalized 2-indenylmetallocenes such a bis(2-ferrocenylindene)zirconium dichloride and bis(2-adamantylindenyl)zirconium dichloride . crystallographic characterization of bis[2-(4-(dimethylamino)phenyl)indenyl] zirconium dichloride revealed an anti conformation with a coplanar orientation of the dimethylamino substituent to the aryl ring in the solid state . the polymerization behavior of all five zirconocene dichloride in liquid propylene wa studied in the presence of MAO at various temperature , and the result were compared to those for the known catalyst system bis-(2-phenylindenyl)zirconium dichloride / MAO ( M1 / MAO ) . the productivity of the 2-arylindene metallocenes in propylene polymerization wa on the order of 100-7000 kg of PP / ( ( mol of Zr ) h ) . In contrast , the (2-adamantylindenyl)metallocenes exhibited very low productivity of <nUm> kg PP / ( ( mol of Zr ) h ) in propylene polymerization . the reaction of [CPh3][B(C6F4R)4] with [Cp'2-ZrH2]2 ( cp' = C5H4SiMe3 ) give the new binuclear hydrido complex [Cp'4Zr2H3][B(C6F 4R)4J ( r = F , SiPr3i ) , which are highly active initiator for the polymerization of isobutene and isobutene - isoprene copolymerizations at near - zero concentration of ionizing solvent . the structure of the trinuclear hydride [ Cp'5(e1:e5-C5H 3-SiMe3)Zr3H4J+[B(C 6F4SiPri3)4]- is reported . A variety of stable five - coordinate organo-zirconocene-ate complex , 2-4 , <nUm> , 12a,b , <nUm> , and <nUm> , have been prepared and structurally characterized . the reaction process is based on both ( i ) the nucleophilic attack of tertiary phosphine on acetylenic reagent and ( ii ) the ability for 16-electron d0-zirconocene(IV) complex to coordinate two electron donor ligand . we have shown that the nature of the heteroelement directly bonded to the triple bond of the terminal acetylenic system directs the nucleophilic attack of the phosphine ; in all case only one regioisomer is observed . surprisingly , the nucleophilic attack of the phosphine in 1a occurs on propargyl derivative 19-21 to give the corresponding zwitterionic zirconate complex 22-24 . the reactivity of 12a with ClH and MeI ha been tested . the new precursor M(NMe2)2Cl2(dme) ( m = Zr ( 3 ) , Hf ( 4 ) ) react with the dilithium derivative of the silyl-bridged bis(1-indenyl) ligand bearing pendant 4-pentenyl group Li2-[3,3'-5R2-SBI] ( 2 ) in toluene at <nUm> ° C to provide the corresponding bis(dimethylamido) metallocenes with rac / meso ratio of 6-7 : <nUm> . subsequent treatment of the substantially racenriched zirconocene mixture with excess TMS-Cl in dichloromethane in the presence of a catalytic amount of anhydrous ClH provides rac-[3,3'-5R2-SBI]ZrCl2 ( 7 ) in <nUm> % isolated yield free from it meso isomer . similar reaction of Li2[SBI]*OEt2 and of Li2[EBI]*OEt2 with <nUm> and <nUm> also lead to selective formation of the rac - metallocenes with rac / meso ratio a high a <nUm> : <nUm> for [SBI]Zr(NMe2)2 ( 10 ) . sodium amalgam reduction of rac-[3,3'-5R2-SBI]ZrCl2 ( 7 ) in THF result in the intramolecular tail - to - tail coupling of the pendant olefin to provide the crystallographically characterized a,a'-disubstituted zirconacyclopentane <nUm> in <nUm> % isolated yield . In contrast , reduction of rac-[3,3'-5R2-SBI]HfCl2 ( 8 ) ( prepared from <nUm> and Cl4Hf in toluene ) lead to both the symmetric a,a'-disubstituted and the unsymmetric a,b'-substituted hafnacyclopentanes ( <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio . zirconacycle <nUm> reacts with [HNMe2Ph]+[OTf]- to give the monotriflate <nUm> , in which one of the 4-pentenyl arm is released and the other is formally protonated at it terminal carbon atom to give this thermally stable secondary alkyl complex . formation of <nUm> is best understood a proceeding through a mono-olefin intermediate <nUm> , which can be trapped with 2-butyne to form the corresponding zirconacyclopentene <nUm> . reaction of <nUm> with the organometallic lewis acid BC18F15 result in the formal abstraction of a hydride from the 3-position of one arm to form [HB(C6F5)3]- and a THF - bound p-allyl cation <nUm> , in which one pendant alkene is also free . A kinetic study of the photochemical reaction of [Cp2Zr(m-SiH2Ph)]22+2[BBu n(C6F5)4-n]+ ( 1 ) with PhCH2SiH3 to give the analogous PhCH2SiH2 complex <nUm> wa carried out using a combination of NMR and EPR spectroscopy to follow the rate of disappearance of reactant and the appearance of intermediate and product . the paramagnetic intermediate [Cp2ZrIII]+[BBun(C6F 5)4-n]- ( 3 ) is produced with a quantum efficiency of <nUm> ± <nUm> on irradiation of <nUm> with light having λ < <nUm> nm . the rate law and analysis of intermediate support a Zr(IV) / Zr (III) redox mechanism in which the rate - determining step is photodecomposition of <nUm> to generate <nUm> and silyl radical by homolytic dissociation . In the presence of excess PhCH2SiH3 <nUm> reacts rapidly to give product . effective cocatalysts need not contain metalloid / metal-carbon bond and the property of the resulting metallocenium cation - anion pair are sensitive to both the counteranion core structure and the metallocene ancillary litigation . the perfluoroaryloxide salt of the formula Ph3C+Al(OC6F5)4- and Ph3C+M(OC6F5)6- ( m = Nb , Ta ) were synthesized and characterized . In combination with sterically encumbered zirconocene dimethyl complex , they yield active ethylene polymerization catalyst . the reaction of bis(cyclopentadienyl)titanium(IV) / zirconium(IV) dichloride with a new class of organometallic thiosemicarbazones ( LH ) , derived by condensing acetylferrocene with substituted thiosemicarbazides , have been studied and two type of bimetallic product , viz. [Cp2M(L)Cl] ( m = Ti or Zr ) and [CpZr(L)3] , have been isolated . on the basis of various physicochemical and spectral study , five- and seven - coordinate structure have been assigned to these derivative , respectively . attempt have been made to establish a correlation between biological activity and the structure of the product . reaction of lithiated 1,1',2,2'-tetramethyl-disilyl-1,2-bis[2-(4,5,6,7,8-pentahydro)-azule ne ] ( I ) with Cl4Zr in THF at <nUm> ° C gave the new { 1,1',2,2'-tetramethyl-disilyl-1,2-bis[2-(4,5,6,7,8-pentahydro)-azul enyl]}zirconium dichloride complex ( II ) in reasonable yield . it crystallizes in the orthorhombic pnma space group with a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å and z = <nUm> . the complex ( II ) is symmetric with respect to a mirror plane passing through the Zr and the two Cl atom . the coordination geometry of Zr atom is that of a distorted tetrahedron formed by the two Cl atom and the centroid of the two cyclopentadienyl ring of the pentahydroazulenyl moiety . the Zr - Cl bond length are <nUm> and <nUm> Å and the Zr - C distance vary in the range <nUm> - <nUm> Å . polymerization of propylene with the three - component catalytic system bis(2-phenylindenyl)zirconium dichloride-alkyl magnesium chloride-triisobutylaluminum is studied . the annelated zirconocene is alkylated by the grignard reagent . the three - component system is a good in activity a two - component system with polymethylalumoxane a a cocatalyst . stereoblock elastomeric polypropylene with a high molecular weight is formed . conductive film were grown on silicon , germanium , and OSi <nUm> / Si structure by chemical vapor deposition using bis(cyclopentadienyl)titanium dichloride ( titanocene dichloride ) and bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( zirconocene dichloride ) . the composition and property of the film were then modified by annealing in an atmosphere of organosilicon compound . film were also produced by deposition from mixture of titanocene or zirconocene dichloride and organosilicon compound . the elemental and phase composition of the film were determined by auger electron spectroscopy and x-ray diffraction analysis . the investigation of the intermolecular composition distribution of an ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer using DSC method ha been carried out . the known method : step crystallization ( SC ) and successive self - nucleation / annealing ( SSA ) have been adapted for this purpose , and particularly , the optimal condition of the process have been chosen to enable the best fractional crystallization of the copolymer . the method ha been applied for fractionation of two ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer synthesized with supported vanadium and zirconocene catalyst and having similar concentration of 1-hexene . although metallocene catalyst are known from their more homogeneous structure of active site in comparison to multi-site ziegler - natta catalyst , the copolymer obtained over both catalytic system gave DSC curve resolved into several peak but with different melting point . using the thomson - gibbs equation , comparable average lamellar thickness of the separated peak ha been calculated . the amount of copolymer fraction with defined lamellar thickness have been determined . it wa obtained that the copolymer produced from the metallocene system contains a thinner and more homogeneous lamella thickness than that obtained with ziegler - natta vanadium catalyst supported on the same carrier . the heterometallic zirconocene(III) aluminum hydride complex (Cp2ZrH)2HAlCl2 · C2H4O · CH wa synthesized by reduction of Cp2ZrCl2 with lithium aluminum hydride in the presence of Cp2TiBH4 and 1,4-dioxane , and it structure wa established by x-ray diffraction analysis . the use of two different type of metallocene catalyst in the dehydrogenative coupling of phenylsilane to produce poly(phenylsilane) wa investigated . the metallocene catalyst were first synthesized ( i ) through the reaction of zirconcene dichloride with n-butyllithium in toluene and ( ii ) through the reaction of zirconocene dichloride with sec-butyllithium in toluene . after the catalyst synthesis , phenylsilane wa added in situ commencing polymerization of the phenylsilane to poly ( phenylsilane ) through dehydrogenative coupling in each case . the resulting poly(phenylsilanes) were characterized by 1H NMR , GPC , FTIR , and UV / vi , and were shown to be successful photoinitiators for a variety of acrylate and methacrylate type monomer . activity of ethylene / a-olefin copolymerization were found to increase with silane - modified silica - supported MAO using ansazirconocene catalyst . the increase in activity wa le pronounced when higher a-olefins were used . however , silane modification resulted in the narrower molecular weight distribution of polymer . 13C NMR revealed that ethylene incorporation in all system gave polymer with the similar triad distribution . none density functional theory with hybrid exchange - correlation functional B3P86 is used to calculate the molecular structure of neutral Fe (II) complex formed in the LFeCl <nUm> / AlMe <nUm> system ( L = tridentate bis(imine)pyridyl ligand ) . A simplified model of the LFeCl <nUm> complex is used in calculation , where L is replaced by three NH <nUm> ligand . parameter of geometric and electronic structure of the complex ( NH <nUm> ) 3FeMe(m-Me)AlMe <nUm> ( I ) and ( NH <nUm> ) 3FeMe(m-Me) 2AlMe <nUm> ( IIA and IIB ) , which are the structure where the Fe-Me and Fe-m-Me group are in one or two perpendicular plane , respectively , were determined . complex II , which were earlier identified using 1H NMR spectroscopy , are more stable than complex I . complex IIB is strongly polarized ( the distance r(Fe-m-Me) and r(Al-m-Me) are <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) and coordinatively unsaturated due to the transfer of the methyl group from ( NH <nUm> ) 3FeMe <nUm> onto AlMe <nUm> . it ha significant electron density deficit in the coordination sphere of the transition metal [ ( NH <nUm> ) 3FeMe ] q ( q = +0.80e ) . the energetic profile of the reaction of ethylene addition to the Fe-Me bond for the complex ( NH <nUm> ) 3FeMe <nUm> , IIA and IIB , wa calculated . it wa shown that , compared to ( NH <nUm> ) 3FeMe <nUm> , a drastic decrease in the activation energy of ethylene addition is observed in the case of IIB ( from <nUm> to <nUm> kJ / mol ) . the reason for the more efficient activation of the complex LFeMe <nUm> by a weak lewis acid ( AlMe <nUm> ) and for the increased reactivity of the metal - alkyl bond in complex IIB compared to the zirconocene complex cp 2ZrMe <nUm> is discussed . the surface compound of zirconium in OSi <nUm> / MAO / cp 2ZrMe <nUm> ( I ) and OSi <nUm> / cp 2ZrMe <nUm> ( II ) catalyst were studied by the IR spectroscopy of adsorbed CO at 93-293 K . it wa found that the bridging and terminal complex of CO were formed on the surface of the catalyst at <nUm> K ; the adsorption of CO wa reversible . At <nUm> K , CO wa irreversibly inserted into the Zr-Me bond with the formation of various acyl compound of zirconium ; these compound were characterized by absorption band in the region 1495-1750 cm <nUm> in the IR spectrum . these data suggested the heterogeneity of the surface composition of zirconocene catalyst I and II . catalyst I , which wa active in ethylene polymerization , contained surface zirconium complex that can be considered a the precursor of active center for ethylene polymerization . since the nineteenth century , many synthetic organic chemist have focused on developing new strategy to regio- , diastereo - and enantioselectively build carbon-carbon and carbon-heteroatom bond in a predictable and efficient manner . ideal synthesis should use the least number of synthetic step , with few or no functional group transformation and by - product , and maximum atom efficiency . one potentially attractive method for the synthesis of molecular skeleton that are difficult to prepare would be through the selective activation of C-H and C-C bond , instead of the conventional construction of new C-C bond . here we present an approach that exploit the multifold reactivity of easily accessible substrate with a single organometallic specie to furnish complex molecular scaffold through the merging of otherwise difficult transformation : allylic C-H and selective C-C bond activation . the resulting bifunctional nucleophilic specie , all of which have an all-carbon quaternary stereogenic centre , can then be selectively derivatized by the addition of two different electrophiles to obtain more complex molecular architecture from these easily available starting material . the systematic synthesis of 1- and 2-substituted silylindenes , with a wide variety of substitution pattern on the silyl moiety , and their corresponding zirconocene dichloride are presented . the rac- and meso-diastereomers of the 1-substituted zirconocene dichloride can in most case be separated . instable zirconocenes were observed for certain substitution pattern . two of the obtained zirconocene dichloride , bis[2-(dimethylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 4a ) and bis[2-(trimethylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 4b ) , were characterised by single crystal x-ray diffraction . on the basis of DFT result , the two compound are geometrically similar , i.e. the additional methyl group on the silyl moiety only affect the conformational energy profile . difference in their catalyst performance in the homopolymerisation study with ethane are thus attributed to conformational control . for the remaining complex , sterically le demanding silyl group seem to be favoured with respect to the catalyst performance . all the 2-isomers have lower polymerisation activity than the unsubstituted bis[indenyl]zirconium dichloride / MAO system . curiously , the rac-bis[1-(dimethylphenylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride / MAO system is found to be the most active catalyst in ethene homopolymerisations . reaction of [ Zr(e-C5H5)2Cl <nUm> ] with LiR*(tmeda) [ R* = CH(SiMe3)C 6H4Me-o , tmeda = Me2NCH2CH 2-NMe2 ] under different condition yield [ Zr(e-C 5H5)2(Cl)R* ] ( 3 ) , and the diastereoisomers meso - ( 2a ) and rac - ( 2b ) [ Zr(e-C5H 5)2R*2 ] , the latter of which is prepared from ( 2a ) by photolysis or thermolysis ; [ Zr(e-C5H 5)2R*(thf)x ] ( x = 0-2 ) is obtained and characterised by e.s.r . spectroscopy in tetrahydrofuran ( thf ) solution by ( a ) Na[C 10H8]-thf - reduction of complex ( 2a ) , ( 2b ) , or ( 3 ) [ via the radical anion of ( 3 ) , itself accessible by reversible one - electron reduction of ( 3 ) ] , or ( b ) Na-Hg-thf - reduction of ( 3 ) . the zirconocene(IV) dialkyls [ Zr(e-C5H5) 2(CHPh2)R ] [ r = me , ( 1 ) , or having zr-0 <nUm> Å and < Zr-O-C <nUm> ° . bis(2-furyl)zirconocene ( 1 ) , obtained from cp < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ClZr < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ( cp = e-cyclopentadienyl ) and 2-furyl-lithium , [ Zr(C5Me5)2Me{(4-C6H 4F)4 } ] <nUm> catalysis the rapid regioselective oligomerisation of RC ≡ CH to 2,4-disubstituted-but-1-en-3-ynes ( r = bu t , prn , me , ph , 4-C6H4Me ) and 1,4,6-trisubstituted-hexa-1,3-dien-5-ynes ( r = prn , me ) ; isolation of the unprecedented crystalline complex , [ Zr(C5Me6) 2{CH = C(R)C ≡ CR}]+ ( r = but2a , Pr n 2b ) and [ Zr(C5Me5)2{C(SiMe <nUm> ) = CHCH = C(SiMe3)C ≡ CSiMe3}]+ 3f , provides firm evidence for the catalytic cycle . treatment of (e2-ethene)(trimethylphosphane)zirconocene <nUm> with 3,3-dimethylcyclopropene <nUm> lead to the formation of a new type of bis(ethylzirconocene) complex <nUm> with 3,3-dimethylallenediyl a a m1,m2-bridging ligand ; the crystal structure of <nUm> is determined by x-ray analysis . the unusual four coordinate bis(imido) alkene complex [ Mo(NBu t)2(CH2 = CHR)(PMe3) ] ( r = H , me ) have been synthesised via treatment of [ Mo(NBut)2Cl 2(dme) ] ( dme = dimethoxyethane ) with two equivalent of RCH 2CH2MgCl ( r = H , me ) in the presence of PMe3 ; the molecular structure of the propene derivative is reported . rare e2-benzyne and benzylidene complex of niobium have been synthesised from [Nb(C5R5)(NR')Cl2] ( r = H , me ; R' = 2,6-Pri2C6H3 ) via intermediate diphenyl and dibenzyl specie and their molecular structure have been determined : these complex are analogue of well - established zirconocene derivative . insertion of zirconocene into the C-X bond of 2-halophosphinines ( x = Cl , Br ) take place between <nUm> and <nUm> ° C in tetrahydrofuran ( THF ) ; the x-ray crystal structure analysis of such an insertion product show a normal geometry at zirconium and a highly delocalised phosphinine ring with all C- ... A (e2-phosphabenzyne)dicyclopentadienylzirconium- trimethylphosphine adduct is obtained a a stable complex by thermal loss of RH from a Cp2Zr(R)-2 - substituted phosphinine ( r = me or ph ) in the presence of PMe3 ; C ≡ C and C = O multiple bond selectively insert into the Zr - c2(ring) bond of this complex . zirconocene e2-alkene and e2-imine complex with adjacent cyclopropane ring undergo cyclopropane ring cleavage to afford novel e3-allyl , e3-azaallyl , and e1-enamine complex . cyclization of 1,4,7-trienes , which are easily prepared by double allylation reaction of alkyne , proceeded in the presence of a stoichiometric or catalytic amount of zirconocene compound to give only ci isomer ( > <nUm> % stereoselectivity ) . N-(2-bromoallyl)-N-prop-2-ynyl- and N-allyl-N-(2-bromoallyl)-amines <nUm> and <nUm> undergo intramolecular cyclization by using zirconocene methyl chloride to give zirconacycles <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively , which are characterized by deuteriolysis affording product <nUm> and <nUm> ; carbonylation of <nUm> and further reaction with electrophiles ( deuterium oxide , allyl bromide , 4-chlorobenzonitrile , benzaldehyde , benzophenone and benzylideneaniline ) lead to compound <nUm> , <nUm> and 11-15 . half - sandwich imido tantalacyclopentane complex are prepared via alkene coupling reaction : their novel insertion chemistry with CO and MeCN is reported . X-Ray structure determination of complex (1)-(5) have been carried out . their molecular symmetry is close to <nUm> , or crystallographically imposed <nUm> in ( 3 ) , with the stereochemistry about the metal centre best described a distorted tetrahedral . the angle X-Zr-X is <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> ° for the halide (1)-(5) , respectively ; and the corresponding centroid-Zr-centroid angle are <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> ° . metal - halogen distance in ( 1 ) [ <nUm> and <nUm> Å ] and ( 3 ) [2.212(6] Å are significantly longer than in the parent zirconocene(IV) halide [Zr(e-C5H5)2X2] ( cf. <nUm> Å for x = Cl and <nUm> Å for x = F ) a are [ by ca. <nUm> Å ( average ) ] the metal - centroid distance in (3)-(5) . dimethylzirconocene complex [ ZrMe2(C5H 4R)2 ] ( r = H or CH3 ) were treated with catechol to give the (catecholato)zirconocene complex . low - temperature NMR spectrum indicated dimeric metallatricyclic structure for these complex and the corresponding (ethene-1,2-diolato)- and (but-2-ene-2,3-diolato)-zirconocenes . dynamic temperature - dependent NMR spectroscopy revealed that all these complex underwent a thermally induced degenerate rearrangement process , similar to the reorganization reaction of some sharpless catalyst precursor , with gibbs activation energy close to <nUm> kJ mol-1 . A labelling experiment showed the intramolecular nature of this automerization . compound crystallizes in space group P212121 with cell parameter : a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> and R' = <nUm> . dipotassium benzene-1,2-diselenolate , C6H4(SeK)2-1,2 this yield can be increased by using the ' caesium effect ' from benzene-1,2-diselenol ( 18-40 % ) . these macrocyclic compound are able to complex heavy metal [ especially mercury (II) ion ] via their selenium atom . the mercury complex have been characterized by multinuclear NMR spectroscopy . the molecular structure of the tetraselenacrown ether <nUm> and the mercury complex of macrocycle <nUm> have been established by x-ray diffraction . insertion of 1-lithio-1-chloroalk-2-ynes into zirconacycles give cyclic zirconocene e3-prop-2-ynyl / allenyl complex which afford useful organic product on protonation or lewis acid induced addition of aldehyde . allenyl carbenoids ( 3-chloro-1-lithioalk-1-ynes ) insert into zirconacyclopentanes and zirconacyclopentenes to afford cyclic e3-allenyl / prop-2-ynyl zirconocene complex which give allenyl , alkynyl or cyclised - alcohol product on addition of aldehyde activated with boron trifluoride-diethyl ether . the phosphine stabilized ethylene complex of zirconocene , Cp2Zr , reacts with <nUm> equiv. of BC18F15 to form the girdle - type zwitterion Cp2Zr+(PPh3Me)CH2CH 2B-(C6F5)3 <nUm> , which serf a an ethene polymerization catalyst either with or without added BC18F15 . zirconocene enolate radical cation are generated and characterised in solution for the first time ; the sterically congested radical cation undergo a mesolytic Zr-O bond cleavage process yielding zirconocene cation , the kinetics of which are determined . aryl bromide can efficiently react with some metallocenes , typically zirconocene dichloride , in the presence of a palladium / phosphine catalyst system and an appropriate base to produce the corresponding pentaarylated cyclopentadienes . zirconium - catalysed reaction of alkynyl halide with EtMgBr produced cyclobutene derivative in which two carbon-carbon bond were formed on the ethyl moiety of EtMgBr via an ethylene group in a catalytic cycle . low temperature NMR study indicate that the dicationic salt [Zr(e-C5H4CMe2C6H4Me-p)2]2+[MeB(C6F5)3]-2 and [Zr(e-C5H4CMe2Ph)2]2+ [MeB(C6F5)3]2- are formed when the neutral compound [Zr(e-C5H4CMe2Ph)2Me2] and [Zr(e-C5H4CMe2C6H4Me-p)2Me2] and [Zr(e-C5H4CMe2Ph)2Me2] are treated with <nUm> equivalent of BC18F15 . six zirconocene enolate radical cation and one hydroquinone biszirconocene radical cation have been generated and characterised in solution by standard and fast scan cyclic voltammetry . the electroanalytical result along with those from product analysis of preparative one - electron oxidation indicate that the sterically congested radical cation undergo a mesolytic Zr-O bond cleavage process . the kinetics of the mesolytic Zr-O bond cleavage yielding zirconocene cation and the lifetime ( t1 / <nUm> ) of the zirconium enolate radical cation in dichloromethane at room temperature are determined . the dimerization and ion - pair formation enthalpy of advanced silicon bridged bisindenyl zirconocenes have been estimated at the density functional ( DFT ) level of theory . according to our calculation ( based on molecular mechanic geometry optimization with subsequent DFT geometry relaxation ) , a properly designed bisindenyl ligand sphere help to avoid catalyst dimerization and reduces coordination of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) anion to cationic site . interestingly , we also found a correlation between the dipole moment of the active specie considered here and their catalytic performance . these result suggest that an appropriate substituent pattern favour complexation of propylene monomer a the dominant mechanism to stabilize electron deficient active site due to a diminution of particular intermolecular force which yield catalytically inactive resting state . diffusion coefficient for ion pair containing zirconocene cation and fluorinated tetraphenyl- or methyltriphenylborate anion in benzene solution are substantially smaller than those expected for monomeric specie and indicate that ion quadruple are present in these solution . the new compound [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4) 2}(cis-e-C4H6) ] ( 2* ) , [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4)2}Ph <nUm> ] ( 3 ) , [ Zr{Me2C(C5H4)2}-(cis-e 4C4H4Me2 ) ] ( 4* ) , [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4) 2}(cis-e4-PhC4H4Ph) ] ( 5 ) , [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4)2Cl} 2-m-O ] ( 6* ) , [ Zr{Me2-C(e-C5H4)2}{e 3-C4H6B(C6F5) <nUm> } ] ( 7 ) , [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4) 2}{exo-e3-C4H6B(C 6F5)3}PMe3 ] ( 8* ) , [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4) 2}-{endo-e3-C4H6B(C 6F5)3}C6H5N ] ( 9* ) , and [ Zr{Me2C(e-C5H4)2}{Endo- and exo-e3-C4H6B(C6F 5)3}NC'Bu ] ( 10a ) and ( 10b ) have been prepared . an asterisk indicates the crystal structure ha been determined . the photoelectron spectrum of <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined and assigned with the assistance of density functional method . the factor relating to the relative stability of cis- and frans-butadiene structure for <nUm> and <nUm> are discussed . Di-Iithiation of +ac(R)-1-methyl-9-[2-(2-indenyl)-1-naphthyl]fluorene , +ac(R)-6 , generates an axially chiral fluorenyl ligand , (a-S)-lO , which on reaction with Cl4Zr enantiospecifically provides the planar chiral ansazirconocene (p-S)-[1-(1-methyl-9-fluorenyl)-2-(2-indenyl)-naphthalene]zirconium dichloride , (p-5)-8 ; single crystal x-ray structure have been determined for the racemic awsa - zirconocene rac-8 and the related C8 - symmetric ansazirconocene <nUm> . the application of stoichiometric transition metal complex in organic synthesis were discussed . the organometallic mediated reaction which have relevance to organic synthesis were analyzed . it wa shown that reaction of alkyne with diethyl zirconocene followed by a chloroformate produce a,b-unsaturated ester . it wa also shown that with the chromium complexed on one face of the ring system , selective reduction of the indolene double bond can be achieved . the ligand to metal charge transfer ( LMCT ) transition of racemic siloxy substituted ethylene bridged bis(indenyl) - type zirconocenes were studied using UV / VIS spectroscopy in combination with ab initio hartree - fock and hybrid density functional B3LYP method . clear correlation between the experimental LMCT absorption energy and theoretical HOMO-LUMO energy gap were observed . the LMCT absorption energy were analysed a a function of the ligand structure . hydrogenation of the indenyl ring and position of the siloxy substituent have strong influence on HOMO-LUMO energy gap , and consequently on the observed absorption energy . imines which do not react with grignard reagent reacted with EtMgBr in the presence of a catalytic amount of Cp2ZrCl2 to give ethylated product in excellent yield ; the stoichiometric reaction of the imines and the zirconocene-ethylene complex did not give the ethylated product , whereas addition of MeMgBr or BuMgCl to the mixture afforded the ethylated product after hydrolysis . density functional computation ( BP86 / ECP1 and B3LYP / II level ) have revealed that the phenyl group in [ Zr(e-C5H5)(e-C5H4 CR2C6H5)Me]+ ( r = H ) is coordinated to the Zr atom via one of the phenyl carbon atom , rather than via an agostic Zr-H contact , a suggested previously . A stationary point with such an agostic interaction is the transition structure for phenyl rotation with a barrier higher than <nUm> kJ mol-1 ( B3LYP / II level ) , consistent with result from dynamic NMR spectroscopy for a closely related compound ( r = me ) . the structural assignment are supported by the good accord between the computed ( GIAO-B3LYP / II level ) and experimental NMR chemical shift . A second dynamic process with a very similar activation barrier is indicated to involve dissociation of the coordinated phenyl moiety from the Zr atom and inversion at the latter . the same structural motif ( i.e. e1-bonded aryl group ) is also found for the [ Zr(e-C5H4CH2C6H5 )2]2+ dication . the bis(phosphinoenolato) zirconocene <nUm> , prepared from the phosphino camphor derivative 3-exo-PPh2C10H15O <nUm> , represents the first C2 - symmetric chiral diphosphine containing an early transition metal centre tethered to the phosphino group via an enolato linkage . it allows the selective assembly of lewis - acid early - late bimetallic combination , a exemplified with the Zr / Cu and Zr / Ag complex <nUm> and <nUm> . the monophosphinoenolato titanocene <nUm> wa also prepared . reaction of <nUm> or <nUm> with [Pd(dmba)(m-Cl)]2 ( dmba = o-C6H4CH 2NMe2 ) or [PdCl2(SEt2)2] led to complete transfer of the functional ligand to the Pd (II) centre , with formation of [(dmba)Pd(PPh2C10H14O)] <nUm> or cis-[Pd(PPh2C10H14O)2] <nUm> and [Cp2ZrCl2] / [Cp2TiCl2] , respectively . A heterobimetallic Zr / Pd intermediate complex <nUm> of this rearrangement could be detected . complex <nUm> and <nUm> were prepared independently by reaction of <nUm> with [Pd(dmba)(m-Cl)]2 or [ Pd(SEt2)2Cl <nUm> ] , respectively , which first afforded complex <nUm> and <nUm> which were then treated with KH . the crystal structure of <nUm> , <nUm> and 8*THF* H2O have been determined by x-ray diffraction . the reaction of but 3Al with ArBH2O2 ( Ar = 2,6-diisopropylphenyl ) lead , via the intermediate [ but 2Al(O)BAr(OH)]2 <nUm> , to the crystallographically characterised boralumoxane zircono-ethylphosphonate , which could be converted into various functionalized ethylphosphonates . zirconacyclopentenes generated in situ from alkyne and ethylene undergo selective reaction with aldehyde to afford homoallylketones in yield exceeding <nUm> % in the presence of AlCl3 . addition of diazoalkane derivative RCH(N2) [ r = CO2Et ( a ) , SiMe3 ( b ) ] on a-phosphino zirconocene anchorable functionality , Cp'[Me2(EtO)SiCH2Flu]ZrCl2 ( 10 ) and Cp[C5Me4SiMe2OEt]ZrCl2 ( 11 ) wa considerably hampered by competitive Zr – Cl and Si – OEt bond splitting . when activated with MAO ( methylalumoxane ) , <nUm> – <nUm> yield active ethylene polymerization system . the novel dimer [ Cp(2)Zr[upper bond start]([minus sign in circle])S([plus sign in circle])CH(Ph)CH[double bond]C[upper bond end]PPh(2)](2) , the first example of a structurally characterised sulfur - bridged binuclear zirconathiolane complex , wa prepared , characterised by NMR spectroscopy and x-ray crystallography , and some aspect of it solution behaviour were studied . whereas the rate of propene polymerisation catalysed by zirconocene ion pair are strongly anion - dependent , hexene polymerisation are not ; the finding demonstrate the existence of very different kinetic regime for two closely related reaction . the hydrozirconation of alkyne with zirconocene hydro-chloride and the dimethylzinc - mediated addition of alkenylzirconocenes to diphenylphosphinoyl imines can be greatly accelerated with microwave irradiation , resulting in a convenient and rapid one - pot process for the preparation of synthetically useful allylic amine . the diphenyl-ansa-zirconocene complex <nUm> add BC12F10H at the C[?]C double bond of it pendent cp - allyl functional group to yield <nUm> . during <nUm> day at room temperature the – BC12F10 group take part in an electrophilic substitution reaction at the adjacent cp - ring to form <nUm> with formation of one equivalent of benzene . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the systematic synthesis of 1- and 2-substituted silylindenes , with a wide variety of substitution pattern on the silyl moiety , and their corresponding zirconocene dichloride are presented . the rac- and meso-diastereomers of the 1-substituted zirconocene dichloride can in most case be separated . instable zirconocenes were observed for certain substitution pattern . two of the obtained zirconocene dichloride , bis[2-(dimethylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 4a ) and bis[2-(trimethylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride ( 4b ) , were characterised by single crystal x-ray diffraction . on the basis of DFT result , the two compound are geometrically similar , i.e. the additional methyl group on the silyl moiety only affect the conformational energy profile . difference in their catalyst performance in the homopolymerisation study with ethane are thus attributed to conformational control . for the remaining complex , sterically le demanding silyl group seem to be favoured with respect to the catalyst performance . all the 2-isomers have lower polymerisation activity than the unsubstituted bis[indenyl]zirconium dichloride / MAO system . curiously , the rac-bis[1-(dimethylphenylsilyl)indenyl]zirconium dichloride / MAO system is found to be the most active catalyst in ethene homopolymerisations . insertion of (E)-(1,2-dihalovinyl)lithium into zirconacyclopentenes wa followed by elimination of halide to afford an alkyne which insert intramolecularly into the resulting carbon – zirconocenium bond to give a methylenecyclopentene , whereas insertion of (2-haloethynyl)lithium give the same product via a zirconocene alkenylidene . titanocene and zirconocene carbene complex of a phosphorus equivalent of an arduengo 's carbene have been synthesized in the coordination sphere of titanocene and zirconocene and exhibit a nucleophilic character which ha been exploited in the synthesis of 1,3-diphosphafulvenes . the compound [HNMe2Ph][NpB(C6F5) 3](Np = C5H11 ) reacts with dimethylzirconocenes to give active propylene polymerization catalyst which are significantly more active and give higher molecular weight polypropylene than do the catalyst obtained using BC18F15 ; the [ BC18F15Np ) anion is for steric reason more weakly coordinating than is [MeB(C6F5)3] . the vinylidene phosphine (Prn2P)2C = CH <nUm> ( 1 ) undergoes schlenk dimerisation on treatment with an excess of any of the alkali metal Li , Na or K to give the butane-1,4-diide complex [(L)M{(Prn2P)2CCH2}]2 [ bond , <nUm> reacts smoothly with K to give <nUm> , with no evidence for P-C cleavage . compound <nUm> is an excellent ligand transfer reagent : metathesis reaction between either <nUm> or it phenyl have additionally been characterised by x-ray crystallography . it ha been a busy and productive year in the arena of heterocyclic chemistry . particular highlight include the first report of high enantioselectivity achieved in an oxaziridinium - mediated epoxidation , a catalytic asymmetric aziridination procedure which us simple sulfonamide a nitrene precursor , two new catalyst for the enantioselective [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition of ketenes with aldehyde to form b-lactones , a multicomponent coupling of imines , alkyne and acyl chloride to give pentasubstituted pyrroles with control of regiochemistry , a catalytic asymmetric aza-Diels-Alder reaction yielding chiral dihydropyridones , and a remarkable zirconocene - catalysed reaction of a bis-alkynylsilane with three equivalent of nitrile to give fused pyridine . zirconocene - alkyne complex prepared from Cp2ZrBu2 , phosphine and alkyne reacted with CO to give double carbonylation product , 4-hydroxycyclobuten-1-one derivative after hydrolysis . this tutorial review survey recent advance in the field of zirconium promoted coupling reaction of unsaturated molecule ( and / or organolithium compound ) and heterosubstituted alkene . this reaction ha recently emerged a a powerful tool in organic chemistry to access a variety of synthetically useful building block not easily available by other method . In particular , three different reaction pathway are discussed : i ) the reaction involving alkyne - zirconocene and aryne - zirconocene complex which allows access to dienyl and aryl zirconocene complex ; ii ) the reaction of alkene - zirconocene complex and enol ether which ha shown to be highly dependent on the structure of the enol ether used , allowing the synthesis of simple vinyl zirconocenes or multicomponent coupling product , and ; iii ) the reaction involving imine - zirconocene complex which supposes a new entry to allylic amine . the zirconocene enolate complex bis(2-propenolato)ZrCp <nUm> ( 1 ) reacts with two molar equivalent of the 1,2,3,4-O-tetramethyl-a-d- glucopyranoside ( 2 ) with liberation of two equivalent of acetone to yield cleanly the bis(carbohydrate)zirconcene complex ( 3 ) . alternatively <nUm> and the " bifunctional " glucose derivative 3-O-benzyl-1,2-O-isopropylidene- glucofuranoside ( 4 ) react to the corresponding zirconadioxacyclopentane - type metallacyclic product that wa isolated a the respective dimer ( 5 ) featuring a sequence of linearly anellated five- , four- , five - membered metallacycles . both carbohydrate zirconocene complex <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by NMR experiment a well a by x-ray diffraction . In these day a renaissance of metallacycles a an increasingly important class of organometallic compound for synthetic and catalytic application is evident , making such very attractive for a plethora of investigation . titanocene and zirconocene bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene complex , regarded a three - membered metallacycles ( 1-metallacyclopropenes ) , present a rich chemistry towards unsaturated molecule . by elimination of the alkyne these complex form by reaction with unsaturated compound five - membered titana- and zirconacycles , all of which are relevant to stoichiometric and catalytic C-C coupling and cleavage reaction of unsaturated molecule . the complete sequence of step of a tentative catalytic cycle for intramolecular hydroamination / cyclisation ( IHC ) of 4,5-hexadien-1-ylamine ( 1 ) by a prototypical cationic [Cp2ZrCH3]+ zirconocene precatalyst ( 2 ) ha been examined by employing a gradient - corrected DFT method . the predicted smooth overall reaction energy profile is consistent with the available experimental data , thereby providing further confidence in the proposed mechanism . following activation of the precatalyst by protonolytic cleavage of the Zr-Me bond , the catalytically active amidoallene-Zr complex undergoes addition of an allenic CC linkage across the Zr-N s-bond . the alternative exo- and endocyclic pathway show similar probability for the sterically le encumbered reactant { <nUm> + <nUm> } investigated herein . however , steric factor are expected to exert control on the regioselectivity of ring closure . on the other hand , the metathesis - type transition state for subsequent protonolysis are indicated to be le sensitive to steric demand . formation of the six - membered azacycle-Zr intermediate through intramolecular CC insertion into the Zr-N s-bond is predicted to be turnover limiting . the factor that govern the regioselectivity of the aminoallene IHC have been elucidated . bis(cyclopropylethynyl)zirconocene show a bisected conformation in the crystal : the magnitude of the stabilizing conjugation of the Cp2Zr lewis acid centre with the cyclopropyl substituent across the connecting C ≡ C triple bond is assessed by DFT calculation and a comparison with a series of cationic organic and organometallic reference system . the rich chemistry of substituted bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium and hafnium complex bearing side-on coordinated dinitrogen ligand is highlighted in this perspective . our study in this area were initially motivated by the desire to understand side-on vs. end-on dinitrogen coordination in bimetallic zirconocene and hafnocene N < inf > <nUm> < / inf > compound . In the case where η < sup > <nUm> < / sup > ,e < sup > <nUm> < / sup > -dinitrogen compound were isolated , both structural and computational data have established significant imido character in the metal-nitrogen bond . this additional bonding interaction , which is diminished in end-on complex bearing both terminal and bridging N < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ligand , facilitates dinitrogen functionalization by non-polar reagent including dihydrogen , carbon-hydrogen bond and weak bronsted acid such a water and ethanol . In hafnocene chemistry , where unwanted side-on , end-on isomerization is suppressed , cycloaddition of phenylisocyanate to coordinated N < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ha also been accomplished . for N-H bond forming reaction involving H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > , kinetic measurement , in addition to isotopic labelling and computational study , are consistent with dinitrogen functionalization by 1,2-addition involving a highly ordered , four - centred transition structure . A tethered ethylenebis(indenyl) zirconocene wa covalently immobilized on H - terminated Si(111) surface using UV - mediated alkene hydrosilylation , thus making possible the development of structured catalytic surface with highly controlled property . A new family of hydroxytris(pentafluorophenyl)borate anion [ B(C 6F5)3OH]- associated with organic and aprotic cation c+ ( imidazolium , pyrrolidinium and phosphonium ) ha been prepared by a general one - pot synthesis that implies the chloride borate analogue [B(C6F5)3Cl] -[c]+ . the [c]+[B(C6F 5)3OH]- salt have been isolated and fully characterized . the borate anion [ BC6F5 3OH]- ha been shown to protonate the Zr-Me bond in the Cp2ZrMe2 complex forming CH4 and the first published example of anionic [ Cp2Zr(Me)OB(C6F 5)3]- specie . standard spectroscopic method demonstrate the covalent character of the Zr metal center and the anionic character of the boron atom . this protonolysis methodology using [ B(C 6F5)3OH]- anion affords a new route for the incorporation of a covalently bonded anionic functionality on organometallic complex . this provides a new way to immobilize transition metal complex in ionic liquid . A high yield of the tetraphosphaladderene , anti-tetraphosphatricyclo[4.2.0.02,5]octa-3,7-diene , is obtained from reaction of the zirconocene 1,3-diphosphabicyclo[1.1.0]butane with Ph2SbCl3 in THF or CCl2H2 . exploration of the reaction pathway using density functional theory suggests that an envelope - type adduct of Ph2SbCl and 1,3-diphosphabicyclo[1.1.0]butane play a pivotal role in the reaction . the zwitterionic character of this intermediate specie allows it to act simultaneously a both an ene and an eneophile , and a symmetry - allowed bimolecular reaction lead to the tetraphosphaladderene specie via a spirocyclic intermediate . new neutral and ionic functionalised zirconocene dichloride compound have been isolated and characterised . the ionic zirconocene exhibit excellent cytotoxicity against a range of human tumour cell line , which represents the first active anticancer zirconocene dichloride compound . 1,4-Bis[trimethylsilyl(ethynyl)]naphthalene ( 1a ) and 1,4- bis[trimethylsilyl(ethynyl)]anthracene ( 1b ) undergo diastereoselective coupling with Cp2Zr(py)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) to give trimeric macrocycles in good yield . air - stable lewis acidic m2-hydroxy bridged binuclear complex of zirconocene pentafluorophenylsulfonate wa successfully synthesized and found to show high catalytic efficiency in chemoselective allylation of carbonyl compound with tetraallyltin in aqueous methanol medium . we report the polymerisation of isobutene with the intramolecular aryl stabilised zirconocene cation [ e5-Cp-(e5-C 5H4-CMe2C6H4Me)ZrMe ] + ( 3 ) , [ ( e5-C5H4-CMe 2C6H4Me)2ZrMe]+ ( 4 ) and dication [ ( e5-C5H4-CMe2C 6H4Me)2Zr]2+ ( 5 ) ( cp = C 5H5 ) which were generated in situ by the reaction of the corresponding dimethyl compound with the cation generating agent ( CGA ) B(C 6F5)3 . whereas the cationic compound gave polyisobutene in moderate yield , the dicationic compound gave polyisobutene in excellent yield and high molecular weight . computational study of the cationic and dicationic compound were undertaken to ascertain the nature of the cationic initiator . judging from natural charge and bond critical point , the coordinated monomer is more strongly polarised in the case of the dication <nUm> , compared with the monocation <nUm> . furthermore , in the case of the cationic compound <nUm> , decomposition into the allylic compound wa computed . we found that the activation barrier of this process is <nUm> kJ mol-1 , which is too high for a direct C-H activation by the Zr-Me group . selective cleavage of both active and inert C-C bond in substituted allylcyclopropanes wa realized via a novel ligand - controlled approach using zirconocene(ii)-1-butene or zirconocene(ii)-benzyne complex . condensation of allylcyclopentadiene <nUm> with acetone in the presence of pyrrolidine gave 2-allyl-6,6-dimethylfulvene ( 2 ) . methyllithium addition gave lithium 1-allyl-3-tert-butylcyclopentadienide ( 3 ) . transmetallation with <nUm> equiv. of Cl4Zr yielded the respective functionalized zirconocene dichloride complex meso-4 and rac-4 , which were both isolated isomerically pure . with <nUm> mol % of [Cl2(PCy3)2RuCHPh] the rac-4 diastereoisomer underwent a clean intramolecular ring - closing olefin metathesis reaction to yield the ansa - zirconocene complex rac-6 . the complex meso-4 , rac-4 and rac-6 were characterized by x-ray diffraction . treatment of the open metallocenes meso-4 and rac-4 , respectively , with excess methylalumoxane gave rather active ethene polymerization catalyst . the corresponding catalyst derived from the conformationally restricted bulky ansa - metallocene rac-6 is markedly le active . reaction of the amido-bridged zirconium complex ( CpSiMe 2NSiMe2Cp)ZrCH3 ( 1 ) ( cp = C5H <nUm> ) with half an equivalent of BC6F5 <nUm> or Ph3CB(C6F5)4 afforded the binuclear zirconium complex [ ( CpSiMe2NSiMe 2Cp)Zr)2(m-CH3)][RB(C6F 5)3 ] ( 2a , r = CH3 , 2b , r = C6F <nUm> ) with a methyl group a the bridge between the two zirconium atom . In the presence of one equivalent of BC18F15 or Ph3C(C6F5)4 , <nUm> wa transformed to the zwitterionic complex [(CpSiMe2NSiMe2Cp)Zr] [RB(C6F5)3] ( 3a , r = CH3 , 3b , r = C6F5 ) which are free of a metal - bound s-alkyl ligand . 2b is stable with Me3Al while 3b combined with me 3Al to form a hetero - binuclear complex [ ( CpSiMe2NSiMe 2Cp)Zr(m-CH3)]Al(CH3)2][B(C 6F5)4 ] ( 4 ) a shown by NMR spectroscopy at room temperature . treatment of 2a or 3a with an excess of Me3Al led to (CpSiMe2NSiMe2Cp)Zr(C6F5) ( 5 ) through a group exchange process . 2b , 3a and <nUm> have been characterized by x-ray diffraction study . 2a , 2b , 3a and 3b were highly active catalyst for ethylene polymerization and copolymerization with 1-octene in the presence of trialkylaluminium , but the binuclear zirconium complex ( 2a and 2b ) showed higher activity than their mononuclear counterpart 3a and 3b . polymerization activity varied with the trialkylaluminiums and increased with the trialkylaluminium concentration applied in the system . the product existed mainly in the form of Al(PE)3 with polymeric chain , and it molecular weight and distribution were greatly influenced by the type and amount of trialkylaluminium applied in the catalytic system . allenes have proven themselves to be valuable building block toward complex molecular target , revealing novel application in natural product synthesis , pharmaceutical chemistry and material science . the ongoing interest in allene chemistry result in a variety of new methodology and pathway for the synthesis of allenes . this feature article highlight some of the recent important development on the synthesis of allenes and the application on the synthesis of allenic natural product and allenic - based optoelectronic material . coupling of the N,N-dimethylacrylamides 6a-c with cyclopentadienide resulted in the formation of the substituted 3-dimethylamino-1,2- dihydropentalnenes 2a-c . deprotonation followed by metallation with CpZrCl 3*DME gave the substituted zirconocenes 12a-c . the reaction of 3-dimethylamino-1-methyl-dihydropentalene 2a with ZrCl2(NMe 2)2*2THF resulted in a unique coupling between a pair of the aminodihydropentalene derivative to yield an unsymmetrically bridged novel ansa - zirconocene framework ( 9a ) . treatment of the 1,1-dimethyl-substituted substrate 2b with this Zr - amido reagent in contrast resulted in a clean deprotonation and formation of the unbridged bis(dimethylaminohydropentalenyl)ZrCl2 complex 10b . the compound 2a , 9a , meso-10b , 12a and 12c were characterized by x-ray diffraction . reaction of (Et2N)2P-P(SiMe3)Li with [Cp2MCl2] ( m = Zr , Hf ) in toluene or pentane yield the related terminal phosphanylphosphido complex [ Cp2M(Cl) {e1-(Me3Si)P-P(NEt2)2} ] . the solid state structure of [ Cp2Hf(Cl){e1-(Me 3Si)P-P(NEt2)2 } ] wa established by single crystal x-ray diffraction . the reaction of (Et2N)2P- P(SiMe3)Li with [Cp2ZrCl2] in THF or DME solution lead to the formation of deep red crystal of the first neutral diamagnetic zirconocene - phosphanylphosphinidene dimer [ Cp2Zr{m 2-P-P(NEt2)2}2ZrCp2 ] . the molecular structure of this compound wa confirmed by x-ray diffraction . the reaction of (R2N)2P-P(SiMe3)Li with [CpZrCl3] yield the related tetraphosphetanes R2NP(m 2-PSiMe3)2PNR2 , which apparently are formed a a result of a transfer of NR2 group from a P atom to the Zr atom . starting from 1,1'-diacetylferrocene the ortho-amino,a- dimethylamino[3]ferrocenophane system <nUm> wa prepared . this wa converted to the o-imino,a-Cp - amido zirconium complex 11b . In a similar way the [3]ferrocenophane derived fluorenyl-Cp ansa - zirconocene dichloride complex <nUm> wa obtained . the 20-methylalumoxane ( MAO ) system is an active homogeneous ziegler - natta catalyst for ethylene polymerization . the 11b-MAO system reacts efficiently with an ethene-1-octene mixture to yield a mixture of linear polyethylene plus the ethene-1-octene copolymer . the compound <nUm> , <nUm> , 10b , 11b , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> were characterized by x-ray diffraction . A number of half - zirconocene anilide complex of the type Cp*ZrCl <nUm> [ N(2,6-R <nUm> <nUm> C <nUm> H <nUm> )R <nUm> ] [ r <nUm> = i Pr ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) , me ( 2 ) ; r <nUm> = me ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) , bn ( 3 ) ] and Cp*ZrCl[N(2,6-Me <nUm> C <nUm> H <nUm> )Me ] <nUm> ( 4 ) ( cp* = pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ) were synthesized from the reaction of Cp*ZrCl <nUm> with the lithium salt of the corresponding anilide in diethyl ether at room temperature . all new zirconium complex were characterized by <nUm> H and <nUm> C NMR and elemental analysis . molecular structure of complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> were determined by single crystal x-ray diffraction analysis . upon activation with Al i bu <nUm> and ph <nUm> CB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> , complex 1-4 exhibit good catalytic activity for ethylene polymerization , and produce polyethylene with a moderate molecular weight . among these zirconium complex , complex <nUm> show the highest catalytic activity while complex <nUm> show the lowest catalytic activity for ethylene polymerization . complex 1-3 also exhibit moderate catalytic activity for copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene , and produce copolymer with relatively high molecular weight and reasonable 1-hexene incorporation . In addition , the activation procedure of these catalyst system were studied by <nUm> H NMR spectroscopy . facile activation of nitrous oxide is achieved using a series of fluoroarylboranes , BC18F15 , PhB(C6F5)2 , MesB(C6F5)2 , BC18F15O , B(C6F4-p-H)3 , B(C6H4-p-F)3 and 1,4-(C6F5)2BC6F4B(C6F5)2 in the presence of the basic , bulky phosphine tBu3P . room temperature reaction yield mono- and biszwitterionic specie of the form tBu3P(N2O)B(C6F5)2R ( r = C6F5 <nUm> , ph <nUm> , me <nUm> , C6F5O <nUm> ) , tBu3P(N2O)BR3 ( r = C6F4-p-H <nUm> , C6H4-p-F <nUm> ) and tBu3P(N2O)B(C6F5)2C6F4(C6F5)2B(ON2)PtBu3 <nUm> . N2O activation is similarly achieved using Cy3P and B(C6F4-p-H)3 yielding the zwitterionic specie Cy3P(N2O)B(C6F4-p-H)3 <nUm> . reaction of <nUm> with [Ph3C][B(C6F5)4] result in facile transfer of the robust tBu3P(N2O) fragment to the stronger lewis acid Ph3C+ generating [tBu3P(N2O)CPh3][B(C6F5)4] <nUm> . similarly exchange reaction with titanocene and zirconocene cation generate transition metal and phosphine stabilized nitrous oxide salt , of the form [tBu3P(N2O)MCp2Me][MeB(C6F5)3] , ( m = Zr <nUm> , Ti <nUm> ) . the alkoxy zirconocene cation [Cp*2Zr(OMe)]+ form an FLP in the presence of tBu3P which reacts with N2O providing a direct synthetic route to the corresponding salt [tBu3P(N2O)ZrCp*2(OMe)][B(C6F5)4] <nUm> . kinetic study of the self - exchange reaction of tBu3P(N2O)B(C6H4-p-F)3 with B(C6H4-p-F)3 were carried out acquiring information regarding the mechanism of exchange . A method for the preparation of bifunctional carbosilane dendrons ha been developed and used to synthesize first- and second - generation dendrons containing [ cp <nUm> MCl <nUm> ] end - group ( m = Ti , Zr ; cp = cyclopentadienyl ) and Si-Cl focal - point bond . these dendrons have been fully characterized in solution and , in the case of the zirconium derivative , immobilized on an amorphous silica surface and tested a ethylene polymerization catalyst . the immobilization wa quantitative and quite stable under the condition of the catalysis . 1-Pentene and 4-methyl-1-pentene ( 4M1P ) have been polymerised using several C2 - symmetric ansa - zirconocene catalyst rac-X(2-R 1,4-R2-Ind)2ZrCl2 [ x = C 2H4 , R1 = R2 = H ( 1 ) ; x = SiMe <nUm> , R1 = R2 = H ( 2 ) ; x = SiMe2 , R1 = me , R2 = H ( 3 ) ; x = SiMe2 , R1 = H , R2 = ph ( 4 ) ; x = SiMe2 , R1 = me , r <nUm> = ph ( 5 ) ] with MAO a cocatalyst . the effect of polymerisation condition a well a substituents on the indenyl ligand were studied . except for the poly-1-pentenes synthesized with <nUm> and <nUm> at low temperature , low molecular weight isotactic polymer were generally obtained . compared to their behaviour in propylene polymerisation , the relative activity and selectivity of catalyst 1-5 are considerably different for 1-pentene and 4M1P polymerisation . of the five catalyst , <nUm> and <nUm> showed the highest activity for both 1-pentene and 4M1P polymerisation , while <nUm> resulted in the lowest activity , especially for 4M1P polymerisation . subsequently , a cs- and several C 1-symmetric zirconocenes , (R1)2C(3-R 2-Cp)(2,7,-R3-Flu)ZrCl2 ( R1 = me , R2 = R3 = H ( 6 ) ; R1 = R2 = me , R3 = H ( 7 ) ; R1 = me , R2 = t-Bu , R3 = H ( 8 ) ; R1 = me , R2 = R3 = t-Bu ( 9 ) ; r <nUm> = ph , R2 = t-Bu , R3 = H ( 10 ) ; R1 = ph , R2 = R3 = t-Bu ( 11 ) , were tested in 1-pentene and 4M1P polymerisation with MAO a cocatalyst . the effect of substituents on the bridge , the cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) and fluorenyl ( flu ) ligand , wa studied relative to the polymerisation temperature and type of monomer . the molecular weight of the polymer were considerably higher than those of the poly-1-pentenes and P4M1Ps obtained with C2 - symmetric zirconocenes ( 1-5 ) . the catalytic activity and polymer molecular weight strongly depend on the fluorenyl substituent and the bridge , while the type of substituent on the cp ligand ha a strong influence on the tacticity of the polymer . A methylzirconocene cation ( with a [ B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] - counterion ) transfer a methyl cation equivalent to diphenylphosphino-alkynes to generate ( η <nUm> -alkyne)ZrCp <nUm> complex bearing the [ RCCPPh <nUm> me ] + ligand . two example of the PMe <nUm> ligand stabilized [ ( me <nUm> P)Cp <nUm> zr(e <nUm> -RCCPPh <nUm> me ) + ][B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - ] salt were characterized by x-ray diffraction . the five - membered zirconacycloallenoids <nUm> react rapidly with dihydrogen under mild condition to yield the corresponding ( s-cis - conjugated diene)zirconocenes <nUm> . the reaction involves splitting of the H <nUm> molecule between the metal center and a ligand carbon atom . zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) ha been shown to be an effective catalyst for the transamidation of primary amide with amine in cyclohexane at <nUm> ° C in 5-24 hour . for favourable substrate , the reaction can be performed at temperature a low a <nUm> ° C . an efficient protocol for the highly regioselective opening of aliphatic zirconacyclopentadienes is reported . the one - pot process involves a zirconocene - mediated cyclization of 1,6-diynes and highly selective cleavage of the metallacycles with NBS and enables a concise synthesis of the tetrahydrofuran - core of the leupyrrins . the reaction of η 2-iminozirconocene chloride complex with trimethylsilylethynyl lithium lead to rapid C-C coupling at room temperature to yield the corresponding five - membered aza-zirconacycloallenoids . such compound were also obtained by trapping of in situ generated zirconocene with alkynyl imines . A series of novel monochloro half - zirconocene complex containing phosphine oxide-(thio)phenolate chelating ligand of the type , ClCp'Zr[X-2-R1-4-R2-6-(Ph2PO)C 6H2]2 ( cp' = CH , 2a : x = O , R1 = ph , R2 = H ; 2b : x = O , R1 = F , R2 = H ; 2c : x = O , R1 = tBu , R2 = H ; 2d : x = O , R1 = R2 = tBu ; 2e : x = O , r <nUm> = SiMe3 , R2 = H ; 2f : x = S , R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = H ; cp' = C5Me5 , <nUm> g : x = O , R1 = SiMe3 , R2 = H ) , have been synthesized in high yield . these complex were identified by 1H {13C} NMR and elemental analysis . structure for 2b , 2c and 2f were further confirmed by x-ray crystallography . structural characterization of these complex reveals crowded environment around the zirconium . complex 2b and 2c adopt six - coordinate , distorted octahedral geometry around the zirconium center , in which the equatorial position are occupied by three oxygen atom of two chelating phosphine oxide - bridged phenolate ligand and a chlorine atom . the cyclopentadienyl ring and one oxygen atom of the ligand are coordinated on the axial position . complex 2f also fold a six - coordinate , distorted octahedral geometry around the Zr center , consisting of a Cp-Zr-O ( in PO ) axis [ <nUm> ° ] and a distorted plane of two sulfur atom and one oxygen atom of two chelating phosphine oxide - bridged thiophenolate ligand a well a a chlorine atom . when activated by modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) , all the complex exhibited high activity towards ethylene polymerization at high temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) , giving high molecular weight polymer with unimodal molecular weight distribution . the formation of 14-electron , cationic metal alkyl specie might come from the Zr-O ( in phenol ring ) bond cleavage based on the DFT calculation study . the synthesis and crystal structure of a zirconocene derivative with a-Keggin mono-aluminum - substituted polyoxotungstate , [ a-PW 11Al(OH)O39ZrCp2]26- ( cp = C5H5- ) ( 1 ) , which wa obtained by the reaction of a-Keggin mono-aluminum - substituted polyoxotungstate with a biscyclopentadienylzirconium(iv) complex , is described herein . analytically pure , homogeneous , yellow crystal of the tetra-n-butylammonium salt of polyoxoanion <nUm> , [(n-C4H9)4N] 6[a-PW11Al(OH)O39ZrCp2] <nUm> ( TBA-1 ) , were obtained from the ca. <nUm> : <nUm> reaction of [ ( n-C 4H9)4N]4[a-PW 11{Al(OH2)}O39 ] with Cp2Zr(OTf) 2*THF ( OTf = O3SCF3- ) in acetonitrile solution under an argon atmosphere , followed by precipitation from water and crystallization from acetonitrile . TBA-1 wa characterized based on x-ray structure analysis , elemental analysis , thermogravimetric / differential thermal analysis ( TG / DTA ) , fourier transform infrared ( FTIR ) , and solution ( 31P , 27Al , 19F , 1H , and 13C ) nuclear magnetic resonance ( NMR ) spectroscopy . single - crystal x-ray structure analysis revealed that the two {PW11AlO40} unit are bridged by two " bent sandwich " Cp2Zr 2+ fragment with C2 symmetry . each zirconium center wa bound to a terminal oxygen atom of the aluminum and tungsten site and an edge - sharing oxygen atom at the Al-O-W linkage . further , the stability towards water wa investigated by NMR ( 31P , 1H , and 13C ) and FTIR spectroscopy . the e5- cyclopentadienylzirconium fragment were not eliminated from the surface of [a-PW11{Al(OH2)}O39]4- even after <nUm> h exposure to <nUm> equiv. of water . zirconocene , in situ generated by treatment of zirconocene dichloride with two molar equiv. of n-butyl magnesium chloride , is trapped by the enynes R-CC-C(Me)CH <nUm> ( r = -SiMe <nUm> , 7c ;
