r = tert-butyl , 7b ) to give the zirconacycloallenoids 6b and 6c , respectively . compound 6c add an additional equivalent of the enyne 7c to form the seven - membered alkyne insertion product <nUm> which itself exhibit a typical zirconacycloallenoid structure . acetonitrile insertion into the Zr-C bond of 6c also result in the formation of a seven - membered metallacycloallenoid , isolated a the respective enamido tautomer <nUm> . compound 6c reacts with two molar equiv. of benzaldehyde to give a nine - membered cyclic allene . compound 6b add one molar equiv. of the enyne 7c to yield the nine - membered metallacycle <nUm> that contains two metal bonded allenoid moiety inside the ring structure . low temperature photolysis in PhMe or MeC6H11 of various zirconocene(IV) alkyl , aryls , chloride , cyclopentadienyls , or hydride [Zr(e-C5H5)2(R)X] lead to the e.s.r . characterisation of a number of ZrIII complex : [ Zr(e-C 5H5)2R ] ( 1 ) and [ Zr(e-C5H 5)R2 ] a well a their phosphine adduct , [ Zr(e-C 5H5)2Cl ] , and a ZrIII hydride ( 2 ) ; the primary photo - product from [ Zr(e-C5H5) 2R2 ] ( e.g. , r = CH2Ph ) are ( 1 ) and R* , with ( 2 ) derived from ( 1 ) by a dark reaction . copper - mediated electrophilic imination of alkenylzirconocenes generated in situ from alkyne and zirconocenes is accomplished under mild reaction condition . the reaction can be used to prepare various 2-azadienes . diffusion NMR spectroscopy wa applied to investigate all individual component and combination thereof for the Cp2ZrMe2 / MAO ( DMAO ) / TBP ( MAO = methylaluminoxane , DMAO = AlMe3 depleted MAO , TBP = 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol ) ternary system , selected a a prototypical catalytic pool for homogeneous olefin polymerisation . both MAO and DMAO were found to self - aggregate in C6D6 with the latter having a higher propensity . TBP reacts with DMAO affording MeAl(2,6-di-tert-butylphenoxide) <nUm> and causing a structural modification of DMAO , whose aggregate become much larger . the actual dimension and self - aggregation tendency of (D)MAO , which depend on Al concentration and the possible presence of TBP , turned out to carry over to [ Cp2Zr(m-Me)2AlMe 2]MeMAO ( 1 ) OSIP ( outer sphere ion pair ) and [ Cp2Zr +Me ⋯ MeMAO- ] ( 2 ) ISIP ( inner sphere ion pair ) that form upon activation of Cp2ZrMe2 . once the intrinsic self - aggregation tendency of MAO ha been subtracted , OSIP <nUm> and ISIP <nUm> behave exactly a analogous ion pair with borate ion : ISIP <nUm> doe not self - aggregate , whereas OSIP <nUm> exhibit the same self - aggregation trend of zirconocene OSIPs with borate counterions . functional group transformation at the group <nUm> metallocene framework have been demonstrated , which have provided relatively straightforward access to otherwise synthetically challenging derivative . the pendant nitrile group in Ti and Zr metallocene complex of the type [ ( e5-C 5Me5)(e5-C5H4CMe 2CH2CN)MCl2 ] wa converted into an intramolecularly bound ketimido moiety by alkylation , which took place not only at the nitrile , but also at the metal centre . the choice of an alkylating reagent ( alkyl / aryl lithium , grignard reagent ) wa crucial : e.g. , <nUm> equiv. of MeMgBr effected the alkylation only at the metal , yielding selectively complex [ (e5-C5Me5)(e5-C 5H4CMe2CH2CN)MMe2 ] , while the use of PhMgBr , PhLi , or MeLi instead gave selectively the ketimido complex . organyl lithium reagent were , however , not compatible with the titanocene derivative . the metal - bound ketimides were subsequently cleaved off by the reaction with ClH , which afforded metallocene dichloride with a pendant imino group . these compound were easily protonated again at the nitrogen atom to produce a cationic iminium moiety . aqueous hydrolysis of the imine or it respective hydrochloride proved to be viable in the case of Zr and it finally afforded a pendant ketone group attached to the zirconocene framework . A conjugated enyne reacts with in situ generated zirconocene to yield a five membered zirconacycloallenoid that wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . In two consecutive equilibrium the compound (Cp*)2Zr(OMe) <nUm> undergoes insertion of CO2 to form the mono- and bis-hemicarbonates . both equilibrium are exothermic but entropically disfavoured . magnetisation transfer experiment gave kinetic data for the first equilibrium showing that the rate of insertion is overall second order with a rate constant of <nUm> ± <nUm> M-1 s-1 , which is substantially higher than those reported for other early transition metal alkoxides , which are currently the best homogeneous catalyst for dimethyl carbonate formation from methanol and CO2 . activation parameter for the insertion reaction point to a highly ordered transition state and we interpret that a there being a substantial interaction between the CO2 and the metal during the C-O bond formation . this is supported by DFT calculation showing the lateral attack by CO2 to have the lowest energy transition state . the recently reported cationic titanocene complex [ cp <nUm> TiMe(OH <nUm> ) ] + wa subjected to detailed computational study using density functional theory ( DFT ) . the calculated NMR spectrum revealed the importance of including the anion and the solvent ( CD <nUm> Cl <nUm> ) in order to calculate spectrum which were in good agreement with the experimental data . specifically , two organic solvent molecule were required to coordinate to the two hydrogen of the bound OH <nUm> in order to achieve such agreement . further elaboration of the role of the solvent led to bader 's QTAIM and natural bond order calculation . the zirconocene complex [ cp <nUm> ZrMe(OH <nUm> ) ] + wa simulated for comparison . this journal is an ansa - zirconocene bearing methyl substituents at all position adjacent to the bridgehead [ (-C(Ph)HC(Ph)H-)(e5-2,5-Me2C 5H2)2ZrCl2 ] ( 4 ) wa prepared in high yield ( <nUm> % ) through the reductive dimerization of 1,4-dimethyl-6-phenylfulvene utilizing ZrCl2*DME generated in situ . the structure of <nUm> wa subsequently confirmed using x-ray crystallography . <nUm> exhibited excellent catalytic performance with regard to 1-decene oligomerization , which wa carried out with the intention of preparing lubricant base stock . high activity ( <nUm> × <nUm> g mol-1 Zr h-1 activity ; TON = <nUm> <nUm> ; TOF = <nUm> s-1 ) were observed at temperature a high a <nUm> ° C and the oligomer distribution wa appropriate for lubricant application . the simulated distillation ( SIMDIS ) data confirmed that a wide range of oligomers were formed , ranging from the dimer ( 2-mer ) to 20-mer . A minimal amount of the dimer and oligomers larger than the 10-mer wa formed ( <nUm> and <nUm> wt % , respectively ) . alternatively , a typical unbridged complex such a (e5-nBuC5H4)2ZrCl2 primarily produced dimer ( <nUm> wt % ) , whereas the ansa - zirconocene (EBI)ZrCl <nUm> primarily produced oligomers larger than 10-mer ( <nUm> wt % ) . the methyl substituents at the position adjacent to the bridgehead in <nUm> played a significant role in the catalytic performance . the copolymerization of 2-methyl-1,5-hexadiene ( MHD ) with propylene ha been studied with different single - site group <nUm> metal catalyst . system based on ansa - zirconocene precursor such a rac-{Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind} Cl2Zr ( 1 ) and C1- or CS - symmetric ansa-{CpCR2Flu}ZrCl2 ( <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) , once activated by MAO , are highly active ( 20-600 kgpol g cat-1 h-1 at 60-70 ° C ) and yield copolymer in which MHD is cyclopolymerized a methylene-(1-methyl)-1,3-cyclopentane ( MMCP ) unit . 13C NMR study revealed , depending on the symmetry of the precatalyst used , either highly isotactic ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) or syndiotactic ( 3 ) polypropylene ( PP ) backbone , with isolated MMCP unit . fully trans-diastereoselective cyclopolymerization of MHD wa observed with <nUm> / MAO , while a mixture of trans and ci MMCP ring wa observed with <nUm> and <nUm> / MAO . the amount of MMCP unit in PP ( <nUm> - <nUm> mol % ) can be controlled by the amount of MHD in the feed . In contrast , the constrained geometry catalyst system based on {C5Me4SiMe2NtBu}TiCl2 ( 4 ) and MAO showed a much lower productivity ( ca. <nUm> kgpol gcat <nUm> h-1 at <nUm> ° C ) and yielded a regioirregular , atactic copolymer in which MHD is simply vinyl-inserted in quite moderate amount ( <nUm> mol % ) . two new phenyl capped cyclopenta[c]chalcogenophenes ( PhCPTPh and PhCPSPh ) were synthesized by zirconocene mediated coupling and characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction ( SCXRD ) . replacement of sulfur by selenium destabilized the HOMO level and increased the structural rigidity . the crystal structure of both the compound were found to be nearly planar . PhCPSPh , though isostructural with PhCPTPh , packed in a very - ordered and specific pattern by Se ⋯ π interaction between two neighboring molecule . hirshfeld surface analysis supported the crystal structure study . theoretical calculation exhibited very close reorganization energy of <nUm> and <nUm> eV for PhCPTPh and PhCPSPh , respectively . this journal is this journal is poly(hexene) with very high molecular weight is produced at <nUm> MPa ( <nUm> atm ) with (C5HMe4)2HfCl2-methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) a catalyst ; the dependence of the polymerization on the reaction pressure ( <nUm> MPa - <nUm> GPa ) and the substituent pattern of a zirconocene catalyst is described . dibutyl zirconocene - mediated trans-selective cyclization of methoxyallyl-ene followed by the reaction with electrophiles is a convenient method for the synthesis of functionalized cyclopentane derivative . ring - closing metathesis of the obtained cyclopentane derivative yielded a common building block for the synthesis of sesquiterpene analogue with unnatural trans-[3.4.0]bicyclo-nonane skeleton . dimeric product were produced besides the monomeric ( and expected ) cyclization product , on subjecting diacetylenes to the condition developed by negishi ( ZrCp2 from ZrCp2Cl2 and -BuLi ) . the structure of the dimeric product were established by spectroscopic data and single - crystal x-ray structural analysis . the mechanism leading to their formation are discussed . the cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> - catalyzed methylalumination and cycloalumination of 1-alkynyl selenides followed by deuterolysis or hydrolysis affords corresponding (Z)-1-alkenyl selenides in high yield . alternatively , (E)-1-alkenyl selenides were prepared by the reaction of 1-alkenylaluminums with organic diselenides in a one - pot procedure starting from the corresponding 1-alkynes , which provides a versatile tool for the preparation of stereo - defined unsaturated organic derivative of selenium . the titanocene alkyne complex without any additional ligand Cp2Ti(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) <nUm> and the zirconocene alkyne complex free from stabilizing phosphine ligand Cp2Zr(L)(Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( L = THF <nUm> , pyridine <nUm> ) a well a the metallacyclic complex Cp2Zr-O-CMe2-C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) <nUm> react with some substrate in an unusual manner depending on metal m , ligand L and the substituents r of the substrate . also in some case the competitive reaction of coupling of the complexed alkyne occurs . In this account all product without coupling of the silylalkyne are numbered , the data of detailed NMR study and x-ray crystal structure analysis are given in the cited reference . the reaction of " Cp2Zr " with benzophenone give the ligand stabilized metallocene e2-ketone complex <nUm> . with di(tert-butyl)acetylene-dicarboxylate a coupling of a C = C- and a C = o-ester group to <nUm> and with bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylenedicarboxylate an unusual 1,3-migration of a SiMe3 unit from an oxygen to a carbon atom yielding the dimeric complex <nUm> occurs . ketimines react with metallocenes either to the ligand stabilized e2-complexes <nUm> or the derivative bearing N-H function to amido alkylideneamido complex <nUm> and <nUm> by a hydrogen transfer reaction . aldimines give the cyclic diamido complex <nUm> or in the case of a methyl group at the nitrogen under evolution of methane an unsaturated cyclic complex . heterocyclic C = N system , e.g. benzoxazoles or benzthiazoles , show a ring enlargement and a simultaneous coupling to <nUm> and <nUm> or , e.g. benzisoxazoles , yield without coupling the dimeric complex <nUm> . depending on metal , ligand , substituents and used stoichiometry the generated metallocenes " Cp2M " react with one equivalent of 1,4-disubstituted 1,3-butadiynes RC = C-C ≡ CR ' to give five - membered metallacyclic cumulenes <nUm> and <nUm> or with a half equivalent of the diyne the bimetallic complex <nUm> - <nUm> . two diyne molecule are coupled by " Cp2Ti " to yield a titanacyclopentadiene <nUm> in contrast to " Cp2Zr " , which give the seven - membered zirconacyclic cumulenes <nUm> and <nUm> . also a novel cleavage of the central C-C single bond of the butadiynes by the metallocene occurs yielding the homobimetallic , doubly s,p-acetylide bridged complex 23-26 . the heterobimetallic complex <nUm> wa obtained in the reaction of the metallacyclocumulens <nUm> with " Cp2Zr " or <nUm> with " Cp2Ti " . complex (Ph3P)2Ni(e2-RC ≡ C-C ≡ CR ' ) give with " Cp2Ti " the ni(0) complexed titanacyclocumulene <nUm> or with " Cp2M " the heterobimetallic s,p-acatylide - bridged complex <nUm> <nUm> . the metallocene unit interact with one equivalent of an alkynylsilane carrying Si-H group ( RC ≡ CSiMe2H ) to yield trans-coordinated alkyne complex with strong Si-H-M interaction like <nUm> , which at low temperature is in agreement with the description on the way to a novel hydrido e3-silaallenyl complex . two molecule of the alkynylsilane are coupled to metallacyclopentadienes without Si-H-M interaction ( e.g. <nUm> ) . <nUm> . alkyl and alkenyl zirconocenes react readily with CO to give intermediate acylzirconocenes ( 3 ) that can be elaborated to aldehyde or carboxylic acid derivative depending on reaction condition . very recently it ha been reported that <nUm> can react a an unmasked acyl anion with aldehyde or in Pd catalysed cross coupling reaction . <nUm> . alkenyl zirconocenes may be easily transmetallated to the corresponding organozinc compound and added to aldehyde in a process promoted by the resulting zirconocene byproduct . if catalytic amount of chiral aminothiols are present , good enantioselectivities are obtained with aromatic aldehyde . <nUm> . the Pd catalysed coupling of alkenyl zirconocenes with vinyl halide or allylic halide / acetate is an excellent method for the construction of conjugated and 1,4-dienes . although the Zr to Pd transmetallation in alkenyl zirconocenes is slow , addition of Cl2Zn promotes the formation of coupling product . the reaction of <nUm> with nitrile yield imine derivative which subsequently react with different electrophiles ( E1 = H , I , S ) and are hydrolysed to the corresponding ketone . with respect to r ' and r '' anti friedel craft acylation product can be obtained in good yield ( > <nUm> % ) . access to 2,3-dihydroindoles by reaction of <nUm> with allyl amine is very easy and good yield are obtained ( <nUm> - <nUm> % ) . the two iodo substituents allow a variety of further transformation . regioisomeric control of the insertion of trialkylsilylacetylene is high ( > <nUm> : <nUm> ) . subsequent reaction with sulfur dichloride and treatment with tetrabutylammonium fluoride yield polysubstituted benzothiophenes . besides dihydrofurans , other heterocyclic alkene either with nitrogen or oxygen a heteroatoms and different ring size react with <nUm> and show excellent enantiomeric excess and yield . moreover buchwald and coworkers published the stereoselective synthesis of allylic amine by using optically pure <nUm> . various polysubstituted , metalated olefin are easily prepared from heterosubstituted alkene such a vinyl enol ether , vinyl sulfide , sulfoxides and even sulfones in a one - step procedure . A complete isomerization wa observed in this process , which lead only to the e isomer . <nUm> introduction <nUm> oxidative metallation of organic halide <nUm> metal - halogen exchange <nUm> Metal-Hydrogen exchange <nUm> hydrometallation reaction <nUm> carbometallation reaction <nUm> transmetallation reaction <nUm> the shapiro reaction <nUm> limitation of these method <nUm> zirconocene complex in organic synthesis <nUm> discussion <nUm> vinylic enol ether into vinylic organometallic derivative 4.1.1 mechanistic discussion <nUm> vinylic thioenol ether into vinylic organometallic derivative <nUm> vinyl sulfoxides into vinylic organometallic derivative <nUm> vinyl sulfones into vinylic organometallic derivative <nUm> conclusion . ( A ) the reaction of diethyl benzene sulfinyl methylphosphonate with n-tosyl imine in the presence of a catalytic amount of HNa ( <nUm> mol % ) at <nUm> ° C give substituted (E)-a-benzene sulfinyl vinylphosphonates in 68-85 % yield . <nUm> ( figure presented ) ( B ) the aza-Baylis-Hillman reaction of n-tosylimine with phenyl vinyl ketone give the double aza-Baylis-Hillman adduct in good yield with excellent stereoselectivity in the presence of lewis base DABCO <nUm> in THF . ( figure presented ) ( C ) reaction of n-tosylimines having proximal chelating group with crotyl bromide and indium in aqueous medium give a-crotylation product stereoselectively with syn selectivity . <nUm> ( figure presented ) ( d ) monocarbonyl iodonium ylides generated in situ from (Z)-(2-acetoxyvinyl) iodonium salt via an ester exchange reaction with EtOLi undergo alkylidine transfer reaction to n-tosyl imine yielding 2-acyl aziridines in good yield . <nUm> ( figure presented ) ( e ) dengs et al. have used n-tosyl imines to prepare functionalized pyrrole derivative . this approach is based on nucleophilic condensation of an a-diazo-b-ketoester or an a-diazo-b-ketoketone with n-tosyl imine followed by Rh (II) - catalysed diazode-composition . <nUm> ( figure presented ) ( F ) treatment of alkenylzirconocene chloride complex to n-tosylimines in the presence of [RhCl(COD)]2 ( <nUm> mol % ) catalyst in dioxane at room temperature give allylic amine derivative in excellent yield . <nUm> this is the first example of the catalytic addition reaction of alkenyl zirconocene chloride complex to aldimine derivative . ( figure presented ) ( g ) the formation of a 1,4-dipole from isoquinoline and dimethyl acetylene dicarboxylate ( DMAD ) and it trapping by phenyl isocyanate , diethyl mesoxalate and dimethyl azodicarboxylate were reported by huisgen , <nUm> the utility of this reaction for the synthesis of six - membered heterocycle ha not been explored so far . nair et al. <nUm> have reported that the 1,4-dipole derived from isoquinoline and DMAD ha been shown to react readily with n-tosyl imines resulting in the diastereoselective synthesis of 2H-pyrido[2,1-a]isoquinoline derivative . ( figure presented ) . condensation of a,b-unsaturated carbonyl compound with g-trimethylsilylmethylallylzircocene followed by anionic oxy-Cope rearrangement provided a novel method for the synthesis of functionalized allylsilanes compound possessing a carbonyl group in the same molecule , which are versatile intermediate for intramolecular allylsilylation , giving cyclopentanols on treatment with n-Bu4NF . addition of 1-pentadecenylzirconocene chloride to 2,3-O-cyclohexylidene- ( r ) -glyceraldehyde in CCl2H2 wa best promoted by trimethylsilyl triflate ( TMSOTf ) to give the diastereomeric anti- and syn-alcohols in <nUm> % yield . TMSOTf also showed remarkable catalytic activity for the addition of 1(E) - alkenylzirconocenes to ketone , giving tertiary allylic alcohol in good yield . stereoselective dienyl zirconocene derivative have been prepared via a tandem allylic C-H bond activation isomerization - elimination reaction . these reagent can be either trapped directly with electrophiles or transmetalated to copper to participate in several carbon-carbon bond formation . when the transmetalation is performed on allylic a well a vinylic zirconocene derivative , the reaction occurs with inversion of stereochemistry of the dienyl system . zirconium - mediated diastereoselective alkene-carbonyl coupling reaction of n-alkenylcarbamate derivative are reported . the present alkene-carbonyl coupling reaction using chiral tertbutyl 3-butenylcarbamates having a substituent at the homoallylic position proceeded in a highly diastereoselective manner to give a-methyl-g - substituted a-aminobutyric acid ( GABA ) derivative . iodination of the intermediary zirconium specie gave the a-iodomethylated g-aminobutyrates , which were , in turn , converted to the 5-substituted pyrrolidine-3-carboxylate having ci stereochemistry . zirconocene - mediated cocyclisation of 2-heterosubstituted-1,6-dienes and -enynes gave zirconacycles bearing an endocyclic b-leaving group which eliminated under the reaction condition to provide exocyclic alkylidene group . the scope of this cyclisation / elimination ha been investigated along with further elaboration of the monosubstituted zirconocene intermediate by insertion of alkenyl carbenoids . allylic zirconium reagent that are generated in situ via allylic C-H bond activation of alkene proved to serve a metal counterpart in nickel - catalyzed cross-coupling reaction . b-Phenethylmagnesium chloride react with alkyl halide , tosylates , and sulfate in the presence of a catalytic amount of Cp2ZrCl <nUm> to afford 2-arylalkanes via alkylation of styrene - zirconate intermediate at the benzylic position . competitive reaction using mixture of alkyl halide ( alkyl-X ; x = F , Cl , Br ) showed that the reactivity of the halide increase in the order of alkyl-Cl < alkyl-F < alkyl-Br with the relative rate of <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> . A new method for the selective functionalization of aromatic ring by the zirconium promoted cross coupling reaction of an aryllithium compound and an enol ether is reported . formation of an aryne - zirconocene complex and it regioselective coupling with an enol ether are the key step of the process . this methodology allows the synthesis of functionalized styrene or z-alkenol derivative from simple and easily available starting material . the carbocupration reaction of alkynyl carbamate lead to the stereospecific preparation of polysubstituted alkenyl carbamate . subsequent treatment of these enol carbamate with the negishi reagent gave the corresponding vinyl zirconocene specie . the one - pot preparation of allyl- and dienyl-zirconocene derivative can be easily achieved via a tandem allylic C-H-activation-b-elimination reaction from unsaturated fatty alcohol and enol ether derivative , respectively . the reaction proceeds rapidly , under mild condition , and is insensitive to the length of the carbon tether between the double bond and the leaving group moiety . an efficient route to 3-benzylpyrrolidines using a zirconium - mediated cyclisation both in solution and on a solid support is reported . 3-Benzylidine-pyrrolidines , 3-aryl-pyrrolidines and 4-arylpiperidines were also synthesised . intramolecular co-cyclisation of 4- or 5-azanona-1,8-dienes , -enynes and -diynes using zirconocene(1-butene) give zirconacycles which may be protonated to afford 3,4- or 4,5-disubstituted azepanes or , for the diyne derived system , reacted with dimethyl acetylenedicarboxylate and ClCu to afford 2- or 3-benzazepanes . cation - like intermediate formed by the activation of zirconocenes L2ZrCl2 [ L2 are cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) , indenyl ( ind ) and fluorenyl ( flu ) ligand ] with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) at high Al / Zr ratio were characterised by 1H NMR spectroscopy . activation of molecular nitrogen by transition metal complex is an area of current interest a investigation using the inert N molecule to produce higher - value organonitrogen compound intensify . In an attempt to extend the addition of hydride reagent E-H ( where e = BR2 , AlR <nUm> , and SiR3 ) to the dinitrogen complex ( [NPN]Ta ) 2(m-H)2(m-e1:e2-N <nUm> ) [ <nUm> ; where NPN = ( PhNSiMe2CH2 ) 2PPh ] , the reaction with zirconocene chlorohydride , [ cp 2Zr(Cl)H]x , wa examined . the crystalline product formed in <nUm> % yield wa determined to be ([NP(N)N]Ta)(m-H)2(m-N) (Ta[NPN])(ZrCp2) ( 2 ) in which the coordinated N ha been cleaved to form a phosphinimide bridging between Ta and Zr and a triply bridging nitride . the mechanism of this reaction wa examined to determine the fate of the chloride and hydride ligand attached to Zr in the starting zirconocene reagent . using the zirconocene dihydride dimer ( [ Cp2ZrH 2]2 ) , a higher yield of <nUm> wa obtained ( <nUm> % ) , and H <nUm> wa also observed by 1H NMR spectroscopy . to probe the origin of the eliminated H , the dideuterated dinitrogen complex ([NPN]Ta)2(m- d)2(m-e1 : e2-N2)(d2-1) wa allowed to react with ( [Cp2ZrH2]2 ) , which resulted in the formation of ([NP(N)N]Ta)(m-D)2(m-N)(Ta[NPN]) ( ZrCp2 ) , ( d 2-2 ) , with no evidence of hydrogen for deuterium scrambling between the starting zirconocene dihydride and the ditantalum dinitrogen complex . study into the use of preformed Zr (II) and Ti (II) reagent were also performed . the proposed mechanism involves initial adduct formation that facilitates inner - sphere electron transfer to cleave the N-N bond to form a specie with bridging nitride , one of which is transformed by nucleophilic attack of a phosphine donor to generate the observed phosphinimide . bis(1-methylethenyl-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( 7a ) wa prepared by a fulvene route . photolysis at <nUm> ° C with pyrex - filtered UV light resulted in a rapid and complete intramolecular [2+2]cycloaddition reaction to yield the corresponding cyclobutylene-bridged ansa - zirconocene dichloride isomer ( 8a ) . this is one of the rare example of an organic functional group chemistry that lead to carbon-carbon coupling at the framework of an intact sensitive group <nUm> bent metallocene complex . more sterically hindered open metallocenes that bear bulky isopropyl or tert-butyl substituents at their cp ring in addition to the active 1-methylethenyl functional group undergo the photochemical ansa - metallocene ring closure reaction equally facile . the metallocene system used and obtained in this study have served a transition metal component for the generation of active metallocene propene polymerization catalyst . single - site polymerization catalyst enable exquisite control over alkene polymerization reaction to produce new material with unique property . knowledge of catalyst speciation and fundamental kinetics are essential for full mechanistic understanding of zirconocene - catalyzed alkene polymerization . currently the effect of activator on fundamental polymerization step is not understood . progress in understanding activator effect requires determination of fundamental kinetics for zirconocene catalyst with noncoordinating anion such a [B(C6F5)4]- . kinetic NMR study at low temperature demonstrate a very fast propagation rate for 1-hexene polymerization catalyzed by [(SBI)Zr(CH2SiMe3)][B(C 6F5)4 ] [ where SBI is rac-Me 2Si(indenyl)2 ] with complete consumption of 1-hexene before the first NMR spectrum . surprisingly , the first NMR spectrum reveals , aside from uninitiated catalyst , Zr - allyl a the sole catalyst - containing specie . these Zr - allyl , which exist in two diastereomeric form , have been characterized by physical and chemical method . the mechanism of Zr - allyl formation wa probed with a trapping experiment , leading u to favor a mechanism in which Zr - polymeryl undergoes b-H transfer to metal without dissociation of coordinated alkene followed by s-bond metathesis to form H and Zr - allyl . Zr - allyl specie undergo slow reaction with alkene but react rapidly with H to form hydrogenation product . copolymerization of racemic a-olefins with ethylene and propylene wa carried out in the presence of enantiopure C1 - symmetric ansa metallocene , { 1,2-(SiMe2)2(e5-C 5H-3,5-(CHMe2)2)(e5-C 5H3)}-ZrCl2 to probe the effect of the polymer chain end on enantioselection for the R- or s-a - olefin during the kinetic resolution by polymerization catalysis . copolymerizations with ethylene revealed that the polymer chain end is an important factor in the enantioselection of the reaction and that for homopolymerization , chain end control generally work cooperatively with enantiomorphic site control . resulcts from propyclcene copolymerizations suggested that chain end control arising from a methyl group at the β carbon along the main chain can drastically affect selectivity , but it importance a a stereo - directing element depends on the identity of the olefin . four isomer of 5,7-dodecadien-l-ol were previously proposed a being the sex pheromone of the pine moth . the isomer were stereoselectively synthesized from 1-hexyne and tetrahydropyranyl ether of 5-hexyn-l-ol . the ( 5Z , 7Z ) - isomer wa synthesized by a chodkiewic cadiot reaction followed by hydroboration , and other three isomer by novel synthetic method including the addition of zirconocene hydride [ schwarz 's reagent C10ClH11Zn ] to control the regioselective coupling reaction . the 5,8-and <nUm> , 9-dodecadien-l-ols were also synthesized by similar method for comparison of their characteristic with the endogenous sex pheromone . ab initio molecular dynamic simulation of a catalytic reaction are presented . ethylene insertion is observed to proceed in a HSi <nUm> - bridged di-(cyclopentadienyl)methylzirconocene cation a well a in the corresponding titanocene cation . the entire reaction path starting from the π coordinated ethylene-metallocene complex up to and including propyl formation take place in about <nUm> f for the zirconocene and <nUm> f for the titanocene . for both a Zr and a Ti based monocyclopentadienyl metallocene no insertion wa observed , which is indicative of a barrier to insertion . In accordance with this , stepwise variation of the relevant C-C distance along the reaction path a set prior to the dynamic simulation did reveal insertion . these data are in qualitative agreement with result obtained from static simulation on similar specie . ab initio molecular dynamic simulation of a catalytic reaction are presented . ethylene insertion is observed to proceed in a H2Si - bridged di(cyclopentadienyl)methylzirconocene cation a well a in the corresponding titanocene cation . the entire reaction path starting from the π coordinated ethylene-metallocene complex up to and including propyl formation take place in about <nUm> f for the zirconocene and <nUm> f for the titanocene . for both a Zr and a Ti based monocyclopentadienyl metallocene no insertion wa observed , which is indicative of a barrier to insertion . In accordance with this , stepwise variation of the relevant C-C distance along the reaction path a set prior to the dynamic simulation did reveal insertion . these data are in qualitative agreement with result obtained from static simulation on similar specie . terminal alkyne <nUm> react with Cp2Zr(H)Cl ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) and CO to give acylzirconocene chloride derivative <nUm> , which are trapped with diaryldiselenides to afford (E)-a,b-unsaturated selenoesters . the reductive coupling of aromatic aldehyde and ketone ha been achieved using a catalytic amount of zirconocene dichloride in the presence of magnesium metal and chlorotrimethylsilane in THF at room temperature to afford the corresponding 1,2-diols in good yield and diastereoselectivity . the preparation of an annulated verbenyl indene is described . reduction of the verbenone oxo group and water elimination provided a verbenylindene with an embedded fulvene unit , which wa reduced to an annulated verbenylindene , a fluorene derivative . the ansa - bridge wa constructed between the fluorene 9-position and 6,6-dimethylfulvene by way of the lithiated indene . dilithiation of the ligand and treatment with Cl4Zr yielded the corresponding zirconocene . air - stable zirconocene bis(perfluoroctanesulfonate) s [ cp 2Zr]OSO 2C 8F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] ( 1 ) with high lewis acidity and high thermal stability wa prepared by the reaction between cp 2ZrCl <nUm> and AgO2S 2C 8F <nUm> . the as-prepared complex <nUm> exhibit good activity and selectivity in the cyclotrimerization of various ketone to the desired 1,3,5- triaylbenzenes . furthermore , in the cyclic experiment , the complex <nUm> show little loss of activity after <nUm> cycle . the result afford a general and efficient method for the cyclotrimerization of ketone using cp 2Zr(OSO 2C 8F <nUm> ) <nUm> a catalyst . an efficient method for the preparation of multi-gram quantity of ethynyl sulfide is exemplified by the synthesis of ethynyl n.pentyl sulfide . treatment of the latter with zirconocene chloride hydride / n-iodosuccinimide gave e-2-iodoethenyl n.pentyl sulfide in high yield and stereoselectivity . the latter compound rearranged to the z isomer on storage at − <nUm> ° C . replacement reaction of zirconocene dichloride are described for preparation of pentahaptocyclopentadienylzirconium b-diketonates of the general type (h5-C5H5)Zr(dik)3 . when the diketonate ligand is fluorinated , the complex are readily obtained by reaction of C10Cl2H10Zr with excess free ligand . with non-fluorinated ligand , the most effective mean of obtaining pure complex is by reaction of C10Cl2H10Zr and free ligand in triethylamine n solvent . eight (RC5H4)2ZrCl(O2CR') complex , where r = h , ch3 ; r ’ = 2.-c10h7 , 2-C10H7CH2 , C4H3 , p-Cl-C6H4OCH2 , were prepared by the reaction of R'CO2Na with (RC5H4)2ZrCl2 in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio in toluene at room temperature . the composition , structure and coordinative mode of the carboxylate ligand in these complex have been characterized by elemental analysis and IR , 1H - NMR spetra . all the complex have five - coordinate , 18-electron zirconocene structure . two different polyoxozirconium oxide cluster tri- and tetranuclear half - zirconocene complex assisted by 2,3,4,5-tetrafluorobenzoic acid and 3,4,5,6-tetrafluorophthalic acid have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analysis , FT-IR , NMR ( 1H , 19F , and 13C ) spectroscopy , and x-ray crystallography . the structure analysis reveal that <nUm> is trinuclear with a 3-oxygen bridge , central to a Zr-O backbone ; <nUm> is a tetranuclear complex with four Zr 's tetrahedrally arranged around a 4-oxygen . substituted metallocene ligand containing cyclopentadiene ring fused to either selenophene or benzo[b]tellurophene were prepared following method previously developed for analog containing sulfur . 5-Methyl-4,5-dihydro- cyclopenta[b]-selenophen-6-one ( 2 ) and 3-Methyl-3,4-dihydro-benzo[b] cyclopenta[d]telluraphen-2-one ( 7 ) ( major isomer ) were prepared by polyphosphoric acid catalyzed friedel - craft acylation / nazarov cyclization of methacrylic acid onto selenophene and respectively benzo[b]tellurophene . following reduction of the ketone to alcohol , then dehydration , the chalcogen - containing cyclopentadiene olefin were prepared . the olefin were deprotonated with n-butyllithium followed by either bridging with dichlorodimethylsilane , deprotonation and metallation , or deprotonation and direct metallation . In this manner , isomeric mixture of -rac / -meso dimethylsilanediylbis(e5-5-Methyl-cyclopenta[b]selenophenyl) zirconium dichloride ( 5 ) bis(e5-2-methyl-cyclopenta[b][1] benzotelluraphenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 9 ) were prepared and characterized . complex formed active olefin polymerization catalyst when activated with methylalumoxane . polymerization result with ethylene and propylene are included . the strained alkylidene episulfides were synthesized by carbene and alkylidene carbene addition to thiocarbonyl compound / thermal , photochemical , and acid catalyzed reaction have been extensively investigated , and and the transition metal - promoted reaction result in the first isolation of thioallyl iron tricarbonyl complex . germylene and zirconocene also reacted with thioketene to give metallic analogue of alkylidene episulfides , which are excellent synthetic source of a variety of cyclogermanes and stable enethiolizable thioaldehyde . thermal sulfurization of some <nUm> , <nUm> , 3-butatriene derivative and <nUm> , <nUm> , 3-selena-diazoles with elemental sulfur ha been examined to give a variety of novel cyclic polysulfides having an unique structure . reactive silicon and germanium specie also reacted with elemental sulfur and selenium to afford cyclic metallachalcogenides . reaction of a zirconocene phosphinidene like complex , <nUm> , with the dichlorophosphine 2,4,6-('bu3)C6H2PC12 , the eschenmoser 's salt [ CH2 = NMe2][Cl] , the phospha - imine (Me3Si)2N — P = N — SiMe3 or ' BuOH lead , respectively , to the diphosphene 2,4,6-(MeO)3C6H2 — P = P — 2,4,6-('Bu)3C6H2 , the phosphine 2,4,6-(MeO)3C6H2 — P(CH2NMe2)2 , the diphosphino metallacycle 2,4,6-(MeO)3C6H2-P — P(N(SiMe3)2 — N(SiMe3) — ZrCp2 or the metallated phosphine 2,4,6-(MeO)3C6H2 — P(H) — Zr - Cp,(OtBu) . using the nucleophilic ability of tertiary phosphine we have been able to prepare a large variety of unprecedented stable phosphonium anionic zirconocene(IV) complex . the solution polymerization of ethylene using a binary metallocene system ( BMS ) , [C5Me4(SiMe2NtBu)]TiMe2 ( CGC-Ti ) / zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) / tris(pentafluorophenyl)boron ( TPFPB ) / modified methylaluminoxane ( MMAO ) , ha been carried out in a high - temperature , high - pressure continuous stirred - tank reactor ( CSTR ) at <nUm> ° C , <nUm> psig and with a mean residence time of <nUm> minute . A series of BMS with different catalyst and cocatalyst incorporation were used . the utilization of Cp2ZrCl2 and MMAO in the BMS reduced the activity greatly , and the effect of MMAO wa more severe . formation of long chain branch decreased even though more macromonomer wa produced . polyethylene with higher molecular weight and broader molecular weight distribution were synthesized using the binary system than those produced using the CGC-Ti catalyst alone . the overall rate constant of ethylene propagation , long chain branching , ethylene macromonomer formation via chain transfer to monomer and b-hydride elimination , and chain transfer to hydrogen were estimated . novel metallocene - dithiolene complex with titanocene and zirconocene a the organometallic ligand have been prepared and characterised . this work concentrate on using the gas - phase polymerization technique for the production of highly loaded nanocomposites . filler loading level near the vicinity of <nUm> wt % have been obtained using different nanofillers . three different in situ polypropylene ( PP ) nanocomposites , i.e. , Cloisite-20A filled polypropylene ( CFPP ) , kaolin filled polypropylene ( KFPP ) and nanosilica filled polypropylene ( SFPP ) have been prepared by gas - phase polymerization . the catalyst used is Nanosilica-Supported-Zirconocene . the filler used are Closite-20A , kaolin and nanosilica , respectively . these were pre-treated with MAO ( methylaluminoxane ) to inhibit their deactivating action on the catalyst because of the presence of either acidic or basic group on their surface ; in this way MAO act a a co-catalyst for the three polymerization reaction being discussed . significantly higher molecular weight polypropylene wa formed with nanosilica a the filler . the melting temperature and enthalpy is also observed to be comparatively higher in this case . however , in the case of other filler , the molecular weight , a well a melting point , are comparatively lower . with the catalyst used , a mixture of crystalline and amorphous polypropylene wa observed to form . comparatively lesser amount of crystalline polypropylene are also observed . homogeneous catalyst system , Cp2MCl2 / Et3Al + R3SiCl ( cp = e5 = CH , m = TI , ZR ; r = me , ph ) , polymerizes ethylene in toluene medium . the activity of such catalyst system are governed by the factor like nature of metallocene dichloride , chlorosilane , and polymerization parameter such a Al / m , Si / Al molar ratio and temperature . it is observed that zirconocene dichloride system show higher polymerization efficiency a compared to titanium analogue . furthermore , the use of trimethylchlorosilarn in combination with triethylaluminum ( TEAL ) a cocatalyst yield more polymer in comparison to triphenylchlorosilane and TEAI system . linear a-olefins from propene to 1-eicosene have been polymerized using a zirconocene catalyst and a hafnocene catalyst . the resulting isotactic polymer were characterized by NMR , GPC and DSC analysis . compared to the zirconocene product the molecular weight of the poly-a - olefin made with the hafnocene catalyst were higher . the molecular weight distribution wa found to be narrow a expected for metallocene polymer . DSC measurement showed that side chain crystallization occurs for the polymer from poly-1-decene to poly-1-eicosene . reaction of titanocene and zirconocene dichloride with ethyl pyruvate aroy1hydrazones [ viz. , ethyl pyruvate picolinoylhydrazone ( EPPHyH ) , ethyl pyruvate furanoylhydrazone ( EPFHyH ) and ethyl pyruvate thiophenoy1hydrazone ( EPTPHyH ) yield complex of the type Cp.M(L) C <nUm> <nUm> ( where m = Ti or z r , n = <nUm> or <nUm> and L - ethyl <nUm> n <nUm> -n pyruvate aroylhydrazone anion ) . the complex have been <nUm> characterised on the basis of elemental analysis , IR , PMR , NMR <nUm> and electronic spectrum . the magnetic susceptibility data indicate the complex to be diamagnetic . copolymerization of ethylene and propylene wa carried out in the presence of racethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 ) with O2Si a the support for the catalyst . the effect of trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) wa investigated using two method of providing a supported system . the resultant data were analyzed in detail . acetylenic stannanes <nUm> react with Cp2Zr(H)Cl ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) and CO to give acylzirconocene chloride derivative <nUm> , which are trapped with br2 in alcohol to afford (Z)-a-stannyl-a,b-unsaturated ester <nUm> in good yield . we have used computer - assisted sperm analysis ( CASA ) to evaluate the spermicidal activity of <nUm> metallocene dihalides ( vanadocene dichloride [VDC] , titanocene dichloride [TDC] , zirconocene dichloride [ZDC] , molybdocene dichloride [MDC] , hafnocene dichloride [HDC] , vanadocene dibromide [VDB] , bis[methylcyclopentadienyl] vanadium dichloride [VMDC] , and vanadocene diiodide [VDI] ) ; <nUm> vanadocene di-pseudohalides ( vanadocene diazide [VDA] , vanadocene dicyanide [VDCN] , vanadocene dioxycyanate [VDOCN] , vanadocene dithiocyanate [VDSCN] , and vanadocene diselenocyanate [VDSeCN] ) ; and <nUm> disubstituted derivative ( vanadocene ditriflate [VDT] , vanadocene monochloro oxycyanate [VDCO] , and vanadocene monochloro acetonitrilo tetrachloro ferrate [VDFe] ) . whereas the metallocene complex containing titanium , zirconium , molybdenum , and hafnodium were inactive , all <nUm> vanadocene complex elicited potent spermicidal activity at nano-micromolar concentration with an order of efficacy VDSeCN > VDSCN > VDB > VMDC > VDCN > VDA > VDC > VDOCN > VDI > VDT > VDFe > VDCO without disrupting the acrosomal membrane , a determined by high - resolution low - voltage scanning electron microscopy . the sperm- immobilizing activity of the vanadocene complex wa rapid and irreversible , since the treated sperm underwent apoptosis a determined by the flow cytometric annexin V binding assay , DNA nick end - labeling , and confocal laser scanning microscopy . these result provide unprecedented evidence that metallocene complex containing vanadium(IV) , especially VDSeCN , may be useful a contraceptive agents.Computer - assisted sperm analysis wa used to evaluate the spermicidal activity of <nUm> metallocene dihalides , <nUm> vanadocene di-pseudohalides , and <nUm> disubstituted derivative . the metallocene complex containing titanium , zirconium , molybdenum , and hafnodium were inactive . however , in high - resolution low - voltage scanning electron microscopy , all <nUm> vanadocene complex elicited potent spermicidal activity at nano-micromolar concentration with the following order of efficacy : vanadocene diselenocyanate vanadocene dithiocyanate vanadocene dibromide vanadium dichloride vanadocene dicyanide vanadocene diazide vanadocene dichloride vanadocene dioxycyanate vanadocene diiodide vanadocene ditriflate vanadocene monochloro acetonitrilo tetrachloro ferrate vanadocene monochloro oxycyanate , without disruption of the acrosomal membrane . the sperm - immobilizing activity of the vanadocene complex wa rapid and irreversible due to induction of apoptosis . the potent spermicidal activity of metallocene complex containing vanadium may provide the basis for the development of novel vaginal contraceptive agent . study are underway to further evaluate the mechanism involved in the induction of vanadocene - mediated apoptotic pathway . A method is presented by which it is possible to obtain estimate of dose rate in the body a a function of depth for a person at the air - ground interface of a semi-infinite half space of air which is uniformly contaminated with a radioactive photon emitter . the method involves calculating the photon flux density a a function of energy in an infinite air medium and using the computed spectrum a a source incident upon the reference man phantom . interaction of the photon in the body are followed by monte carlo technique and resulting dose rate determined at <nUm> initial photon energy ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> MeV . dose rate at other initial photon energy may be obtained by interpolation . perturbation of the surface dose rate from one - half the equilibrium value far inside the cloud due to the change in density and composition at the air - ground interface are shown to be small . perturbation in the dose rate due to the presence of the phantom are considered in detail . In the title compound , [Zr(C16H13P)Cl2] , the geometry at the metal atom is distorted tetrahedral ; the Cl-Zr-Cl angle is <nUm> ( 16 ) ° and the cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) centroid subtend an angle of <nUm> ( 3 ) ° at the Zr atom . the P atom lie <nUm> ( 3 ) and <nUm> ( 3 ) Å out of the plane of the cp ring . the C-P-C angle of <nUm> ( 7 ) ° reflects the pincer effect of the two cp ring . three C-H ⋯ Cl , one C-H ⋯ P , one C-H ⋯ π and one Cl ⋯ P inter-action link the mol - ecules to form thick layer parallel to the bc plane . the title compound , dichlorobis{e 5-[1-(3-methylbutyl)-cyclohex-1-yl]cyclopentadienyl}zirconium(IV) , [ZrCl2-(C16H25)2] , ha a pseudo-tetrahedral bent - metallocene structure in which the substituted cyclopentadienyl ring are asymmetrically bonded to the central Zr atom , due primarily to the interaction between the large substituents and the C1 atom . the molecule ha local C2 symmetry with the substituents positioned in a trans arrangement and directed towards the lateral sector of the bent - metallocene unit . the distribution of the d electron over the corresponding orbitals in transition - metal complex is a central concept in the theory of metal - ligand bonding . the description requires the assignment of an axis of quantization , which is unambiguous in symmetric environment but not clear - cut in the now commonly encountered case of a low - symmetry coordination environment . As the d-electron population can be derived from accurate diffraction data using the method of charge - density analysis [ holladay et al. ( 1983 ) . acta cryst. A39 , 377-387 ] , the need for an appropriate procedure is relevant in this area of crystallography . several criterion for the choice of coordinate system based on the resulting orbital population are discussed . they are tested on a cobalt atom in a trigonal bipyramidal site and applied to transition - metal site in cutt - alanylvaline , and an open zirconocene . the population of the d-orbital cross term for the different coordinate - system orientation is used to judge the result . In the case examined , the intuitively most reasonable coordinate system corresponds to the one with smaller value of the sum of the population of the d-orbital cross term . the title compound , [ C5H5Zr2 4(C16H15PS)2]*2CH 2Cl2 , wa prepared by insertion of diphosphinoacetylene into the Zr - C bond of the transient ( e2-thioaldehyde ) zirconocene formed by treatment of Cp2ZrMe2 with one equivalent of ethanediol . the sulfonium zirconocenate complex exhibit a centrosymmetric sulfur - bridged dimeric structure . the title compound , [ Zr(C5H5)2Cl(C 20H24N ) ] , is the second example of an enamido zirconocene to be crystallographically characterized . the geometry about nitrogen is planar , but the orientation of the aryl and vinyl substituents indicates that the nitrogen lone pair is not conjugated with their p-systems . these feature are attributed to the steric bulk of the complex . the title compound , [CrZr(C5H5)2(C2H3O)Cl(CO)5] , consists of two metal centre , with a (penta-carbonyl-chromium)oxymethyl-carbene group coordinating a a monodentate ligand to the zirconocene chloride . p-Delocalization through the Zr - O - C = Cr unit is indicated by a short Zr - O distance [ <nUm> ( 3 ) Å ] and a nearly linear Zr - O - C angle [ <nUm> ( 3 ) ° ] . mol - ecules are aligned with their mol - ecular plane ( through Zr , Cl , carbene and Cr ) parallel to the ab plane . C - H ⋯ Cl inter-actions result in zigzag chain of mol - ecules propagating parallel to the b axis . the title compound , [ Zr3(C14H20Si 2)3O3 ] , consists of three disila - bridged zirconocene nit , which are connected via an oxide ligand , forming a nearly planar six - membered ring with a maximum displacement of <nUm> ( 8 ) Å . the compound wa isolated a a by - product from a mixture of [ ( C5H 4SiMe2)2ZrCl2 ] and Li[AlH <nUm> ] in Et2O . the title compound , [ C5H5Zr3 6Cl2O2 ] , exists a discrete molecule possessing a series of three Cp2Zr unit ( cp is cyclopentadienyl ) bridged by oxide ligand and end - capped by chloride ligand . the cp plane in the central and terminal zirconocene unit form dihedral angle of <nUm> ( 2 ) and <nUm> ( 2 ) ° , respectively . the two Zr - O - Zr bridge angle are nearly linear and form a planar O2Zr3 core . the molecule bear C2 symmetry with the central Zr atom lying on a crystallographic twofold axis . the title compound , [FeZr2(C5H5)4Cl2(C13H18B2)] , is a heteronuclear complex that consists of a [3]ferrocenophane moiety substituted at each cyclopentadienyl ( cp ) ring by a BH3 group ; the BH3 group is bonded via two H atom to the Zr atom of the zirconocene chloride moiety in a bidentate fashion . the two cp ring of the [3]ferrocenophane moiety are aligned at a dihedral angle of <nUm> ( 4 ) ° arising from the strain of the propane-1,3-diyl bridge linking the two cp ring . [ one methylene group is disordered over two position with a site - occupation factor of <nUm> ( 18 ) for the major occupied site . ] the dihedral angle between the cp ring at the two Zr atom are <nUm> ( 3 ) and <nUm> ( 3 ) ° . the bonding Zr ⋯ H distance are in the range <nUm> (7)-2.14 ( 7 ) Å . As the two cp ring of the ferrocene unit are connected by an ansa bridge , the two Zr atom approach each other at <nUm> ( 1 ) Å . the crystal packing feature C - H ⋯ Cl interaction . alkyl zirconocene cation have been of considerable interest a reactive specie in many polymerization process . In the crystal structure of the title compound , [ Zr(C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > )(C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ](C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > HB < inf > <nUm> < / inf > F < inf > <nUm> < / inf > O ) , the [ Zr(C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ( (t-Bu)-C = C(H) - C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ( t-Bu ) ) ] < sup > + < / sup > cation display a buta-1-en-3-yne ligand side-on coordinated to a typical bent zirconocene [ centroid(cp)-Zr - centroid(cp) = <nUm> ° , Zr - c(buta-1-en-3-yne) = <nUm> ( 3 ) , <nUm> ( 3 ) and <nUm> ( 2 ) Å ] . In the [ HO(B(C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > F < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ] < sup > - < / sup > anion , intramolecular O - H ⋯ F hydrogen bond are observed . one tert-butyl group in the complex cation is disordered over two set of site with occupancy <nUm> : <nUm> . the title compound , [Zr2(C10H15)4(C6H6N2)2]*C6H14 , wa obtained by the stoichiometric reaction of adiponitrile with [Zr(C10H15)2(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3)] . intramolecular nitrile - nitrile coupling and deprotonation of the substrate produced the (1-imino-2-enimino)cyclopentane ligand , which function a a five - membered bridge between the two metal atom . the IVZr atom exhibit a distorted tetrahedral coordination sphere defined by two pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand , by the imino unit of one (1-imino-2-enimino)cyclopentane and by the enimino unit of the second (1-imino-2-enimino)cyclopentane . the cyclopentane ring of the ligand show an envelope conformation . the asymmetric unit contains one half of the complex and one half of the hexane solvent molecule , both being completed by the application of inversion symmetry . one of the pentamethylcyclopentadienyl ligand is disordered over two set of site with a refined occupancy ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> . In the crystal , the complex molecule are packed into rod extending along [100] , with the solvent molecule located in between . the rod are arranged in a distorted hexagonal packing . transition metal are known to stabilize high - energy specie and to activate otherwise unreactive one . the zirconocene unit stabilizes highly strained alkyne and alkene , allowing their use in selective carbon-carbon bond - forming reaction . this unit also increase the reactivity of unactivated molecule , enabling them to participate in nontraditional transformation . A general route ha been developed that allows a wider variety of unsaturated fragment to participate in these reaction . the use of these zirconocene complex in organic synthesis ha led to the development of novel route to a number of polyfunctionalized organic molecule . triphenylmethyl salt of the very weakly - coordinating borate anion [CN{B(C6F5)3}2]- ( 1 ) , [H2N{(C6F5)3}2] - and [ M{CNB(C6F5)3} 4]2- ( m = Ni , Pd ) have been prepared in simple one - pot reaction . mixture of (SBI)ZrMe2 / <nUm> / AlBu <nUm> i ( SBI = rac-Me2Si(Ind)2 ) are 30-40 time more active in ethylene polymerization at 60-100 ° C than BCl2ISZr / MAO . the quantification of anion effect on propene polymerization activity at <nUm> ° C give the order [CN{B(C6F5)3}2] - > [ H2N{(C6F5)3} 2]- ≈ BC6F5 <nUm> - ≫ [MeB(C6F5)3]- . the highest productivity were of the order of ca. <nUm> × <nUm> g PP ( mol zr)-1 h-1 [C3H6]-1 , about <nUm> - <nUm> time higher than with BC6F5 <nUm> - a the counter anion . the titanium system CGCTiMe <nUm> / <nUm> / AlBu <nUm> i gave activity that were very similar to the zirconocene catalyst . the concentration of active specie [C*] a determined by quenched - flow kinetic technique indicates typical value of around <nUm> % , independent of the counter anion , for both the borate and MAO system . pulsed field - gradient spin echo and nuclear overhauser effect NMR experiment on system designed to be more realistic model for active specie with longer polymeryl chain , (SBI)M(CH2SiMe3)(m-Me) BC18F15 and [ (SBI)MCH2SiMe <nUm> + ... BC6F5 <nUm> - ] ( m = Zr , Hf ) , demonstrated the influence of bulky alkyl chain on the ion pair solution structure : while the MeB(C6F 5)3 compound exists a a simple inner - sphere ion - pair , the BC6F5 <nUm> - compound is an outer - sphere ion pair ( OSIP ) , a consequence of the relegation of the anion into the second coordination sphere by the g-agostic interaction with the alkyl ligand . the OSIP aggregate to ion hextuples ( <nUm> mM ) or quadruple ( <nUm> mM ) . implication for the polymerization mechanism are discussed ; the process follows an associative interchange ( I a ) pathway . ethylene and propylene polymerization on immobilized catalyst of composition MMT-H2O / AlR3 / Zr - cene ( MMT = montmorillonite ) and on the corresponding homogeneous catalyst of composition Zr-cene-MAO ( Zr - cene = rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 , rac-Me2Si(Ind) 2ZrCl2 , rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind) 2ZrCl2 , rac-1-(9-e5-Flu)2-(5,6-Cp2-Me-1- e5-Ind)Et]ZrCl2 ) is considered . here , the activating support for the zirconocenes is montmorillonite containing methylaluminoxane or isobutylaluminoxane synthesized directly on the monmorillonite surface by the partial hydrolysis of an alkylaluminum ( AlMe3 , Al(i-Bu)3 , Al(i-Bu)2H ) with the mobile water of the support ( MMT-H 2O / AlR3 ) . the MMT-H2O / AlR3 support are demonstrated to be effective activator for ansa - zirconocenes . the catalytic property of the immobilized system ( process kinetics and efficiency , the molar mass of the resulting polymer , and the structure of the macromolecule ) depend on the activating support and the zirconocene precatalyst . the complex of the MMT-H2O / Al(i-Bu)3 support with all zirconocene precatalysts are more active in propylene polymerization than the same complex of MMT-H2O / AlMe3 . the zirconcenes immobilized on MMT-H2O / AlR3 afford polyethylene and polypropylene with a higher molar mass than the corresponding homogeneous system . furthermore , immobilization cause activesite heterogeneity . As compared to the homogeneous single - site catalyst of composition Zr-cene-MAO , the corresponding catalyst immobilized on MMT-H2O / AlR3 / Zr - cene are more stereospecific in the case of rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl <nUm> ( C <nUm> symmetry ) and are le stereospecific in the case of rac-[1-(9-e5-Flu)2-(5,6-Cp-2-Me-1-e5-Ind)Et] Cl2Zr ( C s symmetry ) . the kinetics of methyl methacrylate polymerization in the presence of benzoyl peroxide + metallocene ( ferrocene , titanocene dichloride , and zirconocene dichloride ) initiating system is considered , and the effect of the nature and amount of metallocene in the system are reported . the polymerization is assumed to be a complex - radical process . the structure of the complex - radical site of chain propagation and a scheme of their formation are deduced from quantum - chemical calculation . A new zirconocene ansa-Me2Si-(2Me-4-p-Tol-cyclopenta[b]indol-3- yl)2ZrCl2 complex ( I ) , in which the cp ligand is fused with the indole ring , ha been synthesized and studied by x-ray diffraction anal- ysis . light brown crystal are triclinic , space group P1 ; m = <nUm> , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A3 , z = <nUm> , rcalc = <nUm> g / cm3 . the structural parameter of complex I are compared with the known bis-indenyl zirconium complex : rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( II ) and rac-Me 2Si(2Me-2Ph-1-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( III ) and analogous substituted rac-Me2Si(2,5-Me2-3Ph-6-Cp[b]Tp) 2ZrCl2 ( IV ) and rac-Me2Si(2,5-Me 2-1Ph-4-Cp[b]Py)2ZrCl2 ( V ) . complex I alkylated by the grignard reagent ( MgMe2 ) in the presence of the Al-iso-Bu3 cocatalyst is an effi- cient catalyst for the polymerization of propylene into isotactic polypropylene . density functional theory wa used to study gas - phase reaction between the Cp2*ZrMe+ cation , where cp* = C 5H5 ( 1 ) , Me5Cp = C5Me5 ( 2 ) , and flu = C13H9 ( 3 ) , and the ethylene molecule , Cp2*ZrMe+ + CH2 → Cp2*ZrPr+ → Cp2*ZrAllyl + + H . the reactivity of the cp2* ZrMe+ cation with respect to the ethylene molecule decreased in the series <nUm> > <nUm> ≈ <nUm> . substitution in the cp ring decreased the reactivity of the Cp2*ZrMe+ cation toward ethylene , in agreement with the experimental data on the comparative reactivity of complex <nUm> and <nUm> . the two main energy barrier along the reaction path ( the formation of the C-C bond leading to the primary product Cp2*ZrPr+ and hydride shift leading to the secondary product Cp2*Zr(H 2)Allyl+ ) vary in opposite direction in the series of the compound studied . for flu ( 3 ) , these barrier are close to each other , and for the other compound , the formation of the C-C bond requires the overcoming of a higher energy barrier . A comparison of the result obtained with the data on the activity of zirconocene catalyst in real catalytic system for the polymerization of ethylene led u to conclude that the property of the catalytic center changed drastically in the passage from the model reaction in the gas phase to real catalytic system . the effect of zirconocene dichloride and it indene - containing derivative on the radical polymerization of methyl methacrylate initiated by benzoyl peroxide ha been studied . the influence of the metallocenes on the kinetic parameter of the process and the average degree of polymerization ha been established . concentration and temperature dependence have been measured for the initial rate of reaction and the average degree of polymerization in relation to the content of the component in the system . the microstructure of poly(methyl methacrylate ) prepared in the presence of the used initiation system ha been determined . the copolymerization of ethylene with propylene in the liquid propylene initiated by ansa - metallocenes of the C <nUm> symmetry , rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl-1- e5-indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride and rac-[1-(9- e5-fluorenyl)-2-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl-1-e5- indenyl)ethane]hafnium dichloride , activated by methylaluminoxane ha been studied . triisobutylaluminum ha been used a a cocatalyst . the propylene-ethylene copolymer thus prepared contain 5-60 mol % ethylene unit . the reactivity ratio have been measured . In the case of the zirconocene - based catalyst , the molecular mass of the copolymer decrease with an increase in the content of ethylene unit . the reverse situation is observed in the case of the hafnocene - based catalytic system . the copolymer are characterized by the low T g value ( down to <nUm> ° C ) . incorporation of a small amount of ethylene unit ( <nUm> mol % ) result in a rise in the elastomeric behavior of the polymer . the quantum - chemical model formerly designed is described , which explains the high reactivity of the d 0-transition metal-carbon s-bond in concerted reaction including polymerization of olefin . In this model , the energy of transition from the ground singlet state to the excited singlet or triplet state corresponding to the transfer of electron density from the metal-carbon bond to vacant d-atomic orbitals correlate with it relative elongation after which a change in the valence state of a metal begin . this change is caused by the difference in the geometry of valence s- , p- , and d-atomic orbitals having close energy ; a a result , at a certain bond elongation , partial uncoupling of electron involved in bonding take place so that one of them becomes localized on d-atomic orbital . this process facilitates formation of the reactive state of the bond of the biradical type and lead to a reduction in the energy barrier of the insertion of an olefin molecule into this bond . lower energy of this barrier correspond to lower value of DE(S <nUm> → S j ) and DE(S <nUm> → T j ). As shown at the example of zirconocenes cp 2ZrMe2 and Me2CCp2ZrMe2 , alongside with a reduction in the energy barrier of olefin insertion into the Zr-Me bond of the cationic complex being formed , the characteristic absorption band in the spectrum of the corresponding neutral derivative shift to the long - wave region . this band is attributed to the transfer of the electron density from the Zr-Me bond to the Zr atom . analysis is performed of the cause for bathochromic shift of the long - wave absorption band for adduct formation in the system including metallocene and Al - containing cocatalyst . the compositional heterogeneity of ethylene-1-hexene copolymer synthesized with various type of supported catalyst , namely , the titanium - magnesium catalyst Cl4Ti / Cl2Mg and the zirconocene catalyst OSi 2(MAO) / Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 , is studied via the method of successive self-nucleation-annealing ( SSA ) with the use of differential scanning calorimetry . on the basis of the data on the temperature of individual peak on SSA curve , the thickness of lamella composed of macromolecule with a certain degree of short - chain branching is estimated . the copolymer synthesized with the zirconocene catalyst ha a narrower range of fusion and doe not contain large lamella composed of molecule with a low degree of short - chain branching . with the use of the broadness index , it is shown that the copolymer synthesized with the zirconocene catalyst ha a more uniform distribution of the comonomer than doe the copolymer synthesized with the titanium - magnesium catalyst . for the copolymer synthesized with the titanium - magnesium catalyst , the compositional heterogeneity increase with an increase in the content of 1-hexene . the free - radical polymerization of methyl methacrylate initiated by the three - component system ferrocene - zirconocene dichloride-benzoyl peroxide ha been studied . the kinetic feature of the process , the interaction between component of the initiation system , and the molecular characteristic of the polymer have been investigated . In the case of the three - component initiation system , the content of syndiotactic fragment grows and the thermal stability of the polymer is improved compared to the product of polymerization carried out in the presence of solely a peroxide initiator . the effect of the nature of metallocene ( ferrocene , titanocene dichloride , and zirconocene dichloride ) and it content in benzoyl peroxide - metallocene initiating system on the kinetics of polymerization of methyl methacrylate have been studied . the kinetic feature of polymerization and change in the molecular characteristic of poly(methyl methacrylate ) indicate that the process occurs via the complex - radical mechanism . on the basis of quantum - chemical calculation , a scheme describing the formation of complex - radical center of chain propagation for the benzoyl peroxide - ferrocene system is proposed . anchored aluminoxanes are synthesized by the reaction of aluminum alkyl AlMe3 and Al(i-Bu)3 with water contained in the intracrystalline cavity of synthetic and natural zeolite ( NaY ( Si : Al = <nUm> ) , HZSM-5 ( Si : Al = <nUm> or <nUm> ) , NH4ZSM-5 ( Si : Al = <nUm> ) , NaZSM-5 ( Si : Al = <nUm> ) , and clinoptilolite - containing tuff ) and are used for the synthesis of heterogenized complex of ansa - zirconocenes ( rac-C2H 4(Ind)2ZrCl2 , rac-Me2Si(Ind) 2ZrCl2 , and rac-[1-(9-e5-Flu)-2-(5,6- cyclopenta-2-Me-1-e5-Ind)C2H4]ZrCl <nUm> ) active in the polymerization of propylene . the nature of the zeolite support determines the content of zeolite water and affect the formation of anchored alkylaluminoxanes and the activity of immobilized catalyst . among the studied catalytic system supported on zeolite , NaY and NaZSM-5 are the most efficient for the polymerization of propylene . PP synthesized with the supported zirconocene catalyst ha a higher molecular mass and a wider molecular - mass distribution than those in the case of the corresponding homogeneous catalyst . the index of isotacticity and the content of pentad mmmm in PP prepared with immobilized metallocenes with the C <nUm> symmetry , such a rac-C2H4(Ind) 2ZrCl2 and rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl <nUm> , are likewise higher . the stereoselectivity of supported catalyst depends on the zeolite nature . the main spectral - luminescent property of organometallic complex of Ti , Zr , and Hf with aromatic ligand are examined . this class of compound exhibit highly emissive ( phosphorescent ) ligand - to - metal charge transfer ( LMCT ) state . the linear dependence of the phosphorescent characteristic of zirconocene on parameter that describe the molecular structure of organic medium and also the nature of coordinative ( inner- and outersphere ) interaction of the phosphorescent metal complex with medium molecule is discussed . bis(e 5-cyclopentadienyl)-2,4-bis(trimethylsilylethynyl)-3,5- bis(trimethylsilyl)titanacyclopenta-2,4-diene ( 1 ) and the seven - membered zirconacyclocumulene bis(e 5-cyclopemadienyl)-2,4,7-tris(trimethylsilyl)-3- ( trimethylsilylethynyl ) zirconacyclohepta-2,4,5,6-tetraene ( 2 ) react with sulfur monochloride to yield an identical product , 2,4-bis(trimethylsilylethynyl)-3,5-bis(trimethylsilyl)thiophene ( 3 ) . A one - to - one mixture of the homo-and heterobimetallic bis-s,p-acetylide bridged complex Cp2Ti(m-e1:e2-C ≡ CSiMe 3)M(m-e1:e2-C ≡ CSiMe 3)Cp2 ( m = Zr ( 4 ) , m = Ti ( 5 ) ) is formed in the reaction of zirconacyclocumulene <nUm> with three equivalent of Cp2Ti(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) . the reaction proceeds most likely via alkyne elimination , a C-C-single bond activation , and the cleavage of the starting diyne lake place . various zirconacyclopentadienes fully substituted at the metallacycle react with ethynyl-ferrocene in the presence of [ NiBr2(PPh 3)2 ] or with methyl or ethyl 3-ferrocenylpropynoates in the presence of ClCu to give penta- and hexasubstituted phenylferrocenes , respectively . X-Ray diffraction analysis showed that the cyclopentadienyl and benzene ring in (5,8-diphenyl-1,2,3,4-tetrahydronapthalen-6-yl)ferrocene are rotated by a much a <nUm> ° . the titanocene complex Cp'Ti(m2-Me 3SlC2SiMe3 ) ( cp' = cp* ( 1 ) , cp* ( 2 ) ) react with pyrrole under the formation of the titanium (III) mono-N-pyrrolides Cp'2Ti(NC4H4) ( cp' = cp ( 6 ) , cp* ( 7 ) ) ; whereas the corresponding zirconocene system Cp2Zr(m2-Me3SiC2SiMe 3)(thf) ( 3 ) form in a different reaction pathway first the cp 2Zr(NC4H4)[C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe <nUm> ) ] ( 8 ) and then the zirconium(IV) bis-N-pyrrolide cp 2Zr(NC4H4)2 ( 11 ) . with Cp*2Zr(m2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( 4 ) and pyrrole , the zirconium(IV) mono-N-pyrrolide with an agostic alkenyl group Cp*2Zr(NC4H 4)[C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe3) ] ( 9 ) wa obtained . In the reaction of the ethylene-bistetrahydroindenyl ( ebthi ) complex rac-(ebthi)Zr(m2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) ( 5 ) with 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoroaniline under N-H bond activation , a complex with an agostic alkenyl group rac-(ebthi)Zr(NH-C6HF4)[C(SiMe <nUm> ) = CH(SiMe3) ] ( 10 ) wa formed . compound <nUm> reacts with additional 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoroaniline to give the bisanilide rac-(ebthi)Zr(NH-C6HF4)2 ( 12 ) which wa obtained directly from <nUm> with two equivalent of 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoroaniline .
