2,3,4,5-tetramethyl-1-(dimethylsilyl)cyclopenta-2,4-diene with [ZrCl4] in boiling THF . the reduction of <nUm> with excess magnesium in THF in the presence of excess bis(trimethylsilyl)- acetylene ( btmsa ) afforded the bivalent metal ansa-disilylene complex with p-coordinated btmsa [ Zr(e2-btmsa){e5-C5Me4(SiMe 2)}2 ] ( 2 ) . the dehydrocoupling of SiMe2H group wa accompanied by a hydrogen transfer to releasing btmsa to give a mixture of cis- and trans- 1,2-bis(trimethylsilyl)ethene . chlorination of <nUm> with ClPb <nUm> afforded ansa-[Zr{e5-C5Me4- (SiMe2)}2Cl2 ] ( 3 ) and liberated btmsa . the crystal structure of complex , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by x-ray crystallography . chiral amino-functionalized silicon - bridged indene derivative 4a-4c were synthesized from 3-(2-(N,N-dialkylamino)ethyl)indenes 2a-2c . the C-Si coupling reaction are regioselective , leading exclusively to the formation of 1,3-disubstituted isomer in a rac / meso ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> , a indicated by NMR spectroscopy . the solid - state structure of the dimethylsilyl-bridged bisindene (R,R)-4a is described . the formation of corresponding ansa - zirconocenes via amine elimination chemistry wa monitored by 1H NMR spectroscopy . this article highlight some of our recent effort and present new data on the importance of cyclopentadienyl substituent effect on group <nUm> metallocene dinitrogen chemistry . reaction such a the coordination of N to an isolated titanium sandwich complex , alkali - metal reduction of zirconocene dihalide complex , alkane reductive elimination reaction , and the hydrogenation of zirconium dinitrogen complex are all extremely sensitive to the group present on the cyclopentadienyl ring . these result are promising for the future of N fixation , a the reactivity of a specific metallocene can be dramatically altered by subtle manipulation in ligand substituents . the 15-thia-15-deoxy analogue of prostaglandin E1 methyl ester ha been prepared by the zirconocene chloride mediated conjugate addition of an n-pentyl ethynyl sulfide derived anion to an appropriately substituted cyclopentenone . similar methodology ha also been used to prepare other 3-(3'-thia-1'-octenyl)-cyclopentanones . CO insertion and C-C reductive elimination involved in the carbonylation of the metallacyclic zirconocene complex , 1,1-bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)-1- zirconaindan ( r ) , have been theoretically studied with the aid of DFT calculation at the B3LYP level . it is found that the c(sp3)- c(sp2) reductive elimination is preferred over c(sp <nUm> ) - c(sp2) , and importantly , this preference for C-C reductive elimination directs the CO insertion into the Zr - c(sp2) bond rather than the Zr - c(sp3) bond , even though the CO insertion into the former bond is kinectically le favorable than into the latter bond , a result related to that the CO insertion is found to be reversible . the synthesis and spectroscopic study of metalloporphyrin dimer having 1,3-butadiyne linker attached to the beta pyrrolic position of the linked porphyrin are reported . bromoethenyl metalloporphyrins were synthesized by zirconocene - promoted bromomethylenation of beta formyl metalloporphyrins . bromoethenyl metalloporphyrins were dehydrohalogenated by potassium tertbutoxide to give beta ethynyl or 2-ethynyl metalloporphyrins . it is the first documented example of zirconocene - promoted bromomethylenation of beta formyl metalloporphyrins . bromoethenyl metalloporphyrins were also synthesized by halo - wittig route . 2-ethynyl metalloporphyrins were self dimerized to give metalloporphyrin dimer having 1,3-butadiyne linking bridge . FTIR , raman spectroscopy , UV - visible , elemental analysis , 1H NMR and mass spectrometry were used to characterize the compound . the purpose of this paper is to summarize mode of action of cisplatin on the tumor cell , a brief outlook on the metallocene compound a antitumor drug a well a the future tendency for the use of the latter in anticancer chemotherapy . molecular mechanism of cisplatin interaction with DNA , DNA repair mechanism , and cellular protein are discussed . molecular background of the sensitivity and resistance to cisplatin , a well a it influence on the efficacy of the antitumor immune response wa evaluated . furthermore , herein are summarized some metallocenes ( titanocene , vanadocene , molybdocene , ferrocene , and zirconocene ) with high antitumor activity . ethylene polymerization wa done to form polyethylene nano-composite with nanoaluminum nitride using zirconocene catalyst . result show that the catalytic activity is maximum at a filler loading of <nUm> mg nanoaluminum nitride . differential scanning calorimeter ( DSC ) and x-ray diffraction ( XRD ) result show that percentage crystallinity wa also marginally higher at this amount of filler . thermal behavior of polyethylene nanocomposites ( <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> ) mg wa studied by DSC and thermal gravimetric analyzer ( TGA ) . morphology of the component with <nUm> mg aluminium nitride is more fibrous a compared to <nUm> mg aluminium nitride and higher filler loading a shown by SEM image . In order to understand combustibility behavior , test were performed on microcalorimeter . it result showed decrease in combustibility in polyethylene nanocomposites a the filler loading increase . two commercial nanoclays were used here a catalytic filler for production of polyethylene ( PE ) and linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) nanocomposites via in situ polymerization with zirconocene / MAO catalyst . it wa found that both type of nanoclays designated a clay A and clay B can improve thermal stability to the host polymer a observed from a thermal gravimetric analysis ( TGA ) . the distribution of the clay inside the polymer matrix appeared good due to the in situ polymerization system into which the clay were introduced during the polymer forming reaction . upon investigating the clay by x-ray diffractometer ( XRD ) and fourier transform infrared spectroscopy ( FTIR ) , it wa observed that the crucial difference between the two clay are the crystallite size ( A < B ) and the amount of amine group ( A < B ) . the higher amount of amine group in clay B wa supposed to be a major reason for the lower catalytic activity of the polymerization system compared to clay A resulting from it deactivating effect on zirconocene catalyst . however , for both clay , increasing their content in the polymerization system reduced the catalytic activity due to the higher steric hindrance occurring . polypropylene wa synthesized using binary metallocene catalyst , rac-ethylenebis-(1-e5-indenyl)-zirconium dichloride ( rac - Et(Ind) 2ZrCl2 : cata A ) and zirconocene dichloride ( cp 2ZrCl2 : cata B ) , in the presence of ZnEt2 . the result indicated that ZnEt2 wa an effective agent in modulating isotactivity of polypropylene . moreover , it wa found that the [mmmm] pentad value of polypropylene prepared in the presence of diethyl zinc decreased to <nUm> , and the new peak of [rmmr] and [ rmrr + mmrm ] appeared , in contrast to the peak from polyproplene obtained in the absence of diethyl zinc . therefore , the possible reason wa the occurrence of chain - shuttling polymerization in the CataA / CataB / ZnEt2 catalyst system . In our experiment , monospheres ( ball of silica , diameter 200-250 nm ) , carbon fiber ( diameter <nUm> nm , length 0.5-3 mm ) and carbon nanotube ( diameter 15-25 nm , length <nUm> mm ) were used a filler . before polymerization , the filler were separated by ultrasound and then treated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the MAO reacts partially with the OH - group of the silica and the formation of methane . catalytically active center are formed after adding the zirconocenes or other transition metal complex . the thickness of the polyolefins can be controlled by the pressure of ethene or propene and by the polymerization time . by this method , highly filled nanocomposite polypropene can be obtained with a silica content of up to <nUm> wt % . such combined material are stiff and hard . every particle is surrounded by a thin film of polyolefin with a thickness of <nUm> to <nUm> nm . carbon fiber and carbon nanotube can be covered also within isotactic or syndiotactic polypropene . because of the hydrophobic character of the carbon surface , the polymer is drawing on the fiber . this lead to a reinforced combined polymer with special property . different metallocene catalyst were used to synthesize propene / 1-hexene and ethene / styrene copolymer . for the propene / 1-hexene copolymerization , [Me2Si(2-Me-4-PhInd)2]ZrCl2 and [Me2Si(2-Me-4-NaphthylInd)2]ZrCl2 give high activity and random copolymer . In contrast for the ethene / styrene copolymerization , silyl-bridged zirconocenes produce polymer with only a low amount of styrene unit . here , isopropyl-bridged C2 and CS symmetric zirconocenes incorporate high amount of styrene up to <nUm> mol % . A comparison wa carried out in respect of the catalyst activity and it ability to incorporate styrene a well a of the property of the resulting polymer , such a molar mass , melting and glass transition temperature . metallocene complex Cp2TiCl2 , cp 2ZrCl2 , Cp2Zr(NnBu2) <nUm> , Cp2Ti(e 1-OC(O)C6H 5)2 and Cp2Zr(e 1-OC(O)C 6H5)2 were supported on ClMg <nUm> / SiCl4-n (n-C6H13O)n carrier and used for ethylene polymerization . the supported complex result in highly active catalyst when treated with different aluminum alkyl-based co-catalysts . these catalyst are able of tuning the final property of the produced polyethylene . mixed composite of metallocenes and conventional ziegler - natta catalyst supported on the same carrier were also studied . A supported zirconocene Cp2Zr(e 1-OC(O)C 6H5)2 on Cl2Mg / SiCl4-n (n-C6H13O)n resulted in a highly active catalyst that eject control on the molecular weight , crystallinity and morphology of the resultant polyethylene . background : monomeric group IVB ( Ti , Zr and Hf ) metallocenes represent a new class of antitumor compound . there is literature on the general biological activity of some organotin compound . unfortunately , there is little information with respect to the molecular level activity of these organotin compound . we recently started focusing on the anti-cancer activity of organotin polymer that we had made for other purpose and a part of our platinum anti-cancer effort . method : for this study , we synthesized a new series of metallocene - containing compound coupling the metallocene unit with dienestrol , a synthetic , nonsteroidal estrogen . this is part of our effort to couple known moiety that offer antitumor activity with biologically active unit hoping to increase the biological activity of the combination . the material were confirmed to be polymeric using light scattering photometry and the structural repeat unit wa verified employing matrix assisted laser desorption ionization mass spectrometry and infrared spectroscopy result . result : the polymer demonstrated the ability to suppress the growth of a series of tumor cell line originating from breast , colon , prostrate , and lung cancer at concentration generally lower than those required for inhibition of cell growth by the commonly used antitumor drug cisplatin . conclusion : these drug show great promise in vitro against a number of cancer cell line and due to their polymeric nature will most likely be le toxic than currently used metal - containing drug such a cisplatin . these drug also offer several addition positive aspect . first , the reactant are commercially available so that additional synthetic step are not needed . second , synthesis of the polymer is rapid , occurring within about <nUm> second . third , the interfacial synthetic system is already industrially employed in the synthesis of aromatic nylon and polycarbonates . thus , the ability to synthesize large amount of the drug is straight forward . lithium dimesitylgermanedithiolate reacted with titanocene or zirconocene dichloride to give 2,2-dimesityl-1,3-dithia-2-germa-4-titanacycle ( 3a ) and it zirconocene analogue ( 3b ) , which afforded a stable 2,3,4,5-tetrathiagermolane ( 4 ) in treatment with ClS . the reaction of 3b with Ph2GeCl2 gave unsymmetric 1,3,2,4-dithiadigermetane ( 5 ) . the bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl) derivative of cis-2,3-di-t-butyl-2,3-diphenyl-1,4-dithia-2,3-disila-5-titanacyclopentane ( 7a ) obtained from lithium 1,2-di-t-butyl-1,2-diphenyldisilane-1,2-dithiolate reacted with electrophilic reagent ( Cl2S , ClS , ClSe , R2GeCl2 ) to give the corresponding heterocycle . novel zirconium - iron dinuclear complex , [ FcSiMe <nUm> ( r <nUm> r <nUm> Cp)ZrCl <nUm> cp ] ( fc ; ferrocenyl , r <nUm> = r <nUm> = H ; 2a , r <nUm> = me , r <nUm> = H ; 2b , r <nUm> = r <nUm> = me ; 2c , r <nUm> = ph , r <nUm> = H ; 2d ) , [ FcSiMe <nUm> Cp{ZrCl <nUm> ( me <nUm> cp ) } ] ( 3a ) , hafnium - iron dinuclear complex , [ FcSiMe <nUm> Cp{HfCl <nUm> ( me <nUm> cp ) } ] ( 3b ) and zirconium - iron trinuclear complex , [ ClZr <nUm> ( FcSiMe <nUm> cp ) <nUm> ] ( 4 ) , were synthesized and complex 2d and <nUm> were characterized by an x-ray diffraction method . olefin polymerization were conducted by using these multimetallic zirconocene catalyst with the coexistence of methylaluminoxane or tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borates . the maximum catalytic activity of complex <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> were observed at low temperature ( 15-45 ° C ) in ethylene polymerization , contrary to the conventional zirconocene catalyst ( [ ClZr <nUm> cp <nUm> ] ) , showing the maximum activity at between 70-80 ° C . A detailed investigation of ethylene polymerization and NMR measurement of the active specie suggested that the interesting behavior of these complex arose from an electronic cooperative effect between the zirconium and iron atom . it wa also revealed that complex <nUm> were highly reactive toward propylene or diene in the copolymerization of ethylene and propylene or terpolymerization of ethylene , propylene and diene . dialkylzirconocenes in situ generated such a Cp2Zr(n-Bu)2 , Cp2ZrEt2 , and Cp2Zr(t-Bu)(i-Bu) are thermolyzed to afford zirconocene - alkene complex . In the case of Cp2Zr(n-Bu)2 and Cp2Zr(t-Bu)(i-Bu) , Cp2Zr-alkene complex generated from them tend to act a a " Cp2Zr " equivalent , since the initially generated alkene is often replaced by another p-bond containing compound . In the presence of alkyne , for example , alkyne complex may be generated . on the other hand , Cp2Zr(ethylene) tends to serve a an intermediate since the ethylene moiety is often incorporated in the final organic product . ring expansion and contraction , ligand substitution , transmetallation , migratory insertion , stereoisomerization , regioisomerization , oxidative addition involving these Cp2Zr-alkene and Cp2Zr - alkyne complex a well a their structure are reviewed . this account describes recent development in carbon-carbon bond cleavage reaction and selective transformation of 5-membered zirconacycles , including zirconacyclopentanes , zirconacyclopentenes , and zirconacyclopentadienes . these zirconacycles can be prepared by coupling of unsaturated compound such a alkene and / or alkyne , but the zirconacycles also undergo b,b'-C-C bond cleavage , which ha been further applied to organic transformation reaction . combination of the b,b-C-C bond cleavage and the C-C bond formation on zirconocene provided a highly selective and novel transformation . vinylzirconation of alkyne , regioselective allylzirconation of alkyne , and coupling of alkyne with nitrile or ketone were achieved by this method . zirconacyclopentadienes prepared symmetrically or unsymmetrically were converted into naphthalene , diene , and benzene derivative . preparation of benzene derivative from three different alkyne wa performed by combination of C-C bond cleavage and C-C bond formation on zirconocene in one - pot in high yield with excellent selectivity . bis(cyclopentadienyl)zirconium chloride hydride ( schwartz reagent ) proved to be an efficient radical chain carrier for radical reduction of organic halide . treatment of 1-bromoadamantane with Cp2Zr(H)Cl in THF at <nUm> ° C in the presence of triethylborane furnished adamantane quantitatively . radical cyclization of 2-haloalkyl allyl ether afforded five - membered product under the same reaction condition . reduction with Cp2Zr(H)Cl generated in situ from Cp2ZrCl2 and sodium bis(2-methoxyethoxy)aluminium hydride ( Red-Al ) also proceeded smoothly . moreover , the reduction could function by using a catalytic amount of cp 2ZrCl2 . A zirconocene - olefin complex also induced reductive radical cyclization of 2-haloalkyl allyl ether in THF . this complex served a a single electron transfer reagent to promote the radical cyclization . furthermore , the cyclization reaction in DME afforded 3- tetrahydrofuranylmethylzirconium efficiently . one - pot synthesis of cyclohexene derivative from two alkyne and one maleic acid derivative could be achieved . two alkyne were treated with [ cp 2ZrBu <nUm> ] to give zirconacyclopentadienes . addition of <nUm> equiv of H 2O followed by the reaction with maleic anhydride at <nUm> ° C in toluene for <nUm> h afforded the cyclohexene derivative in high yield . the corresponding titanacyclopentadiene did not give the desired product under the same condition . In the case of Hf , only <nUm> % of the product wa obtained . dienylzirconocene , which could be prepared by the addition of one equiv of EtOH or t-BuOH to the zirconacyclopentadiene , also reacted with maleic anhydride to give the cyclohexene derivative in <nUm> and <nUm> % yield , respectively . the reaction of dilithiated silylene-bridged cp - ligand , whose silylene had one or two vinyl substituents , with Cl4Zr gave racemo - rich mixture of the complex RR'Si(C5H2-2,4-Me2)2ZrCl <nUm> ( <nUm> : r = vinyl , R' = me , rac / meso = <nUm> / <nUm> , <nUm> : r = R' = vinyl , rac / meso = <nUm> / <nUm> ) . the pure racemic complex 1-rac wa isolated after several recrystallization process in a satisfactory yield ( <nUm> % , rac / meso > <nUm> / <nUm> ) and wa structurally characterized . polymerization of propylene with 1-rac / MAO gave highly isotactic polypropylene . when aromatic halide were treated with alkylmagnesium reagent ( which have b-hydrogens ) and a catalytic amount of zirconocene dichloride , dehalogenation proceeded smoothly in high yield . the stoichiometric dehalogenation using dialkylzir - conocenes also proceeded with high selectivity . A zirconocene-ethylene complex C p2Zr(CH2 = CH2 ) - ( PMe3 ) reacted with R3EX ( e = Si , Ge , Sn ; r = ph or bu ; x = Cl , OE1 , or OER3 ) to give R3EEt in high yield after hydrolysis . the reaction mixture of the ethylene complex with Bu3SnCl further reacted with phenylacetylene to give homoallyltin compound . when the reaction mixture wa treated with Ph3SnCl or Ph3GeCl instead of phenylacetylene , Ph3SnEt or Ph3GcEt wa obtained in high yield after hydrolysis via the replacement of the b-SnBu3 moiety . nonbridged zirconocene dichloride , ( 1,2-Me <nUm> -4-RC <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( r = me ( 3 ) , ph ( 4 ) , p-FC <nUm> H <nUm> ( 5 ) , 2-furyl ( 6 ) , 2-thienyl ( 7 ) , and fc ( 8 ) ) , and meso- and rac-(1-Me-3-PhC <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) , in the presence of MAO show a high catalytic activity ( <nUm> - <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> gPP / molZr · h ) in the polymerization of propylene and produce almost an atactic elastomeric polymer of high molecular weight ( m w = <nUm> - <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> ). In contrast , rac-(1-Me-3-t-BuC <nUm> H <nUm> ) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> ( 12 ) show very low activity and produce a rather high isotactic polymer of low molecular weight . the introduction of furyl group to the position next to the silylene bridge of an ansa - zirconocene catalyst wa found to remarkably enhance the catalytic activity and the molecular weight of PP during the isospecific polymerization of propylene . A C2 - symmetric afwa - zirconocene complex which ha a Si-Cl moiety on it bridge wa immobilized on O2Si by the reaction of the Si-Cl anchor with Si-OH on the solid surface . the prepared solid catalyst wa found to be effective for isospecific propene polymerization . it exhibited higher productivity compared to a catalyst prepared using the zirconocene without a Si-Cl anchor . the effect of pretreatment of silica surface with Me3SiCl on catalyst performance is also described . zirconocene - mediated coupling of bis(methoxyethynyl)-disilanes ( 1a and 1e-g ) led to zirconacycles ( 2a and 2e-g ) , which were converted into 3,4-dialkylidene- and 3,4-benzo-1,2-disilacyclobutanes ( 3a and 6e-g ) via protonolysis and transmetallation with tin followed by diels - alder reaction . their Si-Si bond were reactive toward palladium catalyst to give bissilylation and silyl-Heck product ( <nUm> and <nUm> ) . novel zirconocene or hafnocene - containing silsesquioxanes with a vinyl group Cp2M{[(vinyl)Me2Si](c-C5H9)7Si7O12} ( cp = cyclopentadienyl , m = Zr , Hf ) were synthesized , a well a a derivative with a trimethylsilyl group Cp2Zr[(Me3Si)(c-C5H9)7Si7O12] . A derivative containing a dimethylethoxysilyl group wa also synthesized . DFT calculation clearly show that a zirconocene-ethylene complex , cp <nUm> Zr(C <nUm> H <nUm> ) , easily reacts with hydrosilane , HSi <nUm> , to afford either cp <nUm> Zr(H)(C <nUm> H <nUm> HSi <nUm> ) or cp <nUm> Zr(SiH <nUm> )(C <nUm> H <nUm> ). In the transition state , the Si-H anti-bonding s*-orbital of HSi <nUm> overlap well with the p-back donating molecular orbital between Zr d π and C <nUm> H <nUm> p* orbitals . Cp2ZrEt2 reacted with one equiv of Cp2ZrX2 ( x = Cl or Br ) in THF to afford ethylene-bridged bimetallic zirconocene complex , (Cp2ZrX)2(CH2CH2) ( x = Cl ( 2a ) , or Br ( 2b ) ) , in high yield . the structure of 2b wa determined by x-ray analysis . reaction of 2a-b with various anion Y- gave a series of ethylene-bridged bimetallic zirconocene complex , (Cp2ZrY)2-(CH2CH2) ( Y = ph , me , bu , CH2SiMe3 ) in good to high yield . new stereorigid bridged zirconocene having an indenyl group and a fluorenyl group a ligand wa synthesized and investigated a an ethylene / 1-hydroxy-10-undecene copolymerization catalyst . this catalyst using MAO a a cocatalyst promoted polymerization to produce copolymer having high molecular weight ( mw : <nUm> ) and high polar monomer content ( <nUm> mol % ) , displaying higher polymerization activity at higher temperature . the reaction of zirconocene - alkyne complex prepared from cp <nUm> ClZr <nUm> with BuLi and an alkyne with CMoO <nUm> yielded 2,3-disubstituted-5-ethylcyclopentenone derivative by incorporation of once eliminated butene with excellent regioselectivity . zirconium - mediated cyclization of an allyl-ene compound afforded organozirconium intermediate , which after alkylation ( allylation and acylation ) afforded either dienes or unsaturated ketone . these are considered to be precursor further elaboration of which should yield functionlized steroid . dimerization of aryl-substituted terminal alkyne on indenyl zirconium complex occurred in a selective way . 1,4-Aryl-1,3-diene derivative were formed exclusively after hydrolysis . it is in sharp contrast to the reaction on [Cp2Zr] complex . organometallic complex are useful tool in synthetic organic chemistry . we investigated a novel synthetic method for ring construction using organometallic complex and synthesized natural product and biologically active substance using these method . metalacycles formed from an early transition metal and diene , enyne , and diyne are stable under the reaction condition and they are easily converted into compound with functional group by the addition of various agent . we have developed a novel synthetic method of heterocycle from enyne and diene using Cp2ZrBu2 . the total synthesis of (-)-dendrobine , (+-)-mecembrane , and (+-)-mecembrine were achieved using this procedure . to synthesize these natural product a a chiral form , a novel palladium - catalyzed asymmetric allylic amination wa developed , and chiral 2-arylcyclohexenylamine derivative were synthesized . from these compound , the total synthesis of (-)-mesembrane , (-)-mesembrine , (+)-crinamine , (-)-haemanthidine , and (+)-pretazetine were achieved . by further development of this procedure , a chiral 2-siloxymethylcy-clohexenylamine derivative could be synthesized and the novel synthesis of indole derivative wa developed from this compound . from this indole derivative , (-)-tsubifoline and (-)-strychnine were synthesized . novel zirconium - mediated carbon-carbon bond - forming reaction were developed . the allylic , g-alkoxyallylic , allenyl , and g,g- dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie can be prepared from corresponding ether under mild condition through the addition of a zirconocene - butene complex to the carbon-carbon multiple bond of the ether and subsequent b-elimination of the alkoxyl group . the g,g-dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie reacts with carbonyl compound at the b-position of the zirconium atom like a ketene dialkyl acetal in the presence of stoichiometric amount of lewis acid and gave cyclopropane and / or cyclobutane derivative . intramolecular reaction of allylic zirconium specie with acetal also develops a a ring contraction reaction of carbohydrate and morpholine derivative . this method is useful for the construction of chiral highly functionalized carbocycles and pyrrolidines . the intramolecular ester transfer reaction through the zirconium - mediated coupling reaction of alkenyl carbamate gave g-aminobutyric acid derivative and pyrrolidine-3-carboxylic acid . four isomer of 5,7-dodecadien-l-ol were previously proposed a being the sex pheromone of the pine moth . the isomer were stereoselectively synthesized from 1-hexyne and tetrahydropyranyl ether of 5-hexyn-l-ol . the ( 5Z , 7Z ) - isomer wa synthesized by a chodkiewic cadiot reaction followed by hydroboration , and other three isomer by novel synthetic method including the addition of zirconocene hydride [ schwarz 's reagent C10ClH11Zn ] to control the regioselective coupling reaction . the 5,8- and 5,9-dodecadien-l-ol were also synthesized by similar method for comparison of their characteristic with the endogenous sex pheromone . stability of various fluorinated BPh4 anion in ion - pair metallocene catalyst system ha been studied . XPS measurement show that the incorporation of electron - withdrawing fluorine substituents decrease the electron density of boron drastically . the anion can be classified into three type according to the reactivity associated with it lewis basisity . i.e. , the number of fluorine substituents : ( 1 ) the anion without any fluorine substituent that reacts with Cp2ZrR with phenyl group transfer , ( 2 ) those with <nUm> – <nUm> fluorine substituents that react with trialkyl aluminium , and ( 3 ) those with <nUm> and <nUm> fluorine substituents that undergo no side reaction . practically , the stability of the anion is one of the most important requirement for the application of the ion-pair(non-MAO) metallocene catalyst . we have synthesized polyethylene and polypropylene copolymer having cyclopentane unit in the main chain by copolymerization of ethylene and propylene , respectively , with cyclopentene ( CPE ) or 1,5-hexadiene ( HD ) using metallocene catalyst . among the obtained copolymer , poly ( ethylene-co-HD ) , which ha 1,3-cyclopentane unit in the main chain , show isomorphism with a transition of the crystalline structure from orthorhombic to hexagonal . we used this finding for the molecular design of a liquid crystalline polyolefin . A liquid crystalline phase wa discovered in poly(methylene-1,3-cyclopentane) ( PMCP ) , which wa obtained by cyclization polymerization of HD using zirconocene catalyst . PMCPs clearly showed a birefringent texture which indicates a nematic liquid crystalline phase . A high cyclization selectivity of inserted HD unit , a high trans-content of the 1,3-cyclopentane unit , and a low molecular weight without crosslinking were necessary to induce the liquid crystalline phase . dinuclear complex attracted attention a ethylene and olefin polymerization catalyst because they frequently show different catalytic property than their mononuclear analogue . most of the known dinculear catalyst are composed of the same transition metal center . herein we synthesized novel dinuclear complex by the olefin metathesis reaction and used them a the catalyst for olefin polymerization . olefin metathesis of the zirconocenes with alkenyl group affords the dinuclear Zr complex having a bridging spacer with various length . the dinuclear complex show higher catalytic activity for ethylene polymerization than the corresponding mononuclear complex . heterodinuclear complex containing early and late transition metal were synthesized by facile cross-metathesis reaction . they promote polymerization of ethylene to afford polyethylene with various branched structure depending on the combination of the metal center . the polymerization mechanism includes formation of ethylene oligomers on the late transition metal center followed by copolymerization of ethylene with those oligomers on early transition metal center . none the reaction of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) or I2 with the living zirconium - polyolefin bond ( Zr-PO ) using zirconocene catalyst system were examined . although the reaction of MMA with the living Zr-PP doe not proceed , I2 readily reacts with the living Zr-PO , such a atactic polypropylene ( ataPP ) , iso poly(1-hexene) and syndiotactic poly(propylene) ( synPP ) , quantitatively to give the terminal iodized polyolefins ( PO-I ) . moreover , PO-poly(methyl methacrylate ) ( PMMA ) block copolymer could be obtained by the reaction of MMA with living Sm-PO , which wa formerly prepared by the transformation of PO-I by Cp2*Sm . A five - membered metallacycloallene complex , 1-zirconacyclopenta-2,3-diene , wa prepared from low - valent zirconocene and 2,4-bis(trimethylsilyl)but-1-en-3-yne . the complex reacted with carbonyl compound to afford alkynyl alcohol after hydrolysis via C = O insertion into Zr-C bond . similarly , nitrile inserted into the Zr-C bond to give the corresponding ketone after hydrolysis . the insertion of C = O and CN selectively took place at zirconium- sp3 carbon of the metallacycle . cp - bonded alkyl substituents may change the structural and chemical feature of group <nUm> bent metallocene complex considerably . increased solubility appears to make in situ generated ( MeCp ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ClHZr an improved hydrozirconation reagent . the use of methylcyclopentadienyl ring system allows the detection of the dynamic behaviour of the doubly acetylide bridged [ ( MeCp ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > Zr-C-C-Ph ] - dimer . steric interaction between bulky cp - bonded tert-alkyl group and the substituents at the internal carbon atom of a conjugated diene ligand cause hindered (RCp)-metal rotation in many (diene)zirconocene and -hafnocene complex ( DG+ r o t ≈ <nUm> kcal / mol ) . due to the preferred chiral cp - rotameric conformation of the ( me < inf > <nUm> < / inf > C-Cp ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > m bent metallocene system this dynamic feature can readily be detected in solution by NMR spectroscopy . the ( cp - CHMePh ) < inf > <nUm> < / inf > ClZr < inf > <nUm> < / inf > / alumoxane - system catalyzes the stereospecific polymerization of propene . catalyst derived from rac-[(1-phenylethyl)cyclopentadienyl]-zirconocene dichloride produce isotactic polypropylene via enantiomorphic - site and chain end control . mono- and bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium complex show interesting stereochemical featureswith regard to their use in organometallic and organic synthesis a well a in catalysis . an example is described where the zirconocene unit serf to stabilize a planar tetracoordinate carbon center . next , various building block ( a metal carbonyl , an organic carbonyl compound , a conjugated diene , plus one or two organic alkylating electrophiles ) are assembled at the Cp2Zr - moiety and stereoselectively coupled to give new functionalized heteroatom stabilized carbene complex or directly organic product . chiral (R*Cp)2Zr - derived metallocene / alumoxane ziegler - type catalyst have been used for propene polymerization . it is shown that chain end control and enantiomorphic site control are not operating independently for determining the product stereochemistry . additivity effect have been disclosed in a series of [Cp-CHRlR2]2rCl2 - derived olefin polymerization catalyst with regard to the degree of stereocontrol exercised by the chiral metallocene unit . finally , the preparation of the new chiral lewis acid “ (diboma-Cp)zirconium trichloride ” and application in enantioselective catalysis are described . cationic zirconocene or hafnocene complex serve a a novel class of lewis acid with unique reactivity , which are to be exploited in organic synthesis . four category of reactivity are discussed , that is , ( A ) C-F bond activation / cleavage , ( B ) coordinative activation of ether linkage , ( C ) carbonyl activation , and ( d ) C-O bond cleavage via zirconocene alkoxide . co-cyclisation of alkene with alkene or alkyne and zirconocene give zirconacycles which are further elaborated by the consecutive insertion of allyl , propargyl , or allenyl metal carbenoids and electrophiles . insertion of other carbenoids give the first zirconacyclohexanes with the potential for further elaboration . most synthetic application of organo(chloro)zirconocenes involve the use of terminal zirconocenes derived from hydrozirconation of monosubstituted or symmetrical triple or double bond . In our study to effect stereoselective hydrozirconations of internal alkyne and alkene , we have explored the alkoxy-directed hydrozirconation of homoallylic and bis-homoallylic alcohol . the discovery of a new method to prepare zirconocene hydride in situ from readily available , air - stable zirconocene dihydride ha allowed u to demonstrate for the first time that kinetic hydrozirconation product of internal , non-functionalized alkene can be formed in preference over isomerized , thermodynamic product . the zirconocene - catalyzed rearrangement of epoxy ester to give 2,7,8-trioxabicyclo[3.2.1]octanes ( ABO - ester ) add a new modification to carboxylic acid chemistry . acid / base - sensitive a-amino , a-hydroxy and b-bromo acid derivative are converted in high yield to ABO - ester using this protocol . this strategy is complementary to the OBO - ester technology , and orthogonal method for the deprotection of ABO - and OBO - ester have been developed . using chiral epoxy alcohol derivative , a convenient and general asymmetric synthesis of bicyclic ortho ester can be achieved . new application of ABO - ester in organic synthesis include conjugate addition to a,b-unsaturated ortho ester and their use a homoenolate equivalent a well a the preparation of tertiary alcohol . the reduction behavior of the novel zirconocene dichloride , ( e5-C5Me5 ) , ( e5-C5Me4CH2CH2 ER2)ZrCl2 ( ER2 = NMe2 , PMe2 , PPh2 ) , ( e5-C5Me4CH2CH2 PMe2)2ZrCl2 , and ( e5-C5Me4CH2CH2 PPh2)(e5-C5Me4 CH2CH2PMe2)ZrC12 , together with the new type of intramolecular activation of inert C-H and c-heteroatom bond are presented and discussed . A remarkably thermally stable zirconocene alkylhydryde type framework complex (e5-C5Me5)[e5,s -C5Me4CH2CH2N(Me) CH2 - ]Zrh , zirconocene arylhydryde complex (e5-C5Me5)[e5,(s -C5Me4CH2CH2P(Ph) -o-C6H4-]ZrH , tetramethylfulvene hydride - type complex (e5-C5Me5)[e6 : e1-(CH2C5Me3) CH2CH2PR2 ( r = me , ph ) and ( e5-C5Me4 CH2CH2PPh2 ) [ e6:e1 -(CH2C5Me3)CH2 CH2PMe2]ZrH are reported . the first unusually thermally stable zirconocene ( e5,e1-C5Me4 CH2CH2PMe2)2Zr with the Zr (II) center stabilized by intramolecular coordination of two Me2P - group is described . none A novel series of para-diiodobenzene derivative , 3,6-diiodo-4,5-dialkyl-phthalic acid dimethyl ester , were prepared via cycloaddition of two TMS-substituted alkyne and dimethyl acetylenedicarboxylate , which wa mediated by zirconocene . after iodination , three new compound of 3,6-diiodo-4,5-dimethyl(dipropyl , dibutyl)-phthalic acid dimethyl ester ( 3a , 3b , 3c ) were synthesized in high region - selectivity and yield , and characterized by NMR . the crystal structure were determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction . the crystal of 3a ( C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > I < inf > <nUm> < / inf > O < inf > <nUm> < / inf > , mr = <nUm> ) belongs to the triclinic system , space group P1 with a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> A , α = <nUm> , β = <nUm> , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , z = <nUm> , F(000) = <nUm> , d < inf > c < / inf > = <nUm> mg / m < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , μ = <nUm> mm < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , T = <nUm> K , S = <nUm> , r = <nUm> and wR = <nUm> for <nUm> observed reflection with I > 2s(I) ; the crystal of 3b ( C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > I < inf > <nUm> < / inf > O < inf > <nUm> < / inf > , m < inf > r < / inf > = <nUm> ) is of triclinic system , space group P1 with a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> A , α = <nUm> , β = <nUm> , γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , z = <nUm> , F(000) = <nUm> , d < inf > c < / inf > = <nUm> mg / m < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , μ = <nUm> mm < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , T = <nUm> K , S = <nUm> , r = <nUm> and wR = <nUm> for <nUm> observed reflection with I > 2s(I) ; the crystal of 3c ( C < inf > <nUm> < / inf > H < inf > <nUm> < / inf > I < inf > <nUm> < / inf > O < inf > <nUm> < / inf > , m < inf > r < / inf > = <nUm> ) belongs to the monoclinic system , space group P2 < inf > <nUm> / c < / inf > with a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> A , β = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> A < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , z = <nUm> , F(000) = <nUm> , dc = <nUm> mg / m < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , μ = <nUm> mm < sup > <nUm> < / sup > , T = <nUm> K , S = <nUm> , r = <nUm> and wR = <nUm> for <nUm> observed reflection with I > 2s(I) . hexaterf-butylcyclotrigermane , the only peralkylcyclotrigermane reported to date , reacts with the heavier chalcogens or aryl isocyanides by insertion into one Ge-Ge bond to provide the ring - enlarged four - membered cycle . hexakis(2,4,6-triisopropylphenyl)cyclotristannane ( 21 ) , first described by masamune and sita , is now easily accessible by treatment of tin (II) chloride with 2,4,6-triisopropylphenylmagnesium bromide . heating of <nUm> to ca. <nUm> ° C lead to an equilibrium between <nUm> and it cleavage product bis(2,4,6-triisopropylphenyl)stannylene ( 22 ) and tetrakis(2,4,6-triisopropylphenyl)distannene ( 23 ) , both of which can be trapped by various addition reaction . the reaction of <nUm> with the heavier chalcogens provide strong evidence for a true tin - tin double bond in distannene <nUm> . with transition metal substrate stannylene <nUm> reacts by substitution or insertion to give some new stannylene complex . treatment of the intermediate zirconocene with <nUm> lead to a very airsensitive product , whose spectral data indicates the formation of the first transition metal complex of a distannene . attempt to prepare a more stable distannene of type <nUm> by replacement of the 2,4,6-triisopropylphenyl group by the bulkier 2,4,6-tri-tert-butylphenyl group remained unsuccessful a yet , because in this case aryl / alkyl rearrangement take place . trialkylsilanols were reported to modify and also to improve the catalytic performance in ethylene polymerization when added to zirconocene / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) system . In order to obtain more information about the chemistry involved , a new stable catalytic precursor wa investigated in this work . the precursor bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)bistriphenylsilanolatozirconium(IV) [ZrCp2(OSiPh3)2] wa compared to ZrCp2(CH3)2 and ZrCp4 , which can generate ZrCp2(OSiPh3)2 in situ on triphenylsilanol addition . In ethylene polymerization , ZrCp2(OSiPh3)2 exibits a comparable activity and a larger stability than dicyclopentadienylzirconium complex . on addition of triphenylsilanol to zirconocenes , the productivity increased and the molecular weight sharply decreased , thus suggesting the occurrence of ligand substitution in solution . the reported result are discussed with reference to the proposed mechanism of ethylene polymerization with the conventional ZrCp2Cl2 / MAO system . NQR ( nuclear quadrupole resonance ) spectroscopy is potentially one of the best way of characterizing the bonding of metal cation such a zirconocene cation and Ag + to halogen donor atom in weakly coordinating anion and neutral ligand such a halocarbon . known coordination of organoiodine atom to silver ion wa studied by <nUm> I NQR spectroscopy in [ Ag(p-C <nUm> H <nUm> I <nUm> )](PO <nUm> F <nUm> ) , [ Ag(o-C <nUm> H <nUm> I <nUm> )]NO <nUm> , [ Ag(CH <nUm> I <nUm> ) <nUm> ]PF <nUm> , and the explosive [ Ag(CH <nUm> I <nUm> )]NO <nUm> ; a possible case of iodocarbon coordination to a mercury atom in C <nUm> Cl <nUm> HgCl-CH <nUm> I <nUm> wa also investigated . both the low - frequency ( ca. <nUm> MHz ) and the high - frequency ( ca. <nUm> MHz ) NQR signal were detected for each compound , and , for the first time , the quadrupole coupling constant e <nUm> qq zz / h and asymmetry parameter η of coordinated organohalogen atom were obtained . As compared to the free iodocarbons , substantial ( <nUm> - <nUm> % ) reduction of e <nUm> qq zz / h and substantial increase in η ( to about <nUm> - <nUm> % ) were found in the iodocarbon complex of silver , but not of mercury . from approximate theoretical analysis of the data , it appears that the electronic interaction of silver and iodine is quite substantial . none none trimethylaluminum add to cyclotrimeric zirconocene oxide [Cp2ZrO]3 to give the cyclo-dimeric mixed metal complex [Cp2Zr(CH3)OAl(CH3)2]2 ( 3a - dimer ) featuring a central AKO- . containing four - membered ring system . complex 3a - dimer crystallizes in space group P21 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , rw = <nUm> . with methylalumoxane 3a - dimer give an active catalyst ( Zr : Al = <nUm> : <nUm> ) for ethylene polymerization . none none none the chiral ligand precursor system [1-Cp1-1-R1-2-R-2-2-Cp2]ethane 5a – d bearing two different cyclopentadienyl fragment ( cp1 , cp2 = cp , ind , flu ) and a variable bridge substitution pattern ( R1 , R2 = H , ph , cyclopentyl , cyclohexyl ) were prepared starting from the corresponding epoxides . the solid state structure of six organic intermediate are reported in order to prove the stereochemistry of the ligand forming reaction . treatment of the dilithio salt of 5a – d with Cl4Zr in CCl2H2 afforded chiral ansa - zirconocene dichloride ( 6a – d ) . none N-(2-bromoallyl)-N-methylaniline <nUm> is easily converted into the propargylamine - zirconocene complex <nUm> via loss of methane from 2-[zirconocene(methyl)]allyl amine <nUm> . regioselective insertion reaction with alkene and benzophenone afford , after iodinolysis . product <nUm> – <nUm> . 2,5-Hexanedione wa converted into the bisfulvene <nUm> , then treated with two molar equivalent of methyllithium to yield the [4-cyclopentadienylidene-4,7,7-trimethyl-4,5,6,7-tetra-hydroindenyl]dilithio compound <nUm> . hydrolysis , followed by treatment with acetone / pyrrolidine , gave the corresponding fulvene system <nUm> . reaction of <nUm> with methyllithium followed by treatment with ZrCl4furnished the ring - annulated C1 - bridged ansa - metallocene <nUm> , bearing a tert-butyl substituent at the cp ring , a a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of two diastereoisomers . treatment of the fulvene <nUm> with LiAlH4followed by ZrCl4yielded the respective isopropyl-substituted ansa - metallocene diastereomers 9a and 9b . complex 9b wa separated by fractional crystallization and characterized by x-ray diffraction . complex <nUm> and <nUm> provide active homogeneous ziegler - type catalyst system upon activation with excess methylalumoxane producing low molecular weight isotactic polypropylene with high catalyst activity . reaction of lithium(neomenthylcyclopentadienid) <nUm> with dimethyldichlorosilane give dimethylbis[3-(neomenthyl)cyclopentadienyl]silane <nUm> regioselectively a a mixture of double bond shift isomer ( <nUm> % isolated ) . deprotonation with <nUm> equiv. of butyllithium followed by treatment with zirconiumtetrachloride furnished a mixture of the three {dimethylsilylenbis[e5-3-(neomenthyl)cyclopentadienyl]}zirconium dichloride diastereomers from which the pure meso-like isomer 6c [p-R(1'S,3'R,4'R),p-S(1'S.3'R,4'R)] wa isolated by fractional crystallization . complex 6c wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . it Dl-Zr-D2 angle of <nUm> ° is very similar a observed in bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride ( D1 and D2 denote the centroid of the cyclopentadienyl ring ) . the homogeneous 6c / methylalumoxane ziegler - type catalyst produce polypropylene of low molecular weight ( [ formula omitted]e ≈ <nUm> at ambient temperature ) . related catalyst system may find interesting application in organic synthesis . none treatment of (butadiene)zirconocene with two molar equivalent of benzylmercaptane result in the formation of Cp2Zr(SCH2Ph)2 ( 11 ) . subsequent reaction of <nUm> with [ Cp2ZrCH3 +][CH3B(C6F 5)3 - A similar reaction is observed upon treatment of Cp2Zr(SC2H5)2 ( 15 ) with <nUm> to yield the thioacetaldehyde - bridged dinuclear metallocene cation complex Cp2Zr-m-(e2-MeCHS)-m-(SEt)ZrCp2 ( 16 ) . the synthesis and characterization of <nUm> new boryl-substituted zirconocene dichloride complex are reported . after activation with methyl aluminoxane ( MAO ) these complex are catalyst for homogeneous ethylene polymerization . the combination of these complex with nickel catalyst containing lewis basic substituents produce polymer with bimodal molecular weight distribution . none die retention und die isotopeneffekte nach ( n , y ) -Reaktionen wurden fur verschiedene zikron- und hafniumisotope in form der Bis-Cyclopentadienyl-Metalldichloride in festem zustand und in losung mit benzol und Benzol-Aceton al losungsmittel gemessen . auch die retention nach ( n , n')- und ( n , 2n)-Reaktionen mit 14-MeV-Neutronen wurde bestimmt . ein unerwarteter isotopeneffekt trat bei den 14-MeV-Neutronen-Reaktionen auf . alle ergebnisse werden mitden entsprechenden , fruher an den phthalocyaninen dieser elemente erhaltenen resultaten verglichen . recent advance in polymerization of allyl and diallyl monomer catalyzed by homogeneous ziegler - natta catalyst are reviewed . zirconocene catalyst are effective for copolymerization of ethylene or propylene with Al - masked allyl monomer , a well a homopolymerization of allylsilanes . phosphine - sulfonate Pd complex promote the copolymerization of ethylene with various polar allyl monomer , in the absence of a masking agent . late transition metal catalyst promote stereoselective cyclopolymerization of diallyl monomer having various polar functional group . the cyclopolymerization of alkyl-substituted diallyl monomer by Pd diimine complex affords the polymer having alternating oligomethylene and trans-1,2-cyclopentene group . mono- and bi 2-arylindenyl zirconocene / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) catalyst are prepared on a crosslinked polystyrene resin using gel - phase organic reaction . the 2-arylindene ligand are bonded to the polystyrene backbone through a disiloxane linkage , and the zirconocene is prepared directly on the support in high yield . these supported 2-arylindenylzirconocenes in the presence of MAO show high activity and yield polypropylene with microstructures similar to those produced by the analogous solution - phase catalyst . this paper evaluates the adsorption capacity of zirconocene - based silica material in the pre-concentration of antimicrobians ( tetracycline , sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim ) in aqueous medium . these material were prepared by grafting the zirconocene onto silica pre-treated at different temperature . the retention capacity of these material wa evaluated by off line SPE and HPLC-UV and the proposed methodology wa validated in ultrapure , tap and river water . the recovery for tetracycline wa <nUm> % ( in the solid phase A ) and , for sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim wa <nUm> and <nUm> % in the commercial C18 , respectively . the target antimicrobians were not detected in the arroio diluvio ( porto alegre - RS ) . ethylene / 1-hexene wa copolymerized by an unbridged zirconocene , ( 2-PhInd ) 2ZrCl2 / MAO ( methyl aluminoxane ) at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> ° C respectively . high copolymerization activity and 1-hexene incorporation were observed at <nUm> ° C , with the copolymer formed having random sequence distribution and narrow molecular weight distribution . ethylene polymerization at <nUm> ° C showed high activity , but copolymerization at <nUm> ° C showed much lower activity , which decreased sharply with increasing 1-hexene concentration in the monomer feed . copolymer formed at <nUm> ° C showed blocky sequence distribution and broad molecular weight distribution . A mechanism model based on ligand rotation hindered by the propagation chain ha been proposed to qualitatively explain the observed phenomenon . the metallocene dihalides are a relatively new class of small , hydrophobic organometallic anticancer agent that exhibit antitumour property against numerous cell line including leukemia P388 and L1210 , colon <nUm> and lewis lung carcinoma , B16 melanoma , solid and fluid ehrlich ascites tumour and several human colon and lung carcinoma transplanted into athymic mouse . titanocene dichloride I ha been the most widely studied metallocene and the drug is currently in phase II clinical trial . formation of metallocene - DNA complex ha been implicated in the mechanism of antitumour property of the metallocenes , a both titanocene dichloride <nUm> and vanadocene dichloride <nUm> inhibit DNA and RNA synthesis , and titanium and vanadium accumulate in nucleic acid - rich region of tumour cell . however , in contrast to the well characterized platinum - based anticancer drug , the active specie responsible for antitumour activity in vivo ha not been identified and the mechanism whereby irreparable DNA damage and / or structural modification of DNA or other cellular target occurs is poorly understood . this review will focus on recent study that have been carried out in order to identify the biologically active specie and more fully understand the molecular level mechanism of action of the metallocene dihalides . study with nucleotide , oligonucleotides , DNA and protein including topoisomerases , protein kinase C and transferrin have provided important insight into potential cellular transport mechanism and the interaction of metallocenes with biomolecular target . new structure activity study including the design of hydrolytically stable metallocenes and the preparation of highly water soluble amino acid analogue have not led to improved anticancer activity of titanocene dichloride <nUm> . the vastly different chemical and hydrolytic stability of each of the metallocenes point to a unique mechanism of action of each metallocene in vivo . the use of several zirconium reagent a the schwartz reagent [Cp2ZrHCl]n , the dimethylzirconocene Cp2ZrMe2 , the zirconocene [Cp2Zr] , and the diphenylzirconocene Cp2ZrPh2 allows the synthesis of a variety of new linear and cyclic P-C and P-N ligand . <nUm> diphosphines can be prepared from unsaturated monophosphines . A useful methodology involving ring opening reaction permit the preparation of phosphinite - phosphine and bis-phosphinite ligand . N - functionalized imines and b-diimines substituted with phosphino group are obtained from cyanophosphines or dinitriles . carbozirconation of chlorophospha-imine lead to the unprecedented p-metalated iminophosphorane which present a versatile reactivity towards electrophiles and small unsaturated molecule . constraint three and four phosphorus cycle can be easily isolated using [Cp2M] ( m = Zr or Ti ) . interaction between benzynezirconocene and unsaturated phosphine afford numerous method to prepare linear and cyclic phosphorus reagent . enantiomerically pure iminophosphines can be synthetized from phosphinozirconocene complex . A method for synthesis of cyclic zirconium complex ha been developed . treating zirconocene complex having aryl methyl ether substituted ligand with BBr3 affords cyclic zirconium complex . the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with LiP(H)B(Ni-Pr 2)2 • DME in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio provides the metallodiphosphane Cp2Zr[P(H)B(Ni-Pr2)2] <nUm> ( 5 ) . combination of <nUm> with Mo(CO)4(norbornadiene) give the diphosphane adduct Cp2Zr[P(H)B{}(Ni-Pr2)2] 2Mo(CO)4 ( 7 ) in which <nUm> act a a bidentate chelating ligand . the reaction of <nUm> with n-BuLi in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio generates a phosphane - phosphide " ate " complex Li{Cp2Zr[P(H)B(Ni-Pr 2)2][PB(Ni - pr2)2 ] } • DME ( 8 ) . this unusual complex contains a planar , asymmetric LiP2Zr ring . the compound have been characterized by spectroscopic method and the molecular structure of <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined by x-ray diffraction method . this review article describes development in chiral metallocenes a polymerization catalyst focusing on C2 symmetric ansa - zirconocene complex . selective synthesis of rac - isomer of ansa - zirconocenes are surveyed . isospecific polymerization of propylene catalyzed by chiral zirconocenes are summarized . advanced series of polymerization by chiral metallocenes such a asymmetric polymerization and polymerization of polar monomer are also introduced . In this work we report the polymerization behaviour of natural clay ( montmorillonites , MMT ) a activating support . these material have been modified by treatment with different aluminium compound in order to obtain enriched aluminium clay and to modify the global bronsted / lewis acidity . As a consequence , the intrinsic structural property of the starting material have been changed . these change were studied and these new material used for ethylene polymerization using a zirconocene complex a catalyst . all the system were shown to be active in ethylene polymerization . the catalyst activity and the dependence on acid strength and textural property have been also studied . the behaviour of an artificial silica ( SBA <nUm> ) modified with an aluminium compound to obtain a silicoaluminate ha been studied , but no ethylene polymerization activity ha been found yet . A novel method for the zirconoarylation of alkyne wa developed . TCQ - promoted reductive elimination of arylzirconate [ LiCp2ZrAr(RC = CR ) ] , which wa prepared by the reaction of zirconocene - alkyne complex with aryllithium compound , afforded trisubstituted alkenylzirconocenes . this reaction can afford multi-substituted olefin with high stereoselectivity . stereoselective ring transformation of 2-vinylheterocycles to vinylcarbocycles wa efficiently carried out by the use of a zirconocene equivalent ( " Cp2Zr " ) . the transformation proceeded through an intramolecular allylation of z-allylic zirconocene specie to the epoxide or aziridine ring . zirconium - mediated synthetic method of a series of heterocyclic compound were reviewed . discussion wa focused on the reaction including the other metal , such a Cu , Ni , Li , and so on . these enable u to synthesize a series of heterocycle having N , O , Si , S , Sn , etc. in the ring skeleton . the key point of the reaction is transmetalation from Zr to the other employed metal , which have a crucial role for reactivity and selectivity of the reaction . the phenyl sulfide bridged zirconocene complex [ ( C5H 5)Cl2ZrC5H4CH2(C 6H4-p)]2S ha been synthesized by treating the dilithium salt of the phenyl sulfide bridged cyclopentadienyl ligand with two equivalent of C5H5ZrCl3(DME) and characterized by 1HMNR and elemental analysis . homogenous ethylene polymerization by this complex ha been conducted systematically in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the influence of the molar ratio [MAO] / [Cat] , the catalyst concentration , time and temperature have been studied in detail . the highest catalytic activity of <nUm> is up to <nUm> × <nUm> g PE / mol*Cat*h . higher temperature is favorable for increasing the catalytic activity for <nUm> . high temperature gel permeation chromatography ( HT - GPC ) prof the production of polyethylene with a broad molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) , which is reached <nUm> . the thioether bridged zirconocene complex [ ( C5H 5)Cl2ZrC5H4CH2CH 2]2S ha been synthesized by treating the dilithium salt of the thioether bridged cyclopentadienyl ligand with two equivalent of C 5H5ZrCl3(DME) and characterized by 1HMNR and elemental analysis . homogenous ethylene polymerization by this complex ha been conducted systematically in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the influence of the molar ratio [MAO] / [Cat] , the catalyst concentration , time and temperature have been studied in detail . the catalytic activity of <nUm> is <nUm> × <nUm> g PE / mol*Cat*h . higher temperature is favorable for increasing the catalytic activity for <nUm> . A high concentration of the catalyst drop the catalytic activity a well a the molecular weight of polyethylene for the complex . high temperature gel permeation chromatography ( HT - GPC ) prof the production of polyethylene with a broad molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) . this work describes the synthesis and characterization of new organometallic specie , an unprecedented mononuclear zirconium complex bearing a tetraalkylated s-indacene ligand , and secondly , it respective dicarbonyl complex obtained by reduction with Mg / Cl2Hg . theoretical calculation of these two compound were carried out to gain further understanding of these novel molecular system . system including diphenylzinc , metallocene , and methylaluminoxane , at various combination ha been attempted , a initiating system for homo- and copolymerization of styrene and various styrene related comonomers including : substituted styrene , styrene derivative , a-olefins , dienes and more recently cycohexenes including norbornene . the used metallocenes were those containing titanium , zirconium and for comparative reason hafnium . the metallocene efficiency towards syndiotactic polystyrene polymerization showed the order : titanocene > zirconocene > hafnocene . while the polymerization a well the copolymerization of styrene with related to styrene compound resulted to be much influenced by both electrical and steric hindrance effect . for styrene substituted derivative those group or element having I+ inductive effect depending it position at styrene 's it phenyl ring favour homopolymerization a well their copolymerization with styrene . the steric hindrance also showed a determinant influence on reactivity , so methyl and tert-butyl group , having a I+ effect , when at para-position improve activity and stereoregularity of their polymerization process . but when placing at orto - position showed a very low capacity to polymerize . the present and previous result indicate that polymerization process are initiated by monomer coordination to active metal specie either of the binary metallocene - MAO or of the ternary Ph2Zn-metallocene-MAO . the two different kind of impregnation ( in situ and ex situ ) were used in the heterogeneous copolymerization of ethylene and 1-hexene for production of LLDPE / silica composite . for the ex situ impregnation , MMAO cocatalyst wa immobilized firmly onto the silica support through washing and drying step before introducing the powder of MMAO / silica support into the copolymerization system . for the in situ impregnation , MMAO wa only contacted with silica support for the short period of time before bringing all of the slurry of MMAO / silica support into the copolymerization system . by comparing the catalytic activity between two method , it wa found that the in situ impregnation provided the higher one beneficial from the lower interaction between MMAO and silica due to lower contacting time . the lower interaction enhanced the reactivity of MMAO toward zirconocene catalyst during activation process thus leading to the higher catalytic activity . the said interaction can be proven by thermal gravimetric analysis ( TGA ) and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy ( XPS ) analysis . In addition , the obtained polymer were further characterized by mean of scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) , 13C - NMR spectroscopy ( NMR ) and differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) . different mesoporous titania synthesized by hydrolysis and polycondensation reaction of tetrabutyl titanate with various hydrolysis ratio ( H 2O / Ti by mole ) were employed a support for zirconocene / MAO catalyst in ethylene / 1-olefin copolymerization . the pure anatase phase of titania wa detected by x-ray diffraction ( XRD ) and the morphology wa seen by scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) . the titania obtained wa then impregnated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . the amount of [Al]MAO were measured by energy dispersive x-ray spectroscopy ( EDX ) and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy ( XPS ) . the copolymerization of ethylene / 1-hexene ( EH ) and ethylene / 1-octene ( EO ) wa performed using titania - supported zirconocene / MAO catalyst . upon polymerization , it wa found that the high surface area of titania apparently exhibited high polymerization activity due to large amount of [Al]MAO present a seen by EDX and XPS . the obtained copolymer wa further characterized by 13C nuclear magnetic resonance ( 13C NMR ) and differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) . it revealed that based on 13C NMR , the random copolymer wa obtained for both EH and EO system . however , EH copolymer exhibited higher melting temperature ( T m ) than EO copolymer indicating that the EH system had le comonomer incorporation . Nano-TiO2 and it modification with gallium ( nano-TiO2-Ga ) and zirconium ( nano-TiO2-Zr ) were used here a nanofillers in production of linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) . the nanoparticles were immobilized by modified-methyl aluminoxane ( MMAO ) to be a catalytic filler prior to introducing into the in situ polymerization of ethylene and 1-hexene using zirconocene catalyst , and consequently produced LLDPE / O2Ti nanocomposites . it wa found that the modified nano-TiO2 by Ga and Zr can hold more amount of MMAO on the surface than the unmodified one . this is because the modified particle have a stronger interaction between MMAO and the surface , a observed by thermal gravimetric analysis ( TGA ) . however , the stronger interaction lead to lower catalytic activity for the polymerization system . observing from the molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) of the resulting product , it wa found that the modified nano-TiO2 with Ga can produce the LLDPE / O2Ti nanocomposites with bimodal MWD . this result wa due to the heterogeneity of the surface after modification , which can generate the multiple active site for the catalyst , leading to multimodal property of the polymer . coulson ( ZINDO ) , mulliken ( MP2 / 6-31G* ) and natural ( MP2 / 6-31G* ) population analysis of several large molecule were performed by the fragment reassociation ( FR ) method . the agreement between the conventional ZINDO ( or conventional MP2 ) and FR - ZINDO ( or FR - MP2 ) charge of these molecule wa excellent . the standard deviation of the FR - ZINDO net atomic charge from the conventional ZINDO net atomic charge were <nUm> for C5H11 ( <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for NH2-C16O2H28-COOH ( <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for NH3+-C16O2H28-COOH ( <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for NH2-C16O2H28-COO- ( <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for NH3+-C16O2H28- COO- ( <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for a conjugated model ( O = CH - ( CH = CH)15-C = O-(CH = CH)12-CH = CH2 ) , <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for aglycoristocetin ( C60N7O19H52+ , <nUm> atom ) , <nUm> for a polypropylene model complexed with a zirconocene catalyst ( C68H121Zr+ , <nUm> atom ) and <nUm> for magainin ( C112H177N29O28S , <nUm> atom ) , respectively . the standard deviation of the FR - MP2 mulliken ( or natural ) partial atomic charge from the conventional one were <nUm> ( or <nUm> ) for C5H11 , <nUm> ( or <nUm> ) for NH2-C16O2H28-COOH and <nUm> ( or <nUm> ) for NH3+-C16O2H28- COO- , respectively . these error were attributed to the shape of molecule , the choice of fragment and the degree of ionic character of molecule a well a the choice of method . the CPU time of aglycoristocetin , conjugated model , polypropylene model complexed with zirconocene and magainin computed by the FR - ZINDO method wa respectively <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> time faster than that by the normal ZINDO method . the CPU time of NH2-C16O2H28-COOH and NH3+-C16O2H28- COO- computed by the FR - MP2 method wa , respectively , <nUm> and <nUm> time faster than that by the normal MP2 method . the largest molecule calculated by the FR - ZINDO method wa B-DNA ( <nUm> atom ) . these result will enable u to compute atomic charge of huge molecule near future . none isospecific propylene polymerization behavior of meta-and para-Lewis base ( e ) functionalized unbridged zirconocenes ( [ 1-(En-Ph)-3,4-Me2C 5H2]2ZrCl2 , e = NMe2 , OMe ; n = <nUm> or <nUm> ) wa investigated under bulk condition . catalytic activity of the zirconocenes , and molecular weight and isotacticity of polypropylene are found to be dependent on the position and number of the lewis base functional group in the zirconocenes . all the crude polypropylene posse a broad molecular weight distribution and multi-melting transition , indicating an involvement of multi-catalytic active specie in the polymerization . the highest [mmmm] value of an isotactic portion of the polypropylene reached <nUm> % , which is higher than that ( <nUm> % ) from the wellknown C2 - symmetric EBIZr ( rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) catalyst . these result support that the in situ generated , rigid rac - like cation - anion pair through the lewis acid - base interaction between the functional group of zirconocenes and methylaluminoxane anion is effective in the formation of isotactic polypropylene under bulk propylene polymerization condition . alkenylzirconium compound react with various organic halide in the presence of a palladium or nickel catalyst to give the corresponding cross-coupling product in high yield with high selectivity . carbometallation of alkyne using alkylaluminums such a trimethylaluminum is catalyzed by zirconocene dichloride . the triisobutylaluminum / zirconocene dichloride system induces hydrometallation and subsequent carbometallation of enynes to afford exocyclic olefin . addition of <nUm> equiv. of n-butyllithium to zirconocene dichloride convenient ly produce a zirconocene equivalent . i.e. , “ Cp2Zr ” , which can induce bicyclization of enynes or diynes . reac tions of alkene and alkyne with the zirconocene give zirconocene - alkene and - alkyne complexes.respectively . whose structure have been determined by x-ray study . novel <nUm> - migration reaction on zirconium or other metal are also discussed . this article deal with a recent development of selective reaction using zirconocene - alkene complex in our group . the following reaction are reviewed . ( i ) preparation of zirconocene - alkene complex . ( ii ) alkene - alkene coupling reaction on zirconocene . ( iii ) reaction of alkene complex with ketone or aldehyde . ( iv ) selective skeleton transformation via C-C bond activation . ( v ) selective functionalization of zirconacyclopentenes . ( vi ) allylation reaction of alkyne using a zirconocene complex and allylic compound . ( vii ) zirconium catalyzed C-C bond formation reaction of alkene on zirconocenes . ( viii ) zirconocene catalyzed hydrosilation reaction using zirconocene - alkene complex . ( ix ) zirconocene catalyzed C-C bond formation reaction of alkyne on zirconocenes . ( x ) zirconocene - catalyzed allylation reaction . recent study in this laboratory is reviewed . combination of group <nUm> metallocene dichloride ( Cp2MCl2 : m = Zr , Hf ) and silver salt ( AgX : x = ClO4 , OTf etc. ) is a particularly effective reagent for activating glycosyl fluoride , which offer a new and efficient method for o-glycoside synthesis , which made u to succeed in the first total synthesis of mycinamicin macrolide antibiotic . mechanistic consideration of this activation led u to find that the reagent combination in <nUm> : 2-ratio , rather than the original <nUm> : 1-ratio , of Cp2MCl2 and AgX engendered further enhanced reactivity . some of the recent application in oligosaccharide synthesis is listed to show the broad scope of this new glycosidation reaction in natural product synthesis . furthermore , this combinational reagent offer a powerful basis for aryl c-glycoside synthesis and the total synthesis of three prototypical compound of this class , vineomycinone B2 methyl ester and gilvocarcin m and V , were successfully carried out by this glycoside activation method . zirconium - mediated carbon-carbon bond forming reaction have been extensively developed for the last decade . an allylic zirconium specie and related organozirconium specie can be prepared from the reaction of allylic ether with zirconocene equivalent “ Cp2Zr ” through b-alkoxide elimination under mild condition . this methodology is applicable to the ring contraction reaction of vinyl sugar and vinyl morpholine derivative to give enantiomerically pure polyfunctionalized carbocycles and pyrrolidines with high diastereoselectivity , respectively . the origin of high diastereoselectivity in these transformation wa deduced by isolating the nine - membered cyclic intermediate possessing (Z)-allylic zirconium specie . useful application of this zirconium - mediated ring contraction reaction to synthesis of bioactive compound are also described . it is also discussed that the diastereoselectivity of the zirconium - mediated coupling reaction of a chiral imine with unsaturated compound is highly dependent on the generating temperature of zirconacycles . A series of group IV metallocene complex such a titanocenes , zirconocenes and hafnocenes possessing ansa - chain are discussed a regio- and stereoselective catalyst for polymerization of propylene or styrene . isotactic and syndiotactic polypropylene are produced via primary cis-addition by the catalytic use of C2- and Cs - symmetric zirconocenes , respectively . significantly , syndiotactic polystyrene is produced , in contrast , via secondary cis-addition even by using C1 - symmetric titanocenes . the reaction mechanism of those polymerization , the structure of catalytic specie and the significant role of methylalumoxane ( MAO ) are also discussed . it is generally known that small cyclic alkyne such a cyclopentyne is extremely reactive and unstable . therefore it ha been believed impossible to isolate cyclopentyne compound . we recently reported that low - valent group <nUm> metallocenes reacted with 1,2,3-butatrienes to give 1-metallacyclopent-3-yne complex and that resulted compound are surprisingly stable and isolable . we succeeded in determination of their molecular structure by x-ray diffraction analysis , and showed that these are five - membered cyclic alkyne , while p,p-interaction of butatriene wa also suggested . In this review , the preparation , structure and reactivity of these 1-metallacyclopent-3-yne compound are described . the l-zirconacyclopent-3-yne complex reacted with another ' zirconocene ' to form bimetallic complex in which the cyclic alkyne coordinated to the other zirconocene moiety , indicating that the zirconacyclopentyne behaved a an alkyne . seven - membered cyclic alkyne were also prepared from 1,2,3-butatriene and a zirconocene - alkyne compound . protonolysis and subsequent nucleophilic attack to aldehyde gave allenyl or dienyl alcohol depending on proton source . In this review , the result of study on new methodology for bond activation by using transition metal complex are described , in order to realize the expeditious and selective synthesis of organic compound . carbon-carbon bond formation reaction , accompanying with cleavage of unactivated bond such a carbon-carbon , carbon-boron , and carbon-silicon bond , are reported . this review involves , for example , the new synthetic methodology to introduce both cyano and ester group ( cyanoesterification ) via the C-C bond activation , regio- and stereoselective synthesis multi-substituted olefin mediated a zirconocene complex via the C-B bond activation , and cross-coupling reaction of alkynylsilanes activated by a copper salt via the C-Si bond cleavage . each reaction can be applicable to synthesis of functional molecule such a opto - electronic material , an anti-cancer agent , and liquid crystalline compound . In this paper , the efficient methodology for the synthesis of multi-substituted olefin by using zirconocene complex is described . the key step is regioselective formation of zirconacyclopen-tenes from alkynylboron and alkynylsilane compound . the subsequent negishi and suzuki - miyaura coupling reaction of C-B and C-Zr bond give rise to multi-substituted olefin . the developed reaction can be applicable to the synthesis of various functional molecule , for example , an anti-cancer agent . In addition , the mechanism for a regioselective formation of zirconacyclopentenes is analyzed by reaction of alkynylboronates and a zirconocene ( II ) complex . As a result , it is disclosed that an electrostatic interaction effected the regioselective formation of zirconacyclopen-tenes . the synthesis of various unprecedented tri- and tetra-alkylated olefin using b-hydrogencontaining alkyl electrophiles and alkylzinc reagent a coupling partner in regio- and stereocontrolled manner is also described . it is well known that the mechanical property of highly isotactic polypropene depend on the crystalline structure of the material . up to now , the polymer property were modified by varying either the processing condition - e.g. , extrusion , annealing etc. - or the composition - e.g. , blending , nucleation . highly active ethylene bridged C1 - symmetric zirconocene catalyst can be used to design the material property by varying the crystallinity of thermoplastic ( elastic ) polypropene . with the new unsymmetric catalyst rac-dichloro[1-(9-fluorenyl)-2-(R , s)-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methylinden-1-e5-yl)ethane]zirconium ( IV ) / MAO ( 1 ) polypropene of variable isotacticities are accessible . the variable and thus defined use of two different side of the catalytically active specie allows the placement of single , cumulated and consecutive [rr] - triad within an isotactic polymer chain . the formation of these stereoerrors is adjusted in an arbitrary manner by the polymerization condition temperature and monomer concentration . the mechanical property of polypropene produced with <nUm> / MAO vary from tough thermoplastic to excellent elastic . stress - strain behavior of these physically crosslinked elastomer can be designed similar to the one of polyisoprene or partly crosslinked natural rubber . In the presence of <nUm> mol % zirconocene bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate)s , indoles reacted with aldehyde / ketone at room temperature in tetrahydrofuran for <nUm> ∼ <nUm> min to give diindolylmethane derivative in <nUm> % ∼ <nUm> % yield . the catalyst zirconocene bis(perfluorooctanesulfonate)s can be reused <nUm> time , and the conversion rate is still a high a <nUm> % . this reaction doe not require strict anhydrous condition . this procedure provides a new and efficient way for preparing diindolylmethane derivative . the catalytic behavior of the highly isospecific catalyst rac-Me2Si(2-Me,4-PhInd)2ZrCl2 immobilized on the surface of a polymer support , PE with grafted poly(acrylic acid ) that wa preliminarily treated by poly(methylaluminoxane) , wa studied . the immobilized catalyst wa activated by triisobutylaluminum . the molecular mass , melting temperature , and isotacticity of the produced PP were examined . it wa shown that the modification of the catalyst by the boron salt Me2NHPhB(C6F5)4 lead to a change in the kinetics of polymerization and in the isotacticity of the resulting PP . factor affecting the rate and stability of the catalytic behavior of the studied supported catalyst such a the content of immobilized zirconocene , the concentration of triisobutylaluminum , and the reaction temperature were analyzed . it wa demonstrated that the catalyst is not washed out from the support surface in the course of polymerization and that PP is produced in the form of granule with a bulk density of <nUm> - <nUm> g / cm3 . the influence of the activation procedure applied to a metallocene on it catalytic behavior in ethylene polymerization is discussed and the effect of the zirconocene / activator nature on the property of PE is demonstrated . MAO and TIBA / CPh <nUm> B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> are intercompared a cocatalysts . the catalytic behavior and the kinetics of ethylene polymerization catalyzed by TIBA / CPh <nUm> B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> - activated metallocene complex allowed to infer that , in ternary catalytic system with dichloride precatalysts , TIBA act not only a an impurity scavenger or simply an alkylating agent , but also a a cocatalyst giving rise to heteronuclear cationic specie providing lower chain propagation and chain transfer rate than those generated upon MAO action . when activated with TIBA / CPh <nUm> B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> dichloride zirconocenes were moderately active a compared with MAO and yielded EsP of considerably higher m . A halide or alkyl ligand present in the outer coordination sphere of active site affect considerably both the catalytic performance of active specie and the property of the resulting PE . the Cl - keeping Al - Zr heteronuclear active site give rise to high-M linear PE ; alkyl holder are highly capable of chain propagation and chain transfer to monomer . the high reactivity of the Zr - Cl bond in the latter active site manifest itself also in the high ability to incorporate alfa - olefin to yield PE chain containing branch with <nUm> - <nUm> incorporated ethylene unit . propylene / ethylene copolymer were prepared over two complex catalyst system : ( i ) an AlEt3 - activated Cl2Mg - supported titanium catalyst Cl4Ti / Cl2Mg with dibutyl phthalate and propyltrimethoxysilane used a respectively internal and external donor and ( ii ) two methylaluminoxane (MAO)-activated , unsupported zirconocene catalyst system differing in indenyl ligand structure , viz. , Me2SiInd2ZrCl2 and [Me2Si(4-Ph-2-Et-Ind)2]ZrCl2 ( rac : meso = <nUm> : <nUm> ) . the olefin were copolymerized ( table <nUm> ) in liquid propylene at <nUm> - <nUm> ° C at constant ethylene overpressure ( above C3 pressure ) varying over <nUm> to <nUm> atm corresponding to ethylene concentration of <nUm> to <nUm> mol / L in the liquid phase . the copolymer contained 1.6-18 % of C2 mers . catalyst activity ( fig. <nUm> ) and kinetics of copolymerization ( fig. <nUm> ) were studied and the microstructure , molecular weight characteristic ( table <nUm> ) and mechanical property ( table <nUm> , <nUm> ) of the resulting copolymer were determined .
