IR spectrum ( recorded , not included ) are discussed . the comonomer reactivity coefficient were evaluated for the copolymerizations run over the three catalytic system . treatment of the diazametallacycle Cp2Zr(N(t-Bu)C = N(SiMe3)N(SiMe3) ) ( 4a ) with diphenylacetylene resulted in the formation of the azametallacyclobutene Cp2Zr(N(t-Bu)C(Ph) = C(Ph) ) ( 6a ) and Me3SiN = C = NSiMe3 in high yield . A kinetic study using UV - vi spectroscopy wa carried out on the transformation . saturation kinetic behavior wa observed for the system , which is supportive of a mechanism that involves a reversible formal [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] retrocycloaddition of 4a to generate the transient imido specie Cp2Zr = N-t-Bu ( 7a ) and Me3SiN = C = NSiMe3 . trapping 7a with diphenylacetylene in an overall [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] cycloaddition reaction affords zirconacycle 6a . the study of cycloreversion / cycloaddition reaction between diazametallacycle complex and diphenylacetylene wa extended to other zirconocene system . detailed kinetic study were performed for the exchange reaction between the diazametallacycle complex Cp2Zr(N(2,6-Me2Ph)C = N(SiMe3)N ( SiMe3 ) ) ( 8a ) and Cp2Zr(N(2,6-Me2Ph) C = N(t-Bu)N(t-Bu) ) ( 8b ) with diphenylacetylene ( 5a ) to give the corresponding azametallacyclobutene complex Cp2Zr(N(2,6-Me2Ph)C(Ph) = C(Ph) ) ( 6c ) and extruded carbodiimides ( Me3SiN = C = NSiMe3 for 8a and (t-Bu)N = C = N(t-Bu) for 8b ) . for both system , the reaction were found to be first order in metallacycle and zero order in alkyne . treatment of the diazametallacycle complex Cp2Zr(N(2,6-ii-Pr2Ph)C = N(Cyc)N(Cyc) ) ( 9a ) and Cp2Zr(N(2,6-i-Pr2Ph)C = N(i-Pr2) N(i-Pr2) ) ( 9b ) with alkyne 5a resulted in the formation of the six - membered zirconacylces 10a,b , respectively , upon heating at <nUm> ° C . the product 10a,b are generated from the overall insertion of alkyne 5a into the nitrogen-carbon bond of the zirconium - containing diazacyclobutane . complex 10a ha been characterized by an x-ray crystallographic study . when the azacyclobutene Cp2Zr(N(2,6-i-Pr2Ph)C(Ph)) ( 6e ) wa treated with CycN = C = NCyc or (i-Pr)N = C = N(i-Pr) , the same six - membered zirconacycle complex 10a,b were obtained . kinetic analysis of the reaction of 6e and (i-Pr)N = C = N(i-Pr) to yield 10b support an associative process wherein alkyne 5a directly insert into the zirconium-carbon bond of 6e . the diazametallacycle complex 4a underwent a stoichiometric metathetical exchange with symmetrical carbodiimides RN = C = NR ( r = p = tol , m-Tok , i-Pr , cyc ) to generate new cyclic zirconocene complex and Me3SiN = C = NSiMe3 . kinetic study were carried out on the exchange reaction between 4a and (m-Tol)N = C = N(m-Tol) to form 4e and Me3SiN = C = NSiMe3 . the experimental rate data obtained are consistent with a dissociative mechanism . additionally , the saturation rate constant derived for this system from the data is the same ( within experimental error ) a the saturation rate constant obtained from the kinetic study of 4a and diphenylacetylene to form 6a and Me3SiN = C = NSiMe3 . these finding provide additional support for a dissociative mechanistic pathway in the exchange reaction , since the rate constant in the formal [ <nUm> + <nUm> ] retrocycloaddition reaction to generate imidozirconocene specie Cp2Zr = N-t-Bu ( 7a ) and Me3SiN = C-NSiMe3 should be the same for both reaction . the polymerization of ethylene using supported zirconocene catalyst with varying support composition SiO2-MAO-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 + TIBA ( catalyst I ) and MgCl2-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 + TIBA ( catalyst II ) ( MAO is methylaluminoxane , ind is indenyl , and TIBA is triisobutylaluminum ) wa studied . the examined catalytic system differ in their activity , ability to control the molecular mass of the resulting polymer , and kinetics of copolymerization with 1-hexene . the molecular structure of PE prepared with supported catalyst I and II and a homogeneous catalyst Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 + MAO wa studied by IR and 13C NMR spectroscopy . As evidenced by 13C NMR spectroscopy , PE sample synthesized with the homogeneous catalyst and catalyst I contain ethyl branch along with the end methyl group in the low-molecular-mass fraction . on the contrary , PE prepared with supported catalyst II is devoid of ethyl branch but contains vinyl group a the basic type of unsaturation . aryl enolsilanes and 2-silyloxy-1,3-dienes react with zirconocene to give alkenylzirconium , and novel 1-methylene-2-propenylzirconium compound which can be used a 2-dienylation reagent . thus , one - pot coupling of 4-phenyl-1,3-butadienyl-2-zirconocene ( 2d ) with a range of electrophiles including aryl , alkynyl , allyl halide , bromine , iodine and a michael acceptor occurs regioselectively at the C-2 position in the presence of Pd or Cu catalyst . the asymmetric ansa - ligand precursor (C5Me4H)SiMe2(C5H4R) ( r = H ( 1 ) , me ( 2 ) , SiMe3 ( 3 ) , < Pr ( 4 ) ) and their lithium derivative [Me2Si(C5Me4)(C5H3R)]Li2 ( r = H ( 5 ) , me ( 6 ) , SiMe3 . , ( 7 ) , ' Pr ( 8 ) ) have been prepared . the cmsa - niobocene imido complex [ Me2Si( ? / 5-C5Me4)( ? ; 5.C5H3R)]Nb( = N'Bu)Cl ( r = H ( 9 ) , me ( 10 ) , SiMe3 ( 11 ) , ' Pr ( 12 ) ) were synthesized by the reaction of nb( = N'Bu)Cl3(py)2 with [Me2Si(C5Me4)(C5H3R)]Li2 in THF . the tmsa-zirconocene complex [ Me2SiO;5-C5Me4)0 / 5-C5H3R)]ZrCl2 ( r = H ( 13 ) , me ( 14 ) , SiMe3 ( 15 ) , ' Pr ( 16 ) ) were prepared by the reaction of ZrCLj and the corresponding lithiated cmsa - derivative . the molecular structure of <nUm> , and <nUm> were determined by single - crystal x-ray diffraction study . preliminary result for the catalytic activity of 13-16 in the polymerization of ethylene are reported . the activity and stability of zirconocene catalyst immobilized on magnesium chloride modified with an organoaluminum compound AlR3 ( r = me or et ) were studied in the polymerization of ethylene ( table <nUm> , <nUm> ) . an original method wa used to introduce a lewis internal base into the magnesium support . trace amount of water present in magnesium chloride were assumed to react with the organoaluminum compound to produce on the surface of the chloride an alkylaluminoxane [R2AlOAlR2] with the basic center functioning a a lewis internal base . the resulting support wa used to immobilize a zirconocene compound which , when activated with MAO , became a very active complex catalyzing the polymerization of ethylene at a constant rate ( <nUm> kg PE / g Zr · h ) . catalytically active center were found to occur in the solvent solution only ( and not on the solid support surface ) at a concentration found to be nearly equal to that of water in the magnesium chloride . the ethylene polymerization kinetics studied with two catalyst system prepared and the physical and mechanical property data measured for the resulting PE ( table <nUm> ) allowed to infer the highly stable zirconocene homogeneous catalyst system to have magnesium atom incorporated into the following structure [ ClMgOAlR2 / Cp2ZrCl2 ] . the modifier AlR3 wa found to affect the physical and mechanical property of the resuiting PE ( table <nUm> ) . the synthesis of a series of 1-methyl-3-aryl-substituted titanocene and zirconocene dichrorides are reported . these complex are synthesized by the reaction of 2- and 3-methyl-6 , 6-dimethylfulvenes ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) with aryllithium , followed by the reaction with TiCl4*2THF , Cl4Zr and (CpTiCl2)2O respectively , to give complex <nUm> - <nUm> . the complex [ e5-1-methyl-3-(a , a-dimethylbenzyl)cyclopentadienyl]titanium dichloride ha been studied by x-ray diffraction . the red crystal of this complex is monoclinic , space group P21 / C with unit cell parameter : a = <nUm> × 10-1 nm , b = <nUm> × 10-1 nm , c = <nUm> × 10-1 nm , α = β = γ = <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> × 10-3 nm3 and z = <nUm> . refinement for <nUm> observed reflection give the final r of <nUm> . there are four independent molecule per unit cell . two supported zirconocene catalyst were prepared : ( I ) O2Si / MAO / Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( <nUm> wt. % Zr , <nUm> wt. % Al ) and ( II ) Cl2Mg / Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( <nUm> wt. % Zr , <nUm> wt. % Al ) . ethylene wa homopolymerized and copolymerized with 1-hexene ( <nUm> - <nUm> ° C , <nUm> bar , TIBA a cocatalyst ) over ( I ) and ( II ) . catalyst ( I ) incorporated the comonomer a much a did the homogeneous catalyst of the same composition . Cl2Mg used a support resulted in reduced copolymerization reactivity of the catalyst . copolymer crystallinity and catalyst activity were studied in relation to the concentration of 1-hexene . ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization over the O2Si - supported zirconocene / MMAO catalyst wa investigated . the silica support wa modified by different batch of <nUm> and <nUm> wt % Ga . it wa found that Ga wa well - dispersed all over the silica granule which can not be detected by XRD . based on the EDX measurement , it wa revealed that Ga - modification increased the adsorption ability of MMAO on the silica support after impregnation . thus , Ga - modification showed a promising way to enhance the rate of ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization . based on TGA study , lower interaction between MMAO and support caused by Ga - modification wa another reason for increase in catalytic activity . moreover , the Ga - modification increased lewis acid centre or active specie on the catalytic system . In addition , a comparative study of polymerization wa also conducted with in situ and ex situ impregnation method . it wa found that the in situ impregnation method of the MMAO onto silica exhibited remarkable ( almost <nUm> time ) activity compared to ex situ method which is attributed to lower deactivation effect of the catalyst . 13C NMR analysis , however , indicated that only random copolymer were produced in all system . these result could be related to the high degree of 1-octene insertion and thus amorphous copolymer were produced in all system . the temperature - programmed desorption ( TPD ) technique wa used to study , by mass spectrometry ( MS ) , the desorbates released from O2Si - supported MAO ( I ) and O2Si - supported Cp2ZrCl2 ( II ) surface . with II , cp group were found to be copiously released at temperature exceeding <nUm> ° C . hence , decomposition of Cp2ZrCl2 while the compound is being heterogenized , can not explain the low activity of the catalyst II in which Cp2ZrCl2 is chemically bonded to the carrier surface through OH group . the MS ( intensity vs. temperature ) curve recorded for the I desorbates exhibit maximum ( fig. <nUm> ) for m / z = <nUm> - <nUm> at about <nUm> ° C and <nUm> ° C . they represent the methyl group liberated on thermal destruction of = Al-C- bond in respectively AlO(Me)2 and AlO2Me . At about <nUm> ° C , the MAO oligomer molecule were fragmented to produce AlOMe ( m / z = <nUm> ) , Al2O ( m / z = <nUm> ) , AlOMe2 ( m / z = <nUm> ) , AlO2Me ( m / z = <nUm> ) , AlO ring ( m / z = <nUm> ) , and (Al3O3)-O- ring ( m / z = <nUm> ) . alternating adsorption ( up to <nUm> time ) of AlMe3 vapor followed by H2O vapor on O2Si surface wa tried to synthesize O2Si - supported MAO with no " free " AlMe3 . As a result , surface structure of the type ≡ Si-O-(AlMeO)n , ( n = <nUm> ) were produced . the MAO thus synthesized wa showed by TPD study to have a linear or a planar net structure . ethylene wa sequentially homopolymerized ( <nUm> ° C , <nUm> - <nUm> min ) and copolymerized ( <nUm> ° C , <nUm> - <nUm> min ) with 1-hexene or 1-octene over a Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO or a C2H4(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst in toluene a solvent ; a-olefin conversion were <nUm> - <nUm> mol % . the preliminary homopolymerization of ethylene wa found to affect only slightly the composition and the MW and MWD property data of the resulting ethylene-hexene ( CEH ) and ethylene-octene ( CEO ) copolymer . HDPE / CEH and HDPE / CEO reactor mixture ( RM ) were synthesized , containing various proportion of the copolymer ( table <nUm> ) . the RM component were found to cocrystallize during the polymerization process . mechanical property data were determined for pure and for modified HDPE ( table <nUm> ) . with the copolymer endowed with desired property and introduced into HDPE in an appropriate amount , high - strength and simultaneously high - MFR material can be prepared . the bonding between electron deficient zirconocene complex such a [(e5-C5Me5)2ZrR]+ and the counterions [(C6F5)3BR]- ( r = CH3 , <nUm> , r = H , <nUm> ) ha been investigated by DFT and extended huckel calculation . the molecular bonding analysis ha been carried out in the light of the structural information on the inter-ion interaction available for these and other similar electron deficient coordinatively unsaturated zirconocene complex . it ha been shown that the " anion - cation " interaction in <nUm> and <nUm> are different manifestation of the same need to provide electron density to the metal centre . In <nUm> this is achieved via the -C-H s-bonds and ha been described a a pseudo-agostic interaction , whereas in <nUm> electron donation occurs via the phenyl F - atom . the study of the covalent component of the bonding between the ionic component ha shown that the weak electron donation , though not sufficient to saturate the metal centre , stabilises the unsaturated specie and allows it to have a longer life time . it ha been inferred that in the homogenous ziegler - natta catalytic process the approach of a strongly coordinating molecule , such a an olefin in the polymerisation , destroys the weak interaction and allows the reaction to proceed whilst the ion - pairing maintains the counterion in proximity of the complex . propylene polymerization were carried out by using rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( zirconocene catalyst ) and a commercial third generation ziegler - natta catalyst in a semibatch reactor . from the polymerization reaction , the optimum reaction condition and the physical property of polymer produced from each catalyst system were investigated . the optimum reaction temperature of rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 and ziegler - natta catalyst were <nUm> ° C , <nUm> ° C , respectively . on the basis of the result for the produced polymer particle size distribution and the catalytic activity of polymerization reaction , the reaction temperature should be considered a an important factor for the successful polymerization reaction . especially , the polymer wa conglomerated in the higher reaction temperature . it wa found that there wa an upper limitation to co-catalyst concentration . reaction rate and polymer yield rather decreased with increasing the concentration of co-catalyst , i.e. , MAO and TEA1 affected only polymerization activity , but the PEEB in ziegler - natta catalyst system affected isotactic index of produced polymer a well a activity . based on these observation , the production yield seems to exhibit a first order linear relationship to the partial pressure of monomer . the optical absorption spectrum of system including ansa - zirconocenes ( Me2SiCp2ZrCl2 or Me2CCp2ZrCl2 ) and a modified poly(methylaluminoxane) were studied . the alkylation of zirconocenes involves two stage - fast and slow - resulting in the formation of monoalkyl and dialkyl derivative , respectively with trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) being the main alkylating agent . A bathochromic shift wa observed for <nUm> < Al : Zr < <nUm> in the system containing Me2SiCp2ZrCl2 , and for markedly greater component ratio in the system with Me2SiCp2ZrCl2 . introduction of TMA in the mixture markedly accelerated the alkylation rate and retarded the formation of complex responsible for the bathochromic shift . A model of the complex structure is proposed and the law of complex formation in the system studied are discussed . A MgCl2(THF)2 support modified by organoaluminum chloride or MAO enabled u to obtain specially active zirconocene catalyst system for ethylene polymerization . the zirconocene system on the bimetallic support wa found to be the more active than that on the monometallic support . two kind of catalytic active site were found to exist in the supported zirconocene catalyst : unstable active site that become deactivated during the polymerization of ethylene , and very stable catalytic center created in the olefin environment . the kinetic investigation on the ethylene polymerization allowed to suggest the reason underlying the creation of the stable active site . bulk polymerization of propylene wa studied over four ansa - zirconocene catalyst , viz. , Me2SiInd2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) , Me2Si(4-Ph-2-Et-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) ( rac : meso = <nUm> : <nUm> ) , Ph2C(CpFlu)ZrCl2 ( 3 ) , and Me2C(3-Me-CpFlu)ZrCl2 ( 4 ) , which were characterized by different symmetry ( C1 , C2 , Cs ) . the structure of the metallocene affected the structure of PP . upon reaction with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) or triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) , compound 1-4 produced very active catalytic system which catalyzed the polymerization to yield various structure of PP . catalyst <nUm> and <nUm> gave isotactic PP , catalyst <nUm> gave syndiotactic PP and catalyst <nUm> gave hemiisotactic PP . Hemiiso-PP wa similar in structure to amorphous PP and had no melting point . the catalytic activity of the system and molecular weight and stereospecificity of PP were studied in relation to the mode of preparation of the catalyst . kinetic parameteres were evaluated , viz. , time of insertion of the propylene molecule ( <nUm> - <nUm> s ) and the time of growth of a single PP macromolecule ( 3-6 s ) , and from these data the minimum degree of polymerization wa determined . activation energy were evaluated for the polymerization carried out over each catalyst system . young 's modulus , molecular weight and stereoregularity of the PP prepared were determined . methylalumination of 1-organylthio-1-alkynes RSC = CR1 ( <nUm> : r = ph , R1 = C5H11 ; <nUm> : r = me , R1 = C10H21 ) with trimethylalane Me3A1 in the presence of zirconocene dichloride Cp2ZrC12 proceeds regio- and stereoselectively and affords 1-organylthio-2-methyl-1-alkenes RSCH = C(Me)R1 ( <nUm> : r = ph , R1 = C5H11 ; <nUm> : r = me , R1 = C10H21 ) in the yield not exceeding <nUm> % . rac-[isopropylidenebis(4,5-benzindenyl)] zirconium dichloride / MAO promotes copolymerization of ethylene and styrene to form a random copolymer with a high activity . the random copolymer ha head to tail St-St sequence and isotactic stereo - regularity both of the head to tail St-St and alternating Et-St sequence . this catalytic system also promotes homo-polymerization of styrene to form isotactic polystyrene . the steric interaction of the C <nUm> symmetric ligand framework to polymer chain end and monomer phenyl group may control isotactic propagation , similarly to the isotactic polymerization of propene reported , with complex having C <nUm> symmetry . the effect of support type on the activity of zirconocene - triisobutylaluminum ( TIBA ) system wa studied in the polymerization of propylene , and on the property of the resulting PP . three zirconocenes were used : Me2SiInd2ZrX2 ( x = Cl or me ) and Ph2CCpFluZrCl2 ; and three support were used : ( i ) O2Si ( spec , area ssp , = <nUm> m2 / g ) ; ( ii ) SiO2-gr-PAAc [ i.e. O2Si modified with poly(acrylic acid ) by radiative grafting ] ; ( iii ) PE-gr-PAAc ( i.e. functionalized by radiative grafting , ssp = <nUm> m2 / g ) . propylene wa polymerized in , the liquid monomer . the support were made to react with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and the product wa used to immobilize a zirconocene compound to produce a supported catalyst . with TIBA a cocatalyst , the resulting PP constituted a replica of catalyst particle ; the bulk density of PP wa high , up to <nUm> g / cm3 . As the Zr content in the catalyst wa increased , the specific productivity ( g PP / g catalyst ) rose to attain a maximum , characteristic for a given support . catalyst activity and m of PP were studied in relation to TIBA concentration . the type of MAO - modified support had little effect on the PP property . modification of the O2Si / MAO / Me2SiInd2ZrCl2 catalyst with a boron compound , CPh3B(C6F5)4 / did not affect PP property but reduced the activity of the catalyst system at AlTIBAZr > <nUm> . [ ( C13 H8)Si(CH3)2(C 5H3 ) ] wa prepared with fluorenyl lithium , dimethyldichlorosilane and cyclopentadienylsodium with <nUm> % total yield . furthermore , a Si - bridged fluorenylidene cyclopen-tadienylidene zirconium complex [ (C13H8)Si(CH3)2(C 5H3)]ZrCl2 wa synthesized by reaction of [ (C13H8)Si(CH3)2(C5H <nUm> ) ] and Cl4Zn with THF a a solvent under the schlenk system . the reaction gave the target compound in <nUm> % yield . the zirconium complex wa characterized by 1H NMR and 13C NMR . after activated with methylaluminoxane , the metallocene complex showed a high catalytic activity for the ethylene and propylene polymerization reaction under atmosphere pressure . it wa found that the title compound ha a catalytic activity in the order of <nUm> g / h , and the molecular weight of ethylene-propylene copolymer is about <nUm> . A family of zirconocene , yttrocene , and scandocene complex have been prepared utilizing an easily modified doubly bridged ligand array , ( 1,2-SiMe <nUm> ) <nUm> { η <nUm> -C <nUm> H <nUm> -4-R}{e <nUm> -C <nUm> H-3,5-(CHMe <nUm> ) <nUm> } , developed in our laboratory . variation in ligand array substitution and metal center provide complex that exhibit a range of stereoselectivities and activity in a-olefin polymerization . A series of C s -and C <nUm> -symmetric metallocenes have been utilized for the preparation of polypropylene and polypentene under various polymerization condition . analysis of the resulting polymer microstructures ha provided valuable information about the factor that dictate syndiospecificity , a well a common error forming mechanism for these system . the reduction in THF and oxidation in CCl2H2 of the bent - sandwich complex (e5-Ind)2ZrMe2 ( 1 ) ( ind = C9H7 , indenyl ) were studied by cyclic voltammetry . complex <nUm> in THF undergoes one - electron reduction to radical anion 1._ , which partially decomposes with the liberation of the ind- anion . even at <nUm> ° C the one - electron oxidation lead to the formation of an unstable 15-electron radical cation undergoing fast heterolytic decomposition to the me . radical and (e5-Ind)2ZrMe+ cation , which is the key reaction center in the catalytic polymerization of olefin . comparative analysis of electron - transfer - induced transformation of bent - sandwich dimethyl and dichloride zirconocenes of the general formula L2ZrX2 ( L = e5-Ind , e5-Cp ; x = Cl , me ) wa performed . A kinetic , active centre , and morphological analysis ha been carried out on the polymerization of ethylene and propylene in hydrocarbon , aromatic and chloroaromatic medium using selected homogeneous and silica supported metallocene catalyst activated by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . A number of procedure for supporting selected model zirconocene compound ( biscyclopentadienylzirconium dichloride and ethylenebisindenylzirconium dichloride ) on different type of silica have been investigated . it is established that the overall activity and kinetic behaviour of these supported catalyst are strongly affected by the procedure used for the catalyst preparation . In general supported metallocene catalyst were shown to have lower activity and also lower number of propagating active center than did the corresponding soluble catalyst system . MAO pretreated silica catalyst were shown by SEM study to produce polymer with good morphology and the result obtained indicated that silica fragmentation producing microreactor behaviour could be obtained in these polymerizing catalyst system . the oligomerization of ethylene catalyzed by Cp2ZrL2 ( L = Cl , me , OC6H4-p-Me ) / EAO ( ethylaluminoxane ) afforded not only common chain oligomers but also methylenecyclopentane . it is the first example of oligomerization and simultaneous cyclization of ethylene to a cyclic oligomer . the selectivity of methylenecyclopentane , affected by the structure and the concentration of precatalysts , solvent , aging and reaction temperature and some other factor , came up to <nUm> % when a third - component C5H5N wa added to the Cp2ZrCl2 / EAO system under optimal condition . this paper describes how benzene derivative were formed with high selectivity in one - pot from three different alkyne in excellent yield . firstly , a novel method for pair - selective coupling of an alkyne with ethylene forming zirconacyclopentenes wa developed ; then , highly selective cross - coupling of two different alkyne forming zirconacyclopentadienes wa achieved ; finally , transmetallation of Zr - C bond to Cu - C bond in the presence of a third alkyne led to the formation of benzene derivative of three different alkyne . new evidence were obtained for understanding the reaction mechanism . polymerization of 1-hexene or 1-octene under high pressure ( 100-1000 MPa ) wa investigated using permethylated ansa - metallocenes / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) a catalyst system . besides the known zirconocene complex ( <nUm> , Me2Si(e5-C5Me4) 2ZrCl2 ) , dialkylsilylene- and dimethylgermylene-bridged hafnocene dichloride , R2E(e5-C5Me4) 2HfCl2 ( <nUm> , r = me , e = Si ; <nUm> , r = et , e = Si ; <nUm> , r = vinyl , e = Si ; <nUm> , r = me , e = Ge ) , were synthesized and structurally characterized . the catalytic activity of the ansa - metallocenes wa remarkably enhanced under high pressure despite their very congested structure . poly( 1-hexene ) with unprecedented high molecular weight such a mw = <nUm> × <nUm> ( mw / Mn = <nUm> , by GPC ) wa obtained under <nUm> MPa with <nUm> . study on termination reaction revealed that the bimolecular chain - transfer process ( b-hydrogen transfer to olefin ) is much accelerated under <nUm> MPa in <nUm> , while b-hydrogen elimination to metal is still major termination process in <nUm> . this indicated that two complex that have same structure but central metal showed quite different high - pressure effect . the copolymerization of ethylene(E) and norbornene ( N ) wa examined by using various metallocene catalyst and modified - MAO(MMAO) cocatalyst . for C2 - symmetry catalyst such a rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 , Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 , me2 Si(Cp)2ZrCl2 and Cs - symmetrical iPr(FluCp)ZrCl2 a well a CGC and di-bridged zirconocene , the effect of catalyst structure and [N] / [E] feed ratio on catalyst activity , thermal property and [N] content of copolymer ( COC ) wa investigated . for rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst of a constant [N] / [E] feed ratio , the appropriate condition of [Al] / [Zr] mole ratio , polymerization temperature and cocatalyst structure were found to be <nUm> , <nUm> ° C , MMAO cocatalyst , respectively . As [N] / [E] feed ratio increased , the incorporation of norbornene to copolymer increased while the activity of catalyst decreased except for iPr(FluCp)ZrCl2 . with consideration of catalyst activity a well a N content , it wa found that rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MMAO system exhibited relatively high activity and controllable tg . monomer reactivity ratio wa determined by kelen - tudos method . copolymerizations of ethylene and a-olefin with various zirconocene compound at a high temperature were carried out to study the relationship between the ligand structure of zirconocene compound and the copolymerization behavior . all of the indenyl-based zirconocene compound in combination with dimethylanilinium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate / triisobutylaluminum produced only low molecular weight copolymer at a high temperature , regardless of the substituents and bridged structure of the zirconocene compound . however , zirconocene compound with a fluorenyl ligand gave rise to a significant increase in the activity and molecular weight of the copolymer by the selection of a diphenylmethylene bridge structure even at a high temperature . ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer obtained with the fluorenyl-based catalyst contained inner double bond accompanied by the generation of hydrogen , presumably because of a C-H bond activation mechanism . the content of the inner double bond were significantly influenced by the polymerization condition , including the 1-hexene feed content , polymerization temperature , and ethylene pressure . the phosphonium - bridged ansa - metallocene complex { [Me2P(C5Me4)2]ZrCl 2}+ and { [Me2P(C5Me4)2]HfCl 2}+ have been prepared by the reaction of {[Me2P(C5Me4)2]Li2}I with Cl4Zr and Cl4Hf , respectively ; the isolation and structural characterization of { [Me2P-(C5Me4)2]ZrCl 2}+ complete a series of isostructural zirconocene derivative , namely , [R2P(CpR)2-ZrCl2]+ , [R2E(CpR)2ZrCl2] ( e = C , Si , Ge ) , and [R2B(CpR)2ZrCl2]- , which differ according to the charge on the complex . reaction of (ClMe2SiC5H4)2ZrCl2 ( 1 ) with K ( Na ) in liquid ammonia / toluene at - <nUm> ° C gave the ansa - zirconocene dihydride none the four new asymmetric ansa - zirconocene dichloride rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(2-phenyl- 1-e5-indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride ( 4c ) , rac-[(9-e5-fluorenyl)(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl) dimethylsilane]zirconium dichloride ( 4d ) , rac-[(9-e5-fluorenyl)(2-methyl-1-e5indenyl) dimethylsilane]zirconium dichloride ( 4e ) , and rac-[(9-e5-fluorenyl)(2-phenyl-1-e5-indenyl) dimethylsilane]zirconium dichloride ( 4f ) have been prepared , and their polymerization behavior wa compared to the recently published rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(5,6-cyclopenta-2-methyl-1-e5- indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride ( 4a ) and rac-[1-(9-e5-fluorenyl)-2-(2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl) ethane]zirconium dichloride ( 4b ) . the Si - bridged ligand are easily accessible by the reaction of fluorenyllithium with dimethyldichlorosilane and the subsequent addition of indenyllithium . A similar route using 1-(9-fluorenyl)-2-bromoethane wa applied for the synthesis of the ethylene-bridged ligand . the Zr(IV) complex of all ligand are highly active catalyst for the propene polymerization reaction after activation with MAO . the influence of the bridge and the particular substitution pattern of the indenyl fragment ha been studied with respect to monomer concentration and polymerization temperature . the exchange of the ethylene bridge by a dimethylsilane unit result in a strong increase of the molecular weight but also in a decreased polymerization activity deriving from a fast decomposition of the active catalyst specie . interestingly , significantly higher polymer molecular weight could be found for the complex that contain the 5,6-cyclopentyl substituent on the indenyl moiety . all catalyst showed the effect of a declining stereo - selectivity with increasing monomer concentration , leading to the formation of homopolypropene elastomer . the mechanism of stereoerror formation of these C1 - symmetric specie wa investigated by deuterium labeling study on the propene monomer and by comparison with C2 - symmetric complex . the primary silane p-TolSiH3 ( p-Tol = p-CH3C6H5 ) can be polymerized to poly(p-tolylsilane) with <nUm> mol % of both the chiral and achiral zirconocenes Cp2ZrCl2 , Cp(CpSi*)ZrCl2 , and (CpSi*)2ZrCl2 ( cp = CH , CpSi* = C5H4Si(CH3)2-(1R)-endo-(+)-OC10H17 ) in combination with <nUm> mol % of n-BuLi . generally , higher molecular weight linear polymer were obtained when using the substituted zirconocenes in comparison to the parent zirconocene , which in turn produced larger quantity of low-molecular-weight cyclic product . each polysilane sample wa analyzed by 29Si{1H} DEPT and 1H and 13C{1H} NMR spectroscopy . deconvolution of selected region of the 29Si{1H} DEPT and the 1H NMR spectrum for higher molecular weight linear polymer indicated that these catenates were predominantly atactic , on the basis of a triad level bernoullian statistical model . the data suggested that , in this case , chiral substitution of the zirconocene ring had no effect on the stereogrowth of the polysilane chain . under the condition originally developed by taber and nugent , a 1,6- or a 1,7-diene will smoothly condense with zirconocene to give the intermediate metallacycle . while these zirconacycles can be isolated and characterized , they usually are carried on directly , by reaction with a suitable electrophile ( e.g. O , or CO ) , to give the organic product . As zirconium is inexpensive , the procedure is operationally simple , and the byproduct zirconium sulfate is nontoxic , intramolecular diene cyclozirconation ha become a useful tool for carbocyclic and heterocyclic ring construction . from the inception of this reaction , it wa anticipated that the central Zr could serve a a scaffold to direct the formation of two , three or even four new stereogenic carbon center . subsequent work ha shown that the cyclometallations are reversible , and that the reaction can be carried out under either kinetic or thermodynamic control . it is particularly exciting that the semiempirical computational package ZINDO can serve effectively to predict the relative stability of the intermediate diastereomeric zirconacycles . this ha allowed ZINDO to be used in a predictive sense , to guide the design of dienes that cyclize with high diastereoselectivity . the use of this approach in conjunction with total synthesis of the natural product elemol , dendrobine , haliclonadiamine and androstenedione is described in this article . the organometallic lewis acid BC18F15 add to the terminal = CH2 group of the (butadiene)-metallocene complex 5a and 5b to give the ansa - metallocene betaine system [Me2Si-(C5H4)2]Zr[C 4H6-B(C6F5)3 ] ( 6a ) and [ Me2Si(3-MeC5H3) 2]Zr[C4H6-B(C6F5) <nUm> ] ( 6b ) , respectively , in high yield . both complex were characterized by x-ray diffraction . they both contain a substituted n3 - allyl ligand F of e configuration , and they show a characteristic ( ortho aryl)-C-F ⋯ Zr interaction that stabilizes the electron - deficient metal center inside the dipolar structure . BC18F15 also add to one butadiene terminus of (s-cis-n4-C4H6)[Me2C(C 5H4)-(indenyl)]Zr to give a high yield of a single isomer of the respective ansa - metallocene [C4H6-B(C6F5)3] betaine complex <nUm> . the x-ray crystal structure analysis of <nUm> ha revealed that in this case a (Z)-n3-allyl-CH2B(C6F5)3 ligand is formed . this precluded the (aryl)C-F ⋯ Zr coordination . instead , the zirconium center in <nUm> form a stabilizing internal ion pair interaction between the negatively polarized [B] - C(4)H2 methylene group and the positive zirconium center . the analogously structured ansa - metallocene [(Z)-C4H6-B(C6F5)3] betaine complex <nUm> is obtained in high yield from BC18F15 addition to (s-cis-n4-butadiene)[Me2C-(C5H 4)(fluorenyl)]Zr . In solution the complex <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> exhibit structure that are analogous to those found in the solid state . however , treatment of ( butadiene ) [Me2Si(C5H4)2]-Zr ( 5a ) with BC18F15 under kinetic control ( <nUm> K in toluene-d8 ) quantitatively yield the [Me2Si(C5H4)2]Zr[(Z)-C 4H6-B(C6F5)3 ] betaine isomer <nUm> , which contains the stabilizing [B] - C(4)H2 ⋯ Zr internal ion pair interaction . subsequent thermally induced rearrangement of the kinetic product <nUm> ( DG ‡ rearr(298 K ) = <nUm> ± <nUm> kcal mol-1 ) then result in the formation of the eventually observed thermodynamic ansa - metallocene betaine product 6a , that contains the (E)-C4H6-B(C6F5)3 ligand and exhibit internal (aryl)C-F ⋯ Zr coordination . A similar reaction sequence wa observed during the addition of BC18F15 to the parent (butadiene)zirconocene system <nUm> : at <nUm> K the kinetic Cp2Zr[(Z)-(1-3n),kC4-C4H 6-B(C6F5)3 ] betaine product <nUm> is formed , which rapidly rearranges at temperature above <nUm> K to yield the previously observed stable Cp2Zr[(E)-C4H6-B(C6F 5)3 ] betaine system <nUm> , which is characterized by an internal C-F ⋯ Zr bond . the ansa - metallocene betaine <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> are all active homogeneous single - component ziegler catalyst for ethene and propene polymerization . they are similarly effective a the usually employed ansa - metallocene dichloride / methylalumoxane catalyst system . UV / visible investigation were carried out on the zirconocene activation mechanism in the case of a series of racEt(Ind)2ZrX2 derivative where x represents ligand of various extractability . two different elementary step were identified , depending on the amount of added activator . first , a hypsochromic shift of the ligand to metal charge transfer ( LMCT ) band occurred , corresponding to the zirconocene methylation . second , addition of larger quantity of activator ( MAO , B(C6F5)4(-) ) led to a bathochromic shift of the LMCT band to <nUm> nm that express the ionization of the zirconocene . copolymer of ethene and 1-hexene were catalyzed with (MenC5H5-n)2ZrCl2 / MAO catalytic system . the copolymer were found to have property that depend on the number of methyl substituents n but also their relative position . the presence of comonomer doe not influence the termination reaction following insertion of ethene . new example of chiral C2 - symmetric zirconocenes of low stereoselectivity are presented . zirconenes <nUm> and <nUm> , upon activation with methylalumoxane , produce amorphous polypropylene with acceptable molecular weight at practical polymerization temperature and mmmm pentad value between <nUm> and <nUm> % . non-bonded interaction analysis by molecular mechanic account for the low enantioselectivity of <nUm> and <nUm> , and predicts the isospecificity of the rac-H2C(2-Me-3-iPr-1-Ind)2ZrR+ catalyst . metallocene complex having multiple Si-Br functionality attached to the ancillary ligand were synthesized by boron - silicon exchange . the obtained functionalized complex are readily immobilized on dehydrated ( partially dehydroxylated ) silica . an unbridged zirconocene complex bis(1,2-diphenylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride [(1,2-Ph2-C5H3)2ZrCl2] <nUm> ha been synthesized and structurally characterized . when activated by MAO , <nUm> produce ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene with high melting transition temperature , a well a atactic oligopropylene with average molecular weight of ∼ <nUm> g mol-1 . [ cp ° 2ZrCl(PHCy) ] ( <nUm> ; cp ° = ? / 5-C5EtMe4 ) cy = cyclohexyl ) and tCp'2ZrCl{PH(TRIP)} ] ( <nUm> ; cp ' = ? ; 5-C5MeH4,TRIP = 2,4,6-Pri3C6H2 ) readily insert RNCX ( r = ph , x = S , <nUm> ; r = pr1 , x = O ) to give [ cp ° 2ZrCl{ ? / 2-XC(PHCy)NR } ] ( x = S , r = ph ( 3 ) ; x = O , r = ph ( 4 ) ; x = O , r = pr1 ( 5 ) ) and [ Cp'2ZrCl{ ? ; 2-XC{PH(TRIP)}NR } ] ( x = S , r = ph ( 6 ) ; x = O , r = ph ( 7 ) ; x = O , r = pr1 ( 8 ) ) . 3-8 were characterized spectroscopically ( IR , NMR , MS ) , and crystal structure determination on 4-6 showed an if bonding mode ( X,N ) of the XC(PHR')NR ( r ' = cy , TRIP ) ligand . of the two possible coordination mode of the ligand , <nUm> and <nUm> are obtained exclusively a the endo isomer , in which the NR group is adjacent to the Zr-Cl bond , while for 6-8 , both isomer ( endo and exo ) are formed ( <nUm> : <nUm> ( 6 ) , <nUm> : <nUm> ( 7 ) and <nUm> : <nUm> ( 8 ) ) , whereby the exo isomer is favored . the exo isomer of <nUm> wa structurally characterized . none the optical absorption spectrum of system including ansa - zirconocenes ( Me2SiCp2ZrCl2 or Me2CCp2ZrCl2 ) and a modified poly(methylaluminoxane) were studied . the alkylation of zirconocenes involves two stage - fast and slow - resulting in the formation of monoalkyl and dialkyl derivative , respectively , with trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) being the main alkylating agent . A bathochromic shift wa observed for <nUm> < Al / Zr < <nUm> in the system containing Me2SiCp2ZrCl2 , and for markedly greater component ratio in the system with Me2CCp2ZrCl2 . introduction of TMA in the mixture markedly accelerated the alkylation rate and retarded the formation of complex responsible for the bathochromic shift . A model of the complex structure is proposed and the law of complex formation in the system studied are discussed . reaction of (C5H4R)2Zr(C ≡ CPh)2 ( r = me , t-Bu ) with vanadocene Cp2V yield the heterodimetallic complex Cp2V(m-e2:e4-butadiyne)Zr(C 5H4R)2 ( <nUm> , r = t-Bu ; <nUm> , r = me ) . both compound have been characterized by elemental analysis , raman spectroscopy , and magnetic susceptibility . according to the x-ray structure of Cp2V(m-e2:e4-butadiyne)Zr(C 5H4t-Bu)2 ( 4 ) , the [Cp2V] and [(C5H4t-Bu)2Zr] metallocene moiety are bonded to a butadiene framework through the two internal carbon atom for [Cp2V] and through the two internal and the two external carbon atom for [(C5H4t-Bu)2Zr] . the distance and angle observed around the internal carbon atom of the butadiene framework indicate that both carbon are planar and tetracoordinate . these structural consideration are supported by a topological analysis of the electron localization function ( ELF ) . the existence of the (C5H4R)2Zr(e 4:1,2,3,4-PhC = C = C = CPh ) ( r = H , SiMe3 , t-Bu , me ) zirconacyclocumulene specie a a key intermediate in the formation of the ( Cp2V(m-e2:e4-butadiyne)Zr(C 5H4R)2 heterodimetallic compound is evidenced by NMR study of either the formation of such zirconacyclocumulene specie by addition to (C5H4R)2Zr(C ≡ CPh)2 of a catalytic amount of Cp2V or of the formation of compound <nUm> or <nUm> by addition of Cp2V to (C5H4R)2Zr(e 4:1,2,3,4-PhC = C = C = CPh ) ( r = t-Bu , me , respectively ; synthesized from dialkynyl zirconocene complex (C5H4R)2Zr-(C ≡ CPh)2 via hn daylight ) . the x-ray structure of the (C5H4R)2Zr(C ≡ CPh)2 ( r = H ( 6 ) , t-Bu ( 7 ) , SiMe3 ( 8 ) ) dialkynyl zirconocene complex is also reported . study related to the behavior of different metallocene catalyst for the homopolymerization of 1-octadecene and it copolymerization with ethylene will be presented . the metallocenes : rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 , rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 and Ph2C(Flu)(Cp)ZrCl2 were chosen for the homopolymerization study . they show important difference in catalytic activity at high temperature ( ≥ <nUm> ° C ) , with rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 showing the highest activity . At lower temperature ( ≤ <nUm> ° C ) the difference are negligible . for the copolymerization of ethylene with 1-octadecene only the catalyst rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 and rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 were studied . the result show that their catalytic activity is just like that for the homopolymerization of 1-octadecene , with higher activity for the metallocene with the et - bridged catalyst . 13C - NMR analysis show that the composition of the copolymerization product depends on the catalytic system . copolymer obtained with rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 have greater comonomer incorporation . thermal analysis show that poly-1-octadecene synthesized with the catalyst rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 is very dependent on the polymerization temperature . the homopolymer obtained at <nUm> ° C present two endothermal peak at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> ° C , a compared with the one obtained at <nUm> ° C which present one wider peak with a maximum at <nUm> ° C . for the catalyst rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 this trend is not observed . the type of metallocene and the reaction time do not significantly change the intrinsic viscosity , but the polymerization temperature change it drastically , giving higher value at lower temperature . viscosity measurement on the copolymer show that an increase of comonomer concentration in the feed reduces the molecular weight of the copolymer , and it wa also found that for homopolymer , the molecular weight is independent of the catalytic system . we systematically assessed the cytotoxic effect of five metallocene dichloride containing vanadium ( vanadocene dichloride ) , titanium ( titanocene dichloride ) , zirconium ( zircodocene dichloride ) , molybdenum ( molybdocene dichloride ) , and hafnium ( hafnocene dichloride ) a the central metal atom and <nUm> other vanadocene complex . these compound were tested against the human testicular cancer cell line tera-2 and ntera-2 using both 3-(4,5- dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide assay and apoptosis assay . notably , only the vanadium(IV) - containing metallocenes exhibited significant cytotoxicity against tera-2 and ntera-2 cell and induced apoptosis within <nUm> h. vanadocenes with dithiocyanate [ VCp2(SCN)2*0.5 H2O ] and diselenocyanate [VCp2(NCSe)2] a ancillary ligand were identified a the most potent cytotoxic compound . vanadocenes , especially the lead compound VCp2(NCSe)2 , may be useful in the treatment of testicular cancer . enantio- and diastereoselective diels - alder reaction between dienophiles <nUm> and cyclopentadiene are catalyzed by a chiral , dicationic complex formed on reaction of the chiral ansa - zirconocene <nUm> ( x = me ) with <nUm> equiv of the strong acid [(Et2O)2H][B(ArF)4] ( <nUm> ; ArF = 3,5-(CF3)2C6H3 ) , in either dichloromethane or 2-nitropropane solvent . the enantioselectivities are higher at lower catalyst loading , particularly in dichloromethane solution , and spectroscopic study suggest that this is related to competitive formation of ether - coordinated complex at relatively low oxazolidinone : catalyst ratio . reaction of the branched tetraalkynylsilanes ( RC ≡ C)4Si ( 1a : r = ph , 1b : tBu , 1c : SiMe3 ) with the metallocene source Cp2Ti(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( 2 ) led to complex 4-6 , and those of 1a with Cp2Zr(THF)(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe <nUm> ) ( 3 ) to complex <nUm> . these , via 2-fold migration and C-C coupling of the alkynyl group , gave a novel type of dinuclear carbon - rich spiro complex . the conversion proved to be independent of the metal , the substituents r , and the stoichiometry employed . all new complex have been characterized spectroscopically . additionally , an x-ray crystal structure analysis wa performed for <nUm> . A versatile zirconocene - coupling route to a family of conjugated polymer containing thiophene-1-oxide and selenophene unit is presented . these polymer have lower band gap than those associated with related thiophene structure . conjugated polymer have a unique chemical , electronic and optical property . such property are determined by the polymer structure and by the composition of the polymer backbone . the property of interest are varied by changing the polymer structure via appropriate synthetic method . many of the synthetic method that are employed are based on transition metal - mediated coupling reaction , primarily with palladium and nickel reagent . Rac-H2C(3-t-Bu-1-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) is a novel , easy to synthesize , high performance catalyst for the polymerization of isotactic propylene ( i-PP ) . methylalumoxane (MAO)-activated <nUm> produce i-PP with good activity at <nUm> ° C in liquid monomer and AlMAO / Zr of <nUm> mol / mol , melting point around <nUm> ° C , and average viscosity molecular weight around <nUm> , at tp = <nUm> ° C . the isotacticity of i-PP from <nUm> / MAO is similar to those of the xylene-insoluble fraction of i-PP from heterogeneous Ti - Cl2Mg catalyst . melting point are lower than those of i-PP from Ti catalyst , but close to or higher than stereospecific zirconocene catalyst . molecular weight distribution are narrow a typical of metallocene catalyst . the use of zirconocene coupling reaction for the synthesis of novel conjugated polymer with interesting electronic property is explored . it is demonstrated that zirconocene - coupling reaction provide a versatile method for tuning the electronic and optical property via manipulation of the chemical structure and composition of the polymer backbone . this chemistry is used to synthesize highly emissive polymer containing electron - deficient thiophene-1-oxide and dioxide unit and a base - dopable cp - containing polymer . the morphology of the thermoplastic polypropylene elastomer generated with unbridged bis(2-phenylindenyl)zirconocene is studied using differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) and nitric acid digestion . thermal fractionation DSC reveals the presence of many melting fraction which is likely caused by a broad distribution in crystallizable block length . hard crystalline domain dispersed in a continuous amorphous matrix are clearly visible in the AFM image . image of stretched sample show irreversible morphology change at high elongation . high temperature nitric acid digestion study provides another estimate of the crystalline domain size in the polymer . copolymerizations of ethylene / 1-hexene were conducted using different zirconocene / AIR3 / BC18F15 catalytic system at <nUm> ° C . when AIEt3 wa used a alkylate agent , very low copolymerization activity wa observed with both bridged catalyst Et[Ind] 2ZrCl2 and unbridged zirconocene Cp2ZrCl2 in-situ activated with BC18F15 . In appropriate Al / Zr mole ratio using Al(i-Bu)3 , the catalytic activity of both zirconocene catalytic system were similar to those of sophisticated zirconocene / methylaluminoxane(MAO) catalytic system . the catalytic activity , comonomer incorporation and molecular weight of the copolymer synthesized with Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 / Al(i-Bu)3 / B(C6F 5)3 were higher than those obtained with cp 2ZrCl2 / al( / -Bu)3 / B(C6F 5)3 . the effect of the concentration of 1-hexene on catalytic activity , copolymer molecular weight , and comonomer incorporation wa investigated . the complicated " co-monomer effect " , together with an increase in comonomer incorporation , a decrease in the copolymer molecular weight , wa found when the comonomer concentration wa increased . α , b-unsaturated tellurolesters have been prepared in good yield by the reaction of ArTel with acylzirconocene chloride . the complex (C5H5)2Zr(Me)(methallyl) ( 1 ) wa prepared and studied a a model for Zr - bound allyl specie which are likely to arise in zirconocene - based polymerization system . <nUm> undergoes allyl-alkyl exchange with trimethyl aluminum ( TMA ) or with methyl alumoxane ( MAO ) at rate that are proportional to the Al concentration , but remain 1-2 order of magnitude below those of typical olefin insertion . it perfluorotriphenylborane adduct <nUm> , i.e. , the contact ion pair (C5H5)2Zr(methallyl)++H 3CB(C6F5)3- , ha been characterized with regard to the rearrangement dynamic of it allyl ligand . propene reacts with <nUm> , at rate which are substantially lower again than those of cationic Zr - alkyl specie , under insertion between Zr and one of the allylic terminus . scrambling of deuterium from an allylic CD2 terminus over several C atom position next to the unsaturated chain end indicates rather extensive metal migration within an initial olefin insertion product . density - functional calculation indicate that insertion of propene directly into an e3-coordinated Zr - allyl unit occurs with lower activation energy than insertion into an e1-bound Zr - allyl specie and that the lowest - energy pathway for the reactivation of a cationic zirconocene allyl specie is it reconversion to the corresponding Zr - alkyl specie by molecular hydrogen . the synthesis and propene polymerization performance of the novel rac - [ CH <nUm> ( 3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl ) <nUm> ]ZrCl <nUm> ( 2 ) and rac - [ CH <nUm> ( 3-tert-butyl-1-indenyl ) <nUm> ]ZrMe <nUm> ( 2-Me <nUm> ) are described . the ligand precursor , bis(1-tert-butyl-3-indenyl)methane ( L2 ) , is obtained in ca. <nUm> % conversion from the condensation of 3-tert-butylindene and formaldehyde in DMF at room temperature and is isolated a a yellow powder by washing with pentane . red <nUm> is obtained in 50-60 % yield and free from it meso stereoisomer by reacting an et <nUm> O solution of the ligand dianion , (L2)Li <nUm> ( et <nUm> O ) x , with a slurry of ClZr <nUm> in either pentane or toluene . yellow 2-Me <nUm> is prepared in <nUm> % yield by reaction of <nUm> with excess MeMgCl in toluene . alternatively , 2-Me <nUm> ( contaminated with about <nUm> % of it meso isomer ) can be obtained directly from the ligand L2 , by reacting L2 in et <nUm> O with <nUm> equiv of MeLi and then <nUm> equiv of ClZr <nUm> in toluene . both <nUm> and 2-Me <nUm> are remarkably soluble in pentane ( <nUm> , ca. <nUm> g / L ; 2-Me <nUm> , ca. <nUm> g / L ) and toluene ( <nUm> , ca. <nUm> g / L ) . <nUm> / MAO and 2-Me <nUm> / MAO polymerize liquid propene with good activity to highly isotactic ( mmmm = 95-98 % ) , fully regioregular polypropene with medium - high molecular weight ( M w = <nUm> 000-780 <nUm> ) and high melting point ( T m = 154-163 ° C ) in the T p range 30-70 ° C . the behavior of <nUm> is compared to that of the prototypical montell zirconocene rac - [ me <nUm> C(3-t-Bu-Ind) <nUm> ]ZrCl <nUm> ( 1 ) . <nUm> is the first example of a highly efficient and at the same time simple and inexpensive zirconocene catalyst for isotactic polypropene . the molecular structure of <nUm> and it Hf analogue ( hf-2 ) have been determined and compared to that of <nUm> . by kinetically stabilizing imidozirconocene complex through the use of a sterically demanding ligand , or by generating a more thermodynamically stable resting state with addition of diphenylacetylene , we have developed transition metal - catalyzed imine metathesis reaction that are mechanistically analogous to olefin metathesis reaction catalyzed by metal carbene complex . when <nUm> mol % of Cp*Cp(THF)Zr = NtBu is used a the catalyst precursor in the metathesis reaction between PhCH = NPh and p-TolCH = N-p-Tol , a <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> equilibrium mixture with the two mixed imines p-TolCH = NPh and PhCH = N-p-Tol is generated in C6D6 at <nUm> ° C . the catalyst wa still active after <nUm> day with an estimated <nUm> turnover ( t1 / <nUm> <nUm> m ; TON = <nUm> h-1 ) . when the azametallacyclobutene Cp2Zr(N(Tol)C(Ph) = C(Ph) ) is used a the catalyst precursor under similar reaction condition , a total of <nUm> turnover are obtained after <nUm> day ( t1 / <nUm> <nUm> m ; TON = <nUm> h-1 ) . an extensive kinetic and equilibrium analysis of the metallacyclobutene - catalyzed metathesis of PhCH = N-p-Tol and p-F-C6H4CH = N-p-F-C6H4 wa carried out by monitoring the concentration of imines and observable metal - containing intermediate over time . numerical integration method were used to fit these data to a detailed mechanism involving coordinatively unsaturated ( 16-electron ) imido complex a critical intermediate . examination of the scope of reaction between different organic imines revealed characteristic selectivity that appears to be unique to the zirconium - mediated system . several zirconocene complex that could generate the catalytically active " CpCp'Zr = ArN " ( cp ' = cp or cp* ) specie in situ were found to be effective agent in the metathetical exchange between different n-aryl imines . N-Alkyl aldimines were found to be completely unreactive toward metathesis with n-aryl aldimines , and metathesis reaction involving the two n-alkyl imines TolCH = NPr and PhCH = NMe gave slow or erratic result , depending on the catalyst used . metathesis wa observed between n-aryl ketimines and n-aryl aldimines , but for n-aryl ketimine substrate , the catalyst resting state consists of zirconocene enamido complex , generated by the formal C-H activation of the a position of the ketimine substrate . homopolymerization of 4-methyl-1-pentene and it copolymerization with ethylene in the presence of catalyst based on zirconocenes , [(CH3)5Cp]ZrCl3 , [(CH3)2C(Cp)2]ZrCl2 , [(CH3)2C(Ind)2]ZrCl2 , [(C6H5)(C2H5)C(Ind)2]ZrCl <nUm> , [(CH3)2Si(Ind)2]ZrCl2 , [(CH3)2C(CH3Cp)(Flu)]ZrCl2 , and [(Ph)2C(Cp)(Flu)]]ZrCl2 , were studied . it wa shown that the order of loading of the reagent affect the yield of poly ( 4-methyl-1-pentene ) . unsymmetrical , bridged metallocenes exhibit the highest activity in polymerization . for the [(CH3)2C(CH3Cp)(Flu)]ZrCl2-methylalu minoxane system , formation of a syndiotactic poly(4-methyl-1-pentene) wa observed . In the copolymerization of 4-methyl-1-pentene with ethylene , condition providing preparation of a linear LDPE with a variable content of 4-methyl-1-pentene unit were determined . the effect of the molar ratio of methylaluminoxane : Zr on the yield and composition of the resulting copolymer wa revealed . trimethylphosphane add to the zirconocene-[C4H6B(C6F5)3] betaine complex 2a regioselectively by an overall inversion pathway , with opening of the internal FZr - ArC bond and formation of the Cp2Zr(PMe3)[C4H6B(C6F5)3] adduct <nUm> . complex <nUm> wa characterized by X- ray diffraction . the betaine complex <nUm> contains a -CH2B(C6F5)3- substituted p-allyl ligand with characteristic bonding parameter of C1-C2 : <nUm> Å , C2-C3 : <nUm> Å , Zr-C1 : <nUm> Å , Zr-C2 : <nUm> Å , and Zr-C3 : <nUm> Å . the pendant (e2-formaldiminium)zirconocene cation complex <nUm> is generated by treatment of the (Cp-CMe2NMe2)CpZrMe2 precursor <nUm> with BC18F15 . the formation of <nUm> proceeds with C-H activation and methane evolution . addition of the phosphanes PPh2R ( r = ph , CH3 and cyclopropyl ) lead to the stable adduct 6a-c , in which the Zr-CH2-N three - membered ring structure of the (e2-for-maldiminium)Zr subunit is retained . the reactive complex <nUm> readily insert benzophenone into the Zr - CH2N linkage to yield the carbon-carbon coupling product 7. a-Olefins also insert into the reactive Zr-C bond of <nUm> . exposure of <nUm> to ethene at a low temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) result in the formation of the labile metallacyclic mono-alkene- insertion product <nUm> , that is characterized spectroscopically . styrene and 4- tert-bu-tylstyrene undergo a clean [2,1]insertion into the Zr-C bond of <nUm> to selectively yield the isomerically pure mono-insertion product 9a and 9b , respectively , that exhibit their aryl substituents in the a-position adjacent to the zirconium center . In each case a single stereoisomer is formed that contains a s-p-structured e3-benzylic coordination of the chain end , exhibiting the meso-allyl position oriented ci to the substituted cp ring at the resulting metallacyclic framework . complex 9b wa characterized by x-ray crystal - structure analysis . the catalytic activity of Cp2ZrCl2 supported on three type of molecular sieve ( MCM-41 , VPI-5 and Y zeolite ) wa evaluated in the polymerization of ethylene . the support were dehydrated , pre-treated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , and then reacted with Cp2ZrCl2 . after heterogenization of Cp2ZrCl2 on the molecular sieve , the MAO concentration could be reduced without significant effect on the catalytic activity . the polymer obtained with the heterogeneous catalyst showed higher melting point and molecular weight , a well a narrower polydispersion than those obtained with the homogeneous catalyst precursor . the substituted 6-hydroxy-trans-3-hexenoic acid 2-4 have been prepared by a template coupling reaction between ( butadiene ) zirconocene , C6O6W , and cyclobutanone , cyclodecanone , or cyclododecanone , respectively , followed by hydrolytic / oxidative demetallation of the resulting metallacyclic zirconoxycarbene tungsten complex . the hydroxyalkenoic acid 2-4 have been found to form two novel fundamental type of associated supramolecular structural array in the solid state through intermolecular hydrogen bonding , which have been characterized by x-ray diffraction analysis . the cyclobutanone - derived compound <nUm> exhibit an infinitely extending sheet - like structure , which is composed of symmetrically alternating interconnected 12- and 36-membered ring , each being constructed from the functional group or framework of four individual molecule of <nUm> . In contrast , the cyclodecanone- derived compound <nUm> adopts a ribbon - type structure composed of C2- symmetrically arranged symmetry - equivalent 15-membered ring , each containing the functionality from three individual molecule of <nUm> . on the basis of scanning force microscopy study , the cyclododecanone - derived compound <nUm> would appear to have a similar structure in the solid state . the structural feature of the molecular assembly that are formed by intermolecular hydrogen bonding of compound 2-4 in the solid state are selectively controlled by the size and favoured conformation of the spiro - anellated carbocyclic ring at C6 of the 6-hydroxy-trans-3-hexenoic acid carbon chain . the title complex are stable , borate - bridged ansa - zirconocene specie which have been prepared by reacting [ { Ph(SMe2)B(e5-C5H4) 2}ZrCl2 ] ( 1 ) with cp*2 - AlMe and [PPN]Cl . their molecular structure were determined by x-ray diffraction . noteworthy are the stability of the borate-cyclopentadienyl linkage and the enhanced lewis acidity of the boron within it strained ansa position . the chemistry research community is identifying hafnium 's potential capability a a catalyst to advance N and C-H activation reaction . the research ha found a close relationship between the physical and chemical property of hafnium and zirconium . it is reported that hafnocene-N2 and zirconocene-N2 complex react with H to form a hydrazine core between two metallocene unit . hafnium is also found to offer broader reactivity of the dihafnocene-N2 complex with carbon dioxide leading to double insertion of carbon dioxide into the Hf-N bond to form a n2-carbon dioxide core . the group <nUm> metallocene reaction with acetylene form adduct between bi ( trimethylsilyl ) acetylene , titanocene , and zirconocene . the chemical researcher have applied the enhanced reactivity of hafnium organometallic compound for synthesis and catalysis . several supported zirconocene catalyst were prepared by using Cl2Mg · 6H2O a a precursor for producing an active support . such catalyst combined with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) obtained by reacting Cl2Mg · 6H2O with AlMe3 show good activity for ethylene polymerization similar to that of anhydrous Cl2Mg supported zirconocene catalyst . the chemical structure of end group of medium - low molecular weight atactic and isotactic polypropylene ( a-PP and i-PP ) , produced with zirconocene / methylalumoxane catalyst , have been analyzed and used to infer the chain - transfer reaction mechanism , which are then correlated with the zirconocene ligand structure and the polymerization condition . for the chiral , isospecific ansa - zirconocenes such a rac-[ethylenebis(1-indenyl)]ZrCl2 / methylalumoxane ( <nUm> / MAO ) and rac-[ethylenebis(4,7-dimethyl-1-indenyl)]ZrCl2 / methylalumoxane ( <nUm> / MAO ) catalyst , i-PP molecular weight is dependent on the reg / ospecificity of the catalyst , a shown by the presence of cis-2-butenyl end group , formed by chain transfer to the monomer after a secondary propylene insertion . At low monomer concentration , chain - transfer with <nUm> / MAO shift from predominant transfer to the monomer after a secondary propylene insertion to b-methyl ( allyl end group ) and b-hydrogen transfer after a primary insertion ( 2-propenyl , or vinylidene , end group ) . Ansti-bis(3-R-indenyl)ZrCl2 ( ansa = CH2 , Me2Si , Me2C ; r = me , t-Bu , Me3Si ) catalyst , which are highly regiospecific , produce polypropylene with chain transfer via both b-hydrogen transfer after a primary insertion and b-methyl transfer . for example , rac-Me2C(3-t-Bu-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( 4 ) exhibit the highest selectivity for b-methyl transfer so far observed in an isospecific zirconocene . As for <nUm> / MAO , the rate of b-methyl transfer in <nUm> / MAO increase by lowering [propylene] . the reaction of the bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene permethylmetallocene complex Cp*2M(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( m = Ti ( 1 ) , m = Zr ( 2 ) ) with H2O and CO2 were studied and compared to those of the corresponding metallocene complex Cp2M(L)(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( m = Ti ( 3 ) , L = - ; m = Zr , L = THF ( 4 ) ) to understand the influence of the ligand Cp(e5-C5H5) and Cp*(e5-C5Me5) a well a the metal titanium and zirconium on the reaction pathway and the obtained product . In the reaction of the permethyltilanocene complex <nUm> with water the dihydroxy complex Cp*2Ti(OH)2 ( 5 ) wa formed . this product differs from the well - known titanoxane Cp2TiOTiCp2 which wa obtained by the reaction of the corresponding titanocene complex <nUm> with water . the reaction of the permethylzirconocene complex <nUm> with water give the mononuclear alkenyl zirconocene hydroxide <nUm> . an analogous product wa assumed a the first step in the reaction of the corresponding zirconocene complex <nUm> with water which end up in a dinuclear zirconoxane . In the conversion of the permethylzirconocene complex <nUm> with carbon dioxide the mononuclear insertion product <nUm> wa formed by coupling of carbon dioxide and the acetylene . In contrast , the corresponding zirconocene complex <nUm> affords , by an analogous reaction , a dinuclear complex . In additional experiment the known complex Cp*2Zr(e2-PhC2SiMe3) ( 8 ) wa prepared , starting from Cp*2ZrCl2 and Mg in the presence of PhC = CSiMe3 . this complex reacts with carbon dioxide resulting in a mixture of the regioisomeric zirconafuranones 9a and 9b . from these in the complex 9a , having the SiMe3 group in b-position to the metal , the Zr-C bond wa quickly hydrolyzed by water to give the complex Cp*2Zr(OH)OC( = O ) - C(SiMe3) = CHPh ( 10a ) compared to complex ( 9b ) which give slowly the complex Cp*2Zr(OH)OC( = O ) - CPh = CH(SiMe3) ( 10b ) . the production of polyethylene by zirconocene catalysis is a multistep process that includes initiation , propagation , and termination . each of these step ha a number of associated equilibrium and transition state structure . these structure have been studied in the gas - phase environment using density functional and integrated method . we have also examined the effect of solvation upon the energetics of the various polymerization step employing continuum and explicit representation of the solvent ( toluene ) . the reaction step we have studied are initiation , propagation , propylene and hexene incorporation , termination by hydrogenolysis , termination by b-H transfer to the metal , termination by b-H transfer to the monomer , and reactivation . the solvation effect of toluene take on special significance for the initiation , termination by hydrogenolysis and by b-H transfer to the metal , and reactivation step . none interaction between different zirconium compound a schwartz reagent [Cp2ZrHCl]n , zirconocene [Cp2Zr] or benzyne zirconocene and unsaturated system incorporating main group element have been investigated . efficient new methodology of preparation of several linear mono- , di- , tri-or polyphosphanes a well a mono- , di-or tricyclic compound incorporating phosphorus , nitrogen , antimony or tin are reported . the mono- and bis-ring substituted zirconocenes with pendant phenyl group [ Zr(e-C5H5)(e-C5H4CMe 2Ph)Me2 ] <nUm> , [ Zr(e-C5H5)(e-C5H4CMe 2C6H4Me-p)Me2 ] <nUm> , [ Zr(e-C5H4CMe2Ph)2Me <nUm> ] <nUm> , and [ Zr(e-C5H4CMe2C6H 4Me-p)2Me2 ] <nUm> have been prepared . the crystal structure of <nUm> and <nUm> have been determined . compound 2-5 react with methyl abstracting reagent such a BC18F15 or [Ph3C]+[B(C6F5)4] - to form cationic zirconocene complex 6-9 a solvent separated ion pair a shown by low temperature NMR spectroscopy . for the cationic complex [ Zr(e-C5H5)(e-C5H4CMe 2Ph)Me]+[RB(C6F5)3] - ( r = me 6a or C6F5 6b ) and [ Zr(e-C5H5)(e-C5H4CMe 2C6H4Me-p)Me]+[RB(C 6F5)3]- ( r = me 7a or C6F5 7b ) evidence for the co-ordination of a phenyl group to the zirconium centre via agostic C-H-M interaction wa obtained by NMR spectroscopy . these cationic complex can be considered a model for solvent adduct in kaminsky catalyst . the cationic complex [Zr(e-C5H4CMe2Ph)2Me] +[RB(C6F5)3]- ( r = me 8a or C6F5 8b ) ( derived from <nUm> ) and [ Zr(e-C5H4CMe2C6H 4Me-p)2Me]+[RB(C6F5) 3]- ( r = me 9a or C6F5 9b ) ( derived from <nUm> ) , respectively , exhibit more complex behaviour . these observation contrast with those from the previously published benzyl congener [Zr(e-C5H4CH2Ph)2Me2] <nUm> which , with methyl abstracting agent , generates both a solvent separated cation / anion pair and a tight ion pair . zirconocene supported on alumina or magnesium chloride exhibit modest olefin polymerization activity but not when it is supported directly on silica . the surface silanol a well a siloxane group must be passivated with appropriate reagent . A very active and stereospecific supported catalyst wa obtained by first reacting silica with methylalumoxane and bisphenol A before the impregnation of the ansa - zirconocene precursor . the main difference between a homogeneous and supported catalyst is that at the same gross amount of metallocene , the net concentration of it in the pore of a support material is several order of magnitude greater than it exists in solution thus the rate of deactivation in the former case is correspondingly faster than in the latter . most other supported metallocene catalyst based on support such a zeolite , cyclodextrin , polymeric MAO , synthetic polymer , etc. , are poor in olefin polymerization for this and other reason discussed . the tetraphenyl substituted disiloxane bridged ansa - zirconocene ha been generated to probe the effect of bridging ligand on metallocene polymerization . the indicated zirconocene ha been synthesized by the reaction of Cl4Zr with the distannylated precursor compound . the new disiloxane bridged ansa - metallocene wa characterized by 1H and 13C NMR , mass analysis , and elemental analysis . ethylene polymerization wa carried out to in- , vestigate the polymerization property of the prepared complex . polymerization experiment exhibited that the catalytic activity increase with the increase in polymerization temperature a well a the amount of cocatalyst . on the other hand , the molecular weight of the polymer decreased with the increase in polymerization temperature . it turned out that tetraphenyl replacement caused about <nUm> to <nUm> % activity reduction . the most important feature associated in tetramethyl to tetraphenyl substitution wa that molecular weight of the polymer from the tetraphenyl substituted complex were enormously improved comparing to those of the polymer from the tetramethyl one . three procedure were developed for the preparation of Cp2ZrH{(m-H)2BC4H8} , <nUm> . it can be prepared from the reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with K[H2B2(m-H)(m-C4H8) <nUm> ] in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio ; the reaction of Cp2ZrCl{(m-H)2BC4H8} with K[H2B2(m-H)(m-C4H8) <nUm> ] in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio ; and the reaction of Cp2ZrCl{(m-H)2BC4H8} with HLi in a <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio . although the first and second procedure imply the possible synthesis of Cp2Zr{(m-H)2BC4H8}2 , this compound is not formed . group IVB metallocene polyethers containing the synthetic estrogen diethylstilbestrol have been synthesized in moderate yield with chain length ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> employing the interfacial polycondensation procedure . infrared spectroscopy show the absence of the O-H group and formation of the M-O linkage consistent with the formation of the polyether . F-MALDI MS result are consistent with the presence of metal - containing fragmentation cluster containing one and two metal atom and ion fragment up to several hundred unit long . the polymer all show moderate to good inhibition of a group of cancer cell line including colon , breast , lung , and prostrate cell line . the titanocene - containing polymer ha significant CI50 value showing a preference to inhibit the cancer cell line in preference to the WI-38 normal cell line . acetylenic stannanes react with Cp2Zr(H)Cl ( cp = e5-C5H5 ) giving organozirconium(iv) complex , which are trapped with alkynyliodonium tosylates in the presence of Pd(PPh3)4 to afford (Z)-l-en-3-yn-2-ylstannanes . (Butadiene)zirconocenes add tris(pentafluorophenyl)borane in a <nUm> : <nUm> stoichiometry to yield metallocene-hydrocarbylborate-betaine system that serve a active single component metallocene ziegler catalyst . under specific reaction condition , the first olefin insertion step can be experimentally observed . this is used to characterize the stereochemistry and reaction profile of single alkene insertion at a variety of metallocene ziegler catalyst and related system . we have analyzed the computational result for several elementary reaction of the ethylene polymerization process catalyzed by an alternative ( to the existing metallocene catalyst ) " non-cyclopentadienyl " catalyst such a diimine - M(II) ( where m = Ni and Pd ) and chelating bridged ti- and Zr - complex . the obtained data have been compared with those for the existing zirconocene - based catalyst . In general , it wa shown that : ( i ) the resting stage of the process is a metal-olefin-alkyl complex , the olefin coordination energy of which is a few kcal / mol larger for diimine - M(II) system than zirconocene or dialkoxide system ; ( ii ) the rate - determining barrier is a migratory insertion barrier calculated from the metal-olefin-alkyl complex , which is found to be a few kcal / mol larger for the diimine - M(II) system compared to the Cp2ZrCH3+ catalyst . the presence of certain flexible bridging ligand x in the Ti - alkoxide complex , [Y(Ph)X(Ph)Y]TiCH3+ , which are capable of donating electron density to the cationic metal center at various stage during the reaction make this barrier a few kcal / mol smaller for the dialkoxide than the Cp2ZrCH3+ catalyst . it wa shown that an increase in the metal - bridge interaction decrease the migratory insertion barrier and , consequently , increase the catalytic activity of these complex . although the diimine - M(II) catalyst are le active than zirconocene - based one , the microstructure of the polymer produced by the former catalyst , which is found to be a function of temperature , ethylene , steric bulkiness of the auxiliary ligand , and transition metal center , make them attractive for practice . we also have studied the mechanism of several chain termination / transfer reaction , a well a the role of steric effect in the studied elementary reaction . we have clearly demonstrated tremendous possibility of the computational chemistry in solving complex problem of the homogenous catalyst , and it high capability of predicting new and more active catalyst for different commercially important process including olefin polymerization reaction . ethylene is polymerized by heterobimetallic combination of early and late transition metal catalyst . dual combination of zirconocenes and cationic nickel and iron catalyst with multidentate nitrogen - donor ligand are described . reactor blend of linear and branched ethylene homopolymers are obtained . with zirconocene / nickel complex catalyst combination , addition of hydrogen selectively reduces the molecular weight of the linear polyethylene formed by the metallocene catalyst . tetramethyldisilane - bridged bis(1 - indenyl and tetrahydroindenyl ) metallocene dichlorides(Me2SiSiMe2)Ind2MCl 2[M = ti(1) , zr(2) ] and (Me2SiSiMe2)[IndH4]2MCl 2[M = ti(3) , zr(4) ] were synthesized . complex 1-4 were characterized by 1H NMR , mass spectrum and elemental analysis . complex <nUm> and <nUm> were used for the polymerization of ethylene after activation with methyl aluminoxane(MAO) at different temperature and normal pressure . the titanocene <nUm> show a lower activity but produce polyethylene with a higher molecular weight than zirconocene <nUm> . the catalyst system show a dependency of the activity and molecular weight on temperature . metallocene catalyst in dissolved form are in most case unsuitable for the production of polyethylene or polypropylene on an industrial scale . In order to use them in existing technical process , metallocenes have to be supported . Cs - symmetric zirconocenes show a high activity and no leaching additional triisobutyl aluminum is used a scavenger and MAO - covered silica for heterogenization . the aluminum : zirconium ratio can be reduced to value of <nUm> : <nUm> to get optimal activity . the syndiotacticity of the obtained polypropylene is lower compared with polymer of the homogeneous catalyst and decrease strongly with a thinner propene concentration . the moderate electrophilicity of palladium (II) - phosphine catalyst compared to those of zirconocene dichloride make them more tolerant toward a variety of polar functionality of olefinic monomer . this allows use of Pd (II) complex a catalyst for the copolymerization of olefin with readily available polar monomer , like acrylic acid derivative or carbon monoxide . In particular , development during the recent year have opened the way to a new and broad family of high molecular weight 1-olefin / CO co- and terpolymers . these 1,4-polyketone material show interesting and easily variable property which can be tuned from insoluble , highly crystalline to thermoplastic elastic . the latter polymer resemble in some case flexible PVC and even vulcanized natural rubber . new data on the structure of polymethylaluminoxane[-Al(CH3)O-]n ( MAO ) , the nature of it lewis acidity , and the mechanism of formation of the active center of the metallocene catalyst during interaction between MAO and Cp2ZrMe2 obtained by spectroscopy ( 27Al , 17O , 1H , and 13C NMR and spin probe ESR ) and density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation are considered . A three - dimensional structure of MAO ( a cage structure ) with four - coordinated aluminum atom and three - coordinated oxygen atom is found to be the most probable . experimental evidence for the presence of relatively weak lewis acid site in MAO ( about <nUm> site per <nUm> atom of Al ) is obtained for the first time . the acidity of MAO depends on the size of a MAO molecule n , and it increase with increasing n . A scheme for the formation and structure of lewis acid site formed upon interaction between MAO and Al2Me6 , which is always present in the MAO sample is proposed . cationic intermediate formed in the MAO / Cp2ZrMe2 system at high molar ratio Al / Zr = 200-4000 corresponding to real condition of polymerization are characterized for the first time . A scheme of equilibrium between them and the most probable precursor of the active center in this system are proposed . A new mechanism for the formation of the [Cp2ZrMe]+[MAO · me]- ionic pair involving the abstraction and occlusion of a methyl ligand in the bulk of a MAO molecule is proposed on the basis of quantum - chemical calculation . the polyethylene obtained in the presence of the catalyst constituted by the meso isomer of the prototypical zirconocene complex (ethylene)bis(l-indenyDzirconium dichloride activated by methylalumoxane is characterized by the presence of ethyl branch . the intensity of the 13C NMR signal associated with these branch indicate that there are about 1-2 ethyl group per <nUm> monomer unit .
