As a consequence , the melting temperature is 10-15 ° C lower than the linear polyethylene obtained with the rac mixture of the same zirconocene complex . on the basis of kinetic evidence , a branching mechanism that involves a 9-H transfer to the coordinated ethylene is proposed . catalytic pauson - khand reaction product with norbornadiene could be effectively transformed to trisubstituted cyclopentadienes , which have been used to synthesize a series of unbridged bis(1-R'-2-R-3-R'-trisubstituted cyclopentadienyl)zirconium dichloride <nUm> ( r = R' = ph ) , <nUm> ( r = ph , R' = me ) , <nUm> ( r = n-Bu , R' = me ) , <nUm> ( r = t-Bu , R' = me ) , <nUm> ( r = (CH2)4OMe ) , R' = me ) , and <nUm> ( r = n-Bu , R' = ph ) . the crystal structure of <nUm> wa determined by x-ray crystallography . these zirconium complex in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) show activity for the polymerization of ethylene . the activity are in the following order : <nUm> > <nUm> > <nUm> ∼ <nUm> ∼ Cp2ZrCl2 > <nUm> ∼ <nUm> . the activity of <nUm> is four time higher than that of Cp2ZrCl2 under similar condition . In this work , the boron ( B ) modification of MCM-41 - supported dMMAO / zirconocene catalyst showed a promising increase ( almost twice ) in catalytic activity in ethylene / 1-octene copolymerization . the enhanced activity can be attributed to the decreased interaction between the support and dMMAO with boron modification a wa proved by TGA . it wa proposed that boron acted a a spacer anchoring the support and dMMAO . however , at high boron loading ( ca. <nUm> wt % ) , the activity slightly decreased due to the migration of dMMAO into boron layer resulting in le surface concentration of [Al]dMMAO which wa measured by XPS . the inhibition of chain transfer reaction during polymerization apparently occurred upon the boron modification providing higher MW polymer . it wa also suggested that boron modification ha rendered more uniform catalytic site which wa leading to narrower MWD of the polymer observed . based on 13CNMR , boron modification did not affect the microstructure of copolymer obtained . however , the insertion of 1-octene increased with boron modification probably due to decreased steric hindrance of the MCM-41 support . trimethylphosphine - stabilized ethylene complex <nUm> of the ethylenebisindenyl-supported zirconocene fragment are prepared via magnesium reduction of rac - (EBI)ZrCl <nUm> in the presence of ethylene and PMe <nUm> . when the reaction is halted after <nUm> h , good yield of a mixture containing rac-(EBI)Zr(e <nUm> -CH <nUm> = CH <nUm> )PMe <nUm> , rac-1 , and the racemic diastereomer of the zirconacyclopentane derivative (EBI)Zr(e <nUm> -CH <nUm> CH <nUm> CH <nUm> CH <nUm> ) , rac-2 , are obtained . this mixture may be converted to pure rac-1 if treated with excess PMe <nUm> . if the magnesium reduction of rac - (EBI)ZrCl <nUm> is left for <nUm> day in the presence of magnesium chloride , complete epimerization to meso-1 is observed . thus , both diastereomers of <nUm> are available . compound meso-1 and rac-2 have been characterized crystallographically . the coordinated ethylene ligand in compound <nUm> are susceptible to electrophilic attack by the pentafluorophenyl-substituted boranes HB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> and B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> , forming zwitterionic metallocene product . for reaction involving HB(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> , the product meso-3 and rac-3 are characterized by a strong zirconium - hydrido borate interaction , a well a a weak Zr-Cb bonding . In addition to complete solution characterization , the structure of meso-3 wa determined crystallographically . upon treatment of rac-1 with B(C <nUm> F <nUm> ) <nUm> , a more charge - separated zwitterion , rac-4 , wa formed . In addition to retaining it PMe <nUm> ligand , the complex is stabilized by a strong b-CH <nUm> interaction , a determined by x-ray crystallography and NMR spectroscopy . structural comparison between the compound reported herein and previous example in metallocene chemistry are presented . BC18F15 open the ring of the N-tBu azazirconacyclobutane <nUm> by abstracting the carbon from the zirconium ; the resulting amido cation <nUm> reacts slowly with ethylene to form a chelating g-iminoalkyl zirconocene cation , <nUm> . similarly , BC18F15 remove carbon from the Zr of the N-Ph azazirconacyclopentane 5a and the N-SiMe3 azazirconacyclopentane 5b , forming amido cation that are stabilized in the solid state by coordination of phenyl substituents on N ( <nUm> , from 5a ) or C ( <nUm> , from 5b ) ; <nUm> slowly loses hydrogen , forming an azaallyl cation <nUm> . In contrast AlMe2Cl coordinate the N of the zirconaaziridines <nUm> , resulting in an sp2 N coordinated to Zr through a p orbital . the structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and 11a have been established by x-ray crystallography . the reactivity of group <nUm> zirconocene dichloride incorporating (1-trimethylsilyl)-e5-indenyl ( Me3SiInd ) and e5-1-(trimethylsilyl)-4,5,6,7-tetrahydromdenyl ( Me3SiTHI ) ligand toward boron tribromide wa investigated . whereas the reaction of (Me3SiInd)CpZrCl2 ( 1 ) with BBr3 in CCl2H2 immediately cleaved the indenyl ligand from the metal , (Me3SiTHI)CpZrCl2 ( 3 ) reacted with BBr3 in CCl2H2 at <nUm> ° C for <nUm> day to obtain [1-(BrSiMe2)THI]CpZrBr2 ( 6 ) in <nUm> % yield . the reaction of (Me3SiInd)Li ( <nUm> equiv ) with ZrCl4(THF)2 afforded pure rac-(Me3-SiInd)2ZrCl2 ( 2 ) in <nUm> % yield . hydrogenation of ( 2 ) ( <nUm> bar , O2Pt catalyst ) afforded rac-(Me3-SiTHI)2ZrCl2 ( 4 ) in <nUm> % yield . single - crystal x-ray diffraction analysis of <nUm> showed that the Zr atom lie on a crystallographic C2 axis with the CH2 annelated ring projecting into the Cl2Zr hemisphere of the pseudotetrahedral coordination environment . the reaction of <nUm> with MeLi in toluene afforded rac-(Me3SiTHI)2ZrMe2 ( 5 ) in <nUm> % yield . 1H NMR and 13C NMR analysis confirmed the rac assignment for <nUm> . treatment of <nUm> with BBr3 in CCl2H2 at <nUm> ° C for <nUm> day afforded rac-[1-(BrMe2Si)THI]2ZrBr2 ( 7 ) in <nUm> % yield . the reaction of <nUm> with moisture in ambient air gave the ansa - metallocene rac-[m-O-(1-Me2SiTHI)2]ZrBr2 ( 8 ) in <nUm> % yield . In solution , <nUm> showed time - averaged C2 symmetry ( 1H NMR ) ; however , single - crystal x-ray diffraction analysis showed that <nUm> adopts an asymmetric conformation in which only one of the CH2 annelated ring project into the Cl2Zr coordination hemisphere . neither <nUm> nor <nUm> served a a precatalyst for alumoxane - cocatalyzed , homogeneous propylene polymerization . none treatment of the alkyl group <nUm> metallocene cation reagent [ZrCp2{CH2Si(CH3)3}(THF)] +[BPh4]- 2b with bis(propynyl)zirconocene 1a yielded the cationic dimetallic complex [ (ZrCp2)2(m-e1 : e2-CH3CCCH3){m-k 2-C ≡ CCH2Si(CH3)3}]+ 3d with BPh4- anion . complex 3d wa characterized spectroscopically and by a crystal structure analysis . it contains a planar four-co-ordinate carbon atom , which is stabilized by the interaction with both group <nUm> metal centre . finding the C4H11Si substituent , that originates from the alkylzirconocene reagent , attached at the m-acetylide ligand in the final product is unusual . A reversible alkynyl carbometallation sequence is proposed to account for the observed selective formation of 3d . complex 3d reacted with alkyl isocyanides RN ≡ C ( r = CMe2CH2CMe3 , CMe3 , or cyclohexyl ) by replacement of the m-e1 : e2-CH3CCCH3 ligand to form the m-isocyanide complex [ (ZrCp2)2(m-e1-C : e2-C,N-RNC){m-k2-C ≡ CCH 2Si(CH3)2}]+ ( with BPh4- anion ) of which one wa characterized by a crystal structure analysis . dinitrile cyclization reaction leading to new six - membered heterocycle 1-s3,l3-phospha-2,6-diazines 3a,b and 1,4-s3,l3-diphospha-2,6-diazines <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> are presented . these synthesis involve dinitrile derivative , schwartz reagent [Cp2ZrHCl]n , and phosphorus compound a promoted cyclization reagent . an x-ray crystal structure of the 1,4-s3,l3-diphospha-2,6-diazine <nUm> is reported . the polymeric [Ind2Si(C6H4)]n and [Ind2Si(C6H4)]m compound ( ind = indenyl ) were synthesized via the condensation reaction of bisindenyldichlorosilane and p-dilithiobenzene or p-dilithiobiphenyl , and the supported - type zirconocene catalyst were prepared by reacting them with zirconium tetrachloride . the content of zirconium in the catalyst is much higher than that in the metallocene catalyst supported by inorganic compound . polymerization of ethene and propene were conducted with them using methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) or ordinary alkylaluminiums a cocatalysts and toluene a the solvent . the catalyst combined with MAO display very high activity especially for the ethene polymerization . from the polymerization at high temperature , it wa found that the active specie are markedly stabilized , probably due to the rigid backbone of the carrier . the activity of the catalyst activated with ordinary alkylaluminiums is far le a compared with those activated with MAO . reaction of the branched polyynes tris(tert-butylbutadiynyl)benzene ( 1,3,5-(tBuC ≡ CC ≡ C)3C6H3 ) ( 1 ) with the metallocene source Cp2Ti(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe3 ) ( 2 ) and Cp2Zr(THF)(e2-Me3SiC ≡ CSiMe <nUm> ) ( <nUm> ; THF = tetrahydrofuran ) led to diverse novel organometallic ti6 ( 4 ) , zr3 ( 5 ) , and zr6 ( 6 ) complex depending on the metal , the polyynes , and the stoichiometry employed in the conversion . the new complex have been characterized spectroscopically . additionally x-ray crystal structure analysis were performed for <nUm> and <nUm> . this paper describes the use of several kind of group IV cp based catalyst system , in the synthesis of co- and terpolymers of ethylene , propylene and . a-olefins endowed with OH and COOH functional group . the hydroxy monomer used were 5-hexen-l-ol ( 4 ) and 10-undecen-l-ol ( 5 ) and the carboxy monomer wa 10-undecen-l-oic acid ( 6 ) . the three catalyst system used were the C2 symmetric ansa - zirconocene ( 1 ) the " in-site " titanium complex ( 2 ) and the non-rigid zirconocene ( 3 ) , all activated by methylaluminoxane . trimethylaluminium wa used to protect the functional group of polar monomer . the first two catalyst system suffer similar activity loss in the presence of polar monomer whereas the third one exhibited better tolerance toward the hydroxyolefins . NMR and FTIR spectroscopy were used to characterize the polymerization product . all three catalyst system afforded functionalized co- and terpolymers by direct polymerization of ethylene / propylene / hydroxy-a - olefin but only the catalyst system ( 1 ) / MAO display appreciable activity for direct polymerization of ethylene , propylene and carboxy-a-ole-fins . deprotonation of the aminofulvene <nUm> with LiCH(SiMe3)2 provides <nUm> , which reacts with MCl4 ( m = Zr or Hf ) by intramolecular NMe2H elimination and coupling of the fulvene moiety to form complex <nUm> or <nUm> . this reaction is a useful synthetic pathway to allyl-bridged ansa - metallocenes , especially those with a conjugated 14p electron system . r ' = dimethylamino . the present work is aimed at increasing the seed germination of damaged and older seed in an effort to allow such seed to act a reliable seed source . the synthesis and structural characterization of kinetin - containing group IVB metallocene - containing polymer is described . A number of seed were treated with ppm amount of kinetin and kinetin - containing polymer . the rate of seed germination wa generally increased for the seed that were treated in comparison to those seed that were not treated . these increase in seed germination ranged to over seven fold . liquid co- and terpolymers based on inexpensive and abundant a-olefins and ethylene feed stock were produced using a single site zirconocene catalyst . the process is based , in part , on the formation of synthetic hydrocarbon base oil ( SHC ) with catalyst having a high viscosity index , low pour point , low volatility , low cold cranking viscosity , high flash point , and excellent oxidation stability . the characteristic of the liquid polymer were modified by cracking and hydrogenation to generate SHC . the oil ' performance property were comparable to or better than PAO and are an economical alternative to formulating high performance motor oil and lubricant . formal [3+2] cycloaddition reaction between the a-phosphino zirconaindene <nUm> and various cumulenes [ CO2 , CS2 , Cy-N = C = N-Cy ( cy = cyclohexyl ) , R-N = C = S ( r = me , ph ) , R-N = C = O ( r = ph , ' bu ) ] afford stable zwitterionic monomeric five - coordinated anionic bis-(cyclopentadienyl) zirconium complex 2-6 . single - crystal x-ray structure of two of these compound ( <nUm> , 6b ) are reported . A related biszwitterionic zirconocene complex <nUm> is prepared through the reaction of carbon disulfide with the tricyclic a-phospholane zirconaindan <nUm> ; in this case cycloaddition reaction take place on the two carbon sulfur double bond of CS2 . unbridged , sterically substituted zirconocene dichloride can be prepared in high yield by the interaction of a dialkylzirconium dichloride with <nUm> equiv of the appropriate fulvene in hydrocarbon medium with alkene displacement . the requisite dialkylzirconium dichloride can readily be produced by the alkylation of Cl4Zr in hydrocarbon medium with <nUm> equiv of an alkyllithium reagent . generating the R2ZrCl2 reagent in hydrocarbon medium permit their use a hydrozirconating agent for a variety of polar unsaturated organic substrate . A stereoregular alternating ethylene-styrene copolymer , also stretchable in fiber form , ha been obtained with rac-isopropylidenebis(1-indenyl)zirconium dimethyldiamide activated by the methyl-alumoxane catalytic system . from x-ray diffraction fiber spectrum , an isotactic structure ha been assigned to this copolymer a well a the previously described stereoregular ethylene-styrene copolymer . the polymer ha zigzag planar chain conformation with phenyl group oriented perpendicularly to the chain axis . the crystallographic symmetry in B2 / m . lattice constant ( monoclinic , unique axis c ) : a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å ; γ = <nUm> ° . the disagreement index for measured reflection is R1 = <nUm> . A series of substituted indenyl-fluorenyl asymmetric ethylene-bridged ligand have been prepared from the reaction of 1-(9-fluorenyl)-2-bromoethane and the lithium salt of the desired indenyl moiety . the ligand have been converted to the corresponding substituted asymmetric ethylene-bridged metallocenes ( m = Zr , Hf ) . these metallocenes have been evaluated a catalyst precursor for the polymerization of ethylene and propylene . the influence of substitution on the selectivity of the propylene polymerization ha been studied . the metallocene [1-(9-fluorenyl)-2-(2,4,7-trimethyl-1-indenyl)ethane]zirconium dichloride wa found to produce highly isotactic polypropylene with an [mmmm] value of <nUm> % . A general investigation of the elementary reaction involved in the activation process of zirconocene and Ni - based derivative by methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) wa performed through the association of polymerization kinetics and spectroscopic investigation of the catalytic system . this study demonstrates the close correlation between polymerization activity and the change in the UV / visible characteristic absorption band of the transition metal derivative used a catalyst . hex-1-ene wa chosen a model monomer . homo- and copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene were conducted at different temperature and ethylene pressure with several zirconocenes activated with dimethylanilinium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( Me2PhNH*B(C6F5) <nUm> ) / triisobutylaluminium ( i-Bu3Al ) to study the effect of ligand structure and polymerization condition on catalytic activity , molecular weight and chain transfer reaction . At high temperature and low ethylene pressure , rac-ethylene(bisindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) activated with Me2PhNH*B(C6F5)4 / i-Bu 3Al initially give a highly active catalyst that is rapidly deactivated . trans-Vinylene double bond , which were not formed at low temperature , were detected in polyethylene synthesized at high temperature and low ethylene pressure . they reasonably arise from b-H transfer after isomerization reaction . the molecular weight of ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer decrease with increasing 1-hexene feed , followed by the formation of vinylidene end group . this reveals that b-H transfer from propagating chain containing primary inserted 1-hexene a a terminal unit is predominant . this reaction is influenced by the ligand structure . At high temperature and high ethylene pressure , trans-vinylene and vinylidene content decrease and the vinyl content increase , indicating that the high ethylene pressure control b-H transfer after isomerization reaction . ethylene polymerization and ethylene / a-olefin copolymerization were conducted using diphenylmethylidene(cyclopentadienyl)(fluorenyl)zirconium dichloride ( Ph2C(Cp)(Flu)ZrCl2 ) a a catalyst activated with dimethylanilinium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( Me2PhNH · BC24F20 ) / triisobutylaluminium ( i-Bu3Al ) at high temperature and different ethylene pressure . this catalyst produce high molecular weight polyethylene with high activity . the molecular weight of the copolymer hardly decrease with increasing amount of comonomer in the feed . this is attributed to the control b-H transfer from the propagating chain containing primary inserted comonomer . the occurrence of inner trisubstituted double bond wa confirmed . these bond are probably formed by dehydrogenation reaction after b-H transfer from the propagating chain followed by ethylene insertion . therefore , this reaction might play an important role in the production of high molecular weight ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer at high temperature . At high ethylene pressure , isomerization reaction from inserted ethylene or primary inserted a-olefin a terminal unit , which were observed under low ethylene pressure , can be controlled at low level . institut fur anorganische chemie der universitat zu koln , greinstrasse <nUm> , D-50939 koln A series of new ansa - zirconocene dichloride compound [ PR(C5H4)2ZrCl2 ; r = me(5) , et ( 6 ) , iPr ( 7 ) , tBu ( 8 ) ] with phosphorus a bridging atom between the cyclopentadienyl ring have been prepared , isolated , and characterised by 1H , 13C , 31P NMR spectroscopy , mass spectrometry and elemental analysis . the x-ray structure of <nUm> is reported . A novel polymer - supported metallocene catalyst with crosslinked poly(styrene-co-acrylamide) ( AmPS ) a the support ha been prepared and characterized . the probability of long sequence of acrylamide ( Am ) in AmPS is still low even at an Am amount of <nUm> mol % , implying the relatively homogeneous distribution of Am . the infrared spectrum of AmPS and the supported catalyst substantiate that an amide group in AmPS coordinate with methylaluminoxane through both oxygen and nitrogen atom . ethylene / a-octene copolymerization showed that the catalytic activity is not markedly affected by adding a-octene . 13C NMR analysis of the ethylene / a-octene copolymer indicated that the composition distribution of the copolymer is uniform . novel heterobimetallic complex that consist of zirconium and rhodium , LRh(e2CH2 = CH)2Si(e5-C 5H2-2,4-Mc2)2ZrCl2 ( 3a L = e5-C9H7 , 3b e2-C5H5 , 3c e-C5Me5 ) , were synthesized , and 3b wa structurally characterized . the complex have a " C2 - symmetric " ansa - zirconocene part and the rhodium metal on the bridge part . the complex 3a - c in combination with methylaluminoxane catalyzed highly isospecific polymerization of a-olefins . their catalytic activity were higher than that of the parent zirconocene complex , and the obtained polymer had a larger molecular weight . for ethylene polymerization , the supported metallocene catalyst wa prepared by anchoring CpIndZrCl2 on silica with an appropriate spacer . the three procedure were applied for CpIndZrCl2 anchoring on silica with a hexamethyltrisiloxane or pentamethylene spacer . the anchoring procedure exerted a strong influence on the catalyst activity since the different anchoring method gave the formation of different structure of active site . with the new anchoring route , it wa possible to prepare the " heterogeneous single - site " catalyst which wa found to have only one catalyst structure on silica and exhibited a higher catalyst activity than that of the other supported catalyst . At a polymerization temperature of <nUm> ° C , the activity of the heterogeneous single - site catalyst wa comparable to that of the unsupported homogeneous zirconocene . propylene polymerization wa carried out using an ansa - zirconocene pyrrolidide based catalytic system of racemic ethylene-1,2-bis(1-indenyl)zirconium dipyrrolidide [ rac-(EBI)Zr(NC4H8)2 or ( rac-1 ) ] and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) or a noncoordinating anion . In situ generation of cationic alkylzirconium specie wa also investigated by NMR - scale reaction of rac-1 and MAO , and rac-1 , AlMe3 , and [Ph3C] [B(C6Fg)4] . In the NMR - scale reaction using CD2Cl2 a a solvent , a small amount of MAO ( [Al] / [Zr] = <nUm> ) wa enough to completely activate rac-1 to give cationic methyl-zirconium cation that can polymerize propylene . the resulting isotactic polypropylene ( iPP ) isolated in this reaction showed a meso pentad value of <nUm> % . In a similar NMR - scale reaction rac-1 wa stoichiometrically methylated by AlMe3 to give rac - (EBI)ZrMe2 , and the introduction of [Ph3C] [B(C6F5)4] into the reaction mixture containing rac - (EBI)ZrMe2 led to in situ generation of cationic [rac-(EBI)Zr(m-Me)2AlMe2]+ specie that can polymerize propylene to give iPP showing a meso pentad value of <nUm> % . the catalyst system rac - <nUm> / MAO exhibited an increase of activity a the [Al] / [Zr] ratio increased within an experimental range ( [Al] / [Zr] = 930-6511 ) . the meso pentad value of the resulting iPPs were in the range of <nUm> - <nUm> % . the catalytic activity showed a maximum ( rp = <nUm> × <nUm> g PP / mol Zr h atm ) when [Zr] wa <nUm> × 10-6 mol / L in the propylene polymerization according to the concentration of catalyst . MAO - free polymerization of propylene wa performed by a rac - <nUm> / AlR3 / noncoordinating anion catalytic system . the efficiency of AlR3 wa decreased in the order of AlMe3 ( rp = <nUm> × <nUm> g PP / mol Zr h atm ) > Al(i-Bu)3 ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) > AlPr3 ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) > Al(i-Bu)2H ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) > AlEt3 ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) . the performance of the noncoordinating anion a a cocatalyst wa on the order of [HNMePh2][B(C6F5)4] ( rp , = <nUm> × <nUm> g PP / mol Zr h atm ) > [HNMe2Ph] [B(C6F5)4] ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) > [Ph3C] [B(C6F5)4] ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) > [HNEt2Ph][B(C6F5)4] ( <nUm> × <nUm> ) . the property of iPP were characterized by 13C - NMR , FTIR , DSC , GPC , and viscometry . 13C NMR spectroscopic study of the in situ polymerization of 13C - enriched ethylene ( 13C2H4 ) in the presence of Cp2Zr(13CH3)2 and methylaluminoxane or BC18F15 a cocatalysts were carried out . the first direct observation of Cp2Zr-polymeryl specie wa made . the in situ polymerization experiment in the presence of different concentration of dinuclear [(Cp2ZrMe)2(m-Me)]+ and mononuclear cation specie [Cp2ZrMe]+ , having [MeB(C6F5)3]- or [MeMAO]- counterions , were performed . these comparison made it possible to make the assignment of the zirconocene complex bearing the polymeryl chain a ligand [Cp2Zr13CH2P]+[13CH 3MAO]- , [Cp2Zr13CH2P]+[13CH 3B(C6F5)3]- , and Cp2Zr(13CH2P)(13CH3) . they are in equilibrium with each other . mononuclear Zr - polymeryl ion pair such a [Cp2Zr13CH2P]+[13CH 3B(C6F5)3]- and [Cp2Zr13CH2P]+[13CH 3MAO]- either are the propagating active specie or are intermediate , closely related to the active specie , in the polymer propagation . metallocene / borate catalyst , generated from zirconocene dimethyl compound , LnZrMe2 , and anilinium borate , [HNMe2Ph]+[B(C6F5)4] - , were used to copolymerize 5-N,N-diisopropylamino-1-pentene with 1-hexene and 4-methyl-1-pentene . the selected zirconocenes , bis(pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)zirconium(IV) dimethyl ( Cp*2ZrMe2 ) and rac-ethylenebis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl)zirconium(IV) dimethyl ( rac - EB(THI)ZrMe2 ) , provided atactic and isotactic material , respectively . the isotactic polymer produced were amorphous or crystalline depending of the monomer . the calculated reactivity ratio for the copolymerization of 5-N,N-diisopropylamino-1-pentene with 1-hexene and metallocene rac-EB(T-HI)ZrMe2 indicate that this system approximates an ideal azeotropic copolymerization with r1 = <nUm> and r2 = <nUm> . estimate for the reactivity ratio for the copolymerization of 5-N,N-diisopropylamino-1-pentene with 4-methyl-1-pentene were r1 = <nUm> and r2 = <nUm> for rac - EB(THI)ZrMe2 and r1 = <nUm> and r2 = <nUm> for Cp*2ZrMe2 . the polymerization of 1-hexene in the presence of the saturated 1-N,N-diisopropylaminopentane with rac - EBCTHDZrMe2 / borate wa compared with analogous copolymerizations of 1-hexene / 5-N,N-diisopropylamino-1-pentene . the aminopentene wa more effective than the aminopentane in inhibiting the rate of total monomer conversion , implicating both intra- and intermolecular mechanism for inhibition by the amine . copolymer of 4-methyl-1-pentene / 5-N,N-diisopropylamino-1-pentene produced with rac-ethylenebisindenyl zirconium(IV) dimethyl ( rac - EBIZrMe2 ) / borate have higher decomposition temperature with increasing amount of aminopentene . this copolymer can be protonated with ClH to yield a methanol - soluble material . alkyl zirconocenes [Zr(e-C5H4R)2X2] ( where r = CH2Ph , x = Cl 1a or me 1b ; r = CHPh2 , x = Cl 2a or me 2b ; r = Si(SiMe3)3 , x = Cl 4a or me 4b ) and for comparison [ Zr(e-C5H5)(e-C5H4CH 2Ph)Cl2 ] 3a were prepared and characterised . the reaction of these compound with the methide abstracting reagent BC18F15 , B(o-C6F5C6F4)3 and [Ph3C]+[B(C6F5)4] - were investigated by low temperature NMR spectroscopy . compound 1b reacts with [Ph3C]+[B(C6F5)4] - to form the homodinuclear complex [ {Zr(e-C5H4CH2Ph)2Me} 2(m-Me)]+[B(C6F5) 4]- . the related compound [ {Zr(C5H4CH2Ph)2Me} 2(m-Me)]+[MeB(C6F5) 3]- 5a wa formed from the reaction of 1b with <nUm> equivalent of BC18F15 . reaction between 1b and <nUm> equivalent BC18F15 gave [ Me(e-C5H4CH2Ph) 2Zr(m-Me)B(C6F5)3 ] 6a and the ion pair [Zr(e-C5H4CH2Ph)2Me][MeB(C 6F5)3 ] 6b which are in equilibrium with each other . A similar observation wa made when 2b wa used instead of 1b . the sterically more demanding 4b doe not show this behaviour . the role of the ligand in ethylene polymerisation wa investigated . three possible mechanism of ethylene polymerization in the presence of zirconocene catalyst have been described through density functional calculation . about <nUm> structure ( reactant , intermediate , transition state , and product ) have been located on the potential energy surface . only two mechanism , called frontside and stepwise backside , appear to be competitive . the frontside mechanism ha already been described in the literature , but we present here some important new aspect . In particular , we discus the important role of the perpendicular form of the olefin p-complex for the frontside process . the stepwise backside mechanism is reported for the first time . the energy barrier in both mechanism are on the order of <nUm> kcal / mol , which is compatible with the experimental and theoretical value available for similar process . the energy difference between both mechanism is certainly below the computational method accuracy , and a definitive conclusion regarding the most favorable mechanism can not be drawn . the influence of other factor such a substituents on the catalyst or the size of the polymer chain could be fundamental . (e2-Formaldehyde)zirconocene dimer ( 8 ) cleanly add one or two molar equivalent of the borane BC12F10H by insertion of the H-[B] unit into the zirconium-carbon bond of the metallaoxirane moleties to form the mono- and bis-insertion product <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . these system contain five - membered heterocyclic ring that are built up by connecting five different element , namely H , B , C , O , and Zr . the bis(borane) insertion product <nUm> wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . (Butadiene)zirconocene reacts with BC12F10H in a similar way by insertion of the H-[B] unit into the (butadiene)C4-Zr linkage to form the metallacycle <nUm> . the tricyclic zirconocene - phosphaalkyne dimer complex <nUm> reacts with diethyl mesoxalate ( 5 ) or tetracyanoethene ( 7 ) through Cp2Zr-displacement to furnish the novel oxadiphosphatricyclohexane <nUm> or the diphosphatricyclohexane <nUm> , respectively . In contrast , treatment of <nUm> with indanetrione ( 9 ) result in the formation of the dioxadiphosphatricyclooctene <nUm> , which ha been characterized by x-ray structure analysis . ethylbisindenyl zirconium dichloride ( Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) and the MAO methylalumoxane ( MAO ) co-catalyst were heterogenized on davision silica <nUm> partially dehydroxylated at <nUm> ° C , following the concept of equilibrium adsorption . the influence of MAO on the electronic environment resulting from the heterogenization wa investigated using XPS . heterogenization of Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 and MAO on the above silica generated two type of zirconocenium cation ( cation <nUm> and cation <nUm> ) , independent of the heterogenization method . based on the postulated surface chemistry , cation <nUm> is presumed to be in the form of an ion - pair [SiO]-[Et(Ind)2ZrCl]+ , whereas cation <nUm> is presumed to be a trapped multi-coordinated crown complex of MAO . In the absence of MAO , only cation <nUm> is formed . the present study provides some support for the postulated surface chemistry regarding heterogenization of Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 and MAO on silica . carbon-carbon bond - forming reaction of allylic organometals have been recognized a one of the most fundamental mean in organic synthesis , and a number of application for the synthesis of biologically active molecule have been reported . we have reported the carbon-carbon bond - forming reaction by the use of the allylic and related zirconium specie a reactive intermediate . these zirconium specie can be generated by treating allylic ether with zirconocene - butene complex ( " Cp2Zr " ) through the formation of zirconacyclopropane and the following b-elimination of the alkoxy group . this process wa found to be applicable to generate the γ , g-dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie <nUm> from orthoacrylate derivative . zirconium specie <nUm> possibly ha three reactive site : one is the g-position a a typical allyl metal specie , the other is the b-position followed by the a-position initiated by nucleophilic character of ketene dialkylacetal moiety and the third one is regioselective coupling reaction at the a-position . thus , g,g-dialkoxyallylic zirconium specie <nUm> can be conveniently prepared by the reaction of triethyl orthoacrylate with " Cp2Zr " . without an additive , <nUm> itself reacts with aldehyde and ketone at the g-position to afford the gem-diethoxy homoallylic alcohol derivative . under lewis acid promoted condition , this zirconium specie <nUm> reacts with a variety of carbonyl compound selectively at the b-position in the first step , followed by the cyclopropanation or cyclobutanation reaction to afford the corresponding product mainly depending on electronic nature of substrate or reaction condition . In the presence of CCuN , reaction of <nUm> with allylic phosphate proceeded at the a-position of <nUm> in a highly SN2'- selective manner to give the 5-alkenoates . none novel fl / iya - metallocene complex containing bis(indenyl) ligand bridged at <nUm> position were obtained . ethylene or trimethylene bridged type zirconocene wa synthesized from bis(p-tolyl)ethane or bis(p-tolyl)propane a starting material , respectively . dimethylsilylene bridged type zirconocene wa prepared from the protected 4-bromo-l-indanone derivative . it turned out that meso-C2H4[4,4'(2,7-dimethylindenyl)2]ZrCl2 and 7-flc-Me2Si[4,4'-(2-methylindenyl)2]ZrCl2 were suitable catalyst for producing ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer ith high molecular weight . highly isotactic polypropylene wa obtained by using rac-MejSiXS-methyl-l-phenylindenyOJZrClj catalyst and contained only small amount of 3,1-type regiodefects . the molecular structure of these complex were confirmed by x-ray analysis . the dipeptide derivative Boc-Gly-Val-OMe ( 2 ) and Boc-Ala-Val-OMe ( 3 ) selectively add the methylzirconocene cation <nUm> to the carbonyl oxygen atom of the N - terminal amino acid residue ( K-C4 = O coordination ) upon treatment with [Cp2ZrCH3(THF)+BPh4-] in dichloromethane at low temperature ( < <nUm> ° C ) to generate the complex 2-1 and 3-1 , respectively . above <nUm> ° C methane is eliminated to give the stable chelate peptide metallocene cation complex 2- A and 3-A , respectively , both featuring a combined C1 = O / N / C4 = O coordination to the zirconium center . complex 3-A wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the analogous tripeptide derivative Boc-Gly-Val-Val-OMe ( 6 ) , Boc-Ala-Ala-Val-OMe ( 7 ) , Boc-Ala-Val-Val-OMe ( 8 ) , and Boc-Val-Val-Gly-OMe ( 9 ) all form analogous K-C4 = O Cp2ZrCH3+ cation adduct (6-9)I under kinetic control and after subsequent loss of CH4 C1 = O / N / C4 = O chelate complex (8-9)-A under thermodynamic control , both involving selective bonding of the organometallic cation to the terminal amino acid residue of the respective peptide derivative . thermolysis of the primary adduct 7-I ( > <nUm> ° C ) resulted in methane elimination and formation of a mixture of the isomer 7-B and 7-A ( isolated in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio ) . according to the detailed NMR analysis 7-A show the favored chelate coordination at the N - terminus involving C1 = O / N / C4 = O bonding , whereas the cation complex 7-B exhibit a similar chelate structure at the internal ala moiety , characterized by C4 = <nUm> / N5 / C7 = O coordination to the zirconium center . similarly , methane liberation from 8-I and 9-I gave mixture of the respective cationic chelate complex isomer 8-A / 8-C ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) and 9-A / 9-C ( <nUm> : <nUm> ) , respectively . the (8,9)-A isomer have the zirconium ion bonded at the N - terminus , whereas (8,9)-C exhibit the Cp2Zr+ unit at the C- terminus of the peptide chain , involving the ester carbonyl group in forming the chelate framework ( C7 = O / N8 / C10 = O coordination ) . the (6-9)-A isomer are thermodynamically favored . the cation complex 7-B , 8-C , 9-C rearrange to the a-type isomer upon prolonged standing at temperature > <nUm> ° C in dichloromethane solution . interaction between zirconocene or benzyne zirconocene and unsaturated specie incorporating main group element lead to a variety of new metallaheterocycles . efficient new methodology of regiospecific synthesis of mono- , bi- , or tricyclic system incorporating phosphorus , nitrogen , selenium , antimony , germanium or tin are reported . copolymerization of ethylene / 1-octene with three ansa - zirconocene / MAO catalyst system were investigated . the polymerization activity is dependent upon the influence of electronic effect . it decrease in the following order ; C 6H <nUm> ( CH <nUm> ) 2Cp 2ZrCl <nUm> > C 5H 3N(CH <nUm> ) 2Cp 2ZrCl <nUm> > CH 3N(CH <nUm> ) 2ZrCl <nUm> . the composition and sequence distribution of copolymer were calculated from 13C - NMR spectrum . it wa found that the activityes of three ansacatalysts were lower than Et(Ind) 2ZrCl <nUm> under the same 1-octeone concentration . and their copolymer had lower 1-octene incorporation than that of Et(Ind) 2ZrCl <nUm> . other property such a molecular wieght , melting point of copolymer were compared . analysis of the published data on the interaction between the component of a zirconocene-poly(methylaluminoxane) system used a the catalyst of olefin polymerization indicates that the yield of the reaction product , methane , is virtually independent of the concentration of the component over a wide concentration range . it is assumed that methane is formed in the absence of the monomer on the catalytic site of polymerization formed by the interaction of the major component and the activating admixture , including uncontrollable admixture ( H2O , O ) . under specified condition , it is the admixture that control the concentration of the catalytic center and the methane yield . for this reason , the yield of methane is independent of the concentration of zirconocene and poly(methylaminoxane) . the solid - state structure of three zirconocene aryl sulfonate were determined . In Cp2Zr(OSO2C6H5)2 ( 1 ) , one of the sulfonate ligand is monodentate , the other bidentate coordinated . Cp2Zr(OSO2-4-C6H4Cl)2 ( 2 ) and Cp2Zr(OSO2-3,4-C6H3Cl 2)2 ( 3 ) are dimer of pentacoordinated zirconocenes with two monodentate sulfonate and a double bridge of m-O,mu;-O'-sulfonates . A possible explanation for the formation of the solid - state structure is offered in term of difference in electron density of the sulfonate oxygen atom . <nUm> : C22H20O6S2Zr , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , triclinic , P1 , z = <nUm> . <nUm> : C22Cl2H18O6S2Zr , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , triclinic , P1 , z = <nUm> . <nUm> : C22Cl4H16O6S2Zr , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> ° , β = <nUm> ° , γ = <nUm> ° , triclinic , P1 , z = <nUm> . the catalytic activity of Cp2ZrCl2 supported on MgCl2(THF)2 with MAO a a cocatalyst , wa investigated in low - pressure polymerization of ethylene . this catalyst system wa found to be active [ <nUm> kg PE / ( g zr*h ) ] and stable during the polymerization process . the PE obtained ha a narrow molecular weight distribution ( MWD ) ; it molecular weight ( mw ) wa about <nUm> <nUm> . the kinetic investigation of the polymerization process revealed <nUm> % of the zirconium atom to be involved in the formation of catalytic active site . unexpected inactive byproduct were observed in the catalytic polymerization of acetylene using metallocene alkyne complex Cp2M(L)(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) , <nUm> : m = Ti , without L ; <nUm> : m = Zr , L = thf . the reaction of <nUm> wa investigated in detail by NMR to give quantitatively at <nUm> ° C the titanacyclopentadiene Cp2Ti-CH = CH - C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) ( 3 ) . around <nUm> ° C <nUm> start to rearrange to yield the dihydroindenyl complex <nUm> via coupling of one cp - ligand with the titanacyclopentadiene . In the reaction of <nUm> under analogous condition a zirconacyclopentadiene Cp2Zr-CH = CH - C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) ( 5 ) and the dimeric complex [ Cp2Zr(C(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe3) ] 2[m-s(1,2)-C ≡ C ] ( 6 ) were observed . whereas <nUm> decomposes to a mixture of unidentified paramagnetic specie , <nUm> wa isolated and investigated by NMR spectroscopy and x-ray analysis . In the reaction of rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) ( ebthi = ethylenbis-tetrahydroindenyl ) with 2-ethynyl-pyridine the complex rac - (ebthi)ZrC(SiMe3) = CH(SiMe3)](s-C ≡ CPy ) <nUm> wa obtained , which wa investigated by an x-ray analysis . In reaction of Cp2ZrCl{(m-H)2BC5H10} , <nUm> , with HLi , cl- is replaced to produce Cp2ZrH{(m-H)2BC5H10} , <nUm> . reaction of <nUm> with K[H2BC5H10] yield Cp2Zr{(m-H)2BC5H10}2 , <nUm> . the methyl-substituted compound Cp2Zr-(CH3{(m-H)2BC5H <nUm> } , <nUm> , is prepared from the reaction of Cp2ZrCl(CH3) with K[H2BC5H10] . the synthetic route for the preparation of <nUm> prevents side reaction that occur in the direct alkylation of zirconocene organohydroborate complex . proton NMR spectrum of <nUm> at elevated temperature indicate that intramolecular hydrogen exchange occurs among Zr-H-B hydrogen , terminal H on Zr , and cp hydrogen . the structure of <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> are reported . crystal data for <nUm> : space group abm2 ( no. <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , z = <nUm> . crystal data for <nUm> : space group pbca ( no. <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , z = <nUm> . crystal data for <nUm> : space group C2 / c ( no. <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> . new type of silacyclobutene derivative were synthesized by zirconocene- and titanocene-ethylene complex - promoted reaction of some rac - dialkynyldiarylsilanes . the norbornene / ethylene copolymerization wa investigated by using me 2SiCp 2MtCl <nUm> ( Mt = Zr , TO / MAO catalyst system . the copolymerization kinetics wa studied under different condition . the copolymer wa characterized by DSC and 13C - NMR method . it wa found the zirconocene ha better catalyst ability for copolymerization of ethylene and norbornene than titanocene . under similar feed ratio , the copolymer with high norbornene content and glass transition temperature were synthesized compared with literature . analysis of the published data on the interaction between the component of a zirconocene-poly(methylaluminoxane) system used a the catalyst of olefin polymerization indicates that the yield of the reaction product , methane , is virtually independent of the concentration of the component over a wide concentration range . it is assumed that methane is formed in the absence of the monomer on the catalytic site of the process formed by the interaction of the major component and the activating admixture , including uncontrollable admixture ( H2O , O ) . under specified condition , it is the admixture that control the concentration of the catalytic center and the methane yield . for this reason , the yield of methane is independent of the concentration of zirconocene and poly(methylaminoxane) . the biphenyl-bridged , chiral zirconocene complex rac-2,2'-biphenyl-bis(3,4-dimethylcyclopentadienyl) zirconium dichloride catalyzes the reaction of 1,6-and 1,7-dienes with excess dibutyl magnesium to bi (butyl-magnesio-methyl)-substituted cycloalkane derivative . analogous reaction occur with butyl magnesium chloride and with heteroatom - containing dienes . the preference of 1,6-dienes for trans-fused cyclization product and that of 1,7-dienes for cis-fusion at ambient and for trans-fusion at elevated temperature is similar to that observed before for unsubstituted zirconocene complex . the r-enantiomer of the biphenyl-bridged zirconocene complex give trans-fused cyclization product with an optical purity of only <nUm> ± <nUm> % ee . the stereochemistry of these cyclomagnesation reaction is explained in term of the relative rate of mutually competing cyclization and transmetalation step . the synthesis of the doubly - [SiMe2] - bridged zirconocene complex , (Me2Si)2{e5-C5H 2-4-CHMe2}{e5-C5H-3,5-(CHMe 2)2}ZrR2 ( r = Cl ( 2 ) ; r = CH2Ph ( 3 ) ; r = CH3 ( 4 ) ) are described . the structure of (Me2Si)2{e5-C5H 2-4-CHMe2}{e5-C5H-3,5-(CHMe 2)2}-Zr(CH2Ph)2 ( 3 ) ha been examined by single crystal x-ray diffraction method . it crystallizes in the triclinic space group P-1 , with a = <nUm> , b = <nUm> , c = <nUm> Å , α = <nUm> , β = <nUm> , γ = <nUm> ° and z = <nUm> . compound <nUm> and <nUm> are active stereospecific pre-catalysts for the [Ph3C] [B(C6F5)4] co-catalyzed polymerization of 1-pentene . polymerization reaction at low temperature in liquid monomer produced poly(1-pentene) with syndiotactic microstructure and narrow molecular weight distribution . by contrast , in 1-pentene / toluene solution a broad molecular weight distribution is observed . under all condition examined <nUm> / MAO system produced high molecular weight , highly syndiotactic poly-1-pentene with narrow molecular weight distribution . A reduction of previously reported 2-methoxyethyl and 2-methylthioethyl functionalized zirconocenedichlorides ( e5-C5Me4CH2-CH 2EMe)(e5-C5Me5)ZrCl2 ( e = O , S ) and ( e5-C5Me4CH2CH 2EMe)(e5-C5Me4CH 2CH2E'Me)ZrCl2 ( e = O , S ; E' = O , S ) with Mg / Hg in THF lead unexpectedly to the product of O-Me and S-Me bond cleavage ( e5,s-C5Me4CH2CH 2E)(e5-C5Me5)ZrMe ( e = O , S ) , ( e5,s-C5Me4CH2CH 2E)(e5-C5Me4CH 2CH2E'Me)ZrMe ( e = O , S ; E' = O ) , and ( e5,s-C5Me4CH2CH 2S)2Zr respectively . the crystal structure of ( e5,s-C5Me4CH2CH 2S)2Zr wa established by x-ray analysis . At the same time the reduction of ( e5-C5Me4CH2CH 2EMe)(e5-C5Me5)ZrCl2 ( e = O , S ) under <nUm> atm of CO give either only the usual dicarbonyl derivative ( e5-C5Me4CH2CH 2EMe)(e5-C5Me5)Zr(CO) <nUm> ( e = O ) or a complex mixture of product ( e = S ) . bridged ligand 4,4-di(cyclopentadienyl)-N-methylpiperidine ( 4 ) and 4,4-di(indenyl)-N-methylpiperidine ( 5 ) were prepared by condensation of cyclopentadiene or indene with n-methylpiperidone . dilithium salt 4a and 5a were subsequently transformed into the corresponding ansa - zirconocenes <nUm> and <nUm> . No direct contact Zr ⋯ N wa found in the crystal structure of <nUm> . the attempt to prepare zirconocene <nUm> from distannyl derivative 5b gave an unexpected monoindenyl complex <nUm> comprising one unreacted stannylated indenyl group and having direct coordination of Zr by nitrogen . ethylene-bridged bis(N,N-diisopropyl-1-aminoboratabenzene-4-yl)zirconium dichloride ( 5a ) , dimethylsilyl-bridged bist(N,N-diisopropyl-1-aminoboratabenzene-4-yl)zirconium dichloride ( 7a ) , and dimethylmethylene-bridged (cyclopentadienyl)(N,N-diisopropyl-1-aminoboratabenzene-4-yl)zirconium dichloride ( 6a ) have been prepared . x-ray crystal structure of the dimethyl derivative of <nUm> and <nUm> show that the complex closely resemble the corresponding ansa - zirconocenes . when activated by excess methylaluminoxane , 5a , 6a , and 7a are catalyst for the polymerization of olefin . the tantalum carborane complex (Et2C2B4H4)CpTaMe2 ( 1 ) is thermally stable but undergoes clean photochemical insertion with alkyne to give vinyltantalum specie , in contrast to the thermal reactivity of isoelectronic group <nUm> metallocenes which give methylidene intermediate . certain tantalum vinyltitanium product display NMR resonance indicative of g-agostic Ta-H3C interaction sufficiently strong to stabilize two different regioisomers . decomposition of these specie occurs by apparent alkyne deinsertion and ejection of the tantalum fragment to give R2Et2C4B4H4 ( r = me , et , ph ) carborane cluster . the analogous diphenyl complex (Et2C2B4H4)CpTaPh2 ( 8 ) is thermally reactive , eliminating benzene and undergoing trapping reaction of the derived benzyne intermediate with alkyne . the structure of the resulting metallaindene complex are supported by x-ray crystallography , protonolysis , and spectroscopy . insertion occur with good regioselectivity , controlled by steric and stereoelectronic factor that differ somewhat from those observed for zirconocene and titanocene analogue . reaction of complex <nUm> with excess styrene result in a novel triple - insertion process in which styrene unit are added to both ortho position of an aryl ligand and to the central boron atom of the B3C2 ring . the proposed mechanism ( supported by the use of styrene-d8 and alkylated metallacarborane starting material ) feature two benzyne intermediate , derived from activation of both ortho-CH bond , and one insertion into a putative Ta-B bond . an important hypothesis is that a Ta-C fragment can undergo intramolecular insertion into a carborane B-H bond , a step unknown for cyclopentadienyl C-H bond and one that is potentially relevant to the use of metallacarborane complex a catalyst for olefin polymerization and related process . zirconocene - coupling of ( -C ≡ C10H17O 2CH2C ≡ c-arylene-)n polymer , followed by hydrolysis , provides a convenient , versatile route to soluble , diene-arylene polymer . the alternating copolymerization of styrene ( st ) and ethylene ( et ) with high stereo - regularity were monitored by using rac[isopropylidenebis(benzindenyl)] zirconocene catalyst under reduced temperature condition . the 13C - NMR spectrum of the polymer were measured using a spectrometer . the DSC measurement wa carried out under flowing N at a temperature rate of <nUm> ° C / min . In general , significant result were obtained . we investigated copolymerization of propylene and allylmercaptan a a commercially available sulfur containing monomer . after protection of mercapto group with alkylaluminum , the copolymerization wa conducted by isotactic ansa - zirconocene / methylaluminoxane catalyst . polypropylene containing sulfur wa obtained with triisobutylaluminum - protected allylmercaptan monomer , while the no polymer wa obtained with trimethylaluminum - protected allylmercaptan . structure of the product wa investigated by NMR and GPC , and it wa revealed that end sulfurizated polymer wa mainly produced . the polymerization behavior of three linear asymmetrically substituted dienes , i.e. 6-phenyl-1,5-hexadiene ( A ) , 7-methyl-1,6-octadiene ( B ) and r(+)-5,7-dimethyl-1,6-octadiene ( isocitronellene , C ) is reported in order to study the effect of substitution at one vinylic group . homopolymerization of these monomer with the catalyst system rac-Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 / MAO resulted in no reaction product in the case of monomer A and in polymer with mw , = <nUm> kg / mol and mw = <nUm> kg / mol with the monomer B and C , respectively . according to NMR analysis , the vinylene end group of isocitronellene remained untouched during polymerization , which excludes the possibility of cyclopolymerization or crosslinking . copolymerization of isocitronellene with propene resulted in incorporation of the diene ( <nUm> mol- % ) equal to the stoichiometric ratio in the monomer feed , with a relatively high catalyst activity . the degree of incorporated isocitronellene is inversely related to the polymerization temperature , providing control over crystallinity ( isotacticity ) and molecular weight of the copolymer . the isocitronellene homo- and copolymer could be epoxidized quantitatively and brominated to an extent of <nUm> % . perfluorohexyl iodide wa grafted onto the isocitronellene / propene copolymer by radical reaction ( conversion <nUm> % ) , yielding a poly(a-olefin) with fluorinated side chain . none two series of solution polymerization of propene were conducted : ( i ) using three different methylaluminoxane (MAO)-activated zirconocenes , rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( EI ) , rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( MI ) , and rac-Me2Si(Benz-[e]-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( MBI ) , at the same temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) and varying propene pressure from <nUm> to <nUm> bar and ( ii ) using rac-Me2Si(Benz-[e]-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( MBI ) at the propene partial pressure <nUm> bar and at a range of temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C ( ind = indenyl ) . 1H and 13C NMR investigation of the unsaturated chain end group in these sample wa performed , with particular attention being paid to ( i ) a detailed re-examination of the NMR assignment reported in the literature , ( ii ) the distinction between unsaturated specie formed during the polymerization reaction and those formed afterward due to thermal treatment ( i.e. during the NMR experiment ) , ( iii ) determination of the dependence of the quantity of different type of terminal on the polymerization condition ( temperature and monomer partial pressure ) . it wa shown that four unsaturated chain end group are formed during polymerization , that is , vinylidene , 2-butenyl , allyl , and the previously unidentified 4-butenyl terminal . In the oligomeric fraction of sample , no further type of unsaturated terminal were observed . two further type of unsaturated group observed , isobutenyl and the unidentified specie x , were not formed during polymerization but , at least prevalently , afterward during the high - temperature NMR experiment . A previously unidentified regiomisinsertion , lateral n-butyl , is also described . proton and 11B NMR investigation of two zirconocene boracycloalkane derivative A and B , a a function of temperature , identified two hydrogen bridged between boron and zirconium and a third attached only to zirconium . observation of the 11B decoupled proton NMR lineshape of A and B ( toluene-d8 solution ) revealed a fast intramolecular mutual exchange of the two bridged hydrogen and a slower process which exchange each of the latter with the single hydrogen bonded to zirconium alone . comparison of the observed 11B decoupled proton NMR spectrum with calculated lineshapes which take account of the exchange process yielded the corresponding rate and activation parameter . proton NMR data for A and B ( with 11B coupled ) indicate spin coupling between 11B and the bridge hydrogen of ca. <nUm> Hz , subject to averaging by 11B nuclear electric quadrupole induced relaxation ; it rate increase with decreasing temperature . thus , the coupling is averaged at the lower temperature due to 11B relaxation and on warming becomes obscured a a result of hydrogen exchange . analysis of these latter lineshapes taking account of exchange dynamic , 11B relaxation and the 11B proton coupling constant provided dynamic parameter closely similar to those obtained from the 11B decoupled proton NMR data . At elevated temperature ( <nUm> ° C ) , broadening of the cp proton resonance indicates that these proton undergo slow exchange with the three hydrido hydrogen . ansa - ligand , me <nUm> Si(RInd) <nUm> [ r = 2-p ( 1 ) and 3-p-tolyl ( 2 ) ] , have been prepared a a mixture of rac- and meso-isomers in a ratio of <nUm> : <nUm> from the reaction of me <nUm> ClSi <nUm> with cyanocuprates of 1-p-tolylindene and 2-p-tolylindene in diethyl ether , respectively . pure rac - isomer , 1r and 2r , have been isolated by fractional recrystallization of <nUm> and <nUm> . thermal diastereomerization of <nUm> and <nUm> between rac- and meso-isomers ha been studied by <nUm> H - NMR spectroscopy . these result imply that <nUm> and <nUm> undergo the diastereomerization process by migration of silicon moiety and hydrogen atom , respectively . ansa - zirconocenes , me <nUm> Si(RInd) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> [ r = 2-p ( 3 ) and 3-p-tolyl ( 4 ) ] , have been prepared from the reaction of the corresponding dilithiated ligand with ClZr <nUm> in diethyl ether and hexane at <nUm> ° C . the molecular structure of rac-3 ha been determined by a single crystal x-ray diffraction study . propylene polymerization ha been studied using rac-3 and meso-4 in the presence of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . catalyst rac-3 produce a highly isotactic polypropylene ( PP ) at <nUm> ° C by the enantiomorphic site control mechanism and meso-4 affords a syndiotactic dominant PP having a rr triad of <nUm> % at - <nUm> ° C by the chain end control mechanism . reaction of Cp2Zr(thf)(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( 1 ) and rac-(ebthi)Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) ( <nUm> ; ebthi = 1,2-ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) ) with 2-vinylpyridine lead , under elimination of the alkyne , to the five - membered azazirconacycles , which are best described a 1-zircona-2-azacyclopent-3-enes ( 1-azadiene complex ) . one of these complex couple with ethylene to yield a stable a-2-pyridyl-substituted zirconacyclopentane and reacts in a <nUm> : <nUm> ratio with water to yield a b-2-pyridyl-substituted dimeric s-ethylzirconoxane . In the reaction of the 2-derived complex with BF4H , rac-[1,2-ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl)]zirconium difluoride wa obtained . both 1-zircona-2-azacyclopent-3-enes insert carbon dioxide to give structurally different binuclear carbonate - bridged complex . the organotin compound (e5-pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)tin tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( 1 ) ha been synthesized from a reaction between (pentamethylcyclopentadienyl)tin chloride and lithium tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate . this cation proved to be an effective ziegler - natta a-olefin cocatalyst . activity for ethylene polymerization using dimethylzirconocene and <nUm> were <nUm> × <nUm> g of PE / ( mol of 1*[C2H4]*h ) at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> × <nUm> g of PE / ( mol of 1*[C2H4]*h ) at <nUm> ° C . this system wa also effective for the polymerization of propylene . activity using rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)-dimethylzirconium with the tin cation were <nUm> × <nUm> g of PP / ( mol of 1*[C3H6]*h ) . activity increased markedly when using zirconocene dichloride / tri(i-butyl)aluminum / <nUm> . activity for ethylene polymerization using zirconocene dichloride / tri(i-butyl)aluminum / <nUm> at <nUm> ° C were <nUm> × <nUm> g of PE / ( mol of 1*[C2H4]*h ) . activity for the polymerization of propylene using rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)zirconium dichloride / tri(i-butyl)aluminum / <nUm> at <nUm> ° C were <nUm> × <nUm> g of PP / ( mol of 1*[C3H6]*h ) . A well known catalytic system for the oligomerization of 1-alkenes is zirconocene dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) , when activated by a large excess of methylalumoxane ( MAO ) . surprisingly , when activated by only <nUm> equiv. of MAO , Cp2ZrCl2 selectively and catalytically dimerizes a-olefins without formation of any higher oligomeric specie . this reaction is shown to be general for a number of a-olefins . the conversion of o-diallylbenzene give a seven - membered cyclic product in an intramolecular dimerization reaction . A possible mechanism for the dimerization process involving a zirconium - hydrido specie a the catalyst is formulated , and evidence for it is given by detection of by - product and a deuteration experiment . equilibrium constant have been determined for the formation of <nUm> different zirconocene monomethyl monochloro complex from the respective dichloride complex and AlC3H9 . the result indicate that the tendency of a particular zirconocene complex to exchange a chloride against a methyl ligand is a measure for the electron deficiency at it Zr center . the result indicate particularly low electron density for complex with indenyl instead of cyclopentadienyl ligand , especially for those containing a dimethylsilyl bridge . only one methyl group is transferred to a zirconocene dichloride even by a large excess of AlC3H9 , while the uptake of two alkyl group , followed by alkane evolution , is observed with triethyl and triisobutyl aluminum . fulvenes ( 1a-e ) derived from condensation of cyclopentadiene with acetone or a variety of aldehyde were treated with Ar2LiP ( Ar = phenyl , p-tolyl ) to yield the respective substituted (diarylphosphinomethyl)cyclopentadienides ( <nUm> , <nUm> ) . subsequent reaction with Cl4Zr (THF)2 gave the respective bi [(diarylphosphinomethyl)cyclopentadienyl] zirconium dichloride ( Ar = phenyl ( 4 ) , p-tolyl ( 5 ) ) . the complex rac-[C5H4-CH(CH3)-PPh2] 2ZrCl2 ( rac-4b ) wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . the reaction of complex 4a and 5a [(Cp-CMe2-PAr2)2ZrCl2] with PdCl2(NCPh)2 or PtCl2(NCPh)2 lead to the formation of the trans-(metallocene-chelate-phosphane)metal complex 6-9 ( e.g. trans-Cl2Pd(Ph2P-CMe2-Cp)2ZrCl <nUm> ] . chloride abstraction from the reaction product of [Cp-CH(CMe3)PPh2]2ZrCl2 with PdCl2(NCPh)2 eventually gave the cationic complex [ meso,trans-(Cp-CH(CMe3)PPh2) 2(Cl)Zr(m-Cl)Pd(Cl)]+ ( 10 ) that wa also characterized by x-ray diffraction . it feature a dimetallabicyclic framework with two Cp-CHR-PPh2 ligand and a chloride bridging between the early and the late transition metal center . this paper is a review concerning metallic derivative linked to the surface of phosphorus - containing dendrimers , that are dendrimers possessing one phosphorus at each branching point . the sythetic aspect will be described first , concerning in particular the complexation of transition metal ( Fe , W , Rh , Pt , Pd , Ru ) by monophosphine or diphosphine end group , the grafting of metallocene derivative ( zirconocene and ferrocene ) , and the interaction with various cluster ( Au-Fe , Au , Ti ) . some application of these metallo phosphorus dendrimers will be described in the field of material science ( modification of the surface of existing material or creation of new material ) , and in the field of catalysis ( stille coupling , knoevenagel condensation , michael addition ) . rotational barrier about the M-S bond of 16-electron bent metallocene monothiolates (e5-C5H5)2Zr(Cl) ( SR ) ( r = -CH3 , -CH2CH3 , -CH(CH3)2 , -C(CH3)3 ) ( 1a-d ) have been measured by dynamic 1H NMR method : <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> kJ mol-1 , respectively . the groundstate orientation about the Zr-S bond of <nUm> that maximizes spp → mdp bonding ( Cl-Zr-S-R ≈ <nUm> ° ) also maximizes cp ↔ r steric interaction , whereas the rotational transition - state orientation ( Cl-Zr-S-R ≈ <nUm> ° ) is one that minimizes spp → mdp bonding and maximizes Cl ↔ r steric interaction . deviation from a ground - state orientation that is ideal for spp → mdp bonding might be expected a the size of the r group and cp ↔ r steric interaction increase . thus , the aberrant trend for the r = -C(CH3)3 derivative could be attributed to a ground - state steric effect where the sterically demanding -C(CH3)3 group force an unfavorable ( misdirected ) orientation for Mdp-Spp bonding , but a favorable orientation with respect to cp ↔ r and Cl ↔ r steric interaction . however , the solid - state structure of (e5-C5H5)2Zr(SR)2 ( r = -CH3 , -CH2CH3 , -CH(CH3)2 , -C(CH3)3 ) ( 2a-d ) exhibit regular variation of their metric parameter a evidenced by their Zr-S-C bond angle of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , and <nUm> ° and S-Zr-S' bond angle of <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> ° , respectively . neither the S'-Zr-S-R torsion angle nor the dihedral angle that describe the relationship between the S / Zr / S' and cp(centroid) / Zr / cp' ( centroid ) plane ( both indicator of the relative orientation of the Zr dp acceptor orbital and the thiolate S pp donor orbital ) reflect the steric demand of the r group . thus , the size of the r group imposes a measured effect on the geometry of <nUm> and the tert-butyl group is not extraordinary . although the enthalpic and entropic effect could not be deconvoluted for rotation about the Zr-S bond of <nUm> in the present study , literature precedent suggest that both enthalpic and entropic effect may play a role in determining the irregular trend that is observed . intramolecular cocyclisation of 4-azaocta-1,7-dienes , -1-en-7-ynes , -7- en-1-ynes and -1,7-diynes using ' zirconocene ' equivalent affords formed from the coupling / protonolysis of 4- azaocta-1,7-diynes react with activated dienophiles to yield reduced isoquinolines . intramolecular cocyclisation of <nUm> and 9a have been determined . analysis of the published data on the interaction between the component of a zirconocene-poly(methylaluminoxane) system used a the catalyst of olefin polymerization indicates that the yield of the reaction product , methane , is virtually independent of the concentration of the component over a wide concentration range . it is assumed that methane is formed in the absence of the monomer on the catalytic site of polymerization formed by the interaction of the major component and the activating admixture , including uncontrollable admixture ( H2O , O ) . under specified condition it is the admixture that control the concentration of the catalytic center and the methane yield . for this reason , the yield of methane is independent of the concentration At <nUm> ° C , 5a-f react with propene to yield the 1,2-insertion product [rac-(EBI)Zr{e2(C,N)-CH2CHMe(pyrid-2-yl)}][MeB(C 6F5)3 ] , for which two diastereomers ( <nUm> / 6' ) that differ in the configuration of the metallacycle b-carbon are possible . propene insertion of 5a-f is under kinetic control at <nUm> ° C and is highly stereoselective when the pyridyl ring contains a 6-substituent ( R6 ≠ H ; 6a , de = <nUm> % ; 6b , de > <nUm> % ; 6d , de > <nUm> % ; 6e , de = <nUm> % ) . for these case , the major diastereomer is that in which the metallacycle b-Me group point toward the EBI C6 ring ( configuration S,S,S ( R,R,R ) , where the entry denote the configuration of the EBI bridgehead carbon and the metallacycle b-carbon , respectively ) . the diastereoselectivity is low in case where R6 = H ( 6c' , de = <nUm> % ; 6f , de = <nUm> % ) . propene insertion of 5a-f is reversible at <nUm> ° C , and the kinetic <nUm> / 6' mixture evolve to the thermodynamic mixture at this temperature . 6d isomerizes to a mixture of 6d , gd' , and the 2,1-insertion product [rac-(EBI)Zr{e2(C,N)-CHMeCH2(pyrid-2-yl)}][MeB(C 6F5)3 ] ( 6d' ) at <nUm> ° C . molecular modeling calculation for model rac-(EBI)Zr(e2-pyridyl)(propene)+ specie suggest that steric interaction between the pyridyl R6 substituent and the EBI C6 ring cause a tipping of the pyridyl ligand , which influence the pyridyl / propene steric contact and the facial selectivity of propene binding . the modeling calculation also suggest that the more stable propene adduct diastereomer lead to the kinetic insertion product . the mechanism of chain initiation ( reaction <nUm> ) and chain propagation leading to linear and methyl-branched polymer ( reaction <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively ) a well a chain - transfer ( or chain - termination ) reaction including associative displacement ( reaction <nUm> ) b-H elimination ( reaction <nUm> ) , H exchange ( reaction <nUm> ) , and hydrogenolysis ( reaction <nUm> ) of transition - metal - catalyzed ethylene polymerization have been compared for different metal atom in the diimine - M(II) complex ( where m = Ni , Pd , and Pt ) on one hand , and between diimine - M(II) and zirconocene complex on the other . the rate - determining step of reaction <nUm> and <nUm> is the migratory insertion of the olefin into a metal - alkyl bond for both diimine-M(II)- and zirconocene - based catalyst . under the same condition , zirconocenes are slightly more active catalyst than the diimine - Ni (II) complex , with the catalytic activity of the diimine - M(II) complex decreasing a Ni > Pd > Pt . the resting stage of the process is a metal-olefin-alkyl complex , and the larger the stability of the complex , the higher the barrier height for migratory insertion . both chain - propagation reaction , <nUm> and <nUm> , start from the b-agostic intermediate . reaction <nUm> for linear chain growth begin with a barrierless bimolecular reaction of coordination of the next olefin , while reaction <nUm> for branched growth begin a a unimolecular b-hydride-elimination reaction with an activation barrier . higher temperature should increase and higher ethylene pressure should decrease the branching . the barrier height indicate that ( i ) the zirconocenes will produce a higher ratio of linear to methyl-branched polyethylene than the diimine - M(II) and ( ii ) the linear / branched ratio will be larger for the diimine - Ni (II) than it Pd analog . among the chain - termination mechanism studied , the associative - displacement mechanism <nUm> where the coordinating olefin exchange with ethylene from solution is likely to be a preferred one for diimine - M(II) - based process . the C-H activation and H - exchange chain - termination mechanism , which are favorable for zirconocenes , are inefficient for diimine - M(II) . hydrogenolysis is another favorable chain - termination process for both the diimine - M(II) and zirconocene in the presence of gaseous hydrogen . the isothiocyanato complex [ Zr(e5-C5H4Me)2(NCS) <nUm> ] and [ Zr(e5-C5H4tBu) 2(NCS)2 ] have been prepared from the corresponding zirconocene dichloride and KSCN in acetone . analogous reaction with KOCN or CKNSe , led to the formation of the stable dinuclear oxo-bridged complex [ {Zr(e5-C5H5)2(NCO)} 2O ] and [ {Zr(e5-C5H4Me)2(NCSe)} 2O ] , respectively . the molecular srtucture of [ {Zr(e5-C5H5)2(NCO)} 2O ] ha been determined by x-ray diffraction method and consists of two (e5-C5H5)2Zr(NCO) unit linked by an oxo bridge . the Zr-O-Zr bridge [ angle <nUm> ° ] is non linear . the relatively short Zr-O bond length of <nUm> and <nUm> Å support the presence of partial double - bond character . the compound contains N - coordinated cyanato ligand which are almost linear . the anion [ H2B2(m-H)(m-C4H8) 2]- , II , reacts with zirconocene dichloride and with hafnocene dichloride to form (e5-C5H5)2ZrCl{(m-H) 2BC4H8 } , III , and (e5-C5H5)2HfCl{(m-H) 2BC4H8 } , IV , complex , which contain a boracyclopentane ring that is bound to the metal through hydrogen bridge . In these reaction , <nUm> mol of the transannular hydrogen - bridged 10-membered ring compound B2(m-H)2(m-C4H8)2 is also formed . A possible reaction pathway for the formation of these complex is proposed on the basis of time - lapse 11B NMR spectroscopy . the methyl-substituted complex (e5-C5H5)2Zr(CH 3){(m-H)2BC4H8} , V , is prepared from the reaction of III with CH3Li . the molecular structure of III wa reported earlier . the structure of IV and V are reported here . crystal data for IV : space group P21 / n ( no. <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , β = <nUm> ° , z = <nUm> . crystal data for V : space group pbca ( no. <nUm> ) , a = <nUm> Å , b = <nUm> Å , c = <nUm> Å , z = ft . we report on an efficient synthetic route for the preparation of enantiomerically pure ethylene-bridged ansa - zirconocene and -hafnocene complex , bearing different cyclopentadienyl fragment . ring opening of (R)-epoxystyrene ( 1 ) with fluorenyllithium proceeds enantiospecifically and lead to optically pure 2-(9-fluorenyl)-1-(S)-phenylethanol ( 2a ) and 2-(9-fluorenyl)-2-(S)-phenylethanol ( 2b ) in nearly quantitative yield . treatment of <nUm> , the trifluoromethanesulfonate derivative of 2b , with fluorenyl- and indenyllithium result in the formation of 1-(9-fluorenyl)-1-(S)-phenyl-2-(1-indenyl)ethane ( 6a ) and 1,2-bis(9-fluorenyl)-1-(S)-phenylethane ( 6b ) , respectively . reaction of the dilithio salt of 6a with Cl4Zr and of 6b with MOU ( m = Zr , Hf ) affords the formation of the enantiomerically pure complex [ 1-(e5-9-nuorenyl)-1-(fl)-phenyl-2-(e 5-1-(R,S)-indenyl)ethane]ZrCl2 ( 7a = R,R ; 7b = R,S ) and of [1,2-bis(e5-9-fluorenyl)-1-(A)-phenylethane]MCl2 ( 7c , m = Zr ; 7d , m = Hf ) in up to <nUm> % yield . hydrogenation of 7a-d with H / O2Pt give the complex 8a-d , bearing octahydrofluorenyl and tetrahydroindenyl ligand . hydrolysis of 8a,b in basic , aqueous medium lead to the formation of C2 - symmetric m-oxo dimer ( 12a,b ) . the solid - state structure of enantiomerically pure 7b and 8c and of 12b are reported . the kinetics of propylene polymerization using homogeneous Cp2ZrCl2 / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) catalyst have been investigated at <nUm> ° C and <nUm> atm of propylene pressure . the effect of [Al] / [Zr] and [Zr] on the catalyst activity were studied . it wa found that MAO play a critical role in catalyst activation and deactivation . by assuming the coexistence of two dynamic equilibrium between active specie and inactive one which are the product of zirconocene dimerization and zirconocene - MAO complexation , a kinetic model wa proposed . the model could satisfactorily explain most of the experimental result . dimethyltitanocene reacts selectively with a variety of dialkyltartrates with protonolytic cleavage of one of it Ti - CH3 bond to form the respective dinuclear (|Jtartrato)(Cp,TiCH,) , complex <nUm> . dimethylhafnocene reacts quite analogously to give the (|itartrato)(Cp2HfCH3)2 system <nUm> , whereas in the reaction of dimethylzirconocene with the same dialkyltartrates always both zr-methyl linkage are cleaved to yield metallacyclic doubly tartrato-bridged bis(zirconocene) complex . this synthetic organometallic problem wa solved in two way . treatment of Cp,Zr(CH3)Cl with the dialkyltartrate reagent cleanly gave the respective (\atartrato)(Cp,ZrCl)2 complex <nUm> . the enolate complex CpTZr(-O-CMe = CH - A comparison of characteristic structural parameter of the Cp-,M(X)-O-C structural unit point to an increased metal-oxygen ninteraction in the order Ti < Hf < Zr , which may explain the observed different chemical behavior in this series of compound . none the recently reported zwitterionic complex Cp*[e5-C5Me4CH2B(C 6F5)3]ZrC6H5 , <nUm> , reacts rapidly with <nUm> equiv of acetone or acetophenone to form the adduct Cp*[e5-C5Me4CH2B(C 6F5)3]Zr(C6H 5)[O = C(CH3)R ] ( r = CH3 , 2a ; C6H5 , 2b ) in ∼ <nUm> % yield . spectroscopic evidence in favor of this assignment is presented ; the adduct nature of the complex wa also confirmed in each case via an x-ray structural analysis . the ketone ligand are bound in an e1 end-on fashion ( the Zr-O = C angle are near linear at <nUm> ° and <nUm> ° for 2a and 2b , respectively ) , allowing for a p-component to the Zr-O bonding . unlike other fleetingly observed ketone adduct of nonzwitterionic cationic metallocenes , the ketone ligand in compound <nUm> do not undergo insertion into the Zr-C bond neither upon thermolysis nor in the presence of excess ketone . the kinetics of propene polymerization in the liquid monomer medium and the property of the resulting iso-PP were studied in relation to the interannular bridge nature , (CH2)2Ind2ZrCl2 ( I ) , (CH3)2SiInd2ZrCl2 ( II ) , (CH3)2CInd2ZrCl2 ( III ) , and asymmetric (CH3)(cyclo-C3H5)CInd2ZrCl <nUm> ( IV ) , in MAO - activated 1,1'-bridged bisindenyl zirconocene dichloride . data are also given for the non-bridged (2-Ph-C9H6)2ZrCl2 ( V ) system used under similar condition . the system based on zirconocene III are most active and that based on II is most stable . the replacement of one methyl group in the CH2 < bridge by a cyclopropyl group ( compound III and IV ) result in the depressed initial activity and in the greater deactivation of the system during the process of polymerization . the stereoblock polymer wa formed with the catalyst system based on metallocene V , used under similar experimental condition . control of butadiene insertion mode in the copolymerization of propylene with 1,3-butadiene ha not been reported except our previous report <nUm> ) . we reported that dialkylaluminum hydride decreased mole fraction of 1,4-inserted butadiene unit by the hydroalumination of the 1,4-inserted butadiene unit in main chain <nUm> ) . introduction of hydroxy group to the main chain of the copolymer ha been investigated using oxidative treatment of the al-carbon bond . hydroxy group were successfully incorporated into the copolymer . the detail structure of the copolymer will be discussed , <nUm> ) T. ishihara , T. shiono , Macro2noJecuJes2Q03 , <nUm> , <nUm> . <nUm> ) T.Ishihara , T.Shiono , J.
