A procedure for supporting syndiospecific zirconocene on OSi <nUm> open up a way of retaining the syndiospecificity of metallocene catalyst . the effect of supporting temperature , time and initial concentration of metallocene on the supported amount of metallocene were investigated . using these supported catalyst for propylene polymerization , it is possible to reduce the consumption of cocatalyst MAO ( methylaluminoxane ) and produce syndiotactic polypropylene in high syndiotacticity . if partial MAO wa replaced by triisobutylaluminium , it would be shown that the catalytic activity of these catalyst increase greatly . electroconductivities of zirconocene complex - derived catalytic system solution were measured to identify the ionic particle generated by the catalyst activator and to follow the ionic specie formed in the absence and presence of olefin . several organoaluminum compound ( OAC ) and polymethylalumoxane ( MAO ) were studied a metallocene activator . the specific electroconductivity of the solution of each metallocene complex examined in solvent varying in polarity , activated both with OAC and MAO , wa always higher than that of the starting reactant . the electroconductivity value and the olefin polymerization rate were found to vary concurrently . the data obtained show that it is possible to trace the ionic particle generated during the formation of active specie and their change in the course of polymerization reaction . metallocene / tetramethylaluminoxane ( MAO ) catalyst control the tacticity and the molecular weight and it distribution in the polymer . zirconocene and hafnocene catalyst copolymerize ethene with cyclic olefin such a norbornene and dimethanooctahydronaphthalene ( DMON ) to yield copolymer with the double bond , rather than the ring , opened to extend the chain . these product are atactic and have interesting property . syndiotactic polystyrene , mp a high a <nUm> ° C , is another class of tailor - made ( titanocene / MAO ) - catalyzed polymer . with the fluorinated ( CpTiF3 ) substituted for the chlorinated ( CpTiCl3 ) titanocenes , the activity rose by a factor of <nUm> - <nUm> . the two type of polymer were studied with numerous metallocenes used a catalyst . nine metallocenes were used to study their activity in the copolymerization of ethylene with cycloolefins . the reactivity of comonomers were established in the ethylene - DMON system catalyzed by zircono- and hafnocenes . titanocenes proved to be much more active than the system involving alkoxy-derivatives Ti(OR)4 [14] . catalytic behavior wa examined in the series of 2- and 1-substituted bisindenyl zirconium and hafnium complex , (2-PhInd)2ZrCl2 , (2-PhInd)2HfCl2 , (2-p-TolInd)2ZrCl2 , (2-p-TolInd)2HfCl2 , (1-MeInd)2ZrCl2 , (1-i-PrInd)2HfCl2 , (1-cyclo-C6H11Ind)2ZrCl2 , (2-n-BuInd)2ZrCl2 , and (2-All-Ind)2ZrCl2 . 2-Ph - substituted zirconocene showed higher activity in ethylene polymerization than did the unsubstituted indenyl complex under similar condition , and provided polyethylene of the higher molecular weight . these catalytic feature suggest the increase in activity to be caused probably by an increase in chain propagation rate . the lower productivity of (2-p-Tol-Ind)2ZrCl2 complex compared to (2-PhInd)2ZrCl2 is attributed to the electron donating effect of the methyl substituent at the phenyl ring suppressing the effect of the aryl substituent . the two hafnium analog showed considerably lower activity a compared with zirconium complex , the feature commonly observed on replacement of zirconium by hafnium . the most pronounced effect of 1-substituents on the metallocene activity wa observed for the 1-Me-and 1-i-Pr - substituted complex . the activity of the complex examined in ethylene polymerization were found to be linearly correlated with the electronic and steric substituent characteristic . the reaction of the new ligand [ 2,6-(CH2C5H4)2C5H 3N]2-Na2+ ( LNa2 ) with Cl4Zr in THF affords in good yield the trigonal - bipyramidal complex LZrCl2 , where the two chlorine atom are not equivalent . when LZrCl2 and RMgCl ( r = CH3 , n-butyl , C4H11Si ) are reacted in <nUm> : <nUm> and <nUm> : <nUm> molar ratio , the corresponding complex LZr(Cl)R and LZrR2 can be isolated in good yield . differently from the Cp2Zr(n-Bu)2 , which ha never been isolated due to b-H . elimination , the analogous LZr(n-Bu)2 is thermally stable and it x-ray crystal structure ha been solved , confirming it trigonal - bipyramidal geometry with the alkyl group occupying an equatorial and an axial position . an NMR study ( 1H , 13C , HMQC , NOE ) allowed the complete structural characterization of the complex in solution . polypropene were prepared , both in and without the presence of molecular hydrogen , using the six ansa - zirconocene catalyst rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ( I ) , rac-Et(IndH4)2ZrCl2 ( II ) , rac-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2(III) , rac-Me2Si(2-Me-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( IV ) , rac-Me2Si(Benz[e]Ind)2ZrCl2(V) , and rac-Me2Si(2-Me-Benz[e]Ind)2ZrCl2 ( VI ) and also Cp2ZrCl2 ( VII ) [ ind = indenyl ] , under standardized condition ( <nUm> bar partial pressure of propene in toluene solution , at <nUm> ° C , zirconocenes activated by methylaluminoxane ) . the microstructures of the polymer were investigated in detail by using 1H and 13C NMR and GPC , and relationship between catalyst structure and polymer microstructural feature are discussed . hydrogen wa found to activate all of the catalyst to differing degree . trend in hydrogen activation were compared with trend in ( a ) the overall number of n-butyl terminal ( resulting from chain transfer to hydrogen following secondary insertion ) , ( b ) the ratio , in the presence of hydrogen , of chain transfer to hydrogen to the other mechanism which lead to renewed chain growth following secondary insertion , and ( c ) the ratio , in the presence of hydrogen , of site following primary insertion to site following secondary insertion . the absence of any clear correlation under these three heading lead to the conclusion that the release by chain transfer to hydrogen of resting state following secondary monomer insertion can not be the only mechanism giving rise to hydrogen activation with these catalyst . reductive coupling of dimethylfulvene with alkaline earth metal yield inseparable mixture of the tetramethylethylene-bridged complex Me4C2(C5H4)2M and the unbridged metallocene (i-PrCp)2M ( m = Mg , Ca , Sr , Ba ) . In contrast , the reductive coupling of phenylfulvene with activated calcium in THF give nearly quantitative yield of a mixture of cis- and trans-diphenylethanediyl-bridged ansa - calcocenes . the more soluble ci isomer can be removed by recrystallization , yielding the C2 - symmetric trans-Ph2C2H2(e5-C 5H4)2Ca-(THF)2 ( trans-2 ) . the molecular structure of this ansa - calcocene show the cyclopentadienyl ring to be bound in an e5 fashion to the calcium center . this versatile reagent give high yield of C2 - symmetric transition metal ansa - metallocene complex via the facile reaction of trans-2 with metal chloride ( e.g. , Cl2Fe and Cl4Zr ) . the molecular structure of the corresponding anso - zirconocene dichloride complex is described . none organic - inorganic hybrid ( SAV ) supported zirconocene wa synthesized and it catalysis on ethylene polymerization wa examined . the SAV wa synthesized by copolymerization of 4-vinylpyridine with vinyl silica monomer ( SA ) , which wa modified by reacting silica with allyltrimethoxysilane ( APS ) . after treated by MAO , the SAV wa reacted with Cp2ZrCl2 to form organic - inorganic hybrid supported metallocene . the chemical structure and the composition of SA and SAV have been characterized by solid - state <nUm> C - NMR , XPS , and elemental analysis ( EA ) . the SAV supported zirconocene catalyst wa effective in ethylene polymerization at a relatively low MAO level ( Al / Zr = <nUm> ) giving higher activity than that supported by O2Si . 1-Phenyl-1,4-pentanedione ( 3 ) is selectively converted to the corresponding fulvene - ketone ( 4 ) by treatment with cyclopentadiene in the presence of pyrrolidine . treatment with lithium dimethylcuprate result in selective CH3 - addition at the fulvene carbon and subsequent ring - closure reaction to give <nUm> , which in the presence of lithium diisopropylamide is rapidly dehydrated to yield the bicyclic fulvene <nUm> . it treatment with amalgamated calcium metal lead to reductive fulvene coupling and formation of the calcocene complex ( 10 ) of the substituted 7,7'-bi(tetrahydroindenyl) ligand . only the respective rac - isomer is obtained . hydrolysis of <nUm> followed by double deprotonation with butyllithium yield the corresponding 7,7'-bi(tetrahydroindenyl) dianion equivalent <nUm> . In tetrahydrofuran , <nUm> is cleaved at the 7,7'-linkage with formation of the " monomeric " disproportionation product 11-Li and 12-Li , and treatment of <nUm> with zirconium tetrachloride in THF lead back to the formation of the fulvene <nUm> . transmetalation to zirconium is , however , cleanly achieved when <nUm> is treated with donor - ligand - free Cl4Zr suspended in toluene . the corresponding diastereomerically pure rac-ansa-zirconocene dichloride <nUm> containing the ansa - bridge a part of the a-fused bi(tetrahydroindenyl) ligand system is obtained under these specific condition . complex <nUm> wa characterized by x-ray diffraction , and the outcome of the preliminary propene polymerization experiment is reported . the synthesis of Cp2ZrH(OSO2R) and Cp2ZrBH4(OSO2R) ( r = me , tBu , C8F17 , ph , p-tolyl , p-C6H4Cl , m-C6H4CF3 , m-C6H4NO2 ( BH4Zr only ) , 3,5-C6H4(CF3)2 ) is described . the hammett constant of the aryl substituents correlate well with the 11B NMR shift in Cp2ZrBH4(OSO2R) ( r = aryl sulfonate ) . hexene insertion into the Zr-H bond of Cp2ZrH(OSO2CF3) ( 1 ) is fast and reversible : reaction of Cp2Zrhexyl(OSO2CF3) with 2-butyne give Cp2ZrCMe = CHMe(OSO2CF3) and 1-hexene . treatment of <nUm> with styrene lead to a kinetically controlled mixture of Cp2ZrCH2CH2Ph(OSO2CF3) and Cp2ZrCHCH3Ph(OSO2CF3) that equilibrates with a first - order rate law . the rate is independent of added styrene . olefin insertion into the Zr-C bond wa not found . the zirconocene - mediated reaction of vinyl epoxides , vinyl acetonides and 2,5-dihydrofurans proceeds via deoxygenation , yielding conjugated dienes . upon irradiation in toluene solution , meso-racemate mixture of Me2Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C5H2)2-ZrCl <nUm> or Me2Si(2-Me-4-phenyl-C5H2)2ZrCl <nUm> react with <nUm> equiv of the dilithium salt of racemic binaphthol quantitatively to the racemic binaphtholate complex . analogous reaction with <nUm> equiv of the R(+) enantiomer of dilithium binaphtholate give a near - quantitative yield of the enantiomerically pure ansa - zirconocene binaphtholate complex . the structure of the racemic binaphtholate complex , Me2Si(2-Me-4-tBu-C5H2) 2Zr(binaphtholate) , and of a monodentate binaphtholate complex with a meso configurated zirconocene moiety , Me2Si(3-tBu-C5H3)2Zr(binaphtholate) chloride , were crystallographically determined . bis(propynyl)zirconocene ( 1b ) reacts with <nUm> molar equiv of trityl tetraphenylborate by a propynyl group transfer to form Ph3CC ≡ C2H3 and Cp2ZrC ≡ CCH3+ . the in-situ-generated (propynyl)zirconocene cation is not stable under the reaction condition but instantaneously reacts with the neutral starting material 1b to form the [ ( m-C ≡ CCH3)(m-CH3C ≡ CC ≡ CCH <nUm> ) - (ZrCp2)2+][BPh4 - ] salt , <nUm> . complex <nUm> wa characterized by an x-ray crystal structure analysis . it contains an unsymmetrically bridging hexadiyne ligand and exhibit a planar-tetracoordinate carbon center that is stabilized by a three - center two - electron interaction with the two adjacent zirconocene moiety . In solution , complex <nUm> exhibit dynamic NMR spectrum that indicate a symmetrizing exchange of the bonding situation between the two end of the m-hexadiyne ligand . the gibbs activation energy of the automerization reaction of <nUm> is DG ‡ ( <nUm> K ) ≈ <nUm> kcal mol-1 . metallocene catalyst leave a well - characterized fingerprint in the polypropene structure . attempt to expand this catalyst - polymer correlation to ethylene-propene copolymer are presented . the 13C nuclear magnetic resonance ( NMR ) are run on <nUm> % solution of the copolymer in o-dichlorobenzene ( <nUm> % d2 ) at <nUm> ° C , with a <nUm> second pulse delay and <nUm> ° pulse . observation show that single ethylene monomer are added to regioregular propylene homopolymers , and a high level of ethylene insertion adjacent to a 2,1-propylene insertion . this mean that high molecular weight C2C3 copolymer can be synthesized with the incorporation of ethylene for each regioregular insertion . none none none the kinetics of propylene polymerization with Et(H4Ind)2ZrCl2 / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) catalyst have been investigated at 0-50 ° C and <nUm> atm of propylene pressure . the effect of polymerization temperature , catalyst concentration , and catalyst / cocatalyst mole ratio on the catalyst activity and on the property of the polypropylene product were studied . by assuming the coexistence of two dynamic equilibrium between catalytically active specie and two inactive specie , which are the product of zirconocene dimerization and excessive zirconocene - MAO complexation , a kinetic model ha been developed . this model could satisfactorily explain most of experimental result . the electronic absorption and luminescence behavior of a number of bis(4-R-1,2-diphenylcyclo-pentadienyl) zirconium dichloride complex (4-R-1,2-Ph2Cp)2ZrCl2[R = H(2) , me(3) , ph(4) ] in anhydrous n-hexane were studied under an atmosphere of nitrogen . the research result showed that the electronic absorption and luminescence behavior of these compound can be tuned by the variation of the substituents on the cyclopentadienyl group . the absorption and emission wavelength of these complex decrease in an order of r = ph > CH3 > H . As a result , complex <nUm> is a blue color emitter , while complex <nUm> is a green color emitter . the isoselective propene polymerization using the supported catalyst O2Si / MAO / Me2Si(2-Me-Benz[e]Ind)2ZrCl <nUm> / AlR3 wa investigated and compared with propene polymerization using the corresponding homogeneous catalyst system . the influence of propene concentration , polymerization medium , temperature , comonomer , and external aluminium alkyl on polymerization kinetics and polypropene property such a molecular mass , stereo- and regioselectivity , morphology , and bulk density wa studied . we observed the thermochromism of the deeply colored zirconocene complex of 1,4-diphenyl-1,3-butadiene ( DPBD ) in the solid state . variable - temperature 13C-CP / MAS NMR spectroscopy revealed that a remarkable change of the electronic structure of the DPBD molecule by constructing the complex propagates all over the carbon site and that the distortion of the electronic structure of the complex becomes continuously large a temperature is decreased . this phenomenon is closely related to the thermochromism . the mechanism of the temperature variation of the electronic structure of the complex wa attributed to the dynamic of phenyl ring and cyclopentadienyl ring of the complex . fast rotation of the cyclopentadienyl ring around it fivefold axis with the extremely small activation energy of <nUm> meV ( = <nUm> kJ / mol ) and <nUm> ° flip rotation of the phenyl ring about the C-C bond with the activation energy of <nUm> meV ( = <nUm> kJ / mol ) were recognized by the measurement of the spin - lattice relaxation rate of proton NMR . semiempirical ZINDO molecular orbital calculation revealed that the deep color of the complex originates in the HOMO-LUMO and HOMO-LUMO+1 transition . these molecular orbitals are sensitive to the orientation of the p-orbital of cyclopentadienyl ring , suggesting that the dynamic perturbation is operative for the transition energy . recently , the preparation of the first siloxy substituted bis(indenyl) ansa - zirconocene , [ethylenebis(2-(tert-butyldimethylsiloxy)indenyl)]zirconium dichloride and it preliminary application in polymerization of propylene and ethylene ha been reported . currently , the structure / property relationship of siloxy substituted metallocenes are being investigated . the polymerization behavior of several complex is being addressed . this article show some selected result and summarizes the present status of research . copolymerization of ethylene / propylene and ethylene / 1-butene with two zirconocene / methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) catalyst system were investigated . the influence of et bridge between two indenyl group on the catalyst performance and the property of copolymer obtained had been discussed . it wa found that the activity of bridged et (Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst wa higher than that of nonbridged (Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst . the copolymer ( e / P and e / <nUm> - B ) produced with et (Ind)2ZrCl2 had higher comonomer content , lower molecular weight , density and melting point compared with those produced with (Ind)2ZrG2 . azaphosphazirconaindan system ( RCp ) <nUm> ZrN(R <nUm> )P(NR <nUm> r <nUm> )(oC <nUm> H <nUm> ) 4a ( r = H ) and 5a,b ( r = < -Bu ) are easily synthesized in a regiospecific way via a zirconocene-benzyne intermediate by mean of thermolysis of cp <nUm> ZrMePh <nUm> or ( f-BuCp ) <nUm> ZrPh <nUm> <nUm> in the presence of phosphaimines r <nUm> N = P-NR <nUm> r <nUm> ( 3a : r <nUm> = r <nUm> = r <nUm> = SiMe <nUm> ; 3b : r <nUm> = r <nUm> = t-Eu , r <nUm> = SiMea ) . after selective reaction of elemental sulfur on the phosphorus atom , Zr-N and Zr-C bond cleavage occurs on treatment with methanol , affording phosphine sulfide PhP(S)(NHR <nUm> )(NHR <nUm> ) 8a,b . In these two reaction , complex ( < -BuCp ) <nUm> ZrN(R <nUm> )P(S)(NIIR <nUm> )(o-C <nUm> H <nUm> ) 7a,b resulting from a selective cleavage of one N-SiMe <nUm> bond linked by the phosphorus atom can be isolated . with selenium powder , similar behavior lead to complex ( ( -BuCp ) <nUm> ZrN(R <nUm> )P(Se)(NHR <nUm> )(o-C <nUm> H <nUm> ) 10a,b . living ring - opening polymerization of the cyclic carbonate 1,3-dioxepan-2-one wa achieved by using the cationic zirconocene complex [Cp2ZrMe]+[B(C6F5)4] - a catalyst at room temperature . A linear relation between conversion and molecular weight of the obtained polymer wa observed . furthermore , block copolymerization of the cyclic carbonate and e-caprolactone wa successfully performed . this study develops scoping estimate of the required capital investment and manufacturing cost to make a zirconocene catalyst / cocatalyst system [(F6-acen)Zr(CH2C-Me3)(NMe2Ph)][B(C6F5) <nUm> ] immobilized on a specialized silica support . the cost for this fluorine - based system are compared with corresponding estimate for two other metallocene catalyst using methylaluminoxane (MAO)-based cocatalysts . including the weight of the support and cocatalyst , each of the production facility for making the three zirconocene catalyst system is sized in the range of <nUm> to <nUm> tonne per year . the cost to make the F - based catalyst system is estimated to be $ <nUm> / kg , assuming a <nUm> % return on capital invested . by comparison , the cost for the two MAO - based catalyst system fall in the range of $ <nUm> / kg to $ <nUm> / kg , assuming the same return . within the +/- <nUm> % accuracy of these estimate , these difference are not significant . given a catalyst productivity of <nUm> kg of resin per gram of zirconocene , the cost contribution in the finished ethylene-propylene copolymer resin is <nUm> cent / kg , excluding cost for selling , administration , and research . the ansa - zirconocene derivative tetramethyldisiloxandiyl bis(1-indenyl) zirconium dichloride ( 1 ) ha been prepared by the reaction of the dilithium salt of 1,3-bis(1-indenyl) tetramethyldisiloxane with Cl4Zr · 2THF . after catalytic hydrogenation , the corresponding tetrahydroindenyl complex ( 2 ) ha been formed . both <nUm> and <nUm> have been shown by 1H NMR spectrum to be the mixture of the cis(meso) and trans(rac) isomer . the pure trans isomer 1t , 2c and ci isomer 2c were obtained by recrystallization . the crystal structure of 1t and 2c were determined by x-ray diffraction . both crystal of 1t and 2c are monoclinics , belonging to space group P21 / n(1t) and P21 / c(2c) . In the unit cell of 2c , one of the six - membered ring of the tetrahydroindenyl ligand ha two different conformation which have the same probability . none the catalytic dehydrocoupling of bis(1-sila-3-butyl)benzene , <nUm> by Cp2ZrCl2 / Red-Al and Cp2ZrCl2 / n-BuLi combination catalyst yielded a mixture of oily and solid polymer . while the catalytic dehydrocoupling of 2-phenyl-1,3-disilapropane , <nUm> by Cp2ZrCl2 / n-BuLi combination catalyst produced a mixture of oily and solid polymer , the catalytic redistribution / dehydrocoupling of <nUm> by Cp2ZrCl2 / Red-Al combination catalyst gave oily polymer . the dehydrocoupling of <nUm> and <nUm> , unless the prior silane redistribution occurs , seems to initially produce a low-molecular-weight polymer , which then undergoes an extensive cross-linking reaction of backbone Si-H bond , leading to an insoluble polymer . A new dialkylzirconocene type of complex , (1,2-ph2-4-MeCp)2ZrMe2(2) , wa synthesized by reaction of (1,2-Ph2-4-MeCp)2ZrCl2(1) and with <nUm> equivalent of methyl lithium at <nUm> ° C . complex <nUm> wa characterized by elemental analysis , 1H NMR and 13C NMR . the structure of complex <nUm> wa determined by single crystal x-ray structural analysis . upon activation with Al(iBu)3 / Ph3C+ BC24F20 - , complex <nUm> showed a high catalytic activity for the ethylene polymerization reaction at lower n(Al) / n(Zr) ratio and high molecular weight polyethylene sample with high melting transition temperature were produced . the polyethylene sample were characterized by molecular weight determination , DSC and XRD analysis . reaction of zirconocene dichloride Cp2ZrCl2 with aromatic polymer bearing a-diketone and a-hydroxyketone fragment wa studied . using reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with benzil and benzoin , which model a-diketone and a-hydroxyketone fragment , it wa shown that zirconocene dichloride reacts only with hydroxyketone group of the polymer through both reaction with OH group and coordination of Zn to the keto group . the prepared polymer are rather stable and can show promise a catalyst for a number of organic reaction . In this article the recent progress of the application of chiral titanium and zirconium complex in asymmetric synthesis , particularly chiral ansa - titanocene and zirconocene in asymmetric synthesis , ha been reviewed . the feature and future perspective of these catalyst have been reviewed . an investigation ha been undertaken by use of ESCA in the characterization of the central metal(Zr) of dichlorozirconocene / methylaluminoxane homogeneous olefin polymerization catalyst . the change of electron density shown by a shift in ESCA signal ( <nUm> <nUm> eV ) indicates that the catalytic specie are " cation - like " . within the range of detecting sensitivity of ESCA spectrometer , only a part of the new catalytic derivative wa formed . the influence of complexion time and Al : Zr ratio on the formation of the catalytic zirconocene cation ha also been investigated . none the copolymerization of propene and octene-1 using rac - Et(Ind) <nUm> ClZr <nUm> / MAO catalyst ha been investigated . result show that with increasing the concentration of octene-1 in the system , the catalytic activity increased first and then decreased , the incorporation rate of octene-1 increased , and in consequence , m η , T m , crystallinity of copolymer decreased . the monomer composition and sequence distribution of the copolymer were determined by IR and <nUm> C - NMR . with a new trisiloxane - bridged dinuclear zirconocene , hexamethyltrisiloxanediylbis ( cyclopentadienylindenylzirconium dichloride ) ( TSDZ ) Cl2IndZr-CpSi(CH3)2-O-Si-(CH3) 2-O-Si(CH3)2 cp - ZrIndCl2 , the polymerization of ethylene were carried out in the presence of modified MAO ( MMAO ) a a cocatalyst . the effect of MMAO amount and polymerization temperature ( tp ) on polymerization behaviour of TSDZ were examined and compared with those of mononuclear zirconocenes such a cyclopentadienylindenylzirconium dichloride , biscyclopentadienylzirconium dichloride and bisindenylzirconium dichloride . the catalytic activity of TSDZ wa comparable to that of mononuclear zirconocenes , while the weight - average molecular weight ( mk ) and polydispersity index ( MJMk ) of polyethylene ( PE ) prepared with the former were much higher than those of PE with the latter . with increasing MMAO concentration , the catalytic activity increased but mk decreased for TSDZ , a well a mononuclear zirconocenes . with increasing tr the catalytic activity of TSDZ wa a maximum at <nUm> ° C while that of mononuclear zirconocenes increased steadily . for increased tr the decrease of mk and MJMk for TSDZ wa extraordinary compared to that for mononuclear zirconocenes . copolymer of ethylene and 1-octene , 1-tetradecene and 1-octadecene were synthetized in order to study the effect of the comonomer chain length and amount on density , melting temperature and heat of fusion . they were also compared with the property of the copolymer obtained with the heterogeneous titanium catalyst . it could be seen that the density / melting -area of the copolymer obtained with the zirconocene catalyst wa much broader than with the titanium catalyst . it could also be seen that with the same comonomer content 1-tetradecene gave lower density of the copolymer than 1-octene . however , no difference were seen between the density of the copolymer obtained with 1-tetradecene and 1-octadecene . the melting temperature of the copolymer wa seen to be the lower the longer the comonomer wa . In the area of the high branching amount the linear correlation wa not in work . it wa also shown that the difference in the heat of fusion could only be seen at high amount of branch ( > <nUm> branch / 1000C ) : the longer the comonomer the lower amount of heat wa needed to melt the copolymer . the substituted silastannatetrahydro-s-indacenes meso-Me2Si(t-BuC5H3)2SnMe <nUm> , meso-Me2-Si(Me2C5H2) 2SnMe2 , and meso-Me2Si(Me-i-PrC5H2)2SnMe <nUm> , prepared from the corresponding silanediyl-bridged dicyclopentadienide dilithium salt by reaction with Me2SnCl2 , were structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction and by 1H - NMR in solution . these cyclic stannanediyl compound react with Cl4Zr to give selectively the meso diastereomers of the ansa - zirconocene complex Me2Si(3-t-BuC5H3)2ZrCl2 , Me2Si(2,4-Me2C5H2) 2ZrCl2 , and Me2Si(2-Me-4-i-PrC5H2)2ZrCl <nUm> , respectively . reaction of Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-BuC5H2-Li +)2 with me2 Cl2Sn give , instead of Me2Si(Me-t-BuC5H2)2SnMe2 , the distannyl derivative Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-BuC5H2-1-SnMe 2Cl)2 . this compound reacts with Cl4Zr to give a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of the rac and meso isomer of Me2Si(2-Me-4-t-BuC5H2)2ZrCl <nUm> . ring - opened , racemic distannyl compound are formed also from meso-Me2Si(t-BuC5H3)2SnMe <nUm> , meso-Me2Si(Me2C5H2) 2SnMe2 , and meso-Me2Si(Me-i-PrC5H2)2SnMe <nUm> with excess Me2SnCl2 . competition between Me2SnCl2 and Zr center for reaction with stannylcyclopentadiene unit appears to limit the overall stereoselectivity of the ansa - zirconocene complex formation . the method developed by erker for the preparation of " dibornacyclopentadiene " <nUm> ha been generalized to encompass two related cyclopentadienes flanked by bridged bicyclic subunit derived from (1R)-(+)-verbenone ( 4 ) . whereas lithium dimethylcuprate addition to <nUm> lead to 5a , reaction with diisobutylaluminum hydride and methylcopper affords the le substituted analog 5b . both saturated ketone undergo the shapiro reaction and subsequent in situ condensation with ethyl formate to deliver the dienols 7a,b , respectively . the dehydrative cyclization of these intemediates proved to be more difficult to accomplish than in the earlier work involving <nUm> . exposure of 7a to camphorsulfonic acid in benzene at <nUm> ° C give rise to <nUm> in <nUm> % yield . these condition proved much too harsh for 7b , which however undergoes ring closure to give <nUm> ( <nUm> % ) with iodine in ether . following deprotonation , <nUm> can be silylated to give <nUm> , but neither the lithium cyclopentadienide nor the silane can be coaxed into forming a variety of titanocene or zirconocene complex . these reactant must consequently be more sterically crowded than <nUm> , which doe react with MCl4 ( erker ) and CpTiCl3 ( this work ) . remarkably , hydrocarbon <nUm> completely resists deprotonation , a direct reflection of the extreme nonbonded congestion in the vicinity of it sp3 - bound cyclopentadienyl proton . when polymerization of propene wa conducted using the C2 - symmetrical zirconocenes racEt(2,4,7-Me3Ind)2ZrCl2 ( I ) and rac-Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind)2ZrCl2 ( II ) combined with Ph3CB(C6F5)4 , the isotacticity ( [mmmm] ) and the melting point ( Tm ) of the produced polymer markedly increased , along with a decrease of the polymerization temperature from <nUm> to <nUm> ° C . thus , isotactic polypropene ( iPP ) with Tm = <nUm> ° C wa obtained from the polymerization with catalyst I at <nUm> ° C , whereas the [mmmm] and Tm of iPP were almost unchanged in the same temperature range when the C1 - symmetrical zirconocene iPr(3-tBuCp)(3-tBuInd)ZrCl2 ( III or III' ) wa employed . additive effect of dialkylaluminum hydride on propylene-1,3-butadiene copolymerization were investigated with an isospecific zirconocene catalyst , rac-dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-4-phenylindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 4Ph ) , activated by modified methylaluminoxane . dialkylaluminum hydride improved the apparent selectivity for 1,2-insertion of 1,3-butadiene to give a pendant vinyl group . 13C NMR analysis of the copolymer indicated that the dialkylaluminum hydride converted the 1,4-inserted butadiene unit in the copolymer to tetramethylene unit after methanolysis . the novel zirconocene complex [Cp'2Zr(m-H)(SiHR)]22+[BR' n(C6F5)4-n]22- ( cp' = cp , MeCp , Me5Cp ; r = ph or PhCH2 ; R' = bu or H ) were isolated from silane dehydropolymerization reaction mixture catalyzed by Cp'2ZrCl2 / 2BuLi / BC6F5 <nUm> or by [Cp'Zr(m-H)H]2 / 2B(C6F5)3 combination catalyst . A total structure analysis of these compound , performed by multinuclear , multidimensional NMR spectroscopy , show that each zirconocene fragment bear a positive charge , which is delocalized between the metal center and hydrosilane ligand . reaction of zirconocene dichloride Cp2ZrCl2 with aromatic polymer bearing a-diketone and a-hydroxyketone fragment wa studied . using reaction of Cp2ZrCl2 with benzil and benzoin , which model a-diketone and a-hydroxyketone fragment , it wa shown that zirconocene dichloride reacts only with hydroxyketone group of the polymer through both reaction with OH group and coordination of Zr to the keto group . the prepared polymer are rather stable and show promise a catalyst for a number of organic reaction . the (C5H5-nMen)2Zr[e 2-C2(SiMe3)2 ] ( n = 2-5 ; 1,3-dimethyl , 1,2,3-trimethyl ) ( 2C-F ) complex were prepared by the reduction of corresponding zirconocene dichloride with magnesium in THF in the presence of bis(trimethylsilyl)acetylene ( BTMSA ) . all of them are stable in the absence of THF . crystal structure of (C5HMe4)2Zr[e2-C 2(SiMe3)2 ] ( 2E ) and (C5Me5)2Zr[e2-C 2(SiMe3)2 ] ( 2F ) and of the analogous titanium complex are isomorphous . the red shift of the v(C ≡ C ) vibration and the downfield shift of 13C d(C ≡ C ) indicate that BTMSA in 2C-F is more strongly coordinated than in analogous titanocene complex . the nonisolated complex (C5H4Me)2Zr[e2-C 2(SiMe3)2](THF) ( 2B*THF ) rearranges after the loss of THF to give the dimer [ (e5-C5H4Me)(e1-C(SiMe <nUm> ) = CH(SiMe3)Zr(m-e1:e 5-C5H3Me)]2 ( 3B ) . the reduction of rac - (EBTHI)ZrCl2 [ EBTHI = 1,2-ethylene-1,1'-bis(e5-tetrahydroindenyl) ] with equimolar amount of magnesium in the presence of Me3SiC2SiMe3 in THF at room temperature gave the first zirconocene - alkyne complex containing no additional ligand , rac-(EBTHI)Zr(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe3) , <nUm> . with pyridine and (S)-(-)-nicotine complex <nUm> gave the ligand - containing complex rac-(EBTHI)Zr(L)(e2-Me3SiC2SiMe <nUm> ) ( L = pyridine , <nUm> ; L = (S)-(-)-nicotine , <nUm> ) . In the reaction of <nUm> with acetone the insertion product rac-(EBTHI)-(ZrOCMe2C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) , <nUm> , wa formed . complex <nUm> reacted with <nUm> equiv of PhN = CHPh with substitution of the alkyne to form rac - (EBTHI)ZrNPhCHPhCHPhNPh , <nUm> . compound <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by an x-ray structure analysis . complex were prepared in which one of the 2-phenylindenyl ligand wa substituted with cyclopentadienyl type ligand , (cyclopentadienyl)(2-phenyl-indenyl)zirconium dichloride , Cp(2PhInd)ZrCl2 and Cp*(2PhInd)ZrCl2 and studied their behavior in propylene polymerization . the substitution of one of the 2-phenylindenyl ligand with a cp ligand resulted in a fourfold increase in productivity . typical productivity observed for Cp2ZrCl2 type complex were lower . the molecular weight of polypropylene prepared with complex <nUm> wa higher . upon substitution of 2-phenylindene with cp , the ability of the catalyst to generate elastomeric polypropylene is lost . catalytic system based on zirconocenes can produce polymer with an overall amount of regioirregular placement a high a 2-3 % . the higher regiospecifities of titanocene based , with respect to zirconocene based , catalytic system ha been accounted for by the large contribution of the non-bonded interaction , in favor of the monomer coordination suitable for the primary insertion when shorter Mt-C distance are involved . azametallacyclobutene Cp2ZrN-t-BuCEt = CEt ( 1 ) underwent an insertion reaction with CO to form the acyl complex <nUm> ( Cp2Zr(N-t-BuCEtCEtCO) , <nUm> % yield ) . the addition of acetone to azametallacyclobutene <nUm> ( Cp2Zr(NArCMeCPh) , Ar = 2,6-dimethylphenyl ) yielded the N - bonded enamine and O - bonded enolate complex of zirconocene <nUm> ( Cp2Zr(NArCMeCPhH)(OCMeCH2) , <nUm> % yield ) . the addition of aldehyde RCOH to metallacycle <nUm> resulted in the insertion of the aldehyde into the Zr-C bond to form complex Cp2Zr(NArCMeCPhCRHO) ( 8a ) and Cp2Zr(NArCMeCPhC(i-Pr)HO ( 9 ) in <nUm> % ( r = ph ) and <nUm> % yield , respectively . similarly , treatment of metallacycle <nUm> ( Cp2Zr-(NArCEtCEt) ) with benzaldehyde yielded the insertion product <nUm> ( Cp2Zr(NArCEtCEtCPhHO) ) in <nUm> % isolated yield . the structure of complex <nUm> wa confirmed by an x-ray crystallographic study . heating the insertion product 8a and <nUm> led to elimination of the a,b-unsaturated imines <nUm> and 14a ( ArN = CMeCPh = CRH ) in <nUm> % and <nUm> % yield , respectively , and the formation of oxozirconocene oligomer (Cp2ZrO)n . the oxozirconocene monomer wa trapped by dimethylzirconocene , preventing the formation of oligomer and resulting in the isolation of product <nUm> . A kinetic study of this retrocycloaddition produced the following activation parameter : DH ‡ = <nUm> kcal / mol , DS ‡ = <nUm> eu . A hammett slr study showed that electron - donating group α to the metallacycle oxygen accelerate the retrocycloaddition ( ρ = <nUm> ) . the preparation and crystal structure of the first group <nUm> ansa - metallocene with an oxygen atom directly bonded to the 2-position of an e5-indenyl moiety , rac-[ethylenebis(2-(tert-butyldimethylsiloxy)indenyl)]zirconium dichloride ( 3 ) , is reported . In combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , complex <nUm> polymerizes propylene to highly isotactic crystalline polypropylene ( Tm = <nUm> ° C ; mw = <nUm> <nUm> ; mw / Mn = <nUm> ) . under similar condition , the propylene polymerization activity of <nUm> / MAO exceeds that of the conventional ansa - metallocene catalyst system (dimethylsilyl)bis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydroindenyl)zirconium dichloride ( 4 ) / MAO by a factor of <nUm> ( <nUm> v <nUm> kg of PP / mol of Zr / h ; tp = <nUm> ° C ; C3H6P = <nUm> bar ; [Al] : [Zr] = <nUm> <nUm> : <nUm> ) . complex <nUm> crystallizes in the unusual indenyl-backward conformation . the molecular structure is consistent with the expected C2 symmetry . In reaction .of the zirconocene derivative Cp2ZrC(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3)(THF) with ketone and aldehyde the influence of the various substituents of the carbonyl compound upon the formation of different product wa investigated . formaldehyde reacts by an insertion of the carbonyl unit into a Zr-C bond to give a metallacycle which is additionally stabilized by the formation of a coordination dimer [ Cp2ZrOCH2C(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) ] <nUm> ( 1 ) . benzaldehyde yield a monomeric metallacycle Cp2ZrOCHPhC(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3) ( 2 ) . complex <nUm> is le stable than <nUm> , and at higher temperature it loses half of it moiety Me3SiC2SiMe3 , leaving { [ Cp2ZrOCHPhC(SiMe3) = C(SiMe3)][Cp 2Zr(e2-O = CHPh ) ] } ( 3 ) . benzophenone give no insertion , and the monomeric e2-ketone complex Cp2Zr(THF)(e2-O = CPh2 ) ( 4 ) wa obtained . low molecular weight ( ca. <nUm> ) ethylene-1-butene copolymer were synthesized at <nUm> ° C using rac-(dimethylsilyl)bis(4,5,6,7-tetrahydro-1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride ( II ) catalyst and methyl-aluminoxane ( MAO ) cocatalyst . comonomer composition , triad sequence distribution , and end group were analyzed by 1H and 13C NMR . the average polymer molecule contains about one double bond and one saturated end group . the unsaturated end group were formed almost exclusively by transfer from propagating chain containing 1-butene a the terminal unit . At least <nUm> % of the unsaturated end group are vinylidene and trisubstituted double bond , which are present in the approximate ratio <nUm> : <nUm> . saturated end group result from the initiation process . both ethylene and 1-butene are involved in initiation , but ethylene more than 1-butene . the product is a random copolymer with very short block ( no longer than 2-3 monomer unit ) of both ethylene and 1-butene . the comonomer sequence distribution determined by 13C NMR were fitted to first - order markovian statistic , which allowed calculation of the monomer reactivity ratio . the result are discussed in term of a reaction mechanism consisting of initiation , propagation , and chain transfer reaction . In the present study , the linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) / OZr <nUm> nanocomposites were synthesized via in-situ polymerization with rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst . first , the nano-ZrO <nUm> filler wa impregnated with the desired amount of MAO . then , copolymerization of ethylene / 1-octene wa performed in the presence of nanoZrO2 / MAO filler to produce the LLDPE / O2Zr nanocomposites . the amount of nanoZrO2 filler employed were varied at <nUm> and <nUm> g corresponding to [Al]MAO / [Zr] ratio = <nUm> and <nUm> , respectively . it can be observed that the polymer yield increased with increasing the ratio of [Al]MAO / [Zr] . however , the observed polymer yield were much lower ( about 5-30 time ) compared to the yield with no filler addition . the filler content in polymer were in the range of 23-25 wt % . the characteristic of LLDPE / O2Zr nanocomposites obtained were determined by mean of DSC , SEM / EDX , TEM , 13C NMR , and XPS . it wa observed that the LLDPE / O2Zr nanocmposites exhibited slightly lower melting temperature ( Tm ) and crystallization temperature ( Tc ) . SEM micrographs demonstrate the homogeneous matrix of the sample . In addition , with EDX mapping technique , it wa also revealed that the nano-ZrO2 filler wa well distributed over the polymer matrix . based on the TEM result , it wa also revealed that the smaller and more uniform particle can be observed after polymerization . these observation suggested that the fragmentation of nano-ZrO2 particle or segregation of the secondary particle could occur resulting in good dispersion of the particle . the distribution of comonomer wa studied by 13C NMR . it wa shown to be random a seen in the similar catalytic system without filler addition . the binding energy ( BE ) for C 1 obtained from XPS to be <nUm> eV indicating no significant change in the polymer microstructure with the addition of nano-ZrO2 filler . none isotatic polymerization of methyl methacrylate ( MMA ) , t-buyl acrylate and 2-ethyl hexyl acrylate in both toluene and CH 2Cl <nUm> with an ansa-zirconocenedimethyl were investigated using bis(4-methyl-2,6-dibutyl phenoxyl ) methyl aluminum a the activator . the result indicate that polymer with high molecular weight were produced in high yield . none none none 91Zr NMR chemical shift and line width ( du1 / <nUm> ) are reported for a number of ring - bridged and ring - substituted zirconocene dichloride , dibromide , and dimethyl complex . ab initio computation at the SCF level employing basis set of moderate size suggest that the magnitude of the electric field gradient ( EFG ) at the Zr atom dominates du1 / <nUm> when the substituents x at Zr are varied ( x = Br , Cl , me ) . substituents at the cyclopentadiene ( cp ) ring affect the computed EFGs much le ; in these case , the line width du1 / <nUm> are governed by the molecular correlation time tc , which were obtained for several zirconocene dichloride from T1(13C) measurement . experimental trend in d(91Zr) of zirconocenes are well reproduced computationally with the IGLO ( individual gauge for localized orbitals ) or GIAO ( gauge including atomic orbitals ) SCF method employing large basis set . model calculation suggest that d(91Zr) , a well a the EFG , are quite sensitive to the inclination and twist angle of the cp ring and , to a lesser extent , to the CpZrCp' angle . A substantial deshielding , d(91Zr) ca. <nUm> ppm , is predicted for (C5H5)2ZrMe+ , presumably the active olefin - polymerizing catalyst . the first high molecular weight polystannanes , H(SnR2)nH ( r = nBu , nHex , nOct ) , result from dehydropolymerization of secondary stannanes R2SnH2 by zirconocene catalyst . good catalyst include zirconocenes based on both CpCp*Zr ( cp* = e5-C5Me5 ) and Cp2Zr fragment , and the most active catalyst with respect to production of high molecular weight polystannanes wa Me2C(e5-C5H4) 2Zr[Si(SiMe3)3]Me . the latter catalyst produced H(SnnBu2)nH chain ( mw / Mn = <nUm> <nUm> / <nUm> <nUm> ) that were contaminated by ca. <nUm> % ( by weight ) low molecular weight cyclic oligomers . lower molecular weight resulted from dehydropolymerizations of Me2SnH2 , PhMeSnH2 , and Ph2SnH2 . At room temperature , H(SnR2)nH ( r = alkyl group ) polystannanes have lmax value at ca. 380-400 nm , attributed to s-s* transition . thermal gravimetric analysis on the polystannanes reveal that these polymer are a thermally stable a related poly(dialkylsilane)s and have onset temperature for thermal decomposition in the range 200-270 ° C , under both nitrogen and air . the H(SnnBu2)nH polymer ha been shown to be a good precursor to O2Sn , a shown by bulk pyrolysis in air ( ceramic yield : <nUm> % ) . preliminary result also indicate that these polymer may be useful a precursor to elemental tin . the polystannanes are photosensitive , and their photobleaching behavior ha been characterized by UV - vi spectrometry and 119Sn NMR spectroscopy , which demonstrated that H(SnnBu2)nH is photochemically depolymerized to a <nUm> : <nUm> mixture of cyclo-(SnnBu2)5 and cyclo-(SnnBu2)6 . the polymer H(SnnHex2)nH and H(SnnOct2)nH exhibit thermochromic behavior which is visibly evident a a discoloration from yellow to colorless upon warming above room temperature . this reversible behavior is associated with an abrupt change in lmax ( e.g. , from <nUm> to <nUm> nm for film of H(SnnOct2)nH ) and a phase change at ca. <nUm> ° C ( by differential scanning calorimetry ) . thin film of H(SnnBu2)nH and H(SnnOct2)nH on glass slide were doped by exposure to F5Sb vapor to conductivity of 10-2 and <nUm> S cm-1 , respectively . preliminary experiment suggest that the dehydropolymerization occurs by a s-bond metathesis mechanism involving four - center transition state . A previous report on production of high molecular weight poly(dibutylstannane) by the reductive coupling of nBu2SnCl2 by Na / 15-crown-5 wa reinvestigated and found to produce only low molecular weight material with mw / Mn = <nUm> / <nUm> . the rate enhancement effect on comonomer addition and the synergistic effect on 1-butene addition were studied in the co- and terpolymerization of ethylene with long chain 1-olefins using zirconium based metallocenes . with the Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst , the rate enhancement effect wa evident only when the polyethylene wa insoluble in the reaction medium . when the product wa soluble , there wa a rate decrease rather than an increase . the microstructure wa investigated with first- and second - order markovian statistic . the synergistic effect wa not at work in the zirconocenes . when the concentration of 1-butene wa increased in the reaction medium the content of the long chain 1-olefin decreased in the terpolymer . this wa called an antagonistic effect . depending on the reaction condition , small amount of the tetraphosphapentacyclic compound ( tetraphosphacubanes ) 4a , b a well a the isomeric tetraphosphatetracyclic product 5a , b can be isolated from the thermolyses of the phosphaalkynes 3a , b . this cyclotetramerization can be directed towards the formation of tetraphosphacubanes when the whole process is split into two sequential cyclodimerizations . firstly , the zirconocene - phosphaalkyne dimer complex 8a-d are prepared from <nUm> and 3a-d ; in the second step , the Cp2Zr fragment is extruded from 8a-d by reaction with hexachloroethane . the tetraphosphacubanes 4a-d are obtained in good yield by this process . only in the case of 1-adamantyl-phosphaacetylene and the penta- and tetracyclic product formed concomitantly ( <nUm> + 3e → 8e → <nUm> + <nUm> ) . putative intermediate for the second dimerization step are the diphosphetes 9a-e and their diels - alder dimer 10a-e . the preparation of organocopper reagent by transmetalation protocol ha emerged a a versatile new tool for selective C,C - bond formation . In this review , the use of organoaluminum , -boron , -lead , -manganese , -mercury , -samarium , -stannane , -telluride , -titanium , -zinc , and -zirconocene derivative for the preparation of copper complex is presented and compared to traditional protocol originating from lithium or magnesium organometallics . significantly , a wide range of functionality is generally tolerated in the transmetalation procedure , and the reactivity of the resulting cuprates depends on the presence of the residual metal salt . the use of these heterobimetallic cuprates in natural product synthesis demonstrates some of the key feature of this new methodology . bimetallic Zr complex are synthesized by olefin metathesis reaction of vinyl group of monometallic complex . the Si bridged zirconocene { e5-C5Me4-SiMe2- e5-C5H3CH2CH = CH 2}ZrCl2 is transformed by metathesis reaction to the novel bimetallic complex with ansa - structure . ethylene and propylene polymerization wa conducted by bimetallic complex . the activity of the bimetallic complex depends on the steric hindrance of the ligand . the bimetallic complex with ansa - structure gave isotactic polypropylene with a similar high selectivity to that of the monometallic analog . bimetallic complex catalyzed cyclopolymerization of 1,5-hexadiene to give poly(methylene-1,3-cyclopentane) . ansa - zirconocene complex , exemplified by Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 , activated by MAO ( zirconocene / MAO ) exhibit high activity ( A ) for polymerization of propylene . polyolefins exhibiting a range of physical and mechanical property can be synthesized . the molecular structure have been determined by a combination of morphology , molecular and mechanical measurement . the NMR spectrum is consistent with a stereochemical control model of consecutive e / e ' ( E,E ' = enantiomorphic site ) . we have reported previously that the rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)methylzirconium ''cation'' ( 1 ) , which wa produced from the reaction of rac-ethylenebis(indenyl)dimethylzirconium and triphenylcarbenium ( trityl ) tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl) borate , wa exceedingly active and stereoselective in propylene polymerization , and that it catalytic activity and stereospecificity increase with a decrease of tp . however , in the aluminum - free catalyst , a certain amount of <nUm> is consumed in the nonproductive function of scavenging inpurities . we report here an alternate and efficient method to produce alkylzirconocene - type ''cations'' polymerization catalyst . several example are described where in situ generated ( e2-alkyne ) group <nUm> metallocene type substrate add to X-[M2] reagent ( M2 = main group metal ) to form dimetallabicyclic product Cp2M(m-e1:e2-RCCR)(m-X)[M <nUm> ] which contain a planar-tetracoordinate carbon center in the m-e1:e2-hydrocarbyl bridge . thus , (e2-cyclohexyne)(PMe3)ZrCp2 ( 4a ) reacts in this way with excess trimethylgallium to give Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C6H 8)(m-CH3)GaMe2 ( 6a ) . complex 6a is one of the rare example of a gallium compound containing s-hydrocarbyl bridge to this heavy main group metal . complex 6a wa characterized by x-ray diffraction . it crystallizes in space group P21 / c with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 3 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 4 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , and RW = <nUm> . complex 6a contains a planar-tetracoordinate carbon atom C(2) with pertinent bond distance and angle of <nUm> ( 5 ) Å [Zr-C(2)] , <nUm> ( 5 ) Å [Ga-C(2)] , <nUm> ( 8 ) Å [C(2)-C(3)] , <nUm> ( 7 ) Å [C(1)-C(2)] , <nUm> ( 4 ) ° [C(3)-C(2)-C(1)] , <nUm> ( 3 ) ° [C(3)-C(2)-Ga] , <nUm> ( 1 ) ° [Ga-C(2)-Zr] , and <nUm> ( 3 ) ° [C(1)-C(2)-Zr] . both cp ring are disordered . zirconium and gallium seem to form a three - center two - electron bond with C(2) . the planar-tetracoordinate geometry at carbon atom C(2) is probably electronically stabilized by the s-donor property of the attached metal center and by a p-conjugative interaction of the C(2)-C(1)-Zr moiety normal to the s-plane . (e2-1,2-Didehydrobenzene)(PMe3)ZrCp2 ( 4b ) reacts analogously with trimethylgallium to give Cp2Zr(m-e1:e2-C6H 4)(m-CH3)GaMe2 ( 6b ) in almost quantitative yield . complex 6b crystallizes isomorphously to the corresponding Al compound in space group P21 / n with cell parameter a = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , b = <nUm> ( 2 ) Å , c = <nUm> ( 1 ) Å , β = <nUm> ( 1 ) ° , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> , and RW = <nUm> . it also contains a planar-tetracoordinate carbon atom [C(2)] . the reaction of ph - CKsC - GaMe2 ( 7 ) with (hydrido)zirconocene chloride produce Cp2Zr(m-PhCCH)(m-Cl)GaMe2 ( 9 ) which is probably also a similarly structured " anti-va n't hoff / LeBel complex " . complex 6a and 6b react with ethylene or norbornene at room temperature with liberation of Me3Ga and formation of five - membered metallacyclic product ( e.g. , bis(e-cyclopentadienyl)zirconaindane is obtained from 6b and ethylene ) . the nature and distribution of radioactive specie resulting from ( ng ) neutron - capture reaction in the metal atom of zirconocene dichloride and molybdocene dichloride were investigated . retention value of <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> % were obtained for zr-95 , zr-97 and mo-99 respectively . b-Transformation in 95Zr-zirconocene dichloride and 99Mo-molybdocene dichloride led to approximately <nUm> % of the respective daughter nb-95 and tc-99m being retained at the same molecular form a the parent.The nature and distribution of radioactive specie resulting from ( ng ) neutron -
