alunoxane for polymerization of ethylene and it copolymerization with other α - olefine have been studied . some physico - chemical characteristic of synthesized polymer ( ρ , Tm , MM , MMD ) were studied . IR - spectroscopy , 13C NMR and x - ray analysis method were applied . In this paper we report on some preliminary result on ethylene polymerization with cp* 2ZrX2 ( cp* = pentamethylcyclopentadienyl , x = Cl , OH , me ) - AlR3 ( r = me , et , i-Bu ) . furthermore , we carried out a study on propylene polymerization with cp* 2MCL2 ( m = Zr , Hf ) - MAO in comparison with Cp2MCL2-MAO : some data concerning the different chain - transfer mechanism observed in the two system are reported . we have studied reaction chemistry that appears to be relevant to the mechanism of the dehydrogenative polymerization of phenylsilane by zirconocene and hafnocene catalyst . these investigation suggest that the polymerization proceeds by a two - step mechanism involving sigma-bond metathesis . the active catalyst is therefore proposed to be a coordinatively unsaturated d0 metal hydride complex , which mediates a step ( condensation ) polymerization . none kinetic study were performed in short - time ethylene polymerization with biscyclopentadienyl zirconium dichloride ( Cp2ZrCl2 ) in conjunction with a methylaluminoxane catalyst system using two solvent , toluene and n-decane . the concentration of active center ( [C*] ) and the polymerization rate constant ( kp ) were greatly dependent on the solvent , that is , <nUm> mol / mol Zr and <nUm> 1(mol*s)-1 in toluene , and <nUm> mol / mol Zr and <nUm> 1(mol*s)-1 in n-decane . moreover , the catalyst activity wa increased significantly by introducing a small amount of 1-hexene or propylene a comonomer . from the observed result , the increase in the kp value caused by the comonomer wa proposed . dimethyl zirconocene and it derivative are effective catalyst for the dehydrogenative coupling of primary organosilaes to poly(organosilylenes) . the backbone Si-H function of these polymer can be functionalised by catalytic hydrosilylation . since the zirconocene polymerization catalyst is also an active hydrosilylation catalyst , it is possible to perform one - pot synthesis of functionalised polysilylenes . the bulkily substituted zirconocene dichloride complex of the type RCpCpoZrCU [ cpo = 2-MeOArCR1R2Cp , R1 , R2 = CH3 , C2H5 , CH2 , etc. ] have been synthesized by the reaction of 6,6-dialkylfulvene with 2-MeOArLi followed by treatment with RCpZrCl 3*DME ( r = H , me , i-Pr ) , and all the complex were characterised by 1H NMR , IR , MS and elemental analysis . A new type of intramolecular elimination reaction wa found and anisole wa eliminated from the complex with formation of alkenyl-substituted zirconocene . organosilanes and germanes couple readily by H / / <nUm> elimination under the influence of titanocene and zirconocene - based catalyst . the characterization of the polymer and their functionalisation by hydrosilation are described . the current level of our understanding of the mechanism of these reaction is discussed . the author describe the current state of knowledge on how the polymerization of silanes by dehydrogenative coupling occurs , how general ( or limited ) catalytic dehydrogenative coupling may be a a method for catenation of main group atom , what other catalyst may effect reaction and what other catalytic reaction can be effected by the unusual metallocene intermediate produced in this reaction . an experimental study is reported which wa carried out to obtain and characterize a new class of metalorganic polymer . In this paper , the author describe the synthesis of copolymer of cobalticinium <nUm> dicarboxylic acid ( IV ) with zirconocene dichloride and compare their property with those of tin and titanium polymer prepared previously . the polymer are prepared a shown in equation . polymer were characterized by IR spectroscopy , elemental analysis , viscometry measurement , thermogravimetry , and differential scanning calorimetry . experimental result are plotted and discussed in term of reaction mechanism and polymer thermal performance . group IVB - containing polyamine ether were synthesized in moderate yield employing the classical interfacial polycondensation procedure . the polymer were synthesized utilizing the dichloride of titanocene , zirconocene , and hafnocene reacted with acyclovir . the product are high polymer . mass spectrometry and infrared spectroscopy were carried out on the product . MALDITOF MS ion fragment to <nUm> dalton were found . based on dimethyl derivative of zirconocenes with the C <nUm> symmetry and perfluorenyl borate , catalyst immobilized on inorganic ( silica gel ) and organic ( polysorb ) support active for the synthesis of isotactic PP were prepared . it wa shown that the polymerization of propylene with immobilized catalyst in heptane proceeds at the steady - state rate in the presence of triisobutylaluminum . the polymer form in the form of granule whose size grows with an increase in the specific yield of the polymer . the nature of the immobilized zirconocene affect activity of the catalytic system and property of the resulting PP . the macrotacticity index . increase with an increase in the temperature of polymerization . the effective activation energy of polymerization are in the range from <nUm> to <nUm> kJ / mol . none phenylazomethine dendrimer exhibit precisely complexation with metal ion . it wa revealed that phenylazomethine dendrimers can assemble organometallic compound , such a ferrocene and zirconocene , which are known for useful catalyst and easy to be modified by other functional molecule . we found that the big complexation constant enabled ferrocene to make complex with imine at the core selectively , on the other hand , zirconocene can make complex with imine at the outer layer selectively because of the le complexatio constant . it wa also revealed that ferrocene - modified dendrimer turned to film on the electrode by the complexation of ferrocenium to it own imines or next one 's imines . bimetallic zirconocene complex were synthesized by olefin metathesis reaction of alkene - substituted zirconocenes . hydrogenation of a double bond of the bridging chain give a saturated and flexible bridging chain . the bimetallic catalyst with a short bridging chain show a higher catalytic activity for ethylene and propylene polymerization than that with a long bridging chain . the bimetallic catalyst with saturated bridging chain ha an increased activity , compared to the catalyst with unsaturated bridging chain . steric hindrance at R2 position on the cyclopentadienyl ligand decrease a catalytic activity . the steric hindrance at R1 position weekly affect the catalytic activity . transformation that take place in the rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl 2-based catalytic system of olefin polymerization were studied by electronic absorption spectroscopy . polymethylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and it modified analog containing <nUm> % of isobutyl group ( MMAO ) were used a aluminum - containing component . the evolution of absorption spectrum in toluene both with time and upon the fractional addition of new portion of MMAO or MAO to rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 wa examined . it wa presumed that the bathochromic shift of the longwave absorption band in the electronic spectrum are related to the formation of zirconocene adduct with three - coordinated AI atom and / or two - coordinated O atom of polymethylaluminoxane . calculation performed within the framework of the density - functional theory revealed the specific of formation of rac-Et(Ind)2ZrMe2 adduct in comparison with the adduct derived from Cp2ZrMe2 . high performance polymer from simple hydrocarbon monomer such a propylene ( P ) , norbornene ( N ) butadiene ( B ) and styrene ( S ) were obtained by the precise control of primary structure with coordination polymerization catalysis . syndiospecific polymerization of P wa performed with C s-symmetric ansa-fluorenylamidodmethyltitanium activated with AlR 3-free MAO ( dMAO ) in heptane . this catalysis system wa found to be effective for homo- and copolymerization of norbornene with ethylene or 1-alkene . random copolymer of P and B with 1,4-B unit synthesized by an isospecific zirconocene catalyst wa converted to a,o-divinyl isotactic PP by metathesis degradation of the copolymer with ethylene . isotactic PP with pendant vinyl group wa obtained by copolymerization of P and B in the presence of hydrogen in high activity . crystalline S-B block copolymer which posse long crystallizable syn-PS segment chemically bonding with a high cis-1,4-PB wa synthesized by adding B to a syndiotactic living PS . homogeneous single site catalyst have dominated the research interest in olefin polymerization over the past <nUm> year . sinn and kaminski1 started this trend with the discovery that methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) activates group IV transition metal catalyst . the ability to control regio- and stereochemistries , and comonomer content and distribution are some of the important advantage that metallocene catalyst afford in the polymerization process . A current goal is the reduction of the necessary amount of cocatalyst , typically methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , since it high cost and the large amount needed at industrial scale are a barrier to making metallocene system cost effective with respect to ziegler - natta catalysts2 . In this paper , we study the effect of MAO on reaction rate , molecular weight and polymer microstructure in the slurry polymerization of isotactic polypropylene . the active catalyst is a cationic specie generated in an equilibrium reaction between a zirconocene dichloride catalyst and MAO . increasing concentration of MAO shift the equilibrium to the formation of the activated complex . thus , catalyst activity increase with increasing MAO / Zr ratio3,4 . In addition , MAO in solution contains residual trimethylaluminum ( TMA ) in a typical concentration of <nUm> % wt . it is known that TMA can act a a chain transfer agent leading to the formation of an isobutyl-terminated chain and liberation of the activated complex5 . In condition where chain transfer to TMA becomes a competitive process with respect to the other chain transfer reaction , increasing amount of MAO reduce the molecular weight . slurry polymerization of propylene were carried out using rac-ethylene-bis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride / MAO a the catalyst system . polymerization were performed at <nUm> ° C in a <nUm> mL state - of - the - art semi-batch reactor . the effect of MAO / Zr ratio on the rate of reaction , molecular weight and polymer microstructure wa explored in order to allow the chain transfer reaction to TMA to be included in our previously developed kinetic model6 . an exhaustive analysis of end - group of the polymer chain by 1H and 13C NMR wa performed to gain understanding of the chain transfer mechanism . our kinetic model for the homopolymerization of propylene is developed to predict rate of reaction , molecular weight distribution and percentage of unsaturated end - group of the polymer6 . it is characterized by : ( 1 ) non-instantaneous initiation by insertion of the first monomer molecule ; ( 2 ) propagation by <nUm> insertion producing a regioerror that lower the molecular weight through competing chain transfer reaction ; ( 3 ) chain transfer to TMA ; and ( 4 ) catalyst deactivation to account for decreasing catalyst activity with time . the estimation of kinetic rate constant wa performed using a systematic optimization approach involving on - line measurement of the reaction rate and end - of - batch measurement of molecular weight distribution and polymer end - group . A least - square objective function wa defined to minimize the difference between the experimental measurement and the model prediction . the minimization wa performed subject to constraint imposed by the kinetic model equation . these constraint were posed a a set of nonlinear algebraic equation generated by applying temporal discretization technique to the dynamic model . this presentation will focus on the experimental and modeling result obtained with the rac-ethylene-bis(1-indenyl)zirconium dichloride / MAO catalyst system . the ultimate goal of this research is to develop a chemically based kinetic model that can be extensible to a number of single - site metallocene catalyst system . to accomplish this goal , research work with the catalyst rac-dimethylsilylbis(2-methyl-4-phenyl-indenyl) Cl2Zr and rac-ethylene-bis ( 4,7-dimethyl-1-indenyl ) Cl2Zr is underway . the former specie is highly active and stereoselective , while the later specie produce isotactic polypropylene with a high frequency of regioirregular <nUm> insertion . our current work with these catalyst system will be described in the presentation . recent progress of synthesis and application of organoaluminacycles is summarized . As synthetic method for organoaluminacycles , carboalumination or hydroalumination of alkyne followed by thermal elimination , reaction of di-organolithium reagent with aluminum halide , and zirconocene - catalyzed reaction of alkyne with AlR3 have been developed . useful synthetic reaction of organoaluminacycles , such a reaction with a variety of electrophiles , alkylation reagent , and metal - mediated coupling reaction are presented . dialkyl-substituted terminal olefin were synthesized from the coupling reaction of a-olefins which were catalyzed by zirconocene dichloride / methylalumoxane ( MAO ) catalyst system under mild condition . high yield wa gained and no other oligmer wa detected . it wa found that the ratio of Al / Zr is responsible for the selectivity of product . based on dimethyl derivative of zirconocenes with the C2 symmetry and perfluorenyl borate , catalyst immobilized on inorganic ( silica gel ) and organic ( polysorb ) support active for the synthesis of isotactic PP were prepared . it wa shown that the polymerization of propylene with immobilized catalyst in heptane proceeds at the steady - state rate in the presence of triisobutylaluminum . the polymer arises in the form of granule whose size grows with an increase in the specific yield of the polymer . the nature of the immobilized zirconocene affect the activity of the catalytic system and property of the resulting PP . the macrotacticity index increase with an increase in the temperature of polymerization . the effective activation energy of polymerization are in the range from <nUm> to <nUm> kJ / mol . In this study , behaviour of ethylene / norbornene copolymerization using zirconocene catalyst ; rac-Et[Ind]2ZrCl2 ( cat . A ) and Cp2ZrCl2 ( cat . B ) were investigated . based on activity profile at various norbornene concentration , it can be observed that although cat . A is more active than cat . B , it is le stable , indicating more rapid deactivation rate with time . it wa found that deactivation rate wa more pronounced with high concentration of norbornene for both catalytic system . asymmetric activity profile were observed for both catalytic system indicating higher deactivation rate compared to the activation rate . the copolymer produced by cat . A exhibited lower melting temperature ( Tm ) , but higher incorporation of norbornene . however , both catalyst produced copolymer with random distribution . surface modified silica were reacted with different aluminiumalkyls AlR2R ' ( r = me , et , i-Bu , r ' = H , me , et , i-Bu ) , oligomeric methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and combination of both , to yield heterogeneous cocatalysts . these cocatalyts were employed to polymerize ethylene using zirconocene dichloride a the catalyst . the polymerization activity profile have been recorded and compared with the information gained from the scanning electron microscopy ( SEM ) image of the polymer . the fragmentation of the heterogeneous cocatalyts upon polymerization ha been demonstrated . the degree of fragmentation and the polymerization activity depend on the preparation of the silica support and on the preparation of the heterogeneous cocatalysts using these support . the most reactive , fragmentable heterogeneous cocatalysts show polymerization activity slightly higher than MAO in homogeneous solution and almost <nUm> time higher than commercially available MAO on silica ( = MAO on sylopol ) . the preparation of polyethylene with a broad distribution of molecular weight wa studied using Cp2TiCl2 or Cp2ZrCl2 incorporated with ( me or t-BuCp)2SmCl and methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) employed a co-catalyst . the influence of parameter on the polymerization , such a molar ratio of MAO / catalyst , catalyst concentration , temperature and time have been studied in detail . it wa found that the polyethylene had higher molecular weight by using Cp2TiCl2 or Cp2ZrCl2 catalytic system combined with (t-BuCp)2SmClas compared with the system combined with (MeCp)2SmCl . meanwhile , the polyethylene obtained from (t-BuCp)2SmCl - contained catalytic system had high polydispersity ( PDI > <nUm> ) . this review article describes development in chiral metallocenes a polymerization catalyst focusing on C2 symmetric ansa - zirconocene complex . selective synthesis of rac - isomer of ansa - zirconocenes are surveyed . isospecific polymerization of propylene catalyzed by chiral zirconocenes are summarized . advanced series of polymerization by chiral metallocenes such a asymmetric polymerization and polymerization of polar monomer are also introduced . group IVB - containing poly(este r amine ) polymer containing norfloxacin in the backbone were synthesized in moderate yield using the interfacial polycondensation technique . the product are of moderate chain length with degree of polymerization ranging from <nUm> to <nUm> . the product were characterized utilizing HR EI MS , MALDI - TOF MS , and infrared spectroscopy . MALDI spectroscopy showed to be a useful tool in the analysis of the product with size up to six unit found . transformation that take place in the rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl 2-based catalytic system of olefin polymerization were studied by electronic absorption spectroscopy . methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) and it modified analogue containing <nUm> % of isobutyl group ( MMAO ) were used a aluminum - containing component . the evolution of absorption spectrum in toluene both with time and upon the fractional addition of new portion of MMAO or MAO to rac-Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 wa examined . it wa presumed that the bathochromic shift of the longwave absorption band are related to the formation of zirconocene adduct with three - coordinated Al atom and / or two - coordinated O atom of methylaluminoxane . calculation performed within the framework of the density - functional theory revealed the specific of formation of rac-Et(Ind)2ZrMe2 adduct in comparison with the adduct derived from Cp2ZrMe2 . about <nUm> % of all plastic are produced by catalytic process . organometallic compound such a lithiumbutyl , titanium iodide are used for the polymerisation of 1,3-butadiene and styrene . great industrial importance ha the production of polyethylene and polypropylene by phillipps- and ziegler - natta catalysis . beside these classical catalyst , catalyst such a metallocenes , half - sandwich , nickel , palladium , and iron complex have been synthesized - that give tailored polymer of totally different structure and allow to control the polymer tacticity , molar mass and molar mass distribution more efficient . new kind of copolymer and elastomer can be synthesized . it ha become possible to polymerize cyclic olefin with different zirconocenes or nickel and palladium catalyst without any ring opening reaction . the methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) / O2Si in situ- and ex situ - supported Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst were prepared and studied for ethylene / 1-olefin ( 1-hexene , 1-octene , and 1-decene ) copolymerization for linear low - density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) production . the in situ - supported catalytic system exhibited higher activity than the ex situ - supported catalytic system . activity continuously increased a the [Al](MAO) / [Zr] molar ratio increased up to <nUm> . the optimum [Al](TMA) / [Zr] molar ratio wa <nUm> . the ethylene / 1-octene ( EO ) copolymerization showed the most consistency , in regard to activity , for both catalytic system . the copolymer produced in both system were random copolymer . the monobridged compound [ me 2Si(C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ) ] <nUm> , and [ me 2Ge(C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ) ] <nUm> , were obtained a a mixture of three positional isomer from the reaction of the corresponding me 2ECl <nUm> with <nUm> equivalent of Li ( C 5H <nUm> ) . the monosubstituted 2,2-biscyclopentadienyl propane [ me 2C(C 5H <nUm> ) <nUm> ) ] <nUm> , resulted from the reaction of 6,6-dimethylfulvene with ciclopentadien in presence of a base catalyst . deprotonation of compound <nUm> , <nUm> or <nUm> with <nUm> equiv of nButLi and the subsequent reaction with <nUm> equivalent of ClZr <nUm> , suspended in a mixture of THF / benzene produced , in each case , the corresponding ansa - zirconocene chloride [ m-(Me 2E)(C 5H <nUm> ) 2]ZrCl <nUm> . the 1H and 13C spectrum of compound <nUm> , <nUm> and <nUm> are described . VT 1HNMR spectrum a ≈ <nUm> / <nUm> mixture of <nUm> and <nUm> are discussed a an aid in elucidating the spectrum at room temperature . polyethylene / montmorillonite ( MMT ) nanocomposites were prepared via in situ intercalative polymerization . poly ( styrene-co-acrylonitrile ) functionalized montmorillonite wa first obtained by emulsion polymerization . the functionalized MMT wa treated by MAO before being contacted by a zirconocene catalyst . the nanocomposites were prepared by addition and polymerization of ethylene . the exfoliation of the layered silicate in the PE / MMT composite wa confirmed by XRD and TEM observation . the higher storage modulus of the PE / MMT nanocomposites and different tan d in comparison with pure PE were revealed by dynamic mechanical analysis ( DMA ) . A new bis(indenyl)zirconocene bearing a pendant Si-Cl anchor ha been grafted onto MCM-41 , SBA-15 , MCM-48 and a disordered mesoporous silica for the polymerisation of ethylene and propylene , producing polymer with very high molecular weight , low polydispersities and , in the case of polypropylene , higher level of isotacticity than obtainable with analogous homogeneous system . it ha been synthesized two dinuclear metallocene complex [(C5H5)MtCl2] [ (C5H4)CMe2 ( C3H2 ) ] [(C5H5)SmCl][Mt = zr(5) , ti(7) ] , which were used for ethylene polymerization with MAO a cocatalyst . detailed study on the effect of polymerization caused by catalyst concentration , molar ratio of [Al] / [Cat] , temperature and time show that the catalytic activity of complex <nUm> is higher than that of the corresponding mononuclear metallocene of cp2 TiQ2 , while the catalytic activity of complex <nUm> is lower than that of the corresponding mononuclear met allocene of Cp2ZrCl2 ; the molecular weight of polyethylene produced by above two catalyst system is somewhat decreased , and the molecular weight distribution becomes broader . with prolongation of time , the molecular weight of polyethylene obtained by complex <nUm> decrease , while the molecular weight of polyethylene obtained by complex <nUm> increase . none polypropylene wa obtained using the metallocene homogeneous catalyst Methyl2Si-(2-Methyl-4-Phenyl)2ZrCl2 / MAO and the corresponding silica / MAO - supported system prepared at different condition . it wa observed that long metallocene immobilization time for the preparation of silica / MAO / zirconocene supported catalyst doe not imply in higher catalytic activity . the obtained polymer were characterized according to their melting temperature ( Tm ) and crystallinity degree ( xc ) , through DSC analysis . the result showed that the supported catalyst system produce polypropylene with higher Tm and narrower range of melting in relation to the PP obtained by the homogeneous system . polyethylene-clay nanocomposites have been prepared using in situ polymerization . In this study we have evaluated two mineral , silica and bentonite ( smectite ) , a catalyst carrier for the polymerization of ethylene with commercially available zirconocene . the activity of the homogeneous and supported metallocene system were also compared . we have observed that at high temperature , ethylene consumption sharply decrease with time by employing homogeneous catalyst . also , the polymerization profile for both supported system have rapidly achieved a steady state . moreover , the performance of the smectite - supported system wa very similar to that of the silica - supported catalyst . the obtained polymer were characterized according to their melting temperature ( T m ) and crystallinity degree ( x c ) , through DSC analysis . the polyethylene melting temperature ha significantly increased with the use of both supported system in comparison with the homogeneous counterpart . the highest T m of the obtained polyethylene wa <nUm> ° C , which corresponds to that synthesized by the smectite - supported catalyst . A series of ancillary directing ligand bearing O , S , N atom were used to react with ClZr <nUm> to get the intermediate complex , which showed certain diastereoselectivity when reacting with the dilithium salt of ethene - bridged bis(indene) . to carry out the selective synthesis , the ancillary directing ligand wa firstly reacted with equal molar amount of ClZr <nUm> in toluene under argon overnight . the resultant suspension wa transferred to the solid salt of C 2H 4-[(e 5-Ind)Li ] <nUm> ( molar ratio <nUm> : <nUm> ) at <nUm> ° C . the reaction mixture wa warmed up and stirred for <nUm> h at <nUm> ° C . then the solvent wa removed under vacuum and the residue wa analyzed directly by 1H - NMR spectroscopy to detect the relative amount of rac-C 2H 4- ( η 5-Ind ) 2ZrCl <nUm> and meso-C 2H 4- ( η 5-Ind ) 2ZrCl <nUm> . most of these ancillary directing ligand assisted the formation of racemic isomer , rac-C 2H 4- ( η 5-Ind ) 2ZrCl <nUm> , with the molar ratio of rac-C 2H 4- ( η 5-Ind ) 2ZrCl <nUm> to meso-C 2H 4- ( η 5-Ind ) 2ZrCl <nUm> a high a <nUm> : <nUm> . further research demonstrated that the diastereoselectivity wa significantly influenced by the structure , coordination atom and substituents thereon of the intermediate complex . two new hetro - dinuclear metallocene catalyst system of [(C5H5)MCl2] (C5H4)SiMe5 ( C5H4 ) ] [(C5H5)SmCl] [ m = Ti(D , zr(2) ] activated by MAO were used for the polymerization of ethylene . the affection of catalyst concentration , molar ratio of [Al] / [Cat] , temperature and time on polymerization were studied in detail . the result show that the catalytic activity of dinuclear catalyst is lower than the corresponding mononuclear metallocene , and the molecular weight , melt point and crystallinity of polyethylene produced are somewhat decrease . the use of organozirconium compound to prepare oganic fine chemical began only in the mid-1970s . it showed that alkylzirconium complex are easy to handle and that their reactivity toward electrophiles make them excellent intermediate for making alkyl halide . with hydrozirconation a the starting point , organozirconium chemistry ha taken varied path . hydrozirconation of 1-alkylnylphosphonates give the organozirconium(IV) complex <nUm> in syn-addition way . complex <nUm> wa trapped with NCS , NBS or I <nUm> to afford stereodifined a-halo-1-alkenylphosphonates in moderate to high yield . ionic and covalent derivative of the chlorine analogue of the nonbasic , weakly coordinating triflate ion , CCl3O3S - or " trichlate " ion , have been prepared and compared with the corresponding more strongly coordinated chloroacetates , ClxCH 3-xCO2M ( x = 1-3 ) , using 35Cl NQR ( nuclear quadrupole resonance ) spectroscopy . the 35Cl NQR frequency of all type of derivative are sensitive to the nature of the metal ion or lewis acid and are most sensitive in the case of monochloroacetates . In covalent ( including zirconocene ) derivative , the average NQR frequency fall a the pauling electronegativity of m fall . the result for ionic derivative contrast with previous result for ionic hexachlorometalates : the average 35Cl NQR frequency drop sharply a the ionic radius of the group <nUm> cation increase . ab initio gaussian <nUm> computation at the B3LYP / 6-311++G(3df,3pd) level on isolated XCH2CO2M ( m = Li , Na , K ; x = F , Cl ) molecule duplicate this trend , showing increasing polarization of the C-Cl bond and smaller electric field gradient for larger group <nUm> ion ; the relevance of this to the solid state polymerization of chloroacetates ( herzberg , O. ; epple , M. eur. J. inorg. chem. <nUm> , 1395-1406 ) is discussed . we have prepared the dihydrate and monohydrate of trichlic acid , CCl3HO3S . although trichlates have the highest average NQR frequency of any of these salt , the NQR frequency of trichlic acid dihydrate are anomalously lower than those of trichloroacetic acid , which suggests that it is a strong acid , ionized in the solid state to H 5O2 + and CCl3O3S - ion . In an effort to activate and functionalize nitrogen to produce H3N , assistant chemistry professor paul J. chirik et al. at cornell university have found that tweaking the ligand in a soluble zirconium complex provides a clue that may help chemist develop a homogeneous route for nitrogen fxiation . H3N form when tetramethylated cyclopentadienyl ligand are used . upon further addition of H , the end-on complex dissociates to zirconocene dihydride and liberates N , a typical observation for metal-N2 complex . this finding indicates that the tetramethyl ligand alter the coordination geometry of N in such a way to allow H3N formation . while the reaction sequence is currently not catalytic , it may shed light on how to assemble N-H bond under mild condition . the reduction of ZrCl4(PR3)2 with Li powder , in the presence of a stoichiometric amount of trans-1,4-diphenyl-1,3-butadiene , affords the Zr (II) diene complex ( 1 ) in 90-93 % yield . this reaction consists of a rate - limiting step for the formation of the chloride - bridged Zr (III) dimer ( 2 ) and a fast diene - driven disproportionation of <nUm> to <nUm> and ZrCl4(PR3)2 that re-enters the reduction cycle . the reaction of <nUm> with Li2{Me2Si(2-Me-4-Ph-Ind)2} in toluene produce quantitatively the desired racemic , divalent ansa - zirconocene ( 3 ) that is a highly active isospecific propylene polymerization catalyst upon activation with common activator . molecular weight of polyethylene ( PE ) obtained with using of zirconocene catalyst activated with large excess of methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) were determined by gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) method . it wa found that repeatability of the measurement is strongly influenced by MAO remained in PE sample a well a time of sample keeping in the apparatus ( dissolution + measurement time ) at temp. <nUm> ° C . A method of MAO removing from PE sample , before GPC measurement , based on additional washing of the sample with HF in methanol solution ha been proposed . this modification lead to better both authenticity and repeatability of the result . study on the influence of time of sample keeping in the apparatus at temp. <nUm> ° C showed that dissolution time of a polymer showing molecular weight up to <nUm> ̇ <nUm> g / mol should not exceed <nUm> h . the reduction of chloro-2,3,4,5-tetraethylphosphole with sodium , potassium , rubidium , and cesium in THF or 1,2-dimethoxyethane ( DME ) yield nearly quantitatively after recrystallization from a DME solution the corresponding alkali metal 2,3,4,5-tetraethylphospholides (DME)Na(PC4Et <nUm> ) ( 1 ) , K(PC4Et4) ( 2 ) , (DME)Rb(PC 4Et4 ) ( 3 ) , and (DME)Cs(PC4Et4) ( 4 ) . if the chloro-2,3,4,5-tetraethylphosphole still contains zirconocene dichloride from it preparation heteroleptic (THF)CsC5H 5*Cs(PC4Et4) ( 5 ) precipitate . whereas the sodium derivative <nUm> crystallizes a a dimer , the phospholides <nUm> to <nUm> of the heavier alkali metal crystallize a one - dimensional polymer . due to the size of the potassium cation no additional ether ligand are coordinated to this metal atom and a linear column precipitate , whereas for the Rb and Cs compound the DME complex are formed thus leading to a zig - zag chain . the substitution of half of the phospholide anion by cyclopentadienide ligand in <nUm> lead to a three - dimensional network in the crystalline state . the metathesis reaction of the potassium derivative <nUm> with Cl3Ga and ClSn <nUm> yield dimeric (DME)K[(m-Cl)4Ga2(PC 4Et4)3 ] ( 6 ) and monomeric Sn(PC 4Et4)2 ( 7 ) , respectively . whereas in the alkali metal phospholides <nUm> to <nUm> a high degree of delocalization of the anionic charge within the five - membered ring and a e5-coordination are realized , the 2,3,4,5-tetraethylphospholide anion is s-bonded to gallium (III) in <nUm> and to tin (II) in <nUm> . based on dichloride derivative of zirconocenes with C2 symmetry and borate , active catalyst of propylene polymerization were formed on a polymer support , PE with a grafted poly(acrylic acid ) treated with poly(methylaluminoxane) . it wa shown that the nature of aluminoxane affect the activity of the catalytic system : when aluminoxane is synthesized on the support surface , the activity of the catalyst increase . the influence of the nature of zirconocene and borate on the catalytic behavior of a system containing triisobutylaluminum a a cocatalyst wa studied . variation in the polymerization condition ( liquefied propylene or heptane suspension ) wa found not to affect the kinetics of polymerization , characterized by the steady - state rate of monomer consumption . particle - size analysis of the polymer prepared using various system is presented together with their molecular mass , melting temperature , and isotacticity index . composition of catalytic system and copolymerization reaction condition influence on heterogeneity of ethylene / 1-hexene copolymer obtained over MgCl2(THF)2 / MAO / Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst wa studied . one of the DSC technique , i.e. successive self - nucleation / annealing ( SSA ) method allowing separation of the polymer into fraction with differing chemical composition in result of alternating crystallization and melting cycle wa applied . it wa found that the intermolecular heterogeneity exists inside all studied sample irrespective of the reaction condition ( temperature and time ) and the catalyst composition ( Al / Zr molar ratio ) . it wa also confirmed that catalyst composition ha a considerably greater impact on heterogeneity of the copolymer a compared with copolymerization condition , which apart from the first period of the reaction - do not exert significant influence on this parameter of copolymer structure . the synthetic zeolite are characterized by a great variety of structure and composition , a well a by the different adsorption ability to ion , cluster and the transition metal complex . therefore they are interesting a support for heterogenization of the olefin polymerization catalyst . In addition the natural zeolite due to their considerable content in nature and low cost may be used a filler for the polymer composite material . the immobilized metalcomplex catalyst of olefin ( ethylene and propylene ) polymerization have been developed on the base of zeolite . In order to prepare these catalyst , the anchored aluminoxanes have been synthesized by reaction of aluminum alkyl ( AlMe3 , AlEt3 and AliBu3 ) with water contained in intracrystalline cavity and pore of zeolite ( NaY , NaZSM-5 , HZSM-5 , NH4ZSM-5 , mordenite and clinoptilolite - bearing tuff ) . these aluminoxanes , with zirconocenes , vanadium chloride and other transition metal , form the heterogenized complex that are active in the polymerization of ethylene and propylene without addition of other organoaluminum cocatalysts . the nature of zeolite used a a support , determines the content of zeolite water and affect the formation of anchored aluminoxanes and activity of immobilized catalyst . polyolefins prepared with the immobilized on zeolite zirconocene catalyst demonstrate higher molecular mass and a wider molecular - mass distribution than those of corresponding homogeneous catalyst . the stereoselectivity of supported catalyst depends on the composition , structure of metallocenes and on the zeolite nature . the new composite material on the base of ultrahigh-molecular-mass polyethylene UHMPE and natural zeolite were developed . the synthesis of composite wa carried out by ethylene polymerization on the catalytically activated surface ofzeolite filler . depending on the amount of zeolite filler in the UHMPE matrix such composition can be used a wear - resistant , impact - resistant material for production of unit working in condition of dry friction at high loading or a organomineral ion - exchange sorbent for water purification from radionuclides and heavy metal ion . A stereoselective synthesis of conjugated enynes containing allyl selenide unit is reported . selanyl-substituted conjugated enynes were obtained by the coupling reaction of (E)-g-selanyl vinylzirconocene with acetylenic bromide in the presence of ClCu . based on dichloride derivative of zirconocenes with C2 symmetry and borate , active catalyst of propylene polymerization were formed on a PE polymer support with a grafted poly(acrylic acid ) treated with poly(methylaluminoxane) . it wa shown that the nature of aluminoxane affect the activity of the catalytic system : when aluminoxane is synthesized on the support surface , the activity of the catalyst increase . the influence of the nature of zirconocene and borate on the catalytic behavior of a system containing triisobutylaluminum a a cocatalyst wa studied . variation in the polymerization condition ( liquid propylene or heptane suspension ) wa found not to affect the kinetics of polymerization , characterized by the steady - state rate of monomer consumption . morphological characteristic of the polymer prepared using various catalytic system are presented together with their molecular mass , melting temperature , and isotacticity index . the reaction of e2-(1-butene)zirconocene with (4R,5R)-di[(1S)-phenylethyl]amino-1,7-octadienes , carrying two vinyl or two phenyl substituents at C3 and C6 , followed by protonation , gave a mixture of diastereomeric , fully substituted cyclohexanes . In the case of (4R,5R)-di[(1S)-phenylethyl]amino-(3R,6R)-diphenyl-1,7-octadiene , the main diastereomer of the product wa isolated with <nUm> % yield , then reductive removal of the n-substituents afforded (1R,2R)-diamino-(4R,SS)-dimethyl-(3R,6R)-diphenylcyclohexane with <nUm> % yield . three non-bridged dimethylzirconocene complex ; i.e. , bis(e5-cyclopentadienyl)dimethylzirconium ( 1 ) , bis(e5-tert-butyl-cyclopentadienyl)dimethylzirconium ( 2 ) , bis(e5-indenyl)dimethylzirconium ( 3 ) , and the chiral zirconocene rac-ethylenebis(e5-indenyl)dimethylzirconium ( 4 ) were synthesized and used a catalyst for the polymerization of methyl methacrylate , MMA , combined with tris(pentafluorophenyl)borate ( A ) or tetrakis(pentafluorophenyl)borate dimethylanilinum salt ( B ) in the presence of ZnEt2 . the evolution of the polymerization characteristic ; i.e. , molecular weight , molecular - weight distribution , and yield were examined for the above system . the influence of the nature of the solvent wa also investigated . the aggregation behavior , the steric hindrance , and the lipophilicity of the active catalytic system are the most important parameter determining the polymerization characteristic . the tacticity of the product is reported and the influence of the catalyst structure is discussed . finally , the polymerization of other methacrylates ( alkyl = butyl , hexyl , decyl , stearyl , and sec-butyl ) , wa conducted and the effect of the nature of the alkyl ester group on the molecular and structural characteristic wa established . treatment of 1-methylimidazol-2-yl lithium with Cp2Zr(C1)CH3 ( 6 ) gave the corresponding methyl(1-methyl-2-imidazolyl)zirconocene complex <nUm> . treatment of <nUm> with BC18F15 ( 8 ) led to selective methyl abstraction . the resulting (imidazolyl)zirconocene cation <nUm> dimerized under the reaction condition to yield the dinuclear imidazolyl bridged bis(zirconocene) dication complex <nUm> that wa structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction and by DFT calculation . four new mixed - ring zirconium complex , [ CH2 = CH(CH 2)n-C5H4](RC5H4)ZrCl <nUm> [ n = <nUm> , r = CH3OCH2CH2(3) ; n = <nUm> , r = C3H7O ( 4 ) ; n = <nUm> , r = Me3Si ( 5 ) ; n = <nUm> , r = allyl ( 6 ) ] , have been prepared by the reaction of CH2 = CH(CH2)nC5H4ZrCl 3* DME[n = <nUm> ( 1 ) ; n = <nUm> ( 2 ) ] with RC5H 4Li . when activated with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) , the catalytic activity of the above complex in ethylene polymerization were tested . complex <nUm> and <nUm> show high activity similar to Cp2ZrCl <nUm> . introduction of methoxyethyl group into cp - ligand dramatically decrease the catalytic activity of complex <nUm> and <nUm> , which can be overcome by increasing the amount of MAO . for complex <nUm> , the dependence of activity and molecular weight ( Mn ) on the Al / Zr ratio , the polymerization time ( tp ) , polymerization temperature ( TP ) and the polymerization solvent volume ( V ) wa investigated . A series of phenyl-substituted cyclopentadienyl zirconocenes have been prepared by the reaction of the corresponding ligand with n-BuLi and Cl4Zr in toluene , which were characterized by 1H NMR , MS spectrum and elemental analysis . ethylene polymerization with these complex in combination with MAO were studied . it is found that the catalytic activity and the molecular weight of polyethylene with one phenyl substituted zirconocene increase with the enhancement of polymerization temperature . NMR - spectrum of new coordination compound of zirconocene with 5-norbornene-2-ol and 5-norbornene-2-methanol were studied . besides traditional NMR technique , a series of bidimensional one were applied , such a : COSY , HMQC and NOESY . the possibility of obtaining of new metallopolymers via photoinduced polymerization of new Zr - containing monomer is discussed . busico and co-worker have provided a clue to rationalize the factor that control the tacticities observed in PP prepared with conformationally dynamic zirconocene - based catalyst under appropriate experimental condition . In order to find a good agreement between experimental and calculated stereosequence distribution , these author have proposed an alternative plausible oscillating mechanism for the catalyst . solvent and cocatalyst effect have been also documented and compared to more evident environmental factor ( i.e. , the introduction of bulky ring on the ligand ) a regard the conformational dynamism of the catalyst during chain growth . conjugate addition of (E)-3-trimethylsilyl-1-propenylziroconocene to (E,E)-divinylketones in the presence of catalytic amount of CuBr*SMe2 affords (E)-allylsilanes containing (E)-a,b-unsaturated carbonyl moiety under mild condition with good yield . they undergo highly stereocontrolled silicon - assisted intramolecular cylization when treated with Cl4Ti leading to polysubstituted cyclohexanones . the complex polymorphic behaviour of four syndiotactic polypropylene ( sPP ) sample have been analysed by mean of DSC and WAXD technique . two sample ( sPP1 , sPP2 ) were synthesised via metallocene polymerization by using the ansa - zirconocene ph 2C(Cp)(9-Flu)ZrCl <nUm> a catalyst . finally , two additional specimen with different molar mass ( sPP1 - fr1 , sPP1 - fr2 ) were prepared from the most syndiotactic sPP1 sample by temperature gradient extraction . the WAXD analysis show that together with the orthorhombic form I , form II can coexist in a variable but small proportion depending on both the chain feature and the processing condition . the relative contribution of the disordered and the ordered type of form I is also dictated by molar mass , configurational microstructure a well a processing condition . the observed change in the thermal property a measured by DSC and in the mechanic - dynamical relaxation of the sample , on slowing the crystallisation rate down , can be rationalised in term of two concurrent process , namely the perfection undergone by the crystal and the segregation of the amorphous phase . 4,4'-Dibromobiphenyl reacted with n-BuLi to form 4,4'-dilithiobiphenyl , which further reacted with <nUm> , <nUm> , <nUm> , 5-tetramethylcyclopent-2-enone following the elimination of water to give the ligand 4-(C5Me4H) C3H2 - C3H2 (C5Me4H)-4 ( 1 ) . ligand <nUm> reacted with n-BuLi and Cl4Zr to form the p-biphenylene-bridged dinuclear tetramethylcyclopentadienyl zirconium trichloride 4-(C5Me4ZrCl3) · C3H2 - C3H2 (C5Me4ZrCl3)-4 , which reacted in situ with cyclopentadienyl lithium(CpLi) or indenyl lithium ( IndLi ) to give the corresponding p-biphenylene-bridged dinuclear zirconocenes 4-(C5Me4ZrCl2Cp') C3H2 - C6H4(C5Me4ZrCl 2Cp')-4 [ cp' = cp(2) , ind(3) ] . the zirconocenes <nUm> and <nUm> were characterized by 1H NMR , MS spectrum and elemental analysis , and were studied for ethylene polymerization with methyl a-luminoxane ( MAO ) a cocatalyst . both <nUm> and <nUm> show very high activity and reach the maximum at a higher temperature , indicating that the introduction of the p-biphenylene-bridge increased the catalytic activity and thermal stability of the dinuclear zirconocene catalyst . A total synthesis of (+)-epiafricanol ( 6 ) ha been readily achieved from d-glucose . the tricyclic alcohol target wa arrived at by first forming methyl 6-O-benzyl-2-deoxy-2-C-methyl-a-D-altropyranoside ( 12 ) and converting this intermediate into methyl 2-C-methyl-2,3,4-trideoxy-a-D-threo-hexopyranoside ( 14 ) . there followed a series of step resulting in extension of the side chain to give the isopropenyl pyranoside <nUm> . this advanced intermediate wa subjected to zirconocene - promoted ring contraction , which gave rise to <nUm> and set the stage for conversion to <nUm> . this tertiary carbinol wa transformed into <nUm> by sequential ring - closing metathesis and stereodirected simmons - smith cyclopropanation . the reaction of trimethylaluminum with the internal water of a zeolite ( the Na form of ZSM-5 , O2Si : Al2O3 = <nUm> ) yielded immobilized methylaluminoxanes which , in the absence of other organoaluminum cocatalysts , reacted with metallocenes ( Cp2ZrCl2 , Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) to form heterogenized complex active in the polymerization of ethylene and propylene . the kinetics of ethylene and propylene polymerization in the presence of zeolite - supported zirconocene catalyst wa studied . the reaction order of ethylene and propylene polymerization with respect to the concentration of the monomer change from <nUm> to <nUm> a the concentration of the monomer in the reaction zone increase . the apparent activation energy of ethylene and propylene polymerization with the ZSM-5(H2O) / AlMe3 / Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst were found to be <nUm> and <nUm> kJ / mol , respectively . it is inferred that the synthesis of methylaluminoxane directly on the surface of a support and the formation of catalytic complex in the absence of free methylaluminoxane reduce the probability of leaching active center from the support surface to a solution . A series of new oxygen - substituted , asymmetric zirconocene dichloride ( rac-{1-[5,6-(ethylenedioxy)-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl]-2- (9-e5-fluorenyl)ethane}zirconium dichloride ( 3a ) , rac{1-[5,6-(ethylenedioxy)-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl]-2- (9-e5-fluorenyl)ethane}dimethylzirconium ( 3b ) and rac-{[5,6-ethylenedioxy)-2-methyl-1-e5-indenyl] ( 9-e5-fluorenyl ) dimethylsilane } zirconium dichloride ( 3c ) } have been prepared and their polymerization behavior wa investigated in dependence of monomer concentration , temperature and catalyst activation . the presence of oxygen substituents on the indenyl ring result in a strong increase of polymerization activity and also of polymer molecular weight with decreasing Al / Zr ratio . significantly higher molecular mass and activity were found for the dimethyl complex 3b after activation with [(C6H5)3C+] [(C6F5)4B-] deriving from the absence of chain transfer to aluminum and higher concentration of active cata lyst specie . the mechanism of stereoerror formation of the oxygen - containing C1 - symmetric catalyst wa investigated by deuterium labeling study on propene monomer . the result are discussed on the basis of a reversible chain transfer to aluminum . the polymerized metallocene catalyst <nUm> wa prepared by the co-polymerization of ansa - zirconocene complex [ ( CH2 = CH)CH3Si(C 5H4)2]ZrCl2 ( 3 ) containing vinyl substituted silane bridge with styrene in the presence of radical initiator . catalyst <nUm> wa found to display high ethylene polymerization activity of <nUm> × <nUm> gPE / ( mol*h ) with a viscosity average molecular weight ( me ) value of <nUm> × <nUm> using methylalumoxane ( MAO ) a a co-catalyst . the ethylene polymerization ha been investigated under different condition . A group <nUm> metallocene complex that serf a olefin polymerization catalyst wa tethered on a solid support such a silica gel by covalent bond . A zirconocene complex that ha a vinyl group on it cyclopentadienyl ligand wa hydrosilated or hydroborated to introduce a functional anchor for immobilization reaction . the complex with a Si-Cl group wa tethered on a silica surface by the reaction with a surface Si-OH group . the zirconocene with a BH group wa immobilized on a silica gel modified with chlorodimethylvinylsilane . ethylene polymerization using the tethered catalyst showed that the hydroboration-method seems more effective than the hydrosilation-method . it exhibited comparable catalytic activity to the corresponding homogeneous catalyst and produced polyethylene of a higher molecular weight . In order to compare with silylene-bridged group <nUm> metallocenes . C2 symmetric dimethylgermylene-bridged zirconocene and hafnocene dichloride were prepared and employed a the catalyst for polymerization of propylene in combination with methylaluminoxane ( MAO ) . germylene-bridged metallocenes always produced isotactic polypropylene of higher molecular weight than that produced by silylene-bridged analogue . the molecular structure of four metallocenes prepared from dimethylsilylene and germylenebis(2,3,5-trimethylcyclopentadienyl) were determined by x-ray diffraction and showed no substantial difference of geometry between silylene- and germylene-bridged one . unexpectedly the zirconocene metalloligand [ cp ° 2Zr- (OOCCH2SH-k1O)(OOCCH2SH-k 2O,O' ) ] ( <nUm> ; cp ° = C5 - EtMe4 ) reacts with[NiCl2(PMe2Ph)2] or [PdCl2(PnBu3)2] in the presence of NEt3 ( ratio <nUm> : <nUm> : <nUm> ) to give the tetranuclear IVZr - NiII complex <nUm> and the octanuclear IVZr - PdII complex <nUm> , respectively . As a discovery of C - C coupling and amine elimination reaction by treatment of 6-dimethylamino-6-methylfulvene with zirconium tetrachloride , experiment using amino-substituted benzofulvene 1a or aminopentafulvene 2a , instead of 6-dimethylamino-6-methylfulvene , gave bi [1-(dimethylamino)ethenyl-indenyl]zirconium dichloride 1c which wa characterized by x-ray diffraction a monoclinic , space group C2 / c , a = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> nm , b = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> nm , c = <nUm> <nUm> nm , β = <nUm> . <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> nm <nUm> , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> , and bis[(1-methyl-4,5-dihydro-2-pyrrolnyl)cyclopentadienyl ] zirconium dichloride 2c a triclinic , space group P1 , a = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> ( 16 ) nm , b = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> nm , c = <nUm> <nUm> nm , α = <nUm> . <nUm> , β = <nUm> ( 3 ) , γ = <nUm> . <nUm> ° , V = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> nm <nUm> , z = <nUm> , r = <nUm> . <nUm> <nUm> . A zirconocene - olefin complex induced reductive radical cyclization of b-haloalkyl allyl acetal in THF . this complex served a a single electron transfer reagent to promote the cyclization . furthermore , the reaction in DME afforded tetrahydrofuranylmethylzirconium specie effectively . A single - stage , i.e. , degree of polymerization of one , and enantioselective version of the ziegler - natta alkene polymerization wa envisioned a a potentially significant and useful method for catalytic asymmetric C-C bond formation , shortly after the corresponding alkyne version involving Zr - catalyzed alkylalumination of alkyne wa discovered in <nUm> . however , the discovery of such an asymmetric reaction proved to be a major challenge . At least three widely observable unwanted side reaction , i.e. , ( 1 ) cyclic carbometalation , ( 2 ) b-H transfer hydrometalation , and ( 3 ) alkene polymerization , represented by the ziegler - natta polymerization , were noted and were to be avoided . with Zr a the metal at the catalytic center , we eventually came up with a notion that di- or multiple alkylation of Zr wa to be avoided for achieving superior acyclic asymmetric carbometalation . this , in turn , led u to avoid the use of highly nucleophilic alkylmetals containing alkali metal and Mg . aluminum used in ziegler - natta polymerization that can selectively monoalkylate Zr proved to be one of a very limited number of favorable metal . even so , undesirable cyclic carbozirconation can occur in nonpolar solvent via intricate bimetallic route to cyclic organozirconium specie . the vastly different reactant - catalyst stoichiometry and the absence of polymerization promotors , such a methylaluminoxane , in our investigation permit u to ignore the ziegler - natta polymerization a a serious and unwanted side reaction , although use of limited amount of promotors can in some case accelerate otherwise sluggish ZACA reaction . selection of the currently used Zr catalyst including (R)- and (S)-(NMI)2)ZrCl)2 ) , dichlorobis(neomenthylindenyl) zirconium wa made by screening <nUm> or so known chiral zirconocene derivative . systematic scientific design and screening of chiral ligand are clearly highly desirable , and effort along this line are ongoing . even at the current level of development , however , the ZACA reaction show considerable promise a an efficient and selective method for catalytic asymmetric C-C bond formation , which ha already been used to significantly modernize and improve synthesis of natural product including deoxypolypropionates and isoprenoids of biological and medicinal interest . the sequential homo- and copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene and 1-octene initiated by Cp2ZrCl2-methylaluminoxane and C2H4[Ind]2ZrCl2-methylaluminoxane homogeneous catalyst yielded reactor mixture based on HDPE and different amount of ethylene copolymer with these olefin . the composition and property of polymeric product formed at the stage of copolymerization are independent of the preliminary homopolymerization of ethylene . the component of the reactor mixture are capable of cocrystallization directly in the course of synthesis . the synthesized reactor mixture based on HDPE and ethylene-1-hexene copolymer which surpass linear LDPE in tensile strength posse good plastic property and a high melt flow index . A new cyclopentadiene derivative 1,2-diphenyl-4-propyl-1,3-cyclopentadiene(1) wa synthesized by reaction of 3,4-diphenyl-2-cyclopentenone with n-propyl lithium . <nUm> wa treated with n-butyl lithium and then reacted with Cl4Zr in toluene to give sterically bulky unbridged zirconocene dichloride (1,2-Ph2-4-PrCp)2ZrCl2(2) . 1H NMR and 13C NMR spectroscopic analysis reveal it c2u- symmetric conformation in solution . upon activation with methylaluminoxane(MAO) , <nUm> effectively polymerizes ethylene and produce high molecular weight polyethylene with high melting transition temperature at low Al / Zr ratio . At ambient condition , <nUm> / MAO system show high catalytic activity in propylene polymerization and produce oily oligomers . the activity of a MgCl2(THF)2 / MAO / Cp2ZrCl2 / MAO catalyst wa studied in copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene in relation to Al : Zr mole ratio ( 1500-7000 at <nUm> ° C ) , experimental temperature ( 20-70 ° C ) , and time ( 20-90 min at <nUm> ° C ; 10-55 min at <nUm> ° C ) . As the temperature and the Al : Zr ratio were increased , the activity of the catalyst rose . At the same time , the degree of incorporation of 1-hexene into the polymer chain increased and the m , melting point and crystallinity of the copolymer decreased . the catalyst wa stable throughout the copolymerization . the process rate and copolymer property were not affected by copolymerization time . none the sequential homo- and copolymerization of ethylene with 1-hexene and 1-octene initiated by Cp2ZrCl2-methylaluminoxane and CH2 [Ind]2ZrCl2-methylaluminoxane homogeneous catalyst yielded the reactor mixture based on HDPE and different amount of ethylene copolymer with these olefin . the composition and property of polymeric product formed at the stage of copolymerization are independent of the preliminary homopolymerization of ethylene . the component of the reactor mixture are capable of cocrystallization directly in the course of synthesis . the synthesized reactor mixture based on HDPE and ethylene-1-hexene copolymer which surpass linear LDPE in tensile strength posse good plastic property and melt flow index . the reaction of trimethylaluminum with the inner water of a zeolite ( the Na form of ZSM-5 , O2Si : Al2O3 = <nUm> ) yielded immobilized methylaluminoxanes which in the absence of other organoaluminum cocatalysts reacted with metallocenes ( Cp2ZrCl2 , Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 ) to form heterogenized complex active in the polymerization of ethylene and propylene . the kinetics of ethylene and propylene polymerization in the presence of zeolite - supported zirconocene catalyst wa studied . the reaction order of ethylene and propylene polymerization with respect to the concentration of the monomer change from <nUm> to <nUm> a the concentration of the monomer in the reaction zone increase . the apparent activation energy of ethylene and propylene polymerization with the ZSM-5(H2O) / AlMe3 / Et(Ind)2ZrCl2 catalyst were found to be <nUm> and <nUm> kJ / mol , respectively . it is inferred that the synthesis of methylaluminoxane directly on the surface of a support and the formation of catalytic complex in the absence of free methylaluminoxane reduce the probability of leaching active center from the support surface to a solution . the polymerization of ethylene using supported zirconocene catalyst with varying support composition SiO2-MAO-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2+TIBA ( catalyst I ) and MgCl2-Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2+TIBA ( catalyst II ) ( MAO is methylaluminoxane , ind is indenyl , and TIBA is triisobutylaluminum ) wa studied . the examined catalytic system differ in their activity , ability to control the molecular mass of the resulting polymer , and kinetics of copolymerization with 1-hexene . the molecular structure of PE prepared with supported catalyst I and II and a homogeneous catalyst Me2Si(Ind)2ZrCl2+MAO wa studied by IR and 13C NMR spectroscopy . As evidenced by 13C NMR spectroscopy , PE sample synthesized with the homogeneous catalyst and catalyst I contain ethyl branch along with the end methyl group in the low-molecular-mass fraction . on the contrary , PE prepared with supported catalyst II is devoid of ethyl branch but contains vinyl group a the basic type of unsaturation . polymeriztion of linear low density polyethylene ( LLDPE ) using a dual functional catalytic system containing different kind of metallocene / AlEt <nUm> / B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> a copolymerization catalyst and Ti(On-Bu) <nUm> / AlEt <nUm> a the ethylene dimerization catalyst wa studied . using the single cocatalyst AlEt <nUm> in the catalytic system , it is easy to overcome the shortcoming of interference between two catalytic metal in a single reactor . among the four zirconocene system used , the most active dual functional catalytic system is [ Ti(On-Bu) <nUm> / AlEt <nUm> / Et(Ind) 2ZrCl <nUm> / B(C 6F <nUm> ) <nUm> ] , it activity reach <nUm> × <nUm> <nUm> gPE / molZr*h . the density of obtained LLDPE is <nUm> g / cm <nUm> and 1-butene insertion rate <nUm> mol % . the catalytic behavior of the highly isospecific catalyst rac-Me2Si(2-Me,4-PhInd)2ZrCl2 immobilized on the surface of a polymer support , PE with grafted poly(acrylic acid ) that wa preliminarily treated by poly(methylaluminoxane) , wa studied . the immobilized catalyst wa activated by triisobutylaluminum . the molecular mass , melting temperature , and isotacticity of the produced PP were examined . it wa shown that the modification of the catalyst by the boron salt Me2NHPhB(C6F5)4 lead to a change in the kinetics of polymerization and in the isotacticity of the resulting PP . factor affecting the rate and stability of the catalytic behavior of the studied supported catalyst such a the content of immobilized zirconocene , the concentration of triisobutylaluminum , and the reaction temperature were analyzed . it wa demonstrated that the catalyst is not washed from the support surface in the course of polymerization and that PP is produced in the form of granule with a bulk density of <nUm> - <nUm> g / cm3 . this paper describes ethylene polymerization using four kind of zirconocene with different substituents in the cp ring a catalyst and aluminoxane a cocatalyst . polymerization activity , polymerization kinetics and me of resultant polyethylene were compared . it wa found basically that polymerization activity were in the following order : A2 ≅ B2 > A1 > B1 [ A1 : ( CH2 = CH - CH2 - CH2 - cp)2 Cl2Zr ; B1 : ( CH2 = CH - CH2 - CH2 - CH2 - CP)2 Cl2Zr ; A2 : ( CH2 = C2H3 - CH2 - cp)2 Cl2Zr ; B2 : ( CH3 ( CH3 ) C = CH - CH2CP)2 CI2Zr ] . A novel kinetic model wa developed based on the consideration of reactivation reaction . A possible mechanism of influence of different substituents in the cp ring on polymerization activity wa discussed .
